I stopped in for lunch.  I had a trio selection of oysters: grilled, w/ shrimp/crabmeat/crawfish tail, and corn.  All good, though a tad overpriced for the neighborhood @ $12/half-dozen.  The redfish beignets @ $10 was nothing special...you know fried dough on small pieces of fish.

We ate here b/c of the reviews online. The food was excellent. My husband had the cooked oysters (dz) app. along w/ a seafood po-boy for dinner. I had the chicken sandwich w/ a salad. Both dishes were excellent. 
The one thing that wasn't excellent were the two upstairs waitresses. The bus boys did more work than they did! They were more concerned w/ their tips than waiting on the tables! We did sit upstairs and i noticed some other comments that were similar. Maybe the downstairs waitstaff isn't as tip conscious? 
Would i eat here again? no. there are other restaurants where the staff are more concerned w/ their customers.

Worst dining experience ever!!! We sat upstairs, which wasn't crowded, and it took us (party of 4) an hour to get our meal. When we finally did get our food, one order was completely wrong and everything else was cold. By this time we'd had enough and asked for the manager who comped us all of our entrees. The only good thing we had were the raw oysters which were amazing. Definitely won't be returning here again.

The only good thing about this place was the free appetizer at check-in. The grits here had no flavor at all. The jambalaya was nothing to rave about either. Skip this tourist trap.

If you want good shrimp & grits, go to Cafe Amelie. Oceana has great crab cakes and Coop's Place is great all around.

Yelp steered us to Royal House on a gorgeous Friday afternoon in NOLA and as usual, Yelp knows the hot spots! The service was prompt and friendly. The drinks were strong and the food was outstanding. We'll be back!

Across from our hotel wanted to try atleast one landmark of the crescent city. Order with the advice of our waiter. Had the fried alligator, crayfish cakes and crab claws. all were excellent the service was fast and friendly. At the same time there was a bit of a line but only had to wait about 10 minutes. It was a little overpriced but considering the alternatives (Brennan's, NOLA, K-Paul or Antoine's) this was certainly the best bang for our dinner buck. Also a plus casual attire is fine for dinner

We're in New Orleans now, and the service here was so horrible, I had to post a review. 

We're staying at the Omni and were looking for a place to grab a bite and have a chat with a friend. The location was so close, we figured we'd give it a try.

We really wanted to like this place. But what a horrible mistake we made by going here. The food was mediocre at best. The fried gator was lacking flavor. They might as well have breaded up and fried chicken strips. The waiter told us not to bother with the hush puppies, because they were frozen in a bag and not made fresh. The steaks were bland. A little seasoning would have done wonders.

But the service is why I'm writing. Listen, if I'm going to drop $100+ on a meal, I expect the wait staff to actually wait on the table. I don't expect to be kept waiting nearly 20 minutes before having someone come over to take first drink order.

And considering that my husband is in the food business, it was unbelievably insulting to have the waiter deliver a drink that was supposed to be a Crown Royal Whiskey on the rocks - and it wasn't. We're still not sure what it was, but it wasn't Crown - it had a strange rye-meets-rubbing-alcohol-or-some-sort-of-cleaner flavor and smell.

Now, these sorts of mistakes happen, and typically it's no big deal. Everyone's human, the room was packed, I get it.

But to have the waiter stand there, smile patronizingly at us and tell us that he had watched the bartender pour it - and that we were wrong...yeah, that was the topper. 

Given how many food options there are in the Quarter - and that there is the FANTASTIC Original Pierre Maspero's, which is just a block further down St. Louis - we will be avoiding this joint in the future.
Get the trio oysters, bienville is my favorite. Cool watching their mad shucking skills at the bar.

Our last meal in NOLA before heading to the airport we sat by the oyster bar and were welcome to a nice show of shucking oysters. Great ambiance right on the corner of royal street as you can hear the street music performers as well. Heard the balcony seating was a big plus.

We went with the half/half raw oysters with baked oysters. The Louisiana oysters were large plump and meaty while the baked oysters were buttery and garlicky served in a escargot type dish. Sopping up the butter and garlic with the bread was a huge plus. Went with the trio NOLA sampler as well. Was a fan of the gumbo and jambalaya but i could tell the crawfish etoufee had frozen tails while i knew it was crawfish season it would be nice to get fresh ones. Overall good experience and great service with flavorful food.

I had some raw oysters here on a rainy afternoon.  The corner and location was good: buzzing and exciting.  But I was served the raw oysters with a bright red WORM on one of them!  How could the shucker miss this?? Horrifying!

The shrimp creole was good though, but there can be lots of places to get it that are just as good.

Examine your food before you eat it if you dine here!  I won't be coming here again.

Yum! I had an awesome seafood experience here. Their raw oysters were delish. In all honesty though, how does one have bad oysters except for ones that are not fresh (and that spells serious trouble)? The next most important thing is that they have tabasco + lemon to serve you. With those 3 items checked off, Royal House made the cut.

My friend and I shared the seafood combo. It was $50 and it came with a large red lobster staring lovingly back at us, clams, mussels, shrimp, and corn. The mussels were tasty. The clams were shriveled and sad and it was only my friend's keen eye that alerted us that our initial order was missing clams. Our server brought them out later. The shrimp was marinated in seafood juices and totally delicious with the shell on (trust me, eating the shell is not a sin). Though it was yummy I thought it a bit pricey for the quantity. You're in a tourist-y area, what can you expect, right?

The servers were super friendly and funny and the restaurant is located on the corner of Royal. On the second floor you could score a seat that overlooks the people below - pleasant dining experience. Cute place, intimate ambiance. I guess based on reviews here the place has been hit-or-miss, but I got lucky with a hit! Hopefully you will too!

Utterly, utterly mediocre. They messed up our order numerous times. Our server was okay, but very unprofessional and she kept talking smack about the kitchen service.

No way I would come back...there were bugs crawling on the walls and I'm pretty sure our wine bottle had been filled with a cheaper wine (it wasn't opened in front of us).

Pass. I'm sure any other option would be better.
Delicious food...service slow but nice...terrific bloody Marys!

Please, please, please don't go here. I guess maybe if you're favorite places are Red Lobster, Chili's and Applebee's, you may like the food here. But if you consider yourself a "foodie", outwardly or closeted, you do not want to waste a calorie or dime here.

The waitress we had was such a sweetheart, so I have nothing bad to say about the waitstaff. It's 100% the food as the reason why I wouldn't recommend a visit here.

The best thing we had here was the Chargrilled Oysters. They were actually quite good. But, because of the ambience (seemed kind of dirty, unorganized), I was afraid to eat Oysters here in fear of getting the dreaded "bad oyster".

I ordered the shrimp and grits, which were too gritty, not smooth as you'd expect. The shrimp was overcooked. And, there was some seriously weird flavoring in it. I doused it with Crystal Louisiana hot sauce, but I think that just made it even more gross. I didn't finish it.

My husband had the Taste of New Orleans. It must have been the Taste of New Orleans right from the trash in the streets of the French Quarter. Each "taste" came in 1 of 3 soup cups, and I really think it had to be the same bland gravy with chunks of old seafood floating in it. Not good. It's a good thing that we had enough delicious food in New Orleans that we knew this wasn't a fair representative of what NOLA is capable of. 

Unfortunately, we also ordered the hush puppies. They tasted like they were very old and maybe even refried a few times to heat them up.

Please pass this place by.

We enjoyed our meal at the Royal House despite it being a bit damp inside.  The oysters were good, but not quite as high quality as I've had at other oyster bars. I was also slightly disappointed in the Bloody Mary which they raved about but felt like it had too much mix for my palate. All in all we had a perfectly adequate meal but it was nothing to write home about and I felt slightly disappointed as this was our one meal in New Orleans where I had heard such amazing reviews of the food.
Very good oysters but the crawfish etouffee was a little disappointing. Nice atmosphere and good service.
delicious oysters and amazing french onion soup!

We had several great experiences here! The first few times we sat at the bar and were helped by Nirobe, who took excellent care of us! He was wonderful and engaging - we made a point to see him each time we went. We also dined upstairs one day and had a fabulous table by the window and another great server. The oysters are enormous and delicious. We will definitely be back our next time in Nola!

This was our spot before we went to Jazz Fest, and though we were looking for brunch, this place offered some delicious options that helped curb our hunger, and we were seated promptly. But first, the cocktails! The girls and I tried the Bloody Mary, Soco Mint Julep, and the Margarita. Those went down faster than our water. I tasted all three, and I would definitely order the Bloody Mary! Our table ordered the grilled chicken salad, catfish po boy, and I had the redfish beignets and seafood gumbo.

Overall, the food was good. My redfish beignets were great and a unique take on the original ones! I loved the sweet sauce that was drizzled over it, and I added some more Tabasco to add a little heat. While these beignets were a hit, my seafood gumbo was pretty bland. Nothing special, so I would move on and order something else. Friends enjoyed their meals, so either they were super hungry or they were as good as they said they were.

Given the busy-ness of the weekend, it was pretty tough to find a spot during the usual brunch hours, so this place was our last resort. I'd probably look elsewhere if it weren't for the longer wait times at other nearby establishments!

Very slow service.  It took us 20 minutes just to get a waiter, while all this time one of the waiters was reciting his life story to the table next to us.  The entire thing including how his family got to the US and how he wasn't born in New Orleans, but got there when he was very young so he felt like a native.  Finally someone showed up, but it took another 20 minutes to get our po-boys. The food was bad too. The bread was dry, the meat hard, and the shrimp had not been deveined.

They even messed up one of the tomato slices in the po-boy.  Three out of four were good, one slice was bad.  How do you mess up a slice of tomato?  All you have to do is a pick a good tomato and cut it.

Unfortunately, after waiting so long for the food, there was no point going somewhere else at that point.

great food and completely respectable service! though i don't eat seafood (i know, i know...) i ordered a french onion soup as an appetizer (yums!) and a burger with fries for my entree (double yums!). only downside was that the waitress forgot my friends' alcoholic beverages, even though she came around multiple times asking if we needed anything else. we didn't mind, it was late in the weekend and we were fine with sober bevvies. i recommend this place for its ambiance and friendly service staff but if you're looking for an oyster recommendation, unfortunately i cannot provide that...

Great food...Redfish blackened...redfish beignet...DELISH..
Our waitress, CINDY, was amazing!!

Food is okay. They didn't have the shrimp and grits because they were apparently out of grits. My wife ordered the oyster tacos... The server said you get three tacos. What you really get are three little slices like you would in a quesadilla. Not sure how this place has a four star rating. Service was good overall however.

great place!  The hidden part of this is that there was great view from the balcony you get of the great street preformers.  We really enjoyed the grilled oysters.  Upstairs the drinks are limited (odd.. can't they bring them up from downstairs)

Hello Friends,

I was wandering through the French Quarter looking for some good eats, when I found myself sitting upstairs at the Royal House Oyster House.  I immediately noticed the authentic New Orleans vibe complete with slow spinning fans, southern accents, jazzy tunes and porch seating.  Upon sitting I was quickly served by a dynamite waitress named Allison.  

While Allison was extremely familiar with the menu, to be expected for a server, her most impressive trait was answering any and all questions in a clear, concise, and polite manner.  I don't like to be bothered often while dining, but Allison seemed to  exhibit a spider-sense the exact moment I required assistance.  I was blown away by her explanation of  cooking protocol in regards to beignets, since in the Empire state we don't eat such things.  I ordered an out-of-character trio of redfish beignets, crawfish raviolis, and a Hurricane drink, a first for having all three, all flawlessly recommended by Allison.

I had think to myself, what did I do to deserve such great day service this day?  I chalked it up to good luck, so I took my chances and asked Allison out on a date.  Even in this embarrassing, awkward situation Allison smiled politely as always and said she was already taken.  Rats!

Sincerely,
Reggie

I had the fortunate misfortune of finding myself in this flawed establishment.  Word of mouth reached me that this was the place to go for authentic bayou cuisine.  The only thing authentic about their entrees was the salt, which they used liberally (by liberally I mean to excess).  I could feel my arteries clogging as I feasted on the Crawfish Etouffée, which seemed like a good idea but the gravy was lumpy, congealed fat which must have lingered in the back of their walk in refrigerator for over a week before reaching my plate.  

On the bright side, I did enjoy the beignets.  They were deep-fried to perfection and lightly dusted with powdered sugar.  The wait staff was delightful and filled to brim with that swampy charm I came to expect in the French Quarter.  I will not name names as that would be immature and unjustified.  Just know that they genuinely tried their best which is more than I can say for the vindictive chef who chose to punish my bowels.  

Laissez Bon Temps Roulet & Stay Away From the Etouffée, 

H. Hinkle
Good stuff. First time in New Orleans and we had a very good experience. Our server, John H., was knowledgeable, explained the dishes, and made terrific recommendations.

Like others, I came here when the line at Acme Oyster House was down the block. Sadly, it was the the wrong decision. 

My fries were cold and limp. The replacement order was every bit as cold and limp. The oysters in my fried oyster po boy were also cold. 

(Side note: the balcony upstairs is nice...but it does bounce when someone moves, which is SCARY!)

Oysters were mediocre. Nothing amazing. Didn't offer the red wine vinegar I like to have with my oysters. I would say Oyster House's oyster in Philly so much more tastier. Thats the least of my complaints. 

The worst part of this visit is that the service was terrible, hence the 2 stars. When we walked upstairs, there were 4+ waiter(s) sitting around complaining how they only served 7 tables in 4 hours. There was no one there to get us. Once we got a waitress after 15 mins of wait, when she found out we were only here fur the dozen oysters, her demeanor completely changed and she made it clear that she wasn't happy that we weren't sitting in fOR a meal. Terrible service. Immature behavior. Whether we get a drink or not or a meal, you treat your customers the same.

Great place with great seafood. Highly recommend the crab claws as everyone has. We accidently ordered the wrong kind of oysters but they kindly exchanged our order and apologized for our mistake. Good service.  Definitely recommend!

I would give this place three stars but the bartender Ryan was nice and made an awesome chocolate martini so I'll give you four stars.

My friend and I ordered the oyster duo which tasted good but Drago's is still my favorite. For my main dish I ordered the shrimp and grits which were meh. I've had better. My friend ordered the fried shrimp platter and thoroughly enjoyed it. It came with hush puppies and fries as well. But the creme de la creme was the bananas foster cheesecake! Man, it may not look good but it is party in your mouth food! Oh yeah!!

I won't mention names but our waitress was kind of ditzy and didn't really check on us. I had to flag her down for things which I hate doing. Maybe she had an off night. 

My friend told me there is balcony dining upstairs which would be great for daytime people watching. 

Oh and check in because Yelp has a free appetizer with purchase dealio!

Happy Quarter dining!

I am confident that this place has the WORST FOOD IN NOLA. The food is cold and greasy, the rice, the seafood, everything is just cooked from ready made frozen stuff. And it is overpriced. If you really want to go there, just order oysters and cocktails, nothing else. I paid overall $80 for dinner, I left the place hungry, disgusted and angry. This place is a tourist trap!

My husband's must. Have desert in NOLA is bananas foster. after two days of eating and walking our way through the Quarter we found that this menu had it.  We went and had dinner at another restaurant before and came back here to have desert.  The hostess told us it would be a 45 minutes wait,  we said not a problem, we just had dinner  we will just go for a stroll and come back in 20 she said , that would be great........ 20 min later we get back  hostess tells us she was looking for us, we can't be seated the kitchen is backed up, they are closing early,  we are like OMG.  She tells us it's not her call it is the managers.  Earlier in the eve about 5 or so we were walking past and my husband spoke to the mgr about bananas foster and asked when their kitchen closed.  When the hostess got the mgr, he remembered that he had seen us earlier and said that one two top wasn't gonna hurt them.  He took us to our tables and we had desert within 15 min.  I didn't give this restaurant 5 strs because we just had desert but if this sort of service is an indication of the attention they pay to everything else I cannot I,aging they are worth less than a 5 star rating.  I will go here each times visit NOLA even if just for desert:-)

We ate here after Jazz fest 5/6/2013... I wish I could give this place a .5. It was one of the worst places I have ever eaten in my entire life. I would eat some dirty street food before eating or drinking here again. First and foremost, we had the worst service, the fellow we had didn't even deserve a tip, his service was atrocious at best. We started with drinks I ordered a pear martini and my other ordered a bloody mary. The pear martini was made with the Worst tasting ingredients of all time and so much melon liquor that is all I could taste.  so bad. The bloody mary I am told was just as bad and overly salty. (We never got another drink because the server was too busy to wait on us and never again once throughout the entire meal asked if we wanted a water or another drink). We then ordered the spinach and artichoke dip which was actually very good, it is a very simple thing to make. Unfortunately, when the waiter took our drink order when he took our food order as well and we never saw him again until we were finished with our meals. I ordered the steak because I don't eat seafood. First mistake because it is USDA choice beef being the worst quality of beef with a better name. The steak came out under cooked, flavorless and cold. It said Cajun and creole, this is laughable!!! The sides were just as bad as the steak, cold and flavorless. My other ordered gumbo and oysters. The gumbo was flavorless and to his knowledge there was no seafood in a seafood gumbo. As horrible and repulsive as the oysters looked to me and my other half, he said they tasted fine and they didn't make him sick so that is all that matters. But if you could see oysters before you bought them we wouldn't of bought them because they looked like the lowest quality oysters ever. If our server would of came back and asked how our meal was I would of sent mine back and asked for nothing else. I ate about a quarter of a $30.00 steak when the server took my plate he didn't even ask if I was done or how my meal was. He took my others plate and again didn't ask him if he was done and he was in fact still eating. (this was again the first time we saw our waiter since he took our order and no other server checked on us through the entire meal). This place is a tourist trap that gets tourists with their balcony!!!) We tipped the dude $9.00 on a $100.00 bill but he didn't even deserve a dollar. I am one to tip very well when warranted,  if you are a good server and even if you are having a bad day and I can tell I still  tip well but if you give it no effort at all you deserve no tip!!! The food and service at this place are absolutely horrendous!!! Save your money and your time!!!!
Bad drinks. Bad service. Oysters on the half shell were warm. Yuck.

Walked in, sat at the bar, had 2 doz oysters in a half shell and a Bloody Mary. HANDS DOWN the BEST Bloody Mary I've ever had. The oysters were big and fresh, and the bartender(I think his name was Joseph) was very nice.
A wonderful experience all around.

My boyfriend and I were in New Orleans over Memorial Day weekend and went to Royal House based on a recommendation of friends who had been there a couple of months earlier.  We sat on the upstairs balcony the first day we arrived and had oysters, gumbo and stuffed mushrooms.  It was delish!  It was superb people watching from up there and the band playing on the street below was wonderful.  We ended up going back for dinner the next two nights and sitting at the bar.  We had great service and excellent food every time.  In addition to the raw oysters I would recommend the sauteed crab claws and the stuffed mushroom caps.  I can't wait to go back again the next time I'm in New Orleans!

Probably the best food i've had in New Orleans. Seriously. I was in a rush so i wish i would've been able to stay longer and enjoy it, but the food is delicious, the waiter was friendly and very helpful, the balcony seating was a thrill ( i loved it despite being scared of heights) it's a small space but it gave the full "visiting new orleans" effect.  I'll be going there again!
Very good oysters and seafood at reasonable prices.

Came here on a trip to New Orleans.  What drew me in was that they had fried alligator and and alligator poboy on the menu AND there was a yelp check in deal (buy 2 entrees and get a free appetizer up to $9.95).  

Service was pretty quick and friendly.  My boyfriend and i had originally ordered the alligator poboy, blackened shrimp jambalaya, crab claws, and the oyster maque choux (6 in an order).  Sadly, our server told us that they were out of the crab claws and apologized.  We then quickly switched the appetizer to the fried alligator instead of the crab claws and got the fried catfish poboy instead of the alligator poboy.

the food came out quickly.  The oysters maque choux were like little corn chowders with a whole oyster served in the oyster shell.  if you like oysters and chowder, this is really good.  it was pipping hot and the shells retained the heat.  the fried alligator was like popcorn chicken with the texture of pork.  i have to say, it was pretty awesome.  not gamey at all like some other alligator meat  i have tried (in California of course).

For the entrees, the fried catfish sandwich was just that....a fried fish sandwich.  only complaint  i have is that the bread was a little too toasted, but the fish was fried perfectly.  The jambalaya with blackened shrimp was awesome in flavor and texture.  my biggest complaint is that  i do not understand why there were 3 slices of bread on the top and a pickled whole pepperoncini in the middle for garnish.  this was not necessary and it looked like they were just throwing stuff on the plate.

Overall, i liked it and was most impressed with the oysters (i like chowdah).  price is probably a little high but it is touristy, so it is to be expected

Real Good!
Found on Yelp. 

This was my first full day going into the night in NOLA. Me and my friend wanted to try a few things so we got some Jumbaliah (I'm sure I spelled that wrong), we got 3 kinds and I got some seafood pasta.

We also checked-in on Yelp and with 2 meal orders got a free appetizer. I believe it was called crab claws and came with some bread. The sauce was amazing, I wanted more!!! It was recommended to us as well.

The mild Jumbaliah was my favorite as I don't do super spicy to well. But my friend loved my pasta cause it was spicy but still delicious for me too.

We got a couple drinks and a couple beers. The drinks were strong but had a great taste to them. I got the Hurricane, wanted something fresh to start the day. Great choice.

The mood in the restaurant was great, modern, felt fresh, but still had that NOLA vibe. When I get back to NOLA I'm coming back here.

Also, the bartender/chef recommend some other places to check out and wrote them down for us. Great service

I really liked this place!  It was recommended to us, and we were not disappointed.  It's right in the middle of the French Quarter and has great ambience.  The food was fresh ad arrived quickly although the place was packed.  I can't say enough good things about our waitress - one of the best we've ever had.   She helped guide us through our selections and checked on us periodically without being annoying.  We will definitely come here again the next time we're in NOLA.

For the reviews to be so high, I was expecting grade A food. But It was more like grade C+. We ordered the alligator appetizer and it was chewing and unappealing. I wouldn't order it again.

I ordered the Oyster Po Boy and it was okay. I have had better oysters in DC. And the sandwich was basic. Nothing to really make the flavors pop.

My friend ordered the char-grilled oysters and that was actually pretty damn good. If I were to come back, that would be the only thing I would have to order.

Our waitress was pretty sweet. For some reason the restaurant doesn't carry remoulade sauce so she made some for me. :) That was super nice of her. I would give service here 5 stars.

Excellent food! The oysters were so big they wouldn't fit on our crackers! The crab claw appetizer was phenomenal! Only leaving off one star because service was only ok. Would eat here again if coming back to the French quarter.

Found this place at about 10pm on a Friday night because of its high Yelp ratings.  Visiting New Orleans we wanted a taste of some Louisiana shrimp with some Cajun spice to it.  We ordered one thing which was Cajun Peel-and-Eat shrimp.  The waitress came back with our order moderately fast.  
As far as the quality of our order of Peel-and-Eat shrimp: half of the shrimps were over-cooked (somewhat mushy behind the shell); the Cajun spices were way too salty;  the order was supposed to be served with corn-on-the-cobb and potatoes, but only came with potatoes (the waitress did not even mention why there wasn't any corn with the order, I had to point that out).  When the waitress finally came back with 1/2 of an ear of corn, she said "sorry it was still boiling."   The corn was soft and mushy on the outside and still frozen in the middle (cold!). 
Because of this experience, I wouldn't trust the freshness of their ingredients or bother to come back here again.  
I would give this one star if it wasn't for the decent response time by our waitress.

Had lunch and the grilled oysters and crawfish ettofee.  Ettofee was unimpressive.  Venue and service was great.   Food just  OK.  The balcony  are is great.  A little hot I'm summer but fun to watch the action below.  Go for venue not for the the food.

Had a great experience here, on the balcony. A plus was an awesome duo on the corner right across the street below us who played as we ate. Fresh oysters on the half shell were sweet and briny and very reasonably priced. The Cajun red fish entree was superb, our waiter friendly. The wine menu is bit limited for a restaurant of this calibre.

After an afternoon of walking around the French Quarter, we stopped by Royal House for a light lunch. The sun had been beating down on us for a few good hours soaking up our huge appetites, but we needed a small nosh as a pick me up. We ended up choosing the crab claws and a side salad for our meals. I was a bit disappointed that the server wouldn't acknowledge our yelp coupon after we had "checed-in." It was a free appetizer, and apparently even though we ordered two of the crab claw appetizers he still wouldn't grant us that. Oh well....

The ambiance was just OK. I wasn't too happy with the table we had since it was situated right by the kitchen's swinging doors and servers frequently had to stop by to close the doors to the bustling kitchen. 

The food on the other hand was good. I could have had a crisper/colder salad and not room temp. But, the crab claws served with garlic toast points won me over. They were smothered in a creole buttery sauce that had me licking my fingers and plate! 

Given the name, I'm sure the oysters are wonderful. I just couldn't try them out given I am six months pregnant. There is always next time!

The crab claws and chargrilled oysters were AMAZ-BALLZ!   Warning:  the crab claws are a bit on the salty side for me, but the flavors were so unique, robust and delicious that it was easy to look past it.

I was not a fan of the Oysters Rockefeller -- they were dry/overcooked and didn't do the oysters justice.

What a beautiful restaurant! I would ask to sit upstairs on the patio or at least by the patio. Food was good & they had a variety. Our server was friendly and constantly checked in with us, which I liked.

I had alligator here for the first time & the batter tasted okay. Gator is a bit gamey as I expected, but it was nothing special. Oysters were okay...I've had better in Seattle.

Pretty decent food though a bit pricey if you ask me. I had the blackened red fish and my husband had their taste of New Orleans dish with étouffée, gumbo, and jambalaya...we also had the stuffed crab claws and they were amazing! I think we will be back the next time we are in the area.

This is our first time here.  I ordered the redfish blacken.  It was decent.  The fish was very charred on one side. Almost inedible. There was no sauce to accompany the fish.  I had to take my piece of lemon from my water and add more flavor to it.    My potatoes were tasty and so was the green string beans.  My husband got the New Orleans sampler.  It was three bowls of different types of jambalaya or gumbo.  Not as feeling as we thought.  We received a free banana foster's cheesecake for dessert.  At first, we were not sure what it was.  It had two scoops of cheese cake on the left and right side of a piece of pumpkin/banana spiced bread slice.  It was engorged in a thick syrup that was sweet and cinnamon flavor.  there were small slices of very thin mushy bananas.  It was interesting to say the least.  Our bill was a little over $50 with tips.

excellent place. decor is very nice (love the windows). Our server Richard was very good and attentive. My wife had the oyster rocks and I had the taste of New Orleans (combo of all thing New Orleans) all very good. Truly a good time. Left feeling like I scored a great meal.

The Seafood Pescatore was absolutely fabulous! This dish is seafood heaven and gives you a little taste of everything. It's not too filling (considering it's a pasta) and the shellfish is fresh. My bartender/server was great and I just so happened to get there just in time for my favorite NOLA seasonal beer...Abita Strawberry! Yum! I will definitely stop by this gem the next time I'm wandering through the French Quarter.

Got to sit outside on the upstairs balcony, while a really fantastic band played in the street below us, and the sun set behind us. Really pretty, and good atmosphere. The service was very good, our server was always nearby when we needed him and we received everything quickly.

Our food was excellent, we started with the grilled oysters and oh my god, they were the best oysters I've ever had and were gone way too quickly. Our main dish was the seafood pot, with boiled clams and mussels and a whole lobster. It was pretty standard, but still really delicious creole flavor. After finishing that we were still hungry so we ordered the crab claw appetizers as a final dish, and WOW it was fantastic, we practically licked the plate clean of sauce with the bread they gave us.

Tonight had a great dinner with exceptional service. Chargrilled oysters awesome. Blackened red fish was moist and well seasoned. Kids had the catfish po'boy and platter. The catfish melted in your mouth.   Waiter was very friendly and helpful. Great eating experience all around.

This was the first restaurant we tried in the French Quarter and it was a let down. 

One of the things I wanted to try while in New Orleans were chargrilled oysters. So I ordered the Oysters maque choux. The hubby ordered the shrimp creole. Place was pretty pricey. Oysters were $2 each and no they didn't fill me up at all. My husband liked the shrimp creole, but it was a small portion for the price. We were both hungry at the end of the meal. 

I was so looking to the food in New Orleans, but nothing really measured up. In retrospect I should have ordered the gumbo here and the oysters at the Acme Oyster House. Or I should have gone with the raw oysters. More bang for your buck.

In our group we had the crab claw, fried shrimp, fried oysters, a dozen oysters, and banana bread. The crab claw appetizer is recommendable. The oysters the biggest I've ever had, and very fresh, but more on the mild side. The fried stuff were also fresh but the batter much too salty. The Bloody Mary could also have been so delicious but again was overly salty. Good ambience and great service.

We come to New Orleans every few months and have something of a routine when we arrive.
We throw our suitcases into our room (we live in Alberta,Canada), jam flip flops onto our feet and head straight to the Royal House...and order the crab claws. 
Every. Single. Time. 
Crab Claws. 
Seriously.
If you happen to see two tattoo'd Canadians eating crab claws in flip flops...that's us.
Crab Claws.
Just came home from 8 days, over Halloween, in NOLA. We managed crab claws on 2 occasions. Yum.
Crab claws.
Ben was great!! We came from out of town and he recommended the best items. Loved the fried alligator and crab claws. The oysters were great as well

Went to New Orleans for Jazzfest and decide eat at Royal House. There was a slight wait but I was in good company so it didn't seem very long. I had the oysters (big and plump) both on the half shell and chargrilled and the Taste of New Orleans which includes andouille jambalaya, crawfish etouffee and seafood gumbo. Everything I had was great. Our waiter was extremely nice and helpful. The tables were a tight fit but made for a vibrant and lively atmosphere. Everyone at my table loved their food and thought I made a great selection in picking Royal House Oyster Bar for late dining. I will visit again!

The food at this place was GOOD, the shrimp etouffee was very delicious. Spicy, flavorful, plenty of shrimp, and perfectly cooked rice. My mom had fish, with well-seasoned sauteed vegetables (I wanted to try some, but I didn't want to risk the hand, so I think it's a sign that it met her standards), and Parmesan-roasted potatoes, they just arrived on the plate, no fanfare on the menu, just these amazing potatoes, that we'll probably have to get on a plane to taste in again in life. 

But the service really took the cake. Our waiter, man I'm cursing myself for forgetting his name, if the managers/owners read this, please give this guy a bonus, he was a brown-skinned African-American guy with a beard, probably between 22-27 with great friendly smile. But he was very attentive, helpful, warm and familiar, which is something we come to love about the people of New Orleans. He really took care of us. It was our last meal before we left and he left such a great impression. I mean all of the staff was pleasant, but he was the bomb.com.

Our waiter was friendly and knowledgeable.  The dish he recommended was the chargrilled oysters which were simply incredible and a great value when compared to other restaurants in the French Quarter.  The raw oysters were plump and sweet, also a great value.  The oysters stuffed with seafood dressing was also very good.

Although unassuming in appearance, don't miss this place when in the French Quarter.

There is a poem by Lewis Carrol that states,

'O Oysters,' said the Carpenter,
'You've had a pleasant run!
Shall we be trotting home again?'
But answer came there none --
And this was scarcely odd, because
They'd eaten every one.
===========================================

A friend wanted oysters.  It was the closest to my place in the quarter.  So we, as walruses and carpenters, jaunted on our merry way.  They offer many types of oyster options.  We were on a time crunch, so we went raw and salads with wine.  The service was average.  Our server knew the food well enough, but did not really suggest matching wines.  The house chardonnay was aggressive and austere.  The rose on the other hand was decent and the sweet red I had was of similar standing.  The oysters were fine.

chris sat us down - she was one of the most friendly hostesses, we've met.
benjamin f. was our waiter - he was not only cute, but excellent. he made thoughtful recommendations, and answered dumb questions like they were smart ones.

hubby had the shrimp platter with fries. excellent. fresh shrimp, tasty fries. i had the shrimp creole over rice. my first shrimp creole and i totally enjoyed it. the rice was perfect.

the homemade bread pudding was to die for. hubby who doesn't eat bread pudding, ate more than his share, it was SO good.

if we'd had more time in NOLA, would've come here again.

Nice restaurant in the French Quarter.  We had the oyster, the alligator po-boy, and a combo (gumbo, etoufee, etc), and Mac N Cheese.  All dishes are good given the price, and service is good.  Unfortunately, there is a little ratatouille running around the dinning room (more like a mouse), and although it's quite cute, it's giving us a little concerns.  We understand that French Quarter is old and mouse is pretty common, so I would not be deterred to go simply because of this.  However, this does take the rating down a notch or two - I would give it 4-5 stars if the little friend did not frequent the dinning area.

Our French Quarter Walking Tour met in front of this restaurant, and we decided to eat here afterward since it was convenient, and our tour guide recommended it. It was a great choice!!

We requested to sit on the balcony, for the full NOLA experience. Tiny, narrow balcony, and the tables sit slanted. :) It was fun though, and we didn't have issues with our dishes staying put.

I received a Yelp offer since I checked in, so we got our red fish beignets for free!! Awesome! I'd heard of seafood beignets...not sure how they'd taste, but it was amazing! Slightly sweet dough, perfectly fried, savory sauce drizzled on top.

I wasn't too hungry, from all the walking in the heat and humidity. So I ordered a half-dozen chargrilled oysters with parmesan. Oh my God...one of the best things I've eaten! This was the first time I've had oysters that weren't fried...or out of a can (bleh). So I was a little wary...still haven't had them raw. But they were tender, and the taste wasn't over-bearing...paired perfectly with the parmesan! And the service was great! Would definitely eat there again!

This place was a big disappointment.  I had read a number of good reviews and decided to take the family.  It was at maybe 3/4 capacity on a July Friday night and we didn't have to wait more than a few minutes to get a table.  Considering that it wasn't packed, service was consistently slow throughout the evening.  Our waiter was about a 4 on a 1-10 scale; not bad but not good either.  Oysters were good and drinks were fine.  Entrees however, were marginal.   3 out of our 4 entrees were lukewarm, and had probably been sitting for at least 10 minutes.  My creole shrimp was just plain bland in my opinion.  My fiancees shrimp etoufee, while lukewarm,  was good until she pulled up some kind of plastic wrapper trash from it.  I sent both back and they were replaced with now hot food.  The shrimp creole was just as bland when hot, but the shrimp etoufee was really good.  After some minor wrangling the floor manager gave us a 25% break on the check.  I don't think I'll be coming back for a second try however.  There are too many good alternatives in this town to go back.

Been a couple times, the charbroiled oysters will make you fall in love with oysters even if you've always hated them, trust me! The host at the door is always pretty good at getting us a place to sit and eat,very nice,the actual servers/waiters are not that great. The food is ok,well their gumbo I didn't care for,and I love gumbo, I had a fresh salad that was not so fresh but the manager brought me out a fresher one and took it off my tab(that's good service) overall the oysters is what kept me going back,they are freaking amazing,I guess with it being an oyster place I can't really expect them to be the best at other foods but they definitely perfected the oysters

Our entire experiece at royal house was excellent. Our waitress was the sweetest women I have ever met, and I feel horrible because I can not remember her name. We ordered a dozen raw oysters and an order of fried alligator- both amazing especially with the waitresses recommendation of hot sauce on the oysters. Then we ordered shrimp and grits and the Louisiana trio- all of which completely delicious. My only regret is that we were only here for a day and a half and only ate here once! We will definitely return in the future.

I went there for a third time on a recent trip to NOLA and wasn't let down.  I always get oysters and boiled shrimp and they are some of my favorite!  My fiancé got the blackened chicken sandwich and it was delicious.  The only let down was their spinach and artichoke dip.  I wouldn't get that again.  Oh - make you get a bloody Mary!  They are delicious!

Been here a couple times.  Good atmosphere.  Good food.  A little pricy for the quality, but worth it for the A/C and great service.  Wait staff is very friendly.  Worth trying if you want some local fare.

I came here on Monday afternoon for a bloody mary and air-conditioning.  The bloody marys here were pretty damn tasty-- but I think NOLA just has a knack for them.  My friend and I decided to share some oysters-- so we got the chargrilled oysters and the oyster duo (rockefeller and royale oysters).  The chargrilled oysters were delicious-- drenched in garlicky butter and grilled perfectly.  The rockefeller and royale oysters had too much going on that it overpowered the taste of the oyster itself.  They tasted good but I regretted not just going for the raw oysters.

The roast beef po-boy was fantastic and the gumbo gmade my southern boy roots very happy!  The waiter Johnny was fantastic and truly knew the history of the area.  I highly recommend it!!!  The prices are very reasonable, especially for the quality.
Had some great fried gator for an app. Then I had the sampler --the gumbo was excellent! Everything we expected.

Great location in the center of the French Quarter!
Food was delicious,Oysrer duo as an appetizer and catfish po-boy and shrimp po-boy are awesome!service very prompt and friendly!

This was one of the best dining experiences I had on my vacation. The food and service here were OUTSTANDING!

I started off with a Big Easy Iced Tea, which was delicious (I like my drinks on the sweet side, so if that's not your thing, you may not like this one). Also had the crab claw appetizer, and the sauce on it was so good I wish I could bathe in it. I ordered the shrimp and grits as my entree, and I believe there is not a more perfect dish to be had. You HAVE to order this one!

Our waiter Dominic was very friendly and knowledgeable and gave some great recommendations. Without exaggeration, I can say he was the best waiter on our whole trip.

I wish I could eat at this place all the time. Seriously, you have to go here.

found this place when woke up starving from a longer than expected nap.  They are open until 11pm which was great since most others i found in the area closed at 10pm on a saturday.  

we were seated promptly after arriving and our waiter John was very nice and knew so much history about the area and city.  
The oysters duo and def must have
the crab claws sounded really tasty but when they arrived, was really salty
the blacken red fish was delicious and cooked to perfection
the shrimp creole also delicious

tip, check in on YELP and get a free appetizer :-)
Best meal we had in the French Quarter!  Our waitress, Tina, was fantastic...she suggested some dishes and they were all so good!  We will definitely be back!

Ryan is a cool and friendly bartender. Victoria is also a great manager who makes an effort to talk to most of the customers who come in.

Food quality, though, is sooo inconsistent to me. I've had excellent dishes such as the sauteed crab claws, bananas foster cheesecake, shrimp creole, and BLT-O poboy (a BLT with fried oysters). Some of the not-so-good include the redfish beignets, gumbo, the oysters royale, and their jambalaya (no flavor at all).

I do love dining in the Quarter as you can dine on a balcony at most French Quarter establishments. The Royal House has balcony dining and it adds a nice touch to the experience on a nice day.

On a pretty day it is hard to beat lunch here with a Bloody Mary, some sauteed crab claws, a BLT-O, and bananas foster cheesecake while sitting on the balcony people-watching.

Cindy was awesome! She taught us how to eat a po-boy New Orleans style. The servings of the roast beef and catfish po-boys were huge and very tasty.  Everyone there made us feel welcome the moment we walked in.  We will definitely return when we are back in NOLA.

Yummy! The locals recommended this place. I asked a few locals where they ate and they all said that this was the place. We started off with the crab legs in a creamy sauce (OMG!) my Bloody Mary was amazing... I love the atmosphere...the staff was SO happy & sweet...the food was AMAZING (IE; AUTHENTIC)...I had the the Taste of New Orleans & my fellow diner had the Shrimp Creole (I kept stealing his shrimp...SO GOOD)....I highly recommend this local favorite. Also....we had the Banana Jubilee cheesecake...SOOOO amazing.........By the way...Marco was our waiter and he was so sweet & helpful & patient for this green (to New Orleans) tourist. Felt like I was at home!

Hubby and I dropped by to get a couple drinks two nights ago. We were totally grossed out by the cook behind the bar shucking oysters, taking bar orders and handling money.  He didn't even change his gloves after touching oysters with his gloved hand, then handling money, then handling oysters again.  I even saw an oyster fall onto a dirty menu. The cook picked the oyster up, put it back in the shell, and back on a plate to be served.  I wouldn't eat here.

What a great place! It's right off bourbon street on a quaint corner. We had a spirited group of 6. They have us our own table upstairs with awesome views. Our waiter Chris was fantastic! Not only did he give awesome food recommendations, but also took the time to write out nightlife and NOLA recommendations in general. Perfect first night with fun friends and great service! Thank you Chris
Chris is the best! Ask for him, he is really knowledgeable about the menu and the area. Possibly one of the best servers ever! Really goes above and beyond!
Best, unassuming oyster house in NOLA. Ridiculously good grilled oysters with a guy at the bar who is more than willing to teach you how to shuck.  Fabulous!!!

I always appreciate it when the business is monitoring it's reviews. Thank you for the response and for talking to staff about this experience. With that said, based on other reviews and your response, I would give this restaurant another chance. Thank you for keeping up with customer comments! (I base most of my experiences in a new town on Yelp reviews)

Decided to try the Royal House on a recent visit to NOLA.  Got to the restaurant around 7:30 and, after some confusion by the hostess, were seated on the balcony. Beautiful summer night.  We decided to treat ourselves to an Oysters Rockerfeller appetizer-hey, were in NOLA.  I ordered the shrimp and grits(first time) and my wife ordered the jambalaya with blackened shrimp. After a fairly long wait, we got the appetizer.  Flavor and size of the oysters were great-however, it seemed that the oysters were kept under the broiler just a bit too long and were a little dry and crusty.  On the other hand, the shrimp and grits was great-cheesy, creamy with 8 large shrimp on top. Ditto for the jambalaya-blackened shrimp were standouts. My wife had a Bloody Mary and I ordered a local beer.  Bloody Mary was one of the best my wife ever had-should be for $10. My local beer was poured out of a bottle and was $6-not a great value.  I did notice a large black beetle crawling out of a crack and thankfully(for it) it never made it to our table.  Service was good-although I got the impression that the servers aren't exactly thrilled with the balcony area.  Overall, a good experience.

We have been to the Royal House several times and the food and service is always excellent! On our last visit, our server Tina was AMAZING! My ice tea glass never went below half full. She was wonderful to talk to and I miss her already!

The French Onion Soup is the BEST in NOLA!!!
Amir! Be still my heart... that was an amazing dirty Gibson! And so were the second, third, and fourth ones! It could be dangerous having such amazing martinis just footsteps from work...

I cannot say enough good things about this place.  Excellent food, beautiful location, wonderful staff!   Perhaps the best thing is the Bloody Mary!   The absolute best in NOLA.  Just the right amount of spice and vodka.  

I love this place.

Royal House was a surprise!  Just steps from our hotel, the food was excellent and the service from Cindy was stellar!

Shrimp and grits.... Excellent
Red fish beignets....excellent
French Onion soup.  Best ever!

I loved this place, we set at the bar with Jeff and had the Crab Claws and they were awesome! I also reccomend the Oysters Rockefeller, and the Grilled Oysters...outstanding.  This place is a good as Acme and it is a lot nicer.

Atmosphere for a great dinner date is recommend. The specialty drinks are ok. Love the overall food and great customer service. For my first time being in New Orleans I have to say this food was great.

Walking down the streets of the French Quarter is a must.
Enjoying a New Orleans meal is a must.
Having it at the Royal is a must. Ask to be seated up stairs.
Derrick our server was extremely attentive and made our experience a treat.
He added in providing drink and wonderful appetizer suggestions.  Needles to say we had a fantastic time at the Royal House.  
-Thank you Derrick!
You must absolutely get the chargrilled oysters!!! Food heaven!

You must stop here if you want a great view of the french quarter, a delicious lunch and unforgettable adult beverage!

Stopped here for lunch after doing a yelp search for the best po-boys in the area. Well, this was absolutely fabulous! I had an alligator po-boy and it was delicious - everything was perfect, without too much bread or breading and the right amount of condiments and greens. 

Not only that - the bar made the best Tom Collins I have ever had! It was fresh, not made with overly sweet and processed sweet and sour mix - just fresh citrus.

Walking through the French Quarter & we were wooed by Ms. Cindy...the Redfish Beignets, Crab Claws and the Chargrilled Oysters were mind-blowing and amazing.  The southern hospitality was genuine and authentic.  We experienced and tasted true New Orleans today.  Thank you Royal House!!!

Redfish Beignets and the shrimp and grits were delicious! They honored the yelp offer and they were really quick with the service.  My glass never went empty.  Overall nice experience.  I will be back to sit upstairs!

My fiancé and I are first timers to NOLA. We came with some friends who have been several times before & raved about the food in this city, especially Royal House's oysters. That was our first stop after getting settled into our hotel and needless to say, they were right----the charbroiled oysters were mouth watering good! So buttery, cheesy and delicious. We also ordered a trio of jambalaya, crawfish etoufee and, I think, shrimp creole which was amazingly tasty as well. We'll be back for more grub this trip for sure!

I had to check the photos of this place to ensure that I was reviewing the right place. I'm confused as to why the reviews are so high here. The service is not bad, but the food is rough. Like bar food rough. 

I tried the fried alligator here, it wasn't bad, but it certainly couldn't be considered good. Their version "shrimp creole" was awful. The rice was hard/unevenly cooked and the shrimp were drowned in this tomato based sauce which was essentially canned tomato paste mixed in w/ Italian stewed canned tomatoes. Find out for yourself if need be, but I wish I didn't spend any money here.

I came here with friends because Acme Oyster House had a massive line out front. I'm so glad we did!

The food was great and our waitress was hilarious. I ordered the chargrilled oysters and a cup of seafood gumbo. The gumbo was fine (very very rice heavy, even for gumbo), and the oysters were very good. We also got a crab leg appetizer, which wasn't quite what we thought (I was thinking cracking-size-crab-legs, but these were the little dipping kind)-- though that didn't much matter, since it was free with a yelp check in, and was admittedly very very good.

I'd go back!

The chargrilled oysters were a religious experience. After having those, I thought I'd be in for a let-down in the raw oysters. Boy was I wrong. I really don't know which ones I like better. These were clearly the best oysters I've ever had in New Orleans. Great service to boot!

Cute traditional place
Staff is nice
Drinks were but pricey than the competitors in the area
Gumbo was okay
Jambalaya was good

This is going to be your decent, overpriced but nice enough, touristy oyster bar. Don't expect miracles, but expect great service and high prices to match. 
I'm all about the older, more traditional establishments, but the whole experience felt like I'd fallen into the tourist trap of eating at the corner restaurant and getting taken for a ride when the check came. I'm not usually one to complain about high prices, but don't go here for a Po' Boy if you're actually a po' boy and can't hang with the $13 sandwich. Go down the street to Johnny Po Boys and get yourself a nice 8 dollar sandwich and spend the rest on a drink somewhere.
I had the oysters (they were good, though I preferred Acme by a long shot) and the boyfriend had the BLT-O, which I think was seriously a $17 sandwich. It wasn't very impressive by any means.
The service was awesome, very old-school and totally delightful. Overall, I wouldn't come back here when there are so many other great options within walking distance. However, I hear they have great mixed drinks, so maybe if I just wanted oysters and drinks in that specific location, it wouldn't be such a bad choice.

We ended up here thanks to the recommendation of a friend after a rather disappointing experience with Acme, so glad we did! The food here is excellent, the drinks are good and the service was great, this place is also much smaller and far less commercial than acme, which suited us just fine.!
We were running late eating and had to be at a show at Harrah's so when we sat down we told our waiter of our plight, he was more than accommodating and had us out the door in time. The charbroiled oysters were wonderful as well as the crabclaws and Alligator bites. We will definitely head back here long before we go back to acme.

This place is a waaaay overrated. All you get is mediocre deep fried bar food and terrible room temperature oysters -- and they don't even bother cleaning the mud out of the oyster shells. This was the only bad meal I had in my 4 days in New Orleans. If you want oysters, go to Acme Oyster House. Save your money and skip this place.

Are the drinks overpriced as a few others have said?  Yes...but what isn't in the French Quarter?  If I'm going to be overcharged, then I expect great service and fantastic food and drinks.  That is exactly what we received.  We ended up here after being discouraged by the line at Acme Oyster House, and I'm glad that we did.  We ordered a shrimp and tortellini dish, and the shrimp and grits.  The shrimp and grits was delicious and definitely the best choice.  I've been dreaming of it almost daily since returning home from our trip.  And the bloody mary, it was the best bloody mary that I have ever tasted.  I don't give out 5 stars too often because I feel that something is usually lacking...taste, service, etc.  But this was a 5 star visit and we will definitely return when we visit New Orleans again.

Went last night with a group of 12 sat upstairs it's a nice room a bit loud. We orders two apps (artichoke dip and tomatoes with mozzarella- smaller portion then most places the crowd at the table said) and a half dozen  oysters (charbroiled on the half shell). 

4- people got the shrimps and grits and licked their plates pretty clean so I would recommend that for a New Orleans style dish. I got the crawfish étouffée- pretty good- good size portion for most entrees. Others tried the ribeye that was tasty and cooked well. 

All-in-all for first time experience was a success. We also received 15% for being New Orleanians

I loved this place. The gumbo was amazing. I got the fried alligator, oysters, and taste of new orleans. Ask for patio seating. It's a great view. The patio is only possible for parties of 2 though. Loved it. Best restaurant on our visit.

Our waitress was nice, but the food was disappointing.

The seasoned cornmeal breading on the Fried Alligator was tasty enough, but the meat was tough and on the dry side.

We ordered the Blackened Shrimp and Jambalaya.  The shrimp was bland.  Not only was it not blackened, it barely had any spices or SALT.  Judging by the transluscent color, the oddly bouncey texture and lack of shrimp flavored, we think they used frozen shrimp... which was a bit shocking since shrimp is a popular local ingredient, and this is a seafood restaurant.

The jambalaya tasted ok but it was barely warmed.  We understand that it would not be made to order, but it should have been reheated to the same temperature as the shrimps that were laying on top, not the cold plate below.

I don't like to write low scored reviews, but these issues do not feel like a flucke (like the regular chef was out.)  I don't want another traveller to waste a meal here when there are so many great places that New Orleans has to offer.

Great environment, great service and absolutely amazing seafood! Marcos was our server and gave us the best welcome to so many newbies. We did oysters, fried alligator, crawlfish ravioli, crawlfish linguini and much much more. Thank you Royal House for making this an excellent time!!!!
The chargrilled oysters were AMAZING. Hot, buttery, Parmesan cheesy deliciousness. I highly recommend them.

Last night in NOLA. I wasn't impressed. I had the crawfish étouffée and my friend had the roast beef po boy. Lousy and cheap. The service was great and friendly. The oysters looked amazing. Heard they were delicious. Disappointed and want my last night redo.

We had a great time here. The staff was really friendly and helpful. Our waitress even recommended some off-the-beaten-track attractions to check out. The bananas foster cheesecake was out of this world, and the crawfish cakes were very tasty. And it doesn't hurt that they also offer balcony dining!
Good food. Good service. Nice place. A little noisy, not just from the street, They left the tv on and up even after the big game was over. Listening to commercials detracted from the ambiance a bit.

It's ok but you can do better in the area.  The plus is they are open until 11pm.  We went in late and the place was pretty stinky of seafood in the trash piling up behind the bar.  I would walk over a few streets to Iberville and hit the oyster houses over there.

The food was good, the service was GREAT!!! Our waitress took great care of us,  was on top of everything.  Someone in out party wasn't feeling well, she picked up on that, and went out of her way as much as she could.  The French onion soup was fabulous,  I would have preferred a little less salt but none the less, great!

A bit of a tourist trap--evident by the host/ess out front often calling to tourists--but can't really fault them for benefiting from a great location (and the fact that much of the French Quarter appears to be a tourist trap).

My wife and I were immediately drawn to the prospect of balcony dining, and although quite narrow, it totally satisfied our tourist-y desire to suck down oysters on the half shell while overlooking the historic streets of the French Quarter.  Sadly, I was pretty surprised/disappointed with the etouffee, my only prior experience from Da Levee in Columbus, which pretty much set me up for failure.  Here, it was unremarkably bland--or should that be remarkably bland?  Whatever, it was bland, and not the flavor blast of soulful comfort in my mouth I had been hoping for and remembered from Da Levee.  On a happier note, my wife's ravioli were much more satisfying (the sauce was comparatively delicious).

The real treat here appears to be their fried platters and po' boy monstrosities.  When i spied our fellow balcony diners' fried platters, I briefly envisioned the proverbial straw that breaks the camel's back--here, I guess that'd be the fried shrimp that makes the balcony go all Mexican soccer stadium.

Overall, a good spot for some oysters and a quick drink if you're loitering around this particular part of the French Quarter.

I really dig Royal Street, so why would I not dig Royal House?

We stopped in for an "afternoon snack" aka oysters and bellied up to the bar for them. The oysters were crisp and fresh, with a side of cocktail sauce served separate from the horseradish (I notice some places pre-mix it). 

What better to order than a Bloody Mary with my oysters? It was good and spicy. I noticed they actually soak their vodka in a large carafe with peppers, so you know it's gonna have a kick! I love the pickled green bean accent on top of the green olive and celery. 

After having so many oyster platters, I did notice that these had a lot of grime on the bottom. Like sand/rocks/mud etc. I mean, I know they're dug out from the ground, but maybe clean them up a bit? Just a friendly suggestion:)

Oh no...I hate to give this place such a bad review.  Obviously others had it better than we did tonight.  On our 4 year wedding anniversary at that!  

Arrived and was seating RIGHT next to the hostess stand.  Ugh, ok whatever.  Than I feel water dripping on me...look up...condensation falling from the dirty a/c vent.  Oh no no no...I tell the hostess that we want a different table, instead she pushes the table over to where my husbands chair is 1/4 inch away from falling off the little step onto the side walk.  We put in our order and we were able to get the 1/2 dozen oysters with the yelp offer for an appetizer so that is cool.  Husband orders the shrimp platter and I order the "Taste of New Orleans"  We are waiting...and waiting...and I feel another drip...oh hell no!  So finally I just wait till I see them clear a table...than our food comes, but wait, we haven't had our oysters yet! omg, so we grab our plates and move, no help from any waiter/waitress/or bus boy.  Fine, we sit and start to eat.  IT'S COLD!  Like my husbands fries had been sitting out for a good 20 min.  Oh and still no oysters at this point.

We told our waitress and she took the food.  More waiting...still no oysters.  Hot food finally comes out and so do the oysters.  Ice half melted under the oysters, served with some cocktail sauce, horseradish and 1 sliver of lemon.  I had to ask for more lemon.  Oysters tasted ok but were really dirty on the bottom.  Hubby said his shrimp platter was nothing special.  Had better fried shrimp earlier in the day on a po boy.  My jambalaya was pretty good, the etouffee was ok and the gumbo was not very good.  Really watery and had a weird flavor.  And than to top it all off...saw a big ass cockroach running around on the floor.  FUN!

Our waitress was nice, running around like crazy.  They weren't very organized, kitchen got backed up big time, no "sorry" from the manager, no free dessert or anything.  Our waitress did say sorry like a million times though.  Won't be coming back here.

I went here alone one evening for a light dinner or oysters and a side of jambalya. I thought the atmosphere was nice, a little cramped and crowded but full of character and great street views. The waitstaff seemed young and inexperienced but totally accommodating and pleasant. They recommended things to me and were very attentive. The oysters were delicious, perfectly cooked not raw, not chewy. The jambalaya was delicious as well.
Really good food. Quick super friendly service. Casual but kinda pricey

I was looking for a place to get a true taste of New Orleans before heading out and this was absolutely perfect.  Amazing food, truly impressive service, and the ideal ambiance. We will definitely be making this a required stop when in New Orleans.

Went there with my sister on a Wednesday for a late lunch. Yes, it's touristy but we didn't mind. Enjoyed sitting upstairs on the balcony overlooking Royal Street. I ordered shrimp and grits, and she had a poboy. Both were good, and our waiter was great (too bad I don't remember his name...)

I think I was too hungry to really enjoy this meal because I devoured it in minutes. Catfish po'boy was flaky and buttery with little seasoning, my cocktail washed it down perfectly. My co-workers enjoyed a shrimp and soup special. The gumbo was supposedly fantastic. Ambiance is quaint, we were seated by the indoor/outdoor patio next to a lobster tank. Great for people watching.
Ate a bunch of appetizers and tried most. The food was good but the atmosphere dampened the experience. The place wasn't very clean and the waiter talked way too much.

Very disappointed.  Our last night and celebrating a birthday.  We had a party of 9.  4 of our entrees came out cold.  Poor customer service.  Even the manager didn't apologize.  He asked "which one of you had problems with your food?"  He did offer some discount.  But that didn't make up for customer service.  He acted like we were an inconvenience to him.
I would recommend this place.  The food was good and our waitress was awesome and super nice!!   Plus you get a free apetizer if you check in on yelp. yum...fried alligator.

Just okay for the price you pay.  Good location and street side seating.  So so service.  Tiny cups of soup for 6 dollars a piece. Crab louis salad = small pile of greens with crumbles of over fried, undetectable crab meat.  We asked our server what the corn side dish was and his answer was, " don't get it." After eating there, we were SHOCKED that this place received 4 stars??!!

I ate here a couple years ago and had some of the best oysters ever. So I just returned here for lunch while back in NOLA. They make decent po boys. Prices are reasonable. And you get a free appetizer when checking in on yelp.

My wife and I first visited Royal House on Sunday night as it was just right outside of our hotel and had good reviews. 

We were seated immediately at around 8pm. Our waitress said she was on her last night of training, but we felt that she did an excellent job throughout the night and had a great personality. 

We placed our drink orders from the bar after looking over the cocktail menu for a few minutes, then ordered entrees at the same time. The bar and restaurant were full, but it didn't seem overly crowded at the time. Our drinks took about 10 minutes to arrive and only seemed to be made quicker because the waitress noticed me constantly looking over my shoulder at the bar. 

My wife just ordered a bowl of gumbo, which she said was flavorful and that she enjoyed it. I had the shrimp platter, which was also good. Both of our portion sizes were larger than average, but just the right size. 

As we contemplated desert, we were told that all of the tables around us had chosen the bread pudding, so we did the same. It came out pretty quickly and it was moist and tasted fresh. 

Besides the drink order being slow, my only gripe is that I felt like we were being rushed a few times throughout our meal. The dessert menu was dropped off and explained with our entrees. After having our entrees for about 10 minutes, we were both just sitting and talking, but clearly had a good portion of food left on our plates. The waitress came by and sort of motioned for the plates and asked if we were done. Not a huge deal though. 

We both had enjoyed our dinner, so we ended up returning the next night. I had the same thing, but my wife got the blackened redfish for her entree, which she loved. We also got the redfish beignets that were recommended the night before. Those were simply amazing and neither of us could stop talking about how great they were. Definitely get those and take advantage of the free appetizer deal from Yelp if it's still going on and you're ordering 2 or more entrees. Our service didn't feel as rushed the 2nd night, but we were also there a little earlier in the evening. The drinks that we ordered from the bar were just as slow as the night before, and the bar was nearly empty this time. Maybe the bartender is just inexperienced or could use an additional hand back there.  

Overall, Royal House is a great choice if you're staying in the French Quarter.

DON'T GO! Worst restaurant we've ever experienced. The place looked very inviting from the outside. It has a pretty balcony on the second floor where diners can sit and enjoy the view below. Unlike some other places near Bourbon, it appears to be clean, have a nice ambience and upscale furnishings. That's all it has to offer. If you just want a drink and to sit and people watch, then it would be fine. But as a restaurant, it's horrible. Only the glass of Pinot Noir and the raw oysters we had were decent. Everything else that required cooking, was disgusting. All cooked items tasted like old food they bought at Costco. That's an insult to Costco and isn't meant to be because food bought at Costco frozen and cooked at home would have tasted 100 times better. I don't know where people get the pictures seen on Yelp because the food we received was nothing like that. I read so much about the reviews of shrimp and grits and was let down- they were ice cold. You can eat pasta cold but grits are like an oatmeal dish. When hot, good but when cold, they turn into hard putty. I had to carve a slice of the grits out to taste. I never return food and had to reject them. The staff was not surprised when I complained..it seemed they are used to getting complaints all day. They brought me replacement grits-my SAME dish back that had been heated up in the microwave. I know it was the same dish because it still had my carving in it. The heat didn't help. No flavor, disgusting and tasted like processed food. My husband got the seafood pasta dish and was not impressed. Nothing tasted fresh cooked. We never use coupons but since we had used the map on yelp to find Royal, a coupon popped up for a free dish. We were so upset with our other food, we were not going to use the free desert coupon but because we couldn't eat our other dishes, we were still hungry. We got the bread pudding with ice cream. My husband even said beforehand, at least they can't mess up ice cream. Well they did, the ice cream tasted like cheap generic old ice cream and the bread pudding was a cold tasteless mess.  If you want raw oysters, go to Acme. It's a no frills place - a dive actually but at least they have fresh real food and nice waiters for much less cost. If you wan to spend a little more money and have an amazing meal, go to Louisiana Bistro. It's a dive also but an amazing chef and every time we come to NOLA we go there because the meals are unforgettable.

I have been to Royal House twice and both times the service and the food was amazing! I always get a dozen oysters on the half shell, first time I went, we got 13 oysters (but I didn't feel it was necessary to tell anyone). The best dishes I have had there is the shrimp and grits, crawfish ravioli, and fried alligator. Om nom nom....also a tour guide told me they get their oysters from the same distributor as ACME, so might as well come here for shorter lines, better service and cheaper food.

Awesome! Had the Oysters Duo app, and was very impressed, The Fried Shrimp was addicting, and The Oyster Pasta was incredible, my wife had the Baked Shrimp Tortellini and didn't like it, drinks are expensive but delicious. Over all I would say go for it, and if there is only two of you sit on the balcony.
Ate here twice.  Oysters were awesome.  The trio of New Orleans was great but jambalaya had only two pieces of sausage.  Will go back again.  Service was also very good.
Service is very good. Food is excellent. I can't recommend the Onion Soup enough. The BLT-O is delicious.

What a great meal we had. 6 of us sat at the bar and ordered a lot of food. Crawfish cakes great, raw oysters amazing, corn topping oyster are good, seafood stuffing oysters tasty;  however, the star of the app show were the chargrilled oysters. Love them. Some of the best tasting prepared oysters I have ever had. 
For the main course, one of our dinners had the gumbo 3 mixture something. It was good. I had the spinach salad (needed some health in my life.  Lol) and it was very fresh and tasty. Two people had the fried shrimp platter. All good, especially the hush puppies if you're into them. The fries were very disappointing. The star of the show was the redfish. Don't miss out. One of the best pieces of fish I have ever had ever in the world. 

All and all, we really had a great time at this place and î would recommend it to anyone.

Too touristy.  
Shrimp po boy (undressed?!) was a waste of good shrimp.  Bread too hard (as others have noted) and lacks flavor.  Why not pour some dressing on it?  If you're looking for a good po boy, go elsewhere , like jimmy j's cafe, for example.  Really disappointing.

Gumbo was decent, however

If this place was not surrounded by better Cajun restaurants, but perhaps in Kansas City, I would give it 3 or maybe 4 stars.  But it does not deserve it's 4 star rating when there are so many good options.

I was really excited to go here during my visit to New Orleans.  My family and I all flew to NOLA for a wedding and it happend to be my brother's birthday the next day on 10/27/13.  So we, nine of us, decided to go to Royal House Oyster Bar for his birthday dinner.

Our drinks took longer than usual, which was fine.  Then we finally got our appetizers of variety of oyster platters which were delicious, but the fries were cold, which I thought was odd.  

Within 5 minutes we were being rushed to finish our appetizers as a tray of our entrees were sitting there, waiting.  Which, at the time, I thought that was weird, but whatever, we were hungry.  Once I got my dish, the shrimp creole, it wasn't even warm.  I asked my family around me and found out that the Taste of New Orleans, the Shrimp and Grits and another rice plate were ALL cold.  All of the fries were cold as well.  I asked the server to reheat our plates, when they brought it back, it still wasn't hot.

Not once did we get an apology or a recognition of the bad service and cold food, we asked the server to bring the manager over to see if there was anything they can do.  The server says, "Well, since you did eat all of the food, I don't know what it is that he can do".  First of all, we did NOT eat all off the food.  Everything was cold and quite frankly, besides the oysters, the rest of the food wasn't even good.  My shrimp creole dish looked like half of it came out of a tomato paste can.  Gross.

As if the comment from the server wasn't already the worst customer service (remember you rushed me appetizers to give all cold food), the manager comes over and yells "Who's the one who had the issues?"  The four of us at the end of the table with the cold food.  ME!  He comes over, not once apologized for anything or even asked me what the issues were.  Just showed me the bill and that they took of 15%.  SMH.  You couldn't even ask me what happened?  Never once acknowledge the fact that our service was below average.  Then come at us with "Who is the one who had a problem?"  I SURE DID.

Unreal.  You're a restaurant.  Customer service should be your priority.  We are a nice family, looking to have a good time to be utterly dissapointed by the lack of service and rudeness from your establishment.

My wife really wanted some fried oysters so we tried a place known for oysters. The service was very slow. We didn't order appetizers so we thought our food would come in a reasonable time. We were wrong. Almost half an hour to receive our meal.

In my wife's words, "the worst friend oysters I have ever had". Almost no meat but a lot of over cooked batter. I had a po-boy and the bread was so tough I couldn't eat it. It is a shame to have a meal in a place with 4 stars and leave hungry and feeling like you threw money away.

In a city known for food this was a real disappointment.

We were ignored for quite a bit when we walked in. there was no host/hostess to be found. The person who finally acknowledged us looked just was frustrated as we were at the fact that  there was no one up front to seat customers.
.Our table smelled (overwhelmingly so)  like wet old rags  and was sticky. 
.Waiter was friendly
