. I ordered something with puff pastry but it tasted like old stale crackers accompanied with the scent of cardboard. Maybe i should've stuck with something deep fried since that's hard to mess up
Their etouffee is really good. I wasn't impressed by the jambalaya and the gumbo. The shrimp tortellini was fine. The bloody mary was too bitter but the rest of my party liked it.
Food was good! Ordered the spinach salad, and bananas foster cheesecake! Yummy! Staff was very polite!

Service was friendly and prompt when we came in. The restaurant has a nice casual atmosphere upstairs with plenty of natural light. 

We ordered the gumbo, a dozen raw oysters, and shrimp po boy to spilt. While I wouldn't say it was anything ground breaking, everything was tasty. The gumbo comes in a cup sized portion which I thought was a bit overpriced. The oysters were very fresh and clean. I had no qualms about eating them raw. The superstar was definitively the fried shrimp po boy. It was crunchy, good flavor, and the shrimp was so fresh!

Royal house is a good place to start for good priced Cajun.
If you are here, make sure to sit out on the balcony. Views of French quarter are quite nice from up there. Also order Crab Claws. One of the best appetizers in all of city. Delicious!

The food is phenomenal! We recommend the blackened redfish, the jambalaya, and bliss potatoes. The brownie a la mode is also delectable without leaving you sick and full. Service is great and friendly. This is definitely a pleasant atmosphere with classy but casual touches while remaining family friendly. The prices make it a great option for a special dinner, family night, or just a great outing!

Becks was a fabulous server with excellent recommendations. The redfish beignets were a unique, wonderful appetizer. Chargrilled oysters were unbelievable! Then the main entrees, all I can say is Wow!

Food was incredible. We had the crawfish cakes, crab claws, gumbo, crawfish étouffée and blackened shrimp and chicken jambalaya. They were all excellent but the crab claws were the best I've ever had. I would be leaving 4 stars if our server had remembered to ring up he second round of drinks we ordered. I found that it was also child friendly, although there is not a changing station in the restroom. The staff was great, food was superb. Don't pass up Royal House!

Still a fantastic place to eat and drink.  Johhny, our server was great. The service was excellent, food even better. Prices are more than fair for the quality and quantity of food you get. We will be back, soon!

11/15/2013
We had our son and daughter-n-laws' "Fabulous French Quarter, Wedding Rehearsal, Po-boy Party! here at the Royal House and it was fabulous!  Jared was wonderful in creating our special "po-boy" menu and sitting upstairs with the french doors open to the wrap-around balcony at 5 in the evening, listening to the music swirling up from Royal Street was just another perfect French Quarter moments!  The oysters were outstanding as usual and the service truly NOLA.

The waiter spilled salsa all over me. Stuff happens, I get it. But they didn't even take the food that was spilled on me off the tab. And there was a mandatory tip put on my tab so I couldn't even make it up that way. I will not be back.
The Shrimp Po-boy was excellent.  Get them to add the crawfish cream sauce to your Po-boy for a tasty twist.
Only tried the oysters, and they are pretty good. The chargrilled are definitely the best from what we tried (the other with was a combo of two others). Although good, I've had better.

Had a lovely evening here on a Sunday night during a busy convention weekend in Nov. 2013.  Our party of 3 (later joined by a 4th) lucked out and was seated upstairs very close to the patio...perfect since it was inside so the threatening rainclouds didn't really worry us, but close enough to the outside that we were able to enjoy the gorgeous, misty evening view and air.  I think the downstairs is much more casual, but the upstairs area really made for a beautifully lit and romantic atmosphere in quaint a New Orleans house (although none of my dinner companions were mah boo :-P). The food was good, although I only got raw oysters and wine, which is all I wanted.  Oysters were fresh and good sized, shucked correctly.

The service, though, was veeeerrrry inexperienced.  In her defense, she was this pixie-haired maybe 22-yr old sweet girl that just did not know what she was doing. We ended up getting bottles of wine, and for whatever reason, we realized after the second glass that she was FILLING our glasses to the brim, i.e. y'know how a wine pour is only perhaps 1/3 of the glass, maybe a 1/2 if someone is generous?  She was pretty much pouring them to the very top of the glass...and it wasn't to give us more wine since we'd already bought the whole bottle.  And when we asked her to pour smaller pours for the second bottle, she was a little miffed/confused as to why.  *sigh*  A bit flighty, but again, I just chalk it  up to inexperience.  We had to ask for water.  She would drop things, like the silverware, when she tried to collect things off our table. Very sweet and smiley though. 

Still - great ambiance, good food overall.

I was waiting outside the restaurant for my friends with a beer from my hotel bar. The greeter asked if I'd like to come in while I wait and I was hesitant because of the outside drink. He said it was no problem at all and they were more than happy to seat me. 

Out of all the oyster places we enjoyed while in NOLA, this one had the best chargrilled oysters, IMO. 

We actually went twice and the second time was equally delicious. The bartender was great and our waitress was so friendly. They provided us with a ton of suggestions as to where to go for great Jazz and warned us that the city would be a little unsafe because of the Bayou Classic game taking place that weekend. 

If there's only two people, I highly recommend sitting on the balcony so you can hear the music from the street performers outside. All around, a great experience!

We stopped here for breakfast over the weekend.  They just started serving it, and it was much better than expected!  It's a pretty limited, traditional southern breakfast menu, but they did it well.  Tastes better than it looks..lol.

Our last night in town, yelp, Anthony Bourdain, Guy Fieri - all of them had failed me. 5 hungry guys looking to me to find one last dynamite meal in a city where we ate like kings! I stumbled upon the Royal House... 

Thank you Yelp! Just when I was starting to lose faith, you bring me right back with a knock out dinner selection. 

We had some oysters, and while I am not an oyster fan, whatever garlic butter they charbroil them in could be poured on a boot and it would be delicious. 

I forgot what everybody had - I was going to be healthy and have the seafood pasta until our jerk waiter said they had amazing fried shrimp (Note to employers - our server was NOT a jerk, very nice)

But I would definitely come back, and I would bring my oyster loving friends in a heartbeat.

We had the pleasure of dining at you establishment on the 16th & 17th of November of this year. Dominic was our server the first night and Heidi the second night. The service and food was out of this world both nights!!! My friend Linda and I agree that the taste and overall dining experience was the best that we had ever experienced. We will return!!!

I was looking for dinner and a good drink in the French Quarter. This place satisfied both! I highly recommend the Oysters Royale. The service was great too. If you're in the area, defiantly consider this restaurant!

We ate oysters on the half shell at almost every restaurant we went into during our trip, so when we saw this place, we knew it was for us. 

We sat at the bar and ordered oysters on the half shell, half dozen ($7). They server shucked them right in front of us, and they were perfect. Very good quality. We also ordered Pimm's Cups..I'm not a huge fan of them in general, but my husband, who is English, claimed it was very good. 

The best part about our visit was that although we ordered only half a dozen oysters, the server would throw in a few extra here and there as he was shucking other customers orders. Maybe more than just a few...:) I hope we tipped accordingly! Great experience in a beautiful restaurant. Best oysters of the trip.

Had a large very enjoyable plate of fried shrimp and fried oysters here over fries. Big portion, fried perfectly. 

Wife had the Taste of New Orleans - gumbo, etouffe, and jambalaya. Jambalaya was the best of the trio but all in all this was a let down. If I didn't have such an order win and just had my wife's food, this would be a 2. 

The crab claw app was very rich and was a little difficult to eat. Wouldn't order it again if I went back. 

Kind of expensive for what it is.

We had quite a long wait outside before sitting down for dinner in this informal place. The Taste of New Orleans combo was not bad (seafood gumbo, so so, crawfish étouffée better, jambalaya definitely good).

Overall I wasn't impressed.

I haven't been to New Orleans in years and after eating at Royal House it made me question what the hell I've been doing with my life. 

The wait was short at only about 15 minutes and we started with what we had been craving for days, oysters on the half shell, but that wasn't enough so we moved on to oysters Rockefeller and they were absolutely amazing. Next we had the royal trio with jambalaya, red beans and rice, and crawfish étouffée. I cannot say enough this dish is why I love this city and it did not disappoint. Top that off with a few more oysters and a couple Abitas and you are off to a great night.
I just stopped here for drinks and the bartender was nice. The spinach dips was warm and delicious  To bad we didn't have dinner here. P.s Check in and yelp offers a deal.
Friendly service. The chargrilled oysters were amazeballs!  We licked it up!  The oyster po-boys are better here than Acme's.  Crawfish étouffée was divine.  Small intimate surrounding.  Great place.

We got lost walking in the French Quarter and stumbled upon this place. It was warm and cozy inside, but we first got seated by an open window despite all the open tables. I requested to be moved and we got seated right by the kitchen door where we could smell and see all the food coming out to be delivered. We got the fish beignets and that was more like a tempura dish (not bad). I got the Taste of New Orleans and would recommend that for everyone to eat!

This place is ok.  I checked in to get their appetizer special which we ended up not qualifying for since we got a bunch of appetizers and 1 main dish (we had to get two).  It was a little disappointing, they should have just honored it since we did spend quite a bit on drinks and food but alas, they want to stick with the rules, OK, just won't give an extra star on going above and beyond.  I also can't say that I will necessary remember this place or make the recommendation, it's a decent joint in the French Quarter that seems like tourists (like us) just stumble into.  If my assumption is wrong, then sincere apologies to the locals that frequent.  That's about it.  FYI, food is on the salty side, like super salty.  I think we all joked a bit about wanting food with the salt.
Great price great food great service.  Second time here.  Super nice laid back atmosphere and great view.  I think Brad Pitt just rode by on his bike!

Classic French Quarter atmosphere and impeccable food! Got the charbroiled oysters, shrimp pescatore and bananas foster cheesecake. All delicious! The dessert was by far the best I've ever had. The cheesecake was served in two large scoops instead of slices. The cheesecake was cold and dense and the bananas were fresh and hot! Coming from a native New Orleanian, it's a must try in the quarter!

The service was really bad and they did put EXTRA bill on us.

We went there for raw oyster and other NO food couple days ago. But what we got was a plate of oyster with live worm. Seeing the worm moving on what we were gonna to eat was really disgusting, so we just canceled the dish (I think we should just walk out there, although the other food was fine) and ordered the other cooked one.  However, they didn't remove the item from the bill and enforced us to paid 20% tip for a group of 5.

We went back to correct the charge and they still hold the original amount of "20% tip" to the final check.

This is my first review because I think they really deserve for the low rating!

The service was outstanding, the oysters fantastic, and the blackened redfish fresh and delicious. Would highly recommend this restaurant. The balcony area upstairs is much nicer than the downstairs as well.

Ate at ACME last night , and I can tell you that Royal House has better chargrilled oysters, fried oysters, and étouffée. Table service was far friendlier and expedient.  I would choose this place over ACME or Felix oyster houses. Étouffée is the best I've had anywhere.

Stumbled on this place while strolling down Royal street Christmas evening! 

SO GLAD we came. They said 35 min wait for 2 at around 6:30 but ended up being much faster. By the time we were seated the wait for all tables was at least an hour which made me wonder if the food was all that good??

Delicious! Ordered the Rockefeller oysters shrimp platter and a sampler of étouffée, jambalaya, and gumbo.

Shrimps  in the platter we're HUGE! Tastely breaded and fried to golden perfection. Also the hush puppies and fries were superb!! The cole slaw was heavy on the mayo but and also had apple added in the slaw.

CrAw fish Étouffée was soooooooo delicious the sauce everything about it was lip smacking good! Would come back and order the étouffée dish for sure.

Oysters were very tasty and topping was excellent. Would recommend this as we saw all tables with copious orders of oysters. 

Crowded and a little loud but it added to the authentic atmosphere

Service- good!!

It was our first night in NO and we had no idea where to go. So we walked around and stumbled upon this place. It had decent Yelp reviews and they were offering a free appetizer for up to a value of $10, so we said let's try it. Big mistake! We should have walked away when we had to wait 15 mins by the front door before we were greeted. But we had been walking for awhile and were famished. We should have walked away again when we had to wait another 15 mins before a server came by. In fact, my boyfriend had to flag down the hostess to find our server. After taking our drink order, she disppeared for another 15 mins. By then, we made an agreement that if she didn't come back in the next min, we would walk. Unfortunately, she came back with our drinks.

We decided to make the best of it and ordered. We got the Crawfish Cakes and really liked it. Wasn't out of this world, but it was good. For our entrees, I got the Shrimp and Grits. Did not like it at all. It was more savory than I would have liked and wasn't all that creamy. The menu said it had Gouda but I did not taste it.  Maybe it was the chopped bellpeppers and onions that threw me off. Regardless, I've had better. But I will say that they did give a healthy portion of shrimp. That's all that was good. 


My boyfriend got the catfish poboy. And at $10 a poyboy, I was expecting one hell of a poyboy. It was at best, mediocre. Nothing special about it. 

Our server was never around and of course to no surprise, she wasn't around when we were ready for our check. Overall, we were disappointed in our experience here. It was our first night out in NO and it was not a great start to our vacation. Thankfully, it was not a foreshadow for the rest of our stay in NO!

Really liked this place.  The service was excellent and so Southern-hospitably sweet I had to pinch myself.  Our server was friendly and even accomodated my request for a few fried oysters on the side when I knew the kitchen was very busy. We had the fried oyster tacos to start: lightly cornmeal-fried oysters on a little slice of taco shell with a heap of sweet cole slaw on top. The saltiness of the oyster and the sweetness of the slaw together had me swooning (hence the extra side of oysters).  For my entrée I had the shrimp and grits. A very nice dish with fresh Gulf shrimp dusted in blackened spices on a bowl of creamy, pepper-speckled grits.  My dining companion had the fried shrimp and catfish platter.  I snuck a bite of the catfish (lovely and fresh) and the hushpuppy (a little ball of fried cornbread bliss).  Would definately return.

Part of a great dining experience is the waiting staff. The food, especially oysters, is fantastic and the ambience of the historic venue is nice.

However, their waitress Becks is one of the best I've ever had in New Orleans. She's a fun and sassy redhead that is very engaging and enjoyable. She is a big reason why my friends and I will be returning to Royal House to see how she's doing.

The week that I moved to New Orleans, my mother, brother, boyfriend and i were walking in the Quarter looking for some decent cajun food. We by chance happened upon Royal House, and we left very happy. Our server was a friendly woman who gave plenty of recommendations. We ordered crab claws for an appetizer, and we asked for extra bread to get every little bit of sauce left. They were delicious. We each had different entrees, and everything was great, although my mom wasn't a huge fan of the shrimp and grits. We ended up coming back when my family visited for Christmas, and the rest of them who weren't here in August also enjoyed their food and the service. Definitely get the crab claws!!!
Traditional New Orleans dishes. We ordered the raw oysters, oysters royale, oysters Rockefeller, gumbo sampler and pescatori. Everything was great and came out quick. Oysters were our favorite.

Visiting New Orleans requires at least one stop for seafood. We originally had a brunch reservation at Royal House but someplace else was recommended to us, so instead of just cancelling, we changed out reservation at Royal House to dinner. I'm glad we did.

The service was Excellent. Everyone was very friendly and the service was prompt. Our server was helpful, funny and attentive. 

We were seated upstairs, which was cozy. I only wish it hadn't been so cold outside because I'm sure the view with the doors open or on the balcony is wonderful. 

The food was good, except for my jambalaya which was...wet? I don't know how else to describe it. Soupy? Not the way jambalaya should be. Oh, and the roasted Red Bliss potatoes, looked good but they were not good. It's hard to mess up a potato.  At least that's what I thought. 

Overall, my family and I had a great experience at Royal House. We are happy that we dined there.

We happened upon this spot by complete accident back in April during a business conference trip.  We had just arrived in New Orleans and after checking in to our near by hotel, we decided to take a stroll and familiarize ourselves with the surrounding area.   We wandered down Royal St and were busy snapping pics of all the amazing architecture and unique balconies.  Royal House caught our eyes as the balcony seating was packed full of people.  Upon waking up, we were greater by a the beautiful smile from Ms Alex.  She was so sweet and personal.  I told her we just arrived from Miami and she gave us great insight on what to try and had us wait at the bar while a balcony spot opened up.  Upon being seated, we were waited on by Dominic.  He is just great, such a warm friendly personality, and a smile that's contagious.  He guided us through the menu to our delight.  We had the fried alligator, a decisions first for us both.  I had the French onion, my partner the seafood gumbo, both amazing and filling. Finally we topped it all off with their grilled oysters which come on the shell with melted Parmesan.  I never really cared for any type of oyster and was very hesitant to try these, but I can now say, I'm a full convert!  They were amazing.  The atmosphere inside is classic upscale relaxed southern.  With everything combined, the view from balcony, Alex and Dominic, and the food, we were more than satisfied.  It made our day and set the tone for a great introduction to New Orleans.  Thank you guys all so much!  Keep smiling;)  My only regret, I didn't listen to my partner when he wanted to come back for a second meal !!  It was by far one of the best dining experiences we had during our 5 days visit.

Excellent food, good beer selection, and quality service. The place was very tight quarters (i.e. no elbow room), but everything came out looking and tasting great, so you forgot about the lack of space quickly :)

Being that I am Vegan, I couldn't eat much here besides a salad.  However, the salad I ordered was yummy and my friends said their food was very good!

My real reason for writing this review is to tell people that this place had the BEST Hurricanes!!!! (Mixed drink)  Out of all of the places we tried the Hurricane drink, this one was the best, so tasty and not made with a mix!!!!!!!!

Enjoy!

Worst $60 l ever spent. 
Tooth Chipping oysters.
Cold and bland shrimp creole. 
Taste of new Orleans plate = $17rip off.
Shitty service too.
I saw others complaining as well so it was NOT my high Yelp expectations getting in the way. 
Do not recommend

Great experience on our last day in New Orleans.

Beautiful balcony view and the food was great.

Stopped in for a app., loved the redfish beignet! Friend liked the oysters. 
Seemed like a nice place to eat. 
Servers were very courteous. 
Classy but relaxed atmosphere.
Came for the awesome reviews, left for the absurdly slow (but friendly) service before even ordering. Menu was outrageously overpriced and different from online as well. Drafty and too dark inside.
This place was awesome!   It's not on the Main Street but def worth finding!!  We had the Parmesan oysters which were amazing!   And the crawfish ravioli and the tortellini were very tasty!

Love this place! Go there every time we go to Nola (3-4x per year). Love the oysters, drinks, shrimp and grits, and bread. Crawfish étouffée inconsistent...but everything else over shadows that little blunder. The guy working the bar shucking oysters is a riot. We love eating at the bar here.

The bestie and I came here on a food expedition. We had a few things we wanted to try and Royal House seemed like it was the place that could deliver.

It was a bit of a trek from our hotel and the street was dark. There are a ton of cops on this street though so it wasnt too bad. Police station and the court house are in close proximity. We walked in and there was no one to seat us. A bar back yelled across the room that we could sit whereever we wanted. We chose a 4 top away from the draft of the door (it was cold!). My friend had never had fried alligator so we started with that and a bowl of seafood gumbo. Both were DELICIOUS!!! The alligator was a little chewy but Ive found that to be the case in more than one restaurant in my life. The entrees were both crawfish based and were super tasty. The drinks were good as well. They have a limited dessert menu so we didnt bother. Everything else was fantastic. Miss Cindy was our server. She was sweet as pie!!! She was helpful and kind and funny and efficient. I would come back just for her service. 

Good times!

Sad to say, this was a last stop for us on our way out of town, and we wandered in by chance because it was near our hotel. The food was incredible, and we are still dreaming of their chargrilled oysters and red fish beignets. We had been sampling them all over town, but this place was the best. Next time we are in town, this will be our first stop. Service was great, and they didn't make us feel like gluttons as the two of us ordered dozen after dozen!

Our favorite spot for oysters! Classic decoration with excellent service. I enjoy sitting at the bar and chatting with customers around me. We had various dish but my favorite remains the shrimp grits.  Yummy yummy yummy! A must visit when you're in NOLA!
Cajun bloody Mary here was excellent. the chargrilled oysters were a bit over cooked. I would recommend the oyster duo more. Both kinds are sooo yummy.

Yummerz first meal in Nola in a while. Lovely waitress. Apparently the oyster grill blew up? Anyway chargrilled oysters were bomb. The jambalaya had a nice blackened taste to it. Cajun Bloody Mary hit the spot although $10 was a bit steep. Overall a great little meal in the crescent city.

Happened into this restaurant, food is ridiculously good.  Had charbroiled oysters, crawfish ravioli and bread pudding for dessert.  The food was great, wonderful service!!  We would highly recommend!  Wish we lived closer so we could do this again.

i wish i'd had time to come for a full meal to properly rate this place. but there just weren't enough meal times during my trip to nola. on my last night in the city, i made it here for my late night second dinner -- 'twas the only way i could fit this place into my schedule.

because i'd had the most amazing and filling dinner earlier in the night, i could only muster up the space to order a couple appetizers to share: hush puppies + fried alligator.

the hush puppies were really good!! mix anything fried with tartar sauce, and i'm in heaven.

the fried gator was just average in my opinion, kinda like eating tough, chewy chicken nuggets. i think that speaks more to the nature of fried gator, than to the quality of royal house as a restaurant.

the service is excellent and the restaurant has a nice ambiance to it. but looking around, the portions seemed a tad small for the prices.

i have no qualms with royal house, really. just wish the experience had been a bit more memorable and impressive overall.

On a bachelor party trip to NOLA, this was our more upscale dinner (though not crazy expensive, I think the place is a really good value). Right in the heart of the Quarter, there were some great street musicians outside and really cool antique arms and coin shop nearby to keep us busy during the wait. The food was really good! Several of us got the taste of New Orleans sampler. The Etoufee was my favorite. One of our party got oysters, they were good. We also tried the fried alligator, which I ordered more for novelty value and it was decent, but nothing special. 

The bar tender was nice, talked up the food and some drinks for us and was pretty helpful overall. The bloody mary is a big hit here.

The only bad thing I have to say is the wait. I was with a total of 5 guys, and we were told 20min wait and it ended up being an hour before we made room for ourselves to sit at the bar.
everything is amazing !!!!! the oysters are HUGE! just good comfort food !!

After reading the reviews in Yelp, my husband & I, along with our 16 year old daughter, walked to Royal House for dinner.  Our server, Chris, was fantastic!  His menu suggestions were spot on & he even prepared a hand squeezed lemonade for my picky husband who doesn't like Minute Maid.  The oysters Rockefeller, fried oysters, & peel & eat shrimp were fantastic, but my crab-stuffed ravioli covered in crawfish sauce was the highlight of the meal.  We shared the bread pudding for dessert & our daughter (who was sure she wouldn't like it) finished it up.  The hurricane I had was much better than what I had the night before at Felix's, too!  A perfect meal!

My girlfriend and I had our first oyster experience ever at the Royal House and it was awesome.  The food was  quality and the wine was great.  We enjoyed a mixed batch of cooked and raw oysters, crayfish etoufee, and a brownie ala mode.  But the best part about this dinner was the service.  Our waitress was Tina and she killed it.  She gave us her full attention and was very attentive even though we were her only table.  Tina rocks!! She is funny, knowledgeable and efficient.  When you go to Royal House ask for Tina!!

From the moment we walked in we were treated to southern hospitality. Our hostess told us where the restrooms were (great if you are stumbling in from Bourbon Street) and who our server will be. Service was excellent. Our server 'Becks' was great. She recommended the Redfish Beignets. They were crispy and sweet. Definitely try them. The Alaskan Snow Crabs in the Cajun boil was the hit of the night. We also had the Catfish Po Boy. The bread was fresh and the fish was crispy and delicious. Prices were reasonable. Drinks were great too. Go early and avoid the rush.

We went to a late show at Preservation Hall and ducked in for a quick dinner not expecting much. The service was amazing, the dinner was amazing and the dessert was honestly one of the best we'd ever had (Bananas Foster). Our server, Becks, was positively brilliant! I'd almost go back just because of her, but the food gave us even more reason. Can't recommend it more!

I came her for my 21st  birthday. They led my large party and me upstairs. It's a very laid back atmosphere. There are multiple windows and seats on the balcony which is pretty beautiful during night time. Not only was the service excellent, but the food was well.

We were starving after we landed in New Orleans so we stumbled across this place and decided it would get the job done.  We sat and quickly ordered some hurricanes, which came in to-go cups, which seems to be the norm in this city.  They were tasty though.  The server recommended the fried oysters which were described on the menu as  "plump"...and they weren't.  They were mostly cheese, that's all I could taste anyway.  Not saying they weren't good, they just were not as explained on the menu.  The redfish beignets were good though.  We also got the trio of gumbo, red beans and rice and etoufee, which were all pretty tasty.  For our first taste of the Big Easy, it wasn't bad, but not super memorable either.

Not a bad place for a bite. 

The "Taste of New Orleans" is a good dish to share and the redfish beignets were pretty tasty.  

The broiled oysters were packed with flavor but seemed to be on the small side.  

Service was good.  They had a bar with the football game on so we just picked on some food while we watched the game.  The hurricanes at Royal House were pretty good so order one if you decide to check this place out.

Royal House is capital-D Delicious!
Sadly we discovered this place on our last night in NOLA, otherwise we definitely would have gone back again. 
Went out for a late meal on Saturday night with no reservation. We were seated right away at a cozy table, and waiter took our drink order immediately. So tired of beer and bourbon from a full week in the Big Easy, I opted for something a little more girly - a sour apple martini. Hubby had a bloody mary. Both werre declicious, and under $10.
For dinner I ordered the shrimp and grits. OH. MY. GAWD. these were delicious. At least 10 juicy shrimp on a bed of the most delicious grits I had over the whole trip. The chopped veggies and gouda really  give them a great flavour and creaminess. WISH I had found grits like these earlier in the week.
Hubby had the blackened shrimp and jambalaya. He raved about his meal too. Jambalaya was full of flavour, and his shrimp were really good (I may have tried one when he wasn't looking...). Both meals were served piping hot and portion sizes were generous. With an appetizer, we probably could have split a meal.
The service in this restaurant is also great. The waiter was attentive, but gave us our space. Will definitely be back here on our next visit. Yum!
Everything was great, but whatever they stuff those appetizer mushrooms with is the equivalent of culinary crack. Fabulous!

DELICIOUS and awesome. We got seated on the balcony (by request) -- so, so nice (though a bit crowded, only good for groups of 2 people). Our server was awesome and extremely helpful guiding us through the menu. We had quite an array of food (including the delicious fried gator) and it was all incredible, as well as a margarita and a bloody mary (both excellent as well). We even got to witness a wedding parade during dinner. LOVE!

For our first real New Orleans meal, we tried the Taste of New Orleans for $17 which included 3 samples of NOLA's finest foods.  Totally rockin'.  The lobster ravioli for $22 left a little bit to be desired, though.  I would totally have eaten the Taste of New Orleans every day of my trip if there wasn't so much other food to enjoy in New Orleans.

Amazing food!!! We tried fried alligator for the first time. Delicious!  The duo oyster plate... Not too crazy about Rockefeller oysters but the royals was very good. Taste of New Orleans was delicious and the oyster plater was just perfect! Great experience and the severer was great! All the servers and employees were welcoming and sweet.
Don't fear the Fisher donut! Lol the red fish benign are too die for so are the bloody Mary's get two! Portions are very generous plan apps accordingly

The food and drinks here are fantastic. The Chargrilled Oysters are unbelievably delicious - butter and Parmesan make great friends. And if you have room after finishing those, the entrees are fresh and perfectly NOLA. I recommend the Mahi Mahi. Big shout out to Becks, our server; she was enthusiastic about the Royal's offerings and fun to chat during our meal.
Not sure what all the fuss is about, a decent meal but with all of the really great places in The Quarter (and the rest of the city) this one earns no more than 3 stars in my book.

My fiancé and I were pleasantly surprised by this place. After working up a hunger after wandering around the French quarter we stopped in for lunch. I must say the reason we ultimately chose this place was for the free appetizer we got for checking in on yelp. We got the crawfish cakes which were delicious. My fiancé ordered a roast beef po' boy which to this day he still talks about. I ordered a gumbo, étouffée, creole trio which was decent. The best part was sitting on the narrow balcony up top so we could soak in the NOLA atmosphere while eating. We will come back.

LOVE this place! The atmosphere is very warm and cozy, and the food was AMAZING!

We started with the crawfish cakes which I had never had before-basically like a crab cake made with crawfish, it was great!

I then tried half a dozen of the chargrilled oysters. I wouldn't consider myself an oyster aficionado, but they were DELICIOUS! Served with a lemon wedge and bread for dipping. I would definitely go back just for these. 

I then had the peel-and-eat shrimp boil which was delicious. Usually you find peel-and-eat shrimp served cold so I was very excited to try these piping hot ones. They're boiled with Cajun spices and served with potatoes and corn. SO GOOD!

My boyfriend got the shrimp po boy which was also delicious. 

The service was AMAZING. Seriously top notch. We will definitely be back on our next visit!

Cozy, great atmosphere. Redfish Beignets... OMG! Great service, attentive & personable. And LA Residents get 15% off. Winning!

Becks is amazing! Personality plus & great server! Super cute and welcoming.

Second time at the Royal Oyster House.  The Oyster Beignets are fantastic, like a delicious donut mixed with an oyster.  There were lots of Abita beers to choose from and awesome service. The chargrilled oysters were ok, but Drago's version is still the best.  Fresh fried catfish was delish.  Note you get a free appetizer with 2 entrees with Yelp check in

Great place for breakfast.  When we went there was no one there, the food was great and it was the best service we have had in New Orleans.   We had the St Louis Special.  The oyster was perfectly fried and the homemade was great.

My boyfriend and I came here late at night after checking into our hotel.  Famished, we stumbled in here because it was the first restaurant we came to.  My boyfriend ordered two appetizers (unfortunately cannot remember what these were, but they were seafood based) and (after learning that they were out of the poor boy that was my first choice) I ordered the Rib Eye.  The appetizers my boyfriend ordered were good, but not great.  The Rib Eye was a crime.  Paying almost $30 for a piece of meat, I expect a halfway decent steak (even if I did make the rookie mistake of ordering a steak at a seafood place).  What I received was a very thin, dry, flavorless piece of commodity meat.  Whatever it was, it wasn't like any ribeye I've ever eaten (an I have eaten a fair few), especially at that price.  As hungry as I was, I could not eat more than a few bites.  When our waitress came to clear our plates, she asked me if I wanted to take it with me.  No, I said, because clearly time was not going to improve this.  She then told me I should have it wrapped up and find a homeless person to give it to.  Look, I appreciate the thought and certainly I have given away my leftovers before, but it is inappropriate to, once I have paid a bunch of money for something I consider inedible, then put the responsibility on me a to wander around the Quarter late at night looking for someone to give it away to.  Great, just want I want after a long day of travel, to overpay for something I don't want to eat and then have to wander around trying to find a way to dispose of it.  Yup.  

Cute place, appetizers are decent, and staff is reasonably friendly.  I just wouldn't necessarily advocate getting dinner here.

I'm really surprised by all the positive reviews. Almost every part of our experience was really subpar, despite the friendly staff. Cocktails were terrible avoid anything not in a bottle. Crab claws were alright, and nice that they were free with the Yelp check in, but I would not buy them myself. Oysters Rockefeller were okay, but should be better if the name of the dish is in the restaurant name. Jambalaya was awful, dry and flavorless. There are many better places in the French Quarter.
Great food! The best service in the entire world!  Our waitress "Becks" although quite shy, was knowledgeable about everything menu and drink related!  Def will be back, highly recommend!!!!!!

Delicious food and great service! If you are in New Orleans go to royal house and get some oysters on the half shell! Our server becks was great! And she even put up with (and played along with!) my dad's embarrassing jokes! Definitely eat at royal house when visiting Nola!!
Saw the Royal House on our obligatory carriage tour and made it a point stop in. Had the oysters Royal and Rockefeller both of them delivered on taste. Make sure you add this stop to your list.

After a long rainy day of bicycling and walking thru the city, my boyfriend and I decided to find respite at the Royal House. He'd been wanting to stop here since the beginning of our weeklong NOLA adventure and walking in the rain proved to be the perfect excuse. The host greeted us with Southern hospitality and we seated ourselves at the bar.

We'd just eaten beignets but I couldn't resist ordering the crab claw appetizers. $12 for fresh crab claws sautéed in a lemon butter garlic sauce served with french toast for dipping. Maybe I just don't know any better but I actually expected whole claws of crab but instead we were greeted with a bowl of broth with the ends of little crab claws. I was pretty disappointed as it felt like a great dish which you got as a leftover. Maybe we just needed to order something else or enjoy the balcony like other visitors, but our overall experience was mediocre at best.

Good atmosphere, and decent food, but nothing amazing to remember New Orleans by. We ordered raw oysters, fried gator, gumbo, and shrimp. Service was really good, but the food was mediocre. Rather pricey for the portions you get. I thought with the ratings this place gets on Yelp we would have gotten a really good experience with Nawlin's eats, but I was ready to move on to the next place.
The oysters are the star here, but if you're in the mood for something else, the crawfish etouffee is the best I've ever had!
Tina was one of the best servers I have ever had! She was very personable and had a great sense of humor. The food was perfect, try the French onion soup it's to die for!!!

Super cute location and interior. I felt like I stepped back into time. Everything was very delicate and polished and the outdoor roof seating was so cute. Although it was pretty chilly, I just HAD to sit out there and enjoy the (little) sunshine and live music playing below. The food was ok. Unlike most of the touristy restuarants where they just batter everything and fry it, Royal House's food was carefully thought out, but half of the things we ordered were pretty bland. However, nothing was over-fried or over-cooked or over-greased. I didn't feel a heart attack coming out and for that, thank you. Their fried gator was the best that I've ever had! I had the Shrimp n' Grits which surprisingly wasn't bad - I approved.
First night in New Orleans and couldn't have picked a better place! Everything on the menu is delicious! Ask for Becks.. She's the best waitress you'll ever have
We went there twice in one trip it was so good. I'd suggest the charbroiled oysters, but all the food was good. The wait wasn't bad, and the server Becks was good as well.
Great service, local food. Crawfish Étouffée, Redfish and French onion soup are excellent.
Got a table by the window thanks to the friendly host, our server was super nice (hi Alex!) and the food was delicious.  And I finally got a good hurricane.  Thank the Lawd.

The "taste of New Orleans" which was supposed to be a jambalaya,  Étouffée and gumbo was total rip off. The trifecta came in dinky little cups and each one was so full of rice there was little to taste, the jambalaya although primarily a rice dish was all rice with one little barely bite sized piece of sausage and and a few little crumbs of other stuff, rice was dry and under cooked, unbelievably boring for New Orleans restaurant providing signature dishes. All that for a way over priced amount of $17. I wanted to throw the the while damn plate into the street. I was so pissed at the bs. I even asked the waiter to confirm if he thought it was something he would recommend.

 I also tried a half doz oysters which tasted good and fresh but were poorly shucked and had more broken shell and debris than normal. The place was really slow too so it wasnt like their shuckker was backed up. The shrimp creole was pretty good nicely flavored. I also took the waiter up on his beer recomendation which turned out to be in a can which I would not have ordered if I knew that.  We sat on the balcony over looking Royal St which with the creole was the only real redeaming factors of the experience.  The reviews on this place are somewhat mixed and I was told to ignore them but based on my experience I couldn't  recommend it. It might be one of those places you have to know what to order, but that won't be me finding that out.

2/9/2014 had lunch with friends.  Great atmosphere but DON"T EAT HERE IF YOU SPECIAL REQUEST ANYTHING!!!  Ordered the blacked chicken sandwich and asked for the sandwich to be put on french bread instead of wheat roll.  Waiter hesitated and told me he would have to see if he could have that done.  Wasn't sure I heard him right, but when the food came out, my sandwich was on a wheat roll.  I asked him to return it and he said he wasn't sure he could......the chef wouldn't like it.  I then wanted the manager. Didn't think this was such a HUGE request.  After all, I am in New Orleans, french bread is awesome there. After a delay, everyone else at my table was enjoying their food, I did get my sandwich, cold, from the manager.  They didn't deduct any amount, from my bill either.  Manager said he was sorry and that was it.  I had a rating card in my bill, which I filled out and didn't hear anything from them.  Told waiter it wasn't his fault ( he was great) but I would never return and I would post my feelings.  What a SNOB of a CHEF!!! REALLY.....EGO PROBLEM MAYBE..... you work in a SERVICE industry!!!  TOTALLY DISAPPOINTED.

Excellent food but one star off only because you can get the same quality food for a lot less else where even in the French quarter.  I probably wouldn't go back only for that reason. Otherwise it was an excellent meal and the bloody Mary's were delish!

The oysters on the half shell were good, much larger than I was expecting. I also had the Royal Salad and added blackened scallops. The salad was good, but the scallops were disappointing. For $6, I got 3 very small scallops that were barely blackened. For $6, I would expect at least 4 medium-sized scallops. Definitely not worth it. I also had a drink, called something like a Bombay Smash that was nice and fruity but not too strong. I'd go back but have something else for an entree next time.

What can I say, food was good, service was most excellent(ask for Beck she's awesome!). Had the charbroiled oysters as an appetizer, followed by my entree Taste of New Orleans then concluded with a dessert of bread pudding. Don't miss out, if you do it's your own fault!

Ameer and Becks made our nights!  New Orleans best bar tender and waitress. made us feel welcome and kept us laughing all night. I would recommend Royal house and ask for Becks, she will make you feel unicorns and rainbows.
The French onion soup is delicious.  The Poor boy sandwich would be better if the bread was softer. Use the free appetizers coupon.. Service was very good.

Ate here twice as it was just beside the Omni hotel where we stayed.

Lunch upstairs near the open air with all the windows open was great. Great service, great blood mary.

First intro to chargrilled oysters.. ammmazing.

Came back a few nights later to eat at the bar during dinner service. Great cocktails all around (the Maker's Mint Julip this time). More oysters and the seafood gumbo, which sadly was a bit bland. Great bartender though.

Really loved this place!

It was a Friday night and we had a large group of 10 so we had to split up so we all sat around the bar which was fine since we were in a bit of a rush.

Our main guy was Antoine. While the bar was busy he never failed to check on us. 
The food came out super fast even though the restaurant was packed with Mardi Gras Goers. 

We ordered the Crawfish Cakes it came with 2 cakes that was delightful and full of flavor. 

My friend and I also shared the Taste of New Orleans entrée. If it was up to me I would have just the crawfish Etouffée  with some bread and be satisfied. 

There was also another bartender that we got a drink from named Sisqo. Ask him to make you his specialty shot. He wont tell you the ingredients in it. "its top secret" but it was delicious. Lemon in flavor.

We appreciate the great service that we got from Antoine and Sisqo. It made this experience of being in NOLA more memorable when its accompanied with superior service.

Definitely will be back here again on my next visit.

First night in New Orleans. The hotel staff recommended Royal House. So glad they did. Food was incredible (try the red fish beigniet s  and shrimp tortellinis). If your not sure ask Becks the waitress she won't lead wrong. She is also very knowledgeable about everything NOLA. This place is definitely worth checking out.

Best server EVER! We went last weekend and the food was great, the atmosphere wAs great and our service was great! The only thing that was ok was the balcony seating, so small and cramped! Definitely have the bananas foster cheesecake! So yummy! Becks was our server and by far the nicest, funniest gal in Nola!
Fantastic service! Best oyster house in the Quarter! Definitely try their bread pudding!
Very fresh and tasty oysters but crawfish Étouffée is wayyyyy to salty

Yes, yes, yes!

Yummy oysters and good drinks. We had to come here twice on our 8 day trip to NOLA. The catfish was also great.

Hit or miss on the wait staff though. Had one delightful waitress and one bumbling newbie.

It was a crowded Friday night in the French Quarter, and of course, there was a wait at every place that looked tasty (or maybe it looked tasty because there was a wait?). We found Royal House which was off the beaten track, and it seemed decidedly less crowded than many of the other places we had attempted. They also offered us a seat at the bar (which for four people, suggested that we would have a better chance of eating sooner here than elsewhere). The drinks are good, and the bartenders give a damn about whether you like it (he was also very interested in chatting us up, and gave us a few picks about where we should spend our time). We split a dozen oysters between the three of us, and they were as good as you would expect.

When we finally got seated, we were a drink or two in, and boy did things get fun fast. I ordered the taste of New Orleans, which was a decent sampler platter, but really, I should have just gotten the étouffée (I was less thrilled with the jambalaya). It's a decent way to try the different items if you've never had them before, though. Service was good, food was okay, and the drinks are tasty. Not a bad place to spend a Friday night.

Oh man they have some great bloody mary's at this place. Head up stairs and try and get a seat on the patio (seats 2 people) for good people watching and likely some good tunes as there's a street violinist around the corner. We had the jumbalaya and the crawfish etoufee and both were great! Great service and exactly what I was looking for during lunch.

In search of a balcony to people-watch and grab some oysters prior to our Sunday departure, we finally passed Royal House and were pleasantly surprised to be seated immediately. Woohooo. The balcony/upstairs seating area was super skinny and a little creepy as we sat at the edge overlooking the street- one bad move and it's possible you could fall off or break the roof (nah, not really). We ordered a half dozen oysters, which were simply delish. While I really can't review on the food, I can say that I did love this place and wished we could have stayed longer. Alas, we were on the hunt for a cab to the airport and wanted to say we viewed Mardi Gras-ers from above. It was fun- will try this place again in the future.

GREAT balcony for people watching, but extremely slow service and low quality food. After ordering, we waited about an hour and a half to receive our food which was cold and very disappointing. I ordered red beans and rice which was described as being mixed with sausage and fried chicken. In actuality, it was a bowl of mushy beans with a small portion of rice, topped with one tiny chicken strip, and one slice of sausage. Let's just say.. my stomach wanted to cry after getting increasingly excited over the past hour and a half and then seeing a cold mushy bowl of beans before me.

I would NOT recommend coming to this place for food, but if you're looking for a nice, relaxing spot to stop for drinks-sure. Large drink menu and awesome people watching balcony.

This was quite a mediocre experience for a place rated so highly. We went on a Sunday of Mardi gras and they werent busy (we were seated immediately with multiple open tables available). The service was extremely slow and the food was not great. A friend received her gumbo at room temp and had to send it back which was priced at a steep $10/bowl. Another friend got the stuffed mushrooms which were also pretty mediocre. Our appetizer came well after we had gotten into our main meal, (crab claws) and they weren't that great. At $12 a po-boy which was dry and unppetizing, I was disappointed.  Our waiter was polite , but either seemed busy and preoccupied or inexperienced. I blame the kitchen staff for the lack of promptness on the food. Overall, I wouldn't recommend going here. Overpriced, and underwhelming.

New Orleans has Gulf Oysters. I think Royal House dealt with them the best. We had oysters in so many different ways it felt like a oyster taste test. People like Drago for the charbroiled oysters, but I think the ones here are much better. The best oysters, for me, were the ones stuffed with seafood. The bar counter top is sexy and perfect for a couple. Bar Dining

I'm gonna keep this real short and to the point. I've ate here on both trips I've made to New Orleans. The raw oysters were some of the best I've ever had. The redfish beignets are killer. And I've never been around a more likeable staff. Location is beautiful and prices don't hurt your feelings.

For anyone whose in New Orleans for Mardi Gras, you know just how crazy things can be, finding places to eat being one of them! Fast forward to Tuesday night, the night of chaos. We're frantically calling different places on Yelp in hopes of finding a last minute place to have dinner on our last night there. To the surprise of no one, nobody's answering us...until we decide to give Royal House a call and then *trumpet blows* a success! We're told that they'll be operating under regular business hours and to come on down. On top of that, we only had to wait a total of 5 minutes after being wait-listed for 20! (Which is a win win situation for anyone whose absolutely starving.)

We ended up getting the charbroiled oysters, crab claws, crawfish ravioli and crawfish étouffée...all of which were divine.  On the side, we ordered a cup of gumbo and grits, which were...not so divine. (But to be fair, grits are always better had for breakfast anywho.)

All in all, a great experience. (My mouth is watering just looking at the picture I'm posting up with this review.) For those of you who haven't gone already, give it a try.

PS. Marco the waiter is awesome and very funny!

Good quality food at great prices. The gumbo and oysters are so yummy, their drinks are delicious and we got a free appetizer with checking in! One of the best places to eat if you're down there for Mardi gras since every other place is crowded or fast food.

This place changed my view of Oysters. They were that good here. I've had them a few times before and they were OK but after a round of oysters before dinner, I was very happy. I ordered the Blackened Shrimp & Jambalaya which was beyond phenomenal. Our waitress was extremely helpful in answering questions and giving her recommendations for our seafood beginner at the table.

The only slight blemish on the experience was when my fiancee ordered her cocktail. I can't remember the exact name of it but it had gin, sprite and cucumber in it. When the drink was delivered, it had a pretty good brown tint to it like either coke was used or whiskey. I asked about it to make sure it was the right drink which they said it was. My thought process was "Gin is clear....sprite is clear...then why is this drink brown?" The bartender asked if it tasted fine, which it did. However, I do want to know where I can find brown gin or sprite.

Upon walking into the restaurant and being escorted to the second floor you get the impression that Royal House is a very fancy place to eat.  However the menu is reasonably priced and the food delicious.  Our waitress, Becks, was very accommodating, charming and as cute as a Pixie.  She certainly made our evening memorable.

As for the food I wanted something light to contrast the heavy knock-you-on-your-ass meals that tend to dominate the city of New Orleans.  I ate the grilled red fish with oyster tacos as my app.  Both were amazing and I'd definitely get them again.  Royal House also has a full bar equipped with large draft beers.  A+

Walking into Royal House, we weren't sure what to expect from this restaurant as it had a very classy but warm atmosphere. However, upon being greeted by our courteous, and entertaining, waitress (Becks), we knew we were in for a good dinner. And, we were not disappointed! The redfish beignets were absolutely amazing--sweet and salty with just a little bit of kick. For the entrees, the redfish (blackened) and the shrimp tortellini were delicious--good mix of flavors and just the right portion. 
Overall, from the great service to the amazing food, I would highly recommend this restaurant!

Here for Spring Break, and I have been here twice in three days. The service is amazing as well as the food. The waiters and waitresses have great Southern hospitality! Be sure to check it out! If possible, ask for Alex! He's ridiculously amazing!!!!

Our server was terrible. His name was Derrick and he said he went to UNT. He did not refill our drinks, was very short with us when we asked questions, and didn't check on us unless we called him over. My friend ordered a coke and he didn't even acknowledge my friend until 10-15 minutes later. 

He also told us they ran out of coke (how?), green beans, all desserts, and alligator. How can a restaurant run out of that many items in one day? 

Our appetizers took so long to come we decided to just get the check then and go somewhere else for our entrees. We got crab claws, a royal spinach salad, and a side of hush puppies for our appetizers. The crab claws were very good but very rich, and the salad was good too. The hush puppies were generic. They weren't worth the terrible service though. 

The only good thing I can say is we didn't have to wait for a table when we came. This was definitely the worst service of our entire Nola trip.

Becks brings service to a new level. She embodies the warmth you get after a sip of sherry. Sarcastic yet comforting as a worn in lazyboy. The atmosphere is fancy yet homey. 
We went for the oysters mainly and they exceed expectations in a grand manner. The pescatore and the crawfish ravioli were just okay. Nothing special. But those fresh oysters are still lingering in my mind ad I eat dessert

Oysters! Lots of oysters. Raw, broiled, fried, topped with lots of stuff, and my new favorite, a BLT-O-.  The French fries were average(the coated kind), and I think the hush puppies weren't fully cooked, but the oysters were great

A large group of us ate here around lunch time.  It was crowded but didn't take very long.  Our server, Richard, was very good and knew the menu well.  He made excellent recommendations and answered all of our questions honestly.  
I ended up with the Shrimp & Grits.  They were awesome, just the right consistency, cheesy with special sauce and shrimp on top.  The rest of my group were all pleased with their orders - taste of New Orleans, Roast beef poboys, and a Shrimp PoBoy.  The only bad thing was the shrimp poboy was a little dry, it needed more sauce.  We all tried each others' and everyone liked the food.    
Other than that, the staff was very friendly, Richard was very attentive and we got refills without asking...always a plus in my book.

My boyfriend and I had a delicious meal here on Sunday night.  There was a wait for the balcony seating, so we went ahead and sat downstairs because we were hungry.  We shared the stuffed mushrooms to start, and they were delicious. I was only able to eat a couple because they were quite rich but perfect for sharing.  My boyfriend started with some chargrilled oysters, which he greatly enjoyed.  I got the red beans and rice, which I enjoyed.  My boyfriend got the crawfish étouffée, and he absolutely loved it.  I tried a bite and thought it was delicious, but a little too rich for me to have as a main course.  It was a delicious restaurant that I would recommend.

Great customer service for a large group, but salty salty salty food! Maybe it's the "Cajun/Creole" way but everything was soooo salty. It wasn't bad, but only if they didn't use that extra spoon of salt! 

We were a big group and got things to share:
-Fried Alligator: I hated the thought of eating an alligator, but the fried alligator wasn't so bad! It kind of tasted like chicken, you must try this! I wish they gave us more. It wasn't too salty but could use less...
-Spinach Dip: Nothing fancy, the name says it all!
-Crab claws: I really thought we were going to get "crab claws" instead it seems more of a soup. The dipping sauce was overwhelming and engulfs the crab claws. Extremely salty dipping sauce.
-Seafood Pescatore: Very spicy! A great spicy kick to it, everything else was salty, but seafood was fresh
-Baked Shrimp Tortellini: The saltiest dish ever. Don't know why the tortellinis were so salty. The shrimp in it was good, tasted very gritty. 
-Blackened Shrimp & Jambalaya: Wasn't too salty, but could use less. Shrimp was excellent and a good jambalaya, not as "juicy" as I would like but overall a decent dish
-Royal House Burger: The name says it all... it wasn't too bad for a Cajun/Creole place!

Over server was super cool and told us to always check the bill here because places add on extra charges (like gratuity) and not tell you around Mardi Gras. Also you get the "Mardi Gras Menu" aka the overly priced food because they can. I've eaten Cajun food in Cali (but not from the source-NOLA) but in Cali it's not salty like the Cajun here...so maybe it's a regional thing, but all the food was just too salty for us. Should have gotten their oysters!
Visiting from St Louis and randomly found this place. It was an amazing find. The food was excellent and so was the service. Cindy was a fantastic waitress. Get the bloody mary.

The Royal House is a nice hidden gem in New Orleans. Aptly, it's located on royal street, tucked away in the French Quarter, away from the hustle and bustle of Bourbon Street. 

My boyfriend and I picked this place for a late dinner (they're open until midnight) on our first night in town. You get a free appetizer with a Yelp or FourSquare checkin! Our waiter recommended the Stuffed Mushrooms, which we tried and absolutely loved. I'm not a big mushroom fan in general, but I couldn't get enough of them. They have a nice selection of local brews, he had the Jockamo IPA and loved it. 

I ordered the Crawfish Ravioli, and he got the Pecan Crusted Mahi Mahi. The ravioli was absolutely delicious, but his Mahi Mahi was definitely burnt. He asked the waiter to trade it for the ravioli, and they were very good natured about it. The service was very friendly and welcoming throughout! I would definitely recommend it as come back again.

This place is a must if you're headed to the Big Easy! The food is amazing and the oysters are as fresh as they come. We had Becks as our server and she was both welcoming, comical, and gave great recommendations. Enjoyed our experience from the dinner to the atmosphere.

Checked ed on yelp got a free $10 appetizer !! Wohoo then I got the peel and eat shrimp. Place was packed so we all sat at the bar and the service behind the bar was the best. The guys were awesome shucking the oysters so friendly ! Peel and eat shrimp was pretty good too.
Really great place! Went here with some friends, and everyone loved what they got! The food is wonderful, and the costumer service is fantastic

My wife and I were not very hungry but wanted a quick bite to eat before a two hour tour. This place had a balcony and several tables by open windows, which all looked very inviting. We asked the Host for one of those tables and he went out of his way to get us one. 

Once we were at the table we ordered a couple drinks from our waitress who's accent was similar to the "Swamp People". We ended up splitting a "Taste of New Orleans", which consists of Chicken & Andouille Jambalaya, Crawfish Etouffée and Seafood Gumbo, plus we had an order Crawfish cakes. All of our food and service was fantastic and the street performers completed the atmosphere. While eating, we wished that we were hungrier so we could try more food.

I went here with a party of 6 and no reservation, and despite being crowded they managed to seat us promptly. The waiter was pretty quick with our food but not the most friendly person. I recommend the chargrilled oysters, which were hands down the best part of our meal. I was impressed that they did a variety of dishes all very well. My table and I enjoyed everything varying from crawfish etoufee to a fish poboy to seafood tortellini.

This was a friendly place, and we got in with a minimal wait, which was great.  My companion raved about her ravioli, which the way-fun waitress had recommended. Unfortunately, my shrimp tortellini wasn't even Olive Garden worthy and the charbroiled oysters were only okay.  They managed to lose our oyster order in the kitchen (printer jam) so that came with dinner. The manager comped us our drinks when we asked, and those were good enough that we got a second round.  So some good, some bad, and I'll order something else next time!
Great food and service on a Friday night. The oysters were great, especially their house special oysters which you can choose the kinds you want in it. We would definitely return!

Stopped for lunch here with my wife and the food was fabulous.  The crawfish cakes were a great start and then we split an oyster po-boy.  Best po-boy ever!! The oysters were super good and the bread was out of.this world. Only minus from the experience was our waiter wanted to talk to us an inordinate amount.  Very friendly but overly talkative.  Would go back anytime!

The service at the bar was slow and seemed unorganized. Shocked it would be that way on a SUN around 8:15PM. After ordering 2 gumbos and a entree we were informed they were out of gumbo after waiting 25 mins. Bartender said "I was wondering why it never came out". We would have walked if he didn't tell us the entree was being prepared. Shrimp was a over done which made it hard to peel.

We wandered in here our first night in New Orleans in search of raw oysters. The place was packed and felt a touch kitschy, but we had read good things about the oyster situation. We shared a dozen raw oysters and a shrimp boil. Simple and delicious, it was exactly the food we hoped for from New Orleans. 

On the gluten situation...I assumed a shrimp boil wouldn't have hidden gluten, but you gotta check. Despite being very crowded in the busy bar section of the place, the waitress was on point and spent the time to check on the gluten situation. 

When I go back to this awesome town, I will definitely stop in here again.

Really good place to eat! Our server was excellent and very friendly and funny. 

Everything had was really good. I got the french onion soup and burger and both were exactly what I wanted. I was just sick of seafood at that point. Friends got all sorts of meals including pasta, raw oysters and NOLA classics and all were really great. I would go back!
Great alligator po'boy. Although I was looking for more meat on mine it was delicious. Fries were great and staff was friendly and funny. I don't Oysters but my party said that they were great.

Stopped in just after the craziness of Mardi Gras! Could not have had a better experience. The food and atmosphere were great! Our server, who's name I forget, was awesome and was filled with knowledge of the local cuisine, a true pro. Definitely a must while in the quarter.

Let me just say that the service was amazing and everyone who worked at the restaurant was friendly and polite because of that they get the 3 star.  The food was okay.  I found a hair inside my gumbo and lost my appetite. I didn't mention it to the staff or anyone at my table.  The party wasn't really satisfied with the food and thought the food was ok.  Beat part of the meal were the fries which were really really good.  I recommend going for great service and fries

I'm pretty sure I was the first person in for lunch on a Thursday. Ordered a dozen raw oysters and a bloody mary right off. My server was excellent and the drink and oysters came right up. Oysters were a big disappointment - had a lot of grit in them. Mississippi River Bottom had much cleaner oysters! After that I ordered the Taste of New Orleans sampler, which had small portions of the crawfish etouffee, gumbo, and jambalaya. The etouffee was the best I've had in town so far - but the other two were just meh. I don't think I found a single piece of chicken and only small pieces of sausage in the jambalaya...it was mostly rice. The service is stellar but I wouldn't come back when there are so many other awesome places to eat in this city!
Char grilled oysters are better than Dragos. The po boys and gumbo are below average.

We were in a hurry and the staff was super gracious and got our order out in minutes. The food was great--I got Taste of New Orleans and was so satisfied! Cindy was our waitress and she was funny, had great recommendations, and treated us well. And the hosts helped us even when we changed the number of our party a couple times!

A decent place to enjoy classic creole fare... It has a solid showing of the basics... In a tourist centralized locale. I can not boast its greatness, however it has survived for so long for a reason.. You can do a whole lot worse. The Cajun trio was adequate ...

So impressed! I'd like to first send a giant shout-out to New Orleans's CM, Morgan Ford, for her wonderful recommendations! I can always count on the world of Yelp when in a new city. :-) I had never had oysters prior to this trip, so I was a little hesitant at first. But my oh my, Royal House really knocked it out of the park! These oysters were delicious. And the restaurant was perfect. 

And the service was spot on. Heidi is a fantastic server! (Don't know her last name - just ask for Heidi.) She's spunky and happy to give you her personal food recommendations, music recommendations, bar recommendations, etc. Ya know, maybe she works for Yelp as well? ha

All in all, great restaurant. Not cheap, but worth every cent.

Thought we waited to late to get a seat. Walked by 15 min earlier and there was a line, called and talked to the manager and told us no more than a 5 min wait. Off we went around the corner, walked right in to our table, other tables filled up as soon as they came open. Waitress Tina was the BOMB! Made suggestions and answered questions! Food was fast and tasty! I had the peel and eat shrimp my wife had the shrimp platter, both excellent! The kids plates were well priced and more than the enough. Jacoby made sure our table was cleared on time and fast! great time! great food! no complaints! Thanks again Tina!

Really had a mixed experience here. On the one hand the chargrilled oysters and jambalaya were really good on the other hand the service was mixed. Burger was also just ok and fries good. Got overlooked at the door and then when finally seated after about a 15-20 minute wait, the food took forever to come out (manager did apologize). Then the order was slightly off but not enough for us to want to change the order given the time. If things had gone smoother we would have looked at dessert which later I regret we didn't try.
The bar looks really great and the waiter was friendly.

We were looking for a place to snack and wanted to hit as many places in New Orleans. We ordered several dishes like the Taste of New Orleans, Shrimp and Grits, and the fried oyster puff pastry. The shrimp and grits were good but the dish that stood out was the fried oyster puff pasty, it was very tasty and we wanted more. Definitely recommend the puff pastry if you go.

Lots of great reviews, but unfortunately this will not be one of them. We went here because I was looking for chargrilled oysters and hubby was looking for some decent gumbo.

Cleanliness: we sat at the bar and I immediately noticed it was a little messy. My original thought was that a few people had cleared out and they would get to it. NOPE. The bar looked like it needed a good wipe down.  Menus were just lying around (and they were not laid out in preparation for incoming patrons). I eventually put the cap on an open bottle of hot sauce that was next to me. My gut said leave, and unfortunately I didn't listen.

Service: our bartender looked like he was cleaning out some sort of oyster bin. Is that really necessary in the middle of dinner hour? That would explain why the bar was a mess and there was a lack of attentiveness. He seemed to find plenty of time to chat when a friend came in though. 

Food: I have had chargrilled oysters before. These were unlike any I have had, and not in a good way. The "topping" was much more like a broken down sauce and running all over the place. Gumbo lacked flavor and had way too much rice. 

I often am more interested in trying a couple of small plates/appetizers at a restaurant before I commit to a full meal. Proved to be the right decision in this case.

Had a truly exceptional meal here- perfect service, excellent food and cocktails, reasonable prices, and all serviced on the balcony.  

We had baked oysters, crab legs, crawfish étouffée, and bananas foster cheesecake for dessert. Man. I can't even think about it anymore. Just go here and sit on the balcony.
Great food, helpful and friendly staff and martinis as big as a punch bowl Enough said.  No better place to spend a wet, rainy evening.
Great food, very friendly people, a block off Burbon St but still can be a bit noisy. Overall it was a great experience in the French Quarter.
Fast and friendly service, every bite was amazing. Red fish was top notch as well as the Chicken Andouille Gumbo.

Walked up to the door of this place 2 hours before close and were informed that they were closing early because the kitchen was threatening to walk out. Went to look for another place to eat but were undecided and when passing by a short time later noticed that the front doors were open again. We were a bit hesitant to go in but decided to take a chance. 
Oysters were awesome but the jambalaya, not so much. It was wet and over cooked. Good bread. Mediocre service. If I return it would be for the oysters only.
First stop off the plane. We were dyin for something quick. They had delicious oysters and great service.
Good food, good service. We went a couple of times while in town and will go back when back in NOLA.

Had a really nice meal here last night! I was walking around the French quarter with my boy friend and we got hungry. We tried to find a place to eat and many were super crowded. We saw Royal House on yelp and it got good reviews / wasn't crowded so we thought we'd give it a shot! Glad we did! 

I got the oyster duo which featured two different types of breaded oysters. I wasn't exactly sure what was in either but I figured you can't go wrong with oysters.. They turned out to be delicious! My boy friend got the oyster po'boy and he loved it!!! 

Other pluses- the atmosphere was really cute, almost old-fashioned looking, and the waitstaff is very friendly. Prices are pretty reasonable. They also let us bring in drinks from other places that we hadn't finished which was really nice! Overall all I definitely recommend if you're in the quarter! Great oysters and atmosphere!

We had char grilled oysters, crab claws and redfish beignets. Our favorites are the grilled oysters and redfish beignets. Tiny crab claws are made with a very tasty sauce, but we find the sauce a bit too salty and over powering the crab claws, perhaps this is how this dish is supposed to be. This is our first time having the crab claws like this. 

Service is pretty ok but could be more efficient. We got our water and beverages well after the dishes already arrived. Our waitress did offer an explanation due some issues in their kitchen. The portion is a bit small, thus a bit on the pricey side. But then this restaurant is located on Royal St. in French Quarter.
Really not worth the money.  Oysters are too salty  suspiciously.  The steak is sub par for its price.  The waiter is nice.

Well my kids love the Royal Burger and Roast Beef Po Boy. I got the oyster on half shell every visit and they were pretty good.
Service was always good, and wait less than 5 min each time. Would definitely come again:)
BONUS: All three visits got a FREE APPETIZER for checking in on YELP! Woohoo!

Went to Royal House because a frd recommend it, plus good yelp review. Big disappointment!

Food: ordered char-grilled oysters, waiter said we must have it with cheese (we went to Felix's last night, and we had it without cheese, so yummy), anyway we ordered a dozen to try. The oysters were tiny, and really salty. We didn't like it at all. Hubby ordered rib-eye, and he didn't like it. And the side potatoes were so salty again. I had crab louis salad, so little crab, haha! And the tempura crabmeat didn't taste like crab at all ~

Service: Very poor. Waiter said he was busy serving 5 tables at the same time. Well .. should I care? Not really! Because I came to the restaurant and expected someone will serve me instead of telling me how busy he was at that moment. I could wait a bit if he tell me the fact nicely. The waiter did not give us a chance to order our drinks until we order the foods. Then he didn't give us small plates for appetizer. Then, he didn't give my hubby a steak knife. Well ... so we constantly needed to find our busy waiter (crazy!). No fun! When we told him the truth about we did not like the oysters. He was shocked and asked us where we come from. I told him we are from NY, and then he said this was the first time he heard from customer. Well ... serious? Maybe he should try the oysters, then he would know. 

At the end, we even forced to pay 18% tips ... we know we won't eat at royal house anymore.

Okay so we went two times on our trip because their oysters were fabulous!!!!!

The chargrilled oysters were the big hit.  So tasty and we requested extra bread to sop up the butter/parmesan cheese.  This was like crack for us and we kept ordering more (hence the reason why we came back another night).  Oysters Royal were really good as well, however better on the first night than the second. The crawfish cakes appetizer was very tasty (got it on the Yelp check in deal...so glad I got to try them...thanks Yelp!).  I had the shrimp and grits (which was on my must have NOLA food list) and it was fabulous with a slightly spicy sauce and creamy grits with gouda cheese (they sold me on that one).  Lastly we shared the bananas foster cheesecake...so divine...LOVED IT and I am not a big dessert purchaser.

Do be warned to make reservations as there could be a big wait.  We were lucky and seated within minutes of arriving, however we were right next to the hostess station and heard people getting turned away. Our waitress was very friendly and attentive and handled our crazy group well (4 of us, but with a couple of drinks in us we were a little goofy at times). ;P

If in town again I will definitely be coming here to have more of the chargrilled oysters and maybe trying another one of their specialties. I can't believe I didn't try redfish when I was in NOLA so next time!

Just say NO! Beautiful location but the food pales in comparison. I'm almost positive the fish was frozen - especially after the waiter told us the seafood truck hadn't made a delivery this morning. Had the New Orleans Trio, which was decent. The crawfish étouffée was the star. Rich and buttery. Next best thing I ate was the hush puppies. Perfectly seasoned fried goodness. Three stars only because it felt like old New Orleans. Go for a drink and the upstairs view/ambience. Keep walking for much better food throughout the French Quarter.

Came here Easter weekend with my girlfriend and we came here our first night. Becks was our waitress and, to say the least, she was a kindred spirit. she was our flavor general and she commanded our palates across the entire battlefield. After multiple oystergasms we recharged with some of the red fish beignets. This review was written before we could even get to the food because we were enjoying ourselves so much. Thanks Royal House and thanks Becks!

"Y'all look like locals."
