What a nice greeting from our server during our first meal in New Orleans. Maybe he was blowing smoke or anyone NOT wearing beads looks like they're from here. Either way, I'll take it!

The boy and I knew instantly that we had to order hurricanes...let me tell you, I've had them in Phoenix where there's a super awesome southern restaurant and they're good. But nothing like having a hurricane in NOLA. It tasted like candy, so delicious.

For an appetizer, we had a Yelp check in for a free appetizer and our server recommended redfish beignets. For dinner, we both had to get po'boys. I got oyster and my boyfriend got alligator. The beignets were divine. The sauce they were served with was sweet and very complementary to the flavor of the redfish. Our po'boys were equally good, considering neither of us had tried alligator or oysters. 

Service was a delight. I wish I remembered the name of our server but he was so friendly and attentive to us. I cannot wait to return!

Nice place for mid-day oyster snack. And Bloody Mary with Cajun infused vodka! Nice outdoor balcony seating.  Balcony is crooked which cracks me up. As long as you don't lose your drink off top it's all good :)*drafted march 2013

French onion soup was great.  The chargrilled oysters are on the small side compared to dragos which are big and great.  They're still okay here.  We like this place because we can sit by open window and we are never disappointed.  We just go to Dragos for our chargrilled oysters usually.  We will be back to royal house

This place is great! This was our first meal in NOLA and is did not disappoint. Becks was our server, she's a cross between Ellen Page and Molly Ringwald. She was upbeat and suggested meals which were amazing. The Shrimp Tortellini and Shrimp and Grits were to die for and the French Onion soup was delish! We look forward to coming back again.

Can't rave enough! The service was impeccable, ask for Becks. She was so attentive, personable, and our drinks were never empty.  The chargrilled osyters were great, the crab claws amazing-- sop up the delicious sauce with your French bread, and then dive into the redfish beignets!! It sounds so wrong ( fish and beignet and syrup!?!) but it is so so right with the crystal beurre blanc sauce. So fantastic we had to order a second batch.  Atmosphere is perfect for people watching and having a great dining experience. Wonderful value for the price. Can't wait to come back!!

We got a balcony table and got the free app from yelp checkin (score!). The view is really nice at night. a bit slanted so it was a bit scary on what we put on the lower side of the table. 

We got the crawfish cakes ($10 lightly breaded and seasoned with crawfish tails topped with crawfish cream) for app. Then tried the Taste of New Orleans which included 
a sampling of Chicken & Andouille Jambalaya, Crawfish Etouffée and Seafood Gumbo. I wasn't a fan of the jambalaya - luke warm at best and not very flavorful. Crawfish etouffee was delicious and seafood gumbo had a slight kick. Both had lots of seafood in the dishes. We had also ordered the Creole shrimp. This was a much better dish than the sampler - hot, tastes fresh and the tomato based sauce was not as heavy as the cream based dishes. Portion was nice too with about 8 medium sized shrimps. 

Overall, a really nice restaurant to hang out and take in the sights/sounds of French Quarter with decent food. 

Service was pretty good - friendly waitress!

Walking back to the hotel last night (from Pierre Masperos, decent pork po boy there), turned up Royal Street where I heard the voice of an angel.  A woman singing at the corner of Royal & St Louis, actually, and she was quite good.

Mentally noted the inviting restaurant at the corner, returned tonight for dinner.  Long story short, loved it!  Rachel was friendly at the bar, I went with her recommendation, a 3-cup sampler Taste of NOLA:  Chicken & Andouille Jambalaya, Crawfish Etouffée and Seafood Gumbo.  It was pretty tasty, a little Crystal helped all three.

Relaxed atmosphere at the not-crowded bar on a Tuesday night, and tonight's entertainment across the street was a musician playing an electric fiddle like a demon.  The acoustics on that corner are extraordinary, really great vibe.  There is balcony seating overlooking the corner, classic Quarter charm.

Will visit a few more times, with consistency this place has upgrade potential to five stars.  Recommended.
The food was moderately good but the service here was terrible. Somewhat of a tourist trap.

we really enjoyed our dinner here. The redfish in the crawfish sauce was excellent. the best part of dinner was our wonderfully quirky server Becks. Beyond making delicious recommendations, she was delightfully entertaining. if I was making a trip to Mordor I would absolutely want her a long for the ride. I heard she may be able to procure a unicorn.

The most fun we've had in a restaurant during our visit. Casual but skilled service. Oysters prepared six ways from Sunday. We tried them all! Try the grilled alligator. Lots of local beers to go with it.
Delicious spinach salad with grilles shrimp. Best French onion soup I've ever had. And they give a 25% discount to the military. Great place.

This place was amazing. Sat in the balcony for amazing people watching. Food was awesome as well as the prices and service. I got the shrimp and grits and my husband got the jambalaya. We shared some oysters which were some of the best I've had. All in all a definite winner and not sure tourist as it's off the main bourbon street area.
Kudos to this restaurants management for reading these reviews and providing feedback. That gives me reason enough to give them another try.

It's not often you leave a restaurant with the phrase "give us us free" repeating through everyone's head. At least it seemed not everyone's dining experience took as long as ours. We did love the apps, but by the time the mains had arrived we had forgotten what we ordered. Our memories were quickly jogged with the taste of dry po-boys in our mouths and less than flavorful jambalaya. We had to express our disappointment a few too many times in order to have the restaurant make up for the long wait and subpar food, but to their credit they seemed genuinely sorry when they finally did and took 25% off the bill. Our waitress Tina was very nice and apologetic on behalf of the restaurant. You would think a restaurant would be more proactive in preventing this when a customer comes in with a yelp checkin deal.

Mediocre food and slow service, but charming ambiance. Our party of 11 came here on a Friday evening several weeks ago. The wait to be seated was 40 minutes, but reasonable considering we had no reservations and there was both a festival and conference occurring that weekend. The host was very understanding and accommodating.

Soon we were seated upstairs. The décor was warm and classic with glittering chandeliers. Several couples tables were located on the balcony. Quite a lovely place to be while vacationing in NOLA. Vintage and charming. 

Service was average. We were kindly offered two complementary appetizers via Yelp check-in considering there were 11 of us who waited quite awhile. However, the food came out incredibly slow overall. It took an hour for appetizers to arrive and another 30 minutes for entrees. Our soft drinks also took 30+ minutes because the restaurant ran out of ice. 

For appetizers, my friends and I shared the baked oyster duo, French onion soup, and redfish beignets. The oysters duo included the oysters Rockefeller--topped with spinach & bacon and to a baked golden brown, and the oysters Royale--topped with a bubbly seafood bake. Both were fine but unmemorable. The French onion soup was standard. The redfish beignets, recommended by our server, were fried golden brown fish filets served with sweet beurre blanc and powdered sugar. They tasted exactly as they sound and A-OK. 

For entrees, many of us ordered the crawfish ravioli which was highly recommended by the server. Unfortunately, the dish was loaded with green and red pepper chunks which overwhelmed the other flavors. It definitely was not the rich, savory crawfish ravioli dish we had been expecting. 

The other half of our party ordered raw oyster platters. Unfortunately, they came out quite late. We could not all enjoy our meal together due to the poor timing. I don't prefer raw oysters but they were reportedly delicious, although I imagine hard to mess up. 

Overall, the food was average and the only true problem was the very slow kitchen. We would probably only return here for drinks or shucked oysters.

Absolutely incredible food and service. The menu is diverse ranging from Cajun to Italian. You also cannot find better prices for the convenient location. 
Mahi-Mahi was delicious and the seafood pascatore was incredibly flavorful and they serve generous portions. The crab claws and spinach appetizers were just as wonderful. 
Highly recommended!!

Wow!  Great food and service here.   Had the Chargrilled oysters and the Crawfish Etouffe, both were hits.  Honestly, really don't think you could go wrong with anything on this menu.  Drinks were also delicious.  Service was great and the lovely open air view of the street was an added benefit to an already fantastic dining experience.

These were the freshest, plumpest oysters I have ever had.  The staff was incredibly friendly and welcoming, and the excellent street performers just outside were an unexpected bonus.  The perfect meal here is a 1/2 dozen raw plus the Oyster duo.  Yum!!

First night in New Orleans and possibly the best dinner we had. We didn't even order entrees! Just had two appetizers and a side to split, which was plenty. The food was phenomenal! We had the oyster duo and crab claws. My gf also ordered a cocktail, which was delicious. It was one of those meals where we just sat silent because we couldn't stop eating.

We had a really good time at this place! It looks like a giant, aged mansion, and that makes it even cooler.

We admittedly first came for the advertised "Free Appetizer" (with Yelp check-in), and wound up not even using it. (You have to purchase 2 full entrees to get it, we wound up with something like an entree and 2 appetizers. No big deal.)

The balcony is fantastic, service is good, and the food is impeccable - all right in the Quarter. I highly recommend the crab claw dish.

On our last night in New Orleans we decided to eat here. We had a great time. The food was cooked perfectly. I had the crawfish ravioli. It was very tasty and very well cooked. My partner had the gator po boy and really enjoyed it. They have a very extensive wine list and the prices are what is to be expected. Our waitress was very nice and attentive. She had no problem taking my yelp coupon for a free appetizer. We got the seafood stuffed mushrooms with it and they were an incredible start. We also got the raw oysters which were very large and well worth the price. Very fresh!  We were seated upstairs and could see out the big open double doors to the patio which overlooked the strip. If you have a party of 2 you can sit out there and enjoy overlooking the street while eating. We would definitely recommend this place. The food was good for the price. It is a little dressier than other places in the same area but not pretentious.

We had such a great time in New Orleans and this was our favorite place at the end of the trip.  Maybe it was because we celebrated our anniversary here.  Maybe it was because we sat at this cute table outside on the balcony.  Maybe because we both wanted to lick the plate clean when we were done.  But we loved it!!!

With a balcony view that overlooks Royal St., Royal House was delicious with terrific seafood, and tons of street music available to listen to. Highly recommended, especially from the balcony.

Prices were fair, food was good, but I thought it was odd that beers were served in plastic cups.

Thanks to my fellow Yelpers, we enjoyed an awesome dinner here! We had charbroiled oysters, oysters Rockefeller, French onion soup, spinach salad, fried shrimp, Mac & cheese, crawfish étouffée = all savory, mouth-watery deliciousness!!!!
Great for the kiddos, and couldn't ask for better service or a more friendly staff!!!!

We were able to get a table for three on the second floor without reservations, which was really nice because we could see down onto Royal Street.  The drinks were complicated and delicious.  I had one of the House's cocktail specials, made with gin and Pim's and the others at my table had drinks made with ginger ale, gin and fruit.  I would definitely recommend both.  For an appetizer, we had the stuffed mushrooms, which were yummy and my crawfish etouffee was out of this world.  As a bonus, our waiter was fantastic.  I will definitely return at some point.

We were in NOLA recently for Jazzfest, and chose Royal House for our last dinner before we left the next morning.

There was a wait for the great tables alongside the windows downstairs and on the balcony on the second level, but we got a nice table upstairs. Our server (a young Molly Ringwald type) greeted us quickly and was ready to take our drink order. Only two beers on tap - Abita Amber and Shock Top. Having the latter should have been a sign - I always wonder why a "local" place would dedicate half its' taps to an Anheiser Busch product?

We got a free appetizer for checking in thru Yelp, and got the redfish fritters our server recommended. They're fried dough strips with a little fish weaves in served with a slightly spicy, sweet syrup. They were ok, nothing special. We really liked the half and half oyster combo, with the Royale and Rockefeller baked oysters.

My partner enjoyed her Seafood Pescatore, but I had issues with my Crawfish Etoufee. When it was served it was barely warm. I returned it, then waited while my partner almost finished her meal before my replacement returned. It was hot now, steaming inferno hot, but the sauce had formed a skin over it like it had been in the oven or microwave for a long time. There were teeny, hard to find crawfish in a dish that was supposed to highlight that ingredient. They reminded me of the dried shrimp treats we have at home as cat treats. The sauce was bland and needed quite a few shakes of Tabasco to have any flavor. Very disappointing. I had the jambalaya at Zatarains Kitchen at the airport the next day that was far superior.

Our bill was about $75, and we were bummed to have chosen Royal House for our last dinner in New Orleans. It was our worst meal in 12 nights in the Big Easy.

The overall experience was satisfactory. The stuffed mushrooms was a great appetizer with a warm seafood soufflé stuffing. The taste on New Orleans is the best plate for undecided guests because it provides a pleasing sample of the jambalaya, gumbo, and crawfish étouffée. The best part of the meal was the French onion soup. By far the best French onion soup I've had and exemplifies how it should always taste!!! I don't think the soup gets enough hype as it deserves. Not that other things on the menu weren't good because they were. Just don't forget the French onion!

This is a tough review for me bc some aspects of the experience deserve 5 stars.  Lets start there...

The chargrilled oysters are AMAZING.  My gf has never has an oyster of any sort and was VERY nervous about ordering them.  However, she could have eaten 50 of these.  They were of a good size and downright drowning in butter and cheese.  They were so good I can ignore the fact that they could have been cleaned a little better.

My gf got the po' boy and she loved it.  It looked freaking good, but I didn't try it.

My crawfish etouffee was so-so.  I liked the flavor, but it came out room temperature.  And the crawfish were fried for some strange reason.   Usually I won't complain about fried ANYTHING, but in this dish it didn't quite fit.

The waiter was very good and the prices were spot on as well.  The building is very cute, and we were seated right by a window so we could people watch.  All in all, a very enjoyable experience.

However, within 20 minutes I had some of the worst stomach pains I've had in quite awhile.  This resulted in....well...I'll spare you the gory details but suffice to say I owe the workers at a certain bar an apology for what I did to their bathroom.  The stomach issues lasted all through the next day.

I can't be certain that whatever got me came from Royal House (they'd get 1 star if I was certain of it), but if anyone else has this problem it would be a good thing to mention on yelp.

I recently went to Royal House with my husband on our last night in New Orleans.  This was by far my favorite meal, and I found the ambiance and staff to be charming.  

We started with the broiled oysters, which were amazing.  We had them the day before at Acme Oyster House, and they were great there, but I preferred these.  

Next we tried a couple appetizers: crab claws in a delicious sauce, and the crawfish cakes. Both were phenomenal, but the crab claws were unique and incredibly fresh tasting.  

I tried the pineapple mojito and it was refreshing and tasty.    

There was a line when we arrived, but there is a line everywhere in NOLA.  We waited 10 minutes tops, and it was worth each of those 10 minutes and more.  

Go here.  Eat crab claws.  Enjoy!

Friends and I stopped here to inquire if a table was available. The gentlemen working the door were very funny and tried to find us a table but they were on a kitchen hold. We asked them to recommend a place nearby. One of the guys advised us to go down to Bourbon street but not turn right because there are rainbow flags which means F**s. We were highly offended. I want the restaurant owner to know that the young man should be warned that expressing opinions like that using derogatory terms makes the establishment look bad. None of us will ever go back.

Really enjoyed our peel & eat shrimp boil. The shrimp were very large & well spiced. Very easy to peel. The corn absorbed most of the heat & spice, in my opinion it was quite soggy, spicy & inedible....(made me cough with all the spice)! But I really didn't come expecting to eat the corn and/or potatoes (which were just ok). But really, the shrimp were worth it! My husband really enjoyed his Cajun Bloody Mary. Infused vodka was very smooth & the drink was well spiced,
Great place, food and service was great. Ask for Cindy, she was fantastic. She even had a tide to go stick for one member of the party. She's the best!

Seafood is the bomb here. Oyster heaven.

The crab claw appetizer is amazing.

Seafood and linguini was the best.

Gotta hit this place again

Military and LE gets a discount here. 25%

Corner location with  upstairs outside seating. Great people watching vantage point.

First and foremost let me explain that i am one of your typical male picky eaters where I stick with safe cuisines like hangar steak, salmon, and chicken.
My fiancée and I decided to eat at Royal House while on vacation in NOLA. 
Enter Chef NiRobi who's purpose on this earth is to create great food for patrons such as ourselves. In the midst of small talk between myself and the chef NiRobi I explained to him my history of dining and playing it safe on most decisions. He explained that I cannot continue with this way of thinking and asked me if I had ever tried oysters?  I explained to him that due to my 'assumption' that oysters were all slimy in texture I stayed away from them. 
He decided to crack one open right in front of me, explained that the slime from afar was nothing but water. He then placed on a cracker and added cocktail sauce and told me try. At that very moment of taking a couple of bites I was beside myself for passing up this experience in prior dining experiences. Chef NiRobi was very detailed in explaining why the combination of the cracker and cocktail sauce was the best way of trying oysters for the first time!  Obviously my fiancée was pleased with this as well since it meant we would eat other foods!
So after his wonderful advice we followed another suggestion of his where he explained that during the day in NOLA one should eat appetizers only and save entrees for when you are ready to go to sleep (since the food is so rich). Upon his advice the Mrs and I ordered fried alligator, charbroiled oysters with Parmesan cheese, and deep fried red fish in a sweet batter similar to beignets. OMG!!!!!!!!! Everything was delicious. Preparation superb! NOLA spices and flavor self evident.
I hope this review has sold you. I'll try to upload a pic.

Amazing service. Amazing atmosphere. Amazing food. I checked in with yelp and received the free crab claws as an appetizer. TO DIE FOR. I had crawfish ravioli and it was mouthwatering make you wanna slap yo momma. My friend had the redfish which look like the whole fish not the small California portions we are used to. French bread soft and delicious.  Cindy was our waitress and she was perfect. Perfect. She recommended the banana foster cheesecake and we got it. It was heaven in our mouths. The next time I'm in NOLA. THIS WILL BE THE FIRST PLACE I HIT.

Food was good
We decided to order an assortment of items since we're visiting and we got there when they weren't too busy. 
We got the: chargrilled oysters
Oysters duo
Shrimp tortellini
Alligator po'boy
-They were all good and matched the nice atmosphere of the restaurant. The mimosa and Bloody Mary were thoroughly enjoyable. The service was nice and everyone was accommodating - the waitress did take a while to add up our check though.
Shariese is the best waitress ever and was so nice during our meal here.  Great food and atmosphere.  Must do for brunch!

Came here for a second time after a business trip. This place was just as good as the first time I came here! The waiters were all very friendly and helpful.

What we ordered:

- Oysters Duo: comes with 6 grilled oysters in 2 flavors, delicious!!, probably my favorite thing here and definitely comparable if not better than the grilled oysters at Acme

- Redfish Beignets: wanted to try this since it seemed different from the typical dish you'd find, basically was battered fish with sauces and powdered sugar, not bad but wasn't awesome like i expected

- Crawfish Etouffee: probably the best crawfish etouffee i've ever had, there was both fried and unfried crawfish which helped make the dish interesting to eat

- Crawfish Ravioli: came with plenty of ravioli to get you full, wish i saw more crab as described though, this dish was good but the crawfish etouffee definitely outshined this
Omg!! So good..best oysters ever! I would also recommend the red fish beignets! It sounded a little odd at first but totally worked and was delicious...I want to go back for more!
Becks is the tits. She provides fantastic recommendations and tells it like it is. She brings food that tantalizes my insides and inspires my outsides. I heart this place and the grub!

Short and sweet...good food, horrible service! Was told 15 min wait for that patio only to wait 45. When we asked about it the staff gets into an argument about them not even using the list what so ever. We had been passed over countless times. Then they say out table was ready and as we were walking to it another hostess seats someone there. So at that point we sat inside, waited forever for our food and any refills, ketchup etc. they were extremely busy but you would think at a location like this they would be accustomed to being a bit busy and still give people decent service.

Bar has an outside view. Ordered the New Orleans sampler and was just OK. I hate to rate a restaurant/bar just solely based on a single experience but I wasn't impressed. The jambalaya was too soupy and the gumbo too dry. I felt the beer selection was limited also.

Great food, wonderful atmosphere.  The tables are tiny and stacked together but the food is worth the wait.  If you like raw Oysters this is the place to start.  The staff is friendly and helpful, service was a little slow but they were quick with drinks.

This place gets busy, but we only waited a few minutes before being seated at a nice table on the balcony, when we showed up for a late dinner (9:45 p.m). The staff was really polite, and we went with the recommendations of our server, Becks, on the food. The Red Fish Beignets were great as an appetizer and the blackened Red Fish main dish, with Royal Sauce, was superb. We also had the chargrilled oysters that were fantastic.  

The only issue we had was with my drink, an Old Fashioned, that had cheap whiskey in it. When I brought it up to Becks, she promptly had it replaced with my preferred choice of whiskey. Thank you, Becks! Also, my wife enjoyed her coconut cucumber mojito. 

All in all, this was a great dinner with great atmosphere. We will definitely be talking about it when we reminisce about out trip to New Orleans. 

Thank you, Becks!

Positives for Royal House are location, price and you don't need a reservation.  We thought the food was good, not great.  I got the oyster duo and the stuffing on the oysters was not very well cooked.  My husband got a piece of red fish and it was pretty small and a little dry.  We also didn't have a very attentive server.  I also had the gumbo which had good flavor.  I had eaten here a few years ago on a much less crowded day and enjoyed the food and the experience a lot more.
So glad we found this place! Food was terrific and our server was prompt, friendly and attentive. Will definitely go again!

Truly an awful experience.  The service was terrible.  Half the people in our party didn't get something.  The Jambalaya was missing half the ingredients.  
Do not waste your time.

Was here this evening. Service was terrible. Ordered jambalaya and it was only rice with a few blackened shrimp, it didn't have any if the ingredients stated on the menu. The server was overwhelmed. He had far to many tables to give any kind of service. We didn't receive our drinks until half way thru our entrees and two members of our party never received theirs. When we asked the server what happened he replied they where out of these drinks to learn later after speaking to a clueless manager this was not true. By no means do I blame the server he was just trying to survive I blame management for not staffing properly or manage the rest or the staff that was just standing around.
By far the best charbroiled oysters I have ever had just make sure to ask for extra bread to mop up that savory sauce n follow that up with their spicy bloody mary.

Holy sh**!
This is literally one of the BEST places to eat in NOLA!
After some folks said Gumbo Shop was disappointing, we opted in this place. 
I started off with a pineapple cucumber Mojito.... So refreshing and used with the freshest ingredients! 

Between our table of 10.. We had the chargrilled oysters (orgasmic), crab claws (MUST GET!!), Taste of New Orleans, oyster pasta, and the list goes on!

Nothing we had was disappointing! NOTHING!

Delicious food!! We had the crawfish cakes, the oysters royal and a linguine with seafood, everything was amazing!! Specially the oysters! Completely worth going and not at all expensive for the quality of the food!! 

Fully recommend!! Amazingly delicious!!
We had a balcony view which was worth the wait. We had the sautéed crab claws for an appetizer and they were amazing. Wasn't impressed with my shrimp tortellini- was rather bland.

The food was delicious and the ambiance was unbelievable It is open doors and windows. It reminds me of all the European restaurants I see In the movies. Paradise. It gets packed so get there early. Everyone strives to make sure you are happy. The place was great. The food was great. The service was great. Only one thing the men's bathroom needs a redo holes In tile on floor were not up to par that's all if not 5star.
Delicious meals, very friendly and attentive service, reasonable prices. We were a party of four and enjoyed a wonderful evening. 5 Stars, everything was perfect.

Royal house has great ambiance especially if you sit in the balcony. There was this duo of a violinist and guitarist the night before that were spectacular. Unfortunately they played earlier in the night but were gone by the time we got there. They usually play on the corner Friday sat and Sunday night. We were there Monday night for Memorial Day. We waited only 20 mins for the balcony. Skipped drinks went right to the oysters. Huge raw oysters the size of your palm no joke. So fresh and yum Had the oysters royale as well to change it up. Also delicious. Then I had the snow crab boiler pot. Delish. My lady got the Dungeness crab pot. We suggest the snow crab. Just as much work but more meat. It comes with corn and red potatoes. Worth the effort and $$. I would come back to try the jambalaya or gumbo or gator dishes. Cool spot with lots of big easy flavor and culture. Classier than the ratchetness in the area.

Decent food that's tasty but definitely not for a palate of a foodie....

My boss and I were trying to get into NOLA but they were fully committed so I looked up my BFF Yelp and we were close to the Royal house.

We waited about 20 min on a Friday night, not too bad.

Our server was beyond fantastic I'm pretty sure her name was Tina, if I'm wrong (she has a thick NOLA accent, been serving seafood for 15 years but doesn't eat it and loves fried Alligator). 

Appetizer
We ordered the Fried Alligator it was my Bosses first time having it and it was super good. Papadeaux makes a better Fried Alligator it's less chewy but all in all it was good.

Cocktails
I had a Hurricane which was way too sweet, 
Zatarains at the New Orleans Airport is way stronger and will set you right!

My boss had a manhattan which was super good and strong!

Entrees
I had my waitress decide for us:

Boss
Roast beef Po Boy-Very Dry, cold and needed more jus.

I had the Pecan Crusted Fish-Cooked perfectly, very moist but the sauce on top lacked flavor and could have used more.

Side
Corn Maque Choux-slap your mom delicious. Creamy and exploding with flavor.

If I haven't had the best food in my life in New Orleans I would have given them more stars. But with Emerial, Aunt Lea and John you have to come guns blazing.

Amazing chargrilled oysters comparable to Acme!!! - no wait, and the oysters were bigger on our particular visit.  

The shrimp creole and crawfish étouffée were also pretty good. In addition, we really appreciate the great service from our waitress, Raven.  Other ladies in the restaurants we interacted with were courteous as well.  The combination of good service and good food seems hard to come by in NOLA.

Will be back for more chargrilled oysters!!!

We ate oysters, oysters and more oysters. When handed the menu my Wife and I looked at what they had for oyster dishes and order one of eat (except raw). The service was amazing and the food was just as good.

Came here for a quick dinner. Ate around 5pm so no wait and it was a Monday. Ask to sit on the balcony, nice view of the street but warning the balcony is uneven, so your table, and chair is un-leveled. I don't remember the name of the food I ordered but it's basically like a seafood pasta. Delicious! I usually don't order pasta but their seafood pasta was the best I ever had!

I had the crawfish ravioli and it was so good.  I would definitely get it again and come back just for this dish.  Grilled oysters were good but not as good as the ones I had at Mr. B's.  Check in on yelp and you get a deal here too.

Maybe we just hit this place on a bad night, but honestly, not one of the 6 of us had a good meal.  What you first see when you walk in, is the lobster tank that is so filthy, that the poor lobsters are probably praying for death.  Going up the stairs, you see worn, dirty carpet.  We were seated at a folding  table that is identical to one at Costco.  The people seated on the end, had no room for their feet, so we asked to be moved.  The food was not good.  The fried fish and shrimp was surely frozen, as it was watery.  They were out of hushpuppies.  The bread that was under the fries was days stale.  Our vegan friend ordered a salad that had orange slices...that were rotten!   She tried eating our bread, but it was too stale.  After days of eating wonderful, fresh seafood, this was a real disappointment.  Maybe the oysters are the only thing to order here?

I was not overly impressed.  The food looked great in the pictures but did not live up to the pictures. 

I started off with ordering a half a dozen char-grilled oysters. Not as good as Acme house. They still had a fishy taste unlike Acme. I was happy because you get a free appetizer when you check in so I didn't have to pay!

I also ordered the shrimp and grits because I had it elsewhere and really liked it. It was different,  a little too flavorful and spicy though.  I prefer Pierre Masperos better. The shrimp was bigger but the grits were chunky in some parts where Pierre Masperos was creamy almost like mashed potatoes and just the right flavor. Totally different recipe though. I did notice they have bigger portion sizes than other places like the oysters and shrimp were larger. 

My mom had the Taste of New Orleans. She was not impressed either. She said one bowel was hot and the others were like luke warm.  She felt like it wasn't really a meal and one of the dishes - I think it was the crawfish etouffe tasted pretty bland. 

Our waiter was very nice though and I liked the window seating to people watch.

Royal House was pretty good, but I'm sure there is wayyy better food in New orleans.  It was pretty sweet that we were able to be seated right away and even get a balcony seat.  The ambiance is really what sold us on eating here.  We shared an order of crab claws which were pretty good, but nothing mind-blowing. The same goes for the shrimp & grits my husband ordered and the spinach apple salad I had.  Overall, it was good food, but for the price you are paying for entrees (approx $16/plate), you can find better.
The food is absolutely phenomenal. Had the sweet potato bread pudding...yum and the oysters were delicious

I went here for lunch after reading praise on Yelp. Using the Check In Offer from Yelp for a free appetizer, I had to order the Crab Claws. They were fantastic! Everyone at the table enjoyed them and we had to order two additional plates of bread to ensure we soaked up every last drop. Do yourself a favor, order the Crab Claws and ask for extra bread. 

For my entrée I got the Fried Fish Po ' Boy. Compared to the appetizer, it was pretty mediocre. I found that my entrée wasn't particularly flavorful or memorable. Others at the table who ordered more expensive dishes seemed to enjoy their food much more than we did.

All in all, Royal House was a good experience. The wait staff was personable and efficient. Next time, I'd just be sure to order something else!
Love the oysters! They are so delicious, flavored yet not too strong. Drinks and noodles are good, too.

A nice restaurant with very nice Decor. No wait as it was a Tuesday night. I had the crab salad and baked oysters. The oysters came out perfect and had nice flavor with the crab stuffing. The salad was good but definitely use more crab meat. The red fish was grilled to perfection and tasty. Only one drawback from 5 stars. The waitress rushed everything so that she can go home. While the salad just came out 1 minute later the main course was out as well. I would repeat but if I see the same waitress I will ask for someone else.

We had tried to get in to Royal House on Memorial Day at about 8 pm, but were told it would be a 45 minute wait.... So we came back the next night. We were seated in the upstairs dining room promptly but it took over 7 minutes for our waitress, Cindy, to acknowledge us.  She was very busy toting plates of oysters up the stairs to diners in her section.  She was very animated and funny, but was sort of frustrated with her coworkers earlier in the day, with her neighbor, and with the very melancholy singer outside the window across the street.  Not sure why she shared this information with us... maybe because it was late, or because we seemed friendly and receptive... Its fine, just not what we expected in a restaurant that seemed to be a pretty old-school, formal place. (At least they were not so fancy so as to be bothered with us showing up in very casual day clothes!) She was very helpful with menu suggestions, however, and we placed our order, taking advantage of the yelp complimentary appetizer.) It took a long time to get our beverages, a coke and a bottled beer. Our appetizer came out next. We got fried gator bites, which were great.  For the main course, my BF got a fried seafood sampler. I got linguine with fried oysters mushrooms, and spinach. My BF's platter looked like it was from a county fair or something. Mainly fries and hush puppies, a little catfish and shrimp. Basically a huge "kiddie plate," but he said it was good. My food was tasty but very light on oysters, spinach, and mushrooms. I got lemon and red pepper to enhance the cream sauce, which was heavier than I expected.   We got the deconstructed bananas foster cheesecake for dessert. It was heavy but tasted fine.  The graham cracker "cookie" in the middle was a brick and nearly impossible to break with forks.  So as the girl outside bleated on with her torchy renditions of Sarah McLaughlin, Joni Mitchell, etc., and our waitress griped jovially about all kinds of stuff, we rolled back out into the quarter with our bellies full, wondering how we could have made a better dining decision on our last night in NOLA.

We were originally in line for ACME oyster house when my hangriness forced us to walk around the corner to Krystal's for a burger snack to hold me down for a 2-hour wait. By the time we finished our snack, my happiness returned and Hubbs changed his mind about ACME. So we decided to go somewhere around the area, and Royal House was our lucky location (short line + 4 stars = winner).

When I checked in, I saw that we got a free appetizer, so we ordered the Redfish Beignets (my hope was a perfect mix of sweet and savory). And since I wasn't that hungry, I got a bowl of French Onion soup. Hubbs ordered two orders of the Chargrilled Oysters (12 total) and the gumbo.

Redifsh Beignets were... kind of weird. I guess I was thinking that the batter was going to be more fluffy than crunchy. To me, it was just deep fried fish with syrup on it. The french onion soup was perfect... great onion flavor, good layer of melty, gooey cheese with a crustini on top. I'm not a fan of gumbo, so I thought Hubbs' gumbo was okay but he liked it. And he really liked the oysters and gobbled them up in a hot second.

Later we found out that the appetizer wasn't complimentary. Mainly because we were supposed to order two entrees in order to get that deal. Our waiter could've told us, but just gave us a full-priced bill instead. Whomp whomp.

I guess being a not-fan of seafood makes me feel "meh" about this place. I wouldn't come back.

Our experience at Royal House was fantastic. We spent two nights in New Orleans and this was the best food we had. We got the fried alligator appetizer which was amazing - perfect for an adventurous eater and a more cautious foodie. The breading was great, crispy and consistent without being greasy. We then had the shrimp plate and New Orleans sampler dish for our entrees- amazing! The sampler dish was the perfect way to try out three of New Orleans most signature dishes. 

What really bumped Royal house up from four stars to five stars was our service. Our waitress, Cindy was hands down the most caring, loving, inviting waitress I've ever had (without being overbearing or nosy). She gave us great tips on how to spend our two days in the city and made us feel right at home. So attentive and warm. I'll never forget her service, so thank you Cindy!

You can't imagine how good the chargrilled oysters are!  I would come back to New Orleans just to eat those oysters.  On the half shell are fresh shucked to order and the service at the bar downstairs and the dining room upstairs was the best we had in the quarter.  If you come to New Orleans don't miss the Royal House!

Amazing food, nice atmosphere, friendly & knowledgeable staff with great recommendations. Came here twice, once for dinner and once for lunch. They have a nice balcony space if you have a party of 2. I would recommend the taste of new orleans, redfish beignets, oysters, stuffed mushrooms, and the breadpudding. 

Food here is absolutely amazing, a must try when in the french quarter. Did not try a poboy here, although I saw many other patrons did. Their menu is too good just to order poboys here. Food is much better than Acme house, which I think didnt live up to the hype.

The location is extremely good along with the atmosphere. Frank Sinatra reportedly used to rent out the second floor. Have been here three times and the only problem is that the food is just ok. Ask to dine on the second floor on the balcony. Very special experience, apart from the average food. 

Also, we were served by Becks. She was the best waitress we saw over a 5 day trip to NOLA.

This was the best seafood restaurant we could find near Bourbon street that had good reviews without a long wait.  The chargrilled oysters were great.  Our daughters said the crawfish ravioli and shrimp creole was delicious.  My wife liked the shrimp jambalaya.  Awesome bananas foster cheesecake -- it's not what we were expecting, but better.  Raven, our waitress, was very friendly.  Everyone left happy.

Service was good. Food was good. Environment was good. Drinks were good. A place I really can't complain about.

Mallory was our waitress and she gave great  recommendations and was super pleasant. We had the crawfish étouffée, fried alligator, hush puppies, and the fish po boy. All were flavorful and really delicious. The fish basically melted in my mouth and was seasoned enough that it wasn't bland as some fried fish is. Alligator was surprisingly great (first time eating it) and I'd definitely get it again. The étouffée was also a first, even though I have nothing to base if on, my taste buds were impressed.

For dessert we had the bread pudding with raisins and white chocolate sauce. Very tasty, but would have been better if it were warmed up in an oven or toaster to be crunchy on outside and soft on inside. It was probably microwaved but still good. I work at a bakery and because it's quicker we do that too, so I'm not going to take stars or credit away for something most business do.

All in all, we enjoyed this place and if I visit New Orleans again, I'll come back.

Would not recommend. My family ate here since it was after 10:00 and almost everything else was closed. The chargrilled oysters were good. However, I ordered the mahi mahi after a recommendation by the waitress and it was so over cooked I couldn't even cut it with a knife in some places so it went back immediately. My son likes his burger well done but his was beyond that. The shrimp po boy was average.  Service was ok.
Everything we ordered was fantastic, service was excellent, better choice (and way less stuffy!) than Emeril's NOLA.

The charbroiled oysters were phenomenal, and can definitely compete with some of the more famous oyster houses, like Acme Oyster. And no wait! However, I would pass over the Taste of New Orleans trio sampler. I have had it twice now and both times it was just ok. Good, but not great.

Best food - loved the dessert. Will make it a regular stop when traveling in New Orleans!

Make sure you ask for Cindy F. as your server - she'll let you know the most delicious entree of the evening!

The ambience was nice and so was the weather so we decided to sit upstairs on the balcony. The grey, wooden floor is sloped away from the building and there is not much room for movement. Iron railings keep you from tipping over the edge onto the pavement below. On the streetcorner there was a gentleman playing Coltrane tunes on his sax. Environment was set so now we were ready for some great food. 

So always follow your first mind. We were supposed to go for Po Boys. But you know how you can be so hungry you'd eat a rickety table if it was seasoned well enough? We that was us. Everything that the wait staff brought past us looked great. So we changed our minds and ordered blackened shrimp / jambalaya and Taste of New Orleans trio: crawfish etoufee, chicken / sausage gumbo and a cup of sausage jambalaya. We also ordered redfish beignets to start which were tasty. 

When our food arrived I realized I made a huge mistake. I was dissappointed because my trio had more rice than chicken, crawfish or sausage but I was  starving so I ate it. Don't get me wrong..it was alright..just not fantastic. On the other hand the redfish dish, oyster po boy and pasta Alfredo with crawfish, crab and fried oysters on top the table inside ordered looked amazing! Maybe try that and skip the gumbos. Our appetizer was free cuz we had a Yelp coupon for checking in. 

All in all try ordering what they specialize in and not what you think looks good. Looks can be deceiving after all.

Great service and food. Had chargrilled oysters, shrimp and grits, crab claw appetizer, and the NO sampler. Balcony seating. Everything was good. The crab claws were probably be the best thing I've eaten in the French quarter. My girlfriend loved the oysters more than any other place.
Great place to eat oysters on the half shell. Be sure to try the crab claws, they are to die for.  Can not wait to go back.

Charbroiled oysters are almost perfect, with parmesan cheese and a teensy bit too much butter, delicious nonetheless! Bar service is perfect - friendly employees. Crab claws come in a thick sauce, a little too rich for my taste - it drowned out the delicate flavor of the crab. I still ate every bite, though. ;)

This was a great little high end cafe style spot for breakfast! My fiance and I were visiting for the last day before we flew back home and found this spot using Yelp. The food was fantastic and the wait staff was also very accommodating.  We got a cute little spot by a window and enjoyed some great southern breakfast before heading back West.

Found this place the last night of our vacation but wished we had found it sooner!!
We were able to walk in and not have to worry about what we were wearing (flip flops and shorts)
Started off with the crab claws! This was by far the BEST dish we had on the whole trip! My hubby joked that he wanted to lick the dish out at the end!!  Our waitress was Christian and she made her helpful suggestions which we listened to! Husband had blackened Redfish and I had to try the shrimp and grits.  Both dishes were good but the fish was better in my book ! Would highly recommend the REDFISH!  For dessert we again listened to our waitress and had the cheesecake with vanilla carmel sauce! Very good!!!!
We sat inside on the lower area. There is balcony seating upstairs that is outside and very French quarter looking!
Would highly recommend eating here!

Chargrilled oysters were great.  Crawfish ravioli was very good but I was expecting a cream sauce so I was a little caught off guard.  We also tried the red fish beignets because we received a free appetizer when we checked in on yelp!!!  This was a great little surprise!  

We have had chargrilled oysters at acme, dragos and home made.  Their oysters were comparable to these restaurants.  

Waiters were nice, knowledgeable and attentive.  We had a 30 minute wait for 2 people on a Saturday night.  Larger parties had a much longer wait.
The BEST crawfish cakes I have ever had! Great food, service and atmosphere. Would definitely recommend this place!

Great food! My daughter and I had the Spinish Salad which was delicious and my two sons had the alligator po-boys and said that it was delicious. The waiter was very nice and helpful. The atmosphere was very French Quarterly and highly recommend coming here. The price is a little on the pricier side but worth every cent. Enjoy!!!

We walked in after 11AM and took a seat at the bar.  It was our first night in NOLA, so we were your typical tourists....wanting to order gumbo.  After we ordered, the bartender Becks asked if she could make some recommendations.  She suggested the oyster tacos and red fish beignets.  We took her suggestion, and we are glad we did!!!  Thank you Becks for giving us the recommendation on what to eat and where to go during our visit....you made us feel at home!!!

Went here twice during a recent trip to New Orleans, and had great food and service both times. Tried several apps, small plates and salads and none were disappointing. Sat at the bar both times and each time the bartenders took great care of us (thanks Jeff and Nairobi!). 

The place is clean and I liked the white tiling and dark wood decor. It was a nice, cool respite from the heat. Seemed like a place frequented by locals too, dining in and ordering to go, which is usually a good sign. Never had to wait for a seat. 

For the food we had the sautéed crab claws (in a to die for sauce), oysters raw, charbroiled and the oyster duo (Rockefeller and Royalel), royal spinach salad, alligator bites, and the tomato mozzarella "salad" which was basically a caprese. Of all items the caprese was my least favorite, as there were giant slices of raw red onion between the tomatoes/mozzarella, and it was drenched in what tasted like a basic balsamic vinegarette dressing. I'd have preferred no onions and a healthy drizzle of balsamic, and also basil. We also had some great hurricanes here, which were made with fresh/real ingredients rather than mixes. Yum! 

I would definitely recommend this place for oysters and seafood when in the French Quarter.

I checked into yelp and to my surprise it provided me with a free appetizer (up to $10 value). 

We ordered the crab claws for the appetizer and wow were we impressed. It was cooked to perfection and came in a bowl of cream which we basically gobbled up with the bread.

My boyfriend ordered the po boy and wasn't impressed.
I ordered the crawfish étouffée and wasn't impressed either, I didn't think it was horrible, I just didn't think it was anything special

I would come back just for those crab claws though.

Went here for a late night dinner after a ghost tour and it was great!

Seafood stuffed mushrooms are delish.

Based on numerous reviews, we ordered chargrilled oysters and crab claws for appetizers. Not bad but not die-for good either. My favorite was red fish and crawfish ettouffee (??). 

Negative was service. Our waitress rarely came to our table; bread was served after we were almost done with dishes. We submitted $10 yelp offer; she didnt take it out in our receipt. A 18% tip for a large party was added in the receipt for our group of 6. The waitress said the 18% tip was added for a group larger than 5. Is it a normal practice in NOLA??? Overall, my experience is below average despite awesome red fish. I wouldnt visit again.

Best spinach and artichoke dip I've ever had! The chips were covered in Parmesan, which added so much flavor. For dinner I ordered the blackened redfish and it was divine. Highly recommend this place. Only waited 30 mins for a table on a busy Sunday night at 8:30pm, which is low considering I had a 2 hour wait at another restaurant, and 1.5 wait at one more.

We were scared walking up to The Royal House as there was a long line of people out front but we only waited a short time and were sat at a table half inside and half outside on the street which was cool. Our waitress Heidi was quick and friendly. Her recommendations for food were awesome as well. For our appetizer, we ordered the Oyster Duo which was oysters prepared two different ways. I ordered the Taste of New Orleans for my meal which was three different cups of jambalaya, crawfish etoufee and gumbo. Each was delicious! My friend ordered the crawfish ravioli and I wish I had ordered that along with my meal because I still dream about how amazing it was! I will definitely be back here next time I'm in New Orleans!
Excellent and excellent service... First time in New Orleans and would definitely make this place a repeat visit

Not as good as I had anticipated base on the reviews. I went for appetizers other yelpers had recommended: alligator bites and crab claws. Alligator bites were good, but they didn't give you much! The sauce in the crab claws was great, but the crab claws were tiny with barely any meat on them. Also, the service was pretty bad. We waited fifteen minutes after completing our meal before receiving the check from our waitress. Then waited another twenty minutes before she came to get them. Between this time, we saw her in the back just standing around talking to coworkers or rearranging Tabasco bottles. It wasn't busy either as there were a bunch of empty tables since we came in at 8:30pm on a Saturday. I won 't be back here during my next trip or recommending it to other friends that visit - the food wasn't worth the trouble.

This place was okay.  I had the sampler entree which when served looks too small to fill you but is actually quite filling.  The gumbo is not spicy but they will bring you hot sauce so you can spice it up to your taste.

I went to Royal House with 8 of my best girlfriends while we were in town for vacation. Instead of rolling her eyes and putting up a wall like most servers can when faced with large groups of women, our server, Becks, was So Wonderful! She shuttled us in with humor and a smile, gave us perfect recommendations, and split our check before we had even asked!! Best server ever, really, ask for Becks! 

As for the food, wow. I am normally a vegetarian, but break it for local specialties while I'm traveling. Boy am I glad I did! The grilled oysters here are to die for! I could've eaten them all night. Becks also recommended the blacked redfish with a crawfish gravy addition. My mouth is watering just thinking about this fantastic meal. I highly recommend it for anyone!

More of a bar than a restaurant.  Food was plentiful but not super tasty.  Oddly bland for a creole restaurant.  Our server was that shining star.   Really great guy who tried very hard to make sure we had a good experience.
Beautiful and tasty food! Good selection for dinners with celiac disease.  Presentation and service was fabulous.  Definitely a two thumbs up.

We sat at the bar due to the long wait for a table (45 minutes).  It ended up being just fine as our bartender was very friendly, attentive and provided good service.

The food was very good.  The only exception was the jambalaya which didn't seem to have much flavor.

My son has food allergies (dairy and peanut) and the staff went out of their way to find a meal that he could eat - basically created a dish for him that wasn't on the menu and charged us a very reasonable price for it.

Went here based on reviews and photos from yelp and was extremely disappoint especially after seeing the bill. Chargrilled oysters do not even compare to Acme's. They were small and littered with shell. BLT-O was sub-par at best and small for price. Fries it came with were terrible. Alligator was really good. Drinks were overpriced and too heavily seasoned. Manager looking guy looked like a slob and when we asked him to clear some plates from our table he was obviously not happy with having to do it (we literally had to stack our plates on top of each other when our entrees came and no one stopped to take empty app dishes). Fried fish platter was meh. Coleslaw was terrible and there were so many of their awful fries. Fish was decent. Hardly crispy as advertised though. This was my biggest regret on my trip to New Orleans and when I was only staying for 2 nights I was extremely upset to have wasted any time and money here. Our waitress was decent and decor was nice but not worth the $100 or the hour spent here.

second time come to New Orleans. another restaurant we know closes at 10, so we decided to try here base on the reviews on yelp.
the oyster here is good, but will never come back because of the cockroach in my wife's plate.
Great food, excellent service.  Dominic knows all of the best dishes.  The charbroiled oysters, the blue crab claws, the redfish...all excellent!  Every year for Essence Fest, this is a #1 spot.

Crab Claws are small but the flavor is amazing!!! The toasted French bread is great for dipping in the lemon, garlic butter sauce. Shrimp platter is good. Skip the Taste of New Orleans (crawfish étouffée, jambalaya and gumbo). Crawfish étouffée is delicious. Jambalaya is just ok, I prefer my jambalaya to be a little saucier, this tasted more like dirty rice. Gumbo is not good, really disappointing. Next time I will get the crawfish étouffée. One added bonus was service. Waiter was so helpful and really kind, volunteered to get us more French breach for dipping and more sauces, without us having to ask.

Simply Amazing! 

Thanks to Yelp I've been finding all of the sweet spots in the French Quarter . I came across Royal House looking for something with a bistro feel and this place is right on target. 

Venue: The venue is a small 2 story bistro on the corner of Royal Street. You can either sit upstairs on the balcony, inside at the various 2-tops with the street view, at the small inside dining area or the actual Oyster Bar. This place has a vintage yet modern feel. Looks the the interior is old but kept up very well. The seats are comfy and this place isn't crowded. 

Service: Our server greeted us relatively quickly btw I loved the staff's attire. Our server got our drink order in quickly and honored our Yelp Free Appetizer.

Food: Holy moly New Orleans!? Lol...wow...this is legit the best place to have a meal in the French Quarter hands down. Our meal started off with Crawfish Cakes in a cream sauce as an appetizer which were so flavorful and cooked to perfection. For my entree I ordered the Oyster Pasta and my friend ordered the Shrimp Tortellini. Both were exceptionally prepared and full of flavor.

Overall: I highly recommend this place on your must visit list in New Orleans. You won't be disappointed!!

Great place, great service,  authentic cajun food in NOLA French Quarter... We ordered the NEW ORLEANS sampler, which was lacking a little bit of more meat and seafood,  but was good; the shrimp étouffé was good and as an appetizer the red fish beignets. ..

I was excited to eat here seeing the Yelp reviews but our party of 5 was totally disappointed. 3 of our entries were cold.   Our waitress returned them and commented,  "I'm sorry but remember I don't cook the food".  Not sure why she said that since or bill came with an automatic 18% gratuity.  Since we're on vacation we've been trying alot of the cuisine and there was nothing special here worth the 'smelly' trip down Bourbon St.  The Service was good and the bread that came with my meal was the best thing on my plate.

Great service if you mention yelp free appetizer we got the red fish good I ordered oyster pasta good but oysters a little salty.  Everyone else got the gumbo Jambalaya they didn't like they sent it back but our waitress was still pleasant.

Great way to end the weekend. Started with some baked oysters that had garlic on them (ate here a month ago so I forgot what they were called) that the server recommended and it was amazing! I had the baked seafood tortellini and the bf had the crawfish poboy. Everything sure hit the spot. And to top it off our server was great! I would like to try to sit on the balcony next time, on a cloudy and semi humid day.

My husband and I didn't originally realize this was an oyster bar but, upon looking over the menu decided to try it out anyway! They are listed as Creole/Seafood and that is exactly what you get! My Shrimp Creole was a tad spicy (I expected more) and absolutely yummy! The flavors blended well! My husband had the shrimp platter-the breading was delicious and the shrimp were a good size! Both portions were large and filling! They DO NOT skimp on alcohol either! Prices are reasonable and there is a laid back, casual atmosphere
Crab claw appetizer was delicious but not too filling (free with yelp check in).  Blackened shrimp and jambalaya was great as well.

Ein wirklich sehr schöner Laden, man kann in der Atmosphäre einen romantischen Abend verbringen. Wie hatten einen Tisch gleich neben der Toilette :( aber OK! Leider wurde uns statt der 2 Wasser nur eins gebracht, auch OK.. Wir haben einmal den Redfisch- gegrillt bestellt und einmal Spinatsalat. Beide Portionen waren sehr übersichtlich, eher eine gute Vorspeise. Zu dem Fisch gab es 4 Bohnen und 6 Würfelstücken Kartoffel. Wirklich mies war aber, dass der Fisch sowasvon durch war, dass man ihn richtig zersägen musste. Das Eiweiß war aus dem Fisch schon ausgetreten. Als wir das dem Kellern gesagt haben, bot er uns an, etwas anderes zu bestellen (auf eigene Kosten) oder eine Soße zu bestellen... Trotz alledem war der Fisch gut gewürzt und die winzigen Portionen wirklich lecker. Wir würden dem Laden noch eine Chance geben aber wirklich empfehlen können wir ihn nicht. Stern Abzug gibt es für die Menge, den zähen Fisch, das fehlende Wasser und der Bedienung die uns ständig unterbrochen hat.

If you want to have a pleasant and quaint dining experience, then Royal House is a great place to visit. Thanks to Yelp, we were able to have a free appetizer, and we chose the crawfish cakes. Although the portion was small, the wonderful flavor made up for it. Definitely left us wanting more. They were fantastic. We had a really nice waiter who was well versed on the menu items and helped us decide on the Shrimp tortellini and the oyster linguini. Both dishes were extremely tasty and filling. The oysters in the linguini were fried and really yummy. All the menu items were fairly priced and the experience overall was a great one!

We had to wait for quite some time but it was worth it. We were seated when I spotted a perfect table. I asked if we can switch although the table wasn't ready. It was no problem and within minutes we had the perfect table. The red wine was too warm but everything else was really good. Nice service and the oysters were super tasty.
It was the perfect venue for a romantic dinner.

Ahhhhh glorious food coma. The alligator was seasoned wonderfully, crab claws delish, crawfish étouffée yummy and gumbo was a family favorite! Just be sure to bring extra $ for a good tip because if the rest of the waitresses are anything like Cindy, it will be well deserved!!!!!
Crab claws appetizer is amazing!  Seafood boiler pot is incredible and the staff is very accommodating.   I love this place.  2nd time eating here on a short trip to NOLA so u know it's good!

We were seated immediately.  It took a moment for the waitress to come over.  Cindy apologized and said she would be right back to take our order, she was super friendly and personable.  We would definitely come back. We took the advice of the reviews on Yelp and they didn't disappoint.  For starters we had the Redfish Beignet, which are delish.  For entrees we had the Taste of New Orleans,  the Shrimp Po-Boy, and the Shrimp Tortellini.  We were throughly pleased and the portion sizes were just right.

Surprise- the best dish we had this restaurant was the spinach artichoke dip! DELICIOUS! My husband and I sat out on the balcony and let me tell you, the acoustics on that corner are fabulous! There were two ladies playing violin/guitar and an impromptu singing performance by a passerby. We only wish that that the gumbo would have been better, but other than that, we really enjoyed our dinner!

I'm confused with all of the rave reviews for this place... maybe we caught them on an off night? Or more likely, it's a tourist trap. 

I had the shrimp and grits, which I had waited to try and finally got here. HUGE MISTAKE... the whole dish tasted like uncooked green peppers and the shrimp was small and tasted like I was licking a salt block. I like creole seasoning and this was not it, it was gross. I tried to remedy with adding things, but it was a lost cause. 

My boyfriend had a Po'Boy as he had eaten a bit earlier and it was soggy. The veggies on it looked soggy and not fresh. 

The service was also blah for a city so known for hospitality and it was not crowded so there was no excuse.

Yummy shrimp and grits and fish beignets. Everything was hot and fresh. Bloody Marys were off the chain!!! 
 
We had Lunch for 8 people on a Saturday without any wait. Quick service. Cute place. Pretty casual.

Had the shrimp étouffée it was out of this world. So good I ordered it several more times at other restaurants during my visit
To Nola, but alas no ones étouffée was as good as Royals. Nice ambiance as well
Great service! Great food! The Shrimp Creole is unbelievable. Heidi was our server and did a great job!

Thanks for the free appetizer (offered in Yelp). We tried the alligator 'bites' and the oyster beignets--both fantastic!! It was busy when we arrived for dinner and the service was friendly but 'distracted'; long wait for water. I'd say the food value and quality was all there.

We were on first visit to French Quarter and Royal House made a good first impression. We subsequently found that there are plenty of choices for great seafood in the area. See ratings elsewhere.
Go here. Spicy crab legs... and killer desserts

Edit May 2016:
I returned to wonderful New Orleans last week, and after much hype from myself and my friends, we anxiously returned to our favorite restaurant from last time. Holy cow. We were all severely disappointed. The hostess and waiters were rude, slow and disrespectful. The bar tenders, however, were super awesome. But again, the wait staff were appalling. Additionally the food was HORRIBLE. No one in our group was satisfied. 

I even ordered the shrimp and grits again thinking they'd be the same as last time. Boy was I wrong. The grits were deep fried in these triangle shapes. It was disgusting! The shrimp were in a sauce that was not enjoyable either. I only ate the shrimp to avoid starving. I left the restaurant overall very upset. We will not be returning. 

They do still make a mean bloody Mary though. So if you must go, head to the bar. 

ORIGINAL REVIEW FROM MARCH 2014:

I was in NOLA for Mardi Gras for my first time back in March. We stopped here for lunch on our second day and I was absolutely BLOWN away by the food. One of the BEST meals I have ever had in my life.

It was early but there was a wait, but we were fine with that so we hit the bar. I'm not a fan of bloody marys but my friends are. They all ordered one and they honestly looked amazing! They were served with all of these marinated vegetables it was practically a side salad. I gave it a try and really liked it! But I ordered one of their custom margaritas instead and was LOVING it.

We were brought upstairs when our table was ready and upon walking up I saw someone's dish that looked AMAZING. I asked the server what it was and he told me it was the Shrimp & Grits. Knew we had to order it!

We had a decent sized party and none of us had been to NOLA before so we decided to do it family style and order a bunch of different things and split it all. I got the Shrimp & Grits and the rest got some oysters, a shrimp po-boy and some etoufee. Everything really was fantastic and so was the service. But the star of the meal was definitely the shrimp and grits. I'd never had a dish like that before and I literally fell in love. We honestly wanted to return again the next day just to eat that again but decided we should do something different while we're in town for the short time.

We had a perfect experience here and I will definitely be returning. Get the Shrimp & Grits! Fabulous!

Usually swing by at least once when I'm in town. It's a tourist spot but good food & atmosphere! 
I always order the taste of New Orleans which gives me all 3 of my favorite dishes!

While in NOLA for the Essence Music Festival 2014 this became one of my favorite hangouts. Not only did I enjoy the food, but I loved the staff...from Cindy to Nairobi to Jeff I was made to feel at home. I can't wait to return in September.
Sorry, not all that. Reasonable, but not great. Oysters however were awesome and staff were nice/cool but overall no more than 3-stars.

Just returned from a trip to New Orleans and I enjoyed it so much I ate there twice. 

The first time we sat at a table on the upper level. Our server was excellent and answered all of our questions about the menu. The Spinach dip was great and stuffed mushrooms were huge. The Shrimp and Grits were amazing. They had a little more spice than I wanted but they were still outstanding.

The second time my group sat at the bar with Chris who was amazing. He also took the time to answer questions about the menu and provide recommendations. The conservation with Chris was interesting as well.
Dominic was a friendly server.  Ben, behind the bar, was too. Had a good meal.  I'd go back again.
Service was stellar... food was excellant... only reason I didnt give it 5 stars was because they were out of the Crab Claw appetizer. One of the best meals we had during our stay in NOLA!

I had their shrimp po-boy and it was pretty plain to me. No special sauce but they gave plenty of shrimp.  Need more lettuce and tomato.

My friend had the BLT-O...basically BLT with friend oysters. They could've given more lettuce and bacon, but the flavors are good.  The bacon gave the salty flavor and the oysters were plump and juicy (cooked very well).

If you check in, you get a free offer of free appetizer under $10 with 2 main entrees.  WE got 2 main entrees and so we picked the stuffed mushrooms.  Worth it if you like stuffed mushrooms.  We loved it!  

Fries were good.
 It is a relatively popular place and we went on a weekend so be ready to wait.  I don't know if they take reservations or not so call in.

The chargrilled oysters were absolutely divine! I ordered a half dozen but wished I had made it a dozen. The crawfish étouffée was delicious! I had to stop myself from licking the plate to be honest. Hubs had the shrimp creole. It was good but not outstanding. Atmosphere was lively and fun. Everyone was having a great time.

They were really busy and we practically demanded to sit where they were the busiest so they aren't getting docked a star for the service.  We had the seafood stuffed mushrooms to start (amazing!), then taste of New Orleans (meh, it was okay), and oyster pasta (amazing!!).
Food at the royal house was outstanding! Beyond that, the service was  amazing compliments of Becks! Will definitely come back soon.

The atmosphere at this place was awesome. The greeter was warm and funny. The people that worked there actually seemed happy to work there. We ordered the spinach dip along with the catfish platter and shrimp po-boy. Everything was great and savory. I would definitely go back on my next trip to New Orleans. A calm place in the mist of the storm of people on Bourbon street.

Tried to get a spot at acme but the queue was ridiculous so we found Royal. The fresh oysters were great and the oyster combo was cheesy and rich. The red fish beignet are a must have- one of the most unique flavour profiles salty, sweet and fried and a delicious fish- we absolutely loved it. On the downside- the gumbo my boyfriend had was a bit of a disappointment, as were the the chargrilled oysters- they had a bit of a sandy gritty bite. Overall- Friendly service and good food, we would definitely come back here.

Came in for my first trip into the Big Easy.  Luckily I came in as they opened on a Sunday afternoon.  Got right in and sat at the bar.  Had the crawfish etouffee which was excellent, I regret being so full I couldn't order desert.  My bartender Patricia really took care of me, when i was disappointed that they didn't have any sweet tea she made some for me free of charge!  That was amazing customer service.  I will definitely be coming back for more.

Wow. I mean NOLA certainly has its fair share of places with fresh oysters, but these were the size of my fist with so much flavor. They shucked them right in front of you if you're sitting at the bar enjoying an amazing bloody mary. Which is exactly what we did. We got the creole shrimp and the taste of louisiana? but both were filled with so much flavor. The shrimp was in a flavorful red sauce and we didn't even use the rice it came with because we loved the flavor by it self. The taste of louisana had three bowls of three different things, and my favorite was by far the jambalaya. 
Our bar tender was so nice and really told us about the menu based on expectations of flavor and his personal favorites. I loved this place. We went on a Monday, immediately was seated, and made nice acquaintances who were sitting next to us at the bar. I would highly recommend this place to anyone in the French Quarter. Won't disappoint!

We had some family in town and of course they wanted seafood, I had never been here but heard that the food was really good. Oh yeah, were they right! We had the crabclaw appetizers (sauce is amazing and french bread to dip), fried oysters, oysters duo, fried alligator, hush puppies and the snowcrab legs! Everything was so good! I work a couple of blocks away and will definitely recommend Royal House to people when they ask where a good place to eat is and we will absolutely be back ourselves!

If you are visiting the area and are looking for amazing food, great prices, and phenomenal service, visit Royal House Ouster Bar and ask for Chris. She is amazing and attentive! Whenever I eat at a new restaurant, I always ask the server what their favorites are. I have never had such great recommendation as I had with Chris today. I had the Redfish Beignets as will as the crab stuffed ravioli and I never wanted it to end. Do yourself a favor, and check it out!

Good service but the product is nothing special. I've had a lot better po boys In NO I think I just had a below par one possibly because everyone was saying how good they are. I'd try this place again but try something different.

You can't leave town without having a taste of authentic New Orleans crawfish etouffee and this place was it.  We enjoyed it even more because of the Yelp deal of free appetizer.  I read reviews of people being offered a different appetizer when they mentioned the deal, but the key is to order the appetizer first and then mention the deal so they can't renege on it.

I checked in with yelp and was able to get a free appetizer! I got the crab legs, it was the waiter's recommendation, and it was great. The sauce was good, the bread was okay, and the legs were tasty. I ended up ordering the seafood pasta dish with marinara sauce (the name eludes me), and it was fantastic! One of the better seafood pasta dishes I have had, and it had the right about cajun spice. Definitely would come back to order it again.

My friend got the boiled shrimp plate, and that was good as well. The corn ended up being way too salty - practically inedible, but the manager kindly switched it out for another side, hush puppies. Those were fantastic as well. 

Overall, the service was good and the food was good as well, I would definitely return to the restuarant.
We had great bartender. I think his name was Calvin. Exceptional customer service. Hands down the best in New Orleans.
Great place! got there before if any rush the appetizer the entree and desert was great.  On top of that service was great as well!

Absolutely divine. 

I arrive and sit at the bar. The bartender strikes up a conversation, asks me where I'm from, etc. Very friendly. He was quick with my drinks and my order. Exceptional service. 

The atmosphere fits right in to the French quarter. It's got an upscale feel while keeping the relaxed Nola attitude. The jazz playing wraps it all together. You could show up in jeans or a jacket and both would feel right at home. 

But what makes this a 5 star joint is the food. The crab claws are the best thing I've had in New Orleans and probably the best seafood dish I've ever had. They sauce is creamy and perfectly salty and the claw meet just falls off. The bread was a little tough, but that's an insignificant complaint,

With the claws I had the oyster duo (half Rockefeller / half Royale). They oysters were perfectly cooked and just melted in your mouth. The baked ingredients did dry out the dish a bit so lemon is necessary. 

Or, you take the sauce from the Crab Claws and put it on top of the oysters. I did and had a momentary glimpse of heaven. 

I'm glad I've lived long enough to take that bite. Easy 5 stars.
Wonderful! We had the crawfish étouffée and the boiled shrimp. Both were delicious. Service was great and the portion sizes were large. Would definitely go back.

Walked in. Seated quick. Quick drinks... Then no contact. We wanted to order for a while then magically as I type this for you our waitress appears and we order the "taste of New Orleans" and the "Po Boi" also stuffed mushrooms to get started!!!!!

AMAZING is all I can say!

We ate here not once, but twice, during our most recent trip to New Orleans. 3 of us just happened in when we were hungry and the Hermes bar across the street didn't start service til 5:30pm. We each had an appetizer (stuffed mushrooms, crawfish cakes, crab claws) and were so amazed that we decided to come back for dinner the next night, with our party of 19 friends & family that were in town for my birthday. 

The team at Royal House was able to accommodate us on 45 minutes notice with seating for all of our guests. We had the most patient wait staff in the world, who had an amazing sense of humor and a wonderful attitude despite having such a large party thrown at them at the last minute. 

After this visit, Royal House may trump Gumbo Shop as my #1 place to eat in the French Quarter...

Oh my God - the oysters here are to DIE for. I'm pretty sure the boy & I sampled some of every type of oyster, and they were all great & flavorful. They're different from the oysters we've eaten back at home in California - I feel like these gulf oysters are meatier & sweeter, yet are savory at the same time? We came around 1 PM, and it was super easy to grab a seat by the bar, and our server/bartender [I think his name was David?] was really nice & friendly. He had tons of suggestions for places I needed to visit during my next stay in New Orleans.

Royal street is probably one of my favorite streets in New Orleans, and I absolutely love Royal House. Great last meal in one of my favorite cities ever.

Our family of 10 stopped in during our first day in New Orleans for dinner. The reviews looked good, and we were nearby so we went in.  I will start off by saying that it may have been the humidity upstairs that made the whole atmosphere feel slightly miserable.  The doors were open for balcony seating, and we were sitting inside, so it was just really stuffy upstairs.  Not what you want to feel after walking around all day. 

We started off with some appetizers and those were good. The stuffed mushrooms were amazing!  The tomato mozzarella salad was pretty good too.  I got a shrimp po' boy, for dinner, and it was kind of plain.  The bread was really chewy, and the whole sandwich was just very dry.  I would not recommend that. My sister had the shrimp and grits, and that was really good.  We had a couple vegetarians at the table and they were accommodating to their needs, so we were very appreciative of that.
