Unfortunately, the service was really not the best.  Our server and the other staff were all friendly enough, but even when we flagged our server down to let her know that we were ready to order after waiting a while, she said okay and then walked away to do something else without any explanation. Five minutes later she finally came to get our order. 

The worst was when my mom's salad came out with no dressing on it, and my dad's dinner was completely cold. It had never even been put in the oven!  The server was apologetic.  

Some of the food was excellent but the humidity and the unprepared food is why I give it 3 stars
We ate here based on previous reviews...how anyone gave this 4 stars I will never know...I have it one star because service was good...food was terrible...many much better choices in New Orleans

STAY AWAY. Overpriced & horrible food.

From all the reviews and awesome pictures, I was expecting an AMAZING dinner!! I was greeted at the front by a young girl who later turned out to be my waiter. 

She was really pushy on the drinks, but extremely sweet.

I decided to go with the shrimp and grits... HORRIBLE. The plate is $16 and comes with roughly 6 pieces of shrimp and a huge plate of grits. "Whatever" I thought, this plate must be amazing because of the great reviews... WRONG. The grits tasted spoiled? Apparently they have some kind of cheese inside of them... Not exactly sure what kind of cheese it is but I've never tasted something like this.. ever. 

The server saw my face and asked me what was wrong, I told her and we decided to go with the crawfish ravioli ($22). Came with only 5 pieces of ravoli and what seemed like chopped vegetables sprinkled with some melted cheese on top. This wasn't bad.. but It didn't have any flavor whatsoever.. not even salty or anything.

Extremely dissapointed with this restaurant. Basically almost a $30 meal for ONE person and the quality was not good at all. My server was really nice but it seemed like she was serving half the restaurant and greeting people in the front by herself since she was all over the place. 

Don't recommend.. STAY AWAY!

The chargrilled oysters are amazing. Get extra bread, order two orders. Sit, indulge. This is the place that when the plane lands and we get settled in, the first place we always go. Sit upstairs, do not be scared by the table lean..it is all part of the fun of it. Everything we have eaten here is good, wait staff is friendly and follow up just the right amount. A bit pricey, but when on vacation.....

Raw oysters very good as well.

This place was wonderful!!! We originally wanted to sit on the balcony, but when we got out there decided we would be more comfortable inside. So we sat at the bar where Marco was our bartender and our waiter. Marco was fabulous!!! Not only did he make one of the best bloody marys we've had but he talked to us about good food etc. We've been making our food decisions on yelp reviews and this place really lived up to the good reviews!
We would definitely come back to this place!!! 
The oysters, onion soup and shrimp and grits were the best we have had. We also ordered the fried alligator and the tomato  mozzarella salad which were wonderful!!
Becks was our server. She is a petite sweetheart who is about 95 lbs soaking wet. She was awesome and very knowledgeable of the menu.  Great food!

Ok! First off, great food. Great, GREAT food. Like, absolutely perfect for Cajun/creole food lovers. 
    Second, service is really awesome. My friends and I sat at the bar while waiting for a table and the bartender was very amiable and efficient. Our server, Becks, with the awesome business card (yes, business card), was very knowledgeable about the menu and just had great chemistry with our table. I mean, some serious female bonding within 5 seconds. SHE IS AWESOME!
    Finally, the atmosphere is really perfect. New Orleans through and through. An absolute must for dinner!

Hope this helps to you food connoisseurs out there!

Let's me start by saying, Becks, our waitress was amazing!  She was sarcastic and pretensions, just as her card stated.  
Becks recommended the redfish beignets and crab claws for an appetizer.  Both were delicious.  For the main dish I ordered the Redfish.  It was okay.  My wife ordered the shrimp tortellini.  It to was just okay.  The food was very average for the cost!

Beck keep up the good work

Small local restaurant that has wonderful local seafood. There's gonna be a wait on the weekend, one because it's small and two because it's good. But it's worth the wait. I recommend the oyster tray, crawfish cakes and the crawfish ravioli. The service wasn't the best was fairly decent. Definitely would return next time I'm in New Orleans!

This place is absolutely Devine!!! Our waitress Heidi was great!  The food OMG the crab claws were AMAZING, shrimp and grits FABULOUS and the taste of New Orleans EXCELLENT!! This is definitely a must visit when in New Orleans!!!

Ok I havnt been to the Rotal House but I was fortunate enough to try their food at Satchmo Festival yesterday. I can not stop thinking about it. Their crab clause were out if this world and service with a smile goes a long way with me too. I'll be heading there for dinner VERY soon! Great job YUM!

I give it two stars because it was edible and we didn't die. Our entrees were about $17, the cheapest options, and were definitely not worth it. Fried shrimp was too salty, and had been plated on top of half cooked French fries too quickly, so the grease formed a little pond underneath the food. Hush puppies were cold and from a store bought mix. Husband got the taste of New Orleans - I didn't ask for a taste because I know what gumbo and red beans and rice are supposed to taste like and I didn't want to taste their version. Glad I didn't see the check-in coupon for a free appetizer. Lots of other tourists seemed enjoy their meals - maybe we got the wrong thing.

So I stopped here while visiting fam in NO. I always like to eat something great while I'm in town and saw this as option. I was wrong. The food does not stack up. I know better than to eat anywhere near the French Quarter. I should have stayed away but the reviews said otherwise. I had the sampler and my husband had the shrimp creole dinner. My gumbo had way too much filé. I couldn't even finish it. I gave it to my husband. The oysters and the shrimp etoufee were good though. But I won't be returning. Should have just stuck to my usual poboys at the local establishments. They never do me wrong.

Great location, great food, great atmosphere.   Lost a star because of two very important reasons: they were out of Tabasco sauce (!!!) AND hush puppies.   

Shrimp and grits was amazing.

Sat in bar so i dono how long usual wait is. Oysters are greatttt. They shuck it fresh in front of you and top w side of horseradish and cocktail sauce. I ate 14 oysters by myself in one day. They so have best gumbo I've ever had but I'm not from new Orleans. Their jambalaya was great too. Not too crazy about shrimp creole. And the etoufee w crawfish was aight too. I had all three by ordering the sampler which has small cup of jambalaya, gumbo, and etoufee.
The food was excellent; the service was wonderful.  Can say nothing negative about this place.  I will definitely be going back and telling all of my friends about it.

My goal in New Orleans was to try everything that I possibly could in a short 2 1/2 day trip.  I like to think I was pretty successful. We were on the hunt for a place that covered what everyone wanted, and with 9 people, that was tough. We found ourselves standing in front of a restaurant called Royal House Oyster Bar.  After perusing the menu, we all settled on eating there.  I had already tried oysters, shrimp, gumbo,  and jambalaya so I went with the crab legs for lunch. We shared a bunch of fried alligator at the table as well.  Here in Denver, there is a place call Bayou Bob's that has some awesome fried alligator, but this one was so much better.  They were actual pieces, like chicken nuggets. Great flavor and very tender, I would put these at the top of great things I ate in New Orleans. The crab legs came out and the bowl looked very inviting. A couple of crab clusters, corn on the cob rolled in Cajun seasoning, and giant red potatoes.  The one thing missing was the butter.  I had to ask for it to be brought out. They were quick to respond and brought out a very large bowl of drawn butter with tiny pieces of green onion in it.  I don't think this changed the flavoring, just added to the presentation. Overall, most of the party of 9 were happy with their choice.  I think, everyone was on the same page though, and feel that Acme Oyster House was better and less expensive.  Oh and a quick drink recommendation: get the pineapple cucumber mojito

This restaurant wasn't on our "must do" list, and we happened in by chance. Boy are we glad we did. The ambiance is nice. We were seated immediately and promptly attended to by the waitress, who was very friendly. We ordered the crawfish cakes and tomato and mozzarella appetizers. Both good. One of my party had the blackened redfish, served with potatoes and beans. It was perfectly cooked, very flavorful but not too spicy. The real star was my Taste of New Orleans combo. A cup each of jambalaya, seafood gumbo, and crawfish etouffee. Delish!! The jambalaya was spicy, but not overly so. The gumbo was loaded with seafood, and the crawfish etouffee just incredible. Also had a side of hush puppies. I'm not a southerner so I don't claim to be an expert on this southern classic, but these were some of the yummiest hush puppies I've ever had. They were light yet still dense and very tender. Not the heavy dry balls that some places give you. I'm a bread pudding fanatic so dessert was bread pudding. It was ok, edible, but not something I would order again. Despite the lackluster dessert, dinner at Royal House was great. I will definitely return on my next trip to NOLA. FYI dress code is casual.

Loved the food and the service here.

Oysters on the half shell ($13) - shucked at my order and were served in the briny juice with all the fixin's and were delicious.

Oyster tacos ($10) - four tacos as an appetizer. Layered flavors - I would have ordered these as a main.

Shrimp Creol ($16) - served with rice a great spice to it.

We caved and had the Bananas Foster for dessert because...we could. Yummm.

Drinks, food, THANKS BECKS for the great service and awesome one-liners. Much appreciated.

Also loved the balcony seating on a gorgeous night in NOLA.

We kept seeing the very enticing billboard every time we were on the elevated expressway towards New Orleans & my son loves Charbroiled Oysters so we gave it a shot. Needless to say my husband & I were not impressed. $96 lunch (tax & tip) included 3-soft drinks, apps were crawfish claws which were very good, oyster taco's that I took a bite of & gagged. I never would have though there would have been cinnamon somewhere in the dish. I DO NOT DO CINNAMON!  Son had the 1/2 dz charbroiled which were good.  I had the $12 1/2 dz Oyster Royale which was oysters that were supposed to have some kind of seafood stuffing, sprinkled w/ cheese then baked. Took me a whole 35 seconds to eat my meal. The cheese was burnt on a couple. They were pretty tasteless. My husband had the Shrimp Grits suggested by the server. They were BLAND & gummy. The 8 pieces of shrimp were somewhat flavorful. My husband didn't finish his dish. Left a little more than 1/2 the grits. The service was great. Not sure if we'll give it another try or not

Meh, I've experienced way better. Especially in such a foodie town as NOLA. 

The service was OK. Went with the boyfriend for a shared app and meal. Had some gumbo that wasn't rich in flavor or seafood. Also shared a Po Boy burger which pretty  much tasted like Burger King but we paid about $15 for it. 

The only reason people end up going is because it's on Royal Street and it has a cool balcony seating. Other than that, extremely over priced for the quality.

Very disappointed after seeing that Yelpers had given it such great reviews.

I really liked this place , I ordered pasta with fried oyster , the pasta was sooo delicious I meant u can eat it without that fried oyster , the sauce is fantastic , for the first time in my life I had alligator , not a fan of the texture and the taste at all ! I recommend this place !

We ordered an appetizer only because of their Yelp deal which stated a free appetizer with purchase of two entrees.  Limit one offer per table.  They didn't honor this even though there were 4 of us, we all ordered entrees, and got one bottle of wine and one cocktail.  Our food came out pretty quickly after the appetizer and the server decided there wasn't enough room at the table for 4 plates and the appetizer so they just took the half eaten appetizer without even asking.  The pineapple mojito was the worst drink I had on the trip.  I thought my actual entree, the Seafood Pescatore was actually pretty good but the other three people I was with didn't care for theirs.

I can deal with a not so great drink but taking our partially eaten appetizer and then not honoring their own Yelp deal left a pretty sour taste in my mouth.

Traveling for business I always attempt to explore the area I'm visiting or at least try a their local cuisine.  Seafood is definitely a big part of New Orleans, so naturally I ventured out to the French Quarter area full of dining options.  I really didn't plan to dine at Royal House, somewhat ran into the place while strolling around looking for the next photo opportunity.  It turned out to be a French Quarter gem with a classic New Orleans atmosphere and menu featuring delicious seafood dishes.

Anyone with admiration for oysters would go bonkers here, from fresh-shucked to charbroiled, you're sure to find your favorite oyster dish here. I opted out and had fish instead, just didn't crave them that night.  I ordered the blackened Redfish topped with sautéed jumbo lump crab.  The super fresh fish was coated with Cajun seasoning served with roasted bliss potatoes and corn.  The meal was absolutely delicious, the Cajun flavor was exactly what I wanted to taste, perfect kick with every bite.  The added crab provided a nice balance to the flavor.

The staff was very polite and assisted me with the menu.  Noticing my camera, she recommended that I make it to the top floor where I could take some photos from their balconies.  It was obvious they were paying attention.  The ambience was very welcoming and didn't have that tourist trap feel, a nice local vibe.  The interior decor was classic with dim lighting throughout.  If you prefer a brighter atmosphere, request a table on the second floor where the endless windows illuminate the dining area or even sit on the balcony.  Although I felt a bit clustered on the balcony due to its narrowness.  I enjoyed it thoroughly, even with so many places in the area, I felt like I chose the perfect place.

A MUST GO if you are in New Orleans! This place is popular, so expect a wait! The wait was about 20 minutes which went by quickly due to some street performers who were just awesome! We ordered the Crab Claws as an appetizer and boy, let me tell you that dish was to die for! The sauce was something that I have never tasted before and I was so impressed. The sauce was so good that it made you want to live in it. (haha) We literally cleaned the plate up, it was THAT AMAZING. 

As far as my entree went, I ordered the blackened shrimp jambalaya! Every bite was very flavorful. The rice was nice and fluffy not like other places, that either have really dry rice or just wet soggy rice. The shrimp was amazing as well! 

Our server was Tina and she was amazing. Her suggestions were great and her hospitality was awesome!

OMG...food was bomb! I thought this would be one of those French Quarter gimmicks, but man was I wrong. My friends and I were so impressed with their food. The bloody mary was TASTY and I had the parmasen oysters that were crazy good. Even my friend that doesn't eat oysters tried them and said they were delicious. You also must get the etoffee....it was so flavorful and creamy and the best I've ever had. I'm thinking about flying back to NOLA and suffer the crazy humidity just to have some Royal House food.
Great food, great service, cool place. We had the red fish beignets (awesome) crawfish ravioli, gumbo, and garlic mashed potatoes. Our server was Tiffany and she was awesome!

I had the shrimp tortellini and the banana cheese cake for dessert. All of it was yummy. The presentation was interesting with the cheese cake served like two scoops ice cream with the crust in between them. It's called bananas foster. Very good!

The étouffée is divine!! We chose the Taste of New Orleans, and by doing so I learned the difference between gumbo, jambalaya and of course, my introduction to étouffée. I'm not sure I've really ever had more than a bite of jambalaya or gumbo, so this was perfect for me. I didn't even know they all came with rice. 

Also, a new first, fried alligator. I didn't dig the taste of that little bit that was all fat, but I'm sure that's rare. I really, really liked it and I was quite surprised. I think the hurricane made me a wee bit more daring than usual :) You have to watch it with those hurricanes or you'll feel like you're in one later - guaranteed. 

The crab claws - wow!! Butter baby!! Heidi made sure there was extra bread on the table to sop up all the sauce...which was amazing. You know when you bite into something and the juices and the flavor...just trickle down your tongue and you don't want to chew yet...? That's what I'm talking about. 

We're are definitely going back before we leave and this time - more of the alligator, more of the claws, and all étouffée. 

This is a place to indulge - so go for it.
The crawfish beginets were the most interesting meal I had while in New Orleans.  This place was a lot of fun and I am glad we went.
I don't like oysters but tried the chargrilled oysters and amazing as well as the banana foster cheesecake!

Why 5 stars? Because it satisfied my NOLA cajun/seafood/oyster craving!

   ---   ---   ---

So I had to grab oysters while in New Orleans right? Royal House... bravo. 

The definite highlight were actually the crab claws. Absolutely out of this world. One of the best things I've ever eaten. It would be a sin to not order this on a trip to Royal House.

The oysters themselves were great, but overshadowed by the epicness of the crab claws. That's no knock on the oysters, but again, the crab claws = life changing.
Amazing food, and the service is great!! Our waiter Eric was really knowledgable about the menu and have great recommendations! I would suggest this place to all my family and friends

My score for this place is actually 3.5. The Food was pretty good, but the staff is kind of...off. Our waiter was very nice, but many of the other employees were rude. For instance, when we were waiting for a table, the host came out, said nothing, and then looked at us as if we were weird for not asking him to be seated. Also heard another waiter sucking snot through his nose...kind of gross when you're trying to enjoy the delicious etouffe.
The Shrimp and Grits were very good!  I would recommend and Abita Amber with it!  Good food, friendly staff, and awesome NOLA atmosphere

The BF and I decided to stop by for drinks and oysters before our fried chicken dinner at Coop's Place.  We got the Oyster Duo, which came with their Oyster Royale, which was a crab stuffing atop baked oysters, and the Oyster Rockefeller, which was a spinach and cheese stuffing atop baked oysters.  The duo came with 3 of each, which was plenty since they were heavy with the toppings. Both were very good. We also got a dozen on the half shell. They were yummy but some were huge! Luckily the oyster shucker gave us a good mixture of babies and monsters! 

Bryan L. liked the ambience of the Royal House as it was very clean and classy, but still in the heart of the French Quarter. So stank from Bourbon St. here.
This was my first experience in New Orleans. Wow! It has set the bar pretty high. Def lives up to the reviews

Oh man, did we have a great dinner here! We picked this place mostly because we wanted the experience of eating on the balcony in the French Quarter. Oh, also the menu looked delicious!

Service was pretty good. Not 5 star service, but it was friendly and fairly prompt. The host was a little frazzled and didn't make eye contact, and our server was not very personable when he first started. Luckily he became chattier as the night went out and by the end we were all buds. 

The food was really surprisingly yummy. We weren't 100% sure we were going to love this place, but we did! Or at least, I did! I chose the shrimp and grits, which was my first time ordering this dish anywhere. I have nibbled on my bf's plate once or twice at another restaurant, but never ate more than a few bites anywhere. It was MARvelous! Shrimp was a plentiful, and cooked really. The grits were SUPER creamy, because how else do you want them? What really took it over the top for me was this sauce that we accidentally received. My bf wanted to substitute a side, and our server had to ring in something in order to 'upcharge' us. The price of this accidental sauce, I think it was called Royal sauce, covered the upcharge, but the kitchen accidentally made the sauce and the food runner accidentally brought it out. It was creamy, perhaps like a rose/blush sauce, and had seafood in the sauce. It was ridiculous and I poured that shit all over my grits! If you read this, order the grits and ask for the Royal sauce on the side (make sure that it's creamy and seafoodey and that I have the right name). Trust me, it's worth it to try to ask and it's worth the upcharge!

I really liked that they had a Yelp check in offer; I didn't see any other restaurants in the area catering to us like that. Our free app choice was the crawfish cakes, a popular choice. The cakes were really good. Not as amazing as our dinner, but very yummy. 

Lastly, the balcony provided a nice atmosphere. It had all the upsides of eating outside, and it was far enough away from the street to avoid smelling the French Quarter while dining. :) I do want to warn you that the balcony does not = elegant. It's super casual, tables are very small, and the balcony structure has a very noticeable slant that made me maybe slightly nervous.

This place gets one star because we didn't die... Pathetic. 
This place is a complete tourist trap.  All the food is greasy, full of oil and butter and overall disgusting.  Went with another couple and two of the others ordered the same seafood pasta dish and one of the dishes had 90% of the seafood and the other had 10% which only had 1 non opened clam.  Seafood was not fresh.  Obviously the cooks don't understand the concept of dividing portions.  I ordered a scampi dish which was completely drenched in butter and way too spicy... Clearly the container of hot red pepper fell into the dish. Disgusting.  Five minutes into eating the pasta was cold and you could see the puddles of oil. Also we did not receive any silverware and had to ask twice for it while the appetizers of so called char broiled oysters soaked in butter got cold.  We asked for some extra bread and it took forever to arrive. Would give this dump a -5 stars if possible.  Just because there are white tablecloths on the table doesn't mean you can charge exorbitant prices For sub par fare. Stay away. You are better off going to Felix's on Iberville or to Acme.
This was our favorite meal in New Orleans.  We had crab claws, which we fantastic, French onion soup, oyster duo, and etouffee.  All were great!   Sad we found it on our last night!

Came here for a bachelorette weekend, and we loved our experience here. Super friendly staff and excellent food. The chargrilled oysters were to die for, the catfish was fresh and full of flavor, and the bread pudding was yummy. We also tried the fried gator which was surprisingly reAlly good. We also had the oysters on puff pastry, and we loved it. The New Orleans sampler was a very large portion, and should be shared as it's a lot of good.  I highly recommend this place.

If you had to pick one restaurant in New Orleans that you had to go to, you should wander into Royal Oyster House.  We had a superb lunch there.  I had the gumbo, and it was the best gumbo I've ever eaten.  My parents thought the Bloody Marys were the best in New Orleans.  I highly recommend this restaurant.  It's the best lunch in town.

The chargrilled oysters were DELICIOUS and our server was absolutely stellar in helping us navigate the non dairy options. The po boy was stuffed with food and the free check in appetizer was totally awesome. 5 stars for amazing service, and 4 stars for food (mine was a bit greasy and I wish the sandwiches had an option other than french fries). Go for the oysters and check out the view upstairs!
Friendly staff and great food .... The rockefeller oysters are awesome here, this is a great opcion also if you're looking a nice place to eat after 9pm (most restaurants around close before)
Great food, good price! Tiffany was great and full of good suggestions. We were seated on the balcony and enjoyed a wonderful view.

2 stars is generous because the oysters were delicious. Wait staff was nice, but service and food was awful. We were with a large group and they didnt bring us half our food and thn charged us for it. We had to fight with them for a half hour to adjust the bill. 

These reviews are shocking. Overrated.

We all tried the taste of New Orleans. It's nothing bad but I've had better. Perhaps it's not their specialty? Too much rice

Dessert was good....bread pudding was nice. 

Right on royal street....saw the decadence parade. Some thing you just can't unsee. On the other hand. Tonya and dorise play nearby so it's nice.
The best place in NOLA to relax with a dozen oyster and a Bloody Mary. Great atmosphere and nice wait staff. Not so touristy which is good. The best oysters in French Quarter

The food here was decent! The crawfish dish was definitely tasty! HOWEVER the menu on here and on their website is NOT the same- some dishes not on it all in any kind of variation and others you can create by adding additional cost! We chose this place due to that menu- our bad for not checking the menu outside once we got there. Just an FYI to the next person. No reservations required! They sat us quickly. We were hoping to cool down a bit but they sat us upstairs - NO AC! Yikes! Overall food was decent, service was fantastic. We recommend if you want something easy with a some taste of local food!

Five stars!!!!!The only thing better than the crab claws was Alexandra (Alex).   Personable cute and above all pleasant, Alex made Royal House the perfect beginning to our last night at Nola's Labor Day Decadence.  Crab claws oysters and blackened redfish exemplified our ideal New Orleans experience.    Get there early. Place gets crowded.   We waited 45 minutes before getting seated.

Saw some people had bad experiences here, I think we were pretty lucky, we sat at the bar, our barman was very helpful and attentive, food was delicious, it was an enjoyable dining experience. 

Like: lively ambiance, friendly and good services (it was a busy night, we sat the the bar and the bar was full, our barman was still serving at full attention), food was tasty and the menu selection was pretty good.

Dislike: not much.

We had:
Bloodymary - excellent
Oysters, om the half shell - fresh and delicious
Peerl-n-Eat Shrimp
Redfish - blackened
Mashed Potatos
Homemade bread pudding - yummy

Food was overall good (but more of a 3.5 stars), but for us, the service was even better, make it 4 stars for us.

This was the first place we went to dinner during our visit and our favorite.  The dining area upstairs had a beautiful view and quiet atmosphere.  There were 4 people in our party and we all ordered a different menu item.  We started with the alligator appetizer which was tender and spicy!

Each entree was delicious and the prices were very reasonable.  

Becks, our server was excellent; She was very attentive and had a fun-loving attitude.  

The Royal House provided a fantastic start to our weekend!

My price range includes tips and we had drinks with our meal.

Five of us had dinner...gumbo/jambalaya/etouffe trio was very good (not amazing), one had oysters (loved them), and one had a chicken sandwich.  Seating was lame (stuck in a dark corner), staff was friendly but not attentive, and prices high ($25 -$35 pp).

We stopped by here for a quick snack and they were able to give us a table for two no problem. I ordered the Purple Haze (raspberry beer) bottle and it was alright. We ordered 1 lb shrimp boiled in Creole seasoning with a side of corn and potatoes (~$20). The server was very accommodating and attentive. Our water glasses were never empty.

First time to New Orleans, and decided to hit Royal House. Becks, is our server and she has done an amazing job.. Went through the menu, gave phenomenal suggestions, and has been hysterically funny

Looking forward to this meal!
Becks is like if Jesus had a baby with Louie CK and was raised by George carlin and Lisa monelli. I haven't had the food yet but whatever.

Becks is a very witty waitress who entertained our bachelor party with her banter.   Her Kansas City swag is off the hook.  If she was a break dancer she would do a backspin to a backflip in a instant.  We haven't even ate yet.
The waitress Becks made me feel complete.  It was a life changing experience.  Becks basically  Becks changed the game. She's just a good person and thats all that matters
Becks!!! For great food and even better, wittier, faster, and friendlier service, eat here and request Becks as your server.  You WON'T be sorry!

The gumbo I had was great. Unfortunately they served me my coffee in a paper cup. Food looks good here but too early to try to bigger dish for me. I will consider coming back for their other famous dishes. Service was good. One more thing tho. It's such a nice restaurant but they have the radio blasting top 40 in the 90's. Wish they had jazz.
Great staff, great food, great energy and family friendly. Also affordable. Good location right near Bourbon street. We ended up finding this on Yelp and were happy that we did.

Amazing spot in the quarter. Super fresh and delicious oysters on the half shell. The chargrilled oysters were also TO DIE FOR. The atmosphere is cozy and charming, especially during the day. They keep the doors open and you can hear the street performers playing music. It's an absolute wonderful and genuine New Orleans experience. The Bloody Mary and Mint Julep are also fantastic! The wait staff has been incredible, especially our bartender Jeff. A super friendly New Orleanian who knows his stuff. Don't miss this place :) it's true New Orleans.

I love this place!! First time in New Orleans with my husband. Our first stop of the night was Royal House. We were stopped by their friendly staff while we were head back to the hotel to change my shoes.  We made our way back. Best decision ever. The food and service GREAT!! Go see Willie G., best service in NOLA!!
FANTASTIC FOOD! Please try the crab claws and order the shrimp.

We were on our last night in the French Quarter and wanted something a little more special and came upon Royal House as a recommended property on yelp. I'm glad we did! The food was excellent, but more importantly, our server/bartender/entertainment, Becks was amazing! Spot on recommendations, great sense of humour and impeccable timing! She made it our best experience in the Big Easy! Thanks Becks!!

We were trying to get to a nice seafood and oyster place across Canal, got lazy, decided to stay in the French Quarter and stopped at Royal House for our oyster craving. The hostess said a 25 minute wait but we were seated upstairs within 10 minutes. Craving satisfied! 

We started with a tasty crab claw appetizer courtesy of my Yelp check-in FTW! Three of us ordered 2 dozen raw oysters, and 1.5 dozen chargrilled oysters. The oysters on half shell were not shucked as well as they could've been, with too many broken shell bits, but the oysters were crisp & clean tasting. Oysters were slurped in record time.

The chargrilled oysters were definitely rich and delicious, but not overly rich like the other oyster selections. I usually skip cooked oysters, but grilled this way was fantastic!

We also shared 2 Crawfish Étouffée entrees which in hindsight we should not have split since we were licking the plates. 

The food runner was a bit harried, and although we mentioned twice that we were sharing the étouffée and asked for extra plates, they never came. If he didn't have the time to get us plates he should've communicated with our server. Our server, Tiffany, was wonderful! She was pleasant, humorous and made sure we enjoyed our dinner and time at Royal House. 

Go for the second floor. It's a nice dining room with beautiful French doors opening onto the balcony. For one meal, you just might feel you're away from the tourist masses.
Awesome Cindy our server was great and took the time to explain the dishes Had the mahi mahi and the seafood pescatore. Save room for the banana foster cheesecake.

Great service and staff
food was fun.  Ate  a lot of oysters here.   Oysters seem not as clean as I am used to but that must be a  regional thing.   Tasty drinks


overall solid experience

This was a completely random stop for me and a couple of friends, we were just looking for a drink and happened to walk by here and thought it looked good and it certainly was.

We sat at the bar and the bartender was great, very attentive and friendly and her drinks were great. I can not remember what we had but they were all great.

After seeing several orders of oysters head out we had to try some, we got a dozen of the chargrilled oysters and they were some of if not the best oysters I've ever had, big and perfectly cooked and the sauce they were in was amazing.

If anybody is looking for great oysters this is the place to go.

Met up with some friends as they finished their meals. They had the alligator appetizer and loved it. The waitress was really friendly and accommodating, served me water even though we were leaving and offered to get me something to go. I'd love to head back for some of those amazing oysters and a nice glass of wine. Lovely atmosphere, staff and general feel. I recommend them with high stars. Only 4 though since the food review is second hand ;-).

We dined at the Royal House for dinner on Thursday, August 28, 2014. There were four (4) of us.   We were seated upstairs.  The view was wonderful.

We started out with the alligator appetizer which was delicious.  Each of us ordered a different item from the menu.  I ordered the crab etouffee which was delicious.  We all had drinks, some of us had two (2) drinks.  The bill for four (4) people including drinks and an appetizer was only $150 which we thought was more than reasonable.

Our waitress was Becks.  She was delightful.  She was attentive and easy to talk to.  I almost hated leaving at the end of our meal because I wanted to spend the evening with her.  If you go, ask for Becks, as she is the best.

All in all, we were in New Orleans for three nights, and The Royal House was by far our favorite restaurant.  All four of us agreed the food was excellent.  Can't wait to go back again.

There is just something special about eating a meal in the heart of the French Quarter. The staff of places like this are always eager to show you a good time and make sure you experience the best of New Orleans.

I had just finished a photo shoot in the upstairs area of the place, when my companions and I decided to get lunch here as well. It was a rainy, miserable day, but it was nice because the doors were open and we could enjoy the rain from the safety of the restaurant.

We were seated in the downstairs area and greeted by a friendly woman who was eager to take our drink order. As I ordered my iced tea, I looked over to the bar area to see a man shucking fresh oysters. I love watching people shuck oysters. I guess because I love oysters, but there's also something really neat about watching someone who is really good at popping open those shells do his work. Maybe I'm odd.

Okay, onto the food. I decided on a chicken Caesar salad, thinking that this would be a good choice for a small, simple lunch. Well, the salad was HUGE and for the price I was not disappointed at all. The dressing came on the side, which I really liked and the chicken was tender and juicy. I guess I was hungrier than I thought, because I ended up eating the entire thing. It was fantastic!

I love Royal House and I will definitely be back. I feel like it's the perfect NOLA casual dining experience for local and tourist alike. They have everything on the menu from salads and sandwiches to shrimp and oysters platters, so you are sure to find something that you will enjoy.

We stopped in here for lunch at the recommendation of a City Segway tour guide. We were not disappointed. The staff members were so friendly. We felt like everyone went above and beyond to be gracious. We had the Taste of New Orleans (jambalaya, étouffée, gumbo). It was divine. Loved it. I would highly recommend it.

Definitely would come back here. Free appetizer with a yelp check-in. The chargrilled oysters were the best oysters I have ever had. Also loved the stuffed mushrooms. The gumbo soup was good. We ordered jambalaya as the entree which was delicious as well. Atmosphere was nice. You can sit on the balcony and have a nice view of the city while listen to musicians on the street. Definitely a must go to place while visiting New Orleans. Staff was pleasant and great service!
overall not bad place to catch a bite in the French Quarter. Taste of New Orleans was pretty good along with the hush puppies.

I was dining alone so decided to sit outside on the small balcony. It was lovely. Quiet except for the lovely jazz I could hear playing on the street corner. Awesome staff I had a young waitress who was very attentive. The food was incredibly tasty! I had the crawfish cakes. They were a little cold, kinda lukewarm but I was hungry and the flavor was good. I would come back here and try other dishes.

The staff genuinely cares about the welfare of patrons. The pineapple cucumber mojitos are excellent. A savory beignet is offered as an appetizer the taste of which is sufficient cause to try this place (this from a patron who finds du Monde's beignets to taste of stale oil & insipid prep).

So here's the deal. I came to this restaurant because of yelp. Some reviews mentioned a server named Becks. On a whim, I called to see if she was working-- she indeed was-- so I requested to be in her section. This spiritedly young woman walks over, and from that point, everything is incredible. I take every recommendation she has, from the strawberry infused gin to the red fish with the crawfish sauce dressing. And it's perfect. It was a wonderful meal, and upon my next visit I'll surely be returning. Thanks, Becks, and Royal House, for the.. eh hem.. royal treatment. See what I just did?

Dude, Becks is the best waitress I've ever had. She is sarcastic and funny and I wish we could experience her type of interaction everywhere. Becks, you are totally winning :) and as an afterthought the food is amazing.
Nice place. Had the shrimp creole and it was good. The steamed shrimp pot is the way to go though. Generous portions and a free app with a check-in!

Great place for dinner.  Sit upstairs and you can hear the music from the street while you are cooling off. 
I recommend the crawfish étouffée, it may be the best in the Quarter.  Delicious sautéed tails in a bowl with rice and topped with some fried tails to make it outstanding. 
Service was attentive and beer was cold.   
Enjoy!
Get the gumbo. Nice bar and grill right on the corner. Great atmosphere. I sat by a storm shutter door open to the street. Great service, get Megan, she's awesome. Had gumbo and jambalaya.
Great service, drinks and food! If my wife and I are ever back in NOLA we're definitely coming back. Huge shoutout to Magen. Thanks for the great tips and recommendations
Ordered the shrimp creole. It was really good. The crab appetizer was the best I've had. Great service and friendly staff too.
Awesome! Magen, our waitress was gem. Crab claws were yummy! Our second visit and I see a third the next time we make it to NO!
It gets crowded for dinner time, so expect to wait.  It's worth the wait.  I recommend the shrimp creole!!! And the hurricane.

After walking around the french quarter for quite a while we decided to try Royal House. It was pretty darn good.  Good gumbo and jambalaya and the shrimp dish I had was great.  Overall a nice experience
Spent another 7 days in our favorite city, ate the crab claws 1 hour and 45 minutes after getting off the plane....it's no secret we head to the Royal House as soon as our feet hit NOLA soil.

Amazing... We ate here two nights in a row it was so good.  Oysters on the half self were delicious and very reasonably priced. Redfish beignets were to die for!  I also recommend the Oysters Royal.

The drink menu was unique and varied, I got the Basil Berry drink and it was fantastic.  Skip ACME and Felix's and go to this place for all your oyster/seafood needs!!
The taste of new Orleans dish was a great way to try all the new Orleans staples in one swoop.  Banana foster cheesecake was also amazing.  Worth leaving bourbon street for!

Got food to go here.  Sounds crazy I know, but it was one of few options.  Admittedly,  the wife and I were tired of fried food, and neither one of us enjoy raw oysters, but could totally tell this would be a great place if you were into that sort of thing.  The bar tender also shucks your oysters.  Not too shabby.  I gave it a 3 out of 5 mainly because what I ordered was pretty uninspiring, but I would not completely dismiss this place.

I was visiting New Orleans with my aunt and my cousin a fews weeks ago. We noticed the sign for the Royal House as we meandered about the local Outlet Mall. As we made our way towards to restaurant, I thought about all the delicious oysters I was about to consume. As we entered the restaurant, we were greeted by a gentleman (who's name escapes me) who gave us a beautiful smile and immediately accepted our request to sit on the upstairs balcony. Because I live in Las Vegas, as a native southerner, I could feel a thunderstorm in the air and I did not want to miss it. As we made our way upstairs, our host inquired about our day and referred to us as "his Queens" which I found, quite frankly, adorable. As we approached the balcony, we saw mainly two tops and since we were a three, decided on sitting inside with the windows open and a great view of the street blow. I had a smoke on the balcony in anticipation on the dozen raw oysters I had ordered. I wanted a hundred but decided a dozen would do! They did not disappoint. They were plump, delicious and fresh. My aunt's fried oyster puff pastry, my crab salad and my cousin's chicken sandwich were all delicious. Eric, our server, delivered impeccable service. Upon his suggestion, I ordered the chocolate brownie sundae as dessert. It was a perfect ending. We were clearly Eric's last table, and being in the hospitality industry myself, I noticed he was in no way shape or form rushing us through our meal.  As we left, I made sure to let the host know how much I appreciated his hospitality. I love being back home in the south and I was reminded about how much I love home when I saw Eric walking down the street, free for the day. He noticed me, greeted me and went to enjoy the rest of his afternoon. The Royal House FAR EXCEEDED my expectations and I plan on visiting every single time I am in New Orleans. Thank you so much for a wonderful midday meal!

The highlight of our trip was our experience at Royal Oyster House....especially our waitress Becks! From the moment we were seated to the moment we left, she was exceptional. The food was wonderful as well...especially the shrimp and grits and the crab claws.
The food was very tasty. We used the yelp app coupon for a free app- the fried alligator. It was great! Skip the tarter and marinara, mix up some mayo and hot sauce for the best fried gator dip.

This place was okay. We were reluctant too go here but closures of other places on out list bumped the Royal House up. I wasn't disappointed, but I wouldn't say the experience will bring me back. The food was decent. The menu was a little heavy with the fried foods. That said they did accommodate splitting my order between two items, but only in the platter and not in a po boy like I wanted.

Yummy.  We were looking for some authentic cajun food and we found it. We had the tour of New Orleans and fried gator. It was delicious.  The service was also friendly and quick.  The only downside was the drinks. Not strong and very expensive for NOLA. Would go back.

This was our last dinner in New Orleans and I think it was our favorite!

First of all, our waitress Tina is a saint. She took good care of us and called us "sweet babies" the entire time. Recommended the crab claw appetizer which was ridiculous. My fiancé tried to order the "taste of Louisiana" or whatever and she shouted "NO YOU WON'T. TELL EVERYONE." She ordered him the Crawfish Étouffée instead. And was he glad she did!

I had the blacked redfish which was absolutely delicious. My one complaint were the TVs on the walls which broke the quaint atmosphere a bit. But it WAS a Saints game. So it worked.

Go go go here and ask for Tina!

This place is a solid three stars. I think it's a decent option since most of the dining establishments have a tendency to close at 9 instead of 10 or even 11 pm. 

I had the Taste of New Orleans which other reviewers stated you shouldn't get as they have stated that the Crawfish Étouffée is by far the best dish out of that trio. However I couldn't resist as I had not yet had Jambalaya or Gumbo and I thought that this would be a good opportunity for me to try all three. Well, needless to say, everyone is right. Stick with the Crawfish Étouffée. I also tried the Fried Alligator which tastes a lot like chicken but with a different texture. It's almost silky. I thought the batter was way salty though. 

Overall I think that this would be a good option for a late dinner. I wouldn't come back otherwise.

I'd like to start by thanking the concierge at the Hotel Monteleone for recommending Royal House over the likes of Acme & Felix. Those two had massive lines, while at Royal House, we were seated immediately. Disclaimer: this was a bachelor party with 9 dudes! We definitely enjoyed the more laid back and calm demeanor of Royal St., compared with Bourbon St. only a mere block away! It was a pleasant walk over, as we did not encounter any vomiting, fights, or passed out drunkards (not sayin' there's anything wrong with that, we just needed a break...). 

Now I wish I could remember our ponytailed, Cajun waiter's name, because he was absolutely hysterical. Alex, maybe? Anyway, each time he checked on us (which was often, to refill our drinks), he came equipped with a new gag about Boudreau! 

Food was excellent. We had a steak dinner that evening, so we decided to sample all of the oyster platters as share plates. The Rockefeller and chargrilled were by far the winners of the bunch. Could have done without the Maque Choux as the creamed cornesque topping dominated the taste over the oyster. Timing was great, the oysters were, as expected, as fresh as can be, and the atmosphere was great. Also enjoyed the Nola version of the Bloody Mary, which includes amazing pickled green beans that we do not have in Chicago!
Amazing shrimp and grits, Bloody Mary, oysters Rockefeller, and crab fingers. Free appetizer with 2 entrees! Right in the heart of the French quarter. Excellent service too.
Magen was amazing!!!  So helpful with the many options to choose from.  What a beautiful spirit and so informative.  Highly recommend this spot. ...ask for magen....she's the best waitress.

Came here and got the fried fish poboy and crawfish cakes.

-Crawfish cakes: were seasoned well with a kick of spice. 

-Fried fish poboy:  pretty big portion dressed with perfectly fried fish and super tasty fries. The sandwich was fresh and delicious.  

Service was friendly, efficient, and on point!

Would definitely come back again and recommend when back in NOLA.

Had lunch here  I heard the charbroiled oysters were good and they looked good. We had shrimp creole which was good and blackened shrimp and sausage jambalaya.  Not great. Dry and sausage was like 3 years old. Shrimp was average.  And it took 30 minutes and they weren't that busy. Waiter was on top of it and good though.

Found this place on yelp while I was on my New Orleans trip and the "free appetizer with check in" was a major contributor! This place was super close to our hotel too and it was nicer than I thought it would be. A friend of ours told us to try the chargrilled oysters and we're so glad we did. It was the first time I've had really good oysters and it was a life-changing meal! Now I want to try Atlanta good oysters. The flavor of the oysters were amazing. 5 stars for just the oysters! Next we had the stuffed mushrooms which were even more amazing! It got better and better! These were the best stuffed mushrooms ever. 5 more stars! For dinner we got Jambalaya and Blackened shrimp and Chef Justin White got Etouffe with crawfish. Both of the dishes were good. We mixed the shrimp with the rice and the jumbalaya was good, but at first it was lacking flavor and spice before I mixed it. The last time I had jumbalaya it was really spicy so it was weird to have a much milder version. Chef Justin White's etouffe was great though! We were too full for dessert. Our server was super awesome though! Always checking on us and even when I was out of eating utensils, he rushed to get us some. He was really easy to talk to also. The atmosphere of Royal House was great too! We didn't get to sit on the balcony, but I would love to do that sometime and people watch and listen to Tanya & Dorise doing their live street performance right next door! Chef Justin White and my cousin also saw some fireworks! Almost 5 stars! Just had to knock down one due to the jumbalaya not impressing me maybe due to expectations, or maybe due to actually lacking some spice. Would definitely recommend it to friends.

I don't know what has happened with this place- either it's under new ownership or new management but it has definitely gone downhill in both service and food quality. I have noticed a steady decline over the last year but our visit there this past weekend has taken it off of my favorites and recommended list. 

Visited this past weekend and the downstairs was busy but wasn't on a wait. We had to ask for water- it was never offered. And it took a while once we asked for it. Instead of coming back and getting an appetizer order from the table, our server waited at the bar the entire time our drinks were being made and chatted up the bartender. I had to get up and walk over to him to ask him to go fire an app order for the table. Service was nonexistent. 

Entrees were lackluster. Sautéed crab claws were nothing like we've had in the past here. They were small and about half the amount that used to go out of that kitchen. And the ribeye was an overly salted and overcooked thin piece of fat. Only good thing we had were the raw oysters. 

I hope someone in management reads this and takes it to heart. This place used to be my go-to spot. Now it's like almost every tourist joint on Bourbon.

Went to dinner here on our last night in NO. Delicious! I had the alligator appetizer, the shrimp tortellini and a hummingbird cocktail. Everything was delicious! Between our group of 7 we pretty much tried half the menu and everything was fantastic. Jesus was our server and was awesome. And the rest of the staff was very upbeat and nice. Highly recommend it!
I loved everything about Royal House. Great ambiance, amazing food and drinks and wonderful service. Made for a perfect start to our night!
We had the broiled oysters, excellent. Had the boiled shrimp bowl excellent. The service was great highly recommend

I went to the Royal House on the basis on a recommendation from an employee of the hotel I was staying at in New Orleans. I was particularly interested in trying one of their oyster po boys, which supposedly are very good.

The restaurant is quite nice with seating  at the bar or tables - I chose the bar. Service was quick and friendly and my meal arrived within five minutes of ordering, consisting of eight deep fried oysters on a slab of baguette with some sliced tomatoes and pickles and a side of fries. The oysters were tiny and fairly tasteless, and there wasn't anything on the rest of the plate that could be described as tasty or interesting.

Struggling to understand why people rate this place. The food was totally underwhelming and definitely doesn't live up yo it's reputation. Won't be coming back

Yelp failed me this time.

My best friend and I came here for brunch on Sunday. I'd say the best part of our meal was the crab claw appetizer. I could drink that garlic buttery goodness the claws were sitting in. 

The crawfish etouffee was my least favorite I've had in New Orleans in all my trips. I barely touched it. My friend's oyster pasta was okay. It was lacking- she had to add hot sauce to it. 

A couple other friends joined us and ordered the bread pudding and the brownie. They seemed to enjoy it. The bread pudding was like a block and not as moist as I'd like.
Awesome food and great service. The sauces are so addictive I could drink them. Get the crab claw appetizer, it has a sauce from heaven.

I had the blackened shrimp  & jambalaya and it was fantastic. We shared an appetizer of the grilled oysters and they were very good. Our server was excellent. She helped us make our selections, and was attentive and friendly.

Food was excellent!
Shrimp and Grits was really good.
The best part of our meal was by far our server, Becks.
She was so nice and helpful with the menu and was also hilarious. 
Definitely ask to be seated in her section!

What a GREAT find! A classic Oyster Bar, cheery waitstaff and some mighty tasty Oysters (We had then three ways, Raw, Rockefeller & Bienville). WOW! Highly recommended and the menu has lots of other stuff as well although we were STUFFED and no more room! DO come here!
Amazing food! Ate here four days in a row! Sit with Nyrobie at the bar. By far the best food in NOLA
Good food, excellent service, not very expensive. A place to come back.

I love coming here on dates with my girlfriend. Patty is the best bartender and so nice to us. The sauce on the crab claws is amazing. They have the best shrimp po boy and French fries I've had in the French Quarter. The Bloody Mary's are on point. I usually recommend Royal House for oysters as well.

I have one word... BECKS. She is the best bartender ever. Not only does she know her alcohol, but she does it with fun and personality. I highly recommend this spot for the char broiled oysters. But more importantly for Becks. The coolest bartender ever :)

Becks is great!!!! The best margaritas in New Orleans! She is an insane mixologist and has the best personality of any bartender I have ever known. And I have traveled all over the world for business and pleasure so that's saying something. GoBecks!

Good menu good food good service but incredible bar tender. We sat up stairs and Becks turned a mundane business dinner into an incredibly festive dining and cocktail experience New Orleans style. If you plan on going ask for Becks and let her make something for you you didn't even know you wanted.

Went here cause I wanted to try gator...We asked a few people what was the best place for gator and all of them mentioned this place because you have to know how to prepare gator. They were right, the order was small but I only wanted to try it but ordered more...Loved it!! And no, it doesn't taste like chicken....Reminded me of pork..Next time in NO, this will be on my list!!
The best Chargrilled Oysters in New Orleans!! The mashed potatoes are also very good! I can't wait to come back and have their food again.

First place we stopped at when we got to the French Quarter. Our hotel staff recommended it and they were dead on!! We had the Crab Claws and it was delicious!! Be weary if you don't like a lot of garlic though!! The service was impeccable and very knowledgable regarding what the best options were. I will stop here again!!

GO FOR THE BLOODY MARY.  they infuse the vodka with all of the vegetables that garnish a bloody, then take the vodka-ized vegetables and garnish with them anyways.  So yum.  Also served huge oysters.  Dropped in here randomly and was very impressed.

Ate here 2 days in a row on a 4 day trip.  Crawfish etouffe is ridiculous good.  The bloody mary's, bananas foster, chargrilled oysters are all must haves.  Yum!!  Wish I could bring this place home with me to Denver. I'd eat here once a week if I could. Loved it.  Did I mention the service?   Amazing, southern hospitality, friendly and professional.

Currently enjoying our meal at Royal House, discovered through a recommendation from our hotel.   Food has been great, drinks are stiff, and the highlight of our night is our server Becks who has been extremely helpful with 2 tourists.  Ask for her for fun and honest service.

I'd give this place a four but the service, operations and overall execution left me disappointed. The seating experience with the host was horrible and a few of our dishes were warm and underwhelming. The char grilled oysters were top notch, though.
Everything I are here was amazing! Taste of New Orleans, Shrimp and Grits, and Crawfish Ravioli! A must try!

The food here was so lousy. It wasn't fresh and it tasted bland and, at times, flat out bad. I ordered the crab stuffed mushrooms, and they were so overcooked and flavorless. The crawfish étouffée was funky because crawfish is out of season in October and no one told me. I was told that at Drago's, but no not here. The staff had some issue seating us, I put my name down and I was waiting at the bar and they said they couldn't find me even though I told them two times I would be waiting at the bar. Just don't bother going here.

Should have adjusted my expectations when I saw how "touristy" the place was.  I ordered the shrimp and grits.  Grits needed salt and the 8 small shrimp that were all on the plate had not had the intestine cleaned out.  Maybe too picky but, gross! Upside they let me order something else, Bloody Mary was good and service at the bar was pleasant.

While the food's flavor is delicious every time I have eaten here (three times total) the food has been delivered cold.   I am not sure if they cook in mass quantities and leave the food sitting under heat lamps or what the issue is but its very frustrating to spend $40 - $50 for two people to eat a meal and most of it seems as tho its been sitting around for long periods. I will not give Royal House a fourth shot.

Confused to why it's rated so high. At best, it's mediocre Cajun food. Went here based on 4 star rating from over 800 reviewers, but I'm guessing most of those hadn't eaten good food before. 

Ordered a mojito which was all syrup and no club soda, returned it and it was equally as bad. Jambalaya was dry and lacking flavor, mostly mushy rice with dry overcooked chicken mixed with a decent andouille. Only thing I really enjoyed was the redfish beignets (which are essentially just fried fish bites).  

With all the other amazing food choices in New Orleans, I felt cheated out of a good meal that night based on the high reviews here.   It's probably more 2 stars, but I'm giving it a 1 to balance out too many 5 star reviews. 

I would highly recommend looking elsewhere if you actually want a meal to remember.

Great restaurant, very friendly and attentive service. Food was delicious,  fried alligator was my favorite!  The New Orleans trio was a perfect combo of cajun favorites, shrimp Po boy was huge and hush puppies were fried to perfection!  All this in a cool space. Definitely a great place to try!

I dined on the 2nd floor patio at Royal House for lunch. I ordered a dozen chargrilled oysters and fried alligator for myself along with an Abita amber. I just started eating oysters the day before when I had them at Acme for the first time. First of all, the fried alligator was great, tasted just like chicken. The chargrilled oysters were good and if I had not had them at Acme the day before, I would probably have said they were fantastic. They were just a too garlic-y for my liking. It had me wishing I'd ordered raw. My server Nicole was nice and attentive. I loved watching the happenings on the street below and taking in all of the French Quarter surroundings. Outside dining in the French Quarter is the way to go!

The food was delicious! My boyfriend and I are on vacation. We drove down to the French Quarter and while looking for parking we saw that this place was PACKED. People were waiting around the block to get in. Once we found a parking space we headed for the Royal House. It was a 45 minute wait before we could get in but there were some street performers across the way so the wait didn't seem too long! 

For appetizer for order the Tomato Mozzarella Salad. It was delicious! We also order a dozen Oysters on the shell. Those were very good! They tasted fresh! && for our entree we shared the Taste of New Orleans dish. The gumbo was delicious. The jambalaya was yummy! & the ettouffe was BOMB. 

The service was not all that great. Our waitress was all over the place! She didn't really check on us. Just walked by and looked at the table. When we told her we needed the check it took her about 15 minutes to get it to us. I used to be a server and if I was a secret shopper she would have definitely failed. But it wasn't terribly bad.

I visited this place last weekend. Great location and only a short wait for a table. I had the crawfish étouffée... It was pretty good, but was barely warm. The service was great, but the constant "up-sell" attempts were annoying. It was ok overall.

This place was really amazing. I came in from out of town for a quick weekend trip (first timer) and stumbled on this place by way of recommendation from a local shop owner. Since I was eating solo I sat at the bar where I got the greatest service from Becks (yes like the beer). She was great company and suggested some great custom drink options. The food is amazing (alligator bites and French onion soup are the best thing I have ever ate) Overall super pleased and will deff be coming back my next time here. Ps they also let you carry their drinks out sure plus!!

This restaurant has the worst service of any restaurant I have ever been to in NOLA. Went in at 8:30 and was seated at a two top by the window across from the bar. Frazzled waitress came by for drink order and I quickly gave her the order. Also tried to order some crab that they did not have because they were not in season?? Why did the menu not say "seasonal" by that item then? So after 10 minutes the frazzled waitress comes back by and recites our drink order again....okay thank you for reciting to me what I already knew I ordered because I wanted it. Now why haven't you put that order in? Needless to say we left and had dinner and drinks elsewhere. No idea why people have rated this restaurant so highly. Sad we had the experience we had. :-(

This place was delicious. The crab fingers appetizer was fabulous!!! It's like $10 and you don't even know how good. You must try. We got the shrimp po boy and the chargrilled oysters too. They were also handsome. Check this place out.

We recently visited New Orleans for a weekend. During our trip we researched 
on Yelp where to go for a special Sunday seafood dinner. We chose Royal House because of their excellent reviews and the fact that you receive a free appetizer 
when checking in on yelp.
First we ordered 2 drinks and an appetizer. After waiting almost 30 minutes our entrees arrived and no appetizer. When we inquired about our appetizer they were surprised and took our dinners back and returned with the crab claws we ordered, 
Again we waited and waited and no food as we watched others come and go. By this time our drinks were finished I decided to get the check and leave. When we received the check they had charged us for the "free" appetizer. At this point I asked for a manager. The manager returned with our check and said he would take care of the overcharge. We waited an additional 15 minutes for him to finally
tell us that we weren't being charged and we could leave.
Almost one and a half hours and no food.
Every place can fall short now and then but for the price it is not worth taking the chance. 
On this visit they fell short on all levels, service, hospitality and management.
Thought the food was good. Waiter was lacking in service. One dinner sent back because it was cold. Never saw waiter again till time for bill

I came here after seeing this restaurant had 4 stars from over 800 reviewers, but I have to wonder if that was just the alcohol affecting their tastebuds.

The menu is overpriced, the cocktails are just pretty gross. My boyfriend and I ordered  some oysters on the half shell and those were pretty decent. I got the crawfish etoufee, which was barely-warmed slop with no taste, and he got the blackened shrimp jumbalaya, which was slightly better but not actually blackened and again, not even really hot. I was looking forward to having dessert because they sounded good, but after the rest of the bland, mediocre food we thought better of it. I wish I had saved the $70 and gone to a better restaurant.

On a recent trip to NOLA, I was looking for a great local place to dine. Let me start off by saying first, our waitress was the most charming woman ever who wouldn't let us leave till our plates were cleaned off, and trust me my girlfriends and I finished every meal like it was our last. For dinner we had the chargrilled oysters, shrimp and grits and crawfish entoufee. This was my fist time having shimrp and grits but I saw a picture here and wanted to try it, my gosh did I drool when I saw it, it had a perfect balance of buttery rich grits with a tangy shimp sauce to accompany it as well as perfectly seasoned shrimp. The oysters and crawfish were great too, but the shrimp and grits is a must try. Now time for dessert, THE BANANA FOSTER CHEESECAKE! OMG one of the best desserts I ever had in my life and I am from NYC, so I have tried everything. I had no clue what to expect and when we got it, I was a bit confused. There were these scoops which seemed like icecream but it was actually cheesecake. The cookie crust was molded together to a triangle int he center amongst the cheesecake scoops, banana foster and caramel, with a drizzel of caramel and banana cream sauce and the smoothest whipped cream. This was heaven on a plate, I have searched all over back home to see if we have it and we don't. I would fly down just to get it again. A MUST TRY.

The bartender is great.

However I don't like oysters unless they are ice cold. I'm sure the experience cold be better

Went to Royal House last night after receiving many recommendations from locals and travelers alike.  Started the meal off with a spicy cold Bloody Mary to drink. Very well mixed.  Then we went after the crab claws and charbroiled oysters.  Both were seasoned and cooked to perfection. No wonder every table around us had the same appetizers.   The wife and I then shared our entrees of blackened redfish and crawfish étouffée.   Not only did they not disappoint but they exceeded our heightened expectations.   The service was impeccable. Highly suggest this place as a must stop in New Orleans.

The food was very good. We did not actually try the oysters, but we tried the jambalaya, gumbo and etouffe. The latter two were a little soupy compared to what I accustomed to - in fact, they appeared identical and primarily differed in flavor, not consistency - but the taste was very good. Seating is a little cramped, but we got seated by an entrance so were able to enjoy the street performers playing music across the street.

The staff is so friendly. The food is amazing. I had the crawfish ravioli and it was incredible. I used yelps check-in, in which they gave me a free appetizer. Eric,our waiter, was extremely friendly and awesome at coming to our table to check  on us frequently. I highly recommend you try this place out for seafood if you are craving it today! :D

This place was awesome!  Came here on a Tuesday night and they said we would need to wait 25 minutes but we were seated in about 10 right on the balcony!  Inside is really cool and has an old feel.  We actually don't even eat oysters but there was plenty on the menu to choose from.  I ended up getting the shrimp tortellini and my sister got their onion soup and a salad.  We also checked in on Yelp so got a free appetizer!  The waiter was friendly and the service was good.  It was nice because a lady was outside on the street singing and it seemed like she was there just for the restaurant even though she wasn't.

This was our groups first stop when arriving in NOLA. We were hungry and ready for some cajun cuisine. We sat outside on the very narrow deck (or ledge haha) overlooking Royal st. We had a great people watching view and awesome service. My friend and I shared the sampler platter that consisted of a cup of gumbo, jambalaya and crawfish etouffee. All were tasty, but the gumbo had a strange after taste. I'm a HUGE gumbo fan and realize every roux is different so it may just be my liking. When in NOLA again, I'll return for more.

Walked away fairly disappointed after our meal Sunday night.  First, we were told the wait would be 20 minutes, we were seated after a 45 minute wait.  Ordered raw & baked oysters with garlic, the baked oysters were EXTREMELY salty and that comes from someone who really likes her salt.  Our entrees weren't much better.   The fish po'boy arrived cold and had to be sent back.  The shrimp jambalaya was boring, no spice: the sausage seemed to be missing.  Had to stop eating the shrimp because some were just awful,  The shrimp boil was missing the Cajun spice, though the shrimp were perfect in texture.  Étouffée and the gumbo were just fair.  All in all definitely did not live up to the 4 star Yelp rating.
Good food!  Very tasty!  But hands down, the Oysters Rockefeller and Oysters Royale are the most amazing oysters I've had!  Service was friendly.

My friend was really wanting to try jambalaya, and after reading many reviews we thought that Royal House was the place to go. We got there early, a little before 5:30 and actually got a seat on the balcony. Although the balcony was beautiful, it was very shaky and totally threw me off. 

To start off we decided to try the fried alligator. I was skeptical, but when you're in a different state you much try what the locals eat. They were actually very interesting and I would definitely recommend those. For our main meal, my friend got the shrimp jambalaya and I got the blackened chicken sandwich. Neither had very much flavor and we were both pretty disappointed. Obviously not a place for people who don't love seafood like myself.

This place is cool because it's in the French Quarter and has a great balcony. It's got a lot of Souther/New Orleans charm. However, the service was VERY slow and the food was bad. I got the Taste of New Orleans, which includes gumbo, jambalaya and crawfish etouffee. None of them were very good at all.

Went here with a group while passing through New Orleans. This was a solid four star experience. Service was good, food was tasty, tried the alligator po boy with the house sauce (extra $4!! But worth it). The fries weren't hot, but I'll let it slide since I was with a big group. The best part of the meal was the banana fosters cheesecake dessert, amazing.

Recommended by a local, this was one of the 2 best places to get great oysters.  Seems like everyone else thought the same thing as the place was pretty packed at 3 in the afternoon.  

Upstairs we go and ordered Oysters on the Half Shell and the Oysters Royal.  YUM YUM is all I can say.  If you are a skeptic and figure you can't get bad oysters anywhere, you are wrong in my opinion.  This place has great oysters and had I not been so full, we would ordered more and tried some of the others.  Next trip!

I was in town for 3 days. I ate all over the place- including Commanders and the like. This was my favorite meal. The crawfish etouffee was outstanding. Service was top notch. I was skeptical given its proximity to Bourbon street, but you can't go wrong. I was in a group of 4, everyone liked their meal.

The tourists go to Acme, but Royal House is just as good. It's on Royal st and always has live musicians playing outside. Their chargrilled oysters are fantastic with parmesan and butter and the bread they give you soaks it up nicely. I also like their Oysters Rockefeller and Oysters Royale. You can't go wrong with any of the oysters here.

There is the sweetest waitress named Tina who works here. Try to ask for her.

I'm a raw oyster guy but decided to try a half dozen raw and a half dozen grilled ....   WOW!!  Not only is Robe a master shucker and demonstrates his craft right at the bar, but he can tend bar and great guests all at the same time. Great typical open air environment across from court house makes for perfect people watching as well. Will be back to try a po' boy as they looked great.

Decided to try dinner here. We sat on the balcony which sounds way better than reality. The balcony is slanted so you have to slant the other way the entire meal. The oyster fettucini was bland and overly creamy with no flavor. The fried oysters provided the salty component but mixed with the cream sauce was really not very good. The Old Fashioned drinks were great.

Great food!  The Charbroiled Oysters & Royal Oysters combo was really good.  The Crab Claw App has the most amazing creamy sauce to dip bread in.  Go for the Basil Berry cocktail, name is deceiving its not too sweet and very good.

The bar gets five stars the food gets four. Quaint view and environs, but its the people behind the bar that can make this a lifetime memory/experience. I'm not sure of her name, but I think it's Bexx and I'd have to say she's probably the most intelligent and engaging mixologist I've ever met. Rather than just high cute girls, they've hired a cute girl with brains and personality as well as mixology knowledge and passion that is very rare. She has created her own bitters and has drink suggestions for every palate. Everyone in our party commented on her exemplary service and engagement with everyone at the bar.
Megan was amazing and so was the food. Chargrilled oysters, oysters royale, and crab claws were fabulous. Go glad that Megan recommended them to us. Cool atmosphere too!
Excellent fresh oysters! Had a dozen raw with a side of jambalaya an a draft beer for lunch. Excellent service and very friendly staff.

Delicious food and fabulous service! Sunday night crowd with a 30-40min wait and still the entire staff was incredibly friendly. Once we got sat, our server Alexandra was prompt and got our drink orders in and then helped me make a decision on food and her choice was SPOT ON. We had the crab claws appetizer and OMG I could bathe in that sauce, it was heaven. I (with the help of sweet Alexandra) ordered the Shrimp Creole and my friend ordered the Taste of New Orleans. That shrimp creole was so explosive with flavor, I cleaned my plate! Friend loved the seafood gumbo and the jambalaya from the Taste of New Orleans sample platter he got. We split the bread pudding -which I've never had- and other than the new texture, the flavors were great. This is one place I would definitely frequent on a trip back to NOLA.

Went here for a Friday night ladies night. Myself and 4 other ladies. We ordered the ladies night drink which was absolutely delish!! Also we just got a plethora of oysters to go around and I must say we were highly disappointed. And surprised because we checked the place out online beforehand because we all love chargrilled oysters. The place had great reviews, but not that night. All the oysters were over cooked and really really small. I don't eat them raw but one friend who does said that she enjoyed them raw but how can you mess up a raw oyster anywho, too pricy for the quality. Very cozy. Great staff. Right downtown in heart of the quarter. Just don't get oysters. But they did honor the One free appetizer offer through yelp which was cool!

I was kind of shocked of the amount of places that stopped serving food after 11pm.  We were in a desperate hunt for food on a Saturday night and decided to try out Royal House since it was convenient and open.  I asked the waitress if she could split my po-boy with half shrimp and half fish, and she said they wouldn't allow it.  Instead, the waitress talked me into ordering Crawfish Etouffee, which I was already apprehensive about because restaurants can never really get this dish down right.  Crawfish Etouffee is one of my favorite Creole meals and I am highly critical of it, but to be fair, Royal House's etouffee was horrible.  Most of the crawfish were charcoal colored and they were extremely salty.  One of the bites of food that I took was so salty that I had to dispose of it.  I wouldn't recommend ordering this dish from here to anyone.

My bf ordered the Alligator Bites, and they were lukewarm, hard, and had an old taste to them.  It was evident that this alligator was not fried at the time we were there.  I assume it was probably fried earlier that morning.

I would never come here again.  The food wasn't good and definitely wasn't worth the price.

To make matters worse, I had a hair wrapped into my silverware napkin that was waiting for me once I started opening the napkin.  Just shoot me!

We went to this place for the oysters, though probably should have taken a local's advice to "stay out of the French Quarter" for dinners.  While I don't think that's exactly true, we had a pretty bad experience at Royal House.  Everything was exceedingly salty, and the food took forever to come out (cold, at that!).  A few of the dishes we tolerated, but we had to send back my wife's pasta w/fried oyster dish because the salt level was way too high.  It took them about 20 minutes to "rush" another dish out - which admittedly was pretty good in terms of seasoning.  Too bad at that point, everyone else had finished their meal and my wife had filled up on fries.  Maybe we caught them on an off day, but this is one to avoid in my opinion.

I like to think of New Orleans as a place where it's hard to find ordinary food, but I have to say that Royal House undermined that expectation.  We got the Oyster Duo (Rockefeller and Royal), and they were good.  However, for the Taste (Jambalaya, Étouffée, and Gumbo), the dishes were definitely ordinary.
