The gumbo was peppery and undistinguished, and frankly my Jambalaya is better.  After excellent gumbo at another place the day before, this was surprisingly uninspired.  I tried my colleague's Creole sauce, and it was no better than mine!  Mind you, I'm a SoCal boy, so you wouldn't expect that mine should be comparable.  Compared to the exquisite Courtbouillon I had yesterday, this sauce was rather crude.  Overall, this is a place for tourists, not gourmands or gourmets.
Start with redfish beignets,next blackened shrimp and the taste of new orleans.  Cool place.  Try the bloody mary.
Good friendly staff. But food is awful. I mean really bad! The burger was black and had fake cheese on it. French fries looked frozen out of a bag. The root beer was tasty though.
Good environment! Small but good feel! Food is good and Cindy our server was excellent! Made for a fun first time in NO!!

Amazing food! My wife and I split the the baked oysters, crawfish étouffée, crab claws and bread pudding for desert! Amazing service and one of the best meals we've had in a while. I highly recommend the baked oysters and the crab claws.

Royal House ROCKS! I had the charbroiled oysters on the half shell and the french onion soup! We also had the blue crab claw appetizer, which the sauce is to die for! An absolute must-eat restaurant. The entire staff was profession and personal. You won't go wrong! Yum!

With a group of 6, we had a little bit of a wait on a Saturday night. We got some drinks: mojito, berry basil, and cider spice - all were really delicious. Once we were seated our server Heidi was absolutely on top of it! She was so sweet and patient. 

Redfish had a little bit of bones in it (hence minus one star), but the garlic mashed potatoes were really good and Heidi recommended this amazing side of sauce with it - was sooo good! Love this place. Great service. Good food.
Great oysters. The crawfish ravioli and the shrimp and grits were very tasty. On top of that, the service was very friendly. Made for a great dining experience.

They had fantastic char grilled oysters. We sat  on the balcony but I joined my friends after they had been seated and they made me sit at a separate table because on the balcony it was only 2 per table.... so I pulled up a chair after a few min to join my friend. the waiter didn't say anything but another female worker kept giving us the stink eye. It was crowded with 3 people at the table but we managed. Food was amazing and our server was really good to though I cannot remember his name...
We had a wonderful evening.  I enjoyed a Hurricanes drink, Deep Fried Alligator and Crab claws. We sat at the bar and watched our waiter shell oyster and visited with wonderful people we didn't know.
This place is great!  Red fish beignets are a must. Enjoyed everything we had with terrific service and atmosphere. Ask for Ryan at the oyster bar.

I had the crab cake sliders which were awesome...fries needed some seasoning though.  My wife had the shrimp and grits...the shrimp and the grits were cooked perfectly, however...the overwelming pepper flavor was just a killer for us...it just blew us out.  Don't get me wrong...I love pepper...my wife, not quite as much...but it was just too much....even after scraping off the huge cracked peppercorns
Awesome oysters. Great, great shrimp bake with the BEST corn I've ever had. Definitely would recommend.

This place was great.  Food was delicious especially the crab claws and the red fish.  The waitress Megan was very nice and helpful.  Lastly,  they played Otis Redding while I was there and I love him.  Overall it was a great experience.

Arrived shortly after 11 am to order the Taste of New Orleans to go. Received hot and delicious food in about 5 minutes. 4 separate containers, one for each of the 3 dishes and a 4th with the rice in it. Great flavor, not overly salty (which is often an issue for my salt-sensitive palate). Would definitely return to try other dishes

Service was good, recd the crab claw appetizer and it was real good, recd the taste of New Orleans and it was also real good, wife got the shrimp po boy it was just okay she said, wine pour was generous, I would go back for a late night dinner
Came to NOLA for the weekend and wanted to eat near my hotel. Great food and great atmosphere!
Food was alright. Could've had a bit more flavor, but our server Becks was really enjoyable. Has a particular humor that you have to be in the mood for, but she's funny and provides great service.
I had Crawfish ravioli. I would say this is how pasta should always taste. It was delicious and IM going to have a hard time going somewhere else when I go back to new Orleans
Worst place I've tried in NOLA. Luke warm food and mediocre tastes. Only thing good about it is the second floor balconies. Never coming back

We came here for brunch the last day before heading to our flight. There was no wait at all since we were there at 10 am. 

The St. Louis Special was very good...better than the crawfish benedict which was good too. Great biscuits. 

Very laid back atmosphere. Good bloody mary.

Being a local favorite, we finally got a chance to dine here on a Friday night for a late dinner. Fortunately, less crowds on Bourbon = no waiting and we were seated promptly. Drinks were our appetizers of choice- hurricanes & mojitos! Without a doubt...the OYSTERS were amazing- we feasted upon raw oysters, chargrilled oysters (bubbling parmesan & butter can't go wrong), and Rockefeller oysters (you had me at BACON & spinach, which I highly recommend because they were flavorful & juicy). We saved just enough room for the brownie a la mode, which was served warm & perfectly complemented the melt-in-your-mouth vanilla bean ice cream. Service was friendly & attentive! 

INSIDER TIPS:
1. Dine at the bar for the best oyster experience
2. Locals receive a 15% discount- just ask your server!

Happy eating & enjoy!!!
I ordered the oyster tacos and got tortilla chips with oysters on top. Quite dissapointing.
Delicious! Great food! Great oysters! Awesome atmosphere (we sit on the balcony.) Also, for military there is a great discount. One of our favorites!
Food was great and our server, Matthew, provided the best service we have had since we have been in New Orleans!!

Os preços são bem atrativos. A comida é muito farta e gostosa. 
Com certeza o lugar não irá ganhar um prêmio de melhor culinária. 
Mas, a casa cumpre o que promete. A qualidade da refeição está bem compatível com p preço praticado. 
Os pratos são enormes e muito bem feitos. Bastante saborosos. 
Os atendentes, como usual nos bares americanos, são bem atenciosos e simpáticos. 
Recomendo muito a entrada Dips of spinach. O chopp local também é bem gostoso. 
Para quem pretende uma refeição casual el em ambiente mais barulhento e descontraído é uma ótima pedida. 
Recomendo.

Holy smokes, I'll be dreaming of that crab claw app until I'm back again. Creamy and cajun'y and just perfect. Also got the snow crab boil which was worth every penny. Sat at the bar to avoid a wait and the bartender was awesome - even gave me a pearl from the oysters he was shucking!
Etouffee and chargrilled ousters were as good as advertised. Would definitely come back.

#NOLAtourism #foodtourism #chifoodie We went for lunch after many hours of walking the French Quarter.  We were attracted to this place because of the upper balcony.  The staff was accommodating to our party and made sure to find space for us.  The food was fine-- standard tourist fare.  I had shrimp creole and hushpuppies topped with a lemon drop martini.  I picked the shrimp creole at the encouragement of the staff who thought it was fresher and more plentiful than the crawfish étouffée.  It was fine-- fresh-- no complex seasonings, not worth ordering again.  The hushpuppies were a tasty treat.  Our son had the crablouise salad-- lovely but not worth writing home about.  The prices are reasonable.  Most importantly, however, the atmosphere on a beautiful day is fantastic.  We sat on the balcony and let the music of the live musicians www.tanyandorise.com waft up and serenade us.    We watched the tourists and artists below and enjoyed the sunlight.  This experience might be worth returning to.

Came here on a Thursday night (Thanksgiving) for dinner.  The menu looked great and we didn't have to wait long.  We were seated upstairs.  The food was pricey for small bland portions.  The food was nothing special, just average.  The wait staff appeared young and inexperienced.  Luckily there was a coupon here on Yelp.  We won't be back.

This place is a gem. It has a large selection of oyster to pick from. We ended up getting this oyster plate that had corn and it was soooo good! We order the three gumbo sample and it was so good we took it to go! They were super cool about bringing in your own alcoholic drink and even then, we ended up ordering more drinks because their drink selections pretty cool. We also decided to get the fried alligator and it was like a "chicken calamari" it was really good. Our server was cool, he actually kinda look like a fancy version of lil Wayne. Hahahahaha! And of course the live music outside really brings the whole ambience together. Wait isn't took long at all and they will let you pick your table if there are a couple open.  Overall great experience!
Great place to grab a quick bite while down in the French Quarter!  The staff were friendly and the overall service was excellent!  I would definitely return :)

I cannot get enough of this place. During this visit (November 28th), I saw familiar faces (Nairobi and Jeff) and met a new, Tina. 

As before, the food was excellent and service second to none!
Service was good. Prices were fair. Gumbo was poor. Crawfish cake good. Chargrilled oysters really amazing.

Yummy food, excellent service! Thanks Meghan for the tips around NO and recommended crawfish ravioli! 

The downstairs and entrance especially when super busy is not the best atmosphere, highly recommend trying to get table upstairs for a better experience.

With a check in, get a free appetizer so be sure to check that out!

I thought this place was just OK. Like others, I saw the reviews and pictures (Shrimp Creole) and thought I was in for something fantastic.  I ended up getting a hurricane,  redfish beignets and the shrimp creole. The hurricane tasted like punch, redfish beignets were "neatly plated" but bland and the creole was just, ok. I don't think this is a place I'd write home about,  but I'd try it again just in case I just ordered wrong. Service was quick and server was nice. Maybe next time, but 2 stars for now.

Unbelievably delicious oysters!! This review is only for the chargrilled oysters with parmesan butter and the oysters maque choux. They were so fantastic that we ordered both each day of our 5 day vacation. Definitely a highlight of the trip!

The Chargrilled Oysters are to die for!! By far the best food I've had since being here in New Orleans. We also ordered the Oyster Duo (Oyster Rockefeller & Oyster Royale), but they were so so compared to the Chargrilled Oysters. We were originally going to order half a dozen, but our waiter, Marco, advised that we get a dozen, and what a great recommendation!

We also ordered the Redfish Beignet and the French Onion Soup. The beignet was almost like a sweet-&-sour fish dish, and the soup had a lot of cheese. Both were pretty tasty.

For drinks, we got a Hendrick's Royal Cup (Hendrick's, Pimm's, Sprite & Cucumber). It was tasty, not too strong, and very cucumber-y.

For dessert, we ordered the bread pudding. My-oh-my, how tasty too! The bread was nice and warm, soft and had raisins. It was not too sweet either. Just the perfect little wrap-up to our meal.

They have balcony seating, but not for dinner hours, so minus a star for that. Otherwise, a very pleasant experience. Hostess and waiter Marco were very friendly and offered great suggestions.

Love the Royal House!  Packed on a Tuesday night, but 2 of us had no problem getting seated right on the balcony.

Great ambiance.

Onion soup, spinach salad, shrimp tortellini and spinach dip were all delicious.

Service was great!

The bananas foster dessert was pretty good, as was the service.  The $10 Cocktails were weak. I had the shrimp creole as my entree , which was described as spicy on the menu but was disappointingly bland. It tasted like shrimp swimming in Ragu sauce with Uncle Ben's rice on the side.

I'm guessing this place is a tourist trap.

Loved this place! I had the gumbo and it was out of this world! We also got oysters, I can't remember which ones. My friend is an oyster critic apparently and thought they were overcooked but I LOVED them. The staff was grand, the live music playing outside was exquisite, the restaurant is gorgeous, and the drinks were fabulous. I've never loved a restaurant experience as much as this. Go go go! Try everything!  I spoke to people sitting around us and all of them loved their dishes as well. It's the sort of atmosphere where it just makes people feel comfortable talking to each other and my waiter was so stinkin' cute!

While the food was amazing the service here was awful! We ordered drinks and a dozen oysters on the half shell to start. When the drinks came we ordered another appetizer and our dinner. We had to remind the waiter about the oysters twice and they finally came 1/2 way through the main course. They had clearly been opened and set on ice awhile ago as most of the ice was now water. The oysters were typical of any Louisiana oyster muddy but good. The gumbo and catfish étouffée were the best in town.

Having just landed in NOLA, Royal House was the first meal being that it was right next to where I was staying. Should have made another choice, but we were hungry.

Our server was the festively plump Latino server who reminded my wife and I of Katsuji from Top Chef season 12. You're better off if you have someone else as your server as he wasn't really around when we needed him, and when we flagged him down, he'd tell us he'd be right there, and continue in his conversation with another server.

The place is pretty crowded in that there isn't much space between your table and the next in their more general seating area. 

We ordered the Peel-n-Eat Shrimp, the Taste of New Orleans, and the Fried Alligator. The Peel-n-Eat Shrimp were okay with a little spice, but the shells seemed to stick firmly onto the shrimp so that by the time you got it all off, your piece of shrimp looked like it had been run over by an 18-wheeler. Poor skills on our part I guess. They were cooked well, but could have used more flavor. Something like $16 for a pound.

Fried Alligator tasted like overdone frog legs. Nothing special. Too much fried batter. Wish I didn't order it.

The Taste of New Orleans was pretty disappointing. They had a small cup of the etouffee, and a small cup of the gumbo accompanied with a small up of their jambalaya. The jambalaya was chalky dry and all the items in it were severely overcooked. The two soups came out lukewarm and were all in all disappointing. I like my soups hot. I think the temperature helps make or break a soup. So these soups were pretty saddening.

We walked away pretty disappointed, but were hungry, so we cleaned off every plate and bowl. Diner's remorse. Should have taken our money to Domenica or Avery's on Tulane instead.

Chargrilled oysters.  Only thing worth getting here. 

That's the one and only thing that is worth getting here, I came here on a sunny afternoon and was able to sit outside on the balcony, the restaurant is only about 3 years old, but the interior makes it feel as if it was built in the 60s. I love it. 

The chairs and tables have an old - fashioned 1960s feel, and made me feel as if I were transported back to the 60s.  This restaurant is definitely a tourist trap and so overpriced.  I ordered the cajun sampler and 6 chargrilled oysters, the Cajun sampler had gumbo, crawfish etouffe, and jambalaya $18 ( not worth it), the jambalaya was plain and not tasty at all.  The gumbo just tasted like water, and the etouffe wasn't warm or savory at all. 

I probably would only have given them 2 stars but the chargrilled oysters were freaking delicious.  Next time I will probably just order a dozen chargrilled oysters and nothing else.  My waiter was fantastic and so friendly, I wish he had warned me about how crappy the food was going to be though.... oh well my fault for falling into this tourist trap .
Excellent food ! Tried Oyster Taco's & Shrimp Jambalaya. Not rating 5 stars only bcoz of the ambiance, but as expected in a crowded area like French Quarter.

I can only speak to the broiled oysters - anyone who says they're better than Acme's just doesn't like oysters.  Poorly shucked, some burnt, some raw (at least the latter isn't BAD), and watery drinks to boot. Meh. If Acme didn't have bankers hours, I'd have gone there tonight. Won't make that mistake again tomorrow!

We were very pleased with Royal House. The wait staff were friendly and helpful, and the restaurant gives a 15% discount for locals (we live in the New Orleans metro area). I ordered a Fried Fish & Shrimp Platter ($18.00), which came with probably the best coleslaw I've ever had (we all agreed on how good it was). The fries were very flavorful and plentiful, and they give big portions of catfish & shrimp. It comes with lots of hush puppies, too. My dinner mates ordered a Fried Shrimp Platter (for her), and a Fried Oyster Po Boy (for him). He remarked about how the sandwich was more oyster, lettuce, and tomato than bread. We were happy that the batter on the food seemed to be perfectly seasoned and not a bit greasy. All it all, it was an "A+" (outstanding), and we agreed that it was one of the best seafood restaurants we've yet visited. Strongly recommended. RJT

The 3 of us came here for a late lunch on a Saturday around 2 pm. It was close to our hotel and had great reviews, it also had a YELP coupon for a free appie. We walked up and were able to be seated right away. We ordered 3 adult beverages and dived into the menu.  My Bloody Mary was the weakest one I had while in NOLA, I wasn't even sure there was booze in it, and it was priced at $10+, it made me sad. I actually ordered a different drink for my second one b/c it was such a let down. My 2 dining friends said the same about their drink selections.  We didn't want full entrees b/c we had dinner reservations that night at 7 pm and were told that we couldn't use the coupon without ordering entrees, boo.  

With that said, we decided to share a bunch of appies: 

-oysters (mine with the butter and Parmesan was awesome)
-crab claws- sauce was awesome especially with the bread, sadly it was better than the claws themselves
-tomato & mozz salad- rather lackluster, served with rosemary instead of basil? my least favorite dish
-crayfish fritters- very tasty little guys, but not much to the order, luckily we were already pretty satiated from our other choices.

Would I go back- Probably not

We came here late one night, approximately 10PM, for a late dinner.  I was looking forward to my fried oyster and shrimp plate.  However, I felt as thought both had been sitting there for hours.  The overall service was good, but the food was just barely average.  
You have to have fresh when it comes to fried food.

I did have a coupon for a free appetizer from Yelp.  We had the crab claws and they were delish.  The sauce was magnificent.

This is a nice little spot to sit at the bar or dine downstairs, upstairs or on the awesome balcony.  They have an oyster bar and offer a nice selection of local traditional seafood dishes, creole staples and some unique creations.  The service is generally very good and they definitely seem to put a focus on friendly customer service and outside of the classic NOLA Creole flagship establishments this is some of the best service to be had in the Quarter.  The prices are a bit on the expensive side but they do offer a 15% discount to locals.  Currently this is probably the best environment to sit at an oyster bar to eat raw and grilled oysters in the French Quarter and even though this place draws a lot of tourists you still won't be waiting in line like at Felix's or Acme as the hordes haven't taken over this location yet.

After a morning of tours and shopping, we needed to stop for a quick bite to eat. I had read that the Royal House had tasty oysters, so we decided to have a light lunch here. I ordered half a dozen raw oysters, and half a dozen Oysters Royale. The raw oysters were good, but not nearly as large as the ones that Acme or Felix's serves. Mine were also not cleaned very well. Every single oyster had shell or some kind of debris in it. The Oyster Royale were good and I'd suggest them if someone didn't want to try the raw oysters.
 
My mom had the Crab Louis Salad. She said that it probably would have been better had the crab not been tempura-battered, but it was probably more of a personal preference thing. She said that the salad did fill her up and that the rest of the ingredients were really fresh. Our waiter was very attentive and made sure that we had everything that we needed.
 
The host that seated us was a bit of a downer as he seemed like we were making his job hard. There were two of us that came for lunch, and didn't have a seating preference, so I'm not sure how we made his job hard. He also kept talking to us in almost a whisper, and there was a fair amount of noise around us which made it difficult to hear him. I prefer the hosts/hostess to at least smile once during your brief time with them when they seat you. Our waiter made up for the host's bad attitude though. I just wish that I could remember our waiter's name. I only remember that he had blonde hair and was working in the bar area on 12/6.

Alligator nuggets were good, but small. The crawfish étouffée was good with lots of Crystal hot sauce. The Jambalaya was lackluster. I ordered a mojito and my mint was black... So we returned our drink. Rule of thumb: stick to fried foods here, because you can't mess that up.

Awesome place and thoroughly enjoyed dinner there. We used the free appetizer from yelp on the crab claw appetizer which was phenomenal. We also go the oysters as well as shrimp and grits. Everything came out timely and we went back twice!

Bought a living social coupon $10 for $20 in food
Bill came. .. server said we do not honor this promotion.  He gave me $6 off... he was lucky I had the $19 cash.... no tip because did not have any cash left! 
Food was amazing

Great service by Skylar! The charbroiled oysters were delicious! Also the bread pudding was really good! 

I had the shrimp poboy - it was a little dry but ok once you put mayo on it. 

BF had the burger which he inhaled!
Seafood pescatore was really great! Busy restaurant but the wait time is not long at all. Very nice!

Their oyster pasta has such a well-seasoned sauce, my friend was stealing my sauce during the whole meal. Also our fine nice waitress Cindy showed us truly adorable hospitality. I wish I was hungrier last night.

I'm a raw oyster guy but decided to try a half dozen raw and a half dozen grilled ....   WOW!!  Not only is Robe a master shucker and demonstrates his craft right at the bar, but he can tend bar and great guests all at the same time. Great typical open air environment across from court house makes for perfect people watching as well. Will be back to try a po' boy as they looked great.

The best meal I had on our first visit to NOLA. As authentic creole cooking you can find. We split the shrimp and grits, crab claws, dozen fresh oysters, and bread pudding. I will visit Royal House every time I am in New Orleans moving forward.

Had a pleasant dining experience at Royal House Oyster Bar and the service was attentive and friendly. 

For lunch, my dining partner and I ordered the following:
Oysters Duo (3 Rockefeller oysters + 3 Royal oysters) - The oysters were nicely baked to a golden color and were tasty. The Royal oyster's seafood stuffing was particularly delightful. 

Taste of New Orleans (cup of chicken and andouille gumbo + cup of crawfish étouffée + cup of jambalaya) - This entree contains lots of rice, so watch out if you are on a low-carb diet. Crawfish étouffée was creamy and full of flavor, and was the best out of the 3. Jambalaya was tasty and the rice was cooked just right. The gumbo was a bit thick and didn't have much flavor. 

Shrimp Po Boy - The shrimp was nice and crispy, and the bread was fresh and soft. Fries came with the po boy and they were crispy and good. 

Items I would recommend: Royal oysters, crawfish étouffée, shrimp po boy 
Other items I heard are good and would try: crab claws, charbroiled oysters

Chargrilled could have had more char. Rockefeller were filling and tasty....though no fennel so missing the traditional anise. Server/shucker was charming....,as many of the NOLA shuckers  are. Had a good time and left sated.
Really great. Crab claws were tremendous.  I could drink the sauce from a cup! Crawfish cake was to die for! Great ambiance and incredible staff.

Arrived at 2 pm to and had a 30 minute wait.  The hostess was extremely rude but no bother we walked over to the bar as that was self serve seating.  The bartender was very friendly and had some good recommendations.  Tried the bloody Mary which was waaay too salty, had to add beer to balance the taste.  The oysters and shrimp po boy was good but nothing mind blowing. OK french quarter spot but would not come back to again.

We came here after the French Quarter walking tour around 6pm on Christmas day. The hostess told us that there was a 25 min wait, but it was more like 40 min. 

We ordered crawfish cake, rib eye steak, and one dozen raw oysters. The rib eye was cooked as requested and it was very tasty. The oysters were delicious! The service was average. Since we sat behind the bar and the door was open, I felt cold while eating. Overall, I was happy with the food and service.

I tend to overlook the establishments that have staff standing outside with a plastic menu begging for tourist traffic, but honestly this is one of my go-to places when I'm looking for something easy and I know is good.  I've taken my father here for oysters when he was in town, my mom for lunch and frankly I had my first real date with my boyfriend here too! I tend to like the dinner service better because when the sun goes down and you get a window table to look out onto the Quarter, it can be quite romantic! The oysters are amazing-you MUST order the combination plate, which offers all three preparations of their oysters. The shrimp poboy is also quite good-TONS of shrimp! So many shrimps! They also offer some very delicious cocktails and their waitstaff has always been so accommodating and friendly. If you mention that you are local and show proper ID, your tab is discounted 15%.

We went to Royal House for dinner on Thursday night. The line was long and the wait was about 40 minutes. The atmosphere is alright, not very cozy. The chargrilled oysters were excellent! The food was pretty bad. I ordered jambalaya and it was not only the worst jambalaya I have ever had, but it was also cold. My fiancé had oysters pasta and that was not too bad, but a bit plain for me. The sauce was quite sour. Drinks were good. We ordered blood orange margarita and hurricane and both were good. I think there are certainly better places to eat at New Orleans.
Fantastic grilled oysters and delicious French onion soup. Do not go between 4:30 and 5:00. This was shift change and service was very slow.

I enjoyed the location and the appetizers and didn't like the service or the entrees. Regarding the location, it is a very cool place where you can watch people walking around. Appetizers are good and rich with flavor. I enjoyed chewing every bite.
Regarding the service, Josh was a really bad server. We didn't get refills until he brought us the bill. He sent us wrong dishes and didn't listen to any request clearly. He would interrupt and rush everyone of us. The host made me feel like I need to pay him money in order to be seated faster and was roaming around tables and staring at people.
Entrees were just okay. Shrimp and grits had something that looks like grits but definitely tastes nothing like it. Whoever tried shrimp and grits in Georgia will know exactly what I am talking about. Also shrimp creole was okay. Rice was overcooked and the sauce wasn't  tasty. I would come back here to try other dishes but will be very cautious about what I didn't like in my last experience.

I made sure to check the reviews on yelp before heading into Royal House, the reviews were good so I went in. I had oysters and crawfish cakes as an appetizer, both were great. As an entree I had a taste of New Orleans which is a sampler of two types of gumbo and jambalaya, the gumbo a were rich and tasty while the jambalaya was flavorful and had the perfect amount of spices. For desert I had the bread pudding which was amazing and tasted homemade.
The meal was a bit pricey but definitely worth it.

Came here on the recommendation of a local bartender from Bourbon house (which was our most favorite bartender and restaurant of them all) We asked Natasha where else we could go to receive similar quality of food and she sent us here. This review lost one star due to the demeanor of our waitress, who made us feel uncomfortable at times. Otherwise, the charbroiled were amazing! Just as we were told they would be! Just goes to show you, always trust the locals!

Went here after a recommendation from a local. There was a  crowd of people waiting out front and the place was tiny and packed. I figured it was worth trying if so many people were there. Plus a check in on Yelp got me a free app with a 2 entree purchase. 

Had about a 25 minute wait and were seated in a section where our waitress was already working short. I wasn't worried because another gentleman (who I assumed was the manager) helped her and made it so we never felt neglected. Between him and our server we were served very quickly. 

My friend tried the fried alligator and the fried shrimp platter. I got crab claws and the taste of New Orleans. My food was absolutely delicious. I could happily eat my food everyday and be happy. The étouffée was amazing and I could've drank the sauce the crab claws came with. 

I thought the prices were reasonable, the service was good even though it was busy, and the food was superb. Definitely worth visiting again.

We ordered a dozen char grilled oysters.  Butter Parmesan and a hint of lemon made this an amazing this. My boyfriend said that he could eat 100...then we tried Acme Oyster house. Acme had a little less cheese, but the oysters were much bigger.

I got the crab claw appetizer. Extremely disappointed. I wasn't expecting king crab, but these claws were smaller than my pinky nail! Sauce was good with the bread but they might as well left out the claws they were so tiny. 

Boyfriend got the shrimp po boy. That as well was smaller than the others he's had.

Great location. They told us to wait 50 min. to get a table, but that really wasn't a problem since there is so much to see around the French Quarter. We left for a bit and came back to our table in time. 
Ordered the shrimp creole and loved it. Also, free appetizer with Yelp!

Everything was fabulous!  I was afraid it was a tourist trap because of its location but it exceeded all expectations!  The service was exceptional.  Tina had us in stitches, making us laugh, meanwhile giving us candid advice about the menu.  She didn't steer us wrong.  Everything we ordered was delicious.  All five of us were swooning.  I honestly can't wait to go back!
We went with a group of six, were sat quickly during a busy lunch, and thoroughly enjoyed all of our food and drinks. Our server was great and we will def recommend to others.
Get the crab claws the garlic butter sauce they come in is amazing get extra bread to soak up the sauce.   The steamed dinners are great to share.

Oh my gosh! This place is amazing!!!! From everything to the atmosphere to the food! The chargrilled oysters are simply amazing. Best oysters I have ever had hands down. I will definitely visit this place when I come. Very very impressed.

Very average and a wasted meal while in NOLA...very disappointed in the prior reviews!  I have no idea how they have an avg 4 star rating!

Popeyes is a much better value, with exception of the fresh Oysters

Don't let the line fool you, it is a tourist trap
Amazing Crab App and Bloody Marry!! Everything was so wonderful! Great and friendly service!

Was in New Orleans for 4 days, came here for grilled oysters 4 days in a row. sat at the bar, at tables, by myself, with my friends and every time was a great experience. a must-visit for your visit to NOLA.

This place was a great find with awesome view of the French Quarter from the balcony seats we had and a tasty appetizer of char grilled oysters! Can't wait for the craw fish étouffée to come out! Yum!
got the crab claws, rockefeller oyster, shrimp 'n grits, and taste of new orleans. very yummy. the service was very good and very child friendly.

Service was great. Food was decent but not spectacular. Had the oyster po'boy. Oysters good, bread was hogie rolls no crunchy texture and too thick. French onion soup was delicious.  
Waitress fantastic. Enjoyed sitting with view of street , great people watching.

We went here instead of waiting in line at Acme Oyster based on fellow Yelpers' reviews. At 7pm on a Sunday night (the week of New Year's Eve) the place was already crowded and we waited for 30 minutes for a table. No worries, though: with the public drinking and the fantastic music of Tanya and Dorise across the street (check them out at tanyandorise.com) we were entertained long enough for time to fly by.

We had the sampler dish: a cup of gumbo, cup of jambalaya, and cup of crawfish etouffee. It was EXCELLENT. The hurricane was STRONG (as promised) and the oysters HUGE and fresh. 

Tip: get a salad when you see one on the menu. Chances are you may never get any vitamins and ruffage while you're in town between all the fried goodness and drinking.

This one is a tough call. The place overall is kind of a dump but the oysters were really delicious. Had a pretty standard/borderline crappy po' boy , but a pretty delicious bowl of french onion soup. When you check in with Yelp you get a free appetizer so we chose the crab claws, which were drowning in some muck that was difficult to discern.
Luckily there was no wait when we went in, or would have been really disappointed.
Good, attentive service though, with smiles and apologies all around.

The hushpuppies and fried gator were very good as was the cole slaw.  However, the fish po'boy and crawfish etouffee were just okay.  The hostess was very good.  The waiter was very friendly.  They forgot to give us silverware until we reminded them after our food was served, but anyone could make that mistake.

This is really not 4- or 5-star food.  Something funny is going on with the rankings of many places in the French Quarter.  Beware of the Yelp-reviews here.

Was walking around trying to find somewhere to eat and stumbled into this place.

First off, if you're lucky enough to have Skylar as your server... Be thankful! He's awesome! Very attentive and friendly, made the perfect amount of small talk with out being annoying, very hospitable.... I hope management sees this when it comes time to give that young man a raise. He made us out of towners feel at home!

Anyway onto the meal!!! 

The GF and I shared the grilled oysters... Delish!

She had a poboy and I had the burger! We loved them! We finished off the meal with the bread pudding for dessert which DID NOT disappoint! Get the bread pudding. I repeat, order the bread pudding!!!

The restaurant is staffed with friendly people, has a nice vibe to it, is very clean and has nice decor.

We used the yelp deal, had a couple drinks, app, meal and dessert and with tip we were out for like 60.00... Not bad! Definitely gonna come back next time we're in NOLA, or whichever restaurant Skylar's working cuz that dude rocked!

Cheers!

The food is salty and not very tasty I really don't know how it's got such a high review.
I think the best thing about it is its location and the duet who performed outside is pretty awesome, good entertainment while waiting to be seated (solid one hour wait)
Worst gumbo!

We had mixed reviews here as well. After reading reviews on Yelp, we walked in and dined at the bar. Drinks and service is always good at the bar. We ordered their crab claws app which was delish- came with plenty of bread for dipping and then ordered a steak sandwich to share. Gotta say that sandwich was more like beef jerky to us. Barely edible and soggy fries. Everything was extremely salty too.

Everything about the food in here was just OK! Nothing too exciting. When we walked up, the line was out the door so we were a little worried about the wait. It turned out that the wait was only 15 minutes and I think it ended up being even less than that. They turn tables around really quickly in here and it seems like they have a very efficient seating system set up with walkie talkies and things like that. I was happy about that. 

I ordered the crawfish cakes as an appetizer and my friend ordered the chargrilled oysters. The cc's were ok. The flavor was a little off. You get 2 crawfish cakes per order. We actually used the Yelp check in offer to pay for that so I had no complaints. The chargrilled oysters from what I heard were OK. They definitely were not as good as the ones at Katies! 

We finished our apps and we literally waited about 25 minutes before our meals came out. We were starving and the waitress never came back and acknowledged that the food was taking a long time. That was a minus on her end. The waitress gave us her recommendations for food and I went with her first choice, the shrimp tortellini. I was not impressed at all by the crunchy bread crumbs sprinkled all over the dish. The texture of the pasta was a little weird and mushy. The sauce wasn't very tasty. Overall it was ok. 

I tasted my friends BLT). It was pretty good considering that I don't like oysters but anything fried is alright with me! 

Overall i do not feel like I need to come back to this place but it wasn't too bad.
In town for the night and my wife and I were passing through. We stopped at the Royal House. Food and atmosphere was amazing and we would highly recommend it!!!
Two types of oysters. Both amazing. Raw and Rockafella. Can't decide which I liked more. The balcony seating is exactly what we wanted. Just what we needed to finish up the trip.

Very pleased, from the door staff, to our server Oscar. I had the seafood pescatore, which was phenomenal. My fiancee' had the crawfish ravioli, it was also great. The manager Lisa even greeted our table to make sure we were okay. Overall great experience. Don't forget the bread pudding!

This is New Orleans. This is every iconic movie scene about this sultry city. From the tiny tables set upon a delicate balcony leaning dangerously over cobblestoned streets to saxophone tones wafting up from the street corners, Royal House has captured the mood perfectly. 

White linen tables of raw, chargrilled, fried, every-which-way oysters, drowned in Louisiana hot sauce surrounded us, washed down with chilled martinis, the dirtier the better. Like any southern state, a sudden thunderstorm in the winter is a thing. Tables were moved indoors and balcony doors were left open to hear the pounding of the rain, smell the fresh humid air and enjoy the sounds of a late night opera busker out in the streets entertaining tourists. 

I could have lived here and they would have welcomed me. Southern hospitality. it exists.

Visited tonight w'/ 3 friends expecting a 4 star restaurant.  Usually I disregard the 1 star comments, since they're usually short and stupid.  But please read the well thought out reviews.  They're long, but spot on...

It took a little more time that I thought to get our drink order on this busy Saturday night, but I mentioned I desperately needed my water backer for my hurricane.  Well, one in our party got their soda, but that was it.  Diego, our waiter has 2 hands, yes?

About 10 minutes later, the cocktails came out, still no water.  Well, I would be considered the "heavy" drinker of this group as one is an almost "never" and the other 2 are just north of teetotalers.  I've had NOLA hurricanes before, and liked the buzz and the traditional lamp style glass.  The one I was served, had neither.  But it gets worse...

The 2 mint juleps generated blasé responses.  Even one said "it was like I remembered from Disneyland (non-alcohol)."  There were even dead brown/black mint leaves in one glass.  I've never had this drink, but according to the provided drink list, it should have had simple syrup, mint and booze.  The drink was reported as "not sweet at all, and very little booze."  I said they MUST HAVE put soda water in it, since I know ss is 50/50 sugar/water.  And to make matter even worse, my lightweight drink was $10 and I think the others were either $8 or $10 for single shots of liquor.  A quick google check on several recipes showed me how BAD their drinks are.

The food was much better fortunately, my "Taste of NO" was a solid 3-3.5 stars, but VERY light on the meat,  and my buddy's beef po boy and gumbo was at least that, although our server couldn't remember to bring a spoon for his soup.  The Mahi-mahi was "excellent" (and well portioned) but the fried catfish wasn't near as good as Oceana.  And all this time as the server cleared my cocktail glass, my empty water went unfilled until I asked.

Poor drinks and shoddy service, 1 star.  3.5 stars for the food. Overpriced for what the reputation is.  You can do better!

I ate here on New Year's Eve and it was by far the most memorable part of my trip to New Orleans!  Even though it was quite busy EVERYWHERE we were able to get a seat on the balcony.  There was a lovely duo (violin and guitar) playing cover tunes at the corner, so that made it even nicer.  Our server was very nice and made some great suggestions, but the only problem was that they ran out of crab.  Oh well.  Unfortunately, I've written this review too late to remember exactly what was ordered, but this restaurant is well deserving of the four-star rating.

Great view of the street and the upstairs balcony is really quaint and cosy. Our waiter was very helpful and kind. The staff have great personalities and the food was superb with portions just right. The oysters are amazing! Definitely brought out the tourist in me. Thanks for making our afternoon, Royal House!

It was OK. I got the Oysters Rockefeller and it was just kind of meh. I'm not a huge fan of oysters so i may be biased but, the spinach & cheese stuffing wasn't too great. We then tried fried alligator which tastes like chewy chicken. I enjoyed it! I got French Onion soup and it was luke-warm which wasn't too appealing. Besides that, it was great tasting. The service was excellent and the atmosphere was super warm and fun!

I have never had such a strange experience at a restaurant. The server was initially super friendly and then turned on me and became really rude. I thought he was joking at first but then realized he was not. And just to top it all off, he charged us for a dish we never ordered! When I asked him for his name, he lied to me about it. Well, thank you Marco D! It could've been a pleasant experience - we liked you at first...

Found this place on Yelp since I'm on a business trip. It's a nice and relaxing atmosphere. I sat at the oyster bar and ordered chargrilled oysters and shrimp and grits. Omg was the food amazing! The staff is unbelievably friendly and very attentive. It must be that southern hospitality! I would highly recommend this place.

Overall, negative experience. My tiny $10 cocktail was half ice, making it extremely watered down. My "blackened" (barely spiced at all) shrimp and jambalaya was served room temperature. The wait staff promised to "make another," but honestly, I think they just put it in the microwave for 40 seconds. It came back only slightly warmer an unevenly heated (trademark microwave). The wait staff did what they could, brought me another drink, gave a small discount on the bill. They can't be blamed for the idiots making the food and drink.

My wife and I were looking for a place to have dinner and found the Royal House.  My wife had the best of New Orleans plate and I had the ribeye.  Both were exceptional.  We had ordered hush puppies too which were good.  The most tell tale sign was I had a butter knife and cut my steak with ease.  

Service was exceptional and the food was Just as exceptional!  I highly recommended to anyone!  Vintage New Orleans!  Good stuff

Dining Date January 17, 2015.
Stopped in for a snack late afternoon. The crawfish cakes were outstanding, as were the fried alligator bites. Our waiter recommended the bread pudding with raisins and white chocolate sauce. The dessert was incredibly delicious! 

We sat outside on the balcony watching the crowd walk past on Royal St. Great atmosphere on a late Saturday afternoon. The service was a bit slow, otherwise would have given 5 stars.

Acme and Royal both came highly recommended, and the line much better at Royal; plus they were open later.  Even then, there was a 20 min wait at 10pm on a Sunday. 

- Oysters: huge; not bad with hot sauce, lemon, and horseradish 
- Oysters Rockefeller: too rich for me but good when hot 
- French onion soup: very cheesy, standard savory onion soup - good for a cold night  
- Crab: a whole snow crab, which was nicely peppered, but the texture was as if it was previously frozen. No accompaniments
- Hush puppies: not as much corn flavor as I expected. I liked that they were small for more surface area to volume ratio (ie more crispness outside), but it wasn't hot by the time we got it 
- Crab ravioli: cheese ravioli wasn't very special, but the crab and tomato sauce wasn't bad
- New Orleans trio: gumbo was ok, crawfish étouffée was good, dirty rice was pretty good 

Overall, we had expected to be more wow-ed especially given the hype. You would think that when we were freezing and starving everything would taste extra good, but things were pretty ordinary.

Service was very slow despite it starting to clear out now closing time, but they were very patient and friendly with us.

Raven is a wonderful server. She's very sweet and attentive. I had gator bites, shrimp and grits, and a glass of white. All were absolutely delicious. Doors were open and there was a gentleman playing sax out on the corner of the restaurant. Perfect late lunch!

While in New Orleans I wanted to get some good ole seafood, mainly oysters.  I didn't have a list beforehand so I went to my trusty Yelp app. We were famished after going to the Aquarium and walking the downtown area so were really looking forward to some good eats. I ordered a dozen raw oysters to share with the kiddo. It was his first time and he actually enjoyed it. I haven't tasted oysters so fresh in such a long time that I was literally on cloud 9. They had all the fixings and sauces...the way it should be served. In retrospect, we should have gotten 2 dozen :-D

The kid ordered the burger; we were both really impressed with the flavor and quality. The hamburger patty had a crust that lent to a crispy char on the outside and a perfectly medium juicy burger.  I ordered the seafood pasta in a garlic cream sauce. This dish actually is served with marinara but I figured it would overpower the fresh seafood. Loaded with clams, mussels, shrimp and crabmeat, I can't recall the last time I finished a pasta entree but I sure killed it! I wish we would have gotten dessert because banana's foster in New Orleans just sounds oh so right. Too bad we were too full and wanted to venture off Royal and find some pralines to bring home.
Food is out of this world. The second floor is gorgeous, looks like it use to be a nice parlor. The raw osyter bar is and during the day the restaurant is casual. but at night it can be dressy.

If you love oysters, this is a great place to go!  Raw or baked, you're in for a treat. I really enjoyed their baked oysters - it really hit the spot! If you're not an oyster enthusiast, fear not! Try their Taste of New Orleans - it includes chicken & andouille jambalaya, crawfish etouffee, and seafood gumbo. You basically get 3 dishes to try and it's a great way to share witth friends as well as sample the dishes!
Great food, great atmosphere and great service! The oysters and poyboys were amazing and the redfish was cooked to perfection. Our waitress cindy was a delight!

Amazing as usual!

We diverted our trip through New Orleans in order to return to Royal House.  We were not disappointed.  Las year, I tried their Chargrilled Oysters and found them to have amazing flavor.  This year I doubled-down and ordered 12 as an appetizer.  Yum!

Our entrees were both fabulous as well.

For dessert, we tried their Deconstructed Bananas Foster Cheesecake.  OMG - this was amazing!

I came here on a hunt for some crawfish etouffee and this pace delivered.

Not too far off the main drag on a nice afternoon I walked in sat at the bar. It was clean, open, with large slanted mirrors on the wall. The affable shucker/bartender took my order, and the food came out quickly and piping hot. The fried crawfish threw me off  a little but it was a very solid dish, large portions and well assembled. 

If I was in NOLA I would definitely check this place out for some seafood.

Every time I come to New Orleans I come here for the crab claws. Everything else on the menu we've had is good too but those are delicious. Another highly recommended app are the fried oyster tacos or broiled oysters. Fuck it. Get everything. Everything is good.
Great oyster bar. The red fish beignets are amazing! Jeffrey is a great oyster shucker behind the bar. His recommendations were fantastic and he made the visit a great experience!
This is a great place to experience Creole food. Everything was excellent and I simply lived the decor and atmosphere. An old building with floor-to-ceiling windows and ceiling fans.

Love it here.  I've had the raw oysters and the fried oyster linguine.  Bar service was preferable to table service although it was fun being on the balcony.  Our bartender / shucker was just good people though too so I know that made a difference.

Stopped in here for our first sitting of chargrilled oysters and they were great!  Ended up stopping in because the host hollered at us from across the street and couldn't resist.  Loved that!  We were then introduced to their crab claw and they did not disappoint.  Ended up back again the next night to have them a second time.  Bartenders were great also!  Def recommend.

New Orleans was basically just like the definition of delicious.  It was a couple of weeks ago so pardon me as I try and remember all that we ate.  

Spinach dip=delicious
I dont remember what my friends who eat meat/fish ate, but i DO remember that they loved it.  Also our waiter was absolutely marvelous--I forgot his name most unfortunately.

I ate the spinach salad.  I know what you're thinking #neworleansvegproblems but NO this spinach salad was off the hook.

I also had a really delicious/made me drunk drink. loves it.

Oh we waited like 15 minutes for the table.  One thing you should know about Marissa: this girl doesn't wait.  But I did. and it was that WELL worth the wait.

Thrilist rates New Orleans as the best city to eat in and this place is definitely why that statement is very true.

Checking in on yelp scores you a free app and we got the crab claws. Let me tell you about them crab claws. Abso-effing-loutly the best thing I have ever tried. It was mostly the sauce that had me wanting to lick the bowl, but the crab meat itself was super soft and tender. Plenty for two to share.

I also tried the gumbo, which was the main reason why I picked this place, however, it didn't compare to the crawfish etouffee. I've never had crawfish before and I'm glad I had it here for my first time. The crawfish come in two ways, fried and then in the sauté. Don't mix the fried ones in, (as the waitress advised!) because you're supposed to have a little crunch with this meal.

This was such a large meal for me, I had to take several breaks to finish it all and I wanted to finish it all because it was that good. I would def recommend coming to the Royal House for dinner sometime. It is on the pricey side, but I encourage you to splurge here. You won't be disappointed.

Staff is super friendly and will provide suggestions for you meal and will take your phone away from your dinner date if they give the phone more attention than they give to you!

Amazing restaurant. We came here our very first night in NOLA and it truly set the tone for an amazing vacation. Food was great, try the fried alligator if you haven't, you will not regret it. If you can try to sit outside upstairs. It was so nice to be able to listen to music from the band playing in the street while eating a great meal. The seating outside is a bit tight and the tables are slanted due to the way the balcony is built but overall still enjoyable. I will be returning on my next visit to NOLA

Overall this was great. 
We got seated right away which was great even though it was busy. 
Our waiter was great and friendly he even tried to convince my seafood hating wife to try the crab cakes.  Even though she didn't. 
The food was great my only complaint was how long we waited for our entrees. The starters came out quick but we waited almost another 30 minutes after that for the entrees.

My friends and I were on vacation for 4 days and we came back to this place 3x out of the 4 days. YOU NEED TO GO!

The staff is amazing. We had the pleasure of being waitered on by Andrew, Tina and Cindy. Cindy was our first waitress and we cannot say enough amazing things about this woman. She literally sat down and gave us the 411 on everything we needed to try and let me tell you, she was spot on about everything! Thank you so much and we are so grateful! 

Appetizer: Chargrilled Oysters...I am not an oyster person at all but the moment I tried this, I found a new respect for oysters. I craved it all day from the moment we were first introduced. It's cooked in butter and Parmesan cheese, simple but so amazing! 
You will regret not trying this and when you do try it, you'll regret not living in NOLA to access it! 



Entree: The Crawfish Étouffée. I got it each time I was there because I didn't know how to not order it, when I came in. The restaurant was very generous with the crawfish. The fact that they added fried crawfish on top of the dish, it made it even more flavorful. Don't stir it around. With Cindy's direction, you must eat everything together without stirring it so that your dried crawfish doesn't get soggy. 

I really can't rave enough about this place. Those were my favorite out of the menu but everything we tasted and ordered was delicious!

Just as long as you order the Crab Claws appetizer, you will not leave unhappy!  Not to say the rest of their food wasn't good but the Crab Claws was hands down, face down, food coma down, amazing!  It was the best thing we've eaten while in NOLA...or ever, well maybe top three!  And yes, you'll need more bread to wipe that bowl clean and they'll gladly give you more if you ask!  You WILL want to wipe the bowl clean.

#CrabClawsFitForRoyalty

I've been searching for a place for dinner in the French quarter throughout many hours, looking for prices and options. I had delicious salad, onion soup and rib eye, but the best part was a delicious desert of cheesecake with bananas. Everything was kinda pricy, but worths every penny. One of the best meals I ever had.

Seriously, if you are looking for a restaurant to get dinner and you can't make your mind... Stop wasting your time, this is an awesome option.

Stopped in here before out ghost tour. The staff was great. Ashley, our server was funny, attentive and fun!! 
We had a late lunch but decided since we would be out all night to get something to munch on 
We ordered a bunch of drinks  and some items to snack on.

Oysters on a half shell- nothing great about this. It was good, price was great. $13 for a dozen. Can't beat that 

Chargrilled oysters- Prob the best thing we ordered. Sweet, salty, savory and greasy goodness 

Seafood pescatore- very disappointed! Pasta was Sooo overcooked. Seafood was skimpy and the flavor just wasn't there. Everything was soggy and th flavor just didn't mesh well

Peel and eat shrimp- can't really go wrong with this, but could've used me seasoning and the serving was about 1/2lb for $15, not very pleased 

Don't know how this place got such great reviews, but just on food alone, it was poor. The ambience, staff and everything else was great.

The bananas foster cheesecake was the best thing we ate! We took 3 noncrustacean eaters and a vegetarian to a seafood spot where nearly everything including the sides are  cooked with shellfish and everyone managed to find something they liked.  I had the Cajun red fish which was pretty good but the bliss potatoes that accompanied it were amazing! I also enjoyed a half dozen oysters on the half shell for $8, which is a decent price. Overall the service was pretty good and the atmosphere was classic NOLA.

We went here for New Years eve and it was fantastic. Super packed, huge line outside yet the managed to hurry things a long so you aren't waiting too long. 
We had an amazing meal and drinks, our waitress was very nice and attentive. 
Everything we had was just wonderful. I would highly recommend it.
Amazing Crab Claw appetizer! The jambalaya was good and the shrimp and grits were only ok to me (but I'm not a grit eater). I would totally go back for the Crab Claws Appetizer though!

We arrived and were seated promptly outside on the balcony. Our server introduced herself as Meghan/Megan..(sp). She gave us suggestions as to what we should drink and the her favorite dishes to eat. She was not afraid to mention other restaurants for our comparison or as recommendations for food they do not offer. We had the crawfish étouffée as well as Crab Claws, which both were remarkably amazing!! This was our 2nd visit, and if you know New Orleans, then you know eating at the same place twice means something special.
Came with a larger group (6 people) and had a great experience.  To sum it up....Good Food, Great Service and a lively atmosphere.

Tina was our server! Outstanding service. We arrived at the hostess station and after some schmoozing got seated in 5 minutes rather than the original 30 minutes.  Checked into Yelp and got $10 off appetizer with purchase of 2 entrées. Thank you very much. Dozen oysters on a half shell $13. Never can have too much oysters. Spinach and artichoke dip, yummy. French onion soup was perfect and not too salty. I ordered oyster pasta. OMG, just the right amount of spiciness with 8 pieces of oysters. Excellent!  Love the food in New Orleans. The shrimp and  grits were awesome!!

Royal House is among a cluster of restaurants, and it's probably the one with the long line outside. Don't worry, the line moves really quickly. And I really, really hope you get Cindy, the world's coolest, hippest, most helpful, and friendly waitress I've ever met. She was so fabulous that I would return here even if the food was terrible, just for her.

Luckily the food is not terrible. When you check in on yelp, you get $10 off of an appetizer. My boyfriend and I got crab claws, which came with some garlic bread to run through the incredible buttery sauce. A passing waiter brought us some more bread as well, just because he saw us enjoying it. Such great service.

Will had the pecan crusted mahi mahi for his entree, and he loved it. He couldn't get over how good the potatoes were that came on the side. I had the seafood pescatore, which came with clams, mussels, shrimp and scallops of linguine. Cindy recommended that I swap out the marinara for the scampi sauce, and holy crap was she right. It was the best sauce ever. So good, and the pasta was loaded with seafood. Worth every cent.

Cindy talked us into ordering dessert as well. We split the bread pudding, which is loaded with raisins, a white Frangelico sauce, whipped cream, and a strawberry. It was so good.

I have so few things that I can say that are bad about Royal House. The food was all very tasty, you get a discount for your appetizer, and I had the best waitress ever. Everyone around me looked delighted to be there. The only thing was that people waiting in line kept holding the front door open, so it was pretty chilly in the restaurant, but that's not that big of a deal. 

If you're in town and looking for a good bite, come to Royal House and ask for Cindy. She'll take care of you.

Exceptional and truly amazing isn't even close to describing the food here at the Royal House. Due to my experience and how my taste buds reacted that night, the food is beyond fathomable. And it all begins with just the appetizer.

We started off with Grilled Oysters. Not just any grilled oysters, but these babies are smothered in butter with garlic and parmesan cheese. The world
literally ends when you put these babies in your mouth. Then there's the Gator Po Boi. If there was any unique sandwich for you to try here in New Orleans, it would be Gator. If you're not so adventurous... There's a McDonald's 5 blocks down the street,, I'm sure they serve chicken nuggets and french fries there... Last, but not the least the Crawfish Etoufee,  yummy crawfish goodness smothered all over a bed of rice. Yes it's my favorite and yes I am in food heaven whenever I eat this dish.

Their service is amazing, the host was super hospitable and our server was kick ass. This restaurant is a fine example of awesomeness.

Life is great when the glass is half full.

Weeeeeeeeeeee
Excellent oysters, but the crab claws are to die for!

Our first night in New Orleans. Ordered the Redfish and the Taste of New Orleans (gumbo, jambalaya, étouffée). Redfish was cooked to perfection. Also got Fudge Brownie for dessert. Brownie was incredible. Crispy, soft, gooey, choclatey, perfect. Service was friendly and timely.

New Orleans has A LOT of great food options for a small city (compared to NYC, for example). On our first day in NO, we happened upon Royal House, right before the lunch rush (we were still operating on NY time). We were able to walk right in, get a table, and order up some char-grilled oysters and oyster tacos (free, thanks to the Yelp Check-in) to start with. 

If you've not had char-grilled oysters before, this is a great place to try them! They're reminiscent of escargot; similar seasonings and garlic butter oil... make sure you have some bread to sop up the rest after eating the oyster itself! 

The Oyster Tacos were also a wonderfully pleasant appetizer. It hits all of your different taste buds creating a great umami experience!

For entrees we had the crawfish etouffee and the oyster po'boy. Great ways to start open our trip in NO! 

Delicious food + great friendly service = excellent dining experience. As good as it gets!
If you are going for charbroiled oysters?!? You found the right place...make sure to sit at the bar in front of Dono. He'll take great care of you.

After walking around French Quarter all day and stopping at multiple food places, I definitely think that Royal House is one of the best restaurants to get a taste of Louisiana cooking! Royal House doubles as both a restaurant and an oyster bar. In addition to having friends recommend this place, Royal House was also on one of the tourist maps I picked up at the airport. 

This is my second time eating oysters and I certainly was not disappointed. I ordered the half dozen; each oyster was extra meaty and fresh! It was also my second time trying alligator meat. The alligator is served as an appetizer with marinara sauce and tartar sauce. If you have never eaten alligator before, I would describe the taste and texture as a cross between a fish and chicken. As for entree, I chose the "Taste of New Orleans". For less than $20, you can taste three New Orleans staples-- jambalaya, gumbo, and étouffée. 

An extra plus is that the restaurant has amazing lighting for food photos!

Delicious food. Delicious drinks. I had my first piece of fried alligator here. Yum yum. The atmosphere is great and the staff is made up of some very charming individuals. You can also go out onto the balcony if the weather is nice. Perfect place in the french quarter.

This was the first restaurant we ate at when we arrived in NOLA. Omg was it amazing. My favorite was the red fish beignets, which we got for free since we checked in on yelp.  The redfish beignets were sweet and savory and you can taste the freshness of the fish. 
I've never tasted anything like it and was a dish to remember on this trip.

The service was quick and the people were friendly. Great fun atmosphere. 

It was so good I decided to come back for dinner on our last night and we usually venture off to new restaurants since we were only there for 5 days but it was just that good.

BLEH.  So disappointed considering the review status.  Maybe most people are swayed by location, ambiance, or that they were under the influence when writing their reviews. 
Atmosphere was fun considering we had a balcony seating, but if you want fresh, tasty, flavorful food, pric you will be unhappy here.  Cocktail selection is also uninspired-a bunch of overly sweet concoctions without imagination.   It is overpriced for what it is.  
We had the chargrilled oysters...fishy even though this is supposed to be an oyster bar.  Smothered in butter and cheese, they still weren't really edible.  Plus, it took a good 20-30 minutes for them to come out.  
Next the tomato mozzarella salad-tomatoes lacked any flavor, cheese nothing to write home about, and balsamic just average.  
Entree was Taste of New Orleans. Could just call it cafeteria plate. Bad flavor except for the jambalaya. Rest of cafeteria style bowls again not edible. So many other restaurants rated below this one would be a better bet.

Stopped in at the Royal House for lunch recently. We were able to walk in without a wait. Bottom line...get the standard chargrilled oysters. Some of the best chargrilled oysters we have had along the gulf coast.

The staff was very gracious and friendly. Fun atmosphere and people watching if you get a spot streetside. 

We weren't big fans of their Roast Beef Po'Boy. Good, but falls short of some others we've had in the city.

Came here for dinner on our last night in Nola ... Their oysters were delicious! Very fresh. Megan our server was very personable. She made us feel welcomed and wasn't quick to pick up our signed receipt after dinner, as I have experienced at many other restaurants locally. We tried the red fish beignets (powdered sugar sprinkled on for is odd to me, but they were surprisingly good), shrimp and grits (it wasn't bad but not the best I've had) and the jambalaya with blacked shrimp (best jambalaya I've had so far). Overall an enjoyable meal and excellent atmosphere.

Nice place the ambience was good, but the food was extremely greasy for me. Got a free appetizer from check in on yelp promo, it was a nice touch but the redfish beignets that we ordered were swimming in oil, literally....over all was overpriced for what we tried ,and too simple.
Great Place!!! Oysters were delicious, Customer Service was Great! Great For Dinning Dates!

Fried oysters & alligator!!!!!!!!! Need i say more. If i could have this once a week, im sure id be a happier person. The drinks were also very delicious.
The staff is super friendly. They also offer balcony seating so on those warm days, its the perfect way to enjoy your meal.
This is a typical taste of New Orleans, authentic dishes and seafood selection. My favorite is The spinach Dip. I think it's the best dip I have ever tried.

Got the fried alligator here for the Yelp deal. Dang it! Should have gotten the crawfish cakes. I know it's the special thing to get alligator. But trust me, it tastes just like chicken.

The strengths of this place are the oysters. Get the chargrilled. Oysters in butter with parmesan cheese?! Can't go wrong.

We also ordered the Taste of New Oreans- my favorite was the Etouffe! I had never had it before, but it's like a creamy seafood soup. I would get that again as an individual item.

Thank you Royal House for providing us with a great first meal at NOLA!

They have an incredible side order of perfectly fried oysters that is not on the menu for $6.00  perfect size, lite and crunchy!!  :) sit at the bar for super friendly oyster shuckers and ice cold beer...

We we're recommended to come here by brandy.  It was one of the best meals in a beautiful city.   To top it off we received beyond excellent attention from our server Tina, wonderful southern hospitality and charm.   She made our experience even more wonderful.  Best meal and service on our 9 day stay.!  Try the sautéed crab claw appetizer. ...Devine

Checked in and received a free appetizer...score!! They took our party of 22 with a minimal wait and our waiter was friendly. Food overall was pretty good, but the jambalaya was the stand out. If you go to NOLA it's worth a visit!

Stopped in for late dinner. Service for attentive. I had oyster Poboy and my friend had shrimp Poboy. Mine was good but I expected better from the reviews. Lots of bread 1 tomato and some lettuce along with fries . My friend said it was the worst sandwich he had. He said the shrimp were cold and must of been microwaved. He did not like the sandwich at all.  My friend would have given a 1 but I give it 3 stars based on my sandwich and atmosphere.
Best crab claws on the planet! Bloody Mary was amazing too! Can't wait to go back next time I'm in NOLA. Service was also spot on

My friend and I went for Sunday brunch and thankfully, it wasn't too packed! There was fast service and we were seated almost immediately. We ordered the taste of New Orleans and the crab claws appetizer, which was plenty of food for the both of us. They were all very flavorful and tasty and didn't take too long for them to come out. I particularly enjoyed using the garlic bread to dip in the crawfish étouffée. I would definitely recommend this place to anyone looking to try some New Orleans cuisine.

The food at the Royal House was remarkably disappointing. It's alright but you've probably tasted better versions of everything somewhere else. The crab claws were tasty but over salty. The crawfish étouffée was good. Everything else was bland and too heavy. The fried food was not good. Not crispy.

-crab claws delicious
-chargrilled oysters good
-raw oyster good
-red fish beignet no good
service good!
One of the best places in the French Quarter! Cannot go wrong with any dish that you get. The service was fantastic and don't forget to try the bloody mary!
Redfish Beignets--amazingly good. Crawfish Ravioli even better. This place is outstanding!

Burgers are big enough for two here.  We grabbed it to go before our ghost tour which met kitty corner to the restaurant along with a couple of drinks.  The burger took awhile to come out but we'd left plenty of time to grab it before the tour so it wasn't a drama and the burger was so worth it.  Jucy and tasty and HUGE when we saw the size of the container we thought it might have some surprise sides but the burger was just that large.

Oh my god I love my Arnold Palmers but man, they are good here!!!!

Gonna try the blackened chicken sandwich and because I'm in nawlins, the fried alligator appetizer!!! Kinda nervous but it's supposed to be tasty!

Food was oh kay. Nothing to rave about. Actually felt like I was eating in a hotel restaurant. Average food. Would not go back. Rather spend my money on beignets

Fantastic place.  Food was very good, but the staff was wonderful even at Mardi Gras!  Not sure who trained them, but they were all dancing to the music, attentive to the customers, and very quick to react when a small issue arose.   Will definitely return when I am next in NOLA.

We were lucky enough to just walk in and get a table late January. The blackened red fish and shrimp jambalaya was amazing. We ordered the chargrilled oysters but the kitchen forgot them. We were ok with it until I saw these great reviews and wished I tried them there :) oh well... The waitress was very nice too.

I really wanted to like this place. Friendly service. Great location, good for people watching. Ask to sit upstairs. I imagine the 2 person balcony tables are nice when it's warm out. We ordered the chargrilled oysters, crab claws and fried alligator. All were tasty but here is my problem. WAY too salty! I love butter more than a lot of things in life but even these dishes were too much for me. It also would have been better if the Parmesan cheese on the oysters was fresh and not the powdered kind. Sigh, was really hoping this place wouldn't disappoint. 

PS - Hurricane cocktail... Not my jam.
PPS - Alligator really does taste like chicken.

We stumbled upon this place because our evening tour started from here and we needed to use the restroom. The plates looked so good so we decided to come back and it was a great decision!

My boyfriend and I had a great meal, and everything from the red beans and rice to the artichoke dip was great. Hands down they have the best crab claws! Will definitely come back on our next trip!!

This is the first time I have written a review, I was that disappointed in this restaurant. After waiting in line for 1 1/2 hours (we were told it would be 35 minutes), we were also told we were next 50 minutes into our wait.  Apparently this was  "because the kitchen is having problems", we were then escorted upstairs with 16 other people all to be sat at the exact same time in an empty room.  We ordered a salad to start which was delivered to the wrong table.  This table got the salad for free, we ended up having to pay for our salad.  They offered to take it from table and give it to us, but I don't want food that has been at a strangers table.  We then had our entrees delivered: peel and eat shrimp and chicken and sausage jambalaya.  The peel and eat were over cooked and not deveined, we also had to request cocktail sauce.  The jambalaya only had sausage and no chicken and was served with two pieces of dry white bread.  The positives are that the waiter was fine and attentive in refilling our drinks.  I would not go back

I was almost at a 5 star review here!

Duo oysters were amazing. I ordered the seafood pasta with oysters, mussels, scallop, and shrimp, and my husband ordered the shrimp po boy. Both were good, but the po boy desperately needed a sauce and the fries were terrible. Otherwise, the ambiance, service, and flavor are great! Would definitely stop here again if in NOLA. Prices seemed reasonable for this part of town. 

PS: if the restaurant owner sees this, you should seriously consider deveining your shrimp!!!!!! Both my husband and I cringed at the sight of the dirt vein.

The ambiance is great with a great long bar
 The level of food was average we had the jambalaya and etoufee great location for New Orleans unfortunately very touristy however the service was great.

OMG so good! I was like four hurricanes in a really had a good dining experience here. I got the shrimp and grits and they were delicious. I checked in on Yelp and got a free appetizer too. I'm sure that was good as well ;-)
I dream about those grilled oysters. Definitely in the top few of best things I've ever eaten.

Their crawfish etouffee and chargrilled oysters are the star here. 

The etouffee is KILLER. The gravy has a great kick. My Taste of New Orleans dish left out the fried crawfish tails promised on a whole crawfish etouffee dish. If you're thinking about getting the Taste of New Orleans, just get the crawfish etouffee on it's own, as the gumbo had an odd aftertaste and my jambalaya was bland and had almost no seafood or chicken in it. Also, the bread they give you with your dish is depressingly soggy. 

The chargrilled oysters are also really tasty. The cheese surprisingly balanced well with the brininess of the oysters. Careful, the oysters are ridiculously hot when they come out. Kind of wish I found out through the waiter instead of burning my finger trying to pick up the oyster.

Get the fried alligator if you want to say you've eaten alligator. It really does taste like expensive popcorn chicken.

Overall, Royal House is a decent option if you're looking to eat close to Bourbon Street. I'm sure there are better options for each of their menu items elsewhere, but you can't beat being right in the middle of the action at French Quarters and their hours (open until 11pm or midnight)! The wait is also must shorter than Acme Oyster House.
We loved it. Based on the appetizers as we had already had lots to eat before we arrived. Service was great. Ambiance wonderful.
Decent, impromptu choice and wasn't disappointed in the crab fingers or shrimp and grits

Short visit, but was great. Stopped in for late night bite. Oyster Po Boy was fantastic, overflowing with spicy, breaded yumminess. Great bread, crusty, chewy and substantial. Very good service. Asked for best red wine in glass, got 786 Cab and it sucked (wine snob). Otherwise, great Nola foodie experience.

We only ordered 3 items here as it was our 2nd dinner of the night. The gumbo -- I was on a mission to try every gumbo in the city -- was disappointing, very watery and no flavor at all. was made with a light roux instead of a darker one.

The fried alligator was grisly, but if you managed to find a piece that wasn't grisly, it was okay. Nothing really special.

The redfish beignets though was our favorite. Really delicious drizzled in some sort of a honey sauce. I would just come in to eat these!

Service is good, our waitress was very friendly and didn't seem to mind that we were only ordering a few things and drinking water.

The crab claws were absolutely delicious! Do you know what's even better than delicious? FREE & DELICIOUS! Make sure you check into Yelp to get your free appetizer!

I can't say that I remember much about the rest of the meal (I blame it on day drinking) other than it was yummy and filling. Our server was so patient and informative with my never ending menu questions. Go go go get those crab claws!

This place is the best. My boyfriend and I loved this place so much that we ate dinner here twice on our vacation. Service is great. Balcony seating preferred! I still dream about their crab claw appetizer.
I had the crawfish étouffée last night and it was a game changer! Then we had Irish coffees to go- perfection:)
Service was excellent, so we're the shrimp and grits and hush puppies. My boyfriend had the Taste of New Orleans and wasnt happy with the gumbo, but he's not writing the review, I am. :)

OMG...wow...amazing...not sure what other descriptions I can give this place. The oyster tacos were yummy. The crab claws...I think I heard my bad angel sing. ;-) We had the Taste of New Orleans, Shrimp and Grits, and the Brownie a la Mode. Wow! Just wow!! The mixed drinks were also amazing.
