We had a couple of "naughty" martinis and muddled-berry mixed drinks before retiring to ice water. You have to make a stop at Royal House the next time you are in NOLA! And don't forget to check in with Yelp! When I went, they offered a free appetizer with your entree purchase.

My favorite place for oysters until they served me a dozen with mud on some of the oysters. I was doing two dozen a day here, but I guess they are just too busy for quality control. Love the people, server was very kind, but can't trust the oysters anymore.
Came here for dinner on a Friday night around 6 p.m. We were seated right away. The drinks were good, the staff was so friendly and the food was yummy. Portions and prices were fair.

The grilled oysters are delicious. The bread they give you is great for all the buttery goodness from the oysters. I don't care for raw oysters but a lot of patrons were ordering them. If you sit by the bar you can watch them shuck the oysters. The second floor is also nice for dinning.

Incredibly authentic Cajun/Creole food. I was very happy to discover they're top notch, quality food since so much of the food on the French Quarter is average at best. The crab claws appetizer was divine! I had the shrimp and grits and my mother had the fried oysters, both of which were decadent. Absolutely would recommend. However, the place is sort of cramped and loud.

Second time here. First time the service was amazing!! This time out waitress looked a bit flustered. The raw oysters are huge and couldn't be more perfect. The shrimp and grits were lacking. Not cheesy enough and the shrimp were tiny and over cooked. Had a few apps here that were awesome! The redfish beignet and crab claws were both very unique and delicious.
One of our favorite restaurants in NOLA! Had some great drinks and the wait staff was wonderful! The pecan crusted mahi was delicious! Cannot wait to get back here!

Eh,  this place was ok. To be honest I expected a little more from a fancy new orleans restaurant especially for the prices. We went here Valentines night after all the parades ended. First I started off with chargrilled oysters.  They were amazing.  Very good! Then we ordered fried alligator as our appetizer. It was overcooked and very hard to chew. Would not order that again.  Then for my entree I got shrimp tortellini.  Not good. I couldn't even eat it. It was terrible.  If you go for the oysters its good,  go somewhere else for food.
The food was wonderful! The French onion soup was delicious. Our server was friendly and accommodating to our large group! We didn't have to wait and were seated right away.

Dessert calling!- a late night rendezvous with a cinnamon graham cracker between two creamy cheesecake scoops smothered with a brown sugary sauce known as the "Banana Foster Cheesecake".  Divine and sinfully delicious- No better place to have this decadent dessert then where it actually originated in N'awlins!!!! And the Royal House knows just how to make it right!    RIcardo from the Omni Royal hotel highly recommended this place and actually walked us over on our first night in NOLA.   With a few polite words exchanged, he was able to get us seated immediately and avoid the long line of people waiting outside to get in!  Chatter and laughter permeated the room.  This place was lively and so welcoming!- just simply a fun evening out in a friendly restaurant that knows how to make visitors feel right at home!!!

We got the spinich dip and crab claws for appetizers, which were tasty! The claws had a great sauce. Spinich dip perfect for vegetarians! I had the royal spinich salad which was great! My husband had the three course sampler "a taste of new orleans" which he was not a big fan of since 2 of the 3 dishes were bland. The crawfish ettofue was good.

Ahhh..

We stumbled upon this place after having one of the worst meals at Cafe Amelie. 

We ordered taste of new orleans, oysters, fried alligator and jambalaya.

It was pretty good! Their service was one of the best services I've gotten in New Orleans.

Do yourself a favor. if you need a place to grab some food, go there. It's pretty decent.
Be sure to try the seafood "a la Tina" , a delicious variation on the seafood pescatore; subbing scampi for the marinara.
On a business trip with my co worker. Had a wonderful margarita. Waitress was nice and funny.

We went here for dinner, were told that there was a 25 minute wait and then a few minutes later we were asked to wait outside in the rain, so as not to get in the way.  After we were finally seated and ordered it took 45 minutes for our entree to be served. It was not worth the wait.  The shrimp on the shrimp and grits were not "jumbo" but were small tasteless shrimp. The grits were alright. The tiny side of slaw was good.  The red fish was tasty, but was a small half piece of fish which came with a few potatoes and dried out green beans.  This was a very disappointing meal.  We will not return.

The oyster pasta is divine.  The sauce is perfection and combined with the fried oysters was perfection. However, the charbroiled oysters were just ok..a tad salty and there's better places out there for this dish.  The most disappointing was the Taste of New Orleans.  Being a native of this area, I found the gumbo was overly smoky and kind of bland.  The jambalaya was nothing to write home about and the étouffée lacked depth.  That being said, I would come back in a heart beat just for the oyster pasta.

The best place we visited in NOLA, Royal House really rounded off our experience and made it go from good to great. My friend and I shared the chargrilled oysters, hush puppies, and crawfish ettouffee. The oysters were doused in buttery goodness in all the right ways. The crawfish were fried, which I hadn't tried before, but didn't taste heavy, and complimented the ettouffee perfectly. If you're a fan of Bloody Marys, Royal House makes a nice and spicy one. 

We also got to sit on their cute balcony. It's a little slanted and tends to shake a bit but the ambiance is worth it. 

We found that service can be frustratingly inconsistent in many of the French Quarter joints, but our server was a perfect 10. He also gave great recommendations for places to go listen to jazz music. Go here for dinner and get here early - there is usually a line.

We have been to Royal House three times - mostly because they normally have a small wait due to ample seating.  The balcony is nice for the view, but it's small and tilted.  They have barkers at the front door which is annoying but typical in the quarter. Their "signature" Hurricanes are terrible compared to the real thing but the Bloody Mary's are alright though not spicy compared to others in the city.  Fish and chips are enough to split, hush puppies are good (when they are warm), and oysters are large.  They hurry you through which is why the wait is short.  The best thing about RH is the discount for locals.

Would get 5 stars if I hadn't gone back the next night.  The closer mardi gras and the tourists swarmed the quality began to slip.  Red beans and rice (comes with friend chicken and andouille sausage) amazing! You don't feel like you're stuffing your face with carbs as the meat ratio is hefty and the red beans and rice help to soak up the alcohol.  Bartender, waiter, shuckers.... all friendly and remembered us from the night before.  The red fish beignets were very good,  more like a beignet battered fish stick but again they didn't skimp on the meat.  It is a heavier/ large portioned appetizer.  The seafood ravioli was good but red beans and rice are better.  The charbroiled oysters, can't go wrong there.  I would avoid the stuffed mushroom caps at all cost.  Just bland.

I came here for an early dinner around 5:15pm on Sunday and was seated immediately. Luckily for us, we got the double seats in the balcony on the most beautiful evening. There was a violinist playing music along Royal Street which made the experience much more romantic. I felt like I was in Europe. 

For appetizers we ordered the crab claws and half a dozen of chargrilled oysters. We ordered the redfish and crawfish étouffée as entrees. Note that you get $10 off an appetizer when you purchase two entrees and check-in on Yelp! Yay, I love discounts! 

The chargrilled oysters was absolutely delicious. I love that despite all the butter and cheese you can still taste the oyster itself unlike other places that serve chargrilled oysters. The oysters were plump and not overly salty. The crab claws was another winner! The sauce was absolute bliss. We kept swooping up that sauce with the bread. Yummaayy...

The redfish entree was recommended by our waiter and it was definitely different and somewhat of a "healthy" alternative or break from all that shellfish. It was very tasty with bold cajun flavors. Unfortunately it tastes almost exactly like something I made at home before so I wasn't exactly blown away by its uniqueness. Nonetheless it was delicious. The sauce of the crawfish étouffée was pretty good but much lighter in seafood taste than I had expected. I wasn't crazy about the crawfish being fried like that because not only were the crawfish small enough, but the batter was quite plain therefore those little nuggets just taste like your typical fried stuff. It could've have been bits of chicken for all I know.

Overall, this is definitely one of the better restaurants I've been to in New Orleans and I do recommend it.

We just left this joint without eating. We were seated and were very excited to order the seafood pot since it was the main reason why we came.  We ordered the seafood pot and were told they were out of lobster and crab!  Dinner time had just started and they were out already or they didn't buy enough for today's service.  We were so disappointed that we got up and left!

Second time here. Great drinks, service and appetizers. Jambalaya with blackened shrimp was not great, but shrimp and grits were very good.
Worth a try, but not for your best Cajun food experience in NOLA.

Food was good-I had Blackened Redfish, and we also ordered Shrimp Tortellini, Blackened Shrimp Jambalaya, and Chicken Andouille Sausage.

Everyone's food was cold other than the Shrimp Tortellini.  Flavor was very good!

Highlight of the meal was the Bananas Foster Cheesecake.  Heaven on a plate;)

I ordered Oysters, they were really really small, you will need about 30 of them to kinda fill you. And my wife ordered the boiled snow crab, not actually boiled! They grill it! And we are still sitting here while I'm writing this review.

I came here last night for dinner with my boyfriend and his sister.  She swore by this place and their oysters and she was right! BEST oysters I had during my week stay in NOLA.  First time I had char grilled oysters they were amazing.  I got the grilled mahi mahi which was cooked to perfection.  I got the cucumber mojito which was refreshing.  Our waitress was awesome too.  Definitely will be coming back here!

Visited Tuesday 3/10 for dinner.  Food and dinner was delicious.  I had a spring refresher cocktail which was out of this world great.  I ate the craw fish ravioli and my husband had the oyster pasta.  They have upstairs dining which I would have loved to do but we unfortunately  picked the three rainiest days in March to visit. :(  Next time we go, I will definitely take advantage of that.

Stopped in by default do to we were tired. The scenery is beautiful and the wait staff was super friendly and welcoming. Sorry to hear others didn't have the same experience.

The food came out without a long wait. The Po-Boy was just a Po-Boy good bit nothing to write about. It is in the heart of the French Quarter and the Po-Boy should be better.

The restaurant 8/10. Po-Boy 5/10.

Pretty solid food all around.  Everyone at my table loved their meal.  Family from out of town got a good sense of Nola with the food and atmosphere. Right off bourbon but still far enough away not to have to deal with drunkies wandering.  I will be back

My husband and I had the spinach dip and the pecan crusted mahi mahi which is amazing! We also had the bananas foster cheesecake which was unlike any other I've ever had! Phenomenal must have! We had a sweet hostess and waitress. We went Friday night at about 7pm and had no wait for the two of us. We would def come back!

Three things: Delicous food, good service and cheap oysters!

Half dozen oysters on the half shell was $7. They brought me 9 and 7 of them were HUGE. A full dozen is only $13. You just can't go wrong!

Go to Royal House while you're exploring the French Quarter and stuff your face with oysters!
Great for lunch or late-night dinners. Loved the chargrilled oysters and crab finger appetizer!

Very cool location on Royal Street in the heart of the French Quarter.  Came in around 9:30 pm and were seated promptly, however, we were seated between the kitchen and the bathroom with about one foot of space for servers and patrons to move past, which resulted in people literally stepping on us.  Fortunately we were re-seated.  We ordered the crab claws and spinach dip to start.  Crab claws were excellent, great flavor.  Spinach dip was, well, pretty much the same spinach dip you could get anywhere.  For entrees we got the crawfish etoufee (sp?) and shrimp and grits.  Neither dishes blew me away with flavor and were in fact a bit too spicy for me and I like spicy food.  The reason for the three stars is 1. The food wasn't as good as it could have been imo.  The flavor of both entrees could have been kicked up a notch and 2. It took over an hour to get our food AND appetizers, which for the simplicity of the dishes is too long.

If you like oysters, then take a pit stop at the Royal House! They have oysters five ways...
- Raw
- Chargrilled
- Maque Choux
- Rockefeller
- Royale

My wife and I are purist and stuck with Raw. How can you go wrong with $13 for a dozen... yes, $13! We stopped in on a late afternoon after a morning of walking the city. We went in to have a few drinks and a snack. Three dozen later, we walked out happy and full of oysters.

Worth a stop if you want lunch or a casual dinner and if you love oysters.

Everyone in our group really enjoyed brunch here.  We tried everything from the sampler, various oysters, jambalaya, etc. and it was all great.  The service was awesome.  Wish they had food like this in AZ.

We have been to Royal House three times - mostly because they normally have a small wait due to ample seating.  The balcony is nice for the view, but it's small and tilted.  They have barkers at the front door which is annoying but typical in the quarter. Their "signature" Hurricanes are terrible compared to the real thing but the Bloody Mary's are alright though not spicy compared to others in the city.  Fish and chips are enough to split, hush puppies are good (when they are warm), and oysters are large.  They hurry you through which is why the wait is short.  The best thing about RH is the discount for locals.  An easily fixable maintenance issue needs to be addressed by RH.  All three times we have been there, one of the toilets in the ladies room has been out of order, overflowing or running.  Just generally broken.  Wouldn't think that it's a random problem because I have never seen it in working order.  Last time, annoyed at the wait, I fixed it myself.  Ridiculous, I know, but they must know about this problem and refuse to spend the money to resolve it.

We went here after one of the Phantom Quarter tours about ghosts and vampires, or some such thing (they had really good tour guides, we did 2 tours with them). I was trashed drunk with my mom and sisters because New Orleans. We got a table on the balcony with a couple of women we met on the street (yup, drunk... we were very drunk). I ate what I recall as a REALLY GOOD crab cake, had some more drinks, that were on top of many other drinks from earlier in the day/night.

Anyway, we drunkenly people watched from the balcony for 10 minutes or 3 hours, who can tell time in New Orleans? My over 60 mother was so crazy drunk she was swinging around light posts on our walk back to our hotel. 

This seems to have become more of a review about just how awesome New Orleans is, rather than just Royal House, but I don't care. 

10/10 would get drunk at Royal House in New Orleans again.

IF YOU DON'T ORDER THE BANANA FOSTER THEN I WILL UNFRIEND YOU! Every place I been, Banana foster comes with ice cream scoops but this places uses 2 scoops of cheese cake! So it doesn't melt plus it tasted a lot better! The Redfish Harris best in French Quarter. Avoid the oyster royale it has no taste. For the price I wasn't expecting much for late night meal but I was wrong, GOOD service and meal.

Best mix of ambiance & Cajun we've had in NOLA!  Sitting outside on the balcony both of us enjoyed the Taste of New Orleans - étouffée, jambalaya & gumbo.  We agreed étouffée is our favorite, followed by gumbo.  The server says that's most people's preferences.

Great service, and great barbecue oysters.  I give the BBQ oysters a 5...but our oyster po boy was average, bringing the score down.  How've we, we didn't take the waiters recommendation on which po boy to order, so who knows what the rating would be if we had.

No need to go back to this place as it was just ok. The service was good and food was alright. There style of Cajon is just sprinkle it on everything. Long line to get in as we were leaving so maybe we just ordered the wrong thing:  Alaskan crab legs,spinach salad, and oysters. We also both had a glass of wine - $168,00

I order fries here a lot because ... Well they are damn delicious. I truthfully don't know enough about the food to write a review but, I do know the fries are one of a kind!! 

Atleast try the fries if you stop here! :)

The oysters here are really good. A lot of reviews said the oysters are the highlight of this place, and I agree! The chargrilled ones I had were big, juicy, with just the right amount of parmesan and garlic!

Unfortunately I only put three stars because I didn't particularly enjoy my entrée, shrimp and grits. I suppose I might be a bit biased because I don't particularly enjoy grits in the first place, but  looking at other reviews made me want to try it because it seemed good. Honestly I should have known better and just have ordered something else. I was kind of disappointed because I guess I was just expecting more. The shrimp and grits wasn't horrible, but not mind blowing either. It was just alright. If anything, lots of pepper really improved the taste for me.

In addition, the hostess seated us right next to the kitchen doors. There was a weird light but pungent aroma around my table the entire time, and unfortunately I wasn't sure if it was coming from the kitchen or perhaps the body odor of some other sweaty customer nearby. I didn't really enjoy that. I wished we got seated on the balcony or those nice window side tables. I definitely should have requested another table, but at lunch time the restaurant was quite busy. Oh well.

I'd come here again just for oysters.

It is seriously so hard to find bad food in NOLA. Every meal we ate was so delicious and Royal House was no exception. On a Saturday night, we came here a bit early to miss the dinner rush. Royal House is right smack in the middle of the French Quarter, if you are exploring, you will run into it at some point. 

Our waiter was great. He made recommendations, chatted with us and was just so friendly! However, everyone in NOLA made us feel like we were at home. Southern Hospitality is real life here. We decided to start with the crab claw appetizer. It was out of this world! the sauce on the claws was stupid good. When we had finished the crab, our waiter brought us french bread so that we could eat all of the sauce! YUM YUM! For my entree, I choose the taste of New Orleans, which came with gumbo, jambalaya and crawfish etouffee.  Even though they all sound pretty similar, it was great to see and taste the differences in each dish. My favorite was the jambalaya. I would order this as my main on my next visit! 

I think out meal came to around $50, which is pretty good at a nice sit down restaurant right in the heart of the French Quarter. I would eat here again.
Food was great- ordered the Oysters Maque Chioux, gumbo, and hush puppies. Service was incredibly slow. Took 20 minutes to get our drinks and it was only 4:00 and not packed. Nice atmosphere though!

Oh gosh, best meal I had in New Orleans. Their baked oysters were the most amazing oysters I've ever had. It was also much more affordable than other places on Bourbon Street with much higher quality. Pretty busy restaurant but we got seated right away.

The food here was quite delicious. I actually went here on two separate occasions on my trip here. 
The oysters lived up to the hype that they get. The chargrilled ones to be exact. They were packed with so much flavor!
The seafood pasta was delicious from all the freshness to the right amount of spice.
I definitely recommend this place to anyone

You have to order the baked oysters and the fried gator appetizers!! Soooo good! I had the shrimp creole which was absolutely delicious and made room for desert. The waiters were very attentive and fun. If you're visiting NOLA, put this place on your list. The wait is long but the food makes up for it.

Amazing food, atmosphere and staff! Our waiter, Joseph, was awesome! Additionally, they offer a 25% discount for military! 

If you visit New Orleans,  EAT HERE!!!

Wife and I looked for one last stop for some oysters in New Orleans before we left and stumbled upon this place.  Was quickly seated at the bar and had the greatest bartender, Jeffery.  He was very gracious.  We had 2 dozen raw and 1 dozen grilled (must try!!!).  It was awesome and one of the best bloody Mary's in the area.  Will definitely go back if we are ever in New Orleans again!

Chef Steven Young is my favorite. I had a large group that I was herding around New Orleans for a work Summit, and we had a scavenger hunt end at the Royal House, despite the fact that they don't take reservations. That was a big, uncomfortable risk for me, but I had called a week or so before and gotten the down-low on what time to come so that we could have our whole group seated without waiting. I had second thoughts about this, but ended up calling the day before and talking to Chef Steve...he was so flexible and our group got in on the second floor and had a fantastic meal. He came out and introduced himself, and chatted for a bit. I will *definitely* be back - it was basically a magical experience :). 
The staff is on it, the food was great, it happened to rain which I actually loved with the doors open (but it was warm), and then a second line walked by on the street below...le sigh. New Orleans perfection for our out-of-towners!
Casual dining, good food, reasonable prices and great service. No complaints here...worth a visit.

Ryan and Jesse are outstanding bartenders. They answered all of our questions and recommended great food from the menu.
The shrimp creole was to die for. You must visit for great authentic NOLA fare.

This place was so bad I made this my first review. Had high hopes for this place due to all the good reviews, needless to say we came out super disappointed. 

Service: We were seated without reservations right away on a weekday night. Super slow service, we spent about 2.5 hours here, mostly waiting. 

Food: Both the hubby & I ordered the fried shrimp & fish platters & we waited 1 hour...for fried dishes!!! Both came out lukewarm to cold. Garlic mashed potatoes that came out with it were flavorless & just not good, not even a hint of salt. Shrimp was not even close to crispy & cold. Hubby said fish was just ok. We got a measly piece of French bread & the French fries were mushy and again, cold. The only good thing was the side dish of corn maque choux, but again barely lukewarm. 

Drinks: Our server, Diego said they're known for their Hurricanes, ordered one & nope, every Hurricane I've had in my life tasted better than that one. At $10 each, just stuck with water after that. 

The one star is for our server Diego who noticed the hubby's discontent with the food & sent the manager over to make things better. Manager insisted on giving us free dessert. Opted for the bananas foster cheesecake which WAS really good & the high point of our meal, but once again we waited about 40 minutes for it, we were literally about to walk out because we thought they had forgotten about it. 

Overall: Just bad. Super slow service, bad food & bad drinks. Wouldn't even consider giving them a second chance, too many other good options around the French Quarter for far cheaper prices.
Cindy our waitress was amazing. Great atmosphere, awesome oysters and crab and  drinks. Nothing more to say. I will come back!

All you need to know is:

Char-grilled Oysters and Oysters Royale  = FOODGASM! 

I can't imagine eating oysters anywhere else. Actually, there's no need to. 

Drinks are decent and served in generous portions. Our server was funny and sassy. 

Missing one star because service was sorta slow...but I found that to be true in most places in New Orleans. What can I say? I'm an impatient Yank.

This place is OK if you're going to stay in the French Quarter of NOLA.  If you see a line outside, make sure you first go inside and add your name to the list...then wait in that outside line till they call your name.  Also don't forget to check in on Yelp to receive $10 off any appetizer. 

Service was quick and we had a very nice and honest waitress.  She told us what dishes to stay away from that night, the French Onion Soup is the best I've had.  The other mainstream dishes like Jambalaya were just ok.  

If you're looking for a decent sit down place in the area where you can get traditional food, this is the place.  The soup was amazing but nothing else really stood out.

Highly overrated, huge disappointment.   First, there was a long line and the wait was 25 mins.  However, wait for the food was another 30 mins.   Our server was very disinterested in her job.  Refills had to be requested each time.  Server told us that the upstairs kitchen was closed so our food was prepared by the downstairs kitchen and hence the wait.  No apologies from her, and we only knew of this issue when we asked her to check on our food.  We dined at 9pm and all of us thought that all the dishes were dry.  Dried up dishes include Oysters Rockefeller, Shrimp and grits (not enough sauce), and seafood Pescatore.  The gumbo was plain.  Fried alligator and crawfish étouffée were decent.   My sister in law thought that Pappadeaux was actually better.  Definitely only a solid 3 stars, not more than that.

We waited in line and ended up just leaving before we ever made it inside. We stood in line for 40 minutes and people behind us on the list got to go in front of us. They let friends, locals, and whoever slipped them bills in first. I didn't make it inside and I won't go back.

The food has mixed reviews, but service is awful.

I used to love this place but the food quality has went down dramatically. . The royal oysters with seafood topping was pretty dam good but I love crawfish etouffe and they changed how they do it.. the fry the tails now which makes them soggy.. thete was hardly any rice and not many tails.. mostly gravy.. very disappointing. . Oh well many choices in NOLA

Best French onion soup I've ever had. Perfect location, great fresh food, classic atmosphere. The food is amazing, but honestly the best part was Cindy, our server. Authentic, charming, knowledgeable and incredibly helpful. I was in a sad hungover place when I walked in and she wiped it all away in the first two minutes. So happy that we came here!
Amazing food! Grilled oysters amazing! The hurricane was really good to draft beer was a good price

The stars are for the balcony seating. That was a nice experience, people watching from above. The food was not so great. That could be because we did not order seafood? We got a stuffed mushroom appetizer and a roast beef po boy. The mushrooms were so dried and salty. The stuffing was separated from the mushroom, that's how dry it was! The bread for the po boy was substandard. It was super stale. The sauce on the roast beef tasted like salt water. Would not be back.

I like the way people are in New Orleans. When my girlfriend and I asked the host at Royal House if we could sit at one of the tables on the second floor balcony, he didn't consult a seating chart. He just walked out onto the street and looked up at the balcony, and then said that they did have an opening. 

If you go to Royal House, you have to eat on the second floor balcony if it is available. The balcony itself tilts slightly downward, and our table happened to be tilted at a more dramatic angle. We ended up having to lean our glasses against the rail so they wouldn't slide. It certainly made lunch more exciting. The view from the balcony was awesome, and the music was even better. A street band was performing on Royal Street, and it was like we had VIP seats to the performance. The previous day, we had gone to a "jazz brunch" at Mr B's Bistro where we only ended up hearing a few songs. This was way better! We got to listen to a full performance and see all of the people dancing on the street to the music. 

Royal House has a check-in deal on Yelp, so that if you check in, you get a free appetizer (up to $10) with the purchase of two entrees. We ordered the spinach dip with chips for our appetizer. For our main course, we had the crispy fried fish platter and the Taste of New Orleans platter which included gumbo, crawfish etouffee, and jambalaya. 

The spinach dip was really tasty, and did I mention it was free? The Taste of New Orleans platter had just the right amount of each dish. The star of the dish was the etouffee. It was rich, hearty, and had some good spice to it. The gumbo was really flavorful, and the jambalaya was just okay. The crispy fried fish was light and crispy, and the fish tasted really fresh. The flavor was really elevated by adding some Louisiana hot sauce to the fish. 

Our service was excellent. I already talked about the awesome host, and our server was just as good. She was friendly and had a great sense of humor. 

We really enjoyed our lunch at Royal House and would highly recommend it to anyone exploring the French Quarter.

Being from California, I had a list of local foods I wanted to try.  Here we had charbroiled oysters, redfish begniets, alligator poboy and fried oyster poboy.  Yum!  Found out I like oysters!  
Nice corner location, helpful serving staff, good prices(yelp coupon paid for appetizer oysters).  Great lunch stop before partaking of the liquid refreshments offered in the area.

Honestly, meh. I had the pound of shrimp with "Cajun spice" ...didn't taste anything but pepper. Friends had the oysters which were meh, gumbo which was pretty good, and the chicken sandwich which was good but nothing to remember. Service was slow, but maybe because it was a Saturday.

Usually a line outside and am wondering why? Maybe we just ordered the wrong food. In the words of Biggie Smalls I think I need to give it, "one more chance".

We ate here our first night in New Orleans and it did not disappoint! The chargrilled oysters were AMAZING, as was the crawfish étouffée. We also ordered the shrimp creole- good, a cup of gumbo- more smoky than I expected, and jambalaya- tasty. Definitely worth checking out for the oysters and étouffée alone!
Not impressed. Flavorless, cold, jambalaya served on a crack dish. Not even the andouille had a spice. Service was decent, but the food at least for me was a huge let down.

We had a late dinner and were sat right away. Our appetizer's sauce was new to me. Nice to try but won't order again. Loved crawfish ravioli! Service  was excellant. Ambiance is everything I wanted my first meal in New Orleans to be. So happy...Good food, great friends in the best city!

My girlfriend and I were exploring the French Quarter looking for our next meal (cause it had been fifteen minutes and everyone knows you can't go more than twenty minutes in New Orleans without consuming something). We were trying to find a way to snag a spot on a French Quarter balcony without dropping a minimum of $30 on a plate. And then we came across Royal House. 

With no reservations and no line we were immediately escorted (upon request) to the upper balcony that overlooks the street. We ordered oysters that were drenched in butter and cheese so those were obviously fabulous (cause you can't screw up something drenched in butter and cheese). We also got two cocktails, one which was deliciously refreshing and one that was WAY too strong - it was a mint julep but it tasted like straight bourbon.

Overall you can't beat the location and view for the price.

Meh, to sum it up. I won't be back. Just not up to NOLA standards. Stick w/ Brennan"s or Mr. B's down the street. This was just very average food quality. Soulless Shrimp & Grits. Boring stuffed mushrooms and the shrimp poboy was on day old bread. Meh.

Such a great restaurant! The food is good , the ambiance is great, and the staff is super friendly. They also have a fun list of cocktails! 
We had the red fish beignets, which were amazing.  Followed by a tasty blackened shrimp jambalaya, and one of the best desserts ever ... Banana foster cheesecake... A must have!

Went in for a beer and some appetizers.  Jeffrey the bar tender suggested the crab claws. They were fantastic . We ordered the fried oyster tacos wi c h were extremely good . If you have never had oysters like my girlfriend Jeffery is the guy to see. He prepares them three ways so you can have the full experience.  Definitely check this place out
Food was ok, not worth $95.00 for three people.  Service was terrible, waiters and waitress hide behind curtain drinking Starbucks coffee.  Table next to us had to actually flag waiter down.

Wait was minimal, staff was attentive and courteous a street performer was singing outside and she was great and to top it all of the food was delicious. My wife and will return and suggest this restaurant.

Not impressed with this establishment. The host that seated us looked more like a parking lot attendant. The restaurant was not busy and when we requested not to be seated next to the bathrooms he rolled his eyes. No one came to ask us what we wanted to drink for 15 minutes so we left.

A large group of us stopped in here for dinner.

Some of the food was great, while other parts were mediocre.

I do highly recommend the Crab Claws. I had to fight off my friends with a fork as they wanted in on the yummiest of dishes at the table. They each got one bite, but animal defensive instincts kicked in when everybody wanted more. "My food! Back!"

We were a table of 8-10 and the staff took care of us. There were a few lulls in looking for our waitress, but I know that a table that large is difficult and we left content.

Great seafood place! Husband and I dropped by for dinner tonight and were not disappointed. Shrimp po boy was amazing! The batter of the shrimp was delicious and perfectly seasoned. My husband had the blackened shrimp jambalaya and enjoyed it. The spinach dip was gooey and piping hot, and our waiter honored the yelp! Deal with no issue. Our dinner was $30, which is less than we payed for takeout earlier for lunch. I recommend this place!

Omg I love this place. I have had some great food here in NOLA but this is the only place I've comeback to over and over again!! The everything is great here and they have great prices. The burgers, po boys, and drinks!! and don't leave without trying the bread pudding!!!! Best food for the money and period!!!!

You could never go wrong here at the Royal house they have the best oysters tacos they are crunchy and flavorful their chicken andouille sausage gumbo is not to salty it's just perfect! My husband had the crawfish étouffée and he was not to impressed because besides it being crawfish season they served fried crawfish that was too small. The view where we sat was kick ass and the drinks was refreshing.

On our trip to NOLA we stopped in here twice, and everything was delicious! Our favorites were the BLT-O, Crawfish Étouffée, Crab Claws, and Pineapple Mojito. Our waitress Cindy was very good, knowledgable and entertaining. Definitely will come back again!

Cool vibe.

Waitress Cassandra was awesome and helped us pick out some delicious butter Parmesan oysters.  

Poboy was good, taste is NO was good, and experience was definitely worth the wait during a busy Saturday night.

Review from a local - Awful service. Sub-par food. 
Pros: Charbroiled oysters and crab claws were very good. Nice atmosphere on a pretty day.
Cons: Mahi mahi, catfish and shrimp...crap. They don't know how to make an old fashion (drink). There was hair on my husband's plate. They play pop music- this ruins the atmosphere! Again, horrible service....completely not worth the price of crap food. 
MUCH better food and service to be found elsewhere!

I came here with some friends for my last night in New Orleans and ordered a dozen chargrilled oysters to split with a friend as an appetizer and then the Crawfish Etoufee as an entree. The oysters were very well seasoned and very fresh. Afterall, we were in NOLA. The Crawfish Etoufee was good but since it was deep fried, I could barely tell it was crawfish. For all I knew, it could have been any type of seafood. However, I am a big fan of etoufee so I was excited to be able to have it with crawfish. My friend got the snowcrabs which were from how she described it, excellent but extremely spicy. Ambience was wonderful and the waiting staff were very attentive. We had a later dinner but the restaurant was still packed. With its proximity to Bourbon Street, it is a great place for a nice meal. It is a bit pricier than some of the other places in that area.
A lovely breakfast! Donald was our favorite server throughout our New Orleans visit. Kind, considerate and very attentive. We would come back just for Donald but the food was great too!

If you can, sit on the balcony. That just adds to the fun of the meal. The food was good, southern cooking. I had the Gumbo and Jambalaya with shrimp and my wife had the Crawfish Etouffe. Both meals were very good. The service was also very good. Overall a good experience and worth trying.

Eating vegetarian in New Orleans isn't easy. I was on my way to get a vegetarian poboy sandwich at another place, but it turns out half the restaurants in NO are closed Mon/Tues, so I stopped by this place on my way back to the hotel. I don't think they had any veg entrees, but I got a bunch of sides, and they were all delish. The corn maque choux was a little oily, but after I skimmed that off it was a lovely blend of creamy and savory and sweet from the corn. The slaw was a little over-dressed, but the flavor of the dressing was great and I loved the apples and pecans in it. The hushpuppies were crispy but not overcooked and had great flavor, including an unexpected kick from some chunks of hot pepper. It just goes to show that you don't have to be a vegetarian chef to understand how to make veg dishes luscious and tasty.

We arrived at Royal House without a reservation, which led to a wait. Word to those wanting in, make a reservation. We chose to be seated on the balcony, which we knew would be a bit skewed. The balcony here leans out quite a bit. FYI.

We're a bit torn as to what to write here. The service was attentive and friendly, but we ordered an appetizer that never arrived. That's odd. My wife had the shrimp tortellini and I have the blackened shrimp jambalaya. I found the jambalaya tasty, but the shrimp were a tad on the scarce side. My wife thought her dish was tasty, but thought she could order it anywhere and get the same thing. I guess we were expecting more.

So, while nothing was bad - food, atmosphere or service - I think we are perhaps spoiled by the many other great places we've eaten in New Orleans. I also recommend that you not do what we did: we went to a oyster house and didn't eat oysters (that was the appetizer we never got).

I made it a point to return here on my second visit to New Orleans. The first time I popped in on a whim, hungry after some drinking. This time we arrived late on a flight on Easter, so didn't have a dinner reservation. 

I really like that they don't do reservations here (on a busy weekend or peak hours there might be a little bit of a wait, though. But it's nice that you can just show up and you WILL be seated, if you're willing to wait)

Last time I had the redfish beignets and they were so good that before this return trip I went on Google and searched "redfish beignets" to see if I could remember where I had eaten them. Sure enough, not too many places serve them (not sure if you can get them anywhere else)

Also decided to get oysters, this being an oyster bar. Both the grilled ones and raw shucked oysters were excellent -- perhaps the best I've had anywhere.

Drink menu could be a little better, but not horrible. All in all, great place to eat, in a good location.
Awesome food - started with oysters - great ambiance sitting on the upper level - fish and chips were awesome - so was the crawfish ...

I had the cajun Redfish, spinach dip, and a Bloody Mary. While I wish the redfish was a bit more flavorful, everything was delicious. The entire staff was amazing - we started off at the bar but our waitress was great as well.

I would go again.

We decided to pop in here for a nice dinner on Easter weekend for my sisters birthday while we were visitng New Orleans. We had a group of 6 so we had to wait a little bit to be seated, which we didn't mind. We all ordered charbroiled oysters which were good but had better at Acme Oyster. 

2 of us ordered the Taste of New Orleans, one ordered steak, and 3 people ordered some sort of pasta (ravioli, linguine, etc.). We waited an obscene amount of time for our food to come out. By the time our food came out, there was only one table left with people still eating in the dining room. Our server was never around to keep us updated. 

Once the food came out, the steak dish was cold. My friend didn't eat it. The 2 Taste of New Orleans were  lukewarm and not quite as tasty as other bites we have had around the city. The 3 pasta dishes were the only items that anyone enjoyed. 

The pasta and the charbroiled oysters gives this place 2 stars. But the horrible customer service and cold food is why this place isn't rated higher. We won't be coming back here. There are too many better restaurants in New Orleans to give them another chance.
The waitress was the best. So welcoming. Food was pretty good. Had my 1st oyster po boy here & really enjoyed it.

Back again with the daily for oysters in the upstairs area - great food - a little loud today but the festival is underway and it's Friday so that's to be expected being near the festival and fun - yum and fun
Oysters. Yum. A dozen for $13. Shucked perfectly and served with all the accouterments. Great snack while walking around the quarter.

waiting to be seated is an experience in itself..as the groups of tours walk by, musicians playing on the corner, drunk people mix with the classy folks, local hipsters and local homeless make friends with the tourists -  we watch and are seated on the second floor balcony. we enjoyed cocktails and a platter of shrimp and chips aka fries..we tried three types of oysters....Rockefeller, Royale and on the half shell. Half shell oysters are not for the weak - they were very fresh! skip the shrimp and fries - they tasted like they were "frozen-fresh" something I picked up from Safeway and heated up in the oven. Rockefeller and Royale Oysters were perfect. I could have eaten more.

Waited long time for every dish, waitress guys are not nice. We ordered 5 kinds of noodles and he said 4 of them were sold out! It's 12:00 pm, lunch time just began! Anyway we just traveled here and won't come 4ever.

Enjoyed the crawfish cakes and alligator bites on the balcony while enjoying a live jazz band performing in the street for the French Quarter Festival. The food was delicious and the service was great. We'll be coming back next time we visit the Big Easy!

Fried alligator was ok.  Not a lot of flavor, just the fried flavor.  Hushpuppies were decent.  Charbroiled oysters.  Fantastic!  In general, charbroiled oysters are good.  This place was great because the oysters were really fresh.  I also ordered some jambalaya.  Not the best I have ever had.

I feel horrible! I put my review on another restaurant! Here goes!!!! I love this place!

Wow!!!!! The crab claws all the way to the French onion soup are to die for!!!!!!!!!!! I am eating around and this place is a must stop by!!! You have to ask for Tina, the whole staff is amazing!!! Do they have happy hour??!? No this WHOLE place is a happy hour!!!.

Tina was AMAZING and answered every question!

As an out-of-town-er, I couldn't have imagined a better place to eat everything I wanted (minus fried chicken-- but you can see my yelp review on NOLA's best fried chicken) from New Orleans with such perfection. I mean, well of course, they have a set of items called "Taste of New Orleans"-- a must try! 

Biggest highlight-- oysters! Try them all, but chargrilled was my favorite! :))).

This was probably my favorite restaurant (besides oysters) in NOLA. I would really recommend it! And ask to sit on the balcony if it's open (it closes after rain). 

The crab claw appetizer was really good. A little salty, but super good after you squeeze a ton of lemon. 

The taste of New Orleans was also awesome! It comes with gumbo, jambalaya, and crawfish étouffée. My favorite was the étouffée, followed by the jambalaya. The gumbo was just okay. But I would order this again because I like having all the variety when I'm eating. 

The oyster duo comes with 3 oysters Rockefeller (cheese and spinach topping) and 3 oysters royale (seafood cheese topping). I felt like there was wayyyy too much topping, so you can't taste the oyster much. But the topping is bomb, so you can easily fix that by scraping some off to your liking and eating it seperatly.

This place has potential, they had flashes of brilliance and some things that could be improved upon.

The crab claw I started off with had an amazing sauce that was as good as anywhere, the downside was the actual crab claws. They were super tiny and were really hard to eat, think of a tiny portion of meat on a sharp claw. I think lump crab meat would have been a better choice for this dish. I did try the fried alligator, this isn't a knock on them but I think gator taste like watered down chicken.

My entree was the redfish, they way the waitress described it was not how it came out. It was a tougher fish to chew on and a little dry, they may have over cooked it. For my first time having it I expected a lot better. The seasoning of the fish was good though. I did sample the crawfish ravioli which was very good which everyone else agreed with.. Tried a the shrimp n grits from another plate, that was okay overall. 

The banana foster cheesecake for desert was delicious, I would recommend trying that for sure. Overall it was hit an miss for me, people around me did enjoy this place.
Stop in and have Shanieka bring you a Hummingbird before you have the crab claw appetizer.  Save room for the bananas foster cheesecake.  Deconstructed and delectable.
I must say Royal Oyster House has my attention to come back... The grilled oyster are cooked to perfection. Dragos you have a contender....

French Onion soup is amazing! This alone earns 4 stars. The rest of the food was ok- gumbo, chicken sandwich, BLTO... Service was ok but kinda slow. However, everyone in our group agreed they have the best French Onion soup ever.

I want to give this place a probationary 2.95 stars because overall it was "OK," but not excellent.  I had the crawfish ravioli and my wife had the crawfish etouffée. Both dishes had good flavor, the wine was good, the service was good, but both of our entrées came out room temperature. I'm beginning to wonder if this is the norm for the quarter...are entrées served on the cool side or room temperature instead of as a hot dish?  No, I think not.  If the kitchen and the service staff work together then this is an easy fix.  I'll give this place a second try next time I'm in town as except for the cool food temps everything else was good.  Once they are off probation I would give them a solid 3.5 stars and say they are worth a visit.
Good atmosphere, great oysters and the crawfish cakes were so delicious! The jambalaya was average but the service was good.

Kind of unimpressed by this place. We were gonna go with some local suggestions for poboys, but they were all closed. So, I went with a yelp suggestion. I kind of thought the food was a bit overpriced and just okay. It seemed kind of touristy to me, so maybe the food was priced accordingly. I would not go back to this place if I'm ever in NOLA again. Ask a local for recommendations when you're in New Orleans!

Delicious oysters, great service, and terrific drinks!  We had a nice table on the balcony and it was so pleasant - we got to experience some live music on bourbon st while we ate.  Would def go back!

I wanted to get a taste of new Orleans during my recent trip to the French Quarter. I did exactly that with their dish, Taste of New Orleans! 3 bowls of jumbalaya, gumbo, and a crawfish dish. All 3 were excellent and was only $17. The crawfish ravioli was ordered and was simply delicious! Would definitely recommend.

The appetizers and oyster a were out of this world! 

The chargrilled oysters w garlic Parmesan sauce were the best thing there - we ordered a half dozen and then immediately ordered another dozen! And the crab appetizer with the crab claws was so, so good. Yelp check in discount for appetizers, and we got the $12 appetizer and it was discounted by $10. Great deal! 

We then got the trio sampler, shrimp and grits and crawfish ravioli as entrees, and honestly, while they were all decently tasty (though they were out of the étouffée), the oysters and crab really dwarfed the entrees. 

They were out of a lot because it was a busy weekend and we went on a Sunday night, so if there's something you're really wanting make sure they have it! 

Next time we are in New Orleans we'll be back for the oysters and appetizers!

Delicious crab claws in garlic butter sauce! We ordered food to go from here tonight as my 1 year old was not up to going out. The sauce on those crab claws is amazing! I would go back for this dish again and again. It comes with some garlic bread to dip. I can't begin to tell you how good this sauce is. Dessert was also amazing. I would definitely eat here/order food to go again

This is a great spot for dinner in the French Quarter. We ate on the balcony instead of in the restaurant and that was definitely the right choice!

Because yelp gives you a free appetizer with the purchase of 2 entrées (they were flexible about what is considered an "appetizer"!), we started with the Oyster Duo. I don't normally like oysters but both types were delicious! Our entrées were essentially chosen by our waitress since she felt very strongly about some of the options (shrimp and grits = NOT good, seafood pescatore with the lemon butter cream sauce = GREAT). We got the pescatore with cream sauce and the Taste of New Orleans. The pescatore was awesome! The taste of New Orleans was also good but he étouffée part of it was definitely better than the gumbo and jambalaya! (Just like our waitress said it would be!) We were able to finish everything - no leftovers! 

But by far the best part about this place was the atmosphere. While we were eating on the balcony, we heard Tanya and Derise play the violin and guitar on the streets. My goodness the music was amazing - we actually loved it so much that we went and bought a CD after. The live music really made the restaurant experience.

It wasn't perfect - the balcony was definitely too tilted, and while our waitress was helpful she was somewhat slow - but to me it was the perfect way to experience the wonderful Nawlins charm!

I was not impressed with Royal House, despite all the great reviews provided. We had no problem getting a table for 3 during a Saturday lunch time. The server did not provide us with any bread. The appetizers (crawfish cake and oyster beignets) took 35 minutes to arrive. I had the blackened red fish which was mildly seasoned but not the best. Maybe because I have been to 6 other excellent restaurants already and this was definitely not on par with the rest. Would likely not go there again given that there are other better restaurants around.

Our waiter was very entertaining. It was a great experience. If you like oysters, then you have to order the Oyster Royale. It's absolutely amazing!!! I still dream about it. I also ordered the crawfish etouffee. It was really good. It was my first time having it, but I thought it was great. Everyone at my table really enjoyed their food. There were 6 of us and the waiter was able to keep up with our constant alcohol refills.

This place was actually recommended to me by one of the valet guys at the Omni Royal Orleans.  I say good call!  I have been kinda disappointed with some of the recommendations that were given to us.  

This was great, it had that New Orleans feel that I have been wanting.  The service in this city so far too has been lacking.  

But, our waitress was Raven.  She was helpful and attentive.  I ordered the roast beef po boy.  It did not disappoint.  It was soaked in the gravy with the debris.  The meat was delicious!  Also, the French bread roll was perfect.

I would definitely come back, especially since it is right across the street from the Omni.

Maybe I caught my server on an off day, because my experience doesn't appear to be the norm. Dining alone, I was seated at the bar. No menu was given to me, nor was I asked if I wanted anything to drink. The waiter standing across from me at the bar didn't greet me or acknowledge my presence at all. Due to reading other yelp reviews, I already knew I wanted the french onion soup, so when I realized he wasn't going to acknowledge me after 10 minutes of waiting awkwardly I finally waved to catch his attention and asked to order the soup. He then finally asked if I needed a drink, and I inquired what non-alcoholic options were offered. Instead of answering my question he turned away to speak to someone else and ignored me. A minute later he passed me the drink menu (which had no non-alcoholic drinks on it) but he never checked back on me to see what I wanted. This was the only menu I received the whole time I was there. I wanted to leave because I felt so awkward being totally ignored by someone who was standing 6 inches away. I regretted that I had already ordered the soup otherwise I would have walked out. The cook who dropped off my food actually asked me if I needed anything else and seemed surprised when I said "yes, a soda please". He returned promptly with it. I felt jealous as I watched the couple sitting two seats away from me laughing and chatting with their server who gave them menus, took their orders and looked them in the eyes. 

I left after the soup, wishing I had gone somewhere else where I didn't feel like a ghost. 

The soup was good though, which is why this place got any stars from me at all.

Amazing. You will get well taken care of, and the food is incredible.  Hope your server is Chanda.  She is so helpful, knowledgeable, and friendly as hell. What a great place!!  The drinks are as good as the food.  Do yourself a favor and order the French onion soup.

4.5 stars. Oysters oysters oysters, they have those huge gulf oysters and they were in season so had to come here. There are many other places to get oysters and honestly all these gulf oysters taste the same. But this is a classy places with white linen tablecloths and excellent service. With those oysters you MUST get the crab claws. It's their sauce that makes this dish, I could eat that sauce the whole day, a decadent , rich and creamy sensation for the state buds. We had a group of twelve and we had to repeatedly order this dish throughout our time there. So oysters and crab claws are a must. The oysters beignet was also very interesting. All the food there is great, we had several other things and were all very good. They had an awesome Bloody Mary as well. Will defiantly be coming back here on my next NOLA trip.
I stipped in for lunch and had their fried shrimp platter. You get a lot of shrimp and a lot of french fries. The shrimp were good and so was the cocktail sauce. I didn't eat very many fries.

EAT AT THE ROYAL HOUSE!!

I can't imagine passing up an opportunity to dine here when in NOLA. 

Such a cute restaurant, the have awesome service and delicious food! 

I definitely recommend the étouffée!! Also, the grilled oysters are amazing! 

Make sure this is a part of your visit!

I don't like seafood, and I never was a fan of oysters, though I have tried time and time again. However, this is the first place I have ever been that I genuinely liked the oysters. Ordered a plate of oysters with my boyfriend, we ended up ordering two more plates of oysters that night. Two days later we came back and ordered 3 more plates of the oysters, they were just that good. The crawfish etouffee was to die for. Will definietly eating here next time I visit. AMAZING!

dinner tonight. Redfish blackened. 
Orange remoulade sauce is a must for it. 
Shrimp and gator. Decent. 
The potatoes were pretty good. 
They were out of the crawfish cakes, bummer. 
Sat at the bar with Lawrence as he shucked them oysters!! Solid cat. He'd been working hard all jazz fest weekend and still late Sunday was congenial and really made our visit. 
The food itself was fine, nothing memorable. Nothing especially unique about the spot either, but it'll do the trick. Mind the slippery floors.

High marks for being open late and having really cool balcony seating. The drinks are stiff and served with a smile. Waitstaff are super friendly! The food has been hit or miss and it's feels like a bit of a struggle to get an honest/good recommendation from the probably too extensive of a menu.

We went here after hearing about the oysters and balcony seating. The looked busy but the host quickly seated us on the balcony like we requested. 

We ordered oysters Rockefeller, oysters royal, and fried crocodile. The crocodile was really chewy so i wouldn't order it again, but the oysters were great! They are right across the street from where oysters Rockefeller were invented, but here you didn't need to dress fancy or pay for overpriced food. I really liked the oysters Rockefeller and would order more of those than the royal but I am glad I tried both. They also have a great Hurricane. I feel like it is bigger than other places drinks which is good considering it was $10.

Service was friendly but not very prompt, but since it was busy and the balcony was cramped I will give them a break.

This was a truly enjoyable dinner with my colleagues.  We were seated on the 2nd floor which was nice in the French Quarter.  The appetizer was delicious (can't remember the name but it was garlic butter and crab legs).  My entree was pretty delicious as well.

George was our server and his recommendations were on point. We order the alligator and the shrimp po boys. So good! But the crab claw appetizer was to die for. I wish I had a bag to take home the sauce in and try to duplicate!

Crab claw appetizers!!!! Crab claw appetizers!!! Yes appetizerS because one isn't enough when it's this yummy!! I wanted to just lick the plate, but I resisted and just asked for more bread please!!

My party had the oyster poboy, alligator poboy, gator nuggets, & about 4 crab claw appetizers. The only bad dish was the kids Mac n cheese...soooo bland.

So been walking around the French Quarter searching for the best chargrilled oysters. Been everywhere from ACME to Felix, but by far the Royal House, there was no comparison. 

Compared to other oyster bars, the chargrilled oysters had so much flavor w/ garlic and butter. Other oyster bars were lightly breadcrumb seasoned. 

Amazing service, staff are so welcoming and friendly, this place definitely shows what it feels like to receive southern hospitality

Will definitely come back again!!

Excellent food, excellent atmosphere.  We had the crab claws and char broiled oysters to start and finished with crawfish étouffée and baked shrimp and tortellini.  All this while a duel of street performers were jamming on a violin and guitar across the street from us.  The experience was magical !  Oh, the staff was also professional and excellent.  We'll be back here everytime we're in NO.

I'll give it a 2.6 to 3.0. We had the taste of New Orleans and oysters maque choux. It was OK. Not exciting or surprising. I think it's not worth the price. However, their location has a great view if you are sitting by the window on the second floor.

We had an excellent experience at Royal House last night. Upon arrival, the hostess said we would have a 25 min wait. In reality, it was much shorter. Our waiter, CJ, was fantastic. He was very personable and made great recommendations. The redfish beignet appetizer (one of CJ's recommendations) was absolutely to die for!  We went with all local fare...I had the New Orleans sampler and my sister had the Shrimp and Grits. The sampler came with crawfish étouffée, gumbo, and chicken and sausage jambalaya.  Out favorite was the étouffée. The shrimp and grits were also quite good. I am not a grits fan, so I was pleasantly surprised.  I would definitely go back!

We were just walking and we need to Eat! The red fish with the creamy crawfish sauce was the best. "Crunch" was super excellent for our server. Always there when you needed him! More oysters for the oyster lover, fresh fresh....his eyes started rolling to the back of his head. In ecstasy! The bestest time!

Can I just say I love NOLA! It's located in the French quarter. This place was amazing on my last day of my vacation! Came here and we had got the crab claws appetizer and it was so bomb that we had to order another one to go! Our server was amazing along with the staff being so friendly and welcoming! Definitely must come back to this place if I visit NOLA again!
One of our favorite go tos. Oysters are plump and drinks are flowing.  Also grear bar and you can sit on a balcony and watch all the music and art on royal.  Service is mixed but fun.
All I have to say is get the oyster tacos!!! Amazing!! Beautiful view from the balcony dining! We will definitely be back!

We have had snacks here a few times in visits to New Orleans. Great oysters. We tried the balcony. It's a nice day and the narrow little balcony seemed charming. It could stand with a coat of paint and some repair. The stairs up likewise have tired heavily soiled carpet which drop it a star.

Enjoyable experience. Had to wait a bit to be seated - even at 9:30pm on a Sunday. Just walk halfway down the street and grab a drink from the lil beer and frozen drink stand and time will go a little faster while standing in line.

They sent us to be seated upstairs on the balcony. After reading y'all's reviews I was hoping for just that. The seating process seemed a bit disorganized but the upstairs hostess was nice. Place was packed. Our server (Diego maybe?) was great. Friendly and knew his menu. The bf had one of the best bloodies I have ever tried. I almost got my own but just couldn't do it after the whirlwind of travel - I was already delirious and also dehydrated - but I regret not ordering one myself. Wish I had one now. It came garnished with a pickled green bean, celery, olive and onion. So good.

Everything is a little slow going.
Drinks came slow, apps came really slow - like maybe 40 minutes, but Diego came to keep us updated. I get it - in a place like that the kitchen gets backed up sometimes. Despite our hunger we were really enjoying the night air and some good music as there were two ladies playing on the corner below - A violinist and guitar player. It was like having a free show. 

For apps we had the spinach dip and the Crab Louis Salad. Dip was ok. Came with what seemed to be house made tortilla chips. The portion was a bit small. The salad was good. It sounds a little strange, kind of a weird combination of things but it works. The dressing was really good too and they gave just the perfect amount. 

For our mains my boyfriend had the taste of New Orleans which consists of Gumbo, jumbalaya, & étouffée. Neither one of us are big seafood eaters so he was taking a chance here. He liked the jumbalaya and loved the étouffée, but thought the gumbo had a strange flavor. He described it as tasting of vodka. Who knows? It's New Orleans, maybe it is made with vodka and maybe it's supposed to be. I tried it and tasted vodka as well but it was also reminiscent of something else and had a smokiness to it.

I decided to be a weirdo and order a shit ton of sides as my main course. When I was looking at the menu on yelp it had all of these things listed under Lagniappe...stupid me I thought it was like a combination plate which I felt was perfect because I'm a glutton and usually want one of everything. So I had my heart set on that only to get there and realize that this was a list of the available side dishes. Since I had my heart set on it already I ordered the red potatoes; the slaw; the corn maque choux; the jumbalaya; and hush puppies.

Everything was really good. The hush puppies were the best I've ever had. Slaw was good but different from any I've ever had. It is made with apples and I also tasted some cinnamon in there. It was good but a little sweet for my taste. This was my first time ever trying jumbalaya. It was delicious. Also my first time having maque choux. The corn was a little over cooked but I liked this dish as well. Kind of like a combination of corn and New England clam chowder cuz it definitely had a seafood flavor in there. My favorite thing was the red potatoes. Swimming in butter, garlic and Parmesan cheese. Flavor got a bit intense as I got to the bottom where all the sauce collected. Not healthy in the slightest but oh very delish.

I heard a server tell the table next to us that they sold out of the banana foster cheesecake. I was pretty bummed because I had my heart set on that. Oh well I'm developing a tire around my waist on this trip anyway. 

All in all it was a great nite but I've deducted stars for the cleanliness factor, or lack thereof...
I know this spot sees crazy volume but the carpets and walls were gross, as well as the bathroom. Replace that stairway carpet with some tile and get someone on bathroom duty. The dingy-ness made me wonder how clean /not clean the kitchen was....

Go to Royal House for the oysters!  The Half-shell and Chargrilled oysters are incredibly fresh and delicious.  I think they may be better than Drago's chargrilled oysters.  The BBQ shrimp are spicy, come with boiled potatoes and corn on the cob and were great.  I also recommend the Jambalaya which had a decent amount of andouille sausage and shrimp.  The catfish po' boy was a bit dry, it needed mayo or some kind of dressing, and the bread was too chewy (read DRY).  The french onion soup was bland.  

I've been there three times over two trips to NO, and found the service to be slow, but the servers are friendly and the food is good, so it's worth the wait, just sit back and enjoy the balcony view, if you're lucky enough to get a seat up there.  

Tip: They're flexible with the free appetizer "Check-in" - they let me get the oysters with it.

Just had a nice dinner here. Food was good. I had the shrimp creole which was great. I checked in on Facebook and received a free appetizer which was a very nice touch. We sat by a window and enjoyed a nice breeze as we ate. Service was good and relaxed. No one was rushing you and we had plenty of time to enjoy ourselves.  I would definitely go back.
I ordered the taste of New Orleans and Bloody Mary, so delicious! I'm not a fan of gumbo but I couldn't stop eating theirs! Not too pricey either!
Great service with amazing food! Wow! I just moved to the area and will be here often!

It's a decent place when you're looking to eat later I the evening but if you have other options I would go a different route. Places like ACME Oyster House are the Gold Standard for eating oysters in the area

I was in town for 1 day and decided on this place for lunch due to both location and recommendations.

I am a big foodie, and the crab claws appetizer here is seriously the BEST food I have ever had. If I could go back I might order 2 of these as my meal.

For my entree I got the blackened redfish without the crab on top, but with the royal sauce (which contains crawfish). Like the appetizer. The royal sauce was amazing, incredible, extraordinary. The fish was great, slightly "wow" but with the royal sauce it was AMAZING. It comes served with delicious corn and peppers and potatoes. It was almost too much food for me, and I wish i was able to eat more because it was that good.

Seriously recommend royal house... My waitress was very nice and the eating out on the balcony was so nice!!!!

Ugh I will miss this place I am from Chicago and let me tell you those crab claw appetizers make you want to literally pitch a tent and live outside royal house just have easy access to their food on a daily basis. Our server was absolutely amazing I believe his name was kye, but he looked like juicy j from 3 6 mafia because i shit you not he had a deep southern accent, tatted face, and a legit grill in his mouth. He was so awesome though and suggested great drinks and food to try. My friend had the blackened red fish which I tried and was delicious. I had the crawfish ravioli and that was also very tasty.

Char grilled oysters was the best yet! I also had a bowl of gumbo, the jambalaya and the crawfish étouffée. The jambalaya was good, but a bit salty. I enjoyed the crawfish étouffée the most and I would recommended it to anyone.

Omg loved Royal House! The crab claws and grilled oysters were so delicious and so were our pasta dishes! The place was extremely busy but we received our food in an appropriate time. The staff was also very professional and enjoyable to talk to! I will definitely  be back to request a pasta dish but with the crab claw sauce (which they said they could do!!), heaven!!! You must try!!

Really good place to start if you never been to New Orleans. They have a entree that has three signature New Orleans dishes so you don't miss out. Their chargrilled oysters are as good as other people say, and the shrimp creole is also a must. The only thing I didn't enjoy was their bread. Service was excellent, and our server was very friendly helping me through the menu. Very good restaurant for someone who is new to New Orleans food.

We have had snacks here a few times in visits to New Orleans. Great oysters then, not now. We tried the balcony. It's a nice day and the narrow little balcony seemed charming. It could stand with a coat of paint and some repair. The stairs up likewise have tired heavily soiled carpet which drop it a star.  An order of fries shows up that we did order, and no drinks.  My oysters came out without the shells cleaned before shucking and were not safe to eat that way. Grit from the outside of the shell all over the oysters and the lemon and sauce because it was carelessly put together.  So I sent them back with another waiter, who argues with me that they're just fine. "You can't rinse them. It affects the flavor." Once they're open, true. Before? Health and safety. Finally the waitress shows up with the drinks. I was done. Waaay done. They need to get their act together and give that place an overhaul.  Liked it before. Will not be back.

Went in for a mid day snack and we were not happy at all.  We are not the biggest seafood enthusiasts at all so take this review for what it is worth based on that.
Wait staff were fantastic and helpful.  
My wife had the chargrilled oysters and blech.  Not good at all.
I had the crab claws and I was expecting a couple big fat claws to be sitting on a plate.  NOPE.  A bunch of tiny mini claws with minimal meat but that is the dish.  Again, Blech. 
Neither one of us are big on seafood so again, please read this with caution.  Most of the reviews we read were very positive and apparently both of our dishes are highly rated.  That was one reason we ordered both and the other was based on the waitresses recommendation.  
To try and salvage the experience and move forward we ordered the banana foster cheesecake.  The Bananas were meh and the cheesecake had a fishy taste to it.  Was the chef mixing spoons or was the taste of our previous two dishes still lingering....a possibility.   Not a fan either way.
Cheers

Came back home from NC for my nephews graduation. 30 minutes after we landed sitting at the Royal House in NOLA! Amazing as always. Server good and food even better. Must get the crab app and oyster puff pastry app!!!
Loved sitting on the balcony outside. Jazz player played on the corner and it was very romantic. The Red fish was awesome.

We ate here as our first meal in NOLA.  I haven't been to the big easy in 15 years.  We had a great view of some beautiful French quarter architecture on the balcony with a nice view of magnolia trees across the street as well.  The oyster Po boy was good.  The oysters were very fresh however they could have used a bit of a aioli, maybe remoulade type of mayo based light dressing on the veg part of the Po boy to tie it all together.  The only option for that was a "no refrigeration required mayo" per the label which just does not suit this place.  That said, the bread was decent, oysters were crispy and fresh.  Great view.  Service was very good, heather, thank you for the great service.

Terrible service. Super slow. Food was good, but there are many more options out there that will take better care of you. Waitress was outside listening to music as we left...explains lack of attention.

The service was friendly but slow. The building is beautiful. I had the Cajun bloody marry which was great, but there was a hair in it... A big one. 
Main complaint was the po' boy. Most of the food looking around at other tables looked pretty good but the po' boy was real boring- a level of quality equal to subway or something. I eat subway sometimes, not judging, but the price was way beyond the level of quality. Crappy ingredients and no flavor at all.

This is my first 5 star rating and it is well deserved. The atmosphere was everything I was looking for in New Orleans (French District). Our hostess led us to our table immediately. Our waitress was incredible. She was sweet, attentive, and helped my party find the essential New Orleans dishes. Her name is Paulina, ask for her, you won't be disappointed. 

I ordered the 1/2 dozen oysters and the bayou/Cajun sampler (I don't really remember). 

Everything was delicious. My mothers blackened red fish was perfect.

You must eat at this restaurant. Save it for your last meal before going home. It was expensive (115.00 for three people) but it was all worth it. I will come back here again.
Great view on the patio. Flash fried oysters were a bit heavy but it's the south. Overall a good experience

I think this place has a lot of potential but our visit during Jazzfest weekend was nothing to write home about. We ordered a dozen raw oysters and they were served warm.  The catfish in seafood platter was cooked well.  The service was fine although I did hear the hostess say to another server before we came in, that she was crossing her fingers no one else would come into the restaurant that night. It was only 8:45 pm on a Saturday night. I might give this place another chance maybe when it is not so crowded.
Tasty oyster menu.  We sampled the raw, Rockefeller, and chargrilled oysters.  The Rockefeller is a must try.  Shrimp creole was tasty.  Blackened fish was well seasoned but a tad dry.
The food was really great. Our server, Tina was fabulous and made us feel really comfortable. She definitely knows her stuff.

Don't fall for the Acme Oyster House hype - Royal House's chargrilled oysters are far superior.  Heavenly... Crab claw appetizer was also fantastic.  

4.5 stars - would've given it 5, but the cocktails were just ok.

Very disappointing food.
I went to Royal House with my girlfriend and we were expecting to have some memorable local food, but we were disappointed.

We started with the Redfish Beignets, which felt way too sweet. We then had a mix of local specialties such as the Crawfish Ravioli (tasty sauce, but too much cheese and low-quality ravioli), gumbo, jambalaya and crawfish étouffée (none of these were great).

The ambience was interesting, but I wouldn't recommend it.

So I passed this place a few times on my first day. I thought it was gorgeous!  It has a balcony!  So on our second day in NOLA we opted to stop in for a day drink. We asked to sit on the balcony. We were promptly seated and then we waited....and waited....

Our server FINALLY came out after 9 minutes. I know this because I checked in on Yelp. He was either sick or had a drug problem because he kept sucking snot up his nose and running his finger across his nose. Either way, it was disgusting. I tried to let it go.

I asked for a wine list. Five minutes later I received one. I asked for a Chardonnay. My server asked me if that was a white wine. What?  Did that just happen?  A well known NOLA restaurant, that has a two page wine list, does not train its servers?

Then he said they might be out. Another few minutes later, I was told they were out of all white wine except for two. There was an entire page of options. How is that possible?  I accepted it. I order an Abita Amber beer. And then I waited. Another table said they had not gotten service either.  After another few minutes, we got up and told the bartender (because we were five feet from the bar) to cancel our order with our server. We then left. That was my entire experience at this place.
.

The service here was very subpar at best, which can be okay if the food is awesome. It was subpar at best. The only saving grace was the Hurricanes here, which after 2 almost made me forget our waitress almost as often as she forgot about us. Save your money don't bother.
A great oyster bar filled with a tremendous selection of traditional local dishes. The crawfish étouffée is great as is the dungeness crab pot.
Best chargrilled oysters in the city; probably better than fan fried in Port Townsend, WA! Very friendly and helpful staff. 5 star food and 5 star staff.

We were on the way back from Florida to Texas and decided to drop in on this place at 11 pm on a Saturday night. Lets just say it was a mad house outside this restaurant and the timing couldn't be any better as people started to stream in from their night of debauchery. We got the crab claws and some oysters Rockefeller. They were absolutely tasty. The wife loved it so much that she ate a majority of it leaving me just a bite or two. I ended up ordering a seafood linguini combo and it was also good. No complaints at all as the waiter was cool and helpful in taking care of our needs.
