LOVED THIS PLACE!! A good friend and I visited NOLA recently and on our last night, we wanted oysters. We were going to go to ACME Oyster House but due to a private event that was happening that evening, we ended up going to Royal House (by fate? Perhaps!) ;b We didn't even need to wait! There was going to be a table for two for us or bar seating. We chose bar seating and glad we did because we ended up socializing with the bartender/oyster-preparer (Lawrence, I believe his name is) and met some people both to the right and left side of us that we had commonalities with. Lawrence was so nice and when we asked him for recommendations, he first gave us char-broiled oysters with different flavoring for each (I forgot what they're called) because he thought it would be a good starter for people who don't really eat oysters. They were definitely delicious, but we honestly wanted raw oysters so we can control the amount of spices we wanted to put on it and slurp the oysters away! ;) So we ordered a half rack of raw oysters! So good that I almost choked on one of them as I slurped it lol then we had ordered a combo plate of Jambalaya, crawfish etouffee and some other stew-like bowl that was smoked. Ahh...best JAMBALAYA I EVER HAD!! So goooood my mouth is salivating as I reminisce on it. I would definitely go back there if I have another chance to visit NOLA again! bon apetite!

Came here for our last dinner on our New Orleans trip and could not have been more pleased. We sat on the balcony with a perfect view of royal st. The food was great, but our server was what really made our experience awesome. I'm a horrible person and forgot to write down her name but I believe it was Megan (I could be completely wrong). Also, we scored a free crab claws appetizer by checking in online.

The food was really good, but our waitress pretty much disappeared and we had to be asking people around to fill our water cups, or get us some more bread (which never came)... The waitress came and apologized for being gone for so long. We were done with our food, but she didn't even ask if we needed anything! We waited and waited for her to get back with our checks, so we could finally get on our way. Recommend for the food, but the service was very very poor!!
Yum yum yum.  Alligator and grilled oysters ....crawfish ravioli is so good.  One of the girls in our dinner party ate an oyster for the first time and got a pearl!!!! Service was really great

apps:
crab claws - delish
crawfish cakes - yummo
chargrilled oysters - yes!!

entree:
taste of New Orleans - meh
   - étouffée was the best of the three but the base was not as well developed as the sauces on the crab claws and crawfish cakes.
    - gumbo was a little bland, rice was actually a little crunchy/undercooked 
   - jambalaya was nearly meatless

atmosphere on the leany balcony: very fun to be Al fresco looking down on the busy street

service: very good

Overall, very good appetizers followed by mediocre and expensive entrees.

The crabs claws were very tasty, but smaller than I thought they would be. The Lousiana Sampler was just okay. I didn't even want to finish it - and I wouldn't order it again.  Our server was nice and the view from our table was great. But I won't be back.

Royal house was great because they offer a balcony with street view, the service is fantastic, and the cocktails were good. The food could use some work... Go elsewhere if you want any kind of baked oysters, unless you like them dried out and chewy. Their crab cake covered in crawfish étouffée was delicious. The crab salad was awful. The stuffed mushrooms were over cooked and very mediocre. The raw oysters were ok.

Was in New Orleans for jazz fest and came to royal house for a late dinner our first night on Friday.  Was nervous we'd have to wait a while especially so close before closing, but was seated straight away.  Took advantage of the free appetizer via yelp check in and went for the crab claws.  Don't know what they put in that thing, but it was addictively delicious.  The sauce was wiped clean with the bread that was served along with it.  For dinner we went with the shrimp and grits and the oyster pasta.  The grits were definitely the best we've tasted throughout our stay during the rest of the trip.  We really like spice so it hit the spot.  Wasn't too creamy and interestingly had some crunch probably from the peppers mixed in.  The sauce from the shrimp was also tasty.  The oyster pasta sauce, surprise surprise, was also amazing.  The only thing would be the pasta was a bit over cooked, but was not a big deal since we devoured it anyway, slurped up the sauce as well with the bread.  The drinks were decent, had the mint julep, which was quite strong.

I loved it . We were in town for my cousins graduation and decided to try this place, although it was not the first on our list, it was the only place that was open with a variety of seafood. It took them a while to get our table ready (we were a party of 16) but I guess thats not really their fault. The Royal House looks like an old converted house, it is beautiful inside and out. Our waitress was very attentive and knowledgable with the entire menu. She recommended a lot of items and we were NOT disappointed. We tried the fried alligator, which was my first time, and it tastes just like chicken ! Now that I think about it, it could have been chicken and I just don't know it. (Just Kidding !) The gumbo was delicious, the crab claws were amazing, and desert was.... There are no words for the bread pudding and chocolate cake. I'm getting hunger pains just thinking about it. The seafood was plentiful and plates were definitely being passed around for those who wanted to sample another. I would go back to New Orleans just for the Royal House.
Upstairs is light & bright.  Nice atmosphere.  Waiter was too "familiar".  Blackened chicken sandwich was good but not great.  Fries were cold.  You could certainly do worse in the French  quarter.

Came here based off a friend's recommendation and this place did not disappoint. My friend and I sat out on the balcony, which is the perfect spot to people watch and catch random street performances. We started with the crab claw appetizer-thank you Yelp for the check in deal. The butter sauce that comes with this needs to be bottled and used as currency. So good. I had the seafood pescatore and it definitely fulfilled my seafood craving. The chef even added extra chili flakes for me. Our waitress ( I hate that I forgot her name, but she wears glasses and is from Texas) was awesome. She knows her stuff, she was very friendly and prompt. She never missed a beat. Next time I'm in town I'll be back.

We flew in from San Francisco and arrived to New Orleans at about 2000. We drove over towards CBD to check in at our hotel, and by foot we made it to Royal House by 2300. Note: their hours state they close at midnight, what's amazing is their kitchen closes at midnight too so they're not rushing or keeping customers out. I will definitely give them a plus for that.

My general census of the food: salty!

Chargrilled oysters: whoever said they taste better than Acme believes anything caked in butter, garlic, and parmesan is culinary genius. If that's your bag, anything in butter, garlic, and cheese would be delicious.

Crab claws: would have been my favorite dish if they toned down the side of hypertension. So salty I downed two glasses of water.

Shrimp creole: underwhelming. Anyone can pick up a shrimp creole base at the nearby market and make it a hit at home.

Drink of choice - hurricane: I can't fathom why a mass majority of people who told me about New Orleans advised me to get this cocktail. I suppose when you're 19 here for mardi gras it would be the answer to what you're looking for, but for you mature, lover of spirits, this drink would be an offense taken seriously. But hey, if you're looking for a hang over with a side of diabetes, order as much as your liver and gut can take it. They'll keep dishing it out to your heart's desire.

The best meal I have had in a long time. Cindy, our waitress, was full of recommendations. I had the red fish for an entree and the crab claw for an appetizer. The sauce on the crab claw was good enough to eat alone. The red potatoes, OMG, absolutely delicious. Ask for Cindy to be your waitress. She will not steer your wrong!!!
Our first stop in Nola and what a great place. Not only is the food amazing but our waitress Cindy really took this place from a 4 star to 5 star in my book.

This place was amazing I had their crawfish cakes for an appetizer . Amazing . Than I had their shrimp Cajun thingy for my meal. Amazzzzing. It is totally worth it and amazing service. Their hurricane are amazing I had 2. You should totally try this place out.

The food here was great. The oysters were perfect. We got the free appetizer for checking in so we also order oyster tacos and I wish we would have got more. The perfect combination. My husband hates coleslaw, but he loved the tacos which were covered in coleslaw. The service was great and the wine selection was also good. I had a BLT-O which is a BLT with Oysters, yes I love oysters can't you tell. The location was perfect for people watching and enjoying a really nice lunch. It did take a while to get our order in, but they were a little busy for lunch time and the wait wasn't too bad.

3.5 

This place is a great place to hit up when you are in Nola. I was expecting better quality food given the star rating, but this place is A-okay.

My mom and I had the taste of New Orleans which is a trio of jambalaya, gumbo, and crawfish with rice. My favorite out of the three sample sized portions was the crawfish. 

The sauce was so tasty and had just enough spice to get my taste buds jumping. The rice was a bit harder than I expected it to be. At first I thought it was just mine but turns out my mom's dish also came with harder than expected rice. It was chewable but not fluffy soft rice. Maybe because there was so much gravy underneath it and they expect the rice to blend in with the sauce? In any case, for $17 it was a good meal. 

I didn't get a chance to have a drink but from what I saw the menu had interesting cocktails and a good variety at good prices between $10-$13. 

The service was great and the waiters and staff are very very friendly and accommodating. The restaurant is not huge but they make do with the space they have. There is a cool huge slanted mirror near the entrance where the bar is and gives the restaurant a cool dive bar feel. 

Stop by if you're looking for a good place to eat before venturing deep into the French quarter.

Food not good, way they handled it VERY IMPRESSED.
Went here with my bf for his first New Orleans trip. Reviews were kind of up and down so I was unsure. Did not like the atmosphere of the restaurant. Waitress was very knowledgable and she recommended the red fish and the fish pasta with white wine sauce instead of marinara and the crawfish. Should have listened to her...

Used the yelp coupon and got fried gator. So tough we couldn't bite into it. 

Ordered shrimp and grits and blackened shrimp jambalaya. Both came out within 5 minutes of order, not nearly long enough to cook them fresh. Shrimp were fresh frozen and baby shrimp. Jambalaya was awful. It was so dry and flavorless. It left a chalky taste in your mouth and the shrimp were not even blackened. 

I love shrimp and grits and this was pile of greasy slop. 

But...I am giving them three stars because the way the waitstaff and manager handled the situation was fabulous. Brian, the manager, came over to talk to us and apologized profusely. He offered us different dishes which we declined due to timing. He comped our meal and made us feel very comfortable and appreciated as customers.

For the reason of the wait staff and Brian I am giving them 3 stars. If you go here would not try the dishes I listed. 

Glad they have great customer service. Sign of a good restaurant. Just may need a new chef.

What I don't understand is that this place is too expensive and highly rated for the quality of food it serves. We spent $150 and got such low quality food in terms of ingredients and taste. How did this place get 4 stars? did they hire people to write reviews? Also, the place smells so bad. They really need to take a clean rag and clean the place. This place does not deserve 4 stars. I can't trust yelp after this! 

I ordered a bottle of wine ("Riesling"), fried alligator, raw oysters, char-grilled oysters, blackened redfish with crab meat. 

Fried alligator- You cannot chew through the meat. It is so incredibly tough and full of muscle. Not sure why people serve this. I chewed for a good 2 minutes and spit it out. 

Raw oysters- Not flavorful. Just average oysters. 

Char-grilled oysters- you taste the parmesan cheese with oyster texture. Was tasty. 

Blackened redfish with crab meat- The blacked fish was good. Pub quality. However, the green beans were canned green beans and considering the dish cost $30 I would expect fresh green beans. Also the crab meat on top was not fresh!! 

I would not recommend this place.

Dropped in for a mid-afternoon drinks and snack run with my father and fiancé yesterday, and I wish we had chosen any of the other French Quarter options.

Despite it not being peak Gulf oyster season, we decided to get a dozen anyway, as we all love oysters and our server (Chris) assured us these were fine. As expected, they weren't the best, but it probably just wasn't the best time for them. Then, we noticed in several of the oysters there was a grainy black gunk that tasted pretty bad.

I raised this to Chris and he was both flippant and condescending, telling me that this is just how oysters are. He even brought over a colleague to repeat the same line to me - "That's just how oysters are." I sensed that they weren't really going to try to be any more helpful than this so initially decided to let it go, and thought we could just try to eat around the black gunk.

A few minutes later, Chris came back and again repeated his lecture about the oysters (unsolicited!), this time telling me that if you're not that used to oysters, you might think they're weird, but once you get used to them you just get that this is how they are. (Now, I am by no means an oyster connoisseur, but I am a huge fan of them and eat them every chance I get, and I have never, ever seen one with the bad-tasting black gunk in them like these.) I told Chris that I found it really unusual, and he again repeated his lecture. Perhaps he was just trying to offer some explanation, but I found his tone to be extremely condescending, and his stubborn refusal to acknowledge the possibility of my concern being legitimate was very disrespectful.

At this point I asked to speak to the manager, Lisa, who was actually really nice and offered to change the oysters. We declined, as we needed to leave soon, but we appreciated that she  actually came up with a solution instead of just trying to tell us that there wasn't a problem like Chris and his other colleague did repeatedly.

Other food was fine: gumbo was bland but not offensive, shrimp po' boy was decent and salad was fresh. The hurricane was way too sweet, but the bloody Mary was actually quite nice. However, with so many dining options in New Orleans, I don't think "fine" is good enough to stay competitive, and I wouldn't recommend Royal House to anyone. We went to Commander's Palace later that day and had an awesome experience (separate review later!)

I typically don't give 5 stars because with this place, they deserve ever bit of it. Tried this place for the first time and I must say I'm pretty impressed. The food was excellent, our waiter, Tyrone took care of our table, he fixed a small issue we had with the order, addressed it to the manager and in less than 10 minutes the correct order was at our table. We really didn't even have to ask for anything, drinks were always filled, food was served nice and hot, customer service from the hostess, manager, and of course waiter, Tyrone made our visit an awesome experience. Definitely recommend this place.

Food was super salty, cocktails were way too sweet, music was not good, service was meh, no toilet paper in the bathroom... So disappointed :(( 

We ordered the fried alligator which was chewy, the oysters which were pretty dry and the lobster boil which was very dry and very salty. My friend and I were so excited to go here based on the yelp ratings, but apparently we had a very different experience. To top off the disappointment, our waiter wouldn't let us use the yelp check in coupon (you have to order 2 full entrees). It was only a free appetizer but it would have made the experience a little better... NOLA has so many great places to eat, I wouldn't go back to this place :(
I have eaten here many times. Oysters, terrific. Staff, great, atmosphere fun. Highly recommended.
Had the shrimp and grits. Very spicy.  Grits had an oily ring around them.  Service was good.  Just the meal that was disappointing.
The crawfish cakes was delicious. The burger was not their specialty at all - dry and over cooked. The service was good.

I went here for a wedding reception, in the upstairs portion of the restaurant. Our reservation was for 7:30PM, so if you have a big party or reservation, don't go here 15 minutes before because they will not seat you or be ready for you. 

We all were escorted in the side door leading us all the way up to the second level, instead of going through the restaurant. Pretty cool, I felt like we were VIP haha..

The decor inside is nice, and you can tell this building is really old. I am not sure about the history of the Royal House but I saw a ghost tour stop in front of it to talk so there has to be some interesting things about it.

The second level had a cool balcony opened to us, but it was freaky at the same time because it slanted down. I had to have a couple drinks to be brave enough to hang out there. But when I did, it was awesome looking at the passer byers.

I've got to say, the étouffée was the best that I had! The crawfish meat in it was awesome- not overcooked or anything.. I had to get not only seconds but thirds!

The service was accommodating and always quick to clear plates.

I would go here again on my next trip to NOLA!
Good raw and grilled oysters!! Jambalaya is so yummy!! Wonderful service Terrence! I will come back again if we come to visit again.

Food was just okay, service is slow.

- Alligator Bites: tastes like chewy dark meat. The heavy seasoning made it a bit too salty.

- Po Boys: good bread but a bit too hard to eat as a sandwich. I ended up just picking off the fried shrimp. Shrimps were on the smaller side and bland. The beef po'boy tasted like a roast beef sandwich with gravy.

- Taste of New Orleans: neat way to try a bit of everything including gumbo, jambalaya, and etouffe. Just okay, nothing particularly stood out. 

- Service is slow. Eating time was 20min but we probably dined for more than an hour.

First visit to the French quarter and saw this place. The lines can get long but we got a seat at the bar. We ordered the chargrilled oysters and fried alligator. Yep it tastes like chicken! The chargrilled oysters were also very good just a tad bit heavy on the cheese. Atmosphere felt authentic and the bartender was nice. They were just super busy shucking all those oysters. He said he does about a thousand a day! So if you're there check it out. It was good!

I ate there twice (Breakfast and Lunch) while in New Orleans this past weekend.  The service and meals were great. (However, we did not know that they offer a 25% military discount until the second visit. Lesson learned:  Always ask.)

Stopped by for lunch on a Saturday afternoon. The view from the upstairs outdoor balcony was great!  And the food was fabulous.  We had the char grilled oysters to start. Delicious!   And the bloody Mary's were perfect!

Disclosure: This review is going to be based off a visit for a wedding reception. 

The building seems to be very old and have some history to it. Apparently, one of the characters in American Horror Story: Coven was based off of the owner the mansion that is now Royal House. Creepy! 

The reception was held in an upstairs dining room conveniently with a bar.  There is also a wrap around balcony, good for people watching. Although the balcony is a bit narrow and leans a bit. If you're afraid of heights, be wary. lol

The food was served buffet style with a good variety of New Orleans cuisine such as crawfish etouffee, gumbo, redfish, dirty rice, and bread pudding. My favorite of the night was definitely the etouffee. I had five bowls of the etoufee over rice. 

I also was able to order some oysters from the bar and have them brought up. I was not able to try oysters from anywhere else on my trip to compare, but the oysters at Royal House were great! The Gulf oysters were a good size, not too big or too small and meaty. I was pleasantly surprised to see that the bill was only $13 for a dozen... I could have put away another four dozen, but I did not want to spew out oysters all over Bourbon street as there was a four hour open bar that night.... 

Service at the reception was very friendly and prompt. It seems that people have experienced different service according to other reviews. But ours was great. 

If I were to ever make another trip to NOLA (highly unlikely, NOLA is such a dirty ass city) I would stop here again for oysters and etouffee.

Wonderful food, amazing balcony seating! The entrees can get a little pricey but the appetizer size was perfect for lunch and if you're looking to save a bit, highly recommend the French onion soup as well. Nice location, balcony was the perfect view of the music down royal st. The hostess was also wonderful, super nice and funny. Would definitely recommend!

Nice restaurant! Located in the heart of the French Quarters.  Lines to get in on Friday-Sunday.  We went on Thursday evening about 5pm & got seated right away.  Although, an hour later, we noticed a few people waiting for tables.  Service was very nice & attentive.  We ordered Fried Alligator (appetizer), Redfish (dinner entrée), & Oyster Pasta (dinner entrée).  Dinner was delicious.  Enjoyed every bite!  Would recommend coming either early or on Monday- Thursday & beat the crowds.

The food was amazing! First time having grilled oysters and I wouldn't recommend having them anywhere but at this restaurant. Two of my friends recommended we try this place for the oysters and they were right, the best! We also had a shrimp Po-boy and the chicken and andouille gumbo, delicious!! I had my first mint joulip and they were not skimpy on the alcohol!! Would definitely recommend others try this restaurant.
fantastic service - decent food.  The oysters are life changing.

I was alone for an evening when my travel partner ended up stranded Chicago, so I came here and sat at the bar for dinner. I ordered a cup of chicken gumbo and the combination oysters (3 of each kind of their 2 best sellers-seafood and rockefeller I think). The gumbo was so good that it cheered me right up with the first bite. The oysters were equally great. An extra highlight was that the bartender, despite managing a bar full of dinner people like me, was happy and joking with all of us. It didn't feel like dining alone at all. I eventually just put my book away and got to know the people around me.

The ambiance is spectacular. We had a chance to sit on the balcony and we thoroughly enjoyed it. The staff and the hostess were phenomenal.

I just wish the food was as great. We had oysters and jambalaya. They were both Ok but we weren't wow-d. The ambiance compensated for that in return.

Food was okay. Nothing bad, but nothing to really brag about. Prices a little steep for the quality of the food. Overall an okay dining experience. Felt a little cramped in the dining area downstairs, and our waiter was not quite attentive. Could've just been an off night, but I wasn't overwhelmingly impressed.
Over priced, under flavored, over dressed. Don't waste your time. There are far better places in new Orleans to eat, try somewhere else
Chargrilled oysters are the bomb. Tasty and juicy. I wasn't too fond of the oysters Rockefeller or the royale. Chargrilled is the way to go, along with a hummingbird from their drink menu.
From the pineapple cucumber mojito to the raw oysters to the étouffée, everything was awesome.

Service was a nightmare from the minute we sat down. It took forever to get drinks and we didn't get any crackers served with the oysters (the oysters we ordered for an appetizer that were forgotten about.) chicken Caesar salad wasn't bad even if that an easy thing to get right. Better options for food in the French Quarter.

It was hit and miss. The charbroiled oyster were worth $17 a dozen. They were top notch! The crawfish ravioli was good. My husband had an oyster po boy. He said landrys made a better sandwich. He said it was very dry. My sons hamburger... He wouldn't touch it. Paid $94 with tip. Left disappointed.

We used the Yelp check in offer for a free appetizer. We got the red fish benignets (sooooooooooooooooo YUMMY), I reccomend to everyone coming through. They are the perfect amount of savory and sweet. For the entrees we got the Shrimp and Grits and also the Crawfish Ravioli (I highly reccomend the ravioli)! Though this place is four stars meal wise - for having good food in the French Quarter that was decently priced plus the free appetizer it gets an extra star. And we will be coming back!

I am in love with the oysters here. Very fresh and decently priced. I attended a wedding reception here as well in which they served very authentic New Orleans Cajun cuisine. I enjoyed the crawfish étouffée and their bread pudding very much. The staff was very friendly and accommodating .

This was our first stop in New Orleans - we had the oysters on the half shell and hush puppies - both excellent. Cocktails were delicious, if a bit pricey. We were able to sit outside upstairs while listening to street music down below and enjoying the views. Waitstaff was very friendly, bathrooms were clean. Would definitely return for a proper sit down meal.
I don't often review restaurants but our meal here tonight was incredible. Stick with the crab claws appetizer & crawfish ravioli. Both super tasty & full of flavor!

Amazing! Absolutely amazing. The food was great and I wish I remembered our waiters name as he was stellar!! I recommend the royal salad and the crab claws. That sauce is to die for. Dip everything in it!!!! Such a wonderful experience.  If you can make a stop, do it!!

Everything tasted really good. Good service and ambience too. I loved my crawfish étouffée. I thought all of the oyster preparations had too much cheese in it and the dominating taste was that of the melted cheese. And I am a fan of the simple yet precious lemon butter garlic oysters, which wasn't on the menu unfortunately.

My husband got the ribeye with crab on top and the steak, potatoes and green beans were so well seasoned and spiced. I got the ravioli and I did not like the red sauce. It just me wasn't as spicy as I like my food. I would not recommend the ravioli. 

The alcoholic drink called the strawberry lemonade was amazing. It has real strawberries and wasn't too sweet.

Great food, maybe a little over priced, but that's what you get in the French Quarter. Before to check in and get $10 off your appetizer! 

I had the seafood pescatore but substituted the scampi sauce instead of marinara at the waiters suggestion, which I highly recommend. If you want a giant platter of fried goodness, go for a platter.

Great experience here! Both raw & chargrilled oysters were very good. Fried alligator was awesome too. 

If you only have 2 people, take the opportunity to sit on the balcony - so nice. Service was great, really sweet waitress. Highly recommend this spot!

It's really about the indoor space, the history, and the cool façade. We followed the advice of other yelpers and just stopped in for a pimms cup. The pimms cup was on point- as expected but nothing earth shattering. Service was friendly. Menu options and other cocktails didn't look too interesting, and this place does not have a happy hour.

The absolute best shrimp creole in the quarter. Also has amazing hurricanes and besides Pat O Briens which has their signature hurricanes, this is one of the only other places I've found around the quarter with amazing tasting ones!!    
Always friendly service and if you want a nest experience, eat on the balcony over looking the streets. You see the street performers and everything going on!! 
This is a favorite place of mine to eat and I highly recommend it!!

Love this place so much. Red fish beignets as an appetizer are incredible. Between the 3 of us we ordered the fish platter (SO MUCH FOOD), shrimp and grits (so tasty) and the ribeye, which my dad remarked was the best he has ever had. Perfect New Orleans meal. Great service. Will return !
Absolutely wonderful!!!! The blackened redfish was amazing and the staff is unbelievable! The bread pudding isn't too bad either:)

Came here with my girlfriend while on vacation for dinner and had a great experience. Our waitress Magen was very friendly and provided great service. We got the mint julep and bloody mary for our cocktails and both were excellent. Both the oyster tacos and oysters of half shell were to our liking as well. Furthermore I would recommend the shrip tortellini. 

Overall I would definitely recommend this place for anyone looking for a good drink, food, and a cost that doesn't break the bank.

The food was to die for! We've been here two straight days in a row and can't stop really oysters. What is your tacos, oysters Rockefeller, oysters Royale and the list just keeps on going. Love the shrimp and grits too! Service is phenomenal and make sure you see Alexis for some real southern style service. We may get a chance to come back for one final bill tomorrow on our way home to San Francisco! This is a must stop place to eat in the French quarter!

Great food! Our waitress, Alexis M, gave great suggestions and was so helpful. 
Try the red fish beignets - different take on classic New Orleans food.

First time to NO and decided to eat here! Had the grilled oysters...unbelievably good! Our waiter recommended oyster pasta which was creamy but not heavy and topped with fried oysters, soo good! My husband got the craw dad ravioli, which was very good! Reasonable prices. All the food at the tables around us looked amazing, I don't think you can go wrong! Very good service.
The crawfish cakes were awesome and the ettoufee was really good. The oyster duo was OK I had better. The pineapple cucumber mojitos was the best mojitos I ever had.

The fella at the front door cracks me up! He kept calling our group Queens (we were 4 girlfriends traveling for my 30th bday). Food was top notch! We all had oysters, in all different preparations. Raw were my fave.  My mint julep was very strong, but the mint was so fresh and bold that went down like water.  I recommend the crab claws as an app. Heather was a great server, ask for her!

Monday night 6:15 pm
My wife and I wanted to have our last dinner on our vacation here.
We sat down  and waited over 20 minutes  for someone to give us water or bread or take our drink order or simply just  recognize us..nothing
We got up walked out & no one asked us anything.
This place is TERRIBLE.......

That being said we went to Deanie's a few blocks away and had one AMAZING dinner!!!!
Check them out on yelp.
Deanie's is  EXCELLENT. !!!!

By far the best meal and best dining experience we had on our trip to New Orleans. First, big props to our waitress Alexis who was so attentive and so helpful with all of our food choices, she was wonderful and really made our experience wonderful.  Second, the food was SO DELICIOUS. We started with the crab leg appetizer and that was the best crab we have ever had.  The sauce it was in was delicious we soaked up every last drop with our bread, crackers, and were scraping the bowl with our spoons to eat all of it, it was so good.  I got the oyster pasta and that was also to die for.  It was super rich a delicious, but the sauce wasn't thick at all it was perfect to dip the friend oysters in and to coat the pasta nicely, I definitely cleared my plate on that dish as well.  My mom had the seafood pasta with red sauce, and my sister had the taste of New Orleans. My mom loved her dish and my sisters was great, she said the crawfish étouffée was her favorite of the three and she could have eaten an entire bowl of that.  
This restaurant was so good we seriously contemplated coming back here a second night in a row but we knew we had to try other places, but I would recommend this to anyone in the area, it was all around a wonderful experience for us!

We went to Royal House last night.  David our waiter was incredibly friendly and helpful. We started with an appetizer the crab claws which was absolutely delicious.  David recommended the crawfish ravioli which was equally delicious. Despite being full we had the bananas foster cheesecake.  The whole meal was absolutely wonderful thanks to the excellent food and wonderful service.

The oyster tacos are literally the most amazing thing I've ever had in my life. Also chargrilled oysters are epic! The service was great too. But seriously you're an idiot if you don't order the oyster tacos.
The oysters were excellent, as were the Bloody Marys. A bit pricey but that seems to go with the neighborhood. Our server was very friendly and accommodating.

This was the first meal we had at NOLA and it was also the best. Loved the Crawfish Ravioli and the Oysters Royale. They were both really delicious and tasty! It was a 30min wait on a Friday around 8pm. We had to sit at the bar but the barman was very friendly. I think if you check in on Yelp you get a free appetizer
The absolute best meal I've had.  Server Zach made the perfect recommendations and meals were so above anything I've had!!!
Shrimp and grits were amazing!  The monitor were so refreshing! The service was great! I cannot complain about anything please visit if you are in the area!

If you're in the French Quarter, Royal House is a MUST.  I had looked at the menu online and it sounded good, but when I approached the restaurant there was a guy out front shouting out menu items and trying to get customers to come in.  That made me super nervous - usually those are tourist traps and the food is horrible!  Not the case here.  

The location is great - the upstairs seating is a little bleak but some paint would change that. The outdoor patio has such a great view.  And there is AC and ceiling fans.  The downstairs is fantastic, cute and nice to sit at the bar.  

The oyster shucker/server/bartender that helped me (Jeffrey) was so friendly - offered tips about the city, what to do and what not to eat!  The oysters there were amazing.  I ordered char-grilled oysters once or twice a day - basically every restaurant that served them.  Royal House is BY FAR the best (better than a few high end restaurants and some other local 'oyster bars').  The oysters are simple - butter, parmesan, maybe some garlic, a lemon and french bread on the plate and they are boiling in the shell.  Delicious and not overdone.  

Jeffrey told me to watch out because apparently some places in the area buy oysters buy the gallon bucket and buy shells and serve them.  GROSS!  He pulled out a bag of oysters that were delivered when I was sitting there and shucked them in front of me, served me some on the half shell right there and sent more off to the kitchens to be char grilled.  That's fresh and that's service.  

I ate there twice during my trip and it was a huge mistake not eating there more.  

I would have given them 5 stars, but I think the guy out front could be a turnoff for some people and it needs a little decorative appeal upstairs.

I went to this restaurant with 2 other companions on a week night and all the computers went down except one. We sat there for 20 mins at the bar and no one even gave us water. We finally got service at the other side of the bar (we moved bc none of the wait staff wanted to help us). 

My friend ordered a mint julep and they didn't even muddle the mint in the liquor so he couldn't taste the mint. 

We ordered the stuffed mushrooms, shrimp and grits and the fried shrimp platter and it was all bland. Please don't waste your money on the food here, it is just not worth it.
Our waiter was great and the food was excellent. When I return to New Orleans I'll have to drop in again.

I can't speak on the authenticity of their food due to the fact that I'm a Yankee, but after I tried their crawfish etouffee I had a burning desire in me to eat all of it in the entire state.  

What I can speak on is their service.  Our initial encounter was with a hostess/maître d' who was so pleasant and upbeat and immediately saw to it that we were taken to our table.  Our server, Karanji (I literally saved the receipt so I could spell his name for this review...) was phenomenal.  He answered all of our question (we had a lot, it was our first trip to New Orleans) and even recommended some other restaurants where I could continue on my quest to eat crawfish until I literally passed out.  Maybe it's cause I'm from the north, but what really struck me about this place is that everyone seemed genuinely happy to be working there.  That in itself should make you want to stop in for a visit- ask for Karanji!

Great, great service. Super staff. Food was decent, but nothing blew me away. Alligator appetizer was great, make sure to drown it in Crystal hot sauce. The tables could feel a little cleaner, but they aren't dirty. Location was nicely off the street and the seating options are exceptional. Recommended!
Gumbo is great, I'm not a fan oysters, but I decided to give the rockafellar ones a try. The service is AMAZING it's the epitome of Southern Hospitality.
Loved it so much when I stumbled upon it two days ago with my girlfriend, we just had to come back. Easily the best oysters, raw or chargrilled, I've ever had!

First time in new orleans went to royal house...wasnt that impressed....service is average...oysters below average...fried oysters are good and fish was average...mashed potatoes are terrible.  Overall I would skip it and go elsewhere.

Not impressed. Had the half and half oyster special and both had little bits of shell in them. Both were bland and I'm pretty easygoing on reviews. Raw oysters were ok, but same issue with bits of shell, which will happen but shouldn't happen this much. The oysters were also a bit on the warm side. The Wife's dish ten minutes behind mine and at that point she was pissed and didn't want it. Waiter didn't really care as this place is about volume. Skip this place and go to the Original French Market on Decatur. Way better food and way better service.

Great food, decent price for New Orleans. Enjoyed talking with others there that wanted to gush about the food. 

The Crawfish Étouffée is one of the best dishes I've had in years. I got the New Orleans Sampler with Gumbo, Jambalaya, and the Crawfish. All were good, but the Crawfish was so good that I wished I would've just got a couple of orders of that. My wife got the Shrimp Tortallini (could've gotten about the same from Red Lobster) and ended up eating most of my Jambalaya.

The food was adequate.  I ordered the roast beef po-boy and as other reviewers pointed out, the po-boy was extremely tough to cut.  I had to ask our server for a steak knife and even that didn't help much.  It was very crowded and the crowd noise was unbearable.  Needless to say this took away from what might have been a pleasant dining experience.  Also, the menu should provide non-seafood eaters (like myself) more options.

We had an excellent meal and excellent service! We shared the chargrilled oysters and the fried alligator for appetizers. So delicious! 

I got the 'taste of new Orleans' which was a trio of the gumbo, crawfish, and jambalaya. My fiancé got the shrimp creole which was so good!  I don't think you can go wrong here.

Ty, Ty ... Ty, Ty, Ty... Need I say more?! I'm a firm believer that your service makes or breaks you and Ty made my experience at the Royal House a memorable one. He helped me pick my dish, drink and was not only the server but great company. High energy, the right attitude and drive will take you anywhere! Keep doing your thing Ty. Remain happy... Others will follow. Till next time New Orleans!

This is the only place I visited twice on my last visit to New Orleans. Service was great. The crab claws (my god, the sauce is good) are wonderful and they will give you extra crusty bread to sop up all the sauce. Also had the charbroiled oysters (buttery, parmesan goodness).

If you come to NOLA, got to try this place! Shrimp creole is awesome and the crab appetizer is TO DIE FOR!  
Service impeccable!

If you're coming here you must order both the crab claws and the redfish beignets as appetizers. I was surprised to taste how sweet and savory the redfish beignets were, and the crab claws...If they served me a rat in the lemony garlic butter sauce I would delightfully eat it, but BONUS...they gave me the crab claws instead.

I've had three different people tell me the hushpuppies were the best they've ever had so I gave them ago, and I shed a few tears for my future hushpuppy experiences.

Entree-wise, I've had the crawfish etouffee and the crawfish ravioli.  Both outstanding dishes that leave me wanting more.  No complaints, only praise for the Royal House.

This place is great.  You can't beat the food, atmosphere and staff. 

Started with a couple Strawberry Lemonade cocktails (recommended by the great Megan).  It is so good, especially on a hot day  

Appetizer was the Chargrilled Oyster.  They are outstanding.  Just add a dab of hot sauce  

Dinner was the Taste of New Orleans (way more food than it looks) and the fried shrimp plate. Both were outstanding. Crawfish Etoufee was my favorite. 

Desert was the bread pudding.  Make sure to add a scoop of Vanilla Ice Cream. 

Hope you are staying in the French quarter, because after all that food you won't ran to to walk that far.

Went here for dinner on a recent trip to NoLa.. Tried the oysters as recommended by many folks and that was definitely great.

However we didn't dig the entrees..

My friend tried the alligator sandwich which was very so-so..we also had chicken sandwich with a lot of fries that didn't taste fantastic and mahi-mahi ($26) which was ok.

Given the price range, we expected better..the tables were too close together which gave the place fast food restaurant feel... maybe there are better places to try

First time in NOLA, we were out here celebrating my daughter's graduation. Zach was our server and he was AMAZING to say the least. Made some great suggestions on apps and dinner. We decided on the crab claws and the chargrilled oysters..YUMMY!! Shrimp Creole and taste of New Orleans was our entrees and So good. Lots of flavor and more food than you expect. You cannot leave without the bananas foster cheesecake..what an amazing experience and amazing service. Thank you Zach for making my daughters graduation dinner fantastic.

On our last night we went to another restaurant and walked out. We yelped it and found this place! Thank you again Yelp! 

We had to wait in line about 10min but it was fine. 

Once seated we ordered pretty quickly and the waiter said he was impressed that we knew what we wanted and were direct. LoL
We were hungry!

We ordered SO much food! We loved everything except the jambalaya was very very dry - pass! Please see the pics. 

Ambience was warm and amazing. It was the perfect last meal in NOLA!!!

I think we were trying to go to Cafe Soule but stumbled upon this gem instead. It was a weekday so it was kind of slow, so service was great! Our waitress was genuinely nice and gave us ideas of things to do in NOLA. We had chargrilled oysters, crawfish cakes, and a fried fish poboy. All very good!

Overall extremely tasty and satisfying. We got raw and chargrilled oysters and both were meaty and full and delicious. The redfish (blackened rather than grilled) my husband proclaimed one of the top five fish dishes he's ever had. The red bliss potatoes that came with it were amazing, and the yummy Parmesan butter from the potatoes drifted under the fish, making the fish really perfect. The green beans were also nicely seasoned and good. The only thing that wasn't up to snuff was the shrimp and jambalaya. The shrimp were pretty good and well seasoned but the jambalaya had very little chicken or sausage and was bland compared to everything else. Overall, really nice ambience, very friendly service, and great food.

I ordered the redfish that was blackened. I also ordered it with crab. They charge an additional $8 for crab and the amount they put on the fish is a joke. Keep the $8 in your pocket and don't order with crab. The fish is $23 and the lump of crab an additional $8. Pricey for what you got. The waitress said she would make it right but changed her mind and said the amount was 2oz. For sure it was not 2oz. Anyway, my first and last time.

I'm giving this a 4 star now from 2 star as I stopped the restaurant this morning and spoke with the manager Lisa. She apologized for the misunderstanding and made it right the next time I'm in town. 
Thank you Lisa

Blackened Shrimp jambalaya was overly salty. Crawfish ravioli looked fantastic in pictures but what was presented was completely not what was on the menu. Ravioli was supposed to be a breaux bridge sauce but we were served ravioli with what seemed to be a tomato-based gumbo on top. Drinks and oysters were good though.
Had the crab appetizer, the shrimp tortellini, and the crawfish ravioli.  All which were amazing.

I had the crab claws in garlic butter which was awesome!  The server brought additional bread to soak up the sauce without being asked. My wife enjoued a  rwd fish dish.  We sat on the small outdoor balcony and listened to a group of ladies play violins ansd sing.  It was a great night out with the wife.

Whenever I come to New Orleans I always visit the Royal House Oyster Bar. They have the best Chargrilled oysters I have ever tasted. The Bloody Mary's are amazing . The staff is very friendly and I never leave disappointed .

Came here with my friends during our weekend reunion in NoLa and it was just as good as I remember it the first time. Word to the wise though-- the portions are gigantic, so keep that in mind when you're trying to figure out how much to order. Being the gluttons that we are, we ordered three entrees and an appetizer, and still did not finish (we were STARVING). So watch yourself. 

The étouffée here is probably one of the best I've ever had and I would also highly recommend the shrimp. (The shrimp sauce with bread is to die for.)

We came in for lunch, it was hot outside and the AC felt amazing inside! We sat at the bar, Jeff served us, and he was wonderful. We had oysters on the half shell and they were the freshest oysters we have ever had. Jeff was friendly and courteous :) I would recommend this place to anyone!

Our server was friendly, and the service was fast. I had the shrimp and grits; it was okay. Tasted sour like there was vinegar in it. Not my favorite, but some may like it. My friend had the blackened shrimp jambalaya which was overcooked. The charbroiled oysters were mediocre in my opinion.

Are you kidding me? Hey. Hey you. Are you kidding me??? This place is absolutely amazing. Amazing with a capital Z. Get the charbroiled oysters (best in the city so far), get the bananas fosters cheesecake and don't be a idiot and not ask to sit in Shanda's section. Best server in the city by far. You'll remember this in the review when she comes to your table. 10/10. Check in via yelp and get a free appetizer up to $10

We just had to go and be typical tourists stopping by this gem of a restaurant in the French Quarter, didn't we?

I was craving oysters so naturally we stepped into the place advertising their oyster bar-- I am definitely glad we did. They house quite a selection of oysters and the ones we had knocked my socks off - super delish! We ordered two rounds, heh.

For the meals, we decided to see how they'd fare at traditional Cajun food. This is where the 1 star got knocked off for me, personally. My grandmother is Cajun so of course my opinion is gonna be a bit skewed but their presentation of etoufee, jambalaya, and gumbo simply didn't impress. I enjoyed the gumbo most of the 3 but overall just felt - meh. That being said, other meals might impress as much as their oyster selection but we simply didn't get the opportunity to try as we both ordered the Cajun sampler.

Otherwise, the service was friendly and quick, which is always nice. Wish it weren't so packed and hot/sticky, but what else do you expect from a touristy spot?
I'm a local. If people ask me were to go for reasonable prices and awesome food, ROYAL HOUSE is my answer.

I enjoyed my dinner--it was a calm patch in a sea of revelry--but my favorite part of my dinner was definitely my side--the smashed potato--and the tartar sauce. The tartar sauce may have been the best I've ever had. Also, I really liked our server, Tina. 
So, would I go here again? Maybe. But with so any choices in NO, probably not.

This was our first stop in New Orleans and it was recommended by several people.  We started with stuffed mushrooms (delicious) and onion soup (also excellent).  For dinner I had the seafood pescatore.  Very flavorful with a little kick.  My husband had the shrimp jumbalaya.  It was a little dry and salty.  With so many great restaurants in NO we would probably not rush to come back.  The service was very good and everyone was very friendly.

I'll give it a 2.6 to 3.0. We had the taste of New Orleans and oysters maque choux. It was OK. Not exciting or surprising. I think it's not worth the price. However, their location has a great view if you are sitting by the window on the second floor.

All of the food here was excellent! We had crab claws, raw oysters, jambalaya, étouffée, and a blackened chicken sandwich. The manager, waiters, and other employees were incredibly polite and seemed happy to help out. Will definitely come back!

Stopped in for lunch today - had a wonderful meal - couple dozen raw oysters that were wonderful as well as some crawfish etoufee and some jambalaya that was an incredible experience. Highly recommended
We had a great time. The waiter TY was energetic and full of spunk. The food was great too. Had the red fish

If your looking for a good meal with great service in the French Quarter this is the place.  Our waiter, Terrance wins the award for the best server in NOLA.   He has an electric smile and wants you to have a great dining experience.  We had the crab claws, onion soup and char boiled oysters.  There speciality drinks are yummy & pretty!

we decided to try this place out bc of the great reviews. that was a bad decision! let me start out by saying that I was on a 3 night girls' trip & we are all fans of cajun & seafood. my biggest regret of my trip was probably eating dinner at this place. our waitress was slooooww & inattentive and the food was terribly mediocre. we actually sent our fish plate back because it did not taste fresh at all.  we found the food bland, the service frustrating, and the ambiance ordinary.  extremely disappointing.

I was disappointed. This place is one of the oldest restaurants in NOLA and there's no AC, so it's very hot. I ordered alligator for my meal and about 10 tiny pieces came out. Thankfully I ordered a dozen oysters on the half shell and they were great. We ordered cosmos and they came out half full (I could've said empty). I didn't even photograph my meal I was so disappointed

I am NOLA local and I had never been to Royal House.. We went on a early Saturday afternoon for lunch, they served a very well made Pineapple Cucumber Mojito, the Fried Alligator and Crab Claw appetizers go well together.. We actually dipped the Fried Alligator into the remaining Crab Claw sauce and it was delightful.  My Blackened Redfish was perfect and our Steak was cooked to order and they let us substitute sides. We never had to wait too long for a drink refill and or food came out sooner that expected I highly recommend this place for Lunch, expect a long line outside for dinner.

We went here after our other planned restaurant closed early. I was initially disappointed because we had planned to eat somewhere else. But you know the saying "everything happens for a reason" well that was very true. The food was great!! We had Shrimp & Grits, Blackened Shrimp Jambalaya, fried shrimp platter. Every dish was seasoned well and cooked to perfection. 

Now to the best part of our visit. Our server was Robert. I highly recommend anyone visiting the restaurant to request to sit in his section. We took a trip from DC to Los Angels and stopped at many of the top restaurants along the way. No one had better service than Robert. He was fun and entertaining. Our kids loved his jokes and magic tricks. He had a plethora of knowledge to provide us about New Orleans. We have never experienced service as attentive, friendly and welcoming as Robert provided. My only regret is that I couldn't give this restaurant and staff a  higher rating.

Felt like I was in New Orleans, and HAD TO get myself a shrimp po-boy before leaving. Had one here that was pretty uninspired and bland. When mayo and ketchup are your saving grace...that's not good. The shrimp tasted fresh though? But damn. That thing was just bread and shrimp. Bleh.

This was our first time in NOLA. We've never had oysters and tried it for the first time here and it was amazing!!! G was an amazing waiter. He gave us great recommendations on what to try. 

We had the charred oysters, raw oysters, stuffed oysters, fried alligator, hush puppies, claws (the greatest sauce I've ever tasted), gumbo and the étouffée. Everything in this place looked and tastes so good. We will definitely be coming back here when we visit again!

In my opinion, best chargrilled oysters in French Quarter. I tried them all, and my favorites are Rockefeller and Royale. Luckily, both are featured in the oyster duo. My companion also enjoyed the fried alligator app. This is a really great place to enjoy a lazy lunch on a balcony with a good book. We live in the Northeast and have been at Royal House of Oysters the year before and it left a great impression, so we are back this year. Also try the cucumber mojito!

This place has it going on! We came for supper and got the free app of crab claws in sum heavenly sauce thanks to yelp check in. I got the shrimp creole and it was pretty good. But what my wife got was the bomb. She got the crawfish ravioli and it was so damn good! 
We got the bananas foster cheesecake afterwards and omg wanted to lick the bowl once done geez. 
The service and staff were very nice! We will be back as soon as we come back to Nola!!

Came for lunch. If you check in on yelp, you also get a free appetizer. We tried the popular crab claws. Though I think they only took off $10 or a partial amount of what the appetizer actually cost. The crab claws were plentiful and swimming in a pretty buttery and oily sauce/broth. It came with little slices of bread too. I wasn't super hungry so I just got a dozen of chargrilled oysters. Lots of cheese and oil. I think I'm a fan of raw oysters more. The chargrilled ones were good but I don't know if I could eat a lot like I could with raw oysters. Just felt super fatty after eating 10 (my friends tried a couple). Also it came with a few slices of bread for different texture and a break from the oysters. My friends both tried the po-boy sandwiches. The restaurant seemed to be a bit on the fancier side. But we did not feel out of place in our casual, comfy clothes.

Food was fantastic, and our waiter Ty was WONDERFUL!!! We had the redfish beignets, alligator bites, shrimp and grits, shrimp and catfish platter, and a Taste of New Orleans, which included gumbo, crawfish étouffée, and chicken and andouille jambalaya!!! We passed played around so everyone could try it all, and even my notoriously PICKY daughters loved it!!! Will definitely be back!!! If you decide to go find TY; you won't regret it!!!
Was looking forward to this place for dinner our last night. Great server and good oysters but our entrees were dry and the vegetables tasted like they came out of a can. We will not go back.

So disappointing. Do not go here. My family and I came to New Orleans on vacation expecting some good eats and this place did not deliver. Prices were high and the food was just bland. I ordered the trio of gumbo, étouffée, and rice. The étouffée was my favorite, but my brother who ordered the same thing said it tasted like it came out of a Campbell's can. The gumbo was just horrible. I've had some great gumbo before and this was far from it. It tasted like old gravy, didn't even have the flavor or meat of normal gumbo. The rice was bleh, dry and tasteless. My mother got the fried oyster pasta and thought it was average as well. I tried it and although I thought that it had a nice airy, light taste, it needed some salt and pepper. Everything here is just very one-note, not much development of flavor. The service was also average. Took a long time to get our food and it was a Monday night, not even that busy. We were waiting so long that we asked for some bread to hold us over. They looked surprised & they brought out some bread that (like everything else) was tasteless. Obviously, they don't serve bread baskets often. The waiter also forgot to bring butter with it. My advice would be to save your money and your time and head somewhere worth your while.
Fabulous food and service. Get the bananas foster cheesecake for sure!
Informal, tasty, convenient, and really friendly service. That's enough . . . if you're in the quarter and you just want to keep it simple!
We sat outside and listened to a wonderful duo on guitar and violin. The verb claws were divine and the oysters superb. Ashley was the best server ever.

This place was great!!!! Next time in NO I'm coming for sure!!! Waiter was great! All his recommendations panned out to be awesome! Blackened redfish, crab claws, redfish beignets!!!! Me and hubby enjoyed! Might have been best meal in NO! Oh and the absolut strawberry lemonade! A must!!
Amazing dinning experience. Came with a party of 4 during essence fest and we were not disappointed one bit. The Crab Claw appetizers is a must have!!! GAME CHANGER!!!

Delicious! Hit the spot on every taste bud! The crab claw appetizer is life changing lol. You can skip out on the crawfish cakes and just order 2 crab appetizers! The banana fist cheesecake is amazing! Getting it with ice cream is a must! Also, G is the best server. Request him if you can.
Acme was closed for a private event, so we went here in search of chargrilled oysters. They were the worst I've ever had.

Walk off of Bourbon Street and try this place out. It was our favorite restaurant during our visit.  We had great food.  The server was very personable and made sure we were well taken care of.  The only negatives were that our appetizer was sent to the wrong table and the drinks were slow to come out of the bar.  When the server is excellent at his job, small hiccups are easy to overlook though.  I highly recommend.

So it has been 6 months since I ate dinner at the Royal House, and all I can think about is planning my next trip to NOLA so I can eat there again. First off, our server, Cindy, was a total pro and super-friendly. Perfectly attentive and helpful. We took advantage of the free appetizer with a Yelp check-in. Cindy navigated us through the menu and wine choices. My husband isn't a huge wine fan, yet we somehow went through several bottles (and no, I didn't drink it all!). The food? Fantastic. I can't remember for the life of me what we ate, but we totally cleaned our plates. The food was so good it still has be yearning to return. The ambiance in the restaurant was very nice, romantic and intimate. It wasn't too noisy or overcrowded, even though the restaurant was full. 

Bottom line: you should go to Royal House.

Somewhat of a tourist place, it still has decent food at decent prices. The balcony offers good views and the servers have always been polite and prompt. The menu is a wide selection of NOLA favorites and mainstays. The bar has some original drinks (strawberry Arnold Palmer) which are refreshing and strong. A local may not find it particularly special when it comes to the food; however, it is a decent place in the quarter to grab a quick bite, take in a good view, or have some drinks with friends. I wouldn't make dinner reservatios here but popping in for lunch is well worth it.

Following a nap after the madness of Bourbon Street during Mardi Gras, we were in search of some awesome New Orleans Cajun/Creole style food that we were so excited to try. I'm so happy that we picked this place because it was exactly what we were looking for. A happy change of pace from the madness of Bourbon Street, a somewhat elegant/classy yet laid back and approachable place to dine for dinner. Something about the ambiance was very classic to me. I wish I could say we ordered alcohol here, but the aftermath of many hurricanes left me yearning for a ginger ale, so I did that. We started with fried alligator which was excellent and perfectly cooked. I ordered a side of gumbo hoping it would settle my stomach, it was OK but the odor was really strange, almost like BO! It made it difficult to eat, got about half way through. I ordered shrimp and grits, and I have to say it was the best shrimp and grits that I have EVER tasted! Nothing compares to the creaminess of these grits and the delicious jumbo shrimp on top. I sadly had to get rid of the last bit of it because I was just too full and still 'woozy' from Mardi Gras madness! But, I always brag about this dish to anyone who asks about our trip to NOLA and I'm hoping some day I can get back and try it again! My boyfriend had the sampler which featured crawfish etouffee and jambalaya. I normally do not like either of these dishes and they were AMAZING when I tried them at Royal House, leaving me open to wanting to try them at different restaurants. This place was just all around great and I'm so happy that we were able to have a nice, romantic dinner here!

My partner and I tried this place when visiting from Austin and WOW! 

This place is a little gem in the French Quarter! The boiled pot meals are very flavorful and have a kick too them, but the potatoes and corn on the cob that come with your meat choice (crab, shrimp, lobster) make the meal. Delicious!!  Ask for Tina when you go to eat, she is super friendly and took great care of us. Definitely worth a meal if you are in NOLA!

We started off with a free appetizer courtesy of a Yelp check-in deal. Turns out the app is only free if it's $10 or less, otherwise it just takes $10 off the price. 

We selected the crab claws which were totally life changing. The other Brett said the same thing and he was right! I'll have to select useful for him. ;) the sauce was amazing and sooo flavorful. They toast some sliced baguette for you to sop up the sauce. Be careful of the little crab claws because they are very crunchy and might break a tooth. Tip: Only eat the tiny bit of claw meat on eat one. 

For the entrée, the waiter recommended several options. I appreciated his friendliness and willingness to explain different options. I almost always ask their opinions. 

I ordered the combo platter which was some gumbo, crayfish, and andouille sausage. Each one came in a separate small bowl. 3 total. Each with a tons of rice and very little meat. I loved the gumbo and the crayfish étouffée but not so much the other. 

Our waiter kept insisting that we order alcohol but we had already had enough before we found this restaurant. Kind of annoying to keep saying no thanks. 

Other than that it was such a great place! I'd recommend it.
The food and the service are great. The bananas foster cheesecake with ice cream is phenomenal!
Excellent! The next time in NO, I'm def going back. The crab claw appetizer was stupendous.
The Po-Boy here was perfect! Delicious bread, perfectly fried shrimp the added seasoning and sauce made it amazing. Not to forget the chargrilled oysters which were amazing as well!

i have had gator before in sausage but i never had it fried in a po-boy. i ordered  crawfist etoufee I have to say this was my first meal ever on my first trip ever to nola and if this was there worse food in nola it set the bar high.

Royal house was hands down my favorite restaurant in NOLA during my short visit there. They also had fabulous service. We had a server with what I thought was a New York accent but she was actually Latina. This place is an oyster house with both cooked & fresh oyster options. I tried the oyster pasta which was linguine pasta tossed with spinach and mushrooms in a scampi sauce and topped with fried oysters. This dish was better than I could have imagined it to be! It was rich & mouth-watering. I also tried the baked shrimp tortellini with jumbo Gulf shrimp tossed in a seafood cream sauce and topped with bread crumbs (then baked). It was good but wasn't as good as the oyster pasta. My favorite dish here was the crab claws appetizer with fresh crab claws sautéed in a lemon, garlic butter sauce with toasted French bread for dipping. There was leftover sauce that me and my friends swooped up with crackers & appetizer bread (that didn't go with the dish). The sauce was finger-licking good & had us wanting to come back for more. We could have ordered a bunch of those appetizers & been satisfied. I also tried a couple of girly cocktails that were just OK. The food however, will not disappoint! The atmosphere is fun too. It is definitely busy & loud.

I really enjoyed this place and thanks to all the reviews on yelp it made me want to try this place even more. It also helped to get $10 of an appetizer for checking in.   We took the recommendation of fellow yelpers and got the crab claws for an appetizer, for me they were to die for. The sauce itself was amazing and flavorful.  For my entree I got one of the seafood pastas and it also tasted amazing. There were clams, mussels, scallops, and shrimp in it. My partner had the taste of New Orleans which had three different dishes on it. Each one was very different and good in its own right.  My favorite on his plate was the crawfish étouffée, and then the gumbo.

The service was very prompt. The only downside of service was the waiter was very pushy with the liquor. If I want a drink I will order a drink. Besides this my water was always full and we were checked on multiple times, which was nice.  Everyone was very friendly and offered advice on where to visit while visiting New Orleans for the first time.

I will be back here on a next visit. The food and service were very good.

If you love oysters then this is the place for you. You have to get the chargrilled oysters. They will change your life. The main course was pretty good too. I had the crawfish raviolis with crab meat. Very delicious and flavorful but the oysters definitely had my heart. I think everyone should experience them just once in their life.
Our waitress, September was awesome. First time in NOLA and just had to try the local cuisine and it was superb. Definitely coming back to the Royal House.

Top notch customer service and all star food. I was even given a pearl a server found as he was shucking the oysters behind the bar. Totally made my day! 

The welcome party on the sidewalk draws you inside and the staff keeps you there. Jeremy the bartender is beyond phenomenal. He makes sure you're comfortable and makes easy conversation. 

I had the shrimp salad with pecans, cranberries, and apples and was not disappointed. It's a bit on the pricey side if you're on a budget; however, I would splurge for them any day!

The food at the Royal House is decent enough, and it would be a good place to take visitors who are not interested in spicy food, but if you like your food with a kick, I would recommend going elsewhere.

I didn't like my blackened shrimp, they were two small and really had no taste, the fried shrimp was good . The tables are extremely too small and drinks were too sweet. Service was okay. Not a big fan .

Oysters were great but entrees were lacking. $10 drinks that were super weak!! Save your money on drinks. Red fish left a lot to be desired and food was inconsistent around our table. Great server by the name of Michael!
Food was great and fast friendly service. We were In and out within an hour on a Saturday at dinner time.
This place was absolutely delicious! You have to try the chargrilled oysters, although it may be on the salty side.
Customer service is at its best. Even how busy they are, they're able to entertain all customers. The food is great. I love their shrimp creole and stuffed mushroom. Will definitely be back.

Stopped here for some snacks and drinks on a weekday night. We had very friendly service and very tasty cocktails to start. My oysters on the half shell were delicious. We also got tomato mozzarella salads and some fries to munch on. Though we didn't dip fully into the menu, I'd come back and see what else they've got cookin'.

Royal House was incredible. We almost ate at another place, but after sitting in the muggy restaurant with no service after 10 minutes we walked over about a block or two and found this place, and we are SO glad we did! We checked in through the Yelp app and received $10 off an appetizer, and decided to try the crab claws. They were amazing! The claws were very meaty, and the sauce was so flavorful and delicious... we actually kept what was left of the sauce and put it on our fried oyster and fried shrimp poboys!! The oysters were a really nice size and fried perfectly. Our waitress was super sweet, and the host who sat us at our table was very polite and personable. Overall the service was great. I would definitely recommend this restaurant to any of my family/friends and can't wait to come back here on my next visit.

Absolutely amazing! Came here friday night with a large group of friends and we only waited about 30 minutes. They let us bring in our drinks (which made dinner a lot cheaper) and I thought this was great!

The chargrilled oysters were amazing (I definitely recommend over the regular on the half shell ones). The crab claws were by far my favorite dish on the menu. I literally could have bathed in that creamy sauce and the table cleared a few plates of this appetizer. Spinach dip was pretty average- nothing too spectacular. 

I got the shrimp and grits which was really good. The shrimp were pretty small but the portion size was HUGE.

Interior and ambience is awesome.
Went last night with some friends, and the food was amazing! our waitress Ms September was knowledgable and extremely courteous! We will be back...

We went here based upon yelp reviews saying it was great and had 4 stars. Sorry but this place sucks! Our food was not fresh and my red fish was so dry and overcooked that it just tasted like charcoal. We were so disappointed coming in starving since we had been on a swamp/plantation tour all day hoping this place would do it. Wouldn't recommend it for the world!

Food was cold, all 7 dishes came out at different times. All food was a disappointment. What a waste of $150. 

Server complaining of no help. He tried but couldn't do it alone.

I will never come back. Too much good food in this town to waste $ here.

Good food, bad service.  We ordered the crab claws as our appetizer and it was very good.  I had the Shrimp & Grits as my entree.  I had to send the order back since the grits were cold.  My partners rice was lukewarm but he said not to make a fuss so I only complained about the grits.  When the waiter returned with my plate it appeared it had been zapped it the microwave since I could tell where I had tasted the grits when it was first served; however, it was good.  After the waiter brought the plate he never returned to check on our table unless I flagged him down. The waiter was very inattentive and I spent most of my time trying to get his attention.  He had one table on the balcony that he continued to cater to.  I was facing the balcony and he was in & out numerous times but never looked our way.  I had to ask another waiter to bring water twice.  Then no one ever returned to pick up our plates after we had finished our meals.  I waited 10 minutes before I flagged down yet another waiter to remove the plates so we could relax and finish our bottle of wine.  The manager finally come over and I voiced our concerns over the bad service.  He was very nice & apologetic and comped the price of the bottle of wine.  We did appreciate that the manager was sincerely concerned about our experience.  I would give them another chance but with another waiter.

Came here while we were in NOLA for the weekend. We were told the wait was 30 mins, so we started walking around instead of waiting in line. Came back after 20 minutes to find out our names had already been called. The staff was able to find us a seat on the balcony, which was lovely. Service is amazing, food was okay. The jambalaya was too dry and too salty.

A perfect Bloody Mary high on a balcony overlooking the action below?  Why yes!  Sounds like a way to wile away an afternoon in NOLA.

We arrived and told the hostess we only had two requests, Bloody Mary's and an outdoor seat.  She smiled and said, "come this way".  And so we did.  

We walked through the bar, up the stairs, though the dining room and out on a narrow ledge with darling bistro tables.  And so there we sat, watching the show of people below us who had no idea that right above their heads were ladies sipping on their Bloody Mary's watching the world go by.

Can't talk about the food, but for that moment, life was pretty great!  Funny the effect a nicely poured Bloody Mary can make on a day.

Stop in and have your own special moment!

Don't know why it has 4 stars. It wasn't bad, but nothing better than any of the hundred touristy places in the French quarter. Cool building, nice vibe that's about it. 
Food was average at best. They wouldn't let me mix shrimp and oyster poboy together, really strange? Like it all comes out the same deep fryer, you can't combine them on a sandwich? And the shrimp were tiny. 
I'd go to any of the places on Bourbon street if you're looking for a poboy or oysters, at least you'll have the people watching show all around you.

Royal House is delicious with truly amazing staff members. We had Becks as our waitress (the best ever) and she was completely honest about food choices, funny, sweet, amenable, and just so easy going. 

We started off with oysters and the crab claw appetizer. HOLY YUM!!!! Oysters were fresh, you know the Nawlins way; the crab claws were to die for!!! The sauce was magical and the claws were fresh as well. 

Dinner was amazeballs! So worth it! 

Definitely try and stop by for the food & desserts here

This is a good place to go for lunch, or dinner for someone on a little bit of a budget. The food was ok but not great. We had the gumbo and jambalaya and they were both a little bland. Needed salt and Tabasco (which many folks add to the food down here anyway). Once we added this, they were much tastier. The building is old and has a lot of character. The service was great!
This place was bomb! The service was very friendly and the Taste of New Orleans entree is a great way for a newcomer to get a feel of what he or she is going to like for the rest of their stay :)

Had lunch with the family here on a Sunday. No wait. We sat upstairs, good ambience. Walked out on balcony & posed for a few pictures after we ordered food. Ty was our server and he was excellent!!! Top service & he was very sociable with us. 

Everything we had was delicious!!!

Tomato & Mozzarella Salad 
Oyster Combo: Chargrilled, Rockefeller, Royale
BLT-O Po-Boy 
Crispy Fried Fish Platter 
Cajun Bloody Mary
NOLA Blonde Ale
I work in a hotel nearby and always recommend royal house. Good food, fair prices, and really lovely atmosphere make for a dinner spot everyone loves. Thanks for always doing such a great job!

When I eat at a place like this, I expect the best food and the best service around. The oysters are usually small and service is hectic. The food itself tastes great, but there are many things that could be improved on in the entire experience. I like the oysters Rockefeller and the charbroiled oysters. Not a terrible place if you are in the quarter, but for good oysters, go to Casamentos!

I was walking around downtown with my friend and his family from New York. They were tired of walking, hungry, and we didn't want them to get taken aback by the prices in the front of the quarter. We settled on the Royal House which ended up being a great decision.

I got the shrimp poboy and we had a sampling of jambalaya, crawfish etouffe, and gumbo as well as some fried alligator. The food was made well. The prices are reasonable and the service was excellent. 

Good choice if you are visiting the city in the Quarter and can't decide where to go.
Music great drinks not so much had a long island ice tea and it was very weak.  Would go back for the music definitely.  Loved the decor waitress ok but we enjoyed the band.

On our way home from Biloxi, Mississippi, my family decided to stop by New Orleans to eat. 
It was a trouble finding a place to park. After 30 minutes of scrambling around to find a parking spot, a saxophone player told us that there was a public parking lot (I think we paid to park) near the area. 

When we arrived to the place (late at night), we were seated by our waiter. He was very fancy-like and funny. The place was packed! On our way to our table, people left and right were slurping down oysters. We knew we had to get some, so my cousin's father decided to ordered four dozens for the entire family. 
I ordered the Alligator appetizing. It indeed tasted like popcorn-chicken, however, it has a smell to it. It was served with cocktail sauce. 

After finishing the alligator, our oysters arrived. Delicious. 

Later, my entree, Taste of New Orleans, arrived. There were three small/tall cups filled with different flavors. Two gumbos and one Jambalaya rice (?) with sausage. The orange gumbo was my favorite. It tasted very creamy... almost like butternut squash soup (heavenly). It had crawfish tails in it.  The brown gumbo, not my favorite though (even though I slurped all of it) taste kinda burnt. However, the Jambalaya and the Crawfish gumbo made up for it. 

When everyone finished, we agreed that this was the best meal we have had throughout our trip. I wish I could come to this place again. Best experience ever.

I loved this restaurant. It was the first place my family and I actually got good service at during our trip to NOLA from NY. The food is great and the staff was friendly and our waiter Jihad (G) was the best. He was very attentive, social and funny! He really made sure we were all taken care of and was so nice.
