No one had anything bad to say about the food, we were all pleased with what we got. And if you come here, you HAVE to get their banana foster cheesecake... best dessert in NOLA.

I was on vacation and food hunting was one of my top priorities and found this restaurant on yelp based on 4 stars... however i would give it a 3. I was pleasantly greeted at the door from a host who was very welcoming. The restaurant is quaint and well lit which was good. I ordered the stuffed mushrooms with seafood stuffing which were delicious and cooked to perfection I would give the dish a 3.5 , I also ordered the red-fish beignet which is a staple dish for the area and that also was pretty good, I have a sweet tooth so this appetizer to some would be considered a dessert but wasn't as sweet as one would expect but a very unusual and pleasant taste I would give it a 4. For the main course I had the baked shrimp tortellini topped with breadcrumbs and then baked.. I liked the consistency of the sauce but it was overly salty which I didn't discover until i had my left-overs as I was recovering from the sweet from the beignet. I also ordered the Oyster Pasta which had Linguine Pasta with spinach and mushrooms in a scampi sauce. The concept and taste was good but i never understand why someone would put fried protein on top of a sauce... we asked to have the oysters grilled or chared but that wasn't an option. Overall I give the food and my experience 3 stars. pics below

Would have given 5 stars because the food was good and we loved our balcony seating, BUT I ordered red fish and was served talapia.  I pointed this out to our waitress Cindy F who got a little huffy over it and said she is in and out of the kitchen and the boxes say "red fish".  I frequently eat talapia and know what it looks like and tastes like, and I was served a $1.50 talapia filet for the $23 price of red fish.

Ok ... Let's start with the crab claw appetizer. It is amazing! BUT, if you get it do not get another cream based meal like the crawfish ravioli. The ravioli is really really good; however, after the appetizer ... Will not taste as good. I had and would suggest something more like the shrimp creole, which was also amazing. The hurricanes are fantastic, be careful, they go down real easy.

The food was almost as spectacular as the service!!! I honestly have never felt more welcome and at ease in a restaurant. Our server was friendly, fast, and helpful when suggesting menu selections. The food was absolutely amazing. And our table by the open windows had a perfect view of the live jazz music being played on the street corner. It was an almost magical night that we won't soon forget!
Perfectly prepared, wonderfully seasoned... Exactly what Cajun cooking should be. This place was incredible
Good is good. Love the ouster puff pastries! Perfect location, convenient for after drinking.

First of all ask for Ty. Best waiter ever and I was a waiter. Listen to his recommendations and enjoy your meal!  Everyone was eating off of each other's plates, even the picky eaters. The sauces are amazing. Oyster pasta ,fried gator a must.

Stop here on road trip. The food was excellent, the view is nice but a bit hot during New Orleans summer. We had the recommended by the waiter which was very good.

The decoration is classic, and match with the surrounding store. Good food and atmosphere but probably not enough to come back regularly.

I've been to the Royal House three times, each time better than the last. All of the Po'Boys are delicious and be sure to try the soups! I'm sure everything else is great too, I just haven't had the opportunity to try anything else - yet.

I have no idea why this place has such high ratings.  We went here when we visited new orleans based on the reviews and was totally disapppointed.  The food was NOT good at all.  We ordered shrimp & grits, new orleans trio, oyster pasta, and garlic mashed potatoes.  All were terrible especially the garlic mash, it tasted like straight up salt! The only good thing was our waiter, who was attentive and funny.

Had alligator bites and side of jambalaya , AMAZING! Had never tried alligator , and it really does taste like chicken. It was a perfect small dinner to eat with a friend right before we were going out to drink and party in Nola. Our waiter was Terrance was awesome, pure gentlemen and also down to earth.
Grilled oysters are so damn good! Charming and quaint. We got right in for dinner, no wait time at all. Friendly server also!

We stopped in this place to escape re heat and grab a bite. I had the Oysters Royale which was good but not awesome. My mom got the Chargrilled Oysters and loved them. One review said they were a religious experience and she agreed.

Wonderful! Oscar, our waiter, had great recommendations. We had the chargrilled oysters...melted in our mouth. Yum! The seafood pot was perfect. The pescatore with scampi sauce was lovely. We'll definitely go back again!
I had the oyster tacos and they were delish! The people that work here are so incredibly nice. Loved it!!!

Crawfish étouffée was recommended and I found it to be bland, even after adding hot sauce. Server Cindy had a bad attitude. Hey at least I saved calories by not finishing my meal, and money by not tipping as well as I normally do.
Pretty good not knock your socks off. You best believe will pay tourist prices here.  I had crawfish étouffée. Pretty good but for sure not the best. Service is great here good honest people serving.

This is the best southern food I've had! It was amazing. Our waiter was excellent as well - very attentive and had great recommendations. Great atmosphere and a nice place.

We ordered the Alligator PO' boy with the house sauce and the Taste of New Orleans (a sampling of the Chicken & Andouille Jambalaya, Crawfish Etouffee, and Seafood Gumbo.) It was all amazing!! Adding the Louisiana hot sauce to some of it for extra flavor made it perfect.

The drinks were fun and we went with the recommended from the server - fresh fruit for margaritas and a fun spiked lemonade.

It was all great and if we are back in New Orleans we will be back!

Great place, good food, wonderful atmosphere!  

The Muffallatta was DEVINE!  My husband had the Red Rice & Beans and was very happy.  Our boys had the steak Po Boys and practically inhaled them.  Our waitress was very friendly and attentive. We did not feel rushed AT ALL. We ate here while on Vacation as it was my Birthday and the waitress brought over BIRTHDAY SHOTS at the end of our meal to celebrate my birthday.  All in all a VERY GOOD meal, EXCELLENT service and GREAT Atmosphere! I highly recommend this place to anyone and everyone.

Service - Very nice waitress who gave us tips on the menu as well as good advice for us tourists for things to do after in the area. 
Raw oysters - very fresh and tasty, but several of them were covered in mud which made it messy, and a few had the dreaded sand crunch when you ate them. 

Chargrilled oysters - Honestly this was one of the best things I have ever eaten. Absolutely delicious and came paired with some bread to soak up all the remnants remaining in the half shell. The only thing I might suggest is for them to give you a little more bread with it because I enjoyed that part so much as well. MUST ORDER this item when you come here. I ordered the half dozen and next time I would order a full dozen to myself.

The food was extremely salty. The server was bit rude and actually got mad when we asked to split checks when we sat down (for business expense purposes). We didn't even have crazy orders. Service was only okay

I honestly have no clue how this restaurant has 4 stars! 

Our server was so lovely. She checked in on us several times and was extremely humorous. Bumped the overall experience up a star. 

The food was all around disappointing. We were only in New Orleans for one night and wanted to have a great experience with seafood and had seen great reviews via yelp. 

The crab claws had a great flavor, but was 95% sauce and 5% crab claws. The crab claws were also extremely tiny and had little to no meat. The bread was buttered but would've been much tastier slightly toasted. 

My sister ordered a crawfish ravioli which was good, but had a less than generous portion size for the price. My father and I wanted to be adventurous and try to the Alaskan crab boiler pot. 

THIS IS NOT ENOUGH FOR TWO PEOPLE AS WE WERE TOLD. The Alaskan crab boiler "pot" had one half of a corn, four legs of crab, and two potatoes. 

Are you kidding me? This is a boiler pot! Fill it with some more corn (this is hella cheap anyways) other than one measly half cob. Add some crawfish, some mussels, shrimp or anything to fill the emptiness of the pot. This was absurdly overpriced and just not worth it. 

Go somewhere else.
Food was very Good it's in my top 10 spots. I enjoyed my meal and the service was very pleasant to me!!!!

We come to NOLA every summer and Royal House never disappoints!!! We like to sit upstairs at the bar bc the bartenders are really friendly! The Bloody Mary's are made with a house vodka! Delicious!!! We started with the oysters; both raw and char-broiled. Yummy!!! Then the crab fingers were our free appetizer  with the Yelp app. The sauce was amazing!! Husband got shrimp and grits and loved it. I got the red fish. It was overcooked a bit.... But the sauce from the appetizer made up for it. Highly recommend! But sit at UPSTAIRS bar!! Great service!

This place was so good we ended up coming back for a 2nd time during our first visit to NO about a year and a half ago.  

Great place to come late at night after raising some hell at the local bars.

Highlights included crab claws, blue cheese oysters, gumbo, Bloody Mary's and more.  

The service was also great from the bartender (we ate at the bar both times) and greeter who graciously let us bring in some outside pizza my girlfriend had purchased from a vendor prior to knowing we were heading back to Royal House.  She ended up giving it to someone in need but a nice gesture nonetheless when other establishments could understandably take a more hard-line approach.  

Can't wait to come back to NO and can't wait to come back to Royal House for more great, authentic, NO-style late night eats!

Our server was great! She made some suggestions- crab claw appetizer: it was very delicious (uh, can you say buttuh?!?), but so few crab claws, and they were so tiny that it was extremely disappointing. She said we would get a lot more with this appetizer for our family of 5 than with the alligator we were going to try, so when we each only got to try one claw each, the kids were not happy (and I got stuck with one that had no meat at all). However, the broth was so delicious we quickly forgot our disappointment. ;-)
     We ordered the oyster pasta, and she said that was her favorite dish... Um, yeah!! It was AMAZING!! Healthy, no. But the fried oysters with the BUTTERY sauce was a little slice of heaven!
     We also ordered the New Orleans Plate (sampler)- crawfish étouffée was really good, jambalaya was REALLY DRY and not good. Tasted like bad left-overs. Just not good. Gumbo was ok, hubby liked it more than me- I thought it had a greasy meat flavor that turned me off, but it was better than that nasty jambalaya. I wouldn't suggest 
     Kids had the chicken fingers- kid approved! And Mac-n-Chz- always kills me to pay 7 bucks for a little bowl of Kraft mac-n-chz, but they were hot and grumpy, so I didn't argue. It came out looking like it sat under the warmer got a while, but kids didn't care.
     The entrees were around $17-$20, so about average for the area. 
     It was a good experience, but with so many other places, I wouldn't go back- although that oyster pasta might be worth a trip.
A delicious dinner!  We LOVED the chargrilled oysters!  Our server, Ashley, was incredibly friendly with very attentive service.  We had lots of laughs :) thank you!!
Great service. Oysters Royale are a most as well as the crab claws. Ask for balcony dinning for late afternoon & evening occasions.

This place is a bit of a hit or miss. By that i mean depending on what you order, you will either love it or not. 

Service: Amazing service! They're super nice and make sure that you are taken care of. I'm one of those tourists that ask soooo many questions, but they answered every single questions with a smile! Definitely one of the reasons why I went here more than once during my trip.

Food: The crab claws...AMAZING!!!!!!!! We also ordered oysters, fried alligator, gumbo, and jambalaya. These were just ok. Minus 2 stars since the other time we went, we found ourselves just wanting the crab claws. The other dishes were not as flavorful as I would like them to be. It was ok though. 

Overall, I would go here again mainly for the crab claw appetizer. The service is great, but everything else was jsut ok.
Comfortable place, feel at home. Very good crab claws and all entrees are good. The only complaint is that the tables are so small for the amount of food that we ordered

I came here for the light dinner. I ordered grilled chicken salad and it was great!!!!   Highly recommended for that light dinner.  And I saw great oysters at the bar and would like to try that sometimes.

I was in New Orleans for five days and went here twice, the waitress recommended the crab claws and the red fish beignet as appetizers and OH MY GOODNESS!!!!! They were awesome!!! Everyone in my party enjoyed their meals on both visits. A definite must when visiting this beautiful city!!!! I can't wait to return!!!!
Sat on the balcony which was a little small but had a great view. Service was quick and waiter was awesome. Food was delicious too!

Royal House is a small place and fills up quickly.  There seems to always be a wait to get in, but as long as its not too long a wait, like 15 or 20 min, I'd wait for it.  On my most recent visit, I popped in by myself and sat at the bar and ordered up my favorite cocktail from here- called the Grey Goose Drunken Shirley.  It's basically an alcoholic version of a Shirley Temple- (just add vodka!) and I got an order of the appetizer Oyster tacos.  I was a bit disappointed that they were so small. I was expecting fried oysters in mini soft taco shells but it was more like 4 nacho chips (thick pita type chips) topped with fried oysters and pico-de-gallo type toppings and sauce.  Good, but not what I expected and not filling enough.    

Since I was still hungry, I ordered a half dozen of the oyster duo - which is 3 oysters Rockefeller and 3 prepared another way, which I'm drawing a blank on at the moment.  Service was quick and the guys behind the oyster bar could not be friendlier.  I'm a local and don't come down to the quarter to eat all that often, but Royal House is a good bet when I'm in the area looking for someplace casual to pop in.

This was the first place my boyfriend and I ate on our trip to NOLA. It was so good, we decided we'd end our trip and have our last meal here as well. During our first trip, I ordered the taste of New Orleans, where I got to try their crawfish etouffee, jambalaya, and gumbo. My boyfriend ordered their alligator poboy. We both ordered drinks as well. $10 for a top shelf mixed drink... in a tall glass?! I'm in!! 

Although all three dishes were great, I fell in love with their crawfish etouffee. It was the first time I tried and and even tried it in different restaurants but Royal House wins. Their service was amazing, great quality food, reasonable prices. I would highly recommend this place to anyone planning on a trip to NOLA.

I make a bee-line to this place whenever I have the occasion to be in New Orleans hoping that one day I'll get to sit on the balcony and people-watch. While the Grande Scheme has never been fully executed, I still manage to enjoy sitting at the bar downstairs or up. Service is very attentive, and food is everything for which one could wish for in New Orleans. I had the linguine pasta tossed with spinach and mushrooms in a scampi sauce and topped with fried oysters. Usually I just get the signature grilled oysters, a loaf of french bread, and a nice refreshing Long Island Iced Tea. Bring a date: Outside seating is for 2/table max.
Awesome food and our server Magen was fantastic! Try the crab claw appetizer and ask for extra bread to dip in that awesome sauce. I could just order a bowl of that for a meal and be happy!
Great oysters! Loved the staff and ambience. Nice selection of beer and full bar. Great Happy Hour spot in the French Quarter.
We had crawfish ravioli , crawfish étouffée , shrimp po boy and hush puppies. Our appetizer was the mushrooms and crab claws ...amazing!!

Balcony seating was really nice. Although I'm not sure about the safety of the balcony itself. The waiter was great - friendly and polite. My redfish was overcooked. The potatoes were incredible. I suggest you just order the potatoes as a meal! My husband had the crawfish ravioli which he enjoyed but it was light on the crab bits promised in the description. Expected more for the price. Probably wouldn't eat here again.

Ok. Got here around 8 on a Friday. No wait even though there was a long line. We were able to sit right down. We wanted to order the seafood pot, but the waiter told us that it may be sold out already. There were not any Dungeoness crabs, or hardly any seafood that was shellfish available. He told us that there were three lobsters swimming around in the tank, so we urged him to reserve two of those for us. We ordered the raw oysters first, they were very good. The seafood pots were good. The only problem was that since it was probably
The last of the seafood, my corn was a cob of salty water. It was soggy. Between this and the fact that the waiter told us that seafood was already sold out at 5pm at the start of his shift just kind of irritated me. You can't have a restaurant in the FQ and not have an adequate supply of anything. This iand the extreme hecticness of the waitstaff dropping trays of prepared food and running into each other was just too much. The food gets a 4.5 but everything else....lets just stick with the food. 
The GM was there. I must say he was even bussing tables and keeping things moving. Kudos to him. I couldn't see his name.

Rarely do I give a restaurant five stars, but this was one of the best dining experiences I've had in NOLA. We were seated by the general manager, who gave us a very warm welcome. Our server, Ty, totally made the experience...he knew the menu inside and out, and led us to amazing dishes we might not have chosen otherwise. The crawfish cakes, and the jambalaya and blackened shrimp are not to be missed. The Redfish is some of the best I ever had, and the batter on the fried shrimp platter was perfect. If you want classic Louisiana favorites, this place is not to be missed!
Great staff and great food!! We will definitely be going back on our next trip. Has seating upstairs and downstairs.

Grilled Oysters and Shrimp Jambalaya -- both were excellent and as expected, served hot and done to a turn. Service was prompt and excellent. If you want something special just ask Chris, my waiter. The jambalaya is done in the traditional New Orleans manner, not soupy.

Love, love the oyster duo and stuffed mushrooms with shrimp.  We arrived on a Saturday night before the rush and sat outside. Our sever disappeared and the next server made up for it. 

I usually do not enjoy oysters but after this trip I love my oysters. Oyster duo is a 1/2 dozen of oysters Rockefeller and oyster royal bubbly goodness with seasonings and neither took away from the freshness of the seafood.

Stuffed mushrooms button mushrooms stuffed with seafood stuffing and broiled to goodness.

I wish I had just ordered the dozen oysters to start instead of half dozen.

My husband and I went to Royal House on the first night of our New Orleans trip. So glad we chose it. He was very happy with his oysters and I had the sampler plate that came with crawfish étouffée, gumbo and jambalaya. This was probably my favorite meal during the time we spent in NOLA. Also we were seated quickly even though there was a line outside and wait staff was very friendly. Highly recommend this place for a nice dinner that doesn't break the bank!

We requested balcony seating and were sat right away, surprisingly. We started with redfish beignets which were really tasty - fluffy batter fried fish with powdered sugar and a sweet reduction. We also had two cocktails - the Outdoor Living and the Hummingbird (hummingbird was so strong I had to have them bring me more cranberry juice for it!). 

I had the fried oyster po boy (the oysters were a little soggy but the flavor was good) and my wife had a blackened chicken sandwich. We both had fries.

Service was fine but once our food was dropped we had to wait awhile for our server to come back so we could request condiments. The atmosphere was nice (just super hot, but that's to be expected in New Orleans in August). Our server was very accommodating and invited us to stay and chat comfortably, brought us to go cups for our cocktails and was overall very hospitable. 

I really enjoyed our meal here and would come back.

You can't go wrong eating at the Royal House.  The atmosphere was very relaxed and the service was an extension of their southern hospitality.  For starters he had the Oyster Rockefeller and French onion soup followed by the crawfish étouffée.  It was a great experience and would highly recommend this restaurant.

This place amazing service, they were able to take our large party on short notice. The waitress was very helpful to the people in our party that had never been to New Orleans. The étouffée was out of this world, the flavors were amazing and memorable.

Yes, I know this place is touristy, but the food is actually pretty good. I'll admit - I haven't been in awhile. I remember their fried shrimp and their pastas are very good. Their chargrilled oysters rival those of Acme (they have way more cheese!). They also have good cocktails. Their prices are fairly high, but tell them you're a local for 15% off! 

Their service is a little slow, so be prepared for that. Ask to sit upstairs!

My friend and I had lunch here. I had Shrimp and grits and my friend had blackened red fish. My shrimp and grits were great!! My friend's blackened red fish was awesome!! I love those potatoes that came with her red fish. I don't know how they make it but they were so good!!!!! The Red fish was perfectly seasoned, tender and juicy.  Even the vegetables that came with the fish were so good!! I love the way the vegetables were cooked, crispy tender. Shrimp and grits were hooray!! I also got a Hurricane. Real juice and lots of rum! Fantastic!
Great menu with plenty of amazing choices!  Staff very friendly, knowledgable, and readily offer help.  Definitely the place to go if you want something nice but casual.

The BEST raw oyster place I've had in New Orleans so far. 

I'm very sensitive to smell and taste when it comes to raw seafood, but the raw oysters here were so good and fresh that I could eat them without any sauce or even lemon slices. This has never happen before. 

I strongly recommend the dozen raw oysters if you want to taste the ocean. We also got the Oyster Duo to try. The duo was very tasty, too!

The service was great! He gave good recommendations from cocktails to entrées, and was very responsive whenever we needed him. 

If you happen to be in the area, make sure you give Royal House a try!

I'm dedicating this review solely to the dessert here. Make sure you order the Bananas Foster Cheesecake. You will not be disappointed. The flavor is out of this world. It's a great dessert to share for two people.

After walking around Bourbon Street and getting hungry for some good New Orleans jambalaya and gumbo, we came across Royal House... And boy were we glad! We added our name to this list and anxiously awaited for our name to be called so we can get some good food! 

We waited only like 20mins (thank God!) and we were seated... Upstairs, like ROYALty! :) (see what I did there?! Lol) As soon as we got seated, the most pleasant and amazing server, September, came over to help us. She was so wonderful and extremely informative and helpful with our ordering, and also recommended delicious entree options. Of course, when you're traveling out of state, you ALWAYS take the servers recommendation -- and September was awesome! She recommended the Crawfish Ravioli (which I ended up ordering and was absolutely finger-licking good), and the gumbo, and a few other dishes. 

To start, we went with Fried Alligator -- 'cause when in New Orleans, you GOTTA have 'gator. For entrees, we ordered the Shrimp Creole, Taste of New Orleans, and of course I ordered the Crawfish Ravioli.

When our food came, our mouths began salivating just from the smell. Once the food was on our table, all it took was one bite, and wowza -- our tastebuds were having a party of their own; all the flavors went together so nicely, with just the right touch of Cajun spiciness. It was incredible! So flavorful and tasty, absolutely finger-licking good (but don't worry, we ate with our utensils, not our fingers.) I, for one, had never had crawfish before either, and I almost ate the entire portion (couldn't though 'cause it was quite a lot of food.) I now understand why people LOVE Louisiana cookin'... It was awesome! And they definitely don't skimp on that "Southern Hospitality". Thank you, September, for being such an awesome server, and making our experience in New Orleans unforgettable!

Well, I just want to start off by saying our server, CJ, was so sweet and very wonderful to us. That being said, there was a very rowdy bunch of boys seated at a table near us so we asked to move, which we were put on the balcony and that was super nice. I ordered the caprese salad and the shrimp on it was not cleaned and the tomatoes still had the green part in the middle. The person I was with, ordered the oyster duo. He said they tasted good but when he went to eat one of them, there were little bits of shell in it and he ended up throwing that up in his napkin and became pretty embarrassed and didn't touch anything after that. But I want to reiterate that our server was awesome and I didn't have the heart to tell him about the sub par food after we had been such problems. I think that normally they are pretty on point because the flavor was great. It was just the fine details that made our experience not so great. I would definitely try it again with hopes that next time, it's a little more refined.

One of the worst dining experiences we have had in New Orleans. When we first were seated a beer was spilled on my husband and it took at least ten minutes for the server to even come to our table. We ordered an appetizer, alligator bites, and it came out speedy and was tasty. We placed our order the second time the waitress was at the table. We waited almost an hour for our food. We eventually said we just wanted our bill for the drinks and appetizers so we could just go elsewhere. Took over ten minutes for the manager and bill after we asked for it. Never coming here again.

BF and I went there last night due to a local's recommendation- we ordered the alligator bites, shrimp creole and shrimp n grits. The gator bites took a while to come out due to some issues with the fryer- and for $11, it was in a tiny cup 3/4 full and definitely not crisp. Then the shrimp creole rice was dry and clumpy and the sauce  had pieces of shell left in it. It seemed that the shrimps in the creole were not deveined and the shrimp and grits were half deveined. Server wasn't really around and we got the shrimp creole meal recooked, but nothing else was done. (She didn't even dare ask how our meal was after we got a new shrimp creole dish too). I was originally going to give it two stars but dropped down to one since we overheard two other tables had something wrong with their meals too (oyster had something that shouldn't be in it, the Po boy was cold). All in all, complete disappointment and waste of our time and $80 to be there on our short vacation.

So delicious. Get the chargrilled oysters. The red fish beignets are good as well if you like sweet. We sat at the bar and the two bartenders that helped us were AMAZING. I've never experienced such great service from people so busy. You guys rock.

Everytime I go to Nola, I visit this place.

The first thing I fell in love with was the raw oysters.. Having had them at so many places this one is one of my favorites.  Then we ordered the crab claws and those are incredibly decadent and delicious! We used the bread to finish every last drop of sauce and were so full that we HAD to return another time so we could get to the main courses!  I'm not a fan of gumbo ever, but my boyfriend really liked it here, I've had the crawfish ravioli and that was good.  Also we always sat at the bar and everyone that served us there was great!  From recommending food choices to crafting the perfect (off menu) cocktail for me, they exceeded our service expectations.

One of the best spots in the quarters everything was tasty. I had the seafood pescatore with a white wine sauce the seafood was plentiful and flavorful. My server Tina was awesome very attentive and very knowledgeable on the different cuisines.

Cheerful service in a convenient French Quarter location, and the food was scrumptious!  My companion had the baked shrimp tortellini - it was cooked perfectly with a creamy garlicky sauce. I had the Taste of New Orleans trio and it was delicious!
Oyster sampler was FANTASTIC!!! Next time I'm in NOLA, I'll be sure to get here.

It's only been about 12 hours but I'm dying to return. The food was amazing, the service was great and I loved the atmosphere of the place! 

We were seated immediately around noon in the surprisingly empty restaurant and were overwhelmed with the menu. The waiter helped us through it and told us some of the most popular dishes (all of which were brought up in reviews on Yelp already). We ended up getting the Crab Claws, the Chargrilled Oysters, the Royale Oysters and the Taste of New Orleans paired with two Sam Adams. 

The oysters were probably the best I've ever had. They were super fresh and seasoned amazingly. At first I thought the chargrilled oysters were too much because of the amount of sauce/cheese but I scooped some of it off and it was PERFECT. The Royale oysters were cooked to perfection and went reallyw well with the seafood topping. I highly recommend pairing these with beers because we really enjoyed it.

The crab claws came out next and despite the rave reviews it got on Yelp, I wasn't impressed. It was barely warm enough and bland compared to the rest of the food. By itself the flavor wasn't bad but it just paled in comparison. We also didn't think it was that fresh because it didn't seem warm enough and it was in that awkward maybe-it's-supposed-to-be-crispy-or-maybe-not phase. 

The taste of New Orleans was above average in my eyes. I LOVED the crawfish étouffée and kinda wished I got that by itself. The jambalaya was also good with nice flavors but a little dry. And finally the gumbo wasn't bad. I liked it but it wasn't mind-blowing. This dish would probably get a 3.5/5 for me. 

However, the service was awesome and the oysters made the trip worth it. I would definitely recommend coming here!!

Update: we couldn't stop talking about the oysters and ended up coming back the next day for more!! 

We got the Rockefeller oysters and the second grilled oysters (forgot the name - starts with an M?) Just as good as we remembered. Each oyster has its own unique flavor and seasoning but they're all cooked to perfection. 

If I could, I would just come here for the oysters. Super tasty!
Great food in a festive atmosphere. The food is great. The service was attentive even on a busy night. Don't miss this eating opportunity.

The Royal House stands out even in a city full of great food. Seriously one of the best meals my wife and I have ever had. 

If you have a choice, sit upstairs and on the balcony if the weather is agreeable. The atmosphere is great - busy yet homey. 

First, we got the Crab Claws for an appetizer. Easily could have ordered two as an entree. 

For the entrees we got the Seafood Pescatore and the Shrimp Creole. Each equally as good with different tastes. The only downside is that at some point, we were out of food. 

I would have taken a picture but we ate it too fast.

We have patronized the Royal House every time we are in New Orleans and always have a great meal! We had the char-grilled oysters, crab claws, stuffed mushrooms, and bread pudding for dessert. Our food was just as good as last time! Our waiter Tyrone was amazing! He was personable and attentive...he just had a baby boy and couldn't be happier!

With all the food places in the French Quarter and only 4 days to try as many as possible, I didn't think I'd end up at the same place twice, but I did eat dinner here two nights in a row. The first night I had the Shrimp and Grits. It was delicious. The grits were flavored with peppers and gouda cheese and the shrimp and sauce on top was amazing. I loved it. The next night I went with the seafood stuffed mushrooms and shared roasted oysters with a friend before enjoying the bread pudding for dessert. It was my birthday and they dressed the plate up beautifully for my celebration. A fun atmosphere for a special night. I will definitely be back for more on my next venture to New Orleans.

We had three courses and do not have a complaint for any of it!  There where 8 of us that a pretty big foodies and they all said thumbs up on their food! Derrek was our waiter and he was just as good as the food!

Came here on a week vacation with my bff, left with a full clam belly and tons of memories all thanks to Royal House. The fried oyster pasta is LITERALLY the best thing I have ever eaten ( seriously I dream about it) A little more hungry? split a dip with a friend or a lover.  Beware after 9 pm there may be ghost tours mingling outside. Hop on one if interested, never a dull moment if you are down for a spook.

I just happened upon Royal House while trying to figure out where to go for dinner with my son when we visited my daughter in New Orleans.  I was attracted by the menu I found while on-line looking for places close to our hotel (Canal Street). The food is delicious, artful,  and has options for vegetarians like me! My son got a beautiful salad, presented on a rosemary skewer which was as pretty as a flower arrangement, delicious too. The atmosphere is very lovely, classic French Quarter decor with chandeliers, french doors, hardwood floors and a balcony on the perimeter. The prices here are very reasonable too compared with some of the better known, pricey, restaurants.  Lovely place for enjoying the more subtle charm of New Orleans.
Very friendly! The food is awesome and they give you generous portions. The homemade bread pudding is delicious.
Great service, delicious food and reasonable prices. I'd highly recommend Royal House to anyone visiting New Orleans!
One of my new favorite restaurants. Great food. Try the shrimp jambalaya or the or the seafood pescatore. For dessert, the bread pudding or the bananas foster cheese cake is incredible!
Popped into this place while visiting New Orleans. The oysters and calamari were delicious. We also sampled the Taste of New Orleans trio. Very tasty, but all the dishes seemed similar.

Go for the Shrimp and Grits, these are worthy of five stars alone. Best I had while at the FQ. They offer balcony seating so you can people watch, thats always fun. My visit was more like a hit and run... so I cant really say much about anything else. Other than the shrimp & grits were the bomb.
Very good, has a balcony, nice staff and enjoy New Orleans

The yelp reviews are spot on! This place is fantastic! Great food, and fabulous service! The Banana Foster Cheesecake is to die for! This place absolutely deserves 5 stars! We might even return again before we leave!

We came to the Royal House last week and it was great. There was no wait and we were seated immediately. The service was really good. Christian, our waitress was very knowledgeable about the menu and knew exactly what meal she should recommend us based on our preference. 

We had the crab claws which was really good for our appetizer. I had the redfish dinner and had the seafood pasta with scampi. These meals almost changed our lives, that's how goooood they were lol

Went here on a week night with a couple of coworkers  & it was ok, nothing here to rave about but nothing to complain about either. 
Service was good, waitress was local & very authentic Cajun. We started with fried gator, like most of everything else it was ok but pieces were small. We also had crawfish cakes, yum. I had the ettufee (probably didn't spell that right) & it was ok but I've had better. My compadres had the jambalaya  which they liked. 
Beer selections were pretty good. The place is a little worn but comfortable. 
Maybe it's 3.5 stars but not 4 in my book.

Very good taste of New Orleans and accommodation for seafood allergies. Server very kind and was helping other table and people left camera. She spotted camera and quickly ran after them to return it. Food good and tomato caprez very good. Ashley B was a very good server and ask for her!

I love this place! Amazing food and service with a smile as well as history of this great city. Cindy made us feel like family! Bon temps and southern hospitality plus great food. Must try the alligator and redfish beignets. Coming back for seconds.

Our first stop in the French quarter. Ordered a free app (thanks to yelp check in) not sure what it was but crawfish tails and sauce with bread, it was excellent. I ordered Crawfish Etouffee, was spicy and great. Wife ordered Shrimp Poboy, she said it was dry. Needed sauce with the fried shrimp. Overall good new Orleans style food and the service was friendly.
very authentic restaurant with great pricing and great service.  would definitely recommend shrimp and grits and chargrilled oysters

My husband and I ate here on our final night in the city. I ordered the Taste of New Orleans, which was a great way to try all the local dishes at once. The portions were generous for the price. The flavor was good, but not great. The bread was dry and forgetable. The etouffe was delicous, but I thought the jambalaya was dry and lacked flavor. All three dishes could have used a lot more kick. My husband ordered blackened red fish. The vegetables were lackluster, but the potatoes were extremely good. The fish was a bit overcooked for his taste, but had excellent flavor. The wait staff was great; they were friendly, made great recommendations, and brought refills and checked-in regularly. The restaurant is also in a great location with 2 floors of seating available so the wait was not long.

The customer service here is great. From the host to the server, they are energetic & beyond welcoming. The food was good. The sauce from the crab claws appetizer was flawless. My only critique is that the prizes seemed a tad bit higher than the surrounding restaurants.
The crawfish app was amazing. So yummy. Great service, food came out fast, wait or very attentive. Cute place. Wish we would have sat upstairs on the balcony !

This can be a good NOLA experience. Sit on the balcony and enjoy the view of the street below while enjoying oysters and deep fried prawns (shrimps). The service is ok in the balcony but better inside while there is a decent selection of drinks available.

This place had one of my favorite dishes of the entire trip: crab claws appetizer. It's everything you think it would be - creamy, rich, amazing. It's delicious; please get it.

Their chargrilled oysters had way too much cheese (something I thought I'd never say). Their drinks were definitely too sweet for my liking.

Service was on point!

I love this place.  Came here on our last night in NOLA and so glad we did.  Lovely staff and vibe.  And the food is awesome.  

Had oysters on the half shell - they were awesome.  

Had crab claws - holy Moses - get extra bread because the sauce is sinful.  

And split a fried shrimp platter which was lovely.  

But - if nothing else - come here for the bananas fosters cheesecake.  The single best dessert I have ever had.  And I love desserts.  Will be coming back here for sure next time we come to town. 

Recommend if you get a chance, stop by.

Highly recommend!!! Not only was the food amazing but so was the staff! They knew we were in a hurry and were very quick getting us our food with no issues. So good! Will go back next time I'm in Nola!
Great oysters! Everyone was super friendly and patiently answered all my questions!

Beware of the 4 star review.... Think most people are drunk by the time they make it here. Food is not really good. Very salty and extremely buttery. I got the seafood pasta dish with mussels, scallops, and shrimp. Also, place is very run down.

We came here on a Thursday night around 10pm and there was no wait. 

Chargrilled oysters 5/5: grilled perfectly with crunchy baked cheese on top and creamy sauce on top of oysters. Would absolutely get these again.
Raw oysters 4/5: Just about like any other raw oyster place. Nothing too special but nothing bad about it either.
Crawfish cakes 3.5/5: A nice change from the usual crab cakes. I probably wouldn't get it again and would try another appetizer instead.
Taste of New Orleans 3/5: Comes with 3 cups of Jambalaya, Seafood Gumbo and Crawfish Étouffée. The Jambalaya and Crawfish Étouffée were great, but the gumbo was a bit bitter.
Blackened redfish with crawfish sauce 4/5: The fish was cooked perfectly and seasoned really well. The crawfish sauce is extra, but I highly recommend getting it. If you're unsure you can get the sauce on the side and dip it in when you want.

I also went to oyster house a couple days after. The oysters were comparable, and Royal House does have a bigger selection of entrees and less appetizers, but is also more expensive.

Great food and great service. Our waitress, Emma, was very helpful about both the restaurant food and local entertainment. Authentic creole food in a great atmosphere. Sit on the balcony - a little lopsided, but worth it! Try the chargrilled oysters.

I came here for a late dinner around 10pm on a Thursday and was seated immediately without a wait (they close at around 11pm). I've heard that normally the wait is very long and also earlier in the day you can request to sit upstairs (tables for 2 only), which can be cool.

We got the chargrilled oysters which were soo yummy. The parmesan is perfectly baked and bubbling and taste amazing. The oysters here are also very fresh and delicious. I personally actually like ACME's chargrilled oysters a little bit more, but my boyfriend likes them better here, so it's really pretty comparable. The raw oysters were also good, and they are bigger than the ones we are used to eating back in California. They're also saltier than the ones we're used to back in the bay. We also got the crawfish cakes, which were fine. They were a bit salty and dense. I would probably have preferred a different appetizer instead.

I got the Taste of New Orleans, which was yummy. It comes with 3 cups: Jambalaya, Seafood Gumbo and Crawfish Etouffee. I didn't like the gumbo much; it had a weird, bitter aftertaste. The Jambalaya was very good. The rice was very aromatic and flavored very well and not dry at all. The Crawfish Etouffee was by far my favorite of the 3. It's super well seasoned and very tasty. If I came back I would get the etouffee with a side of Jambalaya.

My boyfriend got the blackened redfish because of the yelp reviews raving about it. If you like fish, you should get this! The fish was so flavorful and very well seasoned. I'm usually worried about fish being too dry, but this was cooked so well and was very moist.

My fiance and I stopped in here for some much needed dinner after a night of drinking. We ordered two po boys (oyster and alligator) and some fried oysters. Hey, do as the New Orleans do eh? 

I love the vibe and feel of this place. The staff is super friendly and it's super clean and feels upscale without the upscale prices and frufi-ness. We liked the alligator po boy more than the oyster. The alligator tasted just like chicken but much more moist or fatty so we loved that. 

It's a great place with great food and servers; we will definitely be back here the next time we are in the area.
Great and friendly staff. The food however, is mediocre. It tastes very commercial. If you want the authentic flavor of New Orleans keep searching.

Acme, Felix, and Royal are all very similar and can be considered interchangable, and that's not a bad thing. I would say Felix seems the least touristy of the three, but this place holds its own with the oysters.

Feels like a chain, but can't complain. Chargrilled oysters are what you should order. Rockefeller - not too great, but then again, beats the ones served at Antoine's (which is supposed to be the original). Everything else is OK - not great, but not bad - and consistent... just like a chain.

Great food!  The atmosphere was very nice and the waiter was attentive and funny!  He was caring to our drinks and had very good suggestions as far as food choices go.  

The shrimp and grits were good, and so was the oyster pasta.

Well I don't know what the hell people are ranting and raving about. We tried to go to Acme but the line was wrapped around buildings so I suggested this place since it had great reviews.....
Never realized that so many people enjoy overpriced long john silvers served of a plate in a nice atmosphere. Once again, we had a table of 5 who was excited to try everything and got 5 different meals. All was disappointing. 
Creole was canned spaghetti sauce, gator was probably frozen chicken, shrimp tortellini was definitely from a frozen bag, and all of our rice was hard as cardboard. 
Don't bother with the oysters because they tasted like they pulled them from the potholes outside on the road. 
Very unfortunate experience but won't let it ruin our time.
Please don't let it ruin yours
This place redeemed my dining experience in New Orleans. The service was top notch one of the best servers I have ever had at a restaurant. The food was fantastic and the drinks delicious.

This place is a massive disappointment.   DO NOT waste your money there.  


What we liked
-  Our wine tasted fine

What we disliked
-  Chargrilled oyster was mediocre (do yourself a favor and try Felix).  The ones at Felix was more charred and flavorful.  We thought we can have the same taste again and was massively disappointed.
- Alaskan crab legs boil pot were just snow crab legs and they charged $30 for them.  How misleading to include the word "Alaskan".  The seafood boil was dry!  What kind of boil is that?!  
-  Service was horrendous.  While our waitress was nice, our drinks came way after our appetizer.  We waited for a long time before our food came


I would highly not recommend this place.  We had a much better dining experience at Commander's Place, The Court of Two Sisters and Felix.

Sat at table for over 30min and no one ever came to serve us. Another disappointment in NOLA. But if you are walking in the restaurant in a tight short dress you will have all the attention of the staff.
Seated and ignored.  Never approached.  Very disappointing.  However, it appears that the staff will fawn over you if you're in a tight short skirt.  Can't do that.
Chargrilled oysters were good! The redfish was ok but the crab claw was so good!!! Overall the dishes there were too salty for me, or probably that's why they served bread with a lot of dishes.

Do not go here for breakfast ever ! Drinks were wrong , food over cooked ( eggs and bacon) , per the wait staff all the bacon for the day is cooked first thing in the morning and used all day . Service was poor. May be good for lunch or dinner but stay away from breakfast .......

Overall, very disappointed. Expected more from such a high Yelp rating with many reviews. The crawfish cake appetizers were fantastic and so flavorful. I wish it had been an entire entree because it was heads above our entrees.
Seafood pasta mix- typical seafood mix with a tomato sauce. Not much flavor.
Shrimp n Grits- very plain and bland. I've made better shrimp n grits at home. Very disappointing.

This is an amazing restaurant and it is located off of the hassle and crowds of bourbon street.  The oyster were incredible, especially the oysters Rockefeller and their main courses were even better.  I had the crawfish ravioli and I must say that I was pleasantly surprised by how amazing it was.  

Sure, it's a little expensive, but the food is very worth the price you'll pay.

Oh wow.  Never been here before but tried it this evening with friends.   The alligator bite appetizers were amazing.  WOW.   Enjoyed the crawfish cakes and gumbo as my meal.    I'm still in heaven.    Please don't pass this place up as a dinner option.  Yummmmmmm

Had a shrimp po-boy from here during my trip to New Orleans. Bread tasted a bit hard/stale and the size of the po-boy seemed like it was on the smaller side compared to the one I had gotten elsewhere. You may be much better off getting the oysters and gumbo here. Decent service, but be prepared for a wait if the restaurant is really busy.
Mediocre food and kinda over priced for what it was. All the rice dishes were bland and rice was undercooked and hard

My husband and I stumbled onto the Royal House Oyster Bar one evening after we'd discovered that our first choice for supper was closed. It was around 8pm on a Friday night and it seemed that every other place we wanted to try had an enormous line out front. We stumbled onto the RHOB as we were heading to our hotel down the street (The Monteleone) and I guess our timing was good. They seated us right away!

The atmosphere was very "old school" N'awlins, and packed full of happy people. That means that it's kind of loud, but we scored a corner table downstairs so it wasn't as bad as it could have been.

We started off with cocktails from their promotional menu (a Citrus Vodka Something-or-Other) and they were potent and delicious. We ordered Oysters Rockefeller as an appetizer, I had the Seafood Pescatore for my entrée, and my husband had the blackened Redfish with veggies and potatoes.

Neither of us had ever had Oysters Rockefeller before and we'll probably never get them again. They were fine, I guess, but next time I'll stick to getting them raw, or fried and put into a po'boy. My husband really enjoyed his Redfish with veggies and potatoes. He cleaned his plate! I was a bit less than thrilled with my Seafood Pescatore. The shrimp, mussels, clams, and scallops were fine but I didn't care for the marinara sauce. It was too sweet. I wasn't happy that I got just two medium sized scallops, and one of the clams and one of the mussels didn't open during cooking.

So, while it wasn't a terrible meal, I just can't see any compelling reason to return given that there are so many fabulous places in NOLA to experience. *shrug*
Very good overall, except the shrimp jambalaya was way too salty. My husband ordered a shrimp pasta dish with cream sauce which was delicious. Price is a little high for what you get, in my opinion.

We were sooo excited for this play because of the excellent reviews. And especially once we tried the delicious appetizers we couldn't wait for our entrees! Unfortunately, the entrees were extremely disappointing. Our server was very nice, but in not sure I'd return.
Meh!  Food was ok, part of the problem is we didn't exactly get what we ordered.  The service was mediocre.  Maybe we caught the restaurant at a bad day, would give it another shot.
The staff was great. The food was very good. Stuffed mushrooms and chargrilled oysters are a must!
Great service, food, and ambiance.  While the food was great, I wouldnt say its something that blew my socks off or topped any other cajun/creole place in the area.

Not a lot of advertising for this place like some of the other restaurants in the French quarter. Don't overlook this one, some of the coldest and saltiest oysters i have ever had. The staff was friendly and the prices were great.
We went to sit at bar and do oysters raw and char-grilled with a couple of drinks. Huge oysters getting shucked and nice bartenders. If you like simplicity this way, go here. Music from the street

Overall, it wasn't terrible, but it wasn't a great experience either. We went on a Sunday afternoon so they weren't very busy and got in with no wait, but it still took us 20 minutes to get served water (even though we asked about 3 different servers). I'm allergic to gluten and they weren't very accommodating. I was told by the waitress that they could make chargrilled oysters GF, but she came back after we ordered to tell us that the cooks couldn't do it because they were so busy (as we were surrounded by empty tables). Alright. I ended up getting the shrimp jambalaya. The flavor was ok and the rice was slightly hard. 

My boyfriend had a few dishes but really loved the red fish beignets. They were also really generous with the amount of the shrimp in their dishes.
Loved this place so much that we ate there twice during our three day stay in NOLA.  The shrimp creole and shrimp tortellini were amazing!

Royal House, located in the French Quarter, does not accept reservations. I called about 10 minutes prior asking about the wait to which the lady replied with "10 minutes". Once we arrived the hostess informed, "we cannot make accurate wait times because the staff does not know". We ended up waiting 15 minutes when there was no wait line present.

Street parking is rough, especially in NOLA. If you're having a hard time for parking, I'd recommend valet parking in a hotel nearby. The small restaurant has two floors. On the first floor, there is a full bar in the middle of the restaurant against a wall, with the restaurant surrounding the bar. We got seated first floor, and our waiter arrived promptly.

As a fellow Yelper to another Yelper, do not forget to check in. Although it states "free appetizer", the check in coupon is only worth $10 off any appetizer.

Food:
**Note: A Texas native, I was disappointed at the food portions. So happy everything is bigger in Texas ;)**
Fried Alligator (3/5, Marinated gator meat served with cocktail and tartar sauce): When in NOLA, you gotta 'gator. If you never tried alligator, it literally tastes like chicken but more fatty. Sizes were like mini popcorn chicken pieces. Frankly, I prefer the alligator I've tried in Pappadeaux Seafood Kitchen. If I do come again, I'd use the check in coupon for the Crab Claws!

Chargrilled Oysters (2/5, Plump Louisiana oysters, fresh shucked, topped with our Parmesan butter cheese filling and then grilled to bubbly perfection): I've had better chargrilled oysters than Royal House's. These were disappointing, and we ordered 2 orders of these. It was inconsistent and dry. For some, you can still taste the oyster, but the others I tried tasted like straight up cheese.

Blackened Shrimp Jambalaya (3/5, A classic New Orleans rice dish. Chicken and andouille sausage sautéed with peppers and onions, then topped with blackened shrimp): This was probably the best out of the other 2 main courses we ordered. Pretty good flavor to me with good texture in the rice. Rice was not that wet/soggy texture. My friend mentioned she tried much better jambalaya though.

Oyster Pasta (2/5, Linguine pasta tossed with spinach and mushrooms in a scampi sauce and topped with fried oysters): My friend ordered this and probably came out 5+ minutes after we received the other two dishes. This was probably my least favorite because it was salty and dry to me. It gets a star for the 8 fried oysters though.

Shrimp Creole (3/5, Tender Gulf shrimp sautéed with peppers and onions in a spicy Creole tomato sauce served over a bed of steamed white rice): It was my first time trying Shrimp Creole. I'll say that I wasn't head over heels for it. It's tasty though with a good amount of flavor, which is not spicy like it was advertised. There were plenty of shrimp in this dish that I couldn't finish some. My friends ate them though!

Apparently, you get a 15% discount if you're a local. Service was "eh". Our waiter was friendly, but food took a while and didn't come out one after another. We had to wait for our friend to get the Oyster Pasta. 

My dining experience wasn't the best nor the worst - just "a-ok". None of us didn't find an urge to return especially after trying the food because there are other restaurants in NOLA we would love to try.

Tried to have Breakfast there. It wasn't busy at all and got seated quickly. Service was horrible and waited forever for our food to arrive. Waiter kept saying "it was coming". After 45 minutes of sitting there and still no food (we only ordered egg dishes) we just got a "sorry" and left. Will never come back again.

The food here is pretty good. The service is exceptional. I think for the money the servings are a little small but done quite well. I have the crab claws, one of my favorite dishes, but it was a little disappointing and that the serving size was small and the crab claws were Swimming in a sauce that was so rich I could barely eat it. Crab claws in themselves are very rich so they don't require a lot of creams and other spices to live in them up. They are delicious just with a little butter garlic salt pepper and chopped up chives. My Caprese salad did not have any basil on it. They do not make capris a salad with basil. They make it with Rosemary. An odd combination. My husband had the crab Louis  salad. Highly recommend that you have it with fresh crab and the Caesar dressing. It was delicious!

I ate at the Royal House for the first time, since I had heard so much about it in the past. As a local, I tend to not feed into all the touristy places, however this place is super. For the entrée I had the oyster pasta, and it was amazing, very flavorful. I had the charbroiled oysters which were good, but I have had better at other places. I also had an amazing server, her name was Alexis, she def. deserves all the rave. Thank you Royal House, I will be back.

Always go to the Royal House when we are in New Orleans. We have tried char broiled oysters in a lot of places, and my wife and I agree that these are the best! Ask for Robert, he will take care of you, and tell some jokes along the way!

I came here for some oysters and I left very satisfied. The service was great and the food was even better. The oysters were so fresh and the fried alligator taste just like chicken. Makes it easier to swallow...

You can't really go bad with food in New Orleans it'll be some of the best you've ever had.

I had the oysters, crab claws, and shrimp with grits. I believe the crab claws are the best thing I have tasted thus far on my vacation. The sauce is delicious! The oysters were also fresh. As fir the shrimp and grits I thought it was ok. The service was also really good.

We were seated on the balcony which was great! Food was delicious. Had a chicken sandwich and husband had the taste of New Orleans.  best part: some guy sang on the street beautifully the whole time we were there. It was so romantic. Perfect night out.

Went to Royal House for dinner and I feel in love with this place! I went for dinner w a group of 4 and the wait wasn't long at all - 7 minutes top! - plus there were a violinist on the corner performing, so that made the short wait nice lol. We ordered the chargrilled oysters - half order - and fried alligator for an appetizer. Those oysters are to die for!!! They were so good that we ordered another half dozen! The fried alligator was great too but we were loving the oysters too much to even care about the gator! LOL I ordered the oyster po boy - the bread was crusty but soft and the oysters were again amazing - the fries was seasoned really good also. My group also order the Royal salad - had a bite, was good - and the Crawfish Ravioli - this dish was soooo good, would probably get this when I go back - Overall, the food was great and service was great and fast.

Very satisfied. The crab claw appetizer was awesome. The crawfish ravioli was good but not great.  It was a little bland for my taste. We sat upstairs near the balcony which gave the meal a nice ambiance.

During our walk in French Quarter, opted to try this restaurant. Hubby and I had the crab claw appetizer (free with Yelp check in), which was a-mazing! Delicious tender claws in a buttery lemony and garlic sauce with sliced soft French bread. Hubby had the NO sampler: étouffée, jambalaya, and gumbo, which he loved. I had the redfish, generous portion, grilled with spices ropes with lump crab meat (extra fee) served on top of red bliss potatoes, and veggies. My fish was tender, flavorful, and delicious. Our server, Christian was great, she was friendly and helped us chose our meals, paired with beer for hubby and a Bloody Mary for me. Friendly, courteous, and prompt service. A definite must!
Good food and drinks with a nice staff! We had seafood, hushpuppies, chicken Cesar chicken and drinks! The French fries that came with the sandwiches were really good!!!

This place was really just okay. It had a cool vibe, and the food was good, but mediocre for the price. I definitely think there is probably better food out there, and wouldn't come back if given the choice.

We had an awesome waiter named Ty!! Dude is amazing! If you don't sit in his section, you're getting a dis-service! We had a blast, loved everything he recommended!

Btw..make sure you order the gator bites appetizer!!

We stopped here after a ghost tour for cocktails and snacks. We were seated quickly and had a very charming waitress. She was able to upsell us on some double hurricanes--very much appreciated. I had some great crab claws, prepared in the traditional style. Great vibe, quick service and very yummy.

This place is so friendly and has so much character. It was our first meal of our trip and it didn't disappoint.
Our waitress Chrinstin was really nice, she made great suggestions and made us feel very confortable 
We had the chargrilled oysters to start l. I had the BLT oyster and it was soooooo delicious 
Hubby had the taste of New Orleans witch was also very good. 
Lots of flavors!

Our server was friendly, and the service was fast.
I had the shrimp and grits; it was okay. Tasted sour-- like there was vinegar in it. Not my favorite but it was edible.
Grilled Oysters were fantastic.  And I know it's a sin to eat fried food in NOLA, but I did anyway and they did a fantastic job.

The first time we came here the line was outrageous but then again it was during decadence festival and it was on a Saturday night so we decided to go elsewhere. On our 2nd attempt, the wait time was about 15 mins, not too bad! Considering there was live music right outside the restaurant so we were able to enjoy while waiting. Everything we had here was delicious!! I absolutely love the crab claws!! The raw oysters were a good size and clean. We also had the oyster duo which was half rockafella and half royale. I preferred the rockafella. The baked shrimp tortellini was also a hit. It was baked to perfection with bread crumbs on top. The Shrimp jambalaya had the right amout of spices. All were a good portion. The service was wonderful. The manager took his time to walk through and asked each table how they were doing. Only thing was that, the place was a bit crammed but that won't stop us from coming back! I'm still daydreaming about the crab claws. =)

This place is awesome! It feels a little cramped especially on a busy night. However, the crab claws appetizer is amazing, it seems you get more claws on a weekday thoughw. I also had the jambalaya, as well as the Oyster Rockefeller and Oyster Royale duo. The jambalaya was a bit dry and the oysters were good. The baked shrimp tortellini is to die for. You can also get a 15% off discount if you're a Louisiana resident with a photo ID, but if you use the yelp check-in for a free appetizer, you can only use one or the other.
Food was incredible! We had the oysters, stuffed mushrooms, and the crab claws, and everything was fantastic. Our server Tina was the best. Excellent service!

Best jambalaya I had in the quarter! We came in for late lunch and watched the Saints game. Love how staff get into game day spirit.  The food was also quick and they have a nice bar. Ordered the Taste of New Orleans and it was soo good! I would come back here if I visit NOLA again.

Wandered into this place while walking around the quarter looking for a place to have a nice birthday dinner with my lady. No wait at all. The Hostess was very friendly and led us right to the balcony table we wanted. Our server Chris recommended the Moscow Mule for drinks and they arrived fast and were served in copper. He also recommended some appitizers and we went with the crab claws. Also ordered the shrimp tortallini and shrimp Creole for our main meal. Everything came out fast and tasted great. Shrimp Creole was nice and spicy. Shrimp tortallini was really good but too rich to finish the whole portion. That just means tasty leftovers for later. Finished up with the Bananas Foster Cheesecake which was excellent. It was a really nice experience. My girl and I really enjoyed our meal here. The tab was high for a two top but everything else was fantastic. Glad we found this place. Ask for Chris. Excellent service man! We'll be back.

Was directed here by my Hotel Concierge at the Omni. Had the Hurricane, Fried Oyster "tacos" for an appetizer and amazing gumbo for lunch. We sat at the bar for lunch and while it was busy, our bartender was very attentive and friendly. Definitely recommended for lunch while your in the French Quarter.

I was in New Orleans on vacation and wanted to have some authentic jambalaya before I left which led me here. I got in early for lunch so my food came promptly as I beat the crowd and I ordered the blackened shrimp jambalaya which was AMAZING. For dessert I had the banana fosters cheesecake which was also very good. 

I was served by Ashton who was great and very friendly, I would definitely come back here next time I'm in town. I am not much for oysters but I heard that Royal House serves them well.

We ordered 1. Fresh oysters 2. Charbroiled oysters 3. Alligator bites 4. Crab claws 5. Shrimp and grits.
1. Fresh oysters - they were fresh, clean flavor, not creamy not grimy, minimal debris from the shuck. 4/5 stars
2. Charbroiled oysters, very good. Sizzling parmesan cheese on top and garlic sauce. 5/5 stars. Would oder again
3. Alligator bites, ok nothing spectacular. No extra seasoning, kinda like dark meat chicken nuggets. Good white dipping sauce. 3/5
4. Crab claws, excellent. Fresh tasting claws, good garlic/white sauce. Asked for more bread so I could eat the sauce. Would go great on a pasta/rice/grits dish. 5/5 stars. Would order again.
5. Shrimp and grits - ehhh the ammonia/metallic taste in the shrimp ruined it all. They had 1/2 blackened shrimp that was essentially just a salt lick, and the regular shrimp was masked by the saltiness of the creole sauce. Not too much flavor in that creole sauce, just salt. The grits was ok,  not too buttery, if you want more butter then you'll need to add it. Not salty, perhaps to balance the sauce. What I ended doing was adding the crab claws sauce into part of the grits without the creole sauce. Because of the unfreshness of the ammonia-metallic tasting shrimp and overwhelming saltiness of the creole sauce I have to give it 1/5 star since the key star was the shrimp. Would not reorder. 

Overall 3/5 would come here for oysters, appetizers and drinks. 

Hopes this helps people.

Been here twice on our visit food was great but service was even better.
Crawfish claws the sauce was amazing 
Best French onion I've had 
Get the chargrilled oysters with crab on top
Awesome service! Ty was our server he was attentive and overall a very nice person. I will definitely recommend anybody to go here. Food was delicious as well.

This was a fun find while we were vacationing in New Orleans! We were drawn by the cute little balcony with outdoor seating and great view of the French Quarter. They seemed pretty busy, but we luckily only waited a few minutes.

The service was just ok.  Everyone seemed really friendly, but our waitress just seemed to have too many tables. Luckily the food was really good! 

We started with the Chargrilled Oysters.  They were buttery, cheesy and delicious! I was really happy with them!

For dinner we had the Crawfish Etouffe and Shrimp 'n Grits. 
The shrimp 'n grits were so spicy and delicious! The grits were rich and cheesy. Thinking about it now makes me hungry! 

Definitely worth stopping at!!

This was on our list of restaurants to try. We have gone here twice on our 4 day vacation stay. First time here, we came when they first opened at 11a. It was not too big of restaurant but it was nicely decorated and they have an open tables to see outside. Seating was kinda tight though. Great service by Raven. The food was pretty good and one of the better ones in the French Quarter. She made her suggestions on beer and cocktails. Andygator beer was a good suggestion and was pretty good! The Avion Berry Rita cocktail was served in big glass and was very strong! You should try this too.

Of course, we had to try them chilled oysters and charbroiled oysters. Both were very good and oysters were not grainy with sand from the shell. We had French onion soup, redfish beignets, crawfish ravioli, alligator snacks, shrimp & grits, and shrimp creole. All very good but nothing spicy as I thought Cajun was supposed to carry a little heat? The redfish beignets was too breaded but fish was not overdone. It was sweet n tangy. I really liked the alligator bites appetizer as it tastes like chicken and was very moist. It was not a disappoint.

We did get the banana cheesecake and it was good and uniquely presented with crust in the shape of a triangle standing sideways. I thought it was round balls of ice cream but it was the banana cheesecake and also served with whip and fruits. You have to order this!

We ordered dessert the next night when we were craving dessert. We ordered more oysters and peel-n-eat shrimp. The shrimp was just ok. We ordered bread pudding and chocolate ala mode or something like that. Both desserts we're good but nothing special. Overall, 4.5 stars for me as this is one of the better restaurants here. I just wish they had more heat in their spices if they consider this cajun!

Worst food I've ever had. We couldn't finish our dishes as all we ordered was awful. The staff were soo friendly. They came over when saw the food was almost untouched. The were sorry and they took off the main course so we only paid for the appetizers. 

I'd prefer to stay hungry than eating in such a place.

Ambience at this restaurant is great! There were street musicians playing and we were served by Raven. She was very attentive and polite. I'd recommend the alligator po-boy. It was delicious! The best alligator I've had! We also had the crawfish cakes and oyster duo. They were so-so. The oyster duo was way too much cheese for me. The raw oysters were huge and juicy!

This is more of a 1.5 star restaurant, but I usually round down. 
The waitress did her best to be as helpful and as upbeat as she could, but nothing could save this terrible experience. 

DO. NOT. ORDER. THEIR. POBOYS. EVER.
EVER.
They were easily THE worst thing I had the misfortune of placing into my mouth while in NOLA. I'm pretty sure I've had food that was possibly slightly spoiled that was better than that garbage atrocity of a sandwich. 
Just thinking about it infuriates me. 

Chargrilled Oysters are NOT chargrilled. No wood is involved. They are cooked on their gas stove and then smothered to absolute hypertension induced death with Parmesan, which, when combined with the existing brine of the oysters themselves, equate to salt on top of salt. Terrible doesn't quite describe the experience with justice.

As for the raw oysters, they were old, with no movement at all when lemon was spritzed over them. The waitress had never heard of mignonette sauce and was surprised I asked for something she knew nothing about (I'm pretty sure I was more surprised at her surprise than she was). 
You're better off skipping these too.

The crab claws were salty and tiny, average at best. The toast that came with it were microwaved to oblivion, more of like a gigantic stale breadcrumb than any kind of toast I've ever had.

The prominent flavor profile at Royal House is salt, to the point of where I wonder if the kitchen staff all had terrible colds that annihilated their tastebuds.

My crawfish etouffee was the only reason why I give them 0.5 stars more, but in all honesty, almost anything would have been better than the fiasco listed above. (as in, I would rather eat at Mcdonald's than eat here again) The sauce of the etouffee was pretty tasty, but the fried crawfish were disgusting. As a matter of fact, if you see anything fried on their menu, avoid it like you avoid that awkward clingy "friend" that you happen to see at social gatherings. Quickly, with zero hesitation, and no remorse. 
If you have a business engagement that requires you to eat here, then go with their grilled seafood options, or get the crawfish etouffee with extra crawfish instead of fried crawfish. 

Actually, just do yourself a favor and avoid this restaurant altogether. You're better off eating at Cochon or Cochon butcher again.
The charbroiled oysters were amazing! It's definitely a must have. The shrimp po boy was okay a bit salty for my palette. Overall the service was great!

3.5 stars! Best thing about this stop was the sauce for the Crab Claws. I could drink that stuff! The crab claws were good as were the chargrilled oysters. Dragos were better, but these were still good. Another great thing was the very personable host that seated us & our waiter was super friendly. Very happy with service and food was good enough to come back again. I'll just be asking for some of that extra sauce on the side to dip everything & anything in!

Really have a hard time with even one star - service terrible - food even worse .... Really in new orleans you're going to serve broiled oyster appetizers that are obviously frozen - zero flavor on top of a mechanically sliced oyster, paper thin???? In New Orleans???! A frozen burger requested medium came out raw & when sent back came out (same burger) burnt on the outside and still bleeding throughout - then management gives me a card so that the next time I dine w/ them I Can have a free appetizer ..... So let me understand this .... I'm supposed to spend another $50 on top of the $50 Already spent so I can get more inedible food???! What's wrong w/ this picture?

Only reason giving this place 3 stars was for their appetizer red fish beignet. Light tempura with flavorful sauce for dipping.  (Check in and get 10 dollars of this) the rest of our meal came by suggestion of the waitress. (Forgive me as I once did this job but, she seemed to forget about us so service was slow, otherwise very friendly  ). Entrées not so great, my husband had the crawfish etouffee, didn't care for it.  For me,  maybe I changed up the order too much as I substituted the oyster pasta for chicken (suggested by my waitress as im not too crazy for oysters and she said the sauce was the best) I found it bland,  the chicken charred dry. I'd go again for the appetizer and maybe try something else.

We have been here twice in as many days for drinks and apps.  The grilled oysters were quite tasty as were the alligator bites.  

Our servers were friendly and attentive.

Needless to say this quickly became a NOLA favorite of ours.

Highly recommend this restaurant.

Shared a great meal at Royal House.

Oysters royale  4.5/5
Seafood stuffed mushrooms 3/5 (a bit too cheesy)
Crawfish stuffed ravioli (3.5/5)
Food was below par for New Orleans. We had a fish po boy and shrimp and grits.  Both were disappointing. The hush puppies were nice. Service was quick, but I don't recommend.
I hope this isn't the FQ standard. Gumbo tasted like it was frozen out of a bag. Disappointed in all aspects of the night there. Manager seemed stoned...

Not good if you're trying to plan ahead. I called this restaurant 3 times before bringing a group of 26 - the last time I called was (per the last person I had spoken with) 30 minutes before we were going to arrive at the restaurant to check and see if they could fit us in. The person I spoke to was very pleasant and said they had enough room and they would see us in 30 minutes. When I (and 25 people behind me) showed up the hostess said she had never heard we were coming, the bartenders never tell her anything (apparently they pick up the phones?) and there was nothing she could do. The manager came out but basically said nothing. I finally asked THEM if there was another restaurant in the area they could suggest, and they suggested their sister location a few blocks away. That restaurant, Le Bayou, came through in a REAL way, so thus more than 1 star. Otherwise, this whole experience was stressful and frustrating when they could have said a) No, no room (30 minutes before) or b) gee, we're sorry, let's figure out how to help you (once we arrived).
Cruised in for two tonic waters to go so we could hop on a ghost crawl, 3 dollars for just tonic water. Based on common sense alone is where this rating comes from.

What a fun night celebrating our birthday! Had oysters chargrilled and thanks to yelp for our appetizer discount. Shout out to yelp! Lovely voodoo drink, I wanted a hurricane but Heidi suggested this drink!!! Had tortellini and some raviolis. The ettouffe had battered crawfish and rice. Then we had bread pudding!!!! Lovely time!!!! Lovely people!!!!

Had a delicious and filling lunch here the morning after surviving my hectic first night in New Orleans. Bright and airy, with a distinctively Parisian vibe, the Royal House is a great choice for a casual (or not-so-casual) bite in the French Quarter close to Bourbon. 

Service was *very* friendly, our waiter made a ton of recommendations and steered us clear of some items he said were overrated. We made conversation and he ended up recommending me a list of often-ignored French Quarter bars that we should check out. He genuinely seemed like he loved his town and job, and it made the whole vibe even better.

Started with the chargrilled oysters which were delicious, and then an alligator po-boy which was pretty good, didn't blow me away. My girlfriend had the blackened shrimp jambalaya which definitely needed to be spiced up some more but once it was, it was delicious.

-1 star for the pricing -- it's standard tourist French Quarter upcharge, although I don't know why I'd expect otherwise. There's probably better jambalaya and po-boys at better prices around. 

Still, it was an overall good experience, and I'd probably come back.

Chargrilled oysters were very tasty 4/5; however the oysters Rockefeller were 1/5. Basically a baked oyster topped with a caked paste.  
None the less; it was a nice location with airy sitting on balcony.
