All the food here is extremely average. They are also pretty expensive. If you go here at the very least don't get the Shrimp and Grits or the Taste of New Orleans. The Shrimp and Grits is bland except for the Tons of red and green peppers. The Taste of New Orleans was also flavorless..with lots of rice filler. Other places make these dishes way better. We were incredibly disappointed.
Excellent service checking on ingredients to make sure dishes safe for dietary health restrictions.  Good good,  however wife's food not hot, just lukewarm.

These people just rely on their location and the hope that tourists will only come once and not warn off other visitors.

Terrible food. Oysters Rockefeller tasted like mini pizza. Shrimp creole like a shrimp cocktail in a jar of marinara sauce. Oysters on the half shell left forgotten at the oyster bar, brought to our table swimming in melted ice, grit and grime from uncleaned shells floating in our oysters.

On top of the terrible food, the service was very disorganized. Three or four times, they brought us food meant for the table next to us. At the end of the meal, our check included our table neighbors' bottle of wine.

You don't have to be too good to survive in a touristy area. But you should be better than these people.

Staff deserves 5 stars but actually very mediocre food. I went to lunch and had the alligator Po boy and oyster tacos. The breading was super bland. I was surprised since there are so many great reviews. Also the bread for the sandwich was bland, textureless, and tasteless. You'd think that in place, they'd put an awesome sauce on the sandwich, but no. Iced tea was awesome

Staff is so friendly and happy. Always jammed packed but for a great reason! Ambience is great, service was top notch, and the food and drinks so yummy!!!! I had red wine, but I so badly wanted to try one of their bloody Mary's.

The place lived up to the rating on Yelp. The Oyster Maque Choux which was flavorful and slightly creamy. The osters were very fresh. We decided for the Taste of New Orleans and the Crawfish Etouffee was the best with the Chicken & Andouille Jambalaya a close second. The crawfish were really tiny but very tasty. Gumbo was good too. 
We ended with the Alligator Po-boy was good with the meat really tender, unlike the other places. The rest of the Po-Boy was decent like the others we have eaten around. 
The service was excellent and our server was attentive but did not rush us even on a busy evening. She was nice enough to suggest some good places close by for Jazz music. 
We will definitely visit it again when visiting the Big Easy!!

Eh... We had some amazing food in NO and I have to say, this was the only meal we were not thrilled with. Average shrimp po boy. 
Also, the waitress offered to change the fries to a different side, but I feel she should've mentioned the price difference as well. My bad. Should've asked. 
A table next to the 2 of us, sat after we did, ate before us, and ordered to-go and was out the door when we barely got our food. 
The "free appetizer" with Yelp check in was charged and fixed when we asked. If we hadn't looked, we would've paid. 
I feel the service was slow and below average and food was average. We were sad that it was our last meal in NO. Maybe just a bad day. Everyone has bad days.

Great location in the French Quarter .. There was a line when we got there so we waited about 20-30min before we were seated. (I guess that means the food is really good) We chose to sit on the balcony which only sits parties of two. The balcony was on a slant so if you're not careful your drink and silverware could slide off the table so that was a little nerve wracking. We ordered the taste of New Orleans and oyster duos, food was good and our waiter was amazing. I would definitely come back.

Food was excellent, drinks were strong, and the service from Tina, the best waitress in NOLA was top notch!  If you visit Royal House consider yourself lucky if she waits in you!  We had a great experience and would definitely go back!

Unfortunately this was an expensive loss for our party of four. The food was OK, oh and it was cold. Like not even warm. This happened with our stuffed mushrooms, and my wife's Fries. We were starving at that point and just wanted to get out so we didn't really complain.

The only reason it got 2 stars was the waiter was good, and the drinks were good. I'd stay away if you're looking to not waste a lot of money.

I stopped here for lunch to kill some oysters and have a drink while seated at the bar.  Solid spot, solid find, thanks to Yelp!  The oysters are SO FRESH, they shuck them right in front of you...amazing.  I also had the fried alligator appetizer which was delicious as well.  For those of you who are curious what alligator tastes like- it tastes like chicken (no joke), but has an almost squid-like texture.

I had one of their tequila cocktails which came with strawberries.  It was great as well and I left stuffed with all the NOLA goodness I could fit in my belly during lunchtime.

Upon canceling our reservations at Antoines (the prices and hot/cold reviews) made us re-think our decision, we decided to check out Royal House (diagonally across the street from our hotel). The decor with candle lit tables, warm welcome and abundant seating was just what we were looking for. It was cozy, and homey, with a romantic vibe. Our waitress was amazing, and recommended drinks (the patron punch) and it was KILLER, amazing. We then ordered the Oyster Duo (Oysters Rockefeller and Oysters Royal) both were AMAZING, out of this world delicious, and for our entree I ordered the Oyster Pasta in scampi sauce and my boyfriend ordered the Oyster BLT PoBoy...now when I say these meals were delicious, it's an understatement...these meals were other worldly good. My pasta was cooked perfectly, the sauce a creamy, spicy, garlicky heaven, and the fried oysters were incredible, everything on the plate melded together to form a plate of pure food induced ecstasy (I couldn't stop smiling with every bite, but that could have been the punch). My boyfriends PoBoy was also Heaven sent, a perfect mixture of flavors and textures to send anyone into a welcomed food coma...we were offered dessert, but were both bursting at the seams after scraping our plates clean.
I HIGHLY recommend this place, wonderful servers, great ambiance, and PHENOMENAL food.

Stopped in during a a weekend trip to Nawlins. For appetizers, grilled oysters were awesome. The Taste of New Orleans platter was also very good for an entree. Grits could have used more flavor. Great ambience and energy and the service was personalized and prompt.

Must get the char grilled oysters! Creole shrimp was bomb, gator bites on point and the crawfish ravioli was to die for. Cute spot that offers upstairs dining and balcony seating, if you prefer. A must go to while staying in Nola!

Came here with a large group around 5:30 on a Saturday. We were seated immediately, which deserves 5 stars alone. Our server, LeRoy, was amazing, made great recommendations and at the end of the night, he left us with a list of places to check out after dinner in the city. All of the staff from the hostess to the bus boy were incredibly nice and welcoming. 

We had;
The oyster duo (oysters royale and oysters Rockefeller)
Chargrilled oysters
Alligator po boy
BLT oyster po boy
Taste of New Orleans (jambalaya, gumbo, etc.)
Some sort of seafood tortellini (can't remember the name of the dish)
St. Louis slaw
Fries
Hurricanes
Oyster shots

All of the food was amazing. I could eat the oysters Royale everyday! Hurricanes weren't awesome; go for something cheaper with dinner, and pick up a hurricane later on bourbon.

Me and the wife love stopping here during any day drinking events. Food is really good and we are a sucker for oysters. It seems to be a good place for famous people sightings, as we have seen quite a few dining here during lunch. 

If you can get a seat in the back, it's easier to eat. But I like dining in the front to do a little people watching.

We were very disappointed in our dining experience. After reading all the stellar reviews we were really looking forward to a delicious and authentic New Orleans meal. What we got instead was just a pricey disappointment. Our food came out looking nothing like the other Yelp reviewers photos and the flavors were unimpressive as well.  I'm pretty sure I could have whipped up better versions of everything we ordered myself for a fraction of the price. This place was WAY over rated. :(

We were in a search for a great seafood place after several days of eating heavy gumbos and jambalayas. I mean they were good, but we wanted to get something a little lighter. Found this place based on Yelp reviews and it did not disappoint!

Food: steamed shrimp - just what we were looking for, it was fresh and flavorful 
Charbroiled oysters - one of the best I've had in town (although I wasn't a fan of the French rolls bc it was stale)
Blackened red fish - fish was moist and cooked perfectly, the potatoes were grilled and had sprinkles of parmesan cheese on top
Grilled chicken Caesar salad - just the right amount of dressing with a hint of lemon flavor

Service - it was a little slow, but I still gave 5 stars because overall experience was good and the server was very pleasant.

This place is nice. We sat on the balcony and had a pleasant view. We ordered the Crab Claws and they were DELICIOUS. Seriously, that sauce was amazing. I ordered the Taste of New Orleans and it was mostly enjoyable. The Gumbo lacked a certain complexity without the seafood and I didn't see any okra in mine. The jambalaya was alright, only marginally better than what you could get at a grocery store. The highlight was the Crawfish Etouffee. Wow! That was delicious. It had the flavors I was looking for in the gumbo, and more. My wife got the Blackened Shrimp & Jambalaya and she mirrored my sentiments about the grocery store. Overall it was solid food for a reasonable price. You can't complain about a $2 order of the Crab Claws. Seriously, get the Crab Claws.

My new favorite place for crawfish etouffee! A nice portion of crispy fried tails in a rich, lip smacking sauce that features even more of them bug tails. Wifey loved the unique shrimp and grits which has so much flavor and spice that she guiltily tapped out after only getting half way through. 
  The balcony seemed like a fun idea, but it was tight and slopes so much that every time someone scooted or plopped down in their chair our drinks and plates would slide dangerously close to their demise.  
   The door greater/seater was charming and welcoming, and our waiter was equally attentive and friendly.  ...I can't wait to go back and explore more of Royal House's delicious offerings.

We found this little gem for an afternoon lunch on our vacation and were greeted by the wonderfully friendly Terrance.  They made our custom drinks with attention and care and interacted as old friends throughout our meal.  We delighted in the Spinach Dip, Crawfish Cakes with Cream Sauce, and the Royal Spinach Salad.  The items were spot on in flavor and texture and made our afternoon even better.

The service was excellent, but the food was mediocre. I wanted my friend to try the great food that New Orleans has to offer, but I was disappointed by my experience here. Perhaps it was a long day for the chef.

My daughter took me to the Royal House last night for dinner for my birthday.  It was not a great experience.  

As with most places in the quarter, Royal House is clearly over-hyped and under delivers.  We ordered drinks which were watered down and overpriced.  I asked from a double Blanton's (a single barrel Kentucky Bourbon) to which the server replied that she'd never heard of that particular beer and then promptly handed me their beer list.  

We ordered their signature raw oysters as an appetizer. They were obviously days old and not the "fresh on the day" that they portray and were a gelatinous mess which had not been properly shucked, rinsed and plated.  

I ordered their All You Can Eat endless shrimp bowl which arrived finger blistering hot and looking and tasting like they had been boiled for three days in "fracking" mud.  The All You Can Eat turned into a barely able to touch.  The corn on the cob side was over cooked and mushy.  I did not think that you could over cook corn on the cob so badly and still have it stay on the cob.

I do have to say that my wife ordered their rib eye which she enjoyed as it was properly dressed and properly cooked to medium rare.  My daughter ordered their Oyster Pasta which she also enjoyed.

And no, I did not complain because I did not want to hurt my daughter's feelings as she selected the venue especially for my birthday.

To wrap up:
1. Service - Extremely average, servers need to be educated on their bar stock and the difference between a top shelf Kentucky Bourbon and bottle beer.  Ours could have been a bit more attentive...it was not busy...several tables were open on a Tuesday night.
2. Raw Oysters - C'Mon man!  Horrible and disappointing for a signature offering.
3. All You Can Eat Shrimp -  See #2, above!

Given the choice go to Acme for Oysters and there have to be better places to get shrimp, too.

We were walking down Royal St, actually headed to a different restaurant, when Royal House caught our eye -- or more appropriately, our ear.  As we walked by, we heard the door greeter announcing the delicious items on their menu.  I heard him say "shrimp and grits", and I immediately took pause.  I had been wanting to try shrimp and grits in New Orleans.  We walked a few more steps, stopped, and pulled up Yelp to look at the reviews of Royal House.  They looked good so we turned around and went back.

We were immediately seated on the balcony.  It was nice, except the balcony does slope, which means your table and chair are sloped as well.  A little scary when you have plates and glasses on the table, but we didn't have any problems with anything sliding off.  

I did end up getting the shrimp and grits, and they were delicious.  The grits were creamy with a peppery, cheese, and herb flavor.  The creole sauce had a spicy yet slight vinegar flavor which perfectly balanced the creaminess of the grits.  The shrimp were plentiful and cooked well.  Hubby had the crawfish étouffée and he raved about it.  I don't really care for crawfish, but I had a bite of his dish and had to agree it was quite good.

I'm so glad we happened to find this place.  The service and food were both great.  The door greeter had an awesome personality and we wouldn't have tried this place if it weren't for him.  Prices were reasonable.  We will definitely be back when we visit New Orleans again.
Awesome (the best) oysters on the half shell and drinks. We saw a salad come out of this place that looked amazing too. We had a blast sitting at the bar and taking it all in.
Everyone was very friendly and our waiter, Ty helps us pick out some amazing oysters!

Rainy Sunday afternoon. Came in because of the great reviews that I have seen on yelp. Staff were very friendly but the service is really slow. Our waitress Christin was helpful initially  but that faded away quickly during the course  of the meal..so I would rate that at a 2 out of 5.

Appetizer: 1/2 dozen of chargrilled oysters. It was over run with pamarsean cheese! Overall it was okay.

Entree: blackened red fish with potatoes and green beans. It was delicious and very flavorful.

Desert: bread pudding...one word to describe  this perfection.. YUMMY.

I would come and try again when I visit NOLA.

Worst food I had my entire time in New Orleans and slowest service. Came here with an hour and a half to enjoy lunch before leaving for my flight. By the time we finally got our food, we had only ten mins to eat. What took so long for everything? Three of four items ordered were appetizers. I am a lover of oysters rockafeller, and had yet to have them in the city. Do NOT order them here. So dry and disgusting. I only ate one. Waste of money. Would never come back.

2.5 Stars.  Touristy. A good place for ppl watching and the location on its own gives it cred.  BUT, the service was sucky, my raw shucked oysters were good (hard to F that up),  But my man ordered the "Taste of New Orleans" for $17 and all it was was 3 little soup cups of watered down gumbo, jambalaya & etouffee.  There are just too many good places to eat to waste your time and belly space here.
This was my first stop in New Orleans. The Bloody Mary was awesome and the fried oyster po' boy was the best! The bartender was extremely friendly and helpful with all my questions.

Stopped here to enjoy lunch and watch the view down Royal Street. The balcony is in a great location. Not as busy as a Bourbon Street balcony but definitely busy with people to watch, bands to listen to and sun to enjoy.  

Checking in on Yelp gave us a coupon for a free appetizer (woo hoo!) so we had the Crab Claws. OMG. The Royal Sauce (lemon and garlicy goodness in a butter sauce form) is from heaven itself. Upon the advice of another Yelper, we ordered a side of it for our food. But to be honest, there was enough in the appetizer for our needs.

I had the Baked Shrimp Tortellini. It was fantastic. Breadcrumbs on top were toasted to perfection. Huge pieces of jumbo shrimp were generously strewn through out. Tortellini was tender. The sauce was good but adding the Royal Sauce to it made this an instant hit. I'm kind of sad that we waited for our last day before coming here; I wanted to order it again! 

The wait time for the food and drinks was pretty long but that might have been because of the staff going up and down the stairs. But it gave us time to people watch and talk on the balcony, so it wasn't too bad. Must visit again when I'm back in NOLA!

Great staff, amazing food, good service. So this was my first time in NOLA and I'm eating and drinking to my hearts content. I've been looking to scratch a few meals of the the old bucket list. So far this week, crawfish, po boys, hand grenades, and one I didn't even know I wanted to try until I had it alligator.

After looking for a new place to try on my third day out and about I yelped some recommendations and settled on the Royal House. 

A short walk from my hotel and located at the corner of 441 Royal, the place is simply amazing. I'm glad I came in the off season when the lines aren't actually around the corner. You have to check them out.

Now I know why Royal House has inspired over 1500 reviews! Passionate, knowledgeable staff, wonderful ambiance, and delicious seafood. We started our meal with the Oysters Royale, which were sweet and decadent. I had the redfish with Royal sauce, and my beau had the shrimp gumbo--one of the best he has ever had (and the boy knows gumbo). 

Service is amazing. We will be back for more!
In the middle of the French quarter this restaurant is a bit of a tourist trap; specialized in oysters I was a bit disappointed in my dozen natural ones - fresh tastes different...

Great atmosphere in the French Quarter! The view from the balcony is very entertaining. There are lots of interesting people passing by and musicians playing. I had the spinach dip as an appetizer and it was the best I've ever had. After that I ear some shrimp and grits.  This dish was very filling. Last of all I ordered the brownie with ice cream. Mmmm so good! The only downside is the fact they didn't have sweet tea. Boo! Overall a great experience.

Once again we visited New Orleans and we decided to give Royal House another try. 
When we received our food it was cold and we waited 10 or more minutes for our waiter "Scott " to return and check on us. After sending it back it had been reheated most likely by microwave and was unevenly heated.
We ate it anyway and again waited for our server to return.
When he did he returned with our check and no offer of desert or coffee
We had overheard other servers telling of the different desert offerings.
We would always give second try to a business as anyone can have a bad day. We probably should have left after we received cold food.
It wouldn't hurt to have management checking on their guests during the busy dinner hours.

The service was fast. The grilled oysters were great. I ordered the crab, which was really good as well. They are not cheap, so if you want a deal, you might want to hoof it down to the French market instead.
The bartender was great, however stacking oysters and serving the warm is not my thing! I would like a re-do

Last night in NOLA, found Royal House on Yelp.  So glad we did.  Service was great, thanks Ashley! Ordered the raw oysters, red fish beignet, french onion soup, snow crab legs and peel and eat shrimp.  All were very good.  When we ordered the red fish beignets we didn't know what to expect but we thought we would try it.  Again, glad we did, left us speechless.  Snow crab legs were huge and you barely needed the butter because they were seasoned well and juicy.  Royal House was a great choice.

Well, if you are around, you have to check this place. It isn't expensive, service is up to a great standard. Cocktails are excellent... We spent 6 days in NOLA and ate twice there. It is the best restaurant we've ate at so far in NOLA

Not a bad place, but not quite five stars. They don't take reservations, but we (two of us) got in right away, on Halloween no less! Well actually it was on the 30th, but because of an impending storm, the state moved Halloween a day earlier (say what you want, but blizzards in the northern parts of the country never prompted moving the date...) Others commented on the speed of the place and watching the wait staff it seemed like some were more successful in placing and getting their orders from the kitchen quicker than others. Unfortunately our server was one of the unfortunate ones. Restaurant management would certainly help this as it looks bad to the customers.

The drinks were very tasty and well "seasoned." I started with the oysters two ways, parmesan crusted and raw. The raw were very bland and I would have guessed they had been rinsed out except they were exceptionally gritty. The other half of the plate was very good, so I recommend you have raw oysters down the street, but if you need some as an appetizer, go grilled.

We had crawfish etouffe and seafood pasta with the scampi sauce. Both were wonderful. A bit of heat and a lot of crawfish, mussels, and shrimp. I did find the shrimp tender but also very bland.

I would come back again but would probably scope out a more aggressive server so as to not get stuck watching people who got seated after me get their food first.

Tourist trap you can do better.  The staff is polite and attentive but honestly the food sucks.  Food is cooked well but the sauce is runny, vinegary and lacks flavor.  Try the Gumbo Shop or Stanley's. Otherwise eat as far away from the heavy tourist areas as possible.  If a place has lots of yelp reviews and is in this area, the food probably sucks. Good luck!

Service was very prompt.  Came here for lunch on a Tuesday.  Drinks were very well made and decently priced. We had a small problem with our appetizer and it was corrected very swiftly.  Only complaint I have is the grilled oysters were small and over cooked.

I am a local, and a regular guest at this establishment. I am always willing to give the benefit of the doubt to a sub par visit, but this is three in a row. 

Oysters are what I come for. Six char grilled for twelve bucks is fine, but they need to be plump. I received tiny, inconsequential nothingness soaked in overdone mediocrity. All six weren't equal to two nice oysters. Then a dozen raw...average, nothing special, and a good twenty minutes to get them.

With all the  choices for oysters, especially at happy hour, I'm giving Royal a rest.

This place was OK. It wasn't as good as Yelp led me to believe it was going to be. This is the only place where Yelp overall has rated the food higher than I would have rated it though so thanks Yelp! I got the Louisiana trio (gumbo, jambalaya, etoufee) and my boyfriend got baked oysters. Everything was ok but not great. I was expecting more from a highly rated place in New Orleans. Next time I'm in town, I'll look for something different because this place didn't quite hold up.

the waitress was very knowledgable on the menu she convinced my friend to try the chargrilled oysters...and let's just say..he become a fan! OH and the shrimp and grits were uhh-mazing just the wait for food was an issue but worth it

For our first NOLA food experience, came here to enjoy a variety of items as well as the nice view from the balcony. Server was nice enough to let us in with our frozen alcoholic drinks (probably because it wasn't very busy on a Thursday early afternoon).

Between two people, ordered the Taste of New Orleans ($18), Oyster Tacos ($10), and a side of hush puppies ($5). The "tacos" came first - slightly fried oysters with slaw and a dollop of tangy hot sauce on top of a nacho chip. Not sure how this counts as a taco, otherwise good starter. Next was the Taste of New Orleans: a trio of classic NOLA dishes accompanied by three wedges of bread. Jambalaya was very good, especially with some hot sauce; Crawfish Etouffée was a bit overpowering on the salty end, but great with the bread; Seafood Gumbo was forgettable. The side of hush puppies provided the best bang for the buck, as it tasted fresh and came with a delicious dipping sauce.

I like the ambiance and location, plus the service was quick, though the prices are a bit high. An okay option in the area.

Great find! Tina was my FANTASTIC server, and she recommended the Seafood Pescatore but "la Tina-style" (white wine scampi sauce vs. red sauce - genious!). I also took her recommendation about Pinot Noir vs the white wine that I would normally have chosen. Again, spot on! And if I remember correctly,  it came with 12 shrimp, 3 mussles, 3 clams and 2 perfectly prepared sea scallops. What else can I say? Oh, the price. I think it was $23, and any good restaurant closer to Bourbon that would serve a meal of this quality would charge at least $35. I WILL be having this again, will request Tina, and STRONGLY recommend that you do the same!

We chose this restaurant based on the reviews.  We were told the wait would be 20 minutes, we were seated within 10 minutes BUT waited well over an hour for our FIRST appetizer and waited an additional 10 minutes thereafter for our main dishes. As the two groups seated after us signed their checks, we sadly were eyeing their crumbs.  However, I don't believe this is the norm for this restaurant.  I think we were simply unlucky and in spite of this, our waitress Ashley was EXCELLENT.  She was professional, friendly and genuinely apologetic for the wait.  Although I feel our entire bill should have been taken care of, two drinks and an appetizer were taken off the bill. 

Here are the pros and cons to the food and restaurant itself:

Pros:
(1)  Quaint/romantic atmosphere
(2) Although we were not seated on the balcony, I highly recommend
(3) Stuffed Mushrooms - Excellent 
(4) Roasted Red Bliss Potatoes - these came as a side with our dishes and were THE BOMB 
(5) Berry Basil Cocktail - AMAZING 
(6) Shrimp 'n Grits and Rib-ey - friends commented these dishes were pretty tasty 
(7) Pecan-Crusted Mahi Mahi - very good
(8) Bloody Mary - we did not order this drink but the bartender gave us a sample of the concoction the vodka is infused with - AMAZING

Cons:
(1) Our wait but as I mentioned, I don't feel this is the restaurant's norm 
(2) Chargrilled Oysters - came out cold, they looked appetizing but we sent them back
(3) Bathroom stalls (pro is there are bathrooms upstairs) - zero room (i.e. airplane bathroom)

Love the crab claw appetizer as well as the Alaskan snow crab | very fresh, crab that melts in your mouth without dipping it in the butter. Our server/oyster man/bartender Lawrence made our experience outstanding! WOW!!!

The specialty of the house is the redfish beignets and I highly recommend them. They are different and delicious. The gumbo was good as was the shrimp and grits. The waitstaff was great. It is a casual, fun atmosphere. The drinks are very good as well.
Hands down the best French onion soup I've ever had! And the Bloody Mary Cajun style was to die for  I cannot wait to go back
The food was great but not amazing. I had the gumbo and fried platter. Gumbo has good flavor and bartender was excellent. Loved the location with lots of traffic and people watching

My wife and I dined here the last night of our stay in New Orleans. I've worked in the restaurant business in the past for over 10 years. I know everything from front and back of the house operations. Needless to say we were highly disappointed. From the service to the food, everything we had was sub par. We didn't have a waiter, so the bar tender had to give us service. He seemed to be in the weeds, so I gave him a pass since I know how that is sometimes. We sat on the balcony, which wasn't as nice as expected considering the tables and chairs were slanted. It was very uncomfortable, felt unsafe, and we had to constantly watch our drinks and food to make sure they didn't spill over. 

I started off with a half dozen of raw oysters, oyster duo and a Old Fashion cocktail. The raw oysters didn't taste as fresh as I've had at other places. The cocktail sauce or whatever they call it was nothing but ketchup with a side of horseradish. The ice chilling the oysters was halfway melted and was spilling over into my oysters. The oyster duo was a little better but the breading/stuffing was over powering the oyster. Way too much stuffing on them. After completing our appetizers I still had not received my cocktail which was around $12. Once received it was brought to me in a plastic cup you'd receive in some club, not in a rocks glass. I had to request a silverware replacement twice because there were noticeable food stains on my knife and forks. Now that I'm on the utensils, why would any self respecting restaurant serve their guests cheap, scratched utensils? Looks like they purchased them from Dollar General. The plastic drinking cups were gross as well. Your prices are not cheap but you put out cheap looking utentils? 

I ended up ordering the rib-eye and my wife had the crawfish ravioli. I ordered my rib-eye med, and it came out med-well. The potatoes were good, but my green beans were cold. If I'm paying almost $30 for a steak, I expect it to be cooked to my expectations. The ravioli wasn't impressive either. It tasted like something I could have gotten at Olive Garden. After all was said and done, we spent good money at this place and it was not well deserved. The royal house has a good menu, but they need a makeover in the front and back of the house.

I had a late lunch today, the fried fish Po-Boy. It was served on the worst French bread that I have ever had. Dry and whiter than white. The fish was okay and I picked it out. The French fries were very disappointing as well - tasted like cardboard. I left 3/4 of my plate. To top it off, I put my bag on the floor- big mistake- when I picked it up it had been sitting in a big pool of water. The bottom was saturated and my guidebook was damaged. I do not recommend this restaurant!
The service was passable.
Service.at.bar wasnt.greatest but oysters were very good

Our party of 4 decided to eat here after a ghost tour. Had high hopes for the place as our server, Tina, was fantastic. 2 of us ordered the French Onion soup. One had to be sent back because the cheese on top wasn't cooked. That soup never made it back to the table. The crab claws were good. That's about all the good that I can say because after waiting for 40 minutes  (in a half full restaurant) our entrees never came. The manager was not helpful or accomodating at all. He had the audacity to say that our food was done when we asked him to just cancel the order, but he came to the table twice empty-handed.  Would never return here or recommend it. Clearly the organization, or lack thereof, flows from the top down.

Fuimos a esta esquina después de buscar y buscar donde tener una cena tarde  (tipo 22, tarde para los standards americanos) y este lugar nos gustó. Es bastante grande, dos pisos y un balcón que ya estaba cerrado. Está ubicado cerca de un hotel grande, asi que mucha gente imagino viene de ahí.
Nos ubicaron rápido en una mesa y la atención también fue eficiente. Si bien se especializan en comida de mar, no probé porque no me gusta pero pedí un sandwich de pollo que estaba rico. Mi novio pidió una pastas de mar y estaban bien. 
En el mismo restaurant tienen una pileta con las lobsters ahí. 
Aprovechamos que tienen un beneficio de entrée gratis con Yelp! Pedimos la opción de espinaca con queso.
truly enjoyed the oysters and fried alligator! great ambience as you hear the beautiful street musicians play their music!

The ravioli I ordered were from Costco and the Jambalaya rice we had to send it back to reheat. The burger didn't come with bacon like it show in the menu and they have to bring it in another plate. The drinks were ok. Location is good thou this is why I giving them two start.
Amazing meal at Royal House! So glad we came here. The service was top notch and prompt. The food was devine. Highly recommend the crab claws appetizer. That was the hit of the night!
The food here is fantastic! The waiters are friendly and the atmosphere is just great. If you're in the French Quarter you should eat here!!
The drink menu leaves a bit to be desired but the chargrilled oysters were phenomenal- the best we had during our trip to New Orleans.

This is a neat place on Royal Street in the Quarter. Great for French Quarter food, a lot of seafood so if you don't eat that, there's not a whole lot of options. The staff are very friendly, but the service is a little wishy washy. I wouldn't come here for dinner, but for lunch it's an alright spot.

Wonderful restaurant for oysters and fish. I had raw oysters that were way better than Acme Oyster House.  Entire of grilled redfish accompanied by lump crabmeat. Excellent. Brownie dessert.  Will definitely return

This was probably the worst restaurant I went to during my stay in NOLA. First off, the food took forever to come out - over 30 minutes after we ordered. Secondly, our crab salad was pathetic. For a $18 salad, that "crab salad" was a fried mess on even shabbier spinach leaves. The shrimp in the shrimp po boy was small and miserly. The Oysters on the Half Shell was the most disgusting oyster I've ever had. I'm sorry, but this baked (or grilled - I'm not sure) was stuffed with this SUPER garlicky, cheesy, salty mixture that completely masked the flavor of the oyster itself. I ate one and couldn't eat another. My bf liked it though, but it wasn't for me. And the gumbo was way too spiced and seasoned. The only good thing was the service. The location is fairly centralized as well. Due to the long wait, they gave us free drinks (sodas) and 10% off the bill. We also had the crab salad taken off because, well, just look at the picture. Would you pay $18 for that?

There was a little bit of a wait to get in (no reservations), but only about 15 minutes long. Way better than ACME down the street with its 3 hour wait. 

Not much of an ambience, just a casual setting. We sat upstairs and there was a terrace you can walk out onto on clearer days.

Kitchen should be ashamed and those pics of food people have posted are no longer accurate. Many things have changed. 

Oyster Po boy- ousters were old and not fresh. 

Shrimp and grits was awful with tiny shrimp from a frozen bag. And sauce was brown water with hot sauce. 

Roast beef Po boy must have come from a Campbell's soup can. 

We sent it all back, were afraid to get sick.

This was our favorite meal during our short trip to New Orleans. I will preface this by saying we came here after a few drinks so it was bound to be our favorite meal regardless. We got to sit out on the balcony facing the church which was lovely on this nice warmer night. Our server was just what we hoped for. He managed to suggest everything we were thinking of getting, was extremely entertaining, and attentive. 

We couldn't decide between all the different types of oysters we don't have the option of back home so he brought us two of each, which was perfect. the amount of breading and parm they added to some of them took away from the taste of the oyster itself but all of them were delicious and I'm glad we got to try some. We got the blackened redfish and taste of new orleans so we could test out some jambalaya and gumbo. All of it was spot on delicious and just what we wanted. Redfish was a bit overdone but seasoning was right on. 

Prices were not bad at all. They're open late. The atmosphere ties into the quaint french quarter feel, and I would definitely recommend stopping here!

You know when something tastes so good that it touches your soul and makes you close your eyes so that enjoy every single detail? Everything here will make you feel that way.

Our waiter, don't know his name but he had long dreads was so easy-going, relaxed and had a ton of great recommendations on the menu.

We had the Seafood Pescatore and Shrimp Platter along with Oyster Tacos and the Rosemblum Zinfandel. WOW. 10/10 for all dishes. The Shrimp Platter is VERY generous. Be hungry for it. The Seafood Pescatore is incredibly light. It will make you rethink what that kind of pasta is supposed to taste like. We got the scampi sauce instead of the marinara thanks to the suggestion of our waiter. We did NOT regret it!!!

First of all, the food was really good. I had my first chargrilled oysters here (which I do recommend). This place gets less stars because our server was distracted with another table and messed up my order. This caused my friend to be done with his meal before I even received mine. Not cool. We could tell he cared less about us and more about the larger table with older gentlemen.

Great place to eat! Crab claws are served in a delicious sauce. I loved the sauce so much that  asked for the recipe and the manager gave it to me. I ordered the baked shrimp tortellini and was in heaven.  Service was really good.

Stopped in here for dinner while at a conference. The place was not very busy and I got right in. I ordered the crab claws appetizer that was amazing and then the Taste of New Orleans as my main entree. It was just ok. I also tried the royal potatoes and they were very good. Price was good for the quantity of food ordered.
Had the Lobster Pot. It is excellent, and our server Heidi is awesome! The atmosphere and price were just what we were looking for.

We had one of our favorite meals during our last trip in NOLA at this place.  We had the Royal Spinach salad, Seafood Pescatore (we ordered it with rice instead of pasta), and oyster Po-Boy, and all of them were delicious!

We stopped in to grab a dozen, a cup of gumbo, and a beer mid-day before dinner. The bartender was nice and efficient. The oysters were the filthy and half way round the tray I had eaten as much dirt as oyster. Then the unthinkable happened, I forked out an oyster and in my mouth was a mass of spoiled inedible goo. What to do? Well I was pretty committed at this point having bit into it, and other than violently spitting it out my choices were limited. I then did the unthinkable and swallowed it. What the hell was I thinking!
After 2 hours in the hotel I was free from the questionable crustaceans grips; but boy oh boy girls, if this ever happens to you this is a spit not swallow occasion that your boyfriends will actually appreciate.
2 stars not 1 because I liked the bartender.
Amazing charbroiled oysters and fried alligator bites and I had a mule to drink!! Great cocktails and appetizers! Plus the service was wonderful.
Alexis our waitress was awesome! She helped us out and recommended certain dinner, appetizers and dessert! Thank you!!!

Food was delicious. Crab claws, and oyster pasta were great. But I had a major problem with one thing. I paid over $300 for my bill and the server asked me to pay the tip in Cash because they pool tips and he was in "bind" & didn't want to share with the rest of the staff. Very unprofessional and it ruined my experience. I paid the tip on the card and won't be back because of it.

Jambalaya had excellent rice and the smoky flavor that only comes from cooking it in the right order  (yes, jambalaya is not a throw everything in a pot at the same damn time dish)

Also enjoyed the gator bites.

Out of my entire 6 day trip in New Orleans, this place was by far the best place we dined at. From the service to the food, our server Alexis was great, recommended all the great stuff, super friendly and real! She was top notch, to be honest our best server in New Orleans and on our last night! Shout out to you Alexis! She said she would visit LA too! So if you're looking for good New Orleans style food, this is your place to go, I would come again!

Amazing service, great food and a god like oysters! Come here if you're in the big easy and hungry. From jambalaya to étouffée to shrimp and grits it's all great! You can't go wrong here. I may have got 2 dozen oysters because after the first dozen I couldn't believe how good they were I had to go for round 2!

I came here for lunch and the visit was very pleasant with nice staff helping us. I really don't remember what I got, but everything was tasty and felt like this place was pretty representative of awesome New Orleans food despite being in the heart of the tourist area. With that said, I think this is a great choice for curing hunger with yummy seafood.

Came here for a late night bite and it was delicious. Service was friendly and food came out fast. We ordered Rockefeller oysters and shrimp and grits. Both items did not disappoint. The restaurant is located at a popular corner of Royal and there is always beautiful jazz music playing outside.

What's a girl got to do to get some crawfish etoufee in NOLA, without *fried* crawfish?!? seriously, not everything is better fried (I know, this is a shocking fact to me as well).. and crawfish etoufee is one of those items. Perhaps, I should have asked how the crawfish were cooked prior to ordering, so that's on me... but I was sadly disappointed with my entree. I will say though that they rest of the etoufee components were good, but the crawfish are the main star of the show. Along with the etouffee, I also had the red fish beignets (see picture) for the first time. It was a good mix of savory and sweet, and a huge portion which would probably be best shared between two or three people. 

Good meal - not the best I've had in NOLA, but not the worst either.
The crab claws is a must. Delicious dipping sauce with crap claws and toast points. Gumbo is solid here and the bloody merrys are off the chain.

Stopped in for our first NOLO meal, gumbo. The menu says $6 but doesn't say size, it's for a cup. $9 for a bowl. Since we were working our way through NO, decided to share a bowl. Gumbo was tasty and if you like pepper you'll be happy. Gumbo comes with a couple pieces of white bread.

Our waitress was cute, friendly, offered some Go-Sees around town.
Alexis is awesome! Great service and excellent recommendations. Lots of fun! Thank you.

Royal House is one of the select few restaurants that is open on Thanksgiving Day. I was happy to find a highly reviewed restaurant open on a federal holiday so I spent my thanksgving dinner at Royal House. This restaurant is located in the French Quarter so parking is very hard to find but you can always pay for parking at various garages in the area and walk over. There was a short line on this night but out wait was only about 15 minutes. 

I was looking forward to the chargrilled oysters since this is a New Orleans specialty. I've had it this dish before at two other very highly reviewed restaurants in the French Quarter. I was very disappointed in Royal House's version of chargrilled oysters for one very important reason: size. A dozen oysters was 20 dollars so this dish does cost quite a bit so I expected some juicy oysyers but the size of each specimen was disappointingly about the size of an almond. I've never seen chargrilled oysters so small and all 24 of the ones we had were all tiny. The competition in the french quarter served oysters that quadrupled the size for the same price and in the same season as I visited those restaurants on the following night. 

We also ordered the blackened redfish, chicken sandwich, redfish beignet, and oyster pastry. The highly revered blackened redfish was ok, nothing too special. The chicken sndwich was ok. The oyster pastry and redfish beignet were very unique and tasty. The redfish beignet was covered in a sweet sauce. The shell was very crispy. Unlike a typical beignet which is square and has a dough filling, the redfish beignet was a long and slim rectangle with a fish filling. The oyster pastry was small but very tasty. 

There is a yelp check in offer for a free appetizer. No stipulations were mentioned on the yelp page for check in but our server informed us that we would only get a 10 dollar credit and that we needed to order two entrees. The chargrilled oysters do not count as an entree even though the cost exceeds many other qualified entrees and by a huge amount on some selections. I don't undetstand this logic. 

Two stars overall for this establishment. The price doesn't justify the experience.

We ordered a half dozen char grilled oysters and a half of raw. Oysters were huge and delicious, the grilled dripping in butter with the perfect amount of garlic and Parmesan. We sat out on the balcony with a great view around and the service was friendly and informative

Unfortunately I can't properly review this restaurant. We sat down to dinner, waited for about 20 minutes and never received service... Even though it was 5pm and they weren't very busy at all. 5-6 different servers passed by our table (as did the hostess who sat us at that table), but nobody ever stopped. Our kids were starving, so we left. Too bad - the menu looked really good.

I know everything is cute and decorated well in New Orleans, but I loved eating on the second level with the wood floors, exposed brick, white walls and various paintings. Now the food: everything we tried was what I imagined eating in this city would taste like. Tried the spinach dip, shrimp po boy, chicken and sausage gumbo, and fish and chips. Everything was delicious, especially the po boy. One of my favorite meals here.

ordered way too much food here. oysters were huge! but they weren't very tasty. i think that's just how oysters are in the south, cheaper, bigger, but not as flavorful as east coast oysters. very popular restaurant, but then again, it is in the french quarter.
I am a local, and this is where I bring my friends from out of town for chargrilled oysters. They are my favorite in the quarter.

Do yourself a favor and go elsewhere. 

Pros:
good location, open late, had a good server

Cons:
Overpriced, mediocre food that gave us explosive diarrhea all night instead of full bellies for going out to drink. Should have trusted the bad reviews. 


Went on a busy Friday night. Ordered crab claws app, though the Yelp coupon gives you a free appetizer without a price stipulation (to my knowledge), they only discounted it $10. The app was tasty, though only about 8 tiny claws, no seafood fork to remove the meat was given, and it was barely warm

My date ordered the oyster duo, the oysters were dirty. 

I had the shrimp creole, only some shrimp were properly deveined. This dish was barely warm as well. It was nothing special. 

Bottle of Ménage a trois was $38!!! It is a $12 bottle at publix. 

Our total check was over $100 even though we had the free app. Definitely regretted our choice.

Convenient seafood restaurant. Mostly crowded with tourist, the menu is correct and the food is good. We could not seat at the first floor unfortunately. We were quite in a hurry and the staff did everything to serve us in time.

Excellent seating on the balcony. Accompanied by street music.  Inattentive staff. Mediocre wine.  Got the pinot noir.  The crab in creamy sauce was good.  The sauce kind of heavy. The grilled oysters were too salty to eat.

During our four day stay in the French Quarter we are here twice. The oysters were very fresh and tasty. Hands down BEST hush puppies I've ever had. I'm still dreaming of them. Great location. Excellent service. Can't wait to go back.
Absolutely love the Royal House!!! Amazing oyster bar and a great environment!! Great service and a great place sit at the bar if your just wanting to chill and enjoy some chargrilled oysters!!!

We just loved this place. It's just off Bourbon Street, so not AS touristy. And it is within hearing distance of Tanya & Doris. Loved our bartenders! Just a wonderful atmosphere. We had oysters on the half, gumbo, crab claws and garlic bread-all pretty good!

Absolutely delicious. We got a dozen raw oysters to start but there were plenty of other tempting appetizers I was looking at. The waitress was very helpful and recommended the redfish, crawfish ravioli or the shrimp creole. We chose the crawfish ravioli and the shrimp creole.

The ravioli was amazing. It was so tasty I couldn't get enough - it was cheesy and had great Cajun flavor with just a hint of spice. The crawfish was the perfect compliment to the ricotta. The shrimp was really fresh and delicious a little bit spicier but just a little kick not too hot. 

Got a seat right by the window and could hear live music from outside on the corner. Had the football game on too! Great location on royal right near bourbon street in the French quarter

Royal House was recommended, and it did not disappoint! My sister, her roommate and I loved this place!! I had the crawfish etouffee and it was delicious!!!! New Orleans has some of the tastiest food I have ever tasted, and Royal House did not disappoint. The only thing we were disappointed about was that we couldn't sit on the balcony, I guess it was closed that day :(

Blah.  Royal House was decent, but nothing to rant and rave about.  The Shrimp Etouffee was flavorful, but a little salty.  The Shrimp and Grits weren't flavorful enough.  And the redfish was just plain ole crusty.  However, the crab fingers were delectable.  Service was an A+.  Would I visit again?  Probably not...

Omg I LOVED this place!  We sat upstairs on the patio,  and all we could see was the beautiful view of the buildings around us,  the violinist playing romantic music, some cocktails and an amazing dip and Crawfish app to enjoy in the process.  Highly recommend...

(Look for Ty. He was our server. That guy is GREAT)

French onion soup was cold twice. Honestly want to give this place two stars. I ordered the fried oyster pasta and it was just not good at all either. The gator appetizer portion was so little for 11 bucks. Would not recommend this place.

Ordered the taste of new orleans which had jambalaya, crawfish etouffee and, chicken and andouille gumbo... Prepare for a major carbo load with this order. For drinks I tried the Royal cup which was a very refreshig cocktail. Gator bites were also alright, my first and it tastes just like chicken! Our server was also very attentive and kept checking on us. We were seated outside but service was never an issue.

This was a spur of the moment choice for a large party on a tight time schedule. The wait was complicated by a disorganized hostess that poorly organized the line. While we were waiting, a woman had her wallet stolen from her table near the street.

To her credit, after finally getting a table, the waitress was fantastic and worked with our tight time schedule. The food was of average quality.  My wife had the shrimp and grits and I had chargrilled oysters and crawfish étouffée.  Unfortunately the oysters were drowned in butter and Parmesan and the shrimp and grits a bit salty. There are better options nearby but the atmosphere was cute.

Royal House is a must visit if you enjoy good food, great service and OYSTERS.

We stopped in on a Tuesday night. It was packed, which is always a good sign. (FYI, they do NOT take reservations Thurs-Sat, so get there early to grab a table). 

The restaurant is split up into a few different sections. There is a regular bar, the oyster bar, the downstairs dining room and the upstairs dining room. We sat in the downstairs dining room, amid all of the hustle and bustle and yummy, yummy smells.

Our waitress, Tina, was funny, charming and very knowledgeable. (If she tells you to order something, just order it. She will not steer you wrong).

We started with Oysters Royale (oysters with seafood stuffing, charbroiled). YUM. We followed that with two steaks, mid-rare with crumbled bleu cheese. The steak had a great char, a nice salty, buttery taste and it paired nicely with the potatoes and chef's veggies.

Finally, we dipped our spoons into the brownie a la mode. YES.

All in all, it was a really great meal and I can't wait to go back.

Food: all the food was amazing... Charbroiled oysters, tried the fried alligator.. Some of the group got the platters (fish oyster and shrimp) which were very generous portions of seafood, fries and hush puppies..I got the redfish with potatoes and veggies.. I would recommend all of the above

Service: our waitress was great.. I was debating what to order and she gave really good recommendations, even the host was super nice and friendly, pointing out the restroom to us as he seated us

Ambience: such a good vibe here.. Balcony seating, cute Christmas decorations in a seemingly historic New Orleans building 

Of all the places I ate at on my 5 day trip here this was by far the best

I am sure this is not the best food in NOLA but the menu is large and makes it so that everyone in your group will find something they like.

We came at the perfect time because after we were seated a huge line formed. Being a group of 4 we didn't expect much of a wait but had we gotten there a few minutes later we may have opted to go elsewhere.

Our awesome waitress looked just like Kendra Wilkinson and was able to put up with my sister's boyfriend! Not many people can lol. She also warned me to not leave my phone or purse on the table because it could be swiped by the passing crowds. We were seated on the first floor near the open floor-to-ceiling doors. It was a nice view and I enjoyed the breeze.

We each ordered a different entree and sampled everything. Yum! Again if you are with a group the Royal house is a great choice due to the variety of the menu. My sister ordered the crawfish cakes (1 free app with yelp check in) and they were amazing! Left me wishing I had ordered those for myself. I was way too excited for my shrimp and grits, anyway. The crowd favorite was the red snapper. I never would have imagined that a piece of fish could be so flavorful! If you dine here you must try the red snapper, it left us all feeling like we should have ordered that as our entree! The other options pictured were just okay.

Not the best por boy in NOLA. This place was recommended on Yelp.Not even close. Seriously, the gulf is right there and they served my shrimp por boy with Popeyes quality popcorn shrimp. No sauce.  Caesar salad drowning in dressing. Very first disappointment in NOLA.

Had an amazing time at the Royal House.  The staff are top notch and super friendly here. The vibe inside here's a white lit fun traditional social.   The primary reason you eat here is to have the Raw Oysters: they are the bomb here.  I had 2 dozen for the price of one simply for being a Yelper.  That's a free $16 off my bill.

Also had the taste of New Orleans which is a a quartet of jambalaya, crawfish etoufee, gumbo, and something else.  If you can, replace the jambalaya and the other unmemorable dish with more gumbo and etoufee which tasted out of this world.

I also recommend that you eat at the bar.  The random conversation with passerbiers and strangers was memorable.

This was the funnest part of my experience in New Orleans.

5 stars for service- Alexis, our server was so incredibly accommodating and helpful (we had a large party). She had great suggestions. 4 stars for food- The food was just what we were looking for; traditional New Orleans dishes- Po-boys, gumbo, etouffee, jambalaya.
wow absolutely fantastic! crab claws, po boy, gumbo everything was great, service food and atmosphere. will def be back next time I am in town.
Stopped here for a snack. Oysters were delicious but small in size. The shell was 3-4 times the size of the oyster. The taste made up for the small size of the oyster however

This beautiful and elegant restaurant presents as a perfect place for a special occasion dinner whether it's a romantic birthday or anniversary date, or a larger private function.  If you are planning a private function, you can get a good idea from their website with a very well done virtual tour, but you should come in person to get the full effect.  The oysters stand out as the best part of my meal.  It's an expensive place, but the food quality and high class service seem to match the prices.

Very average food, actually not great at all. Basically bar food. It was nice it was open later on a Monday night. Just average and probably a bit below average. Service was not real friendly and very ho hum. Hoped for more given the Yelp rating.

We came here last night for dinner. Unfortunately we only got to stray for an appetizer. Everybody else we were with were down the street at another restaurant so we had to join them. 

BUT..... While we were there, we had the best service and our waitress was amazing. We still had a few drinks and got to have an appetizer. We had the Caprese Tower Salad. It was very good. Tomatoes aren't in season so they weren't as red and juicy as I would have liked. 

The waitress was kind enough to bring us samples of crawfish etouffee to sample. It was very good. I thought that was nice of her to do that. She knew what we were hoping to get. 

Hopefully we get a chance to go back this week.

Three stars for price, not food. We had raw oysters, oysters Rockefeller and oysters Royal and they were all delicious. 

$12 for 6 oysters Rockefeller is outrageous in a city where good oysters are a dime a dozen. 

I enjoyed the experience but probably wouldn't pay to go back. The restaurant is a good atmosphere in the French quarter with a nice staff but too pricey for what it offers.
Just the experience of the wait" it's strange it always looks crazy long but the staff gets you in and out beautifully.  Charbroiled oysters to die for.. Lively environment yet not over the top

Yet another good review for Royal House, so I'll keep mine simple and to the point.

SERVICE: Super charming waitress serving us that wonderful southern hospitality. She called us "baby" and "honey" and gave us just the right amount of southern sass. Loved her.

FOOD: I got the shrimp creole. The shrimp and sauce were delicious but the rice was bland and slightly undercooked. My sister had the ribeye which was tasty and grilled to perfection. The side of vegetables were very bland though. My other sister had the bowl of gumbo - which was very lack luster, tbh. Every dish had a great portion and an "eh" portion. Not sure which outweighed the other.

Highlight of the night was the fried alligator. Can't believe I even typed that. It was our first time trying it. The picture looked so delicious - it got us feeling adventurous. I know people say "it tastes like chicken", but this seriously did! It was juicy, tender, and packed with flavor. The lemon squeeze and cocktail sauce really drove this home. I actually wanted another order after we finished it.

NOTE: Balcony only seats two people per table. Make sure you check in for a FREE appetizer - $10 limit.

Grilled oysters were amazing.  Service was excellent.  The crawfish ravioli were good but just didn't take me out of this world.  Love this place a its a must do.  So many restaurants in the big easy so four stars is really good.

Loved our oysters. Nothing like sitting at the bar and sharing a dozen gulf coast oysters. Nice atmosphere and Donald took really great care of us and gave us some great things to do while visiting. I would hang there for awhile and people watch if I had a lazy day.

We came back 3 times while visiting. Go upstairs and eat on or near balcony for best NOLA view near charming square. Food? Fabulous. Crab claws in sauce to die for and order side of red potatoes too. Staff is like eating in their home. We could have moved in!! Hot tip: go there!

I know this place is known for its fresh oysters, but it was 10 p.m. and we had been drinking so we were not looking for refined tastes. I had the oyster sandwich. I ate half of it with my fork because I could not close the bread. It was alright, everything tasted fresh and not overly salted but nothing to write home about. Service was awesome! our waitress was super nice and attentive. My husband had a rum and coke that the bartender pout coconut rum in, yuck. We switched it for a bloody mary, which he said was okay.

Service and ambiance is great. We had French onion soup, corn maque choux and crawfish etouffee. The French onion soup is thick (not watery) and is probably the best I've ever had! The corn maque choux is a dish of corn kernels mixed with heavy cream, peppers and creole seasoning (not spicy at all). It really was delicious as a side dish. Crawfish etouffee (which translates to "smothered") is perfectly seasoned.

Delicious, food came out fast.. Well presented and very yummy. Great service :-) 
Our waitress had a great charm and consistently asked if we were OK.. Quick to help us,offer suggestions and make us feel comfortable. Definitely a place to eat!

First and foremost, free appetizer with check in (score!)... Go with the crab claws, not only are they delicious, but the sauce they come in is literally to die for. Soak up every last drop with your bread, or ask to keep it on the table to use with your entree. Its that good. 

I got the snow crab pot for the entree, and it was great. It's cooked in a delicious spicy rub that really gets into the crab meat. My boyfriend got the seafood pescatore and loved it. Definitely get it "Tina style" and swap out the red sauce for a white wine garlic sauce- it compliments the seafood much better.

Last but not least, if you can get Tina as your server, you are in luck! She is so beyond amazing- sweet, funny, and will go out of her way to make your experience world class. She's probably one of the best servers I've ever had in my life, and that's not an exaggeration.

Came on a Saturday at 1:45pm with my boyfriend and we got seated right away on the balcony second floor. Enjoyed the view and the entertainment on the street but when the sun left we moved inside. We had already place our order since we knew exactly what we wanted and our waiter moved us in without a problem.

However with the rush they got it seem like he forgot about us. It was then when we almost got up and left around 2:45 that we got our food. I understand chargrilled oysters take a while but an hour long is a bit much. Everything came out at once and we thought it would be worth the wait but we actually preferred the oysters over at Dragos near the Hilton. Oysters here just seem bland and the po-boy did as well. 

Good location but food could be better

I heard such great things about this place. I came from Dallas, and was waiting until my last day in NOLA to try it out. The environment was great, but the service was terrible!!!. It took an hour for our foods to come out. We ordered charbroiled oyster, and a poboy sandwhich. The waiter came over 1 time during the hour long wait. The foods it self did not live up to the hype. It's safe to said I will not be  returning  to The Royal house in the future.
They got great oyster! I've tried acme, Felix and here. They got the best raw oyster.
Amazing food and was able to sit on the balcony. Recommend the crab leg appetizer and seafood pescatore and taste of New Orleans!
Very cramp, the tables that seat 4 are small card tables, knees are knocking.  Wait staff is friendly and helpful.  Food is good.  Bloody Mary not so - weak and glass tall and skinny.

If you're thinking about oysters, one great option is the Royal House. The service is great and it's less divey than ACME. 

We only ordered oysters as a snack. 

The chargrilled oysters are gooood. Butter and butter equals damn good. 

Don't bother with the Oysters Rockefeller. It's nothing but a piece of seasoned stuffing on top of a cooked oyster. It wasn't very good. 

Other than that, the Royal House is a winner.
a great stop for the family in the Quarter. something all of us loved - the balcony was great to people watch. great service too, also a discount for being a local resident! who would thunk it?

Listen to all the other Yelp reviews and get the crab claw dip! It's a little saltier then I would like but it was still delicious. The check in offer will take $10 off your bill so that is a score! It was our first night in New Orleans and decided to check this place out..nice place and nice ambience. My boyfriend got the shrimp and grits and his exact words are "it was okay I had better". I got the taste of New Orleans which is 3 different samples of their Chicken & Andouille Jambalaya, Crawfish Etouffée and Chicken and Andouille Gumbo. It was really good but a lot of rice...I really wish I got the fish instead.

In short, this is a 3 star restaurant not 4. The best thing on the menu we tried were the oysters which had toppings such as onions and peppers. But oysters are fairly common in New Orleans and they didn't stand out from the ones we tried at Acme (nearby). Also, one of my oysters had a little dirt which was unexpected 

We also tried the red fish blackened and the Cajun shrimp. While the fish was cooked well and had good flavor, it was underwhelming compared to similar fish choices (at similar prices) in San Francisco where we flew in from

The peel n eat shrimp was also underwhelming which had Cajun seasoning but lacked the sort of flavors you'd find at Boiling Crab or similar chains on the west coast

5 stars for our server Jason A. He was amazing. The appetizer we got were the crab claws and they were delicious. I got the oyster platter and that was good but not great. My mom got the blackened red fish and she loved it. Bread pudding for dessert and it was tasty. Will be back again.

Chose this place for an anniversary dinner with the boyfriend on a Sunday night. I wish I had requested to be seated upstairs with a balcony view, but it wasn't a big deal. Something I'll remember to do the next time I return! We were seated immediately upon arrival and since the table was already given to us, did not want to have to inconvenience the restaurant with the request.

Suggest asking for Tina as your waitress if possible! She was funny and entertaining with her southern sass, one of the best servers I've had in a while. It isn't often that I'll rate a review as 5 stars, but honestly there was nothing lacking in service, environment or food that night.

Food Highlights:
+Chargrilled Oysters: Concierge at the hotel I stayed at mentioned Royal House has the best chargrilled oysters in NOLA. While I cannot attest to that, I definitely could see how it is ranked as such. Fresh warm oysters topped with parmesan butter cheese, great starter to open up the stomach.
+Crab Claws: I already had my eyes set on this dish after reading reviews and seeing pictures. It exceed my expectations as I didn't know what to expect. The lemon garlic butter sauce reminds of a crab bisque consistency, but the real winner here is the crab claws themselves! These tiny succulent crab claws really soaked up the flavor of the sauce, could not get enough of them! Highly recommend this appetizer!
+Blackened Redfish (w/ Crabmeat): Tina recommended saving some of the crab claw sauce to place on top of the redfish. This was a tip she provided since an additional $4 would be charged if we ordered it with the dish. Definitely thankful for her suggestion! The sauce was exactly the thing needed to top of the dish. Fish was blackened perfectly, meat was tender and still maintained its fresh-caught flavor.

No disappointments here!

Wow. THESE are the BEST oysters I've ever had. As soon as I tried one, I paused to admire the deliciousness if these chargrilled oysters. I got the dozen and ordered another half dozen after the first bite. The peel and eat shrimp is also delicious with a hint of a kick. MUST VISIT here in NOLA.

Visited New Orleans for Halloween weekend and me and the girlfriend were looking for some really good Cajun seafood. We were originally looking for the places where they dump your food on the table and you eat with your hands but we came up short in the French Quarter. We figured we'd try Royal House since it had great reviews and we saw they had seafood broils.
Looked over the menu and I couldn't find a dish that had everything I wanted so I decided to order the Dungeness Crab and my girlfriend got the Peel n Eat shrimp and we would share.
They were out of the damn crab :( and I'm not a fan of working hard for snow crab just to get such little meat. So I went with the peel n eat shrimp as well.
Let's just say I wasn't at all disappointed they were out of crab because the shrimp was AMAZE! Perfect flavor, perfect hint of spice, and they brought a whole lemon when I asked for extra. Bonus points!
We also shared the bananas foster cheesecake which was perfect. 
Overall delicious food topped with great service.
The place looks fancy but don't let that scare you off. I was elbows deep in shrimp juice and no one seemed to care!

Service was the only thing somewhat good . Food was ok . Feel like I could find same quality po boys in Los Angeles . The shrimp on my
Po boy  was lacking flavor tasted more like it was frozen than fresh . Expected better from a place known for it fresh sea food .
The redfish beignet was excellent. The best appetizer I have had in new orleans. I had the red fish which I felt was overpriced but it was fresh and good.

First meal in NOLA and was quite satisfied! We had the red fish beignet appetizer (save $10 when you check in on Yelp!), chargrilled oysters, crawfish etoufee, shrimp creole, and chicken and andouille gumbo. The crawfish was deep fried so I couldn't tell whether it was fresh, but the sauce was quite tasty! The shrimp creole wasn't nearly as spicy as our waitress had claimed it to be but nonetheless made for a hearty meal. My favorite was the chargrilled oysters, which were the most cheesy and flavorful oysters I've ever had. We ordered half a dozen but honestly should have taken the waitress's advice and ordered a whole dozen! This was definitely the most unique item on the menu, so don't miss out.

Service was a bit strange in the beginning. Our group waited outside for a good 5 minutes before anyone came to greet us. But upon getting seated, our waitress was more than attentive, so I guess that made up for it.
Catastrophically terrible and chaotic service. Took about an hour to serve something cold to the table. This is a tourist spot with more people coming than the restaurant can handle. Try to avoid.

Red fish beignet (free app) on check in. Shrimp and grits and seafood pescatore were delish. Too much to eat for 2 person and salty but the flavor was intense. We sat on the balcony. We wanted to try the banana foster too but was way too full.

Our first stop at NOLA, we were greeted by very friendly staff. I started off with God father 2 and enjoyed the drink. We then ordered the chargrilled oysters with garlic parmesan sauce. I was trying oysters for the first time & I thought it was good. For entrees, we ordered shrimp poboy & blackened red fish. Both were average. I thought the red fish was overdone & needed flavour. Overall I wasn't totally impressed by the food, but the staff were great!

We came here for a light lunch so we got raw oysters, chargrilled oysters, and the duo. We also ordered the taste of New Orleans that came with gumbo, etouffee and jambalaya. The trio was pretty good and what you would expect. The oysters were pretty good as well and the chargrilled one was absolutely amazing. I'm deducting one star because of the extremely long wait for the rest of our food. The raw oysters came out fast but everything else took forever. We didn't even order that much so I was surprised that the table next to us that came after us got their food first, finished and was ready to leave by the time we got our entire order. I was peeved about it but our waiter was nice but he did seem kinda clueless at times.
The Blackened Redfish with Crab toppings along with potatoes & green bean medly is highly recommended. Everything about the plate was delicious & the customer service was wonderful as well.

Great service and food!!! We stopped in to soak up our hurricane. The line was down the street but we were lucky to scoot right to the bar. Nairobi, our sever, recommended the shrimp poboy and stuffed mushrooms and they were soooo good.  The oysters are big and fresh. Like the size was ridiculous!!! I would definitely recommend it to anyone.

Great food, superb service. Some of us were vegetarians but the server took care of us. And what good food, one of the best we had on New Orleans and the only place where I didn't feel stuffy. What's more, they also have walk-ins which we really appreciated since we wanted to keep our plans flexible.
Do yourself a favor and order the dozen chargrilled oysters.  Six is not enough, and these are amazing!

We went for lunch on Christmas day and really enjoyed our food (the shrimp creole was delicious!).  Only reason I'm docking a star is for the length of time it took us to get our food.  This wasn't a big deal since we didn't have anywhere else to be for a while, but for those on a schedule it could have been an issue (we were there for almost 2 hours).  Don't forget to get your free appetizer w/check in on Yelp!  The seafood stuffed mushrooms were very tasty!!
Fun Food Fabulous The most entertaining view from upstairs if you can climb 25 steps Down right loved everything

Great service and lovely seating and views. I also enjoyed my Absolute Mule. However, I admit I was disappointed with the food. The charbroiled oysters weren't too great. While the crawfish ettouffe was ok it wasn't the greatest and that's the main reason I was there. I'd say it's good for tourists but natives should only have the drinks....at happy hour.
We stopped for lunch and it was wonderful. Our server made suggestions and so glad she did. We sat on the balcony and enjoyed the view. Would recommend!

Good food, good location but comes with a rather long wait for a table. I had the seafood pasta and the seafood was fresh and tasty, but nothing speculator that would place it at a 5-star level. Char grilled oysters are good but nothing compared to what's available at Felix restaurant.
Overly priced dishes with fast food quality. The boiled crab was far from fresh. The margarita were lukewarm... I can keep going.
Shrimp etoufee was good, but the shrimp creole was lacking. Service was good, but the appetizers and entree took forever to arrive.  Crawfish balls were good.

Went to the Saints game, met Derek & Mike from Ohio they recommended me & my wife try the place out & man glad we took their advice, the food was incredible !! My tongue exploded in my mouth from the ridiculous deliciousness of all the food !! We had the sautéed crab claws, charbroiled oysters & the bananas foster, best we've ever had in New Orleans. Our bartender Darielle was awesome as she treated us as well as all the guests at the bar with her southern hospitality, quick wit, & excellent service. Love this place & we will definitely be back ROLL TIDE !!

we were lucky to have a short wait and everything was great. we had the fried alligator appetizer and finally tried some chargrilled oysters, serious buttery garlic heaven. Emma was our waiter and she was great and gave us good recommendations. we will definitely come back again!!

Very good meal. 
Shrimp PO boy was superb. 
Waiter and staff were very attentive. 
Quick and easy seating.

Very disappointed!!! This is my first Yalp review because I felt got ripped off! We came because good review and pictures, we waited in a line and I was very exciting to taste it but when we see our dishes, I can't believe my eyes! We ordered shrimp and grits, shrimp Jambalaya and New Orleans sampler, they were totally different as the pictures posted by others!! The shrimp are super tiny!! The food look like from low end restaurant and the waiter didn't even give us silverware to start with and didn't check with us how's the taste either,  I was super disappointed the experience,  not worth the money at all!

We came here Christmas Day. I'm not  huge seafood person but my wife is and she was happy but agreed it is a 3.5 star kind of place.

I ate the red beans and rice as well as some Corn fritters. The rice and beans were simple but nothing worth writing home about especially when compared to all the other amazing places I have had them. The fritters were small but good and they had chipotle mayo for dipping which was a nice suggestion from our server. The service was very slow but I'm willing to forgive them on account of it being Christmas and everyone just wanting to go home. I felt bad there was a family ahead of us that had been waiting 45 min for their table. The hostess prepared it 30 min ago only for a miscommunication that caused the table to be split back up and the family to wait and wait. 

If you come here sit on the balcony. It has great views and really takes you back in time.

This was our first restaurant that we chose to drop by for lunch. The staff were incredibly friendly. We wanted to start our holiday with some drinks. We ordered the Godfather 2 and Basil Fresh. I didn't either of them as I found them to be too strong. Little did I know that, that's how the Nola(ites) like them. 

it was first time for my wife on the chargrilled oysters. We bought really enjoyed them. For entrees, we ordered Shrimp Po Boy and Blackened Red Fish for our entrees. I felt that the Shrimp Po Boy was average and the blackened red fish seemed to be over done and lacked flavor. 

Bottomline: Great staff but very average food.

Definitely the best food I've had in New Orleans. Our server was extremely nice. I checked in for a $10 discount on our appetizer, which was worth it. We got the red fish beignet. I would probably get the puff pastry next time. I would also avoid the raw oysters because they're so small compared to some other places nearby. But the main entrees made up for these things. I had the best seafood pescatore I've ever had. The lemon butter sauce was perfect and spicy. The crawfish ettouffe was also a wonderful blend of yummy crawfish and seasoning. I definitely come back for the entrees and great service.

I was told about Royal House by another Yelper. It was a warm welcome for some late eats after a night of traveling. The inside of the restaurant is small and intimate but gets packed rather quickly. If you check in on yelp you receive a free appetizer with the purchase of two entrees. The appetizer is limited at $10.
