Since there aren't many appetizers at that price point, the restaurant allows you to pay the difference in a more expensive appetizer. 

For the appetizer I had the Redfish Beignets which were so different but amazing. I ordered the Fish Poboy for my entree which was equally as tasty. The service as great too. I wish I had a special delivery of those beignets now!

Nice location, food was overpriced for the taste and the service was horrible.  

Getting seated took forever, and they didn't take into account the order we stood in line when taking several parties up at the same time to their tables.  

Servers didn't come around to see if we needed anything and our waitresses didn't smile once.  

Out of all the places I visited in New Orleans this was easily the worst.

Really underwhelmed with the quality of food. We had the spinach dip appetizer (average), gumbo (disappointing very bland),  and the shrimp and grits (also bland and the shrimp had a strange flavor). Crystal hot sauce made the meal almost palatable. I'm leaving still hungry. 

The decor was amazing! 4 stars for service. 

Maybe it's an off day, but I would not come back again.

We were craving some authentic New Orleans food and we were not disappointed. Oysters were delicious and prices were really reasonable! The entrees are a great size. i had the crawfish ettoufee and it was amazing. tons of crawfish, both simmered and fried!!
Looked up Royal on yelp. Disappointed very bland food. The food that was srrved was cold. Had to send it back to warmup. The gumbo and jambalaya were average to beliw average.

We got into New Orleans pretty late in the day, hadn't had time to make reservations, and turned to Yelp to find an authentic New Orleans meal in the French Quarter. Well, Royal House did not disappoint! The fresh Oysters were outstanding and the other dishes we had - Jambalaya, Gumbo, Fried Alligator, and Crawfish Hushpuppies were all flavorful and cooked well. Nothing was overly spicy which was kind of nice since we were able to add hot sauce as required ;-) The staff was friendly and the service was good too. Though not necessarily on the highlight list for well-known French Quarter restaurants, I recommend Royal House for a taste of New Orleans and the Quarter. PS - the Mint Julep's are outstanding!
Awesome place! Only waited 10 minutes on New Year's Day. Got the sampler of all the traditional meals. The ettoufee  was the best I've ever had. Can't go wrong here!

Bad food. We were hungry & less of a wait here. I will give you a shrimp & grits recipe if you email me. That was the worst shrimp & grits ever. Weird tasting & weird texture. Oysters were bad too. Just awful. Waiter friendly. Great atmosphere. Bad food. I don't mean to be mean, but I hope you try to improve from this post.

I love me some New Orleans. It's probably my favorite city to visit. I was down there in August for a bachelor party and we decided to get the group up and go to a nice dinner. I called ahead and got a table reserved for us since there was a sizeable group. They accomodated us very well and our server was outstanding. I had the shrimp and grits and they were some of the best I've ever had and I have tried them at many places across the country.

Had lunch at Royal house when in New Orleans for a conference in October.  

The service was solid.  I enjoyed my Hurricanes (lol... when in NOLA).  I decided to try things I'd never had before and so had fried alligator (yummy) and oyster tacos which were also really good!  

It was a gorgeous day and we sat near an opening to the outside and so were able to enjoy the weather and watch a street performer while we ate.

All around an enjoyable experience.

Best place I ate at in New Orleans. Chargrilled oysters are the best. My boyfriend and I preferred them to ACME's. The crawfish etouffee was also very tasty and the oyster pasta had delicious plump fried oysters on top. The banana's foster cheesecake was also amazing. Service was a bit slow, but our waitress was great and has great recommendations. Use the Yelp check in coupon for $10 off!

Went for dinner on new years eve.  Sat upstairs.  Friendly staff and service.  Charbroiled oysters were awesome!  We also went outside to the balcony for drinks and people watching.  Lots of fun will go back on our next trip!

This was our first stop in Nola before checking into our lodgings, was NOT disappointed!  
We arrived as the doors were opening. I HATE being that person, but we had been flying all morning and were starving! Our server, Gaynell didn't mind at all, and was very warm and welcoming! If you can, sit on the balcony, you can hear all the street performances nearby.
We ordered the gumbo (has a kick but so delicious on a hot day), the alligator (the BEST I've ever had, although the cocktail/tartar sauces were kind of boring. You guys should come up with something more unique to justify the price), and a shrimp po boy, which was seasoned to perfection.
For dessert, she talked us into the bread pudding, and omg I'm going to make this next family get together. The peaches inside gave it such a unique flavor! It would taste just as good without the raisins I'm sure.
I'm a fan, and I'm going to suggest it to anyone who goes to the Big Easy :)

Went here middle of the day during a busy weekend, there was a line but it moved very quickly. Good atmosphere.

Chargrilled oysters were very good, highly recommend them. Crawfish ravioli was good, lots of meat pieces, good portion without being too heavy. Alligator po boy ok, nothing too exciting, tastes like fried fish/chicken.

Amazing! The red fish beignets are mind blowing, you will highly regret it if you don't try that appetizer! Everyone is so friendly and the service was great! Highly recommend if you want to try some good LA food!

This place already has a bunch of good reviews....and i guess i will add one more. 
The fried oyster tacos were a delicous appetizer. The crawfish ravioli is a total winner. It was really good.  I also liked the shrimp creole. The waiters were moderately attentive, however it was really busy. I would happily eat there all day every day.

The Saturday after New Year at 7PM. The restaurant was half full. We ordered Crawfish Cakes (less than 3 oz a piece costed $11 each and it was ok), Taste of New Orleans (rice in Chicken & Andouille Jambalaya was under cooked. The rice of the Crawfish Etouffée and Chicken and Andouille Gumbo tasted like microwave), Shrimp Creole (rice tasted like microwave and the shrimps did not taste fresh), Bananas Foster Cheesecake, and Bread Pudding. The desserts were nothing to talk about and all other dishes were salty. The whole meal costed $70 without drinks. May be we need a few drinks to find the food taste better!

Excellent choice for dinner! It's in the middle of a lot of stuff and the food is excellent! The crab claws are amazing (appetizer)! The crawfish ravioli was fantastic also! Our table also had shrimp and grits and shrimp po'boy- they were good but not great. Excellent drink selection.

I find it extremely admirable when restaurants take the time to listen to feedback . Though my experience here wasn't stellar in terms of food , when I gave my feedback someone took the time to get back to me and that shows me that someone cares and will work to improving the experience for others. Thank you

A resounding "meh." The food was not particularly good and felt poor quality and mass produced. I am not sure exactly what went wrong with my mojito, but it was actually un-drinkable. I saw so many great reviews on yelp, so we made this our first meal here in Nola. It was disappointing.

My husband and I ate hear during our quick stay in New Orleans. I tried my first Po-boy (fried fish) and it was delicious. My husband got jambalaya, which he really enjoyed too. The drink I got was delicious (tangerine something) and our waiter was quite the character. He had good jokes to tell us throughout checking in on us during our meal.

A bit pricey and touristy, but one of the best meals we had. We adored the crab claws and asked for extra bread to sop of the impossibly delicious sauce. Try the shrimp Po-boy sandwich or seriously, get a second order of crab claws.

The Royal House gave my friend and I a pretty authentic idea of what New Orleans was all about. When we got there, we had to wait about 30 minutes to be seated, but we figured it was worth it. We ended up being seated at the upstairs bar, where a passionate woman named Cyndi waited on us. Let me tell you: if you go to Royal House, request to be seated near Cyndi. Her personality is awe-inspiring, and she made our lunch something to remember. 

We ordered appetizers: oysters on the half shell, redfish beignets (which I highly recommend) and fried alligator (again, I highly recommend!). It was all delicious. The only reason why I don't give the place 5 stars is because it took longer than usual for us to get our food. But overall, the staff was in good spirits and we enjoyed our meal!

Honestly, the best restaurant in NOLA! The charbroiled oysters and the crawfish étouffée are something that my husband and I keep coming back to! We cannot get over how good the appetizers and entrees are here! The service is so friendly as well! Overall, the experience at this restaurant has been enjoyable the number of times we've come.

Antoine's was closed on New Years Day so I quickly looked around for a place to try nearby and I am SO GLAD WE DID. This was one of the best meals we had in New Orleans (and we are foodies). The chargrilled oysters are the best oysters I've ever had. EVER. Oh my gosh, I'm sitting here just wanting to go back to New Orleans so I can eat them right this very second. I can't recommend this place enough!

The interior is cute, ambient of the early 20th century mansions that used to be prominent everywhere in the south. 

The portions are ... SMALL for the price. I eat a lot, but I mean, for nearly $20, you can serve a bigger portion of food. The service was pretty slow, too. Some of our appetizers came out after our entrees did, which was awkward... I would've returned them but the service was good, so we rolled with the punches.

The crab claws were good- perhaps the best item they had. The shrimp and grits was BLAND-maybe they forgot that they forgot to add seasoning? We actually couldn't finish it, and the portion was dinky. The shrimp creole, however, was pretty good. 

And, as for the chargrilled oysters: they were good, but the acme house's are better. yep, I said it. 

But, all in all, it was a good experience. A little overpriced for the quality and quantity of food, but I suppose the balcony view and the service make up for it.

Food was very good no complaints. Had the red snapper.  My issues is the credit card machine has been down for two weeks.  We were never told. It was the guy out Side that told us the two week.  Totally unexceptable.

Perhaps because we were sat very close to the kitchen and there was a whiff of moldy wet smell from it, so my experience wasn't so great.  

That being said, our server was really friendly, attentive and nice.  
We had the 
1) Redfish Bigness, yummy!  This is really good, I would reorder.
2) Taste of New Orleans.  Good local taste, nothing spectacular that you must try. 
3) Roast Beef Po-Boy.  This is just ok. 
4) Bananas Foster Cheesecake.  This is excellent!  Must try in my books.

TVs everywhere.  Quite noisy, but isn't that true everywhere in NO?

Ok, so my friends absolutely raved about this place but I found it only ok. Atmosphere ok, food ok, drinks ok, and nothing wrong with the service. I enjoyed the free appetizer with yelp check in. I got shrimp and grits, it was ok. I have never had this traditional New Orleans food before so I was so excited, but underwhelmed with it. Perhaps I just don't like that dish, but nothing else about this place really stood out to me.

We stopped here after our all day flight, arriving extremely hungry. Showed up here. Yelp said it closed at a certain time and we were several hours before then. Well the man at the door said they were closing early and recommended their sister restaurant. It was a block down. It was mostly a bar though. Anyway, we ordered po boys and sazarack drinks. Both were really good, but to be honest, anything would've been good. Our waitress was super friendly and kind. Wish I could remember her name. We would go back because of her. The food was on the same level as most of the places we ate at in New Orleans.

Great atmosphere! Awesome service! Our waiter, Ty was very friendly, informative and helpful. My hubs had the New Orleans Trio and was very please. Loved the flavor of all three entrees. I ordered the chicken Caesar salad, when it came they had forgotten the chicken. They apologized all over themselves and fixed the problem very quickly. We also had an order of spinach dip and hush puppies, both were delicious!

I thought I had experienced most of the Cajun and Creole food that the Quarter has to offer, and then I found Royal House on my annual visit to NOLA this time. I'm not sure how it had escaped my attention for so long given the extensive and excellent reviews. 

If compared to Commanders Palace or Antoine's, Royal House is not going to blow you away with innovative New Orleans cuisine. This is a solid, delicious and nice place to experience the cuisine that makes NOLA famous in their most traditional form. There is ONE thing that sets Royal House apart: the charbroiled oysters. I don't like oysters normally, but these are a clear exception. They are fresh (we saw them being brought in to the restaurant by the cart loads), grilled over a charcoal fire, and smothered in melted butter and parmesan cheese goodness. How can one go wrong with butter and parmesan cheese? 

The grilled scallop salad was a nice large tasty healthy choice, and the shrimp po boy consisted of fresh French bread and a generous portion of fried shrimp (though I like the shrimp batter better at Mother's and Oceana). The rawfish ravioli is a very large dish that should be shared by two people in most cases -- warning: It is RICH and sweet. 

We only had one complaint. It was a very chilly day outside, and the host seated us by the door. A brothel has never seen a door open and shut so many times as it did during our hour lunch. The hosts that would stand outside LOVED to go in and out of the door every 30 seconds, and every damn time, they would leave the door standing wide open -- freezing us to death. It was like every host had ADHD. THEN the oyster folks decided to make a delivery during our lunch, which consisted of at least another 10 trips in and out of the front door (is there seriously no back door?). Ugh. Folks, please be sensitive if you're going to seat customers by the door on a cold day. 

Our server was really nice, knowledgeable and engaging. We were seated immediately upon our arrival. The manager came by to make sure that we were having a good experience (which we were except for the swinging saloon door).

Ok, enough about the door. The food here is great, and Royal House has earned a place on our list of options for our annual trip. You should try it too.

We came here for dinner and were really happy that one of the poppin spots in FQ had no wait! Yes! So our party of 5 was quickly seated upstairs. Good start! 

So I'm vegetarian so I'm not THE best to review a seafood place. But the spinach dip was really good and FREE cause we checked in on Yelp!! I asked the server and she was helpful in recommending a pasta with hella veggies and marinara sauce. It was really good and it had a kick to it, so must have added some cajun spices! It was huge and $20. It irks me a bit when places charge me the full amount (I got a seafood pasta technically without the seafood) even though some green beans don't cost the same as shrimp, but I always understand that they can't always discount me and stuff. 

My friends all thought their food was good but nothing crazy. 

What is deduction in a star for me is HOW long everything took. The spinach dip was forgotten and she got really weird and said to stop the rest of our food, and focus on the spinach dip, then brought out the food way later. It was all just weird and really annoying.

Ughgggggvjjghnnfghnhgt. Why do people eat here?? They are coasting on name and location. Filthy. Everything was sticky and the place stank. Mediocre oysters-- not served cold. The rest of the meal was gross. Even the server was dirty. No no no. I love oysters and love eating in the Quarter. I will never go back here.

My friends and I came here for drinks and snacks on New Year's Eve. It was busy, but not crazy.  The mint juleps were amazing, and the fried alligator and hush puppies we're delicious. 

Unfortunately, service was abysmal, so I'm not sure I go back. The bartender/server wasn't just slow, but actively rude and scowly, and she seemed angry at my group, even though we weren't very loud and ordered quite a bit of food and drinks.

Sit upstairs and get a great view of Royal Street, even if you don't sit on the balcony. The upstairs room is casually elegant and a bit quieter than downstairs. Very nice.

The highlight by far are the chargrilled oysters.  Definitely order them and ask for some extra bread to sop up the delicious butter sauce.  I have a weakness for shrimp and grits and these were outstanding.  The crawfish cakes and fresh oysters were very good though not memorable. 

Also a must try are the awesome Cajun bloody mary's.  Admittedly based on commercial Zing Zang sauce (a-ok with me, it's delicious) with an added house-made Cajun zing. Very very good.

The service is pedestrian.  Not terrible, just okay.

Overall Royal House is a delicious oasis right in the middle of the touristy French Quarter.

A friend and I ate here tonight (Saturday evening) for dinner. We had excellent service (Chaz was great) and delicious food. I had been here twice before, and I've been happy each time. Tonight we had the crawfish cakes (yummy!) as an app, and I ordered the crawfish ravioli. I was really happy with my meal and I look forward to coming back and ordering more things on the menu!

We went into this restaurant expecting a lot given the rating and the number of reviews. The food is mediocre, especially compared to felix's and acme. My shrimp n' grits are too salty I couldnt finish it.
Their seatings outside on the balcony for 2 people are pretty cool though as you can people watch. The floor is tilted though so I was really nervous when eating, afraid that m dish and glass will slide down the table.

We tried the Chargrilled Oysters, oysters Royal, Redfish Beignets, and the Shrimp and grits. Every part of this meal was amazing. We showed up at 10:30 PM on a Sunday (30 min before closing and were greeted warmly! Thank you for a great experience!

We waited a little bit to be seated in the balcony. We had very good view of Royal street. It took a while till someone came and told us that he'll be back to take care of us. when he came back he talked over the menu like 30 words per second and then I remind him that we haven't got even any water. we never got drink menu either. and took him forever to come back for order. We ordered one of his recommendations for appetizer, which we didn't like at all. The funny part was when he asked about our appetizer and we said that we didn't like it, he replied back, "I told you to order something else."
and the Taste of NOLA wasn't that good either. one of the cups out of three was cold, and the other one was too salty. Jambalaya wasn't that bad.
After waiting again for quite a while he came back and said if you pay with credit card it'll take awhile because they have some problems with their system. I paid cash but it took him forever to come back with my change anyway. 
There are lots of better places in NOLA to have great food and service, don't waste your time here.
Great food, great atmosphere! When you are in NOLA .. try it.  Po Boys are the best!

Wow! We were walking around French Quarter and my boyfriend wanted a PoBoy. I whip out my phone opened up yelp. And found this place. This place had the most reviews and most positive reviews.

Our server Jason, he was so friendly, helpful, and attentive. Jason gave us recommendation because I couldn't decide. I ordered the Taste of New Orleans and my boyfriend got the oyster PoBoy with french fries. Jason brought us alligator sauce to try with our fries. The alligator sauce had a kick! My lips were tingly. 

My order of Taste of New Orleans was a sampler of three cups of jambalaya, crawfish Étouffée, & chicken and andoullie gumbo. They were all very authentic and the best I have ever tasted. I really enjoyed the Étouffée the most. It was creamy and packed with crawfish. They didn't skim on the rice. I'm asian I love rice! 

The oyster PoBoy was delicious too. I had a bite of my boyfriend's sandwich. Fried oyster was cooked perfect. I also really enjoyed eating off the french fries on his plate. French fries was extra crispy, nicely salted, and not soggy. Best french fries I've tried while on my trip here. I'm glad I came here for lunch today. Thank you Jason for a great experience!

Succulent oysters for your aphrodisiac fix. Shrimp and cheesy grits are to die for, and the shrimp étouffée rocks the Royal House. 

Best place to sit is at the bar or the upstairs balcony, where they perform a variety of street shows down below. 

These guys have a famous Bloody Mary, which was so delicious I asked them to hit me again! Perfect for lunch while shopping for Art and fudge on super fun Royal Street!

Royal House was a great spot for my first NOLA style lunch. It's located in a charming, French Quarter styled building off of Royal Street. 

They were able to take our group immediately and sat us by a window. It was a gorgeous day so they didn't have a problem opening large ceiling to wall window to let us enjoy the fresh air. 

We started with the fried gator bites for the group. Delicious! It was big enough for four of us to sample while still saving room for the rest of our food. 

The cocktails were also notable. I went with a berry martini followed up by a basil berry cocktail. I appreciated them at the time but I should have appreciated them more. They are a lovely change of pace from the touristy sweet stuff. They were strong but masked it well. 

I went with the Taste of New Orleans which consisted of the Chicken & Andouille Jambalaya, Crawfish Etouffée and Chicken and Andouille Gumbo. I enjoyed my meal, but to be honest all of these kind of tasted similar. There were only slight variations. I had some of these items at other places and they had much more flavor and distinction. There were so many more creative dishes like the Crawfish Ravioli, Baked Shrimp Tortellini and Shrimp Creole just to name a few. Plus, I tried a piece of my friend's crab claws and it was knock it out of the park amazing. I've never had crab claws before and didn't realize how easy they were to eat. 

Our server was friendly and funny, but a little hard to track down at times. 

Beverages, atmosphere, the gator bites and friends food lead me to give Royal House a 4.

I'd love to replicate the fried alligator bites from Royal House. Crispy, meaty and not at all reminiscent of the scaly, scary creature. Perfect!

In addition to splitting the bites with our group, I had my first gumbo here. It was tasty with a small kick, but I don't have anything to compare it to just yet as a quality verification. For a drink, I ordered the berry-rita. It was strong and sweet -- certainly not my typical boozy drink of choice, but it was enjoyable.

My favorite part of RH was the ambiance. It was a comfortable 70 degree January day in NOLA (!!!!), so a staff member opened the ground-to-ceiling doors to let the fresh, warm air in. You really can't beat that type of dining experience!

Our server was nice and quirky. He shared several jokes at the end of our meal, but I'm not good at processing funny things apparently, so members of the group had to explain each one to me. Ah, well.

I'd recommend RH for first-timers to NOLA. Four-star experience!
Really good food and view of the city while you eat! Had the peanut crusted Mahi (and I'm from Florida where Mahi is prevalent) and it was one of the best Mahi I've had.

We came here soon after arriving in NOLA for a friend's birthday. I had been to NOLA before and seen this on the corner and wanted to try it. Love the setup and the modern yet old feel when you walk in. The staff is very friendly, aside from a local who tried to call out the Falcons while reppin his precious Ain'ts. Now I know my team has a ways to go, but don't do it to yourself. However, he redeemed himself with great service. We checked in on Yelp and received a free app. We ordered the redfish beignets. Now I'm not a seafood person. But THOSE were GREAT! I didn't expect that sweetness with something whose name has the word 'fish' in it. But they were good. I also ate the blackened chicken sandwich, which was great. It was a lot of food for a great price. Only thing I didn't enjoy was the table. I'm a full figured woman and those chairs were killer and the table was small as heck. But that's more of a me problem.

Alexis was great! She was patient with our indecisiveness, but the food was fantastic! Oyster tacos were perfect as an entree, and the slaw was surprisingly flavorful but not over powering. Would love to come back again!

Great food. Highly recommend the crab claw appetizer, as our server suggested. It was a bunch of little blue crab claws in the most divine butter sauce, served with bread for dipping. Even my health and fitness sister-in-law loved that sauce. We kept it through our meal to dip EVERYTHING in it. 
He also pointed us towards the chargrilled oysters topped with crab meat (huge hit at our table). The cocktails were lovely as well. 
Randomly walked in on a weekday, so were seated right away. I forget our server's name, but he was very attentive and pointed us to the best stuff on the menu.

The selection of oyster appetizers is very good, the side Caesar salad is very fresh and flavorful.  The banana foster cheesecake was very disappointing.   Price per person with no entree, but with appetizer, side salad, dessert and one drink was $45.00.

My husband & I came here after we checked into our hotel. We were promptly seated. We also were surprised at how busy it was on a Monday night. Our waitress was very nice. We shared the fried alligator bites, which were tasty. I had the shrimp po-boy, & my husband had the roast beef po-boy. Our sandwiches came with fries. We really enjoyed our food. There was a lot of shrimps in my po-boy, & they were very good. If you check-in on Yelp, you get $10 off on an appetizer. Just show your waitress.
Bartender Cindy in the upstairs bar knows her stuff! Excellent Bloody Mary! Want something else? She'll hook you up. Perfect Nola atmosphere. And the menu is full of authentic NOLA cuisine.

Awesome!  The food the people who work there, the atmosphere, perfect! Terrence was more then just accommodating, interacted with my son making the New Orleans trip amazing for him! Management was concern on service to boot!  An absolute most stop!

Royal House, located directly in the French Quarter, is a quaint restaurant (if a little too crowded for my taste). We were greeted quickly by both our server and the host, and our food came out in a timely manner. After sending back the burger that I ordered for being severely overlooked, they brought me back a delicious one that couldn't be any better! The service was amazing, as I'm not local and had a ton of question for the server, whom either already knew the answer or asked around just to be 100% sure. I would come back for the great service received from our server alone!

First time in New Orleans and it's my boyfriend and my first night here! We decide to go to Royal House to start off our trip with the trio dish - etouffé, jambalaya, and get our first taste of real southern food! Unfortunately, the trio dish came out cold and didn't taste that great to begin with, including the bread that it came with that seemed to be somewhat stale.  The shrimp po boy was just alright and did not leave an impression.

Good thing we ended at Cafe du Monde for some beignets to recover the night!

Went to a wedding pre party here that had amazing fried oysters, great barbecue shrimp, typically mediocre New Orleans style crab cakes (I'm a Maryland native) and a wonderful serving staff;  So decided to try them another evening for their dinner menu; Here goes...wait staff real real slow but very cordial; fried oyster and shrimp poboys a disappointment; loud and I mean loud parties around us so we moved and they put another loud group around us; suggest their managers actually manage and their cooks move back to the Waffle House for training; By the way, the upstairs bartender is 5 stars and is the best reason to go there.

This place had really good food, however the service was basically a turd in a dress. We literally saw our waitress 3 times including when she brought the check. I would like to be able to rate the drinks but seeing as how I was never given the opportunity to order one I can't. I do not even know the waitress's name as she didn't introduce herself. I would definitely go to anywhere else if I had a choice. My girlfriend literally had to eat her soup with a fork because the waitress couldn't be bothered for a spoon. We finally just drank it because obviously a spoon was too much of a hassle. I guess if you're hammered you don't really notice the crap service, too bad we were sober.

Well, the reviews were better than the food.  I really expected much better in the heart of New Orleans.  The batter on the fried food was too heavy and lacked flavor.  The shrimp were small and overcooked.  The fish filet was bland.  The service was good, but not good enough to overcome the very average food.  Royal House was a big disappointment.  Too much of a tourist trap with far better alternatives close by.

The drinks were great. I would recommend the bloody Marys and oyster shooters. Great crab claws, awesome oysters, and very unique shrimp creole. Magen was our waitress and she was exceptional. Wonderful experience.

Royal House is set in a beautiful French-inspired building right off of Bourbon and close to Jackson Square with downstairs seating for people watching, an upstairs area, and balcony seating that is a must when the weather is nice. 

Service was excellent - the staff was super friendly, outgoing, and had a great sense of humor. They were attentive and kept the cocktails flowing (and they did a great job making these cocktails). The food was excellent - the Sampler provides the right amount of food and enough Cajun classics for you to eat as a meal or share with a group. Be prepared for a line or wait, unless you get here off hours.
Disappointing on the food, was served in 2min after ordering, that means they pre cook before you order...not cool.  We even got our main dish before our appetizers which were raw oysters.
We enjoyed a fantastic lunch of Seafood Pescatore in a historic setting. The service was timely and friendly.  We would gladly return.

Love Royal House!  I have been twice on two different trips to NOLA and it's now in our list of restaurants we will eat at each time we go back!  We started out with two appetizers, the crab claws and the artichoke crab dip, they did not disappoint. The sauce that the crabs were soaked in is so great they give you bread to soak it up with so nothing goes to waste.  The dip was also really good, it was hard to stop eating it.
My husband had both the raw and charbroiled oysters that they serve and he said that were amazing!  He ate them all weekend at various restaurants, even Dragos where they are supposed to be "the best", he said the ones at Royal House were so much better! I got their shrimp and grits, they were great as well, the grits weren't as creamy as I would like but it all tasted great, nice and spicy. My son has a very well cooked burger and my daughter insisted on eating their crab claws as her meal, she liked them as well.

No need to pontificate here...this is a must try restaurant in the French Quarter. Service was excellent on a very busy Sunday afternoon. I'm afraid I forgot our waiter's name, but he was a spot on tall fellow with glasses from Michigan. Here's the rundown...the BEST fried oyster PoBoy we came across in New Orleans, and we tried several from highly rated restaurants. We loved the Chargrilled oysters, easily in my top three that we tried in the area...and this visit was a Chargrilled Oyster Tour. Drinks were not impressive, except for the Moscow Mule. We looked forward to trying heir bread pudding because it have gotten a lot of love...for us, it was just decent. I know, everyone has their own taste...but a fat man knows great food, and the bread pudding wasn't great.

Have been here a couple times now and I really like this place! Best oysters I have had so far, especially when it comes to the French quarter!  They have delicious pastas and bloody Mary's too! :-) it's on the pricier side so it is definitely a "date night" or special occasion place for my boyfriend and I to go to. We love it though! It's a must try! :-)
Eh, tourist trap. Classic first night in a new city mistake. The crayfish cakes were good. The drinks were large and fun. Not worth your time in a city with so much spectacular food.
Used to have excellent oysters Rockefeller.  This time it was dry. But fun nice place to eat. Raw oysters were somewhat gritty.

Ordered the Rockefeller and char-grilled oysters. The food was just ok. It wasn't my favorite place when we visited NOLA. Our server was very friendly though. The interior was very nice. It was quite cold when we were there so we didn't get to sit on the balcony.
Great Cajun/Creole food. Visiting from NY and wanted some legit oysters. Our server Tyrone was extremely amicable, loved his job, gave us great recommendations - the best server in NOLA!

The ambiance is nice and relaxed without being guady, which is a refreshing change of pace while walking around the French Quarter. It seems you either get divey or fine dining. In any case, while the restaurant itself was nice, the food here was underwhelming. The cooked oysters weren't all that great (I tried every variety), and the seafood was about average. Nothing was terrible, mind you, but there are simply many better options around the corner. The service was very good, so there's that. I didn't get to sit on the balcony, but I hear that's a plus if you do get the opportunity to. Oh well...

We were first timers who took advantage of the Yelp check in offer! Food was slow and even slower when our server didn't ring in all of our food! Over all a good experience, food was good. But if servers can't remember a complete order for a large table they need to write it down! Ugh. Chargrilled oysters

Came here with my brother for a late night dinner. Waited in line for over an hour but we grabbed some beers from a convenience store around the corner and made the best of it! We were seated upstairs and got the drinks flowing. Very friendly service, absolutely top notch! 
The food itself was very good. We started with fried alligator, seafood stuffed mushrooms and crab claws. All were delicious.
The kitchen was extremely backed up and the food did take a very long time, but we kept drinks coming and I even think they gave us a round on the house. We got the shrimp 'n grits and the taste of New Orleans. All of the food was very good and the service even better.
Great bloody marys and best fire roasted oysters we've had so far. Cindy, the bartender, is quite good. Enjoyed our afternoon with her. Excellent service.
Great typical creole food, don't sit on the alcove as the door is been opened quite often ( in winter).
Great food and great service! I had a dozen raw oysters and the crab claws and omggggg they were delicious!!!! I will definitely be coming back next time I'm in NOLA!

Love this place one of my favorite places in New Orleans, One odd thing whenever we eat downstairs the food is better, The butter and garlic on the oysters as creamy and smooth and upstairs it's kind of firm,

My favorite place to get oysters in NOLA! Get the DUO... won't be upset. We also ordered the crab claws as an appetizer. The sauce was to die for... but the claws were a little small and portion was disappointing for the size of the claw. But... they were excellent so don't count me out for not ordering them the next time... just might request a handful more... cross our fingers. 

I ordered the shrimp creole given reviews and photos on here... I was slightly disappointed. It had a marinara taste to it.. wasn't expecting that in a cajun dish. 

Overall... best oysters, GREAT SERVICE, nice atmosphere. Will be back and try a new entree.

I went here on Friday evening, me and two of my friends were able to be seated right away. They have a beautiful balcony seating, but only if you have a party of two. 

The servers we encountered looked like they really lover their job, lots of high energy and smiles as soon as we walk in. 5 stars for service.

I ordered a classic shrimp po boy, the server ask if I wanted to sub the fries for a side of gumbo. Of course I said YES, huge mistake. They gumbo, for lack of a better word tasted  like crap, bland crap at that. My two friends actually sent their gumbo  back. There is no amount of hot sauce, salt/pepper that could fix it. I decided to keep my crappy bland gumbo only for the fact that it came with my meal. I was so disappointed to be in New Orleans and have bad gumbo. The po boy wasn't bad, but it was that great either. Mediocre at its best.

I hate to sound like one of those cheap-o's but the side of gumbo was a $3 up charge. I felt like the server could have at least mentioned that. I for sure would have sent that gumbo back. I hate have surprises in my bill! 

My table also had the crab claws as an appetizer and they where exceptionally delicious! I almost licked the bowl. 5 stars for the crab claws. 

Overall, maybe just get the appetizers from this place, I you can find much better and cheaper po boys and gumbo elsewhere.

Contrary to popular belief, not every restaurant in the French Quarter serves oysters. The Royal House does. I had lunch there. Their batter was a little too heavy...much like that for fried chicken. I prefer a lighter "Cracker crumb and egg" version that lets the oyster be the star.
Service : excellent, friendly, attentive and accommodating. Oh, did I mention Fast!?
Music: Ehh.... I would prefer something more New Orleans. Old 1980's Madonna is OK, but... At least it wasn't too loud.
Ate here for dinner on my last visit and really liked the upstairs dining room. 
I'll be back whenever I'm in town.

Had this place booked marked. Actually walked right by with my girl when she suggested a mid afternoon schnakin.  Turned around and looked at the menu. Lo' and behold! Just what we wanted. A roast beef po'boy. 

Got sat right away. It wasn't busy for a Wednesday afternoon. Our server, Christin, suggested the crab claw appetizer. OMG!!! Creamy, buttery goodness!!! Served with toasted bread. Little crab claws and the sauce from the gods. We even got the recipe from the manager (No. I'm not giving it to you. Go and get it yourself). So good. I have to go on a serious diet after this trip. 

But, the po'boy? This is what culinary dreams are made of. Simple roast beef dressed in a gravy that words cannot describe. Tender, juicy beef. The roll it was served on was a perfect compliment. Served with fries. Perfect schnakin. 

Try this place as soon as you hit NOLA.

The staff was very friendly and attentive.  We ordered the Crawfish Etouffé, Shrimp Po-boy, a Hurricane, and a Mint Julep.  The food was solid but nothing mind blowing.  The Crab Claws were definitely my favorite. It came in a tomato-ginger-lemon sauce and was super tender.
great charbroiled oysters and raw oysters.  Def worth a stop if in the French Quarter and want something off Burbon

Late nite dinner. Wanted to go to Napoleon House but the kitchen was closed. :-(. They suggested Royal House. Spinach dip was too greasy and cheesy. Redfish beignets had powdered sugar and sat in Cain syrup. Unique flavor. Crawfish etouffe was the best dish ordered. Chargrilled oysters didn't have any char or grill. I asked for French bread and the waiter was happy to report he would bring some. He brought 4 pieces of COLD sliced bread. Overall very disappointing.

My bf and I had this restaurant on our top list of places to eat. Food is very delicious we had the crab claws for an appetizer. Bf got the shrimp creole and I ordered the crawfish ravioli. Everything was excellent except for service. We sat at the balcony and our server rarely came to ask if we wanted another drink. Offered us bread and plates which we never got. I don't know If I would come back before we leave.
My favorite place to have oysters in NOLA. Love sitting in the windows eating and people watching. Best Chargrilled Oysters in NOLA!

My friend picked this place, because she was craving French Onion  Soup, I've always  walked by this place, but didn't  really give it a second glance, because it's advertised for its Oysters and other seafood dishes. I've mentioned  before, I don't eat seafood. So I glanced at the menu, on the way, and noticed some dishes I could try! When we arrived, we were shocked that it wasn't crowed, and got a table immediately. It was  awesome wheather, and was lucky enough to get a table by the window/door panels, close to the street traffic. 
So we were greeted by our server Terrance and he was so charming and awesome, he made great suggestions, but we declined and ordered what we had our hearts set for. I also received a free appetizer for checking in,( Thanks Yelp!) I picked the Spinach Artichoke Dip, which was amazing,  it was a little bit spicy, which was a nice take on a traditional dish. I really enjoyed the freshly fried tortilla chips. For my main dish I ordered the Royal House Burger with Cheddar and Bacon. The burger was cooked perfectly, and sized just right. I did feel as though my fries were a bit overcooked for my liking. And I wished I had went for the red bliss potatoes, over the deep fried , fast food style, french fries. Personally  I would've expected, and preferred them to have fresh cut potatoe fries.  But ohwell. The food was great, and service was even better. We might stop by one last time before we leave town!

Hubby and I had our #1 meal at the Royal House. We were celebrating my birthday and popped in on Jan 23, 2016. There was a short wait of maybe 5 min and then we were seated. I cannot remember our waitresses name but I do know it began with an A. She recommended the Crab Claws...OMG!!!!! the sauce that comes with it makes you want to drink it from the bowl and then lick it clean. She also recommended the Blackened Red Fish...I am salivating just thinking about it. The flavors and the fish being cooked to perfection was amazing. We also had the Fried Alligator and yummy Chargrilled Oysters. I wish I could give them more than 5 star. We ate at several excellent places but this was truly the best!

Enjoyed the fried gator and shrimp and grits.

The raw oysters were fresh, but not used to shells being unclean and shell/sand fragments in the oyster meat.
It was ok.  Literally..  It was just ok.  Not impressed.  I don't mind the wait time, I mind the quality of the food and the semi clean tables.. And the piss ridden bathrooms.

This place was just average and I probably wouldn't eat there again. The alligator was okay. The corn was great. However, I went to order the shrimp and grits. My server said he wasn't going to let me order that. He suggested the best thing on the menu - the crawfish ravioli. It was gross. The inside filing did not have a good texture and by itself didn't taste good. For the price there are better restaurants I would recommend. 

Service as good and prompt.

The hubs and I arrived at the Royal House after trying not to cut off a couple parades and dodging a few bead bombs. We met with his Aunt and her friend and agreed to stop here.

I was marvin'! I had not eaten pretty much all morning up until we arrived at like 3pm.

I am a noob when it comes to Cajun/Creole food and the only "Cajun/Creole" food I've had is Boiling Crab up in The Bay. So what better place to have that type of food than in the South.

I ordered the Shrimp & Grits and the hubs had The Taste of New Orleans  that came with "A sampling of the city's most famous dishes: Chicken & Andouille Jambalaya, Crawfish Etouffée and Chicken and Andouille Gumbo"

He said that he liked the Jambalaya but that the Crawfish Etoufee was very salty and very fishy. Surprisingly enough, they were all not hot. Room temperature at best. 

I honestly should've ordered one of the Boiler Pots. I did enjoy my dish for the most part. I loved that it was full of shrimp. I loved the sauce but I needed it more spicy for my taste.

 The service was sweet! Everyone was really really nice..but it was cramped as hell in there. Overall it was just ok, not our taste or style..
I thought the jambalaya was ok.  I like the chargrilled oysters at dragos much better.  Alligator bites were a interesting and good appetizer.

Me and my girlfriend wanted some chargrilled oysters without waiting for hours at Acmes so we decided to come here since it had good ratings and isn't as hyped. We got an awesome balcony seating with street musicians performing great music at street level. They have a $10 off a appetizer Yelp  check-in offer with the order of two entrees that is greater than $12 in value. We ordered 1 dozen of chargrilled oysters, 1 lb of boiled shrimp (come with 2 potatoes) and the crab claw as appetizer. The chargrilled oysters was phenomenal, it was drenched in butter and simply delicious, why don't they make oysters this way everywhere?? The boiled shrimp was also delicious, I didn't use the cocktail sauce that it came with, I think I tastes better as is with the soup that it was cooked in.
The crab claw had very little crab meat in it but the sauce that it came with was creamy and very tasty, it essentially just because the dipping sauce for our bread and potatoes. 
We loved the seafood, the balcony view and street performance here, definitely beats waiting in line for several hours for marginally better food at Acmes.

Service: excellent, we had Heidi as our server. Prompt, polite, G rapport and attention to detail. 
Food: overall great. I recommend adding hot sauce to the Jambalaya, brings out the best of the dish. We had the Taste of New Orleans, which consists of Gumbo, Jambalaya, and Crawfish Etouffee; Shrimp Creole, and for dessert Bread pudding. 
Drinks: I hated the Voodoo juice- simply because it has banana. But a must is the Hurricane.

Excellent food and even better service. If you get a chance to sit in Tina's section, do so because she is a great waitress and has a wonderful character. Great food, central location... Can't go wrong eating here.

Night of Mardi Gras,  45 minute wait but split up in two couples and got right in on the balcony. Awesome service and food, reasonable price. Live music on the balcony next door was a plus, but don't know if I can attribute that to the restaurant!

First stop we made after checking into our hotel. We split multiple oyster platters, fried gator, gumbo, po' boys and more. Everything was incredible. This place is a must when visiting NOLA. The menu is huge and chock full of delicious creole and cajun food. I still dream about their food. The service was top notch as well. Beautiful old building in the French Quarter. Go. Go now!

I was searching Yelp for a place to have shrimp and grits while in New Orleans.  The Yelp photos from Royal House looked real good so I decided to give it a try. Unfortunately, it did not taste as expected.  I prefer my grits to be smooth and creamy but in fact there were bits of chopped vegetables in them.  I like vegetables more than the average person but I did not want them here. Also, there was something in the sauce that tasted like straight vinegar.  I took a few bites and could not go on.  My waiter was kind enough to let me exchange it for something else.  I wish I could say the 2 items I later got was very good.  But in fact I thought one item was edible but not something I would order again and I could not remember what the second item was.
Ashton was a wonderful server, had only been there a month but it seemed like years. Foodwise i definitely recommend the white fish platter and the crab claws appetizer!

The crab claws were Delish! I had the Crawfish etouffe which had a nice flavor but a little watery and my husband had the fried Crawfish poboy which he liked and was very filling. Good size portions and nice flavor.  I also had an amazing Bloody Mary (flavor and decor were on point)! I had no wait time around 2pm. Our server was a bit slow to come back a few times but very nice. (Visited on Sunday afternoon 2/7/16)

Had my first po boy ever here.  It's not the fanciest restaurant but had a great selection of creole inspired dishes.  Our server Raven was so friendly and made the lunch even more enjoyable.   Onto the food/drink.   I got the special margarita.   It was a little too sweet for me but a very generous portion nonetheless.  The po boy was delicious.  They did not skimp on the shrimp at all.   It had a nice seasoning and crispy  breading.

Boy - do I love me some crawfish etouffee! This is something that I never would have discovered if I didn't visit the Royal House, and that is something that I never would have found if it were not for the recommendation of a random local on the street.

Yep, it is true what they say - locals do know best and this was no exception! It was our first real stop in New Orleans, and not one to be forgotten. Service was on point, the drinks were strong, and the food was excellent. What more could a gal possibly ask for?

Oh, and if that wasn't good enough they also offer a Yelp deal ("Free Appetizer"* - *Actually its $10 off  an appetizer, but several are right at the $10 mark - effectively making them F R E E! Kris and I chose to try Alligator (for like the first time, ever!) and at $12 it was only $2 to enlighten our tastebuds to this tasty critter!

As well as the Alligator I decided to try the sampler which featured red beans and rice, Jambalaya, and the fantastic aforementioned etouffee. The whole plate was delicious but the etouffee really stole the show for me. I miss it, like legit actually miss it. I have yet to find it in Los Angeles and the only Creole guy I know who could probably make some bomb-ass etouffee does not like crawfish (go figure!). Kris had the pound of shrimp (MP) and boy howdy were those shrimp big and delicious!

We also had the apple spice cocktail (MMMMM!!!!) and hurricanes - both very well done. 

Royal house was an exceptional meal at a wonderful price. All in all the kind of place where you think to yourself "I should be paying a lot more for this..."
Our server, Jerimiah, was awesome.  He was very fun. The food was excellent.  We really enjoyed the char grilled oysters. The crawfish cakes and the oyster puff pastries were good too. Will be back.

Fantastic food with even better service. Joseph was extremely attentive to our table, and made sure our experience was top notch. I will definitely return here for the food as well as the amazing staff.

Joseph was our waiter and he was awesome! Very friendly and always there to check up on us. We chose to sit on the balcony and silly ole me thought there would be heaters (40 degree weather). We asked Joseph if he could move us to a table inside if it became available and he was more than happy to! 
Awesome service & awesome food!
Spinach dip--superb
Gumbo--okay
Jambalaya--very tasty
Seafood pescatore--ordered it scampi style and was delicious!

Thanks Joseph for an awesome dinner experience!
Crab legs were great and so was the drench onion soup. Had the King Louis salad, and it was whatever. Great atmosphere and wonderful staff

Great spot close to many tourist attractions, such as Bourbon Street, that at the same time feels not-so-touristy. Good for romantic dinners for 2 on the balcony or a meal with a group of friends. The menu features excellent raw and char grilled oysters among a variety of other items. For me, the best part about Royal House is not only the atmosphere and location, but the price point for such a great restaurant in such a touristy part of town.

Love this place ... Great drinks and food of course ... Order the crawfish ravioli it's hella delicious ... Fried gator bites and the shrimp creole ... Come with time as most likely there will be a line ... Enjoy

Long wait, lukewarm food, and slow service. When we got there, we knew there was going to be a wait but didn't expect an hour and a half. The nice waitress took down our name, and told us to check back in 45 minutes and go off to explore and kill some time. We came back early, after only a half hour and they said that they had called our names and given away our table (even though the expected wait time was 1.5 hours). So our names go back on the list and we stay and wait...and wait...and wait...until we checked again and they passed our names again! 

When we finally got a table after waiting who knows how long, it took a long time to actually order. I was so excited try southern food so of course the Taste of New Orleans was the perfect way to sample everything. Too bad everything came out cold, and the waiters were too busy that night to flag down and get warm food. The chargrilled oysters that we ordered were good, but too salty. My friends also agreed that their food was also pretty salty, and just overall mediocre. 

Overall, definitely overhyped. Poor service could be because it was extra busy that night, but there is definitely no excuse for cold food.
Truly a taste of NOLA! Loved everything from the oysters to the gumbo! Can't wait to go back on my next trip to the big easy! :)
Tried to get off bourbon street and found this place. The food was amazing and I'm going to go back.as soon as possible. The wait staff was great and really went the extra mile.

Yes again,  royal house did not disappoint. Great service, great atmosphere,  great drinks, ama amazing food.  The coleslaw was actually the best I've ever had. I had the blackened chicken sandwich, very good flavor.

Great staff. Food was good but a little too rich for my California veins. 

We had 
- blue crab claws with lemon butter and bread.  Very flavorful.   Claws are small.  Sauce was rich.  
- chargrilled oysters. Was just ok.  A little drenched in garlic and butter
- crawfish etoufee with grilled and fried crawfish.  I like the added crunchiness however it was a little salty. 

Overall his restaurant is at a great location and had very nice staff.  Food was just way too rich for me to feel good after I ate.

Royal House was open late and had great service. It was the only restaurant we could find open at 10:30 PM. The wait staff got us a table right away and our waiter was great. Brought us fresh drinks and made food recommendations. We had the gumbo, French onion soup, artichoke dip, and banana's foster for dessert. The food came out in a timely manner and we devoured it.

Probably the best shrimp and grits I've ever had or very close to it! I practically licked the plate. I've been here twice...and I don't live in NOLA. Both trips we had great servers with fun personalities and, as suggested by Ty, we checked in on yelp for a free app. We had raw oysters and they were fresh and yummy! Siting on the balcony is great if the weather allows because there is often a woooonderful trio of violins that plays on the adjacent street corner. I will be back!

Great drinks accommodated a large group 
Food took a bit was cold they heated it and it was okay

This place was excellent and we really enjoyed the food.  We had the crawfish etouffe, crawfish ravioli, blackened shrimp jumbalaya, Redfin fish beignets, grilled oysters and hurricanes to wash it down.  All so so good.  We ate upstairs near the balcony so the atmosphere was small and intimate.  Downstairs seamed to look a little cramped.  Had to squeeze through two tables to get to the upstairs.  All and all good choice for dinner.
Great service. Huge oysters. We also got the trio of jambalaya, red beans & rice, & gumbo to sample. Nice atmosphere (white tablecloths) but not too fancy. The oysters were my favorite!

Picture yourself sitting on a sunny balcony enjoying a glass of wine while an impromptu band plays jazz on the street below. The atmosphere is perfect and the food is to match. The service was fantastic and I can't stop dreaming about the Crab Claws appetizer!!

We had a great experience. Marco was such a great server! The seafood platter with shrimp and fish was so good as well as the redfish entree. The views from upstairs of the French quarter was nice. You can hear the street performers singing from your table.

This place was really busy(Valentine's day & 2 conventions in town)  the staff were genuine and fun to be around. I highly recommend the crawfish ravioli. The po- boys are ok & so if you want one, you may want to buy it at a less expensive place. A bit slow to get all the food out. Overall, great experience.
Pretty good food. Had a couple of shrimp Poboys with fries. Nothing out of this world but decent.

Tried this place while on vacation in New Orleans and it was the best food I've had in quite a while. The drinks were so delicious and not too strong in taste but you most definitely feel the alcohol in them. Next time I am in town this is a must stop for me. I really regret not stopping in one last time before we left. The Taste of New Orleans was just perfect. And our waitress was great!

We waited for an hour and a half to be seated and once we were, our party was separated because they could not accommodate a party of 8. Only complaint was the restaurant is too small for the crowds of people trying to dine. We ordered grilled oysters Rockefeller & seafood stuffed broiled oysters. Rockefeller oysters had too strong of a bacon flavor so you couldn't taste the oyster. The seafood broiled oysters were great! My fiancé ordered French onion soup & it was decadent & slightly thicker and richer than any I've tasted or seen. I ordered the pasta with fried oysters on top. The pasta was ok. Typical pasta with cream sauce. But the fried oysters?? The absolute best fried oysters I've ever had & ive eaten a LOT of fried oysters! They were breaded & seasoned perfectly! Will def visit again when I'm in New Orleans.
Crag legs, balcony seating over royal street, stiff drinks. That's what the royal house does.

Hush puppies delicious with a kick. Redfish, potatoes and green beans were terrific. Powerful mint juleps. Friendly staff.  Shrimp Jambalaya delicious. Charming , exposed brick, high ceilings. Excellent gator appetizer!  Fresh brewed iced tea. Drinks took too long to arrive, gumbo not as good as other places, bland bread. Huge tasty bread pudding.

We love this place. Close to Bourbon St, without the wild life and noise. The restaurant offers a simple menu with delicious New Orleans food and wonderful intimate balcony seats. During our dinner, we had live music from a street singer below.  

Anyone who visits can safely any dish is a win. I had a wonderful assortment of samplers. The gumbo, ettoufee, and jambalaya were all well seasoned, flavorful and filling.

My wife had a Fried Oyster Pasta. This dish is a must try!  Creamy, delicately crusted and fried fresh oysters, and a loaded serving of al dente pasta makes this dish to die for.

We've eaten here twice on two different trips and I plan on returning every time we visit. This trip we were served upstairs by Magen M and she's wonderful. I let her order for me and she selected Blackened Redfish $28 (moist in the middle crispy on the sides and perfection) with Royal Sauce (creamy and awesome)and coleslaw (apple infused so it's got a sweet finish and is the best coleslaw I've ever had). I will definitely order it again. The wife had a blackened chicken sandwich $12 but subbed it on French bread since they don't have a Blackened Chicken Po Boy (a little weird they don't). Had the spinach artichoke dip $9 and hush puppies $5 as an appetizer and they're both solid. Management needs to acknowledge Magen M and her awesome service and personality. I'll request her when we return.

This place is OK.  Nothing to write home about.  Food is ok, service is ok.  If I had to write a top ten list of restaurants in NOLA, I wouldn't include Royal House because when you are on vacation you want to be wowed and this place is as mediocre as they come.
Nice venue, friendly staff, but slow service if you eat at the bar.  The boiled shrimp was a long time coming ( and overcooked).
A. Mazing.  Do not miss the Oysters Maque Choux or the Crab claws in garlic butter sauce.  Laid back but excellent service.

I came here for lunch. We were able to get a table on the balcony, which was nice. The balcony, however was a bit slanted so it didn't feel like the safest place to be. We ordered two bloody Mary's. They were ok. I think the mix needed more spice. It tasted very much like tomato juice, with not much else. We ordered the Parmesan crusted oysters, which were good. We also shared the crawfish cakes. They were ok but had a lot of filler. I ordered the blackened shrimp jambalaya. It was ok. I wasn't blown away by it. My boyfriend had the crawfish etouffee. He liked it, but wasn't blown away by it either.

Thanks to Max Freedman - Former head of Tulane's GWMSL chapter (Guys With Mad Skinny Legs) - I was told about this place 

Nice bar setting, sat next to some blonde country singer who really wanted my hog, she ok, but she suggested seafood pescatore - with scampi sauce. Great with good kick to it as well - can't go wrong 

Raw oysters good but char grilled oysters are over the top - Loved em.  Gay bartender was a delight too

Worth stopping by

Awesome place!!! Good food, good ambience for an early morning breakfast or brunch, and awesome drink selection. Our waiter was super knowledgeable and accommodating and even made us a breakfast shot!!!! Oh nola....

After travelling from Atlanta, my friends and I decided on Royal house because it wasn't far from our hotel and it stays open later than other surrounding restaurants. This was a very good choice. 

We were seated quickly and didn't get drinks because we planned on hitting bourbon street afterward.

The food was delicious! From the appetizer to our entrees, none of us were disappointed. We all ordered fish, and it was fresh but still flavorful with enough food for leftovers. 

Other patrons seemed to be enjoying their drinks ( some were loud) but it wasn't a bother. I definitely need to find a way to fit this restaurant into my itinerary every time I'm in NOLA.

We waited 20 minutes for 1 beer and 45 minutes for oysters. The wait staff seemed over whelmed (it wasn't Mardi Gras). The staff were polite through the whole transaction but we got original Oysters Rockefeller across the street at Antoine's after getting our beers written off by the staff.
Food was good service was terrible. Drinks took about 20 minutes and that was for beer.

Came here with my girlfriend, mom (whom is a local) and dad, as well as my aunt (whom is a chef and has run kitchens here in New Orleans). Long story short the food and flavors were very on point. We tried the Taste of New Orleans, Crawfish Ravioli, Charbroiled Oysters, Pecan Crusted Mahi, and Crab Claws. The favs were the mahi, ravioli, and oysters.... Matter of fact, they were all the rave! This will be a stop in the future for sure and recommended for any and everyone looking for legit, yummy eats in the Big Easy. FYI to locals, show your Louisiana ID and get a hookup!

Please stop giving this place 4/5 star reviews. 

Royal House is appealing to a NOLA tourist. Outdoor seating on the balcony, overlooking a beautiful area. They have creole and Cajun cuisine. They have great reviews. Right?

We arrived on a Saturday afternoon around 1. Behr hostess put our name down for 15-20 minute wait for the balcony. One person was ahead of us. She was friendly and kind. Several people were lining up and didn't want to take the free seats they had inside - they wanted to wait for the balcony.  After 20 minutes a manager walked over and whispered something to the hostess. She offered us a seat inside and said it was going to be another 20 minutes. We were insistent that we wanted the balcony. She kept trying to sell us on an inside seat saying we'd have to wait even more time. We wouldn't budge. Within a second she told us a table was ready on the balcony. Lame tactics to fill tables inside. 

We were seated by another kind staff member. The balcony is scary. It's awesome. But it's scary. It's slanted and not really supported by additional columns under it. We sat on a corner above a dumpster and it smelled like trash the whole time. That's New Orleans I guess. We got to people watch and take in the beautiful day though. We checked in and got a free app. 

We went with the crawfish cakes. They were good but the dish they were served in was dirty and the presentation was poor. They were like mushy cakes of seafood. Nothing to write home about. Nothing too bad.  My husband and I both ordered a half shrimp half fish platter. When the dishes came out (on dirty plates) there were several issues. 

A nice long strand of hair accompanied my cole slaw. I immediately found the waiter and sent it back. He was apologetic. As a manager made his way over I realized I didn't get any hush puppies with my dish either. The manager apologized - he offered me a free drink or dessert. I declined - probably the first person in all of New Orleans to turn down a drink. 

Our meal was horrible. We would have had a better meal at Popeyes. The batter on our shrimp and fish was thick and bready. There was no flavor. The fries were average frozen French fries. Hush puppies were burnt and tasted like old fryer oil. 

Everyone was kind. Everyone was trying to provide good service. Our waiter was nice and friendly. 

Man. We were disappointed. The food is seriously lacking and things didn't come together. Forget the hair. I can forgive a mistake. But the food wasn't even worth forgiving it for. Go sit on the balcony(not by the trash) and have a drink. That's it.

Food was very good, staff were very pleasant. What really made our dinner was our waiter Chris. Chris made sure to let us know what was great on the menu and what was "less great". He steered us to some amazing dishes, made sure our food came out on time during a dinner rush, and even suggested some things to see and do in the city. This was our first dinner in the city and it was a great start to our vacation. Highly recommended!

Our server was helpful and charming. Our meals were delicious and filling. I highly recommend the crab claws and the seafood pescatore with the white wine scampi sauce instead of what it normally comes with. Going to have to be carried back to my car. Worth it.

My husband and I ate here tonight and I have to say that it did not live up to the really good ratings first I sat down my menu had food all inside the menu the table was kind of sticky then we ordered our appetizers and they brought my husband's first and by the time they brought my appetizer he had already finished his and I wasn't even done with my appetizer and they were bringing my food and the time I was done with that my appetizer my food was cold. My husband food was really good the service was just ok I'm giving it 3 stars but it really should be like two and a half because not once did the manager stop by to ask how my food was or the service.
Prices are not listed one their website for a reason. This is more a $$$ place than a $$
Try was an awesome server.  His suggestions were great and we truly loved our meal. I recommend this place.  This is the best deal going in NOLA.
Food was disappointing, cocktails were spot on, I would not however advise waiting 45 minutes in line for cocktails

There is few words to describe the excellent level of service we received while eating at Royal House in the French Quarter. The attention to detail and common courtesy displayed by Lex (Kristopher) was absolutely unheard of in a "tourist" friendly restaurant. Our server was attentive, full of advice, helped select drinks/dinner, and really made us feel like old friends rendezvousing for a night out in NOLA. 

The food was delectable -- hints of subtle New Orleans styles surrounded by quality ingredients and cooked to perfection. Royal House's menu definitely is catering to visitors who wish to try a taste of New Orleans'.....and I must say that it accomplishes this in every facet of it's core. 

I do not wish to write a long winded review and my only advice would be to make this a date night location while visiting the French Quarter. Drinks at Carousel bar, Dinner at Royal House, finishing with dancing on Frenchmen Street -- I promise you a perfect evening. 

Enjoy.

Off the plane straight to New Orleans. We looked on yelped for a place to get lunch and decided to go to the Royal House. The food and service were both great. We ordered  oysters Rockefeller they were so delicious. For lunch I had spinach salad with blackened shrimp. Fantastic! My Friend had shrimp and grits. We definitely recommend the restaurant.
Shrimp creole and the taste of New Orleans was great!!  The charbroiled oysters were awesome!

Best oysters in NOLa. Seriously. Our waiter Kris (ask for him!) gave us a proper lowdown on both the menu and the town! Crawfish ravioli was chunky and rich. Bloody Mary's were a perfect compliment to the oysters. This spot is so great. Go. Now. Stop stalling!!

I ate here on a Friday night with a friend and was not impressed. The food was mediocre at best. We ordered the chicken and andouille gumbo, oyster tacos and chargrilled oysters. The gumbo and chargrilled oysters were luke warm when they were delivered to the table. There are far better restaurants to eat at in the French Quarter in my opinion. On a positive note the restaurant offers balcony seating which is unique!

Very cute place inside! I was there with my family for my brothers birthday. We ordered the shrimp tortellini, ribeye, and crab stuffed ravioli. Pretty tasted just a little over priced considering it came with no sides

I don't understand how people give this place 5 stars. We waited online for about half an hour, we were excited to try this place because of the reviews.

We ordered:
-oysters (kinda fishy) acme and oceana had much better oysters
-chargrilled oysters (the only thing that tasted good) 
-Oyster duo (wasn't good at all)
-crab claws (extremely over cooked) 
-redfish beignets (it was okay nothing to rave about) 
-shrimp creole (tasted like tomato sauce from a can with peppers. Had barely any taste) 
-Blt oyster po boy (this was recommended by the waiter. It tasted fishy and rotten)

I would never come back or recommend this place to anyone. The staff was very nice and friendly but that didn't make up for the bad food.
My go to in New Orleans almost no wait good food is moderately priced and amazing oysters or anything else you get here.
Lunch was fantastic and our server very friendly. We also loved the chargrilled oysters - definitely a must try!

Had our 1st real meal in New Orleans over here.  Damn good 1st impression!  Had a very good bloody mary using their own infused vodka. Good Mornin!! Their chargrilled oysters were crazy. So smoky and  tasty.  We've had the chargriled oysters in a few places since and these are still the best!  Also had a shrimp po-boy.  Pretty good as well.  Really nice ambiance and sitting at the bar is great...bartenders in New Orleans are the best!!

came here for the first time. first off the look alone was nice and had an original feel. the staff was friendly especially the front hostess. ordered the crawfish ravioli with I thought was good, and the hushpuppies were good too. also ordered the shrimp and grits. now the shrimp and grits are not the same shrimp and grits on the menu. they now fry the grits. my grits were fried too hard. 
our order took almost 30mins and the restaurant was semi empty although the manager did knock off a few dollars because of the long wait.
if I come here again I will not order the shrimp and grits.
Good oysters and food. Royal street is in the heart of NOLA so you will be able to be in the thick of it while eating from Cajun Nom Noms.

Service = 5 stars
- You know when you go to your friends house and their grandma or mama fix you some nasty food? The fact that she takes care of you and makes you feel loved makes the food so much better. In this case, the food wasn't nasty and the service feels like you're at your friends grandmas getting taken care of. True definition of southern hospitality. 

Food that we ordered:
Crab claw = 5 stars. 
This was the first food we got to try as soon as we landed in Nola. We somewhat regretted it as it raised the bar way too high and it made our entrees less satisfactory. This was also our servers recommendation. Definitely something you have to try when you're here. 

Charboiled Oysters = 5 stars
This was out second dish and it once again raised the bar. The garlic, Cajun, buttery creole crack on that oysters were to die for. 

Gator Po boy = 2 stars
Maybe the fact that our palate got way too spoiled in the beginning that's why I'm being kinda harsh on this. The meat was so dry and overpowered with breading. Tasted like chicken nuggets.

Oyster Po Boy = 2 stars
Nothing exciting.. 

Jambalaya = 3 stars
The taste was very bland. Try to avoid it.

Royal House was absolutely incredible. Our server Chris was so knowledgable about all the entrees and made great recommendations. The oyster pasta was AMAZING! Fried alligator was great to try too! Very different, some pieces were kind of chewy and you had to work a little but it was well worth it! I highly recommend!

Good space upstairs....good Bloody Mary's.

My Crab Cake Benedict was good, but some of the other stuff was just average..... service was horribly SLOW! And it was not busy, so no excuse. I am fully aware that down south the pace of life is a bit more laid back but this was beyond that. 

Then we ask for coffee and she brings cream out in the little plastic containers used for salad dressing! Really????

The place has potential to be better, our experience was just average.

The ambiance was incredible! The location was perfect for walking around the French Quarter and enjoying the evening  The food was good.. but a bit on the mass produced touristy side. I've definitely had better etouffee.

After hearing iffy opinions on the food in general in the French Quarter, I was glad to come across some decently solid, classic cajun/creole dishes here.  Grabbing a table was a breeze on a weekday afternoon and while the pacing of the food was on the sluggish side overall, it got the job done.

The oysters across several methods of preparation were just passable.  I would've appreciated more freshness from the raw ones after having excellent ones elsewhere while the oysters royale & rockefeller were both overpowered by the excessively bready seafood stuffing and mixture of spinach and bacon, respectively.  My friend's Taste of New Orleans was pretty good with plenty of flavor from the crawfish etouffee, jambalaya and chicken & andouille sausage gumbo.  Generously portioned too and certain to fill up just about any hungry belly.

Sub par. Food came out cold, ordered the shrimp creole- tasted like shrimp in tomato sauce- the shrimp caprese salad- ok the shrimp were not deveined and also ordered the shrimp platter- fries were soggy shrimp batter soggy- bread so stale

One of the waiters was smoking an e-cigarette while waiting for drinks at the bar, the others were yelling, hootin and hollering with each other inappropriately and in general service was very slow.

Theone thing that was good was the French onion soup.

We dropped in here on Fat Tuesday, looking for lunch and expecting to have to wait a while for a table for five. Imagine our surprise when they were able to fit us in right away! The restaurant was pretty well packed, but we lucked into a nice table off in the corner.

Our waiter, Lex, was absolutely excellent. He made some good recommendations from the menu and was attentive throughout our whole lunch, even though he must have been super busy. We really appreciated the friendly and personable attitude.

I started with the duo of Oysters Rockefeller and Oysters Royale, which was amazing! This is enough to fill you up for lunch. The oysters were very large and juicy, piping hot, and the toppings were great. I enjoyed the Rockefeller better, as I felt the flavor was more robust.  I followed this with a Crab Louie salad, which was OK. My mistake for not realizing the crab was breaded and fried; while it was delicious, it was an odd combination with the cold salad. I did not like the dressing - it was a sort of vinaigrette with Worcestershire sauce instead of the traditional Louie dressing. Those oysters were so good though... next time I'll just get those!
food is horrible.  My boyfriend and I went here to try a new spot in the quarters.  Should've kept my first mind and went to Oceana's.  smh, the food is tasteless and commercial.

Although Royal House is in the heart of the touristy French Quarter, I love it!  Ok, I'm not going to lie, I love the touristy French Quarter even though I've been to New Orleans a dozen times. When I went to Royal House, all I wanted was raw oysters and wine and that's what I got. Gulf oysters are huge which I understand some people don't like, but I feel like more oyster, more better! I sat at the bar and ordered up a dozen with tabasco and a crisp white wine. The bartenders were awesome. Ballsy and flirty but not obnoxious - perfect for tourists and locals alike. While I was dining, a second line came by and I stepped outside to dance a bit before coming back to finish my massive oysters. They were so big, I needed a second glass of wine. Not like that's a bad thing. I can't wait to go back the next time I'm in town.

Severely disappointed with all the high reviews here that led me astray since I was bringing two first timers for some NOLA food near our hotel.

The service was EXTREMELY SLOW. I get we're in the big easy but this went beyond southern slow to the point where it took 30 minutes for an appetizer and 30 minutes for a drink to arrive

The shrimp platter had zero seasoning. The shrimp were literally just boiled in plain water.

Shrimp po-boy came completely dry. Just a huge loaf of bread covered in crispy shrimp. No remolaude or sauce and very little pickled veggies to cut through the dense carbs. Sorely disappointed.

Only giving an extra star for the grilled oyster appetizer which was good. But you can't really go wrong with cheese and butter.

Service was horrible. They completely forgot about us. Took over an hour to get our food then it was cold. 
I asked for lemon and it was an inconvenience to get some- so we had to go to the bar for some. Asked for water and waitress was annoyed. Not good.
