I came to this place with 3 other people and we all had a terrible experience. Let me preface this by saying that 3/4 of us ordered a salad. We got to the restaurant around 9 so not during rush hour or anything. We ordered our food right away, but it did not come out for an hour and 15 min! The one hot entree was cold and the quality of the food was subpar. The service was not good either. Our waitress never refilled our waters and took another half hour to bring us our check. Horrible over all.

Completely unimpressed based on the restaurant having 4 stars. We arrived later than the normal dinner crowd and was seated right away, however, though it was not crowded any longer we waited an hour for our food. On top of that, the food was cold and the waitress did not even tell us the specials. The waitress also never filled our water glasses or came to check on us. I will not be returning.

Came here with a party of 4 and was extremely disappointed... I decided to give the place another chance (mistakenly so) . Appetizer took 30-45mins to show up,  food took over an hour to arrive and when it did,  some of our soup was cold. The shrimp po boy was horribly dry (decided to give this one another try as well,  I came here over a year ago) and too much batter on the shrimp... Again. 
Safe to say it was a waste of our money and especially our time seeing as how we waited over an hour to get food. Don't be fooled yelpers.

Oysters on Long Island, while delicious, are usually priced anywhere from $18-39. So I was surprised when we walked into Royal House and got a dozen for twelve dollars. Their oysters were thick and juicy and fresh. We stopped here daily so I could get my fill. Raw bar was priced insanely low. We ordered a few other items off the menu the first day(Fried gator which the bartender advised us to dip into the gumbo... eh). But if you're an oyster fan in NOLA make a pit stop at Royal House. You'll be dreaming about them mollusks for years to come.
Delicious crawfish ravioli! Our waiter/bartender was great. Would definitely recommend!

Crab Claws were the highlight of the night. Delicious peeled crab claws cooked in the most amazing sauce. i don't know what the sauce was but my friend almost licked his plate clean before asking the chef if he could give him the recipe. LOL

Char grilled oysters were delicious, i ordered 2 dozen for myself for dinner. It's that good. 

I loved our server, she was enthusiastic and very knowledgeable about their expansive menu. She even gave us recommendations on how she would modify her own food. our table was checked on often, water and alcoholic beverages replenished, and plates and utensils cleaned off after every course. she sure got a big tip at the end of the night.

Terrence was a great server for lunch. The po boys were very good. It was a great surprise to have a place that seasoned their breading that they fried the shrimp and oysters. The crab claw appetizer was as good as Terrence advertised!

The Crab claws were sooo good!  Our server was awesome.  Attentive and brutually honest.  She stirred us is the right direction with our order and everything was a hit!  She was so accommodating and did her job well, even making suggest of her favorite dishes.  We ordered they shrimp poboy, Taste of New Orleans and of course the crab claws.  Everything was tasty!

Worst meal of the 4 day trip.  Party of 8 was seated at a FOLDING CARD table with young children seated at the top of an ungated, steep staircase.  Crab claws were TINY in size and quantity.  Crab added to blackened redfish was filled with shells, shrimp on the shrimp&grits and MahiMahi were NOT deveined/were sparsely dispensed/were overcooked.  Oysters Rockafella was UNDERCOOKED and served to a 12 yr even though it was soaked in wine AFTER it was cooked, kid's meat & bun only burger arrived with cheese, kid's mac&cheese was KRAFT blue box.  For all the horrible food, 2 adults/2kids, we paid $156.33 BEFORE tip.

How pleased I was upon stumbling on this gem of a place. I came to New Orleans to eat jambalaya and what better place to go than the restaurant where it was invented. 

Me and my travelling companion Speculos Beamos were greeted at the door and whisked away gallantly to our table where we were greeted by our wonderful server Jeremiah Jambalaya. He was dressed incredibly well and was very polite and charming. He guided us through the menu and I decided to start off with a salad and water. My friend started with a coke and an empty plate (I don't know what his problem was that night, seriously he should have left his issues at the door. I didn't want him to ruin my night) 

The salad was impeccable and onto my main where I had jambalaya and my friend had gumbo. The moment the gumbo touched my friend's lips a smile came to his face that I have never seen since. He said it reminded him of his younger brother Gumbo who drowned in the Mississippi and he often he wished it was the other brother that no one liked. 

Jeremiah brought my chocolate cake, which was an exquisite way to finish the night as my friend watched. Jeremiah dropped off the bill and asked my companion "Would you like some more coke, boss?" My friend smiled and said yes with a tear in his eye. 

The bill was cheaper than I thought it would be, especially for such a refined and cultured establishment. 

Go here if you're in NOLA and ask for Jeremiah. I intend to go back one day and ask him out.

This was really disappointing. After reading all the reviews and even the line of folks outside I thought for sure we might have found a good spot. Unfortunately the food was AWFUL and the only reason I can give this place any stars was the staff was friendly and the service was good. After a good set of recommendations from the waitress we decided in the chargrilled oysters, redfish beignets, and blackened redfish topped with crab meat (extra cost). Everything, I mean everything, was slathered in at least half a stick of butter. The oysters were greasy with little flavor and lots of oyster shell bits in the sauce, the beignets weren't horrible but super sweat and just tasted like fried fish drenched in honey. The entree of the blackened redfish they forgot the crab extra in top so had to bring it out after the fact. The side veggies for this dish were again all butter and grease :( the blacked redfish was probably the best part of the meal as it wasn't too salt or greasy. Sadly the crab topping was soooo salt and soaked in butter we didn't even eat it. If it wasn't for the friendly welcoming waitress I think I'd give this place zero stars. Save the money and skip this place.

Came back 1.5 years after my last visit and was really disappointed.  I was looking forward to the service and authentic Cajun food.  
But this time it was not up to par...service was ultra slow. It was busy but it should not take 10 mins for the server to appear and then another 20 for the drinks to finally arrive.   The place seemed dirtier than I remembered too, the floor was slick like it had been mopped with grease. 
When we were finally able to order, the food came out so fast I knew it was prepared ahead of time.  It was sort of warm or warmed over.  A much different and worse experience than my prior visit. 
I recommend you seek another place, there are lots to pick from.  Oceana Grill is my new favorite.

Shrimp Jambalaya was bland and lukewarm.  I wasn't a big fan of my server who seemed indifferent.  Seems overpriced for the quality.  The best part of my dining experience was the street music and parade I witnessed from second floor balcony seating.

We had an awesome experience here! Our large party was seating quickly in the upstairs room! The room was wonderful with a great view of the neighborhood. The waitstaff was friendly and knowledgeable making our dining experience one to remember. Our party all ordered different meals and each was excellent. The hot brownie sundae was incredible. I meals were reasonably priced and delicious I would highly recommend this restaurant.

Came for dinner on a Sunday evening. Waited about 30 minute for a balcony table; worth the wait! Great  ambience seated on the balcony corner spot enjoying the violinist playing on the street.  Great friendly service (Emma).  Food was top notch; chargrilled oysters,  Taste of New Orleans, shrimp & grits,  3 drinks $60 total.

First timer in NOLA and first timer at the Royal House. We started off with the crab claws appetizer and I must say, definitely delish!! The crabs are declawed; making it easier to eat. Next, the entrees, which was the shrimp creole and the trio. Both delish but wished they'd given more shrimp in the shrimp creole because there was like maybe 5 total. Ate there again 2 days later and had oysters, a pound of shrimp boil and the seafood linguini. All was delish. Wasn't disappointed with neither. But if you're from Cali hoping to find a boiling crab type of feel/taste, it's not the same in NOLA. It's more dry herbs and little to no butter but still good. I can't wait to go back!

The food was just ok. We got the shrimp and grits & the shrimp creole. The food was not served hot. The balcony seating was awkward due to the slope, it seemed the balcony was going to fall off the building. We did enjoy hearing the street performers during dinner.

Well, not only did our waiter not check on us one single time for the entire hour that we waited for our food, but we asked a kind bus boy to check on our food and then it came out soon after. Our waiter literally only took our order and set ketchup on the table, while holding a cigarette I clearly saw, so I'm assuming he took an hour cig break and didn't refill our waters or check to see if we needed anything. The shrimp and grits advertised on the pics of this Yelp, are def not what you're getting. Then we ordered the taste of New Orleans where our rice in the jambalaya, gumbo, AND etoufee were all under cooked and hard. We're very unsatisfied with the food and service here. The only reason we're not speaking to the manager of this place is because we're so ready to just get out of here to start our night. Wouldn't recommend.

The food was amazing and even better service. It was well worth the wait to get in there. The oysters were incredible and the onion soup was the best we have ever had. The jambalaya and crawfish etoufee was delicious!
Food was overpriced and not that great. Atmosphere was nice though. We enjoyed our time.

Hands down the best food I've had in the French Quarter. If you're curious about Cajun/Creole food order the Taste of New Orleans. The jambalaya is INCREDIBLE. The service was phenomenal--our drinks were always full, and everything that we asked for got to the table immediately. Thank you, Gaynell, for the awesome service and for going above and beyond. Will definitely recommend this restaurant to friends and will definitely be back.

I loved this place. The doors and windows are open, lots of natural light and a good breeze for lunch. It was nice to sit down and relax on a hot day. The food is so good and really pleased with portion size.

Fried Alligator Bites - get these! They just taste like a chewier fried chicken. Fun to say we tried alligator
Shrimp Po'boy with Hush Puppies side - again, another good choice
Fried Perch Po-boy - good pile of fried fish on the sandwich and tasty
Bread Pudding - OMGGGG THIS WAS SO GOOD
Absolutely delicious food! Great ambience! & amazing service! First time in New Orleans & i made sure I went there at least twice before I left! 100% recommend, completely worth every single penny.

So when I saw photos on Yelp for the shrimp and grits o got excited. And then they gave this to me and I was so confused. They explained that the grits would get hard or cold and so they found a way to make them just right and fry them up. It was really good. The service was amazing. Our server was so great ans knowledgable!

Stopped in this evening with a couple of friends around 11:00 pm. We were seated immediately by a very friendly hostess. Our server was awesome as well, I wish I had taken down his name. He gave us numerous suggestions with the menu. He suggested that my buddy add the blackened shrimp to his "Taste of New Orleans" meal and that I order the "Seafood Pescatore" scampi-style (not on the menu) since I'm not big on tomato-based sauces. He said that's how he orders it and it was delicious. Everyone agreed it was the best meal at the table. My buddy thought his shrimp po-boy was just ok. Overall a very enjoyable experience, largely due to the excellent service we received. Definitely recommend this place.
I had the seafood pasta. We went on A Tuesday night at 9:30. No waiting line and service was great. My dish was excellent and spicy like I like it. Abundance of seafood in the pasta!
The food is good. Not the best I've ever had but it was satisfying. I would eat here again in a pinch.

I used to love this restaurant but they got a new chef and everything changed.. the service was horrible. 
We waited for a really long time for food... 45 mins later I got my entree and I ate alone. 30 minutes later cake the appetizer and an hour and half later my boyfriends dish came out. We were furious and just walked out after telling the manager we were not paying for anything. This place used to be great but not anymore.

Such a cute place with a great view! If at all possible, sit upstairs! My friend raved about the fish beignets so she took me to try them since we were already in the Quarter, and I've been dreaming about them ever since! Fried to perfection and just the right amount of sugar added from the syrup to the powdered sugar. The blackened red fish was amazing! Food took a little longer to come out than expected but was good nonetheless. I didn't care for the sauce on the potatoes however, I kept getting a weird clump of parmesan in my mouth sort like it was the dried kind from the bottle. Anyway, give them a try. Our server Joseph was very knowledgeable and attentive. The other staff members came over and made sure we were okay throughout our dining experience as well!

Didn't dine in yet but picked up food to go and the crawfish ravioli was spectacular even having it three hours later.  We drove to NOLA just to have its delicious food and now this restaurant is added to our list of places to eat!  My boyfriend loves the shrimp po boy as well!!!

We've never had oysters and wanted to get a sample of creole/Cajun cuisine. The shrimp and grits with bbq cream sauce was divine. I'm not an oyster person, but they were fresh and served with horsey and cocktail sauce. The taste of New Orleans featured gumbo (outstanding), ettoufe (good) and jambalaya (meh). Lots of kids before 6 pm and then there was a line out the door every time we walked by.

OMG!! Their peel shell shrimp is amazing. The first bit is only with few cocktail sauce on it. It tastes nothing special, but after I adding some lemon, it tastes fantastic. The sour of lemon perfectly combined the sauce spicy. It makes me feel fresh and reminds me of beach! Also the price is fair and worth it.

An enchanting restaurant with a lovely outdoor balcony on the upper level.  The service was wonderful as they quickly seated us and being that how we had a tight flight, they made sure to have our meals out promptly.  I ordered the blackened shrimp jambalaya and it was the best jambalaya that I have ever tasted! The portion sizes were just the right amount and the the prices were fair.  Overall, excellent service and well worth the visit! Will be returning back again!

We had the shrimp po-boy, the gumbo, jambalaya, and ettouffee. The shrimp was dry on the po-boy, and wasn't unbearable but I didn't like it. The gumbo is in the same direction as the shrimp, and the other plates were ok. The waiter was nice enough, and the view of the street was too, it is a nice place to come if you need to eat on royal street.

Came here at around 1:20pm and although it was pretty packed we were say right down upstairs with a great view if Royal Street. Once we sat down, no one gave us menus nor presented themselves as our server. After a while we had to ask for menus because I guess they forgot about us. Once we reminded them that we were still waiting, they were extremely apologetic and brought us menus and water immediately. 

Jeremiah, our waiter, is a local and suggested all his favorite dishes. We went with fried alligator tail and  the Taste of New Orleans. The food was good but not great; you do get to sample some of the New Orleans favorites. They take off $10 with a yelp check-in so that is always a plus.

Try the redfish beignets. They are delicious and matched well with a glass of moscato. Ask for Lex (aka Black Chris) for some great recommendations! He told us what to order and what to avoid. Great service and great waiter.

Stopped in for lunch on the balcony... definitely a pretty view, and it had that "new orleans" feel to it. Our very handsome ;) server Chris suggested the French onion soup, he definitely wasn't wrong. The gator po boy was good (not great) but some of the most tender gator meat I ever had. 4 for the food 5 for Chris! Thanks for the airbnb tip to us tourists!
Came here based on good reviews and haven't gotten food yet while my friend got his been here well over an hour and still no food.

First, the hostess (unexpectedly) ushered us upstairs to sit on the outdoor balcony.  The weather was perfect, the street performers were doing a dance * instrumental * techno * rap melange that was super cool so the foundation was great.  Then, our waiter.  Super charming young guy with a good sense of humor and very attentive.  My daughter chose the Oyster BLT with sriracha mayo and fries.  I couldn't decide what to do so I had them give me a mix of Chargrilled Oysters (on the half shell drenched in garlic butter and Parmesan then thrown under the broiler) and Oysters Rockefeller (spinach, bacon & Pernod) with a Caprese stacked salad on the side.  
Pros: French Quarter upper balcony seating. Does it get any better?  Staff was all great.  PO boy was great - though next time we'd ask for the pickles on the side.  Fresh ingredients - well prepared food.  I loved the Chargrilled oysters!
Cons:  vinaigrette on Caprese was really overpowering and the Oysters Rockefeller was just ok next to the chargrilled.
Great late lunch. We went for lunch around two and there wasn't a line to get in.  We were seated fast and our server was sweet. The spinach dip was awesome!

We were walking around and looking for something to eat and also ambiance. We got seated quickly up stars around 2pm, and we just missed the lunch crowd. We looked at the menu and decided upon the New Orleans sampler, but I asked to substitute the crawfish ettoufe for French onion soup, but we were denied. So, the server suggested another jumbalya and I'm glad he did. It was delicious amd shellfish free. All in all, our server was good, the food is ok, and the ambiance was great.

Oysters where amazingly fresh! We ordered the Red fish dish which was to die for. Unfortunately they had run out of rice , and so the gumbos or any dish with rice where not available. Service was pretty good and the location was prime. Will definitely be returning for their signature gumbo

Horrible food. Brought out cold bread with hard butter. Eggplant was soggy. ..the shrimp creile was too much like a tomato soup..the tomatoes over powered the dish. This place is in the middle of the tourist area so folks who don't necessarily know what 'good food' is like give this place good reviews. The only thing good herrbis the oysters were quite fresh but in new Orleans every second restaurant has fresh oyesters... Not worth the hype at all sorry... Go to red dog and Luke jf you want to taste real authentic and good food here.

I ordered the mint julep and the fried fish platter. The fish was all catfish which I dislike. The other items like hush puppies, Cole slaw and beans and rice were also just alright. The good thing about the place was the balcony view - brave it only if you are okay being on a sloping balcony that seems like it will collapse any minute ;)
So glad we stopped for supper! The crab claws were to die for, ended up ordering 2 servings. Husband loved his burger, he hit seafood overload and just wanted meat. Great food!

Good service.  Charbroiled oysters very good....  Pecan crusted mahi mahi a fabulous dish with crisp fresh vegetables.   So nice to get some lighter food that was delish.   Not use to all the heavy fried food of NOLA.   So Royal House provided some nice options and reasonable prices.
Sat at the bar wit a few friends for dinner. Drinks, meal was great. Highly recommend to try all their style of oyster.

Ugh. Tourist trap hell.

We ordered two dozen oysters and spinach dip. Nothing was cooked except for the half batch of oysters that was burned... The spinach dip plate had fries on it magically. 

The drink menu is lacking in any sense of originality- normally a good thing for a place like this- but horrible here. Not to mention it might twenty minutes to arrive. 

Move on. Acme or Felix are worth the wait if it's oysters you seek. Else better drinks are to be had nearly anywhere else.

Took an hour to get entree. Had the crab claws as an appetizer. Not only were there very few crab claws, some has no meat. Good flavor to the disg. Ordered shrimp and grits. Good flavor. Did not eat shrimp and grits because shrimp were not deveined. Husband had blackened shrimp jambalaya.  Shrimp were not deveined. The dish was "ok". Child had chicken tenders. They were overcooked. Manager offered to remake something, but we didn't have the time. She did take the entrees off of our order. Hurricanes were homemade and delicious. I'll ask from now on whether shrimp are deveined.

One of the best place I ate in New Orleans!
While on a trip recently, we decided to have a nice night out to dinner. 
After some searching on Yelp, we found The Royal House seemed like a good fit. 
A short walk from our hotel and we were there and immediately seated up stairs. 
Drinks came quickly and our super nice server answered all my millions of questions about what to order. 
We split the peel and eat shrimp pot and the taste of NOLA dish.
Both were seriously delicious!! The seasoning in the shrimp pot was so, so good!! 
And the craw fish in the Taste of Nola dish was out of this world. My first experience with craw fish and definitely will not be last! 
This should for sure be a place to visit when in New Orleans!!

The bartender was even understandable when I asked if he could change the Pandora station they were on. I wanted some Big Easy jazz music instead of summer hits of 2000! :)

We stopped here on a whim because we wanted a quick meal before leaving for the airport.  I am glad that we did!  We started with the spinach artichoke dip appetizer (FREE- thanks YELP!).  It was very tasty.  My niece had the Taste of New Orleans entree.  The jambalaya was NOT good.  It had a smokey flavor- but not in the good way, like a cigarette smokey way.  The gumbo was good though.  I had the oyster pasta, but with shrimp instead of oysters.  It was great!

Waste of time and money. I think our food was frozen and microwaved. The people next to us had same look on their face we did. Waitress was very nice but don't waste your time. Was still hungry ended up eating around the corner at Willies chicken shack ppfffhh that was worth every penny

The service was excellent. The food (crawfish etouffe, jambalaya, gumbo, oysters Rockefeller) was bland, salty and not good tasting. This is not a place I would recommend if you want seafood, creole, Cajun or New Orleans food.
By far- the friendliest service we experienced in NOLA! The staff was so nice & helpful...the prices are amazing for the quality & ambiance. 5 stars all the way!

Stopped in here last month while in town for some oysters with a great ambience. Somehow our waiter got lost and had to flag down someone else, who was quite friendly but had to cover us and her other tables. The drink she recommended was great but the food was flavorless and disappointing. We had the oysters Rockefeller (overly seasoned and way too cheesy) and shrimp and grits (bland and rubbery shrimp). Skip the food- get a few drinks and sit upstairs on the balcony if you choose to come here!

Ambiance was fine, service was Ok, food wasn't great.  Got a free appetizer from Yelp, but only two of the appetizers were eligible with the coupon, got the Fried Oyster Tacos....which were fried oysters on a tortilla chip with coleslaw.  There are so many dining options in a quarter so I don't think we will return.

This place largely depends on its proximity bourbon St, and dumps on any shadow of service.

Good oysters, but largely a miss with regard to food quality and service.

Mediocre at best.

Came here on a Sunday for some Po Boys. However, found out lunch is not served until 11 (there is a pretty good breakfast menu for the before 11 eats). They nicely let us just hangbout until 11 so we could order off the lunch menu. The fried oyster BLT and fried fish Po Boys were both excellent but eating these can be a real challenge due to the huge size of the bread and fillings:-) Also had the red beans and rice and gumbo. Both were good but have to hand victory to the red beans and rice! Balcony seating is fun but you have to keep a close eye on your food and drink so they don't all slide off the (small) table and into St. Louis street. Overall, it was a nice experience and would definitely come back.

Unfortunately, I wasn't that hungry so only had room to try the Taste of New Orleans.  I liked all 3 samples -jambalaya, etouffee, gumbo- they were warm and yummy, but I wouldn't necessarily recommend coming here for these dishes.  I really regret not having ordered oysters, because they looked amazing!  I just wasn't hungry enough.  I sat at the bar and watched the bartender shuck oyster after oyster (huge, plump, fresh).  Every oyster dish that came out looked amazing.  Also, the staff was really friendly.  The bartender was such a trip, teaching the customers his technique and chatting with everyone.  Even though I was by myself, I had a great time.
So, I guess it's a little strange that I am giving this place 4 stars for their shellfish when I didn't try it myself, but I figure if my dish was 3 1/2 stars and it's not their specialty, it's a good bet the oysters are worth a 4.

"Oh My God" doesn't even begin to describe the food here. I was traveling across the county and wanted to try authentic NOLA cuisine and found this gem on Yelp. 

Now since I've never been to NOLA, I found them on Yelp, saw they did carry out, called in the order, and set out to find them. I had no idea (as I was driving at the time) that they were right in the middle of the French Quarter; no did I have any idea how hard parking/driving in that area would be. 

Anyway, once I got there I ran in to pick up the food, got back in the car, and it was amazing. The gumbo was delicious and had a deep spicy rue; and the shrimp jambalaya was the best I've ever had in my life. It was standing room only with a line wrapped out the front door... I see why they had a nearly perfect score!

The sauce for the claws was amazing and that garlic bread was just soooo good with it. I would completely recommend that appetizer. The oysters royal left a ton to be desired and were lukewarm when served. Overall for the price, it was just ok.

Balcony seating over Royal Street with good food. Started with the fried alligator and spinach dip for appetizers. Both were very good, alligator was tender and some of the best alligator bites I've had in a while. Spinach dip was also good, can't really go wrong with spinach dip. For our entree, I had originally planned to order the Taste of New Orleans, but was politely steered away from that by our server who then suggested the crawfish ravioli..and I am SO glad he did! It was delicious. Very flavorful with ample crawfish and plenty of large raviolis. My husband ordered pecan crusted mahi mahi, we both enjoyed the potatoes and the fish was large and steak-like. Only complaint was his meal came out a little luke warm. Very cool atmosphere, if you're a party of two would suggest sitting on balcony.

Not sure where all the 4-5 star reviews came from but I was not impressed..... We waited a LONG time to get in here and it was our worst meal in New Orleans. Our most amazing meals had no wait. Annoyed we waited over an hour for this....
The place smells like a dirty fish tank. 
We did have some excellent wait staff. 
Seating is tight.
Service is SLOOOOOOOW.....
We were there with 3 others couples, no one was impressed with their meal....
1 star because my French onion soup was actually pretty good 
1 star because the oysters were good

We waited in line for about 10 min then got seated. Our waitress was very friendly and promptly gave us water and took our orders. My friend and I waited at least 35-45 min for our food. I think she forgot to put our order in because she checked on us after 20 MINUTES and another 15 MINUTES or so to "check our order." Our food finally came and it was not worth the wait at all! It was the worst oyster Rockefeller I've ever had. The shrimp in the po'boy was good, but the sandwich was so dry. It was our first night and meal in NOLA and we unfortunately had this experience. Do not go here.

I was expecting fabulous food given New Orleans reputation, but the dishes I had were not by any means fabulous.

The raw oysters were meaty, but very light on the flavor and liquor (or whatever you think of as the juice in the raw oyster). I eat a lot of oysters, and these ones were on the mild side. At the same time, I have had far worse oysters-these just were't amazing. While New Orleans is known for oysters, I usually have better oysters in D.C.

The blackened shrimp and jambalaya were also mediocre. Mushy jambalaya and the shrimp should have had a charred texture to them, but rather were just little sauteed shrimp with basic spices on them- Not really what I think of as blackened shrimp.

Overall, Royal House offers very mediocre food at OK prices. Would recommend trying somewhere else.

Ahh! I really want to give them 4 stars, but my food wasn't even hot!! And the whole ambiance was just eek...

- - s e r v i c e - -
I walked/drove by here several times throughout my stay in New Orleans and there was ALWAYS a line outside. Don't be driven away by this, they go through the line pretty quickly. Just make sure you put your name on the list at the front before getting in line. It was only about a 20 minute wait so not bad at all! Once we were seated we were greeted with the most upbeat and happy waitress (oops I forgot her name...sorry!) But she was great! Super attentive and friendly! Loved it!!

- - a m b i a n c e - -
How do they keep their line moving? Well that's cause this place is PACKED. Seats are back to back, not the most spacious setting. Also since the restaurant has multiple windows that stay open to the outdoors, you get that humidity from outside. Lastly it wasn't the cleaniest or freshest smelling restaurant. So overall with the crowdedness, humidity, and dirty smell...ehhh not my favorite environment.

- - f o o d - - 
Overall, the food was mediocore and prices were ehh a bit on the steep side for what I got...

[ [ fried alligator ] 
FREE WITH CHECK-IN! Well you can get any appetizer, but I mean when else would I be able to try alligator (you usually don't see this in California). This was good! I didn't know what to expect...so they tasted like popcorn chicken bits...not bad!

[ [ raw oysters ] ]
Good! These weren't the best oysters I've had but they weren't bad! Size wise, they were pretty small. But they fresh so you didn't get too much of that raw fishy taste. 

[ [ blackened shrimp & jambalaya ] ]
This was sooooooo good!! They are generous with the shrimp....packed with flavor (for both the shrimp and jambalaya). I really wanted to get some authentic NOLA food and yumm this was it! The jambalya was absolutely delicious! The shrimp and jambalya complemented each other great and I really liked it! I would've loved it but ughh my food came out on the cool-warm side! Why?!

[[ crawfish etouffee ] ]
Again, I loved the flavor and everything but it was cold! The gravy was great and again it came with lots of fried crawfish tails. You definitely want to eat this fast before it gets all soggy! 

Overall...I'm just torn. I loved the food, but it was cold which is so depressing. Ambiance was also just not for me, but great service. This was recommended to me by many locals so it was definitely worth the try.

The chargrilled oysters were fabulous!  The restaurant also has great ambiance. 

Unfortunately that was the only thing that was good about this visit.  Service after the appetizer was very slow, 45 minutes for a salad and gumbo, and the wait staff was rarely stopped by.  She'd be in the area of our table but never asked if we needed anything. Once our food arrived, the gumbo was cold, the waitress never stopped back to check.  The gumbo was removed from our bill after we complained to the manager.  Maybe it was just a bad night but I would never go back.

Chargrilled Oysters and Shrimp nGrits delicious!
Raven was our server and she was wonderful.

3.5 Stars

The food was great.  Only downfall is we had to constantly remind or ask our server for stuff.

Huge benefit on the night I was here is that there was not a super long wait.  20 minutes and we were in!

The French Quarter is littered with so many tourist traps with average food. I've been to Royal House twice, and I was pleasantly surprised both times. The gumbo is good. We also enjoyed the crawfish beignets.  The oyster tacos (more like oyster nachos) are also good. 

Upstairs has a nice ambiance. If the weather is nice, the balcony is a great spot to eat.

I met my other half down the block and we walked up here for lunch because I have been wanting some oysters and thought why not! We sat upstairs on the outside balcony so we could enjoy the amazing weather. We were greeted in a timely manner. WE each ordered a beer and I got the Oysters Duo which I got the Chargrilled and the Rockefeller. It took a bit for our food to come out buy the oysters were pretty good!! I will say the Rockefeller had a tad to much cheese for my liking (i know who would think!) but it covered up the taste of the oysters a bit much that all i tasted was cheese. I would still go back and have oysters there again thou! Plus who wouldn't want to sit on the balcony and people watch!
Amazing crawfish étouffée, crawfish ravioli, and shrimp po-boys to name a few. Great late night atmosphere and open air feel.

Great service and amazing crawfish étouffée! I devoured it! I wasn't a huge fan of the jambalaya however it was still good. My grandpa just makes an amazing homemade jambalaya so I could be biased. Nice location and ambience.

In town for work. Sat on the balcony. Good food, great atmosphere.
Oysters were fresh and tasty. Shrimp and grits were good, not amazing, but still a quality meal.
Local musicians were playing on the corner across the street which made this meal a memory to never forget.

Charcoal Grilled oysters were the best thing ive had that day. Then the lady recommended their new addition to the menu it was eggplant + pasta + oysters and iy was so delicious. I am glad i went there before i went vegetarian  and its on the pretty royal street

Meh... Could be so much better. 

Service was slow and lacking any welcome to guest. Location is nice, a bit cramped though to really enjoy, especially the patio. 

The hostess and waitress seemed to care less if the experience was enjoyable. 45 min to get an ice tea and a salad on a Sunday afternoon. Waste of time for nothing I couldn't get down the street.

Don't really like providing bad reviews on businesses since I own one and know the challenges that come with it...but man this place is just lacking. Must have been nice in earlier days but now it's just a name that lives in a past reputation.

Good food.

Tried to find a place on a Sunday and it was all packed of course- and the French quarter fest is going on.

We had the char grilled oysters which were good, alligator bites for free thanks to our Yelp check in, my sister had the French onion soup and said "it was banging," she also go the ouster tacos and literally was an oyster on a nacho with slaw and some sauce that did not pair nicely but you could just scrap it off. My boyfriend and I each got an oyster platter and it was good.

Our drinks were good and service was good/ nothing to rave about but would come back.

Our waitress was Sherra M and she did a great job!

Thanks Yelp for hooking us up with good eats! Nestled right off the chaos of Bourbon Street sits Royal House, a two floor space specializing in Po' Boys, Cajun fare and other Big Easy staples. 

With tons of foot traffic, we were blessed to have been seated in five minutes. Although our table was cramped between the bar and the St. Louis St. sidewalk, our meals were totally worth the imposition.

All three of us ordered po' boys. Oyster, Shrimp and Roast Beef. Yours truly is a sucker for a fried oyster sandwich, and boy was it tasty. Crisp coating, plump oysters and fresh bread had my mouth watering. My only beef was that there weren't enough oysters! 

**I snuck a quick bite of my friend's Roast Beef and it was delicious.**

Prices seemed fair to me. The bar has a lively atmosphere with a full drink menu available for table seating. I had a local Abita beer. Service was solid and we all walked out satisfied. I bet it'd be awesome to sit on the outdoor, second floor deck. Next time, Royal House!

The majority of the food is warmed up from being frozen. My food (crawfish ravioli) was still cold in the center. I gave it back after three bites. Only fresh item on the menu is the oysters. Service was very slow.
Food was cold.. Not spicy at all ( as told).. And the service was slow as hell! I wouldn't recommend this place
Good food. Gumbo is 8/10. Balcony dining, and there's usually a street performer across the street. Get there early - lines.start at 7 pm.
Excellent service, attentive and friendly.  The food was perfect. Alligator appetizer seasoning was outstanding.  Etouffe was loaded with shrimp and something that we came to town for...delicious.

My husband and I ate here on our last night in New Orleans, we kind of came here by accident (deanie's had an hour wait) but I am glad we did! 

So first things first, they always seem busy from what I can tell and because of this, service can be a little slow..each waiter gets a LOT of tables and also because of this, the host will probably tell you that there will be anywhere between a 15-30 minute wait. here's the fun part, they seat really fast! We lucked out with a balcony table because the couple ahead of us wanted one but didn't want to wait 15-30 minutes and so they left, literally 30 seconds after they left the spot opened up and we were taken instead! 

The balcony is really narrow so it's kind of a squeeze between seats and in the walkway and there aren't any lights so eating at night got interesting but the ambience from Royal st. made up for it, we were surrounded by music and the lights along the quarter. 

Okay okay okay now the food! I had the Pecan Crusted Mahi Mahi and my husband ordered the Crawfish Ravioli. I have to say it was definitely on my list of favorites for new orleans. For dessert we had the Bananas Foster Cheesecake, and I am still crying myself to sleep asking myself when we can go back for it. It was amazing, hands down the BEST thing we had eaten the entire trip. My husband is a chef and I have never seen him speechless over a dish before...this got him. I gave myself chills. We will be back for you royal house!
The redfish beignets are a must have item. The rest of our meals was just ok. Blackened redfish was overcooked.

First meal in New Orleans and had to have a po boy for lunch.  Came in here and ordered the alligator po boy.  The alligator was nice and tender, it reminds me a lot of popcorn chicken but more juicy and soft in the middle.

Pleasant experience! My boyfriend and I went during French quarter fest. We did not have a reservation and went during dinner time. When I had called ahead, they told me the wait for a table would be 45 minutes. We somehow ended up with a table within 10 minutes! The service was good and the food was great. My only complaint is that the service started off amazing, but as the night went on, I could tell our server was getting slammed and was not as engaged as he was initially. Next time, I hope I get a table on the balcony so I can enjoy the view.

Trio of New Orleans - jambalaya was mushy.  Gumbo was average. Crawfish Étouffée was above average
Grilled shrimp - too buttery

Will likely never return.  This is a tourist stop that should be avoided.

Service was great but the food was awful. Had the chopped chicken salad and taste of New Orleans.

The salad was bland. The taste of New Orleans trio of Chicken & Andouille Jambalaya, Crawfish Etouffée and Chicken and Andouille Gumbo was horrible. We had a tiny taste of the Gumbo and had to spit it out. I've never had gumbo that tasted like that before! The etouffee was okay but it was watery and under seasoned. We only managed to finish the Jambalaya, which could have come from a box for how flavorless it was.

Don't be fooled by the 4 stars this is just a tourist trap with fake local fair.

Enjoyed dinner here recently.  Staff is very friendly and provides laid back service with a smile. Food is served in large portions and is very tasty. I am a big eater and could not clean my plate.  It's fun to people watch in this area.  Your entertainment is walking by or performing on the street.  Also check out the art galleries in the area.  Charming and fun.

The crab claw appetizer is a MUST. The sauce it comes in is to die for. I wasn't particularly impressed with the crab leg boil--the sauce was a bit off-putting and WAY too salty/peppery, which is something I never say since I love salt and pepper, but the crab claw appetizer more than made up for it. The fried oysters/fries weren't bad, but wouldn't order them again as they were nothing special.
Decided last minute to come here and I'm glad I did. 4 dozen oysters, crawfish ravioli, everything was great. Service was top notch and the upstairs room with outside patio seating is great.

Our waiter Lex was awesome, he had pretty great recommendations.... not just for the restaurant but all around town!

The Chargrilled Oysters were by far the best thing... we talked about these for days.  The raw Oysters Rockefeller were also yummy, but the Chargrilled take the cake!

The red beans and rice were super delicious along with the blackened red fish.

Lex was a big fan of the crawfish ravioli, I thought it was good, but I enjoyed all of the above way more.  

Must go and at least get the Chargrilled Oysters if thats the only thing you do, but the rest of the food was also pretty darn amazing!
Service is great! But the food is just mediocre. My stomach is somehow not tuned to their flavor as the others do, considering it is super busy.

We wondered into this place our first night in nola. They sat us right away. Busy place, great for people watching. We ordered eggplant chips. Yum! They weren't really "chips", but bigger slices breaded and fried. 

I had the shrimp and grits. The grits were cheesy and also fried into patties. There only 5 small shrimp on the entire plate. It still might be worth getting for the grits.

Hubby had red beans and rice. He said they were perfect.

Not sure if it was the balcony seating (overlooking Bourbon St), the Hurricane's or if the food was really great, but we enjoyed our meal immensely!  Price was very reasonable, especially considering location.

Great service, phenomenal food, and a great atmosphere. 

The wait staff made drinks quickly, cleared our plates as soon as we were done, and made suggestions that turned out to be amazing.

Taste of New Orleans included gumbo, jambalaya, and crawfish etouffee - delicious way to try 3 different things. 

Grilled oysters were an amazing thing to try for the first time! So so delicious. 

Tried the mint julep, the old fashioned, and the pimms cup, all strong and delicious.

First off, anyone who left a negative review is obviously, a. Dumb, or b. Has dumb tastebuds.  This place is delicious, I had the opportunity to try three of their famous dishes this evening and I was very impressed by all of the flavors of each dish.  Let's start with the mint julep, perfection, not overdone with bourbon or mint, all ingredients were mulled perfectly.  On to my appetizer ($10 off with Yelp checkin, btw) crab claws...holy moly this was off the hook! The sauce had a creamy and buttery consistency, not too think, not too light.  I would eat this as a soup is was so bomb.com! The shrimp & grits was not plated as a normal bowl of grits with a ring of shrimp (as pictures by other patrons).  This dish had basically large hush puppies of grits and some shrimp played around the hush puppies, not conventional, but delicious none the less, sauce again, on point!  Crawfish etouffe also had Amazon flavor, sauce not to thick, not too light, had a little spice to it, totally amazing with the little deep fried crawfish.  Our waiter was great (Terrance) had an amazing attitude, made you feel really excited to try the cocktails and food and offered some great recommendations.  This place was AMAZING, there is a reason it has the amount of stars it does, some people are just haters, go with your gut, it won't disappoint!

Ordered the Chargrilled Oysters and they did not disappoint! We probably should have ordered another dozen, but it was time to move on to our entrees. We ordered the blackened Red fish which was outstanding and also had the Crawfish Ravioli which was very good, but not great. The Pimm's cup was ok but their Bloody Mary tasted like a mix right out of the bottle, so I'd definitely skip that one. 

Service was kind of sketchy at times, but the place was hopping so I'll chalk it up to being busy--even though there were a few empty tables and it was about an hour from closing time.

Bottom line: There are other places in the neighborhood that are much better. A good suggestion might be to go here for some apps (Char-grilled Oysters) and head somewhere else for the entree.

I got a free appetizer using the Yelp app, so I capitalized on the seafood stuffed mushrooms which were very delicious and overflowing. For the main course I ordered the New Orleans sampler, which comes with jambalaya, gumbo, and crawfish etoufee and had them put blackened shrimp on top. They are generous with the blackened shrimp which was nice, although the shrimps are not large in a noteworthy way. The three dishes were alright, nothing special (and definitely could have been hotter). The best parts were how nice the waitstaff was and the upstairs dining area which has a great atmosphere and a small balcony that you can sit at (if your party is 1-2 people).

Our wait time was 20-25 minutes, so we kind of just bounced around exploring other food options and bars in that time but ultimately decided to come back here to eat.

Our host almost sat us in a doorway in the lower level, making a joke about it being "kind of like a balcony", but after I requested that she seat us at another table she was very accommodating, so we sat further in, opposite of the bar.

Food was meh. I just wasn't a fan of the seafood stuffed mushroom appetizer, so boyfriend took to eating those. Jambalaya was certainly edible, but the shrimp were very much over-seasoned.

After paying the bill, my boyfriend had noticed that my credit card hadn't come back. He asked our server about it, who in turn said "Oh, yes, a card was found on the ground and I turned it into the bar for safe-keeping. May I have the name on your ID?" I showed him that indeed, my ID matched the card I had just handed to him in the cheque minutes prior, and got it back. If bf hadn't noticed though, it would've very easy to leave without it.

Atmosphere is neat, the ceilings are high and there is lots of interesting decor, but I felt the food was just mediocre.

This was my first time in New Orleans and we ate all over the place. This was one of the better spots we hit. The service was prompt and attentive. I had an oyster po'boy which was overflowing with tasty fried oysters on good bread.  We were there for a lunch during a conference, and were able to get in and out in a timely fashion.

The service was decent. The sautéed crab claws were excellent! I ordered the crawfish ravioli and there was not one crawfish in sight. It should have been called bell pepper ravioli because it was LOADED with bell peppers. I was not pleased with it at all, and it was $22!!! Definitely not worth it. I had to put the sauce from the sautéed crabs on top to make it edible :-(

This is a definite stop anytime your are in New Orleans. Around 5pm looking for happy hour and some Cajun grub and wasn't disappointed. We started off with grilled oysters. They were cooked perfectly and had a garlic Parmesan cheese on them that melted in your mouth. I also order the Caprese Tower which I would definitely recommend. It had cheese,tomatoes, & onions all stacked and drizzled with a balsamic. My main course was the blackened shrimp & jambalaya. I ate every bit of it. We sat upstairs and enjoyed a perfect day people watching and soaking up a few cold ones.

Looking for some authentic food in NOLA. This isn't the place. About 8pm, Saturday, during Jazz Fest we got sat right away. Ordered oysters off the bat which were actually pretty good if a bit on the large side for my taste. Wife had the Shrimp Creole, basically, rice, some frozen shrimp and tomato sauce with a few diced veggies thrown in. Not, UH, good. I had the "Jambalaya". Not sure they know what "Jambalaya" is but it isnt dry, crusty rice with some more frozen shrimp and a lot of black pepper. It literally isnt that but that is what I got served. 

I guess we got tourist trapped.

I wish I could give their customer service negative stars. We waited 45 mins for our food and it was ice cold. Our waiter didn't even talk to us after he took our order. DONT WASTE YOUR NIGHT. I can't believe we thought this place was nice and was part of the New Orleans experience.

For a town with really good food to offer, I would NOT suggest.  The only good thing was the woman outside talking to us before we were seated.  This is probably one of he worst experiences I have ever had at a restaurant.

An abysmal experience. (1) Redfish beignets were recommended to us but were over-cooked, yet cold, fish pieces deep fried and covered in syrup and powdered sugar. They were just totally unpleasant. (2) I ordered a glass of wine and waited about 20 minutes for it. When our server finally brought it, she explained the wait by saying the bartender was "in the weeds" but we had been watching them both chit chat at the bar. As a matter of fact all of our drink orders took a solid 15-20 minutes to arrive. (3) Our waters were hardly ever refilled. And, unless, talking with the bartender, our server was barely seen. (4) After literally 55 minutes, our server brought us our check WITHOUT EVER BRINGING OUR ENTRÉES. We reminded her that we had meals coming, at which point she promised a discount and to track down our food. After another 15 minutes, we informed the manager that we were leaving...hungry. Skip Royal House completely, unless you want to put a damper on your night. If I could give zero stars, I would.

Royal house is for tourists...like me...

The first floor bar smells like a old, moist towel without laundry for three months. Part of it came from the oyster, and the guy open the shells does not ware gloves. He also chatted with customers and shake their hand before going back to open more shells. No oysters was on ice before or after the the process. Ice only met oysters 30 second before your table. Lisa A Elfer is the one who signed their health certificate. He also rubs his face with the same hands. Health Alert!!! I am sitting on the high chair for ten minute, and finally get a MENU,covered with unknown liquid. 

The bar is lovely if you can hold your breath. I was not brave enough to order oyster that night after I saw the opened oysters were sitting on the counter without ice.. You are surely braver than I am. I finally ordered fried gator meat, and taste of New Orleans. unlike other places, they could not do the gator meat blacked. I guess seasoning requires more skills and good spies.  I was so glad that I brought my own water since they did not offer any. 17 minutes in water is in front of me now!!!

The alligator is half the portion compared to what I had this week in other places. It is about $1.50 per bites. You need eat with your hands. Interestingly, the lemon slice amen with it  was covered with shredded cheese. The gator meat is very soft, and soooooo salty. Someone tipped over the salt jar?  Unfortunately, I told the staff that I will have my beer when the dishes arrive. And I never saw my beer that night. 

Taste of New Orleans has three cup of, crawfish étouffée, chicken gumbo, and creole. The crawfish étouffée is well cooked, with plenty of hot spicy taste. The chicken is very good too. It contains chunks of smoked sausage, and enriched with smoky flavor. Chicken meat soaked with the flavor from Cajun, black pepper in the soup is one of the high light. The creole is not among the best in town, dry and lack of ingredient other than rice.

Drop in for a late diner with my sister and brother-in-law on a Friday night during Jazz Fest.  It is a lively place with a a wait of about 15 min though we were told it would be 25 min.  The oysters were great. My shrimp creole was good but the shrimp were slightly over cooked. My sister thought the gumbo had had too much flour in the roux. Otherwise the flavored were good.
Food was ok, not worth the wait. Annoying to wait for 30 min and the entire back area we sat in was empty. Oysters were good, but not as good as other places. Lacked flavor.

Least favorite place my husband and I ate at while visiting New Orleans. We ordered the Taste of New Orleans and it was just okay. Our server was friendly and we were able to sit on the awesome second story balcony. We requested the balcony, but it definitely has a slant towards the street which is a little unnerving, and sometimes hard to keep everything on your little table from falling down onto passersby below. We don't drink, so maybe the bar is what makes this a "go to" destination, but it wasn't a place we would go again.

Very average and a wasted meal while in NOLA...very disappointed in the prior reviews!  I have no idea how they have an avg 4 star rating!

Popeyes is a much better value, with exception of the fresh Oysters

Don't let the line fool you, it is a tourist trap.

This place is awesome! The staff is so wonderful and friendly! We wanted to sit outside on a rooftop balcony which they have but only have seats outside for two people, so instead we sat upstairs but inside and still had a lovely view.

As for food the po-boy (both shrimp and fish) were tasty, French onion soup was really good, the taste of New Orleans had jambalaya, gumbo, and crawfish ettoufee all delicious! But the absolute best was the crab claw appetizer, it's a must try! 

As for desserts the bananas foster cheesecake is to die for and the bread pudding is also yummy.

Everything is priced reasonably too.

Pretty solid oyster bar and restaurant. Depending on the night it can be a decent wait to get in. Very good location and often music can be heard from the streets while eating, but it's not too loud like other areas in the French Quarter. Oysters and gumbo were spot on, definitely a great place with a lot of southern food options.

A group of us decided to try out this restaurant. We were coming in from Alexandria for a disaster relief response with Islamic relief and decided to have lunch here. The restaurant downstairs was super busy and the bar was filled with people. The waiter took us upstairs, the stairs were old and squeaky but it got us up there. The room upstairs was spacious with a balcony view. We were seated quickly and the waitress introduced herself and asked us what we wanted to drink. The waitress also answered our questions about the menu and even other questions about the area! We ordered our food quickly and was on our way to catch a flight! If your New Orleans you should definitely try this place out

This place has HORRIBLE HORRIBLE service!!!! They have no communication with the customers! Terrible food and terrible service!
The waitress was struggling with the large group I was with, and instead of the manager helping her out, he stood behind the bar the entire time!
The food was cold. One person didn't get their meal until it was time to pay. The kitchen was supposedly "having problems".... I highly recommend you not to waste your money here! Especially locals! I am sure you can find wayyyyy better seafood spots in the city!

The food was excellent.  I got the shrimp boil and half dozen oysters.  The only reason I am giving this place 4 stars is because it took a tremendous amount of time to get my drink and food order.  Turns out the waiter (nice guy) didn't know my table was his.  Once I put in my food and drink order I got my water really quick and oysters in a reasonable amount of time.  I thought the shrimp boil came out really slow again however so I'm not sure what happened there since he knew my ytable was his.

Went in because the hostess at the door said there was a Yelp deal of buy 2 entrees and get an appetizer free. They messed up both entrees and said they would comp one. Then they charged us for the appetizer. When we asked about it they said they have done all they can do for us.

We stopped here for an afternoon break and ordered fresh oysters and crab claws. The oysters were good. However, after I read someone's review about violating the health code, I am a bit concerned.  Crab claws were flavorful but way too salty. It made me wonder if they were trying to use salt to cover up something.

Service was slow. Not sure if I would go back.
Yum! Great ambiance, location, food, and service. One of my New Orleans favorites.

At the Royal House when you ask your server to recommend something...you get lucky! Our Server Ty (I think) gave us drink, apps, and entree ideas that were spot on. Good food, good price, great service!

Sat upstairs and I really loved the ambiance.  The service was excellent.  Sadly, the food wasn't that good.  The fish was lukewarm and tasteless and the vegetables looked and tasted like they came out of a can.
Nice restaurant and ambience, they also offer balcony seating with great views of the french quarters. I would return for the oyster pasta. Service was a little slow, but overall good.
Our waiter was amazing, Kris, the food was amazing, and it was the best oysters! Get your butt there now!

Server was super-nice, albeit the overall service experience was painfully slow. Drinks were decent. The name escapes me but I had a gin drink with strawberries- not bad at all. The food? Food was meh, kind of average or even a bit less than. I had the blackened Redfish- fish was a little dry, potatoes were pretty good, green beans were overcooked and they left quite a few of the stems on. Dessert was bread pudding and that was the best part. We had a Caprese salad for an app- a stupid order on my part (being Italian and from NY, lol). The tomatoes were juicy and flavorful, the mozzarella was well, not.
Great place!  Loved the Royal Cup drink and red beans and rice. Will definitely come here again!
Super delicious!  Fried aligator was good.  Beans and rice with sausage was amazing!  Berry margarita is a delight.  And the waitstaff makes me so happy!!
In town for Jazz Fest and this was the best food we found. Redfish Beignet was off the amazing. Our server Chris was the best and made our experience so memorable!
Went there for desserts (mainly bead pudding) and ended up with two deserts.   Amazingly delicious!

Not ideal for those who are Gluten-free. There is no GF menu, server was unaware of what is GF and the manager (who had a terrible attitude) came out and asked what I wanted (as if I knew what possibilities I had) and didn't give any options except for blackened shrimp and caprese salad.

Come early since there will be a wait, regardless, the wait was not bad for our group of 5. And you get some awesome Street performers to entertain yourself while you wait. :)

We ordered crawfish etouffle (the best), redfish beignets, shrimp Creole, shrimp and grits, and jambalaya. Overall, the shrimp they used in the dishes were poor quality, small and dinky... wasn't that fresh. 

The crawfish etouffee was the best! Buttery and creamy, the savory sauce satisfies your taste buds immediately. 

Redfish beignets were good too! For some reason, I was expecting if to be 'redfish stuffed beignets,' but they were more like fried redfish with a small layer of beignet batter on the outside. Still delicious!

Jambalaya was mediocre for me, similar to other Jambalaya you can get in NOLA.

Shrimp n grits were tasty! The grits were in a more solid form than other grits I've had, and there was a nice crisp layer on the outside. :D mmmm crisp. 

Shrimp Creole was my least favorite... Just shrimp with tomato sauce... Reminded me of tomato pasta sauce with shrimp and rice. I would skip this dish. 

Service was honestly really slow, not very attentive as we had to remind the server to fill our water and wait a while for our bill to come in.

We were told that this restaurant has the best food and best oysters in town. The chicken and sausage gumbo had 0 pieces of chicken or sausage.   How do you serve a bowl of gumbo with just rice? We ordered the oysters on the half shell and they had no flavor.  Acme had amazing oysters sweet and salty.  I ordered an oyster po boy and I asked for tartar sauce.  By the time I got it the meal was cold.  Service was poor food was below average.

I had dinner with my husband here(Royal House) on Saturday night. There was a line for waiting they took my husband name and we got sat in like 30 minutes. The waiter was a very nice young lady I forgot her name . I had a pinnacle cosmo and my husband had a strawberry lager beer that is very limited. After she brought me a surprise drink i forgot what she said it was called but very good! For dinner I had shrimp tortellini and my husband had the Taste of New Orleans which is a bit of everything!! Def going back!! Food and service was amazing.

This is one of the best eating stops in the French Quarter. 
Their menu is extensive & you can find a lot of choices, whether you are just stopping for appetizers & a cocktail or interested in a full entree. My favorite appetizers, the oyster beignets & the seafood stuffed mushrooms are two reasons why I love returning to Royal House. My husbands favorite dish are the Oysters Royale, topped with a seafood stuffing. 

The two entree's that are worth recommending are the taste of N.O. plate which includes Jambalaya, Etouffee & Gumbo & secondly, the Baked Shrimp Tortellini. The dessert menu is equally tempting between bread pudding & the bananas foster cheesecake.

Royal House has a laid back & relaxing ambiance, with its balcony overlooking the French Quarter & ample seating areas. Their employees are pleasant & helpful, too. We have especially liked our sweet bartender & server, Ryan R, who has been a part of several of our best visits to Royal House.

Great spinach salad with grilled shrimp, craisins, apples, and balsamic vinaigrette dressing. This place is conveniently located across from my business hotel of choice, the Omni Royal Orleans hotel, and features friendly and prompt service. As a bonus, the background music is classic and fun. While I don't eat oysters, I saw sacks of fresh ones being brought into the kitchen and was told they bring them in fresh every day and go through them all.
Friendly staff but just not impressed with the quality or flavor. Burger was dry and bland but the fried eggplant was really really good!

We loved this place so much!  The food was amazing and the service just clinched the deal.  Lex, our server, made great recommendations and made sure that our experience was close to perfection!  The red fish beignets and crab claws were so unique memorable.   We will definitely be back next time we are visiting the area.

Sure wish we had more time to try some of the other menu selections here at Royal House because the breakfast was amazing! From the moment we walked in we felt welcomed and comfortable!  The hostess was friendly, down to earth with a great sense of humor and professional customer service skills!

We came for breakfast and sat on the balcony upstairs. At first we felt a little tipsy and a bit awkward but after settling in for a minute or two we didn't notice the slant at all! We had just arrived in New Orleans the night before and celebrated a bit too much so we weren't too adventurous in the culinary department! I had the Southerner and hubby had the Eggs Benedict, both pretty simple selections and both were outstanding!! Probably some of the absolute best gravy I've ever had with a very light biscuit and eggs cooked perfectly. Hubby didn't need extra Hollandaise or lemon which is probably a first! We shared a side of bacon and it was nice a crispy just like we both like it! 

Our service was spot on as well!  Very efficient and friendly yet super classy and professional. She kept waters full, delivered the food piping hot and had a smile every time we saw her.

The only reason I'm giving a 4 star review and not a 5 star is because they don't have any "sweet" offering on the breakfast menu. We usually like something such as a sweet roll or french toast to balance everything out so we were just a tiny bit disappointed when we found out they had nothing to offer.

The Royal House gave us the royal treatment for breakfast and we'll definitely be back next time!
got the oyster beignets and royal oysters. bananas fosters dessert is to die for! ask for it with ice cream.

I was so looking forward to this but sadly the service is the spoiler. We arrived as a party of 10 and expected a wait so being told 25 minutes was not a problem. We were told we were fine to get drinks while we waited so went in to get them. The beer arrived and we payed the bill and gave a 30% tip expecting the two other drinks to be on their way. After about 5 minutes of the server shucking oysters in front of us not moving to get the other drinks we said something to be told they were on their way. After 5 more he went to get them. By that time the rest of our party had been seated so we all sat down with to go cups. The very friendly server arrived and we felt we would be in for a good night despite the bad bar service. We were told he was going to fetch water with our drink order. This never arrived despite asking twice. The wrong order was brought and when it was pointed out a quick rush to the kitchen brought us a plate of thrown on rice and the shrimp Creole sauce. I counted 5 shrimp whilst my friend had a great plate. The food for all the rest of our table was good. When the bill came we had two extra dishes on which we needed to have removed. On the whole the food was good. Sadly the service was awful.

I'm not sure how this place has such good reviews. I came here after reading yelp and ordered Oysters and the shrimp boil. The shrimp had NO flavor and the oysters were some of the most disgusting oysters I've ever had. They tasted dirty. We ordered a dozen and as an oyster LOVER I probably had two. Also my boyfriend got the steak and I could have gone to Chili's to get a better steak. Not joking and definitely not recommended.

Free appetizer if you check in on yelp and buy two entrees. We came here to have some food to go. we had to wait at the bar for our food. The baristas are super friendly and accommodating.
Their food were tasty but a bit salty. small portions. Sauce on the crab claws is good with the bread.:)

Not exactly satisfied with my expectations from previous Yelp reviews. The oysters were great and the cheesecake was good (just good). The ambiance is perfection. We sat on the balcony and enjoyed the people watching and the jazz performer nearby. 

BAD: Dinner, honestly don't bother. Fried fish was soggy. Tartar sauce and coleslaw were spoiled and the shrimp Creole tasted like spaghetti sauce with shrimp and partially cooked rice (no spice at all). 

I would only recommend the appetizers.

Snapshot: 4.6/5 Freshness, 4.5/5 Service, 5/5 Menu Options

Great seafood creole restaurant in the quarter. We sat at the bar an Brandon provided excellent service, thanks.

The gator bites are lightly battered and tender. The gumbo was fantastic. I highly recommended the blackened Redfish. It's a huge piece accompanied with red potatoes an string beans.

Save room for desert as the bread pudding was unbelievable. I tasted the brownie and it melted in my mouth.

Overall, great service, fresh food and reasonably priced.
Very good food and our waiter was entertaining.  I had the oyster tacos which were pretty good.  My friend had the crab pot which she loved.

The ambiance here is top notch.  Everything you could ever imagine in the French Quarter.  Gorgeous balconies, huge open windows, and and the sound of jazz from street performers floating in the air.  

The food was okay. Some things were average, some things very good.  I regret not ordering oysters on the half shell after seeing them on another table.  They looked divine.  I had the oyster po boy and it was just okay.  I really had to douse it in hot sauce to really give it any flavor.  I was hoping for a remoulade sauce but was informed they did not have one.  My dad had the same opinion of his oyster po' boy.  They were very largly portioned and bready.  We did however both really enjoy our red beans and rice.  I could probably live off of red beans and rice though.  My sister had a shrimp po' boy and she said it had a lot more flavor.  I did find a shrimp in my oyster po' boy though (and I'm allergic!)

In the future, I would definitely try Royal House again, if not for the ambiance alone.  Next time I'll get the oysters on the half shell and really be in New Orleans heaven. It's a little pricy, but most of the French Quarter is, and you're paying for that quintessential ambiance.

Looked for a place close to our hotel to grab some authentic food for dinner before a night out on Bourbon Street. We waited about 15 minutes and sat at a small table near the bar. We had Tina, and I recommend you ask for her and wait extra if you have to. She was AMAZING. Extremely friendly and recommended great dishes. We ordered and she told us she recommended something else cause she said that what we wanted wasn't the best. Gator bites were great. We got a shrimp Po boy and some other dish she recommended and basically customized that was great. Drinks were perfect too! Must go if you're in NOLA

Mediocre at best... Hosts were awesome! Tks ladies for being so welcoming and gettin us on the balcony! Oysters weren't cut from the shell and had shell fragments in them, watch out! Ordered a Sauvignon blanc but got Chardonnay ... After waiting a bit too long for drinks anyways... Entrees mediocre.. When we got to the host stand the balcony seating was closed? And we got there at prime dinner time... Then after we were sat in the dining room a balcony table opened up and we were moved to the balcony... Idk seemed odd. Won't be back... Sorry royal house... Yelp boasts your balcony seating then it's closed at 8? Then open 10 mins later? Anyways thankful to get a balcony table but the food doesn't make me wanna come back...

Pretty good restaurant, but nothing super special.

We waited about 45 minutes to get seated, but we didn't have a reservation at prime dinner time, so not surprising. They have a balcony that looks really nice to sit at, but we didn't want to wait the extra time to be seated there.

I got their special Bloody Mary, that has onion infused vodka (or something like that), but it tasted like a normal Bloody Mary to me. For my entrée, I got the redfish and it was pretty good. Some of my co-workers got the red beans and rice plate, and it looked REALLY good. Next time I would get that for sure.

Overall, this was a nice spot for dinner, but didn't have anything too special or memorable for me.

While on our eating spree through New Orleans we stopped by their bar for a quick beer and yes something fried.  Well the food here was awesome and so was the bartender! Super approachable and helpful!  We loved the openness air feel  of the restaurant and did I mention the food was great?!  We will definitely go back!!!

Great place for a tourist stop. Crab claws were an awesome appetizer. We also ordered the oyster duo (half Rockefeller half   ), 1 dozen raw oysters, taste of New Orleans (jambalaya, gumbo, crawfish étouffée), 1 pound of steam shrimp. For drinks we had their famous Bloody Mary and an Absolute mule (aka Moscow mule). Both were pretty alright. Nothing that you would miss if you've had both before. Overall the food was fantastic. We had a couple soggy shrimp (probably not as fresh) which was a bit of a disappointment and the oysters were also not as fresh as we have had them in New Orleans before. Chris was fantastic as our server. His professionalism brought this restaurant to another class - made up for the food which is why I give this place 4*.

The service was terrible-- we called ahead and asked how long the wait was and were told 15 min-- but when we got there it was 30. We also left our phone number but of course when tour table was ready, they didn't call us, and when we asked, told us that they hadn't called us yet even though it was clearly marked on the list, which her coworker conceded.  
We sat at the table for a good half an hour  waiting for the food (after waiting forever for the waitress to take our order) while the next table over sat down after us, ordered, ate, AND paid before our food even arrived.  The food was decidedly mediocre. The cheese on the French onion soup was rubbery, and the oysters Rockefeller were really fishy and completely overpowered by the breadcrumbs and spinach. The French fries were cold, and the bread on the poboy was dry. Definitely wouldn't go back again.
Everything here was delicious i recommend trying the crab claws and seafood pescatore

I came with a group of friends today and I must leave a review ASAP because every single one of us were completely satisfied with the food, except the gumbo. We all tried a little bit of it and it tasted a little.... different. Everyone agreed that Royal House was definitely a good choice though! We had the Crab Claws (three orders!) and it was amaaaaazing!!!! We basically put that dip on everything hahaha. Seafood stuffed mushroom was really good as well! Charbroiled oysters were good, kinda cheesy but not bad. My other friends got alligator po-boy and some seafood pasta, they really liked it, along with the Bloody Mary!

Service was good, they're very attentive with the water because they help each other out. Ambiance was nice, we were on the second floor. Windows open, felt a nice breeze here and there. It was just a great experience and we will definitely come back if we're in NOLA.

Absolutely amazing! We were lucky enough to get a two seater table on the balcony so we could see all the action below. The food was some of the best food I've ever had, even with previously living in a predominantly French Creole island. Had the crab claws as an appetizer, the chicken and andouille sausage gumbo to share, and the seafood pescatore and shrimp creole for dinner with the banana foster cheesecake dessert. All of it was absolutely delicious. Service was without a doubt 10/10. Will definitely recommend to everyone and will definitely be back
Everything was wonderful! The service and food was amazing. I had the pecan crusted mahi mahi and am so glad I chose that.

Extremely slow service for a Monday dinner. Crab claws for appetizer were good. Didn't like the shrimp and grits entree. It was too sour. Shrimp creole was fine but the ~$16 entree came with just 5 small pieces of shrimp. So not worth it. Bread pudding for dessert was really good though. Overall this place is overrated.

Good food, nice atmosphere, tasty drinks. I had the peel and eat shrimp. Perfectly cooked and just the right spice. The red fish beignets were divine as was the sauce on the crab claw appetizers. Others in my party enjoyed the pasta pescatori, fried shrimp and grilled red fish. Bloody Mary and Moscow Mule were both great. Also, good prices for quality and location. Not a 5 because it was a little loud and my entree was a little cooler than I would've preferred. Staff were also professional, friendly, and attentive but not intrusive.

Was curious about this place, since every time we walked by there was a decent line. It was so so. Crab claw appetizer was good, best thing we ate. As for the creole shrimp.. It came out cold and lacked seasoning... Pretty much chopped onion, bell pepper & tomato sauce. My companion had the eggplant oyster pasta plate, which also lacked seasoning but was actually warm. It was a miss unfortunately.
I can still taste those char grilled oysters. So good. We sat at the bar, the super friendly guy who took our order never stopped shucking oysters. Expect to wait in line, but really worth it.

Great great food. Service was great as well. Staff all seemed to help each other throughout service. We had the crab claws as an app. The sauce is to die for. Our Server Monica brought extra warm bread so we could sop up the sauce. For entree we shared the taste of New Orleans. No regrets at all. The jambalaya was very flavorful. We opted to add blacked shrimp. The crawfish was beyond amazing. Added some lemon and really loved it. The Gumbo was really good, especially mixed with the crawfish. Can't wait to come back!

Very poor service.

Hostess took us to the wrong table.

Waiter was abysmal.  He seemed lost and comfused; but it wasnt crowded. He explained,  his service areas was very far from each other.

When he asked for our drink orders,  he was too busy being inattentive to us and attentive to others surrounding him,  that he asked us to repeat our orders each. 

When drinks arrived,  he left the drink tray at our table! 

Appetizers came out 3-5 minutes before the entrees.  Our entrees were luke warm! 

Food itself was salty and had a very fishy smell. We enjoy seafood but this had the not-so-fresh fishiness. Ordered the oysters duo, crab claws, shrimp &  grits, and shrimp creole. 

FYI you get a "free"  appetizer of you check in Yelp.  You must physically show the waiter your check-in to redeem this. Further,  the Appetizers were $12+ ea and we only received a $10 discount. 

In the end,  this place was a waste of my time and stomach space.  Disappointed I'm the food and service. First night in Nola,  hope it gets better. 

TLDR: avoid Royal House.

Whoever thought grits should be in brick form obviously has never had real grits.

 I had the shrimp and grits and they were more then disappointing. They were fried? And cold and not good. Plus with 4 little shrimps.
