My friends got the sampler and alligator poboy. All very underwhelming to say the least. 

The waiter was very pleasant but seemed to have a very rehearsed skit. Make sense when you are in the heart of the tourist area. But this please is definitely not worth the hype.
Amazing French onion soup, tasty gator bites, yummy blackened chicken poboy,  spicy shrimp creole and delish blackened shrimp.

Sigh. 

I really wish I could give this ANYTHING higher than a 2 stars. I had pretty high expectations after seeing some of the reviews here (even from other yelpers that I know). My friends and I were able to get a seat here 10 minutes after calling in ahead of time the day of (A Sunday). 

We were seated in a awkward long table by the second floor entrance where the noise level was a bit excessive. People were coming up and down the stairs so it was a bit hard to have a conversation. Our server was friendly enough, when my boyfriend found a rando piece of sharp clam shell hidden inside his NON SEAFOOD Chicken Sandwich, our server was quick to correct things by bringing out the restaurant manager. 

Overall, it was a subpar dining experience. After being seated almost immediately we still had to wait well over an hour for our food to come out, the clam shell piece incident kind of had us all wary of every bite we took. The food in general already was pretty bad and everything was pretty pricey. 
Specifically I'd like to point this out in regards to food but we ordered what we thought was shrimp and grits -- HOWEVER, this new version (as of 05/15/2016) SUCKS. It was two fried blocks of grits, covered in this insanely weird creole-y sauce with way too much cheese covering everything. 3/8 of us ordered this dish and collectively agreed that it was pretty much sadness on a plate. Another thing that was way off-- the mint julep. SUPER strong with little to no mint/sugar flavor to compliment it. My friend actually had to ask our server to bring it back to add some sugar to offset the insanely strong alchy taste it had.

Yeap 4 stars! 

We were there during the southern decadence craziness. It was an awesome time. We got their awesome bloody Mary's, first time having those and I was hooked. Just the right amount of spice and tartness.

We tried coming for dinner around 8pm on a Sunday night. The wait looked long but the hostess stand was a bit crazy. We put our names down but went to check out another place instead. 

We returned later in week and just got oysters. They were very big but lacked any flavor. I've never had raw gulf oysters so perhaps that's how they taste? I love horseradish with oysters but theirs had no flavor and I could pile it on. Not a bad price compared to west/east coast oysters but probably wouldn't get again.

I'm going to give the Royal House 4 stars because the food was so good.  I'm going to leave the service out, and I'll tell you why.   We waited an hour for our food. We watched tables come and go, and missed a show we had planned to see after dinner, because we were there waiting forever.  Our server, who was very polite, and very attentive, blamed it on the kitchen. The manager blamed it on the kitchen. Personally I think she forgot to put the order in.  Whatever the case, they said "sorry" and that was it.  They didn't even offer to take anything off the check or buy a round of drinks.  Oh, they also charged me full price for my app even though I had the Yelp check in special.  "Oh we totally screwed up your night and kept you waiting 4 days for dinner? We better charge you extra!"  Since I'm not really sure what happened or who was a fault, I'm going to just leave it out, because of the food. 

The food.  Started with the crab claws. If we were seated in a dimly lit corner, I would've licked the plate. I'm not kidding.  I could eat this every day.    For dinner was the taste trio.  I opted to add the blackened shrimp to the jambalaya and I'm so glad I did. It was fantastic.  I took a quick taste before taking a pic because I was starving, and before I knew it I had eaten the entire cup.  So good. The crawfish etouffe was so flavorful with big chunks of crawfish.  I'd order a big fat bowl of this if I were ever in the Royal House again.  The gumbo was ok. It was a bit too smokey tasting for me, but my husband absolutely loved it.  

Had the service been better this would've been a 5, hands down.  I'd come back, but next time I'd try to snag a seat at the bar. The bartenders seemed to have it together.

The staff here was PHENOMENAL. My father uses a scooter to get around. The staff not only rearranged the tables for us to fit, but asked guests to help out by moving their tables to assist in our exit after it filled up. The food was amazing, delicious, and served quickly and correctly. Melva was our server and we can't say enough good stuff about her. She made spot-on recommendations. She kept our drinks filled. Her smile was infectious. Her wit and charm are an asset to the Royal House. Make sure you ask to sit wherever she is!  Thank you Royal House for accommodating our little family!

We had the crab claws and stuffed mushroom appetizers. In my opinion the crab claws were probably the only decent thing we had. Neither of the 6 of us cared for the mushrooms. We also got chargrilled oysters that were small and not worth $20 at all. For entrees we ordered the seafood boiling pot, shrimp boiling pot, rib eye, fried seafood platter, oyster pasta, and the soup trio. ALL of our entrees lacked so much flavor. My friend probably took 2 bites of her pasta and pushed it aside. The seafood platter was room temperature and just overall mediocre. My friend hated the soup trio and said it tasted nothing like jambalaya, etoufee, or red beans. The boiling pots lacked so much flavor that we expected since we are in New Orleans.. AND they were supposed to come with corn, which we never got. And when I asked my server if it was supposed to come with it she said yes but we probably ran out since it's the end of the night. It would have been nice to have been offered a substitution or be told they were out to begin with. They probably hoped we wouldn't notice. And the rib eye was just ok. We didn't even want to order dessert for our friends birthday. Would probably never come here again since we paid almost $400 for a meal we all werent the least bit satisfied with. And for $400 we never even got a single drink refill. Save your money and go elsewhere. WOULDNT RECOMMEND TO ANYONE

Mediocre food at ridiculous prices. All of the dishes our party ordered, from the gumbo to the etouffee to the jambalaya to the po-boys, felt lazy and perfunctory, and the seafood wasn't particularly fresh. Nothing was stright-out offensive, however, until we got the bill and saw how much we were charged. The exorbitant price of the on-tap beer would put the most pretentious bars in Brooklyn or San Fransisco to shame.

I'm given to understand that attractive people are put on the upper floor in the balcony windows, but I suppose we weren't the right type of attractive, since we were put in the bar area, which was cramped and smelled of vomit and bleach.

The service was lovely, but I'm not sure this restaurant is worth the expense unless you're confident in your ability to be seated on the upper floor.
Love this place!  Good quick service and great food.  Grilled oysters are the best in town! I stop here every trip. Bread pudding is also pretty good.

Warning: Tourist trap. Because of the great reviews, we assumed this place would be awesome. I am of the impression that those who leave such great reviews had never had oysters before or don't really know what good food is or were FQ wasted at the time. Super overpriced, ultra mediocre. It is pretty, and I had a good drink. Our server totally made fun of/insulted our vegan friend for asking a question politely about a menu item.
Skip it.

Hungry for po'boys. Might not be the best place for those... smaller sandwich, heavy on the fries. The oysters were good, and the fried fish platter was better than might be expected.  The roast beef po'boy had an odd taste, not bad just a little different in the gravy.

The bartender at a very nice hotel recommended we go to the Royal House for dinner. We looked forward to sitting on the balcony and enjoying looking over the French Quarter as we ate creole food. We had a very disappointing meal. The oysters weren't cleaned very well and one of them was so huge and bloated looking my husband didn't eat it. The cocktail sauce was very bland (but they did serve horseradish separately). After waiting a ridiculously long time without seeing our waitress, someone else brought our food. Everything was cold and not fresh looking. The flavor of the roux in the gumbo was smoky, the jambalaya was as if it were scraped off the sides of the pan and the ettouffee had no flavor.  Still not seeing our waitress, we asked the busser for our bill. She was very helpful and brought over the hostess. We explained our disappointment with both the food and the service. She sent for the manager who apologized and made it right for us. There are so many choices in the French Quarter, I would not  recommend this place to friends.

Went here on a Friday night around 6ish and the waited for a table of 3 was about 30-40 mins, but it wasn't that long.  The place was busy and our waitress was fast and friendly.  We ordered the Redfish & Taste of NO, both were delicious.  As for appetizer, we ordered the crab and oysters, both were really good.  The Hurricane drink Was excellent.  My husband's drink was maker mark mint something and he says it was good.

Service was very friendly and the wait was not as long as expected. The food was very mediocre (I had the jambalaya with shrimp) and the cocktails were forgotten upon consumption. However, the highlight is if you're able to sit on the balcony and people watch, like we did for the first night of Memorial Day weekend.

The view from the balcony at night is the only reason I'm giving this place 2 stars. I will make it short and sweet. I ordered the shrimp and grits (which came out looking NOTHING like the pictures on Yelp - but I don't fault them for that - they just changed the presentation, I guess) and they were barely room temperature and bland.  The spinach dip was "meh". Our server was never around, we would wait and wait for service. It took ages to get our check. The balcony was terrifying to be honest. It's at a major slant, especially in the corner that we sat in, and bounced with every step by anyone (not faulting them for this either - we chose the balcony).  Honestly - if the food would have been good, I would have at least bumped this to 4 despite the terrible service. I barely touched my food because it was so cold and not even an inquiry about it.

Excellent meal and our server Ashton was outstanding.  My friends had the oysters and said they were outstanding.   I don't eat oysters but they were huge.  I tried the blackened chicken sandwich and crayfish and shrimp ravioli. Be sure to get the red fish beineights. Great dishes.

Great service, excellent food and friendly staff. We were sat quickly and even accommodated our dogs with water bowls. Excellent Bloody Mary and shrimp PO boys. Fried alligator app was tender and moist and fried to perfection.

TOURIST TRAP!!! Oysters were boring. Alligator was boring. The wait for the food was too long! My Redfish was hard when it came out. My friends finished eating before my fish came out. The only redeeming factor was the Moscow Mule.

Best place we've been so far! The staff was absolutely amazing, out of the 8 people we came in counter with, they were so personable and gracious. The food and drinks were to die for! I recommend the oysters beignet and the shrimp fried grits as well as the crawfish ravioli. To. Die. For.

Mixed review. A ten minute wait ended up 45. Poor understaffed place. Oh well. They did their best with the few people they had. :/ holiday weekend. Anyway mixed likes. I mean it was all good. But varying good. I really enjoyed the boiled shrimp. Very simple not as spicy as I was hoping. Potato was kind of bland too. But we had the tomato caprese salad starter and it was delicious. Could have used a little extra balsamic and flat layered instead of towered would make for easier sharing. Not the season for tomato
Either but the mozzarella was perfect.  Hubby had the shrimp and grits. And although different with mozzarella but delicious. Said it was absolutely delish. 
Also had blackened redfish. It was good but again wanted so much more kick. For the prices I think we faired out pretty good. Serving four people and appetizer free with my check using Yelp! Now that was awesome!!!

Anyway I enjoyed the atmosphere and the waitstaff. :) recommend if you get there early and order without having to wait. Nice variety on the regular menu is why I give it a 4 star!! :)

Love this place!!!
DELICIOUS FOOD - Chargrilled oysters, for me main dish Oyster Linguini and my husband the seafood pescatore, great location, we had a romantic dinner on the balcony listening to a street musician... the service was outstanding!!!

This restaurant has been the best experience I've had with good eating while on vacation. The food is awesome from the appetizers to the desert. 
The atmosphere was everything!

Nothing bad about this place. Service was beyond stellar. Friendly hostess and we seated right away. Had two more friends join and they had no problem getting us a bigger table. 

Ashton was our server and she was simply the best. She knew the menu very well and gave great suggestions. Great attitude and energy as well.

The food great and I was able to try a bunch of items. I did prefer the gigantic raw oysters over the chargrilled ones. Redfish beignets I'd definitely recommend as they had huge pieces of fish on the inside. BLT Oyster po-boy was one of the best sandwiches I've had in NOLA. I tried the crawfish shrimp ravioli as well which had a great sauce with large chunks of veggies in it and lots of flavor.

Oh and if you happen to order a Bloody Mary and make it a double watch out. It's a very generous double ;)

Came here due to my fellow Yelpers! We wanted to try alligator while in New Orleans,so my husband and I ordered the fried alligator, oysters duo, and the seafood pescadore. 

Our server, Tina, was really friendly and helpful. She recommended the Absolut Strawberry Lemonade and Mandarin Dreamsicle. We got both, and I loved the lemonade! It was refreshing, fruity, and sweet! It had a strawberry and two slices of lemon in it. My husband got the Dreamsicle, and we expected it to taste like a creamsicle. It kind of did... but also kindof tasted like medicine. We would order that again.

The fried alligator had moist meat, and came with cocktail and tartar sauce. It was good, but tiny portions. We saw a video of the oysters duo, that it'd be sizzling when it got to the table. It wasn't. And, it was lukewarm, at best. We came when the restaurant was pretty empty too, so I'm not sure why our food wasn't hot. Also, taste wise, for which I'm not sure temperature played a role in, was mediocre. Acme chargrilled oysters are WAY BETTER.

The pasta, Tina recommended we swap out the marinara sauce to a white wine sauce. It was a good idea! So tasty! Again, portions were tiny, and I'm pretty sure we had empty clam shells, but the scallops were cooked really well.

Overall, pretty tasty food, but just tiny portions. Also, we couldnt get a free appetizer from their Yelp deal, because we have to order two entrees, and we didn't :(

Food was just okay and overpriced. Three of us ate the appetizer, grilled oysters and they all had tummy ache a couple of hours later. :( I had the Alaskan Snow Crab which was either overcooked or not fresh because the meat was stuck on the shells, some parts of it were cold, too. It was also too salty, you would not be able to finish it. Steak was good but overpriced. We all liked the banana foster with cheesecake. Service was not that great. We were initially invited in then sent back out saying the table apparently wasn't ready. We went back in and went upstairs and the table still wasn't ready. We stood around for about 5minutes upstairs while waiting for them to set up.

Mediocre food at ridiculous prices. Ordered the redfish beignets, crawfish ravioli, and taste of New Orleans. Nothing tasted particularly fresh. Mostly tasted like it came from those massive frozen food trailers you see on the highway. Nothing felt like someone was really "cooking" it. Nothing absolutely awful but not worth the price and wait. 

The taste of New Orleans wasn't very good. The gumbo was way over spiced, etouffee was soupy, and jambalaya was dry and bland. The rice in all was slightly under cooked. Not a good representation of the city. Crawfish ravioli was just regular red sauce with some spice and micro sized crawfish dropped in. No crawfish was in the ravioli. Huge let down when it was the same frozen ravioli from Sam's club for a 30 dollar dish. 

Couldn't sit upstairs due to a last minute private party that took the space. Had to sit in a cramped space near the bar. Loud area by the sidewalk, not much space to back up your chair without smashing into another patrons chair. 

Was nice that we put our name on the list and could come back. They had called shorty before we showed up and put us straight to the front. 

Overall, much better places to eat around the French quarter. Keep on walking.

This place is a must for my wife and I. I know we will be back to NOLA and knowing that Royal House, Meals from the Heart are must returns for us. When we think of NOLA, my wife and I remember this place and the crab claws. The Royal House is that vivid for us.

Ambiance:
Loud, hustle and bustle of the FQ. Expect it and plan accordingly. Music outside and just a block from Bourbon. This side of FQ has a tamer side to it. If at all possible try to be seated upstairs and in the balcony if it's just you and a date. Expect to wait for dinner.

Price: $$
You are paying for quality here.

Food: 
Crab Claws 10/5
This dish alone will bring your back. It did for us. They use a cajun compound butter with 18-23 pieces of crab claws. We've counted since we've had this dish 3 times. It comes with 4 pieces of buttered french bread. I've looked up the recipe and they call it a Bourdelaise Sauce. Truly an amazing dish that is great and consistent. Give yourself time when enjoying this dish. Don't pair it with too many things that would clutter your meal. Space it out and enjoy it with a drink or two. This dish is that amazing.

Redfish Beignets 4/5
It was definitely a treat and unique to NOLA. So imagine funnel cake with fish inside, powdered sugar, and a spicy cream sauce. It sounds like it shouldn't work but this almost exemplifies all of NOLA. I don't know how but this dish works. Logic and common sense would tell you "no" but this dish screams in defiance what the world is telling you is good.

Drink: N/A
Only had water. It was super humid even at night.

Service: 10/5 (for the 2 visits we were there)
I honestly can't say enough about the service that was provided here from Chris. Very knowledgeable and understanding. First off, Chris is more of a guide then a server. He leads you to where you want to go. He does it in a manner that is very enjoyable and comfortable. He truly led us to having a wonderful night. If at any time you can remember your server's name from 2 weeks out it says something about the time you had at a restaurant. Royal House, I've already spoken to a manager but I truly hope you can appreciate the type of employee you have in your institution. Never allow him to leave.
Stopped in for lunch.  Best alligator ever.  Chicken salad was full of the good stuff, candied pecans, apple, cranberries, yum yum!!
Don't tell anyone else but they have clean restrooms. Good location as well.
Loved!!! Food was delicious! Tried a few different things on menu and loved it all. Definitely a must while in the French Quarter! And service was great!

When traveling seafood cooks are caught craving in the middle of the night in NOLA, they get creative. We used every foodist app we had on both of our phones, our hotel's kitchen had already shut down, and finally the son makes a few calls, gets a lead on what's supposed to be a killer blue crab app, so off he goes, foraging through the French Quarter, manages to grab the very last two servings of this crab claw treatment from Royal House and, folks, what a score. Everything in NOLA starts with a roux, of course, and the chef who saved us had morphed his Blondie into a rich Mornay, choice herbs in his liquid, dropping in the claws last two minutes, producing a velvety, savory dish that screamed, "This guy is a chef." Judging on taste and technique, I wholeheartedly recommend The Royal House, day or late night.

This restaurant was a bit of a walk from our hotel, but I had convinced my dad it would be worth it based on the reviews I had seen on Yelp. It was not, unfortunately. 

The service was mediocre and we were seated at a small table right next to the kitchen, which was unnecessary because the restaurant was mostly empty. Between that and a large party at a table next to us, it was extremely noisy in the restaurant and not very enjoyable while we were eating. 

I am not a huge fan of seafood, so I struggled to find food on the menu I thought I would like. If anyone else loves seafood and cuisine typical to New Orleans, then they would most likely enjoy their experience here more. I used the Yelp offer to get a free appetizer, so I got eggplant chips. Probably the BEST eggplant I've ever had in my entire life! I still think and yearn for that eggplant again in my life.

Overall, I would only return to this restaurant for the eggplant and nothing else. The service was mediocre, like previously mentioned, and the prices for meals were a little pricey.
Stopped in here for a quick lunch. I got the blackened chicken sandwich. It was delicious. Staff was very nice and friendly. Bathroom is small.

We had reservations for commander's palace but then the storm came and shut off power to the kitchen once we got there and after waiting around for a while, they announced all reservations are cancelled =(.

I guess the good thing is I remember walking by this restaurant and always seeing a line so I called and there were seats available so we asked our cab driver to take us here instead. Ask to sit upstairs if it's available.

I would definitely recommend ordering the Crab Claws.  The claws are already pre-cracked so it is not messy to eat at all.  The flavor was amazing and it reminded me of the sauce used on the chargrilled oysters at Cochon.  Definitely recommend ordering the chargrilled oysters here as well and putting the crab claw sauce on them.

The Red fish beignet was also unique.  It had a sweet taste almost like a funnel cake but with a piece of fish inside.  It sounds like an odd combination but surprisingly it worked.

The crawfish raviolo were also tasty as well.

**Don't forget to check into yelp to get a free appetizer worth up to $10.

Man, this place is good. Like, really good. 

My wife and I visited on a recent mini-vacay trip to New Orleans and were thoroughly impressed. Everything from the friendly wait staff (a rarity in NOLA believe it or not - we encountered more rude waiters and waitresses during our trip than I could even comprehend), to the wonderful balcony seating, the presentation of the food, and the delicious flavors were well worth the price (which really wasn't too bad).

For starters, I got the french onion soup, which is one of my favorites... my wife had never had french onion soup, and really isn't a fan of onions, but she was so intrigued upon seeing the crock-full of melty mozzarella covered deliciousness that she had to have a bite. We both enjoyed it a ton and knew we were in for a good meal.

My wife ordered the fried shrimp po' boy and I ordered the shrimp and grits (we don't get fresh shrimp in Nashville, so we were on shrimp kick). This was my wife's first po' boy experience and I don't quite think she knew what to expect, and consequently found the sandwich pretty boring (not to mention a little dry), but she did say that the flavors were delicious. I had a bite and it did not disappoint. Plenty of shrimp flavor, and a dash of hot sauce mellowed out by the crusty white roll. 

The shrimp and grits, on the other hand, were anything BUT boring!! It was absolutely fantastic. First, they don't do shrimp poured over a bowl of grits like you'd expect, but instead they prep the grits and then form them into grit cakes and FRY them to a delicious golden brown. It was probably one of the more unique preparations of shrimp and grits that I have ever had. No kidding - if you go to Royal House, this is a must-try. The shrimp was prepared in a tangy tomato cream sauce and topped with a little bit of grated parmesan. It had so many layers of texture and flavor - the little bit of chew from the shrimp, the crunchiness from the outside of the grit cake, and the creaminess of the cheesy grit goodness inside. 

We finished off the night with the bananas foster cheesecake, which was outstanding in it's simplicity, but HUGE in its flavors. What else is there to say? Creamy cheesecake filling with what I think was a ginger snap crust, and caramelized bananas - all covered in a delicious caramel sauce. Can't ask for a much better way to end the night.

All in all, do yourself a favor and check this place out. It's got a great twist on some of the classic New Orleans fare, and I guarantee that you won't leave disappointed. If my wife and I get to go back to NOLA any time soon, you better bet we will be back at Royal House!

This place was solid. We used the Yelp deal to get the redfish beignets and they were probably the most unique dish I had there. It's perfectly fried and the combination of flavors different because it was both salty and sweet but it's almost like dipping your French fries in a milkshake... It just works!

Other people in my party got the fried oysters in a poboy and a platter and they both really enjoyed the fried oysters. I got the gumbo and it was good- not great but good.

Overall solid. Really friendly service.

Very good charbroiled oysters and fish platter
Very friendly service. We would go back.

I was seated promptly on the balcony but never got a chance to eat let alone be offered water. I waited 15 mins to finally get the nod of acknowledgement by a server. Then, the waiter continued joking around with other servers. When I asked for the manager, the server said nothing and walked away. Needless to say, we walked out after complaining to the hostess. We ended up having a fantastic meal @ Cafe Amelie.

What a disappointment. My husband and I went to the Royal House hoping for our last-day-in-New-Orleans meal. But: it never happened at this restaurant. 

We were seated on the balcony right away. But then we waited. And waited. At the 15 minute mark, my husband got the attention of a server who motioned that he would be there right away. No one came. It had been almost a half hour at that point. So, we walked off the balcony and asked for a a manager. Our request was met with two comments: "I was coming out - you shoulda waited" and "good luck finding a manager".  

With that, we left. We had a lovely meal at Cafe Amelie.

Everything started out great here. The decor was bright and airy upstairs with the doors to the balcony open looking down on the street. We began with the red fish beignets which were excellent. Then I had the oyster pasta, but I substituted grilled shrimp as I wasn't in the mood for fried anything today. It was just ok - the pasta wasn't particularly fresh and I got a couple of small pieces of shrimp shell in there. The bread that came with it was stale on one side so I asked for more. In general, not a $20 pasta dish. 

The real disaster was my wife's dish. (I don't use that word lightly) She ordered the blackened red fish. The fish was lukewarm and the
green beans were cold. The beans were also limp, flavorless, and colorless. They said they were fresh, but we suspect they were frozen. Or at least cooked for so long they became sad little green ghosts of what they once were. Then there was the fresh crab add-on. Oh my. Dry, flavorless, and cooked beyond what any form of fish should be subjected to. 

She sent the dish back to be warmed up as she didn't want to make a fuss about the other problems. They said they would cook it all over again. But it didn't matter. The new dish was just as bad, and sad. 

The waiter was attentive and asked how it was and we were more specific. He then asked if we could express our concerns to the manager, which we did a few minutes later. They were both very apologetic and were kind enough to comp our desserts and gave us 15% off the whole meal. Classy. 

We understand some nights the kitchen isn't doing well or something's off, but they did the right thing to try to make up for it. It's not about the money to us. It's that they were willing to go beyond apologies and put their money where their mouth is. It says they do care and want to do better by us. After all, it's not a $30 meal we're paying for. We came to New Orleans for the great food, so restaurants have to and should be on their game.

Incidentally, the desserts were great. We also tipped well on the full price without the discounts. The server shouldn't lose for the kitchen's mistakes. I gave 2 stars for the food, but added a third just for the service from the server and the manager.

I wish I didn't have to give any stars. Our group of 7 included 3 from people from New Orleans. The food was cold and wrong. Gumbo didn't taste like gumbo. Jambalaya was cold, over cooked dirty rice.  The manager admitted the food is packaged and not "cooked" by them. They just add rice. The only redeeming qualities was the server, wine and dessert.  So, get drunk and order the banana foster.....

This place is solid. Great food and great service. My husband ordered the taste of NOLA, 4 different bowls jambalaya,gumbo, rice and beans and shrimp etouffe. He polished it off! We started with chargrilled oysters, excellent. 
I ordered the tortellini, not too crazy about, it was good not excellent. We sat by the balcony and had a lovely lunch.

The food and server here are great! The first time I went here, I had the chargrilled oysters- they were ok. The cheese makes it very heavy- which I'm not a fan of- I'll just stick to the fresh oysters. However, I came back to try their crawfish etouffee. It was was the BOMB! Gotta try it!!

The two stars are entirely for the service and location, where were awesome. Even on a busy night, the bar staff were absolutely fantastic.

The same cannot be said for the oysters. Here's the thing -- if you've never had oysters before, you might think these are alright. If you've eaten oysters many times before, you will be disappointed here. The rest of the food wasn't great either.

The rule for finding good food in the French Quarter applies to this place: Leave the French Quarter.

Tina, our waitress for the night, was nothing short of fantastic. She recommended their crab claw appetizer and it figuratively literally blew my mind. 
We were being fatties and also got a plate of freshly shucked oyster that were fresh and succulent.
For our entree, we got the sampler plate and shrimp creole. The etouffe and gumbo were both flavourful with the jambalaya adding a nice third complementary flavor (I added a bit of the sauce from the appetizer to the etouffe, would recommend.) I was told the creole was delicious and the shrimp fresh, I can't personally comment because I was already so full. 
Again, a shout out to Tina on making us really feel the southern hospitality!

A group of 10 of us showed up without advanced notice. It took a while to get seated and the kitchen took a while, but the food and service was absolutely worth it. Courtney was a phenomenal server, and made it a very memorable meal. I'll definitely be back next time I'm in town.

When visiting New Orleans, we always end up here because my SO loves having oysters and Bloody Marys, and he loves having them here.  I can't eat raw oysters, so I can't say anything about those.  But I haven't liked much else here except for the various broiled oysters.  It's pretty touristy, but again, he likes it. A LOT.  What we do for love . . .
This place is outstanding!!!!!!! The red beans and rice and creole favorites are top notch!! The staff is friendly and helpful and if you are a foodie who knows what good food is, you must try it!!!!

We had a great experience at Royal House! This was our first dinner on vacation and I am so glad we ended up here. We used the Yelp deal for the free app and ordered fried alligator from the server, who was extremely polite and friendly (forget her name, long brunette hair)

The food came out quickly and was hot! The Alligator was outstanding. I went for the Shrimp Creole and the boy ordered the shrimp poboy. Also came out quick. Mine was outstanding! Such amazing smoky flavors and a generous serving. Brian liked his poboy although it was somewhat lacking, not many veggies and came with no sauce.

We didn't have room for dessert but the menu was tempting. Very classy place to stop by on your visit to New Orleans. Beautiful building, great service, and looks like some awards to back it up:
http://www.royalhouserestaurant.com/news

check it out!

Took a visiting friend who says oysters are the source of all happiness to Royal House a few days ago during her visit. I'm impressed. 

I work in the quarter, and one of my jobs had its holiday party at Royal House. That was the only other time I'd been.

Oysters Rockefellar changed my life. 

Food was excellent, and despite it being a busy night, we were well taken care of. 

Note: Price range can really vary. Our bill was reasonably high, but we did decimate the local oyster population.

First we arrive and get seated on the balcony.  Everything leans so hold onto your drink. You don't wanna drop anything on the table below.

We order our drinks and wait about 15 minutes for  my hubby gets his. It took about 15 more for me to get mine.

We placed our app order of fried alligator and placed our meal order as well. 

My hubby got his meal first, then 25 minutes later I finally got my meal along with our appetizer. 

The waiter was very unorganized and full of excuses. The food wasn't that good. 

Don't waste your time or money
Melva, our waitress, was amazing! Bread pudding was great!!  Very sweet and delicious.  We found this place walking along Canal and it was such a fun find!!

Tried Royal House for lunch. Courteous service beginning to end, but that's where the good points end.

We tried the raw oysters which were not shucked well. This was the only place in NOLA during our trip where the oysters were covered in black grit (subsequently getting all over my hands and napkin) and I slurped up sand and/or small pieces of shell with the oysters. It became a surprisingly messy experience. The oysters themselves were not the freshest we had in NOLA.

The other food - gumbo and jambalaya - were ok, but not memorable, especially given stiff restaurant competition in the area.

The restaurant had an unappealing fishy odor indoors. It seems like a couple of other reviewers have commented on this as well.

I wish I liked it more as the staff was nice.

Royal House has a lot of great reviews so I will let you know why I deducted stars. 

The food was very good. We had they oyster duo app and I had an oyster po-boy for an entree. I took a star off because our table was the only table I could see that lacked any condiments on it (and our candle was never lit like the other tables.) It took almost 6 minutes to get any ketchup or hot sauce to our table and they just took it from another diners table. We were also seated in a corner of the restaurant that was not in the main area and off by ourselves. Perhaps they thought that would be nice but it was really dark and poor lit. Perhaps because of below....

I took off 2 stars because we saw a cockroach. A living, breathing cockroach. It was crawling on the chair beside us and even flew up on the table before we kicked it off and it hovered on the floor for the remainder of our meal. 

The food here was actually really good and I would have probably given this place 4-5 stars had it not been for the extra "guest" at our table.

AMAZING location (right in the heart of the FQ) but the food is definitely lacking in taste and quality. It's catered for tourists, and def doesn't taste like authentic NOLA cuisine. Come for the location, not the food.

Wait staff was very good but wouldn't consider this establishment to have very authentic local food. No sweet tea, bummer. Jambalaya wasn't very well spiced and the shrimp poboy was bland. Alligator and spinach dip were good apps.  Atmosphere is good though.
Don't remember our servers name but she was awesome! The redfish and chargrilled oysters were really good. Nice selection of local beers on tap is also a huge plus for me.

I had the shrimp and grits ($17). They fry the grits into a grit cake, it was different, interesting spin from what I'm use to having but I will still prefer my grits regular. I expected the sauce to be a bit spicy to my surprise it was a bit bland like something was missing. I added salt, pepper and Hotsauce to help spruce it up. I also had a appetize($12), the grilled oyster they were great! Loved the flavor. They made me into a oyster fan. Sitting was a bit crammed. Customer service was great and that's always a plus for me since it's so hard to find good service these days.

First floor smells like a wet rag. Food wasn't that good.  Should've known when they were soliciting for business off the street at noon on Friday. Yelp let us down on this one.

Oysters were ok, but not as creamy as Acme. Fried gator was good; tastes like chicken with the soft texture of white fish. Crab claws were tasty, but we got less than 10 (go to Coops instead). The etouffee started out tasty but was a little sour a few bites in. Mentioned it to the server, who brought it up with the manager. The manager took off the price of cup of etouffee instead of the whole taste of New Orleans entree. I guess that's ok, but shows lack of real care, especially since he didn't even bother to come to say anything personally.

Great service and the food is amazing! Definitely coming back next time we are in New Orleans. Ashton is the best waiter, she is friendly and went above and beyond to give us the best service possible.

This place was really busy but I was able to grab a seat at the bar.  Had the chargrilled oysters and the red beans and rice, both were extremely good.  Was probably my favorite meal during my time in New Orleans.

Had the best oysters in town here, sat at the bar ordered a dozen and was stunned by the size and mild taste of these locally farmed beauties! Staff was very friendly and attentive, bartender suggested a local brew, which was perfect, then a champagne bourbon concoction which was a perfect compliment to both the food and the hot weather.
The only reason for 4 instead of 5 stars is the famous po'boy sandwich here is just so-so, by that I mean good, but there are sooooo many greats to choose from ( ugh, still feeling the extra pounds I gained while visiting) that if you do have one here make sure you sample others... And just keep eating your way through the French quarter!
The ambience is perfect, comfortable, old and solid.

Had the Taste of New Orleans, the Blackened Shrimp Jambalaya, & Redfish Beignet - very good! Especially the appetizer!  Hubby had the mint julep & I had the Stemmari Rose - both up to par. Service was on par. If I came again, I would have the Crawfish Etouffee - it was tasty! Street band outside was Jammin!

Typical tourist place. Food is average at best. I sat upstairs and the seating up there was spacious, windows open with a nice breeze. I ordered the redfish beignets which tasted like fried fish sticks with maple syrup. The shrimp etouffe was ok.. Not much more I can say. If you do end up here.. Sit upstairs!

I came here with my boyfriend on a Sunday for lunch and our experience was great. The food was great, I highly recommend the Red Fish Beignets (I got a coupon off Yelp for a free appetizer). I would also recommend sitting on their 2nd story by the window overlooking Royal Street and if there is good weather sit outside on their balcony for a great view of the city.

Our server was great, the wine and beer was great. 

Overall, a good lunch experience!

After a 15 hour train ride all I wanted to do was eat some dinner and Royal House was great! I ordered the oyster tacos and alligator po'boy. The oyster tacos were my absolute favorite. The po'boy had more bread than filling but was absolutely delicious. I don't remember her name but my waitress was great as well!
We had lunch there 6/19 and 6/20/2016 Jeffery the waiter at the counter was great! Met him there 1 1/2 years ago and he recommend several dishes. The food is the best. Thanks so much!!
Awesome food. Melva is the best server in NOLA...everything she suggested was amazing! Crab claws, red beans, NOLA taster...excellent service and tasty food!
Food was awesome. Our server was friendly and helpful, plus our appetizer was free (thanks Yelp!). Nothing blew me away, but would definitely recommend to others!
Had dinner alone at the bar. Good cold beer. Excellent big creamy raw oysters. Amazing oyster pasta.

This place is in the heart of the French quarter...tourist city, the wait wasn't long but the place was packed. Our server was professional, knowledgable, and cut dry, he introduced himself and gave us some great dinner and drink recommendations. I tried their gulf shrimp platter and my company tried a blackened redfish entree. Both were equally tasty, fresh, and full of flavor, overall this visit was pretty pleasant, when the weathers nice they open all of their doors and turn up their ac (so you don't melt) it gives you a chance to watch parades, street entertainers, and other activities from your dinner table.
The food was amazing and so was the service! The atmosphere was great and the staff was friendly. Would definitely come back. Especially for their French Onion Soup

An all-tourist frequented place in the French quarter with mediocre food and mediocre drinks. 

The mint julep we ordered was harsh and .  Don't get me wrong, I love strong drinks but this one tasted like it was made out of some harsh semi-poisonous stuff. 

Our chargrilled oyster appetizer was way too salty and our entrees came out a full thirty minutes after our appetizers were cleared. And when they did come out, it really was nothing special. The etouffee and gumbo came out cold... :( . The alligator Po boy was very simple and didn't have much alligator. 

Their saving grace was their service which was friendly and attentive. I think I must have been called honey at least 9 times!

I wanted to give this place 5 stars but the service there was not very good. 
We ordered 2 entrees and chargrill oysters. It took a while for the waiter to take our orders. We waited for about 20 mins and nothing came out. I asked my server to check our orders (which also took me about 5 mins to find him) and he said our food would be up in seconds. Then we waited for another 10 mins. 
The food was great. Seafood pasta was cooked just right (lotta seafood and tasty sauce). Chargrill oysters were small but tasty as well. 
This place was very noisy. Avoid it if you want a nice and quiet place.

My husband and decided to enjoy happy hour drinks and appetizers at the Royal House on Thursday evening. What a neat place to seat out in the balcony and enjoy your drinks while not missing out on what's happening out on the streets. Lots of people watching which in NOLA.
We ordered the stuffed mushrooms and two orders of oysters. The raw oysters were great and the fixings were perfect. On the other hand, the charbroiled oysters did not wow us and were too heavy on the creamy sauce type of topping they were served with. We added bacon and the grease of the bacon must have mixed with the other toppings and it was just too much.
Overall, this is a great eatery across the street from the Omni Royal hotel and walking distance to plenty of spots in the FQ.

Excellent food. Had the crawfish ravioli and redfish beignets, highly recommend. Also our waitress, Ashton, was very friendly and informative. She actually recommended the items we ate, she's awesome.

Really enjoyed our dinner here. There is something for everyone. I had the sampler and it gives you a great range of the tastes of the city. Price was reasonable for the Quarter. Family of four well fed for about $150 including tip. Very friendly staff and we were seated in about 10 minutes on a Friday night with no reservation.

Everybody has an off day, and I might have found their's. I had the shrimp creole...came out lukewarm, and somebody forgot the spices...very disappointing. Wifey had the crawfish ravioli...piping hot and very good. I will let her rate her own meal but mine was...ehh...not up to the hype. It was a Friday night, crowded, and waited 30 minutes, so maybe my meal fell through the cracks that night. Too much good food in this city to warrant a 2nd chance though.

This place is super cute, conveniently located and good! I had the blackened chicken pasta and the sauce was amazing. Huge portions and very hardy comfort food. The bartender was super friendly and very attentive. I will definitely return the next time I'm in NOLA!

Located directly in the middle of the French Quarter, this restaurant was admittedly occupied by mostly tourists, and like most French Quarter restaurants, there was a wait for dinner. However, it was absolutely worth it. The food was well-presented, fresh, and delicious - some of the best I've ever had in the city. We ordered over a dozen oysters on the halfshell and chargrilled oysters (aka "New Orleans" style with garlic butter and parmesan cheese), and although I was hesitant to eat oysters because of the recent Gulf spill, they couldn't have been better. Our fried eggplant appetizer was also very filling and flavorful. One of the ladies seated near us ordered a delicious-looking Caprese salad, which I wish I'd also had the chance to try.

The drink menu was a little uninspired, populated mostly with the typical New Orleans staples, and the pours definitely weren't as strong as almost anywhere else. But for us, the drinks weren't the main feature, so I'm still giving it 5 stars.

When you walk in they immediately treat you like royalty. Then the waiters and host are incredible, couldn't ask for better service. The menu has everything you can ever ask for as far as authentic new Orleans cuisine. The stuffed crab mushrooms appetizers and marvelous and cooked and seasoned to perfection; making you wish there was an endless supply of them, however they are just the perfect amount for 2. It was a magnificent experience and highly recommended it.

My hubby and I truly enjoyed our experience at the Royal House. We shared the free appetizer we got with Yelp's promotion which was the alligator. Never hand this we weren't sure how we'd like it but were pleasantly surprised by the tastiness and texture. We then shared the crawfish etoufee and loved it! The salad was lacking that's why we gave it a 4 star review.

We went Royal House on a Sunday night. The crowd was good but not too busy. We sat outside on the balcony which had pluses and minuses: the plus was that we were able too see and hear the street musicians below. The minus was that the balcony was precariously slanted down toward the street. It was a bit unnerving at first but we got used to it

We ordered the spinach salad, the shrimp boil and the peach bread pudding. All of the food was good, especially the bread pudding. The wine selection was a bit limited, but we were able to find a nice pinot grigio.

Overall I would recommend this French Quarter restaurant.

Delicious!  The two person tables on the upper balcony are awesome!  Great people watching and we were able to enjoy street music too!

The baked oysters are amazing - definitely try them!  If you check in on Yelp you can get $10 off an appetizer of your choice which is a great deal.

Service was good - attentive without hovering
  Speed of the meal was just right.

The etoufee was the best I have had.  Gumbo was in the top 5.  Jambalaya in top 5.

Drinks were also very good.  We got out with 3 drinks, 2 entrees, an appetizer - at dinner - for less than $70 with tip.  That's a great value for the kind of meal and service we enjoyed! I would definitely go back.

We had a pretty big party come here for dinner before our ghost tour. The place is a little cramped and not meant for big groups but we managed. Our waitress was amazing in dealing with all of us. She kept the drinks coming, plates cleared so we had maximum room, and was very helpful in making suggestions for dinner. She really was amazing! The food was excellent. The crab claws appetizer had so much meat and you're going to want to slurp up the sauce. I had the shrimp and grits. My grits were actually fried little triangles which was new to me but I was happy because it actually added a nice crunchy texture. Absolutely wonderful. I definitely want to come back next time I'm visiting.

Of all the times we have been to New Orleans we have never eaten here before now. What a mistake. The servers were very friendly and provided excellent service. The cocktails were delicious but I must say the Redfish beignets are a must-have. I have never heard of those before but will certainly be back for them. They are a generous size and would work will as a decadent lunch.
Loved the Mahi Mahi which was pecan crusted. It was topped with sautéed shrimp in a sauce. Great food! It's a block from Bourbon St so I didn't feel like I was in the middle of the chaos.

This place is the worst!!!!
Our waitress was good but everything else about our experience was awful! 
Our food took a long time to get out but we are patient and knew the food would be worth it so we waited but then our food came out and it was awful! 
And our kids meals took a total of 17 minutes to come after our plates arrived! 
No apology! I let the manager that I would not be paying for any of it which he understood but as I said didn't apologize. 
NEVER GOING BACK! it was such a disappointment as this was the only night we were in New Orleans and we were looking forward to an amazing dinner.
Great food and AMAZING service! My wife and I ate here on our last day and we're happy we did. Must get the crab legs.

Tina was super friendly and hilarious; we loved her. My husband had the oyster beignets. At first, I was kind of worried because it sounds gross, but he says it was delicious. The Crystal beurre blanc sauce and cane syrup was clutch. He had the boiled lobster pot and really enjoyed it. I had the blackened redfish; it was okay. This was the last meal of our trip, and by now, I was pretty tired of eating fish since I'm not a fan of the texture of other seafood.
The waiter told us "i mean cmn guys, this is new orleans, everything is cooked with pork here" not a place for veggie or just chicken and fish lovers. Other things are pretty descent.
Wonderful I loved this place , our waiter was chris and he was very knowledgeable about the menu. I had the grilled red fish and I loved it, the music was playing old school jamms

We were walking through the French Quarter with crawdads on our mind when out of the blue we saw a crawdad merchant making a delivery so we asked him "where would you say the best non turisty seafood restaurant is?" And he responded with great confidence," you should go to royal house of course." So we altered our course and soon found the authentic creole establishment. The friendly waitstaff showed us a table large enough to accommodate our group of five. Our waitress recommend the char grilled oysters for an appetizer and we were thoroughly impressed by the prowess of the kitchen by producing this great dish.  We were all happy with our meals ranging from crawdad etufe to red beans and sausage. Great food combined with a friendly waitstaff puts the Royal House a must stop for anyone visiting the French Quarter of New Orleans.

Red fish and beignets was very delicious . Nice bar and Cute place. But I have to drop stars.... I had to wait over 30 minuets to get main dish after appetizer. I was watching other tables getting food beside my table... I thought it's just busy time....  My waiter had despaired in kitchen for long time, by restroom and back area so many times. He didn't care about my table that's for sure. He came asked us ONCE do we wanna one more drink in 30 minutes. Someone came asked us everything ok and I explained that we've been waiting almost 40 minutes. He brought our order in a minute but my husband meal wasn't hot, my pasta was over cooked or must be sitting long in kitchen, Tomato sauce was almost gone.....  I wish I had other waiter that could take care of us and had fresh cooked meal. Other tables food were look delicious tho.

I'm going to have to almost middle of the road. Two nights ago we had the fried fish player and the fried shrimp platter. They were good so we thought we'd eat there again tonite.  We started with the stuffed mushrooms. The mushrooms were dry and stuck the bottom of the plate we ate some of the stuffing, but it too was very dry. We had the shrimp tortellini and the crawfish ravioli both were awful. The pasta was mushy on both plates, the shrimp were way over cooked and there was no solid or whole crawfish or crab meat pieces in the ravioli sauce. They don't serve bread or rolls with either meal.

Awesome Nola eatery. Great service....ask for Christian, she is so sweet and wonderful. Great atmosphere w some awesome Chargrilled oysters. Also recommend oysters Royale. 
The crab claws are phenomenal. The sauce is the best. You can't go wrong w this place. It is really cool and great food.
Great service ,great crab claws , and oysters !! Their Bloody Mary was super yum too!!!

We were looking for a moderately priced place and found this jewel. Quiet diner on a balcony overlooking royal street. Service was fast and food was delicious. I had shrimp creole and my wife tried their burger.

We had one of the best experiences here. Every time I come to NOLA I make a point to try a new place. But this will definitely be a regular. The oyster tacos for an appetizer were perfect. Also, being able to sit on the balcony upstairs was so much fun. Great for people watching. Lol

Drove all the way from Jacksonville, FL to dine at our favorite spot in NOLA.  The staff is ALWAYS pleasant and of course the crab claws and chargrilled oysters were on point.  But above everything the food is sooooo CONSISTENT which I can appreciate as a business owner.  Consumers have a choice of where we choose to spend our $$$ and this place makes sure that if you choose not to return its by choice because they are commited to excellence.
Terrance is a great server. Ask for him. Food was wonderful. Nola Blonde was awesome. Terrance makes the place home & fun. He is an asset to NOLA and a privilege to meet.
-It sounded good but waited 30 minutes for our food and left.  It wasn't busy.  Just forgot about us.

Came here for lunch with my family (6 total), and I loved it! The waiters were very friendly, and the atmosphere was pleasant. We ordered each seafood platter, shrimp 'n grits, the roast beef po-boy, and the chicken and andouille gumbo. I've had better gumbo elsewhere and the po-boy was a bit dry, but the fried seafood was AMAZING. This restaurant is great for lunch, and I'd definitely recommend it if you're looking for delicious fried seafood.

Had a great dinner here last night. Our server - Kris - was fantastic. One of the best servers we have had in a long time. He made fantastic recommendations - try the Bloody Mary - and the food was fantastic. A nice short walk from our hotel at the Monteleone. Great dinner!
I ordered the taste of new Orleans and it was nothing but watered down rice. Waiter was very nice and accommodating. For a seafood place the blackened grill chicken sandwich was bland but ok.
Oyster beignets are my fave!! I also had the seafood pasta but with scampi sauce, easily the best I've ever had. My husband's shrimp and grits were also outstanding.

It was a bit busy and around 10pm, and we were actually seated quickly with a nice balcony view of Royal Street. The view is lovely even if the titled angle of the balcony is a little jarring when you first get up there. 

When it comes to the actual food, though, it's another story. I ordered French onion soup as my appetizer and a shrimp po'boy as my main dish with a side of garlic mashed potatoes. My boyfriend got his gumbo, but my soup still had not come by the time the entrees came out. I was assured several times by our waiter that the soup would be out any minute. When it came time to eat the po'boy, I took one bite and immediately knew it was not fresh. The bread was harder than i was expecting and tasted almost stale, which would have been excusable if the shrimp itself had been hot and tasted good. Alas, the shrimp wasn't even lukewarm, and it tasted as if it had been sitting under a lamp or something for quite awhile. The potatoes were good and flavorful, but definitely not hot. I ended up sending back the dish. 

Finally, after my boyfriend finished ALL of his food, my French onion soup arrived. I have to say, this actually salvaged the meal for me. It was possibly the best French onion soup I've ever had, with mouth-watering cheese that was crispy in all the right places and a really flavorful broth. The waiter was very accommodating and removed both an appetizer and my main dish from the bill.

I don't think I would come back to the Royal House again. It was probably my least favorite place I ate at while in New Orleans, which is unfortunate because the soup was absolutely fantastic.

Not the best food in NOLA, but they do have a great location.  If you happen to get seated by one of the windows, you will have a  great view to the streets of NOLA and the happening movement around town.  I can't say the food was the best I have ever had, but I can't say it was the worst either.  So I can only give it a so-so review.  Our server was funny which helped, but when you are NOLA you are probably gonna want better food.

Good food and great service. Our waiter was very informative and detailed on both cocktails and main courses.

It's pretty loud here, but most places in the French Quarter in the evening are...

Friendly customer service....they got my order wrong on my oysters so they let us have what was on the plate and brought us the right one as well!  Great customer service....4 stars for that!

We ordered the crawfish etouffee and the shrimp creole.  Etouffee was okay....I felt I've tried better flavors elsewhere, but decent and the shrimp creole had great flavor but was on the bit of the salty side.  The oysters were delicious....all the three different ones I tried!  I would go back for some oysters again with a cold drink next time!

Talk about a diamond in the rough.

That's actually a bit unfair.  There are plenty of food options around French Quarter, and I didn't have a chance to try that many of them.  The main reason for this is to get anywhere in French Quarter you have to walk through streets that smell like someone peed vomit out their asshole.

But I digress, Royal House is an astounding place.  We came here with a party of 7 at peak dinner hours and barely had to wait at all for a table, so not sure if we got lucky or what with that.

Service right out of the gate was great.  friendly staff up front, super friendly waitress who we could chat a bit with but not enough to the point where it gets weird.  You know how it goes.

Food:

-Fried alligator: Used the check-in offer to get this for free.  It was good...tasted like popcorn chicken really.  I don't know if that's a disappointment or a relief, it is what it is really.

-Shrimp tortellini: I really enjoyed it.  My wife thought it was a bit too creamy, which boils down to a matter of preference I suppose.  But definitely full of flavor.

-Taste of New Orleans: The crawfish etouffee was really, really good.  I wasn't big on the gumbo or jambalaya, but I would definitely go for the etouffee again.

Really, just a good, solid restaurant with great food and a good atmosphere.  I see a few people being a bit on this place for being for tourists...

..dude, you're in French Quarter, of course it's for tourists.  It's a touristy section of New Orleans.  If I wanted true, authentic creole food right from the source I'd need to go knocking on doors, and I'm not 100% sure southern hospitality extends quite that far.
This place had great food. Jambalaya, etouffe, and gumbo are great but the shrimp with grits was make me wanna smack my momma great!!!
Very yummy! I got the alligator po-boy... Not disappointed! The waiting staff where very friendly. I will be going back again!!!

Had a late lunch here. Glad we came at an off time because we walked by later that night and there was a line to get in! The oysters are good, raw not charred. (Charred have too much butter)

Great Bloody Marys, friendly service, fair prices. The food was ok, typical fried NOLA food, but the atmosphere was great and the oysters are the way to go.

Loved it. We were able to sit on the balcony on a beautiful night and enjoy tasty eats! The server had great recommendations and it truly was an enjoyable experience and affordable. 

If you want the heavy buttery dishes to fill the belly they have them and if you prefer lighter meals to maintain your figure they have them too! 

Walking distance from hotel and close to bars for after dinner drinks, I recommend it to both families and lovers.
The food was great large portions. Cold drinks and great staff will come back again if we are ever in town again. On vacation and this was a wise choice for our first meal in New Orleans.
Food was so good! Taste of new orleans (gumbo, crawfish étouffée, jambalaya) oysters + drinks! Good place to eat and people watch if you're in the french quarter. Friendly service.

Always excellent food and atmosphere! We sat at the upstairs bar with Cindy as our bartender....with a wealth of knowledge about every entree and drink in the place, Cindy made our experience at the Royal House top notch! Highly recommend taking one of the 4 spots at the bar upstairs with Cindy!
This was a great stop right after our walking tour. The oyster combo was spectacular and the mixed drinks you can't go wrong. Our server was so smooth and knowledgeable an added plus.

Save yourself some time and go to somewhere else. Worst service I've ever had. We went at 3pm. The restaurant was empty. Got seated right next to 4 stinky trash cans. Sat there for 15mins, no one talked to us not served us water. We raised our hands and asked to order. The waiters just walked right passed by after a brief glance. Sooooo bad. I cannot believe how rude this restaurant is. We left and went to Oceana, had the same menu. Warm welcome and nice service. Very lively and friendly. Avoid this horrible place at all costs. You don't want this horrible place to ruin your vacation here.
Great hurricanes. I had the taste of new orleans the crawfish etoufee was my favorite. When I visit New Orleans again I will get that as a stand alone dish. Gumbo was good too

Delicious. Food came out hot. Shrimp Creole was wonderful. Friend got the shrimp and grits which she  loved. Tyrone was an awesome server. The service manager with the blue steak in her hair and the hostess with the purple braids- these women KNOW what great customer service looks like. I'll be back!

Great place! The upstairs dining room is spacious and really lovely. Had fried alligator, it was really amazing!!! My friend had the shrimp ravioli and it was super amazing! I wish I had ordered that as well... But my Taste of New Orleans was super tasty. The Etouffee was amazing. My husband got the roast beef Po'boy with Cole slaw.. Both were amazing. I really loved the Cole slaw. Very fresh and different than I have had before. Definitely recommend this place. Service was very friendly helpful.

nice find here.  new breakfast spot with lots of benedicts on the menu, but as I recall?  I had croque madam.  this was a nice change of pace and scrumptious.   I don't recall it being quite croque french bread sandwich style, but more served with the spinach underneath in a plate.

I just know it was a find, and its been a while but NOW I must return.
great place to take people who are visiting you for something new and fun.
excellent waitstaff.

Awesome spot in the quarter! From the many places to choose from, this place sure does stand out! We came in around 7:00 p.m. (their typical dinner rush). We had a party of 7, and were graciously accommodated. Try the seafood pecetore, or the crawfish ravioli. No matter what you try, I'm convinced you can't go wrong. From the awesome door staff, to our waiter Taj, it was southern hospitality at it's best. The manager Lisa was a doll, checking on us frequently to make sure our experience amazing!!! Thank ya'll!

Redfish biegnets are the most amazing thing ever. And their superior highball made the trip worth it. Would definitely dine here again.

Ps ASHLEY was our server... very fun and social and made fantastic recommendations while staying professional.

We've ate here several times over the course of a couple years and have had excellent food and service each time. We've tried a different dish with each visit and have not been disappointed with one single bite.

This is the place to be if you want great service! While I appreciate a polite and knowledgeable waitstaff; I didn't fly all the way from DTW to MSY for customer service. The stuffed crab claws came out first. They were delicious, so I had high hopes for the rest of my meal. The next dish that came out was the redfish beignets. They were okay. A bit too fishy tasting, but tolerable. I was still looking forward to my entree. The mahi-mahi was really disappointing. Way, WAY too fishy. All in all, the restaurant had both positive and negative elements to it. I didn't hate it, but I wouldn't recommend it either.

Enjoyed a great lunch here while in NOLA with friends.  Enjoyed the berry/basil specialty cocktail, and unlocked the free app offer from Yelp, which they were gracious and easy about.  We had the crab claws in the creole sauce and it was amaaazing.  At staff suggestion we kept the sauce on the table and were dipping everything else in it too. Our po-boys were very good.  The service was so friendly and accommodating. Everyone just seemed to be having a great time at work, so we left with full bellies and big smiles.

This was my first restaurant I visited during my stay in New Orleans. We had the stuffed mushrooms and they were probably my favorite appetizer I had during my time here. I also had the French 75 as a cocktail and the shrimp jambalaya- both also delicious! The wait was SUPER SLOW, however...we waited a long time for both the appetizer and main course. the staff was very friendly.

The place is pretty centrally located and encompasses everything New Orleans. The alligator bites were delicious and the bloody Mary that washed them down was even better. I had the shrimp and grits as a main course. The grits were fried to perfection and sat in a very tasteful creole red sauce. All in all it was a great meal and great experience. Slightly pricey but doable.
Ambiance an atmosphere of a place should always equal the price of items they are selling...it doesn't here

This place is awesome! We came with a group of 41 and they seated us quickly with all smiles. Service was wonderful (my service was Ty and he was amazing!), the food was fantastic and came out quickly! We cannot say enough about how much we loved this restaurant. Our flight home was cancelled so this experience at Royal helped to make sure all of our kids were happy.

Awesome place! 4 different people in my group and we all ordered different things. For appetizer, the spinach dip and red snapper beignet. Both were fantastic but if you can only chose one I would do the beignet. Dinner was crawfish ravioli, crawfish étouffée, pecan crusted mahi mahi and shrimp creole. I have no complaints about any of the dinners. They were all made really well and presented nicely. 

The atmosphere was nice and upstairs there's a small balcony that overlooks the streets, offering a nice view of the city. 

This place does not disappoint and we would definitely come back!
Food was delicious from the beginning to the end. Our waitress, Melba/Melva, was excellent and full of energy.

Great food and fantastic service! Thanks Eric! We had the Blackened Shrimp Jambalaya and the Shrimp and Grits. Both were delectable and I would defiantly come back here! We sat inside, but there is patio seating upstairs that provides a lovely view of Royal Street.

This place is for tourist but it is great! The food is delicious and we had the best service here that we had all week in NOLA. (Ask for Heidi). The shrimp pasta dish was wonderful and so was the spinach dip.

Wow wow wow! Everything about this place is amazing! Chris was our server and he is the epitome of what great customer service should be. The food was phenomenal. Get the red fish beignets- they will change your life. Everything else was fantastic from the drinks to the meal to the ambiance and service. Everyone here is so HAPPY!!! Come here- you won't be disappointed. The only reason I docked a star was because the shrimp wasn't deveined and... That's nasty.

We had a great experience at Royal House! The food was fantastic and the service was awesome. We had our one year old with us and they went out of their way to give her attention and keep her happy. We ordered the crab claws, crawfish ravioli  and the crawfish etouffe and they were all wonderful! 

The location is very convenient, tucked in the French Quarter. It has two stories and even balcony seating! I highly recommend this restaurant!

Loved Royal House... Had 2 meals there and we were only in NOLA 48 hours!  Husband loved the oysters on the half shell and red beans and rice...I had shrimp Creole and the shrimp Po boy... Both excellent!   Only thing better than the food was Melva, our server.  Very welcoming!!
Great time waiter was awesome helped recomend something from the menu, was undecided and recommendation was great. Will have to come back next time In town.

I ordered the shrimp and grits. Unfortunately the grits aren't the traditional grits but they are a fried grit patty smothered in barbecue sauce and very substandard shrimp. I didn't care for it at all. My friend had the crab legs which were extremely small. Eating crab legs are a challenge in itself, these crab legs were so small that she gave up trying to eat them because they were over cooked and very small. The highlight of the evening was our waiter Willie from Memphis. He was so incredibly awesome. He attempted to offer up different options for me because of my pecsectarian diet. It was difficult but he tried and kept a smile on his face the entire time. Willie is a gem in this place. He has an exuberance that can't be matched. He loves his job, he loves the customers. Yea Willie!!
Great food and extremely nice staff!! Our waiter Kevin was wonderful!!! Everything was fresh and well presented!!!

Really awesome spot in the French Quarter! The service was amazing- really fast and so so friendly. We started with the red fish Beignets which were TAHDIE! They were crunchy and savory and sweet- like nothing I've ever tasted before. We also had the gator po'boy and the blackened chicken caesar salad. I highly recommend Royal House and definitely stop by for the shrimp and grits when I'm in Nola again!

Very good food although I'm disappointed in their management. I used the Yelp 'free appetizer' code, the waitress accepted it, marked it used on my app and suggested appetizers. We ordered one and out entrees. When the bill came it had the "free" appetizer on it, we asked her to correct it. She apologizes, leaves to correct it only to come back and state that oops you cannot use this one after all. How it's our fault I do not know, we asked and she physically marked it used on my phone. I ask for a manager and he too denies the use because it was supposed to be free WHEN you order two entrees. The app only stated free appetizer when you check in!! So needless to say he wouldn't budge. It's not about getting something for free it's more about the principle, we verified BEFORE ordering an appetizer. If something was stated prior we would have adjusted our order. Other than that mishap, the food was delicious, especially the crawfish etouffee.

I was here two years ago and spent 3 nights in a row dining at the bar of Royal House Oyster Bar. I came back to New Orleans and Royal House was the first place to visit - the bar staff is amazing, the food is awesome and the atmosphere is great and inviting. I'll be coming back for more!

My husband and I went here for lunch last week while we were in New Orleans.  Short walk from Harrah's, where we were staying.  We had the crab claws for an appetizer...the best I've ever had!  The sauce they served them in was divine!  We both had the shrimp po boy for an entrée and a side order of hushpuppies.  Everything was delicious, but what really made our meal was the great service!  The host was super friendly and our waitress was phenomenal...wish I could remember her name.  Will def be going back next time we're in NO.

Came here for the patio, felt guilty sitting on the patio without ordering anything more than drinks, so a Baked Oyster sampler it is. If my mediocre memory is correct, Royal House calls this an "Oyster Duo" and it comes with half Oysters Rockefellar and half Oysters Royale. 

Honestly, I thought the Oysters were garbage. I don't know if they were over cooked or if the chef messed up or what, but these baked oysters tasted like some Walmart freezer isle stuff. Neither of us could finish them. 

Bumping up the rating to three stars is the awesome patio seating for two. Imagine every scene from New Orleans you've ever imagined, and that's what sitting on this rod iron balcony is like, watching the New Orleans world go by. 

Awesome location, but next time, I'll stick to the drinks.

We stopped into Royal House for dinner tonight after the recommendation from a friend.  So glad we took her advice!  My friend ordered the French Onion Soup & shrimp and grits while I ordered the Pecan Crusted Mahi.  The food was absolutely delicious!  In addition to a great meal the service was unbelievable.  Everyone working there took the time to smile, talk to is, and meet our every need.  What a great dining experience!  Enjoy a delicious meal here!

My husband and I are in the French Quarter celebrating our 6th Wedding Anniversary and my birthday. This evening we dined at the Royal House Oyster Bar and the food was fabulous. I must give shout-outs to three fantastic individuals who  made our special time so amazing: (1.) Tyrone was right on time with a glass of orange juice when my sugar level began to tank. (2.) Gaynell our waitress was pleasant, knowledgeable and very attentive and her service was wonderful. (3.) Last but certainly not least the server Anthony was AMAZING! The total epitome of fluidity and grace as he served food to the clientele. He didn't miss a beat and did it all with a smile! Taste of New Orleans,  Crab Claws and Fried Alligator were splendid!

We were seated immediately but went for a spot at the bar as that looked more fun. Very friendly and helpful bartender lady! We are trying out local foods. The oyster  duo was my favorite. The crab legs were good, really enjoyed the sauce. the shrimp were like a provençale tomato sauce, the taste of NO was definitely not our thing and we didn't even eat more than 2 bites of each part. But that might be taste. The cocktail menu is very nice and I enjoyed my drink in a nice tall glass. Overall enjoyable experience. Appreciated the free appetizer thanks to my Yelp check in.

Pricey, but has awesome food. We ordered their oyster shooters to start, which had quite a kick. I also got their shrimp creole which was super tasty. Even though we went right before they were about to close (around 11 or 11:30), the place was still packed, which I think speaks to the quality of the food here. A must try.

Mehhh... Came highly recommended by the hotel concierge. Walked quite a long distance to get to it. If it was really that good, figured it's worth it! 

Seated almost immediately. No wait. But, we had to wait what seemed like forever to get the food. When it finally came, it was disappointing. Everything from the food temperature to taste. I had the sampler, and my wife tried to order the crawfish etoufee, but they were out. She had to order the blackened shrimp. Both were mediocre at best. Pappadeaux's has better food! We're in the French quarter, this should not be the case! Oh well... Next time, I'll look at Yelp first.
I loved this restaurant! Food was amazing and most importantly, the SERVICE WAS EXCEPTIONAL! I would definitely return.

Ate here last night and had a great time.  Our waitress, Ashley (?), was very on top of things without even having to be at our table constantly. Seemed she really had the flow of service down. Management also seemed very attentive to ensure that everyone was happy (they should give a lesson or two to certain nearby restaurants). 

We sat on the balcony where we could hear a violinist throughout our meal, fabulously added to ambiance.  I would warn that the patio is at a pretty steep angle that may freak out the more nervous among us. But seemed to hold up fine for us, haha! Also, the wait was  supposedly 25 minutes when we arrived, but we were seated after about 10 minutes. Happy surprise as that's rarely how wait times go. 

We checked in with yelp and ordered the seafood mushrooms for free. They were fantastic. Seriously, so good. Drinks and drink prices were also good. For our entrees, boyfriend got the shrimp poboy and I did the shrimp tortellini. Both we were very satisfied with, although the shrimp didn't seem super high quality  (relatively small and were certainly frozen for some time). But it didn't detract much from the taste too much. Boyfriends poboy was also loooaded with shrimp, which was nice considering lots of places around give you barely a handful.  Could've used more sauce, but that's a very easily remedied personal preference (wait staff was very prompt in grabbing us a touch more).  


Overall, prices seem right for quality of food, very good food and service, and great ambiance. Definitely a place to go if you're in the Quarter. Oh, and they're open quite late most nights!

The waitress asked if we enjoyed our food, I found that very satisfying.  She was very attentive. We will surely visit Royal house again and bring the kids. Last night  it was just the hubby and I, but I could see bringing the kids with us here.
2.5. Oysters were fresh but they brought out the wrong meal, took forever, and the bread for the poboy was stale. Skip.
