You get what you get. Pressed for time, we stopped by this place in the French quarter, partially due to help reviews and partially due to the short wait. 
High prices are one thing, but each dish lacked pizzazz. The grits looked like the rectangular fish from Lubys. Shrimp was ok. I don't understand such great reviews. Yea, it sucked. There is better food in this city.

Best oysters in NOLA!!  So delicious and the service from the door, bar and wait staff was AMAZING!  I can't wait to hit this spot up again! We ordered every oyster on the menu, I will say the oyster Rockefeller were not the greatest I think the ones at Acme Oyster house are much better but everything else was delicious!
Great food. The shrimp and grits was delicious. Service was kinda slow. Worth the wait though!

Only went to the Royal House for Bloody Mary's but they were superb.  I loved the heat of the horseradish without being overloaded with black pepper. Cindy, the bartender, makes her own mix and she has every relish under the sun included.
Our waiter made the whole experience so fun! The food was amazing. Try the redfish and the oysters were out of this world. #InFoodHeaven
I love the chargrilled oysters and Melva is the best!  I love this place.  I come here every time I am in town!
Absolutly satisfying for some basic Nola faire at a nice price. The Redfish benguettes were absilutely devine, and the pasta hit the spot. Great service from Sharon and the staff!

Four stars for service. While the slow service was a nice change of pace from feeling rushed so the table could be turned, we waited half an hour for our appetizer. The rest of our food came out in a reasonable time.

We ordered the crab legs appetizer- they were very small crab claws in a very rich and tasty Creole cream sauce, served with toasty bread.

I ordered the Taste of New Orleans: Gumbo, Crawfish Etouffe, and Jambalaya, served with more toasty bread. Each "taste" cup had a scoop of rice in it. The gumbo was very good, with a nice Smokey flavor from plenty of sassafras, I believe. The crawfish etoufe was very salty.

My boyfriend ordered the Shrimp Creole- shrimp in a very fresh tasting tomato sauce, served with rice. I do feel like the dishes were rather diluted with the amount of rice, a pretty cheap ingredient, even though that is part of the cuisine.

We had a fantastic violinist street performer immediately below the balcony we were sat at. Very romantic setting and good people watching from the balcony.

10/10 recommend to others.

The food was really good and the service was awesome, make sure to request the server Ty he will have you laughing the whole time. First time in NOLA and picked the perfect spot to get a great New Orleans experience!

Was enthusiastically greeted when we arrived. Offered choice of seating at the bar, table or balcony. Chose the balcony. Met with Ashley and escorted to our balcony table. 

A very nice and personable young man greeted us and introduced himself as Leroy. 

He gave us his personal favorites. But I really wanted more oysters.  Ordered three different ones. Of course I Liked the raw ones the best. 

Prices are reasonable and would definitely return here in the future.

this is my second time in Nola and i have to say i've had better, and cheaper food. we had the sampler which was jambalaya, gumbo, and crawfish etouffee. Didn't really like any of the above. we also tried the crab claws which was a good size, however the sauce was much too thick - we've had better elsewhere. the alligator bites were decent, fried so no funkyness from the alligator meat. the server was really nice and did check on us multiple times but the AC/fan was just not cool enough. i was sweating outside, and inside. and we were seated in an area that had bad ventilation. overall i would have chosen to eat elsewhere but chose this place bc of the vicinity of where we were.
If you are hungry and don't have time to search for an exceptional New Orleans experience, this will do.

My BF and I ordered the fried shrimp and oyster platter and the alligator tail.

The alligator tail was DELICIOUS!! Omg! Alligator tastes so delicious when cooked right ! The meat was soft and tender! 

The fried shrimp and oyster platter was good. It comes with bread and fries under the shrimp and oyster. We thought the fries tasted a little old, maybe it was sitting out for a long time. However when we got to the shrimp and oyster, it was okay.

Would've given more stars, but the food we ate, wasn't too sure if it was the oysters, gave us bad stomachaches. Not a pleasant feeling when we were looking forward to enjoying our last night in Louisiana. :/

2 stars for good alligator and 1 for good service.! Thanks Chris!.

Ya not so much. We had two drinks, dozen oysters a poo boy and hot oysters and it came to 80. The price doesn't bother me the food did. It was average at best. I had really high expectations and they fell short. There are many many restaurants in the quarter selling the same food, go someplace else. Next! The oysters were so over cooked and the cheese to hard it was difficult to get them out of the shell. The poo boy is the exact same thing you can get every place at half the price.

The food here was delicious! For appetizers, we got the seafood stuffed mushrooms. They were pure bliss! They literally were stuffed with seafood and was probably our favorite dish. My husband got the fried fish po-boy, a dish you can't go wrong with. I got the shrimp and grits, and they had a unique spin to it. The grits are fried and they smother it with the sauce and shrimpsl It wasn't what I expected, but it was delicious nonetheless. And of course we have to give a shout out to Gaynelle. She was super sweet and knowledgeable of the menu (I love it when people know everything about the restaurant they work at).

Service is excellent!! The entire staff is friendly & inviting, truly genuine in wanting to make your experience here one to remember. Food is great as well, fresh & tasty! If you go, ask for Melva- she's an absolute delight!
Melva was a fantastic server and gave excellent recommendations. Everyone on the staff was friendly and accommodating. Food and drinks were great.

This was our first meal in NOLA and I was super excited to eat.  We happened to stumble upon this place and it got good yelp reviews so I thought why not.  There was also a small line outside the door before it opened.  The environment was quite nice and we were seated by the window.  The service was SPECTACULAR.  However, we were less impressed with the food.  I ordered the sampler which was jambalaya, gumbo, and etouffee.  My friend order the shrimp po boy with fries.  I don't know if I was just hyping it up too much, but the food was just okay.

I had the fish po boy sandwich, which was amazing. Not what I expected but tasted great. The bread is fresh and crisp and the fish tastes amazing! (4 stars)

My wife had the pecan crusted mahi mahi, which turned out too spicy for her and they were kind enough to change her order free of charge. Note that it didn't look anything like what we expected based on the description. She ended up having the eggplant and chicken Parmesan which tasted amazing (5 stars)

The staff were very nice and friendly, the place isn't 5 star quality but the food is great!

We had a free spinach dip appetizer courtesy of Yelp, which wasn't fresh honestly and the nachos were extremely oily! We've had better. (2 stars)

Overall, I give the place 4 stars because the atmosphere wasn't great and the bad experience with the appetizer.

Attempting to get into Café du Monde on a Saturday morning was, in retrospect, a bad idea for my wife and I as the queue met us a couple blocks away. So we wandered around trying to find a comfortable but inexpensive restaurant for breakfast. Eventually, we stumbled across the Royal House and, encouraged by the staffer with the megaphone, came on in.

We were seated by the open doors making the experience practically al fresco. The breakfast menu was limited albeit focused on Southern/New Orleans cuisine. My wife had the Oysters Benedict and I had the Southerner entrée made up of biscuits and gravy with ground sausage and scrambled eggs. Our server was chatty and friendly in that familiar New Orleans way. She was also thoughtful, adding my requested side order of grits as a "lagniappe" to my meal. 

If you want to experience local cuisine in a casual, warm atmosphere, this is the place to be in the French Quarter.

The best food! We always come here. The service is great! We did not wait for a long time. Their fresh oysters are sooo good! I had 2 bowls of andouille sausage soup. The crawfish ravioli was creamy and just good! The charbroiled oyster was delish. The bread pudding was to die for!
Great server who gave us the best recommendations-great food! The red beans are amazing and the char grilled oyster were on point!

Came to Royal House on a Sunday night, around 10pm. I ordered the seafood pot and my bf ordered the snow crab legs. While his meal was delicious I can't say the same about my food. First off, my meal was overly salty, all the clams and mussels were just empty shells with the meat no where to be found and then I barely got two-three shrimp in my pot. The only reason I didn't give this place a one star is because when I told my waitress that most of my order was missing, she brought me a dish with more mussels and clams. I was very disappointed with this meal. Wouldn't come back again
Very good! Had the redfish the first time that I went and it was amazing. Went again recently and had the shrimp and grits and it was delicious! I'll be getting the shrimp and grits again next time!

Beautiful restaurant. My friend and I sat at the bar and ordered a large platter of oysters. The bartender/waiter was awesome and talked with us while he shucked oysters. It was a great addition to my list of favorite NOLA experiences.
We had amazing service, amazing food, and awesome drinks! I'll be back for more! I can't remember our waiters name- but he was not only hilarious, but on top of everything.

My husband and I, while visiting French quarter, we found this restaurant on Yelp. We were greeted and seated immediately. That's a good sign since we were hungry. LOL. We ordered seafood stuffed mushroom for appetizer, it's a combo of baked crab and shrimp stuffed in button mushrooms. Delicious! For main course, my husband ordered a Seafood Pescatore (linguine pasta tossed with marina sauce and a combo of clams, mussels, shrimp and scallops sauteed with garlic and fresh herbs), he said it's so tasty and delish! Since I always love Jambalaya, I ordered a Blackened Shrimp and Jambalaya which included chicken and andouille sausage sauteed with onions and peppers then topped with blackened shrimp over rice. Love it! 
Service is attentive. Great views from balcony. We would definitely come back next time when we're in town.
Note: restaurant also serving breakfast on Saturday and Sunday.

Food was absolutely delicious. The service was perhaps the best I have ever had at any restaurant. Everyone that was working was super friendly and helpful. Our waiter, Terrence was the best, he made our experience absolutely the best. I hope to dine there every time I am in New Orleans.

We've been in NOLA for two days now and we have eaten there twice... It was close to our hotel, the Omni Royal.  Both times the food was prenominal. 

We had the oysters for an appetizer twice, the one where you get to sample two types, then we had the mahi mahi and the "Taste of New Orleans" platter. The best seafoods I've had in a while. The mahi had the perfect spiciness and after taste kick... I can't explain it. As i juggled that with my wife's sampler platter, my mouth grew confused with the onslaught of flavors. Each meal was drastically different yet both prenominal. 

We had the bread pudding the day before fit desert. The waiter recommended it to us... He said something to us in confidentially about that particular desert, but what i will share is that that particular desert is made by only one person, no other person can make it. It's an old family recipe. He also went on to say that they only allow a few people to cook a few things in the kitchen. That must be true, because the appetizers and dessert was consistently good both times.

We totally forgot to use the $10 off coupon from yelp after checking in the first time... Be sure to check in while you're in there and use the coupon right away...

Service here was amazing. I used our check in at Yelp and got the caprese tower as our free appetizer. The caprese tower was very delicious. 

My friend and I shared the shrimp and fish po boy sandwich. The shrimp wasn't my favorite, I thought it was very salty. The fish po boy was actually really good, not overwhelming salty. Main reason why I'm giving this place 3 stars because a lot of said their food was really salty. I usually remember po boys come with a mayo sauce type and ours didn't have it.

Service was amazing. I believe our waiter was Chris and he had to put up with our rowdy group of 9 girls. I wish I can give this place a 3.5 stars.

My one must recommendation is to sit at the Oyster bar in Nairobi's area. He was friendly and had great customer service, which made this dining experience memorable. In fact, we went back there two nights in a row and just hung out and talked to him all night. The food here was great, however, the brunch here was only mediocre. Must go while in the French Quarter.

Food is fantastic. But in all honesty we came back to this restaurant not just for the food but for the service from Ty the singing hilarious waiter. Made my birthday night all the more fun by his hilarity.  #heard

My First night in Nola and the LOVE from the locals was wonderful. The food was amazing and the service was stellar. This place has a great ambience and vibe.  When we return the Royal House is where we will visit.

The food had great flavor, the servers we're funny and had great advice on the menu.  All the food came out in less than 20 min.  

Please ask for Taj or Tyrone they we're funny and helpful, it felt like family was serving you. 

 I will be back here tomorrow for breakfast.  This is my new spot in NOLA.
OMG! Enough said. Best service and ammmmmmazing food. You absolutely must come here. Glad we waited until our last night or we would not have gone anywhere else. It's that good!

They have amazing food!! Let the waiters hook up your raw oysters!! They know what they are doing!!! My boyfriend and I went there and ate at the bar last night. We didn't even look at the menu and just had them just recommend something and everything we ate was so amazingly delicious!!! I highly recommend this place!! Great service and great food!!

You must try the grilled oysters to start you meal!  I was a bit hesitant about the Parmesan cheese, but it went perfectly.  I had he red fish and it was superb!!! My son had he seafood pescatore with the cream sauce!! We will be back to this amazing place.

I'm not sure why the negative reviews but I will say we really enjoyed our time here. Our waitress (I believe her name was Courtney) was so fabulous. Boyfriend had peel n eat shrimp and I had the pecan crusted Mahi Mahi. Both were extremely delicious! We had a somewhat early dinner, maybe around 6:00 and I can see how it is easy to feel like the service is slow simply because it is in a busy area and we noticed tons of people coming in. But we were never forgotten and were in no hurry; it is vacation after all! We enjoyed our food and the atmosphere. It is a little warm inside but the building is older and they do their best to accommodate. You can also sit on their patio and enjoy the people watching and parades going by. We highly recommend Royal House to those who are on vacation and want to enjoy their NOLA experience. Thank you for the great time, Courtney! (I hope that's your name!)

Is this a popular tourist destination, sure, it is in the heart of the French Quarter after all. Is this an enjoyable spot for locals, sure! Popped in on a Saturday afternoon for some cocktails and seafood. Ordered the Crab Claws; served in a lemon-garlic-butter sauce with slices of French Bread on the side. This sauce is so good you can't help but clean the plate! Also ordered the Chargrilled Oysters, these are always a good choice. (note: no need to fall for the up-sell of crabmeat on top of the oysters, they don't need it!) Had a couple of cocktails that were fine, pleasing enough to suit us. Our server was super attentive and friendly. They show true southern hospitality here.  A French Quarter establishment that is worth a visit.
We stopped in for some what else oysters. First time trying the char broiled, they did not disappoint. The cocktails ain't bad either. Great service and good food. We will be back.

All of the Creole Cuisine Restaurant Concept restaurants are about the same: Good food, good service, nothing spectacular but always worth the money/wait. Royal House is the slight exception as their chargrilled oysters are the best I've had in New Orleans.

We had left another restaurant (Muriel's) because their staff was very rude to us, and sat us at a table with a view of a porta-potty.  This was after calling them a week prior asking for a great table for my boyfriend's 40th birthday.  Bummed that what was supposed to be a great dinner didn't work out, we walked around and found Royal House - and so glad we did.  The food was awesome.  Tyronne was so much fun - he saved the evening - and turned the 40th b'day dinner around to such a great time.  Thank you so much!

Ok not sure if that was an off night in July but the food was terrible:(    i ordered the boiled shrimp pot (or w.e its called) and everything in this meal was unflavored (come on guys at least add some old bay) and to top it off the shrimp was undercooked.  Some shrimp were hard almost to a crunch ugh .. prayed multiple times that I didnt get sick cuz when i started a few of them were a little hard but tried to ignore  got to the point of almost gagging. The gumbo was also bad idk what was going on but we left hungry & didnt even want to reorder I felt nauseous at this point.  And by the way they were going to REBOIL the meal they already gave me!! WTF  no thank u i will just be hungry.. 3 stars because the pple were actually nice
I try and come by the Royal House any time I am in NOLA.  The BBQ'd oysters are yummy.  The ambiance is definitely French Quarter-ish.
Must go while you are in town! Sitting at the bar added to our great experience. Alligator was some of the best I've ever had. The bartender doctored us up some raw oysters which were delish.

This restaurant comes up in searches probably because its longevity but the food and the restaurant itself - repulsed me. The gumbo was super smokey and unappetising and the grilled red fish was dry and tasteless. The bathroom are nasty and our waitress couldn't care less. I was grossed out at the entire experience.

You must go try this place if you're in New Orleans -- we were blown away and still think about the wonderful meal we had at Royal House. 

Located in the center of the French Quarter, parking can be a little hard for Royal House. However, don't let that deter you from coming to eat here. We began with the crab claws appetizer (which we received free by checking in on Yelp -- thanks Yelp!). Our waitress recommended them and although at first we almost didn't go with them, we are glad we did. The claws come ready to eat and covered in a lemon butter sauce with garlic bread. The sauce is so great that we wiped the plate completely clean. I would say this appetizer is the perfect size for two people.

We also shared charbroiled oysters with Parmesan and lemon drizzled on top. These oysters are a must try and will leave you wanting more. We got a dozen for two people and six definitely left us wanting more. The oysters were large and fresh and just the right amount of flavor. 

We then ordered the New Orleans Sampler which comes with a cup of jambalaya, craw fish etouffee, and gumbo. We ordered a side of red beans and rice to try it as well. These portion are a little less than a cup so you'll get to try it all. If I had to come back and order again though I would have only gotten the drafish etouffee and the red beans and rice. Those were by far the two best dishes in the sampler. 

Finally we caved in and decided to try the bread pudding for dessert. It was deliciously warm and came with ice cream on top. Definitely the perfect way to end this meal.

I would say if you're coming to visit 1. don't forget to check in for the free appetizer and 2. order food to share! Royal House has so many great options that you'll want to try as much as you can. 

Can't wait for our next visit to Royal House!
Deeelicious oysters and a lovely, classy (but not stuffy) environment. Elva served us and made our experience an enjoyable one. Highly recommend!

Me and my wife arrived around 8:30pm on a saturday night and were quickly sat at a table next to a bar. Our waiter recommanded pecan crusted mahi mahi and we decided to get it and french onion soup. My foodie common sense still holds true. Never get recommand food. Our food, especially cold mahi mahi, came out after long waited "45 minutes". Through a series of complaints, waiter took the fish plate back and manager brought it back out after microwaved. We were completely disappointed that manager discounted the fish dish. We paid for our french onion soup and tips and left sadly. Dont trust yelp's "1000s" reviews. 

The following is my instagram post. 


You are never guarantee to get good food as a true foodie. Dinner of the night: 45 minutes wait of 1. salty french onion soup, 2. microwaved "after complaints" burned pecan crusted two ounces "hella small" mahi mahi with soggy mushy "breakfast" potatoes with cold ass string beans. I love to recommand this restaurant "NOT TO GO THERE" when you visit NOLA. I noticed a lot of customers did not feel happy about their food around the same time as I were there. #neworleans #manwinvacation #bad #food #not #recommanded #foodie #dinner

Fabulous from the service to the drinks to the food. The charbroiled oysters were so good. Taj, our waiter was very sweet, made tight on recommendations and gave us very good service even tho they were slammed. Waited about 20min to get in. They put us on the balcony but we didn't like it so they moved us inside immed. Will definitely go back again!

we stopped by being drawn in by the lively gentleman standing out front urging us to come in and dine..The wait staff is very friendly and quickly put us at ease as he told us about the specials on the menu as became  family...lol
the food is great great great greattttttt as we had our 1st taste of fried gator which was well seasoned  and very tender...my wife had the crab claws in garlic sauce which was very good..
my red beans and rice was a local staple and lived up to it's name as it was well seasoned and plenty of food for the price...If you ever down in nola make sure to stop in and tell  cousin  Terrance I sent you in for the 1st class treatment and southern hospitality.

I would highly recommend.  We were a party of 4 and ordered the crab claws, spinach and cheese dip, Alaskan crab legs, and blackened chicken sandwiches. All were good especially the Alaskan crab legs. The hospitality was amazing, nothing like you'd experience in NY. The restaurant was clean and intimate.

NOLA is famous for the charbroiled oysters, however, at Royal House, it's the raw oysters that are the best sellers.  Seriously, almost every table had a dozen, so we took the chance and ordered a dozen too.  It was the best Louisiana oysters ever!  Nice, big and juicy!

We also noticed that people had the Blackened Redfish, we think it's just okay, kinda dried.  The waiter had recommended the seafood pescatore, which is a seafood pasta.  It has a nice tomato marinara sauce that is very appetizing.  

Of course, the meal would not be completed without alcohol in NOLA.  H had the amber (beer) and I had the hurricane.  This hurricane was the strongest alcohol content I had the whole week, it knocked me out within a couple of sips.

Stopped here for dinner and met Andre!  He has been here for only 3 weeks, but was hospitable and focused on customer satisfaction!  The red fish was good, but the oysters were phenomenal.  Check it out!

Got the alligator appetizer which was 0pretty good! Wasn't too big on the gumbo but I don't have anything to compare it to. The service was slow but the waitress Tina was very nice and welcoming! I would recommend for a good drink and food!

Tourist trap.  Looking for oysters?  Go to Felix's!!!  Went on Saturday night around 8:30pm.  Sat right away.  Was really looking forward to the grilled oysters. Way overcooked, and quite over seasoned! And we waited 40 minutes for the food to come out of the kitchen.  Server was nice but was obviously in the weeds and didn't have much time to be attentive. Don't ever need to go back.
Melva, best dammed server in the joint, highly recommended crawfish eggs Benedict, red beans and rice- great drinks too!
Two words.......crab claws.......every time we are here we come to Royal House and have to get an order. Do yourself a favor and do the same.

So, came back a second time this week based on my earlier experience.  This time we ordered drinks, shrimp po boys and a caprese tower.  The caprese tower arrived with a dying fly.  We sent it back and it was replaced with a tower with only one slice of mozzarella.  The po boys had no flavor or seasoning and the service was extremely slow.  (Decadence weekend). We waited quite a while for food and cocktails while watching other diners get their meals

Bloody Mary are really good at the Royal House. The best place to sit at is the bar. The bartenders are really cool and funny and take really good care of the customers. I recommend the Oysters and a Blood Mary to everyone.

We were really hungry when we landed in NOLA and as we were staying close by Bourbon street we started walking around to find a place to have lunch. The place itself is conveniently located in the middle of the French Quarter. The staff was nice and friendly. The food however was not that impressive. We felt that the food fell flat and bland. We were so disappointed and we basically were just picking at our food. We left unsatisfied and a few hours later found a better spot to eat. Some of the food on the table of other people looked good....maybe hit or miss kind of place?
We are visiting from vegas. Our server Tyrone was outstanding!!! The food was perfect and so filling! I will definitely come back! Thanks Tyrone! Alright alright alrighhhtttt!! ;)
Best Bloody Mary's in New Orleans! Bloody Mary's are my usual go to drink. They're delicious here!

For the location and atmosphere on the porch you can't beat this place. But the food is nothing special, the jambalaya is just ok as was the shrimp creole. I could have made it better at home. 

The wait staff is also slow. I ordered a water with my wine before I ordered dinner and I had to remind the waitress after I had finished my meal that I was waiting on water. 

If you can afford better, I suggest you go elsewhere. But for the price and location it's not bad.

If you want great food in downtown New Orleans, this is the place to go. The food is served in giant servings and everything on the menu is fantastic. Real Cajun cooking with down home southern hospitality. Tyrone is the best server in the house! Don't pass up on any of his recommendations or you will be missing out!!!! Come here every year and are always blown away.

This is one of my best stops in the French Quarter!!!! Chargrilled oysters at always a must! Had crab claws for the first time last night. Normally I have po-boy but last night I had a salad and ate off my hunni plate, which was a combined platter of shrimp and fish... Very delish... May I add the drinks are on point to. Moved to LA 5 months ago and already ate here 4 times

I never write reviews but I feel compelled to write one now so that people are not mislead by the stars like we were. The shrimp and grits are the most disgusting shrimp and grits I've ever had. I do not understand why this place has 4 stars. Do not come here for shrimp and grits. The grits are served as fried triangles and the sauce tastes like marinara from the jar. Not what shrimp and grits should taste like at all. Avoid this place at all costs.

Our experience at the Royal House was excellent. We had a rough patch at first but our waitress and staff was very pleasant and informative about the menu. I ordered the shrimp platter and it was more food than I could handle.  The shrimp platter was delicious the batter was Cajun style so it had a little kick to it.  The atmosphere is very French it reminds you of cafe . This place is definitely a diamond in the rough.

My family and I came here after the football game and were seated immediately. People seem to eat much later here than where we're from and it's definitely worked in our favor. The restaurant has a nice ambience and a fun bar in the front. 

So let me get to it - INCREDIBLE MEAL. My favorite meal that I had during my stay in New Orleans. Our waiter, Chris, was incredibly knowledgable about the menu and gave us his suggestions on everything. We went with most of them and he was definitely right! My mom got the Voodoo Juice and I got the Mint Julep.  Delicious. Next, with Yelp checkin, we ordered our free appetizer per Chris' suggestion. The redfish beignets were insanely delicious. That crystal beurre blanc sauce and cane syrup was so good and the beignets were so light and flavorful. For my entree, I got the pecan crusted mahi mahi, also at his suggestion. Once again, incredible crystal lemon butter cream sauce. So delicious. Finally, we finished with the bananas foster cheesecake. It's a deconstructed cheesecake but boy is it good. The cheesecake is so light and fluffy. The homemade cinnamon graham cookie is perfect - and there's a ton for people who love extra crust. The whipped cream was also delicious. I wish I wasn't leaving tomorrow so I could come back! Definitely a place to visit if you're in New Orleans.

Absolutely love this place. Visited three times during my visit to NOLA and never disappointed.  Our waitress, Melva, was very personable and took care of us very well.  We will be returning...our next visit can't come quick enough.  Thanks Melva!

Came across Royal House and had a fantastic lunch with an incredibly friendly staff. I sat at the bar and was immediately greater with a smile. The bartender/ oyster shucker, Antoine, answered tons of questions and and was prompt on service! The oysters were HUGE! And I recommend the gumbo, which was full of flavor. A must go to spot when in town.

Stopped by there for lunch because the place we were headed was closed.  What a surprise.  The best meal we had on our trip to NO.  We had the shrimp tortellini, NO sampler, and seafood over linguini with marinara.  This was an excellent experience but what made it was our server Tarrance K.  Tarrance went out of his way to engage us and the 3 surrounding tables and provide us all with entertainment and a warm friendly experience.

Great corner location with many things to offer on the menu. Did not disappoint us but nothing to brag about. I was pleasantly surprised with how food was spaced out so that we could enjoy our meal and not feel rushed. Traffic is away from bourbon so that also came as a plus because we were tired after football game.

AMAZING experience here! My first time to New Orleans and I found this place through handy dandy Yelp! It didn't disappoint! My boyfriend and I decided just to do apps and dessert. We sat at the bar on the side where they shuck the oysters right in front of you. Jeff (who was absolutely AMAZING) suggest the crab claws. WOW! The sauce was one of the best things I've ever tasted. He insisted getting us more bread as well so we could soak it all up. I highly suggest you do the same! It would be a shame to waste it a drop of that stuff. We also got the gumbo soup (delish). And last but not least, the bread pudding... Suggested by Jeff of course. It exceeded my expectations. Best bread pudding I've ever had. This place is a must for anyone who wants a nice, low key, fairly priced, and DELICIOUS dinner! And if you want top of line service and conversation, go and sit with Jeff!
This is place is amazing, great food, and good staff. I am a new fan of craw fish Benedikt!!!!!

Went here on Sunday 09/11/2016. We had a group of 4.
We were seated promptly. However that's where the promptness stopped. We a ordered appetizers. Charbroiled oysters, a cup of gumbo , spinach dip and a salad.
Our server Monica was very slow. Never checked on us. Did not tell us that this oven was broken until I complained to the manager. We waited a hour for a cup of gumbo soup that just had to be scooped out of the pot.
I will say that the manager did try to rectify the situation by comping our food however The damage had already been done.
I would not recommend this place to anyone and I would not go back.
In most towns this would be a 4 star but overall was pretty average compared to the other options in the area.

Nothing to write home about, but definitely solid. Crab appetizer portion was on the small side, but main entree's were huge. Got a side of jambalaya, which was one of the worst things I've had our trip. Other than that, good portions and solid food.
Food was good, I enjoyed using the Yelp appetizer coupon for a free fried alligator appetizer! Good location, it was nice being able to sit out on the terrace!

Spent a few days in NOLA, hotel was right around the corner, just happened to walk by and loved the atmosphere so my friends and I went in. So glad we did! In the few days we spent in the city, we came back twice! Our server was Melva and she's just lovely, fast service, kind and very pleasant. We ordered the eggplant appetizer, shrimp ravioli and the Taste of New Orleans entree and it was all so incredibly delicious. Just love this place, and will definitely be back when I'm in the city!

Royal House was our first stop upon arriving in New Orleans. Their bar is well lit and the oysters are shucked and prepared right in front of you! They have a pretty large wine list, good beer, and their Oyster's were amazing! 

I highly recommended stopping by during the day. They open up all the windows so there is a light breeze! 

Friendly and amazing staff. I will absolutely be coming back.

As good as it gets! This was mine and my boyfriend's last meal while visiting New Orleans for the first time, and we sure ended on a great note.

We showed up starving around 11:30 for an early lunch before our flight. We were one of about 5 parties, so we pretty much had the place to ourselves. The restaurant is huge - large dining area and bar on both bottom and top levels, along with upstairs balcony seating! White tablecloths and nice place settings add to the classiness of the place, but you could still dress pretty casual here.

Every waiter/waitress interaction we had and witnessed at Royal House was pleasant - everyone was extremely friendly. I ordered the Crawfish Ravioli and my boyfriend had the Seafood Pescatore. All I can say is WOW. My ravioli was delicious - perfectly cooked pasta stuffed with ricotta cheese embedded in a creamy, spice-filled crab and crawfish sauce, with even more cheese on top. I was in heaven! My boyfriend thoroughly enjoyed his dish as well, but gobbled it down before I could snag a bite. His pasta was topped with plentiful seafood: scallops, mussels, clams, and shrimp, and tossed in a yummy red sauce.

I wish we could say we had room for dessert, but we will definitely be back to Royal House the next visit to the French Quarter and make sure to try their famous Bananas Fosters Cheesecake or Bread Pudding!

5 stars because it delivers what it promises. 
I had a special of shrimp Creole which was so deliciously spicy I had tears rolling down my cheeks! The others in my party had fried shrimp, scallops, tasty alligator boudin. All very good. The fresh fruit drinks were the best of this trip. There were a couple of famous old football players and the staff did a good job of keeping other patrons away without taking away from service for everyone. Sorry, but I can only remember Tony Dorsett (?). I hope to return before the year is up. Highly recommend. No pics as the staff asked us to not take pics.
Great food love the oysters,great cocktails and great service.
Tahj is the greatest!!! He made sure we had fun in our date night. The fried alligator and the oysters were amazing!
The oyster beignet... YUMMY!  Yep it was that good.... dont miss it!  Oyster tacos spicy but still good.

The crab claw appetizer is indeed everything everyone has "cracked" it up to be...but it's more about the sauce.  I asked for two additional orders of bread to help sop up the yummy sauce, and we still had some left over!

I enjoyed my Roast Beef Po Boy, and the Shrimp Creole was flavorful but not spicy.

I would order the crab claw app again but would want to try other entrees.
all great customer service and great food thank you melva! Enjoyed our visit and i loved the balcony outside perfect for wine drinking and hearing the jazz on the street play

Literally the best food I've ever had in my life. All the oysters, the crawfish beignets, the redfish beignets, the crawfish ettouffee, and OMG the bananas foster cheesecake are all to die for! I haven't been to NOLA in over a year and I still think about Royal House.

As we read the menu posted at the door of the Royal House on Monday 19th September, one of the amazing waitresses, Melva, who was at the entrance, offered us each our own and recommended a few of her favorite appetizers. We were sold and it just got better from there. Our server, Yamini, was delightful and even our busser, Jerome had a welcoming smile and introduced himself. We feasted (and I do mean feasted) on Chargrilled Oysters, Crab Claws and Fried Grits with Shrimp. The great coffee just kept coming and the Rum Punch was one of the best that this Caribbean girl has ever tasted. The restaurant was steps away from our hotel and we promise to be back to try more of the spectacular offerings on our next trip to NOLA.
Oyster beignets. You are welcome. Enough said. (Everything else was spectacular as well.)
Go for the oysters!!!!! Stay for the ambience!!!!! I loved the Oyster Rockerfellers.
Excellent food, Excellent service.  Melva is the best.   No long line to get in and Melva kept the drinks flowing and even closed the shutters when the sun got too bright.  Highly recommended.

Great place for food, add hot sauce to the jambalaya- the crab claws and étouffée were fantastic, and cocktails were made exactly to order. Melville was a great server!  Would definitely suggest to others.
The server was pretty rude and the raw oysters are not eatable in my standard.   We wanted to order couple things to start before we decide if we should stay.  And we left when the oysters arrived.

We ate here a few times during our last NOLA trip.  The staff are amazing.  Very friendly from the greeter to the wait staff.  The food was great.  We had many of their dishes and were happy with each one.  We kept going back for both the staff and the food.  We ate at the bar, a downstairs table and an upstairs table.  

Word of warning, don't take a balcony seat upstairs.  The balcony has about a 15 degree tilt outward and we felt like our drinks were going to slide off of the table and into the street below.  The lighting was poor and the roof above the seating was coming apart and we were afraid something would fall into our food.  We ended up moving back inside.  The staff were very helpful in accommodating the move.

Royal House was one of our top picks for NOLA.

We stopped here on impulse on our way back from a cemetery tour, and it turned out to be a great idea. Our waiter (who I shall call "Matt" because he looks like a Matt) was super attentive and kept us well supplied with water. He recommended the redfish beignets, which were nicely coated and crispy. Their sauce was sweet with a touch of kick. 
My entrée was an oyster BLT - the oysters were well breaded and delicious. To me, the pickles and lettuce were a bit much but when in Rome.... hide them on the side and hope the Romans don't have hurt feelings.
Dessert was the highlight of the meal, if not the day. A deconstructed banana cheesecake which was perfect to split and creamy; there was no excessive sweetness.

I've been twice and I've been consistently disappointed with the service and overall experience. While they serve up some delicious raw oysters, the prices for them are nothing to scream home about. In addition I expect a better/larger selection of beer on tap in the French Quarter but their selection is minimal. Last, they served stale crackers and I had to wait 30 minutes for 2-dozen raw oysters. In my experience at other oyster bars in New Orleans, and even in the French Quarter, it's not unreasonable to hope for better.

The food was horrible and the prices were so expensive. The staff was decent but I could not get past how bad the food was. The bread that came with your meal tasted stale. We ordered the oysters and it did not taste fresh. I will not be back.
At best just mediocre food :( expected way more from a place with 4 stars and more than 2,000 reviews. Very disappointed

We found this place on yelp with good reviews. There were 5 of us. We ordered shrimp creole, fried alligator, chargrilled oysters, crawfish etouffee and crab clams. The only dish which was really good was crab clams. Shrimp creole was the worst one, no flavor at all...( The service was pretty good, no complaints. But overall will not recommend to go there:(
Great service number 1 from Chanel (sp?) Great food number 2. Crab claws on the appetizer menu are killer. Make sure you get extra bread to soak up the amazing sauce!!! Must go!!

I've been here a couple of times. It wasn't bad, but it wasn't great. It's a bit pricey for the food to be so mediocre, but is unfortunately pretty standard for touristy spots like this in the Quarter. My food could have been hotter, had a little more flavor, my drink a bit stronger. A plus is it's location. 

If it's your first time to New Orleans you'll probably enjoy it, but once you find all that the city has to offer for food you'll realize just how unimpressive it is.

WOW! Out of all the places in the French Quarters of New Orleans we decided to try this one out and we were definitely amazed!  First the service was incredible, Tina our waitress, gave us a marvelous service, her personality is incredible and just for that I would have given this place 5 stars.

Now, when our dishes arrived, all those wonderful aromas of creole and cajun spices flourished! We ordered crab claws as an appetizer and pasta pescatore as the main course. Be ready to order more bread because the sauces in these two dishes are to die for!

We highly recommend this place.

Was passing through New Orleans, needed lunch and found this place on Yelp. We only had a couple hours, so we decided we wanted to see the French Quarter. 

Well, first, parking is a pain, but that is like any busy downtown area. We luckily found a spot in a public parking lot - $25 for 3 hours. 

It was around 1:30/2pm when we got to the restaurant and luckily we did not have a wait. The hostesses and our waiter were both super friendly, with great customer service!

The menu is definitely unique, but authentic New Orleans/Cajun. I ordered the Taste of New Orleans: Chicken & Andouille Jambalaya, Crawfish etouffee, and chicken & Andouille Gumbo. It was delicious!! I ate all of it.
My husband ordered the Alligator Po'boy. None of us had ever had alligator, so we all tried it. It was good. Even our toddler had some.

Fun atmosphere, good food, good customer service! Definitely check out this place.
Always return to Royal House! Anything that you order will be delicious! Bloody Mary's to die for! Just control the urge to stay and miss out on the other sights!
Most excellent restaurant! Melva was our server and she was so wonderful! She suggested the broiled oysters and the crab claws and she was spot on! Yum!! I highly recommend stopping here!

Was in search of salad while in New Orleans (a harder task than one would think) and ended up at Royal House. Shared the Fried Alligator (thanks Yelp for the $10 off an appetizer deal!), which was fine. It had nice flavor, but a little too much breading. I then had the Royal Spinach Salad. The salad was pretty basic and overpriced for what it was, but I was willing to pay a premium for some fresh raw vegetables (and loved the candied pecans). Service was friendly. There was nothing that stood out about Royal House, but it has salads so it's a winner in my book.

The male manager didn't honor a free appetizer coupon our waitress said was valid which was fine, but his rude attitude upset our party of 11. Had he simply been polite and apologized our group would have gotten over it and paid no problem, but his customer service definitely recieves a failing F. other than the poor customer service,  the food was good!

Stopped here with a recommendation from a friend. We had eaten dinner earlier so this was a snack.  We sat at the bar. We both had charbroiled oysters. They were very fresh and delicious. Charbroiled oysters are my new favorite thing. For some reason it's not a popular way to serve oysters in California where I am from. 

The bartender was super friendly. Atmosphere was nice. Would loved to have eaten dinner here. Our snack was great. Worth a check out.

Great service and great food! We had fried alligator, taste of New Orleans, and the red bean dish. All of the food we ate was great! The alligator and red bean dish was our favorite. The red bean dish was a little spicy and was great!
The seafood stuffed mushrooms were really delicious. The baked shrimp tortellini was also amazing. The service is slow or I would give 5 stars. I also liked the intimate balcony seating too.
Shrimp isn't deveined. Gross. Food took almost an hour to come out. I ordered a poboy. It was 3pm on a Friday.... not worth it. Nola has so many other places- choose elsewhere.
Two words, crawfish raviolis! The sauce is Devine and the pasta is succulent. Ambience is great, the service was fast and charming. Go!

Nice historic building and fantastic oysters but other menu items really not good. Service is very friendly.

Will continue to stop here for a drink and oysters but have meals elsewhere.
Melva was such a lovely server and the food was delicious. I definitely suggest the fried alligator!

This is one restaurant not to miss when in New Orleans. The food is superb and the oysters are mouth watering. Aside from the high quality food, the service is outstanding. Out server Tina made us feel right at home and treated us like one of the family. She was prompt, courteous, and made sure that we were thoroughly satisfied.
Pimms cup, red beans and rice and crawfish beignets. Now you know what to order. Sit back and enjoy.

We came here as our big finale for our last night in New Orleans. We had a party of 4 but split up into pairs since we wanted to be seated upstairs. 

The appetizer, crab claw, was wonderful. However, it seems like the kitchen forgot about us. The other pair managed to eat their entrees, drink their coffees and finished their desserts. We were seated at 9:30pm, and the kitchen is closing in 20 minutes at 11pm, but we have not seen our food in sight. 

What a huge disappointment! We waited for an hour for our entrees and our group had to wait for us too. When we tried to cancel our orders earlier, they kept telling us that the food was coming.

No doubt the food is wonderful, but I have no idea what happened to us.

The oysters on the hall shell were okay but very gritty. The charbroiled oysters were so small, about the size of my thumbnail. My husband ordered the oyster bacon po boy and it was mostly bread, oysters only on about half of the bread. The worst part was when the server Melva asked what we thought and we told her, she rolled her eyes at us and asked us where we were from. I guess expecting toppings and meat across your whole sandwich is asking too much. Overpriced for the quality of food and the server was rude. We will stick with Drago's for charbroiled oysters, theirs are a million times better!
The pasta is okay but I've had better. The staff is friendly. It depends on what you want to eat
Just grabbed a quick bite. Service was good (Kevin). Alligator appetizer was great. Good place for lunch.
Oysters were great, not the place for traditional shrimp and grits. Service was good.

I had one night in New Orleans...I needed food.  Cajun, southern, good, food.

Started with some Charbroiled Oysters.  So hit the spot!  Cheesy melted parm & garlic butter.  Yum!

I could not decide what I wanted for my main...gumbo?  crawfish etoufee? jambalaya?  I wanted it all!  Fortunately they have exactly that.  So I got all my fixes in one sitting!

Food was good, and so was the staff!
Fantastic service and atmosphere and delicious food. Enjoyed the crab claws for appetizer and red beans and shrimp and grits for entrees. Highly recommend and would come back again.

Some friends told us about this jewel and it did not disappoint! Our waitress was Ms. Tina and she was on point from the drinks to the appetizers. We ordered the crab claws that came in a delicious sauce that was the business. Ms. Tina told us not to let them take the sauce away and she was right. I ordered the steak and it was cooked to perfection I added lump crab meet. This is a must if you are traveling to NOLA!!!!! Ask for Ms. Tina and you will not be disappointed.
We had the Chargrilled oysters it was very oily and didn't use the right cheese , Server was good . Although she didn't give her name  . Overall place is a 2
Our waitress was a hoot.  Couldn't help but love her! The crab claws were delicious.  However, the BLT Oyster was a bit on the salty side!

For our last dinner in NOLA, we picked a great one! First off, they quickly accommodated 6 people on a weeknight. We used the Yelp check-in deal (half off appetizer) and had the fried alligator. Good choice. Then our entrees were delicious! The oyster pasta was my favorite...so much flavor! But tried bites of the shrimp n grits and crawfish ravioli. Everyone loved what they got!
We walked up and down the French quarter and stumbled upon this hidden gem.  Food was absolutely delicious and the ambiance was on point too

Was on a Haunted Vampire tour in New Orleans when we had decided we had had enough & needed to just kinda ditch the tour (we had been on it for 1.5 hours and the tour guide did more talking than a Politician at a debate!!!)  We wanted to see sights & all we got was STORIES... 

So we were staying at the Monteleone on Royal Street & when the tour crossed Royal street & we realized where we were we decided lets just head back that way & then all of a sudden Royal House was there & we thought, Shit lets go in... It also happened to be a Monday night when the Saints were playing Football (and us being HUGE Patriots Fans - had to go in & talk shit) 

Were seated right away, Ordered more Oysters than 2 girls should prob eat in 1 sitting. Got some drinks (as we walked in with drinks already from the tour - this is something I still miss being back home)!! 

Got some drinks, had a GREAT server - was totally a great guy & made the experience just great! 

Food was delish, Might have been one of the best places we ate the whole time in NOLA... 

Would DEF come back if in the area.  All the food was soo good. Just a real casual, Friendly place!

I love this restaurant so much I managed to eat here 3 times in 24 hours! The crab claw appetizer is ridiculously delicious. I ordered shamelessly extra bread to dunk in the incredible sauce and nearly licked my plate clean! The servers are so kind here! The oysters on the half shell as well as the grilled oysters are also to die for! Super fresh! 
I love love love this restaurant and am devastated to leave!

Very disappointed. Read great things about place and it was disappointing. Our big dinner for the night.

The staff were very nice and the waitress really sweet. 

 We got our first round drinks and the appetizers after a normal wait. The spinach dip with crab and raw oysters were delicious. The lukewarm gumbo tasted off, like a masked burnt taste. But, we watched other tables seated after us get their entree food served while we waited and waited.

Our order was forgotten. Our Redfish platter and fried alligator came out warm like it was sitting out for awhile. The Rockefeller oysters was hot. We tried cancelling our crawfish ravioli but was insisted it was coming out. By the time we were to just stand up and leave, it finally appeared. It took over an hour for it to appear. Everything was ordered at the same time and it was a let down. Our group loves to eat and drink so to only have one round of drinks and food coming out lukewarm was a huge disappointment.  We would've ordered 3-4 more rounds of drinks. Lost money there for the business.

Our waitress was sweet but seemed overwhelmed. While other tables had the big trays being carried with all their food come out, our waitress was bringing 2-3 dishes out every so often. Which is probably why some of our food was room temperature. 

Regardless, this place was a huge disappointment. We left this place hungry and sober. Not a good thing for our hungry hippo crew.

I was a bit disappointed with this place after walking by it a few times and seeing the reviews.

Pros

-The chicken burger I ordered was good
-We ordered two cocktails off the menu and both were really good!
-Our waitress was really friendly!

Cons:

-It took a really long time to get our drinks and entrees. We clocked it at taking 50 min to receive our food.
-My husband ordered a Chicken Caesar Salad that had dried chicken and way too much dressing.
-A waitress (not ours) knocked into our table by accident and dropped the condiments. Accidents happen, totally understandable, but she didn't even say sorry. She kind of just expected us to pick it up.

Favorite chargrilled oysters in the city! A good stop for oysters and cocktails when walking through the Quarter. The main food is just so so to me, but it's not terrible. I love the second floor or sitting on the bottom floor and people watching!
As always, my food was great. I visited with two out of state guest and they fell in love. Keep up the great work.

Food was great, but service was awful and slow... worst of all, unapologetic. Orders were arriving at random moments and people from the same party had to wait while others had food and others didn't. We were not alone with this observation as many other guests walked out while waiting for their food. This was a totally different experience compared to last year's dining experience. Hopefully, this was just a Halloween fluke as the chargrilled oysters were tasty.

Busy night on Halloween at the restaurant. Wait time wasn't long, ~20 mins. Service was really good, very attentive and prompt. However, food came out and was luke warm for the Taste of New Orleans platter - had to send it back to get warmed up...but only 1/3 was warmed up. My boyfriend got the seafood pescatore and the clams weren't open so we had to send that back as well. One of the clams were dead and the pasta dish was more like soup then pasta. Ordered oysters and they came out after our entrees did but they were good and really hot. Won't come back again for the food unfortunately.

A bit more overrated than Yelp lead me to believe. Food is 2, and the Staff/location/ambience is a 4.

If you're touring the French Quarter, Royal House is a likely stop by many to rest their feet and enjoy a good meal. The area is charming, it's a tourist "must try", and their location is ideal.The staff was friendly and nice, and the wait time to be seated was reasonable (20 mins for a party of 5 at 9pm). They have a menu that is sure to make most tourists happy (seafood! cajun! creole!) So why three stars?

When we vacation, we let loose. Food is always the focus of our trips, and we love trying local fare. Where Royal house fell short was with the food. My seafood pasta was just OK, with the seafood slightly overcooked and the sauce was very salty for my taste (as I found with a lot of the food in NOLA overall) for the price of $22, I considered it more of a "meh". My friends only had a few days in NOLA so they got the sampler (jambalaya, gumbo, and etouffee) to maximize delicious food. I hate to say it, but the three things they tried tasted like I could have made them from a boxed kit.

Overall, the food was just really blah, so I would not come back here on a 4 day trip that I am trying to eat all of NOLA and cram 6 meals into each day! Perhaps a stop at the bar for a drink would be a better way to take break from walking and still enjoy the atmosphere here.

Five stars for the charbroiled Oysters alone.  After we checked in we were all starving and the Royal House was walking distance from the hotel.  

Abita Amber and a full dozen charbroiled oysters please!  Just what the Doctor ordered.  Man those were good.  I'd never had them before.  Bread, bring bread at once.  This garlic butter with parmesan cheese shall not go wasted!

Shrimp po-boy was uneventful as was the chicken gumbo.  Gumbo lacked depth in flavor and had too much cayenne bite.  I make better gumbo in California with the help of one of my John Besh cookbooks.

Good service.  Thumbs up and cheers to the Royal House!

Wanted good southern sea food and found some here.

All of my food was fresh. I don't like raw oysters but I  had fried ones here that were tender and delicious. 

I had the oyster tacos which I  loved, very fresh light and tasty. I had the oyster pasta too. 

Later I had the redfish bengiets which were delicious and the crayfish ravioli which was cheesy and decent.

My service was good but slow on Saturday when they were busy. They have a remodeled upstairs and balcony which is nicer than downstairs.

I was pretty excited to try this place but it was kind of a disappointment. My friend had a taste of their shrimp and grits at a Bloody Mary festival and said they were amazing so that's why we went. Somehow, sadly they were out of shrimp and grits. So I'll never know how good they were. I checked in on here, a free appetizer popped up which I thought was awesome. We got the grab claws. The sauce was really good, but for an appetizer that would be $12 there was no way that was enough crab for that price. We were told they had the best bloody Mary's in New Orleans so we decided to give them a try. Probably one of the worse bloody Mary's I've ever had. There was extremely too much horseradish it in, I could barely drink it. We got the crawfish etouffee and crawfish ravioli to share. The portions, especially the etouffee, were extremely small for the price. The etouffee was really good, so was the ravioli but it was of cold. Cold ravioli is never too good. We got the bananas foster for dessert and it was DELICIOUS. Best thing we has there. I'd go back just to get the bananas foster. When it was time to pay our bill we found out they give locals a discount. Which is pretty awesome. BUT you can't combine the local discount and our Yelp free appetizer together. They just gave us our locals discount which ended up being more than the appetizer so that was pretty nice. Would have been nice to know that before hand. Our waitress was extremely sweet but everything took FOREVER. We were there almost two hours.

Great spot! Started with sautéed crab claws in a rue that was made to order. Came with bread to sop up the sauce after which was on point! Asked for extra bread. Went with the Jambalaya with blackened chicken. Great flavor in the jambalaya spices were aromatic. Only reason this isn't a 5 is the chicken was ever so slightly over cooked and the umbrellas on the balcony are branded Coca Cola. Small things but when the ambiance is near perfection the red and white marketing emblazoned umbrellas kill it. The service was pretty solid, everyone was professional, knowledgeable and excited about the food (which says a lot). Great place may come back before the trip is over.

What a great spot! Eating on the balcony is a fantastic experience and I highly recommend waiting to sit there. 

The service was fantastic, our server made several great food recommendations and we were checked on by multiple waiters.  

We made a reservation to go back for dinner if that's any sign of great this place is:)

I would not recommend this place at all - avoid it. They present themselves as an "oyster bar" which is why we went in, though one of my group ordered a blackened chicken sandwich. He said it was mediocre and tasted like 'overpriced bar food.' The other two of us ordered 'fresh Louisiana oysters' and it was not good. First, they don't scrub their oysters. I had silt, goop and muck all over my fingers by the time I finished a half dozen. Putting your mouth up to a dirty oyster shell that came from God knows where is troubling enough, let alone thinking about what manner of aquatic monsters might have come along with it. Beyond that, once shucked, the silt ran into the oyster juice making for a lot of grittiness in your mouth, equally unappealing. Other surprising finds: they shucked oysters but threw out the wrong side of the shell, usually you present the oyster in the deeper "cup" not the flatter top shell but several of these came presented incorrectly. One of the oysters had a dark, hard chunk visible to the eye (maybe the beginnings of a pearl? I have no idea WTF it was) and after trying to surgically remove it I told the server I'd like a different one.

On a side note, I'm used to ocean oysters and I assume these come from a river (or delta) however I've never had oysters with other mollusks growing on the shells - typically you want oysters that come from an area with a healthy exchange of water to deliver nutrients to the oysters. Having other sealife attach and thrive on the oyster shell implies they're not grown in an area of free moving water.

Last note about this place, the server was very inattentive. I think this might just be a New Orleans thing as everyone seems to operate on "island time" (for those of you who travel to the Caribbean and know what I mean): it gets done when we get it done and there is no sense of urgency. The couple at the table next to us took over an hour just to get their food and waited 30 more minutes to try to get the check. Overall, miserable place.
Loved the food and atmosphere. Waitstaff were very helpful and kind. We had the taste of New Orleans which was very good. The bread pudding is a MUST have.

Tina was such a joy. Her accent and attitude was something I'll never forget. Just wonderful. We stopped in on our way to Florida and had the taste of New Orleans and some oysters. Both were top notch!!

Visiting from California, just stopped in on whim and sat at the bar. The drinks are good, the chargrilled oysters are amazing and Ryan is the best bartender ever!!! He made our visit so awesome we came back... twice.

A must-visit location for anyone wanting AMAZING service. Our server Ashly B. Was outstanding. I would go back just for her. We went on a Saturday night around 7pm, but had a relatively short wait for a table. Ashly made it more than just a dinner, she made you feel like you were at a friend's house. From the time she first got to the table until we paid our bill, we never felt rushed even though they were extremely busy. After asking advice on several menu items, she jokingly said "I'm gonna just order for you!", I said "OK!!". I was not disappointed!! Everything she brought me was very good, but I would have to say the mahi-mahi was my favorite. Definitely planning another stop there on my next trip to NOLA.
Slow service, food was cold, husband had shrimp and grits that gave him food poisoning. Horrible!

EPIC Fail - Terrible service, awful drinks.  I am my friend ordered an Old Fashion, got muddled orange/cherry with what seemed like Sprite - absolutely zero whisky in either drink.  Sent it back, got back the same drink with a dash (like a dash of bitters dash) of whisky in the drink. Server September was absent from the floor most of the meal, asked for a spoon with the Gumbo, never got it... reminded her when she showed up with the check - but the gumbo was cold... We would have had dessert, but never were asked, so we went to Brenan's, where it was exceptional.

Stopped by for dinner while we were walking around. Saw a line and figured this place must be good. Waited 20 mins in line to get into his "oyster bar". Staff were friendly, location is great, food on the other hand. Nothing special. Every meal we had while we were in town( and we ate a lot of meals at all different restaurants) were better than this. 

The charbroiled oysters were so greasy, oysters weren't even cleaned. I don't understand how they can serve raw oysters that are so dirty. Hopefully they were just busy and forgot to clean them. The fried alligators were so tough and chewy. Again, had his in other restaurants around the area and all were much better. The taste of New Orleans which was a sampler of a few things were tasteless.
Are you north of the Mason Dixie line? do you expect drinks within 45 minutes of ordering.  Or food within an hour?  not here.  this is the definition of southern inefficiency.

Every time we walked by the royal house, the line was out the door which piqued our interest. 

We would have loved to have had a balcony table but they are few and popular. Our food goals here were to eat as much nola Cajun seafood as possible. The food was heavier than we'd ideally like but that's New Orleans style. 

What we ordered: a pound of shrimp, charbroiled oysters, and cried oysters. All were very good and heavy. 

The wait staff was polite and adorable with their southern drawls. I'd recommend the royal house for visitors wanting a good Cajun spiced New Orleans meal.

Second visit to the Royal House... had the Alligator as an appetizer which was excellent... we shared the redfish and crawfish ravioli... grilled redfish was just touch dry but the ravioli was excellent... enjoyed our 2nd Dinner in NOLA...
Started with oyster tacos and 1/2 order of raw oysters. Main dish crawfish étouffée. All were delicious.  Along with excellent service!

First night in Nola and we realllly wanted to find a good place to eat some more traditional dishes. A lot of places were packed but Royal house seemed like a good option and wasn't busy. We should've known better considering the location, but we were starving. I ordered a blackened chicken sandwich and it was chewy like it wasn't fully cooked. I tried it again and still chewy. I had my husband try it and chewy. I told the waitress (who was super nice about it) and in the end just changed the entire order bc I was afraid they wouldn't make the replacement right either. The manager came out and tried to explain that it was cooked so I wouldn't worry about getting sick but I know chicken and it didn't taste right. Anyway I changed it to the shrimp platter and it was really mediocre for the $18 they charge (think Friday's type quality). My husband got the New Orleans trio thing and wasn't very impressed either, it didn't look like their professional photos on Yelp and he feels that they must've cheapened their food. We ended up paying $50 with tip and it was SO NOT WORTH IT. the staff is nice, but the food is not good. We're huge foodies and travel the world seeking out amazing places to eat (& then I blog about it) and unfortunately this place was a disappointment.
Food is fantastic and wait staff was very friendly. Even offered a recipe of one of their dishes we liked. We had oysters, steak, seafood pasta, a few other apps. All very good.

Great food, good service. 
Oysters half shell, search Rockefeller oysters Royaleand  red beansand rice with sausage and chicken.

Char grilled oysters are a must!!!! The crab dip is pretty good as well. Save the Po boys for another place though, but definitely stop by for good service and great oysters. If it's a nice day, get a window seat and listen to the musicians outside.
Disappointed with the food. Charred Oysters had a lot of sand in them. Also had the shrimp poboy which was ok. Overall not worth 4 stars.

Today I was in New Orleans with a group of friends and was craving anything with seafood. I checked Yelp of course, and this restaurant popped up so we decided to come here. 

We came a little after 11 so it just opened so we were seated and food came very quickly. Since I checked in here, we got a free appetizer which is so awesome. I ordered the spinach dip and it was delicious! 

For my meal I was debating between the crawfish étouffée and shrimp po-boy. I finally decided on the étouffée, it tasted as good as it looked!!! I wasn't even expecting it to taste as delicious as it did. Fried crawfish and boiled crawfish was spread throughout it with white rice and an amazing crawfish sauce on top. Everyone asked to try my food because it looked that good and they thought it was great too. My boyfriend ordered fried fish and his was very good too but very very very hot so he couldn't eat it at first for a while but when he got the chance to he also liked his. My other two friends got chicken and andouille gumbo, and they thought there's was great too! Prices weren't too bad pretty normal for what you got. I definitely will be back, my food was great.

We live locally and we get the local discount and this is so we can tip the waitress this discount however the waitress needs to be deserving. We didn't even get Silverware. I mean come on!. Thankfully food is always good and it saved her ass however I tipped according to service. Sorry to the waitress but skills r skills . Either way we will always go back. One waitress won't ruin it. Food is good and u can always count on great oysters

We came to this restaurant seeing the great reviews on yelp. Started with the stuffed mushroom appetizer which was great!  We then ordered dinner. I ordered the redfish, and my partner ordered the shrimp tortellini. The tortellini came out first. After five minutes of not receiving the fish, we asked the waitress if it would be coming out soon. Her response was that the fish takes longer to cook. After we expressed that the tortellini was starting to get cold, they asked us to be patient and could not understand the concept that we wanted our food together.  The tortellini was pretty bland for being Cajun, but the redfish was great.  Would have probably given more stars if they just owned up to messing the delivery of the food up rather than telling us to be patient, as if it's not normal to eat food together.

Ambience, service, and, of course, the food was awesome and right on spot for our mood! Great place to feel the NOLA vibel Grilled and baked oysters, seafood entrees, and the Banana foster cheescake desert, all were lovely! They often have street musicians performing next to the restaurant, so if you sit on the balcony or at a window you'll be likely enjoying nice live music. We were lucky to have a couple playing violins. Great dinner experience!

Delishousness on a plate.  Friendly staff.  Tolerant of our tipsy loud party, and fun. We had five different dishes and they were ALL the bomb.  Casha was our waitress and she was also lovely.  We will be back!!!
Took an hour for 6 oysters, a po boy, a cup of gumbo and a kid's burger. Food was atrocious. Kid burger burnt to a crisp. Don't waste your time or money
Food was awesome and so was the service.  We had six in our group and we got in fast.

Took 50 min for the food to get to the table 
The staff wasn't friendly except the nice lady at the door 
Ordered a medium steak got it burned and dry 
My girlfriend ordered a Mahi Mahi got a different dish 
Will never go there again !!!!! And I recommend other people not to go there as well 
I wish they had 0 stars cause 1 star is one star to much!!!!!!
Raw oysters were GREAT!!! Boiled shrimp were a bit on the salty side due to whatever seasoning they but on top, which wasn't necessary. Ask for Melva she was the BEST server!!!  Will be back!!
One of the best Oyster Po-boys I had in NOLA!  Delicious!

You know what I love about NO, almost anywhere you go, you can find good food. This is truly one of my fav cities to eat. I was there 6 days and gained 6 pounds. Eek, glad I don't live here. 

So we picked Royal House based merely upon wanting to sit at an empty table in the corner of the balcony we spotted while walking by. We saw the perfect spot and said, That is where we need to be sitting right now as the sun sets over the French Quarter. The service was wonderful (hostess and Joseph O.) and they led us right to the spot we had sighted from the street. They gave us no trouble for our tendency to split everything, which us SoCAL gals have to do, since we are used to living on sushi and salads :)

But we are living it up in NO as everyone should do, so our first order: FISH DONUTS! Well, that's what we like to call the Redfish Beignets. Oh lord, they were good! Thank the goddess of my waistline that they don't sell these anywhere near my house. We followed that with Crawfish Ravioli and a couple of Hurricane's to wash it all down. 

Then we watched the night skies cast changing colors over the city and savored our last sips with big smiles from ear to ear.

Do not go here!  After what I'm assuming was a change of management, this restaurant was beyond disappointing.  The fried alligator was good, but took forever to come out, and the portion was about half the size of the pictures that we've seen.  Then our entrees (finally) came out, and were hilariously awful.  The worst "non-traditional shrimp and grits" that I've ever seen.  A pile of grease and parmesan cheese shouldn't qualify as Shrimp and Grits.  Not even close to what they should've been, or what had been pictured on Yelp.  The jambalaya was flavorless, as was the gumbo.  Please don't waste your time here.  We had to leave after just a few bites of our entree.  The nice and friendly staff could only go so far.  That food was a disgrace.

So disappointing!!! After the great reviews, we felt compelled to come. Our food took over a half hour to arrive, during non-busy hours (4pm) and was a New Orleans let down! Alligator app was okay, but just a few small pieces for $11. The sampler was a sad excuse for Cajun cuisine. Crawfish Etouffe was decent but the Jambalaya was flavorless, and the gumbo was watery. The shrimp and grits was the biggest disappointment as it was 2 greasy loves of fried grits, 6 quarter sized shrimp, and a greasy tomato sauce topped with Parmesan cheese. We had high hopes, and although the staff was nice and friendly, the food didn't hold up. It appears many items have changed and are definitely not as what is shown in the photos. Go to the Gumbo Shop.

VERY TIGHT SEATING!  AMAZING OYSTERS!!!  NOLA SAMPLER WAS GREAT (Jambolaya etouffee and gumbo) 

venue:
I loved this venue, it was in the corner and there was out door seating and it was very authentic.  A few feet away was a little band playing music and singing! it was very nice.

service:
our waitress was very nice! she told us what she liked and what a lot of people get!  She convinced us to get the oyster which is a must.  We had a very small table for 4 people and it was very stuffed, very annoying but she came over and took away plates and unnecessary items, WITHOUT TOUCHING THE FOOD.  a lot of waitress assume you're done and pick of the food but she did not and I appreciated that a lot. 

food:
NOLA sampler was very delicious the etouffee was my favorite.  It was not that big of a food serving to share with more than 1 person, but worth it! 

I would come back here if ever in NOLA again!
The raw oysters were 4 stars. The stuffed ones were yucky. The oyster was grilled to a shriveled hard mass, the stuffing dumped on top. There are so many better places in Nola.
Great food. Crab claws and seafood pscatore with white sauce were excellent. Kids had crayfish ravioli.

We are here on the thanksgiving day. I do appreciate that the waitresses are working on a holiday, but the service is TERRIBLE. We asked for two coffees but we only got half cup each person in a foam cup. When we ask for a refill, they said they run out of coffee. After we waited for more than half an hour for appetizer, the waitress spilled the cocktail sauce on my friends dress. Also the appetizers came cold. Then we waited for another 45 minutes for our entrees. I had my hand in the air most of the time, but all the waiters/waitresses just ignored me. Entrees came cold too :(
We had a beautiful thanksgiving brunch. The food was spectacular, and Melva took excellent care of us.

Super cold place, even though temperature outside was warm. 3 out of 6 servings went back - they were cold. Service also lacked quality big time. Looks luxerious, but dont expect anything but to have a high bill.

Very disappointing eating experience! Service was horrible, food was cold and nothing special. It was freezing inside even though it wasn't warm outside. I don't recommend going here unless you are starving, but expect to wait for a while for your food!
I had high expectations for this place, but the food literally took more than 30 minutes to come out and it was kinda cold...

We ate at the Royal House Oyster Bar our first night in town....out of the blue and no idea that it was 4 star Yelp.  Yes it is indeed tight seating.  If heat is a problem for you, see if you can either be upstairs on the patio that I never saw  LOL or near a door.

Had their char-grilled oysters.  They were a slice of heaven.  This is evidently a common way of cooking oysters in NOLA, but since it was our first sampling of them, they were to die for.  Husband had the crawfish etoufee and it was excellent.  I had the shrimp creole and it was neither here nor there.  Service was pleasant...although that was our first experience with what they call southern slow.  For us Californians with doing things at lightning speed all the time...it was tough at the start, but we got used to it in no time.

Actually came back another night and sat at the Oyster Bar and had a dozen oysters.  Not as spicy (even with the local hot sauce) but very tasty, very fresh and at a decent price!

Look, it is in a great location but that's where the positives end.  The food is below average and the bartenders don't know how to make the most basic drinks.  Spend your money and time in better place.
Great menu and a great chef. I eat here every chance I get down to the quarter. The redfish beignets  are the best thing on the menu.

Best place I have had in New Orleans. Best oysters ever and excellent service. The Rockefeller and the Grilled Oysters were to die for. Shrimp pasta was bomb and the Voodoo drink was perfect. Our server Aaron was awesome, couldn't have asked for anything better. Thank you all at the Royal House
