Great supper here.  I never made it past my crab finger appetizer as I ordered a 2nd one for my entree.  Delicious with the toasted french bread to soak up the sauce.  A side of pasta would be amazing the slather in that sauce... mmm  ; )

NEVER COME HERE. Its dirty. I'm annoyed because my table smelled like mildew, and I lost my appetite. I had a mushroom appetizer + jambalaya-- this was my first choice for my first taste of New Orleans; and it was a total disappointment. My friend bragged about this place, and said this was a must. So we had to come here, and even she was upset at how terrible the food and service were.
- Etoufee was entirely too salty to the point were it was NOT edible
- Jambalaya, salty as well-- at least edible, you will have a swollen face later from the sodium intake just in this plate alone.

Service: completely rude runners! we asked one to get the waiter for us, and he said we had to wait. Seriously? Try that in LA.  At least say "he'll be with you guys shortly" as opposed to "nah you gotta wait".
The the service was very good. Everyone is very friendly and happy. The food as well was good. We had the fried alligator as our app and the shrimp po-boy sandwich and peel And eat shrimp

Royal House is a staple of the French Quarter. It's right in the heart of it and difficult not to be lured by the ambiance and seamlessly endless amount of patrons yet not enough to keep you waiting long to be seated. The restaurant itself is very welcoming and cozy. The service was great and the quality of food was good. That being said, I do not believe the price matched the portion. It is easy to tell this place is a tourist trap. Given there are plenty of other local spots that whip up just as delicious food as you will find here, I would like to see prices dip a little to match value. Overall, Royal House is a good place to go if you're visiting the city or just want to eat lavishly in the French Quarter.
Very loud restaurant even at 2 in the afternoon.  Hard to have a conversation with company but both food and service were good.  Had the Mint Julep was delicious!
Great food and service!!! Came at 11pm on Friday night they close at midnight, no rush from staff, fresh food.  Great first experience

Came for dinner on sat around 8:45pm. Estimated 45 min wait for a party of 7. Scored a table upstairs where there's more room to maneuver. Ordered the crab claws, raw oysters, and charbroiled oysters to start. The sauce the crab claws came in was really good. Too bad I ran out of bread to soak it up in. Just wished the dish was a little hotter; it came out lukewarm. I favored the raw oysters over the chargrilled. Something about the chargrilled ones were a little too salty. The baked shrimp tortellini was a pretty heavy dish but tasted better than the taste of New Orleans. You can check-in for a free app but it was only $10 off; not the full price of the appetizer. That wasn't indicated anywhere for the check-in so a little false advertisement there. Not sure if I would come back since there's a million creole restaurants nearby.

Really nothing royal about this place, unfortunately. I thought our chargrilled oyster appetizer was pretty good, but beyond that, I was not impressed. My entree that was $16-17? was supposed to be a Chicken and Sausage Jambalaya with Shrimp but had one tiny piece of sausage and two tiny pieces of chicken, about 6 shrimp and the whole meal was room temp and pretty dry.  We heard someone at the table next to us complain about a hair in the food, but then everyone ended up laughing about it, so I guess they didn't mind all too much. Our server was very very nice so she gets the two stars. A manager did stop by our table to ask how everything was going but by then I had eaten half my dish (because I was starving) and didn't want to speak up and embarrass my friends. I would suggest that the manager perhaps taste some dishes throughout the day to make sure things are coming out of the kitchen as they should.

Nice place inside. Had a good crowd. Sat at the bar for early lunch. Staff was cool and Nairobi the bartender very good dude and excellent bartender. Char Grilled Oysters were pretty good. Not my favorite but definitely worth ordering. Their Oysters Royale however were fantastic. Loved them. Lots of locals at the bar and everyone really friendly. I'll definitely go back here

One of the best spots we've had the chance to eat at during our visit!! Our waiter, Taj, was superb! He was friendly, attentive, and humorous which we all really appreciated. He recommended the seafood pasta dish but with a twist to the sauce, and it was absolutely amazing!! I had the Taste of New Orleans, which came with jambalaya, gumbo, and creole. It was a good option, but hands down the best dish out of all of our orders was the shrimp and grits...all I can say is - get it, you won't regret it!

This has been my favorite place to eat in NOLA, so much so that we had to stop here again before our flight back home. On our first visit here we had the oysters, crab legs, and pasta. Honestly, we only came back here for the crab legs. Trust me. Worth it. Today on our second visit, they told us they were out of the crab legs because of the high demand. Distraught, we decided to go ahead an order the gators and some more pasta. After hours of prayers and an abundance of hope, our server, Leah, came back and said that the crabs came in and that we could still order them. . If you're fortunate enough to come here You will not regret it. The service is awesome and the food is absolutely to die for. Leah, you made our last restaurant stop perfection before our trip back to NY. If i could give 6 stars I would.

Off the chain!!!  Crab claws in sauce (appetizer) were amazing! Fried oyster tacos were so great my friend can't wait to go back and we're only here for 5 days. Crawfish etouffe was terrific. Gumbo was great...everyone in my group of 5 raved about their dinners. Waitstaff was very helpful and not at all fazed when we had an extra person show up unannounced to our group of 5. Very cool balcony seating for groups of 2 in addition to main floor dining. Highly recommended!

The shrimp poboy was nothing special, but the sides were on point. The dirty rice was so delicious and we got the eggplant chips as our free app for checking in on Yelp and those were also delicious. I'd deviate from the shrimp poboy for sure - try something else as your entree.

We were in town for a wedding and had one night that wasn't scheduled so we decided to try this place with friends. We met there and had to wait an extra 30 minutes than original time so that was the first strike. Once sat, we ordered the appetizer, spinach and artichoke dip; which was the best part of the meal.

The shrimp and grits were out which was disappointing so I ordered the mahi mahi. My husband ordered burger and then his friend ordered the sampler. We were all underwhelmed and disappointed. Then, came the check which wasn't split out correctly so we mentioned the split. After waiting 20 minutes, we got the "corrected" check and it was still wrong but we had to meet the wedding party out.

I was pretty upset since it  was our only meal out and I have heard great things about New Orleans cuisine. If I am ever back to the city, I will try a different place and I recommend you do the same.

The food is consistently delicious! Recommend the oysters any way they're prepared, crab claws and alligator. The grilled red fish is tasty as well. Melva was our server yesterday. She was fantastic! We never wanted for anything because Melva took such good care of us.

This is my favorite establishment to hang out in NOLA. The food is excellent and the staff is great. I live in Arizona and am therefore unable to get fresh oysters. I would of course recommend both the raw oysters and char-grilled oysters. The crab claws are exceptional as well. Everything I have tried from the extensive menu has been delicious. I highly recommend this restaurant.

We went looking for a good bloody mary and we found it here. Fresh, house tomato juice (including a little horseradish), just spicy enough, vodka infused with pickled olives, onions, roasted red peppers and green beans, pickled green onions (that also garnish the drink). Has a slight tanginess from the vegetables that made it Delicious!  (The fried gator appetizers were also perfect.)

We enjoyed the food we had. Service wad good! Ended up sending a dish back after waiting over 30 minutes for it but still left with a positive outlook. The way the delayed food was handled was wonderful.

Nice to see a few old favorites in the FQ still deliver!
Nice folks, great food and a balcony seat. Thanks gang for having a reliable spot year after tear
Excellent restaurant. The crab claws appetizer is the best thing you will ever put in your mouth.

Amazing service, friendly staff and delicious Cajun cuisine. Oscar made us amazing drinks and our waitress Ashley B. made us feel welcomed. During my visit to NOLA for two days I ate twice, something uncommon for me. Definitely recommend the Baked Oysters.

The food was extremely tasty. The crab claws are to die for. We dunked everything in our meal in the sauce. LOL I had the shrimp creole, which wasn't as seasoned or as spicy as I'm used to Creole shrimp being, but it was good. My husband got the shrimp platter and the deep fried shrimp was great. The coleslaw the platter came with was different, but tasty. Good meal, but you will spend a pretty penny.

We went here with a large group for our trip trip to New Orleans. We got a wide variety of things for our meals. Everything was super delicious and I would definitely go back. Absolutely my favorite spot so far!
Waitress was fine. Food was fine. Kitchen was extremely slow. It took them 30 minutes to prepare our order. Food was not good enough to come back given the slow service.

We had a very nice dinner here on a Saturday night. We walked right in around 7:30 and got a table for 5. Most of the other oyster places we were looking at had massive lines out the door, but we didn't want to wait. I was a little worried this place wouldn't be very good since there wasn't a huge line, but I was wrong. Everything was delicious! The crawfish ravioli was excellent, my blt oyster po boy was perfect, and the person I was with who ordered raw oysters said they were the best he'd ever had. Our server, Orin, was great! He was our favorite server from the whole trip. He was more than accommodating, very friendly and funny, helped with suggestions, and made sure everything was right on our bill. I would definitely go back here. I can't imagine the places with an hour+ wait time could be that much better than this. It was a pretty excellent experience.
Holy hell!  Great bsr, great service, friendly bartender schucking oue oysters in front of us, killer oysters...lookin at menu, back tomorrow for lunch.  Nairobi is the man!!

The Royal House is a place we come back to every time we visit NOLA.  Oysters alway fresh and delicious every way they prepare them.  Beer cold and cocktails mixed perfectly. Royal St is one of the best locations. Service friendly and helpful too.

As for the one reviewer that complained about mildew smell ... this is NOLA .... every thing smells of mildew ... humidity !!!!
Good food, good service! I've had the alligator Po Boy and the red beans with andouille sausage and rice, and both were very good

We ordered The Taste of New Orleans, which comes with samples of New Orlean's three most famous dishes. The gumbo and jamba had an amazing smoky flavor the last sample had a really rich creamy tomato-infused taste. We also ordered the stuffed mushrooms and oh my gosh, they were soooooooooo good I'm crying. They were rich and cheesy -- so delicious!

Also the atmosphere is fantastic. The walls on the sides facing the street even open up during the day so that you can watch all the street action/listen to live music all while eating delicious food. A+ for the ambiance!

This is a must in NOLA. I highly recommend this place. It is clean and the service is great. I got an oyster Po Boy and it just melted harmoniously in my mouth. It's very affordable as well. The ambience, food, and the service were all great!

Ordered the Oyster Duo and Crawfish Ravioli. Asked for marinara sauce instead of the creamy sauce that comes with the ravioli which the waitress happily was able to sub. Bread pudding for dessert. All the dishes were delicious and the waitress, whose name I unfortunately forgot, was lovely.
Average food, expected much more from a "New Orleans" staple. Go elsewhere if you want quality a Cajun, or seafood experience
Hit the spot!! Red beans and rice were delicious and husband had shrimp po boy that was excellent!
Yamini is the best! We are here with a baby and she made our lunch great. Try the crab and the chargrilled oysters.
The Royal House was great!  We had the chargrilled oysters and they were delicious. The fried eggplant and oysters were really good too. September was our server and she did a great job.

This place was right next to our hotel so we gave it a try, and were so pleased we ended up going back multiple times on our trip. The wait staff was very personable and knowledgeable about the menu, the atmosphere was very upbeat, and the food was to die for. I hate oysters, however I tried one of their chargrilled oysters just to see, and it was so good I promptly ordered a dozen more. If you haven't had their chargrilled oysters you haven't lived!

Horrible service but good food.  It took forever for a server to come to our table and even longer to bring our drinks.  The grilled oysters were very good as was the oyster tacos.  Good food, but be prepared to wait.

My husband and I skipped breakfast which was a huge mistake. By the time noon rolled around, we were starving.   We happened to walk by here and decided to stop in. 

 I had the blackened chicken with fries and a hurricane. My husband ordered oysters and the taste of New Orleans. Overall everything was very flavorful and we enjoyed our meal. 

I didn't go with five stars because it is pricey. Our server was extremely nice but everything was very slow. It also bugged me that our oysters came out after our meal.
The crawfish ravioli was really good~ although, it can be a little heavy. I would still get it again. Inside of the crawfish ravioli, is also stuffed crab meat!

Absolute disappointment. Not sure if the chef had a bad day or if I've spoiled myself with other places.

We ordered a dozen charbroiled oysters and also jambalaya. We also checked in to get crab claws.

First thing's first, the crab claws were delicious but if you're hoping to redeem your Yelp check in make sure you realize it only covers up to $10. We were not made aware of the fact until later, though our waiter was more than aware that we had to order two entrees. Feels a bit uneasy to be slighted as such.

For the entree, they were very mediocre. For the same price you can have the absolute most delicious charbroiled oysters at Acme(biggest fan). Here I'm not sure what I ate. Melted butter with garlic? Couldn't taste any of the grill. This is the way I would have prepared it at my house, but I'm also not spending $17 on a dozen.

For the jambalaya, I tasted a bit and realized that it was not what I hoped. To be honest the Jambalaya at Popeye's would have been better than what I ate here. Bland and mushy shrimp. Very off putting. 

Final words? Just avoid this place. Do yourself a favor and go to Acme for oysters and as for jambalaya, I'm still looking.

I headed to this place after reading the stellar reviews on Yelp. On reaching this restaurant, I found it half empty around dinner time. The only good thing about this place was that we were seated immediately. We ordered the jambalaya and the charbroiled  oysters. 

The oysters were sub par compared to the ones I had at ACME oyster house but were the same price($20/dozen). ACME had converted me to an oyster lover with their amazing charbroiled oysters and I expected a similar quality but was disappointed.

The jambalaya was also lackluster. It lacked flavor and was a major let down. Sadly, I've had better food back in California. 

Bottom line, visit this place if you want to pay exorbitant prices for mediocre food.

After such positive reviews on Yelp, I wanted to give this place a try and not go to my usual spot. The hostess for this place is outside and seated us inside as soon as we walked up-- we came on a week day before 4pm (not so crowded). After we were seated the hostess did not come to our table for 10 minutes. When she finally came to our table she quickly came by and rushed our drink order. It was another 5 minutes before she came by for our food order, and it seemed as if she didn't want to be there and just wanted to rush us. I tried the house gumbo that came out fast, and it was pretty good-it was sausage  and meat based, with no seafood--but not my favorite gumbo in New Orleans. Our problems came when waiting for the food. It was over 20 minutes and our waitress kept saying it was coming but it never came and we saw other tables receive their food that came after us. We finally stopped a manager and asked her to check on our food. She did and told us only five more minutes (on top of the 20 minutes). Five more minutes and no food. I was really hungry and it was not that busy, so I did not want to stay any longer. I asked a second manager for the check because the food never came and I just wanted to pay for the gumbo and go. He asked us what the issue was and I told him our food had not come after waiting so long and our waitress has not come back by, noticing our food had taken a long time. After the second manager, the waitress finally stopped by and still pretended like everything was normal. We told her we were ready to go. The manager finally came, back to our table after the food arrived--which I no longer wanted--to let us know he took care of the gumbo. I'm not sure why he had to make use wait any longer and could not tell us when he first stopped by. The food did look delicious but the service here dropped their ratings all the way down to a one. This is one more restaurant in NOLA that I gave a try, but I won't be coming back to.

I'm giving it 2.5 stars. We were seated in less than 10 minutes on the balcony. We had a great view and listened to beautiful live music from a lovely gentleman across the street. 

It went downhill from there. It took at least 10 minutes to get water and another 15 minutes for the stuffed mushroom appetizers. It tasted good. The entrees took another 20 minutes to arrive. The couple behind us also complained about the VERY SLOW food service. My seafood pescatore was ok. The linguine was overcooked instead of al dente. The red sauce lacked flavor. The shrimp jambalaya was ok. The same goes for the bread pudding. Overall, the food was mediocre.

We chose this place because of the proximity to our hotel and the average 4 star ratings. However the only things exceeding our expectations was the view and live music.
Everything was great! We ordered the Taste of New Orleans, raw oysters, and crab claws. Ate every bite of it!

In a nut shell: We would give it another try. 

5***** Ctab claws app free with check in (any app up to $10). Sauce was amazing, muy husband ate it with a fork once the bread was gone. They would have brought more had he asked. 

3*** Seafood precope in the scampi sauce instead of marinara as suggested by our waiteress. It lacked seasoning and that was odd. A little salt and pepper helped. Shells in two separate bows of sauce makes it hard to enjoy. 

 4 **** Pecan crusted Mahi Mahi. Don't be afraid if the pecans, you won't taste them like you think. The lemon butter crystal sauce is drinkable. Beans were ok. Potatoes were amazing. 

To get to 4 stars they would need to season more appropriately. Take care to ensure no shell fragments are in the sauces. We would give it another try. 

ALL of the staff was amazing.
wonderful nice ambiance in the French quarter. The oysters and dishes were amazing.

With the multiple negative reviews in the last 24 hours, I can't help but to think they are having some weird transition.  But my god, worst choice to eat in New Orleans during our week stay.

We chose this place with the thousands of reviews and an average of 4 stars plus the free appetizer and we were starving! We came here around 2:45 pm on a Thursday.  We were seated immediately on the balcony. It was not very crowded. It took about 10 minutes to get a menu and the waitress asked us if we wanted a menu...uh yeah? On top of that, it took another 20 minutes for her to take our food orders and drink orders at the same time. We ordered two diet cokes, oyster tacos (free app), alligator po boy, and blt oyster po boy. Still no diet cokes.

I had finally just gone up to the bar to get the two diet cokes after not being given a beverage in 45 minutes of being there. The bartender apologized yet our waitress seemed unphased. 

We had contemplated leaving, but decided to wait it out. It was cold outside so we decided to grab an inside table, not that our waitress seemed to care. About 55 minute of being there we got our free oyster tacos. Definitely NOT tacos but 4 fried oysters on top of 4 small chips.  It was good, but hardly an appetizer.

Over an hour being there we finally got our food. It was hard to enjoy after such an annoying experience. I would have more sympathy if the people who worked there seemed to care but they really didnt. After tax it was about 43 for drinks and food...felt like we shouldn't have gotten charged for barely getting a soft drink.

Many other places to try than this place. We saw the manager hiring a few new people so seems like they will be in transition for awhile.

We went for drinks and apps. The crab claws do not disappoint. Like anything else in New Orleans, it's loaded with sodium, but the sauce was divine and leaves you wanting more French bread than the four pieces they provide.

Sit at the bar and enjoy they attention of a great bar staff and good company from around the globe.

We had quite the experience at this restaurant on our last day in New Orleans. Keep in mind, I rarely write reviews and I'm not that picky when it comes to food. We were waiting a while for our food to arrive and the table next to us received a meal that looked just like our order. They were confused and started looking around. No waiters in sight. They looked at us and were like YUP thats ours. They kindly passed the food over to us. We got the oyster tacos to start and the gumbo. The gumbo was cold, and the tacos we not on actual tortillas but instead on stale tortilla CHIPS. We didn't want to bother our waitress so we ate both anyways. Later we got the oyster BLT and the shrimp po boy. The shrimp all had little fecal trails in them. Still ate it. Then I discovered a curly black hair sticking out of the sandwich. That crossed the line for me and I gave it back. Our waitress was nice about everything though and that was the only good part of this experience. I don't see how this place has so many good reviews.

Worst shrimp po boy

Dry bread, little salad and some fried shrimp pieces

Driest sandwich ever

Wait staff super nice but other than that the whole place is a mess

A true mess.

We waited about five minutes to get seated for the group of five, and we were seated upstairs. Our server was really friendly and gave us a quick rundown of the menu, and we got the crawfish beignet as an appetizer from the checking on Yelp. Apparently the appetizer isn't free like the Yelp check-in says but it's -$10 for whatever appetizer you get. Anyway, we ordered a bunch of food including two platters of oysters, and we then we started waiting. And waiting. After maybe twenty minutes, our first platter of oysters came, closely followed by the second plate. We noticed the second plate wasn't what we ordered so we asked the waiter who took it back. We then waited for another twenty or thirty minutes for our food, and our entrees came. Our oysters never did. We told the waiter and he said there was a mixup and our oysters were given to the table next to us. The manager came by afterward and told us that she'd give us two orders of what we got on the house (too bad I don't really eat oysters). So I ate my crawfish etouffee and it was quite good. A bit salty, but good. Nice spicy flavor and a good amount of crawfish, both fried bits on top and in the sauce. I asked for more bread as well so I could soak up the sauce. I quite enjoyed that dish. When the oysters finally came after we had already all finished our meal (this was probably another 10-15 minutes), the Rockefeller oysters came and I tried one. Way too much cheese on top! Otherwise I think ok as far as oysters go. Then we asked for the check do which also took at least five minutes to get here. My crawfish dish was $17 pre-tax which is a bit pricey, and combined with the mixup and the super long waiting times, I wouldn't suggest coming here. The waiter apologized many times for the mixup which is fine, but it doesn't excuse the super long wait times for our main entrees. To be fair, my food (the crawfish etouffee) was quite good and deserves 4 stars, but the long long long wait and inefficiencies (I'm excusing the mix-up with the oysters because there was a miscommunication which I understand happens - what isn't excusable is how long we waited for our entrees/other dishes, the check, etc etc) subtracted 1 star.

Royal house is fabulous! Perfect location, cute decor and even better service. We came here for lunch and got sat right away by their nice general manager. Our server was super attentive and really cared about making our dining experience the best. The general manager even honored our coupon on Yelp! So great! We will definitely be back!
Woohoo. Love it. NOLA restaurant with character and taste. Beautiful dining areas albeit somewhat cramped.

Service was mediocre. Had to ask manager for things like silverware, napkins and condiments. The food took quite and bit and when it did arrive, we got the wrong order! We werent in a rush so we waited patiently. Food was good when it finally came out.

Yes yes yes! First restaurant I went to in NOLA for my trip this time and it was perfect. We arrived at 10PM and even though they close at 11PM, they were able to accommodate a large group extremely quickly and were very friendly about taking us in. We were seated in the back of the restaurant and it smelled a little funky, but we were happy just to find a place. 

Food: 9/10
-Crab Claws: THESE WERE AMAZING. If you check in with Yelp, you get a free appetizer with the purchase of two entrees at a table so we redeemed this with the offer and it was the best part of the meal. The sauce had incredible, fresh, spiced flavor and was a perfect consistency. It came with bread to dip in the sauce and the crab claws were small and easy to eat (already cracked so nothing messy to deal with). Would highly recommend this!
-Taste of New Orleans (Jambalaya, Crawfish Étouffée, and Gumbo): A really good sampling platter of staple NOLA foods. The gumbo was definitely my favorite and helped tone down the spices of the other two. All three foods go very well together and balance out all of the flavors. It also is a good serving size where you will be full, but not uncomfortably so. It's a lot of rice though so be prepared for that, and they also give you three slices of toasted bread to go with it so it's very carb-heavy.
-Seafood Pescatore: Absolutely delicious. Really good variety of seafood inside of it, nice cream-based sauce, and good portion size as well. It wasn't too heavy or greasy like a lot of other seafood pastas end up being. My friend ordered this and I had a few bites - almost wished I had ordered this instead! 

Service: 9/10
-Very fast, accommodating, and friendly.
-Really decent pricing.

Atmosphere: 7/10
-Felt a little unclean and smelled a little weird (maybe like...old seafood). 
-Lively and bright inside.

Loved this place, thought the food was very well-seasoned and cooked, and would definitely return again!
Very convenient to our hotel, and the food is good.  We always sit at the bar, and the service has been friendly and good both upstairs and down.

Lunch on Royal. I passed this place several times and decided to dine in. Silly of me I didn't know the balcony was open so we took a seat downstairs near the window and watched the passing entertainment. The staff was friendly. Food was salty. 
Appetizer:
1. crab fingers- way to saucy. And all of the claws didn't have meat on it. On the salty side.
2. French onion soup- salty but tasty and piping hot. The way soup should be with a nice crusted cheese topping.
Lunch:
1. Char grilled lobster- nice cheesy and garlicky, but once again to salty. And one of them had a raw taste to it.
2. Royal house salad- this was my healthy snack and it was good. Lots of spinach, cranberry candied walnuts and cheese. Nice and light topped with perfectly cooked pan seared scallops.
3. Sweet and salty crab legs- seasoned with Old Bay. Also had a side of corn and potatos. This was good. 
My margarita was okay. No salt. Low on the alcohol.

Royal house was just ok for me. I would advise you to be careful if you have high blood pressure

The spinach dip rice and beans was delicious. Very polite servers and very accommodating. It lost a star for slow service. It could have been cuz it was Christmas week and they may have had people out on leave. Make sure you are not on a timeline if you want to eat here. Highly recommend the food!

Food was delicious but the price for a tiny soup was a bit disappointing.
Overall the service was spot-on great.

Great staff. Good cheesecake banana foster. Red beans and rice with fried chicken strips was unique and tasty, but skip the crawfish étouffée. The crawfish was heavily batter, fried and sitting on top. Wait time was reasonable and atmosphere was casual compared to other places in the area for a holiday weekend.

Attention! This place has a strict ID policy, so even if you are 46, and you look it, you will not be able to have an adult beverage without at least a photocopy of your ID.

We started with crab claws in garlic butter. Very tasty, with plenty of French bread for mopping up the sauce. We got $10 for an app for checking in, so they were practically free. A nice aperitif instead of the cocktails we aren't having ;)

We followed with a shrimp po boy and crawfish ravioli. The po boy was ok, a bit dry, but to be fair I am not really sure what constitutes a good one. Seemed to come out of the kitchen pretty quick so maybe it is assembly line food.  The ravioli was good. It was stuffed with ricotta and topped with a crawfish sauce which really tasted of the "holy trinity". I am a newcomer to Creole food, and was pleased with this choice. Not overly seasoned but schmecks nonetheless.

The specialty of the house is oysters, but I am not a oyster lover so I can't speak to that. Nice atmosphere, away from the lunacy of Bourbon St. I would eat here again and a) bring my ID, and b) try something different on the menu.
great food, no waiting at all. The rice is a little dry and hard, but the dish overall tastes excellent. The free appetizer in yelp is a $10 reward, which is nice. Very fresh oysters.

Great atmosphere but the food is not up to par. A member of my party ordered oysters and they never even came to the table. My caprese had onions on it. It also had balsamic dressing on it instead of balsamic vinegar. Great location and setting that was waste of potential.

We were in NOLA the last week of December and had a blast!! One of the first places we went to was the Royal House because we wanted to sit on the balcony and have drinks. The drinks were good overall. They didn't bug us to order food because we were just taking it all in at that point.  Because they were so nice to us, we went back for dinner a couple nights later. We sat on the balcony again. Great service, good food. I had the shrimp and grits and enjoyed them. I wouldn't say excellent but it was good. My husband had the sampler and it was ok. The crawfish etoufee was awesome though. Try that for sure. Overall though because we were in NOLA and sitting on the balcony, it was perfect.

Just mediocre food at a high price.  Oyster blt was cold and not good.  Only had 4 oysters on the Po boy no tomatoes or pickles.  The Po boy was 6 inches for $18.00.  If you want a great Po boy in New Orleans 14 inches for $15.00 you should take a ride out to Castnet Seafood.

This is a touristy and expensive French Quarter spot but they're open late and their seafood is cooked perfectly! 


What more could you ask for?! 

The portions were generous, the flavors delightful and I left with a full stomach and ready to consume more hurricanes to stay warm on the chilliest day of the year.

Went there for dinner on New Years Eve based on the positive reviews. Wow Yelpers really have this one wrong. I was in New Orleans for a week & ate out 2-3x/day & this is hands down the worst place I ate at during my entire vacation. 
Started out with chargrilled oysters & oysters royal. The oysters came out lukewarm, cheese on the oysters royal had already coagulated, not "bubbly" per the menu. The chargrilled oysters did not have any chargrill flavor at all, it tasted as if they were just baked in the oven. We had chargrilled oysters just the day before & what we had was way better than what we got at Royal House. 
Our entrees included the shrimp jambalaya & the pecan-crusted mahi mahi. I'm sorry but what I got was not mahi mahi nor was it pecan crusted. I don't normally eat fish but when I do I tend to order the mahi mahi because of the mild taste & flaky texture, so I know what mahi mahi tastes like. I was expecting a 2 inch thick filet crusted with noticeable pecan pieces. No, I got a 1/4 inch thin filet that was just battered. I thought I was given the wrong dish that I asked 2 staffers if I got the right dish, of which they said I did. The mahi mahi was the fishiest tasting mahi mahi I had ever had in my life. The batter did not have any pecan taste to it. The "chef's vegetable" that came with the dish turned out to be soggy, overly salty green beans that have probably been sitting in a warm brine bath all day. I think the reason why they top the fish with the creamy shrimp sauce is to help hide the fishy taste of the mahi mahi; well it didn't work for me. 

Their bloody mary was also the worst we had in the city - basically tasted like we were drinking Worcestershire sauce straight. 

Our waitress probably picked up on my dissatisfaction because she didn't even offer us the dessert menu. I ate as much as I could tolerate then got the heck out of there. I cannot believe the price I paid for that dinner, it was not worth it. 

Maybe the chef had a bad night or I just ordered the wrong food. This is my experience and if I ever go to New Orleans again, I will not eat there.

Came for late lunch/early dinner and was seated immediately, next to the bar with a view facing the street via open windows. Friendly, attentive staff here with a very packed, loud bar with TV's and seating area so it might be difficult for larger parties to be accommodated.

Crawfish Étouffée is one of my very favorite dishes to eat and their version included tons of boiled AND fried crawfish on top (which was something new and completely different to me) with a generous serving of rice and a few pieces of French bread. This absolutely hit the spot and was very satisfying. I would order it again in a heartbeat! Great flavor and so delicious.

My friend had the French onion soup and I also ordered raw oysters which were fairly priced considering this restaurant falls more on the touristy side. Would come back here to try some more of their other offerings, but so many other places in the area to try. New Orleans, the city of great eating!

Very good dinner. Raw oysters were huge, fresh and Britney. Excellent. Best part of the dinner. Oysters Rockefeller were also good. Crawfish  Etouffe was decent but not a lot of Crayfish in it. Wife enjoyed the blackened redfish. Would recommend.

Was recommended to come here from a local guide. Its right in the heart of the touristic French Quarter. Excellent food, excellent service (thanks Ashley!) 

I highly recommend this place to all locals and tourists in town!
Atmosphere is pretty cool. I had the shrimp and grits, it wasn't the best ever but it was ok. Our waiter was super nice though.

CraZy long waiting time and super slow service. Not happy at all!!! The food is ok here (not so good but not bad also). However, oh my god we waited more than an hour to get the food. We only ordered appetizers. I can not believe that we wasted so much time in this Restaurant. Not happy.

Tried it for the second time and it was worth it. The eggplant Parmesan with oysters was really good. It was a bit light on the oyster part but the rest was probably one of my top three meals on bourbon street.
Great food! Awesome drinks. Melva was our server and she was awesome. Perfect timing, happy, hard working lady! Will def come back. Atmosphere is second to none!

The service was lacking and they were out of everything. No mimosas. No bloody mary's. No crab claws. No shrimp and grits. I finally ordered the red beans and rice. It was supposed to come with fried chicken strips, but it came with fish instead. Our food took FOREVER to come out. After about 30 minutes, the waitress said she would check on it, but she obviously didn't because we asked her again after another 15 minutes and the food came right out. The food was amazing, but the prolonged wait and the lack of menu items was horribly disappointing. How does one run out of mimosas?!

I really really don't know where all of these 4 and 5 stars are coming from. I'm going to chalk it up to out of town people that really don't know good seafood or service. I am from the south so my expectations are high for service and seafood. We arrived around 2 on a Sunday and was promptly greeted and seated. The waitress was dealing with another customer so she told us she would be with us shortly. We looked over the menu and waited for awhile before she returned. I chalked it up to her being a tad busy so i wasn't upset. We had time to look over the menu several times so we went ahead and placed our order, everything from drinks, apps to entree. We settled on the oyster duo with a side of crawfish etoufee and the shrimp platter with a side of gumbo. We also ordered the oyster tacos as a app. 

We were seated on the balcony and we talked as we people watched. The app came fairly quickly and it consistents of 4 taco chips with oyster and slaw on top of them. I don't know how that can be classified as taco not nacho but to each its own. The app was pretty good, although i could taste the grit from the oyster. The overall taste was a good starter. 

This is where the meal goes downhill. We waited for over 40 mins on our meal. I watched a second line come and go. I listened to at least 5 songs from the street performers. I even watched a lady raise money for her little pig. One thing i didn't see was any food coming to my table. We finally asked the waitress how much longer. Her response was let me go downstairs and check. Well low and behold, her comes our meal. 

The oysters were room temp so they must have been sitting there. The etoufee was meh. The gumbo was pretty good and the shrimp platter was so not worth the price. I was so disappointed that i waited for this meal. 

Unless i am starving and drunk  and everything else is close i will never be back. Even if i was starving i would come out better walking miles for something else, i probably would get something hot and in a faster time.

Amazing service with the New Orleans flavor.  We started with the Chicken And Sausage Gumbo, not to shabby just the right spicy,  NexGen  Oysters on a half shell.  Mowed those down slippery when wet status. Horse radish and red sauce to gulp them down.  My wifeeee had a Creole shrimp meal ,  Wow  I finished it for her, that good.  I had the sea food pescator with linguini and garlic.  That's a meal I will have everyday in heaven because that's where it took me.  5 star all the way.  Our Server is also 5 star 100% matter as fact he needs a raise, thank you Joeseph.

One of the best restaurants in New Orleans! We stumbled across this gem while looking for a place to grab a drink and appetizer. We ordered the oysters and Shrimp Alfredo. It was amazing. We actually came back the second night. The second night I decided to try the New Orleans sampler/trio. It came with a small bowl of jambalaya, crawfish Etouffee and gumbo. Overall it was good with the exception of the gumbo. I usually enjoy gumbo, but the gumbo here was not good. We also had the eggplant chips. They were small pieces of Eggplant, lightly breaded and fried with alfredo and marinara sauce to dip.

A friend of mine recently went to visit New Orleans and we recommended that she check out the Royal House. She went and shared that it was a great experience for her as well!
I had such a great dinner here.  The service was fantastic, the waitress made me feel like family. The crab claws were off the charts.
This place is great. Lots of tables by the open windows, great music, and the best oysters I've had. Melva, our server, was so kind and friendly, that alone was worth the trip in.

We like this place so much that we came back two times. We read previous yelpers and decided to give it a shot.

Melva was our server the second time around. We got amazing service. We came back for the crab claws. Those were the most amazing appetizers ever! Oysters we so fresh and large.

The French onion soup is very good as well  so far the best one we've had in Nola.

I'll say that I was somewhat disappointed by this restaurant even though it had great reviews. The food had extremely high salt content and the flavors didn't particularly standout. My friends and I were basically all chugging water the entire time because of how salty everything was.

- Fried alligator: good -- essentially tastes like popcorn chicken.

- Stuffed mushrooms: good -- the crab and shrimp stuffing was tender and well marinated.

- Taste of New Orleans: the standout here was the crawfish etouffe. The soup was very creamy and rich. Could have been better if it had more pieces of crawfish. The jumbalaya was downright disappointing. It mostly consisted of rice, without any meat or vegetables. The flavoring was the type without tomatoes. The gumbo also tasted somewhat odd and was too heavily spiced. 

- Crawfish ravioli: probably my favorite dish out of all the ones we tasted. The pasta was well cooked and the entire dish was very creamy and cheesy.

- Shrimp creole: basically was just rice in tomato sauce -- I understand that that is what shrimp creole is, but the flavor was one-dimensional.

- Fried shrimp: honestly just so salty it was hard to eat more than a couple of piece.

Atmosphere: Rowdier and louder than I expected. The atmosphere is very casual, with a ton of TVs showing sports games. The website looks very sophisticated in comparison to the restaurant itself.

Service: Was pretty slow. First, the food took a really long time to come out, second it was hard to get ahold of our waitress for water refills or anything else.
Can not say enough great things about this place food service in the best.. I will definitely return every time when I visit NO

Wife and I came here around 4 pm. We were seated immediately and our server Ty was quick to greet us with a big smile. My wife had the crawfish etoufe and I had the fried fish, gator for an appetizer. The food came out quickly and tasted very fresh and hot.  

We are giving this place a 5 star beacase of TY.  While the food was great, Ty was even more awesome.  He was so friendly and welcoming, was very knowledgeable of the menu, and seemed like an overall genuine person.  If you eat here, I would recommend asking for Ty if he is working that day

I'm a bit disappointed by this 2k+ reviews and 4 star restaurant. We spent about $60 between the two of us, ordering a variety of dishes (charbroiled oysters, New Orleans sampler, fried alligators, and shrimp and grits.) Each of them were about 3 stars or less, especially given the price tag. The only one that tasted fresh and worth it was the fried alligators. The charbroiled oysters were over cooked and slightly hard, the New Orleans sampler came less than lukewarm with not so impressive flavors (and I feel like I can say this because I had over 5 gumbos during our NOLA trip!), and the shrimp and grits came with small shrimps (not prawns as shown in the picture from 2 years ago) and fried grits. So.. Overall, I can't give this place more than 3 stars. There are much better places to dine in New Orleans.

3.5-4 stars. Love the location, the vibe, the character and the slight indoor/outdoor nooks to dine in (which is recommended).  

Good menu and Bev selection. Service can be a hit and miss - took a lil while to get up to speed., but our server was most pleasant.  

The gumbo looked Devine (which was enjoyed by our table mates). We dove in and greazed on the char'd  oysters which were ---  ddeeeeeelliiighhhhttffuuull! (And sinful).    

Worth a stop...

Ask for the balcony!!! Loved the view! And great oysters too!
The service is perfect!
They may not have the most juicy oysters but the view is definitely worth it!

We  waited in line for about 30 minutes before going in.  But it was ok because there was a woman performing on her violin across the street.  She was amazing and made our night wonderful (if she was on yelp she'd get 5/5 stars!)

We were seated upstairs and inside but were able to move out to the balcony.  It was such a beautiful night and we really enjoyed the ambient.

The Food:
The chargrilled oysters were delicious.  Unfortunately we did not enjoy the other dish (and I don't even remember what it was....)

The Drinks:
The drinks were 'eh'-not great and very expensive.    

The server was friendly and accommodating however, out of all we ate and did in NOLA this place was the most expensive and the least favorite.
Server was very friendly and courteous. Food was okay

Great food and great service.  I've had the Red Beans and Rice and the alligators po-boy. Both were fantastic. Melva was the best server and full of recommendation of what to do in New Orleans.  I will definitely be back.

Been to NO for the 4th time and our group of 8 was lured in by an employee standing at the front door. We ordered appetizers, entrees and cocktails. Our apps never showed up until our entrees were brought out... food trickled out to the table within 30 minutes of each other... no apologies.... poor service and food experience. No thank you!!!!!! We will never revisit this place. Do not recommend at all! No concern for guests' experiences  due to the heavy flow of customers.
Ty- was the best server!! We had a group of 17 and the service was amazing and the food was fantastic!

Made a beeline for gumbo as soon as I landed. Was not disappointed. Had chicken and andouille sausage, added shrimp. Loved the broth. Spicy! French bread that came with was fresh. Apparently famous for their oysters here. They had over 500 delivered while I was dining.

Amazing food and services from this eatery. Melva attended to my table and she was attentive and considerate. Ordered quite a number of things, and instead of just putting in all the order, she waited for me and my cuzz to finish what we ate to decide if we still wanted more. 
And the food, LOVED IT! It was affordable and great!
This place has great food! Literally everything I ate was super delicious and authentic! Classic food served well, cooked to perfection with super yummy sauces, this place really rocks!
The oysters are AMAZING. Huge and delicious. We had the shrimp and grits and crawfish ravioli. It wasn't terribly busy.

The waiter, JB was full of life and amazing energy. All of our dishes were delicious, especially the blackened oysters! Staff was friendly and welcoming. JB even recommended some great jazz bars in the area. We stopped in the next morning for their to-go bloody Mary's too!

Great customer service! Stopped by while we were strolling around and we're immediately seated. We had the charbroiled oysters with bacon and crab meat and they were to die for!I've never had oysters so good before. We also had the fried fish platter and the red beans with rice and they were both delicious. It's our first time in New Orleans and we couldn't have asked for a better restaurant to stop and have lunch

I went  here Monday night and got seated on the second  floor corner balcony.  Overlooking the intersection  of St. Louis and Royal street . Aaron was our server  and couldn't  be nicer. I got A Taste of New Orleans:
A sampling of the city's most famous dishes: Chicken & Andouille Jambalaya, Crawfish Etouffée and Chicken and Andouille Gumbo  .  
 It was a perfect sampling portion and some bread for dipping was excellent.  Ther balcony table gave us a awesome view of the streets below.  A street performer was singing and playing her guitar on the corner across the street  adding to the perfect  ambiance  of the city.   The Royal  House is definitely  worth a visit. And the staff was great .

Came here for a quick bite while strolling along French quarter and SO happy we did! Our server Leroy was so attentive, helpful with suggestions, and nice. I got the chicken Caesar salad since I wasn't toooooo hungry and my friend got the shrimp creole extra spicy and she loved it! Definitely a must if you're in the area :)

Delightful. Great ambiance, especially for lunch or in the ore evening hours. Cindy is a delight if you sit at the bar, just follow her lead. And I can say, without exaggeration, the bloody Mary is one of the best I've had. House infused vodka and a scintillating spice blend of spices. A perfect place to relax for an afternoon, brushed by breezes off the Mississippi, and maybe a little drunk.

We normally like this place but tonight was awful. The food was well below par and you need to bring your A game knowing that you're surrounded by great restaurants. We'll give you another try but I'm hoping you kick it up a notch.

I wish I could give 2.5 stars. Since I can't, I'll lean positive and go with 3 stars. This restaurant was fine, but with all the excellent restaurants nearby, I would not recommend this one. First, the restaurant did not seem clean from the moment we sat down, when there were flies on the table, which was set but did not seem like it had had a good cleaning before being set. Yes, the doors were open and it was warm, but this had been the case at other restaurants we visited this week as well, without flies and a generally dirty vibe. I also ended up asking for a new wine glass, as mine was noticeably dirty (something I do very rarely). We had a couple of appetizers at our table, the fried alligator and seafood stuffed mushrooms, both of which were fine but nothing outstanding. I ordered the shrimp caprese salad, in part because it was the only menu item with the Eat Fit NOLA stamp. Even though the server confirmed my order twice during ordering, the wrong dish was brought to the table. In fairness, they brought me the correct dish quickly, and removed the charge for the dish from our bill. My food was great, but my fellow diners' dishes did not look appetizing, and I'd be hard-pressed to recommend a place where I would only want to order one dish. Our server was lovely, and made an otherwise decidedly mediocre experience pleasant. All in all, I'd make another choice.
TY was our waiter and he was amazing! Friendly, fun and made our experience special. Food was amazing. I had the Jambalaya which was perfection!

On our first day in New Orleans, blinded by all the lights and alcohol, my cousin and I found Royal and the intriguing mirror bar brought us in. We sat at the bar and watched as the man taught us how to crack open oysters. We ordered half a dozen oysters and my cousin said it's the only times he's ever liked them! Yes, SUCESS! For our meal we had RED FISH BEIGNETS which were literally the BEST THING IVE HAD IN NEW ORLEANS SO FAR. We also got the TASTE OF NEW ORLEANS, which was good but EXTREMELY COLD which was kind of a bummer. Bloody Mary and Dark and Stormy were amazing, and so was our bartender. Would recommend, but please ask for food We HOT HOT HOT!

We didn't have to wait in line and were seated right away on the second floor. We were greeted by a waiter that showed the facilities to us in case we need to find the bathrooms or the way our.

I love their deal of $10 off towards an appetizer, the menu has a big selection of dishes that stand out. We had the oyster tacos as an appetizer, now I even voiced this note to our waiter, the "tacos"
Come on a tortilla chip topped with a fried oyster, creamy coleslaw and a red sauce. The flavors are marvelous but please don't call it taco as it doesn't come in a whole tortilla. Perhaps you should name
It "oyster chip"? Our waiter was knowledgeable of the menu and helped us with some suggestions.  I had the seafood scampi, my husband the red fish, our friends the crawfish ravioli and jambalaya. we were all very pleased with our food.  Thank you for signing happy bday to me...it was a nice touch to our evening.

The best thing about this place: balcony dining! If you get lucky and can grab a seat out in the balcony and not freeze or sweat to death, this is the place to be. You can see the parades, listen to live music, throw some beads, or just people watch while enjoying a good meal.

Check in on Yelp and get a free appetizer (up to $10) when you order two entrees! Note: the raw oysters don't count as an entree but if you order a dozen of the Chargrilled Oysters this counts as an entree.

Food: 4 stars
- Raw Oysters ($16): really good...smaller than Acme and Luke's
- Combo of 3 Rockefeller Oysters and 3 Oysters Royale: AMAZING! The Rockefeller was baked with sautéed spinach and bacon. The Royale was stuffed and baked with seafood (yummm!). My favorite non raw oysters in New Orleans!
- Jambalaya topped with Blackened Shrimp ($18): good, but Acme is a lot more flavorful. The jambalaya here was a bit dry
- Eggplant and Oyster ($19): really good but very heavy. Fried eggplant and oysters over linguine and alfredo and marinara with veggies

Service and Wait Time: 2 stars
- Our server was very sweet and kept checking up on us so that was great but...
- We waited probably around 20 minutes to receive our raw oysters and then another ~30-35 minutes to receive our entrees. It wasn't even a packed house and another table of two that arrived he exact same time as us received their entrees and finished them before we received our entrees
- There were empty tables ready for customers but the restaurant still made people wait outside in line (if there's a line, people will be drawn to it!). This was not cool!

Overall, the food was really good but the wait time was dreadful. With a plethora of other Cajun restaurants all around French Quarter, I wouldn't come back to this one unless I absolutely wanted balcony dining!

What a let down. Based on reviews, was looking forward to some great food. Substandard at best. Watched the waitress put a lemon in our iced tea with her fingers. There are so many great places to eat in the area. Walk around and find one of these gems.

The Royal House tries so hard to be upscale. Maybe too hard. The food was okay (The red onion in the caprese was a little much). French onion soup was good. Overall food was not bad. Issue was that the food came out in a disorganized fashion (ie. we received appetizers during the middle of the meal and the last after we had finished our meal). Bleegh. Service staff was ok although spread thin. Forgot items we asked for, etc. May have been understaffed, but standards should be higher especially because the prices are pretty high for what you get. 
I'll give another swing when I'm in town again.

Oysters are out of this world! The service is very friendly and food is great! Nice drink selection. There are two bars, one downstairs and one up. Seating outside on the balcony for two. Nola cuisine at its finest!

Came here upon the recommendations of the locals, got seated fast and just like our experience in Acme they seem to all get the same grilled oysters from the same suppliers and they are not big at all. We ordered the oyster tacos, grilled oysters, a 1lb of peel and eat shrimp, and roast beef po boy. The oyster tacos was the only dish that stood out. The peel and eat shrimp was quite pricey. I didn't see what was so exciting about the roast beef po boy. My whole NOLA food experience was so so other than Dragos.

Royal House is located just off bourbon street and offered a high end feeling dinner for an affordable price. We opted to sit upstairs and we're seated by the window for an incredible view. 

Thanks to Yelp, we cashed in our free appetizer and enjoyed spinach artichoke dip in the house. It was hot, cheesy, and delicious. 

Our meal did not let us down either. The seafood was incredible fresh. Being from Dallas, I could taste the difference. 

If you are in the area and want to venture away from the craziness of bourbon street, Royal House offers a great ambiance, delicious food, and southern hospitality.

One of THE best dining experiences I've ever had - period. Was in town for New Years with seven buddies and had been trying seafood all week. Nothing compared.

The waiter was extremely friendly, and knew the menu well. We made our meal into a family-style buffet and based our order almost solely on his suggestions. Plates of appetizers, entrees, and beverages were everywhere, and I do no think any of us had a single complaint.

Strong drinks (check), Outstanding food (check), Knowledgeable, fun, waiter patient enough to put up with eight drunk twenty-something-year-old dudes (check)
Ashley our waitress is great!  Nice seating too!  Food is "!!!!!!".  We even got a free song!
Seriously delicious food, and not crazy expensive. The boyfriend said their oysters are the best he's ever had. I don't love oysters, but I had to agree. Delicious!

Had a really lovely dinner here with the wife this evening. It was pretty packed, we did not have reservations but we were able to get in by about 7:15 PM just waiting 15 or 20 minutes. I have to first say that the service here really made the experience great. They were so accommodating, and we interacted with lots of different waitstaff, all were friendly, eager to help, and quite funny!

So this evening I got the crawfish étouffée and wife got the Cajun shrimp with peppers and onions in tomato base. We both really enjoyed our entrées! It was the first time I've ever had étouffée and it was scrumptious! She enjoyed her as well. We then shared a brownie al a mode for dessert. It wasn't anything super special, but it was quite tasty! It was also a good size to share post-meal.

The only downside I would say would be the crab leg appetizer. So I got really excited when I saw the free appetizer with a check in. The one appetizer that I had planned to get they were out of, and given the fact that I don't eat pork, beef, or alligator, we went with the crab legs. The flavor was great, don't get me wrong but the dish itself was a nightmare to try and navigate. The crab comes still attached to the little claws. You have to scrape it off little by little. It took my wife so long to get the crab meat off the legs, that her entrée showed up before she had finished the appetizer. Also, this method leaves a lot of crab shell fragments in the small pile of crab meat that you worked so hard to accumulate. So don't buy down too hard! Like I said, it's a good idea but the execution is a fail on this one. I'm still giving them four stars because of how amazing the rest of our food was and the service. This is definitely a must when you're in New Orleans!
We ordered shrimp platter. Hardly 10 shrimps with lot of fries. All dishes are vVery expensive.

Wow. This place is our new favorite spot when visiting New Orleans. We have always gone to Acme Oyster Bar thinking that they had the best oysters, which they're amazing..... however Royal House has become our #1 spot after ONE visit.

The atmosphere is much cleaner here and if you combine it with the polite and knowledgeable staff you get that truly amazing experience. 

Food was amazing. Oysters were MUCH better, and we complimented them with a Taste of New Orleans. We highly suggest it.

Also, we NEVER decide to get dessert at a restaurant. Our waiter changed our mind and we are so thankful that he did. The bread pudding was to die for!

We only stopped here for drinks and apps. The only reason I went with four stars is when we got there the bartender was in a bad mood. It was a little odd and comfortable, but she did get nicer as time went on. I tried the fried alligator with a few local beers and was happy with both. I would try this place out again if I went back. I guess they are known for their oysters and some of our friends said they are amazing.

We snagged a spot here for dinner one night. I didn't think it would be that great, but I'm happy to say I was wrong. The staff was very nice and worked with my picky husband. Our dinners were very good!

currently on balcony, ordered food over 40 minutes ago, and still no status, had to go get the sever. not sure why it's taking so long, restaurant was mostly empty, and we only ordered 2 dishes, "a taste of New Orleans" and half dozen oysters. 

this is ridiculous. I'm not coming back to this place, would've went to Stanley's around the corner if I knew it was going to be like this
We had the most fantastic service!  Both Tasha and Tina treated us fantastically!  Any time we are in town we will be sure to visit!!  Love all of you at Royal house!
Stopped in for an early dinner and was very pleasantly surprised. The food was delicious and the service very good. I ordered the shrimp po boy and it was delicious. Would definitely recommend.

When I was searching yelp for this resturant,  the reviews had me a little worried about wait time for food to come out.  Honestly,  had no issues with that.  

I am a choosey eatter and do not venture out by trying new foods but trying to break it skowly.  Let me tell you the food was GREAT! 

We ordered the CRAB CLAWS for appetizer.  Sause was so rich and good by itself.  Dish came with bread for dipping.  

I ordered the CRAWFISH RAVIOLI. Amazingly delicious. So want to go back tonight.  LOL.  

Husband has the Shrimp Pescatori.  Another great dish.  Both recommended.

As a solo diner I'm used to not always getting the choice table. But at Royal House, I landed a seat just inside the entrance facing the open window. This let me indulge in people-watching and enjoying the view while I devoured the gator po-boy sandwich.
Ty is the best, most friendly, most engaging server I've ever met. Get his section if you can.
And try that gator sandwich.
Delicious food, but the management was rude. Our server had to check with the manager for a simple request. There's a lot of options for the same type of food. So I'd probably choose another place

We were looking for a good restaurant in town (since we are tourists). We saw good reviews in a great location and we decided to check it out. The male host was very friendly, and the service was great. The problem was the food. We got the spinach deep for an appetizer which was OK. Then, for entries, we ordered the Mahi Mahi and the burger. The fish tasted fine (not great), but the burger was bad!!!! It was burnt on the outside and tasteless. Would not necessarily recommend this place.

Well where to start...I...we got seated quickly and the staff was nice enough.  Our server was obviously new and overwhelmed so I'd like to make exception for her but
the food delivery staff THREE times brought the wrong meals to our tables. 

I was excited to try some real NO Gumbo and was left highly disappointed.  What I got was a bowl of broth with some rice and 5 quarter size/thickness pieces of sausage.  To add insult to injury this was supposed to be my meal and the only part of the order that didn't need really need to be cooked and came out at the end of the meal AFTER everyone else was done eating.

My friend said his oyster BLT was excellent and I can't complain about the other appetizers we had but it just left me flat after the whole experience.

Matt and I ate here during the crazy busy All-Star Weekend here in New Orleans and we were happily surprised to be seated immediately upstairs. Our waitress was pleasant and quick, her recommendations were great. We started with the "Redfish Beignets", I was a little skeptical of the fish donut, but again, happy surprise it was delish! Matt ordered the shrimp pasta, also very good. It was lightly seasoned, and a smaller portion than we would have liked (we were starving), but still good. I got the fried shrimp plate that came with coleslaw, hush puppies, and fries. It was nothing special, coleslaw and hush puppies had good flavor but you only get a little taste so that was disappointing. Overall good restaurant, and we enjoyed the service.

Went during MARDI GRAS parade with a few friends and we all ordered Dozen raw oysters, an order of crab claws, and fried alligator tail (should've had dipping sauce) I rate this 2 stars because of the cleanliness of the place. Waiter was sweet but wasn't as attentive to us as we would like. 
It wasn't too busy and we still didn't get proper service. 
One of the girls went to the bathroom and saw a cock roach in there. 
Food was Ok. We didn't hate it but we didn't love it either.

Typical tourist restaurant. Service was on point but can't say much about the food. My husband ordered the charbroiled oysters which clearly weren't. When he questioned whether they were charbroiled our server said it's all the same, no it's not. They were baked. I ordered the jambalaya which was clearly pre-made. The chicken was  unrecognizable, one piece of sausage and the shrimp was cold. By no means a 4 star restaurant. However, our server did recommend the Bombay Club for jazz music and that was a pleasant surprise.

service was good,  food was subpar. The best thing was my sprite.  crab claws were smaller than any crab I've ever seen. The waitress swore by the crab claws... big disappointment .  Thanks to Yelp they weren't 13.50, got them for 3.50 but its still 3.50 wasted.

Had dinner there the other night in which the food and service was outstanding! If you get the pleasure of having Tina as your server, enjoy as she is a kick and her food recommendations are great!!!!!
This place is so much fun! Great for tourists! We had charbroiled oysters and they were amazing! Fun to have drinks, apps, and people-watch on the balcony!!
Place was decent but they offer the same as all the other restaurants off bourbon st. Nothing spectacular

Cute trendy restaurant located on the corner of Royal st and Saint Louis, just blocks away from the famous Bourbon street! For our appetizer we had the Crab Claws, it was a bit pricy but BOMB.COM. A definite MUST. For our entree we had the Fried Shrimp Platter (delicious and even better when you dip them in the Garlic Butter sauce from the appetizer) and the Taste of Orleans platter, which contains the following: Cup of gumbo, jambalaya and crawfish Estouffee. Dishes were pricy but served family style, great for those who like to taste and share.

Just landed into New Orleans and decided to grab something to eat in the French quarter. We got a variety of stuff between three people. For an appetizer, we got the crab claws- sautéed in lemon, garlic butter sauce with toasted French bread! IT WAS DELICIOUS. we ended up keeping the left over garlic sauce to dip other food items with it. Taste of New Orleans- three samples of chicken and andouille jambalaya, crawfish eutoffee and ch IMDb and andouille gumbo. We liked the first two but for some reason didn't care for the gumbo. (Majority of us has had Disneylands jambalaya and gumbo and even liked that one better) but we will give gumbo another shot! Lastly, we had the shrimp platter with fries and hush puppies. Normally I hate peeling shrimp and get over the taste, but the fried shrimp was very delicious. This is a very cute place in the French quarter and it was enough food for three hungry people.

Incredible meal. I had the best shrimp and grits ever and that is not my to go to food it's my husbands. It has a great kick to it and ask for some dipping bread for the sauce. Oh yum. The Bloody Mary was excellent also. Come in if you are in the neighborhood they are on the corner.

My wife and I went there for dinner. We've been coming to NOLA many times over the past seven years but the first time to this restaurant. Our first surprise was when they wouldn't serve us alcohol unless we showed ID; I'm 67 and my wife is slightly younger, another first in NOLA. Unfortunately my wife doesn't carry her purse with her when out in heavy party places. 
The food was good but the evening ended with me killing a cockroach on our table before we left; another surprise and another first!!

We were given a recommendation to try this place when my boyfriend and I went to New Orleans. We went around 3:30pm on a Wednesday and it was more crowded than I would expect. We were seated immediately on the second floor near an open window (the first floor looked like it was more of a bar than a restaurant). The service wasn't particularly fast, but the oysters and outdoor views made up for it. If it wasn't so hot outside, we would have opted for balcony dining.
went there while visiting NOLA. Liked the food. but i was amazed by their dresser with banana. to die for!

The only reason for the two stars is because they have my group a table right away when there was a long line. The service however was so disappointing. We waiting almost an hour for our food and when it finally came it was wrong. The same happened with my drink and the worst part is i got up to go to the restroom right after they brought my drink and they took it while I was in the restroom! Definitely not going back, when the food came it wasn't even worth it...

This was the last dinner we were having before heading back home from our vacation. We were promptly seated. Our server, Ms. September, was friendly, smiley and took care of us. We ordered Crab Claws as an appetizer. The crab claws and sauce was so delicious! For our entree, we ordered Shrimp 'n Grits, Oyster Pasta, Crawfish ravioli and Baked Shrimp Tortellini. Each dish had it's own unique flavor, especially the Shrimp 'n Grits! My mouth waters just thinking about this meal! It was soooo delicious! So happy to have had such a great meal our last night in N'awlins, will definitely be back!

Visiting for Mardi Gras and were told this is the go to spot. YES IT IS !!!! Best oysters we've had so far the char grilled were just amazing. And the crab claws those are must have !!!!!! Literally wiped every single plate clean. Even tho busy our  server Ty was ON IT. We were a needy table and he was super fun and definitely had a lot to do with our wonderful experience. In love we will be back !!!!! Thanks TY !
Delicious red beans and ricanand sausage and chicken meal service is excellent , short waiting time

This place is amazing!!!! I LOVE it!! My husband and I were so tired at the end of our weekend stay so we stopped by here. They sat us upstairs on the balcony seating it's so cute up there. It's a crooked balcony though so it is a little hard when it comes to eating and keeping your food straight. But it's so cute. We ordered the char boiled oyster. Yes they are as amazing as the reviews prior to mine suggests. We both agreed that we would go back one day for the oysters alone before we even got our food!! Our main course was okay. The crawfish ravioli had some shell in it from the crawfish. But the oysters were amazing. The service was okay..we were seated quickly however after that we didn't see our waiter for 30 minutes at least not at our table. The couple that came the same time as we did we got seated the same time and they got menus, ordered and got drinks all before we even got a look. We had to go find her to place our order after looking on the online menu after those 30 minutes. Even after ordering it took a while to get our food and then after eating we waited 15 minutes to get out check finally we just got up and paid for our meal at the front. The oysters were good but honestly it's service needs a little help..

What a great surprise!  We were supposed to have reservations at another big name place but we were apparently under-dressed.  
So instead, we went to Royal House. From the minute Leroy came to the table, we were in good hands.  We got a few appetizers (crab claws, stuffed mushrooms) and French Onion Soup--wow, amazing.  But the deserts were unreal--Bananas Foster Cheesecake and Chocolate Chip Brownie.  
Leroy was wonderful.  He was enthusiastic, attentive and very helpful. We will be back again, definitely here instead of those big name fancy places!

Best Bloody Mary in New Orleans! We loved the charbroiled oysters (1 dozen for $20).
We checked in on Yelp to get 1 free app.
The jambalaya was wonderful too!

Overall great experience. Ask for a window seat so you can people watch. 
Tina was our waitress and she was THE BEST!!!

They oysters were the highlight of the meal here! We got raw oysters and oysters Rockefeller. I wouldn't recommend getting the Po boys or the jambalaya, I thought neither were seasoned well and I probably could have gotten better tasting versions at a more reasonable price elsewhere. But the service was really good and seriously super good oysters!
Menu has a ton of authentic New Orleans options. The best item is the "Taste of New Orleans" which gives you a taste of three of the best known dishes. Nice ambiance and good service.
Despite a good yelp rating not a good experience at all.  Food took forever and was cold, overpriced for the food.  Definitely wasn't worth the money or time spent waiting for cold food

We were seated on the balcony which was perfect for people watching. We shared the jumbalya and dozen charbroiled oysters which were both great. A little on the pricier side and the jumbalya was a slightly smaller portion than normal. Service could have been better as the waiter took a while to fill up our waters and seemed to want us in and out, despite the restaurant not being very busy. Wifi didn't work on the balcony unfortunately. Experience was okay overall.

This place was awful. We are coming from California for Mardi Gras and we decided to stop and get a bite to eat at this restaurant because it had such great ratings. Little did we know that it was a 1 star restaurant. Most of the waiters were running around with their head's chopped off. The waiters were so frustrated that they almost got in a fight right behind us. Also we sat down and waited 20 minutes before talking to anybody. Then it took an hour and a half to get the food. The waiter was doing the best he could since he was one of the few working. The food is way over priced for the quality and quantity. Also they could not split checks at all which makes no sense and the manager was not helping our terrible experience. Definitely do not recommend coming here.

Randomly went here looking for oysters. Had a great time, sat upstairs near the patio to meet some friends that were on the patio.  They seated us right next to them, but inside, so was perfect. I am not an oyster fan, but my friends enjoyed them. I had fried alligator, which was good and got a fish po'boy to take home, which was OK, but nothing special. The drinks were great and our waiter was super nice & entertaining.
Melva was a great server! We thoroughly enjoyed our service. She was so sweet and welcoming, especially since we were visiting from out of state.

We Ordered crab legs and mine were small and salty and my partners were larger and tasted better. I would have sent mine back if I noticed earlier. Also got crab claws for app and it was so small. Don't order that... it's not what you think it's gonna be.

Came here mainly for oysters as our last meal before leaving NOLA. We were seated upstairs right next to the balcony which was adorable! Super cute for an afternoon of people watching. The breeze did pick up during our lunch though so we ended up closing the doors next to our table. Initially I wanted to order a dozen raw oysters (1 dozen for $16) since one of my friends had never had oysters before, but the waitress told me they were known for their charbroiled oysters (1 dozen for $20) and I was sold. Definitely the highlight of our meal. I'm sure it wasn't anything special, but being from out of town, the Louisiana hot sauce that came out with the oysters was pretty good. I'll probably look for it the next time I go grocery shopping. 

As for the rest of our meal, I ordered the crawfish ravioli( $24)which was mouthwatering. The sauce was absolutely devine and it had a decent amount of crawfish chunks that made this dish an A in my book. My friends meals were not so much a hit. There was one order of the oyster pasta and two orders of the trio sampler (jambalaya, etouffee, and gumbo). The oyster pasta didn't taste like anything special and had fried oysters which i'm not a fan, but it wasn't bad by any means. As for the sampler, the jambalaya and gumbo were probably my least favorite of all the samples I tried throughout the weekend. None of us could pinpoint what the gumbo tasted like, but my friends didn't even finish their cup. The jambalaya was bland and did not stand out compared to all other options in the city. The Etouffee was quite tasty but only came in a small bowl alongside the other disappointing sample bowls. 

Despite the nice atmosphere, unique balcony dining, bomb oysters, and my cheesy ravioli, this place gets stars knocked off for the terrible service that we received at the table. First off, the waitress started off greeting our table by letting us know that they didn't do split checks, either cash or 1 card. Which was fine, except we clearly saw other tables get split checks, and honestly, its not that hard to do. When we went to order our food I wanted to ask her a quick question about the Yelp deal for 1 free appetizer since I saw it while checking in. As soon as I mentioned it she shook her head and stared at me like I was an idiot, stating that all deals were off for all restaurants around the area for the days leading up to Mardi Gras. False, we literally used a deal the night before coincidentally and the waitress there was great. And as if she couldn't leave it alone after I said it was alright, she again shook her head at me and told me how busy it was for Mardi Gras weekend. What. The. Hell. I get it. Move on. Our food also took a decent amount of time to come out, but we were also extra impatient because we were starving so the wait time might be an exaggeration. But it felt like forever. By the time it was time to pay for the bill our waitress reiterates again how they only accept 1 card on the check, after already giving us the non-split one check. Then comes back and gives us "advice" on how we pay the tip in cash if we didn't want to put it all on the card. Come on lady, the more that you talk, the less tip you're getting.
