It's like she thought this was our first time eating at a restaurant. Granted, we were a table of young women in our twenties, but plenty capable of paying for a meal. This has honestly got to be one of worst service experiences of my life. But I won't speak for the entire staff, the host that greeted us in front of the restaurant was extremely friendly. 

Side note, props to this place for having two stalls in their bathroom instead of one. Much appreciated.

Five stars for our limited experience. We sat at the bar for a cup of gumbo and oysters Rockefeller. Both were excellent. Gumbo was thick and rich and the oysters were huge, plump and perfectly cooked. The bartender was knowledgeable and attentive. The only complaint is that the prices were pretty high, but it's in the Quarter so that's to be expected.

My wife amd I went to the Royal Houses for lunch, because it was convenient and near our hotel.
Sat at the bar and met Heather, our bartender. She was amazing introduced us different drinks and the food was espectacular. 
End result,  went back for dinner and it was espectacular again.

Royal house, at the bar and Heather as your bartender... a must in NOLA...

During my visit to Mardi Gras, this was the best I've had so far during THIS visit. The redfish beignets was one of the best appetizers I have ever tried - it had a unique sweet and spicy blend unmatched anywhere. The oysters chargrilled topped with crab meat was amazing. The sauce in the crab claws was so good, you could eat it alone with bread. The crawfish ravioli was so amazing and the cheese sauce was everything. 

I didn't give a five because we waited unnecessary time, because there was confusion about putting your name on the list. My friend was not pleased with the fried grits and the jambalaya was just ok. We had a good waitress, but service for some items were slow.... I do understand it was Fat Tuesday though.

I went there for my last dinner in New Orleans for my birthday . Perhaps my expectations were too high. The service was great and so were the drinks. Our food took a while to come and when it did it seems like very small portions and the food was room temperature. Seeing that they were closing soon and it already took long for us to get our food it just didn't seem worth it to speak up.

Horrible service and presentation.   The raw oysters had nearly no flavor.  The alligator with no dipping sauce.  The crawfish etouffee had fried crawfish mixed in with sautéed... left us wondering if the kitchen ran out and just threw some fried tails on top.  Wine was hot and served in plastic cups.  Not impressed one bit and would not go back.

After leaving Chicago this morning @ 5:15 traveling to Houston, transferring planes  to Nawlins, going to the convention center and registering.  We ran into some of our friends.  It took forever to get da group together because they are slower then hell, but we finally made it over to Royal House around 5:30 pm.  Royal House is located in the historic French Quarter.  By the time we got there I was ready to chew on the table cloth.  We were seated upstairs as the main floor dining room was filled (a good sign).  This was decorated in an old world ambiance 

APPETIZERS
Crab claws - lemon garlic butter w/bread for dipping were succulent and tasty, but didn't have any meat in the crab claws
Oyster w/Parmesan, butter cheese were absolute heaven 
Fried alligator pieces served with a red cocktail dipping sauce a- tasty, but portion size was way too small

MAIN DISHES
Crawfish Etouffee - crawfish tails w/brown gravy & peppers served over rice.  Succulent, savory and excellent flavor
Chicken, Shrimp  & Andouille Gumbo - Served with rice and gumbo soup I savored every bite
Shrimp jambalaya - 
Shrimp & Grits - fried mushrooms stuffed w/mozzarella cheese & topped w/BBque sauce & shrimp
Fried oyster Po Boy w/bacon & cheese - looked incredible, but I didn't get to try it.  You can't go wrong w/bacon & fried oysters
Crispy Fried Fish Po Boy

I had a hurricane which was ok, but too sweet.  The ladies all got margaritas and 2 of the guys ordered beers.

Our waiter Ty was awesome from the get go.  He was super friendly & had a great knowledge of the menu items.  For the people that needed help was able to help us all select our menu items.  Overall everyone really enjoyed their food.  Definitely worth checking out!!

Worst dining experience of our entire trip. Came here for dinner and sat out on the very tilted balcony. 

This place is an oyster house. Don't get anything other than the oysters. Service started out strong, and we ordered the chargrilled oysters which were amazing. After we ordered two seafood pasta dishes. They took forever and then came out completely COLD! Not room temperature or lukewarm, but cold. The dishes were both watery and didn't have much flavor (had a good amount of seafood though). Hoped the service would make up for the bad food, but was disappointed when our server was extremely slow and dragged out the already lackluster dining experience.
Good service, raw oysters and chargrilled oysters fantastic!  4 stars simply cuz shrimp in the shrimp n grits were small

Long lines every day so we finally tried the Royal House for Sunday breakfast on the last day of our New Orleans weekend. Delicious freshly prepared egg benedicts and omelettes with Cajun twists such as crawfish etufee sauce. Wonderful food served by MELVA: a most attentive waitress. Homemade biscuits and Cajun homefries round out a lasting memory of New Orleans cuisine.
Great balcony seating - with good views for people watching. Fun waitstaff.

Ate lunch here and was unimpressed. 

The portion sizes were miniature and very average tasting for what was 5-star price. I had a hurricane which was fine but came in a plastic cup instead of an actual hurricane glass. The Mojito I had was probably the worst one I've ever had, tasted like Sprite with some mint in it. 

Sat on the balcony which was nice but the table was so slanted that I felt like I had to guard my food and drinks so they wouldn't slide off into the street below. The view was okay but the extra bar that was installed really hindered it. 

Overall, the food was overpriced and 1/2 of my drinks were subpar. Won't be coming back

If it smells like a fish, looks like a fish, acts like a fish....it's too fishy for me to trust! 

If people read my reviews they know I don't really eat fish. It's kind a like punishment for me. 
When I arrived here I had hopes of finding chicken. Even though I don't eat fish my group sure wanted some NOLA seafood! We found them some! They LOVED the food here! The good news for me was they had lots of choices even chicken! 

I ordered:
-Eggplant chips (SO GOOD) 
-Potatoes side ( So buttery) 
-Hush puppies (Hot and crispy) yummy!
-Coleslaw (too rich for me but the table liked it)

The table got:
-Spinach dip (ok) 
-Two orders of Charbroiled Oysters (I tried them) surprisingly good!  
-Shrimp and grits 
-Mahi Mahi
-Crawfish
They all loved everything! 5 stars from all of them. I'll give their two cents since they are not yelpers!

Dessert:
-Brownie
-Bread Pudding

Desserts were good but nothing blew my socks off! When I'm in town I would definitely come back! Maybe they weren't as fishy as I thought! ;-)

Taste of New Orleans was an awesome meal, although I felt it was a bit pricey for three small bowls of each. My boyfriend had gotten the Po boy and said it was nothing special, "tastes like long John silvers." Other than that, atmosphere was nice and staff was very friendly and helpful. We sat on the balcony which was very enjoyable but a bit scary due to it being almost a 45 degree angle.

Friendly service and great food! Sat us right away, were quick with our orders and delivery of food. Very cute interior, perfect size tables for our party of four and the staff were all very friendly. Alligator appetizer was delicious but I wish we ordered two for the four of us, one order was a little small but that's on us because they explained portion size when we asked. Everyone's meal was delicious, no complaints on the food whatsoever.

Dare I say this was my favorite stop in Nola? I opted for 2 appetizers because I couldn't decide on a main dish. The chargrilled oysters were nicely presented, drowning in butter with a perfectly crisp layer of breadcrumbs. The oyster tacos were also amazing and not at all what I expected. Fried oyster sitting on a crispy tortilla piled high with cole slaw. Simple, but it just worked!
Great food, great service. Had the oysters rockefeller and red beans and rice. Finished it off with a raisin peach bread pudding that could change your life!

Ok so I just walked up and asked for balcony seating. They happened to have it available this was a Monday night around 4pm. The host was very nice. you have this tall steep staircase to walk up to get to the second floor. But balcony seating is worth it. The balcony is narrow but comfortable. The view is great classic New Orleans. Loved my waiter, can't remember his name, but he had great suggestions for drinks and food. 

The atmosphere is very laid back and you can come dressed comfy casual as you'd like. 

The food: The oysters were so good I had to go back the next day for lunch. I ordered the Oysters Duo, which came with Rockefeller and another oyster type. But I also wanted to try their chargrilled oysters so they provide you two of each type of oyster if you ask. The rockefeller and chargrilled were my favorite. I wasn't going to order a drink because I was on business, but I'm in NOLA of course I did. My waiter recommended the Voodoo it was so tasty. It went down like juice. I was warned to be careful because it sneaks up on you, but I only had one. For my main course I ordered the seafood pasta. It was a bit peppery for me and the sauce was kind of watery, but still had flavor. For lunch the following day I ordered the same oysters duo with the three types of oysters and then I had the taste of New Orleans. They recommend against it because everyone down there serves those dishes. But I ordered it anyway along with my Voodoo. All three were good, but of the three I was impressed with the shrimp étouffée. So next time I go back I know rockefeller oysters and chargrilled oysters with shrimp étouffée. The waiter recommended the blackened fish they served so that might be a dish form boyfriend to get and me to try. Enjoy your time here it's great!

We were seated very quickly. I saw lines at other restaurants but there was no line here although it was quite crowded inside. Our waiter was a nice guy. The wait for the food was longer than expected. I expected the appetizer and kids meals to come out a lot quicker than they did. It took a bit over 40 mins to get any food. Aside from the wait, I loved the views. We were seated upstairs near the balcony. There was music and entertainment going on outside. The appetizer that I got was stuffed mushrooms. They were actually the best thing I had there. It was stuffed with a seafood dressing that consisted of shrimp and crab. I had the shrimp and grits for an entree which was very different from and other I'd ever tasted. I'm use to the cheese grits with the shrimp on top. The grits were fried into 2 coated triangle bricks with shrimp and shredded cheeses layed on top, in a pool of a slightly watery tomato based sauce. The actual grits inside the brick had no salt or flavor. I was not quite a fan. I prefer mine the way as I described before. It was not worth $20. I had a hurricane for my drink. It was nothing spectacular. Not as strong as I'd like but sweet. However I wouldn't mind coming back to try something different but I likely won't because there are so many other restaurants to try.

So horrible!!! Our waiter was fine but the service was slow. Not to mention they were lugging trash cans full of trash back and forth through the dining area!!! Like I have never seen something so disgusting and unsanitary in my life, I wanted to get up and walk out. Not to mention the place is small so the trash cans came through about 6 or 7 times and were really close to the table.
I'm not sure who said that was ok to empty the trash in the middle of a busy day but I was so turned off.

The waiter recommended the shrimp and grits so I tried it. It was horrible the fried grits were interesting but not that good and you would think for $20 that there would be jumbo shrimp but no little baby shrimp that were overcooked and tough. Sent my food back after a few bites and refused to order anything else.

If you want good food and service try somewhere else. This place is too costly for what I experienced.

After three or more visits, it's time to review this marvelous place. Madame and I are frequent visitors to NOLA and we have spent more time at the bar than at a table but we have been upstairs at a table with another couple as well. Service has been keen wherever we plant our posteriors.

If there is any deficiency at this place, we haven't found it yet. It's unlikely you will unless you come at a megabusy time of the year when no one gets good service anywhere in the Quarter.

Our last time at this premiere location was assisted by Donald behind the bar who handled both drinks and shucking oysters deftly. It shows when one has spent a long time working hard to please the customer. He accomplished that and more.

Are we returning? Certainly!

Are we recommending this location to others? Did you miss my very seldom given five star review?

Enough said!
Great fried fish po boy and amazing oysters. The hurricane is fantastic. Would definitely come back.

a patron killed a cockroach next to me as I was about to pay my bill. Then when I was taking this picture and saying that there is a cockroach on the floor a waiter walked by and said it was a palmetto bug not a cockroach and kicked it towards me! I asked for a manager he watched the waiter kick the roach towards me lied and said that didn't happen and got the gm after I said I wouldn't pay the bill for the service, they said I had to pay didn't even offer me a discount or an apology so I paid and left. Do not eat at this over priced roach infested mediocre food place.

Service was horribly slow. I had to ask for napkins and a drink menu, however we never received the drink menu. We ordered mahi mahi and it was tasteless and dry. The jambalaya was mediocre at best. Extremely disappointed.

Service was great, staff was so friendly, you think I was a regular. But, the food was so-so. I had the gumbo which I thought was nothing special. Wasn't bad, wasn't the best, could have gone without ordering it and never missed it.

The Crawfish Etouffe was okay too, except that they coat the crawfish in a batter that ends up kinda hard, and it's crunchy even after soaking in the sauce. I would have preferred it as is, as I could barely taste the crawfish.

Unfortunately, the Shrimp Creole was the worst thing I had. Not inedible, just too plain. The waitress warned me that it might be a little spicy, and I was okay with that. But I couldn't taste any spice. The best I could describe what I had is, shrimp cooked in tomato paste served over rice.

The place always seems busy though, maybe I just ordered the wrong things.

Had the crawfish étouffée and alligator po boys. 
I think the price is definitely up there for the food. 
I tried my friend's eggplants chips and there was nothing special about it. 
Étouffée was also bland along with the small alligator meat inside the cold po boys. :/

We ate alligator bites (decent but comes with no sauce or anything), oysters duo, gumbo, and another Italian pasta dish (forgot name).  All came out at different times and was luke warm like it was sitting for awhile.  Gumbo was average, oysters not good, probably because they were cold.  Not sure why all the great reviews but this place was average at best.  The only thing it has going is the location.

Came here on Friday lunch time. We requested for balcony seating but it wasn't available, which is fine. 

We ordered spinach artichoke dip, a dozen of charbroiled oysters, oyster po boys and eggplant and chicken parmesan pasta. 

Everything was a OK. Nothing too special about any of them. The pasta noodles were too soggy. The oyster on the po boys are mostly coated with the breading, hardly any oysters. Artichoke dip was "soupy". French fries were warm and soggy. They seemed to be pre-cooked and waiting to be served. Charboiled oysters were not impressive. ACME still has the best one so far. 

Lastly, the service was terrible. Waiter took 10 minutes after we were seated to even acknowledge us. The look and feel of the entire restaurant wasn't really pleasant. 

I do not recommend this restaurant especially if you are visiting New Orleans and trying things out.
Very slow.... everything is slow. The soups tasted weird and the seafood pot is nothing like a pot.

Went here on a Monday night, there was about a 40 minute wait, but we enjoyed a Royal Cup while we waited (delicious!) After the long wait we ended up sitting at the bar, but Brian and Oscar were so much Fun and added to the delicious food. We had the crab claws appetizer, and the sauce was AMAZING! We had po'boys for our meal, but everything looked great. Would definitely come here again!

Went here for dinner last night and after a rocky start (waited 45 minutes when we were told 20 minutes--there was some confusion about the wait list and tables stood open for 25 minutes while management sorted it out), I was not disappointed! The food was delicious--get the crab claws--and the drinks were superb. The best part was the service--sat at the bar and had a wonderful time chatting with Ryan and Oscar. They really made up for the rough patch in the beginning, as did the wonderful food. Would definitely go again!

We had to wait outside for about an hour while the kitchen staff was taking a break?  Really?  They should have seated us and said, we have wait a little while to take your order because we've been so busy.  So have a few drinks and relax.  Owner would have liked the revenue I'm sure.  Ok, with that said, I had almost every type of oyster and they were awesome.  Raw, royale, Rockefeller, and grilled.  OMG!!!!

It was my first time in New Orleans and I was quite overwhelmed. This is such a beautiful and busy city yet charming and exclusive. There were so many restaurants to choose from but I was told that they were all good. I parked my car closest to Royal House so I decided to eat here. Big shout out to our waitress Raven! She was super welcoming, I enjoyed her conversations as much as I did the food.

The restaurant itself is very packed. We chose to sit at the one of the open window so we can enjoy the city walk while dining. We ordered grilled oysters, Rockefeller oysters and oysters royals, shrimp creole, crab claws in garlic butter and gumbo. 

This was my first time having oysters in New Orleans. There is nothing better than eating a food at its origins. It's like eating a cheesesteak in the heart of Philly. The oysters royals had breading on top that makes it filling and hearty, the grilled oysters was fused with garlic butter and charred flavor, and the Rockefeller savory with creamy spinach. Individually, they were good, together? They were phenomenal! The shrimp creole was also distinctive, it tasted had a stronger acidic note than what I am used to but nevertheless, delicious. The real kicker here was the crab claws. It is not the claws themselves that makes this unique, it's the sauce! Oh man, the creamy, garlic butter sauce that the claws were cooked in is heavenly. You can put this in pasta, clams, on top of lobsters, oysters, roasted bread, pizza, rice, you name it, it will make everything a thousand times better! 

Overall, it was such an amazing experience. I'm used to Philly where it's busy and people rush you out of restaurants. Here however, we took our time and our waitress loved us for it, it's like she didn't want us to leave and just hang out. Big, busy city scene without the compromise of rushed service and terrific good. Royal House come highly recommended.

The restaurant looked very nice & the menu posted outside showed A good variety of food with very fair prices. We were seated up on the balcony, which was great because the view of the street below was great. The food came in a very timely manner and it was delicious. I had the Taste of New Orleans meal and it was a very good my wife had the shrimp boiler pot and the shrimp were huge and way more than she could eat, just absolutely delicious. I would definitely eat here again whenever I come back to visit New Orleans.

We ate at Royal House on March 13th. The food and the service were both top- notch.  The beverages were tasty and refreshing as well.
Our waitress, Tina, guided us through both the food and drink menus, and made terrific recommendations.  We had stuffed mushroom caps - the best we've ever had, and a half dozen perfect oysters on the half shell.  My wife enjoyed French onion soup and redfish beignets for her dinner, and she just kept repeating the word, "amazing" after almost every bite.  I had the peel and eat shrimp, with potatoes and corn on the cob.  Every bite was delicious.  I was equally pleased with the price, which I found to be very reasonable.

A note about the beverages; they have Dark and Stormy as one of their featured drinks, and their Hurricanes are better than that other place that is famous for them!

All in all, our trip to  Royal House was definitely a highlight of our trip to the crescent city.  Thanks, Tina, for taking such great care of us!

Just had dinner there and it was extremely disappointing. I ordered the seafood pesactore, non e of the clams in the dish was open.  The sauce was bland and watery. Wouldn't recommend this place at all.

Not happy customer - horrible customer service 
Our soup was cold. We sat on the fist floor near the bar,bad spot to much traffic tight area. The mash potatoes are not mashed at all their in pieces. Drinks took long to come from the bar,it wasn't even busy. The Oyster were ok. My friend order the French onion soup it was tasty.

Got in pretty quick got a table,had the crab claw appetizer,crab claw had no meat on it. and are so small,sauce was tasty, butter garlic
Hard to go wrong,friend had gumbo came out cold,sent it back,came back warm,tasted like lentil soup, i had craw fish etouffee it was good could of been warmer,oysters are good,not the best just ok,my server was very nice,it took a long time to get served,people next to us had problems also,would not recommend this place gave it 2  stars because the martini are good,hard to screw that up.
Excellent oysters, fast service and great people watching from the balcony. Order the crab claws and lots of bread to dip the sauce !!

bad service. Also foods are not very good, I don't know why so many people recommend it. However I won't come back anymore. The waitress's service is so bad. Even when we check out, we waited for at least 40 minutes. And the most important is that food cannot reach the expectation.

Highly recommended. The food was amazing, but even better was our service. 

Get the char broiled oysters and the crab claws. Definitely. The po boys were very good as well. The shrimp and jambalaya was also fantastic. They also served quite possibly the best Bloody Mary I've ever had. If you are visiting NOLA, this place is a must. 

When you come here, request Melva as your server. She was very busy but always made time to come over to us to make sure we were ok. She steered us in the right direction and was extremely attentive and sweet. She was extremely passionate about her job and this restaurant.

We were seated upstairs, which had a lovely view and a nice breeze. That was about all we liked about the Royal House. We both ordered crawfish étouffée and it was terrible. It came out cold and the crawfish were smothered in breading. I asked for the waiter to have the kitchen heat it up and it came back just a tiny bit warmer. I never received the glass of water I asked for. We were very disappointed, as we had search for a restaurant that served étouffée all day. We won't be back.
Oysters, oysters, oysters! Great food, great service- would eat here again in a heartbeat! The wait was swift, ambiance was lovely, and the food top notch.

Came here late (around 9:30pm) for a bite after a conference. The ambiance and food definitely impressed me, felt a lot less like a tourist trap than the places I'd visited on Bourbon St. The Jambalaya with Blackened Shrimp was amazing, deliciously flavorful and they didn't skimp on the shrimp. Creole Shrimp was also solid but a little bland in comparison. 

Also very impressed with the drinks (especially the Hurricane!) and service. Our waiter Heidi was super helpful, attentive, and hilarious... Definitely made our experience at Royal House!
Amazing breakfast with excellent service from Melva.  We had the eggs benedict and biscuits & gravy...both were amazing. Definitely coming back.

Great service from Leroy. Sat on the balcony which is great for people watching. My wife got the shrimp po boy and loved it. The taste of New Orleans is a must if you like gumbo or want to try to food of the area. Sautéed crab claws are delicious!
Felt like it was a complete waste of money. Neither my partner nor I liked what we ordered. Drinks were pretty good though but food was really bad

Best oysters of my entire life (and I live in Florida). Holy moly. Had the oysters rockefeller and the charboiled oysters.

Loved the customer service and upstairs balcony views. A Lyft driver recommended the place, and it was my best meal in NOLA.

Excellent restaurant! Service and food were both outstanding. Our waitress was very patient and helpful explaining several dishes to us that we were unfamiliar with. She also made great recommendations. Charcoal grilled oysters were great!

Maybe it's what I got, but after leaving I was surprised this place had a solid 4 stars.

Royal Cup...bomb.
Bartender upstairs...charming.

I was all set to give them 5 stars.

Food taking too long...minus 0.5 star because it was a simple order. 
Food taking too long AND it was barely tepid...minus 0.5 more star.
Food taking too long AND it was barely tepid AND my shrimp poboy was dryyyyyyy times 3.

I really wanted to like this place. Based on the other reviews, I expected more, but Royal House didn't deliver.

I would give this restaurant 6 stars if I could! It has been over a month since I took my first trip to NOLA and I am still dreaming of the char-broiled oysters. Based on our server's recommendation, we ordered the char-broiled oysters and crab legs, a Cajun Bloody Mary, and of course a Hurricane. This meal was so good, my friend and I kept looking at eachother mid-bite with the "is this real life" look on both of our faces. The crab legs were bathed in a parmesan sauce that was to die for, the oysters are perfectly tasty and the drinks were such a treat. I can honestly say I am HOOKED on Royal House!
Char grilled oysters are amazing here. The bananas foster cheesecake is addictive. I wouldn't normally order this, but now I wouldn't go to New Orleans without eating it.

The food was overpriced and nasty. The gumbo was burnt and the jambalaya had No seasoning. And the crab claws...smh.

Save your money.

If you want oysters, do not go anywhere else! We tried that multiple times. Walked in and sat at bar. Jeff was shucking ousters behind the bar. Had 2 amazing margaritas and what was our BEST interaction in NOLA. The largest and cleanest oysters I have had anywhere. Make sure you ask for Jeff he is a good man. Never had grilled oysters before this. But will try them again and again now. Unfortunately the oysters are so good we didn't try anything else so I cant rate the rest of the menu. Thanks Jeff for making our trip.

Go for the crab claw appetizer and the bloody marys! My bartender, Cindy, said I'd want a straw for the sauce and she wasn't wrong. The atmosphere is fun and relaxing. The food is top notch. I'm still thinking about that sauce a day later!
What a disappointment. I ordered the shrimp Creole. It tastes like they took some  salsa and poured over white rice.  I think a microwave dinner would have taste better.

This restaurant came highly recommended to us, upon arrival it was suggested to sit upstairs because it was "more romantic" and it was! The wait staff was exceptionally friendly and were all around amazing! Our waiter (Leroy) was the absolute best and was able to recommend many different dishes. While it was hard to choose because it all sounded so good we ordered 1/2 dozen of charbroiled oysters ( first time trying that) and I HIGHLY recommend trying them. We also got the blackened chicken sandwich and the shrimp platter, both were amazing as well. And what is dinner without dessert?? Try the bread pudding and add the shot of praline liquor...it was perfection!!

Excellent! The food was delicious and the service was top-notch. Great atmosphere. Only complaint: my husbands seafood pascatore didn't have enough sauce, but we asked for extra and they didn't hesitate to bring out more. I got the roast beef poboy - amazing! & definitely try the bread pudding!! It was decadent.

We had a pleasant lunch here! It was a nice location -- on Royal, a street over from Bourbon -- so there were a mix of parties dining at the same time: couples, drinkers, families. If you're eating solo, or as a duo, the bar looked like an excellent space (though we were at a table).

The gulf oysters on the half shell were fantastic, creamy and mellow. Not as briney as the East Coast ones I'm so used to. We also enjoyed a sampling of some classic dishes: gumbo, red beans and rice, etouffee. The last one was my favorite. After eating around NOLA, I know I'm a sucker for shellfish in a red sauce with rice.

I also had my first Abita Amber here, which was served in a huge plastic to-go cup. It's on tap across the city, so it was good to know that I liked this local beer from what I had of it here. 

Service was top-notch, too. Professional, personable, so attentive. A great casual lunch spot!

Classic New Orleans oyster bar. A dozen charbroiled oysters, a cup of gumbo and a beer or glass of wine is the perfect lunch. Sit at the bar with a friend and check in on yelp and you can also get a free app--get the crab claws!
Love this place.  Always get great service and the food is really good.  I may prefer another place's chargrilled over this one, but they do have an extensive menu and I've never been disappointed.

This is the worst place ever. We had lunch here, it was worth $55, they swiped the card twice, never reimbursed. I called the manager several times, he said it will be there in 2-3 days, it's been several weeks! Bad service, got food poisoning from the Shrimp dish they had. $110 gone to waste! 
I WOULD GIVE LESS STARS IF I COULD.
Delicious food, good service. I originally sat on the balcony but there was too much going on outside to enjoy the ambiance. The crawfish ravioli was so delicious, I would definitely recommend it.

Best craw fish ravioli!!!
Our host was very sweet and friendly 
Balcony view very nice 
I would def come back

The house of rude from the waitress to the manager who spilled my overpriced drink while moving the table in order to close the wind doors. Shrimp creole was bland at best but I did finish it because I was starved. 2 stars because the taste of New Orleans was a decent though not exceptional local experience

If you are looking for real NOLA, there are better choices all around.  This place caters to the tourist who know no better.  There is always a line, primarily due to the inefficient way the restaurant seats it's patrons. We stood in line for 40 minutes only to see 6-8 empty tables in the restaurant once we were seated.  The food was average.  The prices high.  Try NOLA food elsewhere.

Hot tip - you can sit at the bar and order food without waiting in line outside. If you want a table then you'll likely have to wait a bit, but though the space seems small outside, there's an upstairs and downstairs - lots of room!

We ordered the chargrilled oysters with Parmesan and butter - tender, juicy and savory. So yummy. 

I ordered the lobster steam pot. The lobster was cooked perfectly and came with a piece of corn and two potatoes. 

My mom ordered the jambalaya and it came with blackened shrimp. 

Recommend if you're looking for fresh seafood (you can watch them shuck oysters at the bar - kinda fun).

Bleh is the best way to describe the food. My husband and I, along with another couple, came for dinner. We were seated quickly on the balcony and the service was fast and friendly but the food was mediocre. We got a shrimp pot, shrimp platter, shrimp po boy, and spinach dip.  The dip was the best part and it quickly went down from there. The shrimp po boy was way too dry. I thought these things had a sauce that went in it? The boiled shrimp pot was not spicy at all, despite the waitress warning us it would be spicy. The shrimp on the platter lacked flavor and was chewy. Would we come back? Only for drinks and the balcony seating, definitely not the food.

If this is authentic creole food, then I'm the frigging tooth fairy. I will be completely honest, we didn't try any of the raw fare, just the fully cooked items. Also, the service was good. Our server was attentive and did not charge us for one of the dishes below for reasons I shall now get into. We had a platter with jambalaya, etouffe and gumbo. It came out as three little thimbles of food. Fine. Was it three scrumptiously delicious thimbles? No. It was some of the worst food I've ever had in New Orleans. I also made the terrible mistake of ordering the creole shrimp. The shrimp weren't deveined and I was told that is normal. Fine. Maybe I'm just a weirdo Texan who likes her shrimp cleaned. The bigger problem is that all of the  food was severely lacking in flavor to the point of being inedible. The etouffe and gumbo both tasted the same. The jambalaya could be choked down,  but only after I doused it in salt and pepper. To add insult to injury it took about 30 minutes to get our bloody mary's (which were ok) and about an hour to get our food (on a Monday with now crowds). It is such a pity because they are located in such a great central area. But if you have the gall to serve such sub par food in the heart of New Orleans, you might as well make it fast because we know you saved time on not seasoning the food.

Service: MELVA was our server. She was on it. She was bubbly and sweet. She loves her job. She knew when to check in on us. She rocked it.

Atmosphere: mellow, cool music, interior is so stylish.
The food was okay, kind of bland. The drinks and service was really good. You can't beat the location because it's really close to Bourbon street.

Slow service .... Mediocre quality food...This place may be gold standard for New Orleans but not for me. Stay with the Shrimp and grits- it was good. Po Boy tasted rubbery.  I won't recommend or come back here again....too many other places around.

The food was fantastic and the drinks were good. I went with a group of 8 and the table they gave us was for a group of 6, but we made it work. The server was attentive and responded quickly if we needed anything. I would definitely recommend this place to anyone, but note that there was a wait.

I'm not impressed. We got the crawfish ravioli and the redfish. Redfish was pretty good, but not exciting. I do not recommend this place. There are better places. The ravioli was too salty. Food took SO LONG to come out we were wondering what happened. I believe it took about 1 hour. 

Giving it a generous 3 stars for the really nice waitress. And the free alligator appetizer from the coupon.

We got table right away after walking for awhile looking for place to eat. Appetizer came out not so long. But we had to wait for dinner for a very long time and they were cold! Food were ok. Service was ok. Prize is too high. It's over prize for food and service. Don't recommend. Should walk away and keep looking for different place.

We got a little bit of a each of the appetizers. I liked the grilled oysters. They were delicious. I had had them the day before & they were better here. The shrimp caprese was ok. The shrimp were perfectly cooked, but the mozz cheese was a little bland. Our service was amazing. It was my favorite part. I would eat here again on our next trip.
Delicious jambalaya!! Had to wait a little for a table, but it was worth it. Service & food was great. You must check this place out for some classic New Orleans food!

Absolutely delicious and fantastic atmosphere. The Oysters Royale and the Crab Claws were amazing. I cannot say enough about how much I enjoyed eating my food and then tasting everyone else's. Great service too. I cannot wait to come back!

We got table right away after walking for awhile looking for place to eat. Appetizer came out not so long. But we had to wait for dinner for a very long time and they were cold! Food were ok. Service was ok. Prize is too high. It's over prize for food and service. Don't recommend. Should walk away and keep looking for different place.
Great place to eat good food and watch New Orleans entertainment! Tasha and Mykel were really personable and took great care of us.

We were in the French Quarter for 2 nights and both nights ate at the Royal House.  The staff and the food were wonderful.  First night was the sampler plate and oysters while sitting at the bar watching Andrew and Nobroe at the oyster bar while Oscar gave us great service at the bar.  Next night we sat up on the balcony over looking a fantastic vocal duo perform on the street below.  It was magical and Raven our server was the epitome of southern hospitality.  I congratulate manager Tasha and her crew for making so many great memories for us.
Seafood is so fresh. Grilled oyster is just so so. But the white sauce in pasta is amazing!

Saw this place had some cool balcony seating right over saint louis street.  Great view and atmosphere of everything going on.  The balcony was on a slight slant which is a little nerve racking but you get over it pretty quick once you put your big boy pants on.

Server Oran was great peoples.  An absolute pleasure.   

Got the char grilled oysters to start (chargrilled in butter and Parmesan) and they were phenomenal.  Next split the ribeye dish and crawfish ravioli and they were both excellent (the crawfish ravioli much more than the ribeye, the ribeye was actually just good.). Overall cool spot and nice experience.

Our server was friendly but not attentive in any way. It seemed like some of her friends or acquaintances were also dining there. She engaged in a 20+ minute conversation with them while we were waiting to pay for our overpriced, cold, lack of seasoning, sat under the heat lamp for hours, not fresh, frozen crostini, piss poor meals. We asked another server if he could give us our checks. He asked who our server was, we gave him her name and he proceeded to walk past her three times without saying a word to her about our request. Again, the service was poor and  the food was less than stellar. I would not recommend this establishment to my worst enemy.
Don't waste your appetite. Go down a few blocks and eat at Acme. Royal house is not worth your time.

A prior positive dining experience at the Royal House was cause for it's selection for dinner during a recent visit to New Orleans. Keeping this brief, the server was curt and inattentive, which could be overlooked were it not for the extreme delay in food delivery. 

A simple appetizer was delivered after a wait of 30 minutes, negating the purpose of that preamble.  A featured local meal was served after an hour's wait and then only after tracking down and complaining to the server.  Further complaint brought the manager to the table with apologies and a reduction in the bill. It should be mentioned that the food was tasty but just warm not hot.

We dropped by after the evening rush and were extremely disappointed. I have no idea why this place was recommended. We sat upstairs on the balcony which was nice but extremely tilted. At one point one of our drinks took off across the table. I barely caught it before it would have went flying down to the street. The worst part was the food. The sauces on the etouffee and ravioli tasted like they came out of a can. Seriously, just like Chef Boyardee. The service was also poor. After 30 minutes our waitress said.. oh sorry, I forgot to put in your order. What? Lastly the prices were way too high. Don't waste your time here.

Eat here. It is delicious! Melva was or server. She is amazing. I had the red beans and rice. My husband has The blackened chicken sandwich. Both were amazing. Highly recommend. The have a couple TVs so my husband got to watch opening day baseball too!

I was refunded a few days ago. Better service about this issue could have been provided, but it is resolved now. Although the shrimp was poisoning, the Royal Oysters were the best I've had in my life, to be fair.

Had lunch here with a large group. The staff was very friendly and accommodated our table of 8 pretty quickly. The service was a little slow, but that could have been related to the size of the group. Ordered the shrimp poboy with the hush puppies. My shrimp were a little on the cold side, which is not great for fried shrimp (perhaps it sat waiting the other orders). The lettuce, tomato, pickles were fine, mayo came on the side. The bread was super chewy - none of he nice crunch of a good French roll. The hush puppies were okay - had some kick with jalapeños, nothing spectacular. Overall an underwhelming sandwich.

Wow, from other Yelper's, and the menu , I must admit it looked great. We were really looking forward to dining here. However...

1) We requested sitting on a balcony, which we waited 10 minutes for. However, while sitting there for 15 minutes, I noticed a very sickening odor, then realized it was gas (the kind from a stove). We were allowed to move inside, but surprisingly even though they said it could have been a burner that burnt out, they sat others there too. Health hazard folks.

2) Received 2 glasses of water, no utensils. Asked our waitress for them, and never got them. 

3) We had ordered, appetizer and meals. Several other tables seated after us had already been served before we received our appetizer. It finally came, and we didn't understand why others (seated after us) received their meals before we even got our appetizer. We stressed that we did not want our meals served until after we finished. 

4) Guess what? Within 2 minutes, a guy comes out with our dishes, and we told him no, we just got our appetizer. With a smug look he circled around, thinking we would accept these. 

5) We requested to speak to a manager. At this point, I could care less if he was going to give us a free dinner, I was so angry, I would never eat here. 

Shame hotel confirmed my initial thought that it was a good place to go. The food may (who knows) be good, but the service ranks among the 10 worst that I have ever had. I would never return here. 

Rather be able to give this place a 0 if Yelp allowed me to.
Good food and the staff is very friendly. We sat on the balcony and it is slanted, didn't feel safe.

I have no idea what others are eating. I was looking for a light shrimp dish for lunch. I ordered the caprese salad with shrimp. Hard tomatoes with a paltry amount of dry cold not spicy shrimp. This is not good food. I just got here so I will keep exploring
Underwhelming food with dangerous shaky balcony. Had the oyster poboy and chopped salad. Nothing to write home about.

Pretty good food here in NO! A little on the pricey side for what you get but since this is a very tourist heavy area, I expect that. We had the alligator appetizer ($11 for 6 small pieces), the red beans and rice, shrimp platter and fish platter. The food was all very good! I saw a ravioli plate pass me and I definitely wished I had gotten that. I will probably return during my stay here.

Was close to our hotel and decided to try it. Hurricanes here are good and fresh! Food is good as well. Had the oysters and red fish beignets. The service is great! 

Good food and great service are what make a restau

Great bar. Charisma the receptionist was incredibly friendly on our carriage ride by and we choose to return to have a late lunch.  The environment is warm and embracing. Antoine at the bar was both bartender & oyster shucker - warm and friendly as well. Great oysters ...and the grilled red fish was delicious.  Definitely in our "return" list.

Worth the wait. I had RH a few years ago when I visited NOLA. My most recent NOLA trip we decided to go back to the same place and try our luck at another amazing dinner. There was a long line but only waited about 30 mins to be seated. We started off with a few apps and proceeded with dinner. No complaints. Food was great just like we remembered!

We were fortunate enough to arrive mid afternoon with no wait. We sat upstairs on the balcony. We started with the stuffed mushrooms. They were more like "stuffing balls" and the mushrooms were the size of a quarter (more stuffing than mushroom).-wouldn't order again.
I had the Shrimp Caprese salad as my entree and my boyfriend had the French Onion Soup. The tomatoes on my salad were hard and barely ripe. The balsamic glaze was good however, the shrimp were very small and mushy. They also were not deveined. I asked for a side of bread and it was hard and stale. My boyfriend enjoyed the soup. We both had a Bloody Mary which was very good yet inconsistent-mine came with an olive, pickled onion, pickled green bean and celery however, my boyfriends only had a piece of celery. We only saw our server twice and had to hunt her down for our check. The entire upstairs floor was empty on the balcony and inside yet the service was very poor. Other than the Bloody Mary the food and service was poor.  Two stars simply for the Blood Mary's and the view from the balcony. Would not return here.

I was disappointed by the reviews.  Our meal was hit and miss.  The chargrilled oysters and French onion soup was good and drinks were yummy.  My husband had the blackened  shrimp jambalaya...we could have made better at home from a box.  I order an alligator po boy but got a fried oyster po boy instead and our server was no where around to tell her.  Find another place for yummy creole/seafood food.

Had high hopes for this place based on the reviews, but unfortunately we were disappointed.   After waiting for almost an hour we were seated in an area that had at least 10 empty tables (why the long wait??).  We ordered the crab claw appetizer (which we never got), shrimp and grits and a cheeseburger.   The shrimp and grits was ok, but the shrimp were very small, popcorn sized., essentially it was nothing special.  The cheeseburger patty was burnt on the outside and raw on the inside.  There are so many wonderful restaurants in New Orleans---please don't waste your time or money on this tourist trap.
Oysters were awesome - tasted fresh! Good service and location. The Po-boys were good, everything tasted fresh from the protein to the bread.
I had the alligator po boy - very good! The French Bread was a little tougher than I would have liked. Our server was very polite and helpful, and the balcony view is great.

Meh.  We were there during the French Quarter Fest and it was very busy, so they may not have been at their best, but our food was warm (at best) and uninspired. The staff was in good spirits and friendly, but they seemed confused about their responsibilities. Grits were dry and firm.

Tina was our waitress, and her sweet New Orleans charm added to the whole experience! She was attentive and sweet with our children. 

We ordered two kid burgers, which came with fries, and the girls ate them right up. Shirley temple was a bit steep at $5, actually a bit more than my iced tea!

For the adult food, we ordered chargrilled oysters, as per Tina's recommendation. They did not disappoint! I may or may not have spooned up the extra parmesan and butter after finishing the oysters, as the flavor was divine :)

My husband and I each ordered the sampler which came with gumbo, jambalaya, and etoufee. My favorites, in order were etoufee, jambalaya, and gumbo. All well seasoned, and flavorful. A perfect last meal in New Orleans!

We will definitely return here during our next trip and ask for Tina :)

Food was excellent. Delicious crawfish ravioli and baked shrimp tortellini. And we were able to redeem the $10 coupon for an appetizer. A nice and reasonably priced bottle of white wine and I say it was an excellent meal in a historic restaurant. PS the wait staff were attentive and informed. Great job!

We love it here. Get the oysters on the half shell! If you don't don't think you'll like them you are wrong. This is the place.  We had Nairobi help us at the counter. He was great. We shared a dozen oysters, fries, a caprese salad and a couple glasses of wine. Once again, come and have a meal here!

You absolutely MUST try the Chargrilled Oysters. Seriously amazing! Garlic, melted butter and parmigiana...plus bread for dipping! Unreal. My husband said the Chicken and Andouille Gumbo was delicious. I could only manage the Seafood stuffed mushrooms...again delicious! We sat at the bar. Which we  often do, better more attentive service. Heather was exceptional. We will be back.

Over priced with not much proteins. I got the oyster po-boy for around $18 it came with 6 tiny oysters.  The bread was comically large and stuffed with lettuce, tomatoes and pickles. 

Daughter got the New Orleans sampler which was 90% rice in various forms - jambalaya, Crawfish Etouffée and Chicken and Andouille Gumbo. Sounds good right? Um 90 percent rice!  For $18. Rice. 

Wife got the crawfish ravioli, at around $25 but it was very good.  Worth the price. Tasty and not overwhelmingly rich.

Such a great experience here! I popped in to get a drink and snack after a busy day exploring and walking around the French Quarter Festival! I sat at the bar to avoid waiting for a table, and the bartenders were so sweet! The one who I mainly interacted with advised me to get the cucumber gin drink, which was also his fave (spoiler alert - I ended up getting three because they were that good. One was to go, but when I brought it back to the air bnb for my friends to try, they drank it all up!). 

For food, I ordered the gumbo appetizer as I really wanted something authentic to New Orleans. I asked my awesome bartender what he would recommend as far as oysters go, and he suggested the charbroiled oysters, which were out of this world amazing! The spices on the oysters tasted so good I wanted to bottle them up and eat them with everything. With my refreshing drink, the semi-spicy and rich gumbo and flavorful oysters were a perfect combo!
Incredibly delicious. Gotta try the crab hush puppies. Great service, great drinks.

Don't see how it is possible this place has so many positive reviews.  Indifferent service, not cheap, but worst of all, completely mediocre fare.  Went for Etouffee and got a lukewarm bowl of gelatinous sauce that tasted like it came from a Campbell's can AND the crawfish were deep fried like a fast food restaurant - horrible for my $20.  For comparison, my wife had the same dish the previous night at KPauls and it was fantastic - OMG what a difference $10 extra makes.
Highly overrated. Food portions were moderate with a high price. Go down the street to Mr. Ed's. Larger menu and better tasting food.

5/5: customer service, food, and hey it's New Orleans!
Our server/waitress was friendly, genuine, and knowledgeable about the menu.

Will I return? HellA yes, dam right!

Date night; birthday celebration
Excellent time at the Bar watching them shuck the oysters.  We went through about 48 raw oysters, and I wanted more but was too full.  Excellent spot, and I will be going back.

I was hesitant to eat here since there were some mixed reviews, but I'm very glad we made this our choice for a late Friday night supper!  The Fried Alligator was tasty, and the Oysters on the half shell didn't disappoint!  My daughter had the Shrimp Tortellini ...it was AMAZING!! My Red Beans and Rice was very pleasing. Our waitress offered to substitute the fried chicken fingers for more sausage on my dish, and I'm extremely glad!! The sausage was awesome!!! My husband liked his Gumbo...this was probably the only thing I wasn't wild about...I still prefer a good seafood gumbo. The dessert, however, OMGoodness!!!! We split a Banana Cheesecake which is a deconstructed cheesecake with what appeared to be a Bananas Foster type of sauce. I'm not a huge Banana fan, but this dessert was off the charts delicious!!!!!!!!  I wanted to lick the bowl!!

Best Bloody Mary's on the planet!!!  Bartenders were awesome and had great recommendations.  The food was a disaster however.  Took 45 minutes to come out and then the rice in the jambalaya was under cooked to the point that it hurt.  Still though, the manager comp'd those and the drinks were spot on.
Good food. Sat upstairs. Nice view. Stairs are crazy steep and scary. Went for lunch. Service was good.

The banana Foster's cheesecake is a must!! Best thing I've ate in New Orleans. The crab claw appetizer is very good also. I had the pecan crusted mahi mahi with the potatoes. Both were very good but the potatoes were extremely flavorful and exceeded my expectations. Overall the Royal House is my new favorite for the big easy!

If you are looking for high quality food but like me you're wearing shorts and a tank top then this is the place for you.  It was fine dining with decent prices and a causual atmosphere. Everything was amazing! We had charbroiled oysters, fried alligator, the taste of new orleans, and bread pudding. Everything was delectable! We sat at the bar and had amazing service. Mint julep was fantastic!
The food is really good but the 5 stars is really for the service. They're friendly, helpful and entertaining as heck. Tina was our server and she was absolutely lovely.
Love this place. And Leroy the bartender is awesome. The food and service is great. And who ever complains is just a nagging person. I recommend this place.

Worst fried shrimp I have ever had, I would rather go to Long John Silver's. How sad is that?
$15.00 for a shrimp po-boy. Only worth about  $8.00 if that.
Definitely will not return!
Melva provided awesome service! Delicious shrimp. Awesome fresh oysters. Great drinks!

We dined here at 5pm on a Wednesday. It was pretty empty. The hostesses cared more about carrying on their conversation than greeting us. We asked to sit up on the balcony and we (my husband and myself) were one of two tables occupied on the upper level. The service was ridiculously slow. We had one server and ordered our appetizer of the combo char-oysters and after waiting several minutes a different server came up and said he was now taking care of us. Weird but whatever. Several more minutes later we got the app. The oyster were amazing which is why I'm giving this place a three star review. Absolutely freaking amazing, hot and fresh. But man the service... after finishing our 6 oysters we waited and waited for our server. It was at least 10 minutes until we saw him again and he just glanced at us and quickly spirited by. Another 5 minutes and we asked for the check deciding to give one of the other restaurants nearby a shot since our service was so poor. So if you aren't in a rush to dine certainly go here for the char oysters but management sometimes and this time included no matter how great the food is the service can certainly sour a meal. I'd go back though and suffer through the pain to have those oysters.

Got the taste if new orleans fir lunch....for $18 the portion was small. To be honest I'm still a bit hungry. That said it was a good Etouffee.  Eating on the balcony with a cool breeze and beutiful  view on the balcony was worth the visit.
Eh. It was ok. Nothing great. Cooked oysters were fine. Raw were good. Waitress was a character. Kind of touristy place. Wouldnt go back
French onion soup is very good. My 2nd favorite with a place in Old Orchard Beach, Maine my favorite. Stuffed mushrooms delicious. Went there twice on my last stay

Houses our favorite chargrilled oysters and we've tried them at Acme (great too) and Felix (good but too charred). Perfect here and would've given 5 stars if the rest was consistent. I had the taste of New Orleans one night and was surprised the Jambalaya was my favorite in the trio. A day or so later came back for the oysters and a side of jambalaya and the jambalaya was totally different and dry. Sort of disappointing but the oysters are worth it here. Good fried oysters as well.

Came in toward end of lunch rush was seated right away by the window. Wanted to try oyster rockefeller so decided in a oyster duo which also had the oyster royale. They were both great. Rockefeller had a bit of a kick to it which I didn't mind. Also got raw oysters and those were good too. Overall, good food and good service
Very slow service. Waited over 30 minutes for our food and still forgot our oysters. Fried alligator was the worst we've had. The taste of New Orleans was just ok.

I had the unfortunate pleasure of coming to dinner here with a group of 8 girls on a Friday night. We were told the wait was going to be 30-45 minutes which was fine as we had a large group. After waiting about 45 minutes we were seated in the completely empty upstairs. Another group of 8-10 girls was seated nearby about 10 minutes after us. That group was promptly greeted and served bread while our server sat down some packaged saltine crackers (I guess because we ordered oysters). About an hour into us sitting down I asked if we were going to get bread to which I was told that they couldn't give us any because they didn't have enough to serve with entrees. Our food eventually came out, 5 out of the 8 dishes were completely cold and 1 of the 8 dishes was missing entirely. Also, the bread that they were "saving" for our entrees was as thick as a tortilla. They took the cold food back to be reheated after we complained. 

While waiting for food for a second time, our server asked if we wanted another round of drinks. One of the girls said "I want something strong, I'll get an old fashioned". She brought the old fashioned out in a TALL glass and told us they were out of short glasses. Shocking how many things this restaurant is "out" of. If you see the attached picture of the old fashion you will see how much of a joke this place is. When the bill came, my friend was charged for a double old fashioned. She asked the server why she was charged for a double when that is not what she ordered to which the server responded "well you said you wanted something strong". 

Overall a bad experience. Maybe it's better if you're in a small group but wow, we won't be returning. There are way too many other enjoyable restaurants in New Orleans.

Visited for dinner and brought some friends that were visiting New Orleans for the first time.  I bragged a bit about the place but was a bit disappointed. I had the eggplant clam dish and it was so bad that I almost couldn't believe it was the same restaurant that I visited months prior. 

The noodles were so watery that the flavor was diluted. The portion was a lot smaller than my pre-Mardi Gras visits. I was so disappointed.

The view on the balcony was fun especially if you have the right performers out there. We had a violinist in the background. So, the service here is superb. Our waitress, Chrisela (sp?) was funny. Everyone is super nice and attentive. Food came out on time and complete. 

I tried their Hurricane drink which was too sweet for my taste but thought I'd try it since it's one of NOLAs signature drinks. 

The crab legs were delish! Only wish there were more of them in the tasty cream. 

I ordered the fish poboy that came with fries. For $15 I thought it was overpriced for flavor. There was nothing spectacular about it. It wasn't bad but it wasn't the best poboy I've had. 

4 stars was for the service, the view and ambience.
Great place for Oysters. Shucking them right at the bar.  Supper nice staff.  Trying the fried shrimp tonight.

Wow seriously disappointed. Was excited to eat here. Took over an hour before even appetizers came. Food came out cold. Rice was way under cooked. When I complained they came and said they'd send a manager. Manager came out with a replacement that I didn't want.  I asked for them to take them off my bill and they did but still charged me for the appetizer. So long story short we are back at Acme eating an awesome meal. If I could select 0 stars I would.
Great service, everyone was so friendly. Food was good too! The royal house burger was cooked perfectly and everything was served hot and fresh. The music was fun too!
Great service, sat at the bar and the bar tender was outstanding! Great oysters, the Caesar salad was iceberg lettuce- sadly quite disappointed, in the salad - would not recommend it
The balcony looks like it will fall off the building at any moment, but their food is incredible. Especially the oysters. SO. GOOD.

This place gets 5 stars because of TYRONE!!! If you go here you MUST ask for him. 
He is the best waiter I actually have ever had. He just ran to Cafe Beignet to get my friend one.. like ran down the street and surprised her. I mean.. just amazing.
And the foods great too!!

The food was lacking taste for sure. The bananas foster cheesecake was more like soup and the coffee was served in a to go cup. The one star goes to the oysters. It took one hour for us to receive our entrees and nothing was offered during the wait.

Due to the fact that Royal House is centrally located in the French Quarter and has high reviews, I decided to come here for dinner. The oyster duo (Rockefeller/Royale) was a good way to start the meal. Of the two, we preferred the Royale. We ordered two orders of fried alligator, as each order only had about 4 pieces. I would say it tastes like fried chicken, but a bit chewy. The redfish beignets (fried golden brown in tempura batter and finished with a Crystal beurre blanc sauce and cane syrup) were probably my favorite- crispy and flavorful. The Taste of New Orleans is a sampling of the city's most famous dishes: Chicken & Andouille Jambalaya, Crawfish Etouffée and Chicken and Andouille Gumbo. I didn't really care for any of them. 

The evening was fine until we got our bill. My friend had ordered a drink and asked for another shot to be added as it was weak. She was surprised to see her drink was almost $20. We asked our bill to be split between card and cash. When the waiter came back with my card, he had taken all of my friend's cash. Did he think he was getting a 50% tip?! Uh, no. When I politely asked him for the change back from the cash, he told me I needed to sign my receipt first and the bartender will handle the change. Ok... Overall, IMO the place is overpriced tourist trap. Don't let the long lines fool you.
Enjoyed the food, which I came to realize after was all a bit pricy, and the hospitality was very great. Each of the dishes was very unique and has its own special taste only found in New Orleans.
Great view of street performers if you get a seat on the balcony.  The food is pretty average, and much more expensive than I expected. The sauteed crab chase were r really good.

Disappointing. Our waiter was kind but ticket times for appetizers were around 20 minutes and dinner had to be near an hour. Our party of 8 was there for over two hours and after we were done eating we waited for our check for 30 minutes. They forgot one person's burger and another entree was cold and had to be sent back. The restaurant was not busy. They don't split checks either which caused more problems than the food was worth. Better options in the city for sure.

So, so, so shocked that this place is as highly rated as it is. Frankly, the food approaches "sucking". Two stars for really friendly service and the crab claws, but our mozzarella and tomato salad was terrible (grainy tomato, tasteless mozz, and gigantic chunks of raw red onion ?). Our main, a whole red fish, was just absolutely terrible. Before it even touched our table it was so clear that it was dried out. It looked like it was sitting under heat lamps in a buffet for hours. When we went to try it, it was even drier than it appeared. Complete waste of a NOLA trip meal. If you insist on coming, at least try to cop a seat on the balcony, like we did, so you can enjoy the view!
Food is great Melva is great. She took such good care of us. My husband ordered all the seafood from the menu! Great experience.

Came back again for the famous New Orleans redfish a few nights later. Fish was meh, broccoli tasted like it was nuked from a bag, potatoes were too garlicky and drowning in oil. Nothing to write home about. Still like the ambiance of the place.
Food was ok, staff was nice but for some reason I wasn't really feeling it.  I felt rushed and that kinda killed the experience for me.  Huge meh.

Had a huge group of 10 and was completely taken care of. We ordered  everything from the Oyster BLT to baked shrimp tortellini.  Dessert was amazing with bananas foster cheesecake and a walnut brownie ala mode. But a HUGE SHOUTOUT to AARON!! He took such good care of us.  Lovely and patient with us. Thank you Sir!

Delicious food all-round. The free appetizer is a great bonus! Been here twice now and would come back for more. 

Crab claws appetizer - for some reason i was expecting a couple of large crab claws but it was actually like a dozen small ones. The sauce was tasty with plenty of garlic flavor.

Charbroiled oysters, delicious. Again lots of garlic which I love.

Blackened shrimp and crawfish jambalaya was also pretty good but nothing spectacular, i would try something else next time.

Banana fosters cheese cake. - best thing i ate. Omg, so deliciously rich with banana and cheese flavor. Slight rum taste and i think the cheesecake base was pecan flavor. Together it was just amazing. Mind, it doesn't look like a normal cheesecake slice, like the base is like a cookie slice and then the cheese cake top is like in separate lumps and then there are banana slices. Yum!

Came in for a dinner since it's right downstairs from our hotel. Great location and great food. The taste of New Orleans is a good deal that gave you the three most NOLA style food. I like the atmosphere in the restaurant. Didn't try the oyster bar but it seems very popular.
Excellent service!  Very helpful and courteous.  Excellent food.  ID before giving drinks.

Food was delicious and service was great. My husband and I ordered the southern and the St. Louis special. Both were fantastic. We sat on the balcony which was amazing. Definitely recommend for a breakfast meal.

What an experience. I've been here several times before when visiting New Orleans and this time was my least favorite. The wait was long with not many people seated inside. The food was greasy and took forever to come out. They didn't have some of the appetizers anymore and it was only 6pm. I'd try it again for another round but it's no longer my first choice in NOLA.
Me and my wife and the Pecan crusted Mahi Mahi and it was Delicious. We had an outstanding waiter his name was ROBERT. Overall this place is spictatuclar. We I'll be coming back here for more.

Was heading to another place for brunch but place was dead walked by Royal House.  Decided to take a chance.  Very unassuming but open air seating, small menu I had the St. Louis special, my wife had the Royal Omelette.  Possibly the best two breakfast dishes we've ever had.  You gotta like seafood but if you like fried oysters and etouffe you should go.  Elva was great!!!  Very nice surprise....

I went here on a Sunday evening simply for the shrimp and grits. The wait time was about 45 minutes. Finally when we got in and it was time to order I was told that the ran out of the shrimp and greats so we ended up going with the Shrimp Jambalaya and the Shrimp Creole. The Jambalaya was so so and the Shrimp Creole was.. lets just say unbeatable. The food is also a little pricey for the microwaved taste. Although I did not enjoy the food This i am still giving the Royal House 4 stars because the service was great and the ambiance is nice. The staff is very friendly and helpful. Very nice environment just disappointed in the food

For our last night in New Orleans, we wanted to try a nice dinner in a more up-scale restaurant. We finally decided on this place based on reviews and the menu. It was a Monday night around 8, so me and my husband were seated immediately. After between 5-10 minutes, we still hadnt been greeted by a server. Then another couple was seated next to us and it was very quick after that the server showed up and spoke to them first, took their drink orders and food orders and told us she would be with us shortly. She finally came to us and took our drink order then asked what we wanted to eat. We ordered drinks then my husband stated we were still  looking at the menu to which she responded "well I saw y'all sitting there so I figured you were ready." Yes, we were ready to order our drinks you never took. I got my drink not long after but it took at least 10 minutes to get my husband's beer. Our food came within a reasonable time frame. It was delicious, even though I'm not sure how they run out of shrimp and grits? I really had my sights on that but ended up having to order a sandwich which again was tasty. The entire time we were maybe seen 3 times by the waitress. We weren't offered refills until we finished our food. She would glance at our table, help her other two next to us, and walk off or go talk outside. I am incredibly disappointed in the service at this place. It was a shame - quality food but with McDonald's hospitality
The oysters are really good! Poboys are packed with seafood. No complaints here! They have balcony seatings too which is really great. Southern food at its finest
Oysters and crab claws were amazing! My husband got the fried oyster po boy and said it was only ok
Bartender was friendly , wine and prices were good , but crawfish etouffee was good but not great -too mild for my taste

Why stand on a line at Acme when you can be in a nicer restaurant and get amazing grilled oysters and other delicious food as well. We had the fried oyster blt and fresh oysters as well. As this was all last meal in New Orleans we really wanted to load up on gulf oysters, they are unlike anything you can get in the north east. I am always a bit leery of what the hotel recommends but this time they were spot on

All touristy. Very over priced. Slow service (went in around 9, the place was empty, still took 20 minutes to get a drink - that I sent back). The drinks: I ordered a double vodka and soda, and it came in a dixie cup, and was $16 dollars. I sent it back - standards in NOLA are at least double the size of that class, for at least half the price. My partner got a bloody mary - $11 for again a very small glass. Didn't get food. Took 20 minutes to get our check. All in all, a waste of time, money, and energy stopping into the Royal House. Go somewhere else for your southern hospitality. I'm confident the only reason they are in business is due to their location and tourist foot traffic. Good luck!
What an amazing restaurant and bar. The crab leg appetizer was so delicious. My wife and I went in 2 days in a row. I highly recommend this place. Everyone is friendly and attentive.

Originally we wanted to go somewhere else to find oysters but since the wait was horrendous for the other restaurant we decided to dine here instead. The wait wasn't too bad at all for a party of 5 on a Saturday night.

We ordered a dozen Chargrilled Oysters and Fried Alligator appetizer to share. I ordered the Crawfish Etouffee for myself. The Chargrilled Oysters were my favorite out of everything. The Crawfish Etouffee was seriously under flavored and tasted pretty bland. It also was luke warm so that didn't help either. 

Service could definitely use some improvement as well. They messed up one of our orders so one person had to wait longer for their food and forgot to to comp the free app we got for checking in through Yelp. I'm just glad the oysters were good.
service here is insanely awful, especially considering the prices. definitely a tourist trap. the host was awesome but other than that, seriously disappointing experience

The food was good but the service was even better. Our server was funny, told great stories and had great suggestions. I ordered the blackened chicken po boy that was perfectly seasoned. We sat by one of the open doors and people watched. A pop band even came and played some music in the street. Use the Yelp check in coupon for the appetizer! Drinks were on point too...not as sweet as what you would find on BOURBON!

I'm pretty surprised that this place has such a high rating. Then again, I'm only giving three stars since our waitress was so sweet and nice and the overall service we received was great. Without that this would most likely be a two star review given the quality of food compared to the prices we paid. 

My friend and I checked in to get the free appetizer and chose spinach artichoke dip which ended up being the highlight of the meal. Aside from that, everything was pretty subpar given New Orleans standards and very processed tasting. We had clams royale which I had been craving since we landed and did not satisfy that craving at all, which surprised me since oysters were one of the things people mentioned repeatedly. For our main entrees, my friend got jambalaya she had been craving and I got the shrimp and grits. My friend said the jambalaya she had at Mother's the next day was much better than the mediocre one at Royal House. The Shrimp and grits were a complete disappointment on my end. The shrimp were small compared to what's been offered at other establishments and the grits looked like they were scooped out of a big vat with everything haphazardly thrown on top. 


I will not be recommending this to anyone for the food, but the service was great.

I enjoyed the food and the staff was very friendly I got the crawfish etouffee it had ok flavor a dash of hot sauce made it better.  I also got oyster duo I enjoyed the crawfish stuffing one better.   The spinach dip was very good though my husband said he likes Chedders better I felt it had great flavor.  I would go just for that.
Our server was awesome, Tyrone had us laughing the whole time. Service was great and the charred oysters... so good! I'm coming back for the bloody Mary's!!

Can't really speak for the food. This review is for drinks and people watching on the balcony. The balcony is super narrow, and it tilts downward a little. Just have faith that nothing will break during your time. Loved the Pimm's cup from here, aka the Royal Pimm's Cup. 

Fried alligator really did taste like chicken. It was super breaded, so couldn't really taste much.

Finally got the perfect balcony seat, safely removed from the street, and able to enjoy people watching, cool breeze, street music, bottle of wine, dozen grilled oysters, and pecan brownie ala mode. Devine!,
Our waitress Melva is the BOMB. Quality Louisiana hospitality and the tastiest food this side of the mason Dixon. A must stop in New Orleans!

All of the food was so fantastic! We got three entrees and split them and everything was perfect! While the food was great, our server Melva was the best part of our  experience! She was so kind and suggested many different drinks and entrees. THANKS MELVA!!!
Great oysters, al fresco dining, and reasonable prices. Simple food but definitely one of the most famous places to enjoy food.

The one star was for the server and the atmosphere.  We ordered a dozen char grilled and a shrimp poboy.  The oysters were gritty and most were burnt.  The poboy had little shrimp and was all bun.  Do not be fooled by the 4 star rating, we were.

Great location, quick service, nice tables by the open windows. Food was average though and the server was pleasant but busy with many tables. It is a bistro style restaurant so quick and standard fare for a fill-up between French Quarter activities are what you get.

Great food and drinks, the chargrilled oysters are well cooked and very flavorful. The banana foster cheese cake is worth every calorie ingested. Friendly waiters, but service can be slow on a busy night. Loud, there were periods of our meal where we could not converse with the person sitting across the table.

A wonderful place for dinner! We had the fried alligator bites, the chargrilled oysters (topped with Parmesan- which made them absolutely amazing), and a spinach salad with gulf shrimp. I didn't get to try it but the other dish at the table was the crab claws in butter and it certainly looked rich and buttery! If I could I'd subtract a half star for the noise level- we couldn't hear the person next to us sometimes but that also seems to be the norm around here. They don't take reservations but we walked straight in on a Friday night and didn't have to wait!
The Oyster BLT was very good. The bread wasn't tough, like some poboys can be. And the rice and beans were full of flavor. The staff was also friendly.

Came came across royal house on my way to another restaurant and I'm glad I stopped in, this place is fabulous! I ordered the BLT oyster Po boy and it was Unbelievable. They also made me my Sazarac which made me very happy. I will definitely go back to Royal house as it's one of the better places and recommended by many locals.

This place was SOOOO good! We sat at the bar to eat dinner since there was a little wait for a table. The Crab Claws Appetizer was amazing. I would bathe in that sauce if it was socially acceptable. The bartenders were great - the perfect combination of funny and sarcastic.

Thick, juicy, fresh oysters! End of story. Great view of Royal Street and its street performers from the second floor balcony, as well. It was a great place to quickly stop in for a few drinks after a 2-hour walking tour of the French Quarter.

Food decent, service good. Yelp offer is misleading. Ad says "Free appetizer with purchase when Check in" once clicked shows that it can only be redeemed with purchase of min 2 entrees. Wish it was transparent. Not any other purchase.

Best thing about this dinner was the staff. Everybody was so nice. We really loved the French onion soup, cheese was overflowing the pot! My daughter's burger and the alligator app was really good. Can't say that for my shrimp and grits though. Our waitress told us they have a new chef, so the picture posted as the shrimp and grits, wasn't what I received. The grits were underdone and had no flavor besides the sauce on top. I had to send it back because it came out cold, so they pretty much just microwaved it and gave it back to me... not cool, not good. 
Probably won't go back next time we're in New Orleans.
Food was unbelievable!  The jumbalaya was ridiculous!  As was the blackened red fish.  Notable 2nd was red beans and rice and the etouffee.

I am traveling from LA and I had MUCH BETTER New Orleans food there than this place!!!! Quality and service was way lower than expected. It was really tourist trap kind of restaurant. NEVER EVER going back here!!!
