Great breakfast place!! Music is awesome!! Melva was amazing!! Great personality, attentive, spirited, everything you want in a server. You could tell that she truly enjoys her job an serving her customers!
Definitely will return because of the great service!! And, will recommend this place to friends!!!
Thank you, Melva!!!!
Highly recommend! The breakfast is awesome with excellent service. The Bloody Mary's are the BOMB

This was the last place my boyfriend and I ate at during our vacation, and by far the most memorable. We were seated on the balcony overlooking the intersection and served drinks right away. The view was absolutely gorgeous! Our server was very attentive and friendly. We ordered chargrilled oysters and pasta with various seafood in it. Everything was fresh and delicious.. Probably the freshest seafood we had the entire trip (and not deep fried!). I can't wait to visit this restaurant again.

3 stars because the food was okay, great crab claws and the crawfish ravioli wasnt bad but the experience was awful. We were pretty much ignored only getting help from busboys we stopped and then after only eating our appetizer our waiter brought our ticket and a to go water, which I asked for twice. They didn't even know we didn't get our meal, it was never put in. Very frustrating experience, in the end we were taken care of but only after putting up a fight. I normally would never feel i should get a free meal but this was outrageous from the 1st minute.

Oh my! This place was very very good! The oysters are amazing don't go to acme it's not as good as this place. Plus the balcony seating was amazing it gave us the whole view of the place make sure you check your bill when paying because we did the yelp check in but forgot to let our waiter know we did checked in. Overall this place is very very good!!

Man man man. I usually don't give low ratings but I came in here expecting really good food due to the other reviews I came across. Not only did the food take long it was also really disappointing. The spinach artichoke dip was below average and served with stale tortilla chips. The oysters needed more Parmesan but were pretty big. I ordered the redfish topped with crab meat but this tasted like a burnt piece of cardboard and the crab meat had no flavor. Service was good but the food needs to be on the same level.
Staff was very friendly and helpful with suggestions. Food was good. The jumbalya was phenomenal!

First off- check in and get the appetizer. We used it for raw oysters, which were huge and tasty.

We sat at a street side table and were within earshot of an incredible violinist. What a treat!  Drinks were good, but too sweet and not very strong. We got the peel n eat shrimp boil, which was pretty good. We also got a shrimp po boy, which does not come with a remoulade, which I was really craving. And they had none in the back of house, so I had to make my own. Haha. Still a good dinner and a pretty good pit stop while wondering the French quarter.
Try to get the balcony. Come here for the ambience, it's in great location of the French quarter. Food is excellent as wrll

Honestly I've never been a seafood person. My ideal protein is chicken and I usually hate the rubbery texture and sea flavor of most seafood meals. New Orleans and especially Royal House has converted me to seafood! 

First of all, the yelp check-in here is clutch. With the order of an entree per person you get a free appetizer! It will be a lot of food as each entree is probably enough to feed 2 but why not? :)

The balcony is open during the weekends and other popular hours but even if it is closed, there are many great tables right by the windows with a view of the French Quarter. 

Onto the food. The appetizer blew our minds - Lemon Garlic Butter Crab Claws. Tender pieces of crab in this amazing buttery sauce. We soaked up every drop of the sauce with the bread. Next we had the fried oyster linguine. Nicely fried with good flavor and not too much oil. The creamy pasta was a perfect addition. Lastly we had the fried fish po boy. Sauces provided were just mayo and ketchup and the dressing was nothing special, but the fish itself was delicious! Light breading and tender fish. 

I think its safe to say that my meal at Royal House taught me how to correctly have a seafood feast. Life changing.

Overall the food was good, this was our first stop down in New Orleans so we had nothing to compare it to yet. The wait was reasonable since they were incredibly busy. The charcoaled oysters were awesome! Definitely a MUST if you're into oysters. The crawfish etouffe was okay, nothing mind blowing and it was overpriced for the portion. Restaurant was clean and we even had a manager come by our table to ask if we were doing okay. 
Good place and a nice stop, try to ask to sit at the balcony so you can see the view from Royal st.
It was okay but not what I'd hoped for.  I've eaten at some amazing spots this week and could've skipped this one. The service was excellent though!

We had a very bad experience at this place.

After we placed the order, we waited almost an hour before the dishes came out. We had the waiter check in it twice. At last, when the waiter brought it out, the food looked like it had been sitting in the kitchen for quite some time --- you can tell from the rice, the ravioli, and the jambalaya: they had become much drier and colder than they should have been. We don't know if the waiter missed the finished dishes in the kitchen, or if there were some mistakes in the kitchen.

Apart from that, the dishes tasted badly. We don't think it compares to the other places in New Orleans with similar Yelp ratings. Especially the gumbo, which tasted awful --- the rice tasted like it had been over-burnt and carbonized.

Last but not least, the table is way too small and cramped for a group of 4 -- they provide table of the same size to all groups of 2 and 4.

We wouldn't come again, and wouldn't recommend it to others.

My friends and I came here on a not very busy Monday evening. We waited for over an hour until we got our dishes. The food kinda ruined our all-good experience at New Orleans. The food was lukewarm and taste not fresh. The worst dish was the gumbo. It tastes really strange, we feel like the rice was over-burn, tastes very bitter. It's a disaster comparing with other places such as the gumbo shop. We would not recommend this place to any one and it was hard to understand the stellar review of this place.

The location of the Royal House couldn't be better if you're a tourist checking out the Quarter. But honestly the food is lacking in flavor, presentation, and freshness. 
The eggplant chips were really just thick friend slices of eggplant, delicious but overpriced. My friend ordered the catfish ettoufe and didn't eat it, she said it was bland and not worth it. 
The chopped chicken salad I bought was completely wilted, and saturated with far too much of what was clearly a bottled dressing, but I powered through because I paid like $13 for it. 
Overall, the food is not great and absolutely NOT worth the price. If you're looking for somewhere with great food, go elsewhere (try magazine street!!!), but come in to the Royal House if you want a nice ambience at the bar and some oysters.

We ordered the jumbalaya and the gumbo and it was worth every penny! While slightly more pricey, the location, ambience and the  food is definitely worth it. Great place for a drink and some noms; the menu was varied, with quite a few options, but definitely New Orleans.

This place does not deserve 4 stars. If you are looking for an authentic Cajun-Creole meal do not come here! The Gumbo was not good at all and it tasted like it came out of a can. The grilled oyster came to our table cold and were not good.This place is over priced and poor quality. Save your time and money!

The service at this place was the worst I've ever seen anywhere! First they seated us at a table that was still wet. Then our server did not show up for the longest time. When she finally did, she did not get us any cutlery, did not get us water, and even after we ASKED for those things (and napkins to wipe down the table) - did not bring any of that out, like at all. She got our drinks wrong - brought a Heineken instead of a Hurricane. And then later on, she actually tried to bill us for that Heineken too. We could see it on her face plain as day that she did it on purpose and not by mistake. I had to flag another server down to get cutlery - who also took forever by the way and did it in three rounds - I kid you not. First he brought the forks out, then the knives, and then the napkins. The food also took forever to come out and some of it was cold, not warm, COLD. How these people are still in business, I've no idea. Guess because (some of) the food isn't half-bad, and same goes for the drinks (once we finally got them.) But the quality of the service was so horrific that it took away from our whole experience. NEVER AGAIN.

I see mixed reviews for the Royal House, but for my family and I, we were quite happy with our visit here.  We came on a weekday thinking the lines wouldn't be bad, but we did have to wait considering our large party.  No big deal since there is always something to see out in the streets of the French Quarter.  The architecture and history all around is a sight to see!  When we were finally seated, we were greeted by our very awesome waiter.  Our service from start to finish was top notch as well.  

We checked in on Yelp, so were were able to redeem a free appetizer. I wanted to stick with some good ole Cajun food, so Fried Alligator it was!  It was seasoned and cooked to perfection.  It had a slight heat like I would expect out of this dish.  For my entree, I decided on the crawfish etouffee.  It was tasty and filling, but I have had better.  Now the table favorite which my daughter ordered was the pecan crusted mahi mahi.  It was pan seared, but with the pecan crust, it had a nice deep fried crust to it.  The lemon butter sauce topped on the fish was outstanding.  It really made the dish.  She ordered garlic mashed potatoes and hush puppies on the side which were both tasty.  My wife's redfish was delicious as well.  It was blackened just right and the taste was great.  For dessert, if there is bread pudding on the menu, I'm getting it, full or not!  What made this bread pudding stand apart from others is that there was peaches baked into it.  It was a nice touch and a pleasant change from just raisins.  The sauce on top was a frangelico sauce which is essentially a hazelnut topping.  Delicious I tell ya!

Overall, I can see why this is a local favorite.  With thousands of reviews and high ratings, the ratings are well deserved!

From the lovely hostesses at the front desk to our wonderful waiter Joe, everything here was perfect.  I'd had plenty of fried oysters before, but I finally took the plunge and ordered my first half dozen on the half shell.  They were delicious!  We also had the chargrilled oysters - garlicky and tender - and the spinach salad that came with a sweet and tangy apple vinaigrette.  We completed our meal with a bottle of cava.  I couldn't have asked for a better dinner!

Great food, great view, and excellent service! We had oysters Rockefeller, the New Orleans sampler, and the spinach salad which i added blackened red fish to. The Bloody Mary is the best in town! Outserver Kaitlyn was so attentive, friendly, and had the best recommendations-will definitely be returning.

Highlight was our server. He was super friendly and took great care of us. We had the crab legs as an appetizer and that was for sure the best part of dinner.

I tried the alligator po boy, which was decent, but a little salty. My husband the taste of New Orleans, which he really liked. The server up sold him on it, which ended up being a good choice but an extra $7. 

Overall, thought this was a good place for dinner.

This was my first time in New Orleans and we read many good reviews about this place. 

We ordered crab claws, fried alligator, gumbo, taste of New Orleans, and their brownie dessert. Overall the food was pretty good. The crab claws has a great sauce which we dipped our bread in and ordered extra bread. The fried alligator tasted exactly like chicken, we wouldn't have been able to tell the difference if we were aware that we were ordering gator.  The taste of New Orleans came with 3 small bowls of gumbo, chicken and sausage jambalaya, and crawfish etouffee. Of the 3, the best was the crawfish etouffee which was perfectly seasoned. The gumbo was not bad but I don't have much to compare it to. Their jambalaya was nothing special. Lastly, the brownie dessert came with ice cream and strawberries, but overall was standard dessert.

Service was good but a little slow. The restaurant was on the busier side when we arrived for lunch. 

If I we're to come back to New Orleans, I think I would be willing to come back, but to try their other dishes.

My husband and I came to NOLA for the first time to celebrate his birthday and our anniversary. We have had  2 prior days of nothing short of fabulous meals... breakfast, lunch & dinner.
On 3rd day we took a plantation tour that resulted in us not being able to stop for a lunch break. After arriving back at hotel at 3:30p starving, we  were  anxious to find a great late lunch place and were recommended to Royal House. It seemed like a nice casual bar/small Restsurant and we felt lucky to be given a table at an open air spot with a very nice  waitress.  Our luck stopped there... we ordered a fried shrimp po'boy and a chicken on a salad.  The po'boy were terrible!!  Wilted lettuce and a tomato that was mushy and stale. The salad was the better of the 2 dishes however a good portion of the lettuce was bad and we couldn't eat.  I would never go back there as the food in New Orleans in general is so wonderful that I felt so disappointed to have wasted a meal here:(

Looking for restaurant in New Orleans, This was one that had high ratings and didn't disappoint. We enjoyed the food and to top it off was a violinist playing right outside. (Can promise the violinist but was still enjoyable)

We are in NOLA for a bachelorette party and this was one of the go-to places for some seafood/oysters. I'm a huge oyster fan... I was pretty satisfied with the oysters I got here. 

The reason I gave it three stars were due to two things: servers... super nice and informative. But lack of awareness when it came to refills on water and checking up on us. Second, my spinach artichoke dip. My girl friend got the same appetizer and she sat across from me. When she got hers, it was a nice sizzling fresh out of the oven dish. When I got mine at the same time, it was burnt all around the edges and the cheese in the middle was not even melted. To me, I don't think it was appropriate to bring out two of the same dishes, at the same time, and have one looking awful while the other one looks appealing. 

Everything else was great. Hostess was accommodating and helpful. Oysters were good (7/10 rating) and decent pricing.

We ran in for quick breakfast.  My husbands cheese omelette has 2 slices of plastic cheese that comes in cling wrap and tons if grease. It came with undercooked flavorless grits.  I had eggs with "Cajun spiced" potatoes that were just plain flavorless potatoes. Our waitress wouldn't let me substitute grits for meat that came with my plate- even though grits cost less. Waste of time, fat, and money.

Stopped in for a last plate of oysters just before leaving the city. Jeffery at the bar was great, shucking oysters like crazy barehanded. Food was all good.  Food that others ordered look d great as well.   Definitely worth checking out!
The food was delicious and satisfying especially the red velvet pie. Moreover, the server Melvi was amazing at being a sweet person taking care of everything! I would recommend trying out this place.

So my mother and I enjoyed the restaurant on Wednesday, June 7. It is a lovely location on the corner on Royal street. We search the menu and decided to try the Oyster Tacos and the Shrimp and Chicken Jambalaya. We were originally seated on the second floor but we were able to eat on the balcony! This was definitely on my New Orleans bucket list and the weather was beautiful. 

So for the food...
1. The oyster tacos were very yummy! The fried oyster and slaw was on a tortilla chip and the flavor was good. Only downside was that it was expensive for so little. The tacos was small and came with only 4 tacos. So 2 for me and 2 for mother. I wish there were more tacos for $14.

2. The Jambalaya was great as well! The seasoning was good and there were little chicken or beef (I don't know what it was) pieces in the rice that was so good! Highly recommended and I would eat there again!
Food was decent but the open style of the venue is dope and the staff were attentive which made it worth a visit.

We were on a vacation .Great drinks!! I had the voodoo juice and my husband had the hurricane and both were amazing! For dinner I had the red fish beignets and crawfish etoufee. The red fish beignets were AMAZING it was a mixture of sweet and salty but so good the etoufee was ok. The service was great too and perfect if you have kids too they brought crayons and paper  my daughter to color

Only giving 3 stars becausethe food was good but the service was horrible!! I hate doing it but the server was not busy was standing and talking to others and pretty much ignoring us. We couldn't get refills or even checked on. We ordered 2 desserts bread pudding and a brownie a la mode well after waiting over 18 minutes we gave up. Those 2 dessets should only  take a couple os minutes to get out I guess just not ours. I went to go cancel the order and get the check and she is no where to be found. My hubby then had to go to the people at the front door to get the check and cancel the order when they got our check someone else was bringing out our desserts. We left anyway.

Really good New Orleans food. Been here on both of my visits to NOLA & have been very satisfied both times. Restaurant is very well located in the heart of the French Quarter. The place always looks clean, the service if very friendly & fast. They have two floors with balcony seating on the second floor. 

They have a good variety on their menu. Oysters are always good & fresh. The eggplant chips were phenomenal!!! The jambalaya is also great. This place is a must stop for any who want legit local food in the French Quarter at a reasonable price.

An authentic taste of New Orleans. Went on a date here with the most beautiful woman. When I was finally able to take my eyes off of her I was then able to enjoy the food and notice how beautiful the restaurant was. Sat up top on the balcony and enjoyed live music from a girl guy duo. The mixture of the live music and delicious food made for a fantastic evening. Aaron, who was our server, was well versed in every dish and had a gregarious personality to match. Great service, great food and an even better date. I recommend the charbroiled oysters and the crab claws. You will not be disappointed. Cheers to you Royal House.

Jambalaya was tasteless and rice dried out. The service was poor.  It was like the wait staff took our order and forgot about us. I would not recommend with so many other places to eat in New Orleans. When I commented about the jambalaya when she asked how the food was I received a snide comment back.

Get the char grilled oysters! I think they have the best in the city. I went twice here in my stay in Nola. I had the jambalaya the first time and the second I had thE baked shrimp tortellini. The jambalaya is worth every bite. Shrimp tortellini was also good but a insuperior dish to the jambalaya. The service is nice too.
Great breakfast, the Bloody Mary was fantastic. The staff was so friendly, especially our waitress Melva! Great place to sit and do some people watching.

Best Charbroiled oysters I've ever had...didn't even get my meal yet. Awesome staff and superb cocktails. 
Oh and I'm 50 and they carded me.

Great service! We really liked the appetizers (crab claws and stuffed mushrooms). The taste of New Orleans sampler was also good but I have had better gumbo on our trip. The crowning element was the service!

Food was out of this world! 

My boyfriend and I had a dozen grilled oysters as an app and it was incredibly! I could have eaten 12 on my own! 

I had the seafood piscatory and it had a little kick to it, but was delicious.
My boyfriend had the Red Fish, blackened, and it was very good- not fishy at all. 

I highly recommend coming here when you are looking for an amazing spot for seafood!

First, one must understand that the cajun food in N.O sets the bar very high. We are talking degrees of good, and Royal House hits the mark but does not exceed it. I ordered the crayfish étouffée. That could have been a bit more spicy and a bit less salty. My wife had the bar-b-que shrimp served with grits. That dish was near perfection, not too spicy or greasy. The service was great. And the atmosphere was very nice.  The seating on the balcony is very uncomfortable because it is not level.

Arrived here and told we would have to wait 20 minutes for a table and to wait at the bar, fine. After about 35 minutes (again fine) we were shouted over by the greeter to be told they are ready to serve us but we we would have to sit at the bar (in worse seats than we just left) We've just been sat there for 35 minutes. It was a shame as the food looked good and I wouldn't have minded eating at the bar but don't like been messed around so went somewhere else instead (there's plenty of choice around here) Bad service will only get better if people vote with there feet.

Wonderful food and service. Like eating great food at a relatives house. Highly recommend. The broiled oysters are wonderful as are the entrees. We had an alligator po-boy and the taste of New Orleans that included étouffée, gumbo and jambalaya. 
Drinks are great as well I had an old fashion and my wife had their pimms cup.

We ordered the alligator bites, jambalaya and the rice and beans. The portions are a good size and the food was decent. Service was also ehhh. Our waiter forgot to bring us water and it took about 20 mins for us to get our bill (after we have signaled to them that we would like to get the bill). Nothing spectacular or outstanding. For the amount of time we waited in line and the number of reviews, we were expecting more.

I ordered a Hurricane which was promptly given to me.  It was strong and still had the flavor of the hurricane.  The Staff was friendly and very conversational.  The shrimp and grits was some of the best that I've ever had.  They kept me full the entire night as I explored the french quarter.

After 6 days in the city, this was the best gumbo ive eaten in New Orleans, by far.  But the SERVICE was even better than the food! Shout out to the hostess,  Natasha, for welcoming us in right from the start,  Joel,  our waiter,  who was funny and accommodating even though his caffeine hadn't kicked in yet,  and all the other staff who's names escape me (Arrow?) These people treated us like family,  laughed with us and just had a wonderful time - you wouldn't even think they were at work.

The food is mediocre. There was a group of 7, and no one was wowed with their order. The building/upstairs, ambiance is the draw.  The waitress was pleasant. Coffee - not fresh, which was also disappointing.

A delicious experience. I've been on a food tour across the country and I knew that I needed to explore as much as New Orleans as I can. This place was a great time. I ordered the shrimp creole. The shrimp was super tender and fresh tasting. They were baby shrimps though haha, the rice was cooked well meaning it had the perfect firmness. The sauce of the Creole was really good but not the greatest, it lacked a kick that I was craving. However the service was great, the location was nice and the best thing about it was I didn't have to wait forever. I would definitely come back

The food is fine, unless you get the crab claw appetizer. Then it is amazing!

 The sauce that comes with the crab claws tastes great, and goes with everything from fried shrimp to the Jambalaya. It makes everything better. 

The staff are friendly, warm, and efficient. We ordered and got our food in about 15 minutes. I was not expecting that, as every table was taken.

We came here 20 minutes prior to closing on a Monday night.  Most places would have treated you horribly -- they on the other hands greeted us like old friends.   Our waiter never made us feel rushed and he put up with me changing my mind.

The cup of soup was a bit smaller than I was expecting and the Gumbo a little spicier, but it was good.   The others in my party got a burger and they seemed to enjoy it immensely.   I would recommend it highly and I want to go back and try something else :)

We came here because Deanies was an hour long wait. Super happy we did! The service was excellent and the food the food was amazing!!! We got the stuffed mushroom appetizers. I got  the New Orleans which is Chicken & Andouille Jambalaya, Crawfish Etouffée and Chicken and Andouille Gumbo. My wife got the gBlackened Shrimp & Jambalaya
Baked oyster is really good.  servers were very accommodating. But when it's peak hours they might not accommodate you well.

The Pecan Crusted Mahi Mahi was very good. It came with red potatoes and green beans that were some of the best I've had.
The restrooms had changing tables which is something that is important to me because I have 2 in diapers. 
They also have a 25% military discount for the service member's meal.
Only 4 stars because my wife ordered a pasta with clams, mussels, and shrimp and it was rather bland

Service here was fantastic. Greeted at the door when I came in and was immediately seated with a friendly bar tender/host (I sat at the bar). I ordered a beer and a poboy. The beer came out immediately and the poboy only took about 10 min. Pretty big portions for the price and the location is great - right near Bourbon street. I am rating 4 stars just because I personally was not a fan of the poboy (seemed really dry and the shrimp lacked seasoning), but it looks like they had other great things on the menu.

The Royal House did not disappoint!! We were originally seated in the middle of the dining room but asked our waitress (Heidi) for a window seat and she happily obliged. Started our meal with some Hurricanes and they were delicious!! Followed by our crab claws and spinach dip appetizers which were equally as yummy! I had the New Orleans sampler (etouffee, gumbo and red beans and rice, RBR) hubby had the jambalaya platter. Friends had the crawfish ravioli and shrimp poboy. I am from west Louisiana so I can hold my own when it comes to concocting all of these dishes so I can be somewhat critical of creole food. I was impressed by the etouffee and gumbo for sure but highly disappointed with the RBR. The RBR dish was dry, rice was tough and not fully cooked. The jambalaya was decent but I could have beat theirs in my kitchen. We followed dinner with the Banana cheesecake foster, which was AMAZING!!!!! I will revisit the Royal House next time I'm in NOLA.

This was one of our two favorites in New Orleans, and that's saying a lot for a city full of eateries, not to mention Fresh Market where the smoked salmon salad is out of this world.
We ducked in during a terrible rainstorm and stayed for a meal. I'm not a big eater so I had the Oyster Tacos, which are really nicely grilled oysters served atop crispy tortilla chips with a generous helping of spicy, crunchy coleslaw. Delicious! I traded one to my husband for tastes of his Taste of New Orleans, a trio of shrimp and chicken gumbo, jambalaya, and crawfish etouffé. The soup was flavorful with chunks of shrimp and chicken, not big pieces, just enough to flavor it. Jambalaya had andouille sausage, which I don't really like, but all the ingredients were balanced and blended so they all contributed to the soup without overpowering it. The crawfish was our favorite, yummy with a brown sauce and chunks of crawfish. Also, he had a side of red beans and rice; I've had it several times in NOLA and this was the best. (I do like my rice and beans so the beans are firm but tender and you can taste them, not mushed together like pea soup.)I tasted his dessert, bananas Foster with scoops of cheesecake on the side. He said it was the best dessert he ever had, and I agree it was exceptional.
Service was very relaxed but we were ok with it partly because of the storm; I liked that I didn't feel rushed although the place was doing a pretty brisk business. You might not like it if you were in a hurry; but I don't think many people here are in a hurry.

All hype ... first night in New Orleans. Received a coupon from my hotel for free appetizer here.

Pictures will be included. Over priced and not worth a second visit. 

It has a beautiful decor, staffers are friendly and their coffee is excellent. That's the most positive thing to say.

I really like this place!  Some things are definitely better choices on the menu than others but for the most part everything I've tried has been very good. Servers are very friendly. Had a great glass in wine, the first one listed under whites, the muscadet
Great place for a late night dinner!!  The stuffed mushrooms and chargrilled oysters are excellent!!  Friendly staff and reasonably priced!
Giving a 3 is still more then I was going to but the only thing that was good was the claw appetizer. Minus the hair we found in it. And the horrible weard servers. Overated.

This place was great! Server was great! I cant remember her name. But I was thinking Melva. She was super excited that I ordered the Ribeye! The person who brought it out to me was also excited about it. Couldn't figure out what the big deal was. But it was great! Im very picky about steak. Husband had crawfish ravioli. Also, very good! Free alligator app was just as good as anything else fried. I would definitely go back.

Second visit and it was just awful!  Rude bar staff and servers - we got the appetizers before one of the drinks arrived - and the oysters - 3 out 12 where full of shell!! - took about 2 hours for main food to arrive - then it was colder than Stone Cold Steve Austin!  Asked for 2 more beers - one amber and one Bud light - waitress brought 2 ambers and just said - well you asked for 2 more beers!!!  Just not worth it when there are so many really good places in New Orleans and considering that our meal for 4 was $250!!!  Just not a good experience at all!!

I'm not a seafood person so I did not have the oysters here but I can say that the chicken/sausage gumbo and roast beef po boy were fantastic. It was a rainy Tuesday night when we went so needless to say it was pretty quiet, but I know this is a fun place because our hotel was right across the street. They have a great outdoor dining area overlooking the street. Good service and always someone stationed at the door to greet you.
We used a free appetizer coupon just by checking in on Yelp. The stuffed mushrooms were off the chart good. Red beans and rice had great flavor. Can't go wrong here.

I have been a loyal follower of Yelp reviews for many years, however I never took the time to create an account and post my own reviews.....  until now.

The Royal House in New Orleans is so bad, I feel it is my duty to fellow Yelpers to bring this to everyone's attention.

From the unfriendly greeting at the street, to the poor food quality and the incorrect bill after my cc was run.  Royal House was a huge disappointment.  

The shrimp and grits were the poorest excuse for s&g's that I have ever experienced.  Totally gross.  Will never go back and will steer people away when I get the chance.

Good food, nice atmosphere. Kinda pricey compared to some of the places one block over. Balcony dining is fun. Service, was not so good. Was a bit on the busy side around 1PM on a Saturday, but still the staff could have checked on the table instead of just taking the order and bringing out the food (and did not come back to check on the table until the very end).

The oysters were five star (they were the best part of the meal), but my fried oysters po-boy wasn't up to my standards. Have definitely had better po-boys in NOLA.

First time visiting this restaurant and it exceeded my expectations! We ordered the crab claws, chargrilled oysters, fried alligator and the fried alligator po boy. Everything was DE.LI.COUS! He flavor profile was off the charts. The service was impeccable. Our server, Robert, took excellent care of us. 

Uh oh. I forgot to mention the voodoo juice.  That was heaven in a cup. Granted it's only 2 o'clock in the afternoon and humid as hell--but who cares. It's never too early to drink in New Orleans. 

Forget all of your other recommendations you've received. Drop everything. And run here. It's that important.

P.S. 
I'd pass on the crawfish ravioli. If your taste buds agree with bell peppers, then please disregard the aforementioned. The ravioli was made for you.

Staff was amazing and friendly. Didn't have to wait long for a table for 3 and once seated our waitress was there to take our order! We had the spinach dip app (which was free with the yelp check in!)...it was delicious and seasoned to perfection. We all had pasta entrees which were good. Only downside to visiting was a minor roach issue behind us. We informed our waitress and she called someone over to kill it but then 2 more appeared. Unfortunately I know roaches are an issue everywhere but I think something should've been said or done once we saw not 1 but 3.
Great Oysters for a reasonable price.  Melva our server was the best part of the place. A must have if stopping by the French quarter.
Great appetizers... entrees were okay! Oyster Duo and the stuffed mushrooms were amazing!!

Excellent food and service. Came in because we had a free appetizer and sat at the bar. We really loved that we can watch them shuck oysters behind the bar. We had the mixed stuffed oyster appetizer. Everything was delicious and fresh.

Horrible service by the manager. Food came late and she tried to compensate by coming over and giving a very sarcastic and disingenuous apology. Our server was very nice but explained the mishap as the order being sent to the wrong table. The manager then corrected him saying that wasn't the case, which was very confusing. All in all, we've told our friends to avoid this place because the food was mediocre when it finally came. Luckily we weren't late for our flight but was very sure to tell everyone to avoid this place when trying to get oysters in New Orleans

My family came here off of the ratings on Yelp, but were incredibly disappointed. Perhaps this place used to have good food, but now it's genuinely awful. The gumbo is bland and honestly just gross. The bread it came with also tasted stale. The pecan crusted mahi mahi was okay, but did not justify the price. Also the shrimp looked tiny, sad, and most likely frozen. The only person in our party who liked their food ordered the ravioli. There's a review below that has a picture showing the difference between what the dishes look like now and looked like before. That tells you everything you need to know. The food quality of this place is suffering.

Food wasn't great and in the middle of our meal a roach ran across the table and I was completely done at that point. I would never recommend anyone to this restaurant. Plus I think our waitress was on some from of crack and she was honestly terrifying.

Good food, great service! If you are looking for a great lunch or dinner I would recommend this place! I believe they have breakfast as well but my friends and I came for lunch! The staff were very friendly and kept it real when it came to the menu options! Plenty of seating because there was an upstairs and a downstairs. We sat upstairs so we had a great view of the streets! For starters we had the crab legs. The sauce that it was in was ammaaaazing! I wish I knew the recipe. My cousin and I got the red beans and rice. Really good, seasoned and fulfilling! It comes with two sausages, two chicken strips on top of red beans and rice! This is no side, this will fill you up and have some for you to take home! My sister had the shrimp t... can't remember the name but it tasted like shrimp alfredo but NOLA style! My friend had the catfish platter! Plenty to take home and share! Good place overall! Will be back!

You'll really enjoy the food the great service!  Melva is a doll and will take care of you with excellent service!!!
Kudos to the chef and team for a great dining experience.

The shrimp and grits was abhorrent. Dry grits they crumbled. The pictures are from several years prior. Maybe when they have a damn. Outside of that the waiters are sweet. Management is nice and took that bull-Ish shrimp and grits right on back. My friend had the claws and loved it and ordered it twice. 
Had the oyster "tacos" while the oysters were fried well - they are not on tacos. It's on a tortilla chip. Seriously?! 
Maybe bc I'm from cali is why that bothered me so. 
Hubby had the redfish. It was dry but the veggies were good. Oh yes the alligator bites were super tasty. 

So they get three stars bc the appetizers were totally worth it but the entrees left a lot to be desired.

Loved the hospitality from the staff. The drinks and food are great! Sat at the bar, Kyle and Leroy were awesome. Leroy was very entertaining. Kyle had this swagger that I digged. Wished I got his number ;)
Very good food and service. I love that there's a check-in on Yelp! for a free appetizer.

Firstly, they told us we could go outside on the balcony when we sat down. We did that and then come back to find they had completely cleared off our table and belongings. It couldn't have been more than five minutes. I could understand if they were waiting around for us but we had already put in our order and we were waiting for it to be made so we took advantage of the nice afternoon.  When the food finally came it was small portions of mediocre food. I would NOT come here if you wanted a decent New Orleans experience

Free appetizer with your entree was great. Had Blackened Shrimp and Jumbalaya with seafood stuffed mushrooms. Very delicious and one of the best meals on my visit to NOLA. Would definitely recommend. It also had a couple options for vegetarians. Would go again. A-plus
Love the Crab Claws app. Just delicious. Can't go wrong with the chargrilled oysters.

My boyfriend chose this restaurant for my birthday because he had a good experience a year ago. This time around we were both disappointed not just by the food but the terrible service we received.
 For starters, we had the crab claws appetizer. As mentioned in many reviews it's all about the sauce but unfortunately for us we didn't get much of it and we had to ask for more bread which took forever to come.  For my entree, I had the oyster and eggplant pasta which was just ok. My boo had Shrimp po boy which was dry and bread was stale. He initially ordered something else but they informed us that a key ingredient was missing 30 mins after our order was placed. Lastly for dessert we had the bananas Fosters cheesecake and that  was good but the presentation was off. Overall, the waitress was horrible and not apologetic at all for the long wait and missing ingredient. In fact she had an attitude.

The only saving grace was the manager who was sincerely sorry that my birthday dinner was ruined and did his best to make things right. If the food was good maybe I'd call it an off night but too many things were just wrong and I had way better New Orleans food elsewhere.  I won't be back!
Mediocre food, fairly good service. Bourbon street smells really bad and they left the doors open for the aroma from outside to enter, that was disgusting.

My sister recommended this place, and I typically trust her judgement. However, I ordered jambalaya which is supposed to have the creole flavor, and it didn't (it was bland). We also got chargrilled oysters, and they looked like dehydrated oysters that they just sprinkled some Parmesan cheese on with some butter (though not evenly dispersed). My friend got the crawfish ravioli, which is good, but then it gets really heavy. Overall, it was fine, but I wish they amped up the flavor of these dishes!

I always thought Rockefeller style was the best way to consume oysters. I was wrong -- turns out chargrilled oysters from Royal House reign supreme. These were arguably some of the best oysters I've had in my entire life. OMG.

This place was less crowded than Acme down the street, and I bargain just as good. Do yourself a service and get these oysters!!

We originally were going to head to Acme off of Bourbon, but the line was too long, and we were too ready for oysters. So we went to Royal House, which was spot on!

The only reason this place isn't getting 5 stars is because the Oysters Royal and Oysters Rockefeller were underwhelming. But the char grilled oysters were TO DIE FOR!

Don't waste your time with anything but the char grilled, they're spot on perfection!!!!

This place has all the staples and a view to boot. The prices for what you get are reasonable once you factor in your location and the view. 

The food was well executed and tasty. The red fish biegnets are delicious, the flavour of the fish still came through despite the sweetness. I got the sampler for my entree and it was also delicious.

Pros: the servers are amazing and helpful. Cons: the bread was stale.

We stopped here at the suggestion of our hotel. I had the crab claws and my hubby had the grilled oysters--first time trying them grilled, he usu likes 'em just raw. Everything was amazing!  The sauce that came w/the claws was so flavorful. Our wonderful waitress, Melva recommended we order w/side of pasta next time. She was very attentive! My hubby even ate his oyster garlic sauce with a spoon after he devoured the oysters.  Oh, and I had my first Hurricane & Melva made sure it was not as sweet at my request. She even taught me the right and local way to drink the Hurricane. We recommend this place and ask for Melva, a local--born and raised in NOLA!

I didn't want to come New Orleans without having a shrimp Po boy and oysters. The oysters were so fresh with Parmesan, garlic and butter sauce. The po boy had fresh warm frenchmen bread and the shrimp were well seasoned and crunchy. The staff were also friendly and attentive overall great experience

Hubby and I visited this restaurant as we were celebrating our anniversary and all I can say is that the food and the service was absolutely phenomenal!!! Monica and Renell were our waitresses and they made us feel extremely special.  Can't wait to come back to New Orleans because we will most definitey visit Royal House again!

Waiter was enthusiastic and polite but service was a bit slow, except for the check. Ha!  Oysters on the half shell were pretty good as was the etouffee but the jambalaya and the gumbo were only ok.  Not very flavorful and you had to pay extra to get blackened shrimp in them.  Thought shrimp usually came in those already(?).  The butter pecan pie was pretty good, though small.  Their version of the Pimm's cup was pretty good.  Not a bad experience by any means but not a great one either.

Oysters were good.  That's about it.  My table of 8, ordered the crab claw appetizer and it only came with 4 slices of bread (baguette) so we had to request more.  Some of our meals came out cold, not sure if it's because of the time we arrived (830).  Do not order the Alaskan crab legs as this is a misrepresentation since these are just your normal snow crabs. The chefs are tricky and mixed old/over cooked shrimps with new ones.  Service is subpar and the employees should know respect of the diners/customers - they are louder and some are disrespectful of their own co-workers.  Ending our dinner with bill that is inaccurate.

As simple as our meals were, Jambalaya and Red Beans and Rice with Andouille. They were some of the tastiest meals I've had in years.  The staff from the young lady at the door to the server were top notch, attentive and on the spot. The young lady at the door we extremely entertaining and able to read and adapt to the customers she was interacting with. Outstanding experiemce across the board.

Very disappointing. Tried this spot with family after reading the Yelp reviews. Not sure if ownership changed or a cook but the reviews did not match the experience we had. Our server was run of the mill, very sweet but not attentive leaving us to ask for water refills. The food took a very long time to come out and he did not provide any update or apologize for the wait. The food wasn't bad but it wasn't great either. Not a place I would recommend trying while on vacation on Nola.

Arrived in town late and looking for something on a Thursday night. Came across this and so glad we did!  I had the Redfish and it was perfect. Also recommend the shrimp jambalaya. Highly recommend this place.

This was my first time here. It was so, so good. Great southern hospitality. I ordered the oyster duo, cup of gumbo, and the BLTOyster all was very delicious! They service was amazing. The accommodated our party of ten very well. Our server Sidney was very attentive and catered to our every need. She was also very sweet!  

The rain started pouring outside so we sat at the bar with Cindy, who was entertaining and poured us some excellent drinks. Her personality and energy was amazing while we waited for the rain to passed. She is fantastic! You must visit her and the team upstairs! Thanks for the good times and great food.

Excellent chargrilled oysters and red beans and rice! Service was exceptional and we really enjoyed our time here. Hostess was very friendly and gave great tips on things to do in the city. Well done Royal House!

Fantastic!! Our last dinner in New Orleans we chose Royal House based off of reviews and I thank all of you who highly rated. Wonderful service, excellent food, great ambiance. Baby crab legs for an appetizer are a must. We both chose pasta entrees for dinner that were out of this world. If we return to New Orleans we will definitely return to Royal House.
Crab claws are crazy delicious but service is hit or miss. Disliked being told to choose any table and then being told we couldn't actually sit in the section we chose.

Ok my first time writing a review. My first thought was it was going to be a long wait we were a party of five. This was on a Saturday evening around seven. We got seated probably less than ten fifteen minutes. And our waitress her name was Kaitlyn, I hope I'm spelling that right lol anyways she was very nice and helpful far beyond what you'd think of great service. So now to the food. The food was amazing my wife had the Crawfish Ravioli, I had the Blackened Shrimp and Jambalaya and my daughter had the Baked Shrimp Tortellini. Oh yeah and I recommend the Seafood Stuffed Mushrooms appetizer those were awesome. Great atmosphere all around great experience I would visit again.
Excellent! I went with a group of four and had the oysters. Perfect! Good service. Attentive staff. My friends were very happy with their food.
The oysters were great! Our server Yamini was timely and extremely polite. Would definitely come back! Bummed they closed the balcony though.

This is the most popular restaurant in New Orleans and it is no wonder! Both the food and service is exceptionally. Their baked oysters are to die for. I also had their red fish and my husband got the po-boy. Everything was delicious and freshly-prepared. Loved it!
Great food and atmosphere!!! Cindy was our BFF by the time we left!!!  Thank you, Cindy and the staff at Royal House. We will definitely be back!!!

Great food and beautiful bar The staff was friendly and the food was delicious A little bit of everything to please all The pecan crusted mahi mahi was very light and moist Het the crab leg appetizer for starts The sauce is amazing I put the rest on my fish

Our meal was excellent. Only 4 stars because it's a little over priced in my opinion. But we had the crab claw appetizer (thanks Yelp!), a BLT-oyster poboy and jambalaya. Really good food. My kid's cheeseburger was, meh. But overall a fun evening. Nadia was an excellent server.

The food sucks! We ordered mojito with yellow mint inside, taste like sweet water, the shrimp is so small and portion is totally different than what you see on the yelp. Pasta is salty, the only thing good is oyster. And it took them 30 mins to prepare our food, the restaurant is not packed or anything. Worse experience in New Orleans ever, restaurant for tourists!

Chris at the Royal House is a must visit! The food is excellent and his service is even better~ it's like visiting an old sweet friend! All of his recommendations were perfect.....so good we went back the next day for lunch!
Decent breakfast choice. Royal omlette was nice and cheesie with bit of crawfish. Biscuits were extra but tastie. Slightly pricey.

Came from out of town and waited for about 20 minutes which wasn't bad but our waiter was a disappointment. We waited for 20 minutes to get seen and my boyfriend and I were sat outside on the balcony. It took another server to ask us 20 minutes after we were sat  to ask us if someone has helped us. I ordered the The taste of New Orleans which was two small cups of coupe and three pieces of bread and rice and my boyfriend ordered a alligator poboy and it took 45 minutes for our server to give it to us. I think our server knew we were a little disappointed with the wait time so by the time he delivered our food he came back with the check. Don't waste your time coming here.

The Royal House was the worst meal I had in my 4 days in NOLA.

We were there on a busy Friday night and they did accommodate several people unexpectedly joining our party, however after we ordered the food took Forever to get there.

The Po-Boy did not have slaw, it had lettus instead, and it was $17!! My boiled potatoes were cold & when I told the waitress she just nodded & ignored me.
The food was delicious! The service was amazing. Definitely try the oysters. We had the chargrilled, raw, and royale. They were AMAZING! Do not wait on an hour long line at Acme. Go here!

We tried the most popular item on the menu, as recommended by our very nice waiter, the Crawfish Ravioli. It was absolutely delicious with just the right amount of heat. The red beans and rice was also excellent. We walked in at about 5 pm on a Friday night and our party of 4 was seated immediately. 

The staff was extremely friendly.  I'd highly recommend this place. The only reason I didn't give 5 stars was due to table size, we barely had room for everything once the plates came out.

The service was excellent, the 2 egg-breakfast, just ok. The crispy bacon was NOT crispy, the grits were gritty. Dont ask for cheese, because they give you the Dennys special of just laying cheese on top of your eggs. Returned for lunch and ordered Charboiled Oysters and Crab Claws.... both were excellent. Almost made me forget about my jiggly bacon!!

Whet here for lunch with our group.  While they were quick to usher us in, the service once there was not good at all.  Mind you, they were super friendly.   We were seated quickly upstairs, only a couple other tables who had a separate waitress.  Hurricanes were terrific, had the crab claws that were excellent as well and even used the Yelp coupon for the free appetizer.  Drinks were really slow.  Ordered oysters which were good but nothing special.  Unfortunately, my son specifically ordered no cheese on his burger, and it came with cheese so it had to be remade.  His meal came after most of us were finished.  Some other items were missing.  After the oysters were brought out, we mentioned to the young man who brought out the food that we were still missing one set.  He told our waitress that we were short a dozen and she blew it off saying that those just take a little longer.  It was pretty obvious that she had actually forgotten them and lied to us.  They came out after our entire party had finished eating.  Again, they were not busy, there were only one or two other couples on our floor with a different waitress.   No one ever offered to take the ridiculously late food off our tab.  Food pretty good, service super friendly but not good as far as accuracy and attention, should have taken extremely late items off tab.  Perhaps we hit it at a bad time but I also question where/when those initial photos were taken because we did not see any presentation like that.   We would have ordered more drinks...but things were not timely.

Top 5 meals of all times! Went on a Saturday night just after 6pm there was no wait yet. All other restaurants in the area had long lines.  Leroy was our waiter and felt fortunate to have him as he guided us through the menu with all the must haves.  For appetizers we had the crab claws which are a must rich and decadent, you will use the toasted French bread with it to clean up all the sauce.  The Caprese tower was another hit at the table.  The crawfish Etouffee and the Ribeye were all seasoned to perfection.  Leroy told us we couldn't leave without having the Butter Pecan pie, we are so glad that we listened.  A pecan pie like that I have never had before.  If you can hit just one restaurant in the Bourbon Street area this would be the one.

Our waiter was creepy so we went and sat the bar, then our bartender was blacked out at noon and could barely speak or walk. Our drinks were terrible and so were the vibes, the food looked good but we didn't have the chance to order before we were creeped out. Loved the host and manger though. Oh and the bartender lost/tried to steal my credit card until the manager showed up and then she "found" it immediately. Overall be weary before entering

We were looking for dinner after our 2 hr steam boat tour. It was hot outside. We meeded something to revive us. 

After checking Yelp we found this little gem. It is small but mighty. When we arrived there was a line but we got in quickly. 

Our waitress Kaitlyn was attentive. She took our orders of the following:

Crawfish Starter
Shrimp tortellini 
Tour of New Orleans 
Crawfish Ravioli 

Now I was afraid to order anything because I don't do spicy so I ordered the tortellini. What a mistake. The Crawfish ravioli had a sauce that was savory and I kept dipping my tortellini in it. The Crawfish starter had an amazing sauce. I have no idea what kind of sauce but it was so good we didn't have any left. 

I ordered voodoo juice which was dangerous because you can't taste the liquor. It was refreshing. 

When I return I plan on stopping here again. It's too good to pass up. Hope u try it too.

3.5 stars I'd really say... 
the pros: attentive, fast server-drink refills (water) on point. She brought condiments without asking. Air conditioning and fan on blast, so ambience is good. 

The cons: pretty sure the shrimp po- boy had frozen baby shrimp. Bread was crunchy, but also sorta stale. The lemonade was not real, was cheap powder mix. The eggplant "chips" were actually like eggplant parmigiana- so the description wasn't really accurate, it was very tasty, but I wasn't expecting that. 

I'd return for drinks and charbroiled oysters.

Oh. MY. GOSH. 

Where to begin....

We've been here twice now since coming to NOLA and each time has been amazing. Our waitress Naudia (sp?) Was great and very helpful. I recommend checking in on the Yelp app so that you get a free appetizer (up to $12). We started with the crab claws, I believe they were $13.50 but we only had to pay $1.50 since the check in saved us $12. They were absolutely TO DIE FOR. The sauce is insanely flavorful! Tons of crab claws as well. Make sure to ask for extra bread.. you'll need it to dip into the sauce!

Waitress recommended the crawfish ravioli with crab meat for our entree. Both the BF and I never really opt for crawfish but decided to try it out. It was delicious. Just the right amount of portion of heat mixed with tons of creole flavoring and crawfish. I would absolutely order this again and I would say this was probably one of our favorite meals of the trip.

Service was on point as well. Highly recommend this place!
Best Rockefeller oysters I've had in my entire life. Line moved fast and waitress was wonderful.
This place was something we stumbled upon. The food was delicious but the service was even better. Melva was our waitress A M A Z I N G! She made us feel right at home. Awesome place!

From experience we had with places in New Orleans the Royal house would be my least favorite. We have set outside on patio, which was a great view but seen cockroaches and had to wait for sever to be back from inside setting. Food was not that great either, we tried French onion soup and oyster duo which we have not been verb impressed.

I've never had cajun food and what a better time to try than when in New Orleans. We walkes here from our hotel. Amazingly there was was no one in line at 7pm fpr dinner. I ordered the crawfish ravioli. It tasted really good. Not too much of a seafood taste. We had gator nuggets as our appetizer and my 5 year old lived them. They tasted like chicken to be honest. My husband had the Sampler of New Orleans. We really liked the gumbo but the jambalaya was delicious! Ill definitely be back if should I ever return. The staff was also  friendly.

We had a great experience.  Got right in on a Tuesday night.  Our server was amazing.  My husband had the best of New Orleans.  It was so good and more than he could eat.  I had a salad with grilled red fish on top. Absolutely amazing! Food was fast.  Very affordable.   And they had a kids menu.  Definitely a plus!

Royal House was recommended by a local bartender and it was fantastic. I had a half dozen raw oysters and the Crawfish Ravioli. The oysters were fresh and humongous!  The Crawfish Ravioli was delicious - tons of meat, decent pasta, tasty sauce, and a generous serving. Do it.

This is the number one oyster restaurant in town ! The service is nice, and always ask for the fried gator. Also, ask for the chargrilled oysters! It's buttery, and has a hint of garlic and cheese. Really the best dish there. The spinach dip is great 2. The dip is spinach and cheese, plus the tortilla chips. The sauce is creamy, and it smells sooooooooo good!

Crawfish Ravioli was seriously the most amazing thing I have put in my mouth in recent weeks.  Service was very attentive and seemed like our food took a little less than average to come out, which was great since we told them we were in a hurry!!  Didn't stay too long because we were heading to a show, but will be back try more things, but also to get more Crawfish Ravioli!!!!

I had a really good experience. I ordered the crawfish ravioli and my mom had the shrimp tortellini. As an appetizer we had the crab claw. The sauce for the crab club wasn't my favorite and the claws were tiny but my mom really enjoyed it. It was okay for me. 
The ravioli and tortellini were yummy. Particularly my crawfish ravioli. Raven was my server and was very knowledgeable and outgoing. She was great. 
Oh with yelp check in you receive a complimentary appetizer
Really great brunch experience at the bar. Cajun Bloody Mary and crawfish eggs benedict were perfect.  Sat at the bar, staff we're friendly and attentive.

The outdoor balcony was closed but the waitress Melva heard my request and swept into action, moving a table, and opening one the wooden shutters to reveal a picturesque street view of wrought iron, art galleries, and top people watching.  I wanted a quintessential experience and she hooked me up with a hurricane and instructed me to sip the shot off the top, which, being a novice, I wouldn't have known to do. 1/2 dozen raw and 1/2 dozen charbroiled oysters were the best.  She also gave me other recommendations for meals/drinks for my trip.  I'll definitely be back--she made it wonderful!
Quite tasty!  Friendly service, great atmosphere and decent prices. Crawfish Ravioli and fried alligator is a must!

We had a delicious meal yesterday and our waitress,  Melva,  was helpful and excellent.  My wife and I loved her and we loved the food,  we would go back here in a heart beat.  We had the french onion soup,  the crab claws in an amazing sauce,  and crawfish ravioli.  I highly recommend this place,  and ask for Melva,  she helped us make choices from the menu and took good care of us while we were there.   John and Beth Salak
We loved our waitress, Melva!! Had a sampler of New Orleans foods, which was a great way to squeeze in all the must-haves during our trip.
Amazing shrimp creole with a sauce that is to die for. Alligator bites were good but should have been more given the price. Our waiter was amazing and on point.
First time here. Char Grilled Oysters were light, garlicky and perfect! Also had their great  Bloody Mary. A perfect start to out 3 nights in NOLA.

Mini crab claws were amazing but the service was absolutely terrible. We had out kids with us and they forgot to ring in the kids food. Our food took over an hour to come out. Both our kods fell asleep before their food came out and once my food came out the rice was burnt and scorched. Litterly black from being burnt. It was TERRIBLE

"Ok"
Would be the one word to describe this place.
Nice people.
Pretty good Service.
Got the creole shrimp.  Basically a shrimp soup w/ creole sauce.
Very obviously a dish that needs the shrimp pealed prior to creating the dish.  Of the (approximately 12-15) shrimp in my meal, 3 to 4 of them were not pealed.  This made the soup-like dish very difficult to enjoy while having to pull half chewed shrimp out of your mouth to complete the pealing. 

Ok, but that's about it.


Also, condensation from ceiling vent covers that drip on your table.
If you are having a hard time trying to think of what to get...get the shrimp creole my taste buds exploded with the flavor! Very filling. The staff was very friendly and our waiter Ty was amazing!

Everywhere we ate was really good; HOWEVER, this place was by far the least interested in getting us to come back. The oysters were just the "bulk oysters" that they feed to tourists, so, crappy. The oyster beignets were interesting, but slimy and fishy.  The crab was good, but overlooked. The potatoes and corn were spicy and icky. 

We had the AC unit dripping into our food. The guys at the table next to us had part of a scouring pad from the kitchen in their food.

Even with the free appetizer it wasn't worth stopping.

Skip it.

While Royale House offers decent views from the upstairs patio (extremely narrow and kind of uncomfortable due to high traffic of servers) I found their food extremely underwhelming.  We put our name in at the front and then went to get a drink at the downstairs bar.  I asked for a martini and it got poured into a plastic cup.  Awful.  While waiting for our drinks we were escorted upstairs (points for speediness) and offered the patio view.  Upstairs was bustling too.  For food we ordered oysters.  They came out fast, fresh and were appropriately large. Honestly, its hard to mess up oysters.  The horseradish and overall presentation was a little underwhelming but whatever.  For entrees, I ordered the fried clam pasta.  My gf got fried chicken and sausage with beans and rice.  She liked her dish but the pasta was a gloopy mess.  Truly awful with zero flavor.  I seriously contemplated asking for hot sauce just to produce some kind of a flavor.  The clams were tasty but the only redeeming quality of the dish.  The bread just plain ol slices of bread with nothing to them.  This being our first meal in New Orleans, I was very underwhelmed and disappointed.

My mom and I came here for lunch on our last day in New Orleans, and I'm so happy we chose this place. The incredibly friendly staff at the front door made such a great impression, I was immediately glad that we chose to eat here. We got to sit upstairs, outside on the balcony, and the view was nice, although a bit of a squeeze. It's a very narrow balcony, so beware. 

Our server was also incredibly friendly. We shared some fresh oysters, some chargrilled oysters, and the crawfish ravioli, which blew my mind. They are NOT skimpy with the crab. I will definitely return to this place for the A+ customer service, and for a bowl of the crawfish ravioli all to myself!

It was 10 PM when we walked in.  Hot and thirsty from a two hour 5 in 1 ghost tour (highly  recommended).  We ordered food and waited 15 minutes.  No water was served.  Waitress was not around either.   I went to the bar to ask for water for our table, explaining it's been 15 minutes, and can't find our waitress.  Bartender said the manager has yelled at the staff for automatically bringing water to customers.  We have been in New Orleans for four days, and no other restaurants had this policy.  Ever time we sat down we were given a glass of ice water, at all the other restaurants we have been to.
We were not asked by the waitress if we wanted water.  The manager came by and pretty much did not care about the situation.

As for the food the chicken Ceaser salad was good, crawfish etouffee was ok, gumbo was very mediocre.

When it came time to pay, the waitress appoligized for the water mix up.  She did not do that when the water we're finally served earlier.  Well, I know tips are part of her income.  So I did leave her 10%, normally I leave 20%.  I do not recommend this restaurant.  Too expensive for what you get.

The jambalaya was amazing! We tried the gumbo and alligator which was also pretty good. The atmosphere was perfect and our server was wonderful! We had a great experience and would recommend them anytime! Can't wait to go back on our next visit to Nola.

Straightforward spot. We visited after hitting up another spot for Happy Hour. Interestingly this was the only spot we visited that had much Crawfish on the menu (out of season possibly⁉). Best Hurricane I had all week. Fair prices and several options depending on what way you wanted to go. The Oysters looked to be the way to go. Though we opted for something else. Servers and greeters were upbeat and good was delivered in a timely manner.

Service was initially good with waiter (Robert) being quite funny. Food took at least 30 minutes to get to the table and the place wasn't even crowded. I ordered shrimp and grits which is a classic in NOLA, and they got it ALL wrong. They used nasty baby shrimp and the grits were clumpy. I got 3 scoops of grits which should've been softer and cheesy. Not a place I'd ever go back to. About to post a customer pic of my $20 dish that was not appealing.
Great food and service.  Ty was awesome!  My husband is a very picky eater and even he liked it.

We are staying for the weekend and went to dinner there Friday night. There was a long wait time,  and unfortunately they dont allow you to wait by the bar (even if in this case my husband wanted to get a drink and I'm very pregnant and would have enjoyed sitting down). Regarless, when  we were taken to our table it was on the patio upstairs which was very romantic. We were greeted by the nicest waitress im the world, regrettably I didnt catch her name, but red hair and flamboyant personality!! Food was decent, service was trully the best! At end my husband forgot our shopping bag with clothes and the waitress literally ran for almost two blocks down the street to hand it to us. Hope she reads this some day and knows she was the kindest person we encountered this trip! The Royal House is lucky to have you as a part of their team!!
The Crawfish Ravioli is the best EVER!! The butter pecan pie is more than satisfying.

My boyfriend and I enjoyed this spot overall.  We came for a late Friday night dinner.  The hostesses were welcoming, and the waitress was very attentive- all of them were friendly.  The fried gator appetizer was delicious, as was the oyster pasta. 
A male employee walked into the women's restroom when there were three women in there, which I found odd.  He just said, "sorry", and walked out.

3.5 stars rounded up to 4 stars because the service was really good. 

2 girls + 5 plates = can't breathe 
We came here hungry after a 4 hour bike ride in a storm. We needed food NOW. So, what did we order? If you check-in, you get a free appetizer as long as you purchase 2 entrees... so, OBVIOUSLY we needed to take advantage of this sweet deal. 

- Stuffed Mushrooms: I thought this tasted like any other stuffed mushrooms. It was stuffed with crab and shrimp doused with mayo. What's new, right? 

- 1/2 dozen raw oysters: I didn't really like these that much. They were too big, and it didn't really taste too fresh. 

- 1/2 dozen charbroiled oysters: I loved these. They were seasoned well and cooked perfectly. I'm pretty sure it's not the healthiest choice, but it's definitely something you need to order. 

- Shrimp & Grits: This was probably one of the highlights of our lunch. I've become obsessed with shrimp and grits ever since my last trip to Florida, so any chance I get ... we're ordering it. 

- Taste of New Orleans: I don't think I enjoyed this as much as I would've liked. It was nice to try the Chicken & Andouille Jambalaya, Crawfish Etouffée and Chicken and Andouille Gumbo. BUT I don't think I'd recommend getting this dish, since neither of us really ate much of it.

This was a total disappointment.  I stopped in for a late lunch and had to go after the Crawfish Étouffée.   Sat at the bar and the place was decently busy for a late Thursday afternoon.  

Service.  It was sub par.  Not sure what was going on but the bartender was not eager to help me.   Felt like she had better things going on and was an after thought.  It took an unusual amount of time to get my food.  Interestingly enough there were a few times that she came over saying "only a few more minutes".  After I finally got my food, just nothing. 

Food.  Strike two.  You would have thought that since I waited as long as I did, it would be healing over.   Was really disappointed with the amount that was provided (see picture).  The taste was okay but seemed a little bland.   Good thing that the hot sauce was right there.  

Overall I would NOT return.
The food was amazing and service was just as good. We sat in Miss Melva'a section and took very good care of us!! Definitely coming back when we venture back to New Orleans
Great food, great atmosphere, great service!! Really enjoyed sitting out on the balcony. Would definitely recommend to anyone going out to New Orleans.
The recommended crawfish eggs Benedict came out cold had to go back and then the eggs were over cooked.  Disappointing

Food wise, Royal House is by far a phenomenal restaurant that should be visited when near the French Quarter.

However, the cavalier attitudes exuded by two particular hostesses and my waitress took away from the flavorful options offered by Royal House, which was highly disappointing to say the least.

My dining experience started with two hostesses giving off an attitude as if they were doing me a favor by allowing me to eat at their restaurant despite the fact they had very few guests at the time. When I asked to sit on the balcony, they made it seem like an issue and verbally complained about having to walk me upstairs just so I could be seated. Needless to say, that rubbed me the wrong way, but I had my mind set on some fresh oysters (which are prevalent throughout New Orleans) and I had my eye focused on the potential vantage point from their balcony.

The waitress took nearly 15 minutes to approach my table to offer me a beverage. After ordering gumbo, she brought my gumbo out without a spoon. It took nearly another 15 minutes to get a spoon, which I obtained by going to the bar on my own accord. Upon acquiring my spoon, the gumbo was cold so I had it replaced.

On a positive note, the aforementioned food was spectacular. The oysters were fresh and nicely sized, the gumbo was delicious (when served warm), and my friend's catfish tasted as if it was seasoned by the hand of God.

Pros:
Oysters on the half shell,
Fried catfish,
Gumbo,
The location, and
The view from the balcony.

Cons:
The negative attitudes exhibited by some of Royal Houses' employees, 
The poor service I experienced, and 
The french fries were lackluster.

Although I was disappointed, I would be open to giving Royal House another try if given the opportunity so I can taste God's catfish once more.
Great food and great service from Nadia...she was wonderful! We are so glad we chose this place for a delicious dinner!

We ended our trip here with a very special table on the upstairs balcony overlooking Bourbon Street. A very talented violinist was playing and it made for a warm and sentimental evening. The only thing missing was the food to match. 

Royal House left us wanting a little more love in the food. Of all the places we ate this weekend (Commanders, Erin Rose, Gumbo Shop, Pelican Club, Bombay Club, Nola Poboys) this was our least favorite. Albeit, the service was great and the seat outside with a view unbeatable. 

The fried shrimp was tasty but un-memorable. The sampler with étouffée, Gumbo and jambalaya was second best to Gumbo Shop's. But we were glad to have stopped here anyway. Better than most spots in Houston regardless!

If you are in New Orleans, this place is a must. Great food and drinks. Perfect for a date night or  a large group. The staff is amazing and have a sense of humor. The oysters are delicious and food is reasonably priced. Highly recommend this restaurant.

My boyfriend and I are visiting from Reno. We stopped by here to try their crab and shrimp. What a great experience, and the gentleman, Andrew, that helped us was phenomenal and very informative. I would love to return next time we visit. Great food, even better service. Thank you so much!

We sat down to eat, it wasn't busy at all.. our host was very friendly. The server approached us with menus and said she'd come back for a drinks orders after 10 minutes of no sight of her we decided to leave. Disappointing.

Royal House was a really solid place for dinner. I came here with a group of guys and everyone really enjoyed their meals.

I tried to get a couple "New Orleans" inspired things so I could be sure to try what this town has to offer.

As an app we got the Fried Alligator, which was really good. Pro Yelp tip; be sure to check in because they provide an offer for a Free App, so this one was on the house!

Instead of a main entree I got the Crab Claws (on App menu) and the Chicken and Andouille Gumbo.

The crab claws were definitely different from what I was expecting (see my picture) but they were still very very good and the gumbo, well that was awesome!

Overall a really good experience and I'd recommend giving it a try
Love this place! The best oysters and service from Nairobi, Tasha and Ryan!!! Amazing in the Quarter!!

My overall experience was ok..  this was my first stop for lunch when I landed to New Orleans.  The reviews were very high so I was expecting the food to be great!  There were four people total and we ordered 3 big entrees and one appetizer.  That was DEFINITELY not enough to feed us.  The portions were TINY.  Honestly, two people could finish all of that.  I did not like the jambalaya.  It was not what I expected.  The fried alligator was good but SMALL portion.  The crawfish etouffee was probably the only thing I liked!  The server barely accommodated us.  I had to flag them down for bill and etc..
Really great service and bloody Mary's! Also check out the French onion soup and blackened chicken sandwich

Excellent place to eat. The food is very good and the service is also great. My favorite dish on the menu is the red fish beignets. I must have that every time I dine here. If you're in the area this is definitely a place to go.

We've been to Royal House Oyster Bar before and we have never been disappointed. If you check in on yelp, you get a free appetizer. I got the order of 6 oysters, grilled 3 different ways. They were delicious!! Our bartenders were great, Heather and Ryan, and I had a fantastic martini!! Our entrees were so good, my husband had the fried fish and I had the crawfish ravioli, and it was so good!! We will be back next time we are in New Orleans.

If I'm ever in LA Royal town is my first stop. I love the crawfish ravioli. My husband loves the Po'Boy. 

I had to withdraw one star because the wait time for the food was horrible during our last visit. But the food was excellent to say the least.

I had the redfish beignets and they were unforgettable. It's been almost two years since I've been in New Orleans and that dish has stayed in my thoughts. Going back in a few months and that will be my first stop. The oysters Rockefeller were delicious too!! 

Sit outside and enjoy the view!
This restaurant has great service and quality food. I enjoyed the mashed potatoes, red fish beignets, and shrimp po-boy.

We dined here a number of times on our current trip. 
We loved the atmosphere, the food and the servers. 
Red beans,andouille sausage and rice, gumbo, oysters both raw and charbroiled, all outstanding at decent prices. 
We went back and had oysters and cocktails too. 

Only one person we knew didn't appreciate the shrimp and grits ( he ordered it even though the server suggested otherwise). Otherwise everything else was fine. One of my new favorite restaurants in the Big Easy.

Amazing dinner!!!  Definitely one spot to always visit when I'm in town! Great appetizers, dinner and dessert!! Drinks were amazing, both cocktail and after dinner drink!! Banana foster cheesecake is to die for!!! Rich and delicious!!! Waitress Heidi is the best waitress!!! So kind and welcoming!!! Definitely coming back!!!!!

The server here was so great and friendly! I forgot her name but we were here a few weeks ago during my trip to NOLA. she really took her time with us and helping us what to order in addition to suggesting other places to go during our stay. She was so sweet and I would recommend coming here!
Excellent food and service! Leroy gave us the best service. He is very nice and helpful.

The service was great here and the food was delicious! We had the on the half shell oysters and the chargrilled oysters. They tasted amazing! We also had the "taste of new orleans" and I ate it all up. The etouffe was definitely one of the most delicious dish I ate during my time in NOLA.

Solid 5! Our server Sydney was awesome!! She gave us great recommendation on NOLA style food!!! A must try is their gulf fish.... It's such a fresh fish, as well as their charbroiled oyster!! I dropped one of the oyster, I'm still dwelling on the thought of how great it would of tasted had it landed in my mouth! Very friendly staff, food came out fresh, hot, and fast.... great start to my NOLA trip!!!
We had a server called Tina and she was amazing and funny.Everything was quick and delicious - try the alligator (yum). Great location and great food. So tasty.
very slow servic, took 40mins to put food on table, and another half hour to get check.  crab is not fresh, not recommend

The Royal House was exceptional. Our waitress recommended the Bloody Mary. Yum! She also recommended the chargrilled oysters, now I will tell these were the best things ever!!
