I can't begin to tell how awesome they were. The crawfish ravioli was great as well, but I think I could give up everything and just eat those oysters!!

Eating here was my favorite food experience from my entire trip to NOLA, we had Nadia as our server and she absolutely made the entire experience! She was constantly coming over to check on us and to make sure we were comfortable and happy with every little detail of our meals and our visit, she paid attention to every detail and every word we said and she went way beyond what anyone would expect from a server to make sure we were completely satisfied. Her constant smile and joyful attitude made the visit so much more enjoyable . I had the crawfish ravioli that she recommended and it was one of the best meals I've ever had . My over all experience with Royal House was incredible, and I will be returning here every chance I have. The food was out of the world and the service was incredible!

I appreciate the experience I had here last week; the host was very friendly and welcoming and our server, Tyronne, went above and beyond to make our experience enjoyable. He offered us balcony seating so we could experience the New Orleans nightlife and made sure we were well taken care of. 

The Red Beans with Andouille Sausage and Rice was delicious as was my shrimp po' boy. I highly recommend the Voodoo Juice drink; it was delicious on a warm night!
Loved this place. Had the opportunity to sit out on the balcony for dinner and enjoy the street musicians down below. Food was great! I enjoyed the crawfish etouffee and crab leg appetizer.

Absolutely fantastic. The hostess suggested the terrace, wow the best idea. While it was very skinny it was a great view of the street. There was an artist playing the violin and it was beautiful. The waitress and food was great but the show during dinner made it an experience.

We had to wait a long time to get into the restaurant because it is located in New Orleans French Quarter. The waiter was absolutely amazing and very attentive. I ordered the red fish and it tasted amazing.My family all loved what they ordered but I think that the Gator bites could have been larger in portion size for the price we paid.

We visited this establishment based on numerous recommendations and other Yelp reviews. It was a light and fun atmosphere. Due to the wait we chose to set at the bar. The bartender was overwhelmed with drink orders but was helpful. We ordered stuffed mushrooms and oysters for appetizers. The oysters were fresh and tasty. The mushrooms had good flavor but they were cold. For dinner we had crawfish ravioli and the Taste of New Orleans. The ravioli was good but would have been much better if it was stuffed with crawfish instead of in the sauce. The gumbo had good flavor. The jambalaya was bland. The crawfish étouffée was very tasty with good spices.  Overall it satisfied our appetite but we won't rush back.

If you are in New Orleans or near the French Quarter, you MUST stop here. 

Two of us ordered a ton of food just to sample everything. 

The char grilled oysters w garlic Parmesan butter were to die for! Only problem? Wish I ordered a dozen and not 6! 

The gumbo, jambalaya and etuffae were TOP NOTCH. Perfect flavor. 

The entree called Taste of New Orleans is a bit small (trio of 3 things listed above) and it's $18. So if you're hungry, that won't do it. 
Also ordered the creole shrimp. I'm not a fan of tomato sauces so I let my partner eat that. 
The ribeye was char grilled to PERFECTION and the rub they use was delicious. The side of green beans and grilled potatoes melted in your mouth. 

I can't say enough about this place!!!!
2 appetizers
1 bottle of sparkling wine
3 entrees 
1 cocktail
$150

Please go here if you're on vacation!! I went there twice in the 4 days I spent in New Orleans. Had my first po boy and it was very good! Fried alligator and the gumbo were the best. Tried gumbo at other places and they did not compare to this place. Absolutely amazing!!

A MUST when visiting New Orleans!  From the moment we asked for a menu this place had amazing service. They were super accommodating as we are evacuees from hurricane Irma and had two dogs with us. The host Arrow, who was so friendly, quickly got us a table, was very accommodating with a table with open doors for pups. They are dog friendly (that they were very accommodating to give my dog water and make sure my dogs were comfortable). They had open doors at the restaurant which made the experience amazing for all of us. Thank you to our waitress Heidi for the amazing service!  Now onto the food... My fiancé had the red beans and rice and alligator bites.  I had the gumbo. All was delicious, and very fresh! I can't stress it enough it is a must!!!!!!
Disgusting. The food came out cold. The shrimps still had the poop vein in them and they're fried so you won't notice unless you cut into it

Good food. I had the Taste of New Orleans which is a sample platter with different creoles and gumbos. The fried alligator appetizer was definitely my favorite. Fried oyster tacos were also good but the service was terrible. We sat at the balcony. After waiting some time for our food, I brushed it off because the kitchen was probably busy (9pm). I had to wait an additional 20 minutes, ask two servers and get out of my seat and head inside to get someone's attention before I could get utensils and plates and by this time, all my food was cold. What a let down.

Great spot with a super friendly polite staff. Great host at the door got us acconodated. Our waitress Heidi, was a sweetheart and made dinner special and fun.  A nice center bar and cozy atmosphere at the tables with views of the activity going on outside.   I'm coming back for a few cocktails. We had the spinach dip,  oysters on the half shell,  jambalaya and eggplant oyster.  Food is good but could have some extra love to complete experience.

We walked in with our 5 year old with no problem. Food was delicious. Service was great. The crab claws appetizer was soooo flavorful. The crawfish ravioli was good but no excellent. Would have rather had the claws sauce on that. But I was told there is a tortellini dish with that sauce... next time. Red beans and rice was on point.

We had to evacuate from Florida because of Irma and we decided NOLA was the place to go. Our first time ever in the french quarter and this place caught my eye. For a Saturday night the wait wasn't bad at all. 5-10 min tops. However, we sat on the bottom floor and it was a little cramped for a family of 5.

Our server was AMAZING. She was so sweet and very attentive. She even brought out some fruit for my kids while we were waiting for our food. 

We probably waiting 30-45 for our food to come out which I was getting annoyed by but omg. The food was definitely worth the wait!

Crab Claws app - the sauce was super creamy and had just the right amount of spice. Decent amount of crab. Also, we were brought extra bread for dipping. 

Shrimp n grits - best grits I've ever had. Soft and not tacky. Small hint of gouda. BBQ shrimp was on point. Just wish there was a bit more sauce.

Don't  think it deserves 4 stars. 
Lets start with the food,small portions and just ok. Nothing to talk about as for the service,average had to ask for several things more than 2 times. For the prices I would have expected a little more, kinda dissapointed. Guess paying for the location.

I dined here with my wife back in February and we had a great time. We asked to be seated upstairs on the balcony and they placed us near the corner and the view was amazing. There was a small jazz quartet downstairs jamming while we were waiting for our food, which was an added bonus to the New Orleans ambiance. 

We ordered some Fried Alligator for starters and they were delicious. It tastes like a mix between chicken and fish...very interesting texture and the taste is amazing. For entrees, My wife ordered the Eggplant and Chicken Parmesan and I ordered the Taste of New Orleans which consisted of: Chicken & Andouille Jambalaya, Crawfish Etouffée and Chicken and Andouille Gumbo. The Eggplant and Chicken Parmesan and Crawfish Etouffée were definitely the best dishes. For dessert, we ordered the Bananas foster cheesecake which was just great. 

I highly recommend dining at Royal House and be sure to get a seat upstairs on the balcony.

Worst service I have ever experienced. Waited 20+ minutes for drinks, 30+ minutes for an appetizer, and the server was the most inattentive girl, and could careless whether we were content or not. Food had 0 flavor and everything is fried with fish so hopefully you like fish fries and fish hush puppies and fish eggplant. Save yourself the confidence of the positive reviews and go elsewhere .

Excellent food and service!!  A must try when you visit Nola!  We go every time we are in the quarter. Love the crawfish etoufee and shrimp creole. Tried the crab claws and chargrilled oysters from here and they were great as well. LEROY was our server and he is nothing but awesome!! Quick, very polite, and his vibe makes you feel welcome. Enthusiastic and very good at what he does!!  You won't regret eating here.

So glad we found this place!! Excellent excellent excellent oysters!! Wow!! THESE ARE OYSTERS!!
Delicious!! We found this place today through yelp. So glad we did. We decided to try the oysters and I was amazed at how fresh and delicious they were!! 
The service was great. Renelle was our server and she was great. Very professional. There was also a guy wearing a jersey working by her station. He was great too. Really attentive service. Very good salads too!! But those oysters!! Yummy!! I will be back again someday just to eat a whole dozen myself!! 
This restaurant is in a great location of New Orleans. It is located in the French quarter of New Orleans. Very nice safe area. Very nice street.

After roaming the streets of NOLA finally decided on this place. Great location in the heart of the French Quarter. 

Decor-brick walls and interesting art. Couple big screens to watch the game. 

Service-FANTASTIC! Renelle was super knowledgeable about the menu and was always ready to make recommendations. She was very nice and attentive. 

Food-very good, and fresh tasting. Charbroiled oysters were seasoned with garlic and Parmesan, I sprinted lemon on top gave them just the right balance. Egg plant and fried oyster entree was very very good. This was waitress recommendation and I'm glad I ordered it. Foster cheesecake was just the right way to end night. Bit too much liquid then I'm used to, but still very nice. 

I also like that the manager checked on me and asked how everything was going, always to see that. I'll be back NOLA!
My son and I ordered raw oysters and they were delicious. Sat in a seat by a huge window that provided a great spot for people watching! Highly recommend

First time here and got what was recommended to me which was the shrimp po'boy.....and....amazing. The shrimp was very lightly seasoned and fried which had s very light and airy feel to them. I added the chipotle mayo which gave it a much needed kick, otherwise it was not very powerful in flavor. Not bland. But rather very mild in flavor. Good, but could be a lot better but when the chipotle mayo was added it was perfect. The other little tidbit was the bread a tad stale but I'll chalk that up to luck on just not getting a fresh out of the oven bread loaf. All in all it was a great sandwhich and def a place I would come back to...and that's the mark of a great restaurant.
Come for the crab claws, stay for the electrical outlets by the tables next to the washroom to charge your phone!

This place is a hotspot in the heart of the French Quarter, and for good reason! So many deals you can get here, like a free app if you check in on Yelp. A friend and I came here on a hot summer day, and there was nothing better than cooling off upstairs at the Royal House.

The inside is decorated ornately and it has a historic, classy feel with the high ceilings you see so often in New Orleans architecture. The balcony would have been the ideal spot to sit and people watch below, but it was too hot the day we visited.

Our waiter let us know the best things on the menu. Get these:

-- The Crab Claws ($13.50): this appetizer is served up lathered generously with this amazing Cajun, creamy, garlicky sauce. The staff kept the dish on our table even after we were done because there was still some sauce left and they knew how good it is.

-- Any Po-Boy ($15+): Granted, I am not the biggest fan of this sandwich, but they don't skimp out on quantity here. It'll come loaded with meat and served with lots of fries on the side.
The food is awesome.  Ask for Heidi, as she takes pride in making recommendations.  Loved the oysters and redfish!!
Delicious! Absolutely worth the wait! We ordered the New Orleans sampler and the red beans, fried chicken and sausage dish. Good service, great atmosphere, and amazing food!

My first experience at Royal House was so amazing solely based on the chargrilled oysters. I was determined to get back here during my next NOLA vacay. 

On my second encounter, everything (besides the delicious chargrilled oysters) was horrible. Things were so gross, some of my friends actually had to send back their food. 

My blackened Red Fish seemed to be over cooked and not really flavorful. My friend's New Orleans Sampler featured one of the most disgusting bowls of gumbo I've ever tasted. There was a weird after taste and the rice was not cooked well. My other friend's Shrimp Creole dish could be compared to a cup of Ragu thrown on top of shrimp.

Our waitress was super sweet and patient. She's salvaging a star for this review.

I'm super disappointed in this place. Stick with the chargrilled oysters.

The ambiance was nice and out waiter was super friendly. Those were the reasons they received two stars. The char grilled oysters are amazing ! Best I've ever had but everything else food wise was a total let down. I had the New Orleans trio and almost everything tasted Old or pre made. I was expecting way more since we were in New Orleans but I had much better in Texas which was highly disappointing. I tasted my friend seafood platter it was too salty, the fish it was just okay . Honestly this place is just a tourist trap with mediocre food.

The oysters were amazing . We also tried the gumbo and it was so flavorful, that we ordered another bowl . This place is pretty amazing . Make sure to go right when they open in the morning, It gets very packed quickly because they are so good . I will be back here when I come back to New Orleans

Ambiance was pretty nice. Because of that and the pricing, I expected the food to be up to par. I was supper disappointed, I got the shrimp creole and it tasted like shrimp and Ragu sauce. Our waiter was super nice and patient with us, she offered me to get something else and I got the blackened fish which was better than what I had. However it wasn't great. Honestly there food tastes precooked. I was supposed to have steamed rice and it was def boiled. I think they get away with there cheap food because it's in the French quarter.

Went there our first night in New Orleans after reading the review. We sat at the bar as there was a 30 minute wait for a table. Enjoyed watching oyster shucking. Hubby had the New Orleans sampler, it was ok, nothing great. I had the shrimp creole, which was slightly better than average.

So we came here to compare their oysters to Acme and we are so glad we did. We got great balcony seating on the second floor, live music from the street below and a very sweet server named Nadia. 24 oysters later we were a happy couple. Nothing like garlic butter basted, parmesan sprinkled grilled oysters with grilled bread for dipping to win me over.  It was the perfect evening for my Husband who was here for the first time. Thank you Royal House for helping us make fun memories!
The raviolis were awesome, the best I have ever had hands down. The Bloody Mary was equally awesome I highly recommend this place !

Disgusting. The food came out cold. The shrimps still had the poop vein in them and they're fried so you won't notice unless you cut into it 

UPDATE
The restaurant commented this on my post: we sincerely apologize for your experience. We do not devein our shrimp, however, we should have let you know. We hope you will come try some of our other amazing dishes. Thank you for this feedback. 

In response to restaurants comment: It should always be removed, regardless if you are at Applebee's or eating at a 3 michelin star restaurant. That's common sense. You should never have to make your guest eat a shit filled vein.
This was an awesome find. Our waiter was great. We came in at 10pm and Tyrone was great. He had great suggestions. The food was awesome. The bananas foster cheesecake was unbelievable.

I must to give a HUGE shout out to Caitlin (not sure how she spells it)!! I visited Royal House a few years ago and the food was excellent so I knew I needed to go back when I was in town this past weekend celebrating my birthday. When we arrived on Thursday, a small group of us went to Royal House for dinner. That's when we met the lovely Caitlin and instantly became bffs. Even though they don't take reservations Caitlin told us to come back for my birthday dinner on Saturday night and she would have a table ready for us. We were a large party of 9 people so getting a reservation anywhere was challenging. We ended up being super late (about 3 hours) but she still had the table waiting for us anyway! We were shocked! She was so happy to see us and gave us all the warmest welcome. Her recommendations were spot on and everything we ate was delicious - the crab claws are to die for!! When it came time to sing happy birthday she went out of her way to get cupcakes because they couldn't do a dessert from the restaurant. This was the sweetest gesture and made me feel so special! Overall, fantastic experience and I would definitely recommend this place to anyone looking for exceptional service and delicious local food.

Our concierge suggested this lunch spot with tradition NOLA food. Started with a dozen oysters (not briny at all compared to what we have in Boston) and the seafood stuffed mushrooms. Both were fresh and Yummy. Hubby had the French onion soup and loved it. Son had the ribeye topped with crabmeat and could not finish it. Daughter had eggplant and oyster pasta and felt bad she could not finish it because it was so good. Hubby and I had oyster PO'boys. Felt bad that we just ate the oysters and not the huge piece of French bread it came on. Kids commented that it looks like all the staff love each other and like working here. Lovely and friendly wait staff.
The food was just ok. My gumbo was room temperature. There are many other better restaurants to go to.

The food and service were excellent, and especially enjoyed the view from sitting on second floor balcony. Recommend it. Tasty shrimp & grits and husband's eggplant and oysters. Redfish beignets were unique and had sweet sauce.
Wonderful food. Servers were knowledgeable and well trained. We didn't have to wait long for a table.

I have never been a fan of oysters, but the char grilled oysters were a tasty surprise. Warmed on a grill, then topped with butter and Parmesan cheese, they were wonderful. I wished we had ordered more than a half dozen. 
The crawfish ravioli was flavorful in a rich, lightly spiced cream sauce. They didn't skimp on the sautéed crawfish meat and with the additional cheese in the ravioli, it was a hearty, filling main fish. 
I would definitely return to the Royal House for a meal.

Our server was Ashley, she was very good. It was busy so it was a slow start but ended up being good. The food was delish! The crab claw appetizer was the BEST! The sauce it comes in was so good we wanted to lick the plate!!

Great location. Good views. Vibrant atmosphere. Horrible service.   From the rude hostess with a horrible attitude to the incompetent wait service, as long as you have low expectations, you'll have a fine time.   With so many establishments to choose from I'd recommend doing a bit of research and settling on one of many decent options in the area.

Service was very slow, even though there were not many people there. It seemed like the waiter forgot us and/or our order, even though we were sitting near the entrance. Food was average. Prices were as expected for New Orleans.

To start we had the alligator bites appetizer.  I want expecting much because every alligator app I've had elsewhere has always been kinda chewy.  The waitress said that they marinated theirs in a way that should be Tender. It was!  Extremely tender and delicious!  The fried oyster po boy was fantastic as well.  Tender and fresh.  Great lunch spot!

We enjoyed the Royal House very much! It's nothing fancy but everything we had was tasty, the prices are reasonable and the service was good. We started with the fried alligator - it was our first time having it so we have nothing to compare it to but we enjoyed it! We had been warned by others that have tried it at other places that it may be chewy but we didn't find that to be the case at all! It was very tender inside. We also both got the roast beef po' boys and my husband got a side of the gumbo. The po' boys were a little messy but delicious and the fries were super crispy and a good texture. We'd go back if we are ever in NOLA again!

Absolutely love this restaurant. It's in the heart of all the crazy action and the food is amazing. It's also not over priced like so many mediocre place up and down the quarter. I dream about their crab claws.

The alligator appetizer was very tasty and tender but small for the price. For 4 of us we only got 2 pieces each. 
I ordered the fried fish po'boy and red beans n rice.  The po'boy was disappointing... the fish was softer than the bread and didn't have any flavor. (My favorite catfish po'boy was at NOLA po'boy because there was texture and flavor.) The red beans n rice were freaking fantastic and the peel n eat shrimp were enjoyed. I don't think we will be back here though......partly because there are so many great places in New Orleans and partly because half of us were underwhelmed with our food. If we could do half stars, I would give it 3 1/2.
Our server was super friendly and helpful...she gets 5 stars on her own.  : )

Sat at the bar near the man shucking oysters... and I'm not sure if it was his attitude or his "forgetfulness".. but it wasn't the experience I had before. The food was okay... the alligator bites were cold and so was our entrees. I wasn't pleased with the service or the food. Mediocre... and that's what I would rate it as of now. Nothing spectacular.

We had a really nice server from Charleston , SC, I believe. He recommended the blackened red fish. It was served with potatoes  & the chefs choice vegetables, were went well with the blackboard fish.  For our appetizer we enjoyed the crab claws with lemon butter.  I definitely go back here next time I'm in New Orleans.  I'd like to try their shrimp and grits or the crawfish ravioli that was also recommended.

The wait wasn't too bad, although food took a long time to come out. We ordered Chargrilled and Roayle oysters, both were okay nothing amazing. We also had seafood pescare which was also okay, the sauce was a little too thick and creamy. Overall, good experience.
I highly recommend the crab claws. The sauce is amazing. Do not share and make whoever comes with you order there own. I put the left over sauce in a plate and dipped everything I ate in the sauce.

Crab claws were good, though very salty. If you took the claws and sauce from Red Fish Grill and combined it with the bread at Royal House, you would have the perfect combination.  

Pescatore and crawfish etouffe were very good. Drinks were good.

Came here with my boyfriend for our one year anniversary and had a good experience overall. The crab claws were AMAZING. Definitely a must! My boyfriend had the shrimp tortellini and it was pretty good. I wanted to get the shrimp and grits solely because the picture on their website looked good. I ordered it and it was nothing close at all. The shrimp sauce was horrible and the grits were inedible. I got to swap it out for the crawfish ravioli and it was so much better. They even took the shrimp and grits off the ticket. Pretty small portions for the price but it's all about location.
Great atmosphere and good food! All the servers were very friendly and the spinach dip was amazing!

Great New Orleans eating experience.  The atmosphere was fantastic allowing us to talk about the day.  The food was absolutely fantastic.  We split  a poboy and some oysters.  I could see it getting crowded as we finished but at 5pm there was no waiting.  I would recommend to anyone in the area.

The food is JUST ok. It's adequate in an area where you're walking distance from extraordinary. The price to food portion ratio is also WAY off (don't get the gater appetizer, it basically comes in a shot glass). If you're on the fence enough to check a Yelp review, I'm certain you can do better in that area.

Not the best place. We ordered raw oysters and few entrees. For some reason they forgot the oysters and brought the entrees after 20 minutes. We canceled oysters and had them somewhere else. Also there was water leaking from the air conditioning vent directly onto out table. Food was average. Won't visit again.

Stopped in to Royal House after the Haunted History tour. Many places close on Sundays at 10, so we went to the Royal House since they stay open a little later and have live oysters. Tina our server was excellent, she was very attentive and very personable. We ordered the raw oysters, chargrilled oysters, oyster pasta, spinach salad, and the shrimp Creole. The shrimp Creole is the only dish that we felt coiuld have been much better. The Creole sauce was more of a marinara sauce. All other dishes were excellent.

We were looking for a place to grab a quick and affordable dinner after a late night ghost tour. Royal House had pretty good reviews and was open till 10, so we headed over. 

Tina, our server, was given 6 or 7 new tables within a 2-4 minute time frame at about 9:30 pm, and I have to say, she handled it incredibly gracefully. She was amazing, full of awesome recommendations and genuinely such a kind woman. I give her 5 stars alone. I just wish the rest of the staff and management would have helped her manage the influx of patrons by at least getting us some water while we waited to give our orders. 

We ordered the stuffed mushrooms, crawfish etouffee, chargrilled oysters, and oysters royale, taking advantage of Yelp's offer for a free appetizer. 
I really enjoyed the chargrilled oysters - they were outstanding, rich, and explosively flavorful. My boyfriend doesn't like oysters, but they look of delight on his face when he tried one was proof of just how delicious they are. Highly recommend. 

I wish I had known the "royale" filling for oysters royale was the same as the stuffed mushrooms, because it was a little much to have both dishes together, and we probably wouldn't order either of them again. The etouffe was yummy but not the star.

We just stopped and ate here on a whim. I wanted to try a Po-boy before heading home and this was definitely not the place to have tried it. The sandwich was a disappointment as was the restaurant itself-which is a shame because it is a great location and is decorated well, seemed clean. We sat upstairs-wanted the balcony but it seemed very narrow and slanted. The table was not even sitting flat on the floor. As far as food- we got the seafood stuffed mushrooms as a starter-this was pretty terrible. The mushrooms tasted like they came from a can, and the whole thing was room temp not hot. My shrimp po boy had no flavor and was dry. The batter seemed to have no seasoning and there was absolutely no type of sauce-instead they brought out a bottle of mayo. Very disappointing. Don't waste your money like I did.

Went here on a whim and was very pleasantly surprised. Got a table right away for 8 without a reservation in a very crowded restaurant! Service was great and the food was excellent. Some highlights include the crab claw and stuffed mushroom appetizers and the crawfish ravioli! Bread pudding was great too!

Oysters are awesome.  Didn't get the most welcoming feeling  at the bar. Asked for the first drink on the after dinner drink list and was told that "I've never sold that..i don't think we have it". It was on the shelf above her head. But it was good so check it out early in the evening.

The food came so late. We waited for our god for at 35minutes. I have to call another waitress to follow up with our order because our waitress is nowhere to find. After 5 minutes the food came. 

Regarding the food, it wasn't that great. If you're looking for more creole food, I think should house of Gumbo is a lot better. This place is only for first try but won't come back again.
I don't get the hype. The food was just okay. The atmosphere was typical for New Orleans. The service was good.

I don't understand the rating here... food was not good and drinks were weak, all with a high price tag. Actually, I think it's because they have a special where you can get a free app if you check-in/leave a review. Smart on the restaurant's part, but unfortunate for the guests who think they're going to get some really good food. The one thing this place has going for it is the ambiance. It looks pretty neat in here.

The Chargrilled Oysters are amazing!!! Definitely one of my favorites here in New Orleans. I also has the seafood stuffed mushrooms! They were a dream!! The staff is always so pleasant and nice here! Had a wonderful time dining!

Oysters and beer.....wait....Oysters, beer and French Onion soup....Laissez less bonus temp router!

My wife is a born and bred South Louisiana girl. Every time we hit NOLA she expects to go here at least once. Sitting at the oyster bar is the best. These boys can shuck them as fast as we eat them. The chargrilled Oysters are to die for and the French Onion soup is more like a half pound of cheese that happens tho have some soup under it. Great Stuff!

We visited from Austin this past weekend and had yet another fantastic experience at RH!!  We went on Friday afternoon and were seated upstairs by a kind hostess, immediately.  Our server Brionne and our busser (didn't get his name) were so friendly, quick and accommodating.  We were unsure what to order along with out charbroiled and raw oysters, so Brionne recommended the redfish beignets which were AMAZING!  

We had terrible service from a very unfriendly woman at The Old Coffee Pot (steer clear, folks!) earlier in the day, so were really hoping for a friendly staff experience at the other places we chose, and this crew did not disappoint!  I love to talk to the locals when I go on trips and NOLA has the coolest people!  I've been back to RH every time I've visited, despite hundreds of other choices, and I will continue to do so in the future.  I love this place!!  Great job, guys!
Had the Jambalaya with blackened shrimp. I was not impressed.  Very small shrimp like salad shrimp, and very dry and salty.
We enjoyed lunch here as soon as we arrived in New Orleans.  The staff is fabulous and the food was delish!!!!! The jambalaya and ettoufee were excellent!

I came in on the night Hurricane Nate skipped New Orleans and sat at the oyster bar. I had chargrilled oysters that were amazing. I used my bread to sip up the butter/cheese/garlic sauce that was left in the shells and when that was gone I received crackers as well and used those for the rest of it. My server/oyster shucker was Antoine and he was very friendly and helpful. Their chicken and andouille sausage gumbo is amazing though not as spicy as some would like I think. I had the Dark and Stormy cocktail which was pretty fantastic as well.

This is the worst restaurant I've had in NOLA. I've been an oyster eater for more than five years and this is the first time I tasted bad oysters. Their oysters are brown, look like they've been opened and put out for a long time. The oysters even smell like gutter. I had to puke it out because it was really disgusting. Shame on this restaurant for being here, surround by so many good oyster house. Don't go here if you want quality oysters.
Pretty mediocre food. The service is very good and the drinks are decent. Overall feels like a crappy tourist trap.

For the price, the food and drinks were awesome!! Oysters were fresh and Bananas foster was delicious. The view out the open windows at night is so nice, and eventful for sure. All of the staff were so nice and catered to our needs. Must visit again!

I came here on my first day in New Orleans and I wanted to have gumbo, shrimp étouffée, and jambalaya. I figured I was in luck because they have a taste of all three. The jambalaya was dry and I needed to douce it in hot sauce for it to do anything interesting in my mouth. I thought the other two were good until I had them elsewhere.  I won't be running back here any time soon as I believe NOLA has no space for signature dishes that aren't one of the best.

I dropped in because of the rating on yelp and i have to say, it lived up to it.  I was traveling alone so I sat at the bar.  The bartender was great!  He was friendly and funny.  I ordered the Gator PoBoy and really enjoyed it.  I've had gator before and this was much better.  It was fried pieces of meat inside the PoBoy.  They were juicy and tender!  It was great.

For those of you wondering, gator is a white meat and really does taste similar to chicken... well like a blend between chicken and fish.  You definitely need to try it!

Went for dinner with a couple of Co workers. 

Food was amazing! I ordered a taste of New Orleans which is Chicken & Andouille Jambalaya, Crawfish Etouffée and Chicken and Andouille Gumbo with a few slices of bread. Food was seasoned perfectly and all had that nice Cajun spicy kick to it. I have had all of this before from restaraunts close to home in California but wanted to taste the real deal. I highly recommend this place. Co workers were pleased with their food as well. We all left happy campers. 

I also ordered a Abita purple haze which is a local beer. Nice and fruity and felt very refreshing in the nice warm humid weather.

My wife and I thought this place was a bit over rated compared to some of the other cajun places that we went to in the french quarter. We sat out on the patio on the second floor so it was great people watching and watching the multiple weddings pass through the streets below us. Other than that we were not impressed. I ordered the oyster po boy and my wife ordered the taste of new orleans and thought the oysters tasted very fishy and not fresh at all. The portions were a little smaller compared to some of the other places we went to and the service was sub par. Our server over charged us for items we did not order, service was slow, was not impressed overall. We would not go back here again, however we were impressed with Oceania grill if you are looking for a great cajun restaurant. Would definitely go back there!

Overall, I find this 4 star rating very misleading. The jambalaya was dry and flavorless, the shrimp were tiny and bland, I couldn't tell if my bread was lightly toasted or just stale and the gravy on the poboy looked like it was straight from a packet. That being said, our waitress was fun and attentive (and the only reason I'm giving 3 rather than 2 stars).

Ever since we purchased our tickets to NOLA, my main focus was to find the best restaurants to dine on the freshest seafood possible. While the hubs hates the majority of food from the ocean, I LOVE it. On the hunt for the best po' boy in town, I heard the buzz on Royal house - so off we went!

STAR 1 = Location is killer! Right on the corner of St Louis and Royal St, it's easy to spot, and right in the French Quarter! 

STAR 2 = Staff is outstanding in welcoming guests entering into the restaurant, insanely helpful and 100% attentive! We were seated at a table near the back (with plenty of AC, cause let's face it, it's HOT AF) and our waitress came right over to collect our drink order and assist us in the extensive menu. We started with cocktails which arrived right away! Our sweet server came back numerous times to check on us, tell us history of the building and made us feel right at home.

STAR 3 = Food is delicious! Because I was all about loaded sandwiches, I opted for the fried shrimp po' boy, while the hubs opted for a roast beef po'boy - both of which were piled high with the "fixin's" (lettuce, tomato, pickles and more!) and tasted great! We started with the Alligator tail appetizer (cause why not!) and liked that as well! The food came out fast, was large in portion and totally hit the spot! Oysters is what this place is famous for, which I didn't end up sampling but def will next time!

STAR 4 = Make sure to check in on the Yelp app, as you get a free appetizer with the purchase of 2 entrees! 

Although a bit pricey (be prepared to drop a pretty penny), but totally worth it! :)
4 stars for 4 vibessssss!

We came here with friends based on Yelp peer reviews ! You were all dead on. Great place!! I recommend it!   In fact  they remade our order after they noticed it wasn't prepared incorrectly.  Thank you yelp peers and thank you Heidi (server) great job !!!!
What a great spot. The servers and the bartenders are fantastic. The red beans and rice was my favorite but we have eaten here 3 times and love it. The oysters were amazing

The food took forever and the place wasn't very busy. The Oyster Tacos which were to be served in a "crispy tortilla" were just an oily mess on a tortilla chip. Not good at all. My guests did not like meals either. The bright spot were the Bloody Mary and the bar tender, other than that this was not a place I would eat at again.

If you are in New Orleans or near the French Quarter, you MUST stop here. 

Two of us ordered a ton of food just to sample everything. 

The char grilled oysters w garlic Parmesan butter were to die for! Only problem? Wish I ordered a dozen and not 6! 

The gumbo, jambalaya and etuffae were TOP NOTCH. Perfect flavor. 

The entree called Taste of New Orleans is a bit small (trio of 3 things listed above) and it's $18. So if you're hungry, that won't do it. 
Also ordered the creole shrimp. I'm not a fan of tomato sauces so I let my partner eat that. 
The ribeye was char grilled to PERFECTION and the rub they use was delicious. The side of green beans and grilled potatoes melted in your mouth. 

I can't say enough about this place!!!!
2 appetizers
1 bottle of sparkling wine
3 entrees 
1 cocktail
$150

Great food and service! We didn't have a reservation but sat a party of 10 in 30min! The dinners were delicious and they were accommodating for dietary restrictions. Only ding were the gator bites. Very expensive for a small portion of deep fried balls.  Would go back!

We had been to the Royal House 3 years ago and LOVED it. The food had been excellent.

On our return trip, the restaurant was extremely disappointing. 

We ordered oysters prepared 3 different ways. The char grilled oysters were so salty that we couldn't eat them. We also ordered the oysters Rockefeller and the Oysters Royal. both tasted exactly the same, though the Oysters Rockefeller did have a minuscule amount of spinach under the oyster. both were overly salted and over cooked.

Based on our last experience at the Royal House, we would recommend that you seek a better place to eat!

l loved Royal House! Its located on Royal street, a stones throw from Bourbon street and the craziness over there.  You can dine on the balcony overlooking the parties and celebrations below. I recommend:
-stuffed mushrooms
-their oysters, both raw and baked
-gumbo
-oysters pasta
-catfish po-boy sandwich
-shrimp tortellini 
Price: $$
Service: fast and friendly
Tip: Check into Yelp for a free appetizer!!

Food and service were amazing! Nice atmosphere. I'm not a seafood eater so I got the red beans and rice, it was delicious. My family ordered shrimp tortellini and the red fish, they were in seafood heaven. For apps, we ordered the fried eggplant and spinach artichoke dip, both were very good. Just a great place all around! Stop in!

We ducked in here for lunch during our outing in the French Quarter. We were welcomed immediately, and our toddler was given crayons and a coloring sheet. A pleasant surprise, as you never know what is "kid friendly" down here. Lots of patrons were dressed casually, presumably also out walking around. We ordered the Taste of New Orleans platter. The crawfish etouffée was delicious! Our server was pleasant, prompt and efficient. The menu has several oyster dishes to choose from, we're here for a week and have already decided to come back to eat!

Decent restaurant. Great downtown location. We walked by it and decided to get some brunch (which they only serve on Sat & Sun) because we were starving and the A/C felt amazing. 

We got different types of eggs and I asked for mine with cheddar cheese. When the waitress brought out our food mine had American cheese on it (which I HATE) and I asked her why it wasn't cheddar. She said they did not have cheddar and thought I wouldn't notice. I was not very happy that she told me they had it when she knew they did not. 

Other than that it was a pleasant experience. Would be interested to try the dinner/seafood menu but breakfast was fine there.

Very fast and friendly service. Hostess actually remembered my name when we left 2 hours later. Waitress was very attentive and personable. The food was outstanding, char grilled oysters arrived quickly and disappeared just as quick. The Seafood Pescatore with lemon butter sauce was excellent as well. Definitely recommend this place for outstanding seafood dishes.
Loved it ! Food was great and carnival margarita was amazing just needs a bigger desert menu
Probably had the best French onion soup ever here, husband had fresh oysters, wound definitely recommend if you're in New Orleans. Sit on the balcony if there's seats available you won't regret it.
Delicious and friendly!! That crawfish ravioli though...I'd eat it off the floor!  Love the patio dining area!! The fried fish was awesome!!

Service wasn't great. Didn't seem like the staff could get the fact that we wanted our appetizers before our entrees. Shrimp and grits were cold when served. When we asked for our food to be warmed it took another 20 minutes. The chef did make a new order though. Food was good overall but there are too many other places in the Quarter with good food and good service.
I recommend the chat-broiled oysters. Good for casual eating, staff is very friendly.

We tried alligator for the first time here! Really good prices and amazing service. Their menu has a lot of good choices plus you get to eat in the balcony without too much hassle. Love the atmosphere and the view. If you dont want to sit by balcony, you can still hang out inside, their second floor has plenty of table and a full bar
Got a poor boy. It was bland. Wish I had the oysters and booze that seems to be the thing to get here.

I had some delicious shrimp creole and fried alligator bites. It was probably overpriced for the portion size but it did taste fresh. The waitress was helping train a new waiter and they were both kind and attentive. I think I would come back but try something different.

I'm torn between 3 and 4 stars. A good place to get moderate priced cajun and creole fare in the French Quarter. Not the greatest food, but in this area, it's hard to find great food at a moderate price. It's perfectly fine food, though.  Just didn't wow us. Service was very good and atmosphere is nice (open doors, balcony).  We had the stuffed mushrooms, taste of New Orleans, and shrimp creole. Shrimp creole was a little too close to marinara (a lttle sweet), but it was alright.  If this is your first time having cajun/creole food, or you aren't that picky about your cajun/creole, you'll enjoy eating here when on the Quarter. A good sized menu, so you'll find something for everyone.
This place was awful. The gumbo was ish and our oysters Rockefeller came out cold. Furthermore, we were missing half of our order for 20 minutes. At least we were in New Orleans

Ok. So order the mushrooms. They are flipping amazing and worth the trip alone. This place is an amazing dining experience. Not only is the building beautiful with its crystal doorknobs and incredibly scary staircase, the waiting staff is friendly and just plain fun. We went around Halloween and many of the wait staff were dressed up.  Kaitlyn helped us out dressed as Alice. She was friendly and a lot of fun. Can't wait to visit New Orleans again just so we can visit this place. Yummy!

Came here Friday early evening for a dinner for one. Was promptly seated at a table. The service was excellent, my waitress was very welcoming. 

I ordered a po-boy and I thought it was pretty good. The crispy shrimp was very flavorful and delicious and the portion was fairly large.

Came here for my birthday weekend and found that it had a ton of reviews. They also had a check in special. We had a large party of 12 and knew it would be difficult to accommodate us. Calling them is pointless as they don't take reservations or call aheads and will hang up on you if you ask further questions. The appetizers are all very good. The server kept telling me that they were fixing the coke and kept with that excuse till the very end. Cokeless, I wasn't sure why she never asked if I wanted a different drink. The tease but a bad taste in my mouth that I couldn't wash out. The shrimp Poboy was dry. Disappointed

I did take out. I was just passing through N.O. I went to yelp and this place had a lot of good reviews. The menu had a good selection and it's in a location. The ambience of the place was chill, if I ever visit NOLA again I'd go there again.

Food was fine but the service was pretty bad. We ordered 6 oysters on the half shell. 35 minutes later they arrived and the tray of ice was half melted (meaning it had been waiting for pickup at the oyster bar for a while). Our server was nowhere to be found. Maybe we got a bad server because the other patrons seemed happy.

This place is in a fabulous location. Being beside the courthouse means you get watch wedding processions New Orleans style, band and all, as you sit having your dinner. I had the shrimp and tortellini which was good. The sauce was flavorful and the pasta and shrimp was cooked well. I loved the ambiance but the food quality and price give it just three stars for me. Enjoy!

The service was top notch! The food was amazing! Everyone from the hostess, our server and the bar staff really made our lunch a romantic and tasty dining experience- the perfect start to a day of shopping, jazz, and art! Go and get yourself the redfish beignets to start. You'll love it!

I really enjoyed the gator bites. The crab legs were bursting with flavor. In my time in New Orleans I really feel this was the best restaurant. If I had to say anything negative it would be that the portion were small...and that's just being picky on choosing a negative. Great service from when I walked in to leaving
Zero service . We came here twice in 24 hrs, once for dinner and once for a drink on the balcony. Both times we waited 20 mins for service (both times it wasn't busy). Both times we left...

Sadly enough, I had a negative experience here. I wandered in because I needed a snack, and it looked lively. 

I ordered half a dozen oysters on a Tuesday night at 6 pm, and didn't receive them until 45 minutes later. The waiter explained that they had two large parties upstairs, which is understandable. What's less understandable was receiving my oysters with incredibly muddy shells - we're talking dollops of sandy mud dropping off the edges. After 3-4, I flagged down one of the waitstaff to politely inquire about it, she stated "this is just how oysters always come" and asked, "are you eating them correctly?" (I was... not my first oyster rodeo... or 20th, for that matter) 

I think she meant well and wanted me to have a good experience, but I don't think I've ever been asked that question that way before (customer service background kicking in: a good alternative way to get the same information would have been to ask, "May I see how you're eating them?") 

Not giving a one-star review because I don't want to tank this place on a single experience, no matter how negative. But yeah, I definitely won't be back, not with so many other great options in this city.

Found this place on yelp while walking in the French Quarter.  After a short wait we were taken upstairs and sat in this great warm second floor area.  It was Halloween weekend so our waitress was dressed as Alice.  Her name was Kaitlyn and was really friendly and helpful.  
We started with the stuffed seafood mushrooms.  One of the best apps I have ever had!  You can't go wrong with this wonderful place with tons of history and charm.  Awesome food and friendly service.
Fun atmosphere but the good was average.   Jambalaya was bland with little sausage.   Gumbo was very smoky..... almost had a burnt taste.

While visiting this amazing city for a conference a group of us decided to dine here. The atmosphere was welcome and friendly, which was only stepped up a notch by their amazing staff. They were all smiling and ready to tell us all about their menu items, beverages, restaurant, etc. Chef Terry and his team did a phenomenal job preparing amazing dishes, appetizers, and desserts. Raw oysters, oysters Rockefeller, grilled oysters with crab and mushrooms, red fish beignets, grits, seafood, and every dessert you can imagine. Wowee! We truly were impressed and blown away with each plate that came out. If you want a fun dining experience where you can't help but smile with each bite then this is the place to go.

I had eaten here before and had a pleasant experience, this time not so much. 

The first round of cooked oysters came out smelling so fishy! Afraid to eat them. 

Had them bring out chargrilled they were good, tiny, but good.

Dinner came out and so did the mouse!!!! Food was subpar at best. Hard to enjoy food with a mouse running around my feet the whole time... 

Looks like another restaurant in Nola falls short

The food was an embarrassment to New Orleans

Dear yelpers,

 It's my 4th day in new Orleans with me and my lady a we decided to visit the Royal house which is a nice set up I love the structure and the atmosphere of the place kind of reminds me of the the bars on new York. But every greets you at  the door. So when we get in  we order drinks pretty much all you do here. I got the effen on the beach, she got the carnival Martini. I didn't get to try the carnival Martini but it definitely look good. The opinion on my drink would be that it was a sweet drink something a little different for me. Later down the time of being she order some oyster. the only why we were there I like the fact that they crack them open in front of you. The server we had that nice was a very nice gentleman took very well care of us and the oyster was very good and fresh. Only bad thing about the place was I order a thing of peel-n-eat shrimp never got but was never on my bill so I was okay with it . Otherwise nice place.

Sincerely
Love my yelps

Food was tasty but the portions felt like they were on the smaller side. Nice restaurant and good ambience. Waiter was friendly and prompt. With all the competition in the area not sure that I would return.

Oh this place was soooo great. We came by for lunch and the ambiance was so nice and welcoming. We started with the crab legs, which were in an incredible sauce. I had the seafood gumbo and my boyfriend the shrimp creole. The food was so seasoned well and the waiters were so attentive. One of the best places I ate at for sure!

Great food, good service. They got us in pretty quickly even though there was s line down the street. We had charbroiled oysters, oysters royal and Rockefellers! All great! The mahi mahi was tasty and flaky! The linguini pescatore: excellent! Bloody Mary was really good too! The place is very noisy and crowded but what place isn't in NOLA!

I've used Yelp for a long time to decide on food, activities etc., but this is the first time I've left a review. My husband and I are visiting New Orleans for our tenth anniversary and for our first night really wanted a casual but good, Cajun/creole meal. Royal House absolutely did not disappoint. We arrived around 5:30 on a Saturday night and there was a line to get in. We were originally told it would be a twenty minute wait, but it was more like five minutes. We checked in on Yelp and received a free appetizer; hubby chose the fried alligator bites and I chose the crab claws. The alligator bites were good but not mind-blowing. The tarter sauce tasted homemade and was better than a typical tarter sauce. The star of the entire dinner were the crab claws. I cannot begin to describe how unbelievable the sauce was. The crab claws were small and more of a second thought to the bread and sauce! We ended up dipping everything we could in that sauce! I've never tasted anything like it in my life! It is filled with spice but is in no way spicy. For dinner hubby went with blackened shrimp & jambalaya and I chose the crawfish ravioli. The ravioli was definitely good, but I probably would have liked one of their other offerings better. Nothing was wrong with it-it tasted very fresh, and it's very possible that after my amazing appetizer nothing would ever taste good enough again! My hubby's dish was in my opinion much better than mine (so happy we almost always split all food 50/50 when in restaurants!). Shrimp were well cooked, fresh, and they definitely give you a large portion of them. They don't scrimp on the sausage either, and the chicken was white meat and shredded which we liked. The flavor was spot on, and we thoroughly enjoyed all the food we ordered. (Hubby really liked my ravioli). Portions were good for us-we were filled but not stuffed, with no leftovers. 
As far as service goes, our waiter (I forget his name) was very friendly and helpful regarding the menu, and we got drinks immediately; our appetizers took a little longer than I would have liked, but being as packed as they were I can understand that. Our dinner came out literally as we took our last bite of our appetizer, and he was very quick when it came to bringing the check. I absolutely recommend this place-New Orleans has so many places we want to try but it will be very hard not to go back to the Royal House. Another interesting thing: we were seated upstairs and weddings would go by every 10-15 minutes, and everyone would leave their table to go out on the balcony to cheer on the couple. Definitely a great casual vibe. I only gave it 4 stars because it was our first dinner here; I may change it to five after we sample more of what NOLA has to offer!

I hate writing bad reviews, but I'm shocked at all the 4 or 5 star ratings here. The food here was really subpar.  I'm not a first time visitor to NOLA so I know what the quality food here is like, especially given the price point of Royal House.  I understand the popularity of this place, based mostly on its location in the heart of the French Quarter.  But based on my visit, I would not recommend this place to anyone because it would  give one a bad impression of NOLA food.  We had the charbroiled oysters and Oyster Rockefeller.  The oysters were really bad.  The shells were covered by barnacles, and the oysters were so tiny they were a joke.  I was hard pressed to find any meat in my chicken and andouille sausage gumbo, and the roux tasted of liquid smoke.  My server was pretty cool, and the atmosphere seemed pleasant enough, but the food here is not recommended if you're seeking a memorable meal.  Best to avoid.

Stopped by after arriving in New Orleans for the first time. Server was Billy; very attentive. Billy suggested the shrimp tortellini and it did not disappoint! Very delightful. We also had the Rockefeller Oysters and they were delicious. Best item on the menu was the crab claw..... oh emmmm geeeeee heaven on a plate. Didn't get to snap pictures cause we were so taken back with the great taste. Overall a very nice experience! Thanks for the great experience. We would love to come back.

Great restaurant. The gumbo is the best I've had here in NOLA. Definitely splurge and get yourself an order of chargrilled oysters. Great location and atmosphere and I really loved the service. Lunch on the balcony was great and the fish platter was so good.

Saturday afternoon snack. I was seated quickly, ordered quickly, and received my food quickly. Unfortunately, it looked like my shrimp and grits ($20) was just slopped on my plate. My waiter was fine, the place was lively and had lots of people going in and out. Also, a worker with a large, full trash can came through my part of the dining room (twice!) - so YUCK to that. The food was just okay. The shrimp were small and the grits weren't really that flavorful.

I ordered the shrimp and grits and was very underwhelmed with what I received.  The shrimp were a little small and one was not fully shelled. The grits were boring.  I think they were doled out in four small ice cream scoops. The silver lining was the bbq sauce which had decent flavor.  Maybe it was a bad day, maybe it was the late-ish hour, but it was not worth the price.

This place was banging. Good service, great food and a pretty extensive Menu. 
We got the 'Taste of New Orleans' and a few Po Boys and they were awesome. No complaints, would go back for sure.

The customer service wasn't to die for my waiter did not return after we paid for our meal in cash to thank us for our business. The food was pretty good but the "taste of New Orleans dish" for what you get and the amount of food you get is not worth the price. The setting of the restaurant is vibrant but, overall if I had to choose I probably would try the restaurant out again only because of the taste of the food

Came here on a Saturday for lunch and it wasn't busy. The place is small but clean, and I loved that there were lots of open windows especially on a day with perfect weather. The service was 5/10, could have been a little more friendlier. 

The goods.
-Pecan pie. Not too sweet, would have been better ala mode!
-The windows? 

The mediocre. 
-Oyster Po'boy. Stingy on the oysters, buried in too much (overly toasted) bread. No flavor, no sauces. Get your po'boys elsewhere

Maybe their oysters are better? but I probably won't be back for my next trip to New Orleans to find out.

The service was terrible and 2 of the 4 meals were cold but it definitely wasn't the kitchen's fault.  The food was great anyway.  

We had the New Orleans sampler, roast beef po boy, oyster Po boy, etc.

Me and the boyfriend ate here one night. We loved it before he does not eat seafood and they has non seafood items on the menu. We got balcony seating. It was not a lot of space but the view was nice. A wedding let out down the street and we got to see the band and he wedding party March down the street. It was beautiful. Also on the corner a violinist was playing and music was great. The staff were super nice. I ordered chrome platter and it was yummy! A lot of food! 
Would definitely come back again!

We went during the busy lunchtime hour but they were able to get us a table right away. The oysters were quite big and delicious. 
 Our food ( shrimp po' boy sandwich and shrimp salad) were decent. But we saw a few cockroaches on the ground and water kept dripping onto our table from the A/c unit.

Waited half an hour last night and severely disappointed. Shrimp creole and Jambalaya were made with frozen rock shrimp that was small and tasted off, on top of that the flavor was just not there. We got the crab leg appetizer and the sauce was creamy however that's about it. Would not go again. We were excited because of the glowing reviews and the line outside but this place doesn't measure up to the hype. The free appetizer for check in is only good for up to 12 dollars by the way

The food was not good. Very over priced.  The service was awful.  Our server was in the corner on his phone the entire time.  As we were trying to flag him down to order another round of drinks and point out the wilted/week old lettuce that was served to the bride-to-be.  Very disappointing experience overall.  The atmosphere was nice, location is very cool- right on Royal Street, this is why they can get away with charging so much for bad food and terrible service.
Loved the Chargrilled and Rockefeller oysters. The wine is reasonably priced and seating didn't take but 5 minutes. The atmosphere was very cozy, a cold front had swept in on Saturday.
Great food and atmosphere. Ask for Tyrone if you want great service and a great experience.Tip: sit upstairs if you can!

Not sure why anyone gives this good ratings.  The food was mediocre at best (ok- red beans were good)., the service was slow, and they couldn't figure out what dish went to what table, let alone what person.  Super disappointed.

Had such am amazing time, the food was fantastic. We were with a big party, so pretty much ordered everything on the menu.  Drinks are strong and well made; and the staff was awesome. It's a definite must if you're in the area.

While visiting NOLA I decided to check this place out. Came here for a early dinner and was seated immediately. Place was not busy and there were many empty tables and I was a tad disappointed that the hostess wouldn't think to give us a nicer view or even balcony table since they were open but oh well very minor thing which I wouldn't let affect my review. 

Check in on yelp you get a free appetizer. We opted for the chargrilled oysters and they didn't disappoint very yummy. My daughter ordered the shrimp po boy and since we been in NOLA we tried two different prior po boys from other places and this one was probably the least favorite. Shrimp was okay but not great. I ordered the shrimp tortellini meal and it was creamy and good - I wouldn't order again. Husband ordered the crawfish ravioli (we were in a pasta mood). Crawfish ravioli was divine. I would highly recommend it. 

We ordered hurricanes to drink - classic Nola cocktail and they were good but not too strong and didn't give you a lot for the price point. 

Server was very personable and friendly. 

Overall I think the place is good. Maybe a little too high in price for the quality received (mainly with drinks) - but then again you are in the FQ so they can get away with it. I probably wouldn't come back when in NOLA particularly because there are so many good restaurants and I want to try them all and there was no true wow factor.  I'd recommend for oysters tho and a happy hour drink type of place (if they have those specials).

This place really disappointed, but in my recent return to NOLA, I am shocked at the caliber of foodstuffs found within this hallowed foodie locale. I've always know to avoid the french quarter if value and flavor is what you're in search of - shame on me, I suppose. We tried a sampler platter of étouffée, gumbo, and Jambalaya. Not impressed with any dish they brought out. 

The gumbo tasted more homogenous and sweet than muddy and interesting, and was much more refined than you normally would expect in a gumbo - as though they strained out all the wonderful bits that developed through time. I was told that a full cup of each soup comes with the platter of three items, but I would summate that if I had the ability to combine all three dishes, I would find little more than a cup of soup between all three. The rest of what I purchased assuredly was rice, so ask for rice on the side if you order a cup to be sure of your quantities - save for the jambalaya. 

The jambalaya was mildly flavorful, and the sausage was fine - but not what you would expect in NOLA. Hell, I get better Andouille in Kansas City at a place called Fritz's Smoked Meats, on State-line Road. 

The étouffée was the most interesting, but still tasted like something other than seafood. I couldn't place it, but it's not what I expected - I could not eat it after a few tastings. They also seem to use some sort of thickener that has nothing to do with time and love; the soups were bordering on gelatinous. 

I would never return to this place, as the value gained from the purchase price is far too unbalanced; the death knell for me however must have been the flavors; they aren't revolting, but just not at all what you'd expect. More refined and subtle than the strong, dirty creole seasonings you search out for in NOLA. This experience serves me right, as in my travels I've come to take mark of establishments with "sandwich wranglers" hustling just outside the door, obnoxiously inviting patrons to dine within. If I were you, I would find a less debutant experience if what you seek is a more visceral cajun cuisine. You'll find none of that here.

Terrible customer service. We were held at the door for more than 30 minutes when there were clearly open tables inside. When we asked what are we waiting, the greeter said she didn't know either, and she was waiting for the manager to let in. This is purely a gimmick to create crowds while sacrificing customer experience. Terrible!

Had an excellent Thanksgiving dinner with oysters, wine and onion soup.

The restaurant is small, but seems to have an annex with more tables.

Very cozy restaurant and efficient service. Didn't wait much to have our food during a busy hour

Pretty disappointing experience in a city that should never disappoint when it comes to food.  We went to Royal House on Thanksgiving Day for dinner.  Ok, it was Thanksgiving...they were clearly hard-pressed for staff...but the food and service was really tourist-trap rough.  I ordered a "Taste of New Orleans" because I couldn't decide what I wanted...at $18 this was pretty much worthless.  There was a small amount of each of jambalaya, gumbo, and etouffee at the bottom of some small soup cups, which were then covered in rice.  Each was about 70% rice, which gave me only a few bites of the actual entrees I ordered.  This was truly absurd at $18.  It also took about an hour to come out of the kitchen.  My wife ordered a salad, which was decent if overpriced.  But my daughter is the one who really made out well; she ordered a $5 kid's fried shrimp platter, and got an enormous amount of tasty fried shrimp and fries.  She got probably twice the amount of food for $5 that I received for $18, and though it was unhealthy and lacked diversity, it was fresh and tasty.  

OK, I get it, it's Thanksgiving and I ordered the most touristy thing on the menu, but geez.  This experience was just sad.  Never going back--unless I have a pack of hungry kids who like fried shrimp.

While the Royal House has a definite French quarter New Orleans vibe to it. The food was a little underwhelming. I ordered the shrimp poboy and to my surprise it was just a simple bread, lettuce, tomato and pickle with fried shrimp...nothing more nothing less. A little disappointing, for the $15 price tag. 

Service was slow and again underwhelming. But overall it was an OK experience I would recommend it based on the price alone, but for the vibe...it's New Orleans

Shrimp and grits were microwaved and way too salty. Alligator Po boy was mediocre. Food was overpriced in relation to quality. We came here because it was the only late night food available and we left disappointed.

Royal House was our first meal during our 5 day trek to NOLA and the food here did not disappoint! For 2 people, we ordered the Charbroiled Oysters, Crab Claws, & Taste of New Orleans (Samples of Jambalaya, Gumbo, & Crawfish Etouffee).

I highly recommend ordering the Charbroiled Oysters & Crab Claws here! You won't regret it since both dishes are cooking in an amazing buttery sauce and tastes amazing dipped with bread! Eating 10 pieces of bread dipped in this addicting sauce is definitely worth the calories & carbs! The Taste of New Orleans was mediocre and I would pass on it next time since the Jambalaya tasted a bit underwhelming. Everything else was solid though!

If you've never had Charbroiled Oysters before, then I highly recommend trying it for your first time at Royal House! They have an extensive menu selection, the staff is really friendly, and the seafood tastes great! I'm looking forward to come back to eat more of those oysters. SO GOOD!
This restaurant did not disappoint. Redfish was amazing and so was the crawfish ravioli

This was our first dinner in New Orleans and it did not disappoint. I came here around 5:45pm and there was a line outside. It actually does not seem to be the case that the restaurant is full, but rather some logistical issues and many tables inside were not ready. I walked by this place the next 2 days and there seemed to be no wait at all during dinner time.

Chargrilled Oysters (4/5): delicious, get it. My only complaint is that there were 2 overcooked oysters in my half dozen. They were over-baked so the oyster meat basically disappeared and it was all black. So, I only got 4 oysters in that half-dozen. Not great.

Crab Claws (5/5): this was probably my favorite. Loved the sauce and the bread for dipping!

Fried Alligator (3/5): Do yourself a favor and order this at another restaurant. It was such a small bowl AND there was a piece of bread underneath so the portion was SO SMALL. For this price, you can get double the portion at other places.

Seafood Pasta (3/5): Tastes like canned tomato sauce and dining hall pasta. Don't get this.

Voodoo Cocktail (1/5): SO SWEET and tasted so artificial. Don't order this.

Brandy Milk (3/5): too watered down. So much ice in this.

Service was good and the food came out quickly. Would recommend checking out for the chargrilled oysters and crab claws if you're in the French Quarter.
Ordered shrimp poboy, fresh French bread. Nice sized shrimp. Gumbo ok, roux a little too thick for me. Get the Carnival Margarita to go!

Went to the Royal House after a trip on the Creole Queen.  My nephew texted us to go there and try the crab claws.  From other reviews, I take it they are one of the highlights.  Kinda busy, sat at the bar.  Took our order.  Took about 30 minutes for the crab claws to come out...only 8 of them on the plate and they were very small.  The gravy/sauce poured over them was the bomb.  But, between 2 of us they were gone in a couple of minutes.  Came with 2 small pieces of French bread and we sopped up what we could, but there was still gravy on the plate.  We had ordered more bread...they offer "the garlic bread," or "the free bread."  We wanted the free which is what ours came with.  Took about another 20 minutes to get 4 small pieces of bread.  BUT, that was enough for us to rid the plate of that scrumptious gravy.  Cost was $13 plus for the claws.  They WERE tasty, the gravy/sauce delicious, but if you go by the pictures they show online and in their advertisements, it's kinda like lookin at a Burger King Whopper advertisement - ain't no comparison to whatcha get.  So, yes they were good.  Will we go back.  Nope.  Service was slight, not much interaction with us after the initial order.  We had to flag down one "tender" to get the extra bread.  Yep, they were busy, it was the day before Thanksgiving and I understand, I guess, but I won't go back.  Different strokes for different folks, I guess.  On to the next meal.................

Loved the oysters. Best fresh gulf I've had in years. Waitress was sweet as pie. The crab claws to die for in an even better sauce. The view from our balcony awesome NO style all the way. Prepare for stairs. Lots of em.

Royal House was our last meal in New Orleans, and I am glad it was because it ended our trip on a great note. We sat at the bar, and the bartenders were friendly and cool. First we ordered some hurricanes, and then a bloody mary. All drinks were good, and they also had a good selection of beers, which my husband indulged in. We ordered a half dozen oysters which they shucked right there at the bar. The oysters were fresh and really big! Then we ordered a burger and some fried shrimps. All tasty and delicious. Royal House is like they say - a good place to eat in the French Quarter. Would highly recommend.

So delicious. This was one of our first stops after getting into town. We ordered oysters, peel-n-eat shrimp and a few cocktails. Much needed after a travel day. We enjoyed it so much, we went back the next night for dinner, (more oysters and crab cakes).
Seriously the worst service I got in New orleans. I asked what the specialty was and the bartender handed me the menu and said "everything" rudely. Then she proceeded not to serve me anything.
Waited about 45 mins for the food. I had 2 oyster duos and the sampler. When our food arrived, it was cold. Service was also a bit bad.

Charbroiled oysters here are the jam! So flavorful and buttery and the bread to sop it up with was nice too. I would have just added a few more slices (they are small). We also had the stuffed mushrooms and they were very good as well, just very rich.

My brother, his girlfriend and I came here for lunch after some souvenir shopping. We were seating almost immediately upstairs, where they have another dining area. 

After looking at some reviews, we decided to try the red fish beignets. So, in general, they were tasty. However, in our own ignorance, we didn't realize that the fish would be dusted with powdered sugar and have drizzled syrup on it. Had we known, we would have asked for that on the side, so that we could control how much sweet was on the fish. We collectively decided that we would have enjoyed it much more if it wasn't sweet. The fish was cooked really nicely and the batter wasn't too excessive.

I also had the crawfish ravioli. When we were seated, I glanced over at another table's dishes and that dish caught my eye. Crawfish sauce isn't something I see every day so I had to try it. It's a rich and hearty dish, with about 8 ravioli. Very filling and tasty. I wish I had more time there to try other things, but I'll just have to come back sometime.

If you are in New Orleans, do yourself a favor and stop at the Royal House for the Oysters. You will give your mouth the royal treatment here. The raw oysters are fresh and flavorful. The baked oysters are salts and delicious.

Me, my 6 yr old and my mother stopped here to eat on our way to Florida in August. This place was amazing!! We had the Shrimp Tortellini, Crawfish Ravioli, Crab Claws & my daughter had popcorn shrimp. By far the best food the entire trip! Will come back some time!!

What a great spot! First time to NOLA and this was a place recommended by a friend. Our waitress was very friendly and had great suggestions. Tried the alligator and it was delicious! Great flavor and not too chewy like alligator can sometimes be. I ordered a Moscow mule to drink which was refreshing and the shrimp tortellini for dinner. I'm not a big seafood person at all but I will be dreaming of this dish!
We went here this afternoon for the grilled oysters. Ordered a dozen and they were so good we ordered another! Love the buttery, Parmesan goodness! Had a bowl of the gumbo as well, was very good.

Came here twice during my visit to NOLA. First time was on a Saturday night about 10:30pm. We were sat right away down stairs. It was lively and full. 

My friend had the chargrilled oysters. I myself am not a seafood fan but I tried one. They weren't fishy at all and the flavor of the bread crumbs, garlic and butter was really good. My friend did say they were on the small side but delicious. 

I had the French onion soup, which our waitress claimed was 'the best in the entire city', as well as some hush puppies. The soup was absolutely wonderful. It was rich and not too salty, as the can often be. The cheese and bread baked on top broke up nicely as I ate it so I was left with a giant bread and cheese ball. The hush puppies were average. 

The second visit was on a Tuesday afternoon. We couldn't sit on the balcony because those tables only seat two and this trip there were three of us. 
However we were able to sit next to the open doors of the balcony and still enjoy the lovely weather and view. 

We had a couple cocktails that were both good. I ordered the roast beef po-boy. It was average. Not very flavorful compared to most of the food I'd been eating the entire trip. My friend had the shrimp po-boy and was also disappointed. She was expecting some sauce or more flavor as well to what she was eating. My other friend had the french onion soup and of course loved it. We finished with bread pudding that was actually very tasty and rich. 

The walk up stairs is narrow and definitely feels like and old home or building. Complete with the unevenness that makes some a bit nervous. But the decor makes it worth the climb. I loved the look and would have enjoyed sitting there all afternoon. I would go back next time I'm in town.

Overall, a big let down. We had the jambalaya, which was dry and better everywhere else we tried in New Orleans so far. The ravioli was in a crawfish sauce with crabmeat. There was minimal crabmeat (like almost none) but tons of crawfish. Seemed to really cheap out on the crab. The fried shrimp and fries was alright but the hushpuppies were quite good. The bacardi 8 punch was very syrupy so I ended up not even finishing it but the Gosling Gold Rum Punch was quite good. 
Service was good.
We've been to several other Cajun/creole places while in New Orleans this week which were amazing. This place was a disappointment after all of those. Go somewhere else better with all the choices available in the French quarter.

Two thumbs up for the crab claws. Sauce was amazing, requested more bread so I could soak up more of the amazing sauce. Just wish the claws were bigger. Main entree went with the shrimp creole. Again very good.
Would have been 5 starts but rice in the creole dish was undercooked and I kept getting hard rice kernels with almost every bite. Almost everyone else got po'boys and said they were disappointed in their meal.
Don't forget yelp check in for free appetizer.

I actually give out 3.5 stars. The specialty cocktails are great. I tried Absolute strawberry, oysters, seafood linguine, brownie.   The atmosphere/service/food are 3.5-4 stars but one problem, food was too slow to serve even not fully seated. At least  15mins after I finished appetizer. So I only put 3stars.

Taste of Ne Orleans is a collection of rice. Thank you for letting me know you like rice.
And the flavor is... Well, I can generate something like this after drinking 5 pint beer.
The waiter asked us 'all full'? And my answer was 'awful'.
Came to try this famous crab claw with creamy dipping sauce. Not disappointing at all!

Absolutely wonderful. My server Tina provided a great experience. 
I had the fried alligator bites, a first for me. Hard to describe taste, a little like calamari. Delicious. The blackened redfish also great.

I travel for work to New Orleans area regularly.  

Some of the worst wait time estimates ever.  Told us 25 minutes.  Show up 20 minutes later.  They say 10 to 15 more minutes.
