Showed up in 10 and stand in front of the door.  20 minutes later they say we missed our time and we would be next.  20 minutes pass and 16 more people go in.  Ask and they tell me 25 more minutes.   

At least I was able to pay for 4 drinks at the bar and drink them outside.  

Wont go back.

Amazing food. Coming into New Orleans for the first time & found this place. Super cozy and the food was amazing. Very energetic workers and a little pricey. But we were ordering a lot of seafood too. Free app if you check in with yelp so that was awesome...got fried alligator for free. Definitely would recommend and go again.

Terrible service. Ordered fish Po-boy with red bean and rice and was brought French fries. The waitress took my plate back and when it came back with red beans and rice I noticed it was a shrimp Po-boy (I am allergic to shrimp). It took forever to get my food. My wife was finished long before my food arrived. Never was I brought more water or asked if I wanted another beer. She blamed it on shift change, bull.
2 words: chargrilled oysters. Plus great, friendly service by the lovely Miss Renelle.

We happened to stumble in here off the road and were pleasantly surprised!! After being seated near the bar, we got to admire the quaint atmosphere with a homey, New Orleans feel. The ambience was very nice and before we even got our food a wedding parade came right by the window. The people beside us were devouring the crab claws and I decided to follow suit. Do yourself a favor and get the crab claws with extra bread from the start - you'll want to sop up all the sauce!! For an entree, I got the BLT-Oyster Po'Boy and it did not disappoint. We also got the blackened redfish which was huge and very tasty! To top everything off, our server, Fatima, was incredible and was really energetic and happy to give suggestions. My only complaint is that my Po'Boy and fries were slightly cold and a little overpriced for the portion (18 dollars for a small Po'Boy). Overall, would definitely recommend and come back for a relaxed atmosphere with great food and service.

You *must* come here for the fried eggplant. It was incredible. Well spiced, very crispy exterior and soft interior.

Then I'd suggest going somewhere else for the rest of your meal. 

The good: Service was very good. Great french fries. Beautiful location. Came here for lunch and it was sunny outside. The big french doors gave the place's interior an incredible light. 

The average: I got the grilled oysters and the oysters rockerfeller. 

When I ordered the oysters rockerfeller, I somehow said no bacon - mistake! Those oysters came with a overpowering cheese-spinach mix. The texture of the oysters was good.

The grilled oysters texture was near perfect but the parmesan used felt overpowering in flavor.

I visited the Royal House on the 7th of December for dinner. The place is conveniently located in the French Quarter and it looks lively. I sat and I looked at the menu. I was looking for some local food since it was my first meal in New Orleans. I found a variety of options and I listened to the suggestions that our waiter Yamini listed. After a while I chose to try crawfish étouffée for $19. I also ordered a Voodoo juice for $11. My drink arrived first. It came in a tall glass with a black straw drowned into a blue liquid. The drink is made of rum and a variety of other ingredients. It was good but now, in retrospect, I don't think I would spend more than $6 for a drink so I would have opted for a beer or a cider if I could turn back time. My meal arrived and it consisted of a center of white rice surrounded by breaded crawfish in a crawfish stew with two small slices of bread. It was good and flavorful. I liked it. I was in New Orleans and half of my experience was about eating local food so I discovered from my girlfriend that she could get a free appetizer under $12 with her phone. By this I mean she checked in on Yelp to get the free appetizer but, honestly, she does magic with that phone a lot that it's not even funny sometimes (lol). Most of the stuff was priced above $12 but one thing was not and it was fried alligator. I decided to get that and try it (the menu says it costs $11.5). The fried alligator arrived shortly later and it consisted of breaded nuggets. Honestly, I found it surprisingly good and I really enjoyed it, probably more than the stew. It tasted like chicken nuggets but with some additional texture and a little harder. It was definitely the highlight of the night.
The place is nice. It has a bartender and several waiters going to tables. It feels like a nice place for dinner and people seem friendly. Yamini was nice and friendly with us.

Not too long ago, my first oyster experience (side note: it wasn't here) was terrible and made me swear off oysters for good. Fast forward to the present and now I'm a convert, thanks to Royal House. I had told a friend about how much I didn't like oysters, so they recommended this establishment. I got  the chargrilled oysters which is topped with Parmesan cheese butter. The seasoning was everything I imagined it would be and then some - bursting with flavor at every bite. Squeeze some lemon on top and you'll be in heaven. 

I got my order to go, so I cannot comment too much on service, but the waitstaff was very kind, attentive, and very pleasant. Highly recommend dropping by for a snack if you're ever in the French Quarter. I will be looking for every excuse to stop by here whenever I'm in town.

So we tried this appetizer called crab claws which was amazing ! I wish we got 2 orders lol, my boyfriend got the steak and I got the ravioli both were good. I highly recommend the crab claws with extra bread, you won't be disappointed. The ambiance is cute and clean but the service was slow, waited about 40min until our side salads or even appetizer came out. Minus the slow service, everything was great.

This place is AMAZING ESPICIALLY Ashley B or as she calls herself white ashley lol ..the oysters were amazing  and she kept me and my wife laughing the whole time not only was the service great she told us all the ins and outs of the city  will defiently b back here

Royal house is for oyster lovers, but I am not an oyster lover....
So, I had THE VERY recommended ravioli and the stuffed mushrooms. I had a poboy too--but it wasn't at all like some of the poboys I've had in NOLA. So, I'd save the sandwich for elsewhere--like Mahoney's or Mother's, Mandina's or The Old Coffee Pot Restaurant. 
The atmosphere can get a little crowded and stuffy but we still had a great time.

The crawfish ravioli was amazing.  It had just the right amount of seasoning in the filler and was layered with delicious cheese and just the right amount of sauce.  I didn't have much time to snap pictures or anything since I had to rush off for a tour and took the rest to go, but I highly recommend everyone have this dish, if nothing else.  On the flip side, you might want to be wary of the wait time.  Consider the bar.
Expensive but the patio is nice. Wait staff was very nice. Drinks are strong. Gator bites are pricey
Oyster poor boy for $18.00 was a joke. May have had 4 oysters on it. The char grilled oysters were just ok and small. Won't be back other places to try for oysters. Service was attentive.

I went there today for lunch and the service and food was good, I had the chargrilled oyster and they were the best and is the reason I will go back, I also had the fried fish and gumbo which were ok.  I had an issue with the food but the Management took care of it right away. I will go back.

the food here is great.
Ashly is very helpful :)
this restaurant opens in Christmas eve as well.
Great night out with my girlfriend Megan our waitress was amazing and very accommodating. Food was excellent and barley any wait time for the food. Definitely a romantic night dinner!

Mediocre. The one star is for the alligator bites. They're a ton of restaurants in New Orleans that sale alligator. You might as well go to one of those restaurants so you can get good alligator and food.

Popped in to Royals for raw bar after walking Bourbon (first time visitor in NOLA).  After 2-3 minutes wait, my party of 9 was seated in the upstairs dining room.  I'll cut to the chase: I absolutely loved Royal House!  In fact, we all did. The food was delicious. 

We had gumbo, raw bar, chargrilled oysters (drool), caprese salad, French onion soup (the BEST any of us had ever had), stuffed mushrooms and drinks. I really don't have the words to express how fresh and delicious the food was.  Everything was perfectly seasoned. The F.O. soup had a very light, yet extremely yummy creaminess to it. Not really noticeable to the eye, but you could see it's richness on the spoon and feel it on your tongue.

But wait...there's more! Not only did the food have our taste buds doing the happy dance, the service we received was top notch! Our server-Ty, a Nola native- was extremely pleasant and well informed about the menu, ingredients and preparations. He asked about our taste preferences and offered recommendations on food and drink. And his suggestions were spot-on.  With such a large party, i was overwhelmingly pleased at how quickly our various courses and orders arrived to the table. 

In my opinion, Royal House is the kind of place that makes you want to return to a city just to further experience the menu.  In a city rich with excellent restaurants and even more menu options, i would (and will) recommend Royal House to anyone and everyone who asks!  Thank you for such a fantastic time.

First I have to begin by stating that I have never written a review for a restaurant before; however, the service that me and my family received today was so terrible that I felt the need to warn others regarding this horrid restaurant.

Here is what went wrong:

We ordered our food and drinks and received two of the four entrees along with our sides within fifteen minutes. The two that had yet to arrive were the Taste of New Orleans and the Seafood Pot. Ten minutes later we were informed by a different waiter that they did not have lobster so they were not able to make the Seafood Pot and later brought us the Alaskan Crab Pot, of which we did not ask for and thus had to return. At this time, we also inquired about the Taste of New Orleans since it had been nearly thirty minutes since ordering and the waiter stated that it was hectic in the kitchen and would now put in the order. Nearly fifteen minutes goes by before the waiter comes back and tells us that our food is on it's way. Twenty minutes and two inquiries later, our food comes and is lukewarm. At this point we just wanted to get our food, eat, and leave as soon as possible. When we got the bill it was a complete disaster. We were charged for three things that we didn't get and both the waiter and management unsuccessfully tried to argue their case as to why we needed to pay the full amount. Once paying the correct bill, we gladly left the restaurant as fast as we could. It is important to mention that our waiter, Billy, did the best that he could, but it just didn't pay off due to a plethora of factors. 

My take away:

A majority of tourists in New Orleans are seeking to have a good time and try some delicious Cajun food. Here, some of the dishes are good while others are mediocre at best. However, no matter the quality of the food, I feel that the environment and management of this establishment truly dampened a possibly wonderful experience. I will never come here again nor recommend it to anyone.

Food was just okay- not worth it for the price. Where I'm from, you can get a way better and fresher taste for less. Our waiter's service was exceptional, but due to a miscommunication with other servers, we ended up staying an additional 40-50 minutes in order to sort out our order. What occurred was that we could not have our seafood pot because they had run out of lobster, so we asked if we could have a crab seafood pot instead. Rather than confirming with us, they said they had an idea of what we wanted and brought us a plate of Alaskan crab (which was not what we wanted). We had to send this one back and ask for an entirely different order since the one we wanted may have been a bit complicated. Additionally, we ordered 'The Taste of New Orleans' in our initial order, but never received it. Upon notification, our server placed the order in, having us wait another 20-25 minutes just for that order (my poor, hungry parents have been waiting for about an hour by then). We only received this order when we personally had to ask about its whereabouts. By then it was barely warm. Furthermore, we had ordered a SIDE of jambalaya, but they gave us an entire entree instead. We ate it unaware that it was, thus was charged for it.
In the end, when we received our check, we were charged for a seafood pot we never received ($50), an order that was way bigger than we even asked for, and an additional coke. 
I understand that other people may enjoy the food here, but, honestly, speaking from my own personal experience and opinion, don't bother.

tl;dr slow service, ok food

We got the regular oysters and parmesan oysters to split, and I got the shrimp poboy. The oysters were decent but the poboy was just really dry and lacking flavor. It felt like I was biting into a desert.

It took a while to get our food and the service in general was just kind of subpar (i.e. plates were dirty), especially considering the place was pretty empty when we went.

Royal House was where we had our first dinner during a recent trip to NOLA, and the food here did not disappoint! For two people, we ordered the charbroiled oysters (I initially ordered half dozen, but our astute server recommended that I get a full dozen, and I was so glad that I did!) and the shrimp po-boy.

I cannot recommend the charbroiledd oysters enough! The oysters are an amazing umami bomb, grilled in a buttery garlic sauce, and generously seasoned with parmesan cheese, and are best eaten as is, consuming the leftover sauce with the (slightly stale) bread that is served with it. Save up on your calories and carbs consumption so you can partake in this out of the world deliciousness! The po-boy was just A-OK, and it was a little too bready for our taste. I would skip it the next time I was there, and opt for the crab legs instead.

If this is your first time trying charbroiled oysters, do yourself a favour and make sure it's at Royal House. The menu selection is extensive, the staff is attentive and helpful, and the oysters are BOMB!

This place is a must. We were only in town for a couple of days and we made a point to stop here for dinner. Our FANTABULOUS server was JHERAN...all his recommendations turned out delicious.

I ordered...

*Fried alligator=5 stars
*Shrimp tortellini= 5 stars (seriously
 delicious)
*Black Jambalaya= 2 stars (save your         money people, it was plain rice with shrimp)
*Gumbo= 3 stars (after having tried it around town four other times, this was my least favorite)

In all, it was the service that made the experience. I'd definitely stop by the next time I'm in town.

We came in for a quick lunch before hitting the road to go back home. It was about 12:30, and they weren't busy at all. Got a table in no time. Things deteriorated from there. 

The dining room was a mess. It took a good 10 minutes to be acknowledged by a server. In the meantime, another server (not ours) attempted to drop off food at our table before we had ordered.  

After we finally ordered, it took another 20 minutes or so for the food to come out. Both mine and my wife's food were room temperature. 

Our check was also wrong. When we pointed this out, the server said there was no need to change it because all of the incorrect items on the check still added up to the same price of what we ordered. We double checked the menu and discovered she was wrong; the wrong items added up to more than what we should have paid. We had to get the manager involved. 

I think most of our problems came from a lack of server training.
If you're in NOLA you must try this restaurant, the food are tasty with very good presentation, good music, it is not loud. Classy. The crew treated us really politely and nicely.
the crab claws and chargrilled oysters arw amazing. this is my swcond tume here this week and wr specificallt came back for theses items! Nadia our server was also very friendly amd awesome!

This is my favorite place by far in NOLA!

Nadia was great! She's friendly, very informative, and a sweet heart! Great call on the bacon on our char boiled oysters. 

We ordered a dozen charbroiled oysters, 2 order of the crab claws (the sauce is heaven!) I would lick the plate if I didn't want to be a civilized person in public.

I was expecting more due to the high yelp reviews. The place is cute- we were seated upstairs by the window. The server was non existent and I had to ask the busser for water!!! I had a Bloody Mary, which was warm at first. I had to stir it a lot to cool it down. Weird. We had the shrimp platter, which was good. It did have a lot of shrimp and 2 small hush puppies. The hush puppies were tasty! Too many other places in NOLA to recommend going to this one.

This was my first time ever having La gulf coast oysters. They are big and briny, perhaps lacking the dynamics of other oysters in terms of minerality but no less delicious and a steal. So much so my late lunch turned into an early dinner chomping down on 18 oysters on the way. Try them raw and cooked you can't go wrong but whatever you do don't ask for mignonette bc they don't serve them that way.so delish!

Great stuffed mushrooms and peel your own shrimp served like a low-country boil. The gumbo and Jambalaya are good, but in this city there is stiff competition and this was no better than that of some of the other nearby restaurants. 

The service was nice and efficient. Checking in with Yelp unlocked a coupon. This is a good option and a bit removed from Bourbon Street chaos. Enjoy a relaxed meal before heading back out into the Crescent City.
The food was fantastic and the service was just as good. I had the the shrimp & grits with a Cajun Bloody Mary. We were very pleased....and we stood in line for bit to get in..worth the wait!

Royal House, the place where our food journey through Norleans started. I couldn't be happier that this was the first spot we chose to eat cause' the minute we rolled in we were treated to all that Southern hospitality and then some. 

I'm a big fan of sitting at the bar because I feel the view and the service are a little more special when you do. Royal was especially special because the bar is basically front of the house so you get to see all the action. Action as in drinks flowing and oysters shucking. Plus where do else can you get schooled on how to properly pronounce the city your chilling in. Norleans I was told and politely scolded. Get it right! 

I had some of the freshest, biggest and all around tastiest oysters, I've had in some time. My man treated us correct and made sure we were well taken care of. It was a party of four, sitting front and center, taking in all the Royal had to offer. 

We ordered a myriad of apps, from seafood mushrooms to eggplant chips, all of which were excellent. The star though for the apps was the crab claws and the broth they simmered in! Wow, this was a solid taste.  We then carried on to the main courses. Taste of New Orleans, shrimp and jambalaya and so on. All good here! The Royal could do no wrong and every bite was as good as the last. I would come here again in a heartbeat.

Royal House is a proper joint that was a great intro to our trip to New Orleans!

I had fried alligator for the first time here - tastes kind of like chicken but a little chewier. Bartender was a sweetheart and made us feel welcome. She also made a mean mint julep. 

I also had the oyster combo which was delicious and tasted pretty fresh. Jambalaya was on the salty side but that was to be expected and the flavors didn't leave me wanting for more. 

Great place overall. The only thing keeping me from giving it a five was one of the hosts was a little short with us. We had a wait time of 30 minutes so we decided to grab a bite at the bar while waiting for our table. I guess our table was ready a few minutes sooner so they came to us and said this is why we don't want people to sit at the bar while waiting. Not sure why it was such a big deal but maybe that should be a policy for the restaurant if that's the case.

The service was excellent! We had the chargrilled oysters which were amazing. We also tried a trio of dishes (A taste of New Orleans) which was really good, especially the etouffe. The shrimp and grits was good too!

I've had plenty of oysters but MAN! The ones here are so plump and flavorful I barely had to put salt and hot sauce. I ordered a plate of Rockefeller and my mouth is still watering thinking about how good they were! 

They also have quite a lot of good looking appetizers and entrees that I need to go back and try! Their Bloody Mary was also quite on point!

This place is a tourist trap, fair warning! 
Like other Yelpers, we go tricked with the high Yelp reviews . . .

Drinks are decent, most of the food is not. I had the crawfish ravioli, which was tasty but mostly because it was slathered in sauce and cheese, not a whole lot of seafood made an appearance physically or in flavor. The mahi mahi tasted more like frozen than fresh, and was cooked to the point where it was pretty much inedible. Oysters were shucked poorly, shards of shell were embedded in every one!

We got the spinach dip as a Yelp check in offer, and had to continually ask for it and it didn't arrive until after they had cleared our entree dishes. And we begrudgingly ate the mediocre dip simply because we didn't want to waste food.

Seriously, take your business elsewhere. There are far more restaurants in walking distance that'd be more worthy of your money.

Just wanted to try chargrilled oyster for the last time, when we were visiting the city and had already tried it in other famous restaurants. In Royal House it was wonderful. we also ordered red fish which this one was really tasty. They have a special bloody merry, if you're a fan.

The servers are so nice! It was our first time to eat fried gator and we loved it! It was worth trying. I enjoyed their food so much and I would recommend this place! I will come back again if I had a chance. I love southern food!

Delicious food and great service. Had gator bites, shrimp, a Po boy sandwich, a salad and spinach artichoke dip. When checking in on yelp, you get a free appetizer. Everything was wonderful here. I highly recommend

Holy cow this place is YUMMY!  Was here during Halloween and stopped in without a reservation.  My friend and I were seated promptly.. nice table with outside view.  Service was a bit slow but everything we ordered was phenomenal.  Of course we had the oysters and they were scrumptious!  Prices are very reasonable.  I also got a fried alligator po'boy.  Unfortunately, it was basically all bread.  I think if I had chosen the regular fried alligator appetizer, it would have been just as good, not to mention cheaper. Yummy food and great prices.. can't beat it!

This place is a freaking joke. No, I'm not a tourist either I'm a local. My husband and I went into the quarter to grab a bite and decided on this place. We had never been; and saw some pretty good reviews. So we went in and said party of two. The hostess response was well you can sit at the bar or wait 25 min. We chose to wait. She then says you
Need to wait outside. Ok, we walk outside and stand around the corner away from the draft. After about 10-15 min I notice a group of 3 walk in and get sat right away.  You have got to be kidding me. So I walk inside and ask the hostess how much longer for our table. She says I walked out side a called party of two. I say we were standing right around the corner. She said oh well you can sit at the bar. Umm we don't want to. As we are talking, a lady walks up from her table and says excuse ma'am can you close the door. The hostess responds with yes when we are ready to shut it we will. What kind of employee speaks to people this way?! Needless to say we just left.  Please find another place to eat, where at least the hostesses treat you  better.

Pleasantly surprised by this place true home new Orleans cooking. The jumbalia is quite good and definitely packs a kick. The grilled red fish is super tasty with parmesan potatoes that were killer ! The hush puppies lack flavor but their bread pudding was sensational!

The sautéed crab claws were amazing! Truly one of the best things we've eaten this entire trip. I would give this review a 5 except the staff decided to take down the Christmas decorations while lunch service was going on. So waiters and managers were pulling garland down from the ceiling and taking ornaments off the tree (which subsequently were dropped and would bounce all around the floor.) Very disruptive to an otherwise beautiful day and tremendous meal. Couldn't they have done that before or after hours???

So good!! Service was top notch. Waiter was very helpful and even gave suggestions. I love when the waiter is willing to give their opinion. So we had the smothered crab claws, red beans & rice, crawfish étouffée and banana foster cheesecake for dessert. Every bit of that was fabulous! Some of the best red beans and rice I've ever had and I've had a lot! And the cheesecake was so good! It was different than anything I've had and just simply amazing. Definitely recommend to everyone!

The Royal House is a great corner spot in the French Quarter to grab and go with a quick drink or to sit down and enjoy a meal. They're shucking oysters left and right so get ready to fill up! 

When we stopped by we grabbed a spot at the bar and ordered up some Grilled oysters, crawfish ravioli, crab claws, and their rice and beans. 

The crab claws were a tasty starter but naturally not super filling. The grilled oysters on the other hand were much richer with the bubbly tasty cheese baked right in. 

The Crawfish Ravioli was cheesy, and spiced wonderfully. It has crawfish tails and lumps of crabs woven throughout. 

The rice and beans are solid and everything you'd expect. The sausages were a little over cooked when we got it and it came with two strips of fried chicken which I wasn't expecting. Solid choice. 

It can get busy, but I'd say it's worth the visit and even a wait.
This place was definitely great. The service was top notch and the food was even better. The red beans and rice are the best I've ever had. I would recommend this place to anyone.

My wife and I came here for dinner while staying in the French Quarter. We came a bit later in the evening, about 90 mins before they closed, so it was pretty empty. The service was quick and our waitress was friendly. The food was amazing! I'm a big fan of seafood and I had one of the best pieces of Mahi-Mahi I've ever had. We ordered the Eggplan chips as an app (not bad), and then the Pecan Crusted Mahi-Mahi (Amazing) and the baked shrimp tortellini (good but too cheesy). The prices overall are what you'd expect. Next time I'm back in the French Quarter I'll probably come eat here again.

We went here on New year eve. Our actual plan was to have dinner at Oceana grill but because of the 1 hr wait there, we ended up at Royal house, I am glad we did. We had to wait for like 15-20 minutes in line. Our waiter was very nice, interactive and gave us great suggestions. 

First we had their famous Taste of new orleans. You get to taste 3 authentic dishes of NOLA with it. Of them 3, our favorite turned out to be crawfish etouffe. The texture spices and everything turned out to be great. So that's what we got for entry. 

Though, the best and must dish to have here is Crab claws. Trust me, you have to try it. It was like heaven. Very unique and tasty gravy with soft Crab claws. Ohh my god. Actually the subsequent day, we went at this place again to just have Crab claws. I am glad we listened to our waiter. 

And don't forget to get a free appetizer with 2 entries on yelp if you check in.

Came here for dinner on Thursday and they were busy, but I did not have to wait.
The service was very helpful.
They have a full bar as well.
We ordered the oysters (rockerfeller and the other baked style) which both tasted really well.
We also ordered the taste of new orleans which is a sampler of the gumbo, jambalaya, and etouffee
Prior to this I would have ordered the jambalaya, but their gumbo has a smoky taste that I would definitely recommend.

The Crawfish Benedict with Cajun Fries was on point. 
Everyone who works here is so awesome and friendly!
super great food. fresh, fast amd a great price. we did 3 lunches in a 4 day trip,,, whats that tell you. HIGHLY recommend this sexy cool ass place.

Food is average. It's not the best or worst. Price is a bit high especially since you can get the same dishes at better prices in multiple other restaurants nearby. Good location. Patio is cool when weather is pleasant!

Had a cup of their Gumbo and i thought it was excellent! Its filling and hearty so i enjoyed it even more on a rainy day :) also had fried alligator tail which i thought was a bit pricey ($11.xx for that portion) but overall it was a great meal.

Outstanding. Pleasant service.  We shared appetizers. Fabulous Bloody Mary. Spicy but not overbearing. Perfectly presented Oysters Rockefeller - huge oysters, grilled just right. Gumbo was spicy but packed and flavorful.

The appetizer (crab claws) was really good! The sauce is great, just dip bread in it and eat - yum! I don't eat crab (my family ordered it) but the claws were tiny, enough for two people to share but super tiny.

The shrimp platter wasn't horrible just plain breaded fried shrimp. 

The trio sampler (gumbo, jambalaya & étouffée) wasn't very good at least to me. Bland, no flavor. 

Prices are high but it is a tourist area. I recommend going to uptown or mid city instead.

Any line is worth the wait at this place. The food was phenomenal and it made me feel like a local. Staff a bit slow but I forgot after the first bite. We had the alligator, jambalaya, rice and beans, and the shrimp platter.

Came here for a weekday dinner based on the high number of positive reviews. Overall, I was not very impressed (perhaps the reviews had set my expectations too high). 

We had a half dozen of the chargrilled oysters to start. When these came out, I was immediately underwhelmed. The presentation was messy and did not match what I would expect based on the price. While the flavor was good, I would say there's much better chargrilled oysters elsewhere in the french quarter for the same price.

For entrees, we got the seafood pescatore (substituted the marinara sauce for scampi sauce) and blackened shrimp & jambalaya. The pescatore was great with the flavorful, slightly spicy scampi sauce and I highly recommend doing this sauce substitution. The jambalaya, unfortunately, was cold when it arrived at our table, but the waiter was nice enough to take it back to the kitchen and get a fresh one. It was flavorful, although a little dry. 

I'm giving this place 3 stars because while the food was generally good, it is overpriced for the serving size and appearance of the dishes.

We came on a Saturday near closing time and was seated fairly quickly and we requested a balcony seat. Luckily for us there was a violinist/vocalist busker kiddie corner to us which added it to the NOLA flair. 

The staff was young, but excellent. She gave great recommendation that wasn't always at the top of the price point. 

We had a sort of "off the menu" item which was instead of the Oyster Duo where you can have oyster two different styles, the server was nice enough to let us have the three option of the chargrilled, rockefeller and royale. They were all great, but I still prefer the good ol' raw, cocktail sauce and spritz of lemon. 

We also had the crab claws was buttery, lemony goodness! They were tiny, these aren't your typical dungeness and expect to work for your seafood a little. Tots' worth it.

French onion soup was on point. Nice thick crust of cheese and plentiful on the large, sliced onions. 

Seafood Pescatore was also very good.

Overall Royal House experience. Great. It definitely has a great view-ask for balcony seating, but you may also have to wait a little on more busy times. The essence of New Orleans. I know there are lots of food places in New Orleans, but quality is here.

Excellent service!  Came here on a Sunday night and it was lively.  The food was pretty good, my favorite was the alligator bites. It's near our hotel and the wait was about 30 minutes and then it took about another 30 minutes for our entrees.  Nice place to visit but I'd probably check out other restaurants to try.

I actually give it 3.5 stars. 
1st stop on our Nola trip and I rank it 3rd best out of all the oysters we had. The chargrilled oysters were big and seasoned but just not hot enough. 

The service will always be memorable. We had a local nawlins waitress who was super energetic and her accent was cute. The only upset was that she hyped the French Onion soup to be "the best in town" but it tasted pretty regular in my opinion. That soup was super hot and cheesy though. 

Cute and classy atmosphere, perfect for a get-away from the typical Nola spots.

Friendly bar staff. Drinks were tasty. Nice atmosphere. The jambalaya with blackened shrimp left a lot to be desired. The shrimp were salad shrimp size, out of the freezer over cooked and not blackened at all. The dish needs to be reevaluated or renamed to microwaved shrimp on jambalaya.
Best onion soup ....always fun at the bar with friends, great bartenders and oyster shuckers..
Omg this is my new fav restaurant in Nola. The food was AMAZING and so was service. I will probably come back 2 or 3 times before we leave lol!! The sautéed crab legs and chargrilled oysters.
Crab claws Appetizer is a must. Most delectable sauce. Son had an Alligator po'boy and he said it was delicious. Service was great. Would recommend.

This place is incredible!!!  Cindy was our server and amazing bartender!   We had the eggplant chips, crab claws, shrimp platter and oysters!!!  The Bloody Mary's are amazing!   This is the only place I have ever ordered 2 bloody's at one sitting!   Food amazing, sit at the bar and enjoy!   Cindy is the best!!!

We had to wait almost an hour to find seats, which was worth it! The place was packed at dinner time, and the service was excellent! I was with a group of 6 people, and the food was amazing! We ordered, Crab Claws, Oysters, Fish, Stuffed Mushrooms, and Shrimp Creole.

They don't call it Royal House for nothing!

Brilliant.

Any line is worth the wait at this place. The food was phenomenal and it made me feel like a local. Staff a bit slow but I forgot after the first bite. We had the alligator, jambalaya, rice and beans, and the shrimp platter.

My friend and I were in New Orleans for one night on our road trip and it was great having dinner here. Everyone's friendly and service was great. My friend and I sat in the balcony seats overlooking the street. If you do sit up there, it's not flat, so things can slide off the table, so you can't have glass there because it would be terrible to fall on a person below. Pretty cool place. 

I ordered the Taste of New Orleans, which was a sampling of Chicken & Andouille Jambalaya, Crawfish Etouffée and Chicken and Andouille Gumbo. The bowls seemed small, but they are just the right amount of food and it really was a good sampling. My friend had red beans and rice (I had the Andouille sausage since she's meatless). Be sure to check-in on Yelp for a free appetizer. We tried the Eggplant Chips since it was the other non-meat item and I liked it. I do like eggplant and it's cheesy with Alfredo and marinara sauce. Otherwise, there are other stuff I wanted to try. I didn't get to try the oysters, so maybe next time. 

We had some drinks, too. I had the Voodoo Cocktail, which was pretty sweet, and something else...I can't quite remember. Be careful with drinks when you're sitting on the balcony. 

Anyhow, it was a good spot for our quick visit.

Omg, no words can describe how delicious the ravioli was！ It was the best ravioli I've ever had! My boyfriend had the shrimp creole and that was also delicious. The service was also top notch, everyone was very friendly. All in all, couldn't recommend this place enough, 10/10!

Must visit restaurant. I ordered the waiter recommendation which was crawfish ravioli, and shrimp creole! Damn the best choice I've ever made. When visiting bourbon street at French quarter have to come here for lunch or dinner.

The oysters here are terrific! We sat at the bar on a football Sunday and watched Andrew shuck oyster after oyster. He's a real pro. The drinks and beer are above average (I had the Pimm's Cup and hubs had some beers), and the rest of the food menu is decent as well. Royal House is a great place for a solid meal or appetizers. Nice ambiance, clean bathrooms, casual atmosphere. I'll say the meals didn't completely wow us, but this was our fourth time there and everything is reliable and tasty. Definitely not a white linen type of restaurant, but you can count on good food and great oysters. Service is fast and everyone is friendly. Definitely worth a stop.

Our very first meal in NOLA was at Royal House, which was a lovely start. We arrived on a Saturday late afternoon with no wait at all. I really wanted the balcony view, so requested a table upstairs outside. Unfortunately, the balcony at Royal House is incredibly slanted and narrow. As nice as the view was overlooking the streets below, I was fearing for anything accidentally getting dropped over the balcony. You're literally sitting at a 30 degree angle --kind of scary.

Anyways, we decided to order the Taste of New Orleans ($18) and Shrimp Creole ($18) to share. Since there was a free appetizer with a purchase of two entree deal on Yelp, we also added the Alligator Bites ($12). To start, the alligator bites were something new for us. It was a tiny little cup of fried bites that just tasted like fried meat --good, but nothing very special about it.

Now since this was our first stop, we knew the taste of New Orleans would allow us to try a little bit of everything. This sampler came with a cup of Chicken & Andouille Jambalaya, Crawfish Etouffee, and Chicken & Andouille Gumbo. Along with the shrimp creole, everything was served over a bed of steamed white rice. The rice here was so hard, which made it not as enjoyable. While the jambalaya was our least favorite, the gumbo and shrimp creole were solid choices. The real dish to get here is the crawfish etouffee though. This is the first time I have ever had crawfish etouffee and Royal House has had me hooked! I honestly wish we just got a full order of it instead. The creamy gravy was so whole-hearted with every bite. I'd highly recommend the crawfish etouffee here and anywhere!

I seriously cannot believe it's so highly ranked. I went because of the Yelp reviews and now I have half a mind to hunt down these reviewers and make em pay me back for my gross meal. If cafeteria food or mass produced food opened a New Orleans style restaurant it would be this. Nothing tasted fresh or quality. It was gross. I'm angry I wasted precious calories here

The wait staff was super nice and our order was taken quickly depsite them being so busy. We got an appetizer- seafood stuffed mushrooms- and they were great. Boyfriend had the traditional gumbo and he said it was "pretty f-ing phenomenal." I had spinach tortellini which would have been great had it not been so salty. That was unfortunate.

First time at this location, recommended by a friend who stays here in Metairie. I forgot to snap a pic of my food but I ordered the fried shrimp poboy. It was ok not delicious, but I was hungry. We checked in to get the Yelp offer free appetizer. Shared the spinach dip which was very very delicious! If I return, I will order something different. 

I had the carnival margarita and it was tasty. Photo attached. The waitress was very nice and attentive. When we walked in there was sitting and a bar, but we were sent upstairs and there were a ton of stairs! Which is no big deal, but yeah.

Sometimes you really get lucky when you just pick out a random restaurant while roaming the streets. I honestly had no clue this was one of the highest rated restaurants (Yelp reviews) in the French Quarter. 

Upon walking in around 6ish on a weeknight, I immediately was drawn to the bar area where shucking was being done live. If you are not fond of the typical sea water smell, I'd suggest getting a seat at a table as the bar can get quite stinky. Either way, seating was quick and painless and I was presented a menu right away. I of course wanted some darn oysters due to the fact that guy was shucking them in front of me and splashing me with that tasty salt water (Is that gross?). Ended up chatting with a local next to me and we shared a large platter of oysters raw and boy oh boy were they good! After downing some raw goodness, I realized that I had yet to sample any jambalaya or etouffee', which was sad as I had been in New Orleans for a few days already. The Royal House delivered though offering a sample platter with Chicken & Andouille Jambalaya, Crawfish Etouffée and Chicken and Andouille Gumbo. Order took awhile to arrive, but not the end of the world. The sampler was good, but honestly not the best as some of the dishes were lukewarm and lacking some flavor. Pricing was on the high side, but hey it's the middle of the French Quarter, its like complaining while eating in the middle of Paris, expect it and move on. 

In the end, would I come back, you betcha! I will say I'd go for another round of oysters and pass on the sampler and try something more interesting next time.
Love this place. The crab claws are amazing. It should be called crab crack. The shrimp tortellini and fried shrimp are also really good. Cocktails are also tasty. I can't wait to come back!

We had a hoot of a time here.  I was with 2 NOLA rookies who had ideas of where they wanted to eat from talking to their buddies.  We walked to each of those places and turned away.  Such is life.  Those suggestions were not in the cards.  They turned to me, an experienced NOLA vet, for guidance.  

I fired up the Yelpmobile and did a quick search, the likes and intensity of which only a true Yelper knows.  I punched in my secret codes for filtering out lesser places and for maximum effect I added the double secret passphrase.

The Yelpmobile spit out the Royal House.  It was awesome because we were near Jackson Square at the time, so it was super close.  Oddly, I see another review that says there was a free app for checking in.  I didn't get that.  

There are two foods I try to make sure I get when I'm up this way: redfish and softshell crab.  I got the redfish here at Royal House with crab on top and some nice veggies.

Our server Tina was a rock star.  She was hilarious, fun, and very attentive.  She'd swing by, crack us up, and flutter off to her next table.  We loved her.

The food was well-prepared and tasted fresh.  I'd say it was a bit pricey for what we got, but that's life in the FQ... you always hate your wallet being so empty when you leave (hopefully, you leave with your wallet, it can get rough in the FQ with all the pickpockets) the area.

The place was comfortable and we had a great time here.

This was a great place for lunch. Everything we ordered was really good.  I especially liked the crab claws with French bread. The oysters were good, but I would recommend other places for oysters.

Located in the French Quarter, the ambience of  jazz music was right outside the door. A very good New Orleans vibe.

All I can say is awesome. Three thumbs up .
Definitely a must have in the French Quarter.

Popped in for lunch waiting for the Cork Need a parade to start....and its our last meal in New Orleans. ...wegot the crab claws..smaller.than I thought but they would be but sooooo damn good!!! I had the red fish...also amazing and my traveling buddy had the seafood pescatore and is literally tear in,hear eye "heaven" is her comment...

Royal House was one of the only restaurants open on Christmas Day that didn't require advance reservations.  It was a boon to last-minute travelers like us.  It seemed like we weren't the only ones.  The line for dining continued the whole evening (seating on a first-come, first-served basis).  

The place was hopping.  Servers were swept off their feet.  Despite the cold weather, some people opted to sit outside on the balcony, as trays were being carried up the stairs to them!

We loved our appetizer of crab claws in lemon garlic butter sauce.  So rich and tasty.  It came with four pieces of toasted bread for dipping - we could have used more of that to mop up all that yummy sauce.

We shared the fried fish platter, crawfish étouffée, gumbo and jambalaya. Nothing really stood out.  The gumbo and jambalaya were not served hot.  A big no-no for me.  I would rate the food as just ok as I've definitely had the same dishes better elsewhere in the city.  Not sure if this was due to the holiday kitchen schedule...

We deeply appreciated the hard-working staff of Royal House, who ensured that we tourists could eat in comfort on Christmas Day.  For that, I'm awarding an extra star.
Really great food and top notch service!! Our waiter Totie was great and extremely accommodating.

Thanks to all the yelpers who provided reviews of this restaurant, I chose this one of all the awesome choices in New Orleans. Two of the four of us had shrimp and grits, one had crawfish ravioli, and I got the New Orleans sampler(Red beans and rice, etouffe, and jambalaya). 

Our entire party was happy with their choices! We were there on a Saturday night, with a parade going on outside... And we still were able to get our meal in about 15 minutes. 

I checked into the restaurant and got one free appetizer - which was a perfect start to our dinner. 

Sorry I don't have any pictures - my phone died when I got there. 

There are so many choices in this terrific city - but I would come here again and again!

If you like crab claws and are staying in the French Quarters this is definitely a spot to check out. They were flavorful and not too expensive. For dinner I ordered the Red fish blackened topped with lump crab. It was very good as well. Good service, good food and a nice atmosphere!
Food was average. I would suggest ordering oysters as a snack. Don't waste your time ordering lunch at this place.

I was not impressed!  I learned very early upon moving to the city that the best food was found outside of the quarter.  But entertaining out of town guests on Christmas Day led us here.  I only gave them 3 stars because it was Christmas Day and servers and cooks had to feed me and my family instead of being home with theirs.  I go out to eat a lot, and do not make it habit to complain or be too difficult, because it's definitely a job I couldn't do.  Of the various oysters I have had in the city...they are the bottom of the list.  They didn't seemed freshly cooked and was only warm.  We waited about an hour for our main course that came out to the table cold, not warm, but absolutely cold.  That was a complete turn off after such a long wait and after spending almost $200 for three people. 

I'm chalking it up to timing (Christmas Day) but probably will not be returning.

We started with the Grilled Oysters and they were absolutely excellent. They were worth the trip in the rain by itself. I had the Taste of New Orleans and my wife had the Oyster Pasta. She was torn between that and the Shrimp & Grits and the waiter highly recommended the Oyster Pasta - excellent call. We finished with the Bananas Foster Cheesecake - more than decadent. One of the best meals we had while in New Orleans.

Oysters in the half shell, shrimp boil (with corn on the cob and new potatoes,) crab claws in the best sauce ever! So rich,yet not overwhelming. A perfect, light dinner! Now dessert, so many choices, so little time! Historic ambiance, great wait service

Hands down the best French onion soup in New Orleans!! I was saying mmmmm every single bite!  Also the chargrilled oysters are simply amazing.  So much flavor in both I can't wait to take my friends here.  To make this experience even better! Cindy the bartender is such a bubbly person.  She knew what to suggest and they were all on point! You must have a Bloody Mary from her as well! She will not steer you wrong!!

I always love The Royal House. The Oysters are fresh and the service is impeccable.  I always sit at the bar unless I can get a sit on the balcony upstairs on a nice sunny day.  This time in addition to fresh oysters we ordered the duo of chargrilled and Rockefeller which were both great smelling and tasting.  I'm not a fan of cooked oysters because they've never smelled good to me.  These were tasty.  We also got the shrimp poboy which had bread rivaled by any bakery in Boston or Philadelphia (if you've eaten sandwiches there you know what I'm speaking of)! The cocktails are strong and the bloody Mary's are tasty! Located on the corner across from the Omni and the courthouse in the French Quarter.

4 stars cause although the service was really good , super quick & our server was very attentive . The food wasn't that good . We had the baked oysters which was fav thing we tried . Will probably come back and try something else ?

I am giving it a 3 star due to the service that was provided. We had a male server who very loud, cursing and talking about other customers that were dinning in. All he was concerned about was getting fat tips. We only ordered the spinach dip which was beyond Amazing the best I have ever in life. We also had fried alligator which wasn't the best, not really seasoned and over priced and very small portion. I did not yet the entrees, but service was unprofessional.

This is a definite must go to place. Great atmosphere, food, and service. I was quickly greeted at the door and was sat within 5-10 minutes. I order the gumbo which was fantastic and the blackened chicken sandwich. Order came out exactly how I ordered. Couldn't have asked for more.
Came in for dinner, had very friendly & helpful server! Suggested Redfish Beignets & crab claw appetizer! Was so awesome & tasty! Would highly recommend!

Comparing to the other restaurants we had in French quarter, this restaurant is not worth trying if you only have limited time to stay in this area.
1. The food is so so, it is "made of source instead of quality material"
2. It took long time to serve to us
3. The cost is not qualifying your tongue desire
4. Waitress set the fork and knife on the spare chairs to prepare the next customer visiting (I appreciate the efficiency but in another word, rotating the customer seems more important instead of letting the customer really taste the delicacies)
We were so regretting it was a bad decision of canceling Michelin star restaurant to eat there.

We went here while staying in town for Mardi Gras and was checking out the French quarters. The service was excellent but the food was just ok. I ordered the catfish platter and got a pile of stale fish instead. I couldn't not eat it after 2 pieces so I sent told the waiter who was very understanding and accommodating. I switched to the spinach salad and French onion soup to be safe. Those were good. The best appetizer on the menu that we ate was the eggplant chips. Those were super delicious and light. A must try! Just don't get the catfish!

Probably my most favorite restaurant we ate at on this vacation. The staff went above and beyond to make my 40th Birthday dinner that much more special. Food was excellent from the Bbq Shrimp & Grits, to the Chargrilled Oysters and the Crab Claws with garlic and butter sauce. Our waiters had the entire 2nd floor sing Happy Birthday to me and it was amazing. Thank you for making our last night in NOLA one to remember!

3.5 stars

Liked:
Free appetizer with Yelp check in
Shrimp and grits (but not as good as Luke or Pierre Maspero)
Chargrilled oysters (but not as good as Acme)
Crab claw (almost as good as Palace Cafe)
They let you go on the balcony to throw beads
Service 

Okay:
Fried fish po-boy
Royal oysters
Rockefeller oysters

Not so great:
Waiting time for our food was a bit long and my fries were cold

Still a very solid choice but there are better.

Fresh seafood & oysters on the half-shell in an airy space bordered by a bar & wide-open windows.
We were on the second floor,food was not great but decent , I like the oysters but not impress by the Gumbo there, waiter service was great, he ID me to get my alcoholic drink, I didn't have it because hotel was down the street n my boyfriend bought dinner n I didn't need my purse ,so I didn't drink alcoholic drinks :D, place a little tight n loud at certain point, but I like it just for a quick bite to eat.
The servers and hosts were hands down the nicest and most welcoming people. The food was delicious just as expected. We would definitely be making this our for sure stop next year.

Excellent food, service, location! I recommend the charbroiled oysters! The service was excellent, so warm and friendly which was a breath of fresh air considering the way we were treated at other places during our visit.
Ty was the REALEST waiter I've ever experiences as well as a clairvoyant of what my stomach was craving!!  The food was fresh and cooked to perfection.  I will return!

Rip off. Slow, inattentive service. Lack of table wear until we asked after food on table, no refill on water, basic service level items. Appetizer came late and cold. "Taste of New Orleans" entree consisted of three small (side) bowls of lukewarm liquids with VERY LITTLE proteins (meat or fish), so $18 for some old soups and rice is pathetic. Avoid. So many other "ok" places to eat in this great city.

Nice and funny bartender.  Oysters shucked and delivered in no time.  The rest of the food took way way way too long.  The chargrilled oysters were delicious though, and the crab claws too.  The new orleans sampler was warmed over and very very ordinary.  I understand the appeal but with so many wonderful restaurants this seems like one not worth the trip.

My boyfriend and two of our friends came here hoping for a great experience but from when we stepped in the door to the first step out the door it just felt like we were judged and forgotten about. The host took us in addition to another party and sat us at the same time which felt very impersonal. After that, our server quickly took our drink order, then forgot one of our drinks. Finally about 15 minutes later our server returned to ask us for our order. Keep in mind, we were the first table sat upstairs, so why did we have to wait so long to put our order in? I asked about the market price of the seafood and then ordered the Alaskan snow crab but when our food came out they brought me a shrimp platter. When I told the food runner it was wrong he said "oh this server never makes mistakes" To which I said "well I ordered the Alaskan crab...this is shrimp" To which he then took it back and I didn't receive my order until Over half an hour later when the rest of my party had finished their food. When the wrong order had been brought out the server said he would ask the manager to do something for me. We never saw the manager until after our check came. When our server hadn't revisited our table almost thirty minutes after the crab came out, I asked for our check. The check included everything INCLUDING the shrimp platter that was never ordered AND the crab and I never saw a manager. So I asked to speak to the manager as I was originally told. The manager came out and I told him my complaint about the poor service with the crab and the time it took and how inconvenient it was that my party had already finished their food by the time I even got mine. He said "I'm so sorry, let me see what I can do for you." He went to the back and then came back out and was doing his normal business throughout the restaurant and didn't come back to our table. Then our server came and grabbed our check and ran it, and then when he came back I asked to speak to the manager again. The manager came back and said "what can I do for you?" To which I was astounded and just said "uhh...you said you were going to see what you could do about the service situation..." he said "sorry, let me see your check" and then voided the check and recharged it without the crab or shrimp platter on there. Then he left the table and the server never came back to our table. We left and I doubt we will ever come back to this place. This was one of the worst experiences in dining I've ever had, and I feel like we were stereotyped as young men from the minute we walked in and treated on preconceptions of what we would pay/tip. I'd recommend skipping this place altogether.
Sydney is a great host... great recommendation, go with the crawfish ravioli and char oysters... you cannot go wrong!

We had some early morning plans and set out looking for a place for an early morning breakfast. Yelp gave Royal House a good rating and I can't disagree. We had two different omelettes, one with a Cajun twist and a Cajun Bloody Mary.  Great food and great service. Of course 99% of NOLA was sleeping one off but those of us who get up early have a great option. I'm sure the lunch's and dinners are equally excellent. Our waiter checked my ID and noticed one of my other ID's and offered a military discount. Outstanding!
Food was delicious, i had the chicken and eggplant Parmesan over spaghetti Alfredo. my husband had the rib eye with delicious potato bites. Balcony view at night is great. Love the ambiance!

We stumbled upon the restaurant and couldn't decide if we wanted to go. We decided to take the risk and it was better than we could have expected. We were seated immediately and sat out on the balcony to watch the busy streets of New Orleans. We had a dozen oysters, a pound of fresh Cajun shrimp, and a plate of eggplant chicken Parmesan. The food was fantastic and the service was excellent. And not to mention while we dined on the balcony a marching band and parade came right by. We would go back in a heart beat!

This was a brief snack between meals.  The chargrilled oysters with Parmesan butter cheese was excellent.  The oysters shrink after bring grilled so I wish we had a dozen instead of 1/2 dozen, but this was a good snack before dinner.  It took a while to order, and we had to find the server to ask for the check.

Came in early Saturday evening for dinner with two of my girlfriends. You can't make reservations so I figured we would have to wait awhile but the wait was not even 10 minutes. Trying to actually sit us at the table was the hard part. I swear we walked back and forth to three different tables to get sat but we finally got one. We ordered the redfish beignets and they were delicious. It's almost like a tempura type batter on the fish with a sweet sauce on the bottom. I order the taste of New Orleans which is like a sampler plate of gumbo, jambalaya and etoufee. The jambalaya was delicious, the etoufee was great with just the right amount of spice but the gumbo was gross. It tasted like they had premade it and stuck it in the freezer and it had freezer burn on tasted like a refrigerator. I thought it was just me or the bread but I let one of my friends try and she spit it out. Maybe it was a bad batch who knows. Other than that it's a very open restaurant with the doors wide open. We ended up seeing a parade pass by and we walked out to watch it and came right back. They have a good variety I would def come back and try something new though
Oh my gosh they have the best Charbroiled Oysters!  Must try them during your visit!  So yummy!!!
Pretty basic NOLA food. Didn't have to wait except to get our bill. For a tourist spot it's about what you'd expect.
Stopped for a quick lunch.  Char-grilled oysters were yummy!! Would definitely order them again!

This review is solely for the manager working today. She was completely inappropriate and yelling in the middle of the upstairs at a man trying to move to an outside table. There should have been no reason that the man could not sit there as the second floor of the restaurant had over half of the tables available. Not only did she disturb our lunch, she wouldn't even let the man have the table!! It was crazy. And it was even more wild that she was arguing in front if the rest of the guest and everyone was turned around looking at her and she just continued to argue with him. I haven't even had the food, but I would defiantly not be back solely because of the management and her rudeness. I've worked at restaurants and severe, and it was unbelievable.

Lots of hype but a little disappointed as food (jambalaya) came out warm and didn't looks freshly made. It did had taste though so giving them benefit of doubt. Place seems to be busy so you don't get much of special attn on service side. 3/5 I think is being generous here for first timers.

ALWAYS SIT AT THE BAR!!! It's so much more fun and enjoyable. We go there once a month or so. The food is always great whether you get chargrilled or fresh oyster. Always learning something new from the guys who schuck (spelling?) the oysters. Great times great food!!

Came here today and tried the crawfish étouffée. I was not disappointed! 

People have recommended different restaurants to me for crawfish étouffée, but my fiancé doesn't eat seafood (crazy, I know), so we chose Royal House because they serve burgers (lol). With that said, if you too are in the area and are with someone that doesn't like seafood, Royal House serves up a pretty decent burger, and they also have roast beef po boys as well as another chicken dish. It's clear that their specialty is seafood, though.

Anyway, the crawfish étouffée was served with crawfish two ways-sautéed in the gravy and fried crawfish tails. It was super flavorful, and the texture of the crawfish was great too. The portion size was also perfect-I usually never finished my food but I ate every last bite of my dish and felt comfortably full without feel overstuffed. This is only the second time I've had crawfish étouffée, but I'm so glad we chose Royal House because my dish truly exceeded my expectations.

I've never tried oysters before, but they (obviously) have different oyster dishes as well that are good for splitting. Next time I come back will be with a seafood eating friend so I can try some of their other dishes.

Lastly, we came on a busy Saturday afternoon but were seated super quickly. Our server was also very knowledgeable and friendly, and I was surprised at how fast we received our food given how crowded it was. With that said, although it was crowded it never felt uncomfortable. Like I said earlier, this was only my first time here but it seems like the staff does a nice job of keeping the atmosphere enjoyable even when there's heavy traffic. I'll definitely be back again!

Giving 1 star because even though we were a party of 7 and didn't have a reservation we were seated relatively quickly. Also the red velvet pie was very tasty. Apart from that there is nothing going for this place. 

The wait time to get food is over an hour
They serve you cold entrees
The food is not seasoned properly 

And to top it all off, management refuses to address the poor food service.

Don't waste your time or money  We chose this restaurant based on yelp reviews and were very disappointed  The restaurant was not very busy and our server greeted us promptly  My husband ordered French onion soup and a burger  I ordered the shrimp and grits.  We waited about 15-20 minutes just to get the soup (that was actually good) but the food came well before we finished the soup.  Now on to the food.  The burger easily had twice as much bread (or more) with flavorless meat.  I love shrimp and grits, and it had potential based on the description.  The grits were dry, the shrimp over cooked, and the sauce bland.  We hoped to end the meal with something sweet and tasty and ordered the bread pudding.  It was to be served warm.  After waiting 20 minutes to get it, it was cold.  Yes, take directly out of the refrigerator cold.  Our server did take it off our check.  With tip, our bill was $48.  That was a waste of money and a lot of time!

Yummity yum yum. Fast seating at noon, through the crowd at the entrance made us believe there was a wait. Place was certainly packed, but no wait.

Fast service from super friendly server. She called us both "baby" with a drawl we found adorable. She really took care to refill glasses without needing to be asked while busy with a lot of tables.

I vascilated between french onion soup and gumbo. She said absolutely get french onion.

Hubby wanted to substitute red potatoes for boiled potatoes in shared peel the shrimp pot. No problem. Those red potatoes are served with a sauce that hubby ate faster than I could snap a pic and steal a perfect piece. Crazy good red potatoes. Yep.

Peel the boiled shrimp and corn just Louisiana hot n spicy enough to add nothing. Again, outta the park good.

We shared the shrimp pot, had our own soup and thinly sliced french bread. 

Bravo. 

Service great, crowd loud, laughing,  boisterous,  let the good times roll.

Here on vacation and been to several places. All of them have been good, but Royal House was hands down THE BEST!!!  Best chargrilled oysters ever!!  There's another place voted the best for oysters... nope!!  Royal House was better!  Everything was perfect, even for my husband when is a chef. The ambiance on the balcony was amazing. Don't pass go. Don't collect $200. Go directly to Royal House!!

This is the place to go for a view of the actual Bourbon street parades and festivities that happen along the strip! Def a spot if you want the liveliness of the streets and atmosphere!

Upstairs patio seating can be tight, usually for only a couple people, as they have a limit "before it meets capacity" they just say it so waiters can still see the tables efficiently.

The food was good too! I got the red fish beignets they're known for and that was a different touch to their known beignets, as it was like a fried fish dish that was nice and savory!

The chicken pasta was a solid touch and so was the oysters and seafood pastas! 

Great spot for the view tbh! I love the vibes here!

Waited over an hour for our dish and were told the oven wasnt working, but when we questioned again the manager admitted they forgot our order and then tried to make it seem like she gave us a discount on our appetizer but that discount was because we used the yelp check in discount...and when we confronted her about that she finally decided to actually try to make up for the wait by giving us a discount...what good is the food if you can't keep customers
Gumbo and dessert everytime!  The red velvet cake is so perfect with the drizzle on the plate!

Went here with 3 coworkers and I think I had the best meal. I had the shrimp and grits. Grits were very rich with strong cheese flavor. Shrimp were done just right. I had small dinner salad which was nothing out of the ordinary but was good.

What a great place to eat. We were on vacation from Charlotte and the food was great. You can't go wrong with the charred oysters . Chris was our waiter and he did a phenomenal job. He went over and above to make sure we had a good experience . He deserves a raise !

This place is a must if you're visiting NOLA. The service was great and the food was even better. It has a nice and relaxing ambiance as well. Our server suggested the Crab Claws as an appetizer (check in to get a free app) and it was very good. The sauce was creamy and rich. I ordered the Crawfish Ravioli and it was so delicious. My favorite thing we ordered though was the Shrimp Tortellini, it was one of the best pastas I've ever had. We also ordered the Taste of New Orleans which was good, the gumbo was the best out of all the tastes. It was my birthday but unfortunately they don't offer anything special on occasions, I was bummed but no big deal.

Overall this place was great and definitely worth trying.

I would never come here again.  Employees here have to be the rudest in New Orleans.  Who needs it?  And the worst one of the bunch is the bar manager.  My friend and I are older and not price conscious.  This idiot bar manager starts by giving us a hard time about serving us even though I am 55 years old.  Seriously!!! This guy should have a job cleaning streets or something that doesn't deal with the public.

During Mardi Gras, my mom and I came here in search of seafood late after fighting the crowds. Luckily, we were able to get a table for two right away! The table next to us was located halfway outside on the sidewalk, which was very off-putting. My mother sat there before and said it was very uncomfortable.

Our waiter did not come for at least ten minutes, but once he did we went ahead and ordered our spinach dip appetizer. By the time we got it, it was cold and the chips were even stale. 
My mom ordered the blackened fish with veggies and potatoes and I ordered the eggplant and chicken parmesan with added veggies. Her meal was delicious, and our waiter said it was his favorite and I agreed. The fried chicken on my pasta was crispy and fresh, but the eggplant completely slid out of the fried coating with one bite and the extra $4 veggies added were a few green beans which was unfortunate.

I might come back when it is not during Mardi Gras, but for the reviews and the popularity, I expected a much better experience.

Best fresh raw & chargrilled oysters in all of NOLA, and I tried a lot of oyster spots. There is never any grit/shells (or pearls haha!) Royal house wins!! Get your clean oysters here and you will be completely satisfied. Music on this corner is just fantastic.
Absolutely delicious. Great service! Banana foster cheesecake and jambalaya were my favorite!

A special call out to Maegon B for being our lovely waiting and providing an excellent customer service.

We came here for our last evening in New Orleans before flying back to San Jose, California. We didn't know what to expect but we got a seat outside the top balcony. What was so wonderful was being surrounded by the lovely New Orleans environment including a violinist downstairs and looking down the streets of all the fun.

What stood out to us about the Royal House was the delicious food and drinks. We would highly recommend the mix of fish and shrimp with the chips alongside an appetizer of alligator bites.

Overall, we would return to this place and highly recommend it to any of our friends.
Food was terrible , waited over 30 min to be greeted and for water and spent almost our whole night there service was just that slow would never come back.
Service was great, atmosphere was inviting. We sat on the deck upstairs and had a great view of the activity of the streets and the music!
Sat at the bar and had great service by the oyster shucker. It was a busy night and he was attentive but kept shucking because the orders kept coming in. Oysters, of course is a must have.

A special call out to Maegon B for being our lovely waitress and providing excellent customer service.

We came here for our last evening in New Orleans before flying back to San Jose, California. We didn't know what to expect but we got a seat outside the top balcony. What was so wonderful was being surrounded by the lovely New Orleans environment including a violinist downstairs and looking down the streets of all the fun.

What stood out to us about the Royal House was the delicious food and drinks. We would highly recommend the mix of fish and shrimp with the chips alongside an appetizer of alligator bites.

Overall, we would return to this place and highly recommend it to any of our friends.
This place is amazing price and value...if you want raw or chargrilled oysters this the place.  Eat with Anthony at the bar he is awesome.
I eat here every time I'm in NOLA. Amazing service. Great food at a good price. The gumbo is worth stopping in for. Steaks and oysters are always on point.
Cold food.  Service not fast as well.

We went to Royal House for our last dinner in New Orleans and I am so glad we went. I ordered the Shrimp Creole which was pretty good. But my favorite was the Oysters. Their charbroiled oysters are so delicious. The servers were hilarious and the overall vibe here was amazing.

Good food. I went here because of all the yelp reviews. It was good for lunch. I got a spinach salad with shrimp which was way bigger then expected. They also have good mojitos. There was no wait for a table of 4 which was nice. Nothing super special about it though but if you want a good meal go there.

The staff was very friendly and nice. Food came pretty quickly as well. In a great location to.

I loved royal house. Had the taste of New Orleans, alligator fritters, shrimp & grits as well as the famous hurricane. The view is spectacular. Drinks, appetizer and entrees came to about $100.00. Pretty much the only thing I loved about the French Quarter

Absolutely loved the grilled oysters and crawfish etouffe, they are an absolute must. Jambalaya was tasty but a little dry and I didn't care for the gumbo much, but gumbo is not my thing. Definitely want to go back again for the oysters!!

Good food. I went here because of all the yelp reviews. It was good for lunch. I got a spinach salad with shrimp which was way bigger then expected. They also have good mojitos. There was no wait for a table of 4 which was nice. Nothing super special about it though but if you want a good meal go there.

The staff was very friendly and nice. Food came pretty quickly as well. In a great location to.

Best food I had in New Orleans !!! So my friends and I were in town for Mardi gras , we knew good was going to be amazing and we were going to try a little of everything New Orleans had to offer , let me tell you this place was my favorite !!!!!! I ordered the oyster pasta and jambalaya it was amazing , the jambalaya the the best I've ever had . MUST TRY
The food was amazing! We were here on vacation and I would highly recommend this place. Loved the environment, service, and food. I would definitely come back again.

I ordered the eggs Benedict and it was lukewarm at best.(both the eggs and the potatoes) The sauce was so salty I couldn't finish it. My husband agreed .  The coffee was lukewarm too. I told them the Coffee was not hot and they said that it was brewed  at 6:30 in the morning. It was now 930.  Then she said she  would make another pot for me. There's no way she did a new pot in literally 2 min. It tasted microwaved.  I expected a lot especially since there were only 6 patrons in the restaurant .  They only thing that was good was the orange juice.
My favorite restaurant in the French Quarter. I love the outdoor seating that over looks the unique architecture of the city. The food was delicious & well priced & the servers were very polite.

We celebrated my husbands bday here and sat on the balcony while we heard the street musicians, it was a magical night. The fish beignets were surprisingly delicious, first time I've had them and the oysters were great as well!

Very disappointed!  Ate here a few years ago, and it was very good.  This time?  No!  Asked for more bread for our appetizer?  They said no... we'll give you crackers?  Wife ordered blackened shrimp.  They were tiny frozen shrimp.  And NOT blackened!  Apps were very late.  Dinners came 2 minutes later.  Poor service.  Poor quality food.  Dissappointed!

Another popular place in the Quarter. We sat at the bar, Tony was great to talk to as he shucked a many oysters. A those oysters were big and juicy. The gumbo wasn't bad either. My cousin orders the Cesar Salad with blacked chicken breast was pretty tasty and just good for one.

Nourriture très très ordinaire, j ai pris un Po boy à l alligator et j ai vraiment été déçue , juste quelques petits morceaux dans un pain congelé et à peine réchauffé le tout pour $ 15 ! Je ne reviendrai pas

1. Balcony seating!! A huge plus for us as we got to enjoy some amazing views and NOLA life.

2. Food is great but overpriced

3. Staff are SLOW. A lady waited 1.2 hours for a cup of gumbo!! Really? 

4. RUDE BARTENDER!!! She was working at 5pm Monday on this day 03/12/18. She's blonde, light eyes, didn't catch her name. She made me a great cocktail with gin, lime, and cucumber. When I ordered my second it was weak. (I've made this cocktail several times myself). I told her politely that I LOVED the first one and if she wouldn't mind adding a little more gin. She snapped at me and said she was following the recipe but then conceded and added a splash of gin. It was unprofessional of her to roll her eyes and give such a hostile attitude. 

5. NEEDS BETTER SERVICE!!!

My friends and I stumbled into this place while at a parade and were actually on our way to another restaurant. We had the oyster duo, raw oysters, fried alligator, and each got different entrees. The food was absolutely amazing, especially the oysters and my crawfish etouffee. Our server was so friendly and helped us make it to our ghost tour on time. The inside is decorated nicely, is very clean, and they have balcony seating if you don't mind a little wait. I'm so glad we went to this restaurant, it was truly a great experience.
The taste is not good. And the service is terrible. They missed our dish and keep us waiting for almost 1hour. Totally ruined our plan for today.
Awesome food! Absolutely the best French onion soup. Highly recommend, just be patient service can be a little slow but staff is very attentive.
Same cut/paste answer from management I see on other negative reviews.  Don't bother, much better places in this lovely city to spend time and money with much better food.

I've been in New Orleans for four days and this has by far been the best restaurant I have been to. Excellent staff and amazing food. I had the Oysters Rockefeller with a small gumbo and my boyfriend had blackened red fish. We are both leaving full and happy. 10/10 recommend. 

Hey guys, this is the bf, yeah food was excellent! They even let me bring my outside drink in. I had a (huge ass) beer and she said "... yeah, bring that big ass in here boy" haha! Super cool staff 
P.s. They also play cool jams!
P.p.s. May be a long wait, but worth the wait!

The food here was excellent! My group got the oysters on the half shell, artichoke dip, shrimp and grits, gumbo, and the jambalaya. The gumbo and shrimp and grits were particularly good. The service was great and the hostesses were helpful. Worth the wait!

A little bit messy but overall a pleasant experience. The waiter was friendly and the food was delicious. Went with the duo for the oysters which were equally fantastic. The crab claws were delicious too, specifically the sauce. The sampler was bleh so do not recommend.

Still very good food. I lowered my rating only because I wasn't impressed by my dish like I was the first visit. I opted for the Seafood Pescatore. I left out the red pepper flakes, which left the dish a little flat for seasoning. The appetizers were still great. We had the stuffed mushrooms and crab claws.
