The rest of my party enjoyed their dinner choices, too. The service was great and has not dwindled. All in all, worth another visit.

Worst place ever! We sat down at 10:00, the waitress came by took our order we ordered an appetizer and two entrees and two waters. It wasn't till 10:30 when we received our water! Just water! Then she comes back and says the kitchen is out of potatoes, we ordered nothing with potatoes and still haven't gotten our appetizer! An hour went by still with only water. So we got up and left. The staff here is ridiculously slow!

The line was deceiving but worth the wait. The hostess said about 25 minutes we were seated in less than 10 minutes. Had a wonderful waiter! The food was great and we loved the gumbo and red beans with andouille sausage and rice!

Super busy even on a weekday but we came early ~4:40pm and were seated after a very short wait. Servers were friendly but difficult for them to be attentive considering how busy they were. I love that they had different grilled oyster options but I must admit that Acme Oyster House still tasted better. Ask to be seated in the balcony if the weather is nice. It's got a great view and is a lot quieter and more intimate. My favorite of the night was the crawfish ravioli and my husband's favorite was the crab claws appetizer. Overall, fun place to eat while in Nola.

Great service and wonderful ambiance. We lucked out and got seated immediately. Our food took a little while because they got BUSY, but we just realaxed and enjoyed the beautiful historic building.  My son had an alligator po boy and I had the shrimp. When we left there was a line down the street.

What we loved most about this place was the shrimp and grits! Favorite dish. Delicious! Flavor was the best. The inside of the restaurant is so cute. Very New Orleans. Service was quick. Price was reasonable on most items.
The spinach dip and the Shrimp & grits were absolutely delicious. The staff were courteous. Our waitress was professional, helpful and kind. I totally recommend this place.

This place is worth 10 stars in my book great food great service oyster where money
Best crab claws ever boiled shrimp was good French onion soup is great thank you

First, our waitress was so nice--she was unfortunately working all by herself when we visited for lunch. We were seated right away when we arrived which was nice. We waited for at least 45 minutes before our food came to the table (again, it seemed that they were short-staffed that day). 

I hate to say the food was nothing special. Out of everything my friends and I ate during our stay in New Orleans, this was our least favorite place. I had the jambalaya which was good, and my friends had po' boys (one shrimp, one alligator) which they described as bland and flavorless. We also had a side of hush puppies which were just really salty (??). Overall I would recommend trying another restaurant or just hoping you catch them on a better day than we did.

Loved the service and the oysters were absolutely perfect. The ambience was perfect for our low-key-but-not-low-class dinner.

Edit: Ty was an awesome server- personable and attentive. It was a busy night (St Patrick's Day) and we never noticed our wait because he was so on it the whole time. I appreciated the care he took and the fact that he kept it fun the whole meal.

Amazing! Great service and the crab legs are to die for!!! Would highly recommend. We had the gumbo sampler and crawfish Monica. I wish we had room for dessert. Friendly staff and we got to watch a parade while we waited.

Where do I even begin about this disastrous experience. We decided to try this place based on such rave reviews on Yelp. We were greeted at the front door. Calling us kings and queens was a bit cheesy. We were immediately sat upstairs. We sat for 10-15mins without any servers greeting us. Eventually we had to get drinks from the hostess. AND put in entre orders with the hostess. Eventually our waitress came over to greet us. It took about 25-30mins to get our food. But when it came out, my friend's plate had hair on it. So they had to take it back. 

In the mix of all this, the manager and our waitress got into an intense argument. I literally thought they were going to fight. The entire upstairs was being ran by only two servers. So I guess the waitress were not happy with the amount of people being sent upstairs. 

The food was good but overpriced. We could have gotten better food for half the price if we were outside of the French quarters.

The entire experience was just one issue after another. Maybe we just came on a bad day, but we won't be returning. There are plenty of other options.

First night in NEw Orleans  and hungry , our  concierge recommended this restaurant where local people goes and it wasn't a disappointment .i haven't heard of grilled oyster except the one my hubby cooks for me but their grilled oyster was different . It's so yummy , fresh grilled oyster with butter and melted cheese on top , to die for and I'm hooked . Keep craving it every day !! .Busy area , a little wait but worth it!!

Good food, nice view, terrible service.

Came in for lunch on 3/11/18. Got seated upstairs when we came in but waited for over 30 minutes for our server to actually take our order as well as the two tables next to us. Saw our waiter a total of two times the entire time but I think there were only two waiters for the entire upstairs. 

Had the baked shrimp tortellini pasta which was AMAZING and very filling. My cousin had the fried oysters which were also pretty good but not at all filling for $14. The eggplant and chicken parm was also very filling and pretty good as well. Overall the food was great but a little pricey and the service upstairs was terrible not just for my table but for the ones around us as well.
Red fish and the crawfish ravioli are a must. This place has great balcony tables with a cool atmosphere.
Great atmosphere! Fantastic food. A must eat while in NOLA!! We had the Shrimp and Grits and the Blackened Red Snapper with Alligator bites as an appetizer!  We will be back again!

The raw oysters were good. Balcony atmosphere good. Nothing else was good. Tourist trap. Terrible service. Better shrimp at Popeyes. Sit on the balcony, eat some raw oysters, have a couple drinks, don't order anything else.

Not sure why I haven't posted my review for this place but nonetheless it's amazing. The wait can be long though. My mom and I came to visit New Orleans back in December of 2017 for a weekend trip. I stumbled upon this place while trying to figure out a spot to eat dinner on a Saturday night. We got there around 7:30pm from what I remember and we put our name down on the wait list. The wait was about 45 minutes-1 hour but it wasn't too bad since there was like a marching band coming by so we had something to watch while waiting. It gets pretty crowded by Royal Street neighborhood with all the entertainment by the street performers. 
We got seated next to the bar. We ordered dozen oysters (small), stuffed mushrooms, jambalaya, and some meat ball spaghetti. The dozen oysters were tiny but they tasted super fresh. The lemon and the sauce gives it a crisp taste. The stuffed mushrooms was also one of my favorite. The mushroom was baked and had some crab and shrimp stuffing in them which tasted so amazing! We also ordered the Taste of New Orleans which had three different dishes. It came in three small bowls and one had chicken & andouille jambalaya, crawfish etouffee and the other one was andouille gumbo. Out of the three my favorite was the crawfish. It had tons of flavor in that dish and I definitely enjoyed it. The spaghetti was plain though on the other hand. It tasted a bit bland to us. 
Overall, we had a good time at Royal House and I'd definitely would love to visit here again!

I loved everything about Royal House! First and foremost, the crab claws are literally one of my top 5 favorite dishes ever. They were amazing! Creamy, spicy, salty, complex Cajun seasoning with an amazing balance of flavors and delicious French bread to dip in it. Oh yeah, and crab claws!!! Man, that dish is phenomenal, honestly. I would literally come back to New Orleans just for that dish. I ate every last drop too. I also ordered the charbroiled oysters and Oysters Rockefeller. They were very good, with the charbroiled being the better of the two, which my server recommended before I ordered. On top of the fantastic food, the service was the best! I came in right at 11 am and was immediately and happily whisked off to the balcony tables, which are incredibly charming. My server was the sweetest and everything came out hot, delicious, fast, and with a smile. The service here was better than any other restaurant we went to while in town. The atmosphere, food, and service were top notch! You must dine here and you simply must order the crab claws!!

HORRIBLE! 
I found this place on yelp and was so pumped to visit but I now wish we would of skipped it. Terrible service, the server Monica didn't come to our table until maybe 15 minutes after we had been seated. We ordered our food off the bat because we knew she probably wouldn't come back for a while. Our drinks were never refilled and she never checked to see if we needed anything. We ordered appetizers and not everyone received their plates. We ordered a side of their special potatoes and come to find out from the manager that they had run out. To make matters worse my friend and I were so sick after eating here. Don't waste your time going here and certainly don't waste your time waiting in that ridiculous line to get it in. 

P.S I am only leaving a star because I have to!

This place is such a gem! The atmosphere is really lovely and inviting. We sat at a table by the open window and could look out into the street while getting a nice breeze. Food and service were phenomenal. Reasonable prices. Highly recommend!

Ok - my experience here was brief, but wonderful. After barely making it through a horrendous meal at another restaurant, I found myself with a grumbly tummy and a cranky demeanor. I was honestly too lazy to walk any further than absolutely necessary, so I popped into Royal House as it was the closest place at the time. I was promptly greeted and directed to the end of the bar to place a to go order. I ordered a cup of red beans and rice plus some hush puppies - both were fresh, super delicious and exactly what I needed. Thanks Royal House! **Edit - neglected to point out that the bartender who took my order was super-nice. I will definitely visit Royal House next time I'm in town!

Excellent service and great atmosphere! We were able to hear some local tunes from our table, which really brought home the entire experience. Food wasn't the best, had the shrimp Po'Boy, but overall great time!

We love New Orleans and had read great reviews about this place and we were not disappointed! The food was amazing and the service was excellent! Waitress was very polite and recommended some things to do in the area. Will definitely be back again soon

Great food, great ambiance sitting on the balcony while listening to musicians... service although, not so great. Parmesan cheese and extra plates never made it to the table after asking twice. Server responded with attitude and dropped the check off. Manager showed up and apologized, and responded they are busy. It's a Thursday night, maybe get some staff?

We had dinner here our last night in New Orleans. I had heard a lot of good things about the crab claws and Royal House is super close to where we were staying so it was the perfect option. 

We were seated upstairs - it was a pretty busy evening though I don't think there were any lines. The bf ordered a gumbo for a soup and I also ordered two appetisers - the crab claws and the chargrilled oysters. The crab claws were amazing!! I really enjoyed this dish. I'm not sure what they put in that sauce, but I was addicted! As for the gumbo and the chargrilled oysters - these were average and nothing to write home about. In addition, it took a while for us to track down a spoon to use to eat the gumbo as we didn't get one. In the end, I ended up asking the bar tender at the upstairs bar for a spare spoon as our server was no where to be found. 

As for mains, I ordered their Taste of New Orleans - I had plenty of gumbo during my stay but no jambalaya or étouffée. Again, I would say this was average. I had eaten better gumbo and nothing about the jambalaya or the étouffée was outstanding. The bf ordered the red beans dish - he said it was alright.

Overall, we left our dinner at Royal House both agreeing that we had eaten at better places during our stay in NOLA. Someone once said that NOLA restaurants are generally known for one thing that they do exceptionally, and everything else on the menu is just average. I would agree with that in Royal House's case. In addition, the service was slow and generally inattentive. So overall, I may come back for more crab claws and that would be it.

A MUST TRY!! Everything was absolutely amazing! The oysters were out of this world!! We ordered every kind they had for appetizers and loved them so much we ordered additional dozens with our entrees. The crawfish ravioli is to die for! It may have been the best meal I ate while in NOLA!! 

Great, friendly staff as well which always adds to the experience.

This place is in a great spot in the French Quarter, right in the middle by the courthouse.  I went with a couple of colleagues that evening upon reading good reviews. The food was decent. It wasn't standout but decent for the area and price point. I had the redfish and another colleague had the ribeye. We also ordered stuff mushrooms and the tacos for appetizer. Unfortunately the bad outweighed the good. Our seat, right in the middle of the dining room, smelled like million armpits and wet feet jammed in my nostrils. It was so incredibly offputting. This may be a one off, but this should never happen. I'm hoping it wasn't  eminating from the kitchen... just for this reason I can't  justify giving this restaurant anything but a single star. Management needs to be on top of stuff like this.

An amazing place to go eat! Our server was great, the atmosphere was great and the food was even better! We got the crab leg appetizer and ended up asking for some more bread because the sauce was so good. The crawfish ravioli was also very tasty!

Went there for Chinese New Year with family. Dim sum was ok. When asked to order the crispy pork and roasted duck in the front window, the waiter said it's not for sale...it's just for show. Later we asked what looked like the manager and he said they were for sale. Wow

Good service and good food options. The plates were a bit cold and small (hence the start down) but were good. I had the New Orleans sampler and it was really good. The building is beautiful. The cocktail are really good too.
Very nice spot.  We initially sat in the balcony - it was so nice and relaxing.  Had some delicious oysters - fresh and grilled - highly recommend them!  The service was also excellent!

The crab claws were very good but that's about all, the jambalaya arrived in a small bowl had what seemed like frozen grilled shrimp on top and was very dry.  The red beans and rice had no flavor, and the rest of the dinner was just passable.  We waited in line for 45 minutes and was charged 120 dollars for the experience

We are foodies and this was disappointing. The food was okay but not great. Our stuffed mushrooms came out cold so we asked to have them heated. They were brought back still not hot. My bread pudding was also barely warm. There are too many choices in NOLA for average food at a high price.
Mehh. Food was very average. A bartender was rude to us. Our waitress was very nice but the service very slow. Our dessert arrived before our appetizers & meals.
Highly over rated. Our order took 45 min. The poboy bread was as if it was from 2 days ago. Was chewy

The Shrimp Po Boy was very dry and had little flavor. I had to add tobasco sauce to add a bit of flavor. The waiter didn't bring utensils or a napkin, which isn't a big deal, but it just added to the disappointment. The oysters did look good though. So it may not be so bad if you're going there just for the oysters.

I am embarrassed I just took a cursory glance at the number of stars/reviews and took my friends here. Don't be fooled like me--it was a huge waste of money and a total tourist trap. 

1. The oysters were flavorless and not shucked properly. 
2. Our drinks came out incorrectly. 
3. Our entrees took an hour to arrive. 
4. When they did come out, they were disgusting. One of them was burnt past recognition and missing multiple ingredients--26 dollars for a literal charred piece of unrecognizable fish and some soggy vegetables is a travesty. My shrimp caprese was truly one of the most confusing dishes I've ever had--the presentation looked like a drunk child had tried to make their parents dinner, and it tasted somehow flavorless and oversalted at the same time. On top of that, there were still bits of shell on the shrimp and I accidentally swallowed it. The shrimp smelled bad and tasted old, and afterwards I threw it all up in their bathroom. My body rejected it so swiftly it was kind of impressive. The other dishes were sloppy and oversalted. It all looked like slop.
5. When we decided to ask to speak to the manager (and multiple ppl in our party are servers, so we didn't take this lightly), he took forever to come over. When he did, you could tell he didn't care at all about our legitimate concerns. He just recited a bunch of lines while looking ahead at the wall and then proceeded to take 50 dollars off of our 156 dollar bill. It was clear this happened often. 

I feel like a complete dumbass and I am desperate for other ppl who are typically smart about staying away from tourist traps to receive ample warning if they're just casually looking for somewhere last minute--DON'T GO HERE. RUN. By the end of the night, it all became grimly hilarious, but less so after I looked at my bank account this morning and was reminded of how much I paid for the pleasure of eating food that triggered an existential depression.

Save yourself and your money! We came to royal house right after arriving to town because there was a big lineup and the menu sounded good with fair prices. Also seeing. "4-star" rating on yelp sealed the deal. 

I couldn't have been more disappointed with our meal. The service was awful (slow, disingenuous, disinterested). It took more than 15 minutes before a server came to see us, and the same went for all the tables I observed around us. 

After ordering, we waited a solid 45 minutes for food, and when it came out server apologized. Food was dry and unimpressive. Filled the void but that's about it. 

Atmosphere: bright with 70s rock playing. You're in NoLa... play some jazz! And staff all communicate via 2-way radios so it sounded like I was in a police station... also drinks were served in plastic disposable cups. Zero class. 

There are dozens of better places to chose so please move past the allure of the buzz and find a better place!
Had both diner and breakfast here. Food, staff and atmosphere are all top notch. Highly recommend the crawfish Benedict for breakfast

Loved this place so much!! We got the spinach dip which was absolutely delicious amd had a great chip to dip ratio! We also got the tour of new orleams which has the etoufe, aundouille and gumbo which were all great dishes! The service was great here, everyone was super hospitable and the atmosphere was great! Worth the trip here!

Had 1 hour to grab a bite in New Orleans, decided to go to Royal House! Service was fast, the Voodoo Drink from the bar was incredible, the bartender was so sweet, they even gave us a 25% military discount! Location was pretty great as well, felt like it was in the center of everything, reason for only 3 stars was because the food was just good. The Taste of New Orleans was a sampler plate which included Gumbo, Jambalaya, and Crawfish Étouffée. Although tasty it was just 3 bowls of rice essentially. My friend who ordered the peel and eat shrimp mentioned they lacked flavor and were a bit over cooked. Cool environment, great service, ok food.

Five stars for great service, delicious food, and good drinks. I ended up here after walking all New Orleans and decided to try some typical NOLA plates. My friend and I really wanted to sit on the balcony and they let us know that it would be a little. We decided to wait at the bar, had the Voodoo juice ($11) and was not disappointed! The bartender was so nice, she kept checking on our table for us. Then we had Joel as our waiter and he was super attentive. There was a mix up with our fried gator appetizer (free thanks to Yelp!) but besides that we had no issues. We both had the Taste of NOLA which brings Jambalaya, crawfish etouffe, and gumbo. The sizes are pretty decent but not enough to share. The gumbo was AMAZING. Recommend!

Started with the crab claws and they were great.  Spinach dip was OK.  All of the creole dishes we had were average to below average.  Jambalaya had tiny, bland shrimp.  Gumbo had no flavor and was all rice.

I'm literally obsessed with this place. I come here at least two times every single visit to New Orleans. I have cravings every year for the crab claws. There is something incredibly addictive about the sauce I just want to slather myself in it. This visit I came here twice in one day, no joke. I was that in need of these crab claws. The entire restaurant serves the best of the best New Orleans classics and you won't be disappointed. I highly recommend the mint julep cocktail as it's strong but well-balanced. The oysters are on the large side. If you're somebody who typically enjoys West Coast oysters just be aware that these are much larger than those. I dream about coming here. I have been to Nola six times now, and this my first stop every time.

Our lunch turned into a four hour ordeal somehow. For some reason the food we ordered kept taking forever but the waitress seemed to try and be on top of it (to no avail) because some of it went to the wrong table. Fortunately we were comped a round of drinks as a result. The food was good but I think they need to figure out a better system to getting food to the table. Baked oysters were superb, as were the crab claws. The beignet fish was cool too and sweet, which my dining partner did not care for but I would consider it more of a twist on beer battered fish with a sweet sauce on it.

Went looking for somewhere to eat in New Orleans for an evening meal as hadn't made any reservations, most places seemed to have long queues to get into yet looking at this menu I couldnt understand why there was no wait here. Of course it is a little bit away from the main area but well worth a small walk to. 

They have a balcony and if you are lucky enough to sit out there you will be greater with a fab view and if there is anyone down below playing music then some pleasant tunes. 

The staff were friendly and helpful with the restaurant clean and tidy.

The food came out quickly and was very nice sigh good portions. 

Well worth a visit

Saturday night in New Orleans with no dinner reservations --- yikes what a mistake
We went to dinner with a group of friends and encountered several problems. 
First they don't take reservations this lead to problem 
No. 2. We get there and we have to wait. Not the worst thing but then the hosts say they called our name but that was impossible because we were less than 10 feet from them. 
After some tense discussion a table was found. The food was incredibly average. 
I had an oyster Po Boy it wasn't awful it just wasn't worth the wait. 
The service was awesome. Wife had shrimp tortellini said it was less than good. 
Dinner for us was $60 
That is pricey for average to below average food.

4 stars for the amazing Sauteed crab claws (soooooo good) and friendly staff. We also ordered for a Blackened chicken sandwich which was mediocre. Overall a good experience and I would definitely come.back for the crab claws.

We were seated quickly and the chicken and sausage gumbo was great. Past that it was a painful experience.

While we were seated immediately, it took 15 minutes before we saw our waiter, from there it took another 15 before he took our order, then it took a full hour to actually get our food...all of which was basic "scoop this out of a large batch" type of food (gumbo, red beans and rice, salad).

We didn't see our waiter at all during the hour long wait for our food and he made no effort to apologize or offer some sort of appetizer during the wait.

I had high hopes for this place...maybe we just came on an off night.

5 stars for balcony seating! 3 stars for food. The gumbo was delicious but my jambalaya was extremely dry, the rice cold, and the meat warm. I could definitely tell my food sat under a lamp awhile while the rest of my parties food was cooked.

Came in for my 40th Birthday Dinner. Ordered stuffed mushrooms, tasty; caprese, delicious; and the shrimp p.o-boy, very good!!! Our waiter, TY, made our dinning experience very memorable!!! He had the dinning room sing HB to me. He brought out a cupcake with a lit candle on it. He is the BOMB DOT COM!!! Will return when visiting NOLA again!!! Thabknyou so much TY, love ya!!!
Crab claws were the best thing on the menu. My wife had shrimp poboy and she said it was just okay. I had the crawfish etouffe and it was good not great.
Great food and awesome service. We were able to eat on budget and it was really good.  Definitely better than the tourist traps.

First time in NOLA, first place we went for food. Yuck. Shrimp jambalaya, chicken gumbo and etouffee.. It tasted like frozen packaged food; not fresh, reheated, stale, HUGELY disappointing and NOT even close to the $80 charged. I'm actually nervous about our next meal cuz IDK where to go as this was recommended and gross.

This place was soooooo good & great service! We started with the crab tail appetizer, fucking amazing. For entrees: the crawfish raviolin OMGGGG & the blackened shrimp gumbo. So delicious. I'd like to go back and try the pescatore P:

Service :(

Don't get me wrong, everyone was very nice, but it was so hard to get ahold of someone! We ordered a dozen chargrilled oysters & a po boy sandwich with fries to share. We asked for an extra plate & ketchup that never came. This was the first time in my life that I ate food off of my napkin at a sit down restaurant lol. 

Chargrilled oysters were... pretty good. The alligator po boy was good! Wish it had some kind of sauce in it, but I would get it again.

We waited about 20 min for balcony seating. Kind of awkward seating, but worth the pretty view! Plus we were very lucky & had great music provided by a violinist on the across street corner - she made our dining experience a better one!!
Food was amazing. The staff were very polite and helpful with suggestions. Prices were middle of the road and definitely worth every penny.

Taste of new Orleans entrée is more than enough for a person. Crawfish etouffée is the best of the three samplings..
Crab claws appetizer was mouth watering.
Good place to enjoy Louisiana cuisine..
This is the best meal we have ever had in New Orleans. The Shrimp and Grits was amazing! Danny was so funny and great with our kids. We will be back!

Long wait time- finally seated. Waiter was rushed and distracted. First drink was delivered, never had a chance to order another.  Brought the appetizer (one was wrong) no silverware on the table, no waiter to bring it. Flagged down another server to get water to the table. Food arrived- wrong orders/food was not hot/ three plates were missing. Server blamed the kitchen- most were done eating before the server stopped back and he then "found" the three missing entrées! No apology no discount! Horrible experience. Would give Zero stars!

The good: The restaurant was near my hotel and had a wonderful street performer/violinist playing outside. The wait was also brief (about 10 minutes) with the restaurant having a decent appearance. The food was fair.
The bad: The service could have definitely been better. The waiter just seemed completely disinterested, I had to flag him down for simple things like water, or a glass for my beer (he just put the bottle on the table and walked away). The food took a while to come out to the point that by the time my appetizer came, I was already attempting to flag my waiter down for the check so I could leave and eat elsewhere. To top it all off, EVERYTHING that came out, from the appetizers to the main courses, was cold. Not even lukewarm but cold. Overall it was not what I would consider a great experience nor do I intend to return.

Yelp, your starry rating let me down. While Jesus' rebirth is a cause for celebration, the holy Trinity could not save this experience. Between late service, erroneous appetizer orders, and a general sense of doom from other patrons, I left praying for the rapture. Easter bunny wearing kids and sun burnt bros couldn't rally the atmosphere of a tourist trap guised as an authentic New Orleans experience. Save your money, go to your local grocer and buy the sh*t in a can. Don't worry about warming it up... because it's already an improvement cold.

How much was this delight? $79.92.

Super long wait for mediocre, room temperature food. Service wasn't friendly at all and the clientele are allowed to do anything they want, such as let their kids run around, yell, or drop F-bombs. 
It was a disappointing meal all around.

Stopped in for some oysters and beer.
 Good spot
Great service 
Waiter recommended some spots for us to see
Fun atmosphere

As expected there was a wait. We asked if there was open seats at the bar and were sat immediately. Our waiter was friendly as he was behind the bar the whole time cracking oysters. Service was great. I ordered fried alligator and it was very good. I also ordered the Taste of New Orleans and it wasn't all that great. My bf loved his oyster sampler.

Great location and very good food! However, they were out of one of the entrees we wanted and also out of one side item that came with another entree we ordered...that would have been ok, but they didn't say anything about it, maybe hoping that we wouldn't notice once we were served the meal?

Amazing food & drinks. The oysters were good, the rest of the food even better. Our quick dinner turned into a 3 hour highlight of our trip. The ambiance of the French Quarter with the live music from outside complimenting our evening. The best of all was our waiter Danny who was a blast!

The food was exquisitely made, although for the appetizer and sides I wish there was more to eat. Small portions for sides and fried alligator so you don't get your money's worth. However, when I checked-in with the Yelp app I got the appetizer for free. Anyways, my buddy ordered the oysters and it was large portions and fresh. The baked shrimp tortellini is good with the right balance of shrimp and tortellini noodles. If you don't mind the small sides portion that cost $4 then it's not a bad place to try.

Table service  was somewhat lacking; asked 3 separate times for condiments, plates, silverware. Gator was excellent (not at all chewy), catfish po-boy and etoufee were good, roast beef po-boy was bland and dry. Lunch entertainment was a shooting right outside our street seating, which was handled very well by entire staff - they had all patrons and the building secured within seconds.

Forty minute wait after ordering for mediocre food. The only reason we went there was for the shrimp boil and they ran out of shrimp, but waited a very long time to let us know. There were fragments of clam shell in my boyfriend's BLT. Definitely give this place a miss.

Pretty average. This is what I imagine it would be like if Applebees decided to open a restaurant in the French Quarter.
Ordered the shrimp jambalaya and the shrimp po boy. Jambalaya tasted like something you could buy in the freezer section of a grocery store, and the po boy was nothing more than plain bread with plain shrimp, lettuce, and tomato on it.
To be clear, nothing was "wrong." It just wasn't memorable. I wouldn't recommend this if someone asked me where to look for a great meal in New Orleans.
Red Fish Blackened (AMAZING), Crawfish Étouffée (not a fan), Crab Claw Appetizer (AMAZING), Cajun Bloody Mary(perfectly balanced) & Three Pears Pinot Grigio (smooth). Skyler provided great service!

Thank you Ashli!! Had an amazing dinner based on your suggestions! We had the shrimp tortellini and redfish with the bred pudding as a dessert. The food was sooo yummy! Would come again just to have Ashli as our waitress. We r stuffed, but with a happy stomach :)

We were seated on a nice balcony at a tiny table that was broken, dirty and shaking. We waited for a long time before anyone took drink order. When drinks did come the beer was warm and ice was partially melted. After another lengthy wait our order was finally taken.  Food came and was terrible. Appeared to be leftovers. Bread on poor boy was stale tasteless. The only bright spot was the food runner, Anthony, stopped after noticing the unbalanced table and attempted to fix it with a stack of napkins. Like most of this city this place appears to have given up. They rely on their reputation and drunk tourist. Don't waste your time or money here.

Cindy Cindy Cindy! As a former bartender she was one of the best I've seen so hopefully she's there when you go eat. Oh and order the the Bloody Mary! For food we had the crab claws and chargrilled oysters. Both were excellent!

Came in for lunch.  First of all, the service is great.  Server was friendly and food came out fast.  Order 1 dozen chargrilled oysters to start.  Each one had a speck of meat and pools of garlic and butter. Seafood stuffed mushrooms were delicious.  For entrees, the gator po boy was very good.  Could've had a little bit more gator in the sandwich.  Wife got the pecan crusted mahi mahi and it was a disappointment.  It was very hard to tell that any pecans were used.  Basically looked like a fried filet.  The entire dish came in swimming in butter.  Shrimp was super fishy.  She sent it back and got a po boy instead.  Verdict: if you're a foodie, this place might not be for you.  Stick to the sandwiches and simpler stuff.  

As I'm writing this, another server just spills drink on my back... she is nonchalant about it smh

Update: manager has come over and apologized for the spill, the reaction, and also has decided to take care of our meal.  Classy gesture to say the least.

Food was mediocre. Felt made for tourists as lacked much flavor. Waited ages for our check while we watched server with many of waitstaff smoking across the street. I would have ordered a second beer but no one ever asked.
Wonderful oyster bar highly recommended also if it's not crowded and you can sit upstairs it's nice to have that balcony seat their balconies are a little tight but it's still quite a bit of fun

Our food was cold our wonderful waitress Sydney came back have it heated for us  And she stood there to make sure that we try that that it would be hot.  Well I lied and told her that it was hot because I was starving.  Sydney all of these stars are for you and you only. You were incredible.
The shrimp creole was bland . The customer service was great but I wouldn't definitely not eat here again with so many other great choices nearby.

Royal House delivered! We walked in and were immediately seated at a table that overlooked St Louis St.
We ordered a glass of rosé and an Abita. Both were delicious. To start we ordered raw oysters on the half shell and they oysters were huge! I ordered french onion soup, lots of cheese and salt, but oh so good!
We also ordered the Taste or New Orleans and that had crawfish étouffée, red beans and rice, and jambalaya. All were very tasty, a bit salty and not much andouille in the jambalaya. 
Overall a great meal and great service. Loved the ambiance.
We were able to snag a seat upstairs, which was perfect with the breeze. Absolutely wonderful bloody Mary's. The charbroiled oysters were fantastic as well.

The food is really average, not good portion and extremely pricy. I had a shrimp and grit... the serving size was really small. It was like 24 dollars for a really really average shrimp and grit with small portion size. I am not sure why this place has so many stars

Great food and atomsphere!
Chargrilled Oysters were a plus. Must have the full dozen.
The gator was delicious however the portion size was very small. Not a shareable appetizer. 
Service was on point. Thanks to our server Tina. 
Ordered the shrimp creole...it was great our portion was not spicy. Great flavor though. 
Loved the fact of being seated near an open door to the street you could people watch. Plus it is off the beaten Bourbon street path.
Food was great! Very authentic New Orleans  atmosphere. Close to all the action on bourbon street but far enough away if you want to steer clear of the crowd.

The ambiance is pure New Orleans and gets 4 stars.  The view from the second floor balcony is 5 stars.  Unfortunately I ordered the chicken and shrimp jambalaya and it was barely edible.  I had wine as a chaser.  The only restaurant which makes their food from scratch is the Palace Cafe on Canal.  I suggest to try both restaurants.

I loved this restaurant. Most of the staff was very friendly and efficient, and our food came out within a reasonable amount of time (I hate when it's TOO fast) on a Monday around 8 pm. The spinach artichoke dip was different but delicious, and I HIGHLY recommend the fried oyster pasta! I thought the portions were smaller for the price, but will be back next time I'm in NOLA.
Jambalaya was dry as could be. No sauce. Redfish was good. Service was friendly for a place that turns and burns orders.

I am visiting from Houston and I was walking down bourbon and hanging out. Shortly after I left the restaurant I realized I had forgot my phone.  I was distraught and immediately tried to recover it from places we had went to after. This was Friday night and I knew that it might be difficult to locate my phone. But after looking around the host of the restaurant called me. I can't tell you how grateful I am that they did that.  To top it all off I offered the host money and he did not take it. What an amazing guy.  This is the definition of hospitality. I pulled out all the money in my pocket immediately and gave it to this man and he said no. To me that is powerful. These guys didn't have to call my us and let us know they had our phone but they did. Because of them I am able to continue my visit to this amazing city. Thank you!

If this place is not on your to eat list for NOLA, put it on now!  A must go to!

As the name states, located on popular Royal Street.  We came on Easter afternoon & was seated within 15 minutes.  We sat upstairs.  I wish I had asked to sit on the balcony because there was a parade going on that I wanted to see!  & when I, & others, went out to look, we were quickly redirected to sit back down in our section.  I do not understand why, because there was a lot of space & we were not interrupting people's meals.  It was truly annoying!

Other than that, customer service was very friendly.  Food came out quick & was very tasty!

Bloody Mary:  Strong!
Crab Claws:  I am seriously kicking myself right now for not order 2 of these!  It was definitely 1 of my top 5 things I had eaten in NOLA!  The sauce was killer yummy, so savory.  The crab claws were juicy, I could have eaten 100 of them.
Peel-n-Eat Shrimp:  Fresh & beasty!  Light butter sauce.  Served with corn-on-the-cob& boiled potatoes.
Fried Alligator:  Delicious, tender meat.
Pecan Pie:  Not your typical Pecan Pie.  Custard inside with pecans, & a graham cracker crust.  Different, but good, but I still like the original version better.  Vanilla ice cream for extra.

So great!
Service was awesome!
Food was awesome!
They catered to our very particular dietary restriction as best they could and did so with a smile at all times.
So great!
It was OK. Place is very run down and I didn't think the food was that great compared to so many others in the area. I would skip it - sorry.

Balcony seating had nicer view than at Chartres House.  Shrimp creole was okay.  I will try something else next time.  Other diner said crawfish etouffee (half was fried and half was not fried) was okay.
Relaxed ambience. Fast service. House salad wAsnt anything amazing but the shrimp creole was amazing. A very enjoyable Sunday meal.

I should have known better. After 50+ trips to New Orleans I usually know which places to avoid. And on a Tuesday at 11am, when all of the other area restaurants have a long wait, I decided to go to the Royal House which had just opened for the day.

Arrow greeted me at the door and he is terrific. Some other restaurant should hire him away because he is the kind of hard-working, jovial employee that makes customers want to come back. He even mentioned the bathroom location when seating me - a very nice touch. If only the food was worthy.

I ordered the Taste of New Orleans: Chicken & Andouille Jambalaya, Crawfish Etouffée and Chicken and Andouille Gumbo. I was flying home later that day and wanted one last taste.

The Jambalaya was more like dirty rice than Jambalaya. It was also dry.

The Gumbo was okay, nothing special.

The Etouffee had a tomato soup like base. It was so bad I couldn't eat it.

This is not a good place for these dishes. I should have went to Mothers or Acme. 

If you are going to eat here, ask for Arrow. He is the only reason for visiting.

This was my first restaurant in new orleans and did not disappoint.

French onion soup was probably the best I had anywhere with just the right amount of bitter saltiness and crusted cheese.

The mushroom w crab was amazing with the louisiana hot sauce.

Shrimp and grits seem to be a staple menu in this area so I never tried any others before but I was in for a pleasant surprise as the flavor of the shrimp had a perfect orgy w the grits and butter.

The sausage and beans were alright, wish I got the crawfish ravioli though..

Overall recommend!

Stopped in one afternoon to have lunch, and it was my favorite restaurant in the French Quarter. I had the tour of New Orleans very tasty and delicious. Now the brief broiled oysters were awesome, you must try them. 
 Service was spot on. I highly recommend if you are in New Orleans.

Last time we came to New Orleans we stopped at royal house for our first dinner and we were blown away. 
This time, the food was still good but it wasn't amazing. The bread was stale like it had been cut earlier that day. The restaurant was very busy and we were seated after the rush, but the service wasn't amazing as our drinks got to us after our food (no opportunity to have cocktails and then wine). 
The girls at the hostess station were delightful! Overall it was good and it's a great location, just not as magical as we had remembered.
The crab appetizer was great. I had the shrimp and my wife had the crawfish ravioli, both very good.

Amazing location, food and service! I sat in a window/door seat on the main floor of this bustling restaurant and watched/listened to a violinist across the street play Disney tunes. I enjoyed a Bloody Mary, raw oysters and stuffed mushrooms with a fabulous side of NOLA hospitality. Everything offered was amazing! Everything experienced was surreal! I love this place!

Order shrimp and grits and was not disappointed! For my first Cajun meal, this was great! Ate on the balcony and Raven our server was great. Wasn't a fan of the jambalaya but everything else was great!

Backstory: Only had a few hours left in New Orleans and was looking for a nice place to grab a bite with my colleagues. We read numerous reviews of places within walking distance and chose Royal House. 

We were promptly seated by a very nice waiter. I asked for suggestions and his answer was seafood pescatore. Not too surprised it was one of the most expensive menu options, but I went with his word and ordered it. 

Food took a reasonable time to come out. The place seemed well staffed, something I always appreciate. 

I was deeply disappointed when right on top were two empty mussel shells. Not only that, there was a closed off clam shell as well. I can look past this to a point, but was surely disappointed. Not only that, but there were shell bits throughout the bowl. Ouch!! I won't discredit the taste of the pasta though. The sauce had a nice heat and I really enjoyed it. 

My colleagues ordered gumbo that didn't come with a spoon. Uncertain if that was intentional or not. They both ordered the alligator bites and thought they were just okay, required the cocktail sauce it came with. 

The waiter started to lose our love for him as the lunch went on. He kind of disappeared. He offered me a refill and never brought it. My colleague requested more sauce and he never brought it. We asked twice for a split bill and he still delivered one check. 

Overall the experience was interesting. There was way too many potential restaurant options to probably ever go back.

Great oysters - raw and chargrilled are the best. Sit at the bar and enjoy great service. Shout out to Darnell. Shucks the oysters right in front of you. I come here every time I'm in New Orleans. You should too.

This was our second time here, and our last evening in NOLA. First time we had an amazing experience. This time, not so much. We showed up at around 9:15, after a wonderful hour of music at the Preservation Hall. My 9 year old was starving. We sat down and for a good 10 min, no one came to take our order. Eventually, a waiter- whose name is Jheran- came and took the order of someone who just got in. He was on his way back, with no intention of stopping at our table, when we stopped him and ask him politely to take our order because we are waiting for a long time and our daughter was starving. Well, I guess he didn't like us complaining, because 30 min after our food was not yet on the table. People around us ordered and finished. Our food arrived at 10:10, so 50 min after, brought by other waiter. My oysters were burned and dry, and instead of the nice toast that comes with it, there was this old piece of bread, lonely and cold. My mojito arrived after I got up and asked the bartender to make me one, probably 40 min after we ordered. He never came for water refills, my husband had to get up and ask the bartender for water. Needless to say, we complained to the manager who was super nice, listened, apologized sincerely for what happened and took care of the bill. What a sad way to finish our 6 days in NOLA. I truly hope that Jharen will receive at least a warning, he really ruined our beautiful evening.

Great Food, Great Service, Great Ambiance. Attending the French Quarter Fest from Maryland and looking for a break in the festivities. The Royal House fit the bill perfectly. The Crab Claws and the Eggplant Chips were divine! My waiter at the bar had just the right spirit and attention to detail. Check it out!
Went here on a rainy/stormy day.  The chargrilled oysters app was a must have. Great service friendly. Highly recommend it.

Came here on a whim our first night in town. So glad we did. The food was amazing. Ordered the Seafood Pescatore which was simply devine, felt like I was in Sicily or Tuscany, loved the recipe. The flavours were just out of this world, bravo to the chef on this dish. We also ordered the shrimp jambalaya ahhh the roux was delicious. 

This spot is crowded in the evenings however its definitely worth the wait. We were seated outdoors on a balcony overlooking the street. Now if the balcony didn't move everytime somebody moved we would've sat outdoors admiring the live music and the ambience but my fear of heights kicked in soo we requested indoor seating. Servers were great very accomadating.

Dessert was dissapointing, not a fan of their bread pudding or their chocolate cake but I was satisfied with their delicious entres and friendly service.
Fantastic cooked and raw clams! Great and friendly service. Had the alligator (it was real alligator meat not mixed) and shrimp po boy that was pretty good but the clams are the best!!

This place is so good! There are an abundance of great restaurants in New Orleans, but this place has really great fresh tasting oysters. Some of the best I've ever had. For appetizers we had the redfish beignets and the crab claws, and between my friends and I we had the crawfish ravioli, oyster pasta, shrimp and grits, and crawfish étouffée. Everything was so delicious. The cocktails were very good too and I was highly impressed with the service we received. Will definitely come back on my next trip to NOLA! A+

Stopped by here on a whim. Not bad! Service was delightful, when they were around, but they didn't stop in often. I had the seafood stuffed mushrooms (yum!) and the hush puppies (solid but nothing to write home about), and a rum-based cocktail that tasted like orange juice and bubble gum, but in a kinda good way? My table mates had the peel and eat shrimp (good), the caprese tower (not good - how can you call it caprese without basil?), the shrimp po boy (yum) and the burger (solid). The fries were delicious too. And we all shared the bananas foster cheesecake and DEMOLISHED it - it's "deconstructed", but, very good.

This is the best meal I have had in New Orleans yet! The atmosphere is amazing and the view is incomparable. We LOVED our waitress Corie and the service manager, Tasha, even came over and checked on us! They made us feel right at home. So sad it's our last night here - I would come back 1,000 times! Corie and Tasha- you're the best! San Antonio Zoo 's Royal House!!!

We stopped here for a snack. My husband got the dozen oysters on the half shell and I ordered the spinach artichoke dip. I was satisfied with the dip. It was very spinachy but in a good way. The tortilla chips were freshly fried and good/warm. My hurricane was expensive but good, as with my husbands dark and stormy. The highlight was the oysters. These babies were HUGE and he was incredibly happy with them. $16 for a bakers dozen is a great price especially when the oysters are monsters. Highly recommend this place for them!!

Great Cajun food with a a very helpful server. He help 8 guys maneuver through the menu. The food was wonderful. The oysters were super fresh. The fried alligator was super crispy and flavorful. I had he course that gave me a little bit of everything that New Orleans dining is about. Had a bowl of gumbo, a bowl of jambalaya and a crawfish etouffee. The crawfish etouffee was the best of the 3. Great restaurant with all the flavors New Orleans has to offer under one roof.

Came here on our last night of our NOLA trip based on the great reviews but I didn't care for this place at all. It was loud and had way too much going on. Between the busboys, TVs and the patrons, it gave off more of a bar feel than a sit down restaurant. Food was subpar. I got the blackened Redfish which wasn't all that, especially for the price.

The French Quarter festival ends, but the eating continues. Royal House was overflowing as much as any other restaurant in the French quarter. There were just enough bar seats with our names on em, so there was no wait. I tried 4 different oysters and they aren't my thing, but the gator Poboy was a hit. The bar service was top notch.

Checked in and got a free appetizer. Fried eggplant was perfect. 
Shrimp/grits and red beans and rice for entrees. Both on point. 
Bread pudding was awesome. Great twist on a classic.

One Star. That is a pretty tough rating to give, but this place worked for it. I think I can safely say I had one of the strangest dining experiences here. 

After doing my homework before the trip, this place was bookmarked because they offered a "Taste of New Orleans" dish and the reviews here seemed excellent. So, off we went. And, just for good measure, I am going to copy/paste right from their site as it currently reads: Taste of New Orleans $18.00
A sampling of the city's most famous dishes: Chicken & Andouille Jambalaya, Crawfish Etouffée and Chicken and Andouille Gumbo.

Weird that I did that, right? Well, yeah, it is weird and so is this story. 
Sat down. Pulled up Yelp for the discount (free appetizer) and was informed that I had to buy 2 entrees if I wanted to use it. Done, no problem, we had already planned to anyway. We opted for the alligator bites and ordered some drinks while my husband worked on deciding what he wanted. Finally came time to order and I ordered the Taste of New Orleans and the waitress informed me they were out of it. So, I asked which part they were out of (thinking I could still get it and just be short one of them, which would have been cool with me) and she said, well we actually aren't out of it but we don't have the right dishes. Oh? Ok. So, I said I needed another minute to think it over. After thinking about it I asked if maybe they could just put it in the to-go containers and I would eat it that way? She said no because the manager didn't like how it looked on the table, which I totally get. SO, THEN I said, hmmm well, I think I will just get it to go and we will find a little park to eat in outside and she said no she couldn't do that because they were all out of it. After looping through the whole, "which part?", "well, we have everything but we can't serve it" routine, she basically was just like, look, this menu item is not available for purchase. LOL HUH? 

Really guys, this happened. AND THEN the alligator bites come out (which were OUTSTANDING by the way!) low and behold the dish they were served in, a little crock. Honestly, the exact thing this trio would have been served on. At this point, I knew a few things. I knew I wouldn't be giving this place any more of my business, I knew my Yelp coupon would be voided and I knew that I was beyond annoyed. SO, I did something I rarely do, asked to.....speak to the manager...it actually hurts to type it. Anyways, manager guy comes over and rude as can be and says YOU CANT ORDER IT, WE DON'T HAVE THE PROPER DISHES THEY ARE ON BACK ORDER and walks away. (LOL???????) HUH?

So. This happened. Just to clarify- the place had bowls, the place had smaller crocks, the place had plates and anything from that trio could have been ordered on it's own. I was and still am perplexed at this whole scenario. Honestly. It is not my nature to cause a stink, but I couldn't let this go for some reason, mostly because it made ZERO sense. FIND A WAY. That's it. Like seriously. Especially if the nagging customer (me) asked about it for like 15 minutes in 15 different ways! YEESH! 

There are too many excellent choices for grubbing in NOLA, skip this one!

Asked for extra toast for the crab appetizer and was informed it would cost an extra .50 - really? Like a couple of pieces of toast is going to break you? Sorry - that is so BS 
Food was good but it was cold - we told them and the manager apologized and offered to take it back - uh no thank you. 
I had to hunt for a spoon to eat the etoufee with - it's basically a stew, you need a spoon.  It took 20 minutes to get the bill and another 15 to check out. Sooo not happy. 
     I would not recommend this place .

I arrived for breakfast.  Sat upstairs.  The food was excellent, the location was awesome and my waitress Ariela (?sp) was superb.   Wow, could not have asked for a better place.   OH, yes the Hurricane that I drank at 10 am was the bomb.  Thank you.  LOL

I had such an amazing time and experience the food was was so amazing I cannot explain how amazing the food was and the service was 1000/10 gaynelle was awesome and so was Tasha and our server everyone there did a wonderful job serving cooking and assisting Tasha gaynelle and our server where absolutely amazing and so was everyone just working around the restaurant was so kind AMAZING SERVICE and FOOD
My girlfriend found royal house on yelp. It lived up to the hype for sure. Hush puppies were phenomenal and the crab legs were full of flavor. We enjoyed the Nawlins ambiance!

Great Oysters, broiled, butter parmesan, raw etc. Ok, bread pudding. Great service by Jazz, attentive and efficient. We also had the blackend fish a little dry. She will answer all of your out of town questions. Get there early or you will be on the waiting list.

This is a testament to Yelp is a good place to find bad places, a bad place to find good places.  

Royal House was good....not great, not worth the "premium" pricing, but it is in a hotspot of a location.  Make sure you check in to get the free appetizer!

Shrimp and grits was good (though my son says it is a little dry), the crawfish etouffee was above average, but nothing we had in our meal justified the 90 minute wait (our fault, I know) nor the six figure bill for 5 (3 of whom were kids).

Side note, having ate at a few places (check out my other reviews) I'm a firm believer Cajun cooking is very over-rated.

Worst experience of my life. Waited for more than 1 hour for my order and left the restaurant without any food

Did I say worst experience ever!!!!

This place is so yummy! The staff was beyond accommodating and got my family of four two balcony tables next to each other (they only have two seat tables on the balcony) and our waiter was super sweet and attentive. The food was delicious and came out fast despite being so busy. So happy i happened upon this place

The restaurant was great. I was kind of disappointed that they made us wait outside while our table was ready but either way we were seated within 15 min and the service was fantastic the server was quick and entertained us. The food was great and didn't take too long to get to us even through they were super busy. The server even offered to take our photo as we were celebrating a friends birthday. Thank you it was definitely a good night.

Place was packed, stood on the street over 2hours, watched patrons walk out, 20 plus, and establishment seated no one.  Management is terrible, and service is even worse. Started out a 20 minute wait, turned into indefinite. Servers had no answers. Might be a great place if all is well, but our experience was terrible. Had to find a restaurant at 830. Not easy. Avoid them if you have to wait, as they aren't very honest to their customers

Cool location (we were seated on the balcony), servers are really kind. 
I highly recommend the grilled oysters, ravioli with crab sauce and the redfish!!!! And the banana cheesecake:)
I would definitively recommend this place!

I was here on 4/1 and overall enjoyed my dining experience with my female group except for the black female manager who dismissed our concerns about the tiny chargrill oysters that we were served. As weird and slow as our white male server was the manager was the most offensive. Stop thinking people want free food and do your job and provide real hospitality!!
We ordered a dozen oysters that were very obviously pre-shucked and dry looking. We didn't end up ordering anything else and found somewhere else to have dinner
Business dinner. Great recommendation for a Monday night. Excellent seafood and drinks. Incredibly quaint atmosphere. Thank you Royal House!

Well, let's just say that there wasn't much royal about the Royal House.  Our food was bland and our wait staff was too.  We ordered the Char Grilled Oysters which came half an hour late and certainly weren't worth the wait.  We also ordered the Shrimp and Grits which were underwhelming and too salty.  Lastly we had the New Orleans Sampler which should have been called the Katrina Sampler because it was nothing short of a disaster.  We would be remiss, however, if we didn't note a few nice things about the place.  The best was our bartender.  He was the highlight of our meal.  We also loved our seat on the balcony overlooking the street below.  If you come here, by all means wait for a balcony table.  It's worth it.  We also appreciated our host for helping us to get said balcony table.  This place has all the makings for a great restaurant, but unfortunately it failed to reach its potential.

Incredible little spot in a beautiful building. Sit upstairs near the windows for a gorgeous French Quarter view. Everything on the menu looked amazing and left me wishing I could order 5 meals. Nice wine list, too. I decided on the crawfish ravioli at the recommendation of our sweet waitress and it was heavenly. Plan a meal here during your NOLA stay; it won't disappoint!

I was in NOLA for a quick trip to visit my friend. I have been to NOLA twice before. I wanted to sit on a balcony in the quarter since I never had previously. Sadly most places only sit two tops on balconies, so I was out of luck at this place too. 

When we arrived there were lots of people waiting outside but we were seated upstairs immediately. We were promptly greeted by the waitress. Not sure if there were specials, as none were offered. We ordered Spinach Dip and 1/2 doz raw oysters to start. Spinach dip was 3/5. Could have used a tad more flavor. We ordered Shrimp Creole to share for dinner. The flavor of the sauce was great, could have used more spice. We fixed that up with some Crystal Sauce. No biggie. Prices were mid range for the kind of restaurant in the quarter. Service could have been a tad better. We had to summon the waitress several times. Oysters took a super long time to come out. We needed drink refills and we also had to ask for the check. Overall, it was a Louisiana style restaurant with dishes typical to the area which is what we were looking for. I may return but there are so many other places to try out first!

Came with my 3 friends on a bar hopping excursion. We sat a the bar and had great and friendly service. I at the Alligator nuggets (on my NOLA culinary bucket list) - sooo delicious! They were tender and fried to perfection! Everyone really enjoyed their cocktails and the ambiance was really chill. I would go back, perhaps next time to eat a full meal or sit on the balcony upstairs.

Oysters were good! Two of them looked a little off so I did not eat them but the rest we fantastic. We were able to sit down right away but there was a long time as we were leaving. My friend ordered the peel and eat shrimp. Was a little spicy but great. The waitress was extremely nice!

The best oysters in New Orleans! We tried a few places and this was by far the best. Came in with a large group and everyone was very happy with their order. The waitress was a lot of fun and made good suggustionsm. All around awesome place.

We were celebrating my friends birthday. Walking down Royal street we see this beautiful vintage restaurant and thought it was worth a try. We ordered: spinach dip, oyster BLT; chargrilled oysters; and french onion soup. All of food came out cold. The chargrilled oysters are supposed to come straight out of a broiler, these were lukewarm and had a gross texture. The spinach dip cheese was cold; fries cold; french onion soup luke warm. The BLT had no tomato. I could see one item coming out cold but all of them (especially the oysters?)

The manager apologized and took items off the bill but it wasn't the money principal - our celebration for our friend was not the way you want to remember a birthday meal. I would not recommend Royal House.

I was with a group that was looking for those classic Creole dishes you think of when you think of New Orleans, otherwise I probably wouldn't have stopped in here.  I hate to say anything negative because the staff was very accommodating, seating all 12 of us together immediately and without complaint and our server was very kind and attentive, but this food was not good.  Everything I tasted, save the crab claws which were actually really delicious, was bland, under-seasoned and lukewarm.  Luckily, I seemed to be the only one who knew it.

Looking for authentic creole cuisine? This is your place. We got there around 12 and had some mimosas. We started off with an appetizer that was some type of crab legs and sauce. So freaking yummy! Then we had the baked oysters! Legit some of the best oysters I've ever tasted. Everything was seasoned so well. They only thing I wish was that everything was a little bit hotter. But other than that. This is a place you need to stop by in N/O.

First, the waiter was great; he made up for the dinner, what the food was lacking.  This was our second evening in NOLA, so we wanted to try a different place and this restaurant was recommended. We tried the Oysters Royal, this was our first mistake; the oysters were not that great, quite dry to be exact.  We should has went with the chargrilled oysters. I've had Shrimp 'm Grits from Virginia to Florida; I would rank this dish as the worst. The grits was dry. Being from SC, I'm use to grits being creamy. The Cajun Brown Jambalaya was dry and lacking flavor; I had to add plenty of hot sauce. My wife had the  Seafood Pescatore, it was bland she asked for parmesan cheese to try and add flavor. She also had the cole slaw; she sent it back, as it was tan in color and the taste was not quite right. The seafood stuffed mushroom and the bread pudding were okay, nothing to write home to Mom about. We probably will not be returning.

Spent $90 on brunch. Yikes. Two drinks, one breakfast item. Got there around right when menus switched to lunch so we waited about 5 minutes to order from that menu. Ordered gator bites which were very over priced for a tiny portion. Two speciality drinks were very good but we waited 15-20 minutes since we ordered them to actually receive them! This wasn't during a busy hour either  (on a Monday). Worst part we're they oysters. Slimy slimy slimy. Couldn't finish them for the life of me. Service was slow... no apology for drinks coming out late and had to physically get up to find her to close out my check. Came here from out of state but I wouldn't recommend going to this tourist trap even if yelp says they give you a free appetizer for the "entree" purchases. Sorry everyone

Get the crab claw appetizer! The sauce that it is in is delicious! You get 4 slices of bread with it too to sob up the sauce.

I also had the Bloody Mary. The veggies in it were pickled, loved the green bean. Pretty decent Bloody Mary.
Breakfast before jazz fest. Fried oysters as part of your Benedict is base building at its best.

Sad, sad sad. Quite honestly some of the worst BBQ shrimp and grits I've ever had the displeasure of eating. And unfortunately, our meals took an hour to come out. I love New Orleans, I love good restaurants, this is not it. Move on...and consider yourself lucky that I've taken one for the team.

Ehhh no.... this is the first time visiting New Orleans and this place wasn't great. I thought getting creole and Cajun food meant tons of flavor and some spice. This place was not it. Service was great, portion size was great and we were seated immediately which was a plus but the food was way to bland. Don't recommend it at all.

Great location.  Very small portions for the price. It is painful to dine here. The gumbo was not very good and it lacked that home made taste, just a notch better than Cambell's soup. The $19 crawfish ettoufee is a rip off and not much better than the gumbo. I would go so far as to say it may be canned soup with fried crawfish, about six or seven small ones. The service is friendly but amateurish as orders get mixed up and the server has to be reminded of a drink order. Overall, a poor representation of good New Orleans food and one should pass on this restaurant and find someplace else. Plan on leaving hungry too. Its location saves it from going out of business.

Very good despite the fact that it is in the heart of the FQ. Great place for oysters of any kind and the food was good too. We walked up Royal to the quieter side away from Canal St and found the best shops.
The barbecued oysters are outstanding.  Still.   A dozen for $20.  Full bar.  You should do it!

Couldn't tell you how the food was. Sat there for twenty minutes while the waitress continued to tell us be right with you. The restaurant was not even busy and they had plenty of staff there. Worst service ever.
Oysters have no taste and service was ok. Save your time and money, go Drago's for better oysters, both charbroiled and regular.

Good food and great service! For our last night in NOLA we didn't want to stray too far from the french quarter since it was 9:30 pm on a Monday, so we decided to check out Royal House.  At first I was a little scared since the 2 previous places we ate at in the French quarter were failures (specially 1 in particular and Yelp reviews being total lies). So I didn't go in with high expectations and wasn't going to be fooled by the 4 stars on yelp. However, I was blown away with the service and good. Our server (sorry, I didn't get his name) was outstanding, honest with the menu and made great suggestions. We had the crab claws as the appetizer (discounted or free if you check in through yelp) - they were veeerryyyy tasty. The sauce was too die for. For the entrees we had the blackened redfish that was seasoned perfectly and we also got a shrimp po-boy. Check them out, but maybe not when it's too busy.
So So So Good!! I had happy food feet! Love this place! Amazing service and food! The steak was incredible , so was the Ahi and the eggplant chips.

Each time I come to New Orleans, I stop by Royal House. I love the ambiance and the prices are reasonable for the type/caliber of restaurant. Today was the first time I had the opportunity to sit on the balcony. Great view and great food, what could be better?

I came with my mom (her first time here and NOLA) and we started with the crab claws. Hands down my favorite thing on the menu. I also got oysters. The charbroiled were the best. I'm a big oyster connoisseur so I tried two of each (Rockefeller, Royale and Charbroiled). Skip the other two and go right for Charbroiled. It's totally worth it! Last, I got an oyster po'boy BLT. Yum. The sauce is great. I added a dash of hot sauce and was a happy clam. 

Our server Billy was amazing and made us feel welcome and happy.

The only ding I'll give is my drink. I got a Makers 46 julep. It was a bit watery. Other than that, all around great lunch.

The service was excellent. Very friendly and quick. The crab claw appetizer was great. The sauce is incredible. I just wished the crab claws were bigger. They are baby size. Had the crab boil. It was good. My sister had the crawfish ravioli and said it was just ok. It needed more flavor. My other sister had the redfish and said it was very good and flavored. My third sister had the shrimp creole and said it was good. Very flavorful . We shared the banana foster dessert and bread pudding. Bread pudding was a little dry. They were pretty but just ok. No wow factor . We all would eat there again . Reasonable prices

Amazing. Just starting with the friendly staff to the amazing food.  We decided to the famous Crab Claws. As advertised, the sauce will make you wanna lick the bowl. Then we tried the Alligator it made you think it was the other white meet. Tender and tasty. On the the main course Red Beans and rice with fried Chicken and Sausage. It was a wrap up of a fantastic night.

We were in search for Chargrilled Oysters at around 9:30pm, and this was the only place famous restaurant which was open till late. And thank you very much for that.
Our service guy was very enthusiastic and took good care of us and also recommended what to have. So we ended up having Shrimp Creole, a dozen Chargrilled Oysters and Blackened Redfish. 
Man-O-Man the Shrimp Creole was fantastic served in the tomato sauce and little bit of lemon on it, definitely finger licking good. The Chargrilled Oysters and Blackened Redfish were great too.

This place was awesome! Crawfish ravioli was delicious, the sauce was flavorful and the raviolis packed. The crab claw appetizer was outstanding. We ordered more bread for the sauce. Try the seafood pescatore was full of seafood and the scampi sauce was perfect. The New Orleans trio was a perfect intro to New Orleans.

We got here and got seated quick...which was really good. The food was great , but the service was really slow. Bummer , because we had a great time here but the service wrecked the score. On a positive note, the dessert( pecan pie)was awesome!
My boyfriend and I were in New Orleans for 5 days and went to Royal House 3x. The chargrilled oysters were amazing, as were the poboys and jumbo shrimp. Would recommend to anyone!

Blah. Oysters combo - mushy and non-descript toppings, small oysters.  Red beans & rice side order was very average. Inside is quaint, drinks were fine. Prices were not too bad considering the quality. I suspect the Hyatt concierge that recommended it must have a relative that owns/works there.
horrible service.  after waiting for a bowl of gumbo and a po boy for half an hour, walked out.

I was genuinely excited to try this place out. First the interior, you are in such close quarters that whenever someone walks by you are constantly getting bumped. The service is slow, we ordered our appetizer and by the time we got our appetizer midway through our main course arrived. Now i ordered the roast beef po boy, terrible choice because the meat was way too salty and the gravy that came with it was not a good mix with the bread. The only upside of this experience was the redfish beignet appetizer which was much better than the entree. I would say not the best experience as there are too many other great places to try in this area for me to come back to this place.

The Redfish Beignets and Crab Claws were phenomenal! Entrees took a little long but my waiter Aaron was the best service I had my entire trip! So genuine and on top of his game and his smile was infectious! Again the best service I've had my entire trip THANKS AARON
Very blah. Stuffed mushrooms are soggy, service is super slow, their shrimp tortellini is missing the shrimp and came out cold. Their grilled oysters are nasty, not cooked. Just horrible, avoid.

We were seated promptly on a Sunday evening, and the order was taken almost immediately, including crab claws, chargrilled oysters, crawfish ravioli, and a taster. We waited 45min, and were only told that the kitchen was behind when we looked for our waitress. 

Crab Claws 4/5 - The crab claws contain minimal meat, but the sauce was incredible. No complaint with coupon.

Chargrilled oysters 3/5 - the oysters taste similar as surrounding restaurant offerings, however, they were dry and chewy, with strong indication of being overcooked.

Crawfish Ravioli 2/5 - dry and chewy. Most flavor came from the tomato sauce, with some texture of crawfish. I prefer Trader Joe lobster ravioli.....

The meal ended up taking 2 hours, including an hour wait between ordering and receiving food. With the service and price, the time and money can be better spent elsewhere.

Wow! This place is wonderful! Christopher our wonderful and friendly server! Thank you for your hospitality. The manager she was super nice. She comp'd our appetizer because the kitchen made a mistake and served our entrees before the appetizer.

We had the crab claws (super flavorful and pure heavenly delicious), the shrimp creole and the shrimp PO boy. The food was just bursting with flavors and not heavy at all!!!

What a great and positive experience here at the Royal House!

My friend and I popped in for a light lunch. We really enjoyed our meal. We shared oysters and the crawfish etouffee.
My friend ordered a hurricane- she said it was just right. 
Our server, Ariel, was very sweet and attentive. We actually walked past the restaurant again later that night and talked to the manager about how sweet our server was and left a second tip. 
We will be back.

Found this place on yelp and we were not disappointed!  Food was great, staff super friendly and charming atmosphere. Exactly what you'd want for ideal local flavor. We had best of New Orleans and broiled oysters--both very god and bread pudding was superb!

Great service with great atmosphere!  I had the New Orleans Sampler which was great.  Gumbo all the way!  We got a table in a corner which had a view to the street, and on the corner a violinist playing!  Loved the place and the food!

It was our first time coming and it was not a good experience. We ordered grilled oysters over the phone. The conversation was awkward because the person taking our order was basically trying to get us to not order. She seemed frustrated and annoyed. According to her, it was about 15 minutes before the kitchen closed. We asked if we were able to place the order or not. Whoever took our order had an attitude. She couldn't say no but we could tell she didn't want us to. I work food service and retail too so if it was that serious, I would just have said the kitchen is closed or the order can't be placed. At that point, it was whatever. We get it. We just want to get our food and leave. We get there 5 minutes later to pay and the had to correct the order. It was still pretty busy at the time but the staff just seemed annoyed overall. It was just really unprofessional. We ordered a lot so we didn't mind that the boxes were stuck together. When we got home, we noticed our oysters were undercooked. We tried to eat them anyway because we spent about $70 on them. We tried adding our own butter and cheese on them because they didn't give is the standard amount. The taste was mediocre. It was just really low quality. We couldn't even finish them.

Had the Taste Of New Orleans, the crawfish was amazing! Great flavor. The gumbo was okay not my favorite but wasn't horrible. I loved the jambalaya. I added shrimp to my meal and it was just what I was looking for! Definitely worth checking out.

My friend and I wandered in on our first day in NOLA for a lunch. Our biggest mistake was eating at Royal House first because we had such high standards for cajun cuisine after eating here (no other restaurant could compare). 

We ordered the crab claws, a few po boys, and char-grilled oysters. The po boys were perfectly fine, but the oysters and crab claws were absolutely divine. The sauce with the crab claws was a tangy deliciousness that had a 'homestyle cooking' feel. The oysters were not rubbery and grilled to perfection. I highly recommend eating here to anyone who wants to experience good N'awlins-style cookin.
Had lunch there, Shrimp Poor boy, great roll, great shrimp, fries sub par.  Wife's shrimp Caprese salad very good.  Service by Eric very good.  Overall a nice spot

This place had a 4 star rating and was so off base. The food was very poor quality and over priced. Extremely noises and they seemed to only cater to you if you were drinking alcohol. The table we had was the worst in the place, constant parade of wait staff and customers to the point that my hair was blowing from the movement.

This place is fantastic. Been multiple times and it's a staple when I am in New Orleans. It looks like a cafe you would expect to get on bourbon st. Servers are friendly and helpful. If any menu questions ask them!
