Always start with the oysters. All of them are good but I would stay away from the rockafeller.  They are tasty, but you can get those anywhere. Go with the royale and chargrilled.  Very good and not something you find elsewhere. The raw are fantastic too if you prefer those (which I do!)

Also we got some crab claws in a creamy tomato sauce. This is fantastic!  Get extra bread right away because you will want it to soak up every bit of that sauce. 


I went with the shrimp po boy. Bread was fresh, soft inside and nice crunch on outside to give texture and hold the sandwiches shape. Shrimp were fried nicely. Not heavy and oils but light and fluffy. You could go next level by using sauce from crab claw app above as condiment!

For your sides don't get the fries. French fries are the same everywhere. Get the Jumbalaya or gumbo subbed in.  They are much better and you are in New Orleans right?

Must stop location and you can't go wrong.

Just not that good. Lots of reviews and 4.5 stars. Should have been way better.

Crawfish ettouffe tasted like bland gravy. Could have been fried anything in there, crawfish, shrimp? Who knows. Tasted like nothing.

Wife had the pecan crusted halibut and shrimp. No pecans, it was just fried. The sauce on top was just buffalo sauce as if it were a chicken wing.

Very disappointed, especially for New Orleans.

pretty damn sorry.   one of the worst meals in a city where everything tastes good.  must have worked on food tasting mediocre because they achieved that well. go elsewhere to not be disappointed.  waitress was great but she didn't cook any of the sorry food served us. amazing that an established place in food capitol of us would serve etouffe with breaded fried crawfish.  my wife was aghast and heartbroken.  bottom line- food sucked.  dont bother with so many great places to eat in Nawlins.
Our server was so sweet. The food was ok, my dish better than what my best friend ordered which had left over water/shrimp broth in her salad. But overall it was nice.

Started out with stuffed mushrooms. They were cold and had no flavor.  Next had fried alligator and gumbo.  The gumbo was a disappointment.  Put lord of hot sauce in to make it better.  Gator was great.
Food was delicious! Service was great! Seriously can't wait to be back! Had the gator bites, taste of New Orleans and Jambalaya and everything was delicious!

Our waiter Chris was awesome, he made our experience much better. The oysters plates had nothing to rave about.  They were dry and not very good.  We had them much juicer and better prepared/cooked at Acme.

We decided to get a yelp account only to review this restaurant. Worst restaurant in New Orleans so far. We were enjoying a nice walk in the French quarter, then we decided to go for lunch in this restaurant: affordable prices and they gave us a seat in a nice balcony immediately. The waitress brought us the menu, and water. We ordered a po-boy and an oyster beignet with potatoes. So far so good. And then our watch begun. The watch of our waitress walking by but never bringing us our food. Oh wait, she brought us more water. After 1 h and 15 minutes we decided to leave so we told the waitress. She called the manager. He comes and says "how do you want this thing to be handled?" Don't know man, you tell me. We left. Hungry but well hydrated. We decided to go get some food somewhere else, but that's a whole new story. In conclusion, if on a Saturday morning you are thirsty, highly recommended. If you are hungry, keep walking. And so, our watch has ended.

Voodoo juice
Hurricane
Taste of New Orleans- Chicken & Andouille Jambalaya, Crawfish Etouffée and Chicken and Andouille Gumbo
Crab claws as appetizers- this is a must. We were sopping up the sauce with the bread
Red beans with Andouille sausage and rice- also a must

Amazing food today. I inhaled it honestly. The eggplant parmesan was pure gold. Danny attented us and our specific food accommodations, and the wonderful manager Tasha made us feel at home. As good as our experience was, our only disappointment were the other patrons. We saw two tables eat all their food, then proceed to complain asking for compensation. Shameful that on Mother's Day we couldn't enjoy our meal without people trying to pull one over.

I had a pretty awful experience for dinner at Royal House. I want to include all the details, so I apologize for the length of this review. It started off right. Our server, Danny, was personable and had great recommendations for the table. We had entered the place ready to enjoy ourselves, and he was delivering a great experience. Everyone in my party was there for the seafood, and I had called ahead to ensure they would be able to make one of their dishes vegetarian. I am always a little wary of places being understanding about dietary restrictions. My restriction is not a casual preference, but a deep religious belief, and respect of additional questions I have is very important. The host who answered when I called volunteered that one of the dishes I was looking at was fried in the same oil as meat, so Royal House seemed to be one of the establishments that respected restrictions. My experience when I received my food, however, was very different.

The appetizers we had were all decent. When the entrees came out, the food runner put mine down and mentioned oysters. I asked if there were oysters in the dish, since I had ordered without. He said he didn't know, he just ran the food, and that was the name of the dish. Fair enough. I asked if our server or someone else would be available to confirm. He then got defensive and said he was just someone who brought the food, and how was he supposed to know what was in my dish? If the server had put a note in, I would be fine. I know from experience that notes are often missed in busy kitchens. It is much better for me to confirm then have a surprise reaction to my dish. After a few minutes back and forth asking to speak with someone who would know, he told me that the dish actually didn't have oysters. The oysters would be on top. At this point, I needed to be certain there hadn't been a mixup. This is where things really went downhill with disrespectful service.

Danny had been busy and I couldn't find him, so I asked the hostess if she could confirm with the kitchen. The manager on duty that night came to address me, and immediately approached the conversation as if I were being unreasonable. She told me that she apologized that the food runner called my dish by its name, which included oysters, but the oysters would be on top of my dish so there were no oysters in the dish. I said I understood, but I really wanted her to check with the kitchen and confirm the dish, as made, was 100% vegetarian. Kitchens add animal fats, Worcestershire sauce, oyster sauce, and other ingredients all the time. She told me she didn't need to check with the kitchen because she had worked in the kitchen, and the oysters would have been on top. This was reiterated to my four times. Each time, the manager refused to check with the kitchen. I believe the manager's name was Taia, but she was reluctant to give me her name. She told me she loved her guests, and she didn't know why I was treating her badly. I didn't feel I was treating her badly, but I really couldn't understand why she just couldn't confirm with the kitchen to make me comfortable. I started to get upset. She wouldn't look at me or address me with respect. She kept looking at one of the members of my party, who was also black, as if asking him to reason with me. I suddenly felt like I was being treated differently because of my Indian descent. When Danny returned to the table, he found me tearful. 

I didn't eat my meal. The manager later came over to give us the check and aggressively showed the members of the party the note about not having oysters in the dish. She did take that off of the bill, along with an order of oysters that had not arrived before our entrees. There was no other apology, because she felt she was fully correct in not double checking that my meal was safe for me to eat. 

At the end of the meal, she came back to our table, and asked if there was anything else she could do. I told her I would have been fine had she just checked with the kitchen, and tried to explain how serious my vegetarianism was. At this point she interrupted me and again told me I had been treating her very badly on Mother's Day. She actually suddenly decided to tell me she had checked with the kitchen, and told me she had checked with the kitchen four times. I had misunderstood her. This is another moment where I felt I was being treated differently by Taia due to my race. Perhaps she assumed English wasn't my first language. I had been stubborn about needing this confirmation earlier to feel safe, and she had explicitly told me that she would not do it. I know I did not misunderstand her. She then accused me of not saying thank you like other members in our party. I certainly had nothing I felt thankful about when it came to her service. Our waiter Danny had received plenty of thanks. I was extremely upset about the way I was treated here. The food was fine, but this sort of disrespect was unacceptable.

Fond memories from our prior visit brought us back to Royal House.   However, this was by far our most expensive and by far the worst meal in New Orleans on our recent trip.   Food was way over cooked and not great.   Had the seafood boil and couldn't even get the shrimp skins off, they were out of lobster, substituted crab and could barely get the crab out.  Had the oysters, 3 types, and 2 were way over cooked.  The chargrilled ones were good but the Royal and Rockefeller were OK but dry and over cooked.   I would find other places to go on your visit...

Fantastic bloody mary's.  Spent the night on bourbon street and Cindy single handedly cured our hangovers with one drink. Make sure you stop in when you're in the french quarter. Awesome staff, true/sincere southern hospitalty.

Amazing food. The crab claw appetizer was our favorite. Really good Bloody Mary. Lovely atmosphere.   

Crab Claws
Seafood stuffed mushrooms 
Oyster Duo
My new favorite restaurant in New Orleans French Quarter. Excellent food and amazing wait staff.

The restaurant it gorgeous, staff is amazing and welcoming, the food wasn't all that great. Ordered some alligator, shrimp dish, and oysters (chargrilled). The oysters at Drago's were better. The shrimp dish wasn't good at all but the alligator was phenomenal. Wish I wldve jus stuck with the 8 dollar gator vs the 70.00 bill. Will come back if the food gets better.

Good food but the wait was long and we didn't get our food for over an hour! Our waiter was genial and courteous but the fact that 3 other tables received their food and left before we got our food was unacceptable. Never coming again which is unfortunate because the food was decent
Food was ok.  Cocktails were very bad!!  We were very surprised this place had such high ratings.

The stuffed mushrooms were great! French onion soup was also a home run! We had po-boys and they were bland. Given...this was our first time having any type of po-boy sandwich but I expected more. Maybe they're just not for me. Service was nice

First time in NOLA. Had the crab claws, loved, loved, loved it! Then came the Taste of New Orleans. I loved two out of the three. I definitely would come again though and try more from the yummy menu.
Sitting on the ledge of the restaurant is a great way to spend any night of the week.
Great little spot in the French Quarter. Walked in and were seated on the balcony immediately. Lots of local dishes which is really fun for out-of-Towners. Our waitress Rebecca was really sweet!

The chargrilled oysters were so delicious! Ordered a half a dozen and wished I'd ordered more. 

I ordered the taste of New Orleans which came with  three small dishes: Chicken & Andouille Jambalaya, Crawfish Etouffée and Chicken and Andouille Gumbo.

The Jambalaya and the Etouffée were absolutely amazing! The Gumbo was not that great compared to the other two dishes, it was very bland and lacked certain spices.

I don't know what happened to this place, but I came here 4 years ago when I was in town and it was amazing. This time though, it was disappointing. I don't know if they are under new management or what but the portions are smaller than before and the food wasn't nearly as good in my opinion. Also, from the time we ordered our food until the time we actually received it was about a 45 minute wait. My advice to anyone considering eating here is to just skip it.

Nice restaurant loved the location. Went there to sit on the balcony but the manager had closed it due to rain coming and there was no rain in the forecast, nor did it ever rain. So that was a bummer. I think she was too worried about smoking her numerous cigarettes across the street. Opted for a nice table over looking the sidewalk and had fun people watching. Food was great and thanks to yelp we got a free appetizer. Loved our waiter.

This place was great. The oysters were fresh and yummy. We had grilled oysters too and it was delicious.

We also had a couple of drinks like yellow submarine and margarita. I definitely recommend yellow submarine if you like something sweet.

With so many great food options in the French Quarter, save yourself some time and skip Royal House. 
The food was just Ok. I tried to order 2 different salads and they didn't have the ingredients for them (and one was a basic chicken Caesar salad). The chargrilled oysters had bits of shell in them, so did the crab claw appetizer. 
The worst part of our experience was when we tried to get our bill. The whole process took over 30 minutes, making us late for a tour. We were told it was taking so long because they were splitting the bill. They came and it was not split. We just paid and left. Never to come back.

First time in New Orleans and we have been going hunting down some of the best places to eat! 
The crab claw appetizer was absolutely AMAZING. Service was great !

Great food! I had the crab claws on the appetizer side of the menu. Plenty of portion for me, the sauce was EXCELLENT ! For dessert was the banana foster cheesecake, WOW!!! Got seated right away, we went around 4pm before the rush. My mom had fried oysters and hush puppies, and also had the stuffed mushrooms for my aunt. YUMMY!!!!!! A must try when in NOLA.

Good location! It's in the center of French Quarter. We ordered jambalaya and raw oysters. It comes with a free fried alligator which u must try. All the food are the Traditional New Orleans food！Wonderful experience！

I had high hopes for this place since they have over 3k reviews with 4 star rating. I was so disappointed because of my high expectations. First of all, we ordered pasta with the oyster, platter sampler, and some side dish. There was nothing to it no wow's. It takes very long time for the food to come out and the place wasn't even clean had some weird smells to it. I should have went to other restaurants this was total money waste for my taste.

Upon recommendation from Eric (Flambeaux Bicycle Tours), we decided to try it.  Ordered the New Orleans sampler, the crab claw appetizer, and a half order of the charbroiled oysters.  All of the food was great and received extra bread to soak up the crab claw sauce.  The service was good, but started a little slow.  Made for a great cool place for a snack and break from the heat/downpour.

Sat up at the bar and decided to start with a strawberry margarita and fried alligator! This was the first time I've tried alligator and I was pleasantly surprised! Tasted just like chicken to me!

The taste of New Orleans was so worth it! Between the chicken and andouille jambalaya, chicken and andouille gumbo, and the crawfish étouffée, it was so hard to pick a favorite. I might be leaning toward the crawfish étouffée. But I highly recommend this sampler! It's my first time to NOLA and it hasn't disappointed on the food front!
Best food, casual dress and atmosphere! One of my favorite NOLA eateries. Oysters are a favorite for sure.

Clean plates -- always a sign of a good meal. They were busy so our service was slow, but they were very communicative about it. 

We really liked the Taste of New Orleans plates, which let you try the gumbo, etouffee, and jambalaya. The spinach dip and crab claws also got rave reviews. Highly recommend.

We stopped into this place for some good Cajun food yesterday and we were not disappointed. We sat at the bar per usual and met the coolest, down to earth bartender! Her name is Cindy, and if you have the chance, go into The Royal House to see her!!! Along with the amazing crawfish ravioli we ordered and devoured, what really made the experience a memorable one was her witty, funny, and welcoming personality! She gave us great recommendations too! If you're from out of town and looking for a place to go with great food paired with great service and conversation, go see Cindy !

This restaurant is very good. We sat on the balcony and the ambiance was lovely. The seating on the balcony does lean, so that was a little unfortunate when it comes to getting your drinks. We ordered the alligator bites for an appetizer, I thought it was delicious and perfectly fried. I also ordered the Tom Collins drink, also delicious. The crawfish étouffée was by far my favorite on the item. I was indecisive about what to order, because so many items looked amazing, so I ordered the New Orleans sampler dish, which came with gumbo, étouffée, and the jambalaya. I recommend this place for lunch or dinner
The wait time for our food was 45 long. I ordered the Shrimp and Grits, which was great, but the proportion is small for the price I paid!
The food was pretty good and the environment was great. However, the food took almost an hour and half to come out and we didn't have good waitress service.

Just stopped in for a few apps. Seafood mushrooms and oysters on the half shell. Good service. Nothing to write home about but didn't eat entrees. Wife and I like to try lots of places and smaller meals.

Best, and ask for Tyron to be ur waiter! We had charbroiled oysters and they were heavenly!!!
Tyron was the best waiter I ever encountered, accommodating, polite, professional, funny, friendly. A must go to spot in New Orleans!!

We tried this place first for happy hour. We ordered a bloody mary,and sure glad we did,this is best blood mary I have ever had in my life. We tried thg is drink in at least 3 different places on NOLA and we just decided to go back here and have our fix. As for the food, the grilled oysters were the best, the rockefeller and thermador was good but a bit too much breadcrumbs for me and last but not the least...the crab claws-wowww,that sauce, we actually asked for a spoon to finish off the sauce like a soup. It was right across from Omni hotel where we stayed and across from Antoine's

We stopped by here when looking for lunch and there was no wait so we stopped by! Service was nice the waitress was very nice. I ordered the alligator bites, the chargrilled oysters, and the crab claws I think it was called. The alligator bites tastes like fried chicken so it wasn't anything special. Just the fact that I ate alligator was pretty cool! The claws came in this AMAZING sauce with a few toast pieces and I absolutely loved dipping it in there!! I even dipped some alligator in there it was amazing! The oysters were so good. It was my first time trying it so I was not going to have raw oysters! The chargrilled ones were amazing! I dipped a few in the  claws sauce and it was great! 
Everything was good about this place except for the fact that it was overpriced. Not worth what you paid for by just a few dollars. Especially the alligator bites. Oh well you pay the tax for being in a tourist area! Definitely recommend you try this place tho!
They really have the BEST coffee the cream coffee is to Die for !! I would get one everyday if I lived closer
Good food, has that local feel to it. Wait times can be bad especially over the weekend. Had shrimp and grits/jambalaya. Both were very good. Although it's pricey.

Amazing food. Location is great, in the middle of everything. We got the alligator and eggplant appetizers, and the chargrilled oysters and crab claws. Everything tasted great. The service was great, and he was very nice!

The first place we stopped at to eat in NO. OUTSTANDING!!!!   I had the taste of NO with a Bloody Mary.  The portion was a perfect size and the food was delicious.  Def recommend and it's a great and relaxing environment
Food was alright. Kinda meh. Service was polite, but slow. Not a bad experience, but not memorable.

The Royal House has always been one of the first places I like to hit when arriving in New Orleans. Unfortunately this year I should've stayed away. What a disappointment! We arrived around 430 in the afternoon on a weekday when the restaurant was not crowded at all. Six employees standing at the door with menus in their hand, all asked us if we wanted to sit at a table or at the bar. Why do we need six people stationed at the front door? Anyway... We wanted a table so we were seated and waited about 10 minutes before our waiter came to our table. Here again, six people at the front door but no waiter in sight.

We started with the alligator bites as an appetizer and they came in a tiny bowl and there were four small pieces of alligator. Very poor value. Then we opted to split an oyster Po boy. The taste was fine but the oysters were cold and a bit chewy.

Our waiter kept calling us his "family" which I thought was a little odd. Oh well, I obviously have to find a new favorite place in New Orleans.

First off, the chargrilled oysters were amazing.  We definitely should have ordered a full dozen.  Hubs ordered a gulf fish po-boy and reports that it was flavorful and the bread was great.  The only thing keeping this from being a five-star review was that my peel and eat boiled shrimp were slightly overcooked.  I'm a bit particular though and believe that the peels should slide off easily and not leave the flesh a shredded mess.  However, the Cajun seasoning was delicious - it just needed to come out if the pot about a minute earlier.

Exceptional food. Exceptional Service. Friendly Staff.

Do not miss the Chargrilled Oysters, the Seafood Stuffed Mushrooms and the Redfish Beignets.

Would highly recommend this place for anyone in the area looking for some yummy food.

Nice cozy ambience as well.

I have had PoBoys in many different places including New Orleans but this place was gross. I don't know why they even have a PoBoy on the menu if they are going to serve it on plain bread dry bread. Obviously, they don't care about food. In addition, the service was slow. The server was actually doing the best she could but the issues at this restaurant are clearly with the owners and management.

Don't even think about eating here.  They messed up three of our orders (group of five).  Tripped and THREW on of our meals at us, staining clothing and the manager didn't seem to think it was a big deal.  When they delivered something we didn't order as a COURTESY they removed it from our bill.  We didn't order it!  

Walk away. Walk far away!
This place is the perfect stop for a casual dinner with wonderful food! The menu is extremely diverse with all kinds of options to choose from. The charbroiled oysters were delicious!

The wait in this place is ridiculous. It took incredibly long for our appetizers to come out then another 30 minutes after that for our entrees. The entrees weren't even worth the wait. My food was barely room temperature when it hit the table. The corn on the cob was so salty one bit actually hurt my mouth. Others at my table were also underwhelmed by the food here. And had similar complaints of barely warm food & underwhelming flavor. At the end of the meal we were tired, agitated, full but no satisfied with the food at this place. Not sure why the rating is as high as it is.

My wife wanted to check this place out because...she wanted to sit on the balcony. We ordered a couple items but the stand out had to have been the chargrilled oysters. During my trip I also went to Acme and Felix's. Out of the three locations, I would say Royal House had the best garlic/butter sauce. Wish I had that sauce so I can put on basically anything....steak, shrimp, chicken, etc.
Great place to eat!! The crab claw appetizer is a must have, the sauce is amazing. I ate here two days in a row the food was that good. Our waiter was fast with service and very friendly.

My husband and I had a great time dining at Royal House.  Their entire menu looked amazing, so we got a bit of everything.  We had the crab claw appetizer, baked oysters to start.  Everything was superb.  The only thing we did not like was the gumbo which we both got a cup of.  It was okay, but compared to the rest of the meal (and the other gumbo in NOLA) it just wasn't there. We found out the next day that this is fairly common knowledge.  Regardless, you should absolutely check this spot out, and it's right on Royal so there is tons to do/see before or after you eat.  Fantastic food, great ambience & great service.  We'll definitely dine here again when we come back.
Service was good. Food was okay, and the price was too high for quality and quantity. It can get crowded so you'll need to time it right or you will be standing in line.
Cindy our bartender helped. grilled oysters and crab meet and lime with the oysters! A must must try.
Such a great atmosphere.  This has always been a favorite spot for us but this last visit was exceptional. Cindy and Ashley did a great job behind the bar. Food was dynamite.

Seated at the bar with the promise of full service. 
We ordered within 5 minutes having read reviews, and decided on food stuffs. 
Sunday was a happy bar tender, and a delight to be around, we felt taken care of. Thank You Sunday. 
We ordered Crab Claws, Chargrilled oysters and gumbo. 
Crab Claws- juicy crab claws in a buttery, savory sauce with a few small pieces of bread. We asked for more- they had none (strange.) 
Chargrilled Oysters- so aromatic! Cheesy, garlicky and buttery. Pricey but worth it. 
Gumbo- disgusting. Not even edible. Rice was undercooked and it had no flavor. 
We tried this place because of Yelp, thanks everyone. 
2 stars only because of Sunday, the crab claws and the oysters.

My friend dined at this restaurant two weeks prior to me so she gave me the deets and said make sure you try the oysters duo so I did and it did not disappoint!!! They were so good I think I enjoyed the one with bacon a little more because everyone knows bacon just makes everything more delicious!! Honestly they were both great though!! We also tried the Bloody Mary which was very tasty and another cocktail beverage I can't recall but we did enjoy both!! I would come back again!!

We had oysters Rockefeller, New Orleans sampler and the Redfish. Food was average, nothing over the top. My wife also did not enjoy the gumbo, as another reviewer stated. "Fatima" our server was excellent and very attentive.  The entire waitstaff kept gathering around the bar/tv for the basketball game and their bus boys clearly smelled of weed/marijuana. Another bus boy working in a basketball jersey. Not a super classy place.

Delicious food and great service! 
Highly recommend the blackened Red fish and the New Orleans sampler. Not to mentioned the oysters for an appetizer! Siting on the 2nd story is a must!

I went to Royal House 6/4/18 around 4:30pm. After eating I went use the lady's room. When I walked in the bathroom an employee (she worked behind the bar serving drinks) walked straight out the stall, past the lavatory and walked out without washing her hands. Gross. After I used the bathroom I  was in line to wash my hands. The host was standing at the mirror fixing her hair and touching her eye. After she was done she put the water on and wet her hands (did not use soap) and grab a paper towel and walked out. Can't believe I experienced not one but two workers being unsanitary. The only reason I rated this restaurant a 2 is because the food was really good and the our server was amazing.
Great place. Cool vibe service was great at the bar! Highly recommend. Right in French Quarters.  Good amount of choices for drinks and food.

1  Star for service
1  Star for taste
1  Star for dietary accommodations
1  Star atmosphere
1  Star for overall experience

Service:
Royal House service was top notch. All servers were friendly and knowledgeable about the subtle differences in menu items. Smiles abound and great conversation about New Orleans and local hangs to find.

Taste:
Oysters came out in full flavor. The Rockefeller oysters were very filling and satisfying. If you are hungry from a day of strolling around and looking for some tasty apps and entrees, the Royal House will deliver.

Dietary Accommodations:
Seafood, seafood, seafood! Sound good? The Royal House may not specifically  offer gluten free or vegan options but once again, not sure why a vegan would go to a seafood place? Rest assure though, they have a selection of salads to satisfy the pallet and a lot of naturally gluten free options. A little something for everyone.

Atmosphere:
The Royal House offers its patrons a charming throwback to the 1700s with an upscale feel. 

Balcony: sounds of the hustle bustle from below: some music, traffic, and people. Great views. Great place to unwind after a heavy day of tourism and to prepare you for the nighttime festivities.

Overall Experience:
For starters, I received a free app for checking in with yelp. Not sure if this is always offered but it's worth "a check-in."
My friend and I had a great experience. The balcony views were great, the servers were all super friendly and the food was refreshingly good. Give them a try if you're in town.

Service and food is good. Stuffed mushrooms is dry and the flavor is not that great, I've definitely had better elsewhere. Bloody Mary's are excellent and the Crab Claw appetizer was delish! I wouldn't say I'd definitely come back with so many great restaurants in the area but this place is worth a try.

Terrible experience lowest quality shrimp I have ever had.
We were Sat in front of the kitchen and witnessed some of the most disgusting scene one can ever imagine.
They had used FROZEN shrimps..... guysss don't throw your money away!

Great service and waitstaff but low quality food and expensive. We got the combo oyster, shrimp and grits, and eggplant and oyster pasta. The oysters were big, but nothing to write home about. Shrimps were tiny, about the size of my thumbnail. The cream sauce curdled and only has one flavor profile: salted butter. The grits were old and stale, as if they just scooped it out and microwaved it. The eggplant oyster pasta plate was the same and came out cold. We did not finish our meal because it was so inedible.

I yelped a new restaurant in New Orleans. Royal Oyster house came up with some great reviews, so we decided to give it s try. From the moment we were seated the waitress seem to have an attitude about serving two people. She asked if we wanted drinks, we said yes. We ordered two hurricanes which seem just like fruit juice with no alcohol. No napkins on the table for the drinks and when we asked the waitress for a napkin it look like she pulled out napkins from her apron that of been in there for two weeks and just toss them on the table. As for the food, the oysters were marginal at best. Went to Felix's the night before, and they were way better. The only thing that was really good was the French onion soup. All good that was delivered was just sort of thrown on the table, and no real explanation or presentation. 

I hate writing a bad review, but the Royal House just didn't match up from the service to the quality of the food we expected. 

Sorry Royal House
Food was meh and not worth the price. Our server was not attentive at all. I wouldn't go back with all the other great competition near by.

Came here during a NOLA vacation! I really enjoyed the crab claws they were sooooo good! The sauce was just delicious I had to sop it up with the bread so YUM! I actually ate them all myself they were so good I intended to share but it just didn't work out that way! For dinner i got the shrimp creole and it also was delicious! I prefer my shrimp creole to not have such strong tomato flavor and it was just pure perfection here. I knocked off a star because the service was SLOWWWW to be fair it was a Sunday night but it was just terribly slow. We were offered a complimentary dessert to make up for the slowness and we appreciate when places try to make it right! We ended up coming back later in the week and I got the shrimp creole again and it was a little bit more tomato tasting, so a little disappointed that it's not consistent but what was consistent was the slow service. We thought the first time was a one off but it seems service is slow and it wasn't even a full restaurant so not sure if it was an off week and they were short staffed or what but overall 3.5

The red beans and rice with andouille sausage is soooooo good - flavorful and creamy. Their gumbo is also excellent. The oysters were fresh and a good size but could have been shocked better, there was some grit in a few of them.

Needed a short snack before our dinner reservations later this afternoon. Pleasantly surprised with how delicious the chargrilled oysters were. Little annoyed with the delay of the oysters but on second thought it was probably worth the wait. I will be sure to be back before I leave New Orleans for both more oysters and the shrimp po boys. Worth the hype.

I've been coming here for years so I was super disappointed to see that everything suddenly changed. The service at the bar was terrible (minus the shucker) but we waited it out anyways. I got served the shrimp platter and I couldn't even eat half of it - I ended up going a street over for some street pizza. I thought maybe the batter was just bad but I removed the batter and just ate the shrimp and it was definitely the shrimp that was bad- it honestly tasted like it had frostbite. Coleslaw was also inedible. Extremely disappointed that my go-to place has become a total flop.
Got the alligator bites, gumbo, and oyster beignets. While the customer service was good, the food was nothing to rave about.

Came here on a late Saturday night for a late dinner. It was past 9pm and the place was still pretty festive. My husband and I got seated right away however. We got a table in the second floor balcony. Weather wasn't too hot by this time and I really enjoyed the view and nearby violinist.  Though, be aware that the floor isn't leveled so some tables are super slanted. We moved tables.

Also, folks go out here to smoke. Hence some ash trays.

Food wise, it was good. We had the charbroiled oysters. Tasty enough but very small and almost dry. 

My husband got the shrimp and grits. Not close to the best or top anything. Small little shrimp and bleh sauce.  But I'm spoiled by Charleston shrimp and grits. I could've told him to avoid it here.

I got the crawfish ravioli and it was great! I didn't want to share it. It was devoured with a quickness.

Food is a solid 3 stars. I bumped them up to 4 as a whole because service was very nice and courteous and we enjoyed the ambiance.

I was excited to go to this restaurant because it had such high ratings. I was thoroughly disappointed in the service and quality of food. I have some food allergies and asked for some special changes. They were accommodating (shrimp and scallops as my entree with red bliss potatoes and vegetables with a salads as my appetizer but that is where the service went downhill. Others in my party ordered spinach dip. It took 1/2 hour for the appetizer to arrive. I was served a portion of my meal (scallops) prior to the salad. When the salad came there was no dressing. Ten minutes later the dressing arrived with the shrimp. There were four in our party. One person got their meal. The other meals came out ten minutes later. I got another portion of my meal (shrimp) which was cold. The potatoes had cheese on them that I could not have. I asked them to remake without cheese. Another fifteen minutes later the potatoes came out burnt and no veggies. The server said I didn't ask for them. Another ten minutes later my veggies came out. I was told the potatoes and veggies would be comped. When the check came out they weren't. This was the worst meal I had in the Big Easy. A true disappointment on my last night. Eat here at your own risk.

This place definitely left something to be desired. Menu was WAY overpriced for the quality of food. I got the Crawfish ravioli, only had 4 small crawfish in it and was supposed to have a crab topper, still looking for it. My wife had the shrimp and grits, 3 small shrimp and some grits that were over cooked. Stuffed mushroom app was okay, service was okay. Bill was $68 no beverages, maybe had we racked up a $40 Bar tab first the food wouldn't had been so disappointing.
Raw oysters were good but the jambalaya was very dry and the shrimp were small and salty. Portions are small too. This is New Orleans and the jambalaya should be top notch!

The Char grilled oysters were excellent, just as good as Acme's!!! Although they are a little more expensive here to eat the shrimp creole was good but the Oysters were the star of the show!!! I would recommend filling up on the Oysters!!!
Great French Quarter spot for Bloody Mary and bites. Clean bathroom didn't hurt and they let me bring my fur baby inside

Every time I am at the Royal House oddly enough I get sat at the same table. I feel like it's my own personal Nawlin's eatery. Red beans with Andoullie sausage and rice with a few fried chicken strips to bring it home can't be beat

Sat at the bar for a drink and oysters, the staff did not care that we had been sitting there for ten minutes without a menu. Once we finally put in our order, the drinks took quite a while to prepare even though it was not packed. It seemed like the staff did not know what was going on because they kept scrambling behind the bar and forgot what orders belonged to which customers. Our oysters came out and they weren't even cold, plus they were super muddy. The man behind the counter had just dumped a bag of oysters into the sink and started shucking, they weren't washed or chilled. The platter that they served them on barely has enough ice to keep them cold.  To top it off, we had no utensils so we used two straws until the bartender finally noticed and provided us with a set. The service and food made it a very unpleasant experience, definitely not worth going back to.

The most unimaginative Poboy that has ever been made. Dry, tough bun, lettuce, pickle, tomato with a fried option of fish, shrimp etc. No type of sauce and the only options brought to you are ketchup, mayo, and regular mustard. The caprese tower was wonderful and the stuffed mushrooms were just okay. The server was attentive but had no personality. The overall experience was as forgettable as they come--a solid 3 stars.

Everything here is done well. Nothing is amazing but everything is good. Just outside on the corner if your lucky you will be serenaded by a girl playing violin. The food and entertainment make this place a must go while in town.

Oysters OMGGGGG melt in your mouth. Service NOT GOOD!!!! So slow very inattentive. It took over 45 minutes to get our appetizers & a simple glass of wine took 20 minutes!!!!! They need major staff help otherwise very good. Staff was apologetic but still the wait for drinks & food was way too slow. Bottom line GREAT FOOD vs. VERY SLOW SERVICE

Came in for a late night snack on our way home from a night out in the Quarter. I had their chicken and andouille gumbo -- it was pretty good and had a nice spice and flavor too. My friends tried the red beans and rice, the alligator po-boy and the redfish beignets. Everybody seemed pretty happy. In a town where you can find some of the most amazing food on the planet, this was simply okay. I'm not sure if I'll ever stumble my way in again or just stop for pizza and a beer next time.
Jeff the bartender is an absolute gem. He explained the process of raw oysters in a way us simple folk could understand. The drinks and brunch were amazeballs. 5/5, 10/10, will come back again.
Absolutely great food and fantastic service! Be sure to ask for Tootie as she made our meal memorable and we are sure to come back next time we visit
Food was delicious.  I enjoyed the gator bites, some very delicious lemon, garlic butter oysters and finished off with the bread pudding.  So tasty! Really enjoyed it.

Reallllllyyyyy paiinnnnfuuuullllllyyyyyyy slow.  Food is expensive and the overall vibe is a little lazy.  Not enough menus for everyone.  That said, the food was decent.  The ambience of the upper deck makes it survive.  Not my first choice but could do better.

Totally disappointed in this place.  Our food took 1 and a half hours to come out. Being in the food industry at first I did not think anything of it because kitchens tend to be slow with
Good quality food but come
One almost 2 hours?! Our server did not come and check on us and we sat in disbelief most of the time. It was 4 of us and three tables surrounding us whom got there after us got their food before us. Ironically we were a group of young black women and those around us weren't. I realize that the establishment was not disorganized. They were simply racist. They also told my friend they did not have her vegetables until we complained a whole hour and a half later. The food was not appetizing ( mind you we each had $25 dollar plates) and the service was horrible. I will never ever be back again

This place is awesome. Everything tasted amazing. The fried gator appetizer is a must have. I ordered the Taste of New Orleans it was all great. My son ordered the Shrimp Tortellini and he love it and my girlfriend ordered the oysters and they were very good. I don't even like oysters and I have at least three of them. If you are ever in New Orleans you must come to this place.

There's only one way to dine at this restaurant and that's eating in the balcony. What a view! We actually got lucky and got to listen to jazz music as we ate since there was a musician playing on the street. Our view was absolutely beautiful as you can see in the picture. Eating and drinking in the balcony was by far relaxing and romantic. Be sure to check in thru the yelp app so that you can claim your free appetizer. The only catch is that you have to order two entrees. We started off with the fried alligator appetizer. It was pretty good after you dip it in the marinara/tartar sauce. For entree, we had the Crawfish Ravioli and Baked Shrimp Tortellini. Both were pretty good but make sure you're hungry because both are huge servings. This is definitely a place you should check out!
Beautiful restaurant and great ambiance! Wait staff was extremely polite and professional. The food was delicious and perfectly done. A must try in Nola!
One of our favorite places to come when we are in town. Their crab claw appetizer is what i dream of. They also have the best bloody marys i have ever had. The inside is so cute and charming as well.

Came in here for a late dinner after a cocktail tour (yes, my senses were blurred a bit). The waitress was very attentive when we were seated up until our meal came out...then she disappeared.

My aunt ordered some trio sampler which was all very good (minus the gumbo), and I had half oysters Rockefeller and half chargrilled. I have never had such large, fresh, flavorful, juicy oysters before. It was nearly orgasmic! I was extremely satisfied with my meal. Since I had the alcohol munchies I wanted to order another half dozen of the oysters Rockefeller and a side of étouffée (since my aunts was unlike anything I've ever tasted). We waited....and waited...and nearly fell asleep..and waited..and needed refills.. when she finally came around we asked for the check and I asked for my order to-go so I could David Hasselhoff it in my hotel room. With an attitude she said she can see if that's possible since I let her know so late. It's not like I could've said anything sooner since she didn't come around. 

Anywho I was able to get it to go (with no Togo utensils), and the oysters had so much shell in them. Like a lot...so idk why the difference. The flavor was still great, though.
Royal House was fantastic! Our server was wonderful and very knowledgeable on the menu. The chargrilled oysters were incredible!! We will definitely be back!

Visited New Orleans for a few days. We came here for dinner on day 2. Katlyn was our server and she is amazing! Such an awesome experience and food! Katlyn made great suggestions and really took care of us!!
Best oysters in NOLA. Don't waste time with Acme.  Great variety and great location/atmosphere.  Make it a must do for your trip to new Orleans.

This was a very touristy stop but we had a nice dinner and drinks. Nothing special about the food but it came out hot and it was good for the price. Very friendly waitress though the hostess upstairs had zero personable skills for customers,yet gave one of the busboys her undivided attention.

Too Salty! I ordered the Alaskan Crab legs, it was so salty I gave away most of it. The portion was very good but hard to enjoy. Our waitress was a darling, we enjoyed her.  My sister ordered the crawfish etoufee and she also found it to be very salty. My mom ordered taste of New Orleans, she loved it and had no complaints. The drinks are very good.

There are countless options for cajun/creole fare in The French Quarter, but this had been by far one of my favorite places.  A couple blocks off of Bourbon, this place has a quiet and laid back atmosphere.  It is not your typical restaurant that caters to tourists being lured to the Quarter for a taste of Bourbon street, hand grenades, and debauchery. The food here was exceptional. Quality traditional Cajun/creole food with a New Orleans flare. I had the shrimp and grits and my husband had the crawfish ravioli. Both dishes were amazing. And although many other places boast having the best chargrilled oysters, The Royal House truly had the best I've had in New Orleans. In short, if your looking for great food, minus the droves of tourists look no further...

Sunday is the plug.

andouille chicken gumbo 10/10
raw oysters 10/10
chargrilled oysters 10/10
shrimp n grits 10/10

Just finished eating here and it was so-so. We ordered the oysters royale and crab claws, both of which were very tasty. However, there were numerous other issues. We were seated at a very small table for four people when really only should have been used for 2 people! But they didn't seem to care despite having empty tables nearby. Our waiter was Joe and he was not the most attentive waiter. We did not have great service and despite the restaurant not being too busy the food still came out quite slow. He took an awfully long time to bring us a glass of wine even after ordering it after we sat down. 

First, we ordered the oyster tacos appetizer, and for one thing, chips are not a taco. You should not be calling them tacos when you place oysters on 5 tortilla chips. Secondly, the oyster tacos have a super SPICY sauce on top which they don't even mention on the menu!! I love spicy things but they slathered the sauce on each chip that you could barely taste the oyster and your lips go numb as soon as you swallow. When I asked our waiter Joe about the sauce he said it was a chipotle pepper sauce and I mentioned it was terribly spicy and he walked away as if he didn't care about satisfied customers. Either put it on the menu, put a small drop on each oyster, or have the waiter inform you when ordering it! 

The pecan mahi mahi was good but you couldn't really taste that it was pecan. Etouffee was good. Blackened shrimp and jambalaya left little to be desired. 

During our meal, one of the busboys ran into my sister's arm hard but didn't notice nor apologize. Then, that same busboy knocked over a glass he was carrying and also slammed down plates at the table next to us.

Royal House really ought to crack down on service and attitude because I certainly won't be recommending this place anytime soon to friends visiting Nola.

Our Hotel recommended this restaurant to us.  When we got there, the host was great.  But after that, everything just went down hill from there.

Food took too long.  +33 mins.

Charged us an extra $44.00 for something that we didn't order.  Had the waitress corrected it.

Ordered a hamburger with no cheese and after waiting +33 mins, I finally got my burger with cheese.  I returned the order because I couldn't wait anymore.

The Host apologized for what happened.

Maybe, it was just a bad day for everyone.

Won't let it ruin our 1st experience in New Orleans.

Come here for the seafood pescatore and the crab claws. Order this and you will not be disappointed. (Just in case you don't want to read the whole review here is what you need to get)

The crab claws are sauteed in a lemon garlic sauce with toasted bread on the side and let me tell you this dish was packed with so much flavor! The crab claws were alright, but the sauce was amazing! I don't know what they put in it, but I would order 3 of these if I knew how good it actually was. Truly an amazing dish! 

For my entree I order the seafood pescatore which is described on the menu as coming in a marinara sauce which seemed strange to me, but I really wanted a pasta dish so I ordered it nonetheless. I do not eat shrimp so the server told me I could substitute with extra of another meat instead. I ended up getting extra scallops. When my dish came out the smell was just heavenly and adding the extra scallops was probably the best decision I made! The scallops were huge and they were seared off perfectly! Here's the kicker though... The dish did not come in a marinara sauce it was in what looked like a white sauce with what I can only assume was grated Parmesan on top. 

My fiance got the oysters as appetizers which were alright nothing special really. For his entree he got the crawfish etouffee which was uneventful. Honestly the service and food here is hit or miss, but the crab claws and the seafood pescatore is what I would come back for and the reason I'm giving this place such a high rating!

The food was fantastic except the chargrilled ousters which we ordered as appetizers were brought after our meal. My wife ordered the taste of new Orleans and she loved it and I ordered the gumbo and crab claws which were delicious...also I spoke to the manager about our oysters coming out after our food arrived even though we asked for them at least 20 minutes before we ordered. We didnt eat them and she took them of the bill no questions asked and super apologetic. We will definitely eat here again. Great food and great service

the food here was absolutely amazing. I love house friendly and outgoing the staff was even though it was super busy they were on top.of our table to make sure we were getting everything we needed. Live this place, highly recommend it to anybody visiting the French Quarter

*cracks knuckles* So... I officially have a tradition of having one super trash ass meal every time I go to New Orleans. Last time Mother's took that title...this time it's Royal House which is sad considering it was one of my best meals the last time I was here. So either they have declined immensely or I ate a bunch of trash last time. 

There was some confusion with seating at the beginning. Once we got seated, although we were acknowledged a few times, it still took a while for the waitress to come take any orders. By the time she got to us we were ready to order. For appetizer, fried alligator (which was lit) and crab claws (I expected big ass claws and not the blue crab joints but the sauce alone redeemed the plate) which took a while to come to the table. Even tho we waited an eternity, I thought the tasty appetizers would lead the way to a tasty meal but... I was sadly mistaken.

After waiting for the Third Coming of Jesus, our meals finally arrived. Lemme start with the blackened redfish that should be advertised as Dehydrated Redfish. MakeYouChokeFish. Seasoned ok but overcooked. The veggies were undercooked and hard. The real disappointment tho is the damn Taste of New Orleans. Three small bowls of sadness and depression. No flavor at all. They must have burnt the roux in the gumbo...that was the only flavor I could get from that. Etoufee tasted like nothing, jambalaya was trash. If that was the flavors of NO then everybody needs tongueotomies...and yes I made up a word. I had them comp my meal and refused to order anything else because I would be able to cash my retirement by the time the meal would have arrived. 

What lured me in was the damn free appetizer with a Yelp check in (tryna be cheap after blowing my per diem at emeril's) and we couldn't eem use it after they comped my meal. I was in that joint mad emotional ...brink of tears. Then once we were finally able to leave this two hour ordeal, I was greeted by the Queen of cockroaches outside of their bathroom. 

Royal House = Royal Trash.

I wanted to like it. I really did. I came in with high expectations and was disappointed from the time I got there. Being seated was an issue. The young man said "Follow me" so we did expecting to be seated. We get upstairs just to be told to wait because three were no seats as he told us. When he did seat us, we didn't get acknowledged by our waitress for about 5 minutes. Appetizers were good. Really good. Crab claws and fried alligator. From the time we got there, we were seated and our order was taken, but we didn't get our meal until around an hour and 15 minutes. Taste of New Orleans didn't have taste. Blackened Redfish was over cooked. I salvaged it by putting the crab claw sauce on it. I'm sad. It ruined a great day. I could've been getting drunk instead.
Good spot for breakfast. Cooked the eggs just like I like. Cajun potatoes were yummy not too hot. Staff was friendly and we were well looked after.
not bad parents food came out cold after a little longer than average wait, fried gator was there and gone, not a lot there. a decent spot if you aren't expecting the best meal of your life.
Our favorite brunch spot in NoLa for bloodies and oysters. Love the service and atmosphere. We always opt for the balcony spot which we call our "own perch " on top of the French Quarter.

Don't even think about eating here.  They messed up three of our orders (group of five).  Tripped and THREW on of our meals at us, staining clothing and the manager didn't seem to think it was a big deal.  When they delivered something we didn't order as a COURTESY they removed it from our bill.  We didn't order it!  

Walk away. Walk far

Thanks, but no, thanks, Lisa.  We're going to pass.  NOLA has so many great restaurants, we don't need to come back.

The sauce on the crab leg appetizer is, no joke, one of the best things I have ever eaten, ever! I was visiting from Chicago, so it's sad to think that we can't get it again. Can I have the recipe? 

We sat on the balcony which straight up shook anytime anyone moved a chair or dropped silverware. I was living in fear of the waitress coming with food, it felt realllly structurally unsound. Has the balcony been inspected lately? A little terror added to the meal clearly didn't marr the experience, the crab legs were THAT GOOD!

With an atmosphere that feels brand new, yet classic and timeless, it's easy to ignore the scurrying roaches on the floor (and table!)

The service was top notch and we really felt like we were in a New Orleans classic, even if we'd never been before. 

I'll admit, this was my first exposure to Lousiana oysters and HOLY SHIT they are HUGE!!! The meatiest oysters I have ever had, to the point, it was hard for my mouth and brain to understand these were actually the oysters I've known and loved all these years. Really good and REALLY meaty.

For dinner I tried 6 raw oysters and then when I asked my server which basket I should consider, she responded with "well, we are an oyster house, so I think getting the fried oyster basket makes the most sense." And she was not wrong!

Royal House has completely changed my perception and understanding of what an oyster is or could be. Perfectly touristy and also classic NOLA... Royal House should be on your New Orleans list if it's not already.

Crab claws were yummy.... that's about it. Gross inside and food took forever.... my parents really liked the char-grilled oysters. My meal was Ok... red beans, andouille sausage, rice & fried chicken. Aside from the claws, would not recommend!
Highly recommend the grilled oysters!!  Shrimp and grits were delicious!  Pecan pie was amazing as well.

This place is in the French Quarter so geared toward tourists but we did see a fair amount of locals there as well. Our server was fantastic and very attentive even during the busy lunch rush.

Food was excellent but the main event was the sautéed crab claws - AMAZING. I ate all of it and then asked for more bread to dip in the remaining broth. Fantastic!
The Crab Claws is the best appetizer in the house. We also ordered the sample of New Orleans, and fried eggplant and oyster pasta. 5 stars for the food and environment.
Service was great, along with the food.  We tried every version of the oysters; we were impressed.
Sooo good!! Get the shrimp tortellini or the lobster ravioli. Delicious! Crab leg appetizer, amazing sauce. Friendly staff, delicious food, fun atmosphere.

Royal had the best waitstaff that we came across in New Orleans. Pleasant and attentive to all of our needs. I had the oysters as an appetizer and they were some of the cleanest oysters I've ever eaten. They went down like butter. I had the Red Beans with Andouille Sausage and Rice entree which was to die for. I just wished there was a tad bit more rice to sop everything up with. You will not be disappointed with this place.

Royalty is easy to find, when in New Orleans, of course. I'm speaking of Royal Street...okay, so not your typical type of royal-ness, but even so, if you want a royally good meal, check out Royal House. I've had two food experiences here (about three years apart) and both were great, though we'll get into why things boiled down to four stars shortly.

For starters (if you didn't already guess), you'll find Royal House on Royal Street at the corner of the namesake road and St. Louis Street. It's perfect in proximity to Omni Royal Orleans where I stayed on both trips to The Big Easy. Walking up you'll notice a somewhat classy European style similar to many establishments in the French Quarter. A nice-sized bar on the first floor with a smaller eating area in the back. At the time of this most recent meal, things were a little crowded so we actually headed upstairs where you'll find a whole other level of seating (and a another bar!). 

Once quickly situated, we were under way. I had talked up char-grilled oysters to my family for years and so we began with a dozen of these babies. Their garlicky, buttery flavor hit the spot and should be tasted even if you're not a fan of this bivalve. With the help of a Yelp check in offer, we also snagged a small appetizer of fried alligator (don't freak out, it's actually delicious). The breading was different from what I remembered, but it still did the trick of being tasty.

Here's where my memory comes into question. I've spent the last three years dreaming of Royal House's shrimp and grits. When I came in 2015, the dish was amazing and easily went down as my favorite meal of the trip. This time? It was different than what I remembered. Less spicy with the shrimp being more barbecued than that last plate. The grits were a bit off as well. Don't get me wrong, it was still totally tasty, but not what I was hoping for. In fact, I might say some shrimp and grits dishes from New York were better (oh my!). But even so, the meal was great (even with a good, but forgettable, waiter).

Overall, Royal House delivered on a quality NOLA-style meal. With a beautiful interior and a tasty selection of choices, I definitely recommend it to those visiting New Orleans. For myself, I now have new images in my head plastered over the old ones. Those originals were five stars. These are more four. Hey, it's like the changing of the crown. Sometimes you absolutely love royalty and sometimes you can't stand it. We'll call this one somewhere decently above an average kingdom on a street made for royalty.

Our server Fatima was very pleasant and knowledgeable. The rest of the staff, however, seemed upset and rushed. We sat upstairs in a lovely room overlooking the balcony. I just wasn't impressed with the food. The must have from this place is the crab claw appetizer, phenomenal sauce.
I'm on vacation and this is one of the best restaurant I have eaten at! This Is an amazing place for lunch the service and wait staff are a 10+!
Excellent customer service and delicious food. Moderate prices and fast service. The drinks are extra tasty with top shelf liquor.

If you have never visited the French Quarter in New Orleans before, stop by The Royal House and see waiter John and Tooty at The Royal House Oyster Bar. These 2 were so entertaining and displayed marvelous Customer service skills. Thanks for making my first visit to your restaurant an exciting one. I have been to the French Quarter numerous of times and never a welcome like this one. Thanks
Mediocre cheeseburger plate..  nothing special and not cheap.  Patty obviously frozen..

This was probably my favorite place in New Orleans. The Bloody Mary is so good. I tried the fried alligator, crabs claws, gumbo, and the half shell oysters. I have nothing bad to say about any of these dishes. The gator was great, especially when dipped into the sauce that come with the crab claws. The crab claws were to die for and again, the sauce was mouthwatering. It was my first time trying oysters and after getting over the texture, I can definitely say that I like them and would try them again.
Food and service was great. I recommend the crab claw for an app selection. We had no wait and enjoyed our meal. The waiter was very accommodating.
I will give it a 4. Maybe depends on the dish. 5 for fried catfish. Best in French Quarter. Go here instead of Oceans! Pots  are a 4 or 3.5. Authentic here. All good.
Delicious! I visited on a busy Sunday ( Essence weekend). Service was awesome, no wait. Rib eye was cooked to perfection. I highly recommend this eatery!

Found this place while walking around and looking online later. The restaurant itself is nice enough, super casual and kinda neat. We ordered the Taste of New Orleans(chicken & andouile gumbo, jambalaya and shrimp etouffee) with a side of Red Beans and Rice, and the Crab Claws. The Crab Claws were by far the best dish of the meal in all honesty. The rest of the food was okay,  everything was better with hot sauce. Don't get me wrong, the food wasn't bad just wasn't super flavorful or anything special especially for the price. The waitress was nice enough right when we arrived, gave some suggestions and made small talk. After we ordered we never saw her again until the food came out. She came out to bring the appetizer without saying a word, she just set it down and walked off
Really good southern food. My family Loved it. If you have issues with salt be careful. They use a lot!
I ordered the oysters appetizer and tiramisu. It was reasonably priced and enough for a dinner portion. Delicious food and comfortable venue to go as an individual (table seating at the bar).

Crab claws were tasty & service was 10/10! Our server was super helpful with her recommendations and very attentive. However, it seemed like the menu and the food that came out didn't match up! As good as they were, the crab claws came out in a remoulade type sauce instead of the garlic lemon sauce stated on menu. The shrimp and grits were described as bbq shrimp and gouda grits but came out as plain shrimp bathed in, what I would guess was, the same sauce as the claws and heaping of plain white grits. All in all, the food was good and we appreciated the service; I'm just confused about the menu.
The seafood pescatore was great!  The salad caprese was also very good.  Prompt service and the place had the charm of New Orleans
Classic NOLA ambience and great food! Get a table on the second floor and enjoy the breeze. We got the Jambalaya and Crawfish ravioli; both were excellent.

Awesome food. We ordered 3 dishese and love every bit of it. I ordered seafood cajun pasta and it's dam good. My wife ordered Gumbo combo, the dish is crazy good. My son got a crawfish ravioli and it's also stunning good too. Afer all, we're sastisfied.
Awesome brunch. Great service. Atmosphere is amazing.  I actually want to stay in the hotel on our next trip just to be near the bar.

We stumbled upon this place and the staff was so gracious enough to let us sit on the balcony tables even if no one was there on the top floor. Our server was so sweet and she was very resourceful on NOLA food and drinks.

The food was amazing. Our server suggested us the redfish begnet and I am so glad I said yes to it! It has a wonderful combination of crispy, fishy and sweet. I highly highly recommend it!!

I had the ravioli and it was really good. I don't know what's in that pink sauce but it's like crack. I ended up cleaning my plate.

If you're ever in NOLA, I recommend stopping by this place especially for the redfish begnets.

Ate here Thursday 7/12/18.  Spent 23.00 on skimpy appetizers (the micro chargrilled oysters or oyster fragments and micro fried alligator tail).  How the chef could send the oysters out to a table is beyond my comprehension.  Next time just heat up a shell with some parmesan, garlic, and butter on it.  Entree wasn't bad but nothing to write home to mom about.  Astonishingly disappointed until we went to Harbor Seafood in Kenner near our hotel.  Good food, hot, and plenty of it and at much better prices.  I feel I got next to nothing for my money at the Royal.  No more visits, not ever.
Amazing food! Great waiter!! Great drinks!!! Going for second day in a row!! Crab claws to die for.. voodoo juice yummy.. red beans and rice so flavorful

Had a dozen raw oysters.   They were ok, but not the most flavorful oysters I've had.    There' alligator poboy was meh.  Tasted like chicken.   Lots of staff there, but service was slow.   I'd try another place before returning here.

How is this place reviewed so well? This is some of the most overpriced, underwhelming if not downright poor food in the Quarter. Went for lunch as I work nearby and a friend wanted shrimp. They were not good. How is it possible to eat bad shrimp in New Orleans? Go to this tourist trap, that's how. Service was adequate and atmosphere is lovely thanks to the open air feel but no thanks.

The location could not be any better. The hotel is very old but is maintained very well. I would stay here again. We did opt for valet parking just because downtown is very busy and we didn't want to fight traffic for a parking spot. My only recommendation would be to improve the valet service.

We used the Yelp reviews and picked Royal House because of it's location to our hotel, their ability to accommodate a large party of 10 and it's 4 star rating. Unfortunately we were disappointed in the service and the quality of food. I ordered the crawfish ravioli and I was the happiest of the party. The shrimp Po' Boy was nothing but thick bread, the trio sampler "The Taste of New Orleans "did not meet the quantity of food to serve as a dinner and the oysters were quite tasteless. However the chargrilled oysters were good. With all the delicious choices in NOLA, we will most likely not be returning to this establishment. I had an amazing Shrimp Po'Boy else where, delicious gumbo and outstanding oysters at other restaurants with friendly service.
Great brunch! crawfish Benedict was amazing! Also- make sure you might it back for the best charbroil oysters around!

We bopped in to the Royal House for oysters.  They work on a team system at the bar with a shucker/waiter and a bartender.  Note they measure drinks and ask you if you want doubles.  

Cindy the bartender was completely inept.  In fact, Cindy, you were rude and we waited for far too long for our drinks.  Our waiter had to prompt you twice.  You refused to turn your attention from your own drink and chatting up the staff.  My drink sat sweating while my son's drink was left half made while you chatted away.  When you finally managed to get the drinks toward us you left them three feet away and walked away.  I had to get up and retrieve our drinks.  You should be fired.  

Jeffrey however was wonderful hence the three stars and tried his best to make up for Cindy's ridiculous, rude behavior. We made certain to tip him only.

It damn near KILLS this Scottish-American to pay a whopping seventeen dollars and fifty cents for an Oyster Po' Boy, yes, but it's always worth every (admittedly expensive) chomp.

The bread pudding here is also phenomenal.

A New Orleans favorite time and again!

This is one of my least favorable experiences in NOLA. I visit here at least once a year and I have my favorite places I like to eat at. This time I decided to try something different. Boy was that a mistake! I ordered the taste on New Orleans, which is a sampling of gumbo, jambalaya and étouffée. The jambalaya was hard and old, the gumbo was just broth and rice and the étouffée was not flavorful at all. My friend ordered the same thing and she refused to eat it. The eventually took her portion off of the bill. I can honestly say that this was probably the worst place I have eaten in NOLA.

Tourist trap and not worth the price we paid. Our server was alright, but nothing could save the mediocre food. My husband had raw oysters, which didn't show up until a minute before our entrees. He also had the New Orleans sampler; not only were the portions rather small, the rice on the jambalaya was very undercooked. I wasn't feeling terribly hungry, so I went with gumbo and a salad. About a third of my gumbo spilled out of the tiny cup on the way to the table and my salad was super basic for its $13 price. I totally get that it's in a tourist area and as such, my expectations were not very high, but this was just rough.

We went to Royal House as we heard they had great chargrilled oysters and ended up having a full dinner here.

For appetizers, we had the chargrilled oysters and the crab claws. Chargrilled oysters tasted pretty good as expected (wouldn't say best in NOLA though). The crab claw dish was also quite good - the crab claws themselves were pretty small but the plate of sauce they come in is delicious. We asked for extra bread to finish up all the sauce.

For mains, we had the seafood pescatore and baked shrimp tortellini. The seafood pescatore was a decent choict - came with a lot of scallops. The baked shrimp tortellini however was fantastic - once again the sauce was amazing. 

We also tried a Hurricane here, but it wasn't really to either of our tastes. Could just be that we aren't into Hurricane's in general.

Overall - this is a solid restaurant choice for a nice dinner in the french quarter. However can get rather pricy. Our whole meal was about $100 USD.

The food here was awesome, we just came in for a small bite. We had the crab claws which were sautéed in a lemon, garlic butter sauce with toasted French bread for dipping. It was delish! We also ordered the chicken chop salad - ohmygoodness that plate was HUGE! 

The staff were all very nice and the view from the balcony was beautiful. We sat inside - it was way too hot to sit outside in New Orleans in the summer!

We had the claws appetizer and it was soooooo good. Like slap yo mamma good! We stumbled upon this place in passing while on a tour and stopped in and had a shot! Check this place out if your into oysters!
Delicious Food!! Recommend the French Onion and Oysters on the appetizer menu!! Also great customer service!

Service was very quick, busy Saturday, seated within 15. The drinks were mixed very well, had the old fashion. Enjoyed the ravioli, which were great. We also had the chargrilled oysters, cooked perfect!

This place gets a good crowd of people. We were told that there would be a 25 minute wait before they would sit us at a table. However, our wait was realistically about 10 minutes before we were seated. Our waiter, Danny was terrific! He was on 'high demand' due to the busy-ness but was very quick and fun to talk to and most of all, very accommodating.
My parents and I enjoyed our dinner there. We ordered the crab claws served with an excellent sauce and we also tried the stuffed mushrooms which was fantastic. My father had the rib-eye medium well which was cooked to perfection and definitely a winner for my father. My mother ordered the oyster platter which was also perfect in taste and I ordered the shrimp platter which was just perfect and delicious. For dessert we ordered the Banana Foster Cheesecake and the Pecan Crusted pie both delicious melt-in-your-mouth concoctions that I hope people will order while dining at the Royal House. Overall an awesome dining experience. Mahalo nui (thank you) for your kind hospitality! *Don't forget to check-in when you get there! You may get a free dessert.
Nice restaurant. Gumbo was delicious. Gator bites were great. We ate about 5:00 on a Friday so there was no wait.
Food great. Service, terrible but friendly, then again, even waiters gotta take a dump. Oysters were amazing. This is a good stop for some oysters and a Po' Boy.

Ok - what is there to say - their oysters anyway you order them are awesome - raw , charbroiled, Rockefeller and royale. The Redfish beignets are out of this world. The Blackened Shrimp & Jambalaya is to die for and the Pecan crusted Mahi Mahi - there are no words for.....And better than anythingnon the menu was our service from Jeffery - by the way we sat at the bar - he is just awesome!!!!

Food:
Crab Claws-$13:OMG if you're a person who love garlic this is it! Saucy garlicky goodness with plenty of crabs to share 
Crawfish ravioli-$24: Perfect with a dash of salt. But you really don't need it! Tons of sauce, ravioli perfectly cooked, garlic cheese green onions. 

The whole meal was just a YES! 

Staff is friendly 
Vibe: nice decor, old paintings of some form of water or ships.
Seafood is not fresh at all.  Ordered oyster and seafood pasta as pics shown.  You can know they are not fresh when tasted them.  My mom has diarrhea when we get back to hotel after dinner.
Fried Alligator at Royal House in New Orleans. Eat the first one. Had to order another one for this picture

Charbroiled oysters were great, the crab claws are to die for though! My friend and I loved the sauce they used for those! 

Overall, a good bang for your buck and chill atmosphere!

4th time in new Orleans and know good food when I taste it..Went with party of 5 and nobody was satisfied. Taste of New Orleans, which I had NO MEAT.. alligator was good but VERY SMALL AND SPINACH DIP WAS BURNT..

First dinner to kick off my Bachelorette Weekend. Our server was wonderful and recommended so many great dishes. The Crab Claw appetizer.... make sure to ask for extra bread the sauce is out of this world. Entree ordered the Crawfish Ravioli, was a great dish to share as it was very filling. For dessert we basically ordered all that were on the list and got to taste a little bit of everything. The Banana Foster is different from what I am use to but was perfect with Cheesecake.

Best restaurant we ate at in all of new Orleans.  So good that we went there twice.
Everything pin the menu is good.
We had clams, crab claws, shrimp poboys, and great pastas.

Go hungry!

Delicious food. We had some of their signature plates. Their chargrilled oysters and crab claws were excellent but on the salty side. My daughter had the crawfish ravioli entree and she wolfed it down. It was a good sign. Everything we ordered including the seafood pescatore was scrumptious.
Good food and a great location in the heart of the French Quarter.  The service was great and we will most likely return to eat here again!
The oysters tasted rotten, I felt sick after eating two and we couldn't finish the plate. It's expensive and the serving sizes are very small
Delicious caprese salad and chargrilled oysters! There is outdoor seating as well that overlooks the streets below.

Ate here for our last night of vacation in New Orleans. Tyrone was the best waiter we had our entire week in town! He listened to our likes/dislikes, and his recommendations were spot on! The service and food were great- in a charming setting. Will definitely go again next time we are in town!
Great food. I was too hungry and finished it all. Love Cajun food and they had good customer service overall
Definitely one of my favorite spots in New Orleans. I never visit without stopping by at least once to enjoy their food. I highly recommend the Chargrilled Oysters, one of my favs for sure.
Excellent service and excellent food!  We went there  twice and each time the foid wa great alligator and oyster s.  Even the shrip and oyster platter! Happy Eating '
My dad got a food poisoning after eating oysters there in Saturday. It was really scary and I would suggest everyone to be really careful when ordering sea food there
Great food, great service.  Our family really enjoyed the food.  One of the better meals we had on our trip to New Orleans.
Service was great! A little loud but that's to be expected! The people were friendly and the food outstanding. If you like seafood this is a great place to get that!

All we wanted was shrimp! Therefore, we had the peel-n-shrimp. We got what we wanted and more. This spot is a must if you're in the mood for some great NOLA seafood. What makes it a 5-Star location was our waiter. He was so friendly and courteous that made the experience worthwhile. Had lunch on the outdoor balcony and was able to take pictures and hear live saxophone player giving us the true NOLA experience. I say go here when in town. You wouldn't be disappointed.
So great! We sat at the bar and Cindy was amazing. We had a great time with good music playing and great food!
There was a wait but we got right in. Our waitress Tina was great & all the food was delicious!

Went there with family in town. Had the French onion soup as an appetizer and it was great, until i gave some to my daughter and there was a huge oyster shell in it. I didn't catch it until she chewed on it and instantly started freaking out. When told to the manager, her first response was " well i didn't see any shells in the soup when they brought it back to the kitchen" are you kidding me?! I literally was taking pieces out of my daughters mouth while talking to her. She didn't once mention how sorry she was and how could she make it right. She went straight to asking if i wanted to make an incident report and the GM would call me back. Horrible handling of the situation. No apology. My daughter could of gotten seriously hurt. Will never go back.
CC xf c as,,   . . =_= =_. I am=:-(,,w,,    ,, ,,.      B en    y. be    a ,,z,,z to_=:-$:-b \  ,,z be d be
