Food & drinks were very good, service was excellent.  We sat on the balcony and there was a woman playing violin across the street.  Great evening!
Great food and service.   I even got a fresh water pearl in my PoBoy!
I got the crawfish etouffee and I was in heaven!  My dad loved it too!  His first time in the French Quarter.  A lot of food, great price and friendly service!

Definitely will go back if I'm in NOLA. server was great and the food was delicious. Enjoyed the oysters and salad (wish it had less dressing and more veggies). Drinks were delicious. Felt like eating vacation.
Had a to go order. Food was hot & good fish po boy & fried fish platter. Everything was wonderful!!

Tina rocks. The food was so good. We ordered the crab claws all the sauce was so good. Bread not so much but dip it in the sauce and your all set. We also ordered the rib eye with a clump of crab on top. My bae said it taste like butter on steak. It was Sooooo good. Even amounts of fat and meat. Very juicy and tender and a pretty good portion to. I ordered the snow crab legs, it was a very generous serving and came with potatoes and corn with a warm butter to dip the crab in. It was so delicious. I have my fair share of crab and these two crab clusters had lots of meat and the claws where the best. 
I would recommend this place. Food is a bit pricey so save a little to enjoy here but you can get a free app with a Yelp check in with a purchase of two entrees.

Our "bartender Jaz" had the personality of a doormat. We were encouraged when we walked in to sit at the bar, upon doing so she was rude and uninterested in us or being at work in general. She shucked oysters behind the bar and sprayed their juices in front of our plates. We ordered an appetizer and a meal she forgot the meal and just gave us our appetizer. The stuffed mushrooms were delicious, only reason I gave this a two star. I was flabbergasted by her lack of attentiveness and attitude toward paying customers. Also she used her dirty oyster shucking gloves to grab the ice scooped out of the bin of ice and scooped another customers ice for water with the dirty gloves in the ice so I took that second star I gave for the mushrooms away because of this! So gross and unsanitary.

Came here to try some amazing oysters. The raw oysters are outstanding and very good sized. Was a little disappointed when trying the chargrilled ones because the size of the oyster was way too small and was overpowered by the seasonings they put on top. Also tried the shrimp tortellini, it was very delicious! Overall, very nice experience and the staff was very friendly.

Our experience was made perfectly magical by one of the manager's, Tasha. Not only was she professional, Tasha is a pint-size powerhouse... she made us feel exceptionally welcome and valued. She embodies all the legendary Big Easy charm in one tiny woman. I must confess service and food were subpar this night and Tasha's response to the situation made us forget all about the hiccups. Whomever owns this restaurant should consider themselves lucky to have an employee that takes so much pride in her work.

We stopped by Royal House for lunch on a Sunday afternoon before our evening flight. I was worried that there would be a long line since all the other popular spots seemed to have a wait, but luckily we were seated right away. We ordered some dishes to share: 

[1] Crawfish Etouffee - delicious crawfish etouffee served over a bed of rice. This was easily my favorite dish of what we ordered. 
[2] Fried Alligator - marinated gator meat served with cocktail and tartar sauce. I always love alligator, it's like chicken but more moist and flavorful. The breading was crispy and light. 
[3] Chicken and Andouille Gumbo - NOLA style chicken and sausage served over rice. A-ok imo, but probably my least favorite dish of the 3 we ordered to share. 

Service was kind as usual, I just love southern hospitality. Food was pretty good as well. Out of all the things we ordered I would definitely get the Crawfish Etouffee again.

Funny how the bad review isn't at the top of this list so I figured I would also write one bc my niece whose 4 was eating a French onion soup and started chewing on an OYSTER shell! Yup that's right an oyster shell. Her mouth covered in shell her mother asked to speak to the manager and to our surprise the manager shows no empathy that a little girl could've had an allergy to it (which she did bc her entire back broke out in hives later that evening) or even worse could've choked on it! She had zero customer service skills and stated she "looked through" the soup and didn't find any more shell so idk how that got there...doesn't apologize and proceeds to ask her if she wants to file an incident report....yea lady that's what I want to do on a Saturday night sitting with my family waste time writing up an incident report. No sorry I'm just never going to come back and I'll just spread the word for others to do the same. Highly recommend u work on getting managers with better managerial skills..
GET THE CRAB CLAWS!!!!! That's all I have to say. The waitress recommended it to me and my friend & we came back the next day to eat it again

Our bike driver picked us up at Harrah's for a tour and told us we would like this place.   We stood at the door for a few moments and no one acknowledged us.  The bartender looked at us several times so I finally asked him if we needed to seat ourselves.  He pointed back at the door and the hostess appeared.  We asked about balcony seating so he took us upstairs.  He cleaned off two tables for us and left the one menu that was on the table. The waitress came and took our drink order but did not ask if we needed more menus so we shared.  We ordred oysters, fried alligator appetizer, alligator po boy, and red velvet pie.  The food came out however no silverware or napkins came with it.  Since we could not find our waitress we asked another one for assistance.  She brought me beverage napkins, a spoon to eat the pie, and no napkins for the other table.  Our waitress finally came by and apologized but did not bring correct dinner napkins that all the other tables had.  So 3 starts since the food we ordered was good however no stars for customer service.

What a cool little place! Right down the street from our hotel, was this nice sized oyster bar. Even though it was right on Royal (a touristy area) it still had a neighborhood flair. The oyster king was at the bar shucking his butt off, that was a great pleasure to watch the craft cuz I couldn't shuck one if my life depended on it lol. All the bartenders were really nice and even singing James Brown and other oldies, it was cool. I ordered the mushroom stuffed with seafood, I wasn't a fan of it, was kind of bland and tasted too much bread so I brought it back to my room. I also ordered the oyster rockefellar which was better but not the best but I tore through it =) I would recommend this place for location and the nice staff.

Favorite place I ate at in NOLA during our stay! We were looking around and just walked in here, and glad we did. We shared a few appetizers including the fried alligator, spinach dip, and crab claws. The alligator and crab claws were amazing. I got the crawfish ravioli, another of us got the tortellini, and then the chargrilled oysters... we had zero complaints. I'll be back on my next visit!

I should start by saying this: my husband and kids are the reason we came here. I. Do. Not. Like. Seafood. Of any kind. The waitress, Raven, was fantastic. She even informed me of a coupon they had! She recommended the redfish beignets and they were absolutely amazing. I ate an entire piece myself. We didn't try any oysters but what we did have (crawfish etouffe, blackened chicken sandwich [mine of course], kids shrimp and fries, and kids Mac and cheese) was superb. We are just visiting but this will likely be a spot we hit again.

The service was friendly, fast, and very helpful. We really enjoyed the fried alligator.  The fried fish strips and fries were very good. The shrimp Creole was good but not the best in town. Nice relaxing atmosphere.

Good oysters. Kid friendly. Reasonable prices and friendly wait staff. My husband and I ordered Taste of New Orleans and shrimp basket. Taste of New Orleans was great. Shrimp basket was just battered shrimp but was still really good

A group of 7 stopped here for lunch. We were seated after a brief wait. Our waitress was polite and prompt. As a person that never had oysters before, I can recommend them enough. We tried the Royal, Rockefeller, and Chargrilled. Beat one by far was the Chargrilled. So much that we went back the next day to get more. We also had the salad (Delish), alligator bites, fish fry and shrimp and grits. All was phenomenal. Highly recommend EVERYTHING.

Found this place on yelp and wasn't disappointed! We had the crab claw appetizer and that sauce is the bomb! You literally want to lick the plate. We also had the crayfish ravioli and shrimp jambalaya/both delicious! Our waitress was really sweet!
First place that was happy to have 10 guests....separate checks no problem. Food was fabulous and the service a step above. Definitely a must do stop for a great dinner and tasty beverages!

As a visitor to the city, this restaurant did not disappoint. The menu had a variety of entrees to get a taste of what New Orleans is about!

Had dinner at around 5:30 pm on a Saturday and there wasn't a wait at all. There's plenty of seating including on the balcony for those enjoying a dinner for 2.

The customer service was great. Our server was super nice and helpful. We were well taken care of!

I decided to try the "Taste of New Orleans" as well as the "Shrimp n Grits". Both great dishes.

Need to come back to try other items on the menu!

One of my favorite oysters bars in NOLA. I start every cost here. The hurricanes and gumbo are good. Normally we sit at the bar and get fast service. But sitting at the tables with a larger crowd is also good.

Red Fish Beignets!! Who knew such a thing existed. Yummy yummy!! 
FRESH raw oysters! 
Seafood pescatore served over linguini. You can sub a white wine butter sauce for the marinara. Tastes like a true Italian made it. 
Shrimp and grits. Traditionally southern and absolutely delicious. 
Ice cold beer on a hot August night. 
Lots of the seating is upstairs, lots of stairs. However, the balcony view is worth the climb. Unfortunately No room left for dessert.  
A true New Orleans experience and moderately priced.
Great food and great service.  Parmesan chips  and oyster linguini were excellent.  Oysters Royale delicious. Don't sit at the table by the door, condensation from ac vent drips on you.
Amazing food, worst staff ever. Plate of oysters dumped in my lap, no apology just an oops.

We loved Royal House! My husband and I had been in New Orleans since Thursday and had eaten at the more popular oyster houses and decided that Royal House had hands down the best oysters of all the places we visited, including Acme! The raw and chargrilled oysters were so buttery and delicious. For our entree we had the red beans and rice and it was, as you may have guessed, delicious! We will definitely recommend this place to those sojourning to New Orleans! If possible, see if you can grab a seat on the balcony; it makes the dining experience one you won't forget!
Not only was the food amazing but the service was out of this world. I wish I remembered our servers name but she made our night. Would recommend this place (and the crawfish ravioli) to anyone

I was lucky enough to grab a seat at the bar almost immediately. My first round was a dozen oysters. Totally worth it. Decided to go with an alligator po boy to finish out. It was super disappointing. Just lettuce, tomatoes and pickles. No mayo, aoli, anything. The server gave me ranch, which was terrible and not what the sandwich needed. I wasn't even offered ketchup for my fries.

This was a walk by and go in and check it out. Boy, glad we did. This place was pretty cool, ate upstairs with a view of the french quarter. Had a mojito that was really good. The service was good. Had grilled oysters with garlic butter and parmesan cheese...... YUM! Again glad we stopped in.

The waitstaff was the only thing nice about this place.  Thought the food was overpriced for quality and taste. 

We went there last night for dinner and spent more than a $100 for three people eating three entrees, one appetizer, and three beers.  The gumbo was disappointing, the texture of the broth was thick like they used corn starch.  The blue crab appetizer tasted good but was served with only a few slices of bread.  Maybe they expected us to drink the remaining sauce?  We were charged when asked for extra bread. 

We will not be going there again.  Surprised it has such a good rating.

Well it's been ok. But you have to watch the time of day.  Came 2hrs till closing and got boned.  We tried to go somewhere else but they were all closed. Except the Denny's of the quarter "daisy dukes".  Got red fish bignets and they were cold pancake covered fish like substance. Threw money in the trash that night.

Their chargrilled oysters are really good.

Taste of New Orleans not so much. Both the quality of the food and the presentation was a little too much like a cafeteria.

Spinach salad with blackened scallops was pretty good.

Service was friendly and there when we needed them.

Best thing about this place was that they were open rather late.

We were here last night. Our char broiled  oysters were delish with crabmeat on top. We asked for them well, that's the trick! We also had side salads. Our waitress was awesome. Oh and the butter pecan pie was good also. I think their  char broiled oysters are better than Drago's.

My friends and I stopped by Royal House for dinner on our first night in NOLA. The food was great, service was great, and pricing is on point. We were celebrating my brother and his friend's birthday and the waitress was so sweet - she brought out a muffin with a candle and we sang "happy birthday".

Will definitely come back again!

Had to waste time before a night attraction so we decided to eat in the Royal House. I was not impressed. They didn't have many gluten free items. The one thing that was exceptional was the hamburger but was unable to get french fries because they were coated so instead I had garlic mashed potatoes which was so spicy and full of cheese. Both of which are not my friend. So overall,I did not enjoy my meal and would never return if and when I come back to New Orleans

This place is a must place to visit the place is awesome. The food and service is great. TY is an awesome server. Ask for him to be your server. He provides excellent service and great recommendations.
Had the blackened redfish, potatoes, green beans, TY was an awesome server. Great place.

This place was recommended to us by a few people; we were told to sit at the oyster bar and request Anthony because he's just awesome. Unfortunately when we arrived for a late lunch the oyster bar was pretty packed and it would be a long wait. Since we were on a schedule we decided not to wait and just have a seat at the regular bar. Our bartender wasn't very friendly but she did provide good service. The oysters were fresh, the food was delicious, and the Redfish Beignets were outstanding! I could've eat them everyday. So so good. And although we didn't get to sit with Anthony he still stopped by to say hello and take a picture with us. What a great personality this man has. We will definitely be returning with more time so we can wait to sit with him.
Beautiful restaurant! Great food and service. The drinks are large and very good. It's location is central and close to shops.  Very nice atmosphere

One of the highlights of my trip to NOLA and I will be back. The service was over the top amazing. Our waiter, John, was so funny and charming and steered us in the right direction with our orders. 

Started with the crab claws, please do not leave New Orleans without trying this. They come declawed and in the best roux I've ever had in my 

I NEEDED to have a po'boy and went totally traditional with a shrimp one. It did not disappoint. 

Best friend had the trio of gumbo, etouffé, and jambalaya and liked all three.

The best part is that they let us bring in our ridiculous footlong daquiris from another restaurant and drink them while we dined. Can't wait to come back!

Our waiter was great. 

The food:
Awful. The shrimp jambalaya was dry crunchy rice and cold shrimp.($18)

The Mahi was FISHY and INCREDIBLY salty.($24) 

Such an awful experience.  Not sure how it got 4*.

ALSO, the food presentation is NOT as pictured. False advertisement.

Stopped at the Royal House for a beer to plan an oyster tour. Relaxed atmosphere, some hipsters, some families, friendly staff. Decided a quick order here, half shell with a side of Martinis.  Super fresh, plump oysters.  Stayed for chargrilled oysters, even better.  Fresh oysters broiled in butter and Parmesan was a wow moment.  Reluctantly, we moved on to the next oyster stop but these were exceptional.

Super friendly staff and good food! We ordered the shrimp po'boy and gumbo with hush puppies. The shrimp was well seasoned with light breading in a soft baguette. The gumbo had a lot of flavor also and was really good.

First timer in New Orleans and was recommended by the concierge at my hotel to try the char-grilled oysters as they were some off the best in town. He wasn't wrong! 
I ordered the char- broiled oysters covered in butter and parmesan cheese. A spinach salad topped with cranberries, feta crumbles, julienne green apples and candied pecans. Plus a side of eggplant chips which are thinly sliced fried eggplants and is AMAZING! The bartender that served me, Dan, was cool, friendly and a good sense of humor. Very welcoming.

Ok so i have gone here twice. Once with the kids and again for buisness.
The oysters were not great the first time I got them here and other places nearby are better priced and taste awesome. 
Also costs is super high for lower quality. 
When i stopped by after work I  got a steam shrimp boil which was a disappointment when I got back to the hotel. It tasted leftover and the butter and condiments were missing.

Service was amazing. The best thing was the alligator nuggets. The shrimp po boy was very dry and flavorless and the shrimp creole didnt have any taste, fairly bland. Go to Market Cafe or Copper Monkey
I was told if I ever go to NOLA, try beignets..I tried that and fried alligator! Rocking! Kudos to the chef and the hostess with the mostess,Yamini (and she's cute) Good Service!

Uhmm what can I say, I'm sitting here in the restaurant and I cannot wait to rave about the food and our awesome server Gaynell! I thought I already tasted the best chargrilled oysters but then came... the royal house. Yes. Yes. Yes. Amazingly tasty. Dont get me started with the crab claw...I almost died. Its soooooo good.  I highly recommend both dishes and please when you see Gaynell, tell her shes a star. Amazing customer service. Very friendly and she can damn sing. This is just a great experience for me. Now im just waiting for my red velvet!!!!

OH MY MY!! This place is super excellent! The food and service is superb. 

We had crab claws for starters and they were off the chain delish. I ordered grilled red fish with potatoes and green beans. Did not leave one bite on my plate...YUM. My husband ordered rib eye steak with potatoes and green beans and loved his too. I had to have a bite or three of his huge steak and it was melt in your mouth good. 

The bartenders were friendly, professional and attentive. 

We chose to sit at the bar since the wait for a table was a minimum of 25 minutes. We still had to wait for a seat at the bar (about 10 min) but it was worth it. The place was packed the whole time. Don't be put off by the line waiting outside, it's not as bad as it seems...the hostess will come ask if you want to continue to wait for a table or sit at the bar.

This was one of the best meals we had in New Orleans. The waiter was excellent!! Personable, informative and right on. He recommended the crabs claws which he said I would dream about.. and you know what.. I have!  In addition while they have a bar I'd say this is a kid friendly ( in the day) atmosphere in the French quarter!
Best oysters in NOLA!!! Food is really good too! Wait staff super nice! Bloody Mary's are large and good!
The menu here is filled with amazing options. We ordered    half shell raw oysters that were pretty big and tasted great. I ordered the crawfish ravioli which was absolutely amazing.

The Charbroiled Oysters were cheesier and more robust in flavor than Acme. I was recommended to ask to sit upstairs on the balcony by a local children's clothing shop owner while shopping for a gift, and I couldn't have had a better seat! Great view, breeze, live music drifting up from below... it was wonderful! Rebecca was an excellent, attentive and friendly server who gave me great recommendations!!! Go with the Charbroiled oysters and enjoy a Hurricane
Leroy made the experience for us. Give that man a raise! The oysters we had here were bigger and fresher than other oysters we had in the city. French quarter prices but convenient and enjoyable.
Thanks he up up up tooy6 you have a good day at the office at home and yyyy you turn the heat on latere toda toiy

Terrible service. We got the crab appitizer which took an hour to come out. I gave 2 stars because the appitizer was really really amazing but everything else was terrible. Another 45 minutes for our food. Our kids fell asleep because it took so long and they couldnt stay awake to eat. My rice was burnt. Literally burnt. It was a terrible experience.
This place is so charming yet accessible. Eat upstairs if you can and order the shrimp and grits. You won't be disappointed.

The service was horrible, our waitress didn't say much to us at all, took our order and we were joking that she/he(we weren't sure) was like a ninja, come and just toss something on the table without saying anything. The menu is a tad confusing, we ordered the wrong thing and it was not good at all. Overall we spent a lot of money for terrible food and horrible service.

This place is amazing! Let me start by saying Tosha has to be one of the most lovely people I've met in a long while. She was very pleasant and sociable which I appreciate because she really made this Cali girl feel welcomed. Yamini (spell check) was our server and she was super attentive and very pleasant as well, all the staff was. The food was great, portions large enough to feed 2, and drinks were nice and strong. Will definitely visit again when I am back in LA.

LOVE THE OYSTERS!!! All of them!!!! Rockafeller, chargrilled, fresh! I didn't think I'd like the baked/chargrilled type of oysters because I tend to only like fresh. But Royal House has the best oysters and service all the way. Gaynell was or favorite!  The dinners weren't the best I've had but maybe I'd try something else if we go for dinner again. We did go many times for drinks and oysters. I will also say, if you bring a table the wrong drink that they didn't order, I wouldn't make them pay for it if they drink some of it while they wait for the right drink they ordered. Bad policy and not right to do in the food industry.

This place was OK. We went one night for dinner pretty late. The service was good considering they were about 1 hour away from closing. The food didn't take long at all. But the food was nothing special, nothing memorable. The Jambalaya rice was pretty dry and to me was missing seasoning. The red beans and rice were pretty bland and we definitely had better. The alligator bites were good though but way to small and brought way to little. Should make an option to include more. It brought like only 6 or 7 small bites. For drinks we just had 2 beers and some water. Will I be back? Probably not considering there are so many options in NOLA but if you're looking for a decent place to have a meal this is a good spot.

I wasn't impressed by the oysters here. I ordered a dozen of the chargrilled and they were a little overdone and salty. I also tried the duo which comes with 2 different ones and they weren't great. The waitress was nice, but my goodness the guy who was bringing us the food would pass by toss the plates on our table without even stopping by or looking ..so rude.. I've had much better oysters down the street from there, there are tons of options

This restaurant is a MUST to go to when in New Orleans.  It is at the corner of St Louis and Royal Street. The two times we just walked in and got seated right away.  Our server was Leroy. He was awesome! He knew his menu and was very enthusiastic about it.  Very impressive!  Everyone in the staff was so nice, esp the manager who went around asking if we were good. Must try the crab claws, Pescatore, chargrilled oysters and redfish beignets. Oh & the desserts were delish too...I just cant remember what it was called.. Im sure everything else is good because all the dishes we ordered had lots of flavor and tasty! Definitely add this place to your list!

The food, the service, the atmosphere all A+. Arrow was hosting. He made excellent entree recommendations. Our server, Ariel, was fantastic. She made sure we had everything we needed. The  manager, Courtney, even stopped by to make sure our dining experience had been top notch. Definitely a great choice for dinner.

Great spot in the heart of the quarter! We liked the ambiance so much we ate here twice on our trip. The first time with some family members that had their one year old baby with them, and the Royal House was so accommodating when most of the French quarter isn't super kid friendly. The second time we had a more intimate meal on the balcony. Both times the food was great but the service was even better!

We had high hopes after reading other reviews.  Very disappointing.  Food in the French Quarter seems to be really good or really really bad.  I barely touched my food and it managed to give me a stomach ache for hours after.  Waiter didn't acknowledge my full plate when he cleared it.  Does that mean he wasn't surprised?

Decided to try this place out since it was recommended for their oysters. We ordered grilled garlic and butter oysters and they were so delicious! I really mean delicious! This was the best part of the meal. We really didn't care too much for the entrees but everyone's palates  are different so no worries. The best part of my dining experience here was the service. Ty went above and beyond to treat us like his friends and was so personable that I wish I could clone him and bring him to Houston to show other servers how it should be done. Just because of his service alone, I will be back.

Had an amazing meal consisting of the crab claws, raw oysters on half shell, pound of boiled shrimp, and the pecan mahi mahi. Food was flavorful and rich, definitely a treat yourself meal. Jessica was excellent and so attentive she gave awesome feedback on menu items. My boyfriend and i sat outside on the balcony and were able to hear live jazz...an excellent last meal in nola. A little pricey, but delicious

This was where my husband and I had our first dinner on vacation in New Orleans and it did not disappoint. Start with the oyster rockefeller and try the Taste of New Orleans. The Chicken & Andouille Jambalaya, Crawfish Etouffée and Chicken and Andouille Gumbo are to.die.for. I would not recommend what we had for dessert (red velvet pie), but that would not deter me from coming again!

There are so many places to eat within the French Quarter and I am so happy that we happened to choose this restaurant in particular. Their Crab Claws appetizer is one of the best things I've ever eaten. I wish I knew what was in that dipping sauce! In general, it seems that their seafood there is on point as we both ordered their Seafood Pescatore and Oyster Pasta. Wonderful service and our food was reasonably priced.

Excellent food & service! The staff was friendly & knowledgeable. The char-broiled oysters and gumbo were divine. The drinks were large and very tasty. We will definitely be back on out next trip to New Orleans!

We have eaten here numerous times while in New Orleans! It is so delicious. I had the charbroiled oysters and the shrimp tortellini! Both were outstanding! They also have a fabulous butter pecan dessert! Highly recommend this restaurant!

Kids almost starved waiting for their food.  Dont know why kid's mac n vheese, french onion soup and crawfish ravioli would take more than an hour to come out.  Especially when there are several empty tables around us.     We asked the waitress twice about the mac n chesse since the kids were really starving.  When the food finally came out, the soup was hot, ravioli was warm, and the mac was cold ( probably from sitting on the counter for an hour).  Forgot to mention our cocktails came out after we finished our appetizer.  Although the food was good (except the alligator fried - small portion and not crispy), we couldn't even enjoy it.  Every few minutes our table would be hit by a water drop. Annoying to say the less.

Thought we were done, but before finishing this review we realized that our raw oysters haven't come out yet.  It is not 1.5hr.  This is such a poor experience, we will not be back nor can we recommend this place.

Easy to get to clean and staff was super friendly and kind. Got seated right away. Came in with full intention to order a bunch of food. My eating partner wasn't feeling the menu so we decided to start with the crab claws... really good!! Not the best ever but good. Ask for more bread before ordering! There was a festival and parade outside the restaurant... so the majority of the staff was really interested in watching it... we didn't get checked on for a while. So we decided to end it there and keep moving. Again, not bad at all... just make sure you order quick :)

Came here with a friend - it is okay.  It has a steady clientale of tourists that keep it busy.  We ordered the oysters royal and shrimp and grits.  It was good but not noteworthy.  The service was not bad.  All in all I think it benefits from heavy tourist traffic.  I would probably not go here again.
we order the seafood pasta， the clam、shrimp not fresh。And alsofried oyster is not fresh too

I might have caught the kitchen on a bad night but after waiting an hour for our food and 45 min to sit down here is what went down...
Ordered shrimp creole (18$) and a cup of gumbo ($7).
The Shrimp creole had to be sent back simply because the red sauce was so bland it tasted like ketchup or tomatoe paste. Zero seasoning, no spice and no soul for an 18$ entre I object....
The cup of gumbo was just a plain gray water gumbo not nearly worth $7 but meh....
No crackers no bread no butter, Nothing!
Warning signs went ignored when we saw the adjacent table takeoff before their meal arrived. Be advised, YOU HAVE BEEN WARNED... .

Waited over an hour for two meals. Saw another tables food come out and be put on a table with no customers to consume the food. I guess they got tired of waiting. As I looked around It was the same scene..... tables with no food. It was almost 11:00 p.m on a Sunday night so not sure what was going on. One entree had to be sent back. Waitress said she would get manager but never came back. Super irritating after sitting and waiting and just wanting to pay for what we had eaten. Took forever just to get one beer also. Not worth your time! Never saw manager either .

Food was awesome. Hostess were really nice and friendly. I waited probably for 5 minutes for our seats. I am allergic to shrimp and my friend didn't want oyster so we order differently from a lot of other reviews. I order the eggplant and oyster entree which is linguine pasta with fried eggplant and fried oysters. My friend order seafood Pescatore (I might have spell it wrongly). I wasn't expecting it to be good since the other reviews are on the raw oysters. But it came out really really delicious and I finish the whole plate within 15 minutes. I also used yelp to have a free appetizer (which I recommend everyone to do) for oysters taco. It was so good but not fantastic. The only reason I give 4 stars instead of 5 was because the service was mediocre or bad actually. First, it took forever and then she forgot to give the free appetizer ( which is okay) but the manager minus the yelp and ask us again if we really did the yelp check in and he ended up giving -$12 and we have to pay the remaining of $1.50 which is okay but it shouldn't be if it suppose to be free. Or maybe it has a upper cap of $12 and so I have to pay the difference which my waitress didn't tell me. But I paid it in the end cause I didn't want more delay since it took forever. But I will still recommend someone visiting NO to go to this place though. The other waiter or waitress seem to be more attentive( I had plenty of time to observe).

I enjoyed lunch here on a Monday with my husband and the food was great. We ordered the alligator bites and the crab claws for an appetizer. Both were delicious. I never had alligator before, but in my honest opinion, it tastes like fish. My husband said it tasted like shrimp... idk. It was tasty though and seasoned well. 
For the entree, I had the shrimp platter and he had a fish po boy. Both were yummy and we'd return for the alligator bites if we are ever in the area again.

The crab claws were delicious but the fried shrimp they used in their platter tasted dirty and the chargrilled oysters tasted like someone dumped garlic on them overpowering the oysters themselves. My wife ended up not eating her meal at all and we weren't able to get a refund unfortunately.

We visited the Royal House without a reservation on Sunday, September 2nd at about 9:30PM with a party of two. We sat at the bar.  

The service we received at the bar was excellent. There were two people behind the bar that really enjoyed the company of one another and in turn the service to the guests was great (and entertaining).  

As for the food, we shared two entrees.  One was the Crawfish ravioli and the other was the Alligator Po Boy.  

We found the Alligator Po Boy to be kind of bland.  We found the Crawfish Ravioli to be EXCELLENT; however, the food came out lukewarm to room temperature at best.  We also felt that the portion size received was more in line with a $15.00 entree and not a $24.00 entree.  

So, mixed reviews on the food.  In comparison to other places in the area, I felt the prices were a little bit higher than they should have been.

With that said, I would recommend you try this restaurant on your own and form your own opinion.

This was our favorite place in NOLA. had the raw and chargrilled oysters/ freshly shucked in front of you! and the seafood linguine with white sauce! OMG - it was heaven on Earth. Make this place your special dining spot, u won't regret it. casual yet chic, no fuss just great food!

Ok BOMB! No seriously bomb. While visiting Nola I had high expectations for food and this was one of the few places that met those. The bar staff is so friendly! Cindy one of our bartenders on my last visit there is a character! Shes so funny and knowledgeable and helpful with recommendations  on the menu. The crab legs are sooooo good I even took the remaining sauce to go!
great place great service great drinks delicious food I had the   oysters my wife had some fish its was great
Oyster Beignets were delicious! Perfect taste! Shrimp Po' boy was a little dry but tasty overall. French Quarter Margarita was sooooo good!

Every time my husband and I come to NOLA we have to make a visit to the Royal House Oyster Bar to enjoy some fresh oysters on the half shell, delicious cocktails and the best French onion soup I've ever eaten.  This trip was amazing and we were blessed to have Tasia as our server.  She was kind, gracious and convinced my husband to try the Charbroiled Oysters which he highly recommends.  It's another wonderful trip to the Royal House to round out our visit this time to New Orleans.  We will be back the next time we are in town and asking for Tasia who made this visit our best ever!

Yummy food, drinks and great server! Yamini was great, she anticipated our needs even before we needed to flag her! Definition of a great worker! She was pleasant, engaging, and most of all , she was on top of everything and she was training a new person too! Waters and drinks always full, if she noticed that our other drinks were running low, she would ask if we wanted another one or brought a whole new glass of soda that needed a refill. Fresh oysters on the half shell. Delicious! The char grilled oysters in butter and garlic and Parmesan cheese... to die for. We also had the crawfish ravioli, this dish was also delicious, lots of crawfish without working for it. The taste of New Orleans was ok. It had the gumbo, jambalaya and the crawfish etouffee. We were too stuffed with everything else to fully enjoy this dish!  The Bloody Mary .. oh so good. You can barely taste the alcohol and they use their own mix to make
It. Great place, great food and awesome service.

Friendly staff! Fairly fast service. People with us had shrimp platter. Was very good quality breaded shrimp. Good batter on fries. We had crawfish ravioli. Enjoyed it but the 6 raviolis just didnt feel like $24. Maybe $14-16 would have been worth 6 raviolis? Still tasted good though!

Located in the heart of French Quarter, Royal House is a great place to sit and enjoy the entrancing music from the streets and the lively New Orleans scene. 

I grabbed food at the bar and sipped on a well-made Hurricane :) Maybe it was my selection (parmesan garlic oysters and crab legs), but I found the sauce accompanying the crab legs to be too salty and the portion size itself to be exceptionally small. For my first dish, I got Parmesan garlic oysters which were delicious on principle, but probably overkill because it was hard to taste the oysters themselves.

However, bonus points for free fresh oysters when the server realized it was my first-ish time eating oysters and that I had squandered it by smothering them with cheese and breadcrumbs XD

Kaitlyn W. was our amazing waitress and she absolutely made our experience for our whole trip. She was so friendly and happy and had excellent recommendations for our trip. We were soooo lucky to encounter this beautiful soul!

Raw oysters were so fresh I could taste the ocean. Monica our waitress was amazing she deserves a raise!! 
Blood marry and The Royal cup were so refreshing. I highly recommend the BLT-oyster Po-Boy was to die for.
So much fun.  Crawfish pasta (with shrimp instead) was phenomenal.  I ordered it because I didn't want to regret not tasting it.  Ty our waiter was hilarious and helped make our night extra fun!

There's way to much competition in New Orleans to say who's have the best Charbroiled oysters, but I can say this the Royal House has one me over with their Crab claw appetizer . Nicely located in the French Quarters, right on Royal street away from all the sights and smells of bourbon street
Oysters were not great, which is sad. Bartender hustled us- plunking down another round before we we're halfway through a beer ( neither of us wanted it).  Stay away from this tourist trap.
We loved it here! The food was great (crab claws are a must!!), the service was excellent! And Cindy our host was very friendly, helpful and had great recommendations. We definitely recommend it.
The shrimp and grits were yummy and our server "Kaitlyn" was  super friendly and phenomenal !!

What a terrible experience. We arrived a little after 7pm and was seated upstairs. The waiter came over after a few mins to take drink orders and returned fairly quickly with water but not the drinks. That came about 20 mins later. Things pretty much went downhill from there. It took about 30 minutes for him to come back to take the food order. In fact we had to go look for him to take the food order and he never showed but I believe it was the manager that showed instead. She took the order and said she would get the order in "right away". We didn't see her put the order in until about 20 minutes after that. We waited about 70 minutes to get the food. While the crab claws were pretty good I wouldn't say the rest of the food was worth waiting that long for. The waiter barely checked in on us until we were ready to pay. Terrible customer service. I would never go back.

Absolutely awful...from the hostess to service to food. I had eaten at Oceana the previous night and asked for another recommendation. Whomever is telling you (or me) that this place is even edible must be getting free food or paid...absolutely awful in every way possible. Avoid at all costs! Forewarned.

Lisa contacted me asking for more information...here it is...I do not want anything free...not looking for anything else...already had the most ruinous and vile experience and would never return under any circumstance. How does this place stay in business?

So I've never in my life even wanted to try oysters...I mean, why? Seen so gross. And seriously...raw??? Well, go to Royal House Oster Bar and dang it, just try 'em. On a cracker... Lemon juice... Cocktail sauce... Hot sauce... horseradish... Not bad at all. Now I'm not saying I'm an oyster eater now, but if you're looking to try something new and daring, do it. Decided later that day to try (at Antoines) Oysters Rockefeller...um....hard No.  Back to Royal House... Staff is friendly...beer is good. Oh, and fried alligator.. Another first for me. Honestly, it really does pretty much taste like chicken. Try it.

I came here for the sole purpose to eat oysters, alligator bites, and gumbo. Mission accomplished! I left a happy women! Simple is as simple gets. Flavors were good and it was a hot sunny day for AC and Good food in nawlins'.
The food was great and the service was wonderful. We were very well greeted at the entrance and it has a good view of what New Orleans has to offer.
Excellent service the server was great recommending entres! And the food was great! Awesome to come and celebrate a birthday! Great environment, would totally come again!!

My first time at the Royal House and I enjoyed this restaurant! I was more excited about being able to sit on the balcony and watch the strip as I ate my meal. I ordered the shrimp tortellini and it was good, not great. It was a "I could've cooked this at home" type dish, but I still enjoyed. My boyfriend ordered the red beans and rice, which he loved. Service was decent, atmosphere was crowded but chill.
Service was fantastic! Anthony was professional and attentive, but most importantly, had a fantastic personality!
Outstanding oysters. Chargrilled my favorite.  Great place to have dinner if your in the French quarter

The food was amazing but the SERVICE was incredible!!!! From the hosts to the server to the bussers we were taken care of like we were VIP!! I had a party of 9 and they accommodated  us on a busy saturday night. Thanks so much!!!!

Girls trip in August. A group of 9 of us. I found this going a search of good places to eat in the French quarter and this kept coming up. It was a Friday night and I couldn't make a resi so I was a little bit nervous that with a party of 9 it would be a long wait. But it was all of 5 mins. The waiters were interactive and knowledgable and so entertaining. The food. Omg! I can't say enough! With 9 of us, we got we got a little bit of everything! The roasters oysters were to die, the alligator was tender, the tour was divine, just everything was fresh and tasty! You can't go wrong with a single dish! We shared, everything and found fault in nothing!

Ava was absolutely the best server ever

she was kind and helpful and had several great recommendations

i've been here before and walked away unimpressed but this time was sooooo much better and Eva's charm made all the difference. the sazerac was perfect too!

The food was great and what made my experience even better was our server (Ava). She was very friendly and provided the best service I had in a long time.  I highly  recommend going to the Royal House.

Cindy at the Royal house is amazing! Knows the menu inside and out and knows exactly what to recommend! She made our entire day! We go back in a heartbeat. Food and drinks were fantastic! We're looking for a good appetizer and found the royhouse . We had crab claws and bloody Mary's that were out of this world. Can't say enough about our experience here highly recommend!!!
Nice location and great atmosphere! Oysters were great!  We had balcony seating and enjoyed street performance. Will come back again.

Stopped in with my wife and sister in law for a late lunch. We were seated pretty quickly but the wait for the food was fairly long. Being from South Louisiana it wasn't anything special. Very overpriced for what we got. We got the red beans and rice with chicken tenders, fried shrimp platter with fries, coleslaw, 2 hushpuppies and French onion soup. The chicken tenders were pretty small but okay. The fried shrimp platter was average. My wife loved he coleslaw and the soup was just french onion soup.

This is seriously the best restaurant in NOLA *dreamy heart eyes* If/when I come back, I'm for sure coming here first. My friends and I stayed in the area for about a week, and trust me when we say we literally ate our way through New Orleans. Of everything, this was our favorite place of them all. So good that I even ordered a dozen chargrilled oysters to go home with me on the 4 hour plane ride back to California. *no shame*

TLDR;; this is the happiest place on earth, should be your #1 food stop in NOLA! And get the chargrilled oysters!!

From the hostess to the server to the bartender, everyone was so welcoming, attentive and just..so nice! For 3, we definitely got too excited since we ordered 18 oysters, 4 sides, an appetizer and an entree. Seriously, everything was amazing and did not disappoint. As a tourist, I wanted to try all the different types of food NOLA was known for, so I liked that Royal House didn't specialize in just one thing, and instead, had a good variety on their menu for us to pick from.

*Chargrilled Oysters: THE BEST in town!! I don't know what they do, but it was just enough Parmesan, garlic and all the goods on top of a perfectly grilled oyster. Will make you switch over from being a raw oyster fan

*Raw Oysters: Fresh, large and shucked right in front of you! What else could we ask for?

* Crab Craws Appetizer: Oh man, the crabs are so fresh and meaty, and the sauce is to die for!!! 

*Taste of New Orleans: 3 small cup-bowls of Jambalaya, Crawfish Etoufee, and Chicken/Andouille Gumbo--if you're new to the area like I was, this will give you a sample of the popular dishes of NOLA!

For the sides, we got rice and beans, fries, hush puppies and garlic mashed potatoes. If you're on the fence about ordering these, just go for it :)

I came here with friends on my last night of our vacation. This was where we decided to go after doing a happy hour circuit prior. This is a decent place but by the end of a week long trip, it kind of blended into the other places we had gone. 

We got seated fairly quickly and on the second story. This was both a good thing and a bad one. Good in that we could people watch and bad because there is only one way up and down. You have to take turns going down if people are coming io the stairs. For being mostly open upstairs, you are able to hear your party even with large groups nearby. 

This was another spot where I had the charbroiled oysters. Again, they were very good. I'm not sure I can pick a favorite spot because all of the recipes are slightly different. I then had cajun shrimp with dirty rice. Good but nothing spectacular. 

A good place but not necessarily at the top of my most return list.

I can't comment on the food. Only the service.  We got there around 3pm so it was not busy.  We requested the balcony and were seated there. I felt it was about to collapse onto the street below.  Then we waited to be served....and waited....and waited....then left in disgust.  I would rate lower, but since I did not eat anything perhaps the food is good....if you don't mind waiting FOREVER!

I ordered the chicken sausage gumbo and the fried gator for appetizers. The fried alligator tasted like chicken. Gumbo was so delicious! For dinner I ordered the shrimp boil- it was fantastic! The shrimp was big, perfectly seasoned.

I'm so glad we decided to try royal house. 
The vibe was great, decor was crisp and clean and the service was excellent . 
I had a chicken salad . It included green apples, pecans , cranberries and diced chicken . It was was just what i needed after bombarding my palate with the flavors of NOLA. 

My friend went for it and got the crab claw appetizer ( i didn't try it since I have a shellfish allergy). It's small crab claws in this Cajun creamy sauce., she sopped up every bit of it with her bread so it must've been good. She also got a spinach salad and their garlic roasted potatoes which she said were the best red potatoes she has ever had. 

We ended our meal with bread pudding which had peaches and raisins in it. It was warm and moist  just the way it's supposed to be. 
We also had buttered bourbon pecan pie. This is different than the usual pecan pie. It had a graham cracker crust and a whipped filling -my friend had been looking for pecan pie since we arrived so she was a little disappointed when it came out but she tried it and was so impressed . 

I will definitely be back the next time I'm in town 

Don't forget to check in -you will get a free appetizer!
Waited over an hour and a half  for food and food sucks!!!!! Nothing special at all. Don't waste your time.

Went here for dinner with my fiance. Service was fast and friendly. Get the crab claws and chargrilled oysters to start. They're as good as everyone says. I couldn't decide on an entree so I got the new Orleans sampler which consists of their gumbo, crawfish etouffee, and jambalaya - all delicious! My fiance got the shrimp and grits which also tasted really good. We'd definitely come again.

I would say this restaurant is only worth coming for if you can get a seat on the balcony. It's obviously catered to tourists and I found the food overpriced and average. I wouldn't suggest this restaurant if you are visiting New Orleans.
Oysters are bigger and fresher than those in ACME and felix. Pecan fish(with donation to some charity institution) is so good! Love this resteraunt.

Took a chance...dont know the area...really good

Jambalaya was so good..i ordered that with ribeye and crab meat on top....not only did it look great it tasted great. Grilled and juicy and a good cut of meat.
Kaitlin is the best waitress we've had so far in the city.  She handled all our requests promptly and with a smile.  Good experience and the Food was great!
I just love this place!! Food is delicious and atmosphere is great, love the tables in the window ways.

Right in the heart of the French quarter the location can't be beat. The crab claw appetizer was amazing. Nairobi shucking oysters was the coolest. He showed me how it's done after many years of avoiding oysters, and I won't be avoiding them anymore.

My husband and I had an amazing experience here. Our server Ty was phenomenal. He was so full of energy and positivity and he took amazing care of us. The oysters were excellent and the drinks were delicious!

We stopped in here for a quick dinner on our last night in New Orleans.  Hands down, this was our favorite meal of the week!  We ordered the chargrilled oysters as an appetizer and they were amazing.  My only wish was that we'd ordered 12 instead of 6.  I ordered the crawfish ravioli as my entree and it was also delicious.  My boyfriend was nice enough to share some of his bread with me to sop up the rest of my sauce, or else I probably would've licked the bowl.  Because it was our last night, we also ordered desert.  I had the pecan pie.  I could've died a happy girl after that!  The service was also fantastic!
Best Bloody Mary in NOLA.  See Cindy at the bar  and this gal will hook you up right!

As a visitor this is NOT ONE OF MY FAVORITE PLACES TO COME TO EAT. The Waiter was all over the place. Staff was dragging garbage past our table while we were eating. And the food was just mediocre. The sauteed crab claws and the baked shrimp pasta was a thumbs up. The jambalaya was horrible, rice grains were hard and dry, shrimp just sat at the edge of plate.

Environment is cool and clean, a nice break from the streets of the French Quarter. We came in on a Sunday around 6pm and got seated right away. 

We got the Bloody Mary ($11),fried alligator ($11), shrimp and grits (~$14), and fried shrimp platter (~$19). 

The Bloody Mary was delicious and perfectly sour!! The fried alligator was moist and tasted like chicken to me. The shrimp and grits were creamy and lemony. The fried shrimps were smaller shrimp, but delicious.

I met Nairobi over 6 years ago on my first visit to NOLA and Royal House Oyster Bar. Royal house was AMAZING then and it hasn't changed over the 4 times I've been here over the years. On top of the oysters and food being amazing, Nairobi really separated Royal House from every oyster bar for me.  He couldn't be kinder and made sure I knew what to do and not to do in NOLA. IM always grateful and excited to visit him when I come back to the city!

Well, it's time for me to leave NOLA and one just cannot go without having the chargrilled oysters. It's October (ie rainy season). But natives refer to it as "tropical" which means it won't last all day. There was a long enough break for me to walk over and remain dry. It was about 11:30a-12p. I was promptly greeted and seated by the gentleman at the door. They were busy, but not that swamped busy. My server greeted me as she walked by. She wasn't overly enthusiastic or friendly...kind of there to just do her job and move on. But nonetheless I placed my order. 

The A/C was cranked way down!! Almost like freezing. The front door was open but I couldn't really tell by the inside temps. Sipped my water as to not turn into a popsicle. Oysters were fresh, seasoned and chargrilled well. Not an over abundance of any one ingredient. 

I ate, paid my bill and left. All the staff was very attentive and accommodating...other than my server really. And yes, I would go again.

The only dinner that kinda disappointed. It was Friday night and the whole staff just seemed miserable. The food was ok nothing to rave about. We thought it was overpriced compared to our other meals in the area for the quality. It's an ok restaurant, wont ever come back.

We were looking for a place to eat while here on vacation. I'm glad we chose Royal House! The service was wonderful (I wish I could remember our server's name but I can't!)  and so was the food. My husband had the Taste of New Orleans and I had the shrimp and grits. Delicious, both of them. The Oysters Rockefeller and Oysters Royals were awesome and I've never had oysters before. Check this place out!

We went early on a Friday night and were immediately seated. We had the red beans and and rice topped with sausage and fried chicken strips. It was flavorful. The roast beef po boy was very salty. The meat was tender. Service was good. They have a large bar. Most seats have a view of the passerby's on the streets. Overall, it was ok.

The crab claws were AMAZING!!  I might just go back again for more.  However, sitting at the bar area was very tight and people were hovering around me (I guess they had to grab my seat in a hurry or something) as I tried to pay the bill to leave--it was rude & unpleasant.  Basically eat in a hurry and go kind of feeling.  Oh, everyone's ID is checked at the bar where I think it took to a little ridiculous level where older couples were clearly not under-age were asked to show IDs.  Looks of confusion came on customers' faces.  

I would go back again for the food but I wouldn't recommend sitting at the bar unless you don't mind the eat in a hurry and get out feeling.
Small and cramped and really awesome. Hush puppies are delicious as well as alligator. It's a must have. Great atmosphere and friendly staff.  The burger was decent and the hush puppies are amazing.

Terrible food! We got the creole sampler and only 1 of the 3 items was edible. The manager did take our entree off the bill and offer us something else. When they brought us the crawfish etouffe the rice was undercooked and we kept getting hard rice in each bite. 
The manager was nice and the atmosphere nice but not a 4 star restaurant!

Amazing food and service! I know y'all probably read all the bad reviews but I would really pay attention to this. I think this is the absolute best food I've had visiting New Orleans. I don't usually leave reviews but this place was especially great. The waiters and waitresses are all very nice and accommodating. They loved children and were happy to help anyway they could. I loved it and would highly recommend this place.

Food was amazing!! The sauce for the crab appetizer was magnificent I wanted a bowl of just that! My pasta was amazing. The only thing was I was a little disappointed in the taste of New Orleans plate. I feel like I was lacking flavor.

Good food.. really good food. But horribly slow kitchen. I'm literally sitting here right now waiting on the banana foster cheesecake we ordered 25 minutes ago. I'm here on vacation to see the NOLA, not wait 2+ hours for an entree and dessert. Thanks, but I'll go somewhere else next time.

I ducked in here on a Monday night after a drenching downpour on a haunted Quarter walking tour.  Wasn't my first choice, but they were open till 11pm and I could warm up with some grilled oysters and soup.  The food was great!  Had the grilled oysters, French Onion soup, and fried alligator bites.  They brought me a bowl of gumbo by mistake and let me enjoy it free of charge.  However, I just kinda felt a little rushed and unwanted.  There were still several tables dining and a few people at the bar, which is where I ate.  All my food was brought out at once.  No dipping sauce for the 'gator bites.  Not necessarily ignored by the bartender, service was okay, just felt like they didn't want me in there despite the guy outside trying to lure you in.  Maybe I've just been spoiled with Southern Hospitality at a few other New Orleans locations.
We were in NOLA for 4 days and we ate SOooooooo much food. I can honestly say this was by far the best meal we had during our time there. The egg plant chips were absolutely amazing!!!
The location is great right on Royal St. the food was okay not blown away. Get the peel & eat shrimp. The baked stuffed oysters weren't my favorite.
Food was ok but the service was terrible.  Our waiter was quite charming but very ineffective.  I had to ask for the order, the check, etc.  Typical French quarter restaurant........bummer.
Looks dumpy , however it was pretty good. Wanted just a small bite so  I had crab claws which were very good ! ! Attentive wait staff too !
Great service . Our waiter Oran very courteous & friendly. Food very good & plentiful. Best we have had in NOLA. Good to be off of Bourbon St to eat

Came in for breakfast on Saturday morning. Very friendly staff and quick service! Even though oysters weren't on the breakfast menu, I saw them come in off the truck. I asked if I could have them for breakfast anyway, and they were happy to oblige. I washed them down with a mint julep, and I'm a happy camper! Would come back again.

I have been to Royal house plenty of times. This is usually me and my husbands go to spot when we land in New Orleans but after the waiter experience today I will say we are picking another destination. We were seated promptly with water. We waited 10 minutes for our waitress to ask for our drinks and then she disappeared. I got up myself after 15 minutes to ask another waiter to refill our waters. We waited another 25 minutes and our food came which was good but still no sight from our waitress with our beverages. She finally stopped by after our food was at our table and she asked if we needed anything else. We said yes and told her our drink order again... another 15 minutes passes and she comes back yet again with no beverages. We had already finished our meal at this point. Worst service ever which is a shame because we use to love this place.

I hate to do this, but experienced literally the worst service today at Royal House. Been coming here for years and had to change my 5 star review. After being seated right away we waited over 50 minutes to get our drinks and they arrived after we were done eating. A draft beer and an iced tea ‍. Royal house is my go to in New Orleans and will probably remain so but today was the worst service I experienced there in the last 4 years of coming and hopefully next visit Royal can earn the 5 stars back.

Looks dumpy , however it was pretty good. Wanted just a small bite so  I had crab claws which were very good ! 

Update :  definitely will be back.

I try to go to New Orleans as often as I can and when I do stopping at the Royal Oyster House is a must. Great people watching and the bartenders/oyster shuckers are great to have interesting conversations with about the city and life in general. The food is good too.

Let me start by saying that the atmosphere here is impressive and that alone will draw customers through the door. Meanwhile, if you aren't a tourist and have had true Cajun food, what comes out of the kitchen might disappoint you, as it did us. Keep in mind I can only comment on what we ate, which wasn't good. It was below average, unfortunately. Considering the inflated cost we almost sent it back, but after waiting more than 40 minutes for our food, we figured it was in our best interest to scarf it down (regrettably) and continue on to Pat Obrien's. 

I've eaten Cajun food religiously across the South for almost two decades now and through experience have learned good and not-so-good. For example, I ordered blackened redfish at Pappadeaux in Dallas on Wednesday night, then blackened redfish here at the Royal House Thursday and then the same dish at Louisiana Lagniappe Restaurant in Baton Rouge on Friday night. The first and third were juicy, well seasoned and flavorful. At Royal House the redfish was severely overcooked, mildly fishy (unacceptable), the thickest part of the fillet was dry and the entire third of the outside portion was tough as leather. 

As for the ribeye, we ordered it rare. All but the inside third of the meat had no pink to it. None. Again, more than overcooked. Maybe leather like fish and meat is the in-thing here? As for the vegetables, we had just left Chef Ron's Gumbo Stop in Metarie for lunch where our side of veggies were seasoned, fresh and crisp, which embarrassed Royal's canned tasting, soft veggies. The entire meal was a waste of money, time and took away from one of our two true NOLA Cajun meals. We were only here one night. 

Unfortunately, we didn't choose to eat here, but their sister restaurant (which did look good in photos) closed two hours early because they wanted to paint. They sent us to Royal and said the food was exactly the same. In addition, service was poor. More than 40 minutes to get our food and a waitress with an attitude. We won't be back. Meanwhile, if you are coming for oysters and drinks you'll probably love this place, but entrees are a different story.
Tourist trap! Red Fish over cooked , jambalaya dry... weak drinks. Long wait for nothing ....Very disappointed. Not worth the money!!

Great food, incompetent service. 

Ordered oysters, a beer, fried alligator, and the sampler (red beans and rice, jambalaya, gumbo). The food was all great, but service was slow. It took about 15 minutes to get raw oysters, and another 10 (after we asked) to get napkins and utensils. The beer took 30 minutes. The waiter didn't clear any finished dishes unless we specifically asked, and then he tried to take the platters that were not empty. At the 45 min mark, we asked where the rest of the food was (since a few raw oysters don't take too long to finish). Apparently they had a computer issue. About 15 minutes later, our waiter came by to ask if we wanted dessert or anything else. Um, we still haven't gotten most of our food. We got the rest of our food at about 1h15m. We saw our waiter hanging out with another table for much of our dinner.

Amazing Charbroiled oysters - best in the city! 

Love the atmosphere of this restaurant, staff are very professional and oysters are amazing! 

A trip to Nola would not be complete without a trip to the Royal House

Great place! Slightly off beaten path! We came with our baby daughter and it was quiet enough for her to sleep but just one block from bourbon! Make sue to use the yelp discount for free appetizers for a great deal!

For being right around the heart of the city this spot is pretty good. Our server was really really friendly and attentive. For the dishes they serve though I don't feel like the price points are fair. $17 for red beans and rice is really steep. My group also did not enjoy the shrimp and grits order they had. This place has good items on the menu but I do feel like there are better places with better prices. Items are priced at fine dining prices and this place really just isn't that.

Oysters Rockefeller are fantastic and the craw fish e'touffee was fantastic too! The ambience was casual and welcoming and the staff was helpful but not overbearing, a very pleasant dining experience.

Ambiance
The typical New Oreleans look and feel.  Very loud and noisy.  Clean and well decorated upstairs.

Food
We had the crab claw appetizer, delicious garlic buttery sauce.  We had the shrimp Caprese salad.  Not a fan of the shrimp.  We had the snow crab boil.  It was good.  For dessert we had the bread pudding and their Irish coffee.  The bread pudding was excellent. The Irish coffee was almost ice cold.

Service
The soup salad and meal came out at the same time. The bus boy was extremely slow in picking up the plates he walked by three or four times looked at empty plates and didn't even try to clear them.  Coffee was served cold.the server did his best given the circumstances.

Leon was an excellent server.  I give him 5 stars.

Value
Over priced for what we got.

Highly recommend!! Amazing food and our server was amazing. We asked for outside seating on the deck (even though they were busy, we thought we'd ask anyway) and they accommodated us, as well as about 10 minutes or less after putting our names in. The food was absolutely amazing. We started with fried alligator and oysters. Then I ordered the shrimp creole and my boyfriend ordered the chicken gumbo. This was our first restaurant we visited in New Orleans and it's still my favorite place we've gone to eat!
The food and service was good. Nothing outstanding. The portion size was good for the money.

I got robbed while dining there. The waiter seated us at a table open to sidewalk.
I think he was actually in on it as people who steal work in groups to steal. 
My wallet was snatched off the table. 
I asked the manager to call the police. Either he didn't do it or they never came but they didn't show. He told me I still had to pay for my meal!!! Who would do that. I reminded him my wallet was stolen along with my credit/debit cards and cash. He said my coworker could pay!
Will never eat there again on principle alone. What a jerk. 
I walk by that place many times with friends and coworkers but we won't go there .
This place is awesome! Apps are delicious and entree was as well! Our server was also great, she made excellent recommendations for us. We will definitely come back again and try other menu items

It's not fancy, but it's good. When you're in the mood for some oysters or a bowl of gumbo, this place more than fits the bill. You'll find all your favorite classics in a casual setting. Great for grabbing a beer and lunch.

This was definitely the food highlight of my trip to New Orleans. I don't remember the name of our waiter but he was fabulous and made our visit even more phenomenal. This was our first stop when arriving in New Orleans.

We started with drinks - hurricanes (very strong!) and my friend got a pink lemonade alcoholic drink that was delicious. 

For appetizers, we got the crab claws and the redfish beignets. The crab claws were a recommendation from our waiter and the redfish beignets were a recommendation from our Lyft driver. The crab claws were so tasty. I have never had anything like that before. The sauce that came with the crab claws was one of the most delicious things I have ever eaten. I could have eaten an entire bowl of that sauce with a loaf of bread. It was spicy, rich and salty...all my favorite flavors rolled into one delightful concoction. 

The redfish beignets were very good! I have never had redfish before but this was a yummy little treat!

I ordered shrimp and grits for my main course and it was absolutely amazing. SO GOOD. It was definitely one of the best dishes I have ever eaten. The grits was seasoned perfectly - just salty enough with a nice tangy kick from the cheese. My only complaint about it was that it wasn't a big enough bowl! 

This was an amazing meal. Great food and great service.

I have eaten here every year when I visit NOLA, it's become a tradition. This year I brought a group of friends for lunch. We were seated immediately, even with a party of 7 & agreed to be seated at separate tables because we didn't want to wait for space to open up for our whole party (We were very hungry). As soon as our server realized our party had been seated at two separate tables he quickly remedied the situation & pulled the two tables together so that we could all sit together. Our server was knowledgeable of the menu & our food order was taken fast & the food was incredible. I will be back again next year!

Great oysters.. love their fried eggplant chips! Plus  &
great service when you sit at the bar.. I always eat here when in NOLA. At 1st it was because it's across the street from my hotel but I always keep coming back because it's damn good.

Not sure why this place is popular.  It was my alternative/2nd choice given quite a lot of rush at other more popular places.  

I ordered blackened shrimp jambalaya at the bar hoping I would get some good sized blackened shrimps with good spiced up taste.  It was pretty ordinary and came with little shrimps.  Also the rice had only 1 little piece of chicken.  Wanted to also order half dz. oysters but the guy sitting next to me advised not to as his order of the same oysters turned out to be lousy.  There was a lot of rush that evening so maybe as a result the quality suffered.  But in real restaurants that does not happen.  

So I will keep this as my alternative choice when I am unable to get a table in time at other good restaurants.

For a busy Saturday morning this was a great choice for amazing local cuisine. The wait was short and our waitress Kaitlyn was spot on.  Making suggestions and providing exceptional service.

I've never been disappointed with the raw oysters on my visits to NOLA and these were crisp, cold, and just the right salty.  My favorite always.  The seafood was fresh and prepared perfectly on each of our selections.

Sitting just slightly off the balcony offering us the beautiful views of St. Charles and the sounds of jazz bands matching to the square, I love it!

Servers are great! "Groups are welcome" we watched many small tables get their food before ours. We had a group of 8, and it took over an hour to get our food. Some entrees were cold and not satisfying for the price.

The food was pretty good! I had the fried oyster pasta, shrimp jambalaya and their side potatoes. If I didn't love potatoes already, those potatoes were love at first bite. The service was a bit slow and our server forgot a lot of our items so we had to keep reminding them. The food was presented well. The bathroom has two stalls but it was very complicated to use as it was a very tight area. The vibe was real good and I loved that it's indoors but open at the same time. We were able to watch random street shows that are passing by. The balcony area seems very romantic. We were seated in the second floor and so we had to go up the stairs, while our host ran and left us  I didn't know whether to be upset or laugh..  I laughed.  Overall the food is great, but the service could use a little work.

Normally I come here and the food is good. This time was no different but unfortunately I sat at the bar because the wait was long and the service was poor. The waiter greeted us once and never came back. Literally. I recommend coming her but sit at a table if possible. 
We had the spinach dip and a dozen chargrilled oysters with bacon on them. Delicious

OK let me get to it. 
Food 5 stars 
Service 1 star

The place has some great food, but god the waiter we had couldn't have been much worse unless he just didn't wait on us at all. Had to ask for silverware and then he only brings one napkin, felt like whipping out my knife and cutting it in two pieces.  Asked for bread with our pasta, but that never came. Only managed to get one glass of water, took it down stairs and got the bartender to refill it on the way out.  We had great view on the second floor from the balcony. I will say the balcony actually made me nervous as it moved every time someone moved. This one doesn't have the supports to the ground like some others.   So the food is worth it, but your waiter may be great or terrible.

We searched Yelp for a highly rated seafood restaurant in the Quarter. We decided on Royal House because it had 4 stars and over 1000 reviews. Sadly disappointed! We got to sit on the balcony and that was a plus, however, the service was substandard at best. First, we were seated at a dirty table. Second, it took forever for us to get our drinks which came to us watery. Third, we were given plastic utensils to eat because the restaurant ran out of metal cutlery (unbelievable). Fourth, the waiter who brought us our food never said a word to us which was so weird. He simply put our food on the table and that was that. Our assigned waitress was not very attentive and that was frustrating. Finally, the main course was not tasty at all. The fish was dry and less than flavorful and the texture of the green beans was very rubbery.. We can go on and on but we will stop here. Needless to say, we probably will not pay this place a second visit, as Royal House wasn't so royal after all!!!!! BOTTOMLINE: The cost of the meal did not equate to the quality of service and food!

The service is great and The food tasty. I tried the raw oysters and it didn't taste fishy. The Baked oysters great but which I would have gotten a dozen instead of half dozen. They shrink down after they are baked. Definitely come here for service though great peeps.

Our third time here, twice before in March on our last trip to NOLA, the 'Big Easy.' No exaggeration, the oysters were so fresh you could smell the salt water when they cut the bag / netting to start shucking. Jeffrey is the best! Cindy is crazy, GREAT CRAZY, and was training Hannah. My wife and I had an awesome time, food quality, Bloody Mary and service was over the top. We will be back tomorrow.

We visited on a Friday around lunch time, looking to try some po boys while in town. Searching through yelp, I saw Royal House had 4 stars and over 3000+ reviews. 

We were seated quickly, with no wait, and our server came over soon after. Our service was good; our waiter was lively and they accommodated our request to move tables, once some friends came to meet us. 

However our food was pretty mediocre. I ordered the shrimp po boy, and it was not very good. The fried shrimp didn't taste fresh, and I had to slather on copious amounts of chipotle mayo to choke it down. The French fries were decent though. This was our least favorite meal during our stay in New Orleans.
Best fresh shucked Oysters in town.  Of course it doesn't hurt that it's three blocks from my NOLA home :)

It seemed like the wait staff forgot about us or gave our food to another table. When we asked how long it would take after not having gotten our food for 30 minutes, they said it was still being prepared. Finally when we did get our food, it was cold. They didn't explain why it was late or apologize. No one came to check in with us to see if we needed anything else. We had to keep trying to get someone's attention for water or drinks.

Had high hopes for this place, but very disappointed. The raw oysters were sandy and not cleaned well, the "garlic mashed potatoes" were in whole chunks with absolutely no taste of garlic, my medium cooked burger was burnt on the bottom,  spinch queso felt microwaved with a weird hardened top. Service was fair.
I got the spinach salad with blackened fish for lunch. The salad was meh and the fish was sadly over cooked. Def not worth the $25 I paid for it.
My sister and I loved our visit to Royal House on Monday afternoon. We sat at the bar and had the chargrilled oysters.  The were delicious!  I thought the atmosphere and service were great

Are her last month with my service dog Mal and my dad on their balcony viewing royal st. It's right next to the federal courthouse and a few blocks away from Mondu. The food was delicious. We ordered the oyster, shrimp Po, salad, and gumbo platter. I would come here again because of service and the ambience. Louisiana serves the best food!

Came here on a recommendation from a friend.... had the crawfish ravioli and it might have been the best ravioli I've ever had. Chargrilled oysters were phenomenal as well. Def will be back next time I'm in town
Had a good time here. Ate the Oyster Duo which was delicious. Sat at the bar which service was slow but I was here solely for the food. I'll be back to try Taste of New Orleans

THIS WAS THE BEST SERVICE IVE EVER HAD. & myself working in the service industry, that means alot. Touristing in the quarter with my bf we came across this place cause of the french onion soup! Yum! We had upstairs balcony seating right away. The crew and servers were so happy to be there and so laid back like youve been friends for years! Made a mistake ordering oyters, super nice and quick. Very intimate and laid back. Will return again

Our experience here was absolutely FANTASTIC, from the warm welcome at the door from Lisa, to our wonderful server Tasia (I hope I got that right!), to the beautiful view from our balcony table, and most importantly, the deliciousness which was every dish we ordered! 

I have never tried chargrilled oysters before, and Royal House has set the bar extremely high for other restaurants because these were drool worthy. The parmesan and lemony buttery sauce on the oysters was so so good. My bf isn't a huge oyster person but he enjoyed them so much we almost ordered more! We also got the crab claws which were fantastic, the sauce was mopped up with the toasted bread served with it. Tasia recommended both of these apps (which I was already eyeing) and I am so thankful for her input! We also got a bottle of Sauvignon blanc, I think it was oyster bay (I prefer Marlborough NZ Sauvignon blanc and was happy they had one!) and it paired up perfectly to the seafood apps.
