For entrees we got the taste of New Orleans and added some sides to share so all together we had gumbo, crawfish ettouffe, hush puppies, red beans and rice, and jambalaya. Every. Thing. Was. DELICIOUS. The red beans and rice were the best id had, and again my bf (who hates beans) loves this! 

Everything was just so perfect. Thank you for great service, fanatic food, and wonderful hospitality. Y'all are doing it right! We will definitely be back.

We went there on a Wednesday night. The service was not good. The stuffed mushrooms were all bread stuffing and no Seafood. We did have the claws which were A+ delicious. We went to check it out because we were looking for a birthday dinner restaurant. Decided not to go with the Royal House. I was not impressed at all and would not recommend it.

So pretty below my expectations. Service was not great. In fact getting a water refill was 20 minutes. The food was eh.

We ordered crab legs which were average and a shrimp creole dish. The pasta was like something I bought at a grocery store. 

This is my first trip to NOLA, not a fan of the service we have encountered In most places. Food so far, average at best.

Best place ever! Oysters are as fresh as they come raw is the best but the Royal was real good too!! I'd go back and eat oysters all night long! Our bartender/server was soo great! Loved our time there and will go back!

A day trip to NOLA always means finding a new restaurant to try. We were not disappointed with the Royal House. Stopped in around 4:30 no line and were seated right away. John was a great server, took our drink order and went over a couple of favorites. We chose the blackened redfish and pecan crusted Mahi. Both were delicious, redfish was nice and spicy just the way I like it. While the potatoes were nice and hot the vegetables were just warm and the reason they didn't get 5 stars. You won't be disappointed if you decide to stop in.

We had lunch here the food is fantastic and so were our waiters Jordan and Ordan! Hope I got the spelling of the name right!!! I had the crawfish ravioli and my husband had the oyster dual! Food is excellent and service is excellent!!!

This place was gross. We came on a Saturday night (big mistake) and were seated upstairs. It was much more of a party atmosphere than I expected. I had the shrimp creole which was OK, but a very small portion. Our waiter was working really hard, so hard that he was drenched in sweat. I could not wait to get out of there. Maybe we just came at the wrong time.

Yikes. Eight of us on the first night in NOLO. What a tourist trap. Food was cold. Service horrible. Dishes came out individually. We sat around waiting to all eat at the same time. They did give us a 50% discount for ruining our night. Pass and don't look back. Nothing to rave about. 

Go to Mr B's Bistro and have a great gastronomical experience. Then hit up the Carousel bar at the Hotel Monteleone for some cool jazz...and of course Beignets at Cafe Du Monde...

Checked in and got a free appetizer. Fried eggplant was perfect. 
Shrimp/grits and red beans and rice for entrees. Both on point. 
Bread pudding was awesome. Great twist on a 

Follow up review. Went back for a second visit. Food was still good, but my red beans and rice were not piping hot and it was obvious they had sat for a few minutes before being delivered. Service was very slow. Ended up being at the restaurant for over 2 hours. Noticed several people were unhappy with their wait.

We loved this place! Fantastic food, and quick, attentive service from a very friendly staff. The sauce in my shrimp and grits was THE best!!! I had to ask our server what it was so I could try to recreate it (turns out it's a secret... darn). Excellent choice in the Quarter and we will be back!
Really, really fresh oysters. It didn't taste fishy. Only suggestion is better horse radish. The horse radish didn't really have a kick to it. However, the oysters.... are sooooo goooood.

Loved this quaint little place. We had a great seat right in the window/door opening. We started with the spinach dip which was creamy and delicious. The delicious French onion soup followed- perfectly balanced with cheese, rich broth and tasty croutons. We decided to share the main course and went with crawfish etouffee which did not disappoint. Highly recommend this place.

My husband and I were quite impressed by Royal House, a restaurant located in the French Quarter very close to Bourbon Street; we liked it so much we visited it a few times while in the area.
The atmosphere is festive, loud and super friendly; we sat both in the downstairs raw bar and upstairs balcony and were given the same courteous and attentive service by staff.
I love oysters and here I was able to satisfy my craving without breaking the bank! The oysters were plump, juicy and fresh and most importantly served at the right temperature. My husband fell in love with their French Onion Soup and Redfish Beignets! So delish!!!
We also tried their Chicken and Andouille Gumbo and Creole Shrimp dishes, both quite adequate.
I also had a chance to try their signature cocktail, Royal Cup, made by the one and only, Cindy, who's recipe could not be reproduced! A delight!
If you ever find yourself in the area do not hesitate to give the Royal House a chance!

Our server was Ty fantastic.  He gave great recommendations and kept us entertained.  Food was a little slow coming out but we enjoyed the ambiance and cocktails while we waited.  Oysters were delicious.  Seafood pescatore with lemon butter sauce instead was the best!

Royal house  has the friendliest staff. And the best tasting cajun food down the French quarter the appetizer alone were amazing but ask their servers for recommendations. Good time good people good food it's all you would want.
This place is amazing!!! Service and food is out of this world!!!! Come and get your crawfish ravioli for dinner and crab legs and fried gader for your apps you won't be disappointed!!!
45 minute wait after ordering for gumbo ... pre made ... wait staff just could not pull it together ... may leave shortly
Worst dining experience ever.  Service terrible, food worse than terrible.  They are tourist centered and don't care about repeat customers.  Avoid this restaurant at all costs.
Delicious all around smaller portions, a bit disorganized on the service side, decent atmosphere.
Royal House was a great experience. There wasn't a very long wait, the server was very friendly. By far the best part...the food :) If you get a chance to visit- do!
Ordered the beignets and there was glass in ours. The manager clearly said she would comp our meal but only removed the beignets off our bill. Horrible customer service
The drinks were really good the roast beef poboy was good but not great that's the reason for only 4 stars the atmosphere was awesome.we sat on the balcony and watched a small parade.

This place rocks. Great food. Excellent service. I was seated promptly by a friendly gentleman and my server, Tina was fantastic. Food came out promptly and was delicious. The bananas foster cheesecake was decadent.  Kudos to the manager who came over to ask me how everything was. That's true service.  Great food. Great prices. Great service.  Extensive menu selection. Don't miss out on this place!
A staple in the French Quarter, Royal House does not disappoint.  From their fresh local oysters to their ribeye topped w fresh lump crab.  Deeeeeelicious!  Balcony dining available.  Try it soon!

We went for a late breakfast on a Saturday with 8 people for my husbands birthday.  We got seated at 10:45am, we're given breakfast menus and waited for 15 minutes for our server.  At 11, our server came and told us we couldn't order breakfast because it was 11. WTH?  We rolled with it and decided to get drinks.  35 minutes later-still no drinks.  Couldn't find our sever, so we approached a guy we thought was the manager and he said he would take care of it.  Still no drinks, although all other tables had drinks.  Finally got our drinks but we're missing 2.  Staff did nothing so I walked up to the bar and asked the bartender who personally delivered the drinks to our table.  We ordered our food at 11 and didn't get our food till almost noon.  We were missing a couple of meals which they brought out easy enough because we had finally found a manager.  My mom sat at the table and ate her soup with a fork because no one would get a spoon until we finally walked up to the bar and approached the guy who was just talking.  Not one staff member had told the manager we were having issues even though we all got up multiple times and asked about drinks and our food.  Our server rarely came because he didn't want to deal with the questions.  Finally after over 2 hrs of sitting there and eating,  we heard the server asking the manager to get us out if there and that we were problems.  To even be able to over hear that is so unprofessional as we just wanted a quick breakfast and be done!  Were we supposed to sit there for 30 minutes without our bar drinks and just stay quiet?  We had the best service with the clean up of our dishes!  The food was ok-the baked oysters were really salty but their blood Mary's are really good if you get one.  The two people who recommended this place have one multiple times but just as a couple and they've had great experiences but they felt so bad recommending especially for a birthday breakfast.  The manager did take off several meals and was apologetic which was helpful.  When we were walking out from the second floor to the first floor,  there were people all complaining about service and wait time.  They could have had call ins that day for servers-I don't know but it was a theme of poor service all over.

A little underwhelming. Was so excited to eat here after reading reviews. That staff was friendly and service was good, but the food was just ok. I got the Alligator po boy - the bun was dry, my friend got the shrimp jambalaya - over cooked shrimp tasted like it had been warmed in the microwave. Hoping the rest of our dining experience in NOLA is better.

This is a very nice restaurant. We sat upstairs where is was quiet. I found the oysters to just be "OK" however they serve them every way you can think of. They dozen was $16.00 when other places near by where much cheaper and more juicy. I also got the Caprese Tower which was very minimal in size and flavor. I heard great things about this place and I was just not impressed. I had better oysters at many other restaurants in town.

Dinner with a great view. We sat upstairs. Started with the spinach dip which was great! The cheese on top was the best part. I had raw oysters and the taste of New Orleans. Both were excellent. My
Wife wanted a burger. It was a good portion but was definitely a frozen patty. Wouldn't order the burger again. Everything else was great.

I rarely take the time to leave reviews, but given how disappointing this place was, I'm willing. I took my daughter here to celebrate her birthday, along with my father that I hadn't seen in a year. Our seating arrangement on the balcony was nice and the gentleman, Arrow, who sat us was an absolute delight. The rest was pretty upsetting. The menu description did not adequately describe my $24 pasta dish. It was smothered in flavor hindering cheese and when I asked for a side of corn for my 10 year old, noone mentioned it would be too pepper hot for even myself to eat. My dad ordered a $13 spicah salad and it was the size of a side salad and was limp.
I decided it was worth letting the manager know about the experience we were having so I went downstairs where the host was located to ask to speak to someone. Both the manager and the server took it upon themselves to chastise me for "how" I asked to speak with her and told me I should have just stayed upstairs in my seat and asked for her there. 
They took the meal (and the corn) off and that's fine, but I left hungry, having spent $90 plus a modest tip, and scorned. 
With so many choices in New Orleans, I'm upset with having wasted both the time, the money, and what could have been a great experience elsewhere. I do not reccomend this place.

This little gem is a great spot!!! Popped over for a late lunch. Quick friendly service. We sat here enjoying cocktails entree and dessert.  Watched the local foot traffic go by and enjoyed the afternoon. THANK YOU for making our short NOLA trip memorable!!!

Just spent a great time with Ms Cindy at the bar. Let me just say "Hey Baby" in my New Orleans accent. She suggested we get the Redfish Beignets and crab claws. Absolutely wonderful, we're coming back as the food was great but the customer service was impeccable.

Came to New Orleans for my best friends birthday and wanted to try out the Royal House Oyster Bar. We were recommended to try out the chargrilled oysters. The oysters were AMAZING!!! The oysters are the only reason why I'm giving it 2 Stars. I then ordered baked shrimp tortellini... I've had wayyyyyyy better.
Amazing chargrilled oysters!!! Slow service, dry poboy and cold food. I only gave it a 2 star because of the oysters! They were amazing, otherwise I would not return.

My family and I went here for dinner and ordered several items (2 different oyster plates, spinach dip, hamburger, French onion soup and gumbo). Server was unaware that they were out of the spinach dip until 20 minutes after everything was ordered. She also forgot to put in one of oyster orders - so we never received it. The place gets one star because the oyster plate that was ordered was good, but everything else was not good. The French Onion soup was incredibly salty. We requested the hamburger well done - but it was burnt to a "crisp" - see the picture of "Who wore it better? Napkin or Burger."

Jordan was an amazing waitress! She even gave us a hand written list of things to try in the city! Thank you Royal House for the Royal service. My husband and I recommend the crab claw and alligator bites

We absolutely loved this place. First great atmosphere and friendly staff. Everyone was happy and the servers, cooks were cheering on the Saints. One guy came out and gave a customer a hug very sweet guy. Restaurant is all NOLA, loved the ambiance and style. The food was awesome, especially those crab claws. Server John was fantastic and went above any expectations to make our dinner perfect. Funny and nice guy! Not sure how anyone could give this place a negative reviews prices are fair and it was just everything you would want as far as Cajun cuisine.

My boyfriend and I came here last night and were very disappointed with the service. First let me say that the food was enjoyable and that's why I gave 3 stars. 

1. Our waitress, Tasia, messed up our order for the appetizers and had to wait an extra 15 mins for our crab claws 
2. We had to ask 3 times for silverware for my boyfriend and still took 25 minutes to receive 
3. I asked for something on the side of my pasta and the chef messed up my order, when our waitress advised me of this she said "Will you make a big deal out of it or eat it?".. which I said was fine but the way she asked I didn't appreciate 
4. When our food arrived on the serving tray, I watched the guy take my bread from the tray and put them back on my plate.. SO GROSS. 

This is a super long post but there were so many good reviews and just wanted to make other people aware of our experience!
This is my spot for NOLA style. Love the gator, taste of New Orleans gets it done. And I like their Bloody Mary best in the quarter.

Delicious charbroiled oysters and the fried alligator was good too. The seasonings were done right, better than some other places that we went to. First time eating alligator and it was surprisingly good. They forgot to give the dipping sauces though.

Service was friendly.

Definitely a spot to visit when in the Quarter. Went around 730 on a Saturday night and got a table right away on the balcony. Great weather and got to listen to some great street performers! We split the crab claws for an app and my god that sauce was delicious. Also great for dipping bread in. For entrees I got the Taste of New Orleans and the best dish on it in my opinion was the crawfish etouffee. Very creamy and flavorful. Jambalaya and gumbo were decent. Definitely will be back for some oysters next time!

Shrimp Creole had a good sauce with enough spice level, but I needed more rice, there were only a few spoonfuls of rice put in the middle of the dish. I had this dish earlier this year in another part of the country served with plenty of rice and I think that's how it should be served. Otherwise you are just eating sauce and shrimp. 

The shrimp and grits were good. Kind of mashed up grits into two balls and the sauce was very good. I liked the creaminess here. I don't like some places that make a soupy shrimp and grits. There seems to be so many different ways of making this dish. Portion sizes seem to be slightly on the smaller side here. Not cheap, but the shrimp is good. There is a bar and you can also sit on the balcony. The temperature was too cold, I don't like wearing my jacket when I'm dining and I don't think they need to have all ceiling fans on in November. The temperature of the food was luke warm, too common in the US, no reason why food should not come out hot.
It was just okay.  Shrimp on the cold side and no one liked the French bread.  The hush puppies were the best thing.

The carpet on the stairs going to the second floor is very dirty and smells, it should be replaced. As far as food we got a couple of gumbos, not bad but very small for $7 a piece. I mean coffee cup small, so don't expect much. We also had alligator po-boy but it had the alligator bites in the sandwich, and it was $15 and the plate was not that big. Overall plates were expensive and not that great. Service was not good either. Most servers had dirty cloths on, and ours was very apathetic, like she didn't want the job. With all these options around we will not eat at Royal House until things improve.
This place was open for Thanksgiving!!! Wasn't too bad of a wait.  Food is delicious and doesn't disappoint.  Our thanksgiving feast didn't include turkey but we are ok with that!
Disappointed especially it's our first meal in NOLA. Fried chicken and oyster are too dry. I got a voodoo juice which is decent.

We got lucky, for Thanksgiving dinner, we just walked in and we sat down upstairs eating area! The staff is very very friendly and they all work really hard. Using Yelp, I got a free appetizer with 2 entrées. We ordered the Fried Alligator as appetizer! It was really good. Tastes like chicken nuggets, just a tad bit more chewy! As entrée, I ordered Shrimp Creole! It was delicious! The food was very good. I highly recommend this place! They are very busy. If you do not like a busy restaurant, then this is a place for you!

Good oysters. Excellent French onion soup. Rest of the food was mediocre. Also I don't think the oyster shucker which we ordered from liked us, weird vibe from the staff in general, not the southern hospitality I was expecting.

Our very first meal in New Orleans! We were happy that they opened on thanksgiving day. 

The charred grilled oysters were a little too salty for us. Seafood platter was not bad, but not amazing. The crawfish etouffie was very tasty!

Plus, it is at the center of French quarter. Recommend to go!
Had an early dinner here. Service was spotty. When my food came out they had my husbands plate liberally sitting on top of my steak. Food was ok. Nothing to brag about.
It's okay, the creole shrimp was the only dish that impressed. Jambalaya, beans and rice , crab claws were not very good

Where do I begin?? Fabulous service, great food, great music and atmosphere! Not to be missed!!  Nairobi you are amazing, thank you for making us feel like family...Jeffrey during the day, thank you for the lovely food and counsel, Leroy and Jessica at the bar in the evening take care of your every need. If you want to have a fun, exceptional New Orleans experience,head over to the Royal House Oyster bar, it's all that and more! And the oysters are delicious!!! With aloha, the maui girls Barrie & Mary Jane

The very best food we had in New Orleans was here. We made a day of stopping at places all over town for a drink and little bites, and Royal House was head and shoulders above the others. We had the crab claws and chargrilled oysters, bloody marys and some champagne. I will be dreaming about it until I can get back! Jeffrey behind the bar was a wonderful host.

Stopped here for brunch as the place we originally planned to attend was Buffett style (not what we wanted). We were HIGHLY pleased!!! From the view, the food and down to the superb customer service from beginning to end, we couldn't have asked for anything more. We ate outside on the balcony. If you're afraid of heights or narrow spaces, don't do it. But if you want a nice view and cute scenery for photos like myself, than definitely opt for the balcony. I ordered crawfish hollandaise over a biscuit and Cajun potatoes...perfection!! We also had the mimosas. The cups are a little on the smaller side so be prepared to order multiples.

The oysters here were tremendous both the raw and fried. Nice change of pace place compared to the noisier parts of the French Quarter. It's lively yes but not so you can't have a decent conversation at your table.
We came here because we saw a long line outside, but food was disappointing... except for the delicious grilled oysters. I ordered the taste of New Orleans. None of those three dishes were hot...
The crab claws are so good!!! I cleaned that plate. Lol that sauce fiyah! And their oysters are yummy!

Good place for date night. Friendly waitress and nice suggestions when asked. The seafood raviolis was decadent, very rich but hits the spot if looking for Italian version of seafood. Hubby has the blackened Catfish, a bit dry but still decent. 
The pecan pie is a must! We're so full from oysters and entrees and almost opted out of dessert but I think that was the highlight of the meal.

We made reservations to come here Sunday evening. Place wasn't too packed. We ordered the char grilled oysters ($10 off on yelp check in). Oysters were great and flavorful. We ordered the shrimp po boy, shrimp and grits, and jambalaya. Everything was delicious. The jambalaya was very dry however. Had to add some hot sauce to it. We were celebrating my birthday and my friend wanted to surprise me with a desert but the waiter said we don't do birthdays. Service overall was ok.

Rolled in here after a quick Yelp for tasty noms on a cold and rainy New Orleans evening, and who but warms up my life but one John (Jean?) who magically recommends everything I was eager to try out, while sprinkling in some references to High School Musical. Talk about VIP treatment! From looking at other tables, it was clear that many of the staff were friendly and sociable. John even ended up giving a ton of great recommendations for my very first visit to NOLA.

The food itself was a 4-Star good but I think the staff truly made our visit a shining 5. My companion and I got the crawfish etouffe and the blackened redfish and finished our dinner off with the butter pecan pie. Yum! I'll not a NOLA food expert but it all tasted great. Honestly though, I think everything just tasted better because service was so good. Come drop in! You'll feel full in your stomach and your heart.

It's true what they say -- the restaurants in the touristy areas are way too expensive for what it's worth.  Sure, you pay for the ambiance or the overall hype but Royal House was a disappointment for such a pricey lunch.

The food was nothing spectacular and as someone who rarely uses the salt shaker, it was pretty much next to my plate the entire time.  I ordered the pasta with seafood, and the husband ordered the seafood combo.  We also ordered a dozen of oysters and their crab claws off the appetizer list.  The oysters had an unusual smell and taste.  My husband and I love oysters and we usually toss a coin to see who gets the last one -- this time, we actually insisted to pass.  My pasta was tasteless and appeared to be a whole blob of spaghetti noodles thrown in with under seasoned seafood bites.  My mussels were empty shells and the rest of it needed salt or any form of seasoning.  The husband was not particularly impressed with his dish neither.

Here is the big kicker:  our entrees took a full hour to get to our table.  I was so upset, I nearly walked out but as I was getting ready to leave -- the food miraculously came out of the kitchen.  I could've left but choose not to because I knew that if I did at that point, the restaurant would have tossed out the food.  I hate food waste, so we stayed and grunted as we stuffed down the food we no longer wanted.

I'm giving an extra star to the rating because our crab claws were really good.  The sauce was of what we thought a good creole dish should taste like.  I'm giving one more extra star for the outside patio seating.  On a nice day, you get to sit above the restaurant and watch all the festivities that take place on Royal Street.  Very lively.

Aside from those two highlights, try at your own risk.
Visiting from Denver, food was AMAZING , staff was even better . The gumbo and oysters were big time hangover cures. Yamini was our server and made sure we had an amazing time .
Jeffrey provided great service immediately.  Cindy made AWESOME bloody Mary's!!! Breakfast was yummy especially the grits!!! Definitely coming back.

Food was fantastic... we had an issue with a meal not being brought out but they comped us that meal when we complained.

Overall I would probably try it out again because the grits were banging
This is the place to be. Great drinks, great food, great atmosphere and great service. Look at the way this man shucks oysters for you
Great spot in the French quarter for Cajun food.  We had the redfish beignets, oyster po boy, and shrimp tortellini. Service was great and the food was delicious.  Highly recommend

This was very disappointing. Quality of the shrimp was sub-par when every other restaurant we have eaten in over the past 2 weeks had great shrimp (for size as well as flavor). Sent the first dish back and ordered the shrimp and grits which had a good flavor, but those pesky little shrimp...and not that many. Before you make plans to eat here, plan to go somewhere else.

The entrees are oyster pasta and blackened shrimp and jambalaya. Appetizers are Oyster royale and stuffed crab and shrimp on the mushrooms. I loved Entrees better than the appetizers. Especially the oyster pasta. Definitely should try this one. The gravy is great!

The chargrilled oysters were absolutely amazing. The pecan crusted Mahi was a little dry on the inside, but the crust was nice. The bananas foster cheesecake was SO good!!!!  Overall, it was a great meal - however, our waitress was awful. Obviously, I wouldn't discourage anyone from eating here just because of that, but this restaurant could definitely train their staff better.  If you're walking down Bourbon/Royal streets, this really is a great place to stop and have some TRULY quality oysters, a nice cocktail and some great dessert.

So horrible!!! Our waiter was fine but the service was slow. Not to mention they were lugging trash cans full of trash back and forth through the dining area!!! Like I have never seen something so disgusting and unsanitary in my life, I wanted to get up and walk out. Not to mention the place is small so the trash cans came through about 6 or 7 times and were really close to the table.
I'm not sure who said that was ok to empty the trash in the middle of a busy day but I was so turned off.

The waiter recommended the shrimp and grits so I tried it. It was horrible the fried grits were interesting but not that good and you would think for $20 that there would be jumbo shrimp but no little baby shrimp that were overcooked and tough. Sent my food back after a few bites and refused to order anything else.

If you want good food and service try somewhere else. This place is too costly for what I experienced.

I had the oyster duo, which is half baked and half chargrilled. They were amazing! My bad had the Crawfish Ravioli and omg soooo good!! We did move tables because there was a few fruit flys around the table next to the doors, besides that awesome food. 

Ps. Their Po Boys aren't great.
The food is pretty nice , I only got 1 dozen oysters it taste nice one of them is burned, in general it's pretty good. The waiter is very nice, it's a place worth to try!

I NEVER write reviews, but felt absolutely COMPELLED to write this. I asked the bartender 3 MINUTES after ordering if he could bump my order up to A dozen oysters instead of a half dozen and he literally said NO HE COULD NOT HELP ME. Like WHAT? I'm trying to spend more money at your restaurant? Terrible business. I almost walked out. I will never be coming back. And i work with clients who come from all over the world to visit for business and I WILL NEVER recommend this place.

ALSO On the yelp app it says all you have to do is make a purchase and you get a free appetizer. But you actually have to order two entrees to use this. 
misleading.

This review is for the Red Fish Beignets. We stumbled into here by chance in Dec 2014 and were suggested to try the red fish beignets. We are back four years later because we cannot leave New Orleans without having them again. Amazing!!!

The food was mediocre. We had the Mahi Mahi and the Blackened Shrimp Jambalaya for our entrees and the Grilled Chicken Cesar Salad for an appetizer. The salad took more than 25 minutes which was baffling since it's a simple salad. Our entrees were not anything special and did not have much flavor to them. The service was also pretty slow. Not very impressed
Light on the sauce, skimpy on the bread and the oysters were grainy (usually means they were caught from shallow water). Service was slow!

Decided to eat here based on yelp recommendation for the best etouffee in NOLA, it was marginal at best. The base was very bland and runny. Skimpy on crawfish and on the rice. My wife had the shrimp and grits, they were jus ok as well. She said the shrimp and grits at the airport were better.

Very mediocre. We were recommended this place by the hotels concierge as a good place to get jambalaya. I was immediately off put by that they had people corralling customers in-- which is always the sign of a bad restaurant but given the good reviews and the recommendation by the concierge i looked past that. I got the taste of New Orleans and my fiancé got the red fish. Both didn't taste fresh. It wouldn't be so bad if it was cheap food, but it was as expensive as better restaurants in New Orleans. The service was good though no complaints there.
so i had the "taste of new orleans." it was enjoyable. all three dishes were tasty. but i had to say the étouffée was my fav. it was so good.

We were in NOLA for a conference and came here for brunch because we'd heard such great things. As soon as we came, we were shown a table. All the staff were super friendly and came over to greet us immediately. (Southern hospitality is the best). We were sitting at a dimly lit table so we asked if we could move somewhere more bright and they moved us right away without any issues.

We ordered several things on the menu. We had the Nola sample which included crawfish etouffee, jambalaya, and gumbo.  I wasn't a fan of the gumbo, but everything else was really good.

We also had the crab claws which the waiter told us to order and I'm so glad we did. It was so good and flavorful. The sauce was amazing. We dipped everything in it.

We also had fresh oysters as well as the Rockefeller oysters. The fresh oysters were super fresh and tasted pretty good. I didn't really like the Rockefeller oysters but I don't usually like cooked oysters so I'm biased.

We also ordered the shrimp po boy.  The French baguette was perfectly toasted and the shrimp was delicious. 

I absolutely loved this place.

I had originally skipped over when looking for a great place for dinner. I'll be honest, most of the pics people posted didn't look that great, but, thought we would give it a try. It was a cold evening and they had French Onion soup that sounded delicious.
First- the ladies next to us were not that thrilled. They too were trying to have a nice meal, and it was far from that.  They watched multiple tables get food before them, even though they had not ordered anything special.... and nothing that should have taken the HOuR it took. And they said it was so-so. It definitely looked so-so.  
Now to our food. We got the claw appitizer.  I have only ever had it once- at Copeland's where it was amazing.  They should call and ask Copeland for some help- there's was far from amazing.
Second- we shared a cup of the French onion soup. The cheese was burnt- so lost a lot of the cheesy gooeyness, but, the flavor was amazing. Amazing.
For our entrees- my husband had the tour of New Orleans. At best 1 out of 5 stars.  None of it was well done. None.
I ordered the shrimp creole.  The flavor was not good. Desperately needed seasoning and a kick. Asked for the hotsauce, but quickly realized that my dish was almost completely cold.  Even the bowl they had it in was cool to the touch.  I never send stuff back unless it's truly terrible- but barely warm fish is not very good. They offered to microwave it for me to warm it up- bc microwaved shrimp is good. Um no. So they took it back to remake- but 30 minutes later, my husband is done with his, and mine is still not out. So I told him just to take it off our check.
Neighbors with the 1hr experience had shared their meal to do the bread pudding- and regretted it. Supposedly it was terrible.

If I had read the reviews more, not just the numbers, I would have known that this seems to be more their MO rather than an off night.  Walk a block and go to a local's recommendation - Mr. Ed's- not it was amazing!

We sat at the bar and the staff was very friendly. We got an amazing Bloody Mary and a Hurricane, both did not disappoint. We got raw oysters, which we enjoyed, however they were a little dirty. We also had the oyster Po' Boy, which was a little fishy. We sat upstairs at the bar and could hear the great music outside, which was very nice. Overall would still recommend checking it out!

Nothing Royal about it. 

Count your oysters we ordered 12 and got 9.5. Pointed it out and they brought us exactly 3 back. 

Crab claw appetizer was a joke. Tiniest things I've ever seen so covered in gravy you couldn't taste the puny little things. 

The entree Taste of New Orleans hardly had any meat in it and no flavor. 

Dinner was delicious expensive and a disappointment.

My friends and I had high expectations for this place as reviews and ratings seemed really good on Yelp. When we walked in, we were happy to find ourselves in the warm inviting atmosphere of the restaurant, also the staff was friendly, knowledgeable, and attentive.

Food was so, so. We got an appetizer, the red fish beignets as the check in offer. Not so good. They also only cover $12 of any app but it was not mentioned on Yelp so just an FYI. Batter was too thick and the sauce was too sweet and didn't work well together. One was a syrup and one was spicy mayo. Didn't work. I got the shrimp Creole. Definitely nothing special. Basically below average white rice and tomato sauce was not exciting and seemed like something was missing. Shrimp was also way too small... I was surprised because the waitress said it was really good. Disappointing for sure given the high ratings.

My friends got the combo, shrimp platter, and the grab and crawfish ravioli. Everything was average except the pasta sauce for the ravioli. It was really tasty but portion was smaller than average. 

The drinks are good though. Sapphire smash was sweet but not overbearing and tasty. Overall though, this place missed the mark. I wouldn't come again.

From all of the yelp reviews I had pretty high hopes for this place. Sadly it disappointed me. I ordered fried shrimp which came with fries and coleslaw. Also, I ordered a cocktail consisting of amaretto, rum, pineapple juice and grenadine. The drink was super sweet but it was a good cocktail $12. 
The shrimp platter was not as fulfilling as I wanted. The shrimp pieces were quite small and the fries were bland and very basic. 

I used the "check in" and got a free appetizer. Note: it only covers up to $12 bucks on the appetizer. 

I know this place is supposed to be known for their oysters which I didn't try, which was maybe why I didn't like the place. I would say our waitress was so kind and charismatic. She definitely made the experience better.

We just arrived in New Orleans for a short mini vacation. Ate at the Royal House as it was just down the street from where we were staying. What a great experience. Food was great and Tevin our waiter was the best!! He was so much fun. I definitely recommend this place!!
This isn't my fav. Love the atmosphere and beautiful venue, but the food is meh. There are definitely better places to eat in NOLA. Coming here for a drink is worth it though.

Omg WE ABSOLUTELY loved this place, the food, the staff and the prices!! Our waitress was Kaitlyn and she was sooo lovely and helpful! I WILL CONTINUE TO DREAM ABOUT THIS FOOD FOR THE REST OF MY LIFE. 

Highly recommend the crab claws, redfish beignets, French onion soup, and lastly chargrilled oysters soooo yummy! We don't even like oysters and we were in heaven. Stop what you're doing, book that plane, book that hotel, come
To New Orleans and sit down and have some of this yummy foodddddd!!!!

Our server was great-she was a good server overall, but her Cajun accent was great. It was our first night in NOLA and it was a great start to our weekend, giving us a good feel for the culture. Our family has some allergies (gluten and dairy) and she was knowledgeable about the menu and was accommodating. Great food and location. A classic for NOLA! Would definitely recommend!!

I did not enjoy my visit to the Royal disappointment. The Small portions of not really great food with a big price tag. I had the shrimp and grits. The grits were think and only a bit warm cheese was not even melted. Shrimp was a bit overcooked. Though the sauce was tasty. For an app, we had the crab claws in butter not sure what type of crab but the claws we're bitty. The sauce was peppered with shell fragments which are poor craftsmanship and a big no-no in my book. Overall my experience was underwhelming with great service but sub-par food quality that sides not so the price tag Justice. Go back to Bourbon Street and get a slice of pizza instead.
Excellent food and service! Expensive but it is right next to bourbon street. Able to sit upstairs, down stairs, or even on the balcony.
Great food, great service, and stunning views! Had the southern biscuits and gravy for breakfast with a mimosa and it was delicious.
Terrible...  Save your money!  You will get fresher seafood at Popeye's chicken and biscuits.  Had Crawfish étouffée and wife had shrimp caprese salad.  Shrimp not fresh at all.

Service was HORRIBLE. We order charbroiled oysters and most were dime sized. When I asked a manager if this was normal, she said yes, it's cold so the oysters are smaller. Which was a complete lie because we had the same style oysters 6 other times in the quarter and the were standard size. Also our server was the worst. He took our order and never came back until we asked for the check. It wasn't until he realized that we were irritated that he decided to try and chat with us and be pleasant. By that time we were over the entire experience.

Decent, basic place for breakfast. They had delicious bloody Mary's and mimosas. The service was super friendly. The place isn't too big. Our food came out without having to wait too long. The coffee was delicious. Nothing too over-the-top about this place but a great, basic place for breakfast to start your day in New Orleans.

If you have a dairy allergy, do NOT listen to Yelp's recommendation of this restaurant as having dairy-free options. I informed the staff of my allergy and asked for recommendations, and they picked a stuffed mushroom and oysters. The mushrooms arrived covered in cheese and the oysters with a cheese garnish. 

If I'd taken a single bite I'd have ended up in the hospital. Maybe the food is good, and the service staff were super polite, but I really expect more from a restaurant in the French Quarter. At least have the wait staff check with the chef if they're unsure about allergens rather than providing a life-threatening dish.
Oh my goodness.  Do NOT miss the red fish beignets or the crab claws.  BEST EVER appetizers.
Awesome sauteed crab and redfish beignets.  The crab sauce is to die for. Ask for extra toast!

I saw the reviews and decided to check this place out myself when I was visiting New Orleans! Definitely did not disappoint. The food was brought out quick and I was in a party of 10. The customer service was amazing, I loved the view and the atmosphere overall. The food was fresh and hot. I ordered the chargrilled oysters and crab claws for my appetizer. For my entree I had the Taste of New Orleans. I'm a small girl but I eat a lot but I must say the portion sizes are a great size. The Taste of New Orleans is good to order for 3 people if you eat small portions. The drinks were great, I had 2 but after 1 I was already feeling it. If you are ever in New Orleans you must try this place!

Due to all the high ratting on Yelp, also by a girl's recommendation, I had so high expectation on this place. Right after a very disappointed voodoo tour, my husband and I were so starving. We just hope to have something to fill our stomach. Among all the open restaurants at 10 PM, this place comes with the highest rating so that we chose to dine in here. After we checked the menu, we decide to order some local amd simple dishes: oyster pasta, shrimp jambalaya, and a side salad. And after a half hour waiting time, our food finally got there. Be honest with you, the best dishes among three is the side salad. Start from the shrimp jambalaya. Seriously, o travelled from Chicago to NOLA, and found the jambalaya is much worse than my local restaurant. How ironic that could be. The jambalaya was just so dry, so salty. And the shrimp inside tasted like frozen shrimp. I can even smell the chemicals on the shrimp to keep it fresh. The rice is not juicy, but only salty and dry. If I was not extrem hungry, I don't even want to keep it. Really because I cannot wait for another half hour to get my dish, I just choose to bear it. And the oyster pasta, so watery, so much soup inside. And we could tell that the food might have been ready for a while, but the waitress forgot to bring to us, so the noodle already got sticky together. After all that, the worst part is the price. For those okay food, if you charge me less than $15, I could tell myself to bear them. But when you charge almost $20 and more than $20 on them, but taste like my own home cooking is better than that, I am not feeling right at all. Anyway, if you can, don't let the name and yelp rating fool you. Very regret to eat here

Not sure why this place is getting such good reviews. I think it's just mediocre. Definitely not 4 or 5 stars. Ordered the Trio. It came out lukewarm. The ribeye was over cooked but it had good flavor. Raw oysters were ok. Nothing to rave about. The cooked oysters were not that good too. Mine was over cooked. Either that or they left it under the heat lamp for too long. Picture attached.

Wanted to get some gumbo on a cold December day (at least for New Orleans). Wanted to get away from the lines, and saw that Royal House was open, in a cool area, didn't have a wait. We were seated immediately and the service was great to start with, we had our menus and was seated on the second floor. The atmosphere is nice, and Miss Universe with Steve Harvey was playing on the TVs (weird though there was a primetime NFL game). We ordered the gumbo (chicken/ sausage) . They were very small portions (for the cup, about 6-7 dollars), although the bowl was more for 10 bucks. The roux is not the best, although it did taste very traditional. Chicken was fine, the rice was above average. But I wish the actual substance in the soup was a bit better. See pics for detail.

The oyster is not fresh and little overpriced. Most of dishes are salty and it is probably just in a good location and attract tourist most of time. If you want where local eats, should ask around before make the decision

This was the first restaurant I ate at on my trip to New Orleans, and it was a great introduction to Cajun food. They also have a great deal where if you check in on yelp, you get a free appetizer on your first visit.

I got the oyster duo and it was delicious. I've never really liked oysters before so I wasn't expecting much, but the oysters here didn't have any unpleasant fishiness. The crawfish ravioli was also really good. It was loaded with a bunch of crawfish and crab and I really enjoyed it. I don't eat crawfish that often because peeling it yourself is really tiring, but when the crawfish is peeled for you and it's paired with wonderful ravioli, it's a great experience. 

For dessert, I really enjoyed the bread pudding. It was the perfect amount of sweetness and it had a great flavor. This place is a little pricey, but the portion sizes are pretty big and everything is very tasty.

I never write reviews of this as I hate to criticize an establishment or people but eating here tonight (Dec 24th) was absolutely awful. Waited two hours for our food, portions were tiny and cold. Waiter refused to bring more water, didn't come by once to ask how our food was or if we needed anything.  For the food being so expensive, it may not taste very good but at least hire a waiter that can at least act for a few minutes that he/she enjoys their job. We asked questions about the menu, and he would answer them describing what the menu said about them.  Management and the people downstairs seemed very friendly but the waiter/ service and quality of food was just awful. Disappointed!

The best chargrilled oysters! I went 3 years ago, so this review is overdue (and not recent, but based on the most recent reviews, this place is still putting out top notch cuisine). I cannot wait to return to New Orleans so I can make another visit to Royal House. I discovered this restaurant on Yelp and stopped here my first night in New Orleans when I visited with my family. Great service from the very attentive waiter. A nice, lively atmosphere but not too rowdy. Get the chargrilled oysters and get extra bread to soak up that sauce. My goodness, one of the best things I ever tasted.

We are from Lutz, Florida , we came upon this restaurant by accident. Wow did we get the treatment. Jordan was our waitress. What an amazing experience. Our first time in New Orleans and everyone treated us with the utmost respect.The food here was above and beyond and Jordan I can't say enough. Hope to see you next Christmas. The two old people from Christmas Eve. Amazing.

I had an feeling it might be a tourist trap but we were hungry and the wait time was acceptable...well we didn't get menu and water for about 10 mins after we sat down..well it's Xmas and it's busy...fine.. after we put the order down it literally took about 25 mins to prepare the oyster Rockefeller when the table behind us who sat around the same time was ordering dessert...what was more unacceptable and unbelievable was we didn't have plate nor silverware after we called our server the third time..and by the time we got all the necessary equipment to eat, the oyster is already cold on the outside. 
We had to ask three times to get the tobacco and the third time was actually from another waitress...
No water refill...totally ignored..
The food is overall okay but a bit on the salty side. 
After we got the bill it looks like the restaurant is charging the fries oyster price when the server strongly recommended us do half shrimp half oyster...and they charge extra on the bread you requested for the crab claw.. it a couple bucks so no big deal but just something to made our already sub par dining experience worse.

Seriously I didn't want to leave any tips if it was not the Xmas day..one of the worst service I have ever experienced..have no idea how this place is overall 4 stars
All the food was tasty, but it took forever for our food to come out. Each dish that came out was cold!
i came with my my family, poor service.Oyster is good,.steak KO,crawfish KO,red fish KO. We will not come back again.
I vote for a star because the service is horrible.We waited for 1 hour, it is very,very slow.The food taste torrible.In my opinion this restaurant is bad.

If I could give 0 stars I would. The food was very subpar, not great at all. The service was horrible. We didn't have silverware when our food came out. And our appetizer came out after our meal!! Never again.
Rip-off, definitely pass...long wait, cold and 7 eleven food, for fine dinning price :(((

Crappy drinks, service, tasteless food. Only reason you may like the place is it is the only thing open in a block, or the cute lil girl sitting next to you. Seriously guys know how to do cajun food, you are in the heart of FQ.

We are from Lutz, Florida , we came upon this restaurant by accident. Wow did we get the treatment. Jordan was our waitress. What an amazing experience. Our first time in New Orleans and everyone treated us with the utmost respect.The food here was above and beyond and Jordan I can't say enough. Hope to see you next Christmas. The two old people from Christmas Eve.
Super slow service. In 55 minutes we could just do an appetizer order of eggplant chips and we left without even getting to the entrees that we had ordered in first 10 minutes of coming here.

Extremely poor service. We reached there at 5:50pm and took a seat on the balcony patio. The waitress came to our table to greet us and bring us water at 6:00 and we placed all of our order right then. Our drinks came at 6:15. Appetizers arrived shortly at 6:25. It started raining at 6:35. We got a seat inside at 6:55. We left without our entrees ever showing up at 7:10 pm.
P. S. Our appetizer order was brought to our table again at 6:30 pm which we sent back.

This place is at the top of the list when we get to town for two reasons. Royale and Rockefeller. Love the baked oysters. Other one of each and your night is off to a great start. Had a great time with friendly people Christmas night.

Overated as f...
Served with a dirty dish too. I honestly don't know why there are so many good reviews.

Hard one. It was 5 star in April but only 3 tonight. Maybe an off night for them. Try the appetizers, skip the entrees. 

- Raw oysters - excellent! 
- Crab claws - delicious but dish wasn't served hot
- Char grilled oysters - awesome also! Loved the sauce
- bucket of Cajun seasoned shrimp - good but nothing special. The corn that came on the side was better 
- taste of New Orleans - bad! The jambalaya was not edible
- redfish beignet - didn't try but others at the table liked it

Our server was frazzled but funny. But, so many mistakes on the check - double check everything!!
Service was terrible, couldn't get a 2nd drink, appetizer of grilled oysters came out but after 1 hour waiting on food we left
Food was decent! Egg plant Parmesan chips were to die for, would get that again. Got the shrimp po-boy but it wasn't the best. But the egg plant Parmesan pasta was amazing

Im only giving it a 2 star because the waitress was nice otherwise it would be a 1! Maybe it was because the place was busy but it shouldn't be an excuse. #1- I ordered shrimp etouffee.. about 30 minutes later they come to tell me they are out of shrimp etouffee!! #2- O ordered the chargrilled oysters and stuff mushrooms.. both came back burnt!!! The oysters were charred! The mushrooms burnt and the cheese on the mushrooms was burnt. #3- we were a party of 3 and they sat us in a tight spot in a small table. #4-I ordered a Dixie lager and they were out. #5- we got there at 5pm and we didn't get our food until about 6:30 and we had to rush and eat because we had a tour at 7pm. So overall I was pretty bummed and irritated! Not worth the $156.00 tab.
Great good .... THE BEST CRAB CLAWS IN THE WORLD!!! We tried also Fried Alligator, French Onion Soup and oysters- Oysters Royale & Oysters Rockefeller.

What a great way to end our trip, we walked up and was seated quickly, our server was attentive and answered all the questions my daughter asked her and what she recommended to her was excellent, we had one glitch that the appetizer was slow coming out but the manager came over without being asked and apologized and said they would be taken off the bill. That was more than we expected but just made the experience better, all 4 of us agreed that this was the best meal we had on this trip and I added the Royal House to our must visit list of restaurants when we visit. As you can tell I'm a fan and would recommend them when you are coming to NOLA.

Pro: We were seated right away at 5:30 pm on a Thursday evening.  Service was good, our waiter was friendly and very knowledgeable about the menu.  French onion soup had great flavor and was very filling.  Has balcony seating.  

Con: we trekked upstairs to eat, balcony seating not available that evening because "it might rain".  Iced tea was old, probably from the day before.  Food sucked, oysters were not good quality so although we tried them a variety of ways from the appetizer section of the menu, they just didn't have good flavor to start with so nothing could fix that.  Fried oyster entree was mediocre at best.  Ditto that for the étouffée.    

Save your money - or make sure you are just drunk enough to think the food is good.  80.00 without alcohol was steep considering the quality.  Do yourself a favor and go across the street to Antoine's or walk a few blocks over to Acme Oyster House.

Their chargrilled oysters are well worth the wait. We've tried the famous ones at acme and still find Royal House way better. The ones at acme are grilled with cheese on top and for a longer time compared to Royal House ones that are grilled with garlic & herbs. Good service and warm ambience.

We were shocked to be seated almost immediately despite the crowds. We started with the spinach dip -- despite being warned, I dove right in to the scalding hot dip, which resembles a crème brûlée of sorts with a thick layer of cheese (provolone, I believe) insulating the creamy dip underneath. The chips were a little flimsy to support the dip, but that wasn't anything a spoon couldn't fix.

I ordered the Royal House Burger. It was slightly overcooked but still tasty. The meat used and the way it was cooked reminded me of a (much, much better) Whopper burger. The fries were relatively basic but still made for a nice sidekick to the burger.

The service was great -- every employee I saw was engaging with guests like they were hosting them in their own homes. It was excellent hospitality -- and I've found the bar to be set quite high in New Orleans.

We were seated on the balcony and waited 27 minutes during which time no one ever came out. Went in after 15 minutes to remind them we were out there but never got served. We left the restaurant and no one even noticed. 10 minutes later we walked by and saw our menus still on the table.

Wanted to try this place for the first time. Waiter was awesome. Like he looked out for us. We ordered our food and it took two hours before it came out on a non busy night. We seen at least 4 other tables sit after us and leave before us. Totally unacceptable. First and last time going.

I never have the motivation to write yelp reviews, but Royal House was so bad, that I felt it was my duty to help people avoid it. This is the textbook definition of a tourist trap.
You might see nearly 4,000 reviews on yelp and a 4 star rating, but that does not tell the full story. 

For the appetizer we ordered the oyster duo. It took 2 minutes for it to come out of the kitchen, and it sure looked like they only spent that long making it. The oysters were dry and definitely not fresh. I've never seen such a gross looking "Rockefeller Oyster." There was no cheese or bacon on it, like what a typical Rockefeller Oyster has. We've tried oysters from several other places in New Orleans and the difference in taste is truly outstanding. So that's $14 down the drain.

For the entree, I ordered a Shrimp Poboy that tasted like frozen shrimp with stale bread. The fries were cold as well. My girlfriend ordered the house burger and I've never seen a burger be butchered so badly. She ordered it medium well with bacon (additional $2). Instead she got a soggy bun with a rare patty and no bacon. The cheese was not melted and there was no lettuce. Which typically come with a cheeseburger. 

The best part about this place is that the food came out so fast; I didn't have to wait to be disappointed. Avoid Royal House at all costs.

Seafood and Cajun/Creole restaurant located in the heart of the French Quarter.

We came on a Sunday night during the Christmas holidays. It was busy but they accommodated our party of seven within 15 minutes. 

I started out with the oyster beignets. I'm sold. It is now my favorite way to eat oysters. Absolutely delicious. For my meal I had the crawfish ravioli. It was yummy.

The service was a little slow but the staff were friendly and accommodating.

The location was perfect. We sat on the second floor and all of the doors were open. We could hear the music pouring in from the street performers. There truly is no place like New Orleans.

Great service, great food, the atmosphere was awesome and our waitress Tina was even more awesome-er! I have nothing but good things to say other than to try the "Taste of New Orleans" meal - two Spoons up from me!

Waited for about 1.5 hrs to get in, but once in we were greeted with kindness & nicely accommodated with our larger party of 16. Our server Jordan, she was super friendly, helpful & understanding. Food was wonderful as were the drinks.

Good food, not bad or anything special. I actually went there to try alligator meat, which was not bad. I found shells in some other food but i think that's fine. Bartender  on the second floor was super friendly and very willing to help. If I were in the same are, I don't think I would go there again, but rather try a some other place.

Royal House was on the list of foodie suggestions we got from our local tour guide if you want good oysters.  So why not?

Hubby & I walked in on a weekday.  The hostess said bar or table.  We said table.  We were seated immediately on the first floor at a table.  We weren't offered the option of 2nd floor.  Not sure why.

At any rate, a friendly server introduced herself.  Asked us if we wanted to order drinks.  Hubby went with a red wine.  

We ordered a dozen oysters on the half shell, 1/2 dozen chargrilled oysters, and the deep fried seafood platter which came with fries & coleslaw.

The raw oysters and the chargrilled oysters were good size.  The deep fried oysters were not as plumb as the other ones but edible.

Food came quickly.  Service was friendly.

4 stars service
3.5 food

Service was a 5+.  Bartender was super friendly. Can't remember her name but she was great.  

Food ... maybe a 2.  Got a shrimp Poboy and it was just ok at best.  Wasn't GREAT like I wa shopping for.  Part of the bread was actually cold.  Shrimp wasn't anything different that what I can get in Minnesota (my guess is frozen). I had much higher hopes after seeing 4 stars after so many reviews.  Honestly, the shrimp Poboy I had at the airport when I landed in NOLA was significantly better (Dooky something).  

Was super bummed because it was my last meal in NOLA before heading home.  

Maybe the other stuff on the menu is worth the visit.

We celebrated my cousin's birthday here. Our server was very nice and friendly. The food is pretty good. The oysters were fresh and delicious. Their French Onion soup is a must try as well. The reason I'm giving them 4 stars is because the hostesses were rude. They told us that the wait was over an hour long and that we had time to go around. We came back in 30 minutes and the guy crossed our name of the list and blamed us for now being there. We ended up waiting longer.

The food was pretty good...nothing special. We tried the seafood stuffed mushrooms and they were flavorful, but room temperature. They seemed as though they had been sitting under a heat lamp for a while. After the appetizers, our drinks finally arrived and they were terrible!  When I asked our server to re make my wife's drink because it tasted like they forgot to add the alcohol, I saw the disgusted look on the bartenders face as if he had been personally insulted. I then saw him pour a shot of some well whiskey, when it was supposed to be mixed with Jim Beam, and give the drink back to the server.  I had the bloody Mary and it was mediocre. The only good drink at the table was the wine and I think that's only because the bartender didn't have to mix it.  For $15 per mixed drink, you'd expect them to be better....even in a busy restaurant in the heart of the French Quarter.  The meal was so so. The etouffe, jambalaya and gumbo were pretty good. The pecan crusted mahi was by far the best dish at our table.  Needless to say, I won't be going back and I won't be recommending this place to anyone I know.

A great restaurant in a perfect location with fantastic service.
In all the dishes we ordered, the crab claws appetizer, onion soup, and the steak was definitely the best. Had to wait for an hour to get in but definitely worth it.
Food was good and service was great. A bit slow, but the server kept us updated and was super friendly. There was a couple there that were back for a second time in two days

A lovely night in the French Quarter. All was just as you would hope - perfect weather for dinner on the balcony while being serenaded by a street musician - an amazingly talented saxophonist. Our server Joseph was an outstanding host with excellent recommendations.   Red velvet dessert was a divine ending. Thanks Royal House - apparently we saved the best for last.

This is a great place to stop when wandering around the quarter because it has a ton of seating and a lot of servers. The food is super classic New Orleans style and super delicious. My brother and I even got a coupon for a free appetizer when we checked in on Yelp! I highly recommend you check this out before heading over there.
My po boy came out with 5 shrimp. They did bring out additional after I complained. It's a tourist trap, but the service was pleasant and kind.

The food was delicious. Our appetizer, claws, tasted amazing and would be a great proportion if their entres were bigger. I Was left hungry afterwards and we decided to stop for a pizza slice right after leaving.  I would suggest a bit more food portions. It is a sad thing when you leave a restaurant hungry, and we are NOT big people.

We were shocked to be seated almost immediately despite the crowds. We sat upstairs at the bar. We were greeted by the bartender immediately, and we started looking through the menu. 

We started with drinks - I ordered a Bloody Mary, they use the BEST Bloody Mary Mix that I swear by - Zing Zang! I was happy already. My friend ordered a French 75 and wanted something added to it - the bartender had to problem running downstairs to get him what he wanted. He was hospitable and happy to get us whatever we wanted.

I ordered the Oyster Duo - Sample both of the oyster favorites: Oysters Rockefeller and Oysters Royale. Oyster Rockefeller are Louisiana oysters with sauteed spinach, bacon, sambuca, and baked to a golden brown. Oyster Royale are Louisiana oysters topped with their seafood stuffing and baked to bubbly perfection.

My friends ordered the Taste of New Orleans Entree. It was a sampling of the city's most famous dishes: Chicken & Andouille Jambalaya, Crawfish Etouffee and Chicken and Andouille Gumbo. They loved it! I also ordered a side of Red Beans and Rice - because why not? They did not disappoint!

The service was great -- every employee I saw was engaging with guests like they were hosting them in their own homes. It was excellent hospitality -- and I've found the bar to be set quite high in New Orleans.
​

We only ate there because it was within walking distance to a play we had tickets to. Way too expensive for mediocre food. I'm a local. I was offended by what they charge for such simple dishes. This tourist trap is a waste of money. My husband ordered shrimp creole and there were about 8 mouthfuls in the bowl. It was about $18. The cocktails were full of ice. Watered down. Tourists, please don't eat here and think that's how New Orleans food is supposed to be.
Jesus and Cindy took great care of us. We will definitely come back. Thank you for the wonderful food and service. Great to meet y'all!!
I come here every time I'm in New Orleans. Oysters and drinks are awesome. Jordan was a great server, with a happy attitude and shared NOLA birthday traditions with us. Would always recommend.

Went for dinner here specifically to have the peel and eat spiced shrimp. Hostess had us follow her around until she decided what table to seat us. Ordered bread to munch on while we wait because I saw it was served with several of the platters. The waiter (who was very nice) said there would be an up charge. Not a big deal except the bread was NOT heated, the butter did not arrive at the same time, and the table knife couldn't cut the bread (no other knife was served with the bread). The shrimp and boiled potatoes were very good!  My husband had the shrimp jambalaya. He said it was ok.
Came in here for a last po boy before leaving town - what a disappointment - the bread was stale, there were hardly any oysters and the bill was expensive.

Tevin was our server and did an amazing job and was very kind. We got the spinach dip and it's my new favorite spinach dip. I got the crawfish etouffee  and I was very happy and ate it all! The wine selection is alright, I would recommend to the owner to replace a few of the California's with French wine. We both got Italian wine and enjoyed it. Overall great experience and love the vibe with open windows watching nightlife pass by.

The hostess was warm, welcoming and promptly sat us on the balcony-which was wonderful. Our waitress was attentive and helpful. 

We ordered the redfish beignets and the taste of New Orleans. 9/10 recommend the beignets! It had a wonderful flavor, however, the gumbo on the 3 plate was AWFUL. I'm a gumbo fanatic so my standards are quite high, but honestly you can buy canned gumbo better than theirs. Seriously avoid that

It was our first time at Royal and our server, Becky was wonderful! She recommended the crab claws for appetizers and it was delish! The bread was nicely toasted and cut thick enough to hold the crab before biting into it. The sauce was flavorful and light and we ended up eating all of it.
My sister got the shrimp and grits. The grits were fluffy and in small mounds topped with the sauce and shrimp. The sauce was similar to the one in the crab claw so of course it was wonderful. There was a good amount of shrimp and every bite had a shrimp.
I got the oyster po boy. The bread was crispy yet fluffy and it didn't hurt biting into the French bread like other places where I'm from (California). I didn't need to add any sauces as the oyster fry wasn't dry AT ALL. The fries here are amazing - nice and crispy on the outside and fluffy on the inside.
My husband got the fish fry. It is a lightly battered cat fish and it's worth a try. Soft and fluffy packed with a lot of flavor. It also comes with fries, which has become my favorite. 

The portions here are well worth the price. Most of us ended up having some left over. As you may have noticed, I used "fluffy" to describe most of the food...which is pretty accurate. The flavor and texture of the food and service are well worth the visit. If you get a chance, ask for Becky - she's a great server: attentive, professional, and has such a wonderful attitude.

Tonight was our first night in New Orleans, we decided to dine here and Tyrone was our waiter! He made our night so fun and knew exactly what dishes we would each love! He is the epitome of southern hospitality! Thanks so much Tyrone! Also Gabby was such a sweetheart, we will definitely be returning because of the great service we received!

Tried this place out due to Yelp's recommendations! There was a wait to be seated, but room at the bar for 2 so we opted for that.  Our waiter's name was Leroy and he honestly made our visit, without him I don't think we would've had the same experience. Everything we ordered was based off his recommendation. We started with the crab claws and the lemon garlic butter it soaked in made it mouth watering. I probably would have ordered another one if it wasn't for our main entrees. My boyfriend got the taste of New Orleans while I got the baked shrimp tortellini. Both amazing! But my boyfriend did say he liked mine better than his.  Leroy was very attentive and personable and made us feel very welcomed to New Orleans!
FYI if you sit at the bar you have to be 21 and they will check everyone's ID no matter how old you look. And don't forget to check in for your free app!

We stumbled upon Royal House after our Voodoo tour around the French Quarter, and they were able to seat 6 of us immediately in the upstairs dining area. Tyrone was our waiter, and he was great, even though we could tell he was super busy that night and busting ass, he was still in a really great mood and made time to come by and make us laugh every now and then. Four of the people at our table hadn't spent much time in the south, so they all wanted to try gumbo/jambalaya/hush puppies/etc. Luckily they had a combo plate and I think they all really loved the jambalaya. We also had fried alligator for an appetizer, which was really good. The hush puppies (I really talked them up as I grew up in the south and wanted them all to try it) were a little...I won't say underwhelming, because they were still tasty, but the texture was different from any hush puppy I'd had before, it was a little too dense so they turned back to batter a little bit after some chewing. The food took quite awhile to come out - there didn't seem to be too many people upstairs waiting for food, but I suppose they could've been short staffed because of the holiday (it was 1/1.) Overall, I'm glad we stopped in and had some warm food and good company.
Came in with a group of 8 on a Friday night and they got us in quickly. Good drinks and good Cajun food. Grilled oysters, Ravioli, and redfish beignets were the favorites.
Great spot for friendly bartenders, fresh oysters and authentic New Orleans environment. Cindy is an awesome bartender!
Best Oysters Rockefeller in town!!!! Best waitress, Becky!!!! Absolutely so pleasant and helpful!!!!! Royal House is MUST try!

We picked the best time to come here, the night the saints won, so everyone else would be out getting drunk. This place is usually packed to the brim and for good reason. There's a lot of seating both upstairs and downstairs and there is outdoor galley seating. 

The waitress was super nice in giving us recommendations of appetizers, entrees and desserts. We ended up starting with the alligator and man was it tender. For entrees we got the crawfish ravioli, the seafood pescatore, and the taste of New Orleans which includes crawfish etouffee, gumbo, and red beans and rice. Everything was amazing but the ravioli and the crawfish etouffee in particular were amazing. The seafood pescatore is a bit spicy so definitely be aware if you cannot handle spicy foods. 

This was a very pleasant meal and if I'm ever back in Nola, it'll be on my list of go backs!
Very friendly service. The crab claws and fried alligator were brilliant. We had some raw oysters as well.

First experience here and it was amazing. We were greeted at the door w/ a smiling face from a delightful woman named Gabby that asked us where we would like to sit and if we had been here before. She suggested that we sit at the bar to get the "full experience".  We are so glad that we did!  Leroy (originally from Memphis) was our host and he was over the top with hospitality and charm. He made suggestions for drinks, entrees and dessert. We ordered strawberry lemonade, the hurricane, seafood stuffed mushrooms, crab claws, red fish beignets and the butter pecan pie. Everything was fantastic and there was not a single thing that could have been better. Once again, I am charmed by another amazing New Orleans establishment. Cheers and we'll be back!

Greeters were friendly by the door. We were taken upstairs. The atmosphere isn't as nice as downstairs. The crab claw was highly disappointing. Look at the stale bread. Why would you even serve that. The shrimp dish looks good but has way too much sauce and not enough rice or shrimp; the proportion is off. Would not recommend this place.

The Chargrilled Oysters are tiny compared to Dragos, Acme House and Felix's. They are definitely not worth the price. I recommend you get them elsewhere. Also, the fried gator dish was tiny and the gumbo barely had any ingredients in it, nothing but rice and broth.

This was my 3rd visit, and just as good as my last 2. Our waitress was very attentive to our table and had great menu suggestions. The Banana Foster Cheesecake is out of this world! I will be returning next time I am in NOLA!!!

GO LITERALLY ANYWHERE ELSE! I was excited to try the peel and eat shrimp for a true New Orleans cajun shrimp boil meal. Utter garbage. I have never seen, felt, or tasted such dry, overcooked shrimp. I didn't even know it was possible. I think it was likely boiled and then sat under the heat lamps for a good 10 to 20 minutes. I wish I would have taken a picture of the dish in all its dry, rubbery glory because someone else needs to witness it. The corn that came with it was inedible (think biting into the brown corn stalks you see people decorating with at Thanksgiving) and the potatoes were so salty, like a cured ham. 

When the server asked how the food was I told her it was overcooked and not good. She didn't say anything and then seemed to be avoiding eye contact the rest of the time we were there. She cleared everyone's plates except for my very full one even though I placed my silverware and napkin on the table, clearly done. I could have (and honestly should have) made a bigger stink to save myself the wasted money but I was so done and didn't feel like expending the energy. Finally, after she gave us the checks back, I was able to ask her to please take the plate and reiterated how dry and overcooked and cold it was. She said, "I got you." and took the plate away. No apology or anything. I mean I know it's uncomfortable when someone tells you the food is bad but come on!

So disappointing. A very sour ending to our New Orleans trip. Hopefully I can get one more good meal in before I leave tomorrow to rid myself of this bitter taste.

Like several other reviews (which I didn't read until after the fact, unfortunately) I NEVER leave yelp reviews, but I feel compelled to deter others from this restaurant. We saw that this restaurant had great yelp reviews and the menu online showed a number of options--We could not be more disappointed with the outcome! I ordered the taste of New Orleans and it was very disappointing (and just down right bad). The boxed Zatarain's jambalaya we made the other night was better than the jambalaya from this restaurant. The dishes were also lukewarm which makes sense since we waited a while for the food. The bread served on the side was very dry.
Excellent food and service. So happy we had dinner here.  The manager, Neil was very helpful and congenial. Defiantly will return here for a great meal

I was amazed by how delicious the food at royal house was. The quaint historical building with wraparound balcony overlooking New Orleans creates an authentic Cajun experience. I enjoyed their gumbo which was perfectly seasoned. The French onion soup was delightful with a hefty portion of cheese. My girls and I shared the spinach dip and fried  alligator which was surprisingly robust with flavor. For my entree I devoured the Crawfish Étouffée, and was not disappointed. The manager; Shirly was kind enough to stop by and check in on our experience and entertained my kids in conversation. If you're looking for a great meal and memorable atmosphere, don't pass this one up.

Great Service, bland food . We had raw oysters that we not very clean and did not fresh at all (only ate 2 at the risk of getting ill) and we shared The Taste of New Orleans and let me just say it left me lacking for lots of flavor and the slices of bread that were served with it were stale.  Our host and server were excellent though so kuddos to them !!

I had some delicious shrimp and oysters here! The restaurant is really nice inside and has a good ambiance. It's clean and well taken care of. The waitress was very friendly and attentive. I love boils and I ordered the peel and eat shrimp which came with corn and potatoes. It was buttery and savory. The oysters were huge! 

The restaurant is conveniently located to other bars and attractions. It has a lot of space inside and outside for seating. The staff is helpful and welcoming.

Sever Becky was great! Our food was dili reed super fast!! We started with the crab claw app and it was delish!!! 3 of us got the Alaskan snow crab. The crab was amazing!! Juicy and the Cajun spice was perfection!! The potatoes and corn would be a desired taste. Only one person could handle them at our table. They are super spicy. But if you like the heart, you'll love them!! I got the crawfish ravioli and it's was also really great! I was a little hesitant to order it, thinking there may not be much crawfish on it, but there were more than enough!! Price was reasonable and atmosphere was great. I would definitely come back.

I will give this 5 stars for the charbroiled oysters and 3 stars for our waitress. She would not take our drink orders unless we showed ID. We are both in our 50s. She then told me she has to card everyone. I watched her take drink orders from others and no identification was taken. I even asked the couple next to us and they said they never do that here.  She gave me a drink with no alcohol and in a plastic cup.  She told us the glasses were getting cleaned. I watched other waiters bringing out glasses with drinks. Our oysters came out 45 minutes later and were delicious. She kept coming over explaining not to me but my husband that she was so busy. It's the reason you got a crappy tip. Next time dont be a jerk about the ID, crappy drink, plastic cup and slow service. We were there earlier on a food tour and loved the drink and oyster so much we came back.
Delicious seafood and good service! Loved their seafood pescatore and oysters are so good any way you have it. Grab a table by the doors on a nice evening for some great street performances.

Had a great experience at this restaurant 1/19/19. We had the pleasure of Ebony waiting on our table.
