She was both great at explaining the menu, service, and personality that made this a great experience. We ordered the oysters which weren't sandy and delicious. The mushrooms loaded with crab and shrimp was more fish then breading and delicious. Chef outdid himself with the mahi mahi dinner. Encourage all to check this gem out if you want to spend a little to get a lot.
Our server Becky was awesome!!! We had tons of oysters and they were amazing! Will come back for sure.

Really wasn't much to recommend here.  We waited about 30 minutes outside on the night before the NFC Championship gam3 (there was a crowd).  Went upstairs and ordered chargrilled oysters (raw), oysters Royals (dry...very dry), I had a cup of gumbo....rice and gravy with a 1/3" cube of sausage and no chicken.  There was no other meat in it....not gumbo.  My sister had  the crab claws....not fresh.  I've never left a restaurant and wanted to warn everyone waiting to go somewhere else to eat.

Let's start with the staff. They're amazing. However, the food is not great. If you want oysters, go to Felix's. If you want barbecued shrimp, go to Mr. B's. Ms. Shirley is great for making a reservation for us on a Saturday night what they don't usually do that. However, it doesn't even matter because their food is not great. The seafood in the seafood pescatore tasted like it never touched anything more than water. I can make better drinks and pasta at home. It hurts me to write this review because the wait staff and managers are great, but the food is just not good.

My friend and I were able to get seated on the balcony right away. Our server Becky was helpful and gracious. The crab claws and chargrilled oysters were awesome! I also had the ravioli but could have passed on it. Wasn't bad--but the crab claws and sauce they come in were the true hit!

Amazing chargrilled oysters!! Robert our waiter was by far the best server we had the entire time we were in New Orleans. Bloody Mary's were very tasty and the hurricane is on point with fresh fruit juice. Will definitely be coming back to this place

Went one evening and only had a 20 minute wait (after Saints lost the playoffs). We were blessed with the best server: Jordan. Two of my friends had birthdays & Jordan introduced us to the New Orleans tradition of pinning money to yourself. Best service ever. 
Ordered the mixed platter, oysters, alligator, and French onion soup. All of it was good (the etouffee was the best).

This is one of the cleanest and best tasting restaurants in NOLA. I love to start with the Redfish Beignets. The Redfish Beignets are even BETTER than regular beignets, which I didn't think was possible!! They are more flaky inside, more delicate, more tasty! It would be hard not to curse the minute you eat it! If you can't decide which delicious cajun meal to eat, why not sample multiple?! Get the Taste of New Orleans: Chicken & Andouille Gumbo, Jambalaya, and Crawfish Étouffée. There is SO much on the menu, and not enough time to eat them all! But, that's why you have the rest of NOLA to explore, eat, and drink!

Came here after a day of walking around. Started off with the chargrilled oysters- which were amazing! Our waitress recommended the crawfish ravioli- which was sooo good! Definitely should get the crawfish ravioli. The service was great and the ambiance was nice.
Meh the location was good, the service was good but the food was mediocre, there was nothing noticeable or memorable about it.

This place obviously has rave reviews on Yelp. That, and the line outside the restaurant made me curious.

I happened to be in New Orleans on a really cold night. I arrived and the host told me the wait time for a party of two was 15 minutes. After 15-30 minutes passed, I was really curious as to whether he ever wrote my name down and if he was calling other parties of two ahead of me. As soon as I started to complain, I was promptly seated and service thereafter was good.

I didn't get my waitress' name but she was very pleasant and accommodating. The appetizers - fried oysters and fried alligator were delicious if not a hint salty. As for the mains, the tortellini was absolutely delicious (piping hot) and the red fish was lukewarm and dry. The waitress brought butter sauce which helped tremendously. 

The atmosphere was also lively because that was the night the Saints lost their chance at the 2019 Superbowl.
This restaurant deserves a second chance and added star because of how the waiter and manager handled a sub par dish.

Came in to dine at 10:20 being that their site says open until 1 am. We walked in and felt an automatic unwanted vibe as the hosts started at us like we didn't belong. Catching the weird energy we asked "what time do you close?" They said 11 and ushered us to sit at the bar making us feel very weird and unwanted. As we were hesitantly grabbing our seats the bartender started yelling to the hosts (very loudly and obviously directed towards the situation) "oh wow you and I are going to have a falling out" to which the host responds "what I already sat two tables just now" and he continued to complain and shake his head infront of us heightening the unwelcome feeling....we got up and just walked out and no one asked us why or where we were going. They didn't even tell us to have a good night. Truly disappointing especially because I work in the service industry as well. Lost out on a hefty tip and very easy to please diners. Will not be returning

We enjoyed our experience at Royal House.  The hostess had a really inviting personality which  helped us make the final decision to eat there.  We were a party of 4.  We "checked in" with yelp and got a free appetizer- the crab claws.  We thought they were  good, but we all agreed that we probably would not have been all that excited to pay $12.50 for them. The 4 of us  had the shrimp tortellini, seafood pasta, crawfish étouffée, French onion soup and chicken Caesar salad .  The French onion soup was one of the best we've ever had, with nice rosemary undertones.  My son's shrimp tortellini was disappointing as it came out with only 2 small shrimp.  However, once we showed this to the waiter, he graciously whisked it away to the kitchen and returned about 8 minutes later with a proper shrimp tortellini with abundant shrimp....and it was delicious.  Our waiter worked so hard to please us.  He was delightful. The whole experience was quite lovely.
Had a wonderful experience at Royal House! Monica was superb!! Looking forward to our next trip to New Orleans, will definitely make it back for a meal and drinks here!!

This place is definitely overhyped by other reviewers. We came here for brunch and left the place unimpressed, granted the service was very good. Our waitress was very sweet and even opened the side doors for us when we requested.

We ordered a shrimp platter and taste of New Orleans, a Bloody Mary and a mimosa. Total bill was $75. We definitely paid for the salt that they loaded on those food, not the taste. My tongue was tingling for a good 10 minutes because the fried shrimp was very salty. Overall, food was mediocre, service and ambiance were great.
My waiter was AMAZING!!!!!!!!! Feel bad I forgot his name. Food was really good! Had crawfish pasta (waiter recommended it)
Cindy makes THE best Bloody Mary's!! (Coming from a Bloody Mary snob!) Great atmosphere and the food is delicious!

Cindy is a Superhero and her superpower is crafting an amazing Bloody Mary. I've had them everywhere so I know what I'm talking about. My lady friend is a big fan as well. I scored major points by taking her here.

Busy night but we got a table right away. Seated at a table for four in the corner a bit chilly outside so we started off with french onion soup and Gumbo. My onion soup, I believe, was the best I've ever tasted. My dinner partners all enjoyed their meals: Dozen Oysters, Blackened Redfish, Crawfish Ravioli. My selection was Shrimp and Tortellini. Delicious. All plates piping hot. Waitress was wonderful. Crazy busy but she kept up! Yeah will return next visit to NOLA.

We wanted to get the seafood pot, but they were out. A bit disappointing but no big deal, I understand restaurants run out of dishes every once in a while. We then asked the waiter what he recommended and we ended up getting the seafood pescatore. For $24 there wasn't much seafood on the dish compared to other restaurants. It was also super salty and the shrimps were way overcooked. This restaurant was really disappointing. I'm giving it 2 stars instead of 1 because their chargrilled oysters were really good.

After a day of walking around and working up an appetite I looked to yelp to find a restaurant and it led us to royal house. We sat at the bar and ordered some cocktails (pims cup and strawberry vodka lemonade) delicious! 

Food: 
Peel n eat shrimp- yumm!! Fresh and delicious 

Crab claws- it was A-okay. We came to the realization that the crab claws in NOLA are super tiny and not something we are used to. We were very confused why they were so tiny. But the sauce was absolutely delicious

Fried alligator- we were not a fan it was a bit dry and chewy. 

The service was great! The bartender was super friendly and chatted with us throughout our lunch. He even gave us a slice of king cake which was super yummy.
A service mix-up got us the most excellent French Onion Soup for free!  It's was beefy and gooey and a joy to slurp.  The Oyster Duo also rocked.

Let me start by saying the food here wasn't bad. The food here was underwhelming. The dishes were mostly rice with some sauce for flavoring and small amount of the protien that pertains to that dish. As recommended by the waitress, I ordered "A Taste of New Orleans" which was 3 of their dishes but in smaller portions. I don't mind paying for quality but this place was overpriced for the food they serve.

Wife and I had lunch here on are visit from Ohio and We are very  glad we did. We had a great lunch. Service was top notch, Atmosphere is Awesome it's got the feel of going back in time it's really quint! And I think it's the 4th oldest running restaurant in the French Quarter .We set upstairs which we loved got to see the entire restaurant. They have a really nice balcony upstairs it was a little chilly so we sat at a table just inside and they had a couple of the doors open which was great gave us a little bit of a outside feel. Our food was delicious I ordered a taste of New Orleans which is a cup of Crawfish Etouffee, Chicken and Andouille Jambalaya and Chicken and Andouille Gumbo all were fantastic! Wife order the Shrimp and Grits it was Amazing! And like I said combined with fantastic service it was such a great experience! Thank you !

"Becky with the good hair" was an awesome server who took care of us on our wedding day! 

we had the shrimp creole, blackened chicken sandwich, and shrimp and grits. 

thanks!

First meal in New Orleans. It was everything I needed it to be. We got the crab claws appetizer. The sauce that came with the claws was OUTSTANDING. My SO ordered the blackened redfish entree. She enjoyed the fish a lot but wasn't too impressed with eye green beans or potatoes. I had the Taste of New Orleans. I think that's what it was called. It came with jambalaya, gumbo, ettoufee, and red beans & rice. The drink was unremarkable.

I don't remember the waiter's name (short, older white guy with glasses) but he was friendly, attentive, helpful, wonderful!

Hey friends, this is a place to bookmark, so that you know to visit while you're in the quarter. It gets 5 stars in my book for a combination of location, service, ambiance , views and last, but not least food .

My cousin had red fish beignets . Yes , you heard right. Red fish is a hearty fish, I would say similar to cod? What Royal House has done is dip it in sweet batter and fired it. It's not for everyone , but if you're looking for something different, here you go. My cousin also had some delectable-looking charbroiled oysters that were covered with melted Parmesan cheese. I personally had a spinach salad with a perfectly mixed balsamic vinaigrette, chopped apples, goat cheese and pecans. It was what I needed, when I needed it. You can , of course, add meat to your salad if you choose for an upcharge. 

Tip: When you go ask to sit upstairs if you can. It's a great view of the streets , cozy, and there's balcony seating . 

Getting great service is nothing to worry about either.

Great food made even better by great service! Our server, Becky, made our evening. She was so knowledgeable about the menu and helped us navigate the various options. Becky made sure we were well taken care of while also making us laugh and truly enjoy our dining experience in the French Quarter.

If you're looking for a fantastic and filling meal in New Orleans, look no further than the Royal House. We were lucky to have Becky as our server. I'm not from New Orleans, nor do I eat a lot of seafood. She navigated my tastebuds through an experience beyond taste. From crab legs to French onion soup, and gin cocktails to a seafood pasta, she listened and gauged my meal. There are places you leave full. There are places you leave happy. This is a place you can leave feeling both...without the guilt. Hats off to Becky and the staff on a great experience after a stressful week.
Try the oysters 2 ways!  Really interesting interior!  Local wait staff were very friendly

The Royal house is a Gem in New Orleans and HIGHLY underrated, while Acme, Oceana and Felix's get all the notoriety, I feel that The Royal house has superior food, service and most importantly you are not going to have to stand in line for a hour and a half, just to be underwhelmed. I am only going to say this once, this is pound for pound the best Oyster bar in the city, which means it is one of the best Oyster bars in the country! 

For me my bread and butter is the Crab claws...dude...no lie, I honestly feel like they sprinkle crack in it or something, it is the very definition of delicious and HANDS down the best version of crab claws in the city of New Orleans and I stand by that statement! Oh and here is a pro move, order it with extra crab meat...thank me later!

Next is the Redfish Beignet, this is one of the most simple yet unique dishes I have ever tasted and for me it's the signature dish of the resteraunt, it is sweet savory with just a wisp of spice, but what makes it delicious is that it is really light with the texture of a tempura, honestly it is a perfect marriage of all the beautiful flavors of New Orleans, whoever created this dish needs a t-shirt with their picture on it AND a second line in their honor no cap!

Lastly I am gonna show love to the oyster shuckers, if you come to this place I highly encourage you to sit at the Oyster Bar and if you are REALLY lucky Nirobi or Anthony will be working and without question they are the heart and SOUL of the Royal house and are perfect ambassadors of everything southern and New Orleans, they are fun informative and talented, watching them work is special because they make something that is truly difficult look easy while fully engaging you in colorful and fun dialogue.

Had an great dinner here with my friends for a birthday. We had an extremely enthusiastic waitress whose name i can't remember. She was very sweet and had bangs and was very attentive. 8 of us were seated within 2 minutes of us walking into the restaurant. We got a round of drinks. I had 'effen on the beach' it was really good. We ordered 1/2 raw oysters and 1/2 of the chargrilled oysters with cheese. They were very fresh. We also ordered fried alligator bites. For dinner I had blackened shrimp jambalaya. Very tasty. The others had the crawfish ravioli, baked shrimp tortellini, and a salad. I would totally go back.

The wait wasn't too long. Nice ambience. Waiter staff all looked a bit disheveled in appearance. With the check in was able to order a dozen of chargrilled oysters. Not the best I've had in NOLA but was okay. The fried alligator was yummy and nicely seasoned. The stuffed mushrooms were rather disappointing. The breading was almost twice the size of the mushroom cap and were very dry.
The dozen raw oysters from the Gulf were meaty and delicious.  The french onion soup was overly salty and barely edible.  Inconsistent kitchen.

Always enjoy a stop at the Royal House while we're in town.  Chargrilled oysters are some of the best in the Quarter and the staff is always friendly. Sat at the bar and was served by Cindy, who made the best Bloody Mary in town!

I was quite disappointed with this restaurant. The ambiance is wonderful. The building is very pretty. The service is poor. The hosts were wonderful and engaging but the wait staff was inattentive. Food was mediocre to say the least. One dish a friend got was clearly reheated from a purchase outside of the restaurant. The alligator was tasteless. The gumbo was ok. Disappointed with the experience.
Cindy at the bar made some homemade remoulade. Super yummy. Going to help dress my oyster po-boy with it. Great location great people great food. Right here on the corner of St Louis and Royale.

Just arrived in NOLA yesterday and had to go to my husband's favorite oyster house.  We sat at the bar and Cindy was our bartender.  She is such a great ambassador for this restaurant and your great city.  We thoroughly enjoyed our meal and Cindy's company!!  Will definitely be back before this trip ends!!

Cindy was amazing! Made the best Bloody Mary I've ever had, helped us order all of the best things on the menu (French onion was great) and made us homemade remolade sauce for our fries on the spot (not even on the menu!)

Will be back!

Cindy at the bar is wonderful and took great care of us.  She gave us her special homemade remoulade sauce, which complimented the delicious po' boy.  Great Crawfish Etouffe, too. Check it out,  sit at the bar and ask for Cindy.

It's worth the wait! Yes, it took way longer than they thought to sit our big party.  It didn't matter; the food was amazing.  As others have said, get the appetizers: crab claws and red fish beignet.  You won't be disappointed.  Dip that bread in the crab sauce.  Dip those fish beignet in the syrup.  Dip dip dip.  Enjoy.
The food was good and price was reasonable. Everyone got something different and e tried each other's god and everything was so tasty. I will eat there again when visiting NOLA
Portion size and price suck and the quality is not there. The flavor was whatever. Basic
Friendly staff, delicious shrimp po boy! We enjoyed this restaurant!! The oysters were also very good.

Last night in New Orleans...and unfortunately this didn't cut it..... I sat at the bar and had reasonable service ....but  I ordered an oyster sampler which consisted of 2 of each of Chargrilled oysters,oysters Rockefeller and seafood stuffed oysters....

The Chargrilled were the tasty highlight and a good temperature but the others were all luke warm at best  and the stuffing was more breading than seafood.... not good !

Simultaneously I had ordered.-- Seafood stuffed mushrooms...again a bit too much breading and there was no sauce that accompanied it..
When I asked for sauce the bartender had to go get some which actually took longer than expected and she brought me back a butter sauce ....
This just didn't work ---it wasn't the correct accent sauce .... And I was not overly anxious to acquire another sauce.

(Incidentally a patron next to me wanted some sauce for her sandwich and again the staff had to punch info into the computer and go back in the kitchen) 

Maybe they need to keep some of these options in the bar area...(?). Just a suggestion.  

Poor choices ,cool temps and lousy sauce ....ugh

The staff was accommodating and friendly though!

We visited after a day of shopping in French Quarter. Oysters on half shell were fantastic. Shrimp Po Boy excellent. French onion soup too salty and Charbroiled oysters too salty and soupy with butter as well. 

Would go back but order things without cheese which they seem to load up with salt.

Owner and staff were very gracious. Prices reasonable for NO which seems to have expensive food.

If I could give this restaurant 10 stars I would! Everything from start to finish was absolutely top notch. They feature some of the most fresh and amazing fresh seafood and Cajun entrees I've had in Nola thus far. 

The atmosphere is super cozy and intimate, set in a lovely historic building. The tables are on the smaller side so drinks and food pile up quickly, though the staff is swift to retrieve the empties. The service was outstanding! Ask for Tina if you go there, she's a hoot! The owner was very warm and welcoming with the Southern hospitality. 

Now let me tell you about the crab claw appetizer. It came with 4 pieces of garlic toast cut on the bias and many small meaty claws. And the creamy, spicy tomato sauce it was drenched in... OMG! It's the stuff that I will forever day dream about! It's pure heaven! So devine! 

The food did take about 25 mins to arrive but they were slammed. We downed many hurricane drinks while we waited, which were nicely made. I ordered the gulf shrimp and grits. It had a creamy Creole BBQ sauce and the grits were a little bit clumpy with Gouda cheese. Very tasty though. 

My friend got the ribeye dinner. Done to perfection. I may have to go back one more time while I'm here for the crab claw magic though! Highly recommend this restaurant!

We came here tonight to celebrate my hubby's birthday. We heard the oysters were good here. Unfortunately, we were disappointed. After having chargrilled oysters at Acme and charbroiled oysters at Antoine's, we
Were not impressed with Royal's oysters - and we had them 3 ways - chargrilled, Rockefeller and Royale. Chargrilled was a little dry - we had to scrape the oyster off the shell. I felt the Rockefeller and royale was not succulent for me and not baked long enough to get
A crust on it. All oysters didn't taste fresh. 

We also also shared the New Orleans sampler
Platter which was just okay. Nothing to write home
About. 

The staff however were very professional and accommodating. Our server Tevon was very nice. We sat on the balcony and have to admit I did
Not like getting my lemon drop in a plastic cup. 

It was also a nice touch that the employee at
The front door came upstairs to check on us. Kudos to Royal for having nice employees.

This place had 4 stars so we went for it on a Saturday night. It's perfectly fine food. But it's not 4 stars amazing. It's sort of like chili's for Cajun food. 
We ordered the sampler, shrimp and jambalaya and the encrusted fish. The fish was a big deep fried chunk, the rice was almost instant tasting, the sampler was bland. 
Our waiter was friendly and the atmosphere was lively. The kitchen was slow. 
Perfectly fine place to go- just know what to expect.

Tourist Trap. Almost The worst service I've ever experienced. Your food will definitely take a very long time to arrive. I was excited thinking it would be really good. I ordered the crab claws thinking I'm going to be blown away. I asked for them to be hot
Ahead of time. The crab claws are lukewarm to cold, mushy literally just a few looked thrown in bowl and a fishy taste. Next tortellini shrimp. A step above microwave dinner. I Forced myself to eat it. Both dishes over salted especially crab claws. To ad to everything you will seriously be sitting a long Time waiting for service instead of enjoying the city. And when you ask for something you'll be ignored. Came in on a slow day. Not many customers so don't understand the service. My hunch is they are over worked and over it. Sad.
We waited a long time for service, the food was not great. Great view from the balcony. Def could be better, not a 4+ star restaurant.

Our first night in New Orleans and we came here for dinner. My friend ordered the alligator po boy and she said it was okay. I tried the jambalaya and that too was nothing special. This is very close to bourbon street, and a great place to stop by for a bite to eat if you're around the area late at night.  Our servers were very nice and super helpful!

Not what i expected. The location and interior design is very nice.
But this is not an architecture review.
The food was not as good as i hoped. I mean 4k reviews 4s  maybe im ordering the wrong dish.
Alright so....
Alligator Po'Boy- there was more lettuce than alligator and theres one thing i hate with fried foods is to find deep fried chunks of batter. And there was plenty of that. Sandwich was gone in 4 bites. 

Fries- cold and no season. 
Shrimp Creole- There must be a shortage in fisherman after these Gulf Shrimp. 4 Shrimp on my wifes plate 4. The Sauce tasted too much like marinara sauce. Not pleasant taste. 

Red Velvet Cheese cake- a bit too dry. But good. Definetly had better in Chicago! 

Lemonade was way to sweet

Service was Excellent. She took care of us very well.
Not only was the food absolutely delicious, the service could not be beat. Tyrone with Royal House made our experience the best.
Royal House is a sad representation of New Orleans cuisine. Raw Oysters are tiny and charbroiled are mediocre. Appetizers were tiny and the service is horrible. Will not be back

TWO WORDS: Char-Grilled Oysters! Yes, char-grilled is one word. 
Order those. You won't regret it. 
We ordered a dozen to share. 
We didn't order drinks since we came in with our own daiquiris (which they didn't have a problem with). 
We also ordered the crab legs dish. 
The crab leg dish was OK. Little meat but affordable at about $14. 
Service here was top notch! From host to waitress, everyone was super friendly and accommodating. 
Waitress even gave me a money pin since it was my birthday!

The Royal House is as fancy as it sounds and its prices reflect that. 

We only stopped in for a short snack and a quick drink as we were trying different places along the quarter and some how ended up spending 45 dollars. 

The alligator bites were good, but nothing to write home about and their drinks (cocktails) were actually pretty tasty. (10-15$)

The selling point was the service alongside their rockafeller oysters, which is why 4 stars is awarded. 

I highly recommend garlic and parmesan roasted oysters and the rockafeller oysters half and half dish, best ones we had in New Orleans. 

Overall solid experience and tasty food, a bit pricey but its expected in a place like this.
We ended up going here twice and both times the service and the food was amazing. If I lived in New Orleans I would definitely be a regular sitting at the royal house bar rail
Nice views from upstairs dining room.  We had a seat near the window.  Service was good.  Enjoyed the spinach salad royal.  Did oysters on the half shell and oysters royal.  Not much flavor.
I didn't like the fact that the picture of the menu do not match at all the food that come out... not coming back.

We are here our first night and loved the customer service so much that we ate here for our last day. 

I got the Oyster Duo and it was pretty good. I wish I got fresh oysters or a side with it because this dish didn't fill me up.

For dessert, we got the bananas foster cheesecake. We had bananas foster at other restaurants in the area but I think the cheesecake made it the best! I would totally recommend this dessert!

Come to French Quarter many times as I live in Biloxi ms. In bar area and they have 2 servers, one for drinks and one for Food.  The Black dude who served drinks was extremely good server and friendly .  EMILY WAS TERRIBLE Server with no personality and very UNFRIENDLY.  Expectedly, she smiles when she brought the check.  Waited tables, owned a restaurant and managed one as well.  It was clear and wonder how she got hired. Probably her looks.  She will soon discover that doesn't work in a fine dining establishment.

We recently visited the Royal House... I must say the food and service here was amazing!!  Stop in and ask for Cindy. She's a wonderful bartender, with a great personality and tons of wisdom. Thanks for making our afternoon in NOLA a great one!
Pretty good place for balcony eating in the French Quarter. It wasn't too busy. The tables are a little cramped on the upstairs balcony. The food was decent and not to pricey.

Most unhygienic place, I will never eat here again nor will I recommend this gross place to anyone. We sat at the bar to order the food and the waiter/bartender was chucking oysters at the bar contaminating all the glassware at the bar with raw oyster juice. To make things worse, after chucking said oysters, he then proceeds to grab a glass with his unwashed hands and pours water with the same unwashed hands!!! We then witness this same guy grabbing a to-go cup on the inside of the cup and used one of those hand-held soda streamer with unwashed hands. There was visible oyster debris on his hands and arms while he was making drinks. We promptly walked away from the bar and requested to sit at a table with a different waiter. It just so happened that we were sat near a window facing the outside street where the restaurant keeps their garbage cans. The same bartender/oyster chucker was seen outside throwing away oyster shells and trash in the garbage bins while still "bartending." we were absolutely disgusted of this place's lack of food hygiene and SEVERE contamination. This is a serious health concern especially for those with deadly shellfish allergy, avoid at all cost!!!!!  If this guy is so blatantly unhygienic in front of patrons, I cannot fathom what happens in the kitchen.

As many have said, the reviews and high ratings are very skeptical to say the least. Not up to par to the ratings and the poor quality of food. Be cautious.

Man, I gotta say... the service was good. Our waitress, CiCi was awesome. I had a Sazerac and voodoo juice. The Sazerac was good; the voodoo juice tasted like a piña colada with green/blue food coloring and little alcohol (not a fan). I ordered the shrimp creole and my better half ordered the "taste of New Orleans." In order of what we liked (least to most) was: the red beans and rice, shrimp creole, gumbo, & the crawfish etouffée. All that said, our opinion of the place dropped quickly when we started seeing little roaches on the wall next to where I was sitting. I'm a Floridian and know how tough it can be to control that problem, but we saw at least three & this is the only place we had this happen in the 4 days we were around. We were seated by the TV, and the picture shows the wall where we were. Sorry y'all, but I won't be back.

The crab claws are excellent. It's my favorite thing in the menu. Whenever I'm in New Orleans, I have to stop by for it. They don't take reservations. The chargrilled oysters are also good. I don't normally eat oysters but these are good.

My wife and I were seated right away on a busy night.  We put our order of appetizer and drinks in.  The drinks came, but the appetizer never did.  We ordered our entrees and they came out in a reasonable time.  The food was EXCELLENT! Our service was slightly less than excellent, due to the table of eight that was taking up all of our server's time with special orders and complaints.  The staff made our meal just right by not charging us for the appetizer and also applying our free appetizer coupon (for checking in on YELP) to part of our meal.  Overall, it was almost a perfect meal.
Love this atmosphere. Excellent food and bartenders were especially great. Love the hurricanes here!  Make it a double

Horrible service , 20 mins after we ordered they told us they ran out of the fish,  so we ordered something else then 10 mins later we had to ask for our appetizers that we ordered 30 mins ago , finally our food came out 45 mins later and it was cold and our charbroiled oysters were still raw , never once did the waitress check on us or ask us if we wanted refills . I can understand a wait for a popular restaurant but the customer service was horrible and not worth the wait . The food was mediocre and not worth the wait. This place needs some serious training and organization.

Terrible service & very slow. not only that we waiting 45 minutes for our appetizer and when it came it was cold and looks like it sat in the window way to long. We barely saw the waitress, and she had the worst attitude. Would not recommend

Came here with a group of 6 for dinner, tried ordering the spinach dip as an appetizer but they said they were unable to make it at the time. Tried ordering the oysters Rockefeller and they told us something was wrong with the oven. Asked for ketchup for my fries and they were out of that too. The charbroiled oysters and French onion soup were really delicious and the only thing that redeemed this place for me. We also waited quite a long time for our drinks (water and bottled beer.) I'd be willing to give them the benefit of the doubt and try this place again.

It was my first restaurant in NOLA and if a few things went better, it would have gotten a better rating for me. 

Service: Our waiter was friendly, but knocked a full cup of water onto my husband. He didn't grab a towel or napkin for my husband but told him to dry off in the bathroom with the hand dryer...problem was, the hand dryer was way too high to any good. Service was slow and after spilling water on us, we didn't get anything comped or offered to us. 

Food: The most memorable thing was the crawfish étouffée. Delicious! The crab claw appetizer was good but it was mostly sauce. The sauce was good, but it took forever to get extra bread which ended up being 3 slices. I ordered the shrimp tortellini, and it was disappointing. Not outstanding in any way and I could tell that it was sitting out for a while because the cream sauce had the film on top. 

If there were less restaurants around, I would try this place again, but with so many other restaurant options, I don't know if they would get a second chance from me.

This is a MUST stop in NOLA!!!!
All the staff was super friendly and very very accommodating.   We got Gaynelle as a server and she is hands down the best!!  This is our 1st time in NOLA and she took the time to tell us where to go and what are the must stops and where ton"Avoid".  She recommended the Charbroiled Oysters as well. As some really awesome signature drinks, we shared the Taste of New Orleans and BOOM it's was amazing!!!

You MUST eat here and if your lucky enough you may get Gaynelle but if you don't all the staff was Awesome!!!!!

We Will be back
Miss Cindy was soooo awesome! Great drinks and great recommendations for our oysters! Well come back to see Cindy!
Entrees were great. The bread pudding was a little dense and dry in the middle. Servers were very kind.

Have been here many times strictly for their crab claw appetizer.  For $14, you basically used to get 14 (YES, I COUNT THEM FOR THAT PRICE) little bitty claws and the sauce & bread were delicious.  Today, however, there were only 11 on my plate, and my friend only had 9 on her plate -- BUT THE PRICE WAS STILL $14 APIECE.   I complained to the manager, and his only comment was, "I know they prepare them based on the weight."   Trust me when I tell you, none of them were any bigger than they were the other times I have ordered them.  When the bill came, no adjustment and of course, no one came to add another 2 or 3 to our plates -- THEY JUST LOST ME AS A CUSTOMER.  I am sure they are not the only place in the neighborhood/FQ that offer crab claws.  I DON'T LIKE BEING TAKEN ADVANTAGE OF.

Get the Jambalaya and ask for what ever the sauce is they use for the crab claw appetizer.  I would eat a shoe with that sauce on it.  Don't let them take it away! Ask for bread and soak it up until dry.  Then order more of that sauce! The taste of New Orleans was great but the gumbo was too salty.  

Sit at the bar and watch the professional oyster shucker do his work.  It is mesmerizing.  Dinner on the balcony was cool but the flowers smell strong and your seat and table lean.  Also the sax guy on the corner is terrible and you will want to eat inside.

Our server John smith made the night. He was amusing and add some flair for sure. The Draw backs were vast! We Had to ask for water. We Had to ask for silverware. The appetizers sauces were served in plastic to go containers. My daughter was not elated with the salad and kids burger served with generic fries. I did not regale in the spenders of my ettoufee upon leaving the place either. I could have made a more flavorable one myself. However my wife's large piece of reddish hit home for everyone at the table who tried it. The place is nice looking and I am sure when in a bind it is ok. But would not return to many other places serving real food that work hard to make fresh stocks for the sauces. Who take the time to cut fresh fries and do not serve the side sauces in plastic containers

This was one of my favorite finds in NOLA. Conveniently located and amazing food! Just thinking about the oysters makes me start to salivate. We don't get fresh seafood like that here in Utah, so eating here was quite an experience!!

Ate lunch here. I got broiled oysters and gumbo.  Did not eat the oysters as they were precooked and dried out.  Nothing in my gumbo but rice and broth.  I know it's Mardi Gras but if they can't keep their quality up they need to change their pricing.  I paid the full bill and left a 20% tip but I was not happy!!!!!  Wish I had taken pictures!!!

Get the Jambalaya and ask for what ever the sauce is they use for the crab claw appetizer.  I would eat a shoe with that sauce on it.  Don't let them take it away! Ask for bread and soak it up until dry.  Then order more of that sauce! The taste of New Orleans was great but the gumbo was too salty.  

Sit at the bar and watch the professional oyster shucker do his work.  It is mesmerizing.  Dinner on the balcony was cool but the flowers smell strong and your seat and table lean.  Also the sax guy on the corner is terrible and you will want to eat inside.

The first time we visited Royal house was on our way down the street shopping in the middle of the afternoon and we weren't overly impressed with the bar staff who didn't notice that all we wanted was to order a cocktail. We left without ordering anything. On our way back down the street we decided to give it a second chance because my husband wanted oysters. We were immediately sat down for dinner and our waiter was awesome! He introduced himself as John Smith but we later found out his name was Danny! He was fun and kept things light when we wanted to move our seats. The oysters were fresh and shipped in hours prior. I had THE BEST French onion soup I have had in I don't know when!!! YUM!!!!! Overall we had a great experience and would recommend this restaurant!!

The Royal House is a beautiful place! Their food is like any other in the French Quarter. My favorite was their French onion soup. The service and waiting period for the food to come out unfortunately wasn't the best.
Oh my goodness you guys have the marinated crab claws! They were amazing. We sat upstairs on the patio, and had a great experience! Thanks Royal House.
Great staff! Super friendly and gave great tips about the city!! We just had drinks and appetizers which were good. Don't mind the cork...
Great food - service was a little slow as they were busy. We had etoufee, redfish Beignet's, and oysters and eggplant. Highly recommend!

Terrible food, terrible service! Came here after Barkus for an early dinner, and was disappointed to say the least. We used the yelp offer for a free appetizer and ordered the caprese tower which was just giant thick slices of tomato and thick old mozzarella. My friend ordered a half a dozen of oysters and they came on a watery bed of ice. No presentation at all. For our entrées I ordered the shrimp and grits And she had theShrimp ravioli. My shrimp was tough, the grits were not seasoned in the least, and there were hard chunks in it also. This may fool a tourist but I live in the Quarter and this dish would not have and  should not have been served anywhere! My friend said her ravioli tasted like it just came out of the microwave. The pasta was tough and the meat she said was bland at best. What a shame because I am always getting asked for food recommendations in the neighborhood and I will happily tell people to steer clear of this place! To top off our awful meals, The waitress charged us incorrectly I was charged for my friends meal which was significantly more expensive than mine and vice versa. When we told the waitress she just said oh... We then waited for a few minutes for her to come back and rectify it but she never did so we just left with our incorrect charges.

The food here seem like it had been sitting out for a while and was just reheated in the plate. The cocktails are very good but that was it. The place was loud which is good for a large group. I would not recommend the oysters.

Came to Royal House for some oysters and other good eats. We got the oyster duo, which was fantastic! Another great appetizer was the seafood stuffed mushrooms...tasty! Taste of New Orleans and Shrimp Tortellini did not disappoint either.  Food was great but what we enjoyed most was our waitress, Jordan! A true gem, beautiful and funny!  Her manager even jumped in the photo for a photobomb. Great food, great people!

Our waitress Tierra was COMPLETELY unprofessional! The first thing I noticed was her super long hot pink nails UNPROFESSIONAL ESPECIALLY WHEN DEALING WITH FOOD... we ordered Frech75s and was asked "what kind of Vodka?" when the drink is only made with Gin or Cognac after letting her know SHE STILL BROUGHT US FRENCH75s with vodka--my friend ordered a drink and didn't get it until 15 later... now the food comes someone in my party ordered a shrimp po boy & got a gator po boy instead, when he told the server she tells him "my bad they brought you the wrong food" like what??? SHE NEVER BROUGHT HIM HIS SHRIMP PO BOY or even inquired about it....at the end she took the po boy and threw it away knowing HE DID NOT TOUCH IT! Then when we got had the NURVE to charge him for a shrimp po boy AND CHARGED US VODKA SHOTS oh no maim! When I'm talking to the manager she walks up and ask if I had a problem?" I said I'm not talking to you" she says let me go before I slap her like omg I WOULD NEVERRRRRRRRR EAT HERE

Not bad. Good pasta dish but lots of shells so be careful! Decent service enjoyable atmosphere. I'd come back. Pricey drinks but how often do I get to this coast? Not often so splurge. $85 plus tip for two people for dinner and drinks.

We had the absolute worst service and food on our entire trip.  It took longer to revive a glass of water than to have our burnt broiled oysters delivered to our table.  This is an overrated tourist trap of a restaurant, don't waste your time.

Before I even review... John O, if you're reading this this is for you. Can't wait to come back to NOLA and stop by just to say hello and give you that hug I really wanted to give you Monday. Thank you so much. You made my Birthday truly truly exceptional. 

Ok, so we came here. As everyone says the crab claws are v tasty. Tbh make me a bowl full and I could munch on those all day  the sauce was delicious and they take most of the shell off so easy tho pluck and eat. 

My friend got gumbo which she liked. I got the rib eye. The first attempt was really not good...I'm a patient person, maybe too much so. This was t he first time in my life I've sent food back. But what was great is our waiter (John or at least that's what the receipt said) knew. He gave me my food and specifically said, I will return after you cut to see what you think. Cause he knew it wasn't what I asked for. So he took it back and I swear a totally different person had to have made it. Lol it came back perfect and was delicious. Plenty of buttery-ness if you're into that. You don't get a lot of crab meat if you add that FYI. 

The five stars is honestly mostly for our waiter. He is wild and will chat you up. He comp'd the steak and ended up bringing me the pecan pie (very good and different from your typical) for my birthday dessert, also free. He also got this random table of me to sing me happy birthday. 

For me, it was a five star experience. I would go back for lunch to see John and have a drink with those crab claws.

We came in on a Sunday night, fully expecting to wait for a table. We were quoted a 45 min - 1 hour wait. We ended up being sat within 20 minutes. We were sat upstairs, right by the balcony. It gave us a great spot to people watch.

We ordered 12 oysters on the half shell - delicious. 

Seafood Pescatore pasta - we shared this dish among 3 people. OMG, so delicious.The scallops were cooked perfectly and were tender. The mussels were amazing. I don't normally enjoy mussels, but these were heavenly. 

Chicken & Andouille Gumbo - shared, again. The gumbo was delicious and had a rich, smoky flavor. 

Fried Fish Platter - can't go wrong with catfish in NOLA. Fried to perfection, paired perfectly with hush puppies.
Loved Cindy  the bartender she was great!! The food was amazing my favorites were the oysters and her special Pim's Cup Soo Good

After our lunch plans didn't pan out as we had hoped, my friends and I were incredibly hungry when we arrived back into the French Quarter after a 6-hour tour out to the bayou. We ended up at Royal House based on proximity and didn't really know what to expect,  but I was perfectly content with it. After ordering a hot tea and deciding on the spinach dip as an appetizer for the table (free appetizer with a Yelp check-in!), I perused the menu and had trouble deciding as there were a couple things I really wanted to try. I finally opted for the Roast Beef Po-Boy: Tender debris roasted beef smothered in a brown gravy with a side of French fries.
 
There was entirely too much to eat, even considering the fact that it was 5:00pm and it was my first meal of the day, but it was pretty tasty. The roast beef was cooked well, with no fatty pieces and the gravy had a rich home-style flavor. I do wish that all of the sandwich ingredients had been listed on the menu because I bit into a pickle and that about made me start gagging. I absolutely detest pickles and it is not an item I'd expect on a hot roast beef sandwich. Luckily, there were so many other ingredients and only a few pickle slices, so I was able to pick them off before their nasty juices saturated my bread. The fries were fine but could have done with more seasoning. I used the excess gravy from the Po-Boy to dip them in, but on their own, they were a bit bland.
 
Prices were a little steep in my opinion, but likely on par with the rest of the French Quarter. The restaurant itself was very unique with intricate wood detailing throughout. Although it was a bit small, at least on the side we were sitting, the tables were positioned so that we didn't feel crammed. Also, our waiter was extremely friendly and smiley, which along with the food, brought us out of our hangry attitudes!

Chargrilled oysters!!! Seriously, why is this not a thing in the Northeast?! So so good! We had dinner here on our first night in town and was more than satisfied with the seafood and the drinks. The spot is great for people watching too. Service at the bar was solid!

Royal house was absolutely astonishing. The servers are super nice and friendly and the food was to die for!I couldn't get enough I also had the stuff mushrooms as an appetizer and almost ordered another round it was so good. I and up getting the egg plant oyster pasta and had to take some home with me it was the best thing I've had in New Orleans so far!

4 stars for the taste of the crawfish ravioli and the ambiance is an authentic French Quarter cafe type dining experience. As far as the price goes that's another story. Quite pricey even for the Quarter $24 for 5 standard sized ravioli. Fast friendly service, casual attire, and a good location.

Our server Becky with the good hair was great! She was super friendly and made great recommendations. We also had great seats to see the outdoor life!! We had the alligator appetizer, new orleans sampler and fried oyster platter!! We recommend it and will be back!!
True taste of Nola. Get the dark and stormy to kick things off. Real Nola feel to it and the food is great. They have a sampler in case you can't make up your mind

This was our "classy" night out in Nola and we chose this for dinner on a Friday night. It was amazing! Our server whoever he was "John Doe" as he called himself, was quite the hilarious trip! He was so sure about his knowledge of the menu and we took his advice on everything, even the bottle of wine! 
We ordered the CRAB CLAWS as an appetizer which were AMAZING!!! You must get those if you get an appetizer because that sauce!!...
For dinner we ordered the BAKED SHRIMP TORTELLINI. Oh my, it was my favorite dish in Nola I had the whole trip. Again, recommended by our server. We also ordered the CRAWFISH ETOUFFEE which we really enjoyed, however we had etouffee elsewhere that we enjoyed more. 
For dessert we had the BANANAS FOSTER. That sealed the deal for us. As a NOLA originated dessert, you have to order bananas foster while here, but this one was BOMB.
Shout out to this great dinner on our last night in the city and to our John Doe, may he forever make his tables cry with laughter!
I like Jambalaya and crawfish rice. First time ever tried. The resturant is at the corner and many people will come in and have meals.

We had a great time for Mardi Gras brunch here.  We ate at the bar and the staff were fantastic.  Cindy was incredibly friendly and that gal knows how to make a drink. Christine and Leroy were great. Helpful and made the whole experience better. We had just plain oysters. Great cocktail sauce.  The grilled oysters were a treat.  Excellent butter and cheese sauce.  The staff make a restraint/bar and these guys were amazing.

Place was great. The manager and staff were all friendly. Had the chargrilled oysters and alligator bites. Was pretty dang good... the only reason I gave a 4 star which is minor but the upstairs bathroom was challenging. , super tiny stall .
Jambalaya dry, no flavor. Chargrilled oysters decent, andouille decent. Service excellent!
Food is great very delicious!! But our service was very poor the wait time was too much and our server was horrible she was very nasty if I recommend the food yes but be ready for the poor service

This was BY FAR the best place my mother and I had the pleasure of dining at for our stay in New Orleans for Marti Gras. Our waiter by the name of John Smith as he jokingly told us was incredibly kind and very tentative. I loved his sense of humor and his eagerness to make sure we had everything we wanted. The food was absolutely fantastic. I had the crawfish ravioli and the St. Louis Slaw which was probably the best coleslaw I've ever had in my life. My mother got the Mahi and she was blown away. If I ever visit New Orleans again, I will be sure to return to this amazing place!

Sucks.... I received an undercooked steak and no wait staff inquired about my satisfaction with the meal. Avoid.
PS....someone on staff decided to add a tip to the bill after I paid by credit card. I don't tip bad service and did not authorize any addition to the bill. I have contacted management and will update when it is resolved. Be warned.
Stopped in for some raw oysters and artichoke dip from a locals recommendation.Prices were very reasonable for location.   Was not crowded. It was OK.

I didn't want a full meal here because I knew that I had big plans for dinner and it was already close to 5 pm but I did need a snack after finishing a five hour plantation and swamp tour without a full meal. I settled on a side of garlic mashed potatoes and I must say that they are among the best mashed potatoes that I've ever tried. Be warned, there is a slight kick to them but the heat was easily subdued with a glass of water and the flavor was incredible! My only complaint is that the amount was rather small for the price. At $6 for just potatoes, which are a notoriously cheap food, the quantity could have easily been doubled. The small cup was barely enough to fully enjoy and it left me wanting a second helping.

Stopped in on the day after Fat Tuesday because the line at Oceana Grille was just too ridiculous. Got seated upstairs and , after a bit of confusion from the wait staff, chose a table on the balcony overlooking St. Louis. The atmosphere was amazing and the staff was very friendly. I ordered the Fried Gator which was pretty tasty , but definitely a smaller serving for the cost of a entree. Our drinks were pretty tasty and a nice contrast to the grain-liquor laden slushes of Bourbon St. The shrimp PoBoy we ordered , sadly, had no flavor and the shrimp tasted a bit like Walmart thaw-and-eat shrimp. We also ordered the Taste of New Orleans which included Jambalaya, Gumbo, and Shrimp Etoufee . Although this sampler of classic Louisiana cuisine was tasty, It didn't really wow me in comparison to having some of these same dishes outside of Louisiana. We finished our meal with the Bananas Foster Cheesecake. I enjoyed the overall taste of the dessert. It took a little while, but that's to be expected during the lunch rush. Overall, I will be back to Royal House to sample more fare, But I hope my next visit will be a little bit better.

Service was very slow and poor. No refills, no silver, no napkins, entrees took about 90 minutes despite not being busy. Mid rare ribeye arrived will done, all entrees were cool. Nothing was seasoned.  price to quality rato was way off. No idea how this place has four stars. Two stars since we did eat and not get sick.

Royal House is a personal favorite of mine. This is always the first place I suggest friends go to when visiting. The prices are higher than average, but the location definitely makes up for it.  It is a couple mins walking distance from many major tourist destinations, such as Jackson Square, Bourbon Street, and Canal Street. 
Do not drive to this location, there is no designated parking there or nearby. 

RH has one of my favorite plates ever: Redfish Beignets. I asked my waitress which meal surprises people with how good it is, and she recommended that plate. She was correct, it sounded awful, but is amazing! I also like to get raw oysters here BUT they are more expensive than average, around 1.50 per oyster. It is loud and cramped but spacious enough to maintain a private conversation at your own table. This is a good place to go to as a tourist, as it has most plates that have made New Orleans famous, such as gumbo and banana pudding. Highly recommend!

This was by far our favorite restaurant we ate at in NOLA. We had the greatest time. Our server/bartender/new friend Cindy was the biggest help in suggesting drink and lunch menu options. She ensured that everything would taste great and compliment each other. Her selections did not disappoint. We had amazing Crab Claws and Char-Grilled Oysters with crab meat on top (Cindy's suggestion) as appetizers. Out entrees included the Seafood Pescatore with scampi sauce (again a Cindy suggestion) and the Crawfish Ravioli which were to die for!
Excellent Bloody Mary!  Not too spicy for me. Robert was an awesome server!!  Great jokes and amazing service. Food was excellent also. Favorite was the chargrilled oysters!

What an amazing experience! Had just landed into NOLA and was definitely hungry, and somehow found myself into the Royal House.  Oh my goodness, best place to stumble into! From the service (the amazing Tiara) to the food.  I was recommended the fried oyster sampler (it's perfect for you if you run a little indecisive like me, and I had no idea which one was the best) -- it all tasted amazing! The fried crisp charcoaled grilled oysters is the perfect remedy to ANY day in New Orleans! The acid from the lemon makes the oysters sizzle and pop as you slurp them up! Also ordered the crab claws, it was perfection to every bite. A burst of Cajun flavor, with the sweetly toasted bread slices. This place is a must visit!

This place is a must visit restaurant in New Orleans. Very cute authentic French Quarter restaurant. The charbroiled oysters are the best I've ever had. I'm a seafood fanatic from Maryland (Home of the best seafood in the country) and this place is definitely in my top 5 for crab legs! The service is really good too! The entire staff was very attentive and polite from the time we entered the door until we left! We went to quite a few restaurants in New Orleans and all had pretty bad service so this place was a pleasant surprise! I highly recommend stopping here before you leave New Orleans!

Great spot with a decent sized group. Their ravioli was a group favorite however their redfish was on point too. Our server was super entertaining and had great recommendations.  We got lucky walking away from
Bourbon street and finding this!

Sucks.... I received an undercooked steak and no wait staff inquired about my satisfaction with the meal. 
I'm happy to update that management has corrected my charge. Thanks
Good food, friendly wait staff and a great view from the balcony.  I had the chargrilled oysters and my wife had the peel and eat shrimp.  We'll be back!

The chicken & eggplant Parmesan was to die for and my mimosa was the best I had during my trip to New Orleans. So good! Friendly wait staff and cool atmosphere, too. No wait time when I visited and convenient location in the French Quarter.

The chargrilled oysters are absolutely delicious there. We had a favorite spot, but it has now been replaced by Royal House. As a matter of fact, we went back 2 nights in a row just for the oysters. I also ordered a taste plate, which had samplers of the typical New Orleans food. Honestly, it was not the best in the area but it was still good. The service was fast and friendly even though we were there during Mardi Gras. We will definitely be back for the oysters on our next visit.

Great food good prices and a wonderful waitress ... i loved  the fried alligator bites. Even my fiance who was hesitant to try them kept going back for more.  Fried oyster po boy was filled with beautifully fried oysters.

Eats up food lovers! Today we explored the French Quarter area of New Orleans. We stumbled upon a quaint, vintage Terrace with live music out front and were Tempted to indulge. While waiting for our table, our bartender Leroy did a wonderful job at making a great drink and a great time. Tina, our server made wonderful suggestions for a phenomenal meal. The Chargrilled Oysters were a fan favorite among our group of 7. Overall wonderful. Recommend for all visiting.

I was looking for seafood and didn't want to wait an eternity in line. So we deviated away from bourbon street and found this place. We started with the redfish beignets and the charbroiled oysters.  Both were fantastic. The red fish beignets will seem strange but I promise it works. They come in a hostsauce/syrup sauce. Order them. They're lovely. For the main I had the NOLA trio. It was nice to try the 3 seeming staples of the area. The standout was the crawfish etouffee. Can't go wrong. But, other places in NOLA had better etouffee. The service at this place was lackluster and they seemed understaffed. The upstairs is nice because the windows can be opened but given all the hard surfaces...it was a little loud. Overall, I would come for apps. They were great. The entree I had was just okay considering the surrounding restaurants.

Great food, service and atmosphere.  We were looking for a good cajun meal during Mardi Gras without the crowds of Bourbon St.  A few blocks up we found Royal House.  It is located on the corner of a older building and had warming charm and character. It was the Sunday before Mardi Gras and we were able to get seated right away with a table in the bar area.  Our waiter greeted us shortly after and gave us a great rundown on favorite cocktails and dishes of his.  At this point I was hurricaned out so I opted for a Blue Moon.  

We started with their famous crab claws which were amazing!  The sauce they come in is heaven and I wish I could just have a cup of it by itself.  I got the crab pasta as my entree and my husband got the baked shrimp tortellini.  Both were very tasty and a perfect portion.  My entree was a pasta dish with fried oysters on top, which was what made the dish delicious and stand out from others.  The tortellini was melt in your mouth and the sauce was yummy!  I would def come back for another great meal or to grab some oysters and cocktails at their bar.

Great experience..twice.   We had lunch and went back for dinner the same day.   It was that good.  We highly recommend the crab claws as a starter.   

Tessa was our server for both meals...and made us feel at home.  Perfect service.  Thank you very much for a memorable day.

Really good atmosphere and exceptional service. I've been to a few restaurants here in New Orleans  and haven't had the best service. We had the kindest server and the host was so sweet as well. Dinner was amazing and full of flavor.  Great portions and fun environment. The restrooms were clean and though I didn't have my son with me I feel this could also be a great location for dinner with the family. Over all great experience.

Maybe my expectations were too high but I got the shrimp platte which took forever to get and when I did the shrimp were tasteless and cold .. also the plate was mostly fried with a small Bread roll cut in half as a filler .. yes a bread roll.

Was recommended to eat here by a friend...still wondering why. We sat outside, it took 20 minutes for us to get our waters. Then, about an hour for our food to come. Not sure what happened there. Finally got my shrimp creole, and I'm not kidding, it's like a kids portion. My husbands shrimp and grits were cold. Worst food experience in NOLA. Now we're off to find a second dinner because we are still hungry. Keep in mind that I'm 130 lbs and 25 years old. Not like I have an abnormal appetite. Never again.

The service was awful and the food was mediocre. We waited at our table for 15mins before being greeted by someone who acknowledged that they were not a server but wanted to help out because of the wait. The food took a very long time to come out which would have been ok if it tasted good. The crawfish pasta had a fishy taste to it which tells me the crawfish wasnt fresh. And my husband was not happy with the taste or portion of his shrimp creole. We were in the area visiting and were disappointed because we wanted a true taste of New Orleans

We just got to town, wandered down Bourbon st and settled in at one of Cindy's bar stools. She set our trip off perfectly. Warm, hospitable, entertaining, made us feel at home and got us ready to start this trip off right. 

Would recommend everyone to ask for her by name!

This place has great food. I got oysters (of course) and I also got the crayfish etoufee. Both are outstanding. The crayfish etoufee was one of the best I have ever had and they even top it with deep fried crayfish as well. I am giving 4 stars for a couple reasons. Reason number one is that they do not have the biggest oysters in town, granted they taste great you can get bigger tastier ones. And also my last time there (I've been a few times) my waitress seemed preoccupied and came to the table maybe 3 total times. One to order one to drop off food and one final time to bring the check. We never got our drinks refilled and it was so slammed our oysters came out with our food and they have relatively small tables.
One of our most favorite places in NOLA!!! The awesome sauce is the. Eat. My son loved it! Oysters were delish. Crab claw with awesome sauce is to die for!

I wish I could leave a review of my meal, but after an hour, I still haven't gotten it. My friend ordered chicken Caesar salad with chicken that somehow was rubbery yet hard on the ends. Of all the tables, only 8 had some type of food (oysters, appetizer or meal). Update: the waiter & I had a "miscommunication" about my meal (I ordered an entree without rice), so I got nothing instead. Truly terrible experience. The manager comped my friend's meal and said it was an unusual night. In New Orleans' French Quarter? (I thought all the nights were unusual there.) Maybe it was an unusual night for them, but since it was my only night there, I will never know.

Great food and staff! 

Gator is great and oysters are better.

We came when it was quite busy but they got us in right away. The food was quick and the drink/bottle prices were awesome
Fried alligator is a must. Taste of New Orleans was just what I was looking for. Sat on the balcony and loved the experience.

We stopped in for lunch at Royal House and got a great table in the window. The service was awesome! From the hostesses, wait staff and bar staff, our needs were met. We ordered the shrimp and Gouda grits, Charbroiled Oysters and kids burgers. All of our meals were delicious! The Gouda grits were AMAZING and the Oysters were perfectly seasoned. We thought this restaurant was charming and the perfect afternoon stop for our family.
Service was decent and food was just as decent. Got the gumbo and jambalaya but they weren't as impressive as Gumbo shop just down the street.

What a huge disappointment. After waiting 45 min for food, we found out that everything was frozen. Nothing fresh here. One of the worst meals I've ever had. Food was cold... ugh I'm annoyed as I type this. Thank you, next

I give this review with the disclaimer that I realize my group went on a super busy day, Red Dress Run and we were not decked out in our red dresses. 

The server was fine enough except I had to get up to ask for water. The support staff that brought out the food were almost tossing the plates on the table. When I tapped one of them trying to ask for hot sauce (it was really loud) he gave me a look of "why are you touching me?" and just nodded his head. 

The food was good but not great. I had higher hopes and am hoping they were just so busy the kitchen staff was over worked. My shrimp and grits were lukewarm and the salad had waaaayyy too much dressing. 

Would I try it again? Yes, because clearly there have been better experiences so maybe this was just a bad day. I post in hopes someone reads it and helps the staff find joy in every moment and not take their bad day out on the customer.

Ordered crab claws and fried gator. 
Drink was meh.
Not impressed. 

Staff is absolutely wonderful. 

Price is a bit ridiculous but I suppose it's tourist pricing. 

Would not come back nor recommend bottom line.
Amazing seafood. We had seafood pescatore with white sauce, blackened red fish and blackened shrimp. They were out of this world. This is coming from someone who grew with seafood.

We were told it was going to be about a 30 minute wait, so we got a drink at the bar and went back outside to wait. It was probably 10 minutes later and a table was ready, so we were seated very quickly! And the staff was extra friendly. All the food was GREAT! The star of the show for us were the crab claws that came with the best sauce (we were all dunking our bread in the sauce it was so good).

I loved the alligator appetizer! I've never tried alligator before so I wasn't sure what to expect. My shrimp creole was delicious as was my husbands seafood pasta. The service was excellent! Super friendly and very helpful with menu suggestions. I would definitely recommend it!

Disappointed, we wanted to try different restaurants during are stay and sadly after a good run we were not happy with Royal. We went, as told by a waitress, during their staff changing which cause us to sit for over 10 mins with not even a hello. The food continued the trend... it all came out warm. The only thing I would recommend would be the French onion soup. Sadly the best thing about the restaurant was catching a wedding party walking through the streets outside.
On our morning stop to taste we hit Royal House. Compared to last nights disaster..full review tonight!

This place has the best oysters in New Orleans!  And the staff is super-friendly and helpful!  Sit at the oyster bar if you can -- Cindy will take the best care of you!  Try the crawfish etouffee -- totally awesome!  Great gumbo, of course... but the oysters -- OMG!  Don't walk there -- RUN!

Two stars- one for the server Tina and one for the ambiance. Everything else sucked. 3 years ago I came here and had the best experience. It was truly magical. We sat on the balcony and enjoyed chargrilled oysters and gulf fish. Tina was our server and she embodied southern hospitality. Everything was perfect! That was in 2016. So when I came back to New Orleans last week for spring break 2019, I decided to bring my guest to Royal House. The balcony was closed, which was disappointing but we decided to stay. Tina was our server again and I was excited about that. The chargrilled oysters were as good as I remember, but there was one big one that was slimy & undercooked so I spat it out into my napkin. When the fried gulf fish entree came, i picked up a piece and it fell apart. the inside was a slimy, undercooked mess. All of them were that way. I told Tina and she had the manager take it off the bill. The cook dropped the ball, and I can say with certainty that unfortunately, Royal House will be avoided on my future visits to New Orleans.
Gorgeous place with amazing seafood! Need to go here again. Got the oysters and it was delicious. Tasted great and just the right temperature.

The best grilled shrimp with friend green tomato poboy I ever had.   It was really the BEST poboy I have ever tasted and I am a foodie.  Its a small place you can see straight into the kitchen, but I knew it had to be good when I saw some of the locals in their.  and boy was I right!

I tried the crab claws appetizer and it was absolutely to die for! The sauce was very rich and tasty. As an entree we had the crawfish ravioli and another delicious sauce with big pieces of crab and crawfish. Would highly recommend for some authentic New Orleans cuisine. Desean gave us great service, and suggested great menu items. :)

One of the better places that we tried. The upstairs is adorable. Alligator bites were delicious. Also had the jambalaya with blackened shrimp, it was good, not amazing. My husband got the peel and eat shrimp boil. The shrimp were some of the best I've ever had.

Super yummy!! We arrived in the French Quarter in search of a light dinner not too far from our hotel (Royal Sonesta) & were SO happy that we stumbled upon the Royal House right around the corner. My son got the appetizer fried gator & I got the crab claw appetizer, & both were delicious. Next evening we tried Oceana (it was just ok-good portions- taste is so so)... but decided to go back to the Royal House another evening. We both got the Ribeye & Chargrilled Oysters. So yummy!!!  
Each time we were amazed how a line formed even though we were seated immediately.  It's all in the timing. Suggest that you arrive before 6:00 to avoid a wait.  Staff is friendly  & prices are very reasonable. We are fans!  
Also Cafe Beignet is like 2 mins down the street if you want dessert afterwards.

Bloody Mary was good, but that was about it. The service is slow and the seafood tastes subpar. I ordered the Rockefeller oysters, they were large, but they just cover them in garlic and Parmesan to cover bad quality. I also, ordered the fried alligator - complete waste of money. Lastly, we ordered the seafood pasta and again, the seafood was not good quality. The garlic butter sauce was okay, probably salvaged the dish.

Overall food was okay but not worth the price. Experiment overall was less than I expected. 

So I usually look a place, if it's less that 4 stars I'm probably not going there for dinner. If it's 4 stars I'll give it shot. And if my experience was less than what I would expect I rate it lower and if it's better I rate it higher.

So my wife and I got to this place pretty late probably 9:30. The hostess quoted us for 15 mins so we waited. After about 10 she asked if we would mind sitting at the bar. My wife doesn't really drink so the bar isn't usually our go to for dining but since it was getting late, we went for it. Usually at a bar service is quicker since the bartender is right there and isn't hopping around to tables. The bartender immediately asks for our IDs but wasn't very courteous about it, he said it almost like he didn't think we were of drinking age and he expected that he would turn us away. We both are of age but we look younger so I wasn't surprised he asked just was expecting a little southern charm in the Big Easy and never really got that. On that same note, a guy and his son later sat down at the bar, the rest of their family, 4 women sat behind them, in assuming because they couldn't seat them all together. And the guy gave them the same speil about "having a valid ID" which the kid who was probably 13 clearly didn't... then the bartender went on to explain that you have to be over 21 to sit at the bar. I'm not from LA but I'm pretty sure that, that is not the law and I know most states have exceptions for consuming alcohol if you are with a parent/guardian anyway. Doesn't really matter I guess the restaurant can do whatever they want but the bartender later complained to other patrons about how people should have their IDs. 

The bartender was also shucking oysters when the entire time we were there. Typically that's something done in the kitchen or at least at a back work station. Sounds petty, I don't have an aversion to it and it didn't ruin my meal but if your going to charge 20 dollars for shrimp and grits that I could have made in my microwave and 12 for a cocktail, don't shuck your oysters at the bar and then barely wash your hands before you handle everything that you touch. Also my wife ordered a coke when I ordered my cocktail, again we are at the bar, I could have reached over and sprayed the damn thing into a glass myself if there was a glass close enough, but I had to ask the guy a second time to get her what she already ordered, this is after they had to outsource my drink. I pretty sure the guy said at one point, "we are waiting on the whiskey", which I was confused about what that meant. Either way he definitely didn't make it, I think the other bartender did, and that way about 10 mins after I ordered it. 

Spinach dip was good but that's pretty simple honestly and hard to mess up. The shrimp and grits weren't bad as far as taste. I live along the gulf coast and I've had my share of shrimp and grits, so I was expecting large sized fresh shrimp but instead it seemed like frozen ones out of a bag tossed in sauce over 3 scoops of grits. And yes I could tell that they were scooped out of a larger dish; they were like 3 little mounds of grits. I don't think they were cheese grits either. Also the bowl that it came in was hotter than the actual meal, so they obviously warmed it up. Again it was edible but certainly not worth 20 dollars. 

I think a lot of places in New Orleans rely on tourism and overprice their items accordingly. This is definitely one of those places.

We enjoy outdoor seating when the weather is nice. We go lucky with our last day being sunny and beautiful. We went here for dinner. The outdoor seating area does lean the table considerably but surprisingly did not effect our dining experience significantly including drinks not spilling so don't let that sway you. The dish I ordered was the best I had in New Orleans including "finer" dining establishments. I ordered the ravioli and it was delicious. Would recommend going there and sitting outside if the weather is nice. We also had the brownie ice cream dessert which was also delicious.
Solid food but definitely better seafood restaurants in New Orleans.  However, if you're in the area the waitstaff was nice and service was pretty quick.
We had the most wonderful time, Chentell was just the best! Lunch on the veranda with street jazz and a life long memory. Portions were generous,  taste was outstanding.

You'd expect better based on the line. Was told 25 min wait for 2. After waiting 5 mins a table was ready. 
Was told multiple times the kitchen was not having a good day once seated. App never came so as dinners arrived we let server know. He brought it after I finished dinner.
Food was good, service decent, just not overall all impressed.
We had brunch here and I must say that it's pretty good! Our waiter was very friendly and the staff was very hospitable.

I stumbled upon this place and was hoping for good food and drinks. 

The staff were incredibly nice and I loved the atmosphere. 

However, the food wasn't good and prices were high. 

I had the stuffed mushrooms and etouffee. Both were not good. 

I wouldn't come back, but feel bad bc everyone was  so nice :(

I really wanted things to go better for Royal House. I visited this restaurant on my last night in New Orleans and I wish I would've picked something else. The noise level was pretty loud, but given the restaurant size it was understandable. Our waitress was the downfall of the evening. She came over to start us off with drinks and when I requested the Espresso Martini she adamantly warned me not to get it, that no one orders it, and if someone does it usually gets sent back. She made a different cocktail recommendation that was all fruit juice and melon liquer which turned out to be a total miss. Beyond this initial back and forth, she never came to check on our table. The appetizer we ordered (spinach dip) didnt arrive for more than 25 minutes as other tables around us received apps, drinks, and even entrees. Finally the appetizer arrived and  we were slightly relieved. When the food finally arrived after another long stint of waiting and wondering where she had gone we took the opportunity to request our checks and were finally able to get back to the hotel after a 2 hour dinner.

On our morning stop to start our whirlwind of tasting through New Orleans, we hit Royal House.  Compared to my first nights disaster elsewhere, we were treated to our first real chargrilled oysters that seemed to be something special. I left this review sit for 6 days to compare all the other places I had oysters at and I must say this is my #1 pick for the chargrilled oyster.

Compared to other places who use shredded Parmesan, I found these to be the best with FINELY GRATED Parmesan on top of a garlic butter bathed oyster. You could see the oyster clearly with that nice mound of finely grated and melted Parmesan on top. It wasn't buried under a thick blanket of cheese where all you tasted was cheese.

All the flavors together worked well including the clean taste of the oyster and most importantly no grit in your oyster. Nothing ruins a great oyster experience more than taking in that oyster and then CRUNCH...CRACK, and you are left starring at the person across from you wondering "should I spit it out, try to take it out gracefully between my fingers and leave the good part, or just pick up my napkin for the full KAPOOEY in the napkin experience."

Thankfully, it was all oyster goodness.  
On top of having great oysters they infuse their own vodka and make their own Bloody Mary mix. I had one with my oysters being it was 11 O'Mary in New Orleans. I was really impressed at how good it tasted along with the various garnishes. Clearly making your own mix fresh and using vodka from your own infuser makes a huge difference (as it should).
