My vote for the best chargrilled oysters out of half a  dozen other places tasted during my visit. I am sure there are others out there in this town of oysters but this is a sure bet on the list.

Conveniently on Royal Street you can't miss the signs on the corner of Royal and St. Louis.

5 stars

Starting off with the visit , they got us in quickly on what appeared to be a busy night - 5 min within taking our name down. We had some minor issues with our waitress submitting our order incorrectly but it all worked out. We had some chargrilled oysters , raw oysters, and fried alligator. The char grilled oysters were tasty, however I prefer raw oysters. The raw oysters were great ! The fried alligator was very light and tasted great. To finish off I had a po boy with fried fish and it was very tasty ! Very fresh ! My wife had a fried oyster po boy and hers was real good too. Overall it was a nice place to eat, nice to get off of loud and busy bourbon street.
Expect to wait a long time for diner on the weekends, no call ahead reservations. Food was ok, portions were kind of small but overall a good place to try

Check in to get a free appetizer with entree purchase! In the French Quarter, I'm glad we got to be on the second floor to look down and people watch rather than the first floor and be in the mix of the bustling streets. The second floor is really picturesque and they have hanging flowers and the cast iron on the buildings really stands out.The food is good. My crawfish ravioli was satisfying but I thought it was going to be a little more special. I liked the spinach dip. And the staff was friendly and down to earth. We came here because my husband googled the "the best shrimp and grits in New Orleans", originally I was going to give this 3 stars because I hated them. But my husband enjoyed his food and I realized different southern states in the Mississippi delta clearly do and see shrimp and grits differently. I'm not a fan of this restaurant's interpretation. The grits were scooped on to the plate like mashed potatoes instead of being creamy they were thick and chunky. The sauce was more tangy than I'd like and had a sweet aftertaste that I didn't like at all. So decide for yourself, but I'm definitely an Alabama shrimp and grits girl. Or at least the title of "best shrimp and grits" needs to be re-evaluated ASAP.

Don't recommend. Mostly over priced bar food. Oysters are good but you can get those anywhere. Spinach artichoke dip isn't good and I'm not sure how the bread pudding made any best list--I didn't even finish because it wasn't good.

Got seated right away so we thought it was a good sign. Then we continued to sit for 20 minutes without anyone coming to our table, not even to take a drink order. We tried flagging any staff but got awkward look aways. Walked out without any acknowledgement.

You know, I was really excited and wanted to like this place, but I just had the worst experience. Let's get started.

As we are getting seated by the host, they offered us a seat outside of the restaurant. Sounds cool. Great ambiance, music in the streets. 10 minutes passed, no waiter. 20 minutes later, still no waiter so we decided to walk into the bar to find some service. Decided to sit at the bar and was greeted by Jessica M.

So, Jessica M. She must've had a really long day of work at the bar. She was rude, mean and made us feel as if requesting for extra ketchup or hot sauce was a burden. She slams the kitchen door next to us after receiving our request and gives a big sigh.  After dinner  was done, I mentioned the yelp review and she was so upset. She slammed the door once again, in an effort to look for the manager. Once the bill was ran, she again slammed the check, upset because she was unable to find a pen.

Now, the food. We ordered crab claws. They came out cold and was plated with 5 claws. For 13.50 and 5 small crab claws? Ridiculous. Crawfish ravioli. Again, cold.  Barely any sauce and ravioli hard and dry. Shrimp po boy was okay. Charbroiled oysters can't go wrong. 

Overall, I was very excited to come here. I'm not from here and received lots of recommendations, but this place failed. They went above and beyond to successfully fail.

Came here late, around 9 pm for a quick bite. Got extremely lucky in that, they had one table left inside, so they offered us a balcony table!! We were able to enjoy the views, a marriage renewal parade and eat good food! My friend and I ordered the seafood platter. It was decent enough. They say it comes with hushpuppies, coleslaw and starter sauce, etc. Hushpuppies were 2 in number. The coleslaw and other sauces were in those takeaway small plastic bowls. The shrimp was good. The French fries ok. Looking at the place, I expected higher standards. 
So overall, it is a 3, but the extra star is for our table, the views and the parade.
Amazing service & food!! Our waitress was funny, and knowledgeable. We had an amazing experience.
Good tasting food and great service. We enjoyed the jambalaya and and redfish. We started with the Oysters Duo and stuffed mushrooms, which were great! Great conclusion to our trip to NOLA!

In a city that prides itself on cuisine, the Royal House fell short for me. In nearly any other city this would at least be a 3 star but given it's location, it's no more than 2. I wouldn't recommend this restaurant with so many other great options available. The food and service weren't bad but it was definitely lacking any sort of wow factor. We started with the charbroiled oysters, which were underwhelming. The garlic butter was good but they weren't cooked long enough. For dinner I had the Taste of New Orleans which was a sampler of the Jambalaya, Étouffée, and the Gumbo. Out of the three my favorite was the Étouffée. The jambalaya and the gumbo were 'meh'. Great location and great ambiance but the food was lackluster for me.

Great fresh Raw Oysters and cold beer!  Perfect location to see the quarter in action. Recommend for a pre dinner stop for a beer and oysters more than dinner. Location is great and atmosphere perfect. Service was very good. Dinner entrees were 3.5. Could have been five stars if dinner was better. Do recommend. Just happy hour though.

The food was subpar. I ordered the Shrimp tortellini, and my girlfriend ordered the mahi mahi with the shrimp sauce. The shrimp tasted extra gamey which typically implies it's frozen an/ or improperly cleaned. The side of potatoes were saturated in oil and the artichoke dip we ordered came out stone cold. When we asked for the dip to be heated, a cook came out and sullenly dropped it off at our table without saying anything...
Overpriced & overcrowded for mediocre seafood.
Very mediocre food, but our server was really nice. It's loud and crowded, with none of the quaintness of other Quarter restaurants. The four of us weren't impressed by our bland dinners.
Amazing raw oysters and the staff is out of this world! Sweet, fun, and knowledgeable. This is a place I always recommend on my tours because it's amazing.
it took literally an hour to bring the main dish on Saturday night and the taste is just ok

I didn't really understand the hype surrounding this restaurant. Got one chargrilled oyster appetizer that was really incredible. Everything else was completely mediocre. Waiter was disinterested, food was just OK.

I knew from the call to check wait times this was a good restaurant.  We were seated promptly upstairs.  Our waiter, Joe, made suggestions for the menu that were great.  We had fried shrimp and seafood pescatore.  My Carnival margarita made by Leroy, the bartender, was so really delicious and I can feel the tequila.  The manager, Shirley, was welcoming and spicy.  Great service and food.  Make sure you stop in.
The food was less than average.  Really disappointed in their Po Boy and their pecan pie.

While in NOLA attending a conference for work, our group needed a place to have dinner. It's usually difficult to get a group of people to agree on where to have dinner, especially when none of us are familiar with the area. However, I decided to take charge and select the dinner destination for us all. Royal House was the final decision and it was a good one!

Just like most of the restaurants located in the tourist areas of NOLA (french quarters, riverwalk, bourbon street, etc.) there was a line when we arrived and unfortunately they did not take reservations. So we waited for a least 30 - 45 minutes before being seated. I must say that the hosts and hostesses were really nice and kept us updated as we waited. 

Finally we were seated, the restaurant has the New Orleans, french quarter vibe and decor. Although the restaurant is not very big, they manage to utilize every square footage to its capacity. The two story restaurant has a nice bar area and balcony seating. 

Our waitress was very nice and knowledgeable of the menu. I chose to order the Seafood Pescatore, a linguine pasta with a marinara sauce, topped with clams, mussels, shrimp and scallops, seasoned in herbs and spices to perfection. It was really good!! It paired well with my glass of chardonnay. 

I think it was safe to say that everyone else enjoyed their meals as well.
Best kept secret in New Orleans. Great food, great service. I travel to NOLA 2-3 times a year for work and ALWAYS eat here. Don't ever change!

This was my favorite restaurant that I went to during my trip to New Orleans. The service was amazing, our server was so sweet and helpful. The balcony view of the French quarter was beautiful and live music playing below added to the magic. The food was worth the little bit of wait. I suggest getting the tortellini. In all, this restaurant is a must need New Orleans experience.

Great location with a wonderful view off of the balcony! The service was a bit slow, but we weren't too bothered by it because it was hard to be mad sitting on a balcony in 70 degree weather while people watching. Our fried fish platter came out hot and had a delicious mound of lightly battered Gulf fish over nicely crisped French fries. Definitely recommend for the view, but expect a bit of a wait on your food.

Great food and not too expensive! You won't break the bank for a good meal and amazing bar ! It looks so upscale, nice for a birthday dinner ! It's in the heart of the quarter so you can eat good and then go exploring. I am a hotel manager and it's my number one recommendation to my guests ! Go hear and I'm not paid to promote them ! Food is good
Alright.  Pretty darn good.  Responsive staff.  Seemingly aim to please.  Good quality food.  Actually, pretty great quality experience.  Give it a 4!
Horrible service, probably the worst service I've ever had. EXTREMELY subpar food that is also EXTREMELY overpriced. 10/10 do not recommend, spend your money elsewhere
The food was just okay. Nothing special except that my hubby loved the Chargrilled Oysters.

Came to NOLA early Friday morning searching for a place to get a drink. We were called in by some fine gentlemen from the street. Our bartender was amazing. We explained that we were not locals and he was so detailed about what to do and what not to do. 
Bloody Mary was FANTASTIC! 
Overall a wonderful experience!

This isn't my first time here, but third.  The five star rating is based on all three visits.  The quality of the food served, and eaten, all of it I might add down to wanting to lick the plates, has been excellent.  My favorites, so far, are the stuffed mushrooms and the blackened red fish.  I'm going to have to get here more often so I can try more of their offerings. 

The atmosphere jas been great and the bar service is friendly and knowledgeable.  The staff seem to be enjoying their jobs, this is not always the case in busy tourist market places.  Keep up the great work guys as I will surely be back for more.

Wow guys... this place knows how to make delicious sauces and pastas. We were seated on a Friday night around 6pm with no reservations. I got the shrimp tortellini and I want to drink this white cheesy cream sauce you absolutely need to try it! My boyfriend had the oyster eggplant pasta dish and was very satisfied, it also had a delicious blush vodka like sauce with a little kick. The oysters were fried to perfection and the eggplant tasted amazing with the sauce. The ambiance is casual but intimate and they have balcony seating. Great for date night but also a big oyster bar! The portions are manageable we were both full but not stuffed. I definitely recommend stopping by for dinner! And they honor the free appetizer with 2 entrees yelp deal!

I would never return here. Was seated immediately, however waited what seemed like forever for someone to even come and say that they would be with us in a minute and then waited much more time until we were asked for a drink order. Placed our full order then because we were so hungry at that point. App came out in decent time and was good but entrees took a very long time and were not great. Drinks were not well balanced and service wasn't good. Would not recommend.

With a plethora of options in the French quarter, do yourself a favor and skip this one! 
My friend and I came here after a weird experience at another bourbon street restaurant that we did not end up eating at. We were seated quickly, but that's where the good service ended. Once at our table, it took over 20 minutes to get anyone to acknowledge us. Once we got a waitress, we put in our entire order, worried that if we didn't, we may never get our food at the rate it was going. My friend and I both ordered a drink that was not very good but the waitress never came back upon delivering it so we didn't say anything and added Splenda and drank it. She never even asked if we wanted another drink after that... At this point it was around 9:30 pm and not busy in the restaurant. Our crab claw appetizer came out first and that was pretty good! A good amount of claws to share for 2 people and the French bread was great to dip in the sauce. Again, our waitress dropped off the food and disappeared for about 30 more minutes. Finally, we got our meals. I had jambalaya that was pretty bland and my friend ordered the crawfish ravioli which totaled about 5 ravioli that didn't look completely cooked. I had to wait about 10 minutes after my dinner came until I made eye contact with the waitress and I could ask for hot sauce. Neither of us were satisfied and didn't even get desert as we had hoped to because the menu looked awesome. We were very underwhelmed by the entrees and disappointed with the service, feeling like we were a burden to our waitress and that she could care less. Worst part - we were mis charged for our appetizer but our waitress never came back once she dropped off the bill.
The ambiance is lovely and good for groups if you want to have a conversation. We were disappointed by the food though, expecting a bit more from a higher end restaurant.

We came here on April 1 as a walk-in and we were readily accommodated. I was told the wait would be 15 minutes and my name was added to a list. I walked around the French Quarter and came back in 25 minutes to find a table ready for two. The waiter was very funny, spontaneous, and attentive. We sat near the bar, at a table next to the open windows, which was pleasant. We ordered the oyster duo (3x oysters royale, 3x oysters rockefeller), chargrilled oysters, crab claws, taste of new orleans, and raw oysters. I'd recommend all of the dishes. The wait times were very reasonable. Overall, this restaurant was excellent value, and I highly recommend it.

Walking around on Royal and needing something to eat, we walked upon this place with a awesome atmosphere.  We sat on the balcony ( beautiful scenery). 
Fried Alligator for appetizer (really flavorful).
Shrimp and grits and blackened Shrimp jambalaya.
Our waitress (Monica)  was fantastic !!!
I wish I had more time to order the oysters

The service here was very friendly and the drinks had a healthy amount of alcohol, thus the two stars. Otherwise, it would be one star. The food was not very good at all. The spinach dip was runny, and I'm pretty sure I saw corn in it. Corn is a no for me in spinach dip. The chips served with it were stale. We both ordered the crawfish étouffée, because we just wanted a bowl of it on our last night in NOLA. It was not very flavorful and the bread served with it was tough. I added a side of red beans and rice. The beans were more like mushy pinto beans. All in all, we decided the good reviews must be because the people who eat there are drunk beyond belief and wouldn't know good food if they saw it.
John Smith is the bestttttt waiter!!! The hurricanes were v good and v strong. We got the crawfish étouffée and grilled shrimp tortellini both were really good!!!
Good food, nice wine and drink list. Easy enough to get in without reservations on a Thursday night.
Amazing butter pecan pie.  John was our food service handler.  It is one of the reasons I keep coming back.  Always a treat.  Redfish was the best!!!!
This place is sooo good!! The CRAB claws and the sauce they are IS delicious!! We order shrimp , steak, and tortellini! Yummy tummy!

It was a really busy night, and it rained, so that's probably working against them- but service was so slow. Check in so you can get a free app. We really like the stuffed mushrooms. The shrimp creole was okay- not spicy at all. The shrimp and Jumbolaya (I know that's spelled wrong) was incredible. The seasoning was just right.

Worst restaurant experience I ever had in my life. We were forced (!) to move from our seats to another table with no explanation or any apologies. Not even a "please" word! The server was super nervous for some reason that we were not aware of and forgot one of the drinks completely and ignored me couple of times. Food was not good either. Overpriced and tourist trap by all means. I really don't understand good reviews for this restaurant.

Having read so many good reviews about this place, we decided to go to this restaurant. After settling down and ordering food and drinks, our server came to our table and said we're changing your table! Thay was it, and they just shifted our small plates and cutleries quickly without any explanation or even an axcuse. Being shocked by what we saw they did the same thing with other people and all of a sudden they turned to a very angry person, shifting chairs and making angry noises sweeping, slamming doors. Forgotten about our drinks they served our food after 40 minutes or so, again we asked for the drink, apparently too busy being rude and angry! Honestly I did not expect such a mess from a well known restaurant. No compaints about the food, except the small portion. Definitely not going back when visiting Nola, not a pleasant experience..

Wow guys... this place knows how to make delicious sauces and pastas. I got the shrimp tortellini and I want to drink this white cheesy cream sauce you absolutely need to try it! My boyfriend had the oyster eggplant pasta dish and was very satisfied, it also had a delicious blush vodka like sauce with a little kick. The oysters were fried to perfection and the eggplant tasted amazing with the sauce. The ambiance is casual but intimate and they have balcony seating. Great for date night but also a big oyster bar! The portions are manageable we were bith full but not stuffed. I definitely recommend stopping by for dinner! And they honor the free appetizer with 2 entrees!

https://www.instagram.com/p/BwBV45Rg6Xo/?utm_source=ig_share_sheet&igshid=s5uzwqu5cwuq
Excellent food and service!  Great recommendations for local favorites, really reasonably priced . Thanks John O from table #5!

i was super excited to have my birthday dinner here ... and an hour and some change into waiting for our food, kinda lost the enthusiasm. 

we ordered drinks and appetizers - the drinks came in about 10 minutes. 

they were out of most of the seafood for the boiler pots and the salads as well. so we ordered a caesar salad with shrimp and crab legs, only one appetizer showed up, maybe 40 minutes later with the promise "the rest of the foods coming" ... over a half hour goes by, drinks are empty and not asked if we want refills. 

more time passes and as i was using the bathroom dinner was dropped at the table and we were told the kitchen lost the ticket. 

my brother in laws steak was over cooked - otherwise i can't actually complain about my burger or my sisters eggplant parm. 

the server comped all of our food and we only had to pay for the 3 drinks. no manager touched the table about the issue.

don't waste your time - i'm sure you can get a better experience else where.

We visited Royal House last Thursday with my wife and 12 years old daughter. We ended up with one of the best waiters We have ever met since 40 years of dining experience (not lifetime).
John Obrien probed all of us individually, found the best drinks and meals for each, offered the better choices over our selections and created a great experience for all!
Thank you!!!

Great little restaurant if you want to get away from the craziness! Friendly servers, fun atmosphere, delicious food, highly recommend. We ordered the fried oysters, they are very rich, recommend ordering just a half dozen. We also shared a shrimp PO-Boy and the caprese tower.
This was a pretty good place. Charbroiled oysters and this crab claw in creole sauce were delicious. The service was great. She was so sweet.
Wonderful service, good location and ambiance. Entrees were OK. Crab leg appetizers were excellent

The food was really good! The appetizer of crab claws were amazing! Especially the sauce they pour over it! I had the crab legs which good and juicy. Their service was good! Would definitely recommend and come back.

My expectations were high in going to the Royal (4000+ reviews and still a 4 Star yo!) but some disappointments​.  

Staff - I don't​ know what the deal was, but the staff was not enthusuastic, or seemingly happy to be there.  The hostesses and food servers were not rude, but just like they were doing us a favor​ by serving us.  That being said, our waiter was either new​ or sleepwalking.  We asked for a lemon with our water, but it took a very long time to bring a slice and several reminders to the waiter​.  OK a small thing - but a symptom.  The food order was screwed up and it took forever to bring out the correct dish which was a roast beef po-boy.  Why it took so long to re-fire a sandwhich I have no idea, but is anything worse than a member of your party sitting and waiting for food as everyone else eats?

Failure to refill an ice tea or see if I wanted another beer are things you are taught in waiter 101.  He was professional and polite, just not an​ efficient waiter.  The food was presented by separate​ kitchen servers who just kind of popped it down on the​ table in an indifferent​​t manner that didn't fit the perceived quality of the restaurant​. 

As for the food quality - it was very good.  We all really enjoyed our meals.  Food alone would be 4 star.  Red beans rice and sausage, crawfish etouffee, and beef po-boy.

The place was busy and the ​seating was tight, but the overall groove was nice and comforable.  There are a whole lot of eating choices in the French Quarter, and the Royal will have to do better to maintain its rating.

WORST MANAGER, Ms. Shirley!!!! My husband ordered the red beans and andouille sausage, a friend ordered the shrimp creole and both came with very dry, crunchy rice. Both were sent back to the kitchen to come back the same way. My husband is allergic to shellfish so his choices are limited in this restaurant. We spoke to the manager and as she rolled up said 'What's the issue?!' No hi, hello, sorry for the bad experience...no courtesy whatsoever. Overall the worst attitude for a manager that runs a restaurant, and not a cheap one, to not show compassion or consideration. Honestly, the food was not great. You're better off going to a cheaper place to eat.

After this review and an email to the general manager, we came back to Royal House to give them another try. Michael, thank you for amending the bad experience and turned it to a great ending to our trip and my husband's birthday. We appreciate you. The food, drinks and desserts were amazing. Tina was a very attentive and wonderful server.

So my friends and I had dinner here tonight and this happened. We're in town from the west coast for my 40th birthday, mind you. We all order and our dishes came out. I ordered the red beans and andouille sausage and my friend had the shrimp creole. Both our dishes had rice and the rice was hard and crunchy. We sent our dishes back to the kitchen because we weren't satisfied. Our dishes came back out and my friend's dish was good this time, mine wasn't. I got the attention of the waitress and let her know, I decided I wasn't going to try for a 3rd try. I was going to order a different dish and they weren't even trying to take care of my meal for the inconvenience. The waitress then came back and said that they would take care of half of my replacement dish. That was not acceptable to me. We asked for the manager "Ms. Shirley" and her first words when she got to her table we're "ok, what's the issue". Her approach was totally off and there was no sympathy what so ever. Like it was my fault the kitchen can't make rice in a creole restaurant. We let her know that her tact and technique came across very wrong and she didn't agree and walked away. I then decided to just cancel my replacement dish, I didn't feel comfortable eating there after all of this. As a consumer/customer you shouldn't feel as though you are the problem or feel safe eating somewhere because you spoke up about poor quality.

I'm updating my post from last nights issues. The manger Michael responding to a friend's email about our experience from the night before and wanted to invite back to apologize in person and also give them an opportunity to make things right. We decided to give them a chance. We arrived and shown to a table. Michael came out and introduced himself and apologize for the actions and behavior of his staff. The went above and beyond and we all appreciated their effort. They took care of everything we ordered and the service by Tina was excellent. This is how we tourists like to be treated when visiting from out of town.

The food was just ok. I ordered the shrimp creole and it had no flavor in it. The rice was hard and I felt like I was eating spaghetti sauce and shrimp. I highly doubt I would choose this place again.

What a huge disappointment. Our server had an amazing personality. 
We never received our appetizer. Jambalaya was salty, shrimp creole was equal to Prego spaghetti sauce with shrimp.
Yeah, this place is legit.  The drinks are strong.  The food is delicious.  The wait staff -- Ty -- add the flair that makes New Orleans.  Highly recommend.
Some of the best food in New Orleans!! The shrimp tortellini is delicious! The pecan praline pie is too!

Food is bland and the service is horrible. We got seated outside and didn't have enough room for our food so our waiter just stood there awkwardly as I tried my best to make room. After eating the crab claws and oysters I ran out of bread and asked for more and was told I was going to be charged extra for BREAD! After I agreed, the bread took 10 minutes to come out and it came out cold. Not coming back and wouldn't recommend
Very ordinary food here after we tried Oceana. Everything seemed dry to me. We tried oysters and mushroom appetizer and both were very dray and over baked.

We are at Royal House based on the good reviews on Yelp . What a disappointment. Our server was very rude , not helpful at all . The food arrived cold. I don't understand why the crave about the restaurant . After waiting for half an hour for our food, the server told us that they ran out of rice . Unacceptable knowing We had hungry kids with us . The food is Less than OK.

I was super hungry and Royal House had no wait, so I stopped in. I was excited to try the shrimp Creole, as it was near the end of my trip, and this was one dish I still had yet to try. I thought it was was just OK. The shrimp were not the big, beautiful Gulf shrimp I was expecting and the sauce had little flavor. It also took a really long time to prepare, given that the restaurant was not that full. Those around me mostly ordered sandwiches, and I wish I had gone that route. Service was really good, though. There are better restaurants in the Quarter.
This was a pleasant place to eat at. Good atmosphere and the wait staff was great. The food was decent.

I came from out of town with a few of my girlfriends. We tried this place two times. I'll give an exact and fair breakdown of what our experience looked like. 

Night one- absolutely terrible experience. The food was delicious (we got the crawfish ravioli). The service, however, was completely atrocious. The food took FOREVER and the server chose to help everyone except our table. Once the food came, she never once checked on us. We ended up requesting a manager to let her know, and my friends said she saw the server ROLL HER EYES while we complained of the poor service. Whatttt? 

However Shirley, the manager, redeemed the 0 star review. She truly listened to us and offered us a free entree to make the experience better during our next visit. She was so incredibly kind and understanding and told us we deserve a true royal experience. 

However, I will say- the night 2 food was less than bragging -worthy. I got the fried oysters and could barely finish it because it was sooooo greasy. 

Overall, I'd say it wasn't the best and wasn't the worst. The 4-star is because of Shirley, the manager. Everything else was probably 0-1 star.

I was really excited to eat at Royal House, but with each review I read I became more and more nervous that I sat down and spent my time here. What really made this trip disappointing is that my experience started to match some of the negative reviews I read. 

First we order the Crab Claws. We initially came here for fried shrimp and other seafood. When the dish came out I was shocked and appalled any manager or restaurant would let such a measly dish leave the kitchen. The taste was good, but there were only 6 claws in the dish with a very small portion of meat, not worth the expensive price it was sold for! 

After we finished, we kept thinking , "What does this mean for the rest of our dishes." Our nerves were high. 

Our oysters came out with our shrimp platters, so that was a little frustrating. The oysters weren't great, they weren't as hot and buttery as expected (Acme Oyster House has the best so far) 

Now on to this shrimp platter. Definitely good in terms of breading (it was light enough to taste the shrimp) but I had so many shrimp the size of my nail-beds, which is completely unacceptable for $19!!! You will be pleased with the overall amount of shrimp; Some were a decent size but the others were embryos so I didn't know how to feel and was confused. Needless to say, the shrimp were the highlight of my experience, a plus? 

Nice try Royal House, I won't be returning. 

Btw our waiter was GREAT! Very attentive and timely.

Pleasant evening. We sat on the balcony where we were able to hear live jazz music (someone playing outside). Waitress was friendly and attentive and the food was pretty good. We checked in and were able to get a free appetizer! The value was at $12 and our appetizer was only $9 so they credited us the $3 to our check!
Great food.  Great service. We come back every time we are in NOLA.

I was visiting during the women's flat track roller derby championships in November from San Diego. Being born and raised in San Diego I grew up around a lot of different types of food, but I have never had anything quite like the food I had in the south! Southern hospitality is a true gem and our server was amazing! She was very patient with me not knowing what I should order and so pleasant to talk to! My boyfriend and I ordered the crab claw appetizer which were absolutely divine! I opted for the Taste of New Orleans and loved it! If I were in the area would 100% go back!

Originally I would've rated this a 1. My friends and I visited Royal House our first night in New Orleans because it was so highly recommended. We were served by a younger woman named Tasia. Unfortunately, her service to our table was horrible, which we thought was strange because she seemed very attentive to all the other tables with older guests. We spoke to the manager, Lisa, and she made it all right for us! She assured us that the Royal House experience is much greater and invited us back the following day to dine. We did, during lunch we were served by someone else and the service was so so so incredible. We loved the food!!! I recommend the crawfish ravioli!!!

First stop off the plane. Only came to enjoy the crab claws. Mind blowing. Sauce recipe is apparently so secret only the head chef knows it. Had to really stop myself from going back for more and now that im away i regret not doing that :(
The food was delicious but the best part of this place is Tevin.  He was the most energetic server I've ever experienced.

Best food we've had by far!!! The crab claws and spinach dip were to die for.  Char Oysters amazing I have no other words!! We ordered the combo fish and shrimp and fish and oyster platters!!! Super satisfying meal and great environment. The bartender Leroy had a fantastic personality.

Having lunch on the balcony was a great experience.  The waitress was awesome!  I would give 5 stars for those 2 experiences.  The drinks were super light and that's coming from a person who doesn't normally like too much alcohol on her drink.  We were disappointed with the shrimp creole.  Maybe it's just not what we expected.  It basically tasted like spaghetti but instead of noodles, it was with rice.  We paid over $100 for 2 people for a meal we didn't really enjoy hence the 3 stars.

Based on reviews, sampled the Taste of New Orleans, crab claws and oyster duo all recommended by Payton our waiter.  The crab claw dish was the best--the sauce was to die for; loved 2 of 3 rice dishes and enjoyed the Rockefeller, not so much the Royale.   Service by Payton was excellent.  We'll definitely be back to try the other dishes (eg, redfish).

Pretty good! Nice service. Crab claws were fantastic. Sauce with dish was amazing. Etouffee was good but didn't make me want to order it again. Cocktails were good had the dark and stormy. Good stuff.
I love this place for oysters. A true NOLA experience off the main drags tucked away. Always cool bar staff but the oysters are the stars.

Are there better grilled oysters anywhere in New Orleans? If so, I haven't found them. Unpretentious, reasonably priced, and still in the French Quarter -- what are you waiting for? A favorite. (BTW, if you can, get seated at the downstairs bar or seating area -- other friends have complained that the upstairs service can get slow, which is something we found to be a problem in our balcony seats.)
Great food! Shrimp and oysters are spectacular. French onion soup is good, but a little too salty. Service was disappointing, but that seems to be a trend in NOLA.

Had a good meal here.  Oysters were closer to drago's type and very good.  I had the shrimp pot. Got a ton of shrimp. Was good.  Service was good. They do charge for bread hey brought without stating such.  Odd.

Looking to get your oyster shucked, look no further. Just tip your head back and let those slippery Sally's slide down your throat for a truly unforgettable fine dining experience that will get your ticker ticking and send you off to the races perky as a peach... in other words... simply fantastic!!

My friend and I went here to get crab legs they told us the wrong price, and they weren't very flavorful. Our waitress seemed very bored to be helping us. I wanted extra melted butter with my legs and was told it would be a two dollar up charge. We were also seated on the balcony which was crooked and my friend was anxious the whole dinner that we would fall off.
Got the fried oysters and eggplant.... I feel sick. Too rich and too over fried. The waiter was the only good thing there

The hostess were perfectly delightful and they were organized. Once seated, everything went down hill. The service was slow, we had to ask for things (ie. Tabasco) more than once. We started our order with a dozen oysters on the half shell. They tasted, looked, and were shucked horribly. So bad, that we decided to pay our tab than to even order an entree. The entrees May be amazing, but because the wait staff was so slow and the oysters were, quite literally, the worst oysters I've ever had, we left.
The redfish beignet was worth the wait. One of the most delicious things I've ever eaten.

Very cute restaurant with balcony and friendly customer service. Unfortunately the food was not good. I ordered the Taste of New Orleans and felt "royally" ripped off. It's basically a $18 plate of three little bowls of rice with different flavored sauce. The gumbo tasted the way cigarettes smell. The only good thing about the plate was that the waitress did not give me a hard time when I asked her to remove it from my bill. The place was packed and it seemed like many people were enjoying their food but I personally wouldn't recommend it nor will I be back.

The food and service was mediocre. Asked several times for a fork and 3 different servers forgot. My husband and dad ordered a Stella. My husband got his cup of Stella took a sip, it did not taste like it. My husband told them this is not Stella, they apologized and gave him another one. From where we were sitting, we could see into the bar. We saw them take his cup of beer away and instead of dumping it out, they put the entire cup into the fridge. My husband already drank from it.  Were they saving it? Pretty gross.
My 71 year old dad also got carded... was that necessary?

Wow.  

Nice place.  Best Sazerac  I've had.  Chargrilled oysters were wunnerful.  The Bride's Hurricane was excellent but the Voodoo left a lot be desired.  They did comp the Voodoo as she felt it was way too sweet.  The gent shucking the oysters was not wearing a glove and was excellent.

Service?  We were the second table from the door.  The server was good when he came around, but he seemed distracted by other tables.  

The bride's salad and entree were very good and good.  I was more in the mood for a burger and it seemed like something they bought at Rouse's as day old meat.  Something from Sam's or Costco would have been better.

Will we return?  Maybe.  We try to not repeat places when we go to New Orleans.  It's on the list.
Red velvet pie. Oysters. How can you go wrong? My two friends and I who visit went back 2x during our 3 day trip for the red velvet pie. Enough said. Taste it. Remember it forever.
Great location, friendly staff, and delicious New Orleans food! Plus the place was clean. Try a table upstairs surrounded by a beautiful open balcony.
Good food great waitress and barkeep. Military discount. Food was good beer was cold what else could you want

This place is okay but the shrimp in my blackened shrimp and jambalaya were somewhat overcooked and that's a bad thing for a New Orleans restaurant. The seafood stuffed mushrooms weren't real hot and didn't seem like they were particularly fresh. The fact that this place had people hawking customers out front gives it a bad look and tells you maybe they need to drum up business.

This place is alright but given all the restaurants in the area I'd keep moving past here.

Our favorite stop for char broiled oysters and crab claws. At the bar or in a French door on the street- love the vibe. 
High ceilings, long wood bar, tile floor- classic. 
In the middle of our favorite street- Royal.

A great location and there was a violist right at the street corner! We sat at the balcony and enjoyed a great view. The only thing is he balcony tilted downhill and was a little scary. Chargrilled oysters was not out of expectation. The combo of new Orléans was a little disappointing and the jambalaya was not seafood.

I recommend sitting upstairs or on the upper porch, weather permitting. They leave the doors open, and it gives a nice, airy vibe. Also, free app when you check in on Yelp!  We got the Redfish Beignets, and they were awesome! The portion size was huge, easily enough for 3 people. Large white filets of flaky redfish w a beer-type batter accompanied by a spicy sauce and syrup. Amazing. I wanted to lick the plate. I also had the red beans and rice w andouille sausage and fried chicken tenders. Again, this dish did not disappoint. Zea used to have a very similar dish that I loved and miss, as they are no longer in our area. The Hurricane was very good too. Everything we had was delicious, and the service was good too. We will be back the next time we are in Nola.

Major degradation in service and quality.  We have visited Royal House every time we are in NOLA for raw bar, attentive staff and quality drinks. Now functioning much more like a mediocre French Quarter tourist venue.

Seated upstairs... service atrocious, slow, lacking friendliness.  Food including oysters just so-so. Brought part of main dosh before apps. Drinks too fruity not even medium strong.

Could be we weren't sitting at raw bar, but sadly disappointing amd not likely to return.  Can do much better outside FQ.

The view is very pretty from the balcony. The oysters Rockefeller had absolutely no flavor, so I'm glad I just had that and not dinner also! I should have held out for the oysters Rockefeller at Antoine's but they were closed!

This place was close to our hotel and came recommended by the desk. It's a pretty little place on the corner of Royal and ST Loius. The balcony seating is nice. The flowers keep you from seeing anything. They have a good selection of NOLA favorites. Our  sevicer was helpful with food selection. The French onion soup was good. Not any better than  places in CA. The New Orleans sampler was average, oyster tacos are  6 tortilla chips with a fried oyster on each chip. The oyster was tasty. Charbroiled oysters were good. I haven't had them anywhere else for comparison.

We always love coming to Royal House when we visit New Orleans. The crab claws never dissappoint! We also tried the roast beef poorboy and the fried shrimp. Definitely will have the shrimp again...served hot and fresh. Ebony was our waitress whonwas awesome and we went mid afternoon and were able to get balcony seating. Perfect day to enjoy New Orleans with a pretty view and relaxing atmosphere.  Hubby says two thumbs up!
The French onion soup was delicious; super flavorful! Great location within the French quarter!

The Royal Place is a decent place to try out in NOLA. 

The French Onion Soup was a little too salty, but if you like that then I'd recommend giving it a try. My parents and I came down from Boston so we're used to getting fresh oysters, but the oysters we had were ok (definitely bigger than New England's) so I'd recommend getting fried ones.

For the main plates ranked in order: Pecan-crusted Mahi Mahi, Blackened Shrimp and Jambalaya, and Blackened Redfish. I really liked the Crystal lemon cream sauce, it went well with the Mahi Mahi and shrimp. The potatoes and green beans that came with the fish were decent. I ranked the Redfish last because it felt a little too greasy for me. The portions were huge! 
Food: 4/5 

Our waitress was really nice and attentive! But the main plates took about 30-40 minutes to come out so that was annoying. 
Service: 3/5 

We sat on the second floor of the restaurant and next to one of the doors to the outdoor seating. The outdoor seating was only limited to a party of two. It's also a good place to watch sports since there are several TVs around.  
Atmosphere: 4/5
Just amazing. Try the red fish!! Omg. You don't know what your missing. A taste of NOLA!!
Was  looking forward to a good cajun meal and was disappointing with meal. I had the jambalaya with blackened shrimp. It had very little flavor out side the shrimp taste.

Second time in this beautiful city and I had to hit up Royal House again. The food was as good as I remember and the service was even better. Ask for Becky and you'll get to hear some stories about mafia lore.

Tina is without a doubt one of the best servers I've ever experienced. She immediately approached us, asked how out night was (with a great accent), made some perfect recommendations, took our drink order, modified some food orders for us (per her suggestion), moved us after an obnoxiously loud party sat next to us, and had Mgr check in our us. Food was delicious and she definitely helped with a perfect experience.
Honesty the best food in the French Quarter. Our waiter Oran was the best.very friendly and so helpful! Ask for him you won't regret it !
This is one of our favorite stops for oysters in NO. All pair well with the French Onion soup and spinach salad. Pims cup is great as well!

The Royal House was hoppin' a few weeks ago when we stumbled in on a Saturday night. That's always a good sign. 
Surprisingly, we didn't have to wait to long for a table for 4.

Our server - I WISH I remembered her name - was amazing. Funny, attentive, super friendly - she gave awesome recommendations as well.

Started with a dozen raw oysters and fried gator. Oysters were on point, but the gator wasn't too memorable. It was just "fine."

For an entree I selected the crawfish ravioli, per our waitresses suggestion. It was ridiculously good. Rich, creamy, and FULL of crawfish.

Fun place to check out - solid food and great staff.

I am really not impressed with this restaurant. I love the location and the view from the balcony but the food was really just ok. We had a cup of gumbo, it is a light rue not dark and pretty simple in flavor. We had red beans and rice which was just ok but both cups came out just warm not hot.  Oysters were ok. And the $6 hush puppies were only 4 hush puppies the size of a quarter but round. They were very good just pricy. Over all everything was just ok.

This place is fantastic. The lighting is perfect, the menu is the right size, the location is great, the food (crawfish and crab ravioli, jambalaya) is delicious, the drinks were tasty, and our server was an absolute gem. She was quick with recommendations and her bubbly personality made the experience as comfortable as it was satiating

We had the oysters and the shrimp tortellini. They were both good. One of us did not remember that they didn't like oysters, but that is okay. Our waiter's humor was a little odd, but he was nice. It is right in the French Quarter.

Not impressed at all. This place had real bad service. The food was not good. If the food was not burnt it was cold or wrong. Place was really dirty and they walked big garbage cans full of rotten food right through the dining room between the tables while we were eating. Save your time and money go somewhere else.
Steak was over seasoned, but good the gumbo was good but didn't have a lot of chicken or sausage in it. Burgers are OK a little charred. Waitress was great :-)
I was told the crab claws were good but OMG... easily the best dish I had in New Orleans during my trip!!
Easily the best, fattest oysters I've had here! They were juicy, not gritty and tasted delicious.

Please don't eat here. The reviews/rating are terribly misleading. We order the spinach dip which was edible, but the tortilla chips were incredibly stale. The oyster rockefeller were so bad we only had two. Sad something had to die only to be poorly prepared and not eaten. Lastly, we ordered the shrimp po-boy, which had no dressing on it and was served in a hard/stale french baguette. Long story short, you couldn't pay me to eat here. The most disappointing meal we had in New Orleans.

Absolutely blown away by the food, amazing seafood. Food was steaming hot and delicious. Only giving four stars because the bartender brought my food then disappeared and did not come back for 20+ minutes. Very nice just kind of left me hanging ‍. I asked 3 different servers who said they didn't know how to ring me up while the others were socializing in the back which I could see plainly... 

The food was worth the ehhhhh service and I'll be back if I'm in the area. The food was amazing would easily be 5 stars if service was a bit better.

Also very affordable and a huge selection of drinks at reasonable prices.
Amazing food. More pricy than the $$ rating led me to believe, but worth it if you want quality, delicious food. Some of the best I've had in Nola.

This has by far been our best experience in NOLA. Our waiter, Ty was amazing.  He was very high energy, provided guidance on the best meals and gave us crackers with hot sauce (if he sees this review, he will know who this review is from). We got at least 3 of the recommended dishes and they were fabulous.  Between the food and Ty, the experience was phenomenal.  Must try and ASK for TY!

In a clam shell,  the waiter with the dreds was mediocre.... dry and border line rude. It appeared as if though he was annoyed with us... or our order: 3 dozen oysters,  3 orders of fried alligators,  1 order of hush puppies, and 10 drinks for 5 of us.

FODD: FOOD the oysters were delicious... but then again... how could you mess up raw oysters??? The fried alligator + their crystal sauce was heaven! Tasted like a hot wing... tasted like heaven.  The hush puppies: they were good,  but in a place with so many other options,  I'd opt out if i had the choice again. 

Drinks: totally watered down or sat ay the bar too long before they were brought to us.

Parking: not in the heart of Bourbon St.

The place: place was night.  Very open and airy.

I've been to NOLA twice and I can honestly say that this is my favorite restaurant in the French Quarter.  The food and service is consistent and amazing.  The staff is super attentive and friendly and I can't emphasize that enough.  SOUTHERN HOSPITALITY IS REAL! 

If you're going to dine here, I highly recommend sitting upstairs on the patio.  You get a gorgeous view of the French Quarter and there are tons of flowers and plant life.  As for the food, always and I mean always order the crab claws.  It comes covered in this gorgeous sauce that I could just drink from the bowl.  Without fail, we always ask them to keep it on the table so we can dip everything and anything in that sauce.  Other memorable dishes would be the crawfish etouffee and crawfish ravioli.  We destroyed it in seconds and I'm always wanting more.  I'm actually drooling thinking about it.

Grab a beer or cocktail and FEAST!

Well here you have it.  The undisputed world's worst Oysters Rockefeller on planet earth. Do not be mislead by others, the version at the Royal House is the champion.  Don't think so?  Please study the photo of the Oysters Rockefeller that was served to us - that a chef allowed out of his kitchen and that a waiter had the guts to serve. Oyster ice cold with a glob ball of frozen butter, chopped spinach, and what looks to be some cheese.  There you have it.  And you thought Oyster Rockefeller was supposed to be served hot. Wrong! Not at the Royal House. With the oyster bathed in hot butter. Wrong again! Not at the Royal House. The must believe that the heat and the humidity of the city will eventually warm the oysters and melt the glob to the point that it is edible for cats or rodents - but certainly not human beings.  Aspiring chefs out there, please post this picture as a reminder of what you never want to achieve in your career.  Food service managers of the world, please post this picture as a reminder to your staff - we can be better than this.  Of course, if I am wrong, and this is not the world's worst version of this classic dish, please post it here so we can compare.  I find it hard to believe that anyone else can get every single element wrong.

Great food! We stopped by around 10:30pm. We were seated in the balcony with some live music across the street. Also jazz music parade walked by as we were waiting for the food to come. Really relaxing vibe and the breeze was night. But took a long time for the food to come. We had to ask our waiter to speed it up a bit. 
We ordered what our waiter recommended:
Redfish beignet -- like the fish and chip but with some sweet sauce which balance the saltiness. This is really good. 
Chargrilled oysters are the best ones I've had so far. 
Crab Claws were awesome. The bread that was soaked in the bisque was too soggy though. 
Strawberry margarita was ok. 
Service was good but slow. Atmosphere and vibes are outstanding. Highly recommended.

We stopped in just for oysters sat upstairs on the balcony ordered a dozen raw and chargrilled and some crab claws. Service was fantastic and the food was delicious. However I was most impressed at how well waitress handled a couple of entitled jerks sitting behind us who threw a fit and were being rude to her the entire time they were rude she kept her composure and was polite. We will definitely be back

Now I don't usually come to yelp to write reviews but mannnnn was this place a tearjerker to start my little sister found a dressing cap in her salad my lil brothers rib eye was under cooked and the crawfish ravioli serving portion was incredibly sup par for 24$... five pieces of ravioli. Now the sauces and what not were on point but I came home and I'm still hungry

Order oysters :)
So you're not envious like I was definitely get the crave worthy Crawfish Ravioli
Food was ok. Ordered alligator bites and a shrimp po boy and both came without sauces that is listed. Food was tasty though so points on that but it's a bit overpriced in my opinion. Nothing fancy.

Just finished up eating here and this place is amazing. Our waitress was so extremely nice, sat outside on the balcony, and had one of the best meal I've had here so far. Had the chard grilled oysters and the were delicious. I've never had oysters before but I could have honestly had them as a whole meal in itself. For the entree, I ordered the baked shrimp fettuccine, and that was over the roof delicious! I believe that this place is well priced considering how well the food is made and the portion sized. Definitely a place to come back and eat.

Food is fantastic. The rating is for the service. Slow and uninterested in customers. Never got our appetizer. Had to ask for extra plates for splitting. Never a refill on water. Shame. Had high hopes. The food is a 5.

This place was amazing. The food was sooo good. I had the shrimp po boy. The shrimp was fresh and the batter was nice with different spices. The French bread was amazing and fresh. I would highly recommend to anyone who comes to this area. Will definitely be back.

I'm so sad! I've waited 5 years to eat here and made a special trip into New Orleans in my way to Baton Rouge just to eat oysters here. 

The service was horrible and the food was worse. It took 45 minutes to get my 1/2 oysters and they were warm. And then I ordered the split cooked outstretched app and it was cold. Both dishes must have sat out for at least 15 minutes before the waitress brought it to me. She also never refilled my iced tea.

Bummer

Awesome awesome space, awesome location, awesome bar. Prices are good for the area, fresh huge oysters, great drinks. Its an ideal spot to go to on a hot sunny day with all the natural like the building gets. The food is great, but I don't believe its really up to par with some of its neighbors.
John O. Was such a good time and the food was amazing. Easily my favorite visit in New Orleans

Service was okay. Several order issues, but corrected to expectations.  Gumbo had an off taste - burned roux is my guess.  Ettouffee was cold 1st try, but good on the remake.  The jambalaya was very good.  Oysters Rockefeller were very good, but not enough time to enjoy them since our dinner came fast behind -- that's my fault-- I know better than to order dinner at the same time I order my app. Overall, it was good, but not enough to compel me to go again.
Food was great. The servers were very nice though the service was a bit slow but overall it was good.

Such a cute restaurant with great views. We were able to sit outside on the balcony and have the experience of watching and listening to a second line band go though the street. We ordered the grilled butter, cheese and oil grilled oysters and it was delicious!! Way better than Acme Oyster. We also got a variety of fresh oysters that were good. I ordered the eggplant oyster pasta which had a lot of flavor and my bf ordered the Taste of New Orleans which he didn't love. Staff was friendly!

As usual, the best food and service! We love this place! Sit at the bar and hope Cindy is tending. Her menu recommendations are always perfect, and she cares more about customer service than any other employee we've met in Nola. Shout out to Leroy as well! Thanks for a great meal! We will be back on the next trip!

This was one of the worst service I've ever encountered during my stay in New Orleans. Me and my girlfriend ordered the clam and mussels seafood platter, along with the shrimp and rice. They were both plated on the wrong plate, and was cold as if they let it sit there for 20/30minutes and then brought it out to us. I don't recommend that African Americans go here because they treat you different. I was also told the clams and mussels would be about 10 pieces each on the plate when it actually came with 4 pieces each for $30. Ridiculous!.... never again . They only get a one star because we got free beer out of this and was told we didn't have to pay for the cold food... thanks for that, it was the least you guys could do.

We shared Chargrilled oysters, Crawfish etouffee and fried alligator. 

The oysters were flavorful. The crawfish etouffee was filling, but I do wish it had come with more bread to soak up the sauce. The fried alligator was an appetizer. It wasn't anything special. It really tasted like chicken strips without much flavor. 

We were allowed to bring in our drinks we were walking around with, so that was a plus. 

The waitress was attentive.
The charbroiled oysters and crawfish ravioli are amazing. The redfish is delicious as well. If you check in you get a free appetizer. Good place to eat dinner!

Just got into town late in the evening and needed a place close to the hotel. The food was meh and the service worse.  Told the concierge at the hotel to stop recommending it. Fortunately our stay in New Orleans went up from there.

Omg, their alligator and the oyster ravioli is absolutely amazing!

With the weather being hot and humid, the also offered to give a Togo drink to keep us cool and hydrated. The service was great along with the food, I would recommend anyone to go give it a try. 

Even my friend who HATES seafood loved the oyster ravioli.

To start off the food was very good, I had the redfish special with some broiled potatoes and green beans.  The redfish tasted like a traditional redfish, not a ton of flavors or seasonings, the potatoes were the best part of the dish will a little cheese and seasoning on them. For the food I would give this place 3.5 stars. The reason I am taking away half a star is the service.  The server started off very good, personable, likeable, etc.  throughout the course of the night, we never got a refill on the water, my wife never got the drink that she had asked for, there were long periods of time where we were left without anybody checking in on us.  Also at dessert I ordered two scoops of ice cream, one for each child and only ended up with one scoop of ice cream. We experienced this a few times in New Orleans where the server started out strong and fizzled, but this wasn't our experience everywhere.

Service was okay. Several order issues, but corrected to expectations.  Gumbo had an off taste - burned roux is my guess.  Ettouffee was cold 1st try, but good on the remake.  The jambalaya was very good.  Oysters Rockefeller were very good, but not enough time to enjoy them since our dinner came fast behind -- that's my fault-- I know better than to order dinner at the same time I order my app. Overall, it was good, but not enough to compel me to go again.
Update:  Based on response...will try again next trip to NOLA.

This was our first group dinner spot during our trip. X

The good:
- The crawfish ravioli was amazing. We may come back just to order it again while we are here. 
- Same goes for the chargrilled oysters. Wow!
- Service was great. 

The meh: There wasn't anything bad but 
- The tour of New Orleans was just meh.
- The drinks were ok. A little pricey for what you get, but I'm guessing most restaurants in the area are similarly priced.
Awesome food!! Great service! We loved eating here. I highly recommend the Oysters three ways and Red Beans and Rice.
This place was awesome! From the wait staff to the delicious oysters. I have zero complaints. I'm so happy  my husband and I found this sweet gem in the French quarter. Please go and visit !

I've been in New Orleans all week, and this has by far been the best dining experience I've had here. John was the best server and made the experience wonderful. I would 100% recommend requesting John if you want amazing recommendations and great entertainment all evening. The food was also wonderful. I opted for the blackened redfish and was not disappointed. I also had the bananas foster cheesecake, and it was marvelous! I would absolutely visit again.

Excellent service and amazing food. Thanks so much to our waiter. I believe it was Collin or Gabriel, with all the restaurants we visited I may have mixed up the names. But he was very welcoming and gave us his recommendations and really tried to make our experience perfect. Thank you so much, any time I'm in New Orleans I'll be sure to stop by again.

This was our first stop as we visited New Orleans. Our flight came in late but they were open until midnight on Friday. We sat at the bar and received immediate service. I ordered a hurricane(when in Rome) it was tasty but sweet. For our meals we had the crab claws and the BLT oyster sandwich. Both very tasty but the crab claws seamed to be very small.
Stopped in for an early dinner. Had blackened shrimp and jambalaya. Totally bland and disappointing. I'm bummed I wasted a dinner in NOLA.

One of my favorite meals of my visit! Stopped here for lunch after it being recommended by friends. The crab claws were to DIE for, they were incredible! We could have ordered at least 3 more orders. I ended up getting the seafood pescatore as my entree and was worried it would be too heavy for lunch. It definitely was filling but the seafood on the dish made it worth it. Filled with scallops, shrimp, mussels, clams it also had a pleasantly spicy marinara sauce. Not too much but gave it great flavor. Would recommend and I'm definitely returning upon my next New Orleans trip!

Probably shouldn't have ordered a salad, but spinach was wilted, had 3 small slices of apple and high prices. Pretty weak.

Also, Bloody Mary was tiny, couldn't even drink off my sorrow.
Wonderful food for our first night in NOLA. Tevin is an awesome waiter with tons of positive energy. Cheers!

I had dinner here Thursday, May 30, 2019. We ordered two of the special drinks the strawberry lemonade and I can't remember the name of the other one. Both were delicious. From the dinner menu we ordered the shrimp and grits and the taste of New Orleans. Both plates came out with food that was mediocre and lukewarm. I was so disappointed. Would not recommend anyone eating here. 

That morning we went to a swamp tour and in the afternoon we went to Oak Alley.. so after 4+ hours in the car didn't have the time or energy to send the dishes back. 

I really wish this wasn't our last meal in the city before heading home. Was a complete waste of money and I am surprised this restaurant has so many positive reviews. 

We had a better meal served from the bed of a truck on Frenchman street.

We had lunch there last Friday. We ordered two cocktails and split the oyster BLT po'boy with fries. The sandwich was good but the drinks were REALLY yummy! We ate lunch on the second floor in the nice air conditioning. Our server was also very nice and attentive.

Thank you for a good lunch!

No complaints here. 

This is a cool location on Royal and St. Louis with lots of balcony seating. 

I had the shrimp tortellini which was great (though could have had a little more shrimp).

Service was very helpful and friendly.

Omg!! Was this place good!! 
They accommodated our whole bachelorette party of 12 in under 45 min on a busy Saturday night!
We shared Rockefeller oysters, which were soooo garlicky & cheesy! I always find myself thinking about them...
Everyone kind of ordered different menu items & we were all very pleased with our choices.. I picked off some plates & got to try a bit of everything
My order was the jambalaya pasta.. I wish I took pics of the food, but we were just so drunk & hungry LOL

The worse oyster I have ever had. No matter the raw or all three of the grilled oysters, they are not fresh at all!!!!!!!!! The raw oysters looks dirty and smells weird and nasty. Other food also tastes so so. Not recommend

Oh my god this place is beyond amazing and the food is to die for!!! Had the blue crab appetizer, blackened redfish and butter pecan pie. I literally saw stars. Everything was so amazing right down to the service and decor. A MUST go to! I know I will be a regular whenever I am in town!!!
The ambiance and service was nice but the food was average. There wasn't much flavor to the food, it was pretty bland.

In NOLA, you can find good food anywhere but it is harder to find a truly memorable dining experience.  We found it here.  We sat at the bar and Cindy made this an experience we won't forget.  She made the best Bloody Mary as well as the best conservation. We laughed, drank and ate some of the best food I have ever had.  I thank Cindy for making the start of our day the best ever.

Royal House is one of my favorite restaurants in NOLA. In my personal opinion, they have the BEST chargrilled oysters! Their oysters have the perfect ratio of parmesan cheese and butter - they are truly out of this world! During my visit, I also got to try their "Taste of New Orlean," which comes with chicken & andouille jambalaya, crawfish etouffee, and chicken & andouille gumbo. All three were delicious (I would definitely order this entree again), but my favorite would have to be the crawfish etouffee as it was very flavorful.

Overall, I highly recommend checking out Royal House! Even if you don't want a full meal, it's still a great place to grab a drink and enjoy some oysters. Next time I'm in town, I plan on asking for balcony seating for a view :)

This restaurant was a tale of two cities!

If it was for the food alone, I would have rated this place a 5! Everything we ate was delicious! The only downside was that the servings were a little smaller when compared to other restaurants we ate at in the French Quarter. I would recommend this place solely for the food.

The service I would give 1 star as I had never had this happen to us before. To begin with, we sat under a table that the AC or something was leaking on. It wasn't horrible, but a couple of times during the dinner we felt the drops. It wasn't a huge deal, so we didn't even mention it.

Here is the bad part. For appetizers we ordered oyster on the half shell, Rockefeller's oysters and crab claws. Well, they brought us the oysters on the half shell and then completely forgot our other appetizers! Who does that! Our waitress didn't even notice until we pointed it out to her. Once they brought us our dinner (which again was delicious, but smaller portions) I still went ahead and order one of the appetizers to fill us up.

I'm not sure whose mistake this was, but we didn't really get an I'm sorry or anything, that was really disappointing.

I would go back again because the food was so good, but I would make sure the waitress or waiter was more on top of it.

Came here based on a recommendation from my husband who came here years ago. I sat at the bar and had Taste of Orleans. Wait staff was nice-but I had to ask them to explain what everything was. The jambalaya just looked like fried rice. The gumbo actually had Uncooked rice in it. All three bowls came warm not hot with 3 tiny slices of bread. Like 1 inch x  1 inch. I tried to use the free app coupon on yelp but I had to order two entrees. Since I was alone that wasn't happening.
Our server was great, flavors were good. Portions could be larger. Wish they had more entertainment or music.

Had a great time here. Had the Abita AndyGator and gator tail to start (free ap for yelp check in :) I had the taste of New Orleans, everything was delicious. Our server was top notch and hilarious and made a great meal even better.  There is usually a line here, I understand why now. Come hungry, leave waddling out.

Overall:  Been here in NOLA since Friday afternoon and been overall disappointed with food and service UNTIL this Sunday night at Royal House!!!  Well done and wish my schedule wasn't so busy that I could come back (which might happen:)).  

Food:  5 stars- Ordered the Pecan Crusted Mahi Mahi, Caprese Tower appetizer, and drinks- Hurricane and Rum Punch.  The Mahi and Shrimp wasn't fishy and had an awesome sauce that absolutely complimented the fish.  Green beans and potatoes were also well done. Caprese Tower was fresh with good tasting tomatoes with basaltic vinegar sauce.  Wouldn't change a thing in this meal taste and presentation!  Hurricane was good compared to others in city but the Rum Punch was a hit out of the park!! 

Service:  5 stars-  Sat at bar and taken care of by Leroy and Greg.  They were on spot with recommendations and dished it back (and too each other) as much as I gave it to them.  Leroy made the drinks and were awesome.  He sang allot with the songs playing in background with a carefree attitude and was a natural entertainer.  Greg was more on the reserved and respectful side.  He loosened up a bit more when he realized I was a joker and even gave me a dance at end after a bit of prodding!!  These guys gave us a great balance and level of service not experienced even close to these guys in NOLA!!!

Environment:  4 stars.  Great little place that was clean.  Originally seated in back 1st floor past bar but was too noisy.  Moved to two seats st bar and was great at end of bar.  Never checked our restroom so don't know condition.

There was a short wait for us to be seated and we opted to sit at the upstairs bar top rather than outside on the balcony - it was a muggy evening and around 90 degrees with barely any wind. Jessica was our bartender and did an outstanding job! She was helpful with menu suggestions and told us about some good, more quiet bars to check out in the surrounding area. The food was badass - we had 3 appetizers LOL - and Jessica made us some legit cocktails. We will definitely be coming back here on our next trip to NOLA!

We were very disappointed in this restaurant.   For our last night in Nola we were looking forward to a nice dinner and were very disappointed.  The line to us was a good sign until we ordered our food.  First we ordered 2 apps and 2 entrees. And all came out at the same time. By the time we got to the ravioli and shrimp it was cold and when we mentioned this to the waitress she blew us off.  Apps should have been served first.  Then we waited for a second round of drinks until we had to flag her down. Then the worst part of the meal was the cockroach that ran across the dining area. The waitress was alerted to it and she stepped on it and did not acknowledge it at all and continued to have an attitude with my party and the party seating next to us.  I would not recommend this place. Please be  aware.

Great dinner spot in the FQ!  Great cocktails and great Cajun Dishes. 

French Martini- not many places know how to make but this place gets it. Not on menu.

Seafood pescatore - I asked if they can do the scampi sauce instead....droooool

Crawfish ravioli - droooool times 2

First time in New Orleans and this was our first dinning experience.I felt very disappointed being from California I was really excited about having some good food in New Orleans.

Pros: Great service,friendly staff and excellent crab claws appetizer.

Cons: The taste of New Orleans was horrible!
The gumbo had no seasoning,the jambalaya was mush and the etouffee was runny!
My husband said the red beans and rice was so so but totally not what he expected!

Stopped in for oysters, at the bar, on a lazy sunny afternoon. Even though bar was packed I was served quickly. Paired them with a sparkling rose. The oysters were huge and superb. This was at the beginning of May.
Tevan was our waiter and did an excellent job!!!  The food was great!!  Crab claws are divine. Must go if you're in NOLA.

We we were very satisfied with this place as we waited for our hotel room to be ready. The Bloody Mary was excellent and the food was really good, too. We started with a dozen oysters on the half shell....fresh and tasty.  Then my husband had the alligator po boy....it was very good. The fried alligator was tender and delicious....the rest of the sandwich was ok for me but my husband really enjoys po boys. The fries were good but nothing special. I got the broiled oysters with butter, garlic and cheese.  They were really good. If you don't do them raw, this is an excellent alternative. 

Service was top notch and quick. We were there right at the start of the lunch hour so we were seated quickly.  Overall a good experience!!

Let's begin with the fact that service was good. The waitress was friendly, prompt, and knew the menu well! Everyone was appropriately professional and knowledgeable. The problem was quality. I ordered the seafood linguini, and while the seafood was well executed, the linguini itself was overcooked to the point of there being little texture. That, along with the watery garlic butter sauce, left much to be desired. This dish has potential but it was not executed well. The appetizer, the char-grilled oysters, wasn't much better. The filling they placed over each oyster was overly doughy and salty. With the competition for food in NOLA, this place doesn't live up to expectations. I wouldn't go back.

Royal house... also known as the best restaurant in New Orleans... (according to me and my husband)! From the char grilled oysters to the red beans and rice to the crab claws... take your pick, it's all amazing. The atmosphere is wonderful, every time we come.. which is at least once a day while we're visiting, we meet someone new. Nirobe, you are a man we look forward to seeing every time we're in town... until next year!

We had the sampler but we were not that impressed with any of it. The best thing was the appetizer redfish beignets, those were the best like a funnel cake fish and chips batter. The service was amazing and so friendly and fast.

Made reservations there while in town. Charbroiled Oysters was yummy as was the fried alligator. I ordered the seafood pescatore with marinara sauce and loved it. However, my friends ordered the New Orleans Sampler and were unhappy - only finishing one portion of the 3 samples. Service was not that great - bill had to get sent back and waiter was inattentive. Asked for bread to dip in sauce and got charged for it.

Came in for breakfast and sat at the bar. The bartender was Jeffrey, who was friendly and professional. I ordered a coffee, biscuits and gravy, two eggs over medium, sausage and grits.  The biscuits are light and fluffy and tasty!  Eggs properly cooked and the gravy was excellent.  The grits were cheesy goodness.  Recommend.
Found undercooked pieces of rice. And the food didn't feel freshly cooked. It felt like luke warmed.

Friendly, attentive service....not overly friendly or helpful but that's ok.. just drove in from Disneyworld so I guess my expectations are way too high. Two words....CHARGRILLED OYSTERS....carry on. The rest of the food was good too.

First time having chargrilled oysters and it did not disappoint. Of course we also have to try the raw oysters which was fresh and tasty. For our entrees we ordered the crawfish ravioli and it was phenomenal. It was my first time having it and i LOVED it. I definitely hope to visit next time we are in NOLA. Heads up that it was a bit pricey
This place is off the chart!!!!  Jessica at the bar is my favorite host - caring and always quick with a smile.  Service is great - food even better!!!!  One of New Orlean's classics!!!

Taste like cream of mushroom soup on my shrimp. Shrimp taste frozen., Gross food 
Lighting in this joint is too bright and the whole place looks like they bought all the fixtures at Home Depot. Which they probably did., embarrassing. .
Cindy with a C was the absolute best after a long hot afternoon in the sun. She made us laugh and served up the best drinks I've had all week. Thank Cindy with a C!  You're da bomb...come to NYC!!

Let me just say that was WONDERFUL ! Last night my bf and I went for dinner. First. Our server John. Amazing. Love him. He is a wonderful server. Recommended dishes. That we got. Like the crab claw appetizer AMAZING  the chargrilled oysters were to die for. I've been looking for a great place for chargrilled and I have found it. The gumbo was great. The rice was a little hard but I can get past that. My bf has the pecan crusted mahi mahi. That was really good too! Those potatoes  
Yes, I will be back and recommend this 100 more times to people.
This place was amazing! Ty, our server was the best. He made it a special experience and made us feel at home. The food was out of this world!
Very good meal!  We enjoyed several appetizers and oysters across the table for 4. Drinks were good
Everything was amazing. The gumbo did taste a bit burnt but everything else was perfectly cooked and the staff was so polite will def be back

Popped in here for dinner while exploring Royal Street in the Quarter. Had the Taste of New Orleans with Gumbo, Jambalaya and Etouffee and the Red Fish Beignets. All vey delicious, but the Beignets were the highlight. Very tasty. Will try to emulate at home.

Paten was our waiter on a crazy busy Saturday. We sat along the wall, across from the bar; seating was intimate. Our service was quick, thorough, and hospitable. Paten recommended I order the Bloody Mary, and it did not disappoint. We both ordered the crab boil for dinner; the crab was properly cooked. Note- the seasonings on the crab boil have a slight kick to them. We had a great time, thank you!

What a great choice for dinner this evening! Blackened Redfish what's delicious. My daughter had the taste of New Orleans and she said everything was great. We shared a bread pudding for dessert and it was amazing! If you're in New Orleans must come to the Royal House!

Worst dinning experience ever.. 60$ for 2 water down sugar drinks, a dozen of oversized gross flavorless oysters and a spinach dip which was served in the most disregarding way it's even possible to serve a plate in a restaurant (served the exact same way you can see on the picture). My boyfriend forced himself to try couple ones but after four, he wasn't able to keep eating them. 

Also, the server never asked us how we liked them, he just throw them away without making any comments. On top of that, we waited a long time to get the food while the restaurant was almost empty..
