Wouldn't recommend this restaurant to anyone.

Came here for lunch with the guys - they were able to get 8 of us seated fairly quickly upstairs which was nice. The server was friendly, but took a very long time to get our drinks. Not sure if she had to go work another section or what but there was only our table and one other one upstairs.

The food came out shortly after the drinks. Everything came out ok. I got some chargrilled oysters - they were alright. Also had the seafood pescatore - it was not bad flavor wise but could've used a little more pasta. Had I not ordered an appetizer (fried alligator - free with yelp check in when I did it) I probably would've still been hungry. 

My friend ordered the shrimp "caprese" salad and well, you can tell by the look on his face that there's nothing "salad" about it. They should really consider renaming this because it's misleading. 

All in all it's about what you'd expect I guess. No frills dining. The service could have been a little better.

Our favorite spot for oysters. The chargrilled are always perfect and delicious. Recently tried the marinated crab claws which were outrageously good. Make sure you eat the bread dipped in the sauce-it's the best. Have always had great service especially from Nairobi. Can't wait to come back!

Great food and great service! We ate the crab claw and stuffed mushroom apps. Delicious! For dinner we had the crawfish ravioli and I had the the taste of New Orleans. Both hit the spot! Drinks from the bar were also delicious!!! Would come back for sure!

Thoroughly enjoyed the crawfish etouffee! My husband had jambalaya and red beans and rice. Parents had the crab claws which were also awesome. Also, Blake at the bar is amazing. If you don't go for any other reason, go for Blake... the best "mutha shucka around."
Damn good eats. Everything was delicious. The food was slow coming out, but our server was so nice about it and the manager comped our appetizer.
The oysters are superb. The drinks are excellent. The view off the balcony is great! Our server was attentive and friendly! Great location!

Definitely a good choice if you want to taste a bit of the saucy Nola style seafood. We had the crawfish ravioli, the shrimp tortellini  and it came with a free appetizer so we went with crab legs. Talk about money! So good. Had to ask for more bread cause all of the sauces were soo good. **which they charge**

The vibes here were chill compared to the chaos down bourbon street but still had a turn up vibe if desired.
Samacha was so friendly and helpful.  We let her guide us as she was the expert and we have no regrets!
Always great time! Good food, their spinach and artichoke dip is to die for, amazing and attentive service leaves you with a feeling to come back again.

This place was delicious and has an incredible view, but we waited over 30-40 mins for just our appetizers, then on top of that waited 15 mins more for our entrees. I ordered the baked shrimp tortellini plate and it was AMAZING. The crab claw appetizer was yummy too and the sauce it was covered in is to die for. We just waited way too long here. Hopefully next time is better!

This was a fabulous lunch! We started with the crab claws in an amazing sauce. I had the shrimp and grits and my friend had the crawfish ravioli. The ravioli was delish, perfectly cooked and flavorful ravioli with a yummy sauce. My shrimp and grits had a wonderful flavor, although the grits were a bit on the dry side for my liking. I also had the apple martini, and it was SOOOOO good! Strong and refreshing. Service was very friendly and pleasant. Will definitely be back when in NOLA!

On the tip of Jay G. review on 3/22/19.  I was looking at another place that was close to my hotel and read Jay G's review and that led me to his review of the Royal House.  Tonight's dinner was 5 stars for food and 5 stars for service.  Peyton our server was on top of it the entire meal.  I started with a dozen chargrilled oysters, then I had a second order that somehow was even better then the first.  Thank You Jay G. Peyton, and Royal House for an excellent dinner.

Anytime you have the staff put on the sidewalk excited to welcome you into their establishment to experience good food and drinks is usually a good sign! This would be the case....
AWESOME PLACE! The staff is great and their recommendations re spot on!  
Ask for Desean!!!!!  BEST Waiter thus far.

We definitely made the right choice dining here. Our waiter, I believe his name was Deshaun - was excellent. We got the artichoke dip free for checking in on Yelp and it was delicious. My husband and son shared the New Orleans trio or sampler, whatever it was called - as well as an alligator po'boy. They loved everything. I even tried each of the trio items - not sure if I'd like them - and the crawfish etoufee was my favorite, with the gumbo close behind. My daughter and I shared the fried shrimp - and hands down - it was the BEST shrimp I've ever tasted in my life. Delicious! A++++ for everything.

Visited the Royal House about a year ago and I still recommend it to anyone who's in the neck of New Orleans. From the staff who interacted with us at the door to our server to the beautiful views of the French Quarter, dining at this place is a complete MUST. First off, the food tasted extremely well cooked and flavored. Our server was so helpful and we were able to place an order of gator bites and receive another for free, which were some of the best gator we tasted during our whole trip. Main entrees were amazing and the service was consistent and made our large party feel right at home. Then after we enjoyed hanging out on the balcony that overlooked the street. Beautiful! 

Seriously, if you need some authentic tasting NOLA seafood and care for  a top quality experience: come to this place.
Very great place and ambiance. Oysters were great chucked right in front of you. Jeffrey was an amazing bar tender and thoughts us a lot about oysters.

We ordered 4 dishes, raw oysters, Shrimp Caprese Salad, crab claws and seafood pot. Other than raw oysters, all other dishes were very salty. We couldn't even finish them.

The service was also poor. Our waiter just couldn't stop chatting around other tables and didn't really care about serving us. The table was not too packed for all the plates, but he just put the last plate on the chair! Didn't even try to make some room for it! Absolutely bad experience!
Food was delicious especially the crab claws and chargrilled Oysters.  Service was very friendly
I have to visit every time I'm in the city. In my opinion they have the best oysters in New Orleans. Also you can't go wrong with anything you order here. I try something different every time I come.
This place is sooo good!! The CRAB claws and the sauce they are IS delicious!! We order shrimp , steak, and tortellini! Yummy tum
We enjoyed our dinner today. Tasia was an awesome waitress.  She was very personable. We will return.

My friend was looking forward to the redfish beignets, and much to her disappointment it was heavily breaded. It has become a tradition for her to stop by and order this, but for some reason they dropped the ball. 

I ordered the red beans and rice, and I was disappointed as well. The beans were very watery and bland. I had higher expectations. I enjoyed my red beans and rice much better at Oceana Grill. 

Service was decent especially at midnight. I wouldn't come out of my way to come here again, but I wouldn't mind dining here again if I'm extremely close by.

A great little place right in the heart of the quarter! The service was absolutely top notch with the nicest waitress! There is a nice selection of options to appease a variety of people. Decent selection of local beers. Their chocolate brownie was amazing! We would definitely go back!
Man this place is Amazing!! Getting the crab claws is a MUST.. Whenever you go ask for Payton.. He'll tke good care of you and your party.

Delicious oysters. Great local food. Would definitely come back. 
Went there with my 5 yo old daughter and we had a great time.

Food and service was pure perfection! We had the crab claw appetizer and it was hands-down delicious! They had us sopping up the garlic butter sauce. Red beans and rice was the second best I've had since visiting NOLA. Definitely a spot to check out and if you come early (5:30 ish) you'll beat the rush.

We had the most amazing server. His name is John Smith. The tortellini was to die for but the highlight was John, our server. He was extremely entertaining and had us laughing throughout. This was by far our best dining experience in New Orleans!!!!

Visited this place for our dinner and we actually tried the best dishes over there in most reviews of yelp. The Gumbo bowl and fried alligator  missing in the pics as they are small in quantity and they are gone before we clicked pictures. 

Louisiana is famous for its seafood and we ordered all seafood dishes. 

Tried alligator(crocodile) meat for the first time and this dish tasted like chicken popcorn which has more harder meat with same taste as chicken popcorn. 

Gumbo cup is one of the famous dish in New Orleans as I have seen lot of places with boards saying they serve Gumbo bowls. It tasted more like a sambar rice with different spices. First impression was like this isn't tastes good but after few spoons of that Gumbo rice, it's addictive until you finish the bowl

Crawfish Etoufee - This sauce tasted like sambar too but tasted Like a better version of Gumbo bowl with some fried crawfish meat in it.

Seafood Pescator - seafood pasta with scampi sauce. We substituted marinara sauce with Scampi sauce. This is the best dish at this place. Sauce tasted more like a garlic and butter base sauce. Sauce is so addictive and we were cleaning the plate with side breads for sauce.

Shrimp Jambalaya- tastes good with more shrimp in the plate. But other 2 entrees dominated this dish with their sauces. 

Shrimp Po-boy - typical subway kind of sub with some fried shrimp and veggies. Tastes ok but the bread is so good that we dipped the bread in the Scampi sauce to enjoy that sauce. 

We got a yelp checkin deal to wave off an appetizer and we used it to for fried Alligator. And the rest costed us $92 with taxes.

Tina was absolutely wonderful in taking care of us. Food was yummy as well. Highly recommend the crab claws with the amazing liquid crack sauce. We shared the red velvet cake/pie as well. It was heavenly!!

Bammmm!  What an awesome dinner all the way around from being seated to the food to the waitress.  I was seated very quickly probably because it was a Tuesday night but who cares why, I was hungry.  My waitress (Tierra) was great, very knowledgeable of the dishes, helped me select something different and had my food and drinks coming in cadence all evening.  The food was incredible from the roasted oysters to the crabmeat filled ravioli!  I would highly recommend Royal to those looking for outstanding New Orleans food, great service at a reasonable price.  As they say in Nawlins,,, who dat? Royal is Dat!
Food was excellent. Our server Rebecca was knowledgeable and helpful. All her suggestions were excellent! Try the Ravioli!!
We tried the sampler and it was wonderful. Really about 4.5 stars could've been 5 bit we only tried the gumbo, etouffee, and shrimp creole

The service and ambiance were great, but the food meh!  I got the creole that looked like rice, with shrimp and ketchup.  I'm normally not a 'send it back', but I literally couldn't make myself eat it.  The waiter was gracious enough to say "yes, it's not the best we can do" as he looked at it.  Now, I don't know why he served it to me in the first place if he felt that way, but I digress.  Anyhow, I reordered the blackened shrimp and that was meh as well.  I don't know if it's because it was later in the evening and 44 min till closing, but I will not be back.  There's too many others that do it better than to return to mediocre food.

Our server was just AMAZING!  She was friendly, genuine, and attentive.  We ordered two different entrees to share.  My husband got the crawfish ravioli which was simply amazing.  The sauce was rich and flavorful but didn't over power to tender sweetness of the crawfish.

I got the fried shrimp platter which sounds like it wasn't very adventurous but it was just what I wanted.  The batter on the shrimp was light and crunchy.  The jalapeño hush puppies were sweet, savory, and tender on the inside.

The winner of the evening was the grilled crab claw appetizer.  They were succulent and sweet in a deliciously rich sauce.  If you order nothing else here, get the grilled crab claw appetizer!!

Atmosphere: 4/5, Food: 4/5

Atmosphere: There's nothing that says New Orleans more than being in the French Quarter. While shopping in the market or listening to local jazz, Royal House is a great place to drop in. Or if you're looking for a NOLA inspired dinner, this is also the place! Royal House is a fine dining establishment that maintains the classic feel of old timey nawlins. It could use some improvements, as many areas in the French quarter could, but that would take away from its authenticity. 

Food: The reason I keep coming back over the years is their chargrilled oysters. My my my, Delicious. In my opinion, they're the best in the town! The crab fingers are also amazing. The sauce is so scrumptious you could literally put it on anything! The New Orleans Trip Sampler was a little disappointing to me. The étouffée was not very good and my jambalaya came out cold. The gumbo was very good! Nonetheless, the majority of the food was perfect!

The hostess and my server Robert were super nice and so attentive~ the oysters were so fresh and oh so melt in your mouth. We ordered the Seafood Pescatore, oyster pasta, and eggplant and oyster entree, all of which was good. Only thing I didnt like was the man who brought our food didnt ask who ordered which entree but kind of barked just the name of the entree, which made me feel uncomfortable, although he did wish us a nice dinner. Overall a pleasant dining experience and great food :)

We were in town for a few days before leaving on a cruise and found this place. The food was outstanding, our server was phenomenal, the drinks were great, and the whole atmosphere made us feel very welcome. We were in a large party with picky eaters and kids and everyone found something on the menu that they were very pleased with. We cannot say enough amazing things about this place! We will absolutely come back the next time we are in New Orleans!
Best char-grilled oysters I had on my trip to NOLA. If I come back to the city, I'll definitely be here again.

Our server Tasia made our experience all that much better. She recommended the charbroiled oysters which were great along with the duo oysters. We ordered the pecan crusted mahi mahi which I found to be very fishy. Our Server Tasia made up for our  unfortunate entree. Overall the atmosphere has great vibes.

This was probably the BEST charbroiled oysters i have had yet here!! DELICIOUS!!!! Besides being a fan of the oysters, our server, Tasia, was absolutely amazing! She was extremely welcoming and a ball of energy. An absolute pleasure to have her take care of us. 
We ordered the pecan crusted mahi mahi and unfortunately it was far too fishy for my liking. I usually hate sending back food but Thankfully, Tasia didn't make it a big deal and made sure i enjoyed every minute of my dining experience. I would definitely come back just to have her take care of me again. She was an absolute joy!

Becky was a great server! She made sure that I always had my drink, before I ran out. I did not even have to ask. She brought out dips for my wife and I. I really appreciated that because other place have a tendency to just bring out one dip. The chargrilled oysters were sooo flavorful! The cup of gumbo was very tasty. My wife and I shared the shrimp platter and it was so delicious. I love this place and will come back. Definitely recommend.

Absolutely incredible... I had the chicken and eggplant Parm and it was awesome. Some of the best I have ever had and I have had Eggplant Parm prepared by an actual Italian chef. One of the guys in the group told me he didn't like eggplant... he changed his mind after a bite of mine. Everyone else enjoyed their meal choices as well. Also, the people at the door were friendly and fun to talk to. Prices were great, too... given the quality and the fact you were in New Orleans.

This restaurant has some very rude employees. My coworker and I ordered snow crab legs and it had no meat inside and it was as if I was eating straight up salt. The atmosphere was horrible and only one person out of our 12 person party was fully pleased with their dish. If u are a tourist I would not recommend going here.

Great view, pretty darn good food!  Great place to start off my 50th celebration!  Special thanks to waitress Tasia who helped this lost Chinese guy from Cali to start his Big Easy 50th BDay off right!
We ended up eating here two nights in a row and everything was great. Every plate was great and the staff were all very friendly and attentive.   I hope I get to go back again one day.

Absolutely wonderful & fun staff. The manager has a great staff that is willing to cut up with the patrons & play along with their quirky requests. Hubby found out that he is not a fan of crawfish etouffee. Our waiter was quick to get him something else to replace it.
Sooo good! My favorite was the Royal (Seafood) Oyster. The fried alligator was also amazing!

Service was great. 
The crab claws were to die for. I was so surprised how good they were because I'm very picky about my seafood consumption. They definitely live up to their hype. Their cajun brown jambalaya was ok, in my opinion it was bland. The Red beans and rice were delicious. The seafood boil peel and eat shrimp however was a disappointment. It came with a bunch of shrimp that literally just tasted like it was boiled in water. No seasoning on the shrimp or potatoes. Shrimp also had this weird almost plastic/chemical taste. Ended up paying $30 for the shrimp I didn't eat. Shirley temple was bomb & it had a bunch of maraschino cherries  which I love!!Everything else was amazing.

I am visiting from Chicago and stumbled upon this Royal House on the corner. My waiter Greg was absolutely knowledgeable and very courteous. Had amazing recommendations I had the fried alligator, With the crab claws, with a hurricane. The food was phenomenal and the drink was perfect. Highly recommend stopping by for a quick bite and drink.

Customer service was great, we had the raw and chargrilled oysters and they were excellent. The Hurricane here was perfect. Gator bites were good and definitely a nice atmosphere. 

The only negative for me was that there was a dish that was said to have a spicy marinara sauce however when it came to our table it was both lukewarm and a sweet sauce.
Didn't care for food to much. The service was decent. The gentleman was nice. Nice scenery at night. We sat on the galley.

We had a great experience at Royal House last night... we ordered redfish beignets & crab claws... these apps ended up being our dinner bc it they were so delicious & filling (very generous portions for us). 
Monica was our server & she was super helpful & attentive. 
The only reason I'm not giving the 5th star is the balcony we were seated on (which clearly was an awesome vantage point) needs some SERIOUS repair.

We typically stay at the Omni, which is right across the street. Royal House happens to be convenient, but fortunately it is also delicious. We've been several times now and the service and food are always excellent!

It was our first time in New Orleans and Royal House gave us a pleasant taste, both literally and figuratively, of the city's Southern charm and hospitality.  The food we had (for lunch) was simple yet deliciously flavorful. Deshaun, our server was excellent in his presentation, service and attentiveness. The ambience was friendly, informal, and well managed. We both would highly recommend to New Orleans regulars and newcomers alike.
The atmosphere was great but the food was not good at all. The gumbo was bland and the oysters were burnt

Let me tell you!! I arrived to New Orleans on a Wednesday, tried many local dishes and each at a different restaurant. I'm glad I didn't find Royal House sooner because I would've been here all 5 days I was in town. 
Our server, Peyton, was a the epitome of hospitality. I'm in the industry myself and will always appreciate someone that goes over the menu, tells me the local favorites as well as their own. Peyton did just that. His suggestions were so perfectly on point. 
Fave dish was the crab claws: TO DIE FOR! Be sure to get extra bread! That sauce is epic! I got the Taste of New Orleans and it was equally amazing. Only thing to keep in mind is that if you're not used to big meals, you will be full as i was! But no problem cause leftovers are everything!!!
I'll be back to Nola, for royal house in specific FOR SURE!!!! 
Oooo, last thing!!Prices are decent. Look, I went to other places and spent the same amount of money and it was ok. Not Royal house. You're definitely getting your moneys worth.
The food here was really good the duck was delicious and the rest of the food my boyfriend and I ordered was amazing as well, loved how very chilled and laid back it was

This place is a treasure. It was my wifes and my 1st sit down in New Orleans. They allowed us to bring our dog in to dine with us. The service was fantastic from Becky G. Great smile. Food was fabulous.  I was craving Fried Oysters and they were everything I was wanting. Cooked perfectly. My wife had the New Orleans sampler. She loved it.  We were going through a bad experience from a hotel and Becky G made us feel at home and loved. Our BB gives Becky 2 Paws up...

Fried alligator wow delicious!!
But service was bad, had all the vibes and everything for it to be great food was delicious but it was more of a come in eat and leave. Our waiter was nice and offered great advice on the food, but he was slow to notice drinks were empty and only came when food was to be brought out. Great place just wish we had better service, food was top notch and filled me to the brim!

Best Char Grilled Oysters ever!  I had such a good time here. Try the crab claw appetizer. They have some kid of magic sauce for that one. I was dipping bread in it, and I was in heaven. Greg was waiting our table and he made us feel at home.  Telling all my friends about this place. Good food, good atmosphere, good company.

If I could give this place a 1-star...believe me I would. The service was terrible, all the waiters acted as they were at a party. Like, hello! I need some service over here! The food is minimal and so did not get the "taste of New Orleans.." very disappointing, and please avoid the oyster tacos. It's about 4 chip tortillas with small coleslaw and half an oyster..trust me, I'm Mexican, I know what a real TACO looks like.

This is a great place to eat. The guy that runs the oyster bar is a long time native of New Orleans and he preps the oysters amazing. I love Every dishes they serve here. I prefer their fried shrimp and a great French 75. 

I also got a delicious brownie for dessert. 
The staff is great and very friendly.

Great food and excellent service from everyone. Started from the staff that invited people in front of the restaurant and one of them seated me, then Robert who took care of my table and he even asked the manager to help me use a deal from yelp even I didn't order enough food to use the deal but thanks to the manager (I think her name is Lisa) who is really kind and let me use the deal. Even other staff that always came to check on me and take my plates right away when I'm done. 
      I got Shrimp&Grits and The Duo oyster. They were delicious! Shrimp&Grits portion was big! I was really full after I finished everything by myself and had a hard time carried myself back to the hotel lol. 
      The other thing that I like about this place is the ambient of the restaurant. I say at the table right at th eopen door and I enjoyed watching people having a great time in New Orleans, horse carriage and beautiful building from my table. If I go back to New Orleans I will go back and try other stuff that they have next time. Thank you everyone that took care of me and a great hospitality from Royal House

Friendly staff, however we waited almost an hour to get our food, and the waitress forgot to put in the order for one of our appetizers..... food was definitely not bad, however I we expected a lot more for the price we paid and all the nice reviews we read from yelp.

Me and my fiancée where introduced to this place by a New Orleans local about 2/3 years ago while on our anniversary. It quickly became a favorite and a must have every time we visit. It's very upscale compared to most places you may find in the area. Our favorite server is a woman named Heidi. She always takes care of us when we come down.
Service was fun and fabulous. Thank you Terrill B.! Food was kind of pedestrian. In a town full lf culinary options we won't likely be back.

Was really excited to try this place based on the pictures and reviews. The server was very friendly but the service was slooow. The crab claw was VERY delicious. Unfortunately it came out with our entrees. The entrees for the most part left a lot to be desired. We had the new orleans medley and shrimp and grits.
Oysters on the half shell were fantastic. Good oysters Rockerfeller. I enjoyed my Sazerac, twice over. Our party enjoyed the alligator poboy sandwich, good fries and shrimp creole was tasty.

Fabulous service! My boyfriend and I were promptly greeted at the door for a midday lunch. We requested to sit on the balcony seats, and was accommodated our request without any problems (accept bees). Enjoyed the gorgeous view of the city streets. 

I had a dozen oysters and my boyfriend got the andouille sausage, rice and beans. We both split the caprese tower. The oysters were fresh and decently sized. The rice and beans were filling. The caprese tower was so-so because the red onions overpowered the delicate flavor of the rest of the dish. 

Our waitress was sweet and never broke character for calling us "my lady" and "my king;" after all, it is called Royal House. We walked around after dinner a bit and really appreciated the southern hospitality Royal House delivered.

Is was so good sandwich shrimps.
The service is amazing.
I recommend to come at 7 p.m..
Not so busy and very nice people
Randomly yelped up this gem and they had me at crawfish pasta. Everything here was spot on! I would definitely come back here if I'm ever visiting again

****UPDATE**** we returned nearly 3 yrs later to find a competent uplifting  bar staff and good cocktails.  This is a far cry from our previous experience.   The royal House appears to be headed in the right direction.
The waiters and bartenders were amazing and patient with us, as we were a large group of 9 people. The food and drinks were delicious and the atmosphere was so quaint!!

Had dinner last night. Highly recommend! Service was prompt and attentive. Very friendly. JayRene was our waitress, she is fabulous. She gave us recommendations that were perfect. We started with oysters, which were the best ever. My wife has the blackened redfish and loved it. Fish was very fresh and perfectly prepared. I had the crawfish ravioli which was terrific. It was a perfect dinner!

Dinner with the family here while visiting NOLA. This place was busy but not a long wait for a table.  Had an upscale feel. Service was excellent and attentive. The food was terrific but I found the portions a little small. We had the oysters, shrimp creole, tortellini and Louisiana sampler. All great!  Just water to drink as we were dehydrated from walking in the heat. One other small point was they had MMA on tv, not something I want to watch while eating. The food and service get the 5 stars!

We had a great late night meal here over the weekend.  We sat at tge bar,  Blake was our bartender.  He was very polite and personable. We had the eggplant chips to start, they were nice and crispy with just the right amount of sauce. Then we had the shrimp poboy and the shrimp and grits. The shrimp and grits was my favorite meal of my entire trip to New Orleans. Blake made our experience great.
Fabulous steak & shrimp, service was AMAZING! We were so welcomed from the minute we walked in the door. Peaceful enough to enjoy your meal, but you could still hear all the music from the busy area.
Friendly staff with good food. Was a bit crowded seating but lots of people eating there. Check in for free appetizer. Husband said fish was great. Burger ok but it is a seafood place.

We came here twice during our visit to NOLA. First visit I had the crab claws and they were amazing and service was on point. The second visit, I brought a big party with me as we were celebrating a birthday. Again, the service was on point but even better. The crab claws were so good the first time I had them again. We had a great time that night. Next time I'm in town this will be my first stop.

The oysters Royale were fantastic! Perfectly seasoned, with quite a bit of seafood in the stuffing. Service was stellar, from the gentleman greeting people at the door, to the wait staff. Friendly and attentive throughout the meal.
If you decide to visit, ask if Ty is working! He made our lunch memorable. The food was great. The sauce that the crab claws are in is to die for!!

The food was PHENOMENAL. Was here for my birthday tonight and everything was good. Crawfish ravioli, amazing. Spinach dip, probably the best I've ever had. The waiter, was honest and super friendly! The only reason i'm giving 4 stars instead 5, is because we were seated upstairs, and it was so HOT. The doors to the balcony kept getting left open and letting all the hot air in right by our table. We were sweating pretty much. Once they were closed it cooled off, but once they opened again all the cool air was gone. But other than that, everything was great. We will definitely be back again to try more of the menu, and sit outside on the balcony in a later month!

Shout out to #redhairdontcare!!!! Tina was our waitress and she was awesome. Definitely ask for her when you get there. The oysters on the half shell were great and the Bloody Mary's here are the best I've tasted in NOLA. Will be back to this restaurant good service and good food!

Chargrilled oysters!!!! I've never eaten oysters like this before since coming from the west coast I'm used to eating oysters raw with some vinaigrette sauce, lemon, and tabasco. Over here down south it's chargrilled with lots of butter and garlic. So delicious and the oysters are massive and plump.

My first time in Royale House, also first time in Nola, love the food, great atmosphere.. Our waitress Aida who has only been here for 2 weeks is AWESOME . It was a bad beginning the waiter we had before Aida abruptly left no explanation, and no apologies. Other than the beginning this  was a great experience. Love our new waitress Aida. The previous waiter left spoke to one of the patrons he was serving and apologized but walked right past us. So a little  unsettled about the previous waiter,  only reason I'm rating a 4 is because of the previous waiter. Other than that fre3at service and food.

Cute little bar. It is kid friendly. The shrimp po boy was bland as can be. Shrimp, lettuce, tomato and pickle on French bread. The shrimp on it was excellent. The French onion soup would have been awesome but... it was soooo salty! The mahi mahi was a tad spicy but great.

The best peel-n-eat shrimp EVER! I think it's called the Boiler Pot, comes by the pound, with corn and potatoes. My husband likes his shrimp fried and we don't share!

These shrimp were extra large, cooked to perfection, and seasoned seasoned seasoned. We sat long enough for me to eat them all (by myself) since we were leaving the next morning and I couldn't take home leftovers. 

Peyton was our waiter, chatty and attentive - just the way I like a server to be! The space was small, but the flow of food coming and dirty plates going was so graceful, it really was like watching a dance. 

Ask for a table away from the bar! The bartenders were a little obnoxious and unfortunately our table was right in front of the bar. They yelled "keep us busy" and "let us make drinks" a few times. Fun if your sitting at the bar drinking, but not so much if you are trying to enjoy a nice dinner. 

I picked this place for the location and sheer number of reviews. Seems like you can't go wrong with any meal here. Enjoy!

The Royal House has some of the best deserts I like having. Their banana foster cheese is amazing, perhaps the best here in New Orleans. 
The Jambalaya is also amazing, ordered two orders of Jambalaya.
We have sampled many of the local restaurants here in New Orleans, but so far this is my favorite.
Great food, great atmosphere, and great service. Tevin is one of the best servers ive ever had the pleasure of having. I cannot recommend this place enough.

I had a wonderful experience at this restaurant. Now my waiter Ty this guy right here the energy his knowledge of all the menu items and drink menu. He needs a raise and promoted into management ASAP... I will be coming back many many times to come. I will be requesting Ty every time especially to all my business partners and motorcycle club members nationwide. If anybody knows Floyd Mayweather come see this guy ASAP....
Absolutely amazing! The bbq shrimp and grits is the best in town and the French onion soup is to die for!

My 1st trip to New Orleans and I found a reason to come back! Our waitress, CiCi, was perfection incarnate with her cheerful disposition,  beautiful smile, and helpful attention. We had the seafoodnstuffed mushrooms & fried alligator appetizers. Both were delicious, but the alligator knocked it out of the park! My family ordered the gator po boy, shrimp creole, Royal burger, & crawfish etouffe. I ended up with the French Onion Soup and a side salad. The shrimp creole was the best thing on the table, but ALL of the food was well worth the money! When everything is so wonderful,  why not try dessert? Not being from LA, I was surprised by the "butter pecan pie". It's not like any pecan pie I have ever had and I am a southerner, born & bred! I will tral to NOLA just for this! The homemade bread pudding will give your grandma a run for her money, too! Best food and service you could imagine!

Great po' boy with a FAT serving of fish. My Grandmom has the shrimp po'boy and enjoyed. We got carry out. Huge space with large parties easily being able to be seated. Typical NoLA food fried or grilled with solid seasonings.

Our server is on some sort of opiate and has messed up our order four times. I'm waiting for the corrected check as I write  this. We had to ask her to fix it three times and had to ask for manager. She is so wasted she is wobbling and has lost her balance several times while arguing w us about the check. 
Also, another  staff member  keeps dragging garbage cans past us and hitting me in the back. 
Please get help, please.

Went here for dinner and had a nice time. It was a busy Friday night but we were seated right away. Our waitress was Jrenee and she was so lovely! I was crazy thirsty and she kept the seltzer coming all night without me having to ask her for more every 10 minutes. 
We got the alligator appetizer, shrimp po boy and fish po boy. First time eating alligator, I was pleasantly surprised. The po boys were just ok. I felt there was just way to much bread although the fish and shrimp were good. 
My only complaint was that it was so hot and humid out and they had all of the doors and windows open. No clue if the AC was on and I couldn't stop sweating the entire time I was there. Was really hoping for a reprieve from the heat while I was eating. 
5 stars for Jrenee, 4 for the food and 1 for the crazy hot room. So I think I'll round to 4. :)

We stumbled into this restaurant after an airboat tour starving and thirsty. Our waiter Becky refilled our waters probably 5 times before we ordered with a smile every time. The food was absolutely amazing. This was my second favorite restaurant in New Orleans overall but it was my significant others favorite. We started with spinach artichoke dip which was awesome, split fried fish, French fries and a poboy. These French fries were super fluffy, the fried fish was light and crispy, we were so full by the time we got to the poboy we really only ate the shrimp and it was great. Now for desert I have to recommend a desert I did not get the name of but will include a picture. I would say you need this desert with the funky funny waiter with circle glasses super fresh fella that brought me to the best desert I have ever had. It was custard with pecans and Caramel, we ate one and had one to go. You read that right two waiters because we came twice!

Food was good. Had a terrible person greeting my girlfriend and I. He said chefs were slow and horrible and the wait to get food was going to be hour and a half. And also that chefs were backed up and the servers were terrible. I would not recommend going during the night time as you might see the same host there. Also another customer was very upset that the host was telling them the same thing and trying to make people not to go inside.

Food was mediocre, actually almost tasteless and I was given a chicken salad with zero dressing. When I inquired about, the response I got was "mhmm" only for the waiter to come back and hand me a teaspoon of salad dressing. I am extremely disappointed with this place and would absolutely advise against anyone eating here. It is also very odd to have staff standing outside the door yelling people to come in and eat. So we try it out, get to the fort, and are "welcomed" by blank stares. We were here to celebrate a graduation but definitely avoid this place at all costs next visit. I am sad that my hard earned money went to this establishment. (I am a full time student and work full time) New ownership is desperately need, beautiful building, God awful restaurant!
Food was great but portions were small. French onion soup was amazing but they ran out of a key ingredient during DINNER and didn't seem too concerned about offering an alternative.

The food at Royal House was very good. We had the Oysters Rockefeller and the Redfish Beignet as an appetizer. I was a little skeptical about the red fish beignet but it was really awesome. There was a sweet sauce that went nicely with the flaky fish and surprisingly the powdered sugar was a nice touch too. The Oysters Rockefeller was good, but I couldn't taste the Sambuca at all.  We shared a French Onion soup which was also quite nice and then had the crab leg boil for our entree.  

Where the drop in the rating comes is from our service. Our waiter was a bit distracted which started with our drinks that he completely forgot. Not a big deal... But when our entree came we only had one.  He actually told us that he ASSUMED that since we were sharing other things, that we were sharing our entree.  The other things were appetizers which are typically shared - entrees are not.  We ended up sharing one entree and completely finishing it before the second entree came out.  When we asked for desert to go - neither one of us was in the mood to be there any longer - the server left in the middle of the order to go help others. When my husband flagged him down to give him to order and get the check, he left again saying he would come back to "tell us about something spectacular."  When he finally came back to tell us about some other desert which was different than what we ordered, I was really just done. 

To the credit of the Royal House, I think it was really just our server. He seemed to think he was the star of the show. The other servers appeared to be on it and although the kitchen was a little slow at a very busy time (nothing out of the ordinary), I think our guy detracted from what would have otherwise been a good meal.

Very friendly staff up front. They was no wait time to get a sit. 
We waited for a little too long for a server. Nothing too crazy. The server was very knowledgeable on the menu. She helped us pick the appetizer and desert! They were amazing. Great food! I had the Blacked Shrimp Jambalaya! Very warm and well prepared. I'll definitely come back again

Little roaches in the wall yuck . Server was mediocre. Shrimp boil was $25 and overcooked and not seasoned well. Gumbo had a good flavor but was just roux and rice (where's the sausage and chicken?) I would not recommend this place. Don't know why it was rated 4 stars

4 Stars! Came here for dinner on Saturday night! This place gets pretty busy but the line moves alot faster than you think. I got the crab claws for my appetizer which was pretty good and for my main I had the shrimp and grits which was pretty decent. I would recommend this place!

While walking around in the French Quarter looking for a spot for a nice sit down lunch, we walked by the Royal House, and the young woman out front was so welcoming we couldn't help but stop in.

We sat at the bar where Anthony was the definition of Southern hospitality (and a pro at shucking oysters). The drink menu is extensive, but the Cajun Bloody Mary I ordered was a little disappointing (had to much of that steak sauce taste), and took a few minutes as the bartender seemed to be preoccupied. Everything after the drinks though was absolutely perfect.

The oysters were HUGE. I had oysters a few times in New Orleans and these were by far the biggest. Anthony shucked then right in front of us and they could not have been fresher. Throw on just a dash of Louisiana hot sauce and you're set.

The Shrimp Caprese was a great starter, a hefty amount of shrimp and a nice stack of mozarella and tomato was perfect for sharing.

I was a little hesitant to order alligator, but when in New Orleans you have to try it at some point, so I ordered the Alligator Po Boy, and my oh my was it fantastic. The Royal House doesn't mess around and keeps the Po Boy simple and classic the way it's supposed to be with just pickles, lettuce, tomato, and fried alligator on a French Roll. The alligator really does taste just like chicken, and don't be afraid to use that Louisiana hot sauce again. This sandwich ended up being one of the best, if not the best, things I ate in New Orleans.

If you're visiting New Orleans stop into the Royal House for lunch one day, you won't be disappointed!

We loved the crab claws and oyster duo. They were some of the best starters that we tried on our NOLA trip. We each tried the Taste of New Orleans.  The flavors were good, but each dish included crunchy rice.  If we come back, we will have the starters and drinks, but will skip the entrees that include rice.

Service was slow. The waitress took our order without writing things down, tried to repeat our order and almost got it right. She went to enter the order and they were out of salmon so I ordered the salad and added a spinach dip. When the fried gator came it was given without the condiments.  We had to ask for it and it took about 5 minutes to get it. That does not sound like a long time but the restaurant was not busy and she passed our table 4 times without dropping off the sauce. The spinach dip never came. Our check stated a mis-ring of spinach salad which we never ordered but did not list the dip.  The check also was not correct. Food was mediocre. We were disappointed. Least liked meal during our 6 day stay.

Love hanging out at Royal House and can't believe I've never written a review. I try to go during off times to grab a quick drink and bite when I'm on Royal. The food is always good, and the atmosphere is nice - relaxing, and not too touristy while still feeling local. Yesterday I stopped in and enjoyed a quick bite of alligator and fries with Sapphire Spritzer. The alligator was fried to perfection; tender, juicy, and not overly breaded. The spritzer was the perfect drink for sitting out on the balcony in the afternoon. Gin on a summer afternoon with muddled strawberries? Perfection! 

THANK YOU! 
Service provided by Ty was above & beyond. He knew I didn't have a ton of time, and remained aware of that to get me in & out quickly. Really appreciated all of his recommendations on food, especially the drink, and his happy attitude.

My friend and I came in because she was looking for crab claws and wanted to try a new place. The crab claws were delicious and served in a VERY tasty sauce but unfortunately there weren't a many. 

We both also ordered the French onion soup which was delicious. 

Unfortunately when I ordered the spinach salad my server came back to inform me there was no spinach. I do wish an alternative was offered (perhaps a salad with lettuce or even someone going to purchase spinach) but since there wasn't we took the check and wandered around to look for another place to eat.

This place was pretty good. The service was okay, we ordered wine and it took them about 10 minutes to bring it out to us. I did enjoy how the manager came up to us after our meal to make sure everything was good. We ordered French onion soup, eggplant chips, and the jambalaya. The French onion soup and eggplant chips were delicious!!! The jambalaya was decent, could've used some more flavor, but I really enjoyed the shrimp! Overall an a-okay experience.

The food, the atmosphere, and the very nice staff that work here make this restaurant a must go to restaurant! I sat upstairs where they offer balcony dining and an incredible view, especially when the sun sets. I ordered a french onion soup, a deep fried eggplant appetizer (which was more like an entree), and the blackened shrimp jambalaya. All three dishes were amazing and so filling. The only reason I gave this 4 stars is because we waited a little longer than usual to be greeted, and even longer to receive our 2 glasses of wine we had ordered. I would still definitely return to dine here again because of the food and the niceness of the staff and management.
Delicious food. The server was a little bit distracted doing  something else with another customers, but its ok. Was a good experience, a little pricy but its worth.....

This is the best restaurant that we ate at in the the French quarter. You will not be disappointed and the desert is amazing. Tell them you want Greg for your waiter he makes great suggestions and makes the dining experience awesome.

Absolutely loved the perfectly seasoned peel and eat shrimp, creamy mini crab claws and the scrumptious bananas foster dessert. I wish I lived in New Orleans and could keep coming back over and over just for this fantastic dining experience. They give a free appetizer with yelp check in which is awesome!

My 11 year old daughter loved her food so much we came here twice while visiting New Orleans. Cute space, attentive service, great cocktails. I had the Hendricks gin cocktail both times and it was delicious. She had the crawfish ravioli both times and it was exceptional both times! The servers commented each time she ordered that it was a very good choice, so I think this is one of their banner entrees. I had the fish platter which was massive, could be easily shared. It was okay, a safe choice, but nothing special enough to recommend. I was a bit disappointed with it. However, for our second meal I had the Spinach salad entree and added redfish. It was light, but filling! Fish was tender, tasty and the salad had green apples and blue cheese for lots of good flavor. The Royal House is a solid choice for a good lunch or dinner. Our meals/drinks came to around $70 each time, for the two of us.

I am currently sitting on the balcony of Royal House. The food was great and the views are awesome. But the best part about my meal was our server (Ty). Let me tell you, this man knows his food and drinks. He also is the best server in town. Absolute top notch service. This man deserves a promotion to run the joint. Everything he recommended was amazing. Keep it up!

I don't go to a lot of restaurants In general. Now saying that, I went to this restaurant twice during a week training. I had their seafood lemon base pasta. Wow amazing !! Waitress are great and knowledgeable about the food they serve.
Very cute restaurant good for dinner. They staff were friendly and polite. We ordered the BLT po-boy, char grilled  oysters and crawfish ravioli. A good spot for our first night in New Orleans.

Get seated at the bar because Ms. Cindy is such a doll!! 

She so personable, treated us like family, chose us a yummy dry Cab, and gave us great tips on ordering such as:

Don't order the Nola sample as everyone says there's way too much rice and most people usually rave about the crawfish étouffée. So we got the étouffée and ate around the rice. It was sooo delectable!!

Get the alligator bites but make sure you eat it quick before it bites back ;P

Everything else she suggested was fried so I just drank wine :P but the boy loved it and it filled him up!!

We had such a great time, we stopped by the next morning for a delicious Cajun Bloody Mary!!! It was soo flavorful and helped heal our hangover!! THANK YOU!!!!

This was our first time here at Royal House.
We Took a seat on the balcony for the true New Orleans experience . We were greeted by our host and seated immediately. We started with half a dozen raw and half a dozen Char oysters.
The raw oysters were okay but the char oysters stole the show . After finished we're tempted to get another round . 
For drinks we my wife had red wine and I had a hurricane .
The drinks were given in plastic cups , which we attributed to the fact of being outside as the smaller tables may not have been able to properly hold glasses .

The drinks were good . For entree we had the crawfish ravioli and the BLT oyster Po Boy. The crawfish had flavor but it didn't seem to meet the hype that we faced in other reviews.
The BLT Po boy for me was not the best .
The bread was a little dry and I didn't not feel that the flavors meshed as much as I anticipated.

Overall , I would definitely revisit Royal House  1 because of the experience and ambiance of New Orleans is there despite the entrees not being as pleasurable as we had liked but If I were come back I'd order as many char grilled oysters as I possibly could eat because they are that good and that alone moved this from a 3 to a 4 star review !!!!
Would have been a five star review had the server remembered my gumbo. Also forgot the dressing on my sandwich. Servers were very sweet and the place was nice.
A friend of ours recommended this restaurant and we couldn't have been happier.  Our server Ada took great care of us and it was truely a great evening.

OMG! The hotel restaurant recommendation was around the corner with a 40 minute line and wait. We couldn't wait. We hadn't eaten for 12 hours. So we walked around the corner to Royal House. What a wonderful surprise being exposed to our first Cajun creole fare. My 17 year old couldn't get enough food to fill him up because he's used to giant burgers and fries.  We ordered the crawfish legs with a sauce to die for. Don't let them take the sauce away. Keep it and pour it on anything else you order. I ordered the crawfish ravioli but my son ate most of them and I was still starving. They were excellent. We then ordered the baca? fish, shrimp and chips platter. So so good. We dipped our fish and shrimp in the remaining crawfish legs sauce. Now we were spoiled for the rest of the trip. Our waitress was perfect. Great recommendations and the right amount of attention.
Phenomenal food and a great view if you sit on the balcony! Their food is fresh and reasonably priced! I will definitely be back when I visit New Orleans again.

I was a pretty disappointed with their New Orleans trio. I did not like the jambalaya, gumbo or crawfish ettoufee. The highlight of my meal was their spinach dipping. We also ordered their stuffed mushrooms and oyster tacos which were mediocre.
Decent food.  The roast beef poboy is really good.  The oyster BLT is ok.   The drinks are good.  Overall above average.

Ordered the "Taste of New Orleans" (gumbo, jambalaya, and etoufee sampler), marinated crab claws, crawfish ravioli, and the oyster duo. The crab claws were by far the tastiest and most flavorful. Everything else was quite bland to be honest, and each dish came out lukewarm which was disappointing. The atmosphere is cute though, especially the upstairs balcony area. I probably would not come back though due to my lackluster experience.

Came here for bachelor party. Friendly staff. I got the chargrilled oysters which were covered with Parmesan and butter. They were extremely tasty with soft meat. I would like to try the raw oysters next time.

Ugh this place was horrible. We ordered Rockefeller oysters that tasted like they had been sitting in the window for hours and gator tail. Our server to top it off was rude as hell. Save yourself the trip and head over to ACME oyster house.

OK here we are...arrived in New Orleans at 9:00 p.m. and looking for a restaurant for late dinner.
Royal House was one of the few....So being from Louisiana,  I thought id try the crawfish etoufee
With fried crawfish... not expecting much, I was EXTREMELY surprised and very pleased... Food was awesome...server , John Smith,  was outstanding,
drinks very satisfying,  and dessert SWEET...
try it...you'll LOVE ,it...thank you

Visited for dinner and brought some friends that were visiting New Orleans for the first time.  I bragged a bit about the place but was a bit disappointed. I had the eggplant clam dish and it was so bad that I almost couldn't believe it was the same restaurant that I visited months prior. 

The noodles were so watery that the flavor was diluted. The portion was a lot smaller than my pre-Mardi Gras visits. I was so disappointed.
The waiter kept bringing us stuff we didn't order because "you'll like it" and then had the gall to put it on our bill.  Food wasn't bad, but wasn't anything out of this world either. Overrated.

The food was great. Salad fresh and seafood boil was just right. The service, and let me give a shout out to server Tina F.- was phenomenal. She was fast, friendly and professional. Definitely made us feel home and welcomed. So whatever you're doing Royal House, keep it up with the service. They are great and the food does well too

Royal House is high quality all around. The food is delicious and menu is very good in its variety and specialization. The sophisticated, nice, clean, and friendly ambiance and atmosphere inside the restaurant is top. Royal House is nicely tucked into the heart of New Orleans French Quarter. They have upstairs seating too on the balcony. 

You can taste the biggest classic dishes of NOLA, as well as others. Seafood, especially clams and oysters are delicious and fresh here. The quality of the service from the waiter was lagging, but he had a positive attitude, personality, and was really nice, and helped make for a great and memorable experience. My experience in this restaurant with my friends was sophisticated, fun, relaxing, and truly enjoyable. This was arguably my favorite dinner in NOLA.

Would not recommend. Service was incredibly slow and the food was just okay. Although we were sat immediately and the restaurant was not crowded, it took about 45 minutes just to receive the one appetizer we ordered. Our server was not very friendly and rarely checked in on us.

We always eat here. The staff is great, oysters are so fresh! Love the redfish beignets and you HAVE to try the Pimm's Cup. So fresh and tasty! And the best part of all - the great live music just across the street on any given day or night. Awesome NOLA experience!

8/23/19 Had a great time at The Royal house on our last night in New Orleans. Everyone here was so wonderful. Rooftop seating was a good place to experience all the sights and sounds at night. From the typist across the way feverishly clicking away on his typewriter, talented violinist playing across the street, many cruising by in their cars and party buses in various forms, lit up bicycles. Saw the NOLA police pull up on their bikes escorting a live band walking by. Loved our server, she was a doll. She made sure we were taken care of till the end, even though her shift was over. We loved New Orleans and promised to come back here and see her again!

Wow this restaurant was out of this world! Do not miss the crab claws!! I had the crawfish ravioli and my husband had the taste of New Orleans trio. A slice of pecan pie for dessert topped off our experience and we were fat and happy!

Food was very good. Charred oysters are as advertised to die for. Watched servers Payton and Ty work super hard at making sure their tables were in perfect order. The server we had was minimum at best. Enjoyed the food. Red fish was excellent. Must got to for food. Just hope you get one of those 2 servers.

love to get the shrimp platter! 
the staff is almost always the sweetest! true southerners. we come to nola about once a month and make sure to come here :)
my companion loves the oysters, but wishes they were juicier so she could dip her bread in it.

Great place to really experience good New Orleans food. friendly staff, good specials, and a nice location in the French Quarter. I got the Taste of New Orleans and it was worth it. The gumbo was good and everything has the appropriate level of heat to it. It is family friendly. Prefect night out.

This place is a tad bit overrated.  We order oysters Rockefeller, Charbroiled and crab claws.  Oysters were pretty good but I don't think you can go wrong anywhere.  Crab claws, nothing to write home about.  The seafood pasta dish was ordered, pretty flavorful.  I was tired of fried food so I ordered the caesar with crab, nothing exciting about their caesar. Desserts are pretty basic but I'll never turn away a brownie ala-mode
Cool little Cajun restaurant in the French quarter. Great oysters and jambalaya with blackened shrimp. But the real winner here is the banana pudding.

Great experience with friends! Food was great...I swear we ordered just about everything on the menu...gumbo, crawfish tortellini, shrimp ravioli, the New Orleans experience, alligator bites, oysters...everything was delicious! Staff was super friendly and made the experience fun!

We are here with our favorite girl Ada at Royal House on Bourbon St and Royal 



She is awesome...

Our dining experience at the Royal House was wonderful!  The food was incredible and the service from Ada was absolutely amazing!  She went above and beyond to make our anniversary a memorable one!  We will definitely be back to the Royal House and see Ada again!

Pretty horrible experience. Took forever to get our waters. Even longer to get someone to come take our order. Even long-ER to get our appetizer. And longer still to get our food. And the food was very mediocre and not worth the wait. Our appetizer was pretty much the only good part of our visit. We ordered beers with our food and never got them, even though the waiter had a reminder. By the time he came by to ask how we were doing, we were mostly through eating,  and feared that by the time he brought them out, we'd be out of food. 

Then,  it took a long time again to get the ticket. And then the ticket was wrong and had to be sent back. So we had to wait again. 

Side issues that just compounded a bad visit: it was loud, the LSU game was turned off and waiter couldn't switch it back. And the manager never once checked on our table even though he had to have known we weren't happy and he walked by about 10 times.
This was some of the best service we had on our whole trip! The hush puppies and alligator bites were perfect apps! Definitely recommend

My friend and I decided came here to try a po-boy because of favorable Yelp reviews and great (read: professional) photos. We were duped. On arrival, I asked about the Yelp checkin for a free appetizer and was told it was valid, and that we could get a free app. We ordered two apps (French onion soup and fried alligator) and a po-boy to share between us. 

The French onion soup was ok, nothing memorable or worth writing home about. It was a little salty but had a nice layer of melted cheese on top. The fried alligator had potential, with decent seasoning and breading. It was, however, very oily and the cuts of meat were not great (I'm assuming all gator meat is not like that, dark and grisly). The po-boy, the reason we stopped by this venue, was terrible. The bread (more like cardboard) was insanely dry. The sandwich comes "dressed," according to the menu, which meant it had lettuce, tomatoes and pickles. Apparently this also meant that there was not a drop of sauce or mayo or any moisture inside, which rendered it unfathomably dry. If you could bite into the Sahara desert, I imagine it would taste like this.

And when it came time to get our checks, the manager walked over to our table and made us pull out the yelp coupon. He made us zoom in and pointed out the fine print that read "valid with purchase of 2 entrees." Mind you, this text was not visible from the main Yelp page (it just says valid with purchase, the fine print is shown after you click claim offer) and that the waiter had told us our order was fine and we could use the promotion. He told us they wouldn't honor the deal. 

If the food had been stellar I would have let the deceptive marketing tactics slide, but somehow you managed to deliver a double whammy of terrible customer experience and charged me $40 for it. But hell hath no fury like capitalism and a free market with public reviews. I definitely will not be returning and would recommend you avoid this spot too. If you're looking for a po-boy, don't make the same mistake I did and go for the more legit spots (just Google them).

Just as a side note, our server, who said she didn't know about the 2 entree policy, was cordial and apologetic. We had no qualms with her.
I really enjoyed my crawfish etouffee and my wife's shrimp Creole was also quite tasty although her portion seemed a bit smaller versus mine.

Shout out to John for being such a awesome server and dishing the SASS!! My boyfriend and I had reservations elsewhere but ended up cancelling because our swamp tour ran late. So I hopped onto yelp and came across Royal House. A 30 min Uber ride later, I was seated at a table with window doors facing the street so I could people watch as I ate. John, gave us his recommendations and boy were they good! We got the alligator bites (sprinkle some lemon juice y'all it'll make the flavor POP), crab claws (they open it for you already) , the alcoholic lemonade as a DOUBLE because we shared it, oyster pasta, char grilled oysters, and lemme' tell you about that pecan pie... EXCELLENT. My favorite was the oyster pasta with the breaded oysters in top, random strangers on the street were even asking me about it! The sauce was amazing and pasta was cooked the way I liked. Also, I'm not a crab person but the crab claws at Royal House have CONVERTED ME, that's right I'm changed and now I love crabs. The sauce they used had my boyfriend feening for more and he used my oyster pasta and drenched it with the crab claw sauce. Lastly, the pecan pie is worth mentioning because John recommended it. I never had pecan pie, I'm a key lime girl but the freshness and flavor of pecan pie was definitely A1. It had whip cream, vanilla filling and pecans all over, I was full from my meal but I definitely had space left over when I saw the lil' slice of heaven. Royal House, I wish I could ubereats you to New York because you were that delicious!

Omg two words- STUFFED MUSHROOMS. The stuffed mushroom appetizer was out of this world! Along with the many other delicious pasta dishes! We all really enjoyed our food and fantastic service! I would so come back again next time I'm in NOLA! Good atmosphere and yummy eats!

Service: 5/5
Our waiter was super nice and always checking in on us to make sure we have everything we need. We didn't have to wait long to be seated on a crowded afternoon. 

Food: 3/5
We had really high hope for this place since we wanted to try the famous char-grilled oysters but the oysters were really small. We literally had to scrap off the tiny bit of oyster that was on the giant shell. We also ordered the "Taste of New Orleans" which comes with crawfish etoufee, gumbo and jambalaya. I only liked the crawfish etoufee; the other two are just ok. We also got the crab legs appetizer and it was not what I expected. The crab legs are tiny.. like my pinky finger nails; For $13, I don't think it's worth it. The last thing we ordered was the crawfish pasta and I would give it a 3/5 as well. Very creamy and is a good portion but nothing spectacular. 

Price: 3/5
We paid around $80 for everything which is not completely horrible but pretty expensive for 2 people. 

Location/atmosphere: 2/5
The location is great since it's on Royal and pretty close to the city center. The restaurant is really loud and hot when it's crowded though so it's a bit hard to enjoy a nice meal with all the loud noise.

This place is awesome!! Calvin, Rebecca, and Kim are the nicest people ever. Great hospitality, great food, and service! Next time I come back to Nola I will be here for sure. Everything on the menu is amazing I had a party of seven so we tried a lot of food and lived every bit of it!
The food was awesome and Calvin, Kim and Rebecca were great. We had a wonderful evening.

The lady at the door, Kim, was very sweet & fun.  Calvin, manager, checked on us several times.  Rebecca, waitress, was awesome.  While the people were great, the food was even better!  The food & atmosphere were amazing!  This is a must!

This is my favorite place for chargrilled oysters in New Orleans!  The staff is amazing and always friendly.  They make a great hurricane the way it is supposed to be made with juices and rum not fruit punch.

I was craving a roast beef po boy and onion soup and stumbled upon this place on Yelp. However, I didn't feel up to taking the trek to Parkway Bakery for one. I wasn't impressed at all with the food and service at this place. Our server hyped up how their French onion soup was the best in the French Quarter as well as their po boys. My sister and I were excited, ordered a bowl, and was highly let down. It came piping hot, looked good but, was very salty and didn't have a lot of flavor other than salt. I'm glad my server took it off the bill after he saw that I barely touched it. We checked in and earned a free appetizer which, we chose their spinach dip. It was okay but, I have no idea why the chef sprinkled parmesan cheese on top of the chips rather than bake it on top of the dip itself. We thought that was so odd. They give you way too many chips for the amount of dip they give you but, whatever, it was free. All of the food arrived separately,  with an excessive wait time in between. One particular waiter was walking around talking, joking with other employees, cursing outloud, and dropping the "F" bomb while we ate. We just looked at each other. We had no clue what his problem was. Now, for these amazing roast beef po boys...NOPE! I ordered my sandwich "undressed" and pickles on the side and they came with fries. I believe my sister's was dressed. However, both of ours was mostly all gravy bread. We looked at each other shocked. These things barely had any meat inside with some stray onion pieces in it. Their bread was fresh and good, though. Their gravy tasted like Franco American beef gravy from the can. I was so disappointed in this place. I could've made a better one at home. As I was leaving, I just looked annoyed at our talkative waiter. That entire meal should've been given away for free. Next time, I'll follow my first mind and go to Parkway Bakery, like before. Sadly, I will not be returning on my next trip.

Food was amazing everything tasted great and the building was clean with lots of character. service needs some help the waitress rarely checked on the table and was only helpful towards the end to get a free appetizer.

Great location on Royal and sits across from the LOUISIANA Supreme Court. Located in the old Torretchies restaurant this is a great place for visitors to soak in the FQ. 

Hostess and, servers are extremely nice and welcoming - check. Breakfast is overall good. However, food quality  was so so. Being a "real" southerner from south of I-10,  I can spot Quaker INSTANT GRITS  a mile off (so - to be fair -  they are instant or poorly prepared). Bacon was store bought something like Hornel. So you have an idea of food quality. Their Bloody Mary was pretty good. Overall wait staff and good drink might over power the so so ness of the cooks talents ( the cook gets 1 Star). I do understand that have a great red fish on their evening menu.

We stopped by mid afternoon. We had a small hungry spot. That means oysters! Despite the name here on Yelp, it is an Oyster house. We also got a plate of crab claws There's not a lot of meat on them, but they are very tasty. The default oysters are the larger generic, almost grilling oyster size. They were fresh and tasty. The french onion soup good. The service perfunctory. All, in all, exactly what we needed.

Not sure if they were having an off night, but I would definitely not recommend this place unless you have no other choice. The service was not good. Our server was nice enough, but we were seated right by the ice machine/ice storage chest and every single person that was getting ice out of the machine slammed it shut, which was loud and disturbing.  If just one person slammed that door shut, it could have been a mistake-but every single person slamming that stupid ice chest? That was not a mistake and it was just rude, loud, and disruptive. 

Moving on from that, the food was terrible. I ordered the BLT Oyster po-boy which is supposed to come with bacon, lettuce, and wait for it tomato (BLT). It got to the table without tomato and the French bread was stale and inedible. So I basically had fried oysters for dinner-it saved me the carbs I guess, but if I had just wanted fried oysters, I would have ordered fried oysters. Fries came with the dish and they were the best thing I had there. Fries should definitely not be the best thing you have on your plate at a place that calls themselves a seafood restaurant. So go, but order anything but the Po-boy and make sure you sit far away from the ice machines.

My sister, mom and I were in New Orleans for vacation and we came to Royal House twice.  Royal House has some of the best oysters, Pimms Cup, and service in the city.  I can't say enough good things about Royal House.  The staff is wonderful and the balcony is great for people watching.

First breakfast in NOLA so naturally both me and my friend go for the Crawfish benedict and sadly we were both dissapointed. Poached eggs were undercooked still showing some obvious clear egg white. The hollandaise had this clear color to it, showing it had been broken and not well prepared. The egg was served on a crawfish cake, similar to a crab cake, which was dry and off putting. We were expecting an english muffin with poached egg topped with crawfish chunks and that is not at all what we got. Also the service was incredibly slow. We waited and waited and waited. They brought us waters after waiting for ever with black particles floating in it, which I could smell that it was coffee grounds. But my bloody mary was awesome and so was the people watching. They have doors that open out to the street, so waiting there for our food was actually a pretty good experience. It was the food that killed it. i would not go back here again.

Service: Started off by having two waiters ask if we had been helped then said they would come back. Neither came back. We finally had to stop one to take our order for drinks after 7 min had passed. 
Food: most disappointing part. We ordered this trio that had classic New Orleans style food and it was my least favorite meal out of our entire trip. I would not recommend this dish no matter how tempting it is. 
The location is pretty awesome and place looked clean but I would not recommend this restaurant due to the service and the food.
Cindy with a C is the best bartender!! Great personality & service! She made our visit a delight! Ask for her!!!!!!!
Had better food for same pricing. I didn't care for the chargrilled oysters and shrimp boil was too salty. Go to redfish grill and ask for Ike to serve you much better food for Same price!
We came to NOLA for a conference and really enjoyed the Royal House.  We had the Blue Crab Claws, a shrimp Po Boy and the most delicious French onion soup!  Great food and great service.,

My first meal in New Orleans and Royal House did not disappoint! The shrimp were fresh and fried perfectly. Becky (my server) was attentive, friendly and checked on me often.


Bonus points for being located on a corner where you can people watch unnoticed.

We came here based on the number of reviews and high star rating. First off, our waitress was good. Great conversation and was helpful. The food and drinks were ok at best. One person started with the stuffed mushrooms, but they had to send them back. They indicated the flavors didn't blend well for the dish. They replaces it with the crab claws, which they thought were OK.  I ordered a side salad to start. It was small, nothing special. I ordered the bacon cheese burger (not a huge seafood fan). I ordered it medium well. It came out between rare and medium. Our waitress promptly took it back. It came out a few minutes later, with an extra piece of cheese and was well done. I also noticed that there was no bacon on the burger, and to top it off I realized that they added a few fresh fries to my plate but the rest of the fries were not hot. I think they were the same fries when they first brought out the under cooked burger. All in all, we weren't impressed with the food. Great location though, and there was a talented musician playing the guitar outside of the window, which we enjoyed.

Fantastic experience and the perfect last hurrah for our NOLA trip! Our server Tina was a gem and gave me the rundown on oyster eating without hesitation. She even let me sample a raw one just to get a feel for it! We'll definitely be coming back here the next time we're in town!

I took a group of 17 people here because the reviews said it was good for groups, had live music and the food was reasonably priced. What a disappointment. The carpet on the stairs to the upper floor where we were seated was filthy! The wait staff was inattentive and when we asked for another table to be added to our setting because we were so crammed together they were down right rude. It took almost an hour for our food to be delivered and it came out over a 20 minute period. Some were done eating before others even had their entree. The food was marginal and there was no live music.

OYSTERS & CRAB OH MY

First I'd like to say the service here is outstanding. I love southern hospitality here in NOLA!

Second a dozen fresh oysters for $16 is a dang deal! We pay almost double in LA so I was happy. 

Third their Dungeness crab appetizer thingy was DEEEWLICIOUS!!! It's like a buttery lemony creole broth that you just wanna swim in. The crab legs are tiny but you get plenty and really you just want that bread to soak it in. Ask for extra!

Great food! First visit to New Orleans and Royal House was highly recommended from several sources. Oran was our waiter and was very knowledgeable and had great suggestions... started with an oyster sampler (2 each of oysters Rockefeller, oysters Royale, and chargrilled oysters... AMAZING! Main course was the blackened redfish with lump crab topping... so good! Washed it down with a Makers 46 mint julip...  made for a perfect meal!

Arrived for the first time in NOLA and found this place just a block away from Bourbon Street. Nice relaxed room with good music choice and baseball on the TVs. Friendly service although it took a while for someone to take our order. Good menu of typical Louisiana dishes including alligator! We had po'boys which were great. Decent quality and good prices. Would definitely recommend.

This has become my favorite restaurant in the world, and I don't even live in Louisiana. They're shrimp tortellini is incredible, they're praline pie is the best dessert on earth, and they're eggplant parmesan is the perfect homey entree. You absolutely have to go here to eat if you are in the area. The staff is so friendly and the culture surrounding the restaurant is amazing.

First meal in NOLA and A+ for service and food!

Crab Claws ($13.50): even if you don't like crab legs, you MUST get this dish for that cajun sauce alone. Like, I would buy a bottle of that sauce to go if I could bring it back on the plane. Delicious, buttery, garlicky, creamy sauce that went so well with the bread slices made for dipping. Crab claws were super tiny and didn't soak much of the flavor, but damn, again, you're just here for the sauce. 

Chargrilled Oysters ($20 for dozen): whoaaaaaa! Cheesy, piping hot, salty and filled with herb goodness, you can't miss out on these either! The oysters itself were pretty tiny considering the size of the shells (some were almost palm sized!) but the "stuff" more than made up for it!

Taste of New Orleans ($18): this came with jambalaya, shrimp etouffee,  and gumbo. Least impressed with this, but glad that we got to knock down all three things in one plate! These rice dishes were the least salty, but something about the flavors were a little off to me, particularly the gumbo and etouffee. Just didn't like the seasoning used, I guess?
Food was delicious. Could use some updating in ambiance and décor, but staff was very polite. Good choice for traditional Cajun food at reasonable pricing.

A friend of mine recommended Royal House to me after coming here earlier this summer and I truly appreciate her for it! 

I came here by myself to grab lunch and ordered the chargrilled oysters, fried alligator, and blackened gulf shrimp and jambalaya- definitely way too much food for one person but oh boy was it worth it! I loved everything I ordered, but I loved the chargrilled oysters in particular. They are sooo flavorful.

If you have a chance to go- go! And get the chargrilled oysters while you're at it.
The food was so good. I had the shrimp tortellini and it was some of the best pasta I have ever had. Highly recommend

Hated the food.  Group of 5 ladies and we ordered the shrimp boil and some ordered the crab boil.  It was like they dropped a whole container of salt in the pot.  2 of the ladies order a side of green beans each and one of the dishes had red bell peppers and was served on a plate and the other one had onions served and in a bowl


Now the oysters were amazing.  We had them as an appetizer and after we sent our entrees back we just ordered more oysters.

They comped our bill but it just kind of ruined our night.

There service was good.  She was polite and accommodating and very apologetic about the food.
This place is amazing I ordered the crab claws, chargrilled oysters and  jambalaya every dish was perfect. I highly recommended it.
