My husband and I ate here during our honeymoon. We found the restaurant on yelp and the menu looked good. We got to the restaurant and they sent us upstairs. We were a little skeptical, but OMG!! It was AMAZING!!! The staff upstairs were so great! They were so busy, literally running around, but had great hospitality, great recommendations and the food was DELICIOUS! This was our favorite dinner during our trip and we will definitely come back to this place! I would also recommend sitting upstairs instead of downstairs, the vibe was so different (in a good way) upstairs!

Ordered the Redfish Beignets to start and I had the Shrimp Creole for my main. The beignets were interesting, a nice mix of sweet and salty... But the sweetness can become a bit much. 

The shrimp in my Shrimp Creole were a tad gritty. Super disappointed about that.. 

Service was attentive though.

Excellent bloody Mary's!!! Unfortunately the service was extremely slow. We came in and sat at the bar, wasn't very busy. Our bartender/server Cindy was a character... extremely talkative, opinionated, and forgot to put our order in and made a weird comment about going to burger king or something if we wanted fast food when we asked her how much longer it would take (because we were ready to leave). It took over 30 minutes for 6 oysters. Drinks and oysters tasted fantastic! But... extremely turned off by the service. Staff was bickering behind the bar, right in front of us... awkward.

Stopped in for a last plate of oysters just before leaving the city. Jeffery at the bar was great, shucking oysters like crazy barehanded. Food was all good.  Food that others ordered look d great as well.   Definitely worth checking out!

We came here for lunch because it has alot of reviews on yelp and wanted to try it out. customer service was amazing. Our waiter told us where we should go and what we can do in NOLA. Food was good but i think its kind of expensive. Would have preferred ACME over here.

I had never had Oysters Rockefeller before I ate here. Now, I want them for every meal. I had never had crawfish étouffée, gumbo, or jambalaya before I ate here. Now, I find myself trying to create meals that remind me of the great New Orleans cooking that I had at this restaurant. It's a solid restaurant that will take care of you while you are in New Orleans.

5 out of 5 in terms of service, wait time, and quality of the food. We came on a Thursday at noon and were seated right away. Make sure you ask for Gaynelle and Kayla! They were our very welcoming waitresses. We are from California and this was our first time in New Orleans so we were unfamiliar with southern cuisine. Thankfully they went thoroughly over the menu with us! We ended up ordering a dozen of the raw oysters, charbroiled, shrimp and grits, and the crab claws. Our favorite by far was the crab claws - the sauce was thick, creamy, and good enough to already start planning my next trip back.

This place is great! We are from out of town and wanted some great New Orleans food and this place delivered. We had a fabulous waitress, Becky G., that recommended the crab claws for an appetizer - they were awesome and the sauce was even better! For an entree we split the Taste of New Orleans so you got to try all the traditional dishes. Delicious. Great food and service! We'll be back again this trip!
Great Service. The baked oysters were delicious. Our waiter was very polite. You can hear the music outside. Not too noisy.
Got a balcony table and shrimp po-boys. The best NOLA experience!

The food was delicious!!! I had the crab pot and it was seasoned to perfection. Arrow seated us and was so kind. Rebecca was our waitress and made sure we did not need anything. I would come back to this place again!

We went there on Monday night and we order some appetizers which was mushroom filled with seafood and we were so disappointed with the food... plates were dirty and the place was not as we expected... food came early and there was a good service too but the food we got was po-boys... for dinner ...which I had  never taste a bad or worst food like this.. it was so horrible... even the fries and all the fried stuff was smelling so we had to make an to go and threw all the food after we came in hotel bcoz we didn't want to throw food just like there in restaurant bcoz we liked the service..I wouldn't recommend and would never ever return there....
Had an incredible meal! Gaynell, our waitress recommended the crab claws and my husband couldn't stop eating the sauce! Then we tried the jambalaya, ettouffee and gumbo! Delish!!
Ehh- it was just ok. I was expecting a lot more. I would not be in a rush to come back. There are better choices around the French Quarter

I'm surprised that this place has such high reviews. We sat upstairs, going up a flight of rickety stairs. We moved tables twice because both were dirty. Once they cleaned our tables, we had decent service, but the food was not the best I had in New Orleans. The oysters had so much stuff on them that they no longer tasted like oysters. Checked in with yelp to get the seafood stuffed mushrooms which were really good. The shrimp and grits was salty and would have tasted better with a garlic and lemon sauce.
food is amazing and so are the oysters, very hospitable! Ask for John smith...He is the best and knows his shit!!!

Stopped in for breakfast before a day touring the city,  wait staff was polite but forgot a few things on or order. Eggs were good and biscuits but the home fries tasted frozen not fresh. Average place for breakfast, maybe lunch and dinner is more of their specialty.

We sat at the bar, had very good service and great rum drinks. The chargrilled oysters were very good. The chicken and andouille gumbo was disappointing, $12 for a bowl with 2 pieces of sausage and a teaspoon of rice. My wife had the eggplant and chicken Parmesan, chicken was ice cold, eggplant was overcooked and pasta was just ok.

Amazing food, service and ambiance. I sat at the bar and ordered the Taste of New Orleans. I highly recommend ordering this since it is a sampler of 3 of the cities most famous dishes! It was hard to choose but I think my favorite was the Chicken & Andouille Jambalaya!

The worst experience we had in NO. There was a party of 5 and after a long wait our food came out. 3 in the party had there food cold. Literally could put your finger in the dish and not even warm. My mom had a cheeseburger and we told the waitress, who was great. Literally two minutes go by and the cheeseburger comes out again. The whole plate was just thrown in a microwave. It took several conversations to speak with the manager. After all this, all 3 ladies in our party ended up not eating dinner. Was a horrible experience
Great gumbo and crab claws! Terrific drinks- try the Hendricks Cup! A bit loud but it is NO!!

Have to give 1 star since I cannot give any. We were seated upstairs which was a nice view. Unfortunately, no one came over for the first 15 minutes. A waiter comes by and asks if we've been taken care of and is shocked when we say no so he said he'll take care of us and expedite our orders. We order and I'm not even joking, sat there for an HOUR with not a crumb in front of us. No one brought us any food. We asked the waiter when we finally saw him after 30 mins, he says oh they didn't bring it out?? I'll go check on it.... never saw him again. Finally at 45 minutes, one of our party members asks who we believe was a manager to check on our food and explains how ridiculous it is... we gave him a full 15 minutes before we got up and left because he never came out from the back. We had a tour (and allowed ourselves nearly 2 hours to wait and eat) and it was late at night so we had to stop to grab chips to hold us over. 
Food sounded good but I would never try again. I've actually never had to leave an establishment empty handed(or stomached) before.

Come here if you want to have a romantic dinner for two on the balcony at night. Crab claws were so delicious yet a bit on the salty side. I also had the crawfish ravioli and it was so creamy. They didn't skimp out on the crawfish!

Poor service and mediocre food. Cockroaches 

Okay. I decided to take a few days before writing this review. We were in Nola for three days after the LSU game. The place was nearly across the street from our hotel and always seemed to have a line during the dinner hours. It had a 4 star yelp rating so we decided to give it a go.  
We walked over and were told by the greeter there was only a 10 min wait despite the long line outside. We decided to forgo another reservation and wait. 
Well, ten minutes turned into forty. We were finally seated and when the waitress arrived, she let us know that she was having to be a server and runner. (Interestingly there was a 40 minute wait but there were three to four other open tables when we got to the upstairs dining room.) 
We ordered appetizers and waited, and waited some more. Apps arrived. Crab claws had good flavor but were tiny. Spinach dip was decent but only a handful of chips were supplied.  Dinner order was placed and we inquired about getting more chips.  Waitress said there would be a $2 charge which we said that was fine and ordered them.
After asking another server, and ours again, the chips were still not delivered. Our waitress brought them as we were nearing the end of our dinner. Then she seemed surprised we didn't want them anymore. 
About the time our entrees came is when we saw the first of FOUR COCKROACHES during our time at the restaurant. The first one was very large and crawling across the middle of the wall. I understand these buildings are old, but it was gross. At least three servers saw and kept on walking.  
The food itself was fair.  
We ordered: The Taste of New Orleans.  Bland, flavorless -essentially all dishes tasted the same,  the spinach salad - which was fine, the fried shrimp - quite small and dry which seemed either overcooked or not fresh, and the crawfish ravioli. That was probably the best item we tried.
We never got a water refill or a check back to see how everything was.  
In the men's room is where I saw two more cockroaches. One on the wall and another on the floor just cruising around. That was enough for me to want to get out of this place. On the way out we had one more cockroach sighting on the stairs. 
Food was mediocre at best. Service was poor. The place was gross and I will never go back.

We were so excited to go here! Great reviews awesome balcony.. what more could you ask for?

First of all seating was a breeze and we had the best view of the street below. Our waiter was on point took our drink order and food order promptly no problems there.

We ordered crab claws (thank you yelp checkin coupon), oysters charbroiled and the New Orleans sampler. The crab claws were delicious! We licked our plates clean!! The entrees left something to be desired. The oysters were overcooked and the rice has the right sauces but lacked all the goodies!

We left disappointed in the food but happy with the view and service. I would say this is an ok restaurant but not 4-5 yelp stars.

Because of the good reviews, my expectations coming in were pretty high. Especially after having my first meal in NOLA at Felix's. (I came to Royal House as a 2nd dinner)

We got the crab claws, jambalaya, stuffed mushroom, and fried oyster pasta. Every dish came out barely warm, looked like it has been sitting in the kitchen for a while. While the flavors are not bad, cheese was already hardened and solified when it got to the table. Oysters were small and mostly just batter. Other dishes had a weird tangy flavor to it. 

Good service but probably would skip this place.

We stumbled into Royal House late at night, while looking for a different restaurant and I'm glad it worked out the way it did. We had oyster beignets, French onion soup, chargrilled oysters and shrimp po'boys. The oyster beignets were a little weird, but in a good way and there was a pool of my newest obsession, Steen's Cane Syrup, at the bottom of the plate... sold. The chargrilled oysters were wonderful, much better than the ones I ate earlier at a neighboring restaurant. Our server was very nice and helpful in spite of the late hour and craziness going on around her, which I know isn't always easy to do.

Yeah, sorry but this is not a place I'd go back to for the reasons below:

- The quality of the food is lacking. It seems like because this restaurant stays open late, people that come here may be a little intoxicated so they wouldn't know if they were eating something good. So, the people that work here just whip up something real quick which would totally compromise the quality of the taste in the food.
- I was really hoping the bread pudding would be good since the pics I saw on Yelp looked good, but it was below average in overall taste. My hubs and I actually ended up not finishing it.
- The bathroom needs to be updated. It just doesn't have that "feng shui."
- In order to use their WiFi, you must provide your email addy.

On the flip side, I did LIKE:

- How you can get a free app by checking in on Yelp (details apply)
- They didn't give me a hard time for bringing in and keeping my large luggage inside.

Generally, I hate having food leftovers but here, everything was left unfinished and nothing was taken back home.

Nice place, cool atmosphere and good location. Came in on a Friday a little after noon. Got seated either away and greeting staff was very friendly. But the service was slow, almost picked up and left. 10 minutes before someone came over to see me, another 10 to get a single beer and food took another 35 minutes after that. People seated after me got food before me. Never understand that. I ordered oysters and so did they. I am watching them eat them as I write this sitting at a table void of any food.

Disappointed with the service, or lack there of.  Waited almost 30 minutes before drinks came and after dinner was done, waited another 30 minutes to get the check. Food was warm at most and rather bland. Save your money and go elsewhere; much better places in the area, I.e. the Gumbo Shop.

Well we went here because of all the reviews, but we were not impressed at all.  As we walked to our table the hostess asked who in our party of 8 had her tip and made it seem like she was doing us a favor sitting us even though the place wasn't busy.

After we sat down it took 10-15 minutes to have anyone come to our table.  After two servers went back and forth about who would get our table they finally took our drink order.  10-15 minutes later still no drinks.  We could see the bar, from our table, which wasn't busy.  

We ordered our food, which again took forever to come.  Food was mediocre at best.  I truly wouldn't recommend it for the service or the food.

My goto place in the French Quarter
I've been coming here for many years and it never gets old.  My kids have gone to college in Loyola and when I come up to see them we always go to the Royal.  The food is very good and the service outstanding.  The place is always packed but the line moves fast which doesn't make sense because there is no rush at the tables.   Try the gumbo and the shrimp tortellini amazing.   Be back soon!

Very good service (bartenders were extremely friendly and helpful) and food that you will enjoy till the last bite. Then you will want to walk around the French Quarter for awhile to work off the heavy seafood. It's Tucked away from the crowds of Bourbon Street and I highly recommend the crab claws. The shrimp tortellini was one of the heaviest dishes I've ever had, but damn it was good till the last drop of butter and cream.

Food was good but what really stood out was the service.  Our server was Teja (sp?) and she was the sweetest person we had encountered in 3 days here in NOLA (& NOLA people are nice).  Even the maitre d stopped by to be sure we were happy & ask if we needed anything.  Well done, ladies!

Two for atmosphere sitting on the second floor balcony. Gumbo was a bowl of rice. Kept going lower for the Gumbo but never found it. Server was nice and apologetic. Waited almost 30 mins for Oysters Rockefeller. They were good when they came. Not too rich. Prices were reasonable.

Excellent. The best gulf shrimp and crab. The desserts were the best... bread pudding, pecan pie and banana foster. And don't forget the BBQ oysters and alligator bites!!!! The service was outstanding..... Cici was the excellent
Ended up dining here twice on my trip to New Orleans because service and food was so good!

Service was great. Ada took care of us well.  The only problem was the food. I got the new Orleans sampler and a fried fish po boy.  They were just ok. Compared to the food we ate around the area, this place was just OK.

Great food but even better service by Ty!  We had pretty much every.  I don't eat seafood and Ty care of my entire border bit others enjoyed oysters and more.  Definitely recommend this place and Ty, Gumbo soup was very good.  French onion soup was great too.
John smith was our waiter who made us laugh and gave us great places to go see. To top it off the food was golden.

Service not so great. 

But food pretty good. Favorite were the chargrilled oysters soaked in butter and cheese. We tried the other options like Rockefeller, but they were not as good.

My wife and I visited the Royal House during our visit to NOLA. Top notch service and top notch food. We started with the crab claws which was the best dish I had the ENTIRE trip. I would have drank the sauce they came in- ask for extra bread! Then I had the shrimp and grits - another home run! Last the bread putting to put me down for the count. We loved the vibe and experience and will be back on our next visit

Two for atmosphere sitting on the second floor balcony. Gumbo was a bowl of rice. Kept going lower for the Gumbo but never found it. Server was nice and apologetic. Waited almost 30 mins for Oysters Rockefeller. They were good when they came. Not too rich. Prices were reasonable. 

Update to be clear. The atmosphere was great.

Just walked in for breakfast and sat at the bar. Jeffery was absolutely amazing. Food was excellent drinks were delicious will definitely be back this week for sure. Go in for a infamous Bloody Mary and make it a double

This place is pretty big and has 2 floors. Could easily seat large groups upstairs and has balcony seating. The atmosphere is loud. Our waiter was terrific, pleasant and efficient.  I had a blackened chicken sandwich ($13.50)Served with lettuce, tomato, red onions, pickles, mayonnaise and provolone cheese on a toasted multi-grain bun. There was nothing blackened about it and it was so dry and forgettable. Someone else at the table had oyster pasta ($21) Linguine pasta with spinach and mushrooms in a scampi sauce and topped with fried oysters and this was delicious.  The sauce wasn't heavy, with the right amount of seafood flavoring. I also ordered a mint julep and it was watery, flavorless and flat. Very disappointed with so many options in New Orleans,  I regretted eating here.

We found Royal House because it was close to where we were starting a tour and loved the looks of the menu. My friends got two different kinds of oysters and loved them! I shared a sampler with my other friend that had jambalaya, crawfish étouffée, and gumbo. The jambalaya and gumbo were lacking. Aside from that the service and drinks were great!

Chargrilled oysters on the half shell were awesome. 6/$12
Oysters Rockerfeller good but the oysters seemed overwhelmed by the generous topping - a bit too much 6/$14
Rib eye dinner with green beens and potatoes good $28 though we suspected it might not be actual really rib eye.  Serving of vegetables was a bit on the skimpy side.
This is my favorite place in the French Quarter for crab claws. DELICIOUS!!! The service is always great and the open widows/doors make for excellent people watching.

Last night we had the pleasure of dining at Royal House. The food was absolutely delicious but what really made the experience stand out was our fabulous server, Tina. She has the best personality and gave us the most fantastic recommendations. (We had the chargrilled oysters, seafood stuffed mushrooms, red fish, baked shrimp tortellini, and the blackened gulf shrimp & jambalaya. It was all AMAZING!!!) She took great care of us which made us leave anxious to return upon our next visit to New Orleans. The manager, Calvin, also stopped by our table and we gushed over the food and the service (Tina). Everything was wonderful!

We ate here last night and the food and service was spectacular!!! Our server Tina really made our experience here wonderful. She was a lot of fun and she gave us fabulous recommendations. The chargrilled oysters she recommended were to die for!!!!...and I'm normally not even an oyster person. Calvin the manager stopped by as well to see how our dinner was and he was great too. Loved everything about our dinner and we'll definitely be back to see Tina!
Delicious!!!!!! Our waitress was personable and attentive. Best bloody mart I've had!

I am torn about this review. The location is convenient. The staff was friendly. The oysters were on point. The Rockefeller super super good. The best one we had. The one with the Parmesan cheese and garlic was good but actually a bit too garlicky which is rare for me. This was our second fav. The seafood stuffed one was pretty eh. We got the New Orleans combo with the Étouffée , jambalaya and the gumbos gumbo was super soupy and not flavorful. The Étouffée of crawfish was very good. The jambalaya  was not that good either and it was served a bit cold. Honestly if I only had oysters and the crawfish Étouffée it would have been 4 stars.

The staff was very friendly and the food was good too. 

The chargrilled oysters were good .. I guess all Restaurant's have different flavors  but they all are good . 

Rest of the food was good too .. i got the deal from yelp yaay
This place only gets two stars for their staff. Top notch folks! The food is a hard no, unless you love your oysters over cooked, over salted and over priced. Over it.

Needed my fill of Etouffee and this place did a great job. Cool venue as they have space downstairs, upstairs, and balcony. Service was a bit slow but was nice to enjoy the night. 
Free appetizer with purchase of 2 entrees via Yelp check in so has to take advantage of that. Got the spinach dip which was great!
Then for my entree for the Crawfish Etouffee which was accompanied with bread and little fried crawfish which added a nice crunchy bite. Definitely hit the spot! Recommend checking it out!

Great app eh entree good desert. We got the crab claws. Would like more bread for dipping. The poyboys didn't have any sauce or mayo on them, kinda disappointed nothing special. We got the brownie almode that was good. Overall good service

So let me start off by saying, I almost felt compelled to write a review because it was such a BIZARRE EXPERIENCE. If you check on my profile I usually only leave reviews if I give the business 5 stars, so this review is my first "bad" one since joining Yelp. Let me just say, my BF and I are from Los Angeles and this is MY first time visiting NOLA and my BFs second time. Since we've gotten here I've been pleasantly surprised with how good the food is this town (staying in the french quarter). 

HOWEVER...last nights experience was our first "bad" dining experience since arriving here in NOLA. Had to happened sometime....its been 3 days after all. 
SOOO first, let me just say that I'm not here to bash anyone. I completely understand that waiters/waitresses/bartenders (and so on)  are people with real emotions and are imperfect! Yes, I get that, believe me. The criticism I have, isnt so much with how the waitstaff treated the customers....its more so the lack of professionalism towards each other IN FRONT of the customers. 

From what I could gather while listening to the wait staff complain to one another.... the hostess began telling customers that there was only room at the bar and sat pretty much every patron that entered the restaurant after 10pm at the bar. THIS PISSED THE BARTENDER OFF. He was clearly upset and even walked out of the restaurant at one point (don't worry,  he came back).  Buuuut to his credit...he did remain "polite" to the customers at the bar. It honestly just made us feel VERY uncomfortable. Like he literally tossed a bill book at a bunch of dishes almost causing them to fall into the floor. 
Since we already ordered we were kind of compelled to stay....afterall, the reviews of the food seemed great. And I will put this out there.... the bartender didn't seem like he was receiving any help from the other wait staff.... who were trying to "close out" their sections. 

Let me give another example as to how "unprofessional" the staff was while we were there. A waitress was clearly having issues with one of the men behind the bar. I guess she asked him a question (which I didn't hear) and when he proceeded to give her attitude...she responded with "BITCH I JUST ASKED YOU A SIMPLE QUESTION". I could see the patrons at the bars' reactions because of the big mirror pointed at them. Dear God it was getting super awkward at this point (still hadn't recieved food.) And yes,  the wait staff continuously spoke very hostile to each other...over patrons shoulders... during our stay. 

FINALLY THE FOOD COMES. And its ridiculously disappointing.  We got oysters (since it's an oyster bar) and I couldn't eat more than one.  It had the fishy-est taste....I pulled like 3 small pieces of shell out off my mouth,  and the breading on top had a mushy and  gooey texture (not baked to perfection like the menu described). And no,  GOOD oysters do not have an overtly fishy taste, especially if they've been cooked.

My fried shrimp platter tastes fishy as well.  The fries were good, but then again,  they're fries.... you really cant mess those up.  My BF got the tortellini,  which looked overly oily and tasted.....I guess cheap..... would be the best way of putting it.  

Our meal was over $70 and of course I left a 15% tip because I find it extremely unclassy to leave anything less.... the wait staff depends on good tips people!!! Remember that.  Unless they straight up spit in your food in front of you,  please dont leave the waitstaff nothing. But I digress....

Overall,  I can look past an "ehh" tasting meal.... but dealing with a VERY hostile wait staff,  made the whole experience pretty bad.  Like I said,  I know we all have our bad days,  but when you work in the customer service industry,  it's best not to let EVERYONE you're "serving" blatantly be able to tell your having a freaking terrible day.  

The curse of the Yelp expectation....I thought this was gonna be another great restaurant on me and my BFs trip,  but is the worst place we've gone to since getting here. Hopefully if you choose to go,  the wait staff has patched stuff up!

Ps: the reasoning for 2 stars instead of 1 is because I really don't wanna mess up the restaurant's rating and a 1 star review does.  Like I said in the beginning,  I just wanted to share my story not hate on the staff.
Classy 5 star food and service from our server Robert S. ! The venue is gorgeous and the food was tongue tickling Southern fare. Royal House is a must for all who visit NOLA.

As soon I drop my luggage at the hotel, Royal House is always my first stop in New Orleans.  Grab a seat at the bar and order the grilled oysters along with a drink.  It's heaven!  The staff are friendly and informative on New Orleans news.  Honestly one of my favorites going on 10 plus years.

Honestly the best oysters we've had in New Orleans in a long time! Had the oyster combo and crawfish ravioli plus the fried oysters and shrimp! All were absolutely amazing! The carnival margarita was refreshing as well!

Everything was amazing about this place. The design, the service, the food! The chargrilled oysters were amazing!!!! This is my first time in New Orleans and I know there's so much incredible restaurants but I honestly want to eat here again before I leave. Seriously one of my top favorite restaurants ever.

Edit: We went back and ate here a second time for our last dinner in Nola lol. Our server was the best (I wish I could remember her name) and food was again spectacular. 10/10.

This place...I am still thinking about it and the French onion soup.  The staff was great. Upbeat and having fun. Not because they were at their job but because that is the type of people they are.  All of the New Orleans people. The food was out of this world.  The wine suggestion turned out to be one of my favorite ever.  Thank you for great food and fun.
The oysters were amazing! I wish we would have ate more of them! The only think I didn't like was the French fries but that isn't what we came for! The bacon oyster po boy was really good!
Delicious! Great stop for lunch. Friendly staff and just the right size to keep a lunch intimate yet casual.

Really good red beans with andouille sausage here! The fried chicken added was fantastic  
Lots of good people watching if you sit at one of the tables right near the street! Haha we sat under one of the air conditioning units which had a periodic water drip but it wasn't a big deal (if you're a fussy person though you might not like that part....
Tina was our server and she was great! Very friendly and everything we could have hoped for! 
Oh ps, the spinach dip is worth ordering as well if you want an appetizer and you're not into seafood like me!

We stopped by  the Royal House on our last day in New Orleans. We were lucky that we missed the lunch rush and we were able to get a small corner table by the window. We ordered a fried shrimp plate, French onion soup, and a seafood jambalaya. The soup was very good. The shrimp was ok, the hush puppies were hard and cold. The seafood pasta over rice looked about average. We've had better.

Service was very good. There are better places to eat in New Orleans, and we probably will not head back here.

A few days in New Orleans and on Halloween my girl and I decided to stop here to eat. The food was delicious!! I had snow crab and she had the steak. This place is for people who like seafood and those who don't. The service was fantastic as well!! Our waitress was IT!

We went to this place for dinner last night. We were disgusted at the staff. There was a guy coming from the kitchen delivering food and he was sweating a lot and I watched him wipe his face with his hands then bring food to tables. Fortunately he didn't deliver ours. My husband saw a separate employee pull plastic off of some unopened hot sauce with her teeth while setting a large group table. The food we had was not bad and the place was adorable upstairs but I could not advise you to go with the way the staff does not care about foos safety.

This was terrible. I have had amazing food in NOLA but, in desperation, we stopped here bc we were starving. It's basically the TGIFridays of New Orleans. The stuffed mushrooms were frozen and filled with breadcrumbs not crab as described- inedible. The charbroiled oysters were suspect and the crab claws were laughable. 
The service was terrible. Never asked to refill our drinks and only saw him at the end to pay our bill. Complete tourist trap.

Friendly and fast service. My parents and I ordered The Taste of New Orleans, Crab Claws, Fried Aligator, and the Roast Beef Po Boy. The Fried Aligator and Po Boy were okay, but I really loved the Taste of New Orleans. You get a sample of two different gumbos and jambalaya. The Crab Claws are very delicious and the sauce goes with everything.
The crawfish ravioli and the blackened redfish were the best!! I'd pass on the shrimp and grits if I were you though. But don't miss dessert! The butter pecan pie was divine!!

Poor service and food quality. My son's fried shrimp and French fries were the best out of everything we ordered. I've had better chicken and andouille gumbo elsewhere. The fried alligator was over priced (very few for the price), over cooked, and tough. The crab claws were horrible...the sauce was terrible and the crab claws were tiny.

Stopped by thanks to yelp and sat in Ada's table; who was great server!! We had the oysters and crab legs as starters and my boyfriend had the alligator po boy (not pictured-he said the alligator meat was okay; super chewy which wasn't the restaurant's fault) and I had the french onion soup as my entree (which was the whole reason I chose this restaurant) and it was AMAZING.

After a long day of shopping on Royal we were super parched.

We popped in and grabbed a seat at the busy bar. 

Pricey drinks but fun to sit at the bar and chat with the oyster shucker. Super nice guy, he has been shuckin en for 20 years!

We split the spinach and artichoke appetizer which was good.

Would love to come back next time we are in town and check out their dinner menu. They also had happy hour but it didn't start until 4pm
Food was good.  Nice ambiance.  Service just wasn't there.  Waitress was nice but seemed like the whole place was a bit disorganized.  Not sure I would recommend based on service alone.

A great place for breakfast on the weekends, as they don't serve breakfast during the week. You can actually get breakfast for under $10 which is nearly impossible in the French Quarter! Jeffrey, who is an awesome server here, is usually behind the bar shucking oysters and talking with the customers. I've heard nothing but great things about the rest of the menu, but I've only had breakfast here.

I visited the restaurant this past weekend with a friend from out of town. The food was delicious and I love the atmosphere. The only reason why I gave the restaurant 3 stars opposed to 4 was because I received "dirty" oysters when I ordered the charbroiled oysters. They were delicious to eat however it is a turn off and ick factor to see barnacles and baby oysters still stuck to the outer shell. There where so many that I ended up trading plates with my friend at the table because I was grossed out. 

The crawfish ravioli was amazing and flavorful. The drinks were well crafted as well as both tasty and visually appealing.  I will surly go back again, but will most likely no longer order the oysters.

Four stars is way overrated for this place. There was nothing bad - the food was OK but  just OK. It is a relatively convenient and comfortable spot but very lackluster nothing was great. Our server was very friendly and efficient although the food was very slow at a time when they weren't that busy. All of the staples like gumbo jambalaya crawfish étouffée were just passable. There are much better options close by but this would suffice in a pinch.

You know , I wanted to like this place more than I did but just couldn't. The food was ok. Not great as I expected by the rating.. nice waitress but she charged my BF for two beers and he only drank one. Didn't catch that til later when looking at our receipt.. it's only $8 but how can u make that kind of mistake for someone that only drank 1.  Hmmm wonder how often that happens here ... u can find a better place in the vicinity

Amazing food  

Despite the fact that our order got lost and the food came out an hour later .. the meal was superb! I recommend ordering the crab claws and shrimp tortellini!

Great taste but not good cooks in the on the night shift. My waiter walked past me three times before she attended to us. I got sum dry lumpy artichoke dip, raw hamburger and some nasty ole shrimp and jambalaya crap

This was my first time  in New Orleans. And I will say I am very impressed by the food and ambiance here . It has the southern feel but still upscale . I walked in clueless as to what I was gonna order and our sever DELL was so helpful . She gave me tons of recommendations and the ins and outs of the menu. She was so sweet and super attentive to us . I didn't even choose a single thing on the menu, I let her choose all the dishes and every single one was amazing . Highly recommend if you want something in the heart of New Orleans but still want to be away from the crowds. Dell thank you so much for the amazing experience and service and making our first time in New Orleans extra special .

A must if you're in New Orleans. Our server, Dell, was the absolute best! Every dish she recommended was on point! The place is quaint, the service is 5 stars, and the food is one of a kind! Stop by..you won't be disappointed! Ask for our girl Dell!
Joel and Jessica were such delightful bartenders! Made sure we felt right at home! Will come back!
I had an amazing experience here. Joel and Jessica were amazing bartenders especially loved their humor! Will definitely come again!

During my visit to New Orleans, my mom and I came to this restaurant for dinner one evening. We waited outside for about 10 minutes until we were seated.  It was nice because they have a heater to keep you warm. We were seated upstairs which is kind of inconvenient especially because the stairs are very steep and my mom has a hard time walking. We ordered some drinks to start with and also some fresh oysters. For dinner I ordered French onion soup and a chicken Caesar salad. Everything was very good and the waitress was also very nice.

We came on a Sunday between 11-12pm for lunch craving fried oysters. It was a great experience.

There was no wait and we sat at the bar. The bartender was pleasant and helpful and told us there's a side of fried oysters available not listed on the menu ($8). We were also able to use the free app yelp checkin coupon on the oysters!

We got the taste of New Orleans and shrimp and grits entrees. The oysters were amazing and well-worth getting. If both entrees were as good as the oysters, it would definitely be 5 stars. The food was still satisfying and delicious. It was nice getting three different flavors in the one meal.

Intimate dinner with impeccable service. The staff was very friendly and the food was perfect. We ordered the grilled oysters to share and I had the shrimp and grits entree which was surprisingly super filling and very delicious. Would recommend this restaurant if you are in the area. :)

Finding really good food in a very touristy area is tough to find and I must say that not everything at the Royal House was amazing but we had such a great meal overall that it deserved 5 stars.  It's a casual place with all the staples, oyster bar, and plenty of cocktails.  Lots of attentive staff (though not the most knowledgable about wine) and our server may or may not have given us a free mint julep;). 

the outstanding dishes at the table were the crawfish ravioli, étouffée, and the jambalaya.

OMG! This place was absolutely perfect in every way!

Tina was our server and she was absolutely fantastic! All of her recommendations were spot on. We started off with Crab Claws that I could literally just keep eating with some bread and that sauce... Yummm! The chargrilled oysters were out of this world, too. I got the Snow Crab as my entree and my wife ordered the Blackened Redfish with crab meat and butter on top... And that dish was the highlight! OMG so good! The only complaint I really had was with the snow crab being a bit salty. I didn't have an issue finishing it as it was still really good. The manager stopped by our table, I believe his name was Emile, and he was  an absolute charm. He spoke with us about our stay and brought up the Snow Crab. I told him we would be okay with finishing them as they were still good and his response was "Well, we need you to be better than just okay." That alone deserves 5 stars! I couldn't believe how accommodating and nice the staff were while we were there. You can tell that they really enjoy working there and you can also see how well the management works with them. Emile got a new snow crab boiled for us that weren't as salty and they were  perfect!

This is a must stop restaurant if you're in New Orleans! We'll definitely be back

Brittany was amazing. All the recommendations. The suggestions for things to do in the area. And the ideas for our following morning breakfast. If you want an authentic creole experience visiting New Orleans come here and request Brittany.

Brittany is the bomb!!! Please come see her,
I have NEVER had a better experience!  She's a sweetheart and knows her stuff. Definitely recommend!!!

We had a really good experience. We started with the Redfish Beignets and it was not what we expected. As I expected a flaky puffy fish cake it was actually battered fish. It did have a good taste though. Hubby got Raw and Chargrilled Oysters, they were good but we had better in other places. But I hit the Crawfish Ravioli (because they don't have Crawfish Etouffee) but I was not disappointed. Theses pillows of ricotta and seafood pasta are covered in a creamy and decadent creole tomatoes and cream sauce. It was like nothing I ever had but I was so happy I had ordered it. 
Great , friendly service from everyone we encountered. Definitely a place to visit. And when you do, sit up stairs and on the porch if weather permits and just enjoy.
The ramen was fantastic (so many layers of flavors). Probably some of the best calamari I've had (lightly fried with a delicious spicy mayo).

This is the BEST place! The food is delicious, view on the balcony is heavenly, Dacia our waitress is absolutely the best!
1. French soup is perfectly salted, onion to cheese and bread ratio is spot on

2. Crab claws appetizer is delicious, we asked for more bread just so we can get every drop of sauce. 

3. And for the main course CHARBROILED OYSTERS! Make sure to order a dozen, garlic sauce and char flavor are to die from. 

I recommend this restaurant! Make sure to ask for Dacia, she will make sure you have the best service!
The balcony is cool except that you feel like it might break at any moment. Service is alright. Food is akin to what you might get at red lobster. Well drinks are $11. Not worth it.

Terrible service. Food was like eating at Chili's.  Oyster platter was crap for $24.50. Overcharged for 8oz gin and tonic when specialty cocktails were about the same. Never again! Making sure our friends don't ever visit this spot.

This place was recommended while visiting Nola...but it wasn't THAT great haha. The staff was nice. The hostess let us choose where we wanted to sit. The staff is dressed in black and white but the customers could still be casual. We ordered the redfish beignets, crawfish ravioli, fried alligator bites, jambalaya, hush puppies, and red beans & rice. Everything was presented very nicely.

The redfish beignets were recommended by our waiter because I don't eat pork and the oysters rockefeller has bacon in it. They tasted like sweet fish sticks. The ravioli has A LOT of sauce that was too rich to eat without more noodles or bread...so I just left about 3-4 tablespoons of it in the bowl. The jambalaya and red beans & rice did not have a lot of flavor. We ended up putting black pepper and hot sauce into the plate to make it edible...

Amazing traditional New Orleans fare in the quarter. We sat at the bar upstairs and we waited on by the delightful Ceci. On her recommendation we had the crab claws appetizer, followed by the shrimp tortellini. The crab claws were one of the best appetizers we have had in town! An absolute must try if you are here.  The tortellini put us in a coma.  5 stars.

Chargrilled oysters and gumbo  were great!  The bacon and oyster po boy was good but be warned there is a definite kick in the aoli... also the French fries were delicious and pickled green beans in our Bloody Mary were delicious ... I could literally eat an entire jar!
Fantastic food! Great service! My fave place to come when I'm in town! All the NOLA classics are  so good here. Not a fan of oysters but my friends say they're delish

Amazing dessert, great prices, quiet balcony view, this place has it all. The service was amazing, so friendly and welcoming. The food is incredible and was the perfect end to my NOLA trip. Highly recommend the oysters, so fresh!

Good food, though it was brunch menu and not a ton of options for non-breakfast food. There was a crowd when we arrived with and some confusion with the host who was trying to seat a very large party and ignored everyone else entering the restaurant. I quickly went to Open Table and booked a spot just so we would have a place in line and then we got seated quickly -- so I would recommend doing that before you show up just in case it's busy. The food was good, though I'd like more variety or the option to order off the lunch menu. Our server was fantastic. Only one restroom so there was quite a wait, especially with a lot of customers that have been drinking all day.

The food here is amazing! Fish platter was spot on, nice tender and juicy. Taste of New Orleans came with three bowls that were packed with flavor. Definitely recommend this place, especially sitting out on the balcony enjoying the view of the French quarter. Service was great, nice friendly staff.
Found this place on yelp upon arrival to NOLA. May I say it did NOT disappoint! Our waitress was friendly and food.. delicious. Would come back again!

I have to say I was expecting more from what others stated.  Our service was absolutely horrible.  Food came out at different times, had to hunt down my appetizer and my bill was wrong.  There are many places to choose from and I would look elsewhere next time I'm in town.
The food and the service here was GREAT! My server was Dacia and she went above and beyond to make sure that we were taken care of!

Recently moved to the French Quarter, I am trying out a different restaurant when family comes to visit.  Very friendly at the front door to get you in, but very disappointed.  Food was ok not great. Service was lousy.  I had to ask for bread twice (already finished my meal before bread arrived) then was charged for bread. Our waitress was chatting with another worker the entire time. Crossed off the list.

My husband and I came for dinner around 5pm and it hadn't quite gotten busy, but it took a little bit for a server to come to our table (it appeared there was confusion on who our server was), but when we finally ordered our server was great! It was a fun environment to be in as things began to pick up.
I ordered the Shrimp and Grits and he ordered the Redfish. Both were tasty but nothing special about my dish. The Redfish was phenomenal!
Thoroughly enjoyed our food there and Genelle (spelling?), our waitress was super attentive. We would come back! Get the bottle of Prosecco. Such a good deal.
Open on Thanksgiving Day, which was great. However, chargrilled oysters were very overcooked and had to pry them off the shell with my fork.
Great food to die for! We ordered charbroiled oysters, seafood Pescatore, and reddish beignets. Every dish was amazing. We wish we could've had more bread and pasta to dipthe sauce.

First of all, yes I'm a tourist in New Orleans, but I my family's culture is Creole and for generations from New Orleans. I don't usually write reviews but I did for this one because I originally decided to go here because of the decent reviews and I want to right the wrongs lol. 

This was by far the worst dining experience I've had in New Orleans. So many of the waiters clearly gave no fucks about spilling drinks and food ALL over the tables and floors and barely cleaning it up. We had to get up to ask for water multiple times, ask for utensils, ask for pens to sign the check... 

And the food I'm fairly positive was taken out off the freezer section of a store and heated in a microwave. It definitely was not freshly made. Embarrassing to go here,  even as a drunk tourist.

(Note: I went near Halloween 2019)

This place!! We were there midday (2ish) on a Friday. Service was pleasurable and attentive! My drink stayed full, even without a prompt. The charbroiled oysters were nothing short of amazing. A dish I order anytime a menu offers, however, Royal has it figured out!! The crawfish ravioli was truly amazing. The dish was true to the NOLA creole taste with lots of flavor and sass. My mouth is watering now thinking about it. We can't wait to go back.

Stopped by here because of the convenient location and bar, it's right in the heart of French Quarter by Jackson Square.  Their Chargrilled oysters are always excellent and it's a good place for a drink or 2, The staff is very friendly and easy going, I never feel like I'm in a rush or anything.  Sat at the tables for a quick meal, had the oysters chargrilled and oysters Royale.  We also got the cheeseburgers which came with fries and also ordered a side of the oyster butter which I remembered from the last time I was here which I put on the ribeye and is basically like crack as sauces go.  Also got the bread pudding which is one my favorites in the area.  

Good place to stop by, haven't had anything bad here yet. The crab claws too are excellent and is worth a stop for.
We stopped to try based on reviews.  Tried the fried gulf shrimp platter and wasn't impressed or satisfied.

I have had the good fortune of traveling to NOLA several times over the years. Royal House is one of my favorite spots. Beyond the very good food, it has a unique atmosphere and location in my opinion. The reason I say this is because it can be a great spot to grab a drink or it can double as a nice restaurant.  The don't take reservations, so plan accordingly.  If possible for dinner, request upstairs.  It is especially neat with they have the windows and doors open.

Recommendations for food:

Char-gilled Oysters: Excellent appetizers and a must when in NOLA.

Red Beans and Rice with Andouille Sausage: By far my favorite on the menu. It has some small breaded chicken strips as well that are amazing!

Taste of New Orleans: Yes, you can get this at nearly all the staple restaurants of NOLA.  However, in my opinion Royal House has one of the best representations of this dish.

I don't have really anything negative to say.  The only reason not to give it a 5 star is a "feeling".  Nothing bad to say. 

Bon appétit Yelpers!

Phenomenal food and a great view if you sit on the balcony! Their food is fresh and reasonably priced! Also, their customer service was astounding. I will definitely be back when I visit New Orleans again.

Walking the French quarter and decided to drop in for a late night dinner. We were greeted at the door, and seated quickly- no wait. The service was great, super friendly and quick to take our drink order. 

I ordered a Bloody Mary, the vodka is in a vessel on the counter steeping with olives and sun dried tomatoes- it was delicious! My friend ordered the hurricane, sweet but he had to try a staple of New Orleans. We started with the alligator and the charbroiled oysters. Both equally delicious, I definitely preferred the oysters to the alligator but I've had alligator before, and it's like fried chicken. For our entrees we had the sampler which came with a trio of soups and I ordered the shrimp po boi. The trio was good, a lot of rice, so very filling. And the the sandwich was delicious with perfectly fried shrimp, just lacked some sauce. I should of ask for tartar sauce. But came with fries, and on the sandwich itself lettuce, tomatoes and pickles. 

I'd stop in again, good food, friendly staff and super fast service! Win in my book!
No wait and the food was amazing! Our waitress Brittany was awesome! She made great food recommendations and even gave us a list of other places to go to.

Two nights in a row. Had the Oyster BLT poboy. Scazeracs spot on good. Oysters BLT poboy off the hook. Here are my dings. Sandwich = awesome, battered fries served two nights in a row room temperature. French onion soup nice presentation but crock half empty instead of flowing over. ( over salted as well imop) NOLA blonde beer = happiness. Second night the sandwich was 3/4 the size the night before. 

Bar staff awesome and engaging. 

Good joint just lacking a bit on the quality control. Keep up the good work

Our experience began when our group was greeted by the waitress named Gaynell. The service she provided was next level. Our group is from So Cal so we hadn't had service like this in the 2 days we have been in New Orleans. As a Manufacturing Manager, I fully understand the value in frontline people and Gaynell is a valuable employee. She not only knows her product line but offered us suggestions that made our visit exceptional. The food was phenomenal and I would highly recommend anyone to go and enjoy an experience and atmosphere and not just an amazing meal. All the staff was very pleasant and supportive but Gaynell ran the show for our table. I fully enjoyed everything and look forward to my next visit to try a new dish. 

To the Royal house management, Gaynell is an valuable employee and I strongly suggest you take care of this gem for the benefit of your business. And lastly to Gaynell, I cannot thank you enough for your pleasant smile and hospitality. You were awesome girl.

Such a great place! Our waiter was top notch! Forgot his name but he was great. First time to try oysters. We tried char boiled oyster which was the best part of the meal! Drinks very good! Crawfish ettoufee was so good!
The food and service were both above and beyond anything we expected.  We also had a nice view, while eating on the balcony.   You must order the charbroiled oysters!   They were amazing!

I wish I could leave a review of my meal, but after an hour, I still haven't gotten it. My friend ordered chicken Caesar salad with chicken that somehow was rubbery yet hard on the ends. Of all the tables, only 8 had some type of food (oysters, appetizer or meal). Update: the waiter & I had a "miscommunication" about my meal (I ordered an entree without rice), so I got nothing instead. Truly terrible experience. The manager comped my friend's meal and said it was an unusual night. In New Orleans' French Quarter? (I thought all the nights were unusual there.) Maybe it was an unusual night for them, but since it was my only night there, I will never know.

If you want glorified TGIF or similar, go here. Be fiscally dumb and spend $20+ on subpar mediocre food which uses the lowest quality ingredients while "appearing upscale". Typical tourist place. Crap crap crap. Spend a little more and go to chef based restaurants. This place was formulated and gross. Definitely a place that appeals to the masses.

I was really looking forward to this meal as the menu and pictures sold me on what they had to offer. Unfortunately, I was extremely disappointed.  Here's what I ordered:

Crab Claws: the pictures I saw associated with this meal showed large, beautifully juicy looking claws in a buttery sauce. What I received (pictures attached) was more like pinsers which were many bone with little meat. It was drenched in a creamy-sour sauce that reminded me of an over-spiced (yes, it's possible) thousand island dressing.

Cup of gumbo: I was really looking forward to a good cup of gumbo in NOLA. It was just ok. First of all, it came out lukewarm.Little to no flavor and a much more watery consistency than I am used to when it comes to gumbo. The gumbo itself wasn't bad actually, just not what I look for in gumbo.

Shrimp n Grits: again, The flavor was ok but not amazing. The grits seemed slightly undercooked to me, and the flavor was really overpowered by an overwhelming amount of Rosemary. The shrimp was well cooked and probably the best part of the dish. This dish also came out cold and I am not one to send things back AT ALL, but I had to request them reheat it. 

I think I may have come here on an off night because they have excellent reviews and some of their other pictures really looked great but unfortunately I can't strongly recommend eating here.

We did receive a complimentary bread pudding which was accidentally brought to our table before our meal which was delicious!

Just okay. They had all the typical NOLA staples..like I said though everything was just okay. The gator app was pretty tough and chewy and not seasoned very well. Our server Monica was amazing though. My blackened reddish was tasty...a bit over cooked but most fish at restaurants are. The zucchini and potatoes were delicious. My husband got the shrimp po boy. The bread was great. Again lacked seasoning. Was just okay. Will probably try somewhere else next time in NOLA.

After walking around and exploring the French Quarter, the bf suggested we stop somewhere and have a bite to eat.  Royal House was on my list for their chargrilled oysters and it just so happens we were walking by. 

We decided to sit at the bar and have a few drinks.  Jeffrey greeted us with a few food and drink suggestions which we ordered:
*Crab Claws ($13.50) - Amazing and a must order!  Tiny crab claws are served in a lemon garlic butter sauce and served with a few pieces of bread to soak up the sauce.   The crab claws were already cracked so it made it very easy to eat. This was the bf's favorite dish of the trip.
*Half dozen chargrilled oysters ($12) - So fresh and delicious!  Grilled oysters are topped with parmesan cheese and butter and served on a half shell.  My only gripe was that a few of the oysters were still a little sandy.  

Jeffrey was nice and welcoming.  He made sure we were situated with everything we needed.  The only downside was that they decided to clear one of the clogged pipes from the sand of the oysters which created a not so pleasant smell.  Definitely ruined the mood.

WHAT TO KNOW:
*Full bar
*Table or bar seating
*Extensive menu to please everyone with seafood, poboys, boiler pots, soups, salads and appetizers - even a few options for vegetarians

We had a fairly large group but the hostess hooked us up instead of splitting us up. Excellent service. It was my first time ever having oysters and they were great!! The fried alligator was good. The crab claws were even better and whatever sauce they came in was to die for!! We were all dipping our bread and our food into the leftover sauce. I'd come back just for that sauce alone! Overall great visit
Worst. Oysters. Ever! They were not even washed. Totally filthy and not cold. This place is a total tourist trap. If u want good oysters do to ACme instead
Awful food, loud atmosphere. The food is COVERED in cheese. I pulled about a half pound of cheese off my ravioli. KISS- keep it simple st*pid!
Good restaurant in a great location.  The gumbo was amazing, sand which was decent, but have had better in the town.

Do not skip this gem! The spinach dip, French onion soup, and shrimp poboy were all top notch. I had to pull myself away from the food before I had to be rolled out. Tierra was the best server we've had in a very long time. A big easy 5 stars, might come back tomorrow.

Wife and I went on a Saturday night after 7:30. There was a line out the door but we spotted seats at the bar and walked right up and sat down. Ordered a couple drinks and some apps. Ordered the crab claws and a half dozen raw oysters. For dinner my wife ordered the seafood tortellini and I ordered the mahi mahi but the bartender recommended the redfish and said I wouldn't be disappointed. The crab claws were good. My wife's tortellini was very good. The redfish was very good as well and I was not disappointed. The potatoes that came with them were my favorite parts. For dessert we ordered their version of a pecan pie. It was different. I never received the oysters and no one would stop long enough for us to ask. Couldn't even use the coupon for a free app offered by Yelp for checking in. Food was food service not so much
This place had always been our go to when in New Orleans however the food and service has gone way down hill unfortunately we will never go back

Yum !! This place is a must try when in Nola!! We ordered the taste of New Orleans which is perfect if your looking to try a little of everything. We also order the shrimp po boy and it surprisingly light and super fresh. The star of the show was our free appetizer we got for checking on Yelp, which was the crab claws. Sweet, meaty and the sauce would taste good in anything. Our server 
Becky G was super friendly and guided us on what to try!!! We will definitely try this place when we come again.
Our waitress Ada took very good care of us and made sure everything was to our liking. Thank you Royal house for providing us with a fantastic meal with a great waitress.

Decent food horrible service. Don't come hungry bc I did and I left even hungrier. There were about two total shrimp in my creole. Portion sizes were embarrassing for the price of the food. my wife's pecan crusted Mahi mahi tastEd like store bought frozen tilapia. My daughters po boy looked like a stale subway sandwich. Additionally, the waiter never checked on us and didn't come back when we said we wanted dessert. For being called the royal house, I felt as my experience was peasant like and not regal at all.

My po-boy made me feel like a POOR BOY, the dry crusty bread was disgusting and the shrimp gave me stomach pains for hours. Don't go here unless you are you tired of your local food bank and want to pay $20 for worse food. Also, our server never checked on us and literally left empty water and waiting checks, VERY disappointed.

I was having a serious craving for hush puppies and this place did not disappoint. I had a deep fried fish po boy. It was okay just due to the proportions. If they added a thicker fish it would be a lot better. They were super accommodating with strollers and very kid friendly!
Our server brittany was a very attentive waitress, the alligator apps were to die for as well as the fruity cocktail drinks. Come here if you want great service.

The service was good. The food was pretty good, but nothing to rave about. Overall, it was a nice experience and the restaurant has a very nice atmosphere. The food was a little expensive for what it was but it was good. Tatiana, our server was very friendly and helpful.
The red fish was really spectacular. Very flakey and perfectly seasoned. We also got the red fish beignets which were some of the best beignets we had during our stay in New Orleans.

Looks super fancy, but isnt too bad. We came for a late lunch before our flight, and this place was a great ending to our trip. we checked in on yelp to get a free appetizer, which we choose as the red fish beignets. They were interesting, but I enjoyed them, they were actually fish fillets in a beignet batter style. It was sweet and also had the green onions to cut through the sweetness. I ordered the shrimp and jambalaya which was soooooo good. It had everything about a good andouille jambalaya with blackened shrimps on top. Our waitress was super nice as well, and the place was clean and tidy.

Cindy was phenomenal. She provided us great suggestions of places to visit and go. The Eggs Benedict and St. Louis Special are a must!  PS - ask for the Bloody Mary, Cindy will get you one of her specialities!

Thanks Cindy for a great experience!
Great seafood! Loved the Taste of New Orleans!! We also got the seafood pot, which was delicious. We were served by Brittany and got a free appetizer! Great service! Definitely would come back again.

This was our last stop for the night and it was fantastic. The service was great, from the host who opened the door for us and sat us at a table, to our very jolly waitress with her incredibly friendly southern accent. We all ordered drinks, my husband was not happy with his old fashioned and they gladly took it back and made him something different. The best things on the menu (or at least from what we ordered) was the French Onion Soup (best I've had in a looooong time) and of course their Char Grilled Oyster  (with the butter). If you get a chance come on by and try these too. The restaurant itself was very nice and clean.

Best gumbo I've had in New Orleans. Not overstuffed with seafood, but the flavor was very good for me, and I don't really like heavy/thick soups.  Happened to stop by here by accident, but it's an awesome restaurant and very friendly staff.

The oyster is fresh and delicious. Highly recommend the oyster duo, oyster pasta and eggplant and oyster pasta. Brittany is super nice and friendly.  She helped us clean some leftovers under the table.

Wow, the redfish beignet was unbelieveable! That was our first one in New Orleans. We also got the oyster tacos and the crawfish ravioli that Brittany recommended and it was TO DIE FOR! Hands down, my favorite meal in New Orleans! Great service and great food! May have to come back for the beignets for breakfast! Thanks Brittany for all the help and recommendations!
Ordered the royal oysters and they were terrible. All breading and with a very "gummy" texture. Neither of us enjoyed it at all.
Family and I popped in during the Christmas Holiday and all 5 of us loved our dishes that we ordered.  Plus the two apps were great as well.  We ate in the upstairs balcony room.

G'day cobba. Bloody ripper time. Can't bloody believe ya mates. Crickey farkkk this bloody gr8 toime. Bloody yeah aghhh farkkk. Yeah. Gday Sheila. Thanks mate. Brittanys great. Is it brittney or Brittanyl? Regardless Brittany/Brittney is great...the food hasn't come yet. But yeah we get a discount, right?

Blake was amazing. He was multi tasking like crazy and never missed a beat. He was friendly and entertaining. A great person to serve the amazing food we had. Really surprised at the flavor, I had blacken chicken sandwich and my other half had crab claws. Yum yum yum. It's a must have on your list to eat.
Brittany is a wonderful waitress -blackened shrimp jambalaya, charred oysters, rib eye and pecan pie were superb!

Oh wow! Our dining experience here was great! We started out with the alligator bites as an appetizer and they were delicious!! As a plus we got them for free with the Yelp check in offer. My husband ordered the red beans and rice which came with sausage and fried chicken and he seemed to enjoy it. I ordered the ravioli dish and ohhh man! The pasta was cooked perfectly and the inside mix was flavored perfectly. The red cream sauce it was mixed in complimented the flavors so well. I'm still drooling at the thought of it. I want to go back to New Orleans for some more. We also tried out the Cajun bloody Mary which was pretty good too. This spot had some good quality food. We'll be back for sure!

I don't wanna recommend this restaurant to anyone. I don't think the food is worthy except oyster. Taste of New Orleans was horrible. Food is overpriced and the space is so small. I couldn't focus on my lunch.

My friend and I dropped by for a quick dinner. She got the french onion soup and chicken sandwich while I got the roast beef po boy. She said both of her dishes were really yummy, especially the french onion soup. The roast beef po boy was good but I feel like I can literally get this anywhere in the world...feel like I should've gone for the shrimp or oyster po boy instead. 

Service was also slow even though our server was super friendly and nice. My friend ordered her chicken sandwich in the middle of me finishing my sandwich but the wait (30+ mins) doesn't add up. There are also extra taxes charged that we haven't experienced from any other restaurant within the French Quarter. We didn't even know about it until we had to pay. Basically paid $21 for a roast beef sandwich that tasted meh.

Pretty basic food and drink offerings. It has a great location and views on the second floor balcony. But the drinks leave more to be desired as does the food. Nothing unique but rather all the same offerings New Orleans has, fried stuff , and oysters. Good spot for a casual bite, but nothing fancy or standout.

This was the worst place I have eaten in the city ... service was terrible ... the food ... actually gross ... I had the Cajun shrimp ... a bowl of red sauce ( about 1/2 cup ) with about 3 spoons of white rice , and 5 baby shrimp floating around ... all for $18 ... ridiculous, sauce tasted like out of a can ....Did have a charbroiled oysters  for app ,they were ok .... hence why they got one star  from me ... surprised to see many people gave 4 stars ... was disappointed that it was so mediocre.... anyway , won't go back ... did t know you can get bad food in Nola , this was a first ! Wasted 75$ for our meal ....gave another star for their response

Royal House is a restaurant that plays to there strengths  OYSTERS.  The oyster are fresh shucked to order. We were told to only go to a res6that shucks the oysters to order. The alligator app is good, french onion soup is great, taste of NOLA ok, but the banana foster cheesecake is money. I have actually went twice for the oysters and may go again before leaving town. At the end of the day it's New Orleans Eat, Drink, and Be Merry.

I am very disappointed with the service here, and the food was nothing special nor tasty, and definitely over priced. Please trust me on this one since I live in nyc, the expense there is way higher than New Orleans. 

I ordered blackened shrimp jambalaya and three tastes of New Orleans, coleslaw, and two soda water, came out to be $51.91. 

First, we ordered oysters, and with common sense, oysters should come out before the entrees. But of course, seeing my bill above, we cancelled the oysters because entrees came out first, and they said they haven't opened the shells... sigh sigh sigh 

And, no follow up from the waitress on how our food was.
Beautiful place inside! Ada was our server she was so sweet, knowledgeable, and very attentive! This was our frist time here visiting New Orleans and it was a great experience

This restaurant is amazing! It took about 10 or 15 minutes to get in but it was totally worth it! As soon as you walk in the football game is on and the nice women greet you. Emmy family sat upstairs and we immediately got our drinks. Then we orders my mom and dad got oysters and my brother got eggplant stew his girlfriend got taste of New Orleans. I got crab clause the meal came about 20 minutes later and it tasted so good the service was amazing and overall a great place to eat.

Lines were long when we arrived here during dinner time on a Thursday, but moved fairly quickly. We were hoping for some bomb food given the popularity, but ultimately was a bit underwhelmed. The free appetizer with 2 entrees after checking in on yelp was a nice bonus however!

To start, we ordered half a dozen raw oysters and the fried alligator appetizer. The oysters were large but had a lot of shell bits. The fried alligator was pretty good, but I haven't had a bad plate of fried alligator in New Orleans yet (fingers crossed). For our entrees, we had the crawfish etouffee and the blackened redfish. I enjoyed the etouffee, but it might be a bit bland for some. I topped it off with some hot sauce and crackers which kicked it up a notch. The blackened redfish was the most disappointing dish of the night; it was just too overcooked to be enjoyable.
Jambalaya was not impressive, but charcoaled oyster appetizer was very good. Bathrooms were out of order. Hurricane drinks were very weak. No need to go back again.

Good service but bad food. Definitely a tourist trap. Royal House staff will stand at the door and hustle you in so that you can waste money on their low-quality food. They tried tempting me with a free appetizer if I left a 5-star Yelp review before getting my food. The only reason they deserve 2 stars is because the service was nice. We tried their crawfish beignets -- they were saturated in oil and gave me awful acid reflux. Afterwards, they brought us the fried oysters "piled high," they were not. They use low quality oysters for their fried oysters -- they think that the breading will hide the fact that they use the fowl-tasting mucus-secreting mating oysters. In addition, the breading was not very tasty, either. 

Don't waste your money here. Go to gumbo shop, mothers, Atchafalaya, acme, willie mae's, or mandina's.

Get the shrimp tortellini or the crawfish ravioli but avoid the taste of New Orleans trio. The gumbo is terrible - instead, try it at Cochon instead. In the thick of the touristy part of French quarter but not a terrible tourist trap.

Sat at the bar after waiting in line for about 30mins. The inside looks pretty cool with a few TVs.

Char-grilled Oysters - Awesome
Mushroom App - Awesome
Ravioli- Delicious
Pescatore - Incredible 

Good service to add! Would definitely recommend

So, I've been going to this place for years. Their grilled oysters used to be fantastic. Today, I went and ordered my usual grilled oysters. Of the dozen I ordered, 4 had empty shells, 2 had oyseres that had obviously been cooked hours beforehand, and 2 were so small as to almost be invisible. Also, they ised to give 4 pieces of toasted bread to so you soak up the garlic and butter. 2 very small pieces this time, and barely toasted. Prior to this visit, when they brought the grilled oysters out, the butter was still bubbling. This time they were served almost at room temperature. The only saving grace was the wonderful man begind the counter, withwhom I had a wonderful conversation. I'll go back, but if it is the same as last time, no more.

Leroy is the best bartender in the French quarter, come for the delicious oysters, stay for the delicious drinks!! Ask to sit by Blake has the fastest softest hands this side of the Mississippi, he shucked close to 250 oysters just while we were sitting here and he will take care of you! Also seriously someone please give Leroy and Blake  a raise they are amazing.

The lack of energy of the staff was mind blowing. One bar tender, if you could call her that, was obviously mad about having to work. She looked exhausted and frazzled. At one point she said "I need another job". A young man came to the bar to place a to go order. She was mean to him when he asked for a breakfast item. The other bar tender looked like she was hung over and kept leaving the bar area. The oyster shucker seemed to be having a good day. We were hopeful that the marinated crab claws would save the experience. But alas, we received 14 small sad looking claws drenched in a thick sauce for 13.50.  Granted they were busy, as it was New Year's Day and the Sugar Bowl but I'm pretty sure they had advance warning.

Not a long wait on New Year's day for dinner, and our waitress was nice, but the food was bland! I got the blackened gulf shrimp & jambalaya - nothing about the shrimp was blackened and the jambalaya was trash. Maybe their oysters are better?!

Try to sit upstairs or on the balcony. Nice atmosphere. Good food. Not amazing but very tasty. My tween son enjoyed the fried shrimp platter. Hubby had oysters. I had shrimp and grits which was flavorful but needed more shrimp. Nice servers.

Come around 9pm and the line will be short, about ten minutes. They don't take reservations, so plan accordingly. It's pretty small inside relative to the restaurants around, and it's consistently filled. It's got a unique, low-key, charming ambiance. 

We came for their banana foster deconstructed cheesecake, which my boyfriend had been mentioning for days. It was definitely one of the best cheesecakes I've ever had, and well worth the hype. 

Also got the gumbo, and it was a small app portion, but so delicious. 

Our waitress, Tina, was a hoot. I really enjoyed her energy!

FYI, their check-in offer is only accepted if you purchase two entrees.

Good atmosphere. Pleasant server. Gave us food recommendations. Didn't have to wait too long to be seated or for the food. Good chargrilled oysters. Daughter says the creole was boring. Ravioli was pretty good. Slightly overpriced but isn't most places in the French Quarter.

Disgusting! I ordered the alligator bites which came out crazy fast....however it was cold. Makes you wonder. Also ordered the crawfish etouffee each was almost inedible. Terrible terrible!!! Do not come here......if you must then do not get the etoufee

There wasn't anything wrong with my visit, but nothing about it really stood out, either. Pleasant atmosphere at the bar. It had a nice, old-school feel to it. But being an oyster bar, I was expecting more from the oysters. If you're gonna char-grill them, let the grill flavor and the natural taste of the oysters speak for themselves. *Anything* tastes good smothered in butter and Parmesan cheese. I was also expecting bigger oysters. But the spinach salad and hurricane were quite good, and my visit gave me a break from the relative chaos on nearby Bourbon Street.

We attend here on our last night in NOLA and it was a disappointment. Although all of the staff was super nice and it is in a great location, it couldn't make up for the mediocre food. They were out of a lot of menu items. Drinks were sub-par to other restaurants. Chargrilled Oysters were mostly grease. Gumbo was icky. Shrimp Creole was basically bland marinara sauce with rice and shrimp. Crawfish Ravioli was baked and burnt. Decent po-boy sandwich and Shrimp Etouffee at least. My son liked his meal so I boosted the review to 3 stars. Overall, I think it was the worst meal we had in 4 days in the city - to top it off, it was not a cheap meal. Go elsewhere in a city full of great food!

** Tip: check in on Yelp for free app with 2 entrees **

Maybe it was during holiday season but there was a fairly large line to get in. For 2 people, we only waited maybe 15 minutes so it wasn't too bad. 

We ordered oysters, fried alligator, crawfish etouffee, and blackened redfish. The oysters were not cleaned well at all, there was so much sand in each of them. The fried alligator was good, tasted like more tender chicken poppers.  The redfish was really overcooked though and dry, which was fairly disappointing. 

Overall, not a huge fan and the food is quite pricey for what you get.

Went here for lunch on vacation, ordered French onion soup: burnt topping, they forgot my oyster tacos and when they did remember they brought out 6 nachos that had coleslaw as a base and a fried oyster on top. Charged 13.50. Wow.

It was fine. The food was pretty average. The prices were well above what they should have been for the quality. The Napoleon House has better prices for similar menu items but at a higher quality/taste.
Our server Dacia was excellent! We really enjoyed our experience here and she was a large part of it. She gave great recommendations and made us feel at home. Would definitely come again with friends
Two Stars for the crap claws, but the chargrilled oysters are the worst in town, very tiny of meat and not fresh.

The Royal House had THEE BEST OYSTERS out of all of the restaurants we stopped at for oysters within New Orleans. Seriously- we're picky and eat oysters often in San Diego and Catalina island. These oysters were flavorful and clean of debris and they're chucking them right in front of you behind the bar! With that being said, we had terrible service when we went back the next day for a sit down meal as the waiter was rude and blaming it on staff not showing up for the day. The food (shrimp tortellini, shrimp n grits, Po-boy, and shrimp with fries) was also sub-par and pretty unflavorful. I will say that the craw claws appetizer was the most flavorful dish that was ordered. 

ALL IN ALL stop by this cute digs for a healthy dose of delicious oysters

A larger restaurant off of Bourbon. Typical NOLA fare.

Service was ok, nothing special (they got my drink order horribly wrong). The food was very good.

Not a bad place for a visit or perhaps informal business dinner (not fancy)
