Tourist Trap!!! Drinks were ehh especially for the price, low quality alcohol. Tried the taste of new orleans, oyster duo and the gulf shrimp and grits. Nothing really was outstanding. This place gets two stars because it wasnt crowded. The service was decent, when you need to go approach the server to ask for something thats not good. If you are wanting to try authentic cajun/comfort food go somewhere else.

I don't frequent Royal House, but the few experiences I've had here have been enjoyable, including breakfast this morning.  We were walking the dog while trying to decide where to eat when I remembered that Royal House is dog friendly when the doors to the sidewalk are open.  The friendly host staff offered to do just that, which meant assigning a server to the area. Bonus points for customer service!  

The service was quick and friendly.  The ambiance was perfect, not too touristy, with an open air table overlooking Royal with the occasional mule and carriage passing by.  The coffee with Bailey's was just the ticket on a chilly morning.  The breakfast entrees, including a ham & Swiss omelette, Cajun potatoes and biscuits were all very good.

Royal House is a great option for breakfast, lunch or dinner!

I had come in for oysters and ate at the bar. They were so good and the guy shucking had so much personality, we decided to come back again for a meal. We ordered fried shrimp basket(not great), shrimp and grits (would not order again, grits were too thick), bisque (okay), and shrimp tortellini (okay). While the oysters were good, I thought the meals were sub par. It is a cute spot and I would definitely come back for the oysters.

We enjoyed a New Orleans-style Po'Boy lunch and thoroughly enjoyed it.  I had the oyster, and my companions had the shrimp and the fried fish.  It's a full plate of food.  I was craving the oysters, so I just ditched the bun and enjoyed the oysters, which were fried in what I would say is a tempura style batter that was crispy and delicious.  The fries were good, too, but the fish was the star attraction.

A word of caution and the reason it's not 5 stars is that the floors in Royal House were very, very, VERY slippery the day we were there.  The host told us it was because of the rain, but our server said it's always like that.  She and everyone else, including the host, were wearing non-slip shoes.

My boyfriend and I visited the Royal House for our 2 year anniversary. When we arrived I wanted to be seated on the balcony but unfortunately they were full. So we took a table in front of the bar right next to an open window. Which was not too bad, because we were serenaded by a beautiful violinist during our meal. 

Even though it was very busy our server brought us our drinks and immediately took our order when we were ready. For appetizers we ordered one order of half shelled oysters as well as chargrilled oysters. For my entree I ordered the mahi mahi and my boyfriend ordered the shrimp po boy. 

When we recieved the oysters they also gave us a VERY generous amount of crackers to go with our oysters. This was my first time tryinf chargrilled oysters so I was a bit worried I would not like them very much. But I was wrong! The chargrilled oysters were filled with so much flavor that I had never encountered before. Although I still prefer the regular half shelled oysters, the chargrilled oysters were a nice change from my usual taste of choice. 

For my entree the mahi mahi is where the 3 star review comes into play. The presentation of mt entree was fine but the taste of the fish was.. absolutely.. nothing. I am not usually picky about taste at all but when there is no taste? That is when it is different. The potatoes and shrimp that came with my dish were fine, it was only the fish that fell very disappointing. My boyfriend on the other hand realt enjoyed his po boy, although the size of the dish was quite small. 

Overall, the atmosphere, apps, and service were nice. Just the taste of the food could be improved on greatly. I am eager to come visit the next time I come back to New Orleans. Until then I hope to taste exploding flavors!

This has been my favorite spot in New Orleans so far!! The crab claws for an appetizer were to die for, HIGHLY recommend. We saved the sauce for the rest of our meal. I had a fish po boy and it was delicious. Their bloody marys were great too. The service was wonderful - classic southern hospitality. I have an awful memory and can't remember our server's name but she was SO lovely (we're the 2 girls from Hollywood - thank you for being amazing!!) Would love to come again and try more of their menu! :)

Went here as soon as we got into town for lunch! The shrimp po boy was amazing and my girlfriend got the Oysters Rockefeller! We both loved our meals and the service was great! Not a bad price point either for what it was! Definitely want to go again before we leave!
Last dinner after week in NOLA. Used Yelp to find it. Want to pay forward to other Yelpers. Old history in the building, good food, friendly and efficient staff.

Meh. Our food was meh. And we sat outside on the balcony which was kinda cool and kinda scary. At one point my drink fell off the side. Luckily it was mostly empty and a plastic cup cuz it could have hit someone walking by. I probably wouldn't go back.

Went here for dinner and WOW. There was plenty of tables and seating at this restaurant. The staff was friendly and very attentive. As for the food, I was in awe. My friend and I ordered:
1. Crab Claws
2. Chargrilled Oysters
3. Oyster Pasta
4. Crawfish Etouffee
My favorite was definitely the Chargrilled oysters and the crab claws. The crab claws were in some red sauce that was deliciously addicting! The entrees, Oyster pasta and Crawfish Etouffee were very filling. My friend and I left with a very full stomach. I enjoyed every dish we ordered and def recommend coming here for dinner if you're in NOLA.
BEST BLOODY MARY IN THE WORLD, made by Miss Cindy! I've had bloody Mary's all over and these are hands down THE BEST!!

French Quarter buildings can be deceiving, and this is the kind of place that serves A+ food. The crab claws with sauce you dip them in are AMAZING and there is always a really delightful and sweet dude shucking oysters fresh everytime I've been there. The ENTIRE staff is sweet as pie and charismatic. They sing songs about menu items to get people inside (endearing not annoying). Arrow at the door is super awesome. The bartenders are all super nice and efficient. I am a tour guide and I always recommend this place to my guests. There isn't a TON of space, but its the FQ, that's the way it is, and it's definitely very comfortable anyway!
Wonderful breakfast! The mimosas were absolutely delicious. Great eggs and great food all around. Beautiful balcony seats on the second floor. Would definitely recommend this!

Visited here as one of the gentlemen in my party was feenin for some oysters.  I gave the Oyster Duo a whirl and they were just so/so.  We had to be careful when chewing as there was a lot of shell and/or sand in them.  Big pieces I pulled out of my mouth were definitely shell.  One of the guys I was with couldn't even finish his--he was afraid of breaking a tooth!  I ordered the Taste of New Orleans for my entree and this was underwhelming.  The crawfish etoufee tasted more like the rice and beans you get at Popeye's.  The chicken and andouille jambalaya lacked decent size pieces of meat as did the gumbo.  Flavors were...ok.  This was a one and done for me.
Very cute place with a balcony view and amazing food! Order the crawfish and the oyster tacos. Great ambience as well. You will not regret trying this place out

This is a restaurant in prime location next to Bourbon St. I would say that, after going to 13 other restaurants in NOLA, I was slightly unimpressed by the dish I had, which was the Taste of New Orleans.

Walking in, we were greeted by a 3 employees standing outside, recruiting new customers, however, I came here specifically to test out the gumbo, jumbalia, and crawfish etouffée. It is perfect as this was all in the Taste of New Orleans entree. Service was very quick and place was clean.

3/5 - Gumbo - nothing notable here. To me, tasted like your average gumbo  
5/5 - Jumbalia tasted more like fried rice, which I liked a lot. Note that this does not contain tomatoes, like some of the other Jumbalia recipes.
3/5 - crawfish etouffee, personally, I also didn't find anything special here. There was a descent amount of crawfish in the dish.

The smell of this place caught our attention! We saw it had great reviews and decided to try it out. The waiters and waitresses were super friendly and welcoming. 

We ordered the Taste of New Orleans so that we can try out a few items! The meal included Chicken and Andouille Jambalaya, Louisiana Crawfish Etouffee, and Chicken and Andouille Gumbo. 

Chicken and Andouille Jambalaya: This was my favorite at this place! The taste and rice was cooked perfectly. It didn't have the tomato in it like other places we tried out so glad we stopped by! Good amount of meat to rice ratio. 

Louisiana Crawfish Etouffee: I fell in love with Crawfish Etouffee while being in the city! It was good, but it was lacking more crawfish and taste. 

Chicken and Andouille Gumbo: This was okay. It was not as memorable for me. 

Would definitely recommend the Jambalaya!

5-stars again!

Royal House has never disappointed us. 

We came here for dinner tonight. We started out with a dozen chargrilled oysters. 

The oyster were amazing as always. Best I've ever had in fact and I've had them all over. 

My wife ordered her usual, Seafood Pescatore. She asks our server, Tina to have it made with the scampi 


Tip: Do a Yelp check-in upon arrival here for up to $12 off an appetizer when ordered with 2 entrees. sauce. Always excellent. 

Tonight I had a fried shrimp dinner. I didn't eat the fries, slaw or hush puppies but the shrimp was excellent and the cocktail sauce is house made. 

Thank you Royal House for another fine NOLA meal.

The food here is maybe not the best in New Orleans but the hospitality was pretty high up there. The staff here are super helpful and supper friendly. We ask our server what is one thing she thought was a must see/do/eat in New Orleans and she left and actually came back with a list of all of her other favorite spots. Talk about southern hospitality.

Jambalaya was rather bland, and the blackened shrimp weren't even really blackened. Bartender/server was very sweet and attentive but I wouldn't come back for the food. The free appetizer with check in is only valid if you buy two entrees, which sadly didn't help me out since I dined solo. Based on the flavor of the food & prices I'd suggest going somewhere else unless you're getting oysters from the oyster bar.

Located in a historic building with a combination of both elegant and sports-bar vibe. Had a quick dinner. My friend's blackened red fish was delicious, blackened right to the spot where the inside was still moist and creamy. My Mahi Mahi was alright. The sauce tasted good but the pecan crust was a bit too hard and did not go well with the tender mahi mahi fillet. Also, the green beans was good, but the potatoes was bland. I find the red fish a much better dish than mahi mahi. Hope the consistency could be improved.

I've now been to Royal House twice and it's also been the first meal of each trip to Nola. All I can say is if you don't try the char-grilled oysters then you have done yourself the biggest disservice. This has to be my favorite dish to order. Other notable favorites - the Taste of New Orleans sampler! You get to try the gumbo, jambalaya and entouffee. Gumbo was my second favorite dish. 

The first time I came, I used the Yelp check in to get a free appetizer which is a nice bonus. 

I will be coming back whenever I visit Nola. :)

Great oyster selection and Blackened Red Fish dish. Location is nice, off the mayhem of Bourbon Street. 
Sit either at the bar or on the second floor if you can. Prices as expected based on location.

Excellent service and good oysters. The gator bits were a bit tasteless. The Taste of New Orleans had one good sample. The others were subpar at best. I would definitely recommend for a intro to Louisiana food.

Came here with my friends and had a great meal. I had the shrimp and grits and shrimp they had jambalaya and blackened red fish. All were cooked perfectly. The service was good and prices reasonable for the French Quarter.
Not very busy.  Waited over 15 minutes after being seated and no server.  We left. They continued to say they would be right over but didnt.

Ridiculous wait time. Took at least ten minutes to order drinks, another ten to order appetizers and another ten to order entrees. The drinks didn't come out until the main entrees were served about 30 minutes later. By the time thee waitress returned to the table, the tickets took another 30 minutes to be provided. The restaurant was half empty. Good food but terrible service.

"Just OK" is not OK. Wife had the Taste of New Orleans and I had the fried fish poboy, both so-so. Poboy had enough  fried fish but not much else. Fries were luke warm. Wife's dIsh rather skimpy with a small piece of dry bread to accompany the 3 small samples. Prices and service not bad for a heavy touristy area. The Gumbo Shop which we went to yesterday is a much better choice.

So so menu, decent drinks, and a nice atmosphere. Try to get seated upstairs, the windows will be open if the weather permits, so you'll get a nice breeze and can people watch.

I had a shrimp boil, which was basically a dozen shrimp, two small red potatoes and a half ear of corn boiled in unseasoned water. No seasoning, no old Bay, no salt. Terrible. But their oysters are good, and the other menu offerings look promising.

The brownies are delicious.

Fell in love with this place while visiting the city for my first time and always  make a point to come back each time I visit. Honestly, I mostly come for the amazing company of the bartender, Cindy. She's not only knowledgeable of everything they serve, but she's the kindest, hardest working person I've ever had the pleasure of being served by. And coming from a food and beverage industry worker myself, that's saying a lot.  So come in, sit at the bar during lunch, ask for Cindy and take all of her recommendations.
Food was cold. Service was distracted at best. The drinks are all sugar and no fruit juice. Tourist trap.

The service was great... AT FIRST. We were told they were out of the mix to make Bloody Mary's and 5 minutes later, we saw about 6 of them walk past our table. We asked the server about it, and she said they got some more mix and she would put one in for our table. That did not arrive until we were ready to leave. Then when the food came, one of the people in my group of 4 did not get his food because the server  rang it in wrong. Someone else asked for bacon on her burger and she did not get that. When the last person finally got their food everyone else was done eating so we asked the server about comping his food off. She got an attitude and said she didn't know if she could do that and I asked her to send manager to my table. The manager was very nice and had no problem comping the food. THEN I looked up and saw a cock roach crawling on the wall. We will NOT be back and do not recommend  anyone else to go either.

The entire menu looked delicious, my table ordered a good amount of the menu . The food was soo good that we kept forgetting to take pictures . The efficiency of the line process impressed me. The hostess said that it would be a 15 minute wait and it really was. This was on a busy Saturday night. Our waitress was very attentive and highly helpful on the yummy foods to try. The royal oysters were divine- too good to stop and take a picture. If you are scared of the spicy description of the shrimp creole, don't be; the spice gives it a nice flavor without a strong spice kick. If you can sit upstairs even better for it is quieter and has a great view. Over all, I highly recommend this spot.
Crab finger appetizer was great. Jambalaya and creole were ok but we've had better.  Average overall.

Our first time in New Orleans, family reccomended this restaurant for our anniversary and it DID NOT disappoint!! We asked our server, Joe's, recommendations on food and everything he recommended was on point. We had the crab claws (sauce was to die for), char grilled oysters, crawfish ravioli, seafood pescatore, and an A-MAZING pecan pie that tasted like heaven!! The service was great, the food was awesome!! Would go back any day!!
I loved the food! Service was excellent!  Michael from the oyster bar was great!  He recommended all the good food and we were so stuffed!

This was a great dinning experience ... I sat at the bar where the great service & historic tales came from an awesome black man  (wish I remembered his name) Greeeat personality & awesome service  everything he recommended was on point!

Food was very good and the service even better, ask
for Britney. We had all her recommendations and boy did they deliver! Try the red fish beignet appetizer! Sooooo good!

Service was good. The chargrilled oysters I really liked. The po'boy I got was dry, the bread looked and tasted like it was store bought. Stick to the beef PO' boy and you won't go wrong. Price was reasonable and the atmosphere Was great.
This place is amazing, great vegetarian options (that seems uncommon in NOLA), and great service (ask for Princess Tatiana, she gives amazing service).

My husband wanted to get a seafood boil so we tried this place out.  We sat on the balcony which had great views but slanted in a slightly alarming way and the wood on the edges looked...dubious.  We got the shrimp boil.  The shrimp was very good quality although the broth did lack flavor.  The potatoes and corn were overcooked-- the corn was just garbage.  Nice server.

pretty tight restaurant. super overpriced dishes. seems like a tourist trap with their prices. we got the basics, crawfish ettouffee and jambalaya and a po boy. i honestly think we have better cajun food in houston than this place. only good thing was the oysters, they were nice and sweet.

The Line to get In Is worth the wait. Fantastic server, she was very friendly and gave  great recommendations. We had the blackened redfish and the crawfish ravioli. Oysters where also very tasty. The food was  good and flavorful. This is a place to return.
Food was underwhelming. Blackened chicken wasn't. Service ok, but they were not busy, so expected more.
The service was good! food was not great, but this place is overrated for the price they have they should have better food. The food was cold... Just not a good experience.

My husband and I first ate here almost 3 years ago, and we had been dreaming about these hush puppies ever since. They are crispy with a hint of spice, but absolutely delicious. The gumbo was a good portion size and seasoned well. Service was excellent as well.

Stopped in for dinner on Saturday night. Ordered the peel & eat shrimp and it was regular shrimp already un-peeled and masked with an insane amount of salt. It seemed like they ran out of peel n eat shrimp and just substituted for these, but they tasted awful! My friend got the fried oysters, which were tiny and the coleslaw side was one bite worth. Not worth the $$$$!!!!!
Shrimp and Grits were amazing.  Great atmosphere and could watch the wedding procession below.  So fun.

The atmosphere was great, and we were able to sit  on the second floor near the balcony (they only have tables for 2 on the balcony). The service was also very good. However, we were not impressed with the oysters. This is what we specifically had gone there for and they were  extremely fishy tasting. We have had them numerous times before, and these were a let down. However, I would be open to trying something else on the menu.

With thousands of review, this place should be good.  So much for that thought....

We ordered a gumbo and some friend oysters.  Simple, yes?  The oysters had been previously frozen.... and still were when they arrived.  The gumbo was really some rice in a broth with a few pieces of spam-type meat.  Blah..

The perfect spot to sample authentic New Orleans food! From the time we walked  up to the door, we felt the Southern hospitality! Gregory was our server, and he was awesome! An excellent fun experience all around. Did I mention how delicious the food was? From the crab claw appetizer to the bread pudding dessert, we loved it all!
This place is amazing!! We will be back before our vacation is over. Our server Oran was awesome!! We had a variety of menu items and have no doubt everything on there is fantastIc.
Great service and great he food was very good. I would recommend eating here and will definitely be back if ever in New Orleans again!
Best Shrimp Etouffee we had in our restaurant tour of New Orleans! Excellent service, great chargrilled oysters as well. I still think about the Shrimp Etouffee....

Check in on yelp for a free appetizer with 2 entrees. The sampler gives you a taste  of everything. The etouffee was great! The po boys are huge and the shrimp were great. We all enjoyed our food, service was great! 

For an appetizer we got the fried alligator- a must have in New Orleans! My dinner mate loved the french onion soup- she described it as the best ever!

Upstairs bartender was great...

Raw oysters we great.  Flash cooked were not my favorite, butter and cheese saved the day.
Great Resturant to eat at! It's right in the heart of NOLA. Everything was super fresh! The crab fingers sauce was amazing! Highly recommended!
Saw 2 up armored combat roaches on the stairs but ignored them because I thought the food was gonna be fire.. food was not fire.

Terrible service. I ordered Alaskan snow legs. They were overcooked, had no flavor, the butter sauce had no flavor. I visited the restaurant with a group of 5 at 9 pm.. it was very cold outside and all the waitresses left the outside doors open that go to the upstairs balcony, making everyone literally so cold until they're shivering and wearing gloves and hats just to eat. Made a complaint to the manger but he still didn't lose the doors. Waitress had a terrible attitude. I don't recommend to anyone especially when it's cold.

Not really sure why this place has such good reviews. I didn't really feel impressed nor satisfied and it is for sure much pricier than some better tasting food I've had  on this trip. It's located in the quarters so it'll get lots of tourist traffic but the quality was much poorer than I had expected. 

The chargrilled oysters..can't say those were really chargrilled. Threw some cheese and sprinkled some seasoning. Some pieces didn't even have melted cheese. 

Shrimp and grits were the worst shrimp and grits I've ever  tasted. They were cold and dry. When I think grits, I think warm, creamy, and taking a hearty spoonful followed by a juicy shrimp. These grits were cold and the consistency was like mashed potatoes. They actually gave scoops of it on the plate. Have you every thought of grits as a scoop?? Like an ice cream scoop, like a mashed potato scoop. And it's a Cold scoop. Not my kind of grits. They were nothing close to the photos on their website. Not close by any means.

The etouffee was just ok. Underwhelming. 

The place is pricey for what you get. And what you get is overpriced Cajun food in a touristy location. On the bright side..the staff is very friendly, helpful, and accommodating, so can't knock that.

I'm like really mad I spent money here. 

I came last year and ate with my mom and sister. I don't remember if I liked it or not but since I have eaten here, I thought I would enjoY it again. 

I came here yesterday and I was honestly sO diSappointed. We were seated upstairs which  wAs nice since we were waiting for the parade to comE by. While walking up the stairs, we saw roaches crawling all over the stairs but we ignored it. However, our server (white guy with long blonde hair) was just super unprofessional aNd not pleasant. He seemed to hate his job as he just didn't cut it foR us. 

Anyways, the food here honestly sucked. And I hate to give bad reviews but it really did and I spent so much money for my birthday celebration. We got a dozen oysters which were not fresh, they were small and not soaked and cleaned. You can taste all the sand and shell bits in the oysters. They didn't give us utensils with the oysters so we were using our forks just to grab some of the cocktail and horse radish sauce. We asked for lemon//lime for the oysters and the server never brought it. We got two gumbo which was okay but not authentic. The half/half special oysters were just too much. Like you couldn't even taste the oysters cos there were too much toppings to even taste anything. The jambalaya was good. It was nicE and hearty. The ribeye wAs also really good, but the sides to the ribeye was over cooked and soggy vegetables. We also got snow crab legs at $30lb and thEy we're not fresh. They were old and just plain bad. 

Like I'm just super disappointed in the food I received hEre and I'm mad that I even  brought my friends here. We won't be returning for sure.

Do you like salt and over spiced food? Well do I have a spot for you. Seriously though went here because of the high review rating. Got the seafood boil and it was so over salted I couldn't even eat the corn on the cob which tasted like a salt lick. The girlfriend had shrimp and grits and while better it was still way over spiced. The service wasn't great either but the food stole the terrible show. Stay away.
Oh my gosh what amazing food! Literally had our main courses eaten in ten minutes because it was so good! I would absolutely come back in a heartbeat!

Had a great meal. Our server Blake was very kind and fast with his service. 
I will surely be back for more.
We ordered blaCkened red fish and a steak and they were both awesome

Food was delicious & atmosphere was relaxed. Waiter was full of personality and extremely attentive. GREAT Bloody Mary - spicy with a smooth kick!  Loved my shrimp and grits - not your typical BBQ shrimp over grits. Their version has sweet, tender shrimp served over slices of lightly breaded and fried slab of grits, with Alfredo sauce  over it all. Delicious!  My table mates enjoyed their breakfasts equally well. Definitely recommend you go check it out.

A easy choice when in New Orleans!
Fast service, great food and awesome atmosphere....stop here every time in the city. 
Also can't go with out getting there bread pudding!

Was at a loss for where to go to eat in NOLA. (I'm a notoriously picky eater) we came across this place and we were seated upstairs overlooking the streets which was pretty cool. pretty quick even though they were fairly busy and omg THE CRAB LEGS Y'ALL. 

I can't remember our waitresses name as it was around november of 2019, but she was an older woman with blonde hair. She asked where we were from, made small talk, she was fantasic! Will definitely come back next time I'm in town!

Honestly, we thought this restaurant was going to be terrible. But we had tried so many other places already, and people kept saying it was so good. So we went, and we were NOT disappointed. The staff was amazing, and we tried a couple of different things that were all very good.

I recently wondered into this restaurant during a rather festive night of Mardi Gras. Despite the number of people on the streets there wasn't a wait at all. Our oyster shucker Blake S. was very helpful at suggesting things on the menu. I enjoyed everything!! Will definitely be back.

After the first Saturday night parade, this spot seemed like a good place to  have dinner. It's quite small and so are the tables.

Service: was decent. At times, it took a while to get a drink (they came out at different times)

Food: We started off with the artichoke dip. It was cold so we had to return it. The couple next to us had to return their gumbo because it was also cold. The second one they brought out was piping hot. All the meals were on point with the exception of the Shrimp and Grits. There was something off with the flavor. There was a spice that I couldn't place that was too fragrant in my mouth, as if I was eating lavender. It over powered the entire dish. The other two pasta dishes I would order again. The pasta was cooked just right, the crust on the eggplant and fried chicken was crispy. 

Although there are many Cajun places to choose from in the French Quarter, this is a good spot.

Ugh. I realLy thought I was going to  like my meal here. It wAs my 3rd and final night, and everything else I've had was BOMB. This place was the worst to end my trip.

The wait  wasn't long, but the line was outside. The service was great too. When you check in on Yelp, you get a free appetizer. We went with the fried gator. It was waS too chewy and not warm enough. 

For dinner, I went with the fried shrimp po boy. The shrimp was mediocre at best, and  it was the best part of my dish. The bread was ridiculously dry, and the fries had no taste. 

The other two dishes my friend and sister had were better, but this was not  it.

Fantastic menu, full of great selections and ultimately flavor. Staff was attentive, knowledgeable and warm. 

In particular, Samacha knows her stuff. Her menu recommendations were on point. She seemed to have genuinely tried most entrees and made accompaniment suggestions that made great items even better, if that's possible. 

We may or may not have resorted to mopping up sauce off of plates....

Royal house has great curb appeal. I asked to sit on the balcony overlooking the corner of the court house and they luckily just had a table open up. The view was great although I did feel like the floor was unsteady & super old. The insides has 2 level seating in addition to the balcony tables. While on the balcony we noticed all the tables were narrow two seaters and when someone moved you could feel the floor moving lol. We felt the gator was perfectly cooked (lightly fried, light breading & moist) with a tartar & cocktail dipping sauce. The Oysters Rockefeller  had a crispy broil giving them the texture your looking for in the cheese department. Unfortunately, the oysters on the half shell were dirty. When they got to the table the oysters were sitting in a shallow bowl of water with a few ice cubes (obviously had been sitting). Service  was like a 3 out of 5 (friendly but we waited for drinks & food impacting quality).

First mistake when visiting a local spot and  it's not crowded stay away wife wanted some oysters so we dropped in the inside was clean and well maintained  ordered fried green tomatoes that they put on lettuce which made the tomatoes  cold told the waitress and she said they can make it over but it will come out  the same you would think if I told her it was cold that they wouldn't put it on lettuce didn't want to makE  a fuss so keep it nothing was really  hot  being on bourbon street you would think they would be on point next time I'm in town will definitely will pass right by this place

Came here for a late night dinner, about 10:00 p.m. on a Wednesday. Had some simply amazing charbroiled oysters, and some really good fried shrimp. It was a pleasant evening, the doors up front were open, and I could hear the wonderful lady busking across the street, for some wonderful entertainment while I ate. Ice cold adida was pretty good too.
Omg this place was delicious their oyster by far better than acme and the bloody mary although i switch vodka for beer. Was the best out there i tried.
The service is absolutely hands down phenomenal but the po boy, as others have said, is plain and not impressive

The fried oysters were great and the rest of the food was really good. Our server was amazing as well. My complaint: I feel that they make the servers work a section upstairs AND downstairs. Which makes it impossible for them to keep track of the food is coming out on time or if anyone at the table needs anything as simple as silverware. So my lack of 5 stars lies on the management. We saw multiple people in the seating area waiting on something and that's due to spreading their staff thin

Food was alright. All of our appetizers came out at different times, gumbo for us came out at different times- but isn't it all made in a large batch? Some of the weirdest, slowest, most aloof service. They did NOT honor our Yelp promotion, and it also doesn't show the limiting terms until you click through and only AFTER you check-in. We have been waiting more than 45 minutes JUST to get our check. Talking to a manager, who is not apologetic, and very confused and incapable of remedying the situation. Total mess, avoid. Bad service. No semblance of a customer experience.
Their menu and pictures online look great, but that's not what it's like in person. We were hoping for the wow factor at this establishment, not the case. Other great places to choose from!
Nyrobi is the bomb !  He is pleasant welcoming and service oriented.  The food was very tasteful and we enjoyed our time here.

During a weekend girls' trip to New Orleans we stopped by Royal House and it was not disappointing. We ordered the oysters, fresh and the parmesan ones. Had cocktails and lunch. I had the shrimp tortellini which Nairobi our bartender at the Oyster bar side recommended and it was delicious! Thanks so much!
Great food! Great service. Great menu choices. Jambalaya, shrimp pho boy, crawfish ravioli, red beans and rice were delicious options

Sloppy food and service. The only decent food are the grilled oysters. The ratings are not justified. We got in just because of that, hopefully this will prevent other people to get disappointed at this restaurant.

HORRIBLE service! Not attentive at all. Food took long, my boyfriend's came out way before mine. Meanwhile a staff meeting between waiters is taking place just a couple of tables away. Later one waiter did nothing but hide around the corner watching a fighting match. Food was also not good. Roast poboy didn't taste like much and the jambalaya had a pound of salt in it. Other guests around us were also visibly disappointed with bad cocktails and incorrect food orders.

This place is dangerously bad. They serve room temperature oysters on ice. They also send out oyster condiments at room temperature too and everything was warm. My goodness they will kill someone soon! 
Got all the drinks wrong and then sent a caprese salad out with 5 tablespoons of Italian dressing on top and a balsamic drizzle on the side.   The hostess tried to tell us that the heavily herbed Italian dressing(which was right next to the balsamic drizzle) was in fact still balsamic. I made her taste it so she might stop lying to future customers or fire her idiotic kitchen staff for bastardizing a dish and not mentioning how they screw it up on the menu. 
So warm oysters, wrong drink and a screwed up main the hostess tried to lie about. 10/10 fail. How far has New Orleans fallen? Pathetic is an understatement and they should be ashamed.

My friend Mike G. swears by this place. Me...not so much. Thought it is in an excellent location and a good place to take a break. The restrooms are clean and nice. That's unusual in the French Quarter. And any port in a storm...

I flew all the way from Baltimore for my birthday just for the food there. The crab claws were amazing, the grilled oysters are the best I've ever had. The service and staff were very friendly and attentive. If you're ever in the French Quarter area this spot is a MUST!!
Excellent service and great food. One of the best meals we had in New Orleans. Would send my entire family here.
Great food, slowish service (I can give them a pass for this being it is Mardi Gras weekend). Friendly staff, good music, cool vibe.

Awesome place and they have plenty of room for big parties, 16 of us and seated in less than 5 mins. Very attentive to their customers. We went to two of their restaurants (different names) and got the same treatments. I highly recommend this place and keep up the good work. Your customer service is remarkably good. Thank you for making our short trip memorable.

Make a reservation, this place is always a crowd pleaser. Everything on the menu here is a winner. Staff is delightful. If your smart , you'll request a seat outside near the balcony , this way u can be witness to the sweet serenade from a talented musician performing right below you.

First off , Blake our bartender. was very friendly and super knowledgeable about the menu . He got me EXACTLY what I wanted . Not only did I enjoy the food the his hospitality was phenomenal . Definitely gonna be back if not for the food for BLAKE !

AMAZING!!!!!!!!! Not only is the food all fresh, our server Blake was so attentive and very knowledgeable of the menu!! He gave us really good recommendations and even had people sitting nearby who ordered what we were going to order and they confirmed it was great!! Would highly recommend this restaurant as well as our server Blake!! He is also busy shuckking fresh oysters but makes sure his guests are taken care of!!

I'm not here to talk about the food. That alone is 5 stars. I'm here to talk about our amazing server, Mike. We had a rough night coming in and his smile and attention to our table turned our last night in NOLA into the best. Come here for the food, but ask to sit in Mikes's section!

So I was in New Orleans for Mardi Gras and this had to be the wrost experience I had. I order coffee then the 2 egg breakfast with bacon, cajun potatoes, and a biscuit. My coffee was lukewarm, the biscuit was hard, the cajun potatoes were cold, and the eggs I ordered over easy came out almost over hard. My server Robert made me feel like he didn't care to be there. The prices would have been great IF the food and service would have been better. I am hated that it was not a better experience because this was one place that I wanted to visit.

In a great location but does not live up to the hype. I got Char Grilled Oysters, which were great. I also got a French onion soup which was easily 50% cheese. Honestly, I spend just as much on soup as I did on oysters - and the soup was sub par at best. Service is fine and whatever, but I complained about the soup and the waiter laughed like it was a joke. 4/5 stars on the oysters, 2/5 on the soup. Averages out to 3/5
Anthony at the Oster bar was on point. He recommended great food and service. Anthony is an asset to this restaurant bc he absolutely know what the best in the menu!!

I should start by saying this is the best service I've ever had anywhere. Anthony the bartender is so nice and helpful and probably the best server I've ever met in any city anywhere. I had lost my purse at another bar and flew into a panic attack when I realized I didn't have it and Anthony put my food order in and saved my spot until I got back (I found my purse btw). 
I got the gumbo and the chargrilled oysters. Like another reviewer said they aren't really chargrilled but they're bubbling with butter and cheese and you can't go wrong there. The gumbo was good although I wish it were less rice and more meat. For dessert I got the bread pudding and it was just like the bread pudding I grew up eating back home in Georgia. Would love to visit again on my next NOLA trip.
Love there balcony seating, enjoyed oysters, bloody Mary's, and service was quick, good and drinks were really good.
The service was really slow. Our waitress was really nice but every other table that came after us got their food. The only good thing is the red fish beignets. Don't get the shrimp n grits.

Well, I was looking forward to some delicious Cajun food while i was I. New Orleans for the mardi gra.  We seen the reviews so figured it had to be awesome.
It was late night on 2/21/20  We Ordered to go-  they forgot the eggplant,  the chicken & sausage jambalaya was missing sausage ( not one piece) the containers were small which was fine, but they were only 2/3 full.  The flavor of the crawfish etouffee was great.  I personally wouldn't recommend them for late night dinner.(10:30pm) maybe it's different during the day.

Couldn't get in this place for dinner in the past but today it was no problem AT ALL for breakfast. Had a ham n cheese omelette cooked perfectly with cheesy grits. The staff here are excellent all of them including my waiter Robert. Host and manager were very courteous. Manager even fixed my drink upon requesting a special vodka. It was delicious. I was also amazed they let folks off the street use the bathroom which is rare in most restaurants and on Mardi Gras. I will definitely return!!!

Came here because of the reviews. A bit disappointed. 
1. The crab claw appetizer did not look like the pictures at all. 
2. The oyster combo messed up, we got 2 spinach and 1 random. 
3. The jambalaya to go took 1.3 hours from when we ordered to complete. After we finished eating we still waiting
4. The entree took about 30-40 minutes to come
5. The portion is so small it was not what I was used to. I left hungry after a 100+ meal for 2

Plus side: hurricane is good

Food was great but I have some feedback to give. The waiters need to check on their guest more and tend to their needs.

My party and I sat in the balcony. The balcony seating was nice but it got a bit cold so we wanted to sit inside. We were accommodated, but our appetizers happen to come out at the same time we were moving inside. The waitress moved us to our new table but left our food outside? So I had to go grab my food from the table on the balcony. It really took away from the quality of the service provided. Also, I wanted to highlight that they were not too busy at the time! And the service was very slow. It is kind of funny how the waitress was so quick to bring my party the check with out even asking if we would like dessert. 

Such a shame- I would've given them more stars if it wasn't for the catastrophic service.

Now to the food! The char grilled oyster were fabulous!!! By far my favorite in NOLA. The crawfish ravioli was also amazing in its own special way too!

But....stay away from seafood stuffed mushrooms! Super dry unfortunately. But on the bright side they were free. If you check in on yelp and order two entrées you get a free appetizer!
Came here twice over two days. The food hits the spot, but make sure to ask for Tina when you get here. She's an incredible waitress.
Very dirty :( we could not even eat. The place looked like it had not be cleaned. Maybe it had to do with the Mardigras crazyness.

VERY confused how this restaurant has good reviews. The food was INEDIBLE!! I chose this restaurant based on Yelp reviews--- warning other yelpers--don't trust the 4 stars. First of all the service was lacking. The hospitality at Royal House was no where near the service at other NOLA restaurants. Second, the food was disgusting. Ordered quite a few dishes... across the board all were gross:
-Seafood stuffed mushrooms: the stuffing was rubbery. Not sure what was in it.....
-French onion soup: SALTY!! and THICK. I've never had french onion soup as thick as this one. Literally ate the cheese on top and tossed the rest.
- Taste of New Orleans (Jambalaya, Crawfish Etouffée and Chicken and Andouille Gumbo): Jambalaya was COLD. Crawfish etouffee rice was like instant rice just thrown on top. The WORST was by far the gumbo. It tasted like a chemical was dropped inside the bowl. We quickly spit it out. Tasted like rubbing alcohol. 
- "Mashed garlic potatoes": Unsure how this restaurant considers this dish mashed potatoes. They weren't even mashed... rather they were dried out and salty with some dried out cheese baked on top. 
AVIOD THIS PLACE. There are sooooo many other restaurants in the french quarters. Wasted $70 on this meal---literally all food was thrown out.

Oysters were absolutely amazing! Clean, sweet, delicious! We also had shrimp po boy and red fish. All were very tasty and enjoyed. The service was so friendly and welcoming and very fast. The wait for it all was very limited. Would definitely recommend.
This time didn't like the oysters as much. Also I asked the waiter if they had those little red pickled onions or any vinegar sauce and he acted like he'd never heard of that with oysters.
We loved this place, super friendly staff, food was unbelievable. Saw a bunch of bad reviews and were a little skeptical but thank god we went for it anyways. Definitely one of our New Orleans faves

Checked-in to get the free appetizer. Unfortunately, the only one it covered for free was sold out. The server suggested the crab claws and still charged us for the extra cost above the free appetizer. The crab claws were tiny with very little meat. We also ordered a shrimp po-boy and gulf shrimp platter. Both were average. The food is okay, but nothing to write home about. If you only have a couple days in the French quarter find a different restaurant.
Restaurant looks great, very nice inside. However, that's all to it. Food was mediocre, I expected a lot more from this place given their fresh seafood selection.

Upon arriving my boyfriend and I each went to use the bathroom. The women's smelled so bad I couldn't stop gagging and nearly decided to just hold it. When I got back to the table he told my there was a cockroach in the only urinal in the men's bathroom and showed me a video he took of it. Despite telling our server about our experience all she did was come back a few minutes later and say "all gone" while giving us a thumbs up. The worst part however was towards the end of our meal, the lady at a table behind us got sick all over their table and the floor. While the staff was well aware, nobody did anything to clean it up or help her the whole time we were there. Which was at least 20 minutes after that. I've never been so disgusted by a restaurant's service.

Absolutely amazing. If you are in NOLA this is a must. I recommend sitting at the bar. The Taste of New Orleans is a must as well as the oysters. If you are there for brunch recommend ordering the Blood Mary. I am actually not a fan of Bloody Mary's but this one changed my mind. Out of all the places we ate on our trip to New Orleans this was by the far the #1 place I would go back to. Despite how full I was I literally could not stop eating. It was worth every single bite. We also split a Po Boy which was probably one of the best sandwhiches I have devoured.
The French onion soup is sooooooo salt! The reddish does not taste fresh. The taste of New Orleans is okay. The waitress does not have a good attitude. Do not recommend this restaurant.

Great atmosphere and service! Even better food! We sat at the bar and got to watch them shuck oysters all night. We had the chargrilled oysters which were amazing!! I also had the baked shrimp tortellini and it was out of this world! Highly recommend! Will definitely be back!

I visited on a Thursday evening.  The restaurant was crowded,  but they were still accommodating.  The service and food were both excellent and timely! Downtown New Orleans has so many food choices,  but I cannot wait to eat here again next time I'm in town.

Tonight my friends and myself cane and ordered 2 dozen chargrilled oysters and a shrimp pie boy and the food was amazing! The food came out in an excellent time and our oysters were great. The pinky was topped with pickles, lettuce, and tomato with just enough shrimp! Even better than the great food the service was excellent! There was no wait and our waiter Blake was extremely helpful!! I admired the conversation he gave us while talking about shucking oysters and the skill it took to do it. He was very nice and anything we asked for there was no issue at all. Blake was phenomenal and the food was excellent this is a DEFINITE recommend!

Like with other recent reviewers, we were drawn in by this restaurant's good rating. Group of 9 stopped in for a late lunch. Almost everything that could have gone poorly did. 

First, the place wasn't particularly busy, maybe half full on a late Saturday afternoon. We ordered alcoholic drinks and then our appetizers a bit after and everything seemed normal. It took almost an hour for the appetizers to arrive. Drinks hadn't even arrived yet. We would end up getting them 15 mins after the appetizers came out. Apparently the bar had "run out of everything". Everything. 

It took even longer for the entrees to came out, with several additional problems. We got two orders of the ravioli but each one looked drastically different. They didn't even seem like the same order. They entirely forgot one order (which we never endsd ip getting but remained on the bill) and potentially two more on top of that. We waited on the gumbo and the crawfish etoufeé and asked someone if those were coming. 

The waiter (not our primary waitress) responded they'll get right on it, implying they hadn't been done? Their rush was apparent because the crawfish had lots of shell bits and the rice was splattered all over the plate haphazardly. There were only 3 pieces of unfried crawfish. The gumbo looked like it was hastily poured from an appetizer bowl into an entree bowl, and was very small portion-wise with very little meat. We had to send the gumbo back. 

Another cherry on top was a waitress (not ours) spilled a tray of waters on one of our people. Another waitress who was handing out silverware napkin bundles had a terrible attitude. For me, she just slapped in onto my shoulder and waited for me to grab it there with my other hand. Lastly, we didn't get a single refill on our water until the end of our 2 hour mess of a meal. 

Meal came out to almost $400. At this price point, the service, speed, and food quality/consistency was SORELY lacking.

Overall, reminded me of the worst tourist trap restaurants you'd see in Santa Monica, CA. Our experience was very different from those in Royal's good reviews; it felt like we were in an entirely different place. 

Avoid at all costs, you can find better food nearby for cheaper with better service.
Chris the bartender was amazing!!! He knew what I wanted before I did! We had a great time and delicious food! When I am in the french quarter the royal house is where i go! Thank you chris!!

Our food was delicious! I had the eggplant & fried oyster pasta. It was scrumptious. My boyfriend had the eggplant/chicken parmesan.We sat on the balcony and had a wonderful experience. Drinks were good, super strong. The atmosphere was really nice. There was a man playing the violin down at the corner and it made our dining experience extra special.

Stopped here before hitting the road back to FLA and it was and awesome catch! Not to many places we go to where linette needs extra bread to try and soak the sauce from the bowl but this was one of them. The food was full of flavor, the staff was super nice and helpful in making a recommendation. You wont be dissatisfied stopping here for a meal or drinks!

beautiful location, e x c e l l e n t food (i had the eggplant parmesan as a vegetarian dish & it was delisH), & they played the office and twilight on the big screens??? overall such a fun time & everyone i was with loved it as well! definitely a great NOLA go to!!!
Always a place for bloody Mary's and oysters! Try the crab claws! We have never been disappointed here. There are so many variations of oysters and three are huge!!

Asked for a table upstairs and we lucked out with a table on the balcony. Ordered Red Beans and rice and hubby had Jambalaya with Oyster appetizer. Service was outstanding and food delicious. Got lucky and had a Second Line go by.

Chose this place on our last day here in New Orleans and we were extremely happy with our decision! 

We sat on the balcony which was a little concerning  at first because it has a bit of a tilt to it, but we were comfortable within a few minutes. 

Our server was a very nice and accommodating gentleman named Greg who suggested the Tortellini for my fiancé, I had the crawfish ravioli. Our meals were absolutely fantastic with wonderful flavor, I must admit I had some plate envy for the tortellini! Greg paired a nice white wine with her meal as well. 

By far the best meal we had in this town, highly highly recommend!

Unfortunately visited during the circus-19 outbreak. They were not allowing anyone on premises but did serve takeout from the doorway and what we had we ate on the steps of the courthouse across the street and it was delicious.

My wife and I were visiting from D.C. and my coworker advised me to stop at Royal House. I was pleasantly surprised. Walked in on a Sunday Night, two days before Fat Tuesday during the middle of Mardi Gars and got a good seat at the bar. That is where we met an OUTSTANDING server named ANTHONY! 

I HIGHLY recommend that everyone asks for him. He represents everything New Orleans is about. GREAT HOSPITALITY, GREAT CONVERSATIONS, GREAT FOOD RECOMMENDATIONS! He is very knowledgeable of the menu. He got me to try things I didn't think to order. We were told that we Had to order a Hurricane. It did not disappoint. Decided to order appetizers and settled for the (Alligator). To my surprise it was pretty good. He offered the suggestion to use the Chipotle Pepper Sauce and it was FIRE!!!!!! Absolutely AMAZING!

After the appetizers he suggested the shrimp and catfish platter. Another TOP NOTCH suggestion. My wife ordered the taste of New Orleans. She enjoyed that as well. Finished the night up with great conversation about places to visit in the area and other foods to try. I can't wait to go back and when I do, I am definitely going back to Royal House.
The taste of New Orleans plate is perfect. I got to taste 3 dishes that I really like at the same time. Very delicious.

Back in early March, I made a trip to New Orleans for a bachelor party. Before the festivities started, I stopped by Royal House for dinner and sat at the bar. Royal House is in the heart of the action in the French quarter. 

After starting off with a Pimm's Cup I went with the crawfish ravioli. For the price, I was expecting a larger portion. The ravioli itself was dry too. Rather than being boiled, it seemed like the ravioli was baked but baked a little too long. The execution was lacking but I did like the sauce and you have to have some crawfish when you're in Nola. Service was standard. 

Added bonus: Yelp check-in offer.

oh how I wish I was back in New Orleans eating crawfish, listening to jazz music and enjoying some really great plates at Royal House. Order the oysters! Im writing this review two years later and yet i still think about the grilled oysters here. They were heaven and i cant wait to go back and eat another 2 dozen. Great service and delicious food!

We traveled with another couple to NOLA March 11-15, 2020.  Came home just as NOLA was starting to shut down.  We were able to eat at The Royal House for the birthday girl.  If there are only two of you, definitely ask to be seated on the balcony.  It looks out over Royal Street and you can hear all the street musicians and none of the cacophony from Bourbon Street.  Cajun and Creole cuisine.  Friendly service.  The wife and daughter discovered this restaurant a few years ago on a previous trip and the food continues to be delicious.
Stay safe and healthy.

Great atmosphere, attentive service and delicious food. Friendly staff. Tried red beans and rice, jambalaya and gumbo. The jambalaya was fantastic.  The rice tasted like it looked- like Minute rice. Overall a great restaurant to try passing through; would recommend.

Tonight my friends and myself came and ordered 2 dozen chargrilled oysters and a shrimp po boy and the food was amazing! The food came out in an excellent time and our oysters were great. The po boy was topped with pickles, lettuce, and tomato with just enough shrimp! Even better than the great food the service was excellent! There was no wait and our waiter Blake was extremely helpful!! I admired the conversation he gave us while talking about shucking oysters and the skill it took to do it. He was very nice and anything we asked for there was no issue at all. Blake was phenomenal and the food was excellent this is a DEFINITE reccom

We stopped at Royal House for a late lunch and weren't disappointed. The kitchen has a straightforward, apt menu with plenty of attention paid to New Orlean's traditional fare - gumbo, jambalaya, oysters - and the bar options are abundant. Grab a seat by the by the floor to ceiling door shutters for a sunny breeze and view of the street while you eat, especially if you want to be near the action in the heart of the French quarter. 

We started with half a dozen chargrilled and raw oysters. The chargrilled oysters were pure buttery, cheesy flavor and the raw oysters were the largest I've ever seen and very fresh. However, the outer shells were not well-scrubbed and left debris on my fingers and inside one of the shells. Considering the horseradish and cocktail sauce are pretty standard, it might be worth a skip. (Regardless, I still enjoyed - overall the oysters were good but not excellent). The jambalaya & blackened gulf shrimp was tasty, but the baked gulf shrimp tortellini was on another level. I'm not usually a tortellini fan, but the pasta and filling tasted freshly made and the cream sauce was delicious - highly recommend. If you're on the fence or unsure of what to try don't overlook this dish!
Destiny was an amazing server and the food was amazing! I highly recommend, ordered the crab legs & the blue crab app  and the voodo juice was awesome too! Will be back

First, the waitress was very nice, what a sweet person.

Other than that? It's a $40 meal with a $100 bill. The grilled oysters looked and tasted like they were microwaved. The vaunted redfish was utterly boring. The crawfish ravioli tasted just like Rouse's frozen ravioli although the crawfish sauce on top was pretty good.

If you're coming in from McKeesport PA and "want to do New Orleans" this is the place for you. Otherwise it's a pass for me.

This place is always a must stop for me when I'm in New Orleans. I had my first ever oyster here almost ten years ago and have been addicted ever since. I usually stay at the Omni Royale which is across the street so this is my go to. I would usually sit at the bar and inhale dozens of oysters but this trip was with the whole family so we sat at a table. Service was excellent. I'm so sad I forgot her name but she was great with my toddler son. 

There were 5 of us total. Seated immediately. I had a Bloody Mary which was tasty as always. Love the pickled green beans. Of course I ordered a dozen raw oysters for my meal which were amazing as always. My husband ordered the fried shrimp Poboy which he said was good but there was barely any shrimp on it which is the only reason this doesn't have 5 stars. My son got the Mac and cheese off the kids menu and it was super tasty. The oldest daughter had the grilled chicken Caesar salad which she devoured and said was awesome. But the real star of the show, hear me out, was my stepdaughters chicken strips. HOLY MOLY. They were amazing. She didn't care for the ranch so she asked for honey mustard and oh my gosh. Even the waitress told her to get them because it was HER favorite menu item and boy was she spot on. They were amazing. Perfectly breaded and golden brown. Yum. 

Overall, this is still my favorite and we will still come here every time we are in town. Love this place.
Very friendly service the jambalaya was good and the crawfish etouffee were great the gumbo was pretty good. But the oysters were fresh and delicious would eat two dozen if I could
Table full of oysters is the way to go!  Love both the chargrilled oysters and the oyster Rockefeller from Royal

We were sent here by the Bellman at the Omni Royal Hotel.  

He was not wrong!  Oysters were great, perfectly cooked and the service was perfect.  Mint Julep was amazingly muddled and great with fresh mint and cold glass.  

We went back twice more, haha!
Food was amazing and service was unexpectedly fast. Our waitress was really nice and gave us great recommendations on her favorites. The baked gulf shrimp tortellini was absolutely amazing!

I enjoyed my Voodoo juice libation. I had the seafood stuffed mushrooms, spinach & artichoke dip, and the crawfish & crabmeat ravioli....I loved everything!!!! I left the restaurant with that spinach & artichoke dip on my mind...soon to return for it again!!!
Destiny was our server and she was great and very sweet with our 4 year old daughter.

We came here for my birthday while we were in NOLA. Brittany was our server and made our night! She was so incredibly sweet and made our trip so great! Wish every waitress could be as great as she was! Food was delicious! Thank you!!

We can go with 4.5 stars! I've eaten here before and their food really gives that seafood, creole, savory deliciousness that you are looking for. The Bloody Mary is top notch and I cannot brag on their oysters enough. I always get the oyster duo (Rockefeller and Royal) and a dozen fresh! They also will make you an oyster shot! This time we just had appetizers and and drinks on an extremely hot day during the pandemic. The manager's energy made me smile. Someone with that positive energy in such trying times is irreplaceable. He had the staff smiling even though I could tell they were miserably hot and disappointed about the money they won't make because of the current circumstances. The 4.5 stars was because the air vent kept spraying dust on us and on our food at first but the manager moved us and apologized. I recommend sitting at the upstairs bar or the balcony when all of that is open again!
Great vibe, great service.  Very lively.  Food was not terrible, but definitely something i could've prepared at home with some pre mixed seasoning.  Great atmosphere!

Overall, the food was great but a bit pricey and not amazing compared to some of the other restaurants in the area. The restaurant wasn't really enforcing any sort of social distancing, although servers wore masks. The table we were sat at was wiped down, but not disinfected.

The oyster duo came with two of their unique oysters, and were very good although I personally felt the oyster flavor was a bit lost underneath all the other flavors.

The crawfish etouffee was good, but not as flavorful as I would have liked.
NEVER disappointed when we hit up Royal House. Excellent food and service. Definitely a must whenever we visit.

Let me tell you, this was the BEST food we had during our weekend trip to NOLA and we ate at over 10 restaurants during our stay. The service was beyond amazing, from the host, server to the chef. Definitely recommend the gulf shrimp tortellini

Food was wonderful. Fried shrimp platter on a bed of fries & hush puppies were hot & crispy with a ton of flavor. Shrimp pasta with red sauce had soooo much flavor. We wanted to slurp the leftover sauce right out of bowl. Cajun red bean & rice with added buttermilk fried chicken breast strips was a perfect melody of flavor. It had a hint of spice from sausage but not too much. The staff was AMAZING. Very friendly, there when you needed them. The best part was the manager. He was awesome!! Very friendly, went out of way to explain to my son what a hush puppy was. He gave great advice on places to go while in New Orleans.  He accidentally gave us a wrong dish. We had no idea, we think it was probably better then what we originally ordered & he still took it of the bill. The manager treated us like he owned the restaurant, so devoted, true to his career & love for food. I recommend you check in early for balcony seating. If there is a long wait, you could window shop close to restaurant. With Covid, the French Corridors are pretty empty, but balcony was an hour wait. Balcony will give you the real feel of how quaint &  beautiful  the French quarters are.

My friend and I visited the other day, during Covid restrictions.  The restaurant followed guidelines and made sure all guests did as well.
  The restaurant, itself, was really cute inside and perfectly located in the French Quarter.
  My friend and I ordered the Oysters Royal, artichoke dip, and stuffed mushrooms. Everything was delicious but the Oysters, hands down, were the best part! You definitely need to make sure to get them. 
  We stopped by one more time on our trip and also to the Taste of New Orleans and the Crawfish Ravioli.  The Ravioli was amazing and so flavorful! 
  Of course, being in New Orleans we had to get a hurricane as well. You should too, you won't regret it!

Our server/Bartender was extremely friendly and helpful.

Came here for dinner my first night in new Orleans and so glad I did.
The food was amazing. I had oysters with seafood in them. Kind of like a crab cake. So good. Artichoke dip which was also amazing. The stuffed mushrooms were super good too. We got 5 in an order and there were large ones and really small ones. Wish they were the same size, easier to share. Also had a hurricane (drink) I cant really judge how it was as it's been yrs since I had one previously. Prices seemed fair. Everyone who we dealt with at the restaurant was very friendly and accommodating. Highly recommend eating here.

Good food and attentive service.  Actually, I think COVID made NOLA a more pleasant place to visit.  Sure, some places were closed, but the places we went, the people were super kind and happy to see us.  Royal house had great food and excellent service.  Not cheap, though (but nothing in NOLA is).  Recommended.

Some of the best food in Nola right here! Do not miss the appetizers, the crab claws are totally undersold on the menu as being served in a "garlic butter sauce" but OMG that sauce was SO luscious. It's been a few days and we are still raving about this meal, but especially the crab claws! The shrimp and grits was pretty good but the ravioli blew me away. Perfectly stuffed with spinach and ricotta, lobster and shrimp, then covered with yet another mind blowing sauce. This sauce was full of tender crawfish tails and then finished with cheese and put under the broiler to finish. It was fantastic. We had martinis and a bottle of wine as well, all well priced and paired lovely with the food. Service was great, everyone was very friendly and happy. This is my new Nola dinner spot for sure!
I highly recommend sitting at the 2 person tables on the balcony! The view of Royal St. was amazing and the food- seafood stuffed ravioli and chargrilled oysters- was fantastic. Great location!

This restaurant was a pleasure of food from start to finish.  Staff was on point with service.  Chargrilled Oysters were delicious.  Lobster and Crawfish Ravioli had such wonderful flavor. Definitely will go there again

This place was right on the corner awesome location and lots of space inside. Customer service was top notch, every employee was very friendly and extremely helpful. 

Had the fried alligator as an app--slightly undercooked. Breading was light which was awesome and great flavors, but the gator could have been cooked a bit longer. 

Same for the fried shrimp platter--slightly undercooked. 

Not terrible but definitely not on my return lists when I'm back in New Orleans.

Unfortunately I was dissatisfied with this restaurant. after reading some of the review I decided to try this place out, unfortunately it was not good. I ordered an onion soup and it had a fishy taste to it. The rest of our dinner was just either overcooked or tasted old and definitely not fresh. Oyster where ok, but could have been rinsed before they chucked them, I love oyster but this was a slightly disappointing.  I know covid is affecting lots of business in New Orleans so maybe I'll give it another try. Service was good and the restaurant was clean.

The welcoming atmosphere was apparent from the moment we walked in the door. The hostess was very charming and every employee we encountered was friendly and courteous. As far as the food goes, I decided to give the Taste of New Orleans a try. The crawfish etoufee and red beans and rice were out of this world however, I wasn't the biggest fan of the gumbo. My gf got the catfish platter and it was top notch. Highly recommend the hush puppies. Our server Andre C was very attentive.
We have been to this place the last few nights. The food and drinks were excellent. The number one asset was Brittany who made our experience both nights outstanding and will bring us back again!!

The Royal House has absolutely delicious chargrilled oysters! We loved them and this place got us hooked. We sat on the balcony and enjoyed watching the different groups of glow bikes go by while enjoying our dinner. It's right by the courthouse and in a convenient location in the French Quarter. 

I also ordered the ribeye, which wasn't all that great unfortunately, so I would just stick to the seafood on the menu since that's what they're good at.
Had great fried alligator and oysters on the half shell. Great upstairs patio seating and nice staff!

We were here a month or two ago. All of the employees wore masks and the tables weren't super close to each other. The staff is decently friendly. Ada was our server.

A lot of the restaurants were closed so this was the place that we liked most (within walking distance from our hotel Omni) for oysters.  Most days they were excellent but the last day they were overcooked (see photos). We preferred the original chargrilled to the other choices. 

On the last day, we were happy to see that they opened early (see sign) because we needed to start our drive home to Texas and wanted one last plate of oysters. We walked up and Ada and staff told us that they weren't open even though the doors were open and the sign was out. So we stood there sweating and waiting but we didn't care all that much other than we didn't think it was great customer service. Not sure what that was about but it was a good send off especially because half of mine were overcooked. 

I would definitely check this place out and order the chargrilled oysters, they're fantastic.

We came here because of the good reviews.  Service was slow but we understand restaurants are short staffed these days.  We ordered the crawfish ravioli, crab legs and shrimp creole.  Food was horrible.  Every dish tasted like it was microwaved.  Waste of money.  Yikes.
A great place for apps and drinks! Our server was wonderful and attentive and the decor is super cool. The ravioli and French onion soup are both to die for. Recommend stopping in for lunch!

You talking about some Great eating !! Love this place Services attitude all good ....Selena wasn't in but Kendralle...and Arrow was a charm ...you can't go wrong 20 years in never disappointed ...
Lovd Royal house 
Charbroiled Oysters everything  is Arrow Grest

I was able to visit in June. It was a nice place overall. Great drinks and food. I felt safe with all the precautions they have here.  Great tip . Order the blue crab claws and keep the sauce and dip into your oysters. That's what my bartender told me . 5 stars will come back soon

We stopped in for some light eats and a beer while shopping in the French Quarter. What a pleasant experience we had! Not only was the food great, but the service was excellent from the door to the table. Our server Dell was absolutely perfect, what a beautiful soul with a soothing accent. The gumbo was very good, but the roast beef poboy was absurdly delicious. This place felt like New Orleans to me. It was good to be back home. A restaurant experience is more than food, it's how you "feel". I'm leaving feeling great.

Royal House definitely delivered! The chargrilled oysters were amazing! They came out piping hot and did I burn myself cause I couldn't wait to dig In. 
The crab claws were so tasty and sweet; the sauce, although flavorful didn't take away the sweetness of the blue crab.  My favorite dish of them all! 
Definitely one of the better crab claws you can find in NoLa is at Royal House.
Royal house was delicious! Ask for Kylene. Tried the gator bites and oyster duo, was amazzzzzzzzzzzzzing

There was a dead bug in my wife's salad. Our waiter was nice, but there was a dead bug in my wife's salad. The food wasn't anything to write home about, but there was a dead bug in my wife's salad. The service wasn't too fast, but there was a dead bug in my wife's salad. I would strongly recommend against eating here because there was A DEAD BUG IN MY WIFE'S SALAD! We were both thoroughly disgusted with that experience, and the restaurant needs to know that such things are unacceptable.

A must have while in the French Quarter! I've never had anything like this in any of my travels. The sauce was very flavorful. I couldn't stop eating. Aside from the amazing food, Aida took care of us like Royalty. Not once was my drink empty. She was very knowledgeable with the menu and made recommendations to meet our preferences. Great hospitality.

This is the second time I have visited Royal House. Service was great. The view was perfect. It was a bit hot outside, Butt we really wanted to sit on the balcony. It was wonderful. The sun was setting so the temp cooled and a band was playing down the street. It was the perfect setting to end our New Orleans trip. 

More important the food was delicious! We tried the New Orleans  quad. It was etouffee, jambalaya, Reed beans and rice, and gumbo. I loved the fact we could try a little bit of everything. Combine that was a appetizer of stuffed mushroom and one of the best French Onion soups to complete our meal. The soup was so good I burnt my mouth.

During these time it's hard to find a restaurant that's able to provide excellent service and food Royal Housed did both for us. First our server Destiny she was amazing loved her, our food oysters dou combo of oysters Rockefeller and oysters royals awesome flavors then blackened red fish topped off with bread pudding 
Very good dinner thanks again
Amazing place!!! Food was great, service was great, nice atmosphere. The waitress was the best part! Friendly, charming, and made the night.
Had such a great time, food is 10/10 atmosphere is excellent for quality night life and our host Kendrall was such a personality!
Kid friendly and excellent food!  Oysters Rockefeller, Royal, and Chargrilled.  Blue crab claws in garlic Parmesan dipping sauce.

Had an ok experience. Probably won't be going back though. The food was tasty although it made my stomach extremely upset which rarely happens. I reached out to the restaurant and provided feedback and I never got a response back unfortunately which makes it seem like they do not care.

We sat upstairs in the dining room. We really wanted to sit outside on the balcony but it was raining. Service was ok but the food was amazing. Royal house was a great place to try a few of the NOLA foods that were on our list. The chargrilled oysters were so delicious!! I wish it came with some bread or crackers though. The taste of New Orleans included gumbo, jambalaya, crawfish  etouffee, and red beans and rice. The etouffee was the best! We also shared the crispy fish and chips. All delicious!!

My husband and I, waited more than two hours, yes 2 hours just for appetizers, the food isn't what you see in the photos, and my french onion soup was very very salty. The best think was the corona beer lol. 
Don't waste your time.
Delicious food! Great service! Fried eggplant, shrimp poboy, shrimp n grits were all so good!

Great food, the bustling NOLA atmosphere, and great service that reinforces that classic "Southern Hospitality". Tevin is one of the best servers I've ever had the pleasure of having. I cannot recommend this place enough.

Easy reservation process online. In the heart of the city. This restaurant has two levels for seating and balcony seating for parties of 2. There are a lot of stairs to get upstairs and they are steep. If there was an elevator we were not told about it. The staff wears masks and the tables were seated apart. We had the artichoke dip with taco chips for our appetizer and this was very good. We also had a chicken salad and shrimp and grits. Unfortunately my meal was minimally warm. I notified the waiter who had the chef? come over. They offered to remake it but everyone at the table was already eating and I didn't want to make everyone feel uncomfortable as I sat there while they ate. The food was very good besides the temperature of my meal.

Came in by myself. Ordered their crab claws first. There were about 7 or 8 badly mangled crab claws that had sunk at the bottom of some bizarre cream sauce. The sauce tasted oily & weird, the crab claws were in pieces & I picked shell out of my mouth for the next 10 minutes.
Then I ordered Shrimp & grits. It was brought to me without grits & the server did not notice. He asked me "What do you want me to do about that?"
Their bread pudding was okay. 
Skip the little traps like this place & wait for real restaurants like Brennan's, Galatoire's, Palace or Cochon to open back up. This was a waste of my money. 
I'd have felt less cheated with a poboy from French Market.
Terrific etoufeé, redfish, and oysters. Friendly staff and reasonable prices in Nola.

On vacation again and ofcourse we are at the Royal House again. It's been a while so new bartender and new server but same excellent service as always!  Yamini was our server.  She was fast.  She was courteous and she was funny.  But most importantly she had fantastic recommendations and made our day continue on that much smoother. Yamini, if we had our own restaurant we would tell all our servers to mold their attitudes to be more like you.  We will certainly be back. Also try the Mint Julep!

As we were walking the streets on a late Sunday night we stumbled upon this place. We wanted to sit outside on the patio and was told that the wait would be 15-20. They grabbed our number and we walked around to grab a drink while we wait. We never heard back from them so we went to check if we could get a table and the hostess told us she had been calling us but we received no call. She was very uninterested in helping us, seemed like she didn't want to be there. The food on the other hand was good. The oysters were to die for. The Caprese tower was underwhelming. Our waitress was sweet and we enjoyed having our view from the patio. Overall we had a great visit and I wish I ordered more oysters.

Service was good. The food...that's another story.
I had the crawfish étouffée which was decent.  My bf ordered the roast beef po'boy.  His sandwich had barely any meat on it.
Oysters were amazing. Worth the wait and prices are good, especially for the Quarter.

So sad. One of my favorite restaurants is now gone the way of the dodo. I've lived in New Orleans for over five years and I've had a chance to eat at the royal house when it was very good unfortunately those times are gone. The fish was overcooked the boil was a joke and even the vegetables were overcooked. 

The service was just as bad. The bartender was more concerned with washing his dishes behind the bar than making sure we were happy.

It truly is unfortunate because this restaurant is less than two blocks from my home but I will never eat there again that was ridiculous.

Came in this last Friday night with my group of five for my friends bachelorette dinner. We enjoyed the spacious and breezy upstairs space for our dinner.
