Now I know we're not the first bachelorette party to come through the city so it really meant a lot to have our server Jordan be genuinely excited and congratulatory. She was so friendly and gave us amazing recommendations for our meal. We didn't anticipate going for pasta dishes but wow your chefs put something extra special in that crawfish sauce. The tortellini, ravioli and pescatore (swapped with the crawfish sauce) were all to DIE for, all of which had hefty helpings of the seafood. Almost had to roll out of that building. Would definitely recommend to anyone visiting, thanks for a great night!

Had dinner Friday night, sat outside on the balcony.
1. Gator not bad (some pieces were chewy)
2. Red roasted potatoes delicious 
3. Blackened Redfish - meh
4. Pineapple juice - meh, felt diluted 
5. Grilled oysters delicious   
Good service, food was brought in OK time
Overall, not bad considering location.

Waited 15 mins to be seated. Waited another 45 mins for someone to take our order and I have to go inside twice to ask someone to take our order. Ordered Oyster duo which are cold and can see the topping just placed there. The Cajun Combo Boil pot taste okay but can't taste the cajun

I found this place walking around the French quarter, I was excited to eat here because of their balcony seating. It was a nice quiet place away from
Bourbon St.  The balcony seating was nice, but it felt awkward because it sort of leans to the edge. 

I was skeptical to get to raw oysters because of the reviews, but they were good. I didn't have any issues.
I ended up getting the shrimp boil as my entree. It lacked in flavor, the best part was the corn. The potato was dry and the shrimp didn't have much flavor. 

I also tried the shrimp tortellini (I didn't get a picture of it) it was so delicious. The sauce was rich and creamy!

I discovered this restaurant four years ago and I always go back when I'm back in town. I've introduced four friends/family members to it and they agree- it's delicious! The taste of new Orleans dish is a great intro to the must have local food. We've tried it at other restaurants and this is by far one of the best ones. And that crab claw appetizer is truly mouth watering!! I've been twice during covid and while I wish there was more space between the tables, they take every other precaution and I'm grateful for that. Will keep coming back over and over again

I normally don't leave reviews but Royal House has blown my expectations away. This is the best sea food spot in New Orleans by far. I highly recommend the Alaskan snow crab. It's the best fish I've ever had, better than lobster even. Plus, the location, the drinks, and dessert are amazing.

This place was amazing!  We had the onion soup, seafood stuffed mushroom caps and baked oysters.  Our server Jordan was very good.  Only reason we're not going back today is that we want to try another restaurant while visiting here.  You won't be disappointed.

This review has been a long time coming and I apologize for the tardiness. My life was changed when I entered into this quintessential french quarter building, went up to the balcony and ordered the Crispy fried Oyster BLT poboy. The bread was soft and easy on the roof of my mouth, the oysters were fried crispy golden and paired with thick pieces of smokey applewood bacon. The chipotle mayonnaise ties in all the flavors. I talked about that poboy all the way home. I couldn't get it off my mind, I went back the next day, a week later, and a month ago. I started travel nursing and when I'm missing NOLA I honestly think about this poboy. I'm obsessed. I hope y'all enjoy it as much as I did.

Five stars all the way! 
I took my family here on our staycation Saturday for lunch and we had an AMAZING time. The appetizers that we chose were so TASTY. 
Spinach and Artichoke dip and Blue Crab Claws. I am excited about going back to try the stuffed mushrooms. 

The Kids enjoyed the kid's meal with mac and cheese and hamburgers. 
My husband got the Taste of New Orleans, which is a sampling  of The City's Most Famous Dishes: Cajun Chicken & Andouille Jambalaya, Crawfish Etouffée, Red Beans And Rice, And Chicken Andouille Gumbo. He REALLY enjoyed it.

I enjoyed the Crawfish & Crabmeat Ravioli, Jumbo Ravioli Filled With Lobster, Shrimp, Spinach & Ricotta, Topped With Creamy Louisiana Crawfish Sauce And Sautéed Blue Crab. You have to try this!! 

I will definitely say this is walking distance from so much in the downtown area. Make sure you give them a try locals and tourists alike.

I really wanted this to be the best experience since it was the first restaurant we ate at after arriving in New Orleans.  I was bummed.  First, the service was subpar.  Took ten minutes for someone to acknowledge us at the table (and the restaurant was only half full), then another ten to get our waters.  Once we ordered our meal, it took 30 minutes for them to arrive.  We ordered Po Boy's with fries, red beans and rice and jambalaya.  The bread on the Po Boy was stale, but worse, the fries were literally cold.  All I can think is they fried them up, plated them, then waited until the Po Boys were ready instead of waiting for all to plate at the same time.  The Jambalaya was room temperature and honestly, none of us could find any seafood in the bowls.  The only shining star was the red beans and rice...

The server only came back once and never offered us any water refills.  We had to ask for them.

Hated our first impression of New Orleans!!

Usually Yelp steers me in the right direction when it comes to trying out a new restaurant. In this case, I am totally lost as to why the Yelp community rates this place so highly.  We wanted to come someplace special for our last night in New Orleans and this was not that kind of place. 

Like many other reviews state, you will definitely be waiting a long time from when you get seated to when a server will come up to your table to take your order (or even bring you water!!). It almost seems as though there is no system for what tables servers are responsible for, which makes it very easy to lose track of newly seated customers. I would be able to look past this if the food was able to make up for it, but....

The food was a HUGE disappointment. We ordered the Gulf Fish Beignet appetizer that we got for free by checking in on Yelp. We each took a bite and looked up at each other with such horrified faces wondering whether our entrees would be as terrible too. Sadly, they were. They lacked flavor and had no other redeeming qualities. My boyfriend and I could make a better meal and we are average in the kitchen! 

Take my advice and spend your night elsewhere at a more deserving restaurant in NOLA.

We ordered Taste of New Orleans, Crawfish Ravioli and Oysters Rockefeller. We were here totally as tourists and I think these are good. I just followed the must-have New Orleans food list online to order this meal. The portions were good for a couple who starved for half a day. For me, the ravioli is a little too salty, but for my boyfriend it is okay. Don't know if this is the most authentic taste of New Orleans. But at least it did not disappoint two hungry stomachs.

My 2nd stop while visiting NOLA for the first time. Service was great! Wish I remembered my waitresses name but I dont. My friends and I sat on the upstairs balcony which felt a bit scary because it feels tilted. There were 4 of us but the seating space only fits 2 so we sat in pairs. Now on to the food and drinks.

I have raw oysters, chargrilled oysters, alligators and shrimp and grits. I was very satisfied, but if I had to change anything it would be the chargrilled oysters because they were a bit salty, but still pretty good. I had the Hurricane as a drink which was very good as well. I would come back!
Amazing good and service! The fried alligator and chargrilled oysters was so delicious. The atmosphere is great too.
Service was extremely slow!  Food was over priced and portions were very small.  Won't be back.

To say this place was a huge disappointment was an understatement. We were a party of 7 there on Monday afternoon 12/28 around 1:30. We didn't need to wait too long for our table, but that's about as good as it gets.  We were sat upstairs and it took approximately 15 minutes before we were greeted by a server. After someone finally stopped by and asked if we had been helped, to which we answered no, said she ok, I'll just take care of you. She took our drink order and then turned us over to another server. Waters and sodas came out about 5 minutes later...but our beers took close to 20 minutes and that was only after we stopped our first waitress to ask. 
Food orders were then taken. After we asked our server for several suggestions, we should have paid for our drinks and left, she had nothing great to say about the menu. When asked about the gumbo, she said it was good as long as you added your own salt. What about the eggplant. She nods "no". Ok then what do you like. No answer. Perfect. We played it safe with soup, salads, and oysters.
55 minutes later. Lunch was served. 
Fifty-five minutes *later* we had our food. Ask me how we know how long it was? Because we had a phone call when the server was taking our order. Now, as we understand kitchens get backed up, but there were only 4 other tables filled. Just let us know if it's backed up. We're reasonable people.
But I digress. 
Food comes out. Food runner drops it off and then just, leaves. Thank goodness the host was walking by, saw what happen and gave us our stuff. 
Grilled oysters - barely warm. Closer to room temp. 
Salad - no dressing
French onion soup - very salty.
Dozen raw oysters - and I'm not even joking when I say this, received 12 shells and 11 oysters. Where did the other oyster go and how does one not notice that when shucking?
Food runner did come back with dressing and an extra oyster. So that was nice. 
Also we had to ask him because our waitress had pretty much become MIA. 
Figured we ask for the bill while still eating because, you know, time management. 
Had to yet again, find a different server to find our other server to get the bill. 
We left. We were annoyed, mostly because eating out shouldn't be this difficult. And there are so many other places we could have been. We all know everyone is doing the best they can right now, but even this was pushing the limit.

Freshly arrived in NOLA and regretfully spent it here for our first dinner out.  Many of the restaurants that you come to know in New Orleans have either shuttered or have new covid hours, so there weren't many options for a Monday night.  Ended up deciding to try this place and what a huge mistake.  Menu didn't really have any stand out dishes just the usual Cajun/southern fare.  My wife and I just ordered 2 things, one salad and one entree plus 2 waters.  Our server who was pleasant, but we only saw him twice in the hour plus we sat and waited.  35 minutes into our wait our waiter managed to refill our waters and explain that they were backed up in the kitchen and  he was letting the manager know about our extended wait time for our food.  Another 40 min pass w/ no waiter and no food.  We ended up just leaving w/o any assistance, service, or food.  Not even a manager made an attempt to apologise for the awful service. We sat longer than we should only because we were on the balcony and across the street there was some entertainment going on.  Overall a big waste of time and evening for a really basic restaurant.

I'm currently waiting on my appetizer which was ordered almost an hour and a half ago. They brought out one entree and the other entree was something entirely different than what was ordered. It has taken about 30 minutes to get a cocktail and I'm still waiting. At this point, I'm not sure if I'll ever get my entree, drink or appetizer. I think I'll wait ten more minutes and then call it a day.

Great service!  We were hungry and wanted to beat the dinner rush so we came here for an early dinner. We started with a half dozen raw oysters and a half dozen chargrilled oysters. I found the raw oysters to be salty but otherwise good. The chargrilled oysters could have been cleaned a little better. They still had quite a bit of sand in them but they were so delicious and flavorful I was able to overlook the sand. The shrimp creole, crawfish etouffee and shrimp po boy were all great. Our server was very friendly and attentive. We will be back.

The service here is excellent! Especially considering it was New Years Eve and the restaurant is only a few blocks from Burbon Street. We ordered the spinach dip for an appetizer, and it came out hot and the chips were delicious as well. For dinner, the kids portions were huge! I had the choose three, and all three of samplings were very good. The crawfish and jambalaya were my favorites. On a side note, their draft beer selection is lackluster, but there are plenty of bottled beers  & other fruity drinks to choose from. I will definitely go back
Food was delicious. My husband had the oysters and I had the Taste of New Orleans. The bartender, Nairobi did an excellent job.
Funny, the manager reached out after I posted my review and said he wanted to speak to me but guess what....never did!

I was looking forward to the Royal House Gulf Fish Beignets for 3 days prior to my visit to New Orleans. I get to the restaurants super excited, and it turns out for whatever reason they dont have it prepared. I came to the restaurant at 6:30 and I dont know why it was not available. But, there was another large group that was audibly upset at the news of no fish beignets. I ended up ordering the roast beef po' boy. It wasn't stuffed like some of the other po' boys you'll find in NOLA(see picture). My wife's shrimp etouffe came out somewhat cold, so I have to say that although the food at Royal House is good, it isn't at the ultra high standards of the historic restaurants within the area.

PS: The bar area was packed, people sitting next to each other. Which, honestly many bars and restaurants within the French Quarter were guilty of so I wont blame them for anything.

Delicious! We had the New Orleans sampler, the spinach dip, followed by brownie sundae and bread pudding. All were so yummy. Great place to sit next to wide open windows, listening to the street musicians!

So, coming to New Orleans, I knew I'd have to dive into their unique food culture and try absolutely EVERYTHING I could think of. Keep in mind, I came to this restaurant never having tasted any of the items I ordered, but boy did I make the right choices! We started off with the half dozen oysters, which were delicious paired with lemon and their cocktail sauce. Next was the alligator bites, which as a first timer, was intimidating to me. I debated if I wanted to do this, but as I took my first bite, I was shell shocked and suddenly realized the vast amount of food I'd been missing out on simply because it seemed strange or unknown. I finish the alligator bites within seconds when our next and final plate finally came out. The jambalaya with blackened chicken was delicious and I don't think one plate was enough! I wish we'd came back before we left New Orleans but it's definitely on my list of places to come back to! On top of the amazing food, the customer service is also quick and the waiters are friendly and knowledgeable of their menu!

We really enjoyed this restaurant! The servers and staff were great. Friendly and attentive. The menu had a good variety of entrees. The food came out quickly and was delicious. The fried shrimp platter was fabulous!! It included the fried shrimp, fries, french bread, and hush puppies. I liked that the shrimp did not have tails; so I could just pop the whole shrimp in my mouth. Yum!

Ada was our server and she was AMAZING!!!!
My girlfriend had the shrimp tortellini (she NEVER finishes her plate; but she did tonight) she ate every drop of it. 
Ada recommended a dish for me that wasn't on the menu. It was awesome! 
Since this was our first meal in New Orleans of course we had to drink a hurricane with the meal.  They were great as well. 
We also ordered a voodoo juice which is even better than the hurricane! 
I would completely recommend going to this place any time that you visit New Orleans go see Ada and have an awesome experience!!

Took a ever to server to come to our table... food was not good as people review. Their waiter and waitress were keep going to outside and take a smoke a cigarette break. ( I can watching them while eating a meal... ) ugh ...

Nice corner location with lots of seating.
Friendly staff with a full menu
Food was solid.

Came here because our daughter stated they had the best chargrilled oysters and she was right. We were kind of tired from walking and this was a great place to stop, have lunch and a couple of drinks. Service was very good and Covid safety measures were all in place. We sat next to an open window. Will visit again if in NOLA for sure

The place is nice. The gator was good. The bread pudding was a bit dry but we did go late. The brownie was really good. They no longer have the banana bread pudding which is a shame and they should definitely bring that back! The hurricane was really good and not strong..until I got to the bottom half and realized it just wasn't properly mixed. All I had been tasting was the juice. So I downed the bottom half as it was strong. 
The straws with the drinks could be longer. Overall it was nice.

Beautiful corner spot in the heart of everything in New Orleans! We had a great waiter that helped us through the menu. I got the oysters with a salad. And it was so good. We had a nice little view of the street and it was raining. It made for a great ambiance!

Food was good. Service was decent. We experienced some other we liked better. I would definitely go again if i was going to be in town for a few days. You get plenty of food and the service was fast. They followed the Covid guidelines. Royal street is clean and safe. One street over is sketchy, so the safety part is a big deal, especially for evening dining. We recommend Royal House.

Delicious dinner at Royal House.  Server suggested the crab and crawfish ravioli and it was divine!  Make sure to sit upstairs in the outdoor balcony, I happen to get lucky with some live entertainment from the street below.  Service was a bit slow but I didn't really mind as I was enjoying the setting immensely.
Amazing Charbroiled oysters and po-boys! Great staff and ambiance! Outdoor Balcony is perfect during COVID. Staff follows CDC guidelines.

My husband and I had 8pm reservations. We were sat right away. Even though initially they tried to seat us right in front of the door, they did provide us with another table to sit after I let them know that table would not work for us. We ordered drinks, the French Quarter Margarita and a Corona. We also ordered the Chargrilled oysters and the Oysters Duo, which was a combo of Oysters Rockefeller and Royal Oysters. Honestly, I've had better. They had a little too much breading for me. The service and the drinks were great though.
If you're looking for a great place in the French Quarter, you have to go to Royal House! The oysters are fresh and the food is great! Ask for Jay! Her service was amazing! Highly recommend.

Back in NOLA for the first time in awhile and we were craving some of our favorite dishes but also wanted to try a new place and be in the Quarter.  Royal House fit the bill.  We came for the chargrilled oysters and the Taste of New Orleans, and they were delicious, but the crab fingers stole the show.  The sauce was sooo good that we couldn't help but dip the bread in it and eat it with spoons when the crab was done.  The chargrilled oysters were oh so good too.  We got gumbo, jambalaya and shrimp etouffee for our combo.  The gumbo was my fave, the shrimp etouffee was my husband's.  A little slow getting getting the food and again getting cashed out at the end but overall a great experience.
Always amazing! They always treat you like royalty .. and the food is the best in the French quarter ! I got every time I am in town.  Just go you won't be disappointed.

Came here because we wanted to enjoy the live music out front! The drinks and oysters were good! The Bloody Mary was okay but lacked spice. We didn't order it but we heard that their oyster po boy is delicious! Would definitely have to come back and try it next time we visit!

The service is lackluster and the staff is borderline rude. The place is not very clean and it's unorganized. My table was by the kitchen and the kitchen ceiling was leaking. I'm sure some plates got a serving of ceiling water.
The food was ok but definitely overpriced. Not bad but nothing to write home about. The place definitely did not live up to the hype and recommendations.
Skip the Royal House and go to the Oceana Grill.

I haven't written a Yelp review in about 2 years but our experience was pretty bad so I felt obligated. Overall the staff appeared quite confused and disorganized. We waited nearly 20 minutes before a waiter came to our table.  The food took quite a long time to arrive and once it did it was cold. Our drinks were pretty bad and one drink we ordered never came to our table.  Definitely not worth the hype or the price.

Never going back. food  was not worth the price.drinks was not that great. service was horrible,I mean standing up talking and cleaning silverware next to a table full of customers is very unprofessional
A great meal!  The appetizers were divine and the seafood entrees did not disappoint.
EXCELLENT oysters and margaritas. The gator bite appetizer is also tasty.  The location is pristine and their balcony seating is phenomenal. Check it out!

It's a tourist trap! We stop to have lunch after a tour. Our waitress was the worst. After waiting 10mins for our drinks (without even bringing water) she forgets the cups for the beers. The order of oysters came swimming in water instead of having ice. (Not appealing to the eye.) We ordered basic salads. 1 with light dressing and the other without. Well folks, the one w/o came with and the one "light" on the dressing came with the dressing on the "side". We got the attention of another waitress that corrected the salad.  Our waitress never came by to offer another drink or even appolgize for the salad incident. P.s. the waitress only had three tables.
Please spend your money elsewhere at a more deserving restaurant in NOLA.

Not a long wait time, but a long service time to get drinks and food. Don't say you're not ready to order because they will believe you... Food is average for some things that are on everyone's menu. Stuffed mushrooms stuffed with seafood we're mushy and flavorless. Oyster tostadas are 4 nacho chips with creamy coleslaw and a fried ouster on top... messy and different. Oyster rockefeller and seafood stuffed are mediocre at best. Food orders came out at different times although ordered together for only 2 people. Service was not impressive and slow. If you're in a pinch and everything else is packed it may pass for your taste.

A lot of confusion when we THOUGHT we made a reservation. Was seated, took over 40 minutes for food to come out and we were a party of 5, food was not good at all. A little pricey for the food to not be good or hot. Our waitress was really nice. Won't be returning.

On our final night in Nola, we were really looking forward to trying this place. It was raining and we still aren't ready to dine inside yet due to Covid, so we ordered takeout.  When we called the direct phone number, it went to an odd voicemail, so we ordered through DoorDash for pick up.  It took over a half hour to confirm our order, followed by an hour and a half more for our incomplete order.  One item was out of stock, but we were not told until we were ready to finally leave with our takeout.  We were basically told that they were busy and there was nothing that could be done because we ordered through DoorDash.  After my husband spoke to the manager, he comped his drinks that he consumed while waiting for the order, and offered a free dessert.  The food was delicious, but the service certainly didn't live up to all of the great reviews.

Gentleman setting people was wonderful. Appetizers were great...had oysters and stuffed mushrooms. Salads for dinner were average.  Service was horrible. Waitress expressed she was only one on that side of too
 But literally took over an hour after getting appetizers to get our dinners... which were only salads.

I want to start by saying, I know our server and the managers were doing their best, and they did what they could to improve our experience. 

We came looking for some good New Orleans cuisine and were sadly disappointed. The restaurant was slammed tonight(I used to serve so I know the struggle). We waited over an hour to be seated. Once we sat, we received a warm welcome and our drinks. We put our order for four in pretty quickly. We got raw oysters about 5 minutes after placing the order. Unfortunately the rest of our food came in waves with long waits in between. We waited 30 minutes for a kids Mac n cheese, then an additional 10 minutes for the baked oysters, then 5 minutes later the kids hamburger came out. Those of you with kids understand what it may be like to wait with bored, hungry kids. I waited another 10-15 minutes for my chicken salad. After receiving it and a couple bites, I noticed the meat was raw. 

The server comped the salad, the manager took care of making adjustments to our bill. They were both very pleasant and I wish I knew their names to shout them out. 

When eating here just be aware of busy nights and check your food.

A friend and I met for lunch here before a walking tour in the French Quarter and had a fun lunch date.  The royal House features classic creole cuisine. We were greeted multiple times with friendly smiles and were seated immediately after the reservation we made.  This restaurant has windows that open to the sidewalk so we were seated at an indoor table but it almost felt like we were outside with all of the open windows. It was an added bonus to sit there and watch the French Quarter foot traffic during our lunch. The service was friendly and attentive.  We enjoyed the seafood stuffed mushrooms and I indulged with the shrimp tortellini. My friend tried the shrimp and grits which also got a good review. They have a full bar with a great cocktail menu. I made sure to enjoy my favorite NOLA French 75 while I was there. Clean restrooms. The tables were slightly sticky, but overall the restaurant was clean, followed COVID precautions, and felt very safe.

I wouldn't go here. The food is not good. The drinks are weak. Service is slow. My family came here for dinner and we were very unhappy. The bar was closed by 10. They said due to COVID. There is absolutely no parking. No valet. The music blares so loud so be prepared to scream act your dinnermate. It's like they are trying distract you from the food and atmosphere. The food took a very long time to make it to our table. I love NOLA but this place was horrible. The waitress didn't take my order until the last minute. I find it rude to watch staff sit, eat, and drink while I wait on my food. They gave us so much grief about sitting 6 adults and 3 children. My gumbo was cold!! The burger patty was so tiny and burnt and the waitress did not care. She said "I'll just send the manager" She did not even try to address the problem. I think she was ready to go home. I wish I could give zero stars. This was an absolute bad experience.

UPDATE:
The manager that responded to my review never responded to my email. Go figure!

I loved the atmosphere and service, my sister and I were visiting from Washington DC. The raw oysters were fresh and delicious, we also purchased charbroiled oysters as well. Great size and taste. Will definitely come back when, I return to New Orleans.

This place was one of my absolute favorite out of every restaurant in New Orleans! First, we devoured the spinach dip. Next, the grilled oysters were to die for. We tried a few more things also and nothing disappointed!

Everyone was very fun and friendly. The overall service was awesome! I ordered the crab boil and it was delicious! It says cajun however it was not spicy at all. It really wasn't seasoned but it was still delicious with the butter and they were cooked to perfection. It was easy to get the meat out smoothly and of course that is a huge deal :)

Food was amazing! We made reservations and were seated immediately upon arrival. This was our splurge meal during our time in New Orleans and we were so glad we picked this place! Everything we ordered was absolutely incredible.

Although we waited a while it was WORTH IT! We had the red beans and rice, the Parmesan oysters, the shrimp tortellini, and a salad. We loved everything! Specially the red beans and the shrimp tortellini! Our server Dajiha was amazing made us feel like family! 10/10 would recommend can't wait to come back to NOLA and go here again!
The crab claws and char grilled oysters are to DIE for!! Crawfish ravioli was the best

Was super excited to eat here as I always love trying new restaurants in New Orleans.  Let me start by saying I use to be a Chef so I'm very lenient and understanding on lapse in service and mistakes as long as you make things right.  I finally got seated and it took 20 minutes to get water and since it took so long decided to throw in our full order as we could see this was gonna be a a process to get our order.  I'm looking around for our waiter, which I have no clue his name because he didn't say or care to introduce himself or talk at all after our order.  I see him notice we are looking and he has a shocked look on his face.  I know that look it's the look of holy sheet I forgot to put the order in. Mind you that's another 30 minutes in.  So we get our order 15 minutes after that. My fiancé ordered Redfish which was good.  I ordered The Sampler and 3 of the 4 items were cold.  I mention to our waiter that it's cold and he takes my plate with no explanation to the back and comes back 5 minutes later with the sampler after they microwaved it, not remade just microwaved.  So at this point. Now we are 70 min into dinner and I'm sitting there looking at a microwaved meal.  I only ate a few bites because the food was still not hot just like warm!!!!!!!  So I just want my check and I want to leave. So I set my timer to see how long this takes after the waiter knew I was displeased with the food and ignoring me.  It took another 15 minutes to check out and I had to get out of my seat and stand around the dining room till I could flag him down.  I'm now 85 min from seating to check out for 4 bowls of microwaved rice!  So I'm writing this eating beef jerkey in my hotel room wondering wth went wrong?  
I'm in New Orleans of all places and I'm hungry!  I wasn't as mad at the bad meal and lack of service as the disrespect of staff to just ignore me especially since I never even complained just mentioned what was wrong with food.  If your reading this there are so many restaurants you can't eat at in New Orleans that have better food, service, staff and decency.

Stopped in for some fresh oysters, as one must do when in the "Big Easy." It was my first time trying the oysters down here in this region of the US and I found this establishment because they had seemingly good reviews. 
Well. 
Sadly, I was disappointed. 
We ordered a spinach salad and a dozen oysters, locally caught I believe. 
The oysters were massive; some of the largest I have ever seen! 
They were poorly shucked, and I found bits of shell and/or sand in 11 out of 12 of them. 
The oysters were very "fishy" smelling and tasting, indicating they were perhaps not the freshest, and they tasted harsh and salty. No delicate flavour or texture at all. 
Then, they served them with some cocktail sauce, horseradish, and lemons, but no mignonette! 
I have never seen fresh oysters served without a mignonette sauce and when I requested some, they brought me tobasco. The other staff member I requested mignonette (after receiving the hot sauce instead the first time) had literally no idea what I wanted. It was nuts. 
The oysters were barely palatable and I recommend no one ever order them. 
The spinach salad was ok but literally consisted of some sliced apple and bagged spinach and they charged about $15 for it. Ridiculous. 

The service was adequate and our waiter was polite. That is about the only pleasant thing I can say regarding this establishment. 
If you are looking for fresh, quality oysters, (which they literally advertise) do not come here!!

Don't waste time waiting here for a table. We ordered our food and waited about  20 minutes and asked where our soup was and the server stated she didn't know we wanted our soup before our entree. This was strange to me but she said she would rush the soup. After another 15 minutes the soup came out and she said they were plating our meal. This took another 15 minutes and then the food came out and was rather small compared to other places we have eaten. The quality of the food was very poor compared to other places. The Gumbo Shop was absolutely superior and about the same price point. The drinks here were good but that's about all.

Beware the slanted balcony! Sorry to say we did not enjoy our experience. After waiting forever to get seated on the slanted balcony, we waited another forever for the waiter. The blue crab claws were too salty but the oysters and fried shrimp were decent. But ya, won't return.

We tried twice to dine here because of a recommendation. The first encounter we met a snippy hostess who was busy and told us to wait 35 minutes. Places can be busier than they appear so we simply said no thank you and we'll try again later and we returned early the next evening before any rush.
The hostess left us waiting 10 minutes before seating us, throwing menus on the table. I swear she never welcomed us or anything else. Then wait staff failed to come to our table for another 15 minutes.
We left having never been greeted by the hostess or waite staff.
Too many choices here to put up with a lack of service and rudeness on back to back days.

This place was "okay". Oysters were full of barnacles, in a dish last looked like a dog bowl. Their taste of New Orleans was not anything I would order again. Service was just blah. You can tell she wasn't into being their. Will not be back.

Oysters are fantastic!
If you have a non seafood person with you, good luck.
The roast beef po boy sucked. Cold and not skimpy portion.
On the other hand, the rest of the krew enjoyed the oysters!

The service was great and the music from the guy next door was amazing. I had the crab claws and the sauce is incredible. I'm not usually a sauce shopper but I wanted to get as much as possible into my mouth. Hubby had the shrimp creole and it was great but more Italian than he expected. Definitely get some oysters if you go. Amazing!

We were relieved to find a place open after 9 on a Wednesday night, but were not impressed. Service was decent and our waitress was sweet. Came in specifically for charbroiled oysters and they were good, but they ran out of bread so we didn't get that with the oysters. Kind of disappointing as we love oysters with crusty bread. 

Things went downhill from there when I ordered shrimp and grits. I got one small scoop (yes, a scoop, like hard mashed potatoes) of grits and then the whole thing was covered in this spicy red sauce that completely overpowered the entire dish. There were plenty of shrimp, but if the grits had Gouda cheese in them, I couldn't tell. I was just very disappointed with what is normally one of my favorites anywhere else in New Orleans. 

My husband had the red beans and rice and it was mainly rice and sauce. He was ok with it, but it was not the least he'd ever had. 

I know we came in later, but if your hours are until 10 and we arrive at 9, I should still expect the same experience as if I showed up at 6. And when the bus boys started cleaning up around us at 9:30, that doesn't make for a very pleasant experience either. And we were not the only table of people in the place either.

We really love this place! We're staying across the street and have been twice, and honestly will drop in a 3rd time. The hostess here is super nice and we talked a bit the first night while we waited for a balcony seat. 

The first time we did a full meal of peel n eat shrimp (tons of shrimp!!) and the crab claw app plus 12 oysters. All the food is fantastic. 

Drinks were a bit lame (I got an old fashioned) and it came in a tiny little plastic cup and was not good. I switched to beer as you can't go wrong there.

We stopped by again yesterday for a quick oyster snack (12 for $18 is great) and will do so again today. There's always a street musician playing outside as well. Happy this place is right next to our hotel!

Was here yesterday before leaving to come back to Jersey. I have a severe shellfish allergy so I had the French Onion soup.  Let me just say it was the best I've ever had. Everyone i was with loved their food.  The staff was super friendly.  Can't wait to go back and enjoy the soup.
The food is sooo good here. Alexus helped us today and she was so kind and funny! Will definitely be back.

The service was so unprofessional this time.
Girl was twerking on the manager at bar upstairs while we were eating our dinner. This place is no longer on my list while in NOLA.
I will find another oyster bar elsewhere...
Go someplace else......

Stopped in here just walking around the quarter after a heavy downpour thunderstorm. Looked nice, open air, balcony, and sign said oyster bar.  Had a wonderful afternoon sitting at the bar having wine and various oyster preparations.  Bartender Dell was the best! Friendly, helpful and great pours. The oyster shucker (didn't get name) was friendly too. Had four different variations and all were really good. I'm generally not a fan of cooked oysters but they did them perfect, melted warm toppings but still tender oyster. Can't speak for table service or prepared food, but it was lively and happy inside and the wait staff seemed nice too. Good ratio of staff to tables. I was there on a work trip, and if I return with work or pleasure I'll go back.

Happened upon this place while wandering the streets and braving the thunderstorm. Thankful they let our dog sit with us and made me an awesome hot toddy, despite being out of honey. The cup of gumbo was good, and the stuffed mushrooms were amazing!

This restaurant had been highly recommended for grilled oysters. They ended up being tiny with a weird texture. I ordered an oyster po boy and received a shrimp po boy. It's flavor was ok but nothing special. I tasted my friend's  blackened shrimp and it was very tasty. In defense of our waiter he offered to change out my order but there was a large group of us and it would've made me late eating. Overall it was a very disappointing meal. When you're in New Orleans you save your appetite and your money for the best and this definitely was not it.
Don't waste your time and money at this restaurant. The Service is extremely slow, and the food is very underwhelming. Our server was clueless. We waited an hour for our food. This place is a joke.

We were a party of 6 with a reservation and they sat us upstairs quickly. It took a little time before someone took our drink order and Greg was our waiter. He served our drinks and took our orders. His service throughout our meal was terrific. The food came quickly. The chargrilled oysters were delicious. One of us had raw oysters and said they too were delicious. Four of us ordered shrimp and grits. They amount of shrimp differed from 4 to 12 and the sauce was also disproportionately served. We did complain and to the restaurant's credit they comped those dishes.

I had ordered the Blackened Gulf Shrimp & Jambalaya and the portion was so ridiculously small I don't know what is going on when just that plate is 21$ ?? Covid or not, completely unacceptable no matter what time or day. I was starving and waited AN HOUR for THIS

My boiled shrimp wasn't bad. $25 for the pound. Came with 3 potatoes and 2 ears of corn. The problem wasn't the food, it was the service. The guy working at the bar must absolutely hate working there. Very unfriendly. Never smiled. Acted bothered if you asked for anything. Not to mention, I never saw him wash his hands the whole hour I sat there. He was shucking oysters most of that time. I might go back, but I wouldn't sit at the bar. There were several different small groups sitting at the end of the bar. By the time we got up we had all exchanged notes about our visit & we all felt the same.
Nope. Total disappointment. Robert was a great waiter. That's all good I have to say.

We stopped by here when wandering around the French quarter to grab a quick bite to eat. We ordered the fried alligator and the taste of New Orleans (gumbo, jambalaya, and etouffee) to share. The gator tasted like chicken, with a much chewier texture. It wasn't bad, but I probably wouldn't order again (tried it once, don't need to try it again). 

The taste of New Orleans trio was delicious--each dish was super flavorful and unique. Our favorite was the etouffee, which had strong seafood notes. However, as we were eating it, we discovered that there was a sugar packet/wrapper in it. I'm not sure if it fell into our bowl or if it had been in the pot and ladled out into our bowl, or what happened.  We flagged down our waitress to let her know, and were a little thrown off guard when she asked us what we would like to happen (we both thought it would be her job to take charge of the situation). After a pause, she offered to bring us a new etouffee or a whole new trio, and we asked for just a replacement etouffee since the other dishes were fine. She brought a new etouffee, apologized for the situation, and checked in on us again to make sure we didn't have any other findings in the new bowl. Also, ultimately she ended up not charging for the taste of New Orleans because of it happening, but unfortunately, the experience was just tainted from finding that in our food. 

On a brighter note, we had requested to sit on the balcony since it was a nice day. If you're fortunate enough to snag a spot up top, there's a lovely view.

I'm writing this at the restaurant. It took 30 minutes to get water and a menu. There are other customers playing their own techno music over the restaurant music. Still have not received food or drink as of ONE HOUR AFTER ARRIVING. You'd think you can go anywhere in Nola and be safe. Do not go here!!!!!

TLDR:  Royal house features a dining balcony, very tourist oriented, and unfortunately we caught the worst service in New Orleans.  Our server was a nice young lady who did not appear to have had any training.  We would order.  She would come back 10+ minutes later to say they were out of a particular beer or item.  It took 1 hour to get our first appetizer.  It took 1 hour 10 minutes to get our first beer.   I had to go find knives, forks and napkins for the appetizers, and side plates. 

We stayed until the first beer just to prove that we could out last her.  

Definitely memorable!

0/5

This was our second experience at the Royal House. After writing a previous review, management sent an apology and asked us to please try their establishment again. We did and we're very pleased. The entire staff but especially the gentleman behind the bar were friendly and upbeat.  We tried the crab claws again. This time they looked much like the advertised picture. They were delicious. We are so glad that we gave the Royal House another chance.

What a very enjoyable time we had at this restaurant! We took advantage of the linen topped table for two that lined their sidewalk. The food was amazing and the bread pudding that I had read about was very good! The staff was very attentive to our needs and made a very enjoyable evening for us.

I can't believe how absolutely fabulous this place is! Stopped here for a cocktail and appetizer after we arrived from Chicago. I was a bit nervous that the menu didn't have a French 75 or a Sidecar, but the bartender nailed both! We got the Fish Beignets and Andouille Gumbo, both delicious! Rebecca, our server/bartender, was great! Highly recommend this place!

Possibly the worst service I have ever had.  And it was not at all busy.  I waited 20 min for my dinner and over 30 for dessert.  And then could not flag down the waiter to get my check. Unbelievable!  There are many other options close by with the same or better food and for sure better service.

Some of the worst service I have ever experienced. We were made to wait outside for 45 minutes to make the place look busy and when we were finally seated, the restaurant was empty and not due to COVID restrictions.  Took another 20 minutes for any waitstaff to come take our drink order only to be told that they didn't even have any oysters which was the only reason we came. Terrible experience and complete waste of time.

A few years back this was one of our go to places but on our last trip in 2019 and now today after a year of lockdown we were just okay with with the royal house. The raw oysters really had no ocean pop and the chargrill was just average. Also disappointed how dirty the menus were and bottle of tabasco. Some accountability needs to happen here considering the world we live in now and the high food standards we all would expect.

Stop by here first thing in the morning to get the famous rockefeller oysters. Got seated and ordered the drinks which where fine. After ordering drinks went to order oysters and where told they didnt have any. I said thats okay thinking it wasnt in season or something. 10 minutes later another group comes in and orders oysters and suddenly they have them now. So thats why they are getting this review. Lied to us anout jot having oysters and food was just okay for the price.
Third time here and a real crap shoot. Service was ok just like the food. This was our final time coming. Too many better places to keep giving this one a try

This is one of THE BEST meals we had while visiting New Orleans. The Food, Drinks and the Service were all OUTSTANDING! The Host,  Obie (not sure of spelling?) started it off. while we waited in line for a table he was very friendly with the patrons in line and kept the conversation going. The bartender Leroy was the best we have run across he was friendly, expedient and an expert with reading people and the drinks were potent.  We sat are the bar because the wait was shorter and throughly enjoyed ourselves! The crab claw appetizer was "heavenly" and the Ravioli was nothing short of Amazing! We loved so much we ate there twice. My sister and nephew had the Chargrilled Oysters and loved them.  This is one of my new favorite restaurants in NOLA and will go back every chance I get when in the Crescent City.  I apologize I have no pictures to show.. we were so enthralled with everything we never stopped to take pictures. ‍

Food was meh... service was about the same.  Overpriced and not the greatest quality. Came with a group of 9 and agreed the most edible meal was the 1 kids meal :) Would not recommend.  There are too many better options!

Whenever I land in New Orleans I need to visit this place. People working here are so friendly, attentive and helpful even chefs. The most importantly FOOD is AMAZING! No wonder the restaurant is always busy and long line to get in. Needless to say I highly recommend "Royal House" is must visit place in NOLA.
I tried both alligator and oysters for the first time here and it absolutely SLAPPED! I hope other restaurants make it that good all the time lol

the grilled oysters were AMAZING!  Im disappointed in myself for only ordering a half order, because I have NEVER liked oysters.  But thought, Im here, we must try... and OMG were they insanely delicious!  
The staff was incredible.  All the food was Fantastic!  jamabalaya - delicious!

But... management needs to put A LOT of attention into the service.  the service from the time we sat to receiving food was over an hr.  Our server came by repeatedly to apologize, she'd get to us when she could, then for the food not coming for a solid 45+ minutes.  This is not staff related, this is poor management of kitchen staffing.  
otherwise, ALL was incredible!  and again, those oysters... OHMYGOD!
Great food! Great service! Get the oysters. I would definitely come back when I visit Nola again

This restaurant is over priced crap. I order a fairly simple dish. Fried oyster po' boy. The bread was extremely stale, practically inedible. It had 3 small oysters and brown lettuce on it. Don't waste your time on any restaurants in the French Quarter area.

The wait on Saturday was so long! (2 hrs) But luckily we still walked around while one person waited because Bourbon Street and French Quarter was a nice vibe. 

The food itself was good. We got the Gumbo and the shrimp.

Tried to dine here late last night. We asked if they were still serving food and if we could have a table for three. The young man at the door said yes and proceeded to clean up a table with three chairs. Two young ladies walked in and talked to him as he cleaned the table. He said something to them and they came oustide to stand behind us. They apologized to us for bypassing the line. We said no worries and waited. When the young man was finished cleaning the table he beckoned to the young ladies behind us and proceeded to give them our table. Say what? He then completely ignored us standing at the doorway waiting and walked passed us to go outside. I believe they were closing soon. Maybe he was off?  Maybe we weren't young enough? Pretty enough? I'm too old to mess with all that and make a fuss about stupid things. Needless to say, we took our business elsewhere.

Honestly hands down the best place we ate at in Nola. The staff was extremely welcoming and the food was perfect. All around good vibes at this place with great drinks as well. The oysters were my absolute favorite, I wish we ordered more.

Wait time on a Monday night was over an hour.  Once sat, had to wait 20 minutes for waiter, and that is after we flagged a waitress at 15 minute mark.  Got our drinks, and i mean a coke and a lemonade, after sitting 30 minutes.  We ordered and food took 20 minutes or so, so not excessive.  Had to ask for silverware after they dropped the food and that took probably 5 minutes as our food cooled.  They didnt ever bring one of the appetizers even when we informed them it was missing.  Food and appetizers came at same time. Waiter never returned even once to check on anything.  Food was very mediocre. This place should be a HARD PASS for anyone that isnt desperate for food.  Total failure by the management to train staff on how to give proper service, which is so basic and fundamental in running a eatery.  Oh, i almost forgot...i wanted to order a sweat tea, and they were out of tea.  ARE U FREKIN' KIDDING ME?  Out of tea in a restaurant in the south?  SHAME!(bell rings) SHAME! (bell rings) SHAME (bell rings)!!!

The restaurant definitely has good services and ambience. It was located in the center of French Quarters with the local vibes. Unfortunately, the food was unpleasant and overcooked. The rices in the gumbo and jambalaya were dried and hard as it was old and left on the stove. The baked oysters were burned and heavily garnished with seasonings.

Heard so many great things about this place, and I'm surprised that our experience was not so great. I will start off by saying that all the staff were awesome and we had a great time sitting at the bar. We were lucky enough to grab seats because there were a lot of people waiting outside for a table.

Pros:
-Friendly and accommodating staff
-Great atmosphere in the middle of the french quarter
-Tasty cocktails(and strong)

Cons:
-Slow service
-Over seasoned and salty food
-Usually very long wait time for a table

Even though we had a great time here, can't say that I will make a point to come back because the food was terrible. We ate the Oysters Royale and the Taste of New Orleans entree. Everything was so salty and nearly inedible. Maybe I will come back just to get a drink at the bar, but definitely would not come here for the food.

Do not eat here. There is a line out the door typically and I do not understand why. The staff is entirely unprofessional. I came in alone and took a seat at the bar to have a drink and the horrible bartender first told me I couldn't sit in a seat because it was in front of his station. Like why put a chair at a place and not intend for someone to sit there? So I waited for another chair to open up and sat down. They he asked me if I was just having a drink. At this point I didn't like his vibe so I didn't want to eat there anymore so I said only having a drink. THEN he told me to leave because I was taking up a seat of someone who might be eating. Rude. Unprofessional. Down right infuriating

Edit after I thought about it and cooled down: from the 10 minutes I was at this place, the staff members were respectful except for the one bartender who shucks the oysters and door man who rolled his eyes at me multiple times. Hire more people like the bartender with the ponytail!
Food was fine, to be honest the po boy was just too dry, if they'd fixed that, it would have been better.

I cannot believe that this restaurant is so well rated. I almost never post 1 star reviews, but my experience requires it. 

My husband and I got in line for dinner here at 8 pm and were not seated until well after 10 pm. The employees did not have any regard for the people waiting hours in line. There was loud commotion the entire time, with people heckling us etc. NO FOOD is worth standing 2 hours in swamp weather with sore feet, needing to use bathroom, etc. 

Once we finally got inside, things got even worse. I went to use the restroom and it was dirty; I saw a waitress in the restroom and informed her that there was no toilet paper. She shrugged and did nothing. I had to tell other ladies in line to use paper towels because the staff wouldn't refill the toilet paper. 

We ordered entrees and waited another hour for them- I think we finally got dinner at 11pm. My $18 "taste of New Orleans" included lukewarm gumbo, cold crawfish etouffee, and slightly tolerable jambalaya. My husband's $16 shrimp po boy was stale and the fries obviously microwaved. The entire meal had the taste and texture of something that had been hastily microwaved.

Take it from me and don't come here, especially if there is a line. Not worth it in the least, I wasted $50 and feel awful about it. The place is a mess, service was spotty, there was no element of hospitality, etc. 

My biggest advice if you're going our to the French Quarter/Vieux Carre in the evening: either eat beforehand in a different neighborhood or secure reservations beforehand (go to Arnauds, Felix's or Antoines instead of this place!!) 

Again I hate to be so negative but this experience wasted 3 hours of our night and put a damper on it overall! Avoid!

This is absolutely a tourist trap. Their food quality is just horrible. I ordered a Caesar salad with chicken and shrimp. It was horrible. It was over dressing, chicken was burned and taste bitter and shrimp were greasy. This was horrible. Skip this restaurant for sure
The best Bloody Mary I have ever had. Fun feel and friendly staff and do not miss the marinated crab claws they are mouthwatering.

This place has gone downhill since covid. We started with oyster shooters and a mint Julip. The shooter was warmer than took temperature and almost came straight back up, the Ming julip was all booze with hardly any of the other ingredients, I had to send it back. 

Dinner wasn't great either. My wife got the etouffee, she never uses salt and ended up needing it on a dish that should have tons of flavor. I got a roast need potatoes boy. The meat was cold in some spots. 

I would definitely look elsewhere.

A popular spot in the French Quarter that I've actually been to many years ago.  The level of service that Rebecca, my bartender as of course I sat at the bar, gave me was worth 5 stars.  My Golf Shrimp Po'boy  Was decent a little dry and light on the condiments.  The menu is quite impressive overall having a vast variety of Cajun and creo specialties and of course lots of oysters.  Looking back on it I probably shouldn't went with something else perhaps the baked golf shrimp tortellini or the cajun shrimp and cheese gouda grits?  Don't give me wrong, it was a decent poboy but I'm guessing I probably could have had something even better and just based off their hospitality I'd go back and give it another shot....Check it out and let me know what you think.

The food was delicious and our dining experience was probably the best of our trip to NOLA. My friend and I requested their terrace seating so it was a little bit of a wait, but not as long as some of the other restaurants we went to this trip. Anyways, their terrace is a great place to take photos from that really highlight the NOLA vibes. My friend was a little nervous because the terrace didn't exactly seem the most steady/ sturdy, but it was an experience nevertheless (take that how you will)! 

Anyways, our server was great. He was really honest when we were asking for recommendations and for him to basically choose for us, which I greatly appreciated. I ordered the blackened chicken sandwich with a side of hush puppies, and for dessert I had the brownie a la mode. 

My food was fantastic, the service was incredible, and the terrace itself made for the perfect photo op backdrop- so all in all the night was a success!

Only thing good here is the oysters... never got our appetizer in time...literally came out with the main course that we waited over an hour for. Portions were a damn joke and the menu needs to include portion sizes my damn kids plate had more then an adult plate...after talking with the waitress she became rude as hell and when we asked for a manager no one showed up and we stop receiving service only service from there on was just the damn check...this place seriously needs new management and staff needs to be trained further on there customer service...your better off going to willies and getting a meal there then go to this shit hole...i definitely will never recommend this damn place to anyone one...only recommend they stay far away from here

The only reason this place is getting a star is because of the oysters and I can't put 0...but the service was absolutely horrible!!!! We waited over an hour after we sat down to get our food... the crab pot I ordered was clearly precooked and old. My wife order a 9$ French onion soup, only to get a half ass beef stock cup made for a child... again took over an hour to get a coffee cup size soup... the kids food took just as long... atrocious service and horrible kitchen management.. I could make a true French onion soup from scratch and eat my sooner than the trash they served.... I feel bad for the people that fall into the trap of this place' reviews and go... I'm a big foodie and this place will never receive business from me... and to top it all of there was a kidney bean in the bottom of the soup.... Where the hell did they find these kitchen staff!!!

This place seems like it's struggling a bit with its staff and that is causing some unpleasant guest experiences. We waited an hour to get in and I think it was mainly because they didn't have enough servers to take any more guests. When we got in it took awhile to be acknowledged and we overheard another couple leaving because of an argument with their server. They ran out of the dish my husband wanted to order after he already placed the order but we did get the crab legs which were very good and the French onion soup which was good but very salty (I think it's supposed to be like that maybe). Jalapeño balls were nothing special. Anyways, overall not the best experience but from what we could try it was good food and our server was really sweet too.

This restaurant has lost its groove, its identity, and worse, its Soul.  There was little to no life in its atmosphere or staff or its food. 

The crab craws were decent and the sauce a bit better. 
The Chargrilled oysters didn't stand up to Acme's or J's seafood Dock. 
The oysters Rockefeller were over dressed and least favorite of the night. 
The shrimp and grits, hmm, the shrimp and gravy  were good. The grits were the driest and blandest grits ever (5 decades of grits eating). 
The Gumbo was very bitter but that is just matter of taste.
The Red beans and rice was fine.

The star of the evening was our waitress.  She was extremely professional and attentive. She was one step ahead of us and our needs. She's a rock star.  
Kendralle, thank you.

We stopped in for a late lunch so my boyfriend could get oysters on the half shell after the first place we stopped at was out of oysters. We should've skipped Royal House and walked to another spot, but we were really hungry and just wanted to eat. The waitress was nice and attentive enough. We ordered a boil pot and she told us they are out of crab crackers, and that we would need to use scissors. That's fine. The oysters came out first. They were big, and my bf said they were tasty.  Then we sat and waited for another 30-45 minutes for the rest of the food to come out. Took forever. It finally came out and the boiled seafood was way overcooked, the corn was completely tough and dried up, the crabs were dried up, too. Just not good. We got the crab claws which were drowned in a mayo sauce. Not terrible but not great. The chargrilled oysters had a weird gas grilled flavor. Meh. Then I went to the bathroom to wash my hands, and saw a tiny roach on the wall. The kind of infestation roach you don't want to see, and a little piece of me died. Really hoping we don't get sick after eating here. *positive thoughts*

This place clearly needs to be cleaned up and better managed. I advise not stopping here.

Really wanted to like this place because it looked very nice and the menu sounded good, but unfortunately our experience wasn't the greatest.  To start, our waiter with the long dreads seemed like he didn't want to be there( which I get, working somewhere busy is stressful) and he seemed bothered by us asking for items. Secondly he did not care to check up on us and when he filled our waters, he filled my aunts cup that had soda with water. But we aren't the type to complain so we were going to ask for a new cup of soda but my aunt and mom ended up going to the bathroom so while we waited for them, me and my other aunt saw a HUGE rat!  The gentlemen was stomping the whole time we were upstairs by the bar which we thought was weird but now it made sense that he was trying to scare the rat from coming out! And once a we paid we noticed that the waiters whole mood changed when a pair of Caucasian family came in. Overall the food was ok but over priced for a watered down strawberry mojito, and Luke warm gumbo.Please save your money and go somewhere else where there is better service and food!

My girlfriend and I stopped by on our way through New Orleans. We couldn't have been happier. Our server, Darrick, was fantastic. He suggested everything we had and he was spot on. The alligator appetizer was great and so were the poboys and drinks. The entire staff was very welcoming and kind. I work as a floor manager at a restaurant in California and I wish we could fly Darrick out and have him show the servers how it's done, unfortunately I don't think it's possible to replicate such a kind and genuine attitude. The food was great, but the service made it an experience. Will be back again!

I really enjoyed eating here with my son, the food here is delicious, especially the desserts - the bread pudding - Wow! I dropped a star as it's a bit tatty inside, I think it's a bar after they stop serving food.

Covid has taken its toll. The staff is stellar. They are friendly and cordial. The food wasn't as good as the other four-times we have visited the city. I am hoping it was an off night. Will give another try . This one time won't stop me from coming back. They have earned my loyalty.

Dont get the jambalaya!! The atmosphere and staff were great! If I had to rate the service/bartender it would be 5 stars. None of the food blew me away but I did try the oysters for the first time (grilled) and they weren't bad!

For waiting for a long time in line you would think this place would be worth the time and food. Let's say from the service, the waiter, drinks, food, roach and ratatouille (rat), nobody checked to see if we needed anything on our table but this place was overpriced for all the bad services it provided. Definitely did let all my family and friends know about this place and showed them pictures of the infested place.

I stopped here because I was tired and seen the reviews on Yelp. I was not disappointed. Was greeted by the host who asked me if I wanted to sit in or on the balcony. It was hot but a nice breeze so I went up top. Up the stairs I was greeted by another wonderful host who was out going and happy welcoming me. He sat me down and told me my waitress would be right with me. Moments later the waitress came to take my order. There was so much stuff on the menu I wanted to try for the first time I didn't know what to do. Thankfully they have this Taste of New Orleans where you can sample 3 or 4 dishes. Try 3 for $18.00 or four for $22.00. I opted to try all four. The Cajun chicken & Andouille Jambalaya, Crawfish Étouffée, Red beans & rice, and Chicken Andouille Gumbo. 
My favorite was the Crawfish Étouffée.. Yummy yum yum. The Red Beans & Rice was so good and flavorful. The chicken Andouille Gumbo was delicious. My least favorite was the Cajun Chicken jambalaya. Which I was able to swap out for another bowl of the Étouffée. Great service. Great food. And the best was the view to overlook the street. I highly recommend as will return.
All I can say is ask for Leroy. The best bartender in town. Comfortable seating.  Quiet setting in a wonderful environment.  He was relaxed and inviting. Please stop by. You will not be disappointed
Oysters, good drinks....but most importantly amazing service. Dell and Blake made this a dining experience. They truly embrace the New Orleans vibes and kept us smiling and laughing the whole time.

Cannot say enough good things about Royal House. Good and drinks are amazing. Can't go wrong with the alligator and oyster tostada for appetizers. Alligator or oyster po boys are amazing. The taste of New Orleans platter is a great way to get some amazing local food. 

Inga our server was so polite and attentive. She was amazing and the best server we have had in NoLA. Thank you.

This was the last place I visited before I left New Orleans . The hospitality was phenomenal and I was told this is where I would find the best red beans and rice in the French Quarter . I went during lunchtime and I was seated right away . Upon looking at the menu,  I was immediately intrigued by the blue crab claw appetizer and HAD to order it. I had the Red Beans and Rice with the crispy chicken strips as an entree . 
-The Crab Claws were drenched in a creamy garlic butter sauce and it came with a side of sliced and slightly toasted baguette . I give it a rating of 8/10 . The sauce was delicious I just wish there was more meat on the claws . 
-The Red Beans and Rice very well seasoned and the beans weren't too mushy and cooked to perfection. The crispy chicken was the cherry on top because it complimented the dish very well . I give a rating of 9.5/10 . I personally would've preferred more rice .

My family loved our visit to Royal House. I came to New Orleans with two of my sisters and my brother in law and I wanted to find a place for them to get a good sampling of New Orleans cuisine because it was their first time. First off, we got a free appetizer because I checked in on Yelp and we chose fried alligator. We also got the oysters Rockefeller because one of my sisters had never had oysters. Most of us got the "Taste of New Orleans" sampler for our meals and LOVED it (jambalaya, crawfish etouffee, red beans and rice and gumbo). Looks can be deceiving because it didn't look like a ton of food but was very filling. On the waitress's advice, one sister got the crawfish and crabmeat ravioli and it was soooo good. Excellent food all around. We tried the fried crawfish and learned we apparently love crawfish. Our waitress was so nice and I liked the restaurants atmosphere. Go here!!

The food is fantastic! Everything is fresh to order so it does take a little time but it was well worth the wait! We sat at the bar and let me tell you, the bartender was friendly and drinks aren't watered down

Amazing last meal in NOLA. The crab claws were amazing. Fish beignets sweet and delicious surprise.  Hubby loved the fried shrimp and fish platter! Alexis was an amazing server and was on point with all of her recommendations. Ask for her! Will definitely be back.

wait was long, but not too bad, an hour. server was amazing.  she was very attentive. the food was mediocre at best. my son's order didn't arrive and he had to wait another 20 min.

i would give it a 3 star if it weren't for the big nola rat that ran thru the dining room after we paid our check. 

i am from ny.  i am not new to vermin.  but in the dining room with a dinner that was almost 200 bucks!?  no.

staff's response? "oh, yea. that happens."

no.

When you get off the plane run directly to Royal House... don't stop; just GO! When you get there order the blue crab claws and the fish beignets.  You'll thank me later! 

As for the other factors, Royal house normally has a wait, so be prepared; they have ample seating so the wait may not be long. They have a limited number is seats on the balcony, although I would not suggest siting there. The balcony leans and feels unsteady. Service was hospitable, but the main draw is the food.


Sidenote: DO NOT ORDER the Blackened Chicken sandwich! Period. When you hear blackens I think charred deliciousness.. unfortunately this is not that. It was grilled chicken w/ no seasoning.  I used the sauce from the blue crabs dish and some Mayo to make a rumelade. Hopefully they will reinvent this sandwich b/c it has so much potential.

We stumbled on this location and it was fantastic--Great service! It's a quieter spot as it's just off of Bourbon Street. We sat at the bar and the staff was super quick and very attentive. You know the oysters are super fresh as they were shucked right in front of us (they were massive--see photo). Definitely recommend the shrimp and grits and Royal House!

I visited this establishment twice while in New Orleans, terrific food! It's one block off of the absolute craziness of Bourbon Street. The prices are reasonable/ comparable to other restaurants in the area.  What separates Royal House from other oyster bars is how friendly the staff is, they really make you feel at home & looking forward to that return trip. So if you don't feel like waiting in line at Acme for 45 minutes come here, sit down & enjoy a delightful Cajun meal.

This has become our favorite restaurant in the French Quarter. We order the chargrilled oysters EVERYTIME and are never disappointed. On our recent visit, we also had the Taste of New Orleans and the fried shrimp. All of it was phenomenal. Our server was Michael and he was so attentive and friendly. 

We will always come back when in NOLA.

We had a very enjoyable time eating at the bar here.
Rebecca recommended a Voodoo Juice for my wife - which she loved and I had an Arbita amber.
My wife's sausage and chicken jambalaya with blackened chicken was fantastic. 
I had the fried shrimp platter.  The shrimp was great but the fries were undercooked.  They brought me new ones out but they were still undercooked.
They took the whole meal off our bill which was unexpected but fantastic.
Rebecca did a great job at the bar and made us feel welcome.
Deducting one star for the fries, which would have been good if they were cooked long enough.
Oysters were excellent and they have the Best French onion soup I've had. The Bloody Mary was spicy and delicious. Definitely recommend!

Took family for dinner on a Friday night. Gave name to attendant who barely acknowledged me. Waited about 30 min. 

Ordered the taste of New Orleans, 4 small entrees for $22.00. Was very good overall and filling. 

Daughter ordered cheese burger on kids menu with hush puppies. Burger was way over done and bun was burnt. Instead of getting hush puppies received fries. Told waitress who then brought the hush puppies. Daughter bit into hush puppies and parts were still cold / frozen inside! 

Told waitress who didn't seem to care much. Talked to manager and he resolved the situation. 

Wife also  had issue with her salad. Pieces of  unedible parts of lettuce were left in there. Weird! 

Overall good food but poor service and looked like not enough staff.

We had an excellent meal here.
Went at 4:30 so we walked right in.. Shrimp and grits were soooooo good. We were surprised at how good the chicken parm was, go figure in NOLA.

Went today and our waiter was super friendly and helpful, for him I'll give him 5 stars. But there were four of us and two of us were not impressed with the food. I'll only talk about mine. I got the blackened chicken sandwich, which if you're from New Orleans, you know blackened when you see it and either it was grilled or poorly seasoned. Which I can get over but it was so dry, I couldn't eat it. The waiter comped it, they did offer to redo it or do another item but because they were packed and we had another place to be I didn't want to eat on the go and take more time than it was taking already.
Good seafood and atmosphere.   So good we went twice in a week.  Great if you are staying at the omni.
Started our trip here and came back to finish it. Chandell (Dell)  the bartender was the sweetest. Food was delicious and served quickly. Place was clean & very welcoming.

We came in for a late night dinner and they sat us at the bar. At first the host was pretending like they were not serving food and the restaurant was closing, not really sure why. The restaurant was supposed to be open for another 90 minutes and they sat several couples after us who also ordered food, so not sure what this fuss was all about to get seated. 

We shared a spinach artichoke dip as an appetizer that was very rich and tasty. My wife enjoyed her fish poboy and I ordered the sampler. The gumbo and jambalaya were my favorites in the sampler.

Nice spot for people watching as well as good food.  Seafood raviolis were awesome as recommended from the waiter. I had a couple of nice drinks and overall not bad at all for cruising around and wanting a sit down lunch.

This place is food heaven!!
Food was sooo delicious!!
Service was excellent.....
Thank you Simone, for being so attentive.

When I came here, the line was SO LONG. So I thought it might be amazing, right? I waited over 2 hours basically to get in. Even after that we sat at the bar. Anyways I ordered shrimp and grits as well as the fried fish. Shrimp and grits were really good and so were the fish. But nothing unique I would say. The food was good but not worth the wait in line, plus it was pricey

The food is pretty good here but the staff sometimes just lacks or could care less. On a recent visit I sat at the bar and sat in the middle of the bar. The oyster Shucker bartender immediately told me to move down further because I was sitting to close to the service station which is in the middle of the bar. He never acknowledged me as a patron and I just assumed he only handled one end of the bar so he was not going to serve me. The other end which I assumed was bartender was on her personal phone and too busy to wait on me. After 10 minutes she asked me if I wanted a drink which I did but I came to eat as well. She finally got me a drink and went back to her phone. I asked her for a menu after around 15
Minutes and she handed it to me and left. After another 10 minutes another girl came by and asked if I wanted anything. I tried to order but no one wanted to take my order. Finally I ordered which came with the bill like I was done and not allowed to have another drink or any more food so I paid the bill and left. I should not have to beg to get food and drink at a restaurant and if the employees don't want to work there they should find another job.

So I had high hopes for Royal House. It has a great location down the street from the Historic Court House in the French Quarter. There is also second floor dining and a nice bar as well. We were seated within 15 minutes despite the line of people sitting outside the restaurant. It took a little bit for our server to help us and drinks arrived at tables seated next to us who sat down ten minutes after us. Regardless we waited and eventually our server arrived and greeted us. Drinks took a bit to come out but once they did the food arrived shortly thereafter. We started with the Fried Alligator appetizer which was alright, and moved onto Oysters on the Half Shell. Now the size of the oysters are impressive, but being where I'm from in Vegas, and I don't know if this is just a snobby Vegas thing but the oysters in Vegas are extremely clean. These oysters were sandy and had shell
Pieces. I guess that's because they are shocked right before they reach the table to preserve freshness. They indeed were very fresh, just different from what we are used to. For the entree, we finished with the "Taste of New Orleans." This includes four bowls consisting of Gumbo, Red Beans, crawfish etouffee and jambalaya. All in all they were good but not great by any means. It was a decent dinner, the service was a little slow but I would definitely be willing to give it another try.

Food was ok. Nothing special.  Had the shrimp and grits. Kind of bland.  Expected better In New Orleans.  Oysters were excellent.  Bar drinks were VERY weak.   Not worth the price. Hardly any alcohol.    There are better choices in New Orleans.

My appetizer was really good (spinach artichoke dip) but my steak was horrible. For $29 it was a disaster. The meat in the inside was cooked well but the char on the outside was yuck. I sent the first back and the next one came out the same. I doused A1 on it to choke it down because we were starving. Others in my party got the pasta and they loved it- just steer clear of the steak. The server was nice but just wasn't worth the money.

The worst. When we walked in we asked the host for a table for two, totally normal interaction, or so i thought. He immediately snapped at me "It's going to be TWO HOURS". I asked if we could sit at the bar. He snapped again, points at the bar, and says, "Do you see room at the bar?!"uhm, why yes i do. I also see two people paying. A total of five seats. He said well, the wait for that is an hour and a half. Okay, so the wait has dropped thirty minutes in a matter of seconds? Then he rolled his eyes, changed his mind and said we could sit there. Meanwhile there are three open tables. When we tried to sit the guy shucking oysters told us we could not sit down until he cleaned it. We stood there for ten minutes and decided to grab the seats without it being cleaned. The oyster guy was visibly upset but we didn't want to lose the seats.
