It still took another 10 minutes for him to come over and clean the bar (he also told us we couldn't have water at the bar). We finally got food in, which actually was okay. I'm sitting at the bar typing this and I've listened to the host tell 4 other parties they have a two hour wait (those tables and bar seats I mentioned earlier are still open). A party of three asked to sit at the bar and the host told them it would be two hours for those three open bar seats. They tried to order to-go but gave up after being ignored and left. I wouldn't come back again here if someone paid me. The staff is super rude and obviously have no handle on their business

Horrible experience. Do not eat here if you want to feel disrespected or have terrible service before you even step foot in the restaurant. While approaching the restaurant, me and my husband were the ones who greeted the host, not him, I believe his name is Obie from what we were told. He basically just pulled out the clip board and flipped the pages in our faces after we asked how long the wait time was. He said 20 mins and we were fine with that. He then asked for the name and asked US what time it was, so we let him know 8:30pm (give or take). We did not feel welcomed at all the way we were approached, but hey, it's Friday night, he probably had a long day so we weren't mad about, we were just hungry and wanted to enjoy our night and eat. BUT THEN... after waiting some time to be seated, a family of 5 approach and did not get the same interaction. He immediately communicated with the wait staff over walkie to see if there was a seat for 5. They waited BASICALLY NO TIME until they were seated upstairs... on the balcony.... How do I know? Because Obie proceeded to look right at us afterwards, tell us to follow them, and for US to tell the staff upstairs to seat us on the balcony. As we go upstairs, surprise there are no other balcony seats so we are sat at the bar.. in the corner. No big deal, we are hungry so we are going with the flow. NEXT BAD EXPERIENCE, we are given PLASTIC TO GO SILVERWARE instead of actual silverware while everyone around us is given actual silverware. I can see the other wait staff carrying the actual silverware in napkins to tables that were seated after us. We then left because I felt extremely unwelcomed and treated basically like a second class citizen based on the those interactions. I hate to bring race into it, but the family of 5 that got seated before us were White, my husband and I are Asian and we are not sure that COVID-scare racism could have been anything to do with it but I've never had an experience like that in my entire life that I had to walk out of an establishment. I usually brush things like that aside. But we told the bartender upstairs we were going to leave and she was the nicest person we had an encounter with. The host Obie however, not welcoming at all. I was a host a few years ago and I know how it can be, but being in that position before, it could have been handled better from the start. We called the restaurant to let the supervisor, John, know about our experience. He was even is aware about guests being given plastic silverware because staff are "being lazy". I don't get how you're aware yet still some of your staff does it to one group of people and other staff give actual silverware? I don't know. However, he was understanding about the situation, but that was the experience they gave us overall.

Please do not eat here staff is rude and lazy, I understand some people do not like there jobs and have bad days at work but in no way should they take it out on paying customers and their families. The attitude of the greeter (Obie) was horrible he mugged us like we were second class citizens and told us it was a 40 minute wait. Another white family with a party of 6 were seated immediately. So we not only get seated after them but get shoved in a corner of the bar with plastic silverware handed to us because we are not good enough for metal silver ware. 
We ended up placing the order and leaving because we lost our appetite . 

We called the supervisor John and he was very professional and apologized but from the get go we were treated like second class citizens. Because the host OBIE didn't want to seat us right away because we bothered him when he was scrolling through his Instagram. Also the servers were to lazy to wash silverware and just threw us plastic wear. I was just expecting them to say "we will serve you but you have to eat out back"

We just wanted to be treated like everybody else. Nothing more or nothing less. 

Take your hard earned money else where!!

Nice place. The menu has a lot of options (even for folks like me who don't like oysters). I got the cup of chicken gumbo and the caprese appitizer. My friend got the shrimp  salad and it was huge! We shared the French fries, those were good too! We sat upstairs which was cooled and a nice atmosphere.

Our third time visiting NOLA and the Royal House has been included in each visit. The food is delicious, the service is great, and we love dining on the balcony ... even if the angle of its lean is rather significant (and narrow). Chargrilled Oysters: absolutely; French Onion Soup: one of the best. Gulf Shrimp Platter: the cajun seasoning on the corn and potatoes packs a punch - beware! Ribeye - sometimes you just need meat! Nice cut, perfectly grilled; not much in the way of seasoning; next time I'd probably ask for some of the garlic butter and cheese that they grill on the oysters and slap it on the steak! Now that would be heavenly! No room for dessert this trip!

Our first time dining at the restaurant. The downstairs host Obie, was exceptional! He was very welcoming and set our expectations. The upstairs host, John, was wonderful as well. He was very attentive and made sure we had everything we needed. Our waitress, Yahnah, was also exceptional. We ordered stuffed mushrooms, chargrilled oysters, gumbo, shrimp caprese salad and a variety of cocktails!! A restaurant you must try when in the area!! You will definitely be taken care of!!
DO NOT EAT HERE! Food was awful. We Waited over an hour to be seated and the food was ice cold. Manager offered us a "shot" for the inconvenience. Never again!!

Well too start off, the service was great. Everyone was nice until I received my food and it was completely cold. I got the crawfish and crab ravioli and the sauce was hot but the ravioli felt like it had pieces of ice in it. They took it back and replaced it and it was a lot better the second time. Also what southern place doesn't have sweet tea??? They had unsweetened with just the packs of sugar and Splenda on the table. Other than that everything else was pretty good.

We stopped in here on a whim and it did not disappoint! The staff was very welcoming and the service was great. Food was awesome too! I would definitely recommend the shrimp tortellini it was excellent. Give this place a try when you are in NOLA!

Stop HERE!!  Service was fast to the table then slow down with a margarita.  Open enclosed tables and friendly wait staff. Pros.  Had the fried oysters blt. Oh my god. Just die now cause it won't get better.  Plenty of fried big juicy oysters with bacon lettuce tomato and a chipotle Mayo. Jesus. The bread is to die for.  Just amazing.  Great stop.

two words. SO. AWESOME! my sister and i are visiting for the week and it's been very hard for us to find good food without it being either age restricted or a crazy long wait time. we actually got a recommendation to come here from one of the shop employees down the road, and it's safe to say we were NOT DISAPPOINTED! no wait, beautiful atmosphere, and the best blackened chicken jambalaya i've ever had!

This is a must come! The food was absolutely wonderful, all the oysters were so fresh. We tasted them all and the chargrilled were my favvv!!! Stuffed mushroom 10/10, blue crab claws 10/10... if you're in town check this spot out you won't be disappointed

It's pretty hard to mess up a chicken Cesar salad but this place managed to do that. Food took so long to come out. The chicken was cold, smelled awful and had no seasoning even though I asked for it blackened. When I asked the waitress if they typically season blackened chicken and if it usually comes hot she said she didn't know. I didn't eat it. They did not offer to take it off my bill, fine, so I ordered some fries to fill me up. Fries took 15 mins and were not hot. Probably died in the window waiting for the waitress to bring them. We kept having to flag her down for everything, I couldn't even get a refill of my water.  Oh and the bathroom had no soap. None. Disgusting.
Very good. Alexis was our server, and she was excellent. I had the combo oysters and French onion. Both delicious. The hurricane was also great. Love the interior as well. A great spot!
loved it food was great...highly recommend the stuffed mushrooms...best ever...service was great wait times not bad...second time we got right in. my wife had caprese salad, which was superb

Started with the Blue Crab Claws (5+*) Holy smokes! This is what I've been waiting for. First time in New Orleans? Me too and after days of eating either overpriced and/or downright disappointing dinners (I will not be sharing those unfortunate experiences in this review) I am grateful that we stopped in here.  Hubby enjoyed the French Onion Soup (5+* - no pic - he inhaled it) but LOVED it. Then he finished with the Dozen Raw Oyster Platter (4*) child had the fried shrimp    (4.5*) off of the kids' menu and it was tasty! I then had the Royal Spinach Salad with Shrimp (5*) Overall FIVE STARS! Thank you to the staff and Simone at Royal House! We will be back

The place itself was a decent vibe but the host was rude and sat people of the same party size before us then gave us a crappy table. They gave us plastic wear for our meals even though they had real silverware spread out at a table next to us, which made no sense. The server was great though and helpful. The food really didn't have any flavor so that was disappointing.
I will remember the charbroiled oysters for the rest of my life. The service was amazing. Definitely will be coming back to New Orleans for this restaurant!

We had shrimp po boys which were fantastic.  Our son had crawfish étouffée with fried crawfish on top and he loved it.  Our daughter had French onion soup and it was great.  Wait staff was fantastic and it had a pleasant atmosphere.

We were looking for a great place to have oysters while in NOLA and stopped in Royal House while waking by. So glad we did! I can't recommend this place enough. 

The restaurant itself is in an amazing 100 year old building that oozes history and charm, & is in a nice corner location. Food was hot, excellent and fresh. Service was friendly & quick. Greg is probably the best waiter we had during our stay in New Orleans. Highly recommended!!!

APPETIZERS:
+Blue Crab Claws
+Bloody Mary
Verdict - If you like crab, this is the appetizer for you! Warm buttery crab claws already opened and ready to pop in your mouth. Bloody Mary was perfect after a shot of hot sauce!

ENTRES:
+Chargrilled Oysters
+Oyster Duo
Verdict -  If you've never had Oysters Rockefeller the Oysters Due is a good plate to try. The oysters Royal were excellent too. The star of the show hover was the chargrilled oysters. Chargrilled to perfection, the warm goodness was paried w/ a little garlic butter & parmesan. So simple yet so delicious...and thats coming from someone who doesn't enjoy raw oysters. Cannot recommend  enough.

SUMMARY:
Everything we ate was simply perfect. The atmosphere is outstanding...sitting in that historic French Quarter building, listening to the jazz music come in through the open doors...simply perfection...Get the chargrilled oysters...seriously.  Best in New Orleans and we tried them everywhere...Top notch service (Ask for Greg!)

From start to finish, no wait, it was 4:30pm on a Sunday, the hostess at the door called up & said party of 5. We were sent upstairs to get seated. We waited upstairs for several minutes as the hostess/bar tender stared at us. He finally came over & took menus then walked off to the table. He never said party of 5, follow me, or anything. It was kinda awkward like we were putting him out having to seat us. Only two people were seated at the upstairs tables. It appeared to have plenty of staff, especially for the amount of people eating there. The service was fair, the shrimp & grits were decent, the fried shrimp was really good along with blackened red fish, the oysters were ok. The kids burger was charred to the point we all tried a bite to see if eatable & it was not, we thought the boy just didn't want to eat it. The hurricane was really good. I think if your from the south & love true cajun seafood this is not the place for you, if your not familiar with true cajun food it will be good for you & your family.

Came down from The big apple to the big easy with no expectations but was blown away and Roy's house serves the best oysters in NOLA that I've tried, fresh and grilled are both meaty savory and refreshing

2 dozen plus an ice cold local draft makes for an unbeatable meal

Don't usually do this, but my dad and I wandered past here and the menu looked good so we decided to give it a try. 

Service was kinda slow but the food was delicious. The bloody Marys were flavorful and refreshing; I'd go back just for those. 
After days of greasy fried seafood, I needed something fresh, so I chose their spinach salad with blackened scallops. I'm a sucker for fruit on salad and this one comes with dried cranberries, tart green apple, and pecan bits. 

My dad got the chargrilled oysters and on the side we split some hush puppies. They didn't look like much, being a little smaller than usual, but they had great taste and texture and were my favorite part of the meal. 

Overall a surprisingly solid choice, especially for out of towners looking to sample some classic NOLA favorites.
Nothing to write home about. Drinks were way overpriced and extremely mediocre. Bread pudding was gross. Oysters were okay.
Shrimp Po-boy and oysters are my favorite

The service was good. They were pleasant. It was late night and long waits everywhere for dinner, but we didn't have to wait too long here.
Once seated, the food came out pretty quickly which was nice. But it wasn't that great... Did not seem fresh. It felt like a diner rather than a restaurant. It's a big restaurant and a lot of people come through, so I can imagine they probably have a lot of it prepared and just sitting there.

Not really impressed at all. Carpet going upstairs was SO gross!  Had the flavor of New Orleans and they were fair.  Very simple side salad was $6.50-ridiculous. Much better food elsewhere.  We left and went to Luke for a real dinner.

I had the NO sampler and it was decent. Hubby doesn't go outside of his box much and had a burger. It was a frozen burger and the fries were cooked in old grease. Our waitress was very nice and attentive. I'm not over impressed but it was a lot better than some of the doves on Bourbpn Street for sure.

Updating my previous review. When I say this was probably the best meal I had in New Orleans.... First off, the oysters were incredible, the biggest I've ever seen! The charbroiled were to die for. We also ordered the New Orleans sampler which was delicious! We got the crab leg appetizer and our waiter recommended the lobster and crab ravioli which did NOT disappoint!!! Every single item just hit. I'm so happy I went back and got to try more!! Definitely a must if you're in the French quarter!
Great Place to Eat .. Ask for server Rachel.  She's the Bomb DOT Com!! Fantastic Place to come, Definitely worth the return

Came here less than a week after Ida. They had just reopened and did a wonderful job under the circumstances.

The staff was from sister restaurants in areas less affected.  Also some seafood items were not available because of contamination from the storm.

With all that said what a dining experience!

The alligator bites were a hit with my group and were something special. The caprese and eggplant appetizers were delicious.

The drinks were spot on as well. You can see the vodka infusion for the bloody Mary's at the bar along with the local draft beer.

Everyone enjoy their food. The ribeye was so tender it came with a butter knife. The po boy oyster was lightly fried and the breading was seasoned well. My head bobbed up and down and this is perfectly how it should taste.

The New Orleans sampler was a highlight. A good portion of 4 different things. One of favorite taste came from this dish.

Even the burger is perfectly cooked and seasoned.  Get up and get down to the French Quarter and get a true taste of New Orleans hospitality and cooking at the highest level.

Can't wait to come back!
Last day in NOLA and found this gem for oysters and their fried seafood platter.  Delicious & the service was exceptional.

Wanted some chargrilled oysters on our trip to NOLA. Looked up a list to find the best chargrilled oysters and this one happened to be a few minutes away by foot so we decided to try it out. Good thing we did! It was late afternoon and still pretty quiet. We were given the option to sit on the balcony which we gladly took. The view was beautiful and the breeze was calming as the buildings shielded us from the sun. Our server was extremely nice and helpful. We ended up getting oyster nachos as well and a shrimp po'boy to share. Everything was good! We especially LOVED the chargrilled oysters. Had we not spent the day walking around trying things we would've gotten another order. The service and view are five star alone. However, although the shrimp po'boy was good, I've had better! Definitely a great place  to check out!
We loved the gumbo and bread pudding! We highly recommend this stop if you're visiting the French Quarter.

It always seems every time we walked by there is a lengthy line to eat here. So recently we were quite lucky to walk in with no wait time at all and sit at the bar right before the lunch rush. We kept it simple and had a couple dozen of oysters on the half shell and gin and tonics. The oysters were so fresh and absolutely delicious, and well priced. The gin and tonics were also perfection (gin and tonic is my go to drink, and the ones that I was served here are some of the best ones I've had while in NOLA). We really must have lucked out, because anytime we needed another dozen oysters or another round of drinks, we were served very quickly. If only we tried out more of their menu (which I was eyeing but we were quite full already), so I'm already looking forward to coming back!

Utter disappointment. This establishment is very overrated. Waited in line for 20 minutes to find out later that not only the balcony seating was closed but also they were out of fresh oysters. However this was not the main concern so we stayed.
Took the waiter 10-15 minutes to come to us , we were seated half inside half outside at a very small table near a leaking water pipe off the wall, was very strange. Service was super slow and the waiter was MIA most of the time.Alligator bites were okay, came with two sauces ; fried oysters were good but came on a bed of slaw and soggy chip- not the best combo. Blue crab appetizer was pretty good, but sauce was very watery. Shrimp and grits were pretty good, seafood boil however - very spicy, so spicy it burnt my lips and I couldn't taste anything else. Mediocre at best. Will not be coming back .

Great food! I highly recommend the combo boil with snow crab and gulf shrimp. Staff was very nice and accommodating. Only downside, which the restaurant was not at fault for, was the performers outside who sounded like cats in a bag

I was looking for an oyster po' boy in the French Quarter and one of my favorite places there was closed and the other had run out of oysters.  I happened upon Royal House and was excited to place my order.

The excitement ended when I bit into my sandwich.  While the roll was really good and the shredded lettuce was crisp, the oysters themselves were extremely disappointing. They were so tasteless -- none of that satisfying salty taste of the sea -- that I actually checked to see if they were indeed oysters.  Additionally, a number of the oysters were incredibly tough.  When I bit into them, it felt like my teeth were tearing through tendons which definitely wasn't appetizing.  I ended up not eating about a third of the oysters.  

I'm a huge fan of hush puppies so I also ordered their jalapeno hush puppies.  So disappointing.  They were basically tasteless and the only heat was from the accompanying hot sauce.  I really don't think there were any jalapenos in the hush puppies themselves.

On the positive side, the iced tea was good.

While waiting for my food, I had noticed that the majority of the staff either weren't wearing masks or had them beneath the noses or under the chin.  There were also a number of customers without masks being led to their tables.  Definitely not a safe feeling.

Very nice establishment! Went here on a whim with my friends for my birthday. We had a lovely waitress (I can't remember her name--sorry!) but she was so patient and explained all the orders. We all got the Voodoo Juice to drink and shared the fried alligator appetizer.

I was in New Orleans for a bachelorette trip and this restaurant was the last place we went. I'm glad this was last on the list as I had a great time. Between the awesome waitress and the bomb food, this is a spot I will return to.

Very good restaurant for NOLA favorites. Fresh seafood and the Red Beans and Rice were excellent!
Great service!

Love this place, mostly an oyster bar - long and skinny with tables in the rear too. We sat by an open shuttered window and enjoyed oysters 2 ways with our beer and wine. This place was recommended by a nearby busy restaurant who did not have oysters...we had our mind set on. The other food passing by looked substantial and the shrimp poboy had remoulade drizzled all over. The vibe was just right!
Don't be fooled by the good ratings. The oysters were not good. The oyster topping was extremely salty and the rest of the dishes were mediocre.

Came here for some late dinner, getting off our flight. The place was empty. Had the taste of New Orleans, fried alligator, and Redfish. Taste of New Orleans wasn't bad but it wasn't great either, lacked flavor and depth. The redfish was surprisingly good by itself but the garlic butter sauce made it even better. Fried alligator was good, had good texture, crunchy on the outside and moist, chewy on the inside. Service was better than most places in New Orleans.

Had dinner on the balcony overlooking a jazz band playing on the corner. This atmosphere just could not be beat on a beautiful night. We had the voodoo juice (yum!) As well as the chargrilled oysters, crawfish ravioli, and steak. We had oysters all over the city and these were among the best. Everything was great and the service on point. Royal House is a great stop on your NOLA food route!

I'm generally not a foodie, more or a drinker, but this was THE BEST restaurant we went to, and are actually back for the second time (don't normally do that when traveling).  100% recommend the Gulf Fish Beignet ($14.50) from the app menu!!
Came for some quick chargrilled oysters. Delicious but very salty from the parmigiana cheese. If they added a small amount, it would be a 5/5. Bread pudding was okay.

The best thing was the wine! Ordered sautéed crab claws...claws were cold. Sauce was lukewarm. This place was amazing pre-COVID so maybe that's part of it? Not sure but definitely would recommend trying elsewhere in the Quarter. It's not worth the money.

How is this rated ? Space not appealing, food is a tourist level attempt, service is terrible although the staff acts it's as if they know it and apologize as they're working. Joke. Pass, go down the street.

We planned to come here before we actually got to New Orleans it seemed like a great choice. I'm glad it was our first choice, it was more about the location than the food or drinks.   Food was okay location was better. Corner spot with window sitting to people watch.
There was a 45 wait between salad and soup. The waiter was so interested in being memorable that he ignored a few orders.

I was staying overnight and this was my first restaurant to eat at.  It was on a Thursday and near 1pm so there was little wait to get a table. I was seated with a table facing the sidewalk with the large shutters open to the beautiful weather. The decor inside takes you back in time. The staff have been there for many years. I ordered a lemonade and a bowl of onion soup. The broth was rich with a deep beef flavor the onions were caramelized which added a subtle sweetness and of course the crouton was covered nicely with melted cheese. The season was spot on so no additional salt or pepper was needed. I ordered the Gulf Shrimp and Grits. The grits were cooked perfectly with a creamy smoked Gouda cheese which bonded the mounds of grits covered in the bbq sauce. The shrimp was the highlight with a tasty seasoning which complimented the flavors to balance together. 
I had high expectations and they were met. I'd be glad to return to explore more of the menu.
I don't give 4 stars very often but when I do it's because the oysters are bomb!! Get them with a bud light super delicious.  Food is ok deserving of 3.5 shucking oysters gives it the 4

My first stop for a day of wandering (mainly drinking and shopping) around the French Quarter. Walked in around 1 pm and was able to get a beautiful table on the balcony overlooking some amazing architecture... pure Nola vibes. The balcony is slightly slanted, so keep that in mind because everything on your table will be slanted (drinks, food, cutlery). If that's not your thing, stick to a table inside. 

We enjoyed two bottles of Kim Crawford, a half order of Charbroiled Oysters, Fried alligator, Shrimp with Grits, and a Roast Beef Po'boy. Everything was AMAZING.... Literally the best of the best in flavor. Our service was fantastic as well, very accommodating to our requests, and was fun to chat with. This was one of the best restaurants I've been too in New Orleans and can't wait to come back in the near future.

YAAAAAS!!!  Stopped in here for my first food try on my birthday and was astounded!  Got to sit up on the 2nd floor balcony overlooking the street which was very relaxing (tables are very small outside, so beware). The wine and appetizers came out quickly but the star of the show was the roast beef poboy. The meat was tender and had good seasoning, just the right amount of gravy, and the server suggested adding provolone cheese to it (not listed on the menu) so I took his recommendation and it was the perfect additional layer to the sandwich. Definitely makes it all a fork and knife experience but I would hands down come back just to get this sandwich again. So delicious.

Royal House! Amazing ambiance and experience. 


Our waitress was Destiney and she was lovely! Best waitress that we had while on our trip. Destiney! Remember the name.
First trip to NOLA. Destiny our waitress slayed! Can't wait to come back. Spoke to the manager also and relayed our experience.

The blue crab dip is the best thing in the world!! The flavor is like no other, it is so good!! I just wish they would give you more bread with this. Every time I'm in New Orleans I come for the dip! It is just amazing! You must order it!

The service and food was awesome. Fried oysters are to die for. Need more indoor, closed window seating for rainy and chilly weather. Also when someone ask for hot sauce they don't want tobasco sauce. My waitress said Told me they didn't have hot sauce then she brings to table behind me a bottle of Crystals hot sauce!!!! That's the only reason you get. Four stars. Besides that I will be back!
Great food, efficient but curt service. Good value. Again, waitstaff are well-trained but curt.

Fun taste of New Orleans

This is the first time I've visited the French Quarters in New Orleans. After touring around the area, we came across this restaurant at the corner. We waited for 35 minutes to get a table, and it was a Wednesday.

It's a fairly long and narrow restaurant so seating was rather limited. Our table was placed on the edge, so my chair had 2 legs on the floor tiles of the restaurant, and 2 legs were on the actual sidewalk. I didn't mind it too much though, it was a unique experience.

After being seated, and ordered, we waited for another 45minute before we got our food. Probably because it was so jam-packed, and I don't expect their restaurant is big enough to serve quickly. But hats off to the waitress there. Knowing the food was coming out slow, she was constantly going around, checking on customers, apologizing, doing damage control, and making sure everyone felt taken care of. She also offered a free drink at the house cause of the delay. Which made the waiting bearable.

The three of us ordered a dozen of baked oysters to share and individual entries. I had the "A Taste of New Orleans" which was 3-4 sample size serving of different gumbo. I rarely eat Cajun food. To me, it was okay. Not completely in love with it, saucy rice? I think Cajun food does go well with beer though.  The baked oysters were nice. 

Enjoyed the atmosphere, and the positivity of their service.

Food 7.5  Service 9.5,  Ambiance 8  Value 8

Waited over 30 minutes to get a table upstairs and outside, big mistake, then waited at least 10 minutes for waitress to greet us and get a glass of water. 15 minutes later we still didn't get our wine, we went downstairs and sat at the bar, saw our wine sitting there and people who came in after us already with drinks and food, we explained our disappointment to the useless host staff who just made excuses, we finally had our wine served to us and our dinner remarkably was served less then 5 minutes later, husbands chicken parm was good but the linguini was mushy, I ordered seafood pescatore and all the scallops were undercooked, they were still translucent, again the hostess made excuses and said they are cooked, I have worked in so many restaurants and do a fair share of cooking and i know the difference between cooked scallops and raw ones.  The young lady just looked at me.  I ordered the crab claws and they came out hot and tasty but small and not very filling, so
I ordered the oysters combo and they were also very tasty.  Also, they don't service any bread basket  while you are waiting, charged us .50 for a few pieces of garlic bread that we asked for to have with the chicken parm.

Great service, great food. Staff was extremely friendly & attentive, atmosphere was great, had a late dinner with my girl while in New Orleans, Char broiled oyster with grated Parmesan was very delicious. Great cocktail selection & there was couple across the street singing the worse renditions of Whitney Houston songs, they were so awful but funny, I almost fell off the balcony laughing, there was also another woman playing classical music on a violin on another corner contrasting the bad music. Overall it was a night of great food & service with good & funny entertainment on the outside. A must visit if you are in town.
Good service but not food. Our charcoals oyster was so salty that we couldn't finish it. We usually like heavy taste food but not this one.

My mom and I shared the oysters duo and the 'taste of New Orleans', honestly I've had better gumbo, jambalaya and red beans and rice in Michigan than here. The 'taste of New Orleans' all tasted the same one note there was no variation in flavor at all. The oysters were amazing that's one great take away but if you're looking for good gumbo don't go here it majorly lacked in flavor

Great place for a big group. The weather was just right, so we were able to have the doors upstairs open. 

Food was good, not amazing, but good. We got the oysters for the table, fantastic!!!

Came here for dinner with a party. We put our name down, but they were calling other small parties even though we were there waiting for awhile. We waited for an hour before being seating, but even then we had to check in constantly to see our wait time. After we ordered our food, we waited for a good while before we got our food. I order the On The Half Shell oysters (1/2 dozen). It was a good sized. I also ordered the Crawfish & Crabmeat Ravioli. When I first dig in, the top was entirely covered with a thick chunk of cheese. That was way too much cheese. I had to put all of that cheese on a plate on the side. The food didn't wow me. We had an unreasonably long wait from when we got there to when we left.  We spent here over 2 hours. This place is a big miss for me. Would not come here if I was in town.

The onion soup is the best we've ever had!!! Could use a tad bit more toasting, but NO COMPLAINTS.

The soup is thick, oniony and a real meal on its own. Lots of cheese and amazing bread. My daughter loved the soup so much she bought it two nights in a row. It's comfort food, but gourmet all the way.

I accompanied her the second night, and she pointed out a tiny lady with bright red hair. She said the lady was one of the most amazing servers she'd ever dined with. This was my daughter's first time in New Orleans, so I am very grateful for your amazing food and kind staff. 

Thank you for helping to make this a great experience for my daughter!!!

look.......the first place i stopped at in the french quarter &............the best place ever........atmosphere is awesome, food amazing, staff !!!! blaire, elizabeth & the mr. nairobi straight up bring it !!!! my first experience with charbroiled oysters and i will not be my last here...... 5 soild stars and no bs !!! must visit place !!!!!

Low class place, very unprofessional. Hostess told us to wait 10 minutes for the table, because server was on the brake. We spent 25 mins waiting. When I asked hostess about table, she left, and some lady showed up saying that we have to wait more with no time estimate, and we waited all this time for nothing and she is the manager smh. She told me with straight face that if I'm not happy waiting for uncertain time, I'll be not happy dining there either. We have waited 40 mins including conversation with "manager" for nothing, spend your money somewhere else.
I love this place! Nairobi is incredible! So super accommodating and great at what he does. I came here twice in my three day visit!  The food is amazing! Can't wait to come back.

We came here for dinner one late night because the wait to get into Mambo's was too long. This was one of a few places still open. My son ordered fresh oysters and it had sand in it!  The oysters tasted briny and not as fresh as the other places where we had oysters.  And since it was only served with cocktail sauce only (no lemon wedges nor horseradish), I had to get up to hunt down someone to find some lemon wedges especially since I wasn't able to get our waitress' attention.  The shrimp and grits was so so and crawfish ravioli was drowning in too much cheese.  The food was such a disappointment especially considering the price.  Our bread pudding was burnt in one corner so it was chewy.  In a city with such good food, this was definitely the bottom of the list of places we ate at on our trip.  I wish we just waited a bit longer for Mambo's.  We had been to Mambo's earlier in the week and it was waay better (both food and service).

I was super excited to come here because it's recommended to come here for oysters (not sure raw or chargrilled but maybe raw after eating their chargrilled). Waited in line for about 1 hour due to short staff in the kitchen (understable!). Food took another 30 mins but it's okay since they were still hot.  I got French onion soup, chargrilled oyster, and blue claw appetizer. 

French onion soup: 8/10- The display looks soooo good and the cheese on top was chef's kiss. However the reason why it's not a 10 is due to its heavy salted onion and soup. When I say heavy, I meant heavy sodium. I had to pour about a cup of water little by little to dilute it. Unfortunately, it made my soup cold lol. 

Chargrilled oysters 4/10: small but I assume it's from the heat. The grainy cheese (don't know what it is called) made it so salty. I wish they put less like what some people were saying below. I tried Desire's chargrilled oysters and theirs were juicy. These were dry and salty enough where you can't taste the natural sweetness. They also toasted the bread so much that It felt like eating crackers- no softness at all. It was hard to enjoy the overall dish. Maybe try their raw oysters instead. 

Blue crab claws 8/10: again, this appetizer was great however it was so salty and sour. I used the Yelp offer (for appetizers $13 and paid the difference which was like $5). 

Good service. Overall I think they can improve the amount of salt they put in their dishes! (Or maybe let your waitress know to put less sodium in ur dishes.) This was mentioned in few reviews and I hope feedbacks are passed down to the Chefs. I hope to retry their French Onion Soup the next time I visit NOLA.

We decided to try after looking up the reviews. It did not disappoint. The raw, and Rockefeller oysters were great, and my son tried the chicken Parmesan which was a huge portion, and very good. The Cajun Bloody Mary, and sangria were also great.
The best restaurant!!! Found it on Yelp and ended up being one of my favorite restaurants. Food was amazing and service was great! Will definitely be back!

We had lunch at Royal House. It was the day of the sugar bowl and very busy. Having been a server for many years, I do understand the stresses of a busy day like that. 
When we checked in we were told it would be a one hour wait. It was actually 2 1/2 hours but we were never updated. When, I checked after 1 1/2 hours, all they told me was "there are a lot of people ahead of you."
We were finally taken upstairs and they kindly seated us outside. Someone came and took our drink order but then didn't come back for quite some time. Our food order was taken long after our drinks arrived.  It took quite a while to get the food, the kitchen brought it out. We never saw our server again until we paid our check. We had to go inside to find her to request the check. We were even understanding about the length of time to prepare our food, as there were several large parties. But when it arrived, the oysters were so overcooked they were hard and shriveled up and the bread slices were cooked practically to charcoal. The sauce on the crab claws was barely warm. No one ever came to check for more drinks or even water.
This was the second time we have eaten at Royal House and on the whole this was very disappointing. Even making allowances for the busy day, our experience should've been better than this.
The restaurant was clean.
The prices are a little high. We paid $24 for a dozen oysters. Later that evening, we had a dozen for $19 and the next day we had a dozen for $20. As you can tell I like chargrilled oysters.

As a local educator, I decided to enjoy the last days of Christmas break in the French quarter.  Stumbling onto Royal street, me and my compadre decided to eat at this establishment.  My first time here in years, I decided to try all the appetizers, from the fried alligator, to the blue crab claws, and the Friday oyster tostada's.   The oysters here are some of the best in all of Louisiana.  Fresh tags and all, they are truly the bomb.  Honestly some of the best chargrilled oysters you'll find.  The lemon garlic butter sauce in the blue crab claws will leave you dipping every bit off food one has left over in the sauce guaranteed.   The Royal house is definitely a great spot for a tourist visiting the city in search of good local food at a reasonable cost.  The menu is limited at the moment due to the economic circumstances, but I still had a great time, at the bar so I can interact with all the tourists, near and far.  Had a blast!

By far the shittiest service ever. Came around 7:00 with a party of 6 and was told it would be a 20 minute wait time. 20 mins no problem, I don't mind waiting, but it ended up being near a damn hour and half wait. If Walking past the windows I see a huge table that could accommodate 6, but I figured there were other large parties in front of us waiting so I paid no mind. As time went on and more parties were seated, that table was still available. So I don't see why we had to wait 1.5 hours to be seated. Then once seated it took another 45 mins for food to come out. Everything tasted fine except my pescatore. On the menu it said it's supposed to come with linguine, but if you look at my photo that's rice (undercooked rice at that) on top of it instead of pasta. They never told me they were out of pasta or asked me if I wanted to substitute for rice. The sauce was super acidic and tart from the tomatoes. Overall not a good experience, and strongly suggest everyone to not waste their time coming here!

Great place for dinner after a day of drinking! 

Found this place on Yelp and decided to stop in. I'd say it's Italian with a Cajun and Creole twist. It's also a historic building in the French Quarter. We sat on the upstairs outside balcony. 

To drink, my boyfriend had Maker's Mint Julip. It was supposed to consist of Maker's Mark Bourbon, Muddled Mint, Simple Syrup, Soda. After ordering our waiter said they were out of Maker's Mark and asked if Crown Royal was okay...which it was. My boyfriend said the drink was good and different. 

I had Voodoo Juice. Cruzan Aged Light Rum, Banana Liquor, Blue Curacao, Pineapple And Orange Juices. It was just okay. 

To eat....

We started with alligator bites for an appetizer. Marinated Gator Meat Served With Cocktail And Tartar Sauces. It was very tender and had good flavor. 

For entrees we ordered and shared Crawfish & Crabmeat Ravioli and Baked Gulf Shrimp Tortellini. 

Crawfish & Crabmeat Ravioli- Jumbo Ravioli Filled With Lobster, Shrimp, Spinach & Ricotta, Topped With Creamy Louisiana Crawfish Sauce And Sautéed Blue Crabmeat. DELICIOUS. Nice pieces of seafood and lots of yummy melted cheese. Huge raviolis. Amazing flavor. 

Baked Gulf Shrimp Tortellini- Gulf Shrimp Tossed In A Seafood Cream Sauce And Topped With Toasted Buttery Bread Crumbs, Then Baked To Golden Perfection. YUMMY!!! What a wonderful marriage of flavors. 

Food was delish. Service on the other hand wasn't terrible but needs improvement. Our waiter was very slow in taking our order, even when we told him we were ready to order he said that he had to go down to the bar. He then took a very long time to come back to take our order. We kept seeing him walk around..just didn't come to us for a while.

Picture this.... it's a beautiful day outside,  the temperature being just right. You head up the stairs and are brought to a tiny balcony with a table set for two. Below are the busy streets where a jazz band breaks out into song. You order two cocktails and cheers to a romantic night.

Food served is typical New Orleans cuisine brought by an attentive server. Appetizers of blue crab claws and stuffed mushrooms are both standouts. You finish the night off with some homemade bread pudding before heading back to your hotel.

Loved the lunch and Bloody Mary sitting at the bar which is first come first serve and no wait. Ousters were super fresh and large, crab claw appetizer was great, gator bites were our least favorite. Service was 5 star.

Husband and I came in on a Friday evening just for an appetizer and a drink. We ordered crab claws, which were really tasty and came with some delicious garlic bread. The bartender was really sweet and the cocktails were good. But, as we were sitting there we saw multiple bugs on the bar-  like, large silverfish or small cockroaches- crawling on the napkin dispenser and coming out from under the bar mat.
Excellent food and service!  Kyla provided amazing customer service and we will be back our next visit! The Bloody Mary, Crab Claws and Ravioli was GREAT!!!!! No pics we ate too fast.
staff is better than management...I over heard a manger say that her daughter had Covid and still bring her daughter in with her

Restaurant is terrible! I went to the restaurant it was freezing outside and they made two young ladies stand outside in the cold which I find very rude. I went in to the restroom and heard a manger fussing about the doors being open. A very sweet young lady with long black hair came an apologized for them opening the door back on me and my husband. I felt bad for them because they made her stand out. Management needs to do better and care more for there employees and customers. 
#won't recommend to no one else #do better
